column2: It is sent to the church of God in Corinth, those who are being made right in Christ Jesus, called to live holy lives—and to everyone who worships the Lord Jesus Christ everywhere, the Lord both of them and of us.
column3: Jiosh at ab i em-gawulkai mamt d wo hemajkamgajk. Kumt heg hekaj ab i e hemakoj wehsijj t-wehm ahchim mach hab waꞌap ab ihm g t-kownalig Jesus Christ.

column2: May you have grace and peace from God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ.
column3: Ab o wa si s-em-hoꞌigeꞌid g t-ohg Jiosh g t-kownalig Jesus Christ wehm ch ab wo wa baꞌich i em-mahkad g i wehmtadag ch s-ap tahhadkam.

column2: I'm always thanking God for you because of the grace of God given to you in Christ Jesus.
column3: Chum ani hekid ab si hoꞌigeꞌid g Jiosh em-hekaj. Ab amt i s-wohoch g Christ. T g Jiosh ab i em-mah g geꞌe i wehmtadag.

column2: Through him you have been made rich in everything, in all that you say and every aspect of what you know.
column3: M heg hekaj s-mahch mo haschu s-apꞌe ch s-ap haꞌichu am hab junihim ch s-ap haꞌichu k amjed neneok.

column2: In fact the testimony of Christ was proved valid in your experience,
column3: Am o e chehgidch mam s-wihnam an uꞌukch g haꞌichu t-ahga ab amjed g Christ.

column2: so that you're not missing any spiritual gift as you wait for the coming of our Lord Jesus Christ.
column3: Kum wehs ab i neid g hoꞌigeꞌidadgaj ch ep nenida mat ep wo jiwia.

column2: He will also keep you strong to the very end, so you will be kept right until the day of the Lord Jesus Christ.  God is trustworthy who called you to share together in fellowship with his son Jesus Christ our Lord.
column3: Jiosh at ab i em-waid k ab i em-gawulkai mat hab masma hab t-juh. Kum hab si s-ap s-mahch g alidaj Jesus Christ. T g Jiosh pi hekid am hu gawul wo juh g hab e-elida k an wo t-uꞌukchid matt pi ab hu wo t-chuꞌijigch heg eda tash mat wo ha lodai g pi ap chuꞌijkam.

column2: Brothers and sisters, I plead with you in the name of our Lord Jesus Christ that you all agree and that you're not divided. Instead develop a united attitude and purpose.
column3: T-kownalig Jesus Christ o ab ni-mahkch g gewkdag mant wo haꞌichu em-cheha. Kunt hekaj wo em-ahgi mamt pi ab hu e wui wo gegokiwua k wabshaba ab wo i hemakoj g e-chegitoidag k wo s-ap e tahtkk ab aꞌai e wui.

column2: For I have been told things about you, my brothers and sisters, by some of Chloe's people—that you are quarreling among yourselves.
column3: Ia at haꞌi dada g em-wehm kihkam mo d Cloe hajuni k hab kaij mamsh pi e wehm neneok.

column2: Let me explain what I mean. You're all making different claims: “I follow Paul,” or “I follow Apollos,” or “I follow Peter,” or “I follow Christ.”
column3: Haꞌi amsh hab kaij mamsh ahni am ni-oid ch amsh haꞌi g Apollos am oid ch amsh haꞌi g Peter am oid. Kumsh haꞌi hab e elid mamsh ahpim d waꞌi wohokam oiddam g Christ.

column2: Is Christ divided? Did Paul die on a cross for you? Was it in the name of Paul that you were baptized?
column3: Neh, am amtsh aꞌai i e gaꞌagwulkad k eda d chum hemako ab wecho g Christ. Pi att hema ahchim ab muh kots t ab em wehhejed. Heg at waꞌi Christ hab e juh. Kumt heg ab waꞌi s-wohochud k e pahl wapko.

column2: I'm grateful to God that I didn't baptize any of you, except Crispus and Gaius,  so nobody can claim they were baptized in my name.  (Oh, and I also baptized the Stephanas family—I can't think of anyone else.)  For Christ didn't send me out to baptize, but to spread the good news, and not with eloquent human wisdom, otherwise the cross of Christ would be made powerless.
column3: Pi ant heg wehhejed am hu jiwia manis wehs wo em-pahl wapko. Shahag wepo mant hegam waꞌi Crispus ch Gaius ha wapko, pej hegam ehp Stephanus. Pi ant chegito manis haꞌi ep ha pahl wapko. Pi ani hab ni-ahg mams ahni wo i ni-oi. Pi at heg hekaj am i ni-kei g Christ manis wo ha pahl wapkonad k wabshaba am i ni-kei mant am wo ahgachugad ihda s-kehg haꞌichu ahga mo hab chuꞌig mat ab e muhkid kots t ab t-wehhejed. Neh, id ani waꞌi ahgachug ch pi hekaj g s-hasig neꞌoki mams ab wo si has ni-elid k p i am hu wo amichud k hab pi wo e doꞌibia.

column2: For the message of the cross is nonsense to those who are lost, but it's the power of God to those of us who are saved.
column3: Hegam mo pi d e doꞌibiakam o hab elid mo d wabsh pi haꞌichu g haꞌichu t-ahga mat g Christ ab muh kots t ab t-wehhejed. Kuch wabshaba ahchim mach d t-doꞌibiakam s-mahch mo g Jiosh hab masma ab t-chehgidch g e-gewkdag.

column2: As Scripture says, “I will destroy the wisdom of the wise, and I will wipe out the cleverness of the clever.”
column3: Neh, an o oꞌohanas mo hab kaij g Jiosh:

column2: So how about the wise, the writers, and the philosophers of this age? Hasn't God turned the wisdom of this world into foolishness?
column3: Pegih, am o t‑chehgidch g Jiosh matt pi hedai wo shaꞌi t‑nako machs wo hejel t‑doꞌibia, chum achs hems haꞌichu wo s‑amichudad ch haꞌichu wo s‑mahchkad. Pi att hedai wo shaꞌi t‑nako machs wo ha neꞌowin k wo cheh g Jiosh wohokam.

column2: Since God in his wisdom allowed the world in its wisdom not to know God, it was God's gracious plan that by the foolishness of the good news those who trusted in him would be saved.
column3: Jiosh at hab masma hab t‑juh matt pi hedai wo shaꞌi t‑nako machs hejel wo s‑mai g Jiosh k wo t‑doꞌibia. Haꞌi o pi haꞌichuchud g Jiosh haꞌichu ahga. K wabshaba hab d elidaj matt ab wo i s‑wohoch g haꞌichu ahgaj k hekaj wo t‑doꞌibia.

column2: The Jews ask for miraculous signs, and Greeks look for wisdom,
column3: Ni‑wehm Tutuligo o s‑hohhoꞌid mat hoꞌip nei g s‑hasig haꞌichu k haha wo s‑wohoch hegai mo hab junihim. K g gawul mahs hemajkam s‑kaimk g hemajkam haꞌichu ha‑mahchig mat hab masma wo chum s‑mai g wohokam.

column2: but our message is of Christ killed on a cross—offensive to the Jews, and foolishness to the foreigners.
column3: Ch wabshaba ahchim hi heg ahgachug mat g Christ ab muh kots t ab k hekaj t‑doꞌibia. Tutuligo o hab elid mo id wabsh chehgidch mo pi gewkdag. K g gawul mahs oꞌodham hab elid mo wabsh chehgidch mo pi haꞌichu amichud.

column2: However for those who are called by God, both Jews and foreigners, Christ is the power of God and the wisdom of God.  For the foolishness of God is wiser than we are; and the weakness of God is stronger than we are.
column3: T wabshaba g Jiosh ab haꞌi i t‑gawulkai ahchim Tutuligo k hab waꞌap ab haꞌi i em‑gawulkai ahpim gawul mahs hemajkam matt ab wo i s‑wohoch g alidag k wo t‑doꞌibia. Hegam mo pi d e doꞌibiakam o pi ab hu haꞌichuchud ihda mat g Jiosh am hab t‑juni am gahi wuhshanim g e‑alidag. K wabshaba g Jiosh hab masma am t‑chehgidch g e‑amichudadag ch e‑gewkdag.

column2: Brothers and sisters, remember your calling—and that this did not include many who are wise, humanly speaking; not many who are powerful; not many who are important.
column3: Am g wo s‑chegitok, ni‑wepnag, mam has i masma mat eda koi ab hu i em‑gawulkai g Jiosh mamt d wo hemajkamgajk, Muꞌijj am pi haꞌichu mahch ch pi ha gewkdag ch d wabsh pi haꞌichu am ha‑nena ed g hemajkam.

column2: Instead God chose the things the world considers foolish to humiliate those who think they are wise. He chose the things the world considers weak to humiliate those who think they are strong.
column3: T g Jiosh ab i em‑gawulkai mat hekaj am wo ha chehgi hegam mo pi mahch mo d wabsh pi haꞌichu g haꞌichu ha‑amichudadag ch ha‑gewkdag.

column2: He chose the things that are unimportant and despised by the world, even things that are not, to bring to nothing the things that are,
column3: Pi am ab hu em‑haꞌichuchud ch wabsh s‑em‑uhwaid. T wabshaba g Jiosh ab i em‑gawulkai mat hekaj am wo ha chehgi mo pi d shaꞌi haꞌichu hegam mo g hemajkam ab si has ha elid.

column2: so that nobody should boast in God's presence.
column3: Heg o hekaj hab mahs mat pi hedai wo chum si e haschudad am tahgio g Jiosh.

column2: It's because of him that you live in Christ Jesus, who God made to be wisdom for us. He sets us right, keeps us right, and frees us.
column3: Heg at ab i t‑wehnad g Christ matt ab i s‑wohoch g s‑kehg haꞌichu ahga ab amjed. T g Christ t‑doꞌibia ab amjed g pi apꞌekam k am i t‑apꞌech wehhejed g Jiosh matt d wo hekia s‑apꞌekam hemajkamgajk, Bo masma ab t‑chehgidch g Jiosh haꞌichu amichudadag.

column2: So as Scripture says, “Whoever wants to boast, let them boast in the Lord.”
column3: Heg o hekaj an hab chuꞌig Jiosh oꞌohana ed:

column2: Brothers and sisters, when I came to you I didn't try to impress you with wonderful words or great wisdom when I told you what God had to say to you.
column3: Kuni ahni hi pi shaꞌi hasigamkaj neok, ni‑wepnag, mant eda am wa jiwia em‑wui am ahgachugch

column2: I decided that while I was with you I didn't want to concentrate on anything except Jesus Christ, and that he was crucified.
column3: mat g Jesus Christ ab muh kots t ab am t‑wehhejed. Kuni hab n‑ahg mant heg am wo waꞌi ahgachugad

column2: I came to you in weakness, fearful and trembling.
column3: ch heg hekaj si s‑gihug ch gigiwuk.

column2: I didn't speak to you with persuasive words of wisdom to convince you. I just explained it all to you through the evidence and power of the Spirit.
column3: K g haꞌichu ni‑ahga pi am hu hab shaꞌi kaidag matp hems g si s‑e mahchim oꞌodham haꞌichu ahga. K wabshaba g Hekia S‑apꞌekam Gewkdag am wohokamchud g haꞌichu ni‑ahga.

column2: That way your trust in God wouldn't rely on human wisdom but on the power of God.
column3: Heg ani hekaj s‑mahch mo g em‑wohochudadag pi ab hu shon heg ab hemajkam haꞌichu amichudadag ch wabshaba ab Jiosh gewkdag amjed.

column2: However we do use words of wisdom when we speak to those who are spiritually mature, but this isn't wisdom that comes from this world, or from the rulers of this world who soon fade from the scene.
column3: Am ani wa hi wa ha ahgid g haꞌichu amichudadag hegam mat geꞌegeꞌehogat e‑wohochudadag ed. K wabshaba id pi d hemajkam haꞌichu ha‑amichudadag, chum hems hegam mo d s‑has hahaꞌichu. Hegam haꞌichu ha‑amichudadag at wabsh ha wehm wo huhug.

column2: On the contrary we explain God's wisdom in terms of a revealed mystery that was previously hidden which God planned for our glory before the creation of the worlds.
column3: Ihda haꞌichu amichudadag mani hab ahg o d Jiosh hab elida am t‑wehhejed ch an hab chuꞌig mat koi in hu nahto ihda jewed ch wabsh s‑aꞌagi an hab ah chuꞌig. Do Jiosh hab elida mat g Christ wo t‑doꞌibia.

column2: None of the rulers of this world understood anything about this—for if they had, they would not have crucified the Lord of glory.
column3: Heg o d kownal wehs haꞌichu dahm. T eda g s‑has hahaꞌichu ab naggia kots t ab no pi pi mahch g Jiosh hab elida.

column2: But as Scripture says, “No one has ever seen, and no one has ever heard, and no one has ever imagined what God has prepared for those who love him.”
column3: An o hab chuꞌig Jiosh oꞌohana ed:

column2: But God has revealed this to us through the Spirit, because the Spirit delves into the depths of God.
column3: Jiosh haꞌichu hab elida o pi ta machima am t‑wehhejed. K wabshaba g Hekia S‑apꞌekam Gewkdag wehs s‑mahch ch am i t‑tashogid.

column2: Who knows anyone's thoughts except the actual person?  In the same way no one knows God's thoughts except the Spirit of God.
column3: Neh, no hig pi woho mo pi hedai ep s‑mahch g haꞌichu t‑chegitoi hab masma mach ahchim hejel s‑mahch? Pegih, ch ahchim hab wa masma pi hedai ep s‑mahch g Jiosh haꞌichu chegitoi.

column2: For we have received the Spirit from God, not the spirit of this world, so that we could understand what God so generously gave us.
column3: T wabshaba g Jiosh ab t‑mah g Hekai S‑apꞌekam Gewkdag mat am t‑eda wo ulinig ch am wo i t‑tashogidad mo haschu ab t‑makiog g Jiosh.

column2: That's what we speak about—not using words taught by human wisdom, but what the Spirit teaches. We explain what is spiritual using spiritual terms.
column3: Pegih, pi att wo shaꞌi t‑nako machs am hu wo tashogi g Jiosh wohokam heg hekaj hemajkam haꞌichu amichudadag. K wabshaba g Hekia S‑apꞌekam Gewkdag ab t‑mahkch g haꞌichu amichudadag mach hekaj am i tashogid. T hegam wo waꞌi s‑amich mo hedai edgid g Hekia S‑apꞌekam Gewkdag.

column2: Of course people who are not spiritual don't accept what comes from God's Spirit. It's just foolish nonsense to them, and they can't understand it, because what is spiritual has to be properly examined.
column3: T hegam mo pi edgid pi wo amichud k pi wo bei mo haschu ab t‑makiog. Heg waꞌi Hekia S‑apꞌekam Gewkdag o ab t‑mahkch g amichudadag matt wo s‑amich g wohokam.

column2: People who are spiritual investigate everything, but are not placed under investigation themselves.
column3: Ahchim mach edgid g Hekia S‑apꞌekam Gewkdag att wo t‑nako matt am s‑ap wo i aꞌamich mo haschu am i t‑tashogidch. K hegam pi t‑amichud matp hedai i pi edgid g Hekia S‑apꞌekam Gewkdag.

column2: For “Who understands the Lord's mind, and would think to instruct him?” But we do have Christ's mind!
column3: Id o hab ahg hegai mo an Jiosh t amjed oꞌohanas:

column2: My brothers and sisters, I couldn't talk with you as spiritual believers, but as worldly people—like baby Christians.
column3: Am ani wa pi hasigam neok, ni‑wepnag, mani am em‑ahgid g wohokam namt pi pi koi geꞌegeꞌehogat id eda t‑wohochudadag ch pi am hu si e dagitokch Hekia S‑apꞌekam Gewkdag wui. Bam waꞌi masma mo g aꞌal nam pi d wabsh wechij id eda t‑wohochudadag.

column2: I gave you milk—I couldn't give you solid food to eat, because you weren't ready for it.
column3: Heg o wa wepo mani g wihbi em‑iꞌichud ch pi g haꞌichu hugi em‑gegosid ab wabsh s‑bahbagi haꞌichu em‑ahgidch. Chum wa iaꞌi idani amt koi geꞌegeꞌehogat

column2: Even now you're not ready for it, because you're still worldly. Since you're still jealous and argumentative, doesn't that show you're worldly, behaving just like ordinary people do?
column3: k hab wabsh kia chuꞌig mo hegam mo pi mahch g Jiosh. Neh, am am aꞌai s‑e hehgamk ch aꞌai e kawani. K id hekaj am tasho mam ha oidch hab e wua hegam mo pi mahch g Jiosh.

column2: When one of you says, “I follow Paul,” while another says, “I follow Apollos,” doesn't that show you're being so very human?
column3: Haꞌijj amsh hab chechꞌe mam ahni Paul am ni‑oid ch haꞌijj hab chechꞌe mam g Apollos am oid. K id am wohokamchud mam ha wepo haꞌichu chegito hegam mo pi mahch g Jiosh.

column2: Who is Apollos, anyway? And who is Paul? We're just servants through whom you believed. Each of us does the work God gave us to do.
column3: Pi ach d si haꞌichu ch d wabsh piongaj g Jiosh mamt ab t‑ab bei g wohokam ab amjed g Christ. Do Jiosh mo ab t‑mahkch g t‑chikpan. Kuch am hab wabsh junihim mo haschu ab t‑mahkch hab masma mo g oidag ch ed chikpandam.

column2: I did the planting, Apollos did the watering—but it was God who made you grow!
column3: Heg o wa wepo mani ahni am esh g haꞌichu kai am wehpeg ahgch g Jiosh haꞌichu ahga. K g Apollos am wapga g esha am baꞌich i ahgch. K wabshaba d Jiosh ch am i wuhshad g t‑esha mamt ab s‑wohochud k am heꞌes i oi g haꞌichu ahgaj mach am ahgachug.

column2: So the one who does the planting doesn't count for anything, any more than the one who does the watering. The only one who matters is God who is growing you!
column3: Kuch heg hekaj pi d si haꞌichu ahchim mach am eshad ch wapga am ahgch g Jiosh haꞌichu ahga. Jiosh o d si haꞌichu no pi heg am i wuhshad g t‑esha mam ab s‑wohochud ahpim mam kah g haꞌichu ahgaj.

column2: The one planting and the one watering have the same goal, and both will be rewarded according to what they've done.
column3: Wehs ach t‑wepo masma ahchim mach ahgachug g Jiosh haꞌichu ahga, chum achs hema wehpeg am wo ah, tt hema am baꞌich wo i ahgahi. T g Jiosh ab wo t‑mah g t‑namkidadag matt heꞌes hab i juh g chikpan.

column2: We are workers together with God—and you are God's field, his building.
column3: Pegih, dach piongaj g Jiosh g Apollos wehm. Kum ahpim d Jiosh eniga mach am em‑chikpan wehhejed g Jiosh.

column2: Through the grace of God that he gave to me, I laid down the foundation like a skilled building supervisor. Now someone else is building on it. Whoever does the building needs to watch what they're doing.
column3: T heg ab i ni‑gawulkai mant em‑chikp hab masma mani d s‑ni‑mahchim kihtdam ch am shondad g kih am ahgachugk g Jesus Christ. Kum ahpim epai himchud g kihta ahgachugch g Jiosh haꞌichu ahga. K ab em‑ab mamt si s‑nenꞌoid k am hab wo junihid.

column2: For no one can lay any other foundation than what's already laid—that is Jesus Christ.
column3: Shondaj o heki hu nahtois ch d Jesus Christ. Kumt pi haschukaj ab ep wo shondad.

column2: Those who build on that foundation may use gold, silver, precious stone, wood, hay, or straw—
column3: Neh, tp hems wo e mehi matp haschu kih wabsh g shaꞌikaj hab wo e juh.

column2: but whatever is used to build with will be exposed. For on the Day of Judgment fire will reveal it and test it. Everyone's work will be shown for what it is.
column3: Pegih, t hab wa masma wo i e aꞌappe g em‑chikpan. Mt heg hekaj si s‑ap hab wo juh

column2: Those whose building survives will be rewarded.
column3: k hab wo bei g e‑namkidadag mat hekid wo e mamche.

column2: Those whose building is burned up will lose out. They will still be saved, but it will be like passing through fire!
column3: T hi wo wa e doꞌibia matp hedai pi kehg hab juh g e‑chikpan. T wabshaba g chikpanaj wo huhug hab masma mat g shaꞌi wo meitto am mei ch ed.

column2: Don't you know you are God's temple and that God's Spirit lives in you?
column3: Heg o wa wepo mach d Jiosh cheopiga no pi am t‑eda kih g Hekia S‑apꞌekam Gewkdag. Id amt wo chum s‑mahchk.

column2: Anyone who destroys God's temple will be destroyed by God, for God's temple is holy, and you are the temple.
column3: Jiosh at wo padch matp hedai wo i em‑padch nam pi d enigaj ch d hekia s‑apꞌekam.

column2: Don't deceive yourselves. If there's anyone of you who thinks they're worldly wise, they should become fools so they can become truly wise!
column3: Haꞌi amtp hab i e ahg mam s‑chu aꞌamichud am ha nena ed g hemajkam. Pi g am wo hejel e iattogid. Pi at hab wo t‑elidad machs s‑chu aꞌamichud hegam mo pi mahch g Jiosh haꞌichu amichudadag mattp heg an wo uꞌukchid. Am g wo i e nakog mamt an wo uꞌukchid, chum as hab wo em‑elidad mam pi haꞌichu aꞌamichud.

column2: This world's wisdom is plain foolishness to God. As Scripture says, “He uses the cleverness of the wise to catch them out,”
column3: Do wabsh pi haꞌichu an Jiosh tahgio mo haschu idam hab elid mo d haꞌichu amichudadag. T g Jiosh an wo ha wulsh heg hekaj haꞌichu ha‑amichudadag mo hab masma an oꞌohanas wehhejed.

column2: and “The Lord knows the arguments of the wise are pointless.”
column3: K an hab ep chuꞌig mo d wabsh pi haꞌichu g ha‑chegitoidag g s‑chu aꞌamichuddam am Jiosh wehhejed.

column2: So don't boast about people. For you have everything,  whether it's Paul or Apollos or Peter—or the world, or life, or death, or the present, or the future. You have everything—
column3: Kumt hekaj pi hedai wo chum ge t‑haꞌichuchudad. Dach wabsh em‑pionag g Apollos ch Peter ha wehm. Wehs ihda jewed o d em‑eniga. Hegai mo hemu in haꞌichug ch hegai mo ab hahawa him o d em‑eniga. Doakag ch muhkig d em‑apꞌedag.

column2: and you are Christ's, and Christ is God's.
column3: Kum d Christ hemajkamga. K heg d alidaj g Jiosh.

column2: So think of us as Christ's servants given the responsibility for “the mysteries of God.”
column3: Dach wabsh piongaj g Christ. K heg t‑nuhkudachud matt am wo i tashogi g s‑aꞌagi haꞌichu ahgaj g Jiosh. Kumt hab masma wo s‑t‑mahchk.

column2: More than this, those who have such responsibilities are required to be trustworthy.
column3: Ha‑pionag at heg am hab wo waꞌi junihid mo haschu g ahmoj chehani ch s‑ap wo nuhkud g e‑nuhkuda.

column2: Personally it hardly matters to me if you or anyone else judges me—in fact I don't even judge myself.
column3: Pegih, ni heg am waꞌi chikpanid Jiosh. K pi shaꞌi ni‑kudut mamtp has i masma hab wo elidad g ni‑chikpan ahpim o hedai i hemajkam. Niꞌinis hejel wo ah manis has masma hab wua.

column2: I don't know of anything I've done wrong, but that doesn't make me right. It's the Lord who judges me.
column3: Pi o haꞌichu shaꞌi ni‑kudut am ni‑chegitoi ed manis pi ap am hab junihim g chikpan am Jiosh wehhejed. K wabshaba pi id hekaj e wohokamchud manis am wabsh i si s‑ap am hab junihim. Heg o waꞌi Jiosh s‑mahch machs hedai s‑ap am hab junihim g t‑chikpan.

column2: So don't judge anything before the right time—when the Lord comes. He will bring to light all the darkest secrets that are hidden, and he will reveal people's motives. God will give everyone whatever praise they deserve.
column3: Mt heg hekaj pi ab hu wabsh si s‑hohtam hema haꞌichu wo abch mat koi wo e ai g tash. Am at haha wo t‑aꞌappe g t‑kownalig mat hekid wo jiwia k wo mahsko wua mach haschu i chegito ch haschu ahgch hab junihim haꞌichu k ab haha wo i t‑mahkhi g s‑ap has elidadag mo heꞌes ab i him t‑wui.

column2: Now, brothers and sisters, I have applied this to Apollos and myself as an example for you. That way you will learn not to go beyond what has been written, and not in arrogance prefer one over the other.
column3: Neh, id ani am em‑ahgid, ni‑wepnag, ab t‑amjed ahni ch Apollos mant am wo i em‑tashogi mamt pi am hu dahm wo i chesh hegai mo haschu an oꞌohanas Jiosh oꞌohana ed. Pi amt hedai Jiosh pionag ha baꞌich ab wo si has elidad ch wabshaba ab wehs wo ha kaihamad g Jiosh haꞌichu ahga.

column2: Who made you so special? What do you have that you weren't given? Since you were given it, why do you proudly claim you weren't?
column3: Pi g wo chum si e haschudad heg hekaj mam haschu i edgid ch haschu i s‑mahch. Jiosh at wehs ab wabsh em‑mah mam haschu i edgid.

column2: You think you have all you need. You think you're so wealthy. You think you're kings already, and don't need us.  I wish you were really ruling as kings, so we could rule with you!
column3: Bamsh e elid mam heki hu wehs haꞌichu edgid ch heki hu d s‑kakais ch d ge kokownal. Kuch eda ahchim Jesus Christ chuhchai pi d s‑kakais ch pi d kokownal. Mamt huꞌi woho d wo kokownalk. Kutt em‑wehm d wo kokownalk.

column2: The way I see it, God has put us apostles on display as the last in the line, condemned to die. We have been made a public show before the entire universe, to angels and to human beings.
column3: Kuch eda wehs ha baꞌich d i shoꞌigkam ch attp hems wo t‑koꞌij am wehhejed g Jiosh haꞌichu ahga. Shahag wepo mo g Jiosh am t‑chehgidch wehs ha baꞌich hab masma mat g kownal am wo ha chehgi hegam matp ha gewito k ha lilsoch.

column2: We're Christ's fools, but you are so wise in Christ! We're the weak ones, but you are so strong! You have the glory, but we are despised!
column3: Ahpim am hab e elid mam d si haꞌichu s‑mahchim ab amjed g Christ ch si s‑gewpkdag ch ab d si has ha‑elida hegam mo pi mahch g Jiosh. K eda idam pi kehg has t‑elid ahchim mach ahgachug g Jiosh haꞌichu ahga ch hab t‑elid mach pi haꞌichu mahch ch pi ha gewpkdag.

column2: Right up till now we're hungry and thirsty. We have no clothes. We're badly beaten up, and we have no place to call home.
column3: Hebai ach bihugkoꞌo ch ep tonkkoꞌo ch pi edgid g eniga. K hegam t‑gewichshulig. Pi ach hebai t‑mahch ch kih

column2: We struggle on doing manual work. When people curse us, we bless them. When they persecute us, we put up with it.
column3: ch si chikpan ch hejel t‑dagioꞌid. K hegam s‑koꞌokam has t‑ahg. Kuch ab wabsh i s‑ha hoꞌigeꞌid. T‑shoꞌigchud o. Kuch wabsh nakog.

column2: When they insult us, we respond with kindness. Even now we are treated like dirt, the worst trash in the whole world.
column3: An o ahgahim g iattogi ab t‑amjed. Kuch wabsh s‑hemajim ha wehm neneok. Bo wabsh t‑elid mach d wabsh hegai mo g hemajkam s‑ohhod ch gam hu nehnchud.

column2: I'm not writing like this to make you feel ashamed, but to caution you as my children whom I love so much.
column3: Id ani em‑ahgid mant wo haꞌichu i em‑shelini hab masma mam d si ni‑tatchuidch ni‑aꞌaliga. Pi ani hab ahgch em‑ahgid manis wo si em‑edawua.

column2: Even though you may have thousands of Christian instructors, you don't have many fathers—it was in Christ Jesus that I became your father when I shared the good news with you.
column3: Heg o wa wepo mani d em‑ohg id eda himdag namt pi ab ni‑amjed kah g s‑kehg haꞌichu ahgaj g Jiosh k hekaj bei g e‑wechij doakag. T wo muꞌijk g em‑mashchamdam id eda Christ himdag. Ni eda d waꞌi ahni mant wehpeg am em‑wui uꞌapa ihda s‑kehg haꞌichu ahgaj g Jiosh mamt heg hekaj e doꞌibia.

column2: So I'm pleading with you to imitate me!
column3: Kuni ab i em‑gewkemhun mamt am hab wo junihid mani wa haschu am em‑chehgid.

column2: That's why I sent Timothy to you, my trustworthy son in the Lord who I love so much. He will remind you about the way I follow Christ, just as I always teach in every church I visit.
column3: Ia o daha g t‑wehnag Timothy. Kuni am ahgid mat am wo i em‑chehgim ed k wo i em‑chegitoich matt has masma am wo himchudad g t‑doakag am wehhejed g Christ mani wa am em‑mashchamahim ch wehs ha mashchamahim mani hebai i hihhim. S‑mahch am mat heg ab ni‑amjed ab i s‑wohoch g Christ k heg wa wepo mo d si ni‑tatchuidch ni‑alidag ch am hab junihim g haꞌichu ni‑ahga.

column2: Some among you have become arrogant, thinking I wouldn't bother coming to see you.
column3: Kah ani mamsh haꞌi si e sheshmachud hab e ahgch mant pi am hu wo i em‑chehgim.

column2: But I am coming to visit you soon, if that's what the Lord wants. Then I'll find out what these arrogant people are saying, and what kind of power they have.
column3: Nt wabshaba s‑hohtam ab wo i hih em‑wui matp g Jiosh hab d wo elidak k am haha wo s‑mai mams has masma himchud g e‑doakag ahpim mam chum si e sheshmachud ch muꞌi neneok.

column2: For the kingdom of God is not about mere words, but about power.
column3: Ab ach wecho g Jiosh. K pi hab chum chuꞌig machs wabsh wo neneokad ch wabshaba g s‑ap haꞌichu hab wo junihid heg hekaj Jiosh gewkdag.

column2: So what do you want? Shall I come with a stick to beat you, or in love and a gentle spirit?
column3: Ab o em‑ab mamt ab wo i e dagito wui g Jiosh. Nt hemho wo wa s‑em‑kehꞌel am jiwiak mamtp pi ab hu wui wo i e dagito, k wabshaba si s‑hemajim ab wo i em‑nei mamtp ab wui wo i e dagito.

column2: I hear reports that sexual immorality is happening among you, immorality that even the foreigners don't practice. A man is living with his father's wife!
column3: Am ash haꞌichu hab ep chuꞌig em‑shahgid ch d si geꞌe pi apꞌekam. Msh eda si e hahaschud. Hema ash wabsh hohnig g e‑ohgbad hohnig. Eda chump g Jiosh pi wohochuddam pi hab shaꞌi masma.

column2: You are so proud of yourselves! Shouldn't you have wept with sadness, and excluded the man who did this?
column3: Mt wo chum si pi ap e taht mat id am hab e juh em‑shahgid k wo i wuhshad hegai mat am hab juh ihda pi apꞌekam.

column2: Even though I'm not physically present there, I am there in spirit and just as if I were there I've already made my judgment of the one who has done this.
column3: Chum anis pi am hu haꞌichug ch eda heki hu hab i n‑ah mat ihda oꞌodham hemho wa gam hu wo i e wuhshad,

column2: When you meet together in the name of the Lord Jesus I'll be there with you in spirit and with the power of our Lord Jesus.
column3: no pi hab masma t‑chehani g t‑kownalig Jesus matt hab masma am hab wo junihid. T heg am wo em‑wehmajk. Kumt heg hekaj am wo e nam

column2: Hand over this man to Satan so his sinful nature may be destroyed and he himself be saved on the day of the Lord.
column3: k wo i wuhshad ihda oꞌodham ab e amjed. Kut am wo e shoꞌigch ihda oꞌodham ge Jiawul wecho k atp hems id hekaj ab wo i e shoꞌigch Jiosh wui k d wo e doꞌibiakamk mat ep wo jiwia g t‑kownalig Jesus k wo ha lodai g pi ap chuꞌijkam.

column2: You shouldn't be proud about this. Don't you know that it only takes a little yeast to make the whole batch of dough rise?
column3: Pi o apꞌe mams hab wo chei mam wabsh si s‑apꞌe mo eda an haꞌichug g pi apꞌekam am em‑shahgid. S‑mahch am ihda hab cheꞌidag, “Al chum jewajidakud o s‑gewkdag ch i koꞌokpodkad g wahga.” Id o chum t‑tashogid mat g al chum pi apꞌekam geꞌe haꞌichu wo padch.

column2: Get rid of this old yeast so that you can be a new batch of dough to make bread without yeast. Christ our Passover lamb has been sacrificed.
column3: Neh, t wo wa e muhkid g kahwal mad mat wo e wuhshad g t‑shohshon ha doꞌibiadag. T g jewajidakud gam hu hab wo i e juh. Pegih, k g Jesus Christ d s‑wohokam ch e muhkid am t‑wehhejed mat wo t‑doꞌibia ab amjed g pi apꞌekam. Kum heg hekaj pi padchudas ch gam hu hab wo i juh g pi apꞌekam mat pi wo em‑padch.

column2: So let us celebrate this festival  not with old yeast or the yeast of evil and wickedness, but with the bread made without yeast, the bread of sincerity and truth.
column3: Pegih, tt wo si s‑hehgigk id hekaj ch gam hu hab wo i juh g pi apꞌekam k hab wo waꞌi junihid g s‑apꞌekam ch hab wo waꞌi kaijjid g wohokam.

column2: In my previous letter I wrote that you should not associate with immoral people.  I wasn't referring to the immoral people of this world, those who are greedy and cheat others, or those who worship idols, otherwise you'd have to leave this world!
column3: Heki ant hu wa am em‑oꞌohanid k em‑ahgid mamt pi ab hu wo ha nawojk hegam mo ha wehm woꞌiwup mo hedai pi d ha‑wehm kihkam ch hegam mo s‑bahbanma ch hegam mo melchkwuhim g chehanig kch hegam mo heg ab ihm ch ab wui e hoꞌigeꞌidahun mo pi d Jiosh ch d ha‑nahtoi g hemajkam. Pi ani hegam hab ha ahg mo pi d t‑wehm wohochuddam ch hab chuꞌig. Idam o an wehsko hab chuꞌig. Kumt pi has masma pi ab hu wo ha miabi.

column2: What I meant when I wrote was that you shouldn't associate with anyone who is called a Christian who is immoral or greedy or worships idols; or who is abusive or a drunkard or who cheats others. Don't even share a meal with anyone like that!
column3: Hegam ani wa hab ha ahg mo hab e ahg mo d t‑wehm wohochuddam ch eda am hab junihim g pi apꞌekam. Pi g am chum hems wo ha wehm dadhaiwua matp hedai wo ha wehm woꞌiwup mo hedai pi d ha wehm kihkam o atp wo s‑bahbanmak o atp wo melchkwuhid g chehanig o atp ab wo ihmad mo haschu d wabsh oꞌodham ha‑nahtoi ch ab wui wo e hoꞌigeꞌidahunad o atp d wo s‑iꞌimkamk o atp d wo s‑chu ehskamk.

column2: It's not my place to judge those outside the church. But shouldn't you judge those who are inside the church?  God judges those that are outside the church. “Expel the wicked from among you.”
column3: Pi o ab hu t‑ab machs wo mamche g ha‑chuꞌijig hegam mo pi d t‑wehm wohochuddam. Jiosh at hab wo ha juh. Ab o em‑ab mamt gam hu wo i ha wuwhas hegam mat pi wo dagito g pi apꞌekam k eda d chum em‑wehm wohochuddam. Id o hab ahg hegai mo an Jiosh t amjed oꞌohanas:

column2: How dare any of you file a lawsuit before pagan judges if you have a dispute with your neighbor! Instead you should bring this before other believers.
column3: Pi g am hu aꞌai wo e lodaitad am ha tahgio hegam mo pi mahch g Jiosh ch wabshaba ab e‑wehm wohochuddam ha wui wo e dagito. T am wo i apꞌech mamtp haschukaj pi e apꞌet.

column2: Don't you know that Christian believers will judge the world? If you're going to judge the world, are you not fit to judge in the most minor cases?
column3: Mt wo chum s‑mahchk mo hab him g tash matt d wo uꞌugchuk id dahm jewed ahchim Jiosh hemajkamga. Pegih, tt wo chum t‑nako matt am wo i apꞌech g al chuꞌuchum haꞌichu am t‑shahgid.

column2: Don't you know we are going to judge angels? How much more those things that relate to this life!
column3: Mt ep wo chum s‑mahchk matt am hu wa hebai chum hems g anghil wo ha lodai. Kutt wo chum t‑nako matt wo haꞌichu i apꞌech id dahm jewed hejel t‑wehhejed.

column2: So if you have to judge things that relate to this life, how can you go to judges that are not respected by the church?
column3: Pi g am wo behꞌi hegai mo pi mahch g Jiosh mas am wo i apꞌech mo haschu i pi apꞌe am em‑shahgid.

column2: I'm trying to shame you by saying this. What? You can't find one wise person among you who can settle a dispute that you have?
column3: Dat wo s‑ta edam haꞌichuk mamt aꞌai wo e lodaitad. Ab amsh si has ha elid g s‑chu aꞌamichuddam ch amtp eda pi hema cheh am e shahgid mas am wo i em‑apꞌech.

column2: Instead one believer takes another believer to court, and places the issue before unbelievers!
column3: K amsh aꞌai e lodait am wabsh ha nena ed hegam mo pi mahch g Jiosh.

column2: The very fact you have lawsuits against each other already is a complete disaster. Wouldn't it be better to accept the injustice? Why not let yourselves be defrauded?
column3: Am am e chehgidch mamt i e gehgch mam eda e kamꞌon. Matp pi am hu wo i em‑apꞌech g em‑wehm wohochuddam, mt wabsh pi am hu has wo kaijjid ch wo nako, chum ams haꞌichu em‑ehs.

column2: But you would rather cause injustice and defraud even your fellow-believers in church.
column3: Ni eda kah mamsh wabsh hejel pi ap haꞌichu hab wua ab ha wui ch haꞌichu ha ehsid chum hems g e‑wehm wohochuddam.

column2: Don't you know those who are unjust will not inherit the kingdom of God? Don't be fooled! People who are immoral, worship idols, commit adultery, sexual perverts, homosexuals,
column3: Mt wo chum s‑mahchk mat g pi ap hemajkam pi am hu wo i wahp Jiosh kownaltalig ed. Pi g am wo e iattogid mams am hu wo i wahp mamtp ha wehm wo woꞌiwupad mo hedai pi d em‑wehm kihkam o hedai d em‑wehm chechoj o g em‑wehm uꞌuwi o amtp wo jioshgat k ab wo ihmad mo haschu d wabsh oꞌodham ha‑nahtoi

column2: thieves, greedy, drunkards, abusers, or cheats, will not inherit the kingdom of God.
column3: o amtp wo s‑chu eꞌeskk o wo s‑bahbanmak o wo s‑iꞌimkk o wo haꞌichu ha iattogidad ab hema amjed o wo haꞌichu ha wohppoꞌidad.

column2: Some of you were once like that, but you have been made clean and holy. You have been made right in the name of the Lord Jesus Christ, and in the Spirit of our God.
column3: Haꞌijj am hab chuꞌigkahim. T wabshaba g Hekia S‑apꞌekam Gewkdag gam hu hab i juh g pi ap em‑chuꞌijig k am i em‑apꞌech g t‑kownalig Jesus Christ wehhejed.

column2: People say, “I'm free to do anything”—but not everything is appropriate! “I'm free to do anything”—but I will not let anything control me! People say,
column3: Kumsh hahawa haꞌi hab chechꞌe mo wehs haꞌichu hiwgidas matp haschu wehhejed pi an hu haꞌichug g chehanig. Nt wabshaba am wo em‑ahgi mo pi wehs haꞌichu s‑kehgaj am t‑wehhejed. Pi att wo chum hiwigi mat haschu gan hu wabsh wo i si t‑ui.

column2: “Food for the stomach, and the stomach for food”—but God will destroy both of them. Also, the body is not meant to be used for immorality, but for the Lord, and the Lord for the body.
column3: Haꞌi amsh hab chechꞌe, “Haꞌichu hugi o ab d wuikamaj g t‑wohk ch g wohk g haꞌichu hugi ab d wuikam,” ch hab chum ahg mo wehs s‑apꞌe mach haschu i tatchua am wehhejed g t‑honshpadag. K wabshaba id pi woho mamsh has chum ahg. Pi att wabsh wo huhug hab masma mat idam haꞌichu k heg hekaj wo si t‑nuhkud. Neh, mo g cheoj tatchua mat ab wo i miabi g uwi nat pi hab masma nahto g Jiosh. K wabshaba pi hab d ahga ihda mas wabsh chum hedai wehm wo woꞌiwua, Pi at hab ahgk t‑nahto g Jiosh machs pi ap wo hekaj g t‑honshpadag k wabshaba hab ahgk matt g t‑kownalig Jesus wehhejed wo hekaj nat pi heg am t‑wehhejed muh.

column2: By his power God raised the Lord from the dead, and he will raise us up the same way.
column3: Jiosh at ab uhpam i wuhshad g t‑kownalig Jesus ab muhkig amjed k hab waꞌap wo i t‑wuwhas ahchim heg hekaj e‑gewkdag mat hekaj ab i wuhshad g Jesus.

column2: Don't you know your bodies are parts of Christ's body? Should I take the parts of Christ's body and join them to a prostitute? Absolutely not!
column3: Mt wo chum s‑mahchk mo g em‑honshpadag ab giꞌi ab g Christ ch d enigaj. Pegih, mt pi woho hab wo juh g e‑honshpadag mat ab wo i e wehnad g chehpaꞌawi.

column2: Don't you realize that anyone who has sex with a prostitute becomes “one body” with her? Remember that Scripture says, “The two will become one body.”
column3: Aha nam pi mahch mamtp hema i wo wehmaj woꞌiwua g chehpaꞌawi k d haha wo hemakok heg wehm. Si o shel am ahg ihda g Jiosh oꞌohana ch hab chuꞌig mo d hemako am Jiosh tahgio hegam mat wo e wehm wohpiwua.

column2: But whoever is joined to the Lord is one with him in spirit!
column3: K pi hab chum mahs machs hab wo masmak chehpaꞌawi wehm ahchim matt ab i t‑dagito Christ wui nach pi d hemako heg wehm.

column2: Stay away from sexual immorality! All other sins that people commit are outside of the body, but sexual immorality is a sin against your own body.
column3: Ni heg hekaj hab kaij mamt wo si e nuhkud id amjed mamt pi wabsh chum hedai wehm wo woꞌiwupad namt pi heg hekaj wo e hemakoj ha wehm k wo uamhu g e‑honshpadag k hab masma wo i e mehkod ab amjed g Christ.

column2: Don't you know that your body is a temple of the Holy Spirit that is within you, that you received from God?
column3: Mt wo chum s‑mahchk mo g Jiosh ab em‑mahkch g Hekia S‑apꞌekam Gewkdag. K heg am em‑eda kih. Pegih, k d cheopigaj g em‑honshpadag ch pi d wabsh hejel em‑eniga.

column2: You don't belong to yourself—a price was paid for you! So glorify God in your body!
column3: Jiosh at am i dagito g e‑alidag kots wui mat wo t‑doꞌibia. Kutt d haha wo hemajkamgajk ch heg hekaj ab wo si has i elid k wehhejed wo hekaj g t‑honshpadag.

column2: Now about what you wrote to me: “It's good not to marry.”
column3: Ia ant haha wo em‑ahgi hegai mam wa ni‑kakke ia ni‑oꞌohanidk.

column2: However, because of the temptation to sexual immorality, it is better that each man have his own wife, and each woman her own husband.
column3: K wabshaba haꞌi g ha‑tatchuidag si s‑gewkdag. K idam ha wehhejed baꞌich i s‑apꞌe mat wo e hohnt mat heg hekaj pi am hu wo i shul pi apꞌekam ch ed.

column2: The husband should meet his wife's sexual needs, and the wife her husband's.  The wife's body doesn't just belong to her, but her husband; and similarly the husband's body doesn't just belong to him but his wife.
column3: Kumt ab aꞌai e wui wo e dagito ahpim mam d e hohonikam no pi g em‑honshpadag d aꞌai em‑eniga ch pi d wabsh heheꞌejel em‑eniga. Mt hab s‑ap e tahtk ch wo e wehm kihk.

column2: So don't deprive each other, except by mutual consent for a while— for example because you want to spend time in prayer. Afterwards be together again so that Satan won't tempt you to sin because of your lack of self-control.
column3: Pi g aꞌai wo e daꞌad, heg hi wa mamtp am aꞌai wo e apꞌech mamt heꞌes i tash pi ab hu wo i e miabi mamt heg hab wo waꞌi juh hoꞌigeꞌidahuna k am hab hahawa ep wo masmak mam heki hu mat pi wo em‑gehg g ge Jiawul heg hekaj em‑tatchui.

column2: I'm telling you this not as a command, but as a concession.
column3: Pi ani ab hu em‑chehani mams wo ge hohont, heg hi wa mamtp wo tatchuad ch wo e hohont.

column2: However I wish that everyone was like me, but each person has their own gift from God—one has this gift, one has another.
column3: Mamt huꞌi pi wo ha wehm kihkamk hab masma mani ahni. K wabshaba g Jiosh pi wehs hab masma em‑apꞌechudch ch haꞌi em‑apꞌechudch mamt wo e hohont.

column2: To those who are not yet married, or who are widowed, I would say it is better if they remain like me.
column3: Nt wo haꞌichu em‑ahgi ahpim mam pi ha wehm kihkam ch ahpim mat koi g em‑wehm kihkam. Baꞌich o i s‑apꞌe mamt wo heheꞌejelk mani hab masma.

column2: But if they lack self-control, then they should get married—for it is better to marry than burn with desire.
column3: Mt wabshaba wo e hohont mamtp pi wo e nako mamt wo shohbi g e‑tatchui. Baꞌich o i s‑apꞌe mamt wo e hohont mamt pi wo e kudutad g e‑tatchuikaj.

column2: These are my instructions to those who are married—in fact not from me but the Lord: The wife should not leave her husband
column3: Do chehanigaj g t‑kownalig Jesus mamt pi wo ohhod g e‑wehm kihkam

column2: (or if she does, she should not re-marry, or she should return to her husband); and the husband should not leave his wife.
column3: k amtp wabshaba hab wo sha e juh k hemho wa pi hema ep wo hohnt o wo kunt k wabsh wo hejelk o an uhpam ep wo i e nodagi e‑wehm kihkam wui.

column2: Now, to the rest of you, (and this is me speaking, not the Lord), I would say, “If a Christian man has a non-Christian wife and she is willing to stay with him, he should not leave her.  And if a Christian woman has a non-Christian husband, and he is willing to stay with her, she should not leave her husband.” For a husband who is not a Christian, the marriage relationship is made holy by the Christian wife, and for a wife who is not a Christian, the marriage relationship is made holy by the Christian husband. Otherwise it would mean your children were impure, but now they are holy.
column3: Chum as pi d wo em‑wehm wohochuddamk g em‑wehm kihkam, mt pi am hu wo ha ohhod matp wo tatchuad mat an wo em‑wehmajk. Jiosh at am i apꞌech em‑wehhejed mat pi wo padch g em‑kihdag. T g Jiosh ab wo ha ui g em‑aꞌaliga mat d wo aꞌaligajk. T g em‑wehm kihkam pi wo ha padch.

column2: However if the non-Christian spouse leaves, let them leave. In such cases the Christian man or woman is not slavishly bound, for God has called us to live in peace.
column3: Mt wabshaba wo ha hiwigi mat wo s‑em‑ohhod matp wo tatchuad nam pi pi heg hekaj e wupulshch matp wo s‑em‑ohhod. Do tatchuij g Jiosh mamt wo s‑ap e tahtkkad id dahm jewed.

column2: Wives, who knows? You may save your husband! Husbands, who knows? You may save your wife!
column3: Kum pi mahch mas em‑hekaj ab wo s‑wohoch g Jiosh haꞌichu ahga k wo e doꞌibia.

column2: Apart from such cases, each of you should remain in the situation that the Lord has placed you, and continue to live the life to which God has called you. That's my instruction to all the churches.
column3: Pegih, tt am wabsh wo kia oidad mattp haschu d i wehhejedkam mat hekid ab i t‑gawulkai g Christ. Id ani wehsko ha mashcham g wohochuddam.

column2: Were you circumcised when you were converted? Don't become uncircumcised. Were you uncircumcised when you were converted? Don't become circumcised.  Circumcision doesn't mean anything, and uncircumcision doesn't mean anything. Keeping the commandments of God is what really matters.
column3: Pi o has d ahga mamtp wo pahl hikuchkask o pi wo pahl hikuchkask. Kumt pi wo chum ge gawul e juh id hekaj. Heg o d waꞌi si haꞌichu matt ab wo s‑wohog elidad g Jiosh.

column2: Everyone should remain in the position they were in when they were called.
column3: Mattp haschu d i wehhejedkam mat eda ab i t‑gawulkai g Jiosh ch heg s‑ap am hab wo junihid wehhejed.

column2: If you were a slave when you were called, don't worry—though if you have an opportunity to become free, take it.
column3: Mamtp hedai d wo ha‑neneholigak id dahm jewed ch wabsh pi heg hekaj wo si e ehꞌel ab s‑wohochudk g Jiosh haꞌichu ahga. Tp wabshaba am wo sha s‑em‑apꞌet mamt wo e wuhpulꞌo, mt am hab wo e juh.

column2: If you were a slave when the Lord called you, you are now free, working for the Lord. In the same way if you were called when you were free, you are now Christ's slave!
column3: Am g wo s‑chegitok mat em‑wulꞌo g Christ ab amjed g pi apꞌekam, chum ams d nehol. Wehsijj ach d hahawa neneholigaj g Christ, chum hems ahchim mach pi d ha‑neneholiga id dahm jewed.

column2: A price has been paid for you, so don't become a slave to anyone.
column3: Jiosh at ab uhpam t‑uꞌapa e wui heg hekaj e‑alidag muhkig. Pegih, pi att hegai wo shaꞌi hiwigi mas wo t‑shohbi mach d piongaj g Jiosh.

column2: Brothers and sisters, remain in the position you were in when you were called, living with God.
column3: Heg o chum hekid am t‑wehmaj. Kutt am nenaj ed s‑ap hab wo junihid g t‑chikpan matp haschu wud matt eda ab i s‑wohoch ihda s‑kehg haꞌichu ahgaj.

column2: Now about “people who are not married,”  I don't have a specific instruction from the Lord, so let me give you my opinion as someone who by the Lord's mercy is considered trustworthy.
column3: Neh, nt am haha wo em‑ahgi mam haschu ab ni‑kakke ab ha amjed hegam mo pi ha wehm kihkam. Pi o d chehanig ihda mant wo em‑ahgi. K wabshaba ab s‑ni‑hoꞌigeꞌid g t‑kownalig Jesus ch ab ni‑mahkch g amichudadag. Kunt heg hekaj wo em‑ahgi mo haschu baꞌich i s‑apꞌe.

column2: Because of the present difficult situation we are in I think it is best to just stay as you are.
column3: Shoꞌo waꞌi si geꞌej g t‑kudutalig hemu. Kuni heg hekaj hab elid mo baꞌich i s‑apꞌe mamt am hab wabsh wo i chuꞌigk mam has i masma.

column2: Are you already married? Don't try to get divorced. Are you unmarried? Don't look to get married.
column3: Mamtp wo ge wehm kihkamk ch pi am wo ohhod o pi wo ha wehm kihkamk ch pi an hu wo hema i chum gahghi.

column2: If you do get married, you haven't sinned. If an unmarried woman gets married, she hasn't sinned. But you will have many troubles in this current world and I would want to spare you these.
column3: K wabshaba pi d pi apꞌekam mamtp an wo bei g wehm kihkam. Hi wa g hohnta at ab baꞌich wo i wuhshad g haꞌichu pi apꞌedag. Kuni heg hi wa chum pi hab elid mams ab hu wo nam.

column2: I'm telling you, brothers and sisters, that time is short, and from now on for those who are married it may seem as if they are not married,
column3: Pi o am hu geꞌe wiꞌis g tash mat ia ep wo jiwia g Jiosh alidag jewed dahm. Kuni am i em‑gewkemhun mamt wo e nahtokchid heg wehhejed. Pi g wo shaꞌi hiwgid mas wo em‑shohbi g hohnta

column2: and those who weep as if they did not weep, and those that celebrated as if they had not celebrated, and those that bought as if they did not own,
column3: o g chikpan o g has tahhadkam o g em‑eniga.

column2: and those who are engaged with the world as if it is not fulfilling—for the present world order is passing away.
column3: Tt wo hekaj g jewed dahm haꞌichu k wabshaba pi ab hu wabsh wo si pihk t‑elidad nat pi wehs wabsh wo huhug.

column2: I would prefer you to be free from such worries. A man who is not married pays attention to what is important to the Lord, and how he can please the Lord.
column3: Chum ani em‑tatchuichud mamt pi haꞌichukaj wo e kudutad. Gohkpa o kahch g t‑chegitoi matt wo ge hohnigk. Kutt wabshaba wo t‑nako matt heg am hab wo waꞌi junihid chikpan am wehhejed g t‑kownalig Jesus mattp pi wo ha hohnigk.

column2: But a man who is married pays attention to what is important in this world, and how he can please his wife.
column3: Mattp hedai wo ha hohnt k hemho wa haꞌichu am hab waꞌap wo junihid wehhejed mat wo s‑hohhoꞌidad.

column2: As a result his loyalties are divided. Similarly an unmarried woman or girl pays attention to what is important to the Lord, so she may live a life dedicated both in body and spirit. But a married woman pays attention to what is important in this world, and how she can please her husband.
column3: Kumt ahpim uꞌuwi hab waꞌap wo e nako mamt ab wo gawulkdask ch heg am hab wo waꞌi junihid chikpan am wehhejed g t‑kownalig Jesus mamtp hedai pi wo ha kunk o koi wo ha kunt. Mtp wabshaba hedai wo ge kunk ch haꞌichu am hab ep wo junihid ha wehhejed mat wo s‑hohhoꞌidad.

column2: I'm telling you this for your benefit. I'm not trying to put a noose around your neck, but to show you the right thing to do so you can serve the Lord without being distracted.
column3: Id ani hab kaij nani pi tatchua mant am wo i em‑wehmt ch pi heg hekaj manis am haꞌichukaj em‑shoshobid. Tatchua ani mamt am hab wo junihid mo haschu d s‑apꞌekam ch pi wo hiwigi mas am haꞌichu wo em‑shohbi mamt am wehs wo i e dagito t‑kownalig Jesus wui.

column2: But if a man thinks he's behaving improperly with the woman he's engaged to, and if he thinks he will give in to his strong sexual desire, and if he thinks he ought to get married, he is not sinning by getting married.
column3: Mt wabshaba wo ha hiwigi g uꞌuwi e‑aꞌaliga mat wo ha kunt mamtp hab wo elidad mo d si tatchui nat pi s‑ap geꞌegeꞌehogat. Am o wa s‑apꞌe mat am hab wo e juh.

column2: But if a man stays true to his principles, and there is no obligation to marry, and has the power to keep his feelings under control and stay engaged to her, he does well not to marry.
column3: K wabshaba am wa s‑apꞌe mamt wo ha nuhkudad mamtp hab wo elidad mo s‑apꞌe no pi pi d tatchui.

column2: So the man who marries the woman he's engaged to does well, while the one who does not get married does better.
column3: Pegih, am o wa s‑apꞌe mamt wo ha hiwigi ch hi wa baꞌich i s‑apꞌe mat pi wo ha kunt.

column2: A wife is bound to her husband as long as he lives. But if her husband dies,  she is free to marry whoever she wants in the Lord.
column3: Matp hedai wo e hohont k d wo e‑wehm kihkamk am hugkam mat hekid hema wo i muh. K am hahawa s‑apꞌe mat ep wo bei g wehm kihkam, heg hi wa mat g e‑wehm wohochuddam an wo bei.

column2: But in my opinion she would be happier if she didn't re-marry—and I think I too have the Spirit of God when I say this.
column3: Mt wabshaba baꞌich wo i s‑apꞌe tahtkkad mamt pi ep wo bei g wehm kihkam. Neh, id o am ni‑tashogid g Hekia S‑apꞌekam Gewkdag.

column2: Now about “food sacrificed to idols.” So “we all have knowledge” about this subject. Knowledge makes us proud, but love strengthens us.
column3: Am ant haha wo em‑ahgi hegai mam ab ni‑kakke ab amjed hegai haꞌichu hugi mo g hemajkam an toꞌaw am chum iagchulidch g e‑jijoshga.

column2: If anyone thinks they know anything, they don't know as they really should know!
column3: Pi amki koi haꞌichu s‑mahch mamtp hab e elid mam s‑e‑mahch.

column2: But whoever loves God is known by God…
column3: Jiosh o s‑t‑mahch ahchim mattp ab si tatchua.

column2: So regarding eating food sacrificed to idols: we know that there are no such things as idols in the world, and that there is only one real God.
column3: Pegih, k pi d haꞌichu g ha‑jijoshga am t‑wehhejed nach pi s‑mahch mo g Jiosh d hemako.

column2: Even though there are some things called “gods,” whether in heaven or on earth—in fact there are many “gods” and “lords.”
column3: K eda muꞌi an haꞌichug g gewpkdag an dahm kahchim ch ed ch an jewed dahm mo hab e aꞌaga jijosh ch kokownal.

column2: But for us there is only one God, the Father, from whom everything was made, and he is the goal of our existence; and one Lord, Jesus Christ, through whom everything was made, and he is the means of our existence.
column3: Ch ahchim hi s‑mahch mo d hemako g Jiosh t‑ohg. K wehs haꞌichu d amjedkamaj. Kuch heg wehhejed in d dodakam. K g t‑kownalig Jesus Christ d hemako ch wehs haꞌichu nahto. K heg gahi wuhshanim g Jiosh ab t‑mahkch g wechij doakag.

column2: But not everyone has this “knowledge.”  Some who up to now have been so used to idols as a reality that when they eat food sacrificed to an idol, their conscience (which is weak) tells them they have defiled themselves.
column3: Pegih, msh haꞌi hi wa s‑mahch mo g ha‑jijoshga pi d haꞌichu am t‑wehhejed ch hekaj pi has e elid ch wabsh koꞌa hegai mo an e toꞌaw ha wehhejed. Sh haꞌi g em‑wehm wohochuddam pi am hu s‑ap s‑mahch mo pi d haꞌichu g ha‑jijoshga no pi heki hu waꞌi amjed ab has ha elid. Kumsh koꞌa hegai mo am e toꞌaw. Sh idam am em‑neid ch am em‑oidch hab e junihim ch eda hekaj e kudut no pi hab elid mo pi apꞌe.

column2: But food doesn't gain us God's approval! If we don't eat this food, we're not bad, and if we do eat this food, we're not good.
column3: Kumsh ahpim hab kaij mo pi has d ahga am Jiosh nena ed mamt wo huh ihda. Pegih, matp pi has d ahga k ch pi haꞌichu wo heki em‑wua mamt wabsh wo dagito.

column2: Just take care not to use this freedom you have to eat food sacrificed to idols to become offensive to those with a weaker attitude.
column3: Chum as hi wa s‑apꞌe hejel em‑wehhejed mamt wo huh ch wabshaba pi apꞌe mamt wo huh matp heg hekaj wo e kudut k wo i shul hegam mo pi hab masma s‑mahch ihda.

column2: If another believer sees you who have such “better knowledge”  eating food in an idol temple, won't his weak conscience be convinced to eat food sacrificed to idols?
column3: Idam atp hems am t‑oidk hab wo e juh ahchim mach haꞌichu s‑mahch k am hab wo juh mo haschu hab elid mo pi apꞌe. Pi att am hu wo i wahp k wo t‑gegos mo hebai i e koꞌa hegai mo an e toꞌaw ha wehhejed g ha‑jijoshga

column2: By your “better knowledge” the weaker believer is destroyed, a believer for whom Christ died.
column3: natt pi heg hekaj wo heki ha himch hegam mo pi gewpkdag e‑wohochudadag ed. Tsh eda g Christ ha wehhejed muh no pi s‑ha doꞌibiamk.

column2: In this way you sin against other believers, wounding their weaker consciences, and you sin against Christ.
column3: Kutt wo padch mo haschu hab chum s‑junimk am ha wehhejed mattp wo heki ha himch.

column2: So if eating food sacrificed to idols would cause my fellow believer to stumble, I will never eat such meat ever again, so that I don't offend any believer.
column3: Pi att hekid wo huh matp haschukaj wo heb hu hihi g t‑wepnag mat am t‑oidch hab wo e junihid.

column2: Am I not free? Am I not an apostle? Haven't I seen Jesus our Lord? Aren't you the results of my work in the Lord?
column3: Pi ani em‑ahgid mams am hab wo junihid hegai mani ahni haschu pi am hu hab wua. Ahni ani hab waꞌap pi hekaj g haꞌichu ni‑apꞌedag, chum anis d uhgchu ch geꞌe apꞌedag nat pi am i ni‑kei g Jiosh mant wo ahgachugad g Christ. Ni heg am neid am i dahm mat e chegito k i wuhsh. Kum ahpim d e doꞌibiakam heg hekaj haꞌichu ni‑ahga mani am ahgachug wehhejed g Jesus Christ.

column2: Even if I'm not an apostle to others, at least I am one to you. The proof of my being an apostle of the Lord is you!
column3: Chum as haꞌi pi wohochud mani d Jesus Christ kehsha, m wabshaba ahpim s‑wohochud nat pi em‑doꞌibia k hekaj am wohokamch mani d kehshaj.

column2: Here is my reply to those who question me about this:
column3: Id ani am ha ahgid hegam mo pi wohochud mani d Christ kehsha.

column2: Don't we have the right to be provided with food and drink?
column3: Ahchim mach d Christ chuhchai ach edgid g apꞌedag matt ab wo bei g t‑gegosig heg hekaj t‑chikpan.

column2: Don't we have a right to be accompanied by a Christian wife, like the rest of the apostles, the Lord's brothers, and Peter?
column3: Christ wepnag ch Peter ch haꞌi ehp g Christ chuhchai ash an uhꞌudch g e‑wehm kihkam mo eda hasko hihhim ch am ahgachug g Jiosh haꞌichu ahga. Kumsh am ha dagioꞌid.

column2: Is it only Barnabas and myself who have to work to support ourselves?
column3: Bani wa masma apꞌedag. Kuch eda ahchim g Barnabas wehm pi hekaj g t‑apꞌedag ch wabsh hejel t‑dagioꞌid.

column2: Which soldier ever had to pay his own salary? Who plants a vineyard and doesn't get to eat its fruits? Who feeds a flock and doesn't consume its milk?
column3: K eda wehs nahnko mahs chikpandam ab uꞌu g e‑gehgewi ab e‑chikpan amjed. Shondal am ha dagioꞌid ch g oidag chikpandam ab ha namkid heg hekaj mo haschu i bahijid ch g haꞌichu doakam ha nuhkuddam ha gegosid heg hekaj mo haschu ab i wuhshani.

column2: Am I just speaking from a human point of view? Doesn't the law say the same thing?
column3: Pi o d wabsh hemajkam hab ha‑elida ihda. An o hab chuꞌig heg eda Jiosh chehanig

column2: In the law of Moses it's written, “Don't muzzle the ox when it's threshing out the grain.” Was God just thinking about oxen?
column3: mat g Mosesbad an oꞌoha:

column2: Don't you know that those who work in temples receive their meals from temple offerings, and those that serve at the altar receive their portion of the sacrifice on the altar?
column3: Mt wo chum s‑mahchk mo hegam mo am chikpan geꞌe cheopi ch ed ab i neid g e‑gegosig heg amjed mo g hemajkam ab mahkch g Jiosh.

column2: In just the same way the Lord ordered that those who announce the good news should live from supporters of the good news.
column3: Pegih, k hab waꞌap masma am t‑chehani g t‑kownalig Jesus hemu. Ahchim mach am ahgachug g s‑kehg haꞌichu ahgaj g Jiosh attsh ab amjed wo i nei g t‑dagioꞌidadag.

column2: But I have not made use of any of these provisions, and I'm not writing about this to suggest it should be done in my case. I'd rather die than to have anyone take away my pride in not having received any benefit.
column3: Ni eda pi hekid shaꞌi hekaj ihda ni‑apꞌedag ch pi heg hekaj em‑ahgid ihda manis em‑chehani mamt wo i ni‑dagioꞌi hemu. Baꞌich i mant wo bihugim k wo muh kih hegai manis wo em‑kowlant id hekaj s‑kehg haꞌichu ahga.

column2: I have nothing to boast about in sharing the good news because it's something I feel compelled to do. In fact it's dreadful for me if I don't share the good news!
column3: Ab o ni‑chehani g Jiosh mant wo ahgachugad g haꞌichu ahgaj. Kunt wo si pi ap ni‑tahtkk mantp pi am hu hab wo junihid. Jiosh ash ab ep em‑chehani mamt wo t‑namkid ahchim mam ab t‑amjed kah g haꞌichu ahgaj. Ni wabshaba pi ab hu em‑tahni heg hekaj mant baꞌich wo i s‑ap ni‑tahtkk ab wabsh em‑mahkch.

column2: If I'm doing this work because of my own choice, then I have a reward. But if it wasn't my choice, and an obligation was placed on me,
column3: Mantp ahni hab i n‑ah mant am hab wo junihid ihda chikpan ch hekaj ab wo bei g ni‑gehgewi. K wabshaba g Jiosh ab ni‑chehani ch ab ni‑hiwig.

column2: then what reward do I have? It's the opportunity to share the good news without charging for it, not demanding my rights as a worker for the good news.
column3: Pegih, k id d ni‑gehgewi mani si s‑ap ni‑tahtk heg hekaj mani ab wabsh em‑mahkch g s‑kehg haꞌichu ahgaj g Jiosh. Heg ani hekaj pi hekaj g ni‑apꞌedag manis wo em‑kowlant.

column2: Even though I am free and serve no one, I have placed myself in service to everyone so that I might gain more.
column3: Pi ani hedai ha hiwig ch wabshaba wehs ha wehhejed ni‑pionchud mantp hems hab masma muꞌi ab wo i ha nohnogi Christ wui.

column2: To the Jews I behave like a Jew so that I might win Jews. To those who are under the law I behave as someone under the law (even though I am not obligated under the law), so that I might win those under the law.
column3: Ni am ha oidch hab ni‑junihim hegam mo am oid g heki hu t‑himdag ahchim Tutuligo mani hekid i ha wehmaj

column2: To those who don't operate according to the law, I behave like them, (though not disregarding God's law, but operating under the law of Christ), so that I might gain those who don't observe the law.
column3: ch am ha oidch hab ni‑junihim hegam mo pi am hu oid mani hekid i ha wehmaj mant hekaj ab wo i ha nohnogi Christ wui. K eda pi hab mahs manis pi ab hu wecho g Jiosh chehanig nani pi am hab junihim mo haschu ab i ni‑chehani g Christ.

column2: To those who are weak, I share in their weakness so that I may win the weak. I have ended up being “everyman” to everyone so that by using every possible means I might win some!
column3: Pi ant am hab wo junihid mat haschu wo ha kudutad, chum anis s‑mahch mo s‑apꞌe am ni‑wehhejed. Tp hems heg hekaj wo ni‑hiwigi mant am wo i ha wehmt. Wehs ani ha wepo masma hab ni‑wua mantp hems hab masma ab wo i ha nohnogi Christ wui wabsh chum has masma.

column2: I do all this for the sake of the good news so that I too may share in its blessings!
column3: Id ani wehs hab wua mant hekaj am wo ahgachugad g s‑kehg haꞌichu ahgaj g Jiosh matt t‑wehm wo bei g s‑ap tahhadkam.

column2: Wouldn't you agree that there are many runners in a race, but only one gets the prize? So run your best, so you may win!
column3: S‑mahch am mat g e melchuddam hab waꞌi masma wo bei gehgewi mat wo si e nakogad. Tt hab wa masma am wo t‑nakogad matt wehs am hab wo juh g Jiosh tatchui.

column2: Every competitor who participates in the games maintains a strict training discipline. Of course they do so to win a crown that doesn't last. But our crowns will last forever!
column3: Hegai mo hedai i tatchua mat wo bei g gehgewi at hemho wa wo e momoisha k wo e nuhkud wehs haꞌichu k ed. Neh, id o wehs hab e wua heg waꞌi wehhejed mamt ab wo wahki g gihko. T eda wabsh wo huhug. Ch wabshaba ahchim am hab t‑junihim heg wehhejed m at pi hekid wo huhug.

column2: That's why I run straight in the right direction. I fight accurately, not punching the air.
column3: Ni hekaj hab hi heg wa wepo mani shel med heg wui mant am wo nahto g ni‑mel k ab wo bei g ni‑mahkigdag. S‑mahch am mo g shonikkashdam pi tatchua mas wo heki wua g e‑shonihina. Ni ahni hab waꞌap pi tatchua manis wo heki wua g ni‑apꞌedag wehhejed g ni‑chikpan.

column2: I also treat my body severely to bring it under my control, for I don't want somehow to be disqualified after sharing the good news with everybody else.
column3: Shonikkashdam o ab si e nakog ch e momoisha. Ni ahni hab wa masma ni‑nakog Jiosh chikpan ed mat pi wo ni‑ohhod heg amjed am i dahm mant ab i em‑wai mamt am hab waꞌap wo junihid.

column2: Now I want to explain this to you, brothers and sisters. Our forefathers lived under the cloud, and they all passed through the sea.
column3: Am am wa chum s‑mahch matsh wa haschu has e juh am ha tahgio g t‑shohshon matsh wa g Mosesbad am i ha wanim. Jiosh ash hab masma ha nuhkud ch ha wanimed mash wa g chewagi am ha baꞌich him. Kutsh am gahi i huhud g geꞌe shuhdagi.

column2: Symbolically then they were baptized “into Moses” in the cloud and in the sea.
column3: Id atsh hab ha juni mat hekaj ab wo s‑wohog elidad g Mosesbad.

column2: They all ate the same spiritual food
column3: Wehsijj ash am koꞌa hegai haꞌichu hugi mash g Jiosh ab ha mahk

column2: and drank the same spiritual drink, for they “drank from a spiritual rock” that accompanied them. That rock was Christ.
column3: ch wehsijj ab ihꞌe hegai shuhdagi mash ab geꞌe waw t amjed daꞌiwuni ch s‑wawinig. Ihda waw o wepogidas g Christ mo g doakgaj chum hebai ha wehmaj ch ab ha mahkch g hoꞌigeꞌidalig.

column2: However God wasn't happy with most of them, and they perished in the desert.
column3: Tsh wa eda muꞌijj pi ab hu wohog el g Jiosh. Tsh hekaj si pi ha hohhoꞌi idam k ab ha hugio tohono jewed ch ed mash an oiopohim. Sh g ha‑hohon am wabsh e dagitohim.

column2: Now these experiences are examples to us to show us we should not desire what is evil, as they did.
column3: Pegih, wehs ihda o d wabsh chehgida mat wo t‑shohbi matt pi ab hu wo i tatchua g pi apꞌekam mash wa hab e wua idam

column2: You must not worship idols, as some of them did, as it's recorded in Scripture: “The people feasted and drank, and indulged in pagan worship.”
column3: ch pi ab hu wui wo t‑hoꞌigeꞌidahu mo haschu pi d Jiosh mash wa hab e wua haꞌijj idam. Bo chuꞌig an Jiosh oꞌohana ed matsh wa am dadhaiwua k huh mat haschu am toꞌi hegai mo chum jioshchud k am i wuwhag k e waila.

column2: We must not commit sexual sins, as some of them did, and as a result 23,000 died in one day.
column3: Am hu hebai ehp, sh haꞌijj wabsh chum hedai ha wehm woꞌiwup. Tsh g Jiosh am haꞌi ha cheha matsh wo ha kokda. Tsh gokko gamai waik mihl (23, 000) e koꞌij hemako tash ed.

column2: Nor should we push God to the limit, as some of them did, and were killed by snakes.
column3: Am hu hebai ehp, tsh haꞌijj bagach g Jiosh. Tsh heg hekaj am apꞌech matsh wo ha kiꞌikka g kohkꞌoi k wo ha hugio.

column2: Don't complain at God, as some did, and died at the hands of the destroying angel.
column3: Am hu hebai ehp, sh haꞌijj pi ap has ahg g Jiosh hab kaijch mash pi ap ha dagioꞌid. Tsh heg hekaj am apꞌech matsh g anghil wo ha hugio. Mt heg hekaj pi am hu ha oidch hab wo e junihid.

column2: All the things that happened to them are examples to us and were written down to warn us, we who are living close to the end of time.
column3: Id ash wehs an oꞌohanas mat wo t‑shohbidad matt pi hab wo junihid g pi apꞌekam ahchim mach hemu in d dodakam am wehs ha oidch.

column2: So if you think you're strong enough to stay standing—be careful you don't fall!
column3: Haꞌijj amsh hab e elid mam s‑gewpkdag am e‑wohochudadag ed. Mt wabshaba wo si s‑e nenꞌoidk mamt pi wo i e jushadkad k pi wo i gei am pi apꞌekam ch ed no pi wehsijj t‑aꞌappem g Jiawul.

column2: You won't experience any greater temptation than anyone else, and God is trustworthy. He won't allow you to be tempted more than you can bear, and when you are tempted, he will provide for you a way out so you can stay strong.
column3: Wehs hegai aꞌappema mo ab t‑aihim o chum hedai ab aꞌahe. K wabshaba g Jiosh hab kaij matsh wo t‑nuhkudad ch heg hekaj pi hiwgid mas wo t‑aꞌappe am dahm matt heꞌes wo i t‑nako ch ab t‑mahkch g gewkdag matt wo nakog k wo t‑doꞌibia heg amjed.

column2: So my good friends, stay away from idol worship.
column3: Pegih, ni‑wepnag mani si em‑tatchua, pi g ab hu wui wo shaꞌi e hoꞌigeꞌidahunad hegai mo haschu pi d Jiosh.

column2: I'm talking to sensible people, so you decide whether I'm telling the truth.
column3: Am g wo i aꞌamichud ihda nam pi haꞌichu s‑aꞌamichud.

column2: When we give thanks for the cup we use in the Lord's Supper, don't we share in the blood of Christ? When we break the communion bread, don't we share in the body of Christ?
column3: Ab ach hoꞌigeꞌid g Jiosh ch ab si ihm g alidaj mach eda hab wua g mihshmda chemait hugi no pi hab d ahga mat am i dagito g e‑hon kots t ab k am iawua g e‑ehꞌed mat am t‑wehhejed muh.

column2: By eating from one loaf of bread, we show that even though we are many, we are one body.
column3: Do waꞌi hemako hegai mat am t‑wehhejed muh. Ch ahchim am t‑chehgidch mach am wehmaj d hemako am t‑wehm hab wuadch g t‑mihshmda chemait hugi.

column2: Look at the people of Israel. Don't those who eat the sacrifices made on the altar share together?
column3: Jiosh atsh am ha cheha g t‑shohshon mat wo ha kokda g haꞌichu doakam k hekaj wo iagchul g e‑chuꞌijig wehhejed k haha wo huh hegai chuhkug. K hegam mo koꞌa ab ihm g Jiosh.

column2: What am I saying then? That anything sacrificed to idols means anything, or that an idol has any real existence? Of course not!
column3: Pegih, k hegam mo ab ha wui iagchulid g e‑jijoshta ab ha ihm koꞌadch g e‑iagchulida. K eda pi d haꞌichu g ha‑jijoshta.

column2: The pagans are sacrificing to demons, and not to God. I don't want you to have anything to do with demons!
column3: Ab o wabsh ha ihm g jijawul pi e mahchch mas has e wua. Kuni pi em‑tatchuid mams wo ha wehm ab ha ihm g jijawul koꞌadch hegai mo ab ha toꞌid.

column2: You can't drink the Lord's cup as well as the cup of demons; you can't eat from the Lord's table as well as the table of demons.
column3: T‑kownalig Jesus Christ o ab t‑mahkch ihda t‑mihshmda chemait hugi. K pi shaꞌi hiwgidas mams wo ha wehmajk amai mo ab ha ihm g e‑jijoshga koꞌadch hegai mo ab ha doꞌid.

column2: Are we trying to make the Lord jealous? Are we stronger than he is?
column3: Shahag wepo mam tatchua mamt wo hehgamch g Jiosh ab ha ihmadch g jijawul mamtp hedai ha wehm koꞌa mo haschu ab wui e toꞌaw g ha‑jijoshga. S‑e g wo nenꞌoidk no pi baꞌich i s‑gewkdag g Jiosh mam ahpim ch wo s‑koꞌokam em‑namkid.

column2: Some say, “I'm free to do anything”—but not everything is appropriate! “I'm free to do anything”—but not everything is constructive!
column3: Msh haꞌi hab chechꞌe mo wehs haꞌichu hiwgidas matp haschu wehhejed pi an hu haꞌichug g chehanig. Nt wabshaba wo em‑ahgi mo pi wehs haꞌichu s‑apꞌe am t‑wehhejed. Wehs haꞌichu o hiwgidas ch wabshaba pi wehs d wo i t‑wehmtadagk.

column2: You shouldn't look out for yourself, but for your neighbor.
column3: Am g wo s‑chegitok g chum hedai ha‑apꞌedag ch pi wabsh hejel e‑tatchui.

column2: Eat whatever is sold in the market without asking questions because of your conscience,
column3: Oi g am wabsh wo huhgi matp haschu am e gagda nolawtakud ch ed k pi wo e kudu mas hebai e bei. Pi o ab hu em‑ab mams ab wo ha kakke mas d hegai mo ab e toꞌid g ha‑jijoshga.

column2: for “the earth and everything in it belong to God.”
column3: An o hab chuꞌig Jiosh oꞌohana ed mo wehs haꞌichu d enigaj.

column2: If a non-Christian invites you to a meal, and you feel like going, eat whatever you are served, without asking questions because of your conscience.
column3: Mamtp wo tatchuad ch am wo e gegosido ha‑kih am hegam mo pi d e doꞌibiakam ch ab em‑waid. Kumt wabsh wo huh matp haschu ab wo i em‑toꞌi k pi ab hu wo ha kakke mas ab e toꞌid g ha‑jijoshga, wabsh pi wo e kudu mas hebai be k ab em‑mah.

column2: But if someone tells you, “This food has been sacrificed to idols,” don't eat it for the sake of the one who mentioned it and for conscience' sake.  His conscience I mean, not yours. For why should my freedom be determined by someone else's conscience?
column3: T wabshaba hema ab wo sha si em‑ahgi mat ab e toꞌi g ha‑jijoshga, mt pi wo huh mat heg hekaj pi wo e kudu hegai mo em‑ahgid. Pegih, mtp hems haꞌi hab wo chei, “Ms haschu ahgk hig wo ge has ni‑ahgad heg hekaj mani haschu i koꞌa mani eda heg hekaj ab hoꞌigeꞌid g Jiosh?

column2: If I choose to eat with thankfulness, why should I be criticized for eating what I'm thankful to God for?
column3: Kunis haschu ahgk wo ni‑shohbi heg wabsh hekaj mam e kudut?”

column2: So whether you eat or drink or whatever you do, make sure to do everything to the glory of God.
column3: Pegih, woho o wa mach apꞌedag matt wabsh chum haschu wo koꞌad. K wabshaba ab t‑ab matt ab wo si haꞌichuch g Jiosh wabsh chum haschu k ed, chum hems heg hekaj mach haschu i koꞌad ch haschu i ihꞌe.

column2: Don't cause offense, whether it's to Jews or Greeks or the church of God—
column3: Am g wabsh s‑ap wo kihkad ch pi haꞌichu am hu hab wo junihid mas heg hekaj hedai am hab wo juh g pi apꞌekam, chum hems hegam mo pi d e doꞌibiakam.

column2: just as I try to please everybody in all I do. I don't think of what benefits me, but what benefits others, so that they may be saved.
column3: Bamt wo masmak mani ahni. Pi ani am hu waꞌi hejel ni‑chegito ch wabshaba wehs s‑ha chegito g hemajkam. Bani wa ni‑wua matp hems heg hekaj wo s‑hohhoꞌi mani has ni‑wua k ab wo s‑wohoch g haꞌichu ni‑ahga k wo e doꞌibia.

column2: You should imitate me, just as I imitate Christ.
column3: Am g wo ni‑oidk hab e wuad hab masma mani ahni Christ oidch hab ni‑junihim.

column2: I'm grateful that you always remember me and that you are keeping to the teachings just as I passed them on to you.
column3: Ab ani si has em‑elid mamsh chum hekid s‑ni‑chegito ch am oidch hab e junihim ihda himdag mant am em‑wui uꞌapa.

column2: I do want you to understand that Christ is the head of every man, the man is the head of the woman, and God is the head of Christ.
column3: Mt wabshaba wo chum s‑mahchk mo g cheoj am dahm g uwi. K g Christ am dahm g cheoj. K g Jiosh am wehs haꞌichu dahm.

column2: A man's head is dishonored if he prays or prophesies with his head covered.
column3: Id amt wo chehgidch mam eda e mihshmad. Mt heg hekaj ahpim chechoj pi ab hu wo ha maꞌishchid g e‑mohmi mam hekid i e hoꞌigeꞌidahun ch am ep ahg g Jiosh haꞌichu ahga. Dat wo s‑ta edam haꞌichuk mamtp ab wo ha maꞌishchid.

column2: A woman's head is dishonored if she prays or prophesies with her head uncovered—it's just as if she had her hair shaved off.
column3: Kumt ahpim uꞌuwi hi ab wo ha maꞌishchid g e‑mohmi mam hekid i ha kaichudch e hoꞌigeꞌidahun ch am ep ahg g Jiosh haꞌichu ahga. Bat wa masma wo s‑ta edamak mamt wo s‑wohlim hih g e‑moꞌo mamtp pi ab hu wo ha maꞌishchid.

column2: If a woman's head is not covered, then she should have her head shaved. If it's scandalous for a woman to be shorn or shaven, then she should have her head covered.
column3: Pegih, mt ab wo e maꞌishchid ch wo e mihshmad k heg hekaj pi wo si e el.

column2: A man shouldn't cover his head, because he is the image and glory of God, while the woman is the glory of the man.
column3: Kumt ahpim chechoj pi ab hu wo ha maꞌishchid g e‑mohmi e mihshmadch no pi g Jiosh am t‑eda chehgidch g e‑gewkdag. Mt wabshaba ahpim uꞌuwi ab wo e maꞌishchid nam pi ab wecho g chechoj ch ab chehgidch g ha‑gewkdag.

column2: Man didn't come from woman, but woman came from man;  and man was not created for the woman, but the woman was created for the man.
column3: Jiosh at wehpeg nahto g cheoj k heg amjed ab i wuhshad g uwi k nahto am wehhejed g cheoj.

column2: That's why the woman should have this sign of authority on her head out of respect for the watching angels.
column3: Ab o em‑neid g anghil. Kumt ahpim uꞌuwi am wo ha chehgi ab ha maꞌishch g e‑mohmi mam ab ha wecho g chechoj.

column2: Even so, from the Lord's perspective, the woman is as essential as the man, and the man as essential as the woman.
column3: K eda hab d elidaj g Jiosh mat g cheoj ch uwi ab aꞌai wo e hiwgad ch ab aꞌai wo i e wehmajk.

column2: As the woman came from the man, so the man comes from the woman —but more importantly everything comes from God.
column3: Woho o wa mat g Jiosh ab i wuhshad g uwi ab amjed g cheoj. K wabshaba g chechoj ab hahawa uwi t amjed i wuwhag. K wehs haꞌichu ab d Jiosh amjedkam.

column2: Judge for yourselves: is it appropriate for a woman to pray to God with her head uncovered?
column3: Am g wo oidahid ihda mo pi hab chum chuꞌig mas g uwi ab wo e hoꞌigeꞌidahu Jiosh wui pi ab hu maꞌishch g e‑moꞌo.

column2: Doesn't nature itself indicate that a man with long hair disgraces himself?
column3: S‑mahch ach mo g cheꞌechew moꞌo s‑ta edama am wehhejed g cheoj

column2: However a woman with long hair brings herself glory, because her hair is given to her as a covering.
column3: ch wabshaba am wa s‑apꞌe g uwi wehhejed no pi ab mahkch g Jiosh mat hekaj ab wo e maꞌishchid g moꞌoj.

column2: But if anyone wants to argue about this, we don't have any other custom than this, and neither do any other of God's churches.
column3: Pi ani ahpim waꞌi em‑mashcham ihda. Wehsko ani am ha mashcham mo hebai g t‑wehm wohochuddam e hehemapad. Kush wehsijj g Christ chuhchai hab masma ha mashcham. T hab pi hedai ab hu wo chum t‑neꞌowi heg hekaj.

column2: Now in giving you the instructions that follow I can't commend you, because when you meet together you cause more harm than good!
column3: Msh am haꞌichu ep pi ap hab wua mam am e hehemapad.

column2: First of all, I hear that when you have church meetings that you are split into different factions, and I believe there's some truth to this.
column3: Wehpeg ant id hab wo ah mani kah mamsh haꞌi ab e wui gegok am e nanmekch. Ni am wa heꞌes s‑wohochud ihda.

column2: Of course such splits among you must happen so those who are genuine can prove themselves by their evidence!
column3: Hemho wa at am wo i wuhsh g hab mahs kudutadag em‑shahgid mat am wo i e tashogi mo hedai pi apꞌe.

column2: When you meet together you're not really celebrating the Lord's Supper at all.
column3: Naꞌams hab elid mam s‑ap hab wua g chemait hugi hekid i e nanmekch ch amsh eda pi ap am hab junihim.

column2: Some want to eat first before everyone else, leaving others hungry. Still others get drunk.
column3: Wehpeg amsh e wehm e gegosid ch eda pi aꞌai e hoꞌid ch haꞌi wabsh s‑kokwog ch haꞌi nawkoꞌo ch haꞌi bihugkoꞌo.

column2: Don't you have your own houses to eat and drink in? Do you look down on God's church, and humiliate those who are poor? What should I tell you? That you're doing really well? I have nothing good to say about you for doing this!
column3: Bo wa masma tasho mam pi ab hu has ha elid g e‑wehm wohochuddam ch wabsh si ha edawua hegam mo am d wa shoꞌigkam. Mt hemho wa ab wo e chuꞌijigch id hekaj. Baꞌich o i s‑apꞌe mamt wo e gegos heheꞌejel e‑kihki am k am hab wo juh g chemait hugi mam am e nanmek.

column2: For I received from the Lord what I passed on to you: the Lord Jesus on the night he was betrayed took some bread.
column3: Am ani wa em‑mashcham hegai mo wa g t‑kownalig Jesus am ni‑tashogid ab amjed ihda chemait hugi himdag. Am atsh i shonwua heg i hudunk ab mamtki wa wo gagda matki wo e muhkid. Hegam mash wa ab wui e dagitokch atsh am i e hemapai. Kutsh g Jesus am i bei g chemait

column2: After giving thanks, he broke the bread into pieces and said, “This bread is my body, which is given for you. Remember me by doing this.”
column3: k am i hahai ab hoꞌigeꞌidk g Jiosh k hab kaij, “Do ni‑honshpadag ihda mamt am i em‑hahaini. Id ani hab ahgch hab kaij mant wo ni‑muhkid am em‑wehhejed. Ab g wo huhgi ihda hahainig k id chum hekid am hab wo junihid mamt hekaj wo s‑ni‑chegitok.”

column2: In the same way he took the cup, after the meal, and said, “This cup is the new agreement sealed with my blood. Remember me when you drink it.
column3: Tsh wa woho hab e juh. Kutsh am hahawa bei g tahsa k hab kaij, “Do ni‑ehꞌed ihda nawait. Id ani hab ahgch hab kaij mat g ni‑ehꞌed wo e iawua. T g Jiosh heg hekaj am hab wo juh hegai mo wa hab kaij matsh hab wo em‑juni. Ab g wo ihꞌi ihda k id chum hekid am hab wo junihid mamt wo s‑ni‑chegitok.” Neh, bo kaij g t‑kownalig Jesus.

column2: For every time you eat this bread and drink from this cup you announce the Lord's death, until he returns.”
column3: Kuch hekid am hab i wua ihda chemait hugi ch am tasho wohokamchud mat t‑wehhejed muh ch ab aihim mat ep wo jiwia.

column2: So anyone who eats the bread or drinks from the Lord's cup in a dishonorable way will be guilty of doing wrong against the body and blood of the Lord.  Let each person examine themselves, and then let them eat the bread and drink from the cup.
column3: Pegih, tt am wo si hejel i t‑mamche machs wa woho ab haꞌichuchud g t‑kownalig Jesus k am hab haha wo juh g chemait hugi. Tsh ab wo moht g chuꞌijig matp hedai pi ap hab wo wuad ihda chemait hugi no pi pi haꞌichuchud mat am dagito g e‑hon kots wui k am iawua g e‑ehꞌed mat t‑wehhejed muh.

column2: Those who eat and drink bring judgment on themselves if they don't recognize their relationship with the body of the Lord.
column3: Tt am wo ai g s‑koꞌok t‑namkidadag mattp hab wo juh g chemait hugi pi amichudch mat am t‑wehhejed muh g t‑kownalig Jesus.

column2: That's the reason why many of you are weak and sick, and some even have died.
column3: Heg am hekaj muꞌijj kokꞌo ch pi ab hu gewpk ch haꞌijj heki hu koi.

column2: However, if we really examined ourselves, we would not be judged like this.  But when we are judged, we are being disciplined by the Lord so that we won't be condemned along with the world.
column3: Bat wa masma hab wo t‑juh g Jiosh hab ahgk matt wo dagito g pi ap t‑chuꞌijig k pi gam hu hab wo i t‑juh ab amjed g Jiosh hab masma mat hegam mat pi ab hu wui wo i e nohnogi. Pi at hab masma s‑koꞌokam ab wo t‑namkid g Jiosh mattp hems wehpeg am wo si heheꞌejel i t‑mamche mach has masma.

column2: So my brothers and sisters, when you meet together to eat the Lord's Supper, wait for each other.
column3: Pegih, ni‑wepnag, am amt wo aꞌai e nenida k wehs e wehm hab wo juh g chemait hugi.

column2: If anyone is hungry, then eat at home so that when you meet together you won't bring condemnation on yourselves. I'll give you more directions when I visit.
column3: Matp hema d wo bihugimkamk ch wo e gegos ab e‑kih ab mat koi wo e ai g em‑namki. Mt am hahawa pi heg hekaj ab hu wo e chuꞌijigch. Am ant haha wo i apꞌech mam haschu ab ep i ni‑kakke hekid i em‑neidk.

column2: Now about “spiritual gifts.”  My brothers and sisters, I want to explain this to you.
column3: Ab am wa ep ni‑kakke ab amjed hegai gewkdag mo g Hekia S‑apꞌekam Gewkdag ab t‑mahkch matt ab aꞌai wo i t‑wehmajk. Tatchua ani mamt wo s‑mahchk g wohokam ab amjed ihda.

column2: You know that when you were pagans, you were deceived, being led astray by worshiping idols who couldn't even speak.
column3: Idani am hahawa s‑mahch mam wa haꞌichukaj am i e wanimed mam eda ab has ha elid mam haschu i chum jijoshchud.

column2: Let me make it clear to you: no one who speaks in the Spirit of God says, “Curse Jesus!” and no one can say, “Jesus is Lord!” except by the Holy Spirit.
column3: K wabshaba pi d Hekia S‑apꞌekam Gewkdag ch am i em‑wanimed namt wa ge e nako mams wo wohokamch mo g Jesus d Jiosh. Hegam mo pi edgid g Hekia S‑apꞌekam Gewkdag o hab elid mo g Jesus am gawulkdas ab Jiosh t amjed. Kuch wabshaba ahchim mach edgid s‑mahch mo g Jesus d Jiosh.

column2: Now there are different kinds of spiritual gifts, but they come from the same Spirit.
column3: Ab o t‑mahkch g Hekia S‑apꞌekam Gewkdag g gewkdag matt hab wo junihid g nahnko mahs haꞌichu am wehhejed g Jiosh.

column2: There are different kinds of ministries, but they come from the same Lord.
