column3: K g t‑kownalig Jesus am apꞌechudch matt has masma am hab wo junihid.

column2: There are different ways of working, but they come from the same God, who is at work in all of them.
column3: K d nahnko mahs chikpan mach am hab junihim ch wabshaba wehs ab d amjedkamaj g Jiosh.

column2: The Spirit is given to each of us and is revealed for the good of all.
column3: Heg o ab t‑mahkch g Hekia S‑apꞌekam Gewkdag. K id am t‑gewpkadch ch ab heheꞌejel t‑mahkch matt has wo t‑junihid ch am aꞌai wo i t‑wehmajk. Kuch s‑mahch mo am t‑eꞌeda g Hekia S‑apꞌekam Gewkdag no pi ab t‑mahkch g gewkdag.

column2: One person is given by the Spirit the ability to speak words of wisdom. Another is given a message of knowledge by the same Spirit.
column3: Ab o haꞌijj t‑mahkch matt wo s‑chu aꞌamichud k am wo tashogi g s‑hasig haꞌichu ch ab haꞌijj t‑mahkch matt wo si s‑mahchk ch ahgachugad g Jiosh haꞌichu ahga.

column2: Another receives the gift of strongly trusting in God by the same Spirit. Another receives gifts of healing from that one Spirit.
column3: Ab o haꞌijj t‑mahkch g geꞌe wohochudadag ch ab haꞌijj t‑mahkch matt wo ha doaj

column2: Another is given the ability to perform miracles. Another receives the gift of prophecy. Another is given the gift of spiritual discernment. Another receives the ability to speak different languages while another is given the gift of interpreting languages.
column3: o g s‑hasig haꞌichu hab ep wo junihid. Ab o haꞌijj heheꞌejel t‑mahkch g haꞌichu e‑ahga matt wo ahgad ch ab haꞌijj t‑mahkch matt wo neneokad g pi t‑machiga neꞌokikaj ch ab haꞌijj t‑mahkch matt wabsh wo s‑amich hegam neꞌoki k am wo i tashogi k ch ab haꞌijj t‑mahkch matt wo s‑mahchk mo haschu ahga ab amjed g Hekia S‑apꞌekam Gewkdag ch haschu pi ab hu amjed.

column2: But all of these gifts are the work of the one and the same Spirit, sharing with each person as he alone chooses.
column3: Neh, wehs ihda o ab d amjedkamaj g Hekia S‑apꞌekam Gewkdag. K heg ab heheꞌejel t‑mahkch mo has i mahs chikpan am hab s‑junimk ab gai t‑wuhshanim.

column2: Just like the human body is one unit but has many parts—all the parts of the body even though there are many of them, make up one body—so is Christ.
column3: S‑mahch ach mo g t‑honshpadag muꞌi nahnko chuhchuꞌidag ch wabshaba d waꞌi hemako. Kuch hab wa masma wehsijj d hemako ahchim matt ab i t‑wehnad g Christ.

column2: For it was through one Spirit that we were all baptized into one body. It doesn't matter whether we are Jews or Greeks, slave or free—we all were given the one Spirit to drink.
column3: Muꞌijj am hi wa pi d Tutuligo. Tt wabshaba pi wo t‑nako machs hab wo chei mam pi d t‑wehm wohochuddam. Haꞌijj am hi wa d nenehol. K wabshaba pi has d ahga mam has i mahs ch ab i s‑wohoch g Jiosh. Heg at wehsijj ab i t‑hemakoch. K hahawa heg wa wepo mach d Jesus honshpadag. K g Hekia S‑apꞌekam Gewkdag wehsijj an t‑uꞌukch.

column2: The body is not made of one part, but many parts.
column3: Kuch eda nahnko mahs haꞌichu chikpan hab masma mo g nahnko chuhchuꞌidaj g t‑honshpadag.

column2: If the foot were to say, “Because I'm not a hand, I'm not part of the body,” would that make it not part of the body?
column3: T‑tahtad o pi wepo haꞌichu hab wua mo g t‑nohnhoi. Kuch wabshaba wehs ha tatchua.

column2: If the ear were to say, “Because I'm not an eye, I'm not part of the body,” would that make it not part of the body?
column3: K g t‑nahnk gawul haꞌichu hab wua mo g t‑wuhpui.

column2: If the whole body was an eye, how could you hear anything? If the whole body was an ear, how could you smell anything?
column3: Kuch wabshaba wehs ha tatchua natt ge has masma haꞌichu wo kah mattp pi wo sha ha nahnkk ch pi has masma wo hewagi mattp pi wo sha ha dahkk.

column2: But God has arranged each part in the body, every last one of them, placing them just as he wanted.
column3: Jiosh at am nahto g oꞌodham k hab masma hab juh g nahnko chuhchuꞌidag ab t‑honshpadag ab.

column2: If they were all the same part, what would happen to the body?  However, since there are many parts, they make up the body.
column3: K wehs ab i e wehnadch g hab t‑chuhchuꞌidag no pi d hemako g t‑honshpadag.

column2: The eye can't tell the hand, “I don't need you,” or the head tell the feet, “I don't need you.”
column3: Pi ach hegam waꞌi tatchua t‑wuhpui ch wabshaba g t‑nohnhoi ehp k ch pi heg waꞌi tatchua t‑moꞌo ch wabshaba g t‑tahtad ehp.

column2: Quite the opposite: some of those parts of the body that seem the most insignificant are the most essential.
column3: Haꞌi o pi gewpkdag g hab t‑chuhchuꞌidag ch wabshaba hab wa masma d si t‑tatchui.

column2: In fact those parts of the body we do not consider to be decent to reveal we “honor” more by covering them up—what is indecent we treat with greater modesty!
column3: Kuch s‑ap ha nuhkud ch ha maꞌishch mat pi wo mahsk hegam hab chuhchuꞌidag mo pi ta neidagma.

column2: What's presentable doesn't need such covering up. God has so arranged the body that more honor is given to the parts that are less presentable.
column3: Pi ach hab masma s‑ha nenꞌoid hegam hab chuhchuꞌidag mo pi has d ahga mat wo e neidad.

column2: This is so there wouldn't be any conflict within the body—the different parts should care equally for each other.
column3: Wehs ach ha tatchua g hab t‑chuhchuꞌidag mat wehs e wehm s‑ap wo chikpanad.

column2: So when one part is suffering, all the other parts of the body suffer with it, and when one part is treated well, then all the other parts of the body are happy too!
column3: Pegih, bach wa masma chum t‑wehm s‑ap chikpan ch wehs t‑wehm wo t‑shoꞌigch mattp hema haꞌichukaj wo t‑shoꞌigch. Kutt wehs t‑wehm wo s‑hehgigk mamtp hema ab wo si s‑ap has t‑ah.

column2: Now you are the body of Christ, and each one makes up a part of it.
column3: Pegih, wehsijj ach d hemako g Jesus Christ wehm ch heg wa wepo mach d honshpadaj ch heheꞌejel d nahnko chuhchuꞌidaj.

column2: In the church, God has arranged first for some to be apostles, secondly for some to be prophets, thirdly teachers. Then there are those who perform miracles, those with healing gifts, those who can help others, those good at administration, and those who can speak different languages.
column3: Jiosh at wehs ab i t‑mahkhi matt haschu hab wo junidahid. K id d si wehs ha dahm t‑chikpan mach haꞌi d Jesus Christ chuhchai ch am ahgachugch g haꞌichu ahga ab amjed. K id ab oidch d t‑chikpan mach haꞌi d Jiosh haꞌichu ahga i tashogiddam. K id ab oidch d ep t‑chikpan mach haꞌi d Jiosh haꞌichu ahga ha mashchamdam. Haꞌijj ach s‑hasig haꞌichu hab wua ch haꞌijj uꞌukch g gewkdag matt wo ha doaj ch haꞌijj am i ha wehmaj haꞌi ehp ch haꞌijj am haꞌichu aꞌapꞌechud ha shahgid g t‑wehm wohochuddam ch haꞌijj g pi t‑machiga neꞌokikaj neneok.

column2: Not everyone is an apostle, or a prophet, or a teacher, or able to perform miracles.
column3: Pi att wehsijj gam hu mehk wo ahgachugad g Jiosh haꞌichu ahga ch pi wehsijj d Jiosh haꞌichu ahga i tashogiddam ch pi wehsijj d Jiosh haꞌichu ahga ha mashchamdam ch pi wehsijj uꞌukch g gewkdag matt hab wo junihid g s‑hasig haꞌichu

column2: Not all have healing gifts, or the ability to speak languages, or to interpret languages.
column3: o wo ha doaj ch pi wehsijj neneok g pi t‑machiga neꞌokikaj ch pi wehsijj ab mahks g amichudadag matt wo tashogi idam neꞌoki.

column2: But you should set your hearts on the most significant gifts. So now I will show you a far better way.
column3: K wabshaba haꞌi idam mahkigdag baꞌich d i ha wehmtadag g t‑wehm wohochuddam. Kutt heg hekaj baꞌich wo i tatchua matt wo hekaj hegam. K eda g pihk elidadag wehs baꞌich d i si haꞌichu.

column2: If I were to have eloquence in human languages—even the language of angels—but have no love, then I would only be an echoing gong or a clashing cymbal.
column3: Neh, ttp hems wo t‑nako matt wo neneokad g nahnko mahs oꞌodham ha‑neꞌokikaj o chum hems g anghil ha‑neꞌoki. T wabshaba hegai t‑neꞌoki heg wo wa wepok mo g s‑nakosig haꞌichu am e gew mattp pi wo edgidad g pihk elidadag.

column2: If I were to speak prophecies, to know every secret mystery and be completely knowledgeable, and if I were able to have so much faith I could move mountains, but have no love, then I am nothing.
column3: Dach wabsh pi haꞌichu mattp pi wo edgidad g pihk elidadag, chum achs ab wo mahksk matt wo si s‑ap i tashogi g Jiosh haꞌichu ahga o wo s‑mahchk g geꞌe haꞌichu ch g s‑juhk haꞌichu ahga wo s‑amichudad o wo edgidad g wohochudadag matt wo i himch g doꞌag.

column2: If I were to donate everything I own to the poor, or if I were to sacrifice myself to be burned as a martyr, and have no love, then I gain nothing.
column3: Pi o haꞌichu t‑wehhejed s‑kehgaj mattp pi wo edgidad g pihk elidadag, chum achs hems wo s‑chechojimak matt wehs gm hu wo ha mah g haꞌichu t‑eniga, chum hems ab wo i t‑dagito mamt wo t‑mehid k wo t‑kokda ha wehhejed.

column2: Love is patient and kind. Love is not jealous. Love is not boastful. Love is not proud.
column3: Mattp wo edgidad g pihk elidadag ch wo s‑hemajimak ch ab wo s‑ha bahbgid ch pi wo chu hehgamk ch pi wo woikimak

column2: Love does not act improperly, or insist on having its own way. Love is not argumentative and doesn't keep a record of wrongs.
column3: ch pi am hu wo ha edawua ch pi wo chu daꞌad ch wo s‑bamuistk. Pi att wo kuint mat hema pi ap has wo e juh

column2: Love takes no delight in evil but celebrates the truth.
column3: k pi wo hohhoꞌi g pi apꞌekam k wabshaba si s‑ap wo t‑tahtkk ab kahkch g s‑apꞌekam

column2: Love never gives up, keeps on trusting, stays confident, and remains patient whatever happens.
column3: ch s‑ap hab wo ha elidad g hemajkam. Chum as pi ap hab wo e junihid, tt hab wo ha elidad matp hems wo wa aꞌapꞌet ch hekaj wabsh s‑ap wo nakogad matp has wo e juh.

column2: Love never fails. Prophecies will come to an end. Tongues will become silent. Knowledge will become useless.  For our knowledge and our prophetic understanding are incomplete.  But when completeness comes, then what is incomplete disappears.
column3: Ab o heheꞌejel t‑mahkch g Hekia S‑apꞌekam Gewkdag g haꞌichu ahga ch pi t‑machiga neꞌoki ch haꞌichu mahchig mat d wabsh wo i t‑wehmtadagk hemuch. Kut wabsh wo huhug idam mahkigdaj matt hekid am wo i ai hegai mo haschu g Jiosh wehs s‑ap am apꞌechudch t‑wehhejed. T wabshaba g pihk elidadag pi hekid wo huhug.

column2: When I was a child, I spoke like a child, I thought like a child, I reasoned like a child. When I grew up I left behind such child-like ways.
column3: Neh, no hig pi g ali alikaj neok ch alikaj haꞌichu tahtk ch haꞌichu chegito? T wabshaba ab wo i e ai g geꞌeligaj. T wo geꞌehogat.

column2: At the moment we peer into a mirror's dim reflection, but then we shall see face to face. For now I only have partial knowledge, but then I shall know completely, just as I am completely known.
column3: Pegih, tt hab wa masma am gawul wo t‑juh matt hekid am wo nei g t‑doꞌibiakam am i koꞌok. Hemuch ach wabsh al heꞌes haꞌichu i s‑mahch ab amjed g Jiosh. K id heg wa wepo mach wabsh s‑kohmagim neid haꞌichu. Tt wabshaba heg i tash haha wo si s‑ap s‑mai haꞌichu ab amjed g Jiosh ab i neidok g t‑doꞌibiakam. T g t‑mahchig hahawa d wo wehsk hab masma mo hab masma s‑t‑mahch g Jiosh.

column2: Trust, hope, and love last forever—but the most important is love.
column3: Pegih, chum att hekid ab wo s‑wohochudad g Jiosh ch ab s‑ap wo nenidad mat am hab wo i junihid g e‑neꞌoki am t‑wehhejed. Chum att hekid wo si pihk t‑elidad ha hekaj. K g pihk elidadag wehs ha baꞌich d i si s‑has haꞌichu.

column2: Make love your most important objective! But also do your best to gain spiritual gifts, especially the ability to speak God's message.
column3: Pegih, mt am wo e nakogad mamt ab wo si pikh e elidad wehs ha hekaj ch wo i ha wehmtad heg hekaj mo haschu ab t‑makiog g Hekia S‑apꞌekam Gewkdag matt hab wo junihid. T id d wo si i ha‑wehmtadagk matt am wo ha ahgidad mo haschu g Jiosh am i t‑tashogid.

column2: Those who speak in a tongue are not talking to people, but to God, because nobody can understand them as they speak mysteries in the Spirit.
column3: Pi at hedai hejel wo s‑em‑amichud k ab wo bei g i wehmtadag mamtp wabsh g pi e‑machiga neꞌokikaj wo neneokad. Heg o wa wepo mach heg hekaj ab waꞌi Jiosh wui neneok.

column2: However, the words of those who speak for God build people up—they provide encouragement and comfort.
column3: K wabshaba hegai mo am ha ahgid mo haschu g Jiosh am i ha tashogid am i ha wehmaj ch am i ha gewkemhun ch ab ha mahk g s‑ap tahhadkam.

column2: Those that speak in a tongue only build themselves up, but those who speak God's message build up the church. I would like it if you all spoke in tongues, but I'd prefer if you could speak God's message.
column3: Hejel o waꞌi e wehhejed hab kaij hegai mo gawul kaidam nenneok. K wabshaba hegai mo am ha ahgid mo haschu g Jiosh am i ha tashogid am i ha wehmaj g e‑wehm wohochuddam.

column2: Those who speak for God are more important than those who speak in tongues, unless they interpret what's been said, so that the church can be built up.
column3: Mamt huꞌi wehsijj wo neneokad g pi e‑machiga neꞌokikaj. Ni wabshaba baꞌich i tatchua mamt wo bei hegai mahkigdag mamt si s‑ta amichudam wo ahgad g Jiosh haꞌichu ahga. Pi at am hu hugkam d wo i ha‑wehmtadagk mamtp wo neo heg hekaj pi e‑machiga neꞌoki, heg hi wa matp am hema wo gagda g em‑neꞌoki am wehs ha wehhejed.

column2: Brothers and sisters, if I come to you speaking in tongues, what benefit would I be to you unless I bring you some revelation, or knowledge, or prophetic message, or teaching?
column3: Pi ant haꞌichukaj wo shaꞌi i em‑wehmt mantp hems am wo jiwia em‑wui k heg waꞌi hekaj wo neokad pi ni‑machiga neꞌoki. Bant waꞌi masma wo i em‑wehmt mant am wo tasho em‑ahgi mo haschu am ni‑maskogid g Jiosh o g haꞌichu mahchig ab amjed o g haꞌichu mashchamigaj.

column2: Even when it comes to something non-living such as musical instruments like a flute or a harp: if they don't produce clear notes, how will you know what tune is being played?
column3: Id ant wo haꞌichu wepogi mamt wo s‑amich. S‑mahch am mat pi hedai wo s‑mahchk mo haschu neꞌi am chum aꞌaga matp g uhs kuikud ch ahlpa pi kehg wo kaida.

column2: Similarly, if the trumpet doesn't give a clear sound, who will get ready for battle?
column3: T pi hedai wo s‑mahchk g shondal mat has wo e juh matp g kuhudam pi ap am hu wo kuhu g kuikud.

column2: It's the same situation for you—unless you speak using words that are easy to understand, who will know what you're saying? What you say will be lost on the wind.
column3: Pegih, t hab wa masma pi hedai wo em‑amich mam haschu am chum aꞌaga mamtp wabsh gawul kaidam wo neokad. Heg o wa wepo mat an wabsh wo i huhug g em‑neꞌoki.

column2: There are surely many languages in this world, and there is meaning in every one of them.
column3: Muꞌij o g nahnko mahs neꞌoki id dahm jewed.

column2: If I don't understand the language, those who speak make no sense to me, and I make no sense to them.
column3: Mantp pi wo mahchk g neꞌokij g gawul neokdam, kutt d wabsh wo ge oꞌodhamk ab aꞌai t‑wui nach ge s‑t‑amichud.

column2: It's the same for you—if you are keen to have spiritual gifts, try to have many of those that will build up the church.
column3: S‑apꞌe o mam si tatchua g mahkigdaj g Hekia S‑apꞌekam Gewkdag. Kumt baꞌich am hab wo i junihid mat haschu baꞌich d wo i ha‑wehmtadagk g em‑wehm wohochuddam.

column2: Anyone who speaks in a tongue should pray that they're able to translate what they say.
column3: Hegai mat hedai wo gawul kaidam nenneokad at hemho wa wo chum e hoꞌigeꞌidahun k ab wo tai g Jiosh g amichudadag mat s‑ap wo i tashogi g gawul kaidam e‑neꞌoki.

column2: For if I pray out loud in a tongue, my spirit is praying, but it does nothing for my understanding!
column3: Pi att hedai am hu wo i ha wehmtad heg hekaj haꞌichu t‑amichudadag mattp wabsh g gawul kaidam neꞌokikaj wo t‑hoꞌigeꞌidahunad, chum achs si s‑ap t‑tahtk am heheꞌejel t‑iꞌibdag ed.

column2: So then, what should I do? I will pray “in the Spirit,” but I will pray with my mind too. I will sing “in the Spirit,” but I will sing with my mind too.
column3: Kutt heg hekaj pi wabsh wo t‑hoꞌigeꞌidahunad g gawul kaidam neꞌokikaj ch pi wabsh wo neꞌed g gawul kaidam neꞌokikaj ch wabshaba s‑ta amichudam hab ep wo t‑juh.

column2: For if you only pray “in the Spirit,” how can ordinary people that don't have understanding say “Amen” after your prayer of thanks, since they haven't a clue what you said?
column3: Pi at wo e nako hegam mo pi mahch mach has t‑wua mat t‑wehm ab wo hoꞌigeꞌel g Jiosh mattp wabsh g gawul kaidam neꞌokikaj wo t‑hoꞌigeꞌidahunad nat ge wo amich mach has kaij.

column2: You might have said a great prayer of thanks, but the other hasn't been helped!
column3: Ttp hems hi wa si s‑ap wo t‑hoꞌigeꞌidahu Jiosh wui. T wabshaba idam pi ab hu wo bei g i wehmtadag.

column2: I thank God that I can speak in tongues more than all of you.
column3: Ab o ep ni‑mahks ihda mahkigdag. Kuni ab si hoꞌigeꞌid g Jiosh mani em‑baꞌich i muꞌikko nenneok g gawul kaidam neꞌokikaj.

column2: But in church I would rather speak five understandable words to teach others than ten thousand words in a tongue nobody understands.
column3: Nt wo ni‑nako mant heg hekaj muꞌi mihl neꞌoki hab wo chei. K wabshaba baꞌich i s‑apꞌe mach eda t‑mihshmad mant al hetasp neꞌoki hab wo chei mat wo s‑e amich mani haschu chum ha mashcham.

column2: Brothers and sisters, don't think like children. Be as innocent as babies in regard to evil, but be grown up in your understanding.
column3: Aꞌalkaj am hab e junihim, ni‑wepnag, ab si haꞌichuchudch ihda al mahkigdag ch heg hekaj ab si e haschud. Am g wabsh wo dagito ihda pi apꞌekam. Neh, aꞌal o pi mahch g pi apꞌekam. Kumt hab waꞌi masma hab wo masmak mo g aꞌal mamt pi wo mahchk g pi apꞌekam.

column2: As Scripture records, “ ‘I will speak to my people through other languages and the lips of foreigners, but even then they won't listen to me,’ says the Lord.”
column3: An o oꞌohadag mo hab kaij g Jiosh:

column2: Speaking in tongues is a sign, not to believers, but those who don't believe. Speaking God's prophetic message is the opposite: it is not for those who don't believe, but for believers.
column3: Neh, idam gawul kaidam neꞌoki mam ab si haꞌichuchud o wa d chum chehgida am ha wehhejed hegam mo pi ab hu kaimk g Jiosh ch pi t‑wehhejed d chehgida ahchim wohochuddam. Hegai mo g Jiosh am t‑tashogid matt wo ha ahgi g t‑wehm wohochuddam o am ha chehgid mo am t‑wehmaj g Jiosh, chum as pi am hu wo ha chehgi hegam mo pi kaimk g Jiosh.

column2: If the whole church is meeting together and you are all speaking in tongues, and some people come in who don't understand, or people who don't believe, won't they say that you are insane?
column3: T hegam mo s‑kaimk ch am wo i wahp t‑namki ed hab wo chei matt t‑loligoch mattp wabsh gawul kaidam wo nenneokad.

column2: But if everyone is speaking God's message, and someone comes in who isn't a believer, or someone who doesn't understand, they will be convinced and called to account by everyone's words.
column3: Hemho wa att am wo tasho ahgad mat has chu g Jiosh am wo t‑tashogi matt wo ah. Kut wo s‑t‑amich g pi e doꞌibiakam k wo s‑mai moki d pi ap chuꞌijkam ch atki wo e lodai.

column2: The secrets of their heart will be laid bare, so they will fall to their knees and worship God, affirming that God is truly among you.
column3: Wehs g haꞌichu t‑ahga at ab ha wui wo tashogi g s‑aꞌagi haꞌichu ha‑chegitoi. Kut ab wo i shul Jiosh wui k ab wo ihm k wo wohokamch moki woho am t‑wehmaj g Jiosh.

column2: So then, brothers and sisters, what should you do? When you meet together, different people will sing, or teach, or share a special message, or speak in a tongue, or give an interpretation. But everything should be done to build up and encourage the church.
column3: Id ani hab ahg, ni‑wepnag, mamt wehs haꞌichu s‑ap am hab wo junihid e‑namki ed. Mtp hems hema am wo ah g neꞌi k hema g mashchama hab wo juh k hema wo ah mat haschu g Jiosh am wo i em‑maskogi k hema hems g gawul kaidam neꞌokikaj wo neo k hema am wo i tashogi mo has d ahga ihda neꞌoki. Wehs haꞌichu at d wo i chum em‑wehmta.

column2: If anyone wants to speak in a tongue, make it just two, or three at the most, taking turns, and someone should interpret what is said.
column3: Mamtp wo neneo g gawul kaidam neꞌokikaj, mt am waꞌi waik o gohkajj hab wo juh shakal e oidam. Mt hema am wo i tashogi ihda mo am hab e kaij.

column2: If there's no one there to interpret, those who speak in tongues should keep quiet in church and only speak to themselves, and God.
column3: Kumt pi am hu hab wo chum chei g gawul kaidam neꞌoki matp pi am hu hedai wo haꞌichugk mat am wo i tashogi k wabsh hejel e wehhejed ch ab Jiosh wui hab wo chei.

column2: Similarly, have two or three of those who give God's prophetic message speak, and let everyone else think about what was said.
column3: Kumt waik o gohkajj am wo ah mat haschu g Jiosh ab wo em‑mah. Kumt haꞌijj am wo aꞌamich mo haschu am hab e kaij.

column2: However if a special revelation comes to someone who is sitting down, then the first speaker should give way to them.
column3: Kumt wabshaba wo haꞌasa neo matp g Jiosh am hema ep wui wo haꞌichu i tashogi mat am hab wo chei.

column2: You can all speak for God, one at a time, so that everyone can learn and be encouraged.
column3: Wehsijj am hiwgidas mamt am wo ah g Jiosh haꞌichu ahga hehemakoj. T hab wehsijj wo haꞌichu mahch k ab hekaj wo bei g i gewkemhunadag.

column2: It is for those who speak for God to control their prophetic inspiration,
column3: Mt wo nenida g e‑apꞌedag mat hekid g Jiosh ab wo em‑mah g haꞌichu e‑ahga am ha wehhejed.

column2: for God is not a God of disorder but of peace and quiet.  This is the way it should be in all the churches of God's people.
column3: Pi o tatchua g Jiosh matt wabsh wo has hu t‑wuad ch wabshaba matt wo s‑dodolimak.

column2: “Women should stay quiet in the churches—they shouldn't speak. They should respect their situation, as the laws states.
column3: Ahpim uꞌuwi amt ab wabsh wo ha wechok. Bo masma hab chuꞌig g heki hu t‑himdag chehanig. Pi amt has wo chei ab amjed mo has i kaij g chechoj

column2: If they want to learn they can do so at home, asking their husbands. It is not proper  for women to speak in church.”
column3: k wabshaba ab wo ha kakke g e‑wehm kihkam am e‑kihki am mamtp wo haꞌichu s‑mahchim. Dat wo si edadagk mamtp ab wo ha kakke mam am e mihshmad.

column2: What? Did the word of God begin with you? Are you the only ones it came to?
column3: Pi g hab wo elidad mas ahpim em‑gahi wuhshanim ab i wuhsh g Jiosh haꞌichu ahga o mams ahpim ab waꞌi bei.

column2: Anyone who thinks they are a prophet, or that they have some spiritual gift, should be aware that what I'm writing to you is a command of the Lord.
column3: Mt wo chum s‑mahchk mo id d Jiosh chehanig mamtp hedai hab e elid mam d Jiosh haꞌichu ahgdam ch edgid g gewkdaj g Hekia S‑apꞌekam Gewkdag.

column2: Those who ignore this will themselves be ignored.
column3: Kumt pi ab hu wo ha kaiha matp hedai pi ab hu wo kaiha ihda.

column2: So my brothers and sisters, make it your aim to speak for God. Don't prohibit speaking in tongues.
column3: Pegih neh, ni‑wepnag, am g wo si i e gewpkad mamt wo ah g Jiosh haꞌichu ahga k wabshaba pi wo ha daꞌi hegam mat g gawul kaidam neꞌokikaj wo nenneokad.

column2: Just make sure everything done is done properly and in an orderly manner.
column3: Wehs amt haꞌichu si s‑ap am hab wo junihid e‑namki ed ch pi wabsh wo has hu e wuad.

column2: Now I want to remind you about the good news I announced to you. You accepted it, and you have stood firm for it.
column3: Am ant ep wo em‑ahgi ihda s‑kehg haꞌichu ahgaj g Jiosh, ni‑wepnag. Ab amt i s‑wohoch mant eda am em‑ahgi heki hu k s‑wihnam gegok am e‑wohochudadag ed.

column2: It is through this good news that you are saved if you hold on to the message that I gave you. Otherwise you trusted for nothing!
column3: Do ihda s‑kehg haꞌichu ahga mamt heg hekaj wo e doꞌibia mamtp woho an uꞌukch.

column2: I passed on to you what I myself had also received, a message of vital importance: that Christ died for our sins, according to Scripture;
column3: Am ant em‑ahgi mant haschu bei. K id d si s‑has haꞌichu ahgaj g Jiosh ch hab chuꞌig mat g alidaj muh heg hekaj pi ap t‑chuꞌijig

column2: he was buried and was raised from the dead on the third day, again in accordance with Scripture.
column3: k uhpam ep e chegito mo am d i waik tash mamt am woi cheo ch ed hab masma mo an oꞌohadag Jiosh heki hu oꞌohana ed mat am hab wo e juh.

column2: He appeared to Peter, then to the Twelve.
column3: Am at i e chehgi Peter wui k ab hahawa wehs ha wui g am e‑chuhchai

column2: After that he appeared to more than five hundred brothers and sisters at the same time, most of whom are still alive today, though some have died.
column3: k am ep i e chehgi ha wui g hetasp siant i baꞌiwichkim mo ab d wohochuddam. Muꞌijj idam o an d wabsh kia dodakam. T haꞌijj hi wa koi.

column2: He appeared to James, then all the apostles.
column3: Am at hahawa ep i e chehgi e‑wehnag James wui k ab ep ha wui wehs g am e‑chuhchai

column2: Last of all, he also appeared to me, someone born as it were at the wrong time.  For I'm the least important apostle of all, not even fit to be called an apostle since I persecuted God's church.
column3: k am si ha oidch hab waꞌap i e chehgi ab ni‑wui. Ni eda s‑koꞌokam ha shoꞌigchud hegam mo ab s‑wohochud. K pi ab hu d chum ni‑wuikam manis d wo kehshajk. T wabshaba wa am ni‑wui i e chehgid k ab i ni‑waid k am i ni‑kei.

column2: But by God's grace I am what I am, and his grace given to me wasn't wasted. On the contrary I've worked harder than all of them—though not me, but God's grace working through me.
column3: Bat wa masma si s‑ni‑hoꞌigeꞌel g Jiosh. Kuni heg hekaj d kehshaj ch chum hems wehs ha baꞌich i si chikpan hegam mo am d chuhchaij. K eda d Jiosh mo hab junihim ihda. Pi ani hejel hab junihim.

column2: So whether it's I or them, this is the message we shared with you that brought you to trust in God.
column3: K g Jiosh hab waꞌap i ha wehmt hegam mo ni‑wehm d piongaj g Jiosh. Wehsijj ach heg am wa ahgachug. K d ihda haꞌichu t‑ahga mam ab s‑wohochud.

column2: Now if the message declares that Christ has been raised from the dead, how is it that some of you say there's no resurrection of the dead?
column3: Id o d haꞌichu t‑mashchama mat uhpam ep e chegito g Christ. Msh eda haꞌi hab chechꞌe mat pi hedai uhpam ep wo e chegito.

column2: If there's no resurrection of the dead then Christ hasn't been raised either.
column3: Pegih, t g Christ hab waꞌap pi ep e chegito matp wo wohok mat pi hedai ep wo e chegito.

column2: And if Christ isn't raised, then our message we shared with you is pointless, and your trust in God is pointless too.
column3: Kut pi d wo haꞌichuk machs hekaj wo em‑mihshmad o mams ab wo s‑wohoch.

column2: In addition, we would be shown to be false witnesses of God when we testified that God raised Christ from the dead. But God didn't raise Christ from the dead if it's true that there's no resurrection.  If the dead are not raised, then Christ hasn't been raised either,
column3: T d wabsh wo iattogik mattp wo em‑ahgi mat g Jiosh ab i wuhshad g e‑alidag.

column2: and if Christ hasn't been raised, then your trust in God is useless, and you are still in your sins.
column3: Kumt pi wo shaꞌi e doꞌibia. T pi haꞌichu wehhejed wo s‑kehgajk g em‑wohochudadag.

column2: This also means that those who died in Christ are lost.
column3: T hab waꞌap pi wo e doꞌibia hegam mat heki hu koi ab i s‑wohochudk g haꞌichu t‑ahga ab amjed g Christ.

column2: If our hope in Christ is only for this life, we're the most pitiful people of all!
column3: Shaꞌatt waꞌi si shoꞌig hab wo mahsk wehs ha baꞌiwichkim ahchim wohochuddam mattp pi uhpam ep wo t‑chegito.

column2: But Christ has been raised from the dead, the firstfruits of the harvest from those who have died.
column3: T wabshaba woho ab i wuhsh g Christ muhkig amjed k am i shonwuich mat wo i wuwha g koꞌi.

column2: Otherwise what will those people do who are baptized for the dead? If the dead are not raised at all, why then would people be baptized for them?
column3: Neh, haꞌijj at g em‑tatchui ab i s‑wohoch g s‑kehg haꞌichu ahgaj g Jiosh k hahawa koi. Kumt haꞌi hab waꞌap ab i s‑wohochud k e pahl wapko mamt wo ha wehmajk am i koꞌok. Pegih, pi g hab wo chehꞌi mas pi ep wo e chegito.

column2: As for us, why do we place ourselves in danger hour after hour?
column3: Wehs tashkaj ach pi shaꞌi huwid g t‑doakag ahchim mach am ahgachug g doꞌibiadag. Kutt pi am hab wo t‑junihid matp pi ab hu wo i wuwha g koꞌi.

column2: I die every day—let me say it bluntly, my brothers and sisters. This is just as sure as the pride I have for what Christ Jesus has done in you.
column3: Neh, ni‑wepnag, wehs tashkaj o am hab chuꞌig g s‑ni‑mukimkam. Id ani hab kaij nani pi ab si has em‑elid mam d ni‑wehm wohochuddam.

column2: Humanly speaking, what would I gain by fighting with those people in Ephesus who were like wild animals, if the dead are not raised? If the dead are not raised, “let's eat and drink, for tomorrow we die”!
column3: Ia at haꞌi hab masma ni‑cheggia mo g s‑ta ehbidam haꞌichu dodakam Ephesus t am. Kunt pi ab hu ha wui wo shaꞌi kekiwua am ahgachugch matt ep wo t‑chegito am i koꞌok matp pi d wo wohokamk. Matp hab chuꞌig, nt wabsh oidk hab wo ni‑junihid g hab ha‑cheꞌi mo hab chuꞌig, “Tt hig wabsh wo si t‑gegosidad ch wo s‑hehgigk natt pi hemuch im hu hab wo i t‑juh.”

column2: Don't be fooled: “bad company ruins good character.”
column3: Mt wo e iattogid k hab waꞌap wo masmak mo hegam mamtp ab wo ha kaihamad.

column2: Come to your senses as you should, and stop sinning! Some of you don't know God. I tell you this to shame you.
column3: Haꞌijj amki pi mahch g Jiosh. K id d si em‑edadag. Am g wabsh wo dagito g pi ap e‑chegitoi k s‑ap haꞌichu wo chegito.

column2: Of course somebody will ask, “How exactly are the dead raised? What kind of body will they have?”
column3: Neh, haꞌijj amsh hab chechꞌe, “Shaht masma ep wo i wuwha g koꞌi. Kut has wo mahskad g hohon matp woho hab wo e juh?”

column2: What a foolish question! What you sow doesn't sprout into life unless it dies.
column3: Pegih, nt wo em‑tashogi. T‑hohon o wepogidas mo g haꞌichu kai. Heg at am wo e ei jewed ch ed. T g elidaj wo padt. T g kai am haha wo i wuhsh.

column2: When you sow, you don't sow the plant it will grow into, just the bare seed, whether wheat or whatever you're planting.
column3: Hegai mam am eꞌesha o d wabsh si s‑wohom haꞌichu kai ch pi d wehs hegai mat ab wo i wuhsh.

column2: God makes the plant grow into the form he has chosen, and different seeds produce different plants with different forms.
column3: Jiosh at hab masma am wo wuhshad mo has i masma tatchua k ab mahkch mat hab wo mahskad mo g jeꞌej. Wehs o gawul mahs g haꞌichu wuhshanig.

column2: What living things are made from is not the same. Human beings have one kind of body tissue, while animals have another, birds another, and fish another.
column3: K g haꞌichu doakam hab waꞌap gawul mahs. Oꞌodham o am wa has mahs chuhkug. K g haꞌichu doakam ch uꞌuwhig ch waptopi am wa heheꞌejelko gawul mahs chuhkug.

column2: There are heavenly bodies and earthly bodies. Heavenly bodies have one kind of beauty, earthly bodies another.
column3: Tash ch mashad ch huhuꞌu o gawul masma mo g jewed ch gawul masma s‑kehgaj.

column2: The sun shines in one way, and the moon another, while the stars are different again, with each one shining in a different way.
column3: K idam mo an t‑dahm hab chuꞌig pi e wepo masma s‑kehgaj. Mashad o gawul masma s‑kehgaj mo g tash. K g huhuꞌu hab waꞌap gawul masma s‑kehgaj mo idam ch pi e wepo masma s‑kehgaj.

column2: It's the same with the resurrection of the dead. The body is sown in decay; it is raised to last forever.  It is sown in shame; it is raised in glory. It is sown in weakness; it is raised in power.  It is sown as a natural body; it is raised as a spiritual body. Just as there are natural bodies there are spiritual bodies.
column3: Ihda t‑honshpadag o d wabsh jewed t ab haꞌichu ch wo hekit k pi wo kehgajk ch pi wo ha gewkdagk ch wo muh k ged hu wo e hiash. T g Jiosh ab wo i t‑wuwhas. T g t‑honshpadag d haha wo dahm kahchim ch ed haꞌichuk ch wo s‑kehgajk ch wo gewkdagk ch pi hekid wo hekit k pi hekid wo muh. Jiosh at ab t‑mah ihda t‑honshpadag matt id dahm jewed wo hekaj. K hab mahs mat hemho wa am wo nahto g dahm kahchim honshpadag matt an wo hekajid dahm kahchim ch ed.

column2: As Scripture says, “The first man, Adam, became a living being;”  but the last Adam a life-giving spirit.
column3: Neh, bo chuꞌig g Jiosh oꞌohana mash g wehpeg oꞌodham d Adambad. Tsh id g Jiosh am nahto k ab mah g doakag k Hekaj am i shonwuich g oꞌodham doakag. K wabshaba g Christ ab hahawa t‑mahkch g wechij doakag.

column2: The spiritual did not come first, but the natural—the spiritual came after that.
column3: Pi o an hu wehpeg d dahm kahchim doakag g oꞌodham ch wabshaba hemho wa in jewed dahm wehpeg mahsi.

column2: The first man is from the dust of the earth; the second man is from heaven.
column3: Jiosh atsh wabsh g jewedkaj am nahto hegai si wehpegkam. T heg i dahm ia hahawa jiwia g Christ ab dahm kahchim t amjed.

column2: Earthly people are like the man made from the earth; heavenly people are like the man from heaven.
column3: Wehsijj ach ab d amjedkamaj hegai mat g jewedkaj e nahto ch hab wa masma. Ch ahchim mach ab s‑wohochud hegai mat ia jiwia dahm kahchim t amjed hab wa masma mo hegai.

column2: Just as we bore the likeness of the earthly man so we shall bear the likeness of the man from heaven.
column3: Matt wo i wuhsh ab muhkig amjed k haha wo wepo masmak.

column2: However, I tell you this, my brothers and sisters: our present bodies cannot inherit the kingdom of God. These decaying bodies cannot inherit what lasts forever.
column3: Pi at an hu wo shaꞌi i wah dahm kahchim ch ed ihda jewed dahm t‑hon mo aihim g muhkig.

column2: Listen, I'm going to reveal a mystery! Not all of us will die—but we will all be changed,
column3: Neh, nt am haha wo em‑ahgi g s‑aꞌagi haꞌichu. Pi att wehsijj wo koꞌo k wabshaba wehsijj wo gawul t‑juh ahchim mach ab s‑wohochud g Jiosh haꞌichu ahga.

column2: in a moment, in the blink of an eye, at the sound of the last trumpet. The trumpet will sound, and the dead will be raised never to die again, and we will be changed.
column3: Kut id si s‑hohtam hab wo e juh hab masma mam si s‑hohtam e wuhigid. Wehpeg at ab wo kaida g kukuikud k g si ha oidchkam ab wo kaida. T ab ha hekaj wo i wuwha hegam mat heki hu koi ab i s‑wohochudk g Jiosh haꞌichu ahga. Tt ahchim mattp in d wabsh wo kia dodakamk hab waꞌap wo gawul t‑juh.

column2: For this perishable body must be clothed with a body that never perishes. This mortal life must be clothed with immortality.
column3: Ihda t‑hon at am gawul wo e juh mat pi hekid wo muh.

column2: When this perishable body has been clothed with a body that never perishes, and this mortal life has been clothed with immortality, then the Scripture will come true that says, “Death has been totally conquered and destroyed.
column3: T hab masma wo e wohokamch ihda mo an hab chuꞌig Jiosh oꞌohana ed:

column2: Death—where's your victory? Death—where's your sting?” The sting that causes death is sin; and the power of sin is the law;  but praise God who gives us the victory through our Lord Jesus Christ.
column3: Bo wa masma g muhkig mo g si geꞌe koꞌoi. K g s‑koꞌok t‑namkidadag heg hekaj pi ap t‑chuꞌijig heg wa wepo mo g keꞌij. T wabshaba g t‑kownalig Jesus Christ gam hu hab i juh g keꞌij ab nakogk g s‑koꞌok t‑namkidadag. Jiosh at am i apꞌech mat hab masma wo t‑gewitojel g muhkig. Kuch heg hekaj si s‑hehgigam ab hoꞌigeꞌid.

column2: So my dear brothers and sisters: be strong, stand firm, doing everything you can for the Lord's work, since you know that nothing you do in the Lord is wasted.
column3: Pegih neh, ni‑wepnag, pi at wo shaꞌi heki e wua matt haschu am hab wo junihid g t‑kownalig Jesus wehhejed. Kumt heg hekaj s‑wihnam wo gegokkad e‑wohochudadag ed ch chum hekid wo si chikpanad wehhejed.

column2: Now about “collecting money for fellow-believers.” I'm giving you the same instructions for you to follow as I did to the churches in Galatia.
column3: Id ant hab wo ah heg amjed lial mamt am wo toꞌawad ha wehhejed hegam e‑wehm wohochuddam mo am kih Judea jewed ch ed. Bani ha ahg hegam wohochuddam mo am muꞌikpa kih Galasia jewed ch ed mat am wo toꞌawad g e‑lialiga.

column2: On the first day of the week everybody should set aside some money you've earned. I don't want there to be any collections to have to be made when I'm with you.
column3: Kumt ahpim hab wa masma hab waꞌap am wo haꞌi toꞌawad wehs domig ed mamtp heꞌekia wo i e nako am aꞌamichudk mam heꞌekia i ha gew.

column2: When I get there I will write recommendation letters for whoever you choose, and they will take your donation to Jerusalem.
column3: Kumt am wo haꞌi i ha chuhcha mat am wo i ui g em‑mahkigdag Jerusalem wui. Nt am wo ha oꞌohani g geꞌegedchu Jerusalem t am am jiwiak em‑wui. T id am wo i bei g em‑chuhchai k am wo hihi.

column2: If it works out for me to go too, they can come with me.
column3: Kunt ahni am epai wo ha oi matp d wo Jiosh tatchuik mant am wo hih.

column2: After I've been to Macedonia, I plan to come and visit you. I pass that way through Macedonia
column3: Wehpeg ant am wo i ha neidahi g t‑wehm wohochuddam ha‑kihhim oidk am Macedonia ch ed k am haha wo i em‑chehgimed

column2: and I may stay with you for a while, perhaps spend the winter, and then you can send me on my way to wherever I'm headed.
column3: k antp hems wehs s‑hehpchꞌed oidam am wo em‑wehmajkahim. Mt am haha wo i ni‑wehmt mantp hebai baꞌich wo i hih.

column2: This time I don't want to come and see you for just a short time. I hope I can stay for a while with you, if that's what the Lord permits.
column3: Pi ant wo em‑nei am himadch Macedonia wui nani pi tatchua mant am wo wa tash em‑wehmajkahim matp d wo Jiosh tatchuik.

column2: However I will stay on at Ephesus until Pentecost,
column3: Bani ni‑elid mant ia wo haꞌichugk Ephesus kihhim t am ch ab wo ai g bahijida gegosig.

column2: because a tremendous door of opportunity has opened up for me there, though there are plenty who oppose me.
column3: Geꞌej o g ni‑apꞌedag mant am hab wo junihid g Jiosh chikpan iia, chum as hi wa muꞌijj ab ni‑wui gegok.

column2: Now if Timothy arrives, make sure that he has nothing to fear by being with you, for he's working for the Lord just as I am.
column3: Tp hems am wo jiwia g Timothy em‑shahgid. Kumt si s‑ap ab wo neidad no pi am hab waꞌap junihim g Jiosh chikpan hab masma mani ahni.

column2: Don't let anyone look down on him. Cheerfully send him on his way so he can come and see me—the brothers and sisters and I are waiting for him.
column3: Pi amt wo pi ap hab elidad mo d wabsh wechij oꞌodham ch wabshaba am wo i wehmt. T hab s‑ap e taht k ab uhpam wo i hih. Si ani nenida mat ia ep wo jiwia hegam ha wehm mat am wehmaj wo hihi em‑wui.

column2: As for our brother Apollos: I urged him to go and see you together with the other believers, but he wasn't willing to go at the moment. He'll come and visit when he gets the chance.
column3: Am amsh s‑neidamk g Apollos. Kuni ab chum si i gewkemhun mat am wo i em‑chehgim. K wabshaba pi hab elid mo d Jiosh tatchui mat am wo hih hemu ch heg hekaj pi wo ha oi idam mat am wo i em‑chehgio k wabshaba am wo wa em‑nei mat hekid am wo s‑apꞌekad wehhejed.

column2: Stay alert. Stand firm in your trust in God. Take courage. Be strong.
column3: Am g wo s‑e nenꞌoidad ch s‑wihnam wo gegokkad am e‑wohochudadag ed ch s‑geꞌehogam am wo chikpanad

column2: Whatever you do, do it in love.
column3: ch ab wo e chehgidch wehs haꞌichu k ed mam ab si pihk e elid wehs ha hekaj.

column2: You know that Stephanas and his family were among the first converts in Achaia, and they dedicated themselves to helping God's people. I'm pleading with you, my brothers and sisters,
column3: S‑mahch am mo hegam Stephanas d si wehpegkam am em‑jewedga ed mat wehs e wehm ab i s‑wohoch g s‑kehg haꞌichu ahgaj g Jiosh. Idam at am i e dagito mat haꞌichu am hab wo junihid ha wehhejed g wohochuddam. Kuni ab em‑gewkemhun, ni‑wepnag,

column2: to respect their leadership, and everyone who helps the work with such dedication.
column3: mamt ab wo ha kaihamad hegam mo hab masma em‑wanimed mo idam ch hegam mo hedai ha wehm chikpan.

column2: I'm delighted that Stephanas, Fortunatas, and Achaicus have arrived here, for they did what you weren't able to.
column3: Hemu at wabsh ia dada g Stephanas ha wehm g Fortunatus ch Acaicus. Kuni si s‑ap ni‑tahtk ch ha neid nani pi si s‑em‑neidamk.

column2: They have been a great source of encouragement to me, and to you. People like that deserve your recognition.
column3: Ab at si i ni‑hehgchul hab masma mat hab em‑juh. S‑ap amt ab wo ha neidad g hab mahs oꞌodham.

column2: The churches of Asia  send their greetings. Aquila and Priscilla, along with the church that meets in their home, send their best wishes.
column3: Hegam mo ab ihm g Christ iia Asia jewed ch ed o am i em‑ahgid mamt ab wo i s‑ha hoꞌigeꞌel. Aquila ch Priscilla ch hegam mo am e nanmek ha‑kih am o hab waꞌap am i em‑ahgid mamt ab wo i s‑ha hoꞌigeꞌel.

column2: All the brothers and sisters here send their greetings. Greet one another affectionately.
column3: Wehsijj g wohochuddam iia Ephesus t am o hab waꞌap am i em‑ahgid mamt ab wo i s‑ha hoꞌigeꞌel.

column2: I Paul write this greeting with my own hand.
column3: Ia ant hejel wo oꞌoha g ni‑hoꞌigeꞌidadag am em‑wui.

column2: Anyone who doesn't love the Lord should be excluded from the church. Come Lord!
column3: Jiosh at gam hu hab wo i ha juh matp hedai pi ab hu wo tatchuad g t‑kownalig Jesus. Ia at ep wo jiwia g Jesus s‑hohtam.

column2: May the grace of our Lord Jesus Christ be with you.
column3: Si o s‑hemajima g t‑kownalig Jesus Christ ab em‑wui ch baꞌich ab wo i em‑mah g i wehmtadag.

column2: My love to all of you in Christ Jesus. Amen.
column3: Ab ani si pihk ni‑elid wehs em‑hekaj ahpim ni‑wehm wohochuddam.

column2: What we have seen and heard we are now explaining to you, so that you may also share in this friendship together with us—this friendship that is with the Father, and with his Son Jesus Christ.
column3: Ahchim mach wa neid g Jiosh alidag ach am em-ahgid ab amjed mamt hekaj t-wehm ab wo ihmad g Jiosh. Jesus Christ o d Jiosh alidag.

column2: We're writing to tell you about this in order to make our happiness complete.
column3: Kuni am em-oꞌohanid ahpim mam ab s-wohochud mamt hekaj wo si s-ap e tahtkkad. Nt ahni hab waꞌap wo si s-ap ni-tahtkkad em-wehm.

column2: This is the message we received from him and that we declare to you: God is light, and there is absolutely no darkness in him at all.
column3: Jesus o am t-ahgid mash g Jiosh d hekia tonlig.

column2: If we claim to share this friendship with him and yet go on living in darkness, we're lying, and not living in the truth.
column3: T wo ha iattogi matp hedai hab wo chei mo s-mahch g Jiosh k eda hab wo junihid g pi apꞌekam. Id o am s-chuhugam k ed him.

column2: But if we are living in the light, as he is in the light, then we share in this friendship with one another, and the blood of Jesus, his Son, makes us clean from every sin.
column3: Jiosh o d wohokam. Kutt wo si s-ap t-tahtkkad ab aꞌai t-wui am oidch hihimadch g wohokam. Kut heg gam hu hab wo i junihid g pi ap t-chuꞌijig nat pi heg hekaj t-wehhejed muh g alidaj. Heg o wa wepo mo g alidaj ehꞌed gam hu wakon g pi ap t-chuꞌijig.

column2: If we claim to be sinless we only fool ourselves, and the truth is not in us.
column3: Pi g hab wo shaꞌi chehꞌi mams pi ha chuꞌijig. Heg o d iattogi.

column2: But if we confess our sins, he is trustworthy and right so that he can forgive us our sins and make us clean from all that is not right in us.
column3: Tt wo mahsko wua g t-chuꞌijig. T g Jiosh gam hu hab wo i juh k wo i t-kegch. Heg at hekaj ab nako g Jiosh alidag g s-koꞌok t-namkidadag ab e shoꞌigchudk kots t ab.

column2: If we claim we haven't sinned, we turn him into a liar, and his word is not in us.
column3: Jiosh o am t-tashogid matt wehsijj hab juh g pi apꞌekam. Kut hedai hab wo chei mo pi ha chuꞌijig k am wo e chehgi mo pi ab hu wohochud g Jiosh.

column2: My dear children, I'm writing this to you so you shouldn't sin. But if anybody should happen to sin, we have someone who defends us before the Father—Jesus Christ, who is truly right.
column3: Dam ni-aꞌaliga ab i s-wohochudk g haꞌichu ni-ahga. Kuni ab i em-gewkemhun mamt pi am hu hab wo junihid g pi apꞌekam. Jesus Christ o d hekia s-apꞌekam ch ab e hoꞌigeꞌidahun Jiosh wui am t-wehhejed. Kutt am wo ahgi g Jiosh g t-chuꞌijig matt hekid am hab wo juh g pi apꞌekam.

column2: Through him our sins are forgiven—and not only our sins, but those of the whole world.
column3: T heg gam hu hab wo i juh g t-chuꞌijig nat pi g alidaj heg hekaj nako g s-koꞌok t-namkidadag. Kut wabsh chum hedai wo chum e nako mat ab wo i e nodagi wui.

column2: We can be sure that we do know him if we follow his commands.
column3: Tt wo s-mahchk mach wohoꞌi s-mahch g Jiosh matt am hab wo junihid mo haschu ab i t-chehani.

column2: Anyone who says, “I know him,” but doesn't do what he says, is a liar. They don't have the truth.
column3: Hegai mat pi am hu oidk hab wo e junihid g Jiosh chehanig o pi mahch g Jiosh, chum as hems hab wo chum chei mo s-mahch.

column2: But those who follow God's word have his love totally fill their hearts. This is how we know that we live in him.
column3: Ahchim mach hab wua g Jiosh tatchui ach wohoꞌi ab si tatchua. Id at am wo t-chehgi mach woho d aꞌaligaj.

column2: Whoever claims to be living in him should behave like Jesus.
column3: Jiosh alidag o chum hekid am hab junihim g e-ohg tatchui. Kutt ahchim hab wo chum masmak mattp woho d aꞌaligaj g Jiosh.

column2: My friends, I'm not writing to you giving some new commandment, but an old commandment you've had from the beginning. This old commandment is one you have already heard.
column3: Pegih, ni-tatchui, pi ani em-ahgid g wechij chehanig am em-ahgidch mamt ab aꞌai wo si e tatchuad. Jiosh o wa heki hu hab masma t-chehani. Kum id ab kaichug heki hu waꞌi amjed.

column2: But in a sense I am giving you a new commandment. Its truth is revealed in Jesus and in you, for the darkness is coming to an end and the true light is already shining.
column3: T eda g Jiosh alidag am i wechijid t-wehhejed mat ab i t-mah g wechij doakag. Tonlig o gam hu hab i wua g s-chuhugam am t-wehhejed.

column2: Those who say they live in the light but hate a fellow Christian  still have the darkness inside them.
column3: Am o wabsh kia him s-chuhugam k ed matp hedai s-kehꞌid g e-wehnag, chum as hab wo kaijjid mo hab wua g s-apꞌekam.

column2: Those who love their fellow Christians live in the light, and don't cause others to sin.
column3: Tt am tonlig ch ed wo hihimad mattp woho ab wo si ha tatchuad g t-wepnag. T pi hedai wo pihk chuꞌi heg hekaj mach has masma.

column2: Those who hate a fellow Christian are in darkness. They stumble around in the dark, not knowing where they're going because the darkness has blinded them.
column3: K wabshaba am s-chuhugam k ed him hegai matp hedai wo s-ha kehꞌidad.

column2: Dear friends, I'm writing to you children, for your sins have been forgiven through the name of Jesus.
column3: Pi ant hab ahgk am wo em-oꞌohani mams pi mahch g Jiosh. Gm at hu hab i juh g em-chuꞌijig. Kum s-mahch.

column2: I'm writing to you fathers, for you know him who has existed from the beginning. I'm writing to you young people, for you have defeated the Evil One.  I write to you little children, for you know the Father. I write to you fathers, for you know him who has existed from the beginning. I write to you young people, for you are strong. The word of God lives in you, and you have defeated the Evil One.
column3: Ahpim mam d si geꞌeged am s-mahch mo g Jesus chum hekid d doakam. Kum ahpim wechij hemajkam s-gewkdag ch am gewito g Jiawul nam pi s-gegokim ab e uꞌukch Jiosh haꞌichu ahga ab. Heg ant hekaj am wo i em-oꞌohanid k ab wo i em-gewkemhu.

column2: Don't be in love with the world, and don't long for the things of this world. If you love the world, you won't have the Father's love in you.
column3: Pi g wo shaꞌi si pihk e elidad heg ab mo d wabsh jewed t ab haꞌichu. Hegam matp hedai wo si pihk e elidad id ab haꞌichu at pi wo shaꞌi pihk e elidad ab Jiosh wui.

column2: For all the things of this world—our sinful desires, wanting everything we see, boasting about what we've accomplished in life— these things don't come from the Father but from the world.
column3: Pi o d shaꞌi Jiosh hab elida matt hab wo s-junim g pi apꞌekam o si s-wohom wo s-behim mach haschu i neid o machs haschukaj wo si t-haschudad. Wehs ihda o d wabsh jewed t ab haꞌichu

column2: The world and its evil desires are coming to an end, but those who do the will of God will live forever.
column3: ch hab wa masma d wabsh huhugedam haꞌichu. T wabshaba pi hekid wo huhug hegai wechij doakag mo g Jiosh ab t-mahkch ahchim mach am hab junihim g tatchuij.

column2: Dear friends, this is the last hour. As you've heard, the antichrist is coming. Many antichrists have already come. This is how we know this is the last hour.
column3: Am am wa kah matsh an wo i e maskogi hegai mash d si obgaj g Jiosh alidag. Heki at hu muꞌi an i wuwha t-shahgid mo d obgaj. Kuch heg hekaj s-mahch mo e aihim mat wo huhug g jewed.

column2: They left us, but they didn't belong with us, for if they did, they would have remained with us. When they left they showed that none of them belonged with us.
column3: T wo chum t-wehm wih matp d t-wehm wohochuddam k wabshaba am i t-dagito. K heg hekaj tasho mo pi woho d t-wehm wohochuddam.

column2: But you have been anointed  with the Holy Spirit's blessing, and all of you know what's true.
column3: Jiosh alidag at ab t-mah g Hekia S-apꞌekam Gewkdag. K heg am t-wehmaj ch i t-wehmt. Kuch heg hekaj s-mahch g wohokam.

column2: I'm not writing because you don't know the truth, but because you do know it, and because no lie comes from the truth.
column3: Pi o hekid g iattogi d wohokam. Kum s-mahch ihda nam pi s-mahch g wohokam. Nt heg hekaj am em-oꞌohani ihda.

column2: Who is the liar?—anyone who denies that Jesus is the Christ. The antichrist is anyone who denies the Father and the Son.
column3: Hegam mo hab kaij mo g Jesus pi d Jiosh alidag o wehs ha baꞌich d i s-chu iꞌattomkam ch d obgaj. Heg o hekaj e chehgid mo pi ab hu wohochud g Jiosh.

column2: Anyone that denies the Son does not have the Father; anyone who acknowledges the Son has the Father too.
column3: Hegam mo pi ab hu ihm g Jiosh alidag o hab waꞌap pi ab hu ihm g Jiosh. Hegam o ab waꞌi ihm g Jiosh mo hedai ab ihm g alidaj.

column2: As for you, make sure what you heard from the beginning continues to live in you. If what you heard from the beginning lives in you, you will also live in the Son and in the Father.
column3: Mt am wabsh wo i wohochudad ihda s-kehg haꞌichu ahga mam ga hu i wehpeg amjed kaichug. Kut heg hekaj chum hekid am wo em-wehmajk g Jiosh g e-alidag wehm.

column2: Eternal life—this is what he has promised us!
column3: Heki o hu hab kaij g Jiosh matsh ab wo t-mah ihda wechij doakag matsh pi hekid wo huhug.

column2: I'm writing this to warn you against those who want to lead you astray.
column3: Am ant em-oꞌohani ab ha amjed hegam mo em-iattogid ch im hu hab i s-em-junimk ab amjed g Jesus. Kumt pi ab hu haꞌichu wo mahchim ha ab.

column2: But the anointing you received from him means the Spirit lives in you, and you don't need to be taught by anyone. The Spirit's anointing teaches you about everything. It is the truth and not a lie. So live in Christ, just as you've been taught!
column3: Pi o hab chum mahs mams wabsh chum hasko amjed wo i e gahgidahi mam haschu i pi amichud. Jiosh alidag at ab em-mah g Hekia S-apꞌekam Gewkdag. Kut heg chum hekid am wo em-wehmajk ch wehs wo em-mashchamad g wohokam. Kumt ab wo kaihamad g mashchamaj ch ab wo s-wohog elidad g Jiosh alidag

column2: Now, my dear friends, continue to live in Christ, so that when he appears, we can be confident and not feel ashamed before him at his coming.
column3: ch hab masma pi wo si e el mat hekid ep wo jiwia.

column2: If you know he is good and right, then you also know that everyone who does what is right has been born of God.
column3: Do hekia s-apꞌekam g Jiosh. Kumt heg hekaj wo s-mahchk mamtp hedai hab junihim g s-apꞌekam ch d aꞌaligaj.

column2: Look at the amazing kind of love the Father has for us! This is why we can be called God's children—for that's who we are! The reason why the people of this world don't recognize us as God's children is because they don't recognize him.
column3: Jiosh at hab t-juh mach d hahawa aꞌaligaj no pi si pihk e elid ab t-wui. Hegam mo pi mahch g Jiosh alidag o pi mahch mach ahchim hab waꞌap d Jiosh aꞌaliga.

column2: My friends, we are already God's children; however what we shall become hasn't been revealed just yet. But we do know that when he appears, we shall be like him, because we shall see him as he really is.
column3: Batt wo chum masmak mo g Jiosh alidag nach pi hab waꞌap d aꞌaligaj. K pi koi am hu i si tasho matt has wo masmak nach pi wabsh s-kohmagim neid mo has i masma g Jiosh alidag. T hekid ep wo jiwia k ab wo i e chehgi t-wui. Kutt haha wo wepo masmak natt pi wo s-mai mo has masma.

column2: All those who have this hope in them make sure they are pure, just as he is pure.
column3: K eda hemu tasho mo d si hekia s-apꞌekam g Jiosh alidag. Kutt ahchim wo si t-nuhkudad matt d wo s-apꞌekamk nach pi s-mahch mat ep wo jiwia. Kutt wo neid k wo wepo masmak.

column2: All those who sin are lawless, because sin is lawlessness.
column3: Dat wo pi ap chuꞌijkamk am Jiosh chehanig ed hegai mat hedai hab wo junihid g pi apꞌekam.

column2: But of course you know that Jesus came to take away sins, and that there is no sin in him.
column3: Pi o ha chuꞌijig g Jiosh alidag ch in i wuhsh jewed dahm wepo masma g oꞌodham mat gam hu hab wo i juh g pi ap t-chuꞌijig.

column2: All those who live in him don't go on sinning; all those who keep on sinning haven't seen him and haven't known him.
column3: Pi att am hu hab wo chum junihid g pi apꞌekam mattp ab wo s-wohochudad g Jiosh alidag. Hegai mat hedai hab wo junihid g pi apꞌekam oki pi mahch g Jiosh alidag.

column2: Dear friends, don't let anyone fool you: those who do what is right are right, in the same way as Jesus is right.
column3: Haꞌi o hab kaij mamt d wo s-apꞌekamk, chum hems pi am hu hab junihidch g s-apꞌekam. S-e g wo nenꞌoidk mat pi wo em-iattogi. Jesus o am t-chehgidch g hejel e-doakagkaj matp hedai d wo s-apꞌekamk ch am hab wo junihid g s-apꞌekam.

column2: The message you've heard from the beginning is simply this: we should love one another.
column3: Ihda mani em-ahgid o d hegai mam kaichug ged hu i amjed mamt wehpeg kah. Ab g wo si pihk e elidad aꞌai e wui.

column2: We cannot be like Cain, who belonged to the Evil One, and murdered his brother. Why did he murder him? Because Cain did what was evil, while his brother did what was right.
column3: Neh, hema ash wa d Cain ch hab junihim g Jiawul tatchui. Kumt pi oidk am hab wo e junihid. Cain cheoj wehnag ash wa hab junihim g s-apꞌekam. Sh g Jiosh si tatchua. Tsh g Cain heg hekaj s-hehgam k mua.

column2: So don't be surprised, my friends, if this world hates you!
column3: Pi g wo shaꞌi e totodsid mat hems g hemajkam hab wa masma wo s-em-kehꞌidad.

column2: The reason we know that we have changed from death to life is because we love our Christian brothers and sisters. Anyone who doesn't love remains dead.
column3: S-mahch ach mo ab t-mahkch g Jiosh g wechij doakag nach pi si pihk t-elid ha hekaj g t-wehm wohochuddam ch hab masma ab ha neid mo d t-wepnag. Hegam mo pi pihk e elid ha hekaj g e-wepnag o hab sha masma mo g koꞌi.

column2: All those who hate their Christian brothers and sisters are murderers, and you know that no murderers have eternal life within them!
column3: Heg o wa wepo mo d ha muꞌakam matp hedai s-ha kehꞌid. Kuch s-mahch mo pi edgid g wechij doakag hegam mat hedai d wo ha muꞌakamk.

column2: This is how we know what love is: Jesus laid down his life for us, and we ought to lay down our lives for our Christian brothers and sisters.
column3: Jiosh alidag at ab muh kots t ab t-wehhejed no pi t-hekaj si pihk e elid. Id o hekaj tasho mo haschu d pihk elidadag. Kutt wo si pihk t-elidad ha hekaj g t-wepnag am hugkam matt chum hems wo t-muhkid am ha wehhejed.

column2: If one of you is living well in this world and you see your Christian brother or sister in need, but you don't show compassion—how can God's love be living in you?
column3: Pi o shaꞌi pihk e elid ab Jiosh wui hegai mat hedai haꞌichu wo s-edgidad ch pi heg hekaj ab hu wo i wehmt g e-wehnag.

column2: Dear friends, let's not just say we love with words, but show our love in what we do and how we demonstrate the truth.
column3: Ab att wo ha mah g t-wepnag g i wehmtadag matp wo tatchua k pi hab wabsh wo kaijjid mach si pihk t-elid ha hekaj.

column2: This is how we will know that we belong to the truth, and how we will set our minds  at rest before God
column3: K heg hekaj tasho mach edgid g wohokam. Id att hekaj ab wo i t-gewkemhu matt ab wo i miabi g Jiosh.

column2: whenever we think we're in the wrong. God is greater than how we think, and he knows everything.
column3: Hebaichujj ach ab haꞌichu t-chuꞌijigchud. K wabshaba g Jiosh baꞌich i s-gewkdag mach ahchim ch wehs haꞌichu s-mahch

column2: Dear friends, if we're reassured we're not in the wrong, we can have confidence before God.
column3: ch gam hu hab i juh hegai t-chuꞌijig. Tt hab pi haꞌichu ab hu wo t-chuꞌijigchud k ab wabsh wo i miabi g Jiosh pi shaꞌi has t-elidch.

column2: We'll receive from him whatever we ask him for, because we follow his commands and do what pleases him.
column3: Bach junihim g Jiosh tatchui ch hegai mo haschu ab t-chehani. K g Jiosh heg hekaj am hab t-junid mach haschu ab i tahni.

column2: This is what he commands: we should trust in the name of his Son Jesus Christ, and love one another, just as he commanded us to do.
column3: K id d chehanigaj g Jiosh matt ab wo s-wohochudad g alidaj ch ab aꞌai t-wui wo si pihk t-elidad mo hab masma t-chehani g alidaj.

column2: Those who keep his commands continue to live in him, and he lives in them. We know that he lives in us by the Spirit he has given us.
column3: Mach hedai ab s-wohog elid g Jiosh att ab si t-hemakoj heg wehm. Jiosh at ab t-mah g Hekia S-apꞌekam Gewkdag. K id d Jiosh ch t-wehmaj. Kuch heg hekaj s-mahch mach d aꞌaligaj.

column2: Dear friends, don't trust every spirit, but put the spirits to the test to find out whether they're from God, for there are many false prophets out there in the world.
column3: Muꞌi at an i wuwhag k hab chum e wua mo d ha mihshmaddam. K eda pi ha wehmaj g Hekia S-apꞌekam Gewkdag. Kumt heg hekaj pi wabsh chum hedai ab wo s-ha wohochud k hoꞌip ha aꞌappe mas woho ha wehmaj g Hekia S-apꞌekam Gewkdag.

column2: How can you recognize God's Spirit? Every spirit that accepts Jesus Christ came with a human body is from God;
column3: Ahchim o waꞌi t-wehmaj g Hekia S-apꞌekam Gewkdag mach hedai wohokamchud mo g Jesus d Jiosh alidag ch ia mahsi k d oꞌodham hab masma mach ahchim.

column2: while every spirit that doesn't accept Jesus, that spirit isn't from God. In fact it is the spirit of the antichrist which you heard was coming, and which is already in the world.
column3: Pi o am hu ha wehmaj g Hekia S-apꞌekam Gewkdag hegam mo hedai pi ab hu wohochud g Jiosh alidag. Am o hema ha wehmaj ch d Jesus obga. Heki am hu kah mat an wo i wuhsh g obgaj. K hemuch in haꞌichug no pi an ha wehmaj hegam mo pi ab hu wohochud g Jiosh alidag.

column2: But you belong to God, my friends, and you have defeated them, for the one who is in you is greater than the one who is in the world.
column3: Jiosh alidag obga o am ha wehmaj hegam mo g iattogi chum ha mihshmdahim. K wabshaba g Hekia S-apꞌekam Gewkdag in t-wehmaj. Kutt heg hekaj ha gewito no pi heg baꞌich i s-gewkdag mo hi g Jiosh alidag obga.

column2: They belong to the world, so they speak like people of the world, and the world listens to them.
column3: Hegam o ab wabsh jewed t ab haꞌichu k amjed neneok. K hegam ab ha kaiham mo hab waꞌap pi mahch g Jiosh.

column2: We belong to God and whoever knows God listens to us, while whoever doesn't belong to God doesn't listen to us. This is how we can distinguish the spirit of truth from the spirit of deception.
column3: Pi o ab hu t-kaiham mach chum neneok ab amjed g Jiosh no pi pi mahch g Jiosh. Hegam o ab waꞌi t-kaiham mo hedai s-mahch g Jiosh. Bach masma s-mahch mo hedai edgid g Hekia S-apꞌekam Gewkdag. Heg o am ha tashogid g wohokam.

column2: Dear friends, let's go on loving one another, for love comes from God. All those who love are born of God and know God.
column3: Ab att wo chum si pihk t-elidad aꞌai t-wui no pi g Jiosh ab t-mahkch g pihk elidadag. Mamtp woho wo s-mahchk g Jiosh ch d aꞌaligaj ch wo si pihk e elidad.

column2: Those who don't love don't know God, for God is love.
column3: Jiosh o si t-tatchua ch heg hekaj si pihk e elid ab t-wui. K hegam mo pi edgid g pihk elidadag pi d shaꞌi aꞌaligaj.

column2: How was God's love shown to us? God sent his one and only Son into the world so that we could live through him.  This is love! It's not that we loved God, but that he loved us, and he sent his Son to be the reconciliation for our sins.
column3: Jiosh at ab i wuhshad g si hemako e alidag id dahm jewed. T heg ab nako g s-koꞌok t-namkidadag mach heg ab beihog. Kut hab masma ab t-mah g wechij doakag. Bat wa masma am t-tashogi g Jiosh mo si pihk e elid ab t-wui. Kutt heg amjed i s-mai g pihk elidadag k hahawa si pihk t-elid ab Jiosh wui.

column2: Friends, if this is the way God loves us, we ought to love one another like this too.
column3: Am o wa tasho mo ab t-wui si pihk e elid g Jiosh. Pegih, ni-wepnag, ahchim att hab waꞌap wo chum si pihk t-elidad ab aꞌai t-wui.

column2: No one has ever seen God. However, if we love one another then God lives in us, and his love is fulfilled in us.
column3: Pi ach hedai hekid shaꞌi neid g Jiosh g t-wuhpuikaj. K wabshaba heg ab t-mahkch g si geꞌe pihk elidadag. Kuch heg hekaj s-mahch mo t-wehmaj.

column2: How can we know that we live in him, and that he lives in us? He's given us the ability to love by his Spirit.
column3: Jiosh at ab t-mah g Hekia S-apꞌekam Gewkdag. K heg d Jiosh ch ab t-wehm kihdag. Kuch heg hekaj s-mahch mach d aꞌaligaj.

column2: For we are witnesses to what we have seen and testify that the Father sent the Son as the Savior of the world.
column3: Heki at hu am i kei g Jiosh g e-alidag mat ab wo i hih jewed wui k wo ha doꞌibia g hemajkam. Kuni si neid ihda ch heg amjed am em-ahgid.

column2: God lives in everyone who declares that Jesus is the Son of God, and they live in God.
column3: Wehsijj ach d aꞌaligaj g Jiosh matt hedai ab s-wohochud k ah mo g Jesus d si alidaj.

column2: We have experienced and trusted in the love that God has for us. God is love, and those who live in love, live in God, and God lives in them.
column3: Kuch heg hekaj s-mahch mo si pihk e elid g Jiosh ab t-wui ch ab si t-hemakojidch e wehm.

column2: This is how love is made complete in us so that we can be confident on judgment day: by the fact that we live just like him in this world.
column3: Ab o t-mahkch g si geꞌe pihk elidadag. Kuch wepo masma ab si tatchua mo g alidaj ch hab s-ap t-taht k wo ai g lodaita

column2: Where there is love there can be no fear. God loves us completely, and this love drives all our fears away. If we do fear, it's because we fear being punished, and this shows that we have not been fully re-made by the completeness of God's love.
column3: k pi wo ehbidad. Gm at hu hab i juh g pi ap t-namkidadag g Jiosh no pi si pihk e elid ab t-wui. Kutt heg hekaj pi wo ehbidad ch wabsh aigo wo si pihk t-elidad ab wui. Pi o pihk e elid ab Jiosh wui hegai mat hedai wo s-ehbidad.

column2: We love because he loved us first.
column3: Wehpeg o si pihk e elid g Jiosh ab t-wui. Kuch heg hekaj edgid g pihk elidadag.

column2: Anyone who says, “I love God,” but hates a Christian brother or sister, is a liar. Anyone who doesn't love a brother whom they can see, can't love God whom they can't see.
column3: Pi o woho d Jiosh wohochuddam mo hedai pi ab hu pihk e elid t-wui ahchim mach d wohochuddam. Baꞌich o i s-hasig matt ab wo si tatchua hegai mach pi neid. Pi at wo e nako mat ab wo si tatchua g Jiosh matp hedai pi ab hu wo si ha tatchua g e-wepnag.

column2: This is the command he gave to us: those who love God love their brothers and sisters too.
column3: Ab o t-chehani g Jiosh ahchim mach ab si tatchua matt ab epai wo si ha tatchuad g t-wepnag.

column2: Whoever trusts that Jesus is the Christ is born of God, and whoever loves the father also loves his child.
column3: Dach Jiosh aꞌaliga wehsijj ahchim mach s-wohochud mo g Jesus d alidaj g Jiosh ch d si Kehshaj. Kutt ab aꞌai wo si t-tatchuad nach pi d t-wepngam. K g Jiosh d t-ohg.

column2: How do we know that we love God's children? When we love God and follow his commands.
column3: S-mahch ach mo d wohokam g t-tatchuidag ab aꞌai t-wui nach pi ab si tatchua g Jiosh.

column2: Loving God means that we follow his commands, and his commands are not hard to bear.
column3: K am wa tasho mach ab si tatchua g Jiosh nach pi ab s-wohog elid. K g chehanigaj pi shaꞌi wehch am t-wehhejed.

column2: Everyone who is born of God defeats the world. The way we gain victory and defeat the world is by trusting God.  Who can defeat the world? Only those who trust in Jesus, believing he is the Son of God.
column3: Jiosh o ab t-mahkch g gewkdag matt wo gewito g pi apꞌekam. Ab ach s-wohochud g alidaj. K heg hekaj ab t-mahkch hegai gewkdag matt heg hekaj gewito g pi apꞌekam. Pi at wo e nako g pi wohochuddam mas wo gewito g pi apꞌekam.

column2: He is the one who came through water and blood, Jesus Christ. He did not only come by water, but by water and blood.  The Spirit gives evidence to confirm this, for the Spirit is the truth.
column3: Jesus Christ at ia jiwia jewed dahm k e pahl wakon k am hab juh g e-chikpan k am hahawa e muhkid am t-wehhejed.

column2: So there are three that give evidence:  the Spirit, the water, and the blood, and all three agree as one.
column3: T g pahl wakonaj ch muhkigaj am wohokamch mo d Jiosh alidag ch d doakam id dahm jewed. K g Hekia S-apꞌekam Gewkdag hab waꞌap wohokamchud. Idam waik o am wohokamchud mo g Jesus d Jiosh alidag.

column2: If we accept the evidence that human witnesses provide, then the evidence that God provides is much more important. The evidence that God provides is his testimony about his Son.
column3: Neh, ab ach s-wohochud g oꞌodham mat ab haꞌijj wo t-ahgi mo si s-ap s-mahch. K g Jiosh haꞌichu ahga baꞌich i s-gewkdag mat heg am wohokamch g e-alidag.

column2: Those trusting in the Son of God have accepted and hold on to this evidence. Those who don't trust God make God out to be a liar, because they don't believe the evidence God has given about his Son.
column3: Kutt hedai ab wo s-wohoch g Jiosh alidag k wo si s-ap s-mahchk mo d wohokam. Hekia S-apꞌekam Gewkdag at t-wehhejed wo wohokamch. Hegam mo pi wohochud g Jiosh oki hab elid mo t-iattogid.

column2: The evidence is this: God has given eternal life to us, and we have this life through his Son.
column3: Ab o i t-tashogid g Jiosh mo ab t-makiog g pi ha huhugedam doakag am gahi wuhshanim g e-alidag.

column2: Whoever has the Son has life; whoever doesn't have the Son of God doesn't have life.
column3: Ahchim mach ab ihm g alidaj ach edgid hegai doakag. K hegam mo pi ab hu ihm pi edgid.

column2: I'm writing to tell those of you who trust in the name of the Son of God so you can be certain you have eternal life.
column3: Id ant am em-oꞌohani ahpim mam ab ihm g Jiosh alidag mamt hekaj wo s-mahchk mam edgid ihda wechij doakag.

column2: We can be confident that he will listen to us as long as we ask in accordance with his will.  If we know that he hears our requests, we can be sure that we will receive what we've asked him for.
column3: Si ach s-mahch mat ab wo t-kaiha g Jiosh matt ab haꞌichu wo tai matp id am tatchuij oidch d wo haꞌichuk. Kutt heg hekaj ab wo i t-gewkemhunad ch ab wo haꞌichu tahnid nat pi woho am hab wo t-junidahid.

column2: If you see your Christian brother or sister committing a sin that is not a deadly sin, you ought to pray and God will grant life to the one who's sinned. (But not for a deadly sin. There's a sin that is deadly, and I'm not saying people should pray about that.
column3: Ab att wo tahnid g Jiosh mat gam hu hab wo i juh g ha-chuꞌijig g t-wehm wohochuddam matp ab wo e shohbi. Kut hab wo juh mach haschu ab tahni. Pi ani em-ahgid mams wo e hoꞌigeꞌidahu ha wehhejed hegam mat pi ab hu wo shaꞌi e shohbi.

column2: Yes, all that is not right is sin, but there's sin that is not deadly).
column3: Wehs o haꞌichu d pi apꞌekam mo haschu i pi d Jiosh tatchui. T wabshaba g Jiosh gam hu hab wo i juh g ha-chuꞌijig hegam mat ab wo e shohbi.

column2: We recognize that those who are born of God don't keep on sinning. The Son of God  protects them and the devil cannot harm them.  We know that we belong to God, and that the world is under the power of the Evil One.
column3: S-mahch ach mo g Jiawul edgid g gewkdag am wehs ha dahm hegam mo pi d Jiosh aꞌaliga. Kuch eda ahchim d Jiosh aꞌaliga. Jiosh alidag o t-nuhkud. Kut pi wo shaꞌi e nako g Jiawul mas gam hu hab wo i t-juh ab amjed. Pi att am hu hab wo junihid g pi apꞌekam ahchim mach d Jiosh aꞌaliga.

column2: We also know that the Son of God has come, and has helped us to understand so we can recognize the one who is true. We live in him who is true, in his Son Jesus Christ. He is the true God, and is eternal life.
column3: K g Jiosh alidag ab t-mahkch g amichudadag matt wo s-mahchk g wohokam Jiosh ch wo edgidad g wechij doakag. Heg at hekaj ia jiwia g Jiosh alidag jewed dahm. Heg o d waꞌi t-Jioshga mo d si wohokam Jiosh.

column2: Dear friends, stay away from idol worship.
column3: Kumt pi haꞌichu ep wo jioshchud k pi hedai ep ab hu wui wo e hoꞌigeꞌidahunad.

column2: You were chosen by God the Father in his wisdom, made holy by the Spirit, so that you might obey Jesus Christ and be sprinkled with his blood. May you have grace and peace more and more!
column3: Jiosh at ab i em-gawulkai mamt d wo hemajkamgajk k ab em-mah g Hekia S-apꞌekam Gewkdag mat wo em-wehmajk ch am wo i kegch g em-dodakag. Mt hekaj ab wo s-wohog elidad g Jesus Christ ab i s-wohochudk mat iawua g e-ehꞌed k e muhkid em-wehhejed.

column2: Praise God, the Father of our Lord Jesus Christ! Through his great mercy we have been born again and given a living hope through the resurrection of Jesus Christ from the dead.
column3: Ab att hig wo si i hoꞌigeꞌel g Jiosh heg hekaj t-kownalig Jesus Christ. Heg ohg Jiosh at ab i wuhshad muhkig t amjed. K id am t-chehgidch mat hab waꞌap ab wo i t-wuwhas muhkig t amjed. Tt heg hekaj ab i s-wohochud k ab bei g wechij doakag.

column2: This inheritance is eternal, it never spoils or fades, and it is kept safe in heaven for you.
column3: Jiosh o an nahtokch g si s-kehg kihdag am t-wehhejed an dahm kahchim ch ed. T ihda apꞌechudaj chum hekid d wo hekiakamk ch pi hekid wo e padch.

column2: Through your trust in him, God will protect you by his power until salvation arrives—the salvation that is ready to be revealed at the last day.
column3: Ab ach s-wohochud g Jesus Christ. K heg hekaj t-nuhkud g Jiosh g si geꞌe e-gewkdagkaj. Kuch ab nenida mat s-ap wo maskogi g t-doꞌibiadag mat hekid wo huhug ihda jewed.

column2: So be happy about this, even though you may be sad for a short while as you endure various trials.
column3: Si g wo s-hehgigk mamt wo e doꞌibia, chum ams hems ab wo nakogad g nahnko mahs shoꞌigchudadag ch pi ap tahhadkam hemu.

column2: These prove that your trust in God is genuine, just as fire is used to prove if gold is genuine—even though that too can be destroyed—and your faith is more valuable than gold! In this way your trust in God will be recognized and you will receive praise, glory, and honor when Jesus Christ appears.
column3: Ihda em-shoꞌigchudadag at wo aꞌappe g em-wohochudadag k wo chehgi mo d wohokam hab masma mat g ohla g meikaj wo e aꞌappe mas d wohokam. Ia atsh ep wo i e chehgi Jesus Christ. T g Jiosh am haha wo chehgi mo ab si has em-elid.

column2: You love him even though you have never seen him. Though you cannot see him now, you trust in him and you're filled with wonderful, indescribable happiness.
column3: Pi am hi wa chum neid ch wabshaba ab si tatchua ch ab ep si s-wohochud. K id hekaj si geꞌej g s-em-hehgig. Kumt pi wo shaꞌi e nako mams wehs s-ap wo ah.

column2: Your reward for trusting in him is that you will be saved!
column3: Jiosh at em-doꞌibia namt pi ab i s-wohoch g Jesus Christ.

column2: It was this salvation that the prophets searched for and investigated when they spoke of the grace that was prepared for you.
column3: Hegam mash d Jiosh haꞌichu i tashogiddam oki wa an oꞌohan matsh an wo em-ai ihda doꞌibiadag haꞌichu ahga ch eda an ep chum hoanahim g e-oꞌohana ch an chum mamche

column2: They tried to find out when and how this would take place, for the Spirit of Christ inside them spoke clearly about Christ's sufferings and glory to come.
column3: mas hekid wo i k ch has masma hab wo e juh. Christ atsh ab ha mah g Hekia S-apꞌekam Gewkdag. Sh heg am ha tashogid matsh gam hu si ha baꞌich hab wo e juh matsh wo e shoꞌigch g Christ k haha wo bei g ab si has elidadag.

column2: It was explained to them that they were not doing this for themselves, but for you—since what they spoke about you've now learned from those who shared the good news with you by the Holy Spirit that heaven sent. Even the angels are eager to find out about all this!
column3: S-mahch ash mat pi wabsh hejel e wehhejed oꞌoha hegai mash am ha wui i e tashogid.

column2: Make sure your minds are in gear. Be clear-headed. Fix your hope exclusively on the grace you'll be given when Jesus is revealed.
column3: Am g wo i e nakog k ab wo si i e nenenashanichud k ab wo si i e gewpkai heg ab hoꞌigeꞌidadag mat g Jiosh wo em-mah mat hekid ep wo jiwia g Jesus Christ.

column2: Live like children that do what they're told. Don't allow yourselves to be shaped by your former sinful desires when you didn't know any better.
column3: Ab g wo s-wohog elidad g Jiosh ch pi wo shaꞌi e hiwigi mams ged hu uhpam wo shul heg eda pi apꞌekam mam wa ab tatchua mam eda pi mahch g Jiosh.

column2: Now you need to be holy in everything you do, just as the One who called you is holy.
column3: Jiosh at ab i t-wai matt d wo hemajkamgajk. Kutt heg hekaj d wo chum si hekia s-apꞌekamk hab masma mo g Jiosh.

column2: As Scripture says, “You are to be holy, for I am holy.”
column3: An o oꞌohanas Jiosh oꞌohana ed mo hab kaij:

column2: Since you call him Father, and recognize he judges everyone impartially based on what they do, take your time here on earth seriously, respecting him.
column3: Bam masma ihm g Jiosh ab e hoꞌigeꞌidahunch wui mo d em‑ohg. Kut heg wehs wo ha aꞌappe. Pegih, mt ab wo si has elidad chum hekid mamt heꞌes i tash ia d wo dodakamk.

column2: You already know that you were not set free from your pointless way of living that you inherited from your forefathers by things that don't have lasting value, like silver or gold.
column3: Heki o hu hab elidas mat wo em‑doꞌibia g heki hu em‑himdag. Em‑shohshonbad ash wa chum em‑mashcham mamtsh haꞌichu ab wo namkid g Jiosh k hekaj am wo i e apꞌech nenaj ed. Kumtp hems chum namkid g plahda o g ohla o wabsh chum haschu. K wabshaba ihda hab mahs haꞌichu d wabsh pi haꞌichu am Jiosh tahgio. Kum am hahawa s‑mahch mat g Jiosh baꞌich i s‑namkig haꞌichukaj em‑doꞌibia.

column2: You were set free by the costly blood of Christ, who was like a lamb with no flaw or defect.
column3: Am o t‑tashogid g Jiosh mat has masma wo t‑doꞌibia am t‑chehanich mattsh wo mua g si s‑kehg kahwal k ab wui wo iagchul. Pegih, k g Jesus Christ d si hekia s‑apꞌekam ch hab sha masma e muhkid am t‑wehhejed mat wo t‑doꞌibia ab amjed g s‑koꞌok t‑namkidadag mach d pi ap chuꞌijkam.

column2: He was chosen before the world was created, but he was revealed in these last days  for your benefit.
column3: Jiosh at am i kei mat eda koi in hu nahto g jewed k hemuch hahawa in i maskogi jewed dahm mat wo t‑doꞌibia

column2: Through him you trust in God who raised him from the dead, and glorified him, so that you could have confidence and hope in God.
column3: k ab i wuhshad am i dahm mat e muhkid k ab uhgk i be k ab dai e‑hugid an k ab si has elid. Kumt heg hekaj ab i s‑wohoch g Jiosh k ab si hiwig.

column2: Now that you've dedicated yourselves by following the truth, love each other sincerely like a true family.
column3: Jiosh at ab i hekiagi g em‑doakag namt pi ab s‑wohog el g wohokam ab amjed. Pegih, ab g aꞌai wo e tatchuad wehs e‑ihbdagkaj.

column2: You've been born again, not the product of a mortal “seed,”  but immortal, through the living, eternal word of God.
column3: Pi at hekid wo huhug g Jiosh haꞌichu ahga. Kutt ab i s‑wohochud k hekaj ab bei g wechij doakag. T id hab waꞌap pi hekid wo huhug, chum as g t‑chuhkug wo huhug.

column2: For: “All people are like grass, and all their glory like wildflowers. The grass withers and the flowers fall.
column3: Neh, an o hab chuꞌig Jiosh oꞌohana ed:

column2: So give up all the evil things that you do: all your dishonesty, hypocrisy, and jealousy, all the ways you speak badly about others.
column3: Gam g hu hab wo i juhni g s‑padhog elidadag ch iattogida ch hehgamdadag ch has ahgadag.

column2: You should become like newborn babies who only want pure spiritual milk, so you can grow in salvation  now you've tasted how good the Lord really is.
column3: Jiosh haꞌichu ahga o d s‑kehg gegosig g em‑doakag wehhejed. Ab at em‑wui chehgi g e‑hoꞌigeꞌidadag. Kumt ab wo si tatchuad hab masma mo g s‑moik ali tatchua g wihbi ch hekaj wo i geꞌelhid am e‑doꞌibiadag ed.

column2: As you come to him—the living stone that people rejected as useless, but is chosen by God and precious to him—
column3: Ab g wehs wo i e dagito t‑kownalig Jesus wui. Haꞌi o chum s‑ohhodamk g hemajkam. T wabshaba g Jiosh am i kei mat d wo t‑shonk am t‑wohochudadag ed.

column2: you also become like living stones, being built into a spiritual house. You are a holy priesthood that offers spiritual sacrifices that God welcomes through Jesus Christ.
column3: Kumt ab wo abkad hab sha masma mat g hohodai ab wo abkad g e‑shon am ha‑kihta ed. Heg o wa wepo mach ab ab kihtas g Jesus ch d geꞌe cheopi no pi am hahawa t‑eda g Jiosh. Jiosh at wehs am i t‑chuhcha ahchim Jesus wohochuddam matt d wo hekiakam papalk ch ab wui wo t‑hoꞌigeꞌidahunad ch am hab wo junihid g tatchuij. T id heg wo wa wepok mo g s‑ap iagchulida no pi g Jiosh s‑hohhoꞌid.

column2: As Scripture  says, “See! I'm setting in Zion its main cornerstone, specially-chosen and valuable. Whoever trusts in him will not be disappointed.”
column3: Id ani hab kaij no pi an oꞌohanas mo g Jiosh hab kaij:

column2: In complete contrast, you are a specially-chosen family, a royal priesthood, a holy nation, a people belonging to God. Consequently you can reveal the wonderful things he's done, calling you out of darkness into his marvelous light.
column3: Kum eda ahpim ab s‑wohochud ch d Jiosh hemajkamga ch wehs d papal am wehhejed g t‑kownalig Jesus. Jiosh at am i em‑chuhcha mamt wo i ahgahi g s‑kehg haꞌichu tatchuij. Ab at i em‑wuwhas s‑chuhugam k amjed k ab i em‑wahpki si s‑kehg tonlig ch ed no p i ab em‑mahkch g amichudadag.
