column2: In the past you were nobodies, but now you are God's people. In the past you hadn't received mercy, but now you have received mercy.
column3: Heki am hu pi d haꞌichu ch wabshaba hemuch d hahawa Jiosh hemajkamga ch ab hahawa uꞌukch g Jiosh hoꞌigeꞌidadag.

column2: My friends, I'm pleading with you as foreigners and strangers  in this world not to give in to physical desires that are in conflict with what is spiritual.
column3: Pegih, ni‑wepnag, pi am ia hu d si kihkam jewed dahm. Chum o hems g hejel em‑tatchui cheggia g em‑doꞌibiadag. Kunt wo si em‑ahgi mamt pi ab hu wui wo i e dagito

column2: Be sure to act appropriately when you're with non-Christians, so even if they accuse you of doing wrong, they will see the good things you do and glorify God when he comes.
column3: k wabshaba hab wo junihid g s‑apꞌekam. T hab wo nei g s‑ap haꞌichu hab em‑juni hegam matp hedai ab haꞌichu em‑abchud. T ab wo i e ai g geꞌe lodaita tash. T idam hemho wa wo wohokamch mat g Jiosh si s‑kehg haꞌichu hab juh am em‑doakag ed.

column2: Obey human authority for the Lord's sake, whether it is the king as the highest authority,  or governors that God appoints to punish those who do evil and to commend those who do good.
column3: Ab g wo s‑wohog elidad g kownal ch wehs hegam mo d kownal chuhchai. Idam o chum s‑koꞌokam ha namkid g pi ap chuꞌijkam ch ab i ha gewkemhun g s‑ap chuꞌijkam.

column2: God wants you by doing what is right to silence the ignorant accusations of foolish people.
column3: K d Jiosh tatchui mamt ab wo s‑ha wohog elidad ch hab wo junihid g s‑apꞌekam. T hab pi wo e nako mas has wo em‑ah hegam matp hems nahnko em‑ahg.

column2: Yes, you are free people! So don't use your freedom as a cover-up for evil, but live as God's servants.
column3: Ab at i em‑wuwhas g Jiosh heki hu em‑himdag amjed. Mt hab masma am hab wo e junihid mam d e doꞌibiakam ch d si piongaj g Jiosh ch wabshaba pi wo hekaj g e‑apꞌedag mams am hu hab wo juh g pi apꞌekam.

column2: Respect everyone. Show your love to the community of believers. Have reverence for God. Respect the king.
column3: Ab g wo ihmad g Jiosh ch ab wo si has ha elidad g kokownal ch s‑ap ab wo ha neidad g hemajkam ch ab wo si pihk e elidad ha hekaj g e‑wehm wohochuddam.

column2: If you are a servant then submit to your master—not just those who are good and kind, but those who are harsh masters as well.
column3: Ahpim pion, ab g wabsh wo i e dagitokchid e‑aꞌamo ha wui ch ab wo has ha elidad, chum as haꞌijj wo s‑ta kekꞌeidamak.

column2: For this is what grace is: to endure life's pain and unfair suffering, keeping your focus on God.
column3: Kut g Jiosh ab wo s‑em‑hoꞌigeꞌidad. S‑apꞌe o mamt s‑ap wo nako g shoꞌigchudadag s‑chegitokch g Jiosh.

column2: However there's no credit when you're punished for doing something wrong. But if you suffer for doing what is right, and you put up with it, then God's grace is with you.
column3: Ab o d t‑wuikam g s‑koꞌok namkidadag mattp hab wo junihid g pi apꞌekam. Ttp wabshaba s‑ap wo nako g shoꞌigdag am hab chum junihidch g s‑apꞌekam, t g Jiosh ab wo wa s‑t‑hoꞌigeꞌel id hekaj

column2: In fact this is what you were called to do, because Christ suffered for you and gave you an example, so you should follow in his footsteps.
column3: no pi hab d elidaj matt s‑ap ab wo nako.

column2: and when he was badly treated, he didn't retaliate. When he suffered, he didn't threaten to take revenge. He simply placed himself in the hands of the one who always judges rightly.
column3: Ab amt wa si s‑koꞌokam has ah. T wabshaba pi ab hu aigo has ha ah. Si amt shoꞌigch. T wabshaba pi ha ebkiod k ab wabsh i e dagitokch Jiosh wui s‑mahchch mo heg d si s‑apꞌekam usagakam.

column2: He took our sins on himself in his body on the cross, so that we could die to sin and live rightly. “By his wounds you are healed.”
column3: Christ at wehs moht g t‑chuꞌijig k heg hekaj ab e muhkid kots t ab mat wo t‑doꞌibia. Kutt hab wo dagito g pi apꞌekam k am wo i hihi s‑apꞌekam oidk. Shoꞌigchudadaj at doaj g t‑doakag.

column2: Wives, accept your husbands' authority in the same way, so that if some husbands refuse to accept the word, they may still be won over without words by the way you behave,
column3: Ahpim uꞌuwi amt ab wo e dagitokch heheꞌejel e‑kuhkun ha wui k ch s‑ap wo ha nuhkudad chum hems hegam mo pi ab hu wohochud g Jiosh. Tp hems ab wo i s‑wohoch

column2: recognizing your pure and reverent behavior.
column3: am neidch g s‑ap haꞌichu hab em‑juni, chum ams hems pi has wo kaijjid ab amjed g e‑wohochudadag.

column2: Don't focus on outward attractiveness—hairstyles, gold jewelry, or fashionable clothes—
column3: S‑ap amt ulinim d wo uꞌuwik ch wabshaba heg pi ab hu wo hiwgad mams ab wo si has masma e apꞌech. Pi at wo em‑apꞌech am Jiosh tahgio mamt has masma wo apꞌech g e‑moꞌo o an hab wo juh g si s‑namkig aꞌanilo ch sisishpakud ch eniga.

column2: instead let it come from within, the lasting attractiveness of a gentle and peaceful spirit on the inside. That's what God values.
column3: Baꞌich i mamt wo s‑hemajimak ch wo s‑dodolimak. T hab wo s‑apꞌek g em‑doakag am Jiosh tahgio.

column2: This is how holy women of the past who put their confidence in God made themselves beautiful, yielding to their husbands,
column3: Bo wa masma hab chuꞌig g Jiosh wohochuddam uꞌuwi ga hu i wehpeg ch ab i e dagitokch heheꞌejel e‑kuhkun ha wui.

column2: like Sarah who obeyed Abraham, and called him “lord.” You are her daughters if you do what's right and are not intimidated.
column3: Sarabad o wa hab chuꞌig ch ab s‑wohog elid g Abrahambad mo heg d ha‑wanimeddam am ha‑kihdag ed. Kumt ahpim Jiosh wohochuddam uꞌuwi am hab wo junihid g s‑apꞌekam ch pi haꞌichukaj wo e kudutad. T heg wo wa wepok mam d Sarabad amjedkam.

column2: Husbands, in just the same way, be considerate to your wives as you live together with them. Though she may not be as strong as you are, you should honor her since she will inherit equally with you God's gift of life. Make sure to do this so nothing will get in the way of your prayers.
column3: Ahpim chechoj amt ab wo has ha elidad g e‑hohonig nam pi s‑mahch mo pi am hu hugkam s‑gewkdag mam ahpim. Bamt masma s‑ap wo e hoꞌigeꞌidahunad g e‑hohonig ha wehm. T g Jiosh ab wo em‑kaihamad. Am g wo s‑chegitok mam e wehm uꞌukch g pi ha huhugedam doakag no pi g Jiosh ab em‑mahkch.

column2: Finally, you should all have the same attitude. Be sympathetic and love each other. Be compassionate, and humble.
column3: Wehsijj amt ab wo i e hemakochud k ab aꞌai wo si i e tatchuad ch wo s‑e hoꞌigeꞌidad ch ab wo i e shoꞌigch aꞌai e wui.

column2: Don't pay back evil for evil, or retaliate when you're abused, instead you should give a blessing—because that's what you were called to do, so you could gain a blessing yourself.
column3: Pi g am wo e agwua g pi apꞌekamkaj k pi ab hu wo i nodagi g pi kehg neꞌoki. Ab o t‑ab matt ab wabsh wo i s‑ha hoꞌigeꞌel. T g Jiosh ab epai wo i s‑t‑hoꞌigeꞌel nat pi heg hekaj ab i t‑wai.

column2: Remember: “Those who want to love life, and to see good days, must refrain from speaking evil, and not tell lies.
column3: An o hab chuꞌig Jiosh heki hu oꞌohana ed:

column2: Who will harm you if you're keen to do good?
column3: K pi hab chum mahs mas hedai wo s‑koꞌokam em‑juh mamt am wo si e nakogad mamt am hab wo junihid g s‑apꞌekam.

column2: For even if you suffer for doing what's right, you're still better off. Don't be scared over what people threaten, don't worry about it;
column3: Tp hab wo mahsk mamt wo e shoꞌigch am hab junihidch g s‑apꞌekam, mt wabsh wo s‑ap e tahtkkad nat pi g Jiosh ab wo wa s‑em‑hoꞌigeꞌel heg hekaj. Pi g wo shaꞌi ha ehbidad hegam mat wo em‑shoꞌigchudad.

column2: just keep your mind focused on Christ as Lord. Always be ready to explain to anyone who asks you the reason for the hope that you have. Do this in a gentle and respectful way.
column3: Ab g wo has elidad g t‑kownalig Jesus Christ ch chum hekid wo e nahtokchid mamt s‑ap wo ahgi mat hedai ab wo i em‑kakke mam haschu wui ab e gewpkadch.

column2: Make sure your conscience is clear, so that if anyone makes accusations against you, they will be embarrassed for speaking badly about the good way you live your life in Christ.
column3: Kumt wabsh si s‑ap e taht k wabsh s‑hemajim ab wo ha ahgi.

column2: It's certainly better to suffer for doing good, (if that's what God wants), than to suffer for doing wrong!
column3: S‑apꞌe o matt wo t‑shoꞌigch am hab junihidch g s‑apꞌekam matp d wo Jiosh tatchuik. K wabshaba d si edadag mattp am hab wo junihid g pi apꞌekam ch hekaj wo t‑shoꞌigch.

column2: Jesus died because of sins, once and for all, the One completely true and right for those who are bad, so that he could bring you to God. He was put to death in the body, but he came to life in the spirit.
column3: Jesus Christ o d hekia s‑apꞌekam ch wa eda e shoꞌigch. Pegih, tt ahchim hab waꞌap wo t‑shoꞌigch.

column2: He went to speak to those “imprisoned”
column3: Id gahi wuhshanim Hekia S‑apꞌekam Gewkdag o wa g Jesus Christ am ha mihshmad hegam mo hemu d koꞌi ch gam hu si kuhpi.

column2: that refused to believe, when God patiently waited in the time of Noah while the ark was being built. Only a few—in fact eight people—were saved “through water.”
column3: Jiosh ash wa si s‑hemajim ab ha nenida g hemajkam mash eda g Noahbad ab s‑wohog elid ch nahtohim g geꞌe wahlko. Tsh wabshaba g hemajkam pi ab hu wohog el. Tsh hab ha wiꞌin. Tsh hegam waꞌi Noahbad e doꞌibia am i wahpk wahlko ch ed matsh am i ha wiꞌin. Sh d gigiꞌik hemajkam matsh e doꞌibia.

column2: This water symbolizes baptism that now saves you, not by washing off dirt from your body, but as a positive response to God that comes from a clear conscience. It is the resurrection of Jesus Christ that makes your salvation possible.
column3: Id ani wepogid g t‑pahl wakonadag. Heg att hekaj am t‑chehgi mach s‑wohochud mat g Jesus Christ s‑ap gahi wuhsh g muhkig am t‑wehhejed. Tt ahchim hab waꞌap s‑ap wo gahi wuwha. Pi o hab d ahga g pahl wakonadag machs wabsh wako g t‑chuhkug. Bo d ahga matt ab i t‑dagito Jiosh wui nat pi gam hu hab i juh g pi ap t‑chuꞌijig. Ch hahawa pi heg hekaj t‑kudut.

column2: Having ascended to heaven, he stands at God's right hand, with angels, authorities, and powers placed under his control.
column3: Christ at gam hu hih dahm kahchim wui. Kush g Jiosh ab si has elid an e‑hugid an dahshch e‑kownal daikud an. Kush g anghil ch nahnko mahs gewpkdag an dahm kahchim ch ed ab wecho.

column2: Since Christ suffered physically, you must prepare yourselves with the same attitude he had—for those who suffer physically have turned away from sin.
column3: E at shoꞌigch g Christ k hekaj am gewito g pi apꞌekam t‑wehhejed. Kumt id wo s‑chegitok namt pi hab waꞌap wo e shoꞌigch mamt wo gewito g pi apꞌekam.

column2: You will not live the rest of your lives following human desires, but doing what God wants.
column3: Hemho wa amt am wo e‑dagitokchid Jiosh wui wehs e‑doakdag oidam ch pi g hejel e‑tatchui hab wo junihid.

column2: In the past you've spent enough time following the ways of the world: immorality, sexual indulgence, drunken orgies, partying, binge drinking, and revolting idol-worship.
column3: Tash amt am hihi pi apꞌekam ch ed mam ab jioshga ihda jewed t ab haꞌichu ch nawkkoꞌo ch wabsh e totontochud ch ha wehm woꞌiwup hegam mo pi d em‑wehm kihkam.

column2: People think it's strange that you don't join them anymore in this wild and excessive lifestyle, so they curse at you. But they will have to explain what they've done to the One who is ready to judge the living and the dead.
column3: Hemu at e ai mamt haꞌasa hab juh hegai hab mahs pi apꞌekam. K g em‑wehm oꞌodham hahawa pi em‑amichud ch ab si has em‑ahg.

column2: That's why the good news was shared with those who've already died—
column3: E o nahtokch g Jiosh mat wehs wo ha lodai g hemajkam, chum hems hegam mat heki hu koi. Kut wehs wo ah g pi ap e‑chuꞌijig hegam mat pi dagito.

column2: so that although they were rightly judged as far as being sinful human beings is concerned, they could live in the spirit as far as God is concerned.
column3: E ash wa ahgahim g s‑kehg haꞌichu ahga chum hems wa hegam ha wui mat idani heki hu koi matp hems ab wo bei g pi ha huhugedam doakag k an haha wo wehmajk g Jiosh.

column2: Everything is coming to an end! So think clearly and stay alert when you pray.
column3: E o aihim mat wo huhug g jewed. Kumt wo si e nuhkud ch wo si s‑e tahtkkad ch hab s‑ap wo e hoꞌigeꞌidahunad.

column2: Most of all, you should love one another very deeply, for love covers many of the wrong things people do.
column3: Id o d i si haꞌichu mamt ab wo si ha tatchua g e‑wehm wohochuddam k hekaj wabsh wo pi chegito g pi ap ha‑chuꞌijig.

column2: Show hospitality to each another, and don't complain.
column3: S‑hohhoꞌidam amt ab aꞌai wo i e hiwgidad e‑kihki ed.

column2: Whatever gift you've been given, share it with others among you, as people who wisely demonstrate God's grace in all its different forms.
column3: Ab o t‑mahkch g Jiosh g nahnko mahs mahchig ch apꞌedag. K hab d elidaj matt am aꞌai wo i t‑wehmtad id hekaj t‑apꞌedag.

column2: Anyone who speaks should do so as though God is speaking through them. Anyone who wants to help others should do so through the strength that God gives, so that in everything God may be glorified through Jesus Christ. May glory and power be his forever and ever. Amen.
column3: Mamtp hedai wo ha mihshmad k heg waꞌi Jiosh haꞌichu ahga wo ahgad. Mtp hedai ab wo mahksk mamt wo i ha wehmtad g hemajkam, mt am hab wo juh heg hekaj gewkdag mo g Jiosh ab em‑mahkch. Bamt masma ab wo si has elidad g Jiosh am gahi wuhshanim g Jesus Christ. Neh, wehs o ab d t‑wuikam matt ab wo wechokad ch ab wo hehgchulidad chum hekid.

column2: My friends, don't be alarmed at the “ordeals of fire” you're having, as if these were unexpected.
column3: Ni‑tatchuidch ni‑wepnag, pi g am wo has elidad mam ab nakog g shoꞌigdag.

column2: Be happy to the extent that you share in Christ's suffering, because when he appears in his glory, you will be incredibly happy!
column3: Jesus Christ o wa heg ab nakog. Kumt wo si s‑hehgigk mam hab waꞌap nakog am hab junihidch g chikpanaj. Ab o him g tash mat g gewkdaj wo i e maskogi. Kumt hahawa baꞌich wo i s‑hehgigk.

column2: If you are cursed in Christ's name, you're blessed, for God's glorious spirit rests on you.
column3: Mtp hems s‑koꞌokam has wo em‑ahgad nam pi ab si ihm g Christ. Kumt wabshaba wo si s‑ap e tahtkkad no pi am em‑wehmaj g Hekia S‑apꞌekam Gewkdag.

column2: If you suffer, it should not be as a murderer, or a thief, or a criminal, or as a gossip—
column3: Pi g am hu hab wo junihid g pi apꞌekam. T wo em‑ai g s‑koꞌok em‑namkidadag. Pi g wo ha muaꞌi. Pi g wo s‑chu eꞌeskad. Pi g wo hudawogad hegai mo haschu pi ab hu em‑him.

column2: but if it's as a Christian, then you don't need to be ashamed. Instead praise God that you're called by that name!
column3: Mt ab wo si i hoꞌigeꞌel g Jiosh k pi has wo e el mamtp wo sha e shoꞌigch heg hekaj mam ab si ihm g Christ.

column2: For the time of judgment has come—and it begins with the house of God. If it begins with us, what will be the end of those who reject God's good news?
column3: E at ai mat g Jiosh wo t‑aꞌappe. Kutt chum hems ahchim Jiosh hemajkamga wo t‑aꞌappe g shoꞌigchudakaj. Pegih, t hemho wa baꞌich ab wo i nei g shoꞌigdag hegam mo pi ab hu wohochud g Jiosh haꞌichu ahga.

column2: “If it's hard for those who live right to be saved, what will happen to sinners, those who oppose God?”
column3: Neh, bo chuꞌig g heki hu oꞌohanaj g Jiosh:

column2: So then those who suffer according to the will of God, the trustworthy Creator, should make sure they are doing good.
column3: Neh, Jiosh o d t‑nahtokam ch woho hab wo juh hegai mo hab kaij mat hab wo juh. Kumt heg hekaj ab wui wo i e dagito, chum as hems wo hiwigi mamt wo e shoꞌigch am hab junihidch g s‑apꞌekam.

column2: I want to encourage the elders among you. I'm also an elder, a witness to Christ's sufferings, and I will share in the glory that is to come.
column3: Ahni ani wa g ni‑wuhpuikaj neid mad wa muꞌi e shoꞌigch g Jesus Christ. Jiosh o ab si has elid ch wehmaj ab si has t‑elid ch id am wo maskogi mat hekid ia ep wo jiwia g Christ jewed dahm. K ab ni‑ab mant wo ahgahid ab amjed. Dani hema ha wanimeddam g Jiosh hemajkamga ch heg hekaj am i em‑gewkemhun ahpim mam hab waꞌap d ha wanimeddam.

column2: Look after God's flock you have been given to care for, watching over it not because you're forced to, but gladly, as God wants you to. Do this willingly, not looking to make a profit from it.  Don't be arrogant, lording it over those who have been put in your care, but be an example to the flock.
column3: Am o haꞌi em‑nuhkudachud g Jiosh g hemajkam. Kumt wo si s‑ap ha nuhkudad hab masma mat g kahwal ha nuhkuddam hab wo ha juh g e‑kahwaliga. S‑mahch am mo pi ha shahdahim ch wabshaba s‑ap ha wanimed. Kumt ahpim hab waꞌap wo ha wanimedad g hemajkam ch am wo ha chehgi g e‑doakagkaj mat has wo chum masmak. Pi o hab chum chuꞌig mams ab wo haꞌichu si i ha chehanid. K pi hab chum chuꞌig mams wo si tatchuad g e‑namkidadag heg hekaj chikpan. Mt wo chum si tatchuad mamt si s‑ap wo ha nuhkudad.

column2: When the chief Shepherd appears, you will receive a glorious crown that will never fade.
column3: T g Jesus Christ ab wo em‑mah g pi ha huhugedam si has elidadag mat hekid ia ep wo jiwia jewed dahm no pi heg wehsijj d t‑nuhkuddam.

column2: Young people, do what the elders tell you. Indeed all of you should serve one another in humility, because “God is against the proud, but favors the humble.”
column3: Ab amt wo ha kaihamad g e‑wanimeddam. Wehsijj amt wabsh wo i e shoꞌigchudad. Neh, bo chuꞌig g Jiosh oꞌohana:

column2: Be responsible, and stay alert. The devil, your enemy, is prowling around like a roaring lion looking for someone to devour.
column3: Si g wo s‑e tahtkkad ch wehs haꞌichu wo si nenashanad. Jiawul o chum s‑t‑uꞌimk ch s‑koꞌokam s‑t‑junimk hab masma matp g mawid wo sha t‑be k hab waꞌap wo s‑koꞌokam t‑juh.

column2: Stand firm against him, trusting in God. Remember that your fellow-believers around the world are going through similar troubles.
column3: Wehsijj g em‑wehm wohochuddam o ab nakog ihda hab mahs shoꞌigdag. Kumt heg hekaj s‑wihnam wo gegokkad e‑wohochudadag ed ch ab wui wo gegokkad g Jiawul.

column2: After you have suffered for a little while, the God of all grace who called you into his eternal glory in Christ, will himself restore you, support you, strengthen you, and give you a solid foundation.
column3: Jiosh at ab i em‑gawulkai mamt ab wo i s‑wohoch g Jesus Christ k chum hekid wehmaj wo edgidad g si s‑kehg apꞌedag. Kumt al haꞌas wo i taht g shoꞌigdag. T g Jiosh ab wo em‑mah g gewkdag k hab wo em‑juh mamt wo geꞌegeꞌehogat k s‑wihnam wo gegokkad.

column2: To him be power forever and ever! Amen.
column3: Jiosh o d gewkdag chum hekid. Kutt chum hekid ab wo hehgchulidad.

column2: With the help of Silvanus, whom I consider a trustworthy brother, I send this letter to you. In these few words I've written I want to encourage you and testify that this is the true grace of God. Stand firm in God's grace!
column3: Ia o ni‑wehmaj g Silas ch am oꞌoha ihda al haꞌichu ni‑ahga k am wo i bei em‑wui. Ab ani si hiwig g Silas am eda ihda chikpan.

column2: The believers here in “Babylon,” chosen together with you, send their greetings to you, as does Mark, my son.
column3: Idam t‑wehm wohochuddam mo ia d kihkam Rome t am o s‑em‑ahgidamk mamt ab wo i s‑ha hoꞌigeꞌel.

column2: Greet each other with a kiss of love. Peace to all of you who are in Christ.
column3: Ab g wo aꞌai si e ihmad, ahpim e wehm wohochuddam.

column2: We are always thanking God for all of you, never forgetting you in our prayers.
column3: Chum ach hekid ab hoꞌigeꞌid g Jiosh em-hekaj ch em-wehhejed t-hoꞌigeꞌidahun.

column2: We remember you before our God and Father—how you put your trust in him into practice, how you work hard in love, and how you patiently wait in the hope of our Lord Jesus Christ.
column3: Ab am si s-wohochud g t-kownalig Jesus Christ ch hekaj chum hekid hab s-junimk g s-apꞌekam. Pihk em-elidadag o hab em-wua mam si chikpanid g Jiosh. Kum si s-gewkam him g e-doakag nam pi si nenida hegai matsh hab wo wa t-juni g Jesus. Id ach am wa wehs s-chegito ch hekaj chum hekid ab hoꞌigeꞌid g Jiosh.

column2: Brothers and sisters, we already know that you are loved by God and are very special to him.
column3: Jiosh o ab si em-tatchua ch ab i em-ui mamt d wo aꞌaligajk.

column2: The good news we brought to you wasn't just words, but had power too, for the Holy Spirit completely convinced you. In the same way you know what kind of men we are since we demonstrated to you that we were working for your benefit.
column3: Am att uꞌapa g s-kehg haꞌichu ahgaj em-wui. Kumt ab i s-wohoch. Pi ach wabsh neneok. Hekia S-apꞌekam Gewkdag at ab t-mah g gewkdag k am em-chehgi mo d wohokam g haꞌichu t-ahga. Am am wa s-mahch mach s-ap himchud g t-doakag am em-shahgid. Bach wa masma am em-chehgid mamt has wo i chum masmak.

column2: You were imitating us and the Lord when you received the message, for despite your troubles you experienced the joy the Holy Spirit gives.
column3: Kum am t-oidch s-ap hab e junihim ch hab s-ap hab junihim g t-kownalig Jesus tatchui. Chum ams em-shoꞌigchud, mt ab i s-wohoch g Jiosh haꞌichu ahga. T g Hekia S-apꞌekam Gewkdag ab em-mah g si geꞌe s-hehgig.

column2: So you have become an example to all the believers in Macedonia and Greece!
column3: An amsh e wehgaj ha chehgidch g e-wehm wohochuddam mat has wo chum masmak. Muꞌijj ash ab em-amjed haꞌichu mahchim hegam mo am kih Macedonia ch Greece jejewed ch ed.

column2: You have broadcast the Lord's message, not only in Macedonia and Greece, but everywhere people have heard of your trust in God—so there's no need for us to tell anybody about it!
column3: T g Jiosh haꞌichu ahga gam hu aꞌai ep jejewed dahm i hih ab em-amjed. Wehsko o an e aꞌaga mam ab s-wohochud g Jiosh. K ab hahawa d em-wuikam mamt wo ha ahgi g Jiosh haꞌichu ahga. Kuch ab wabsh em-wui dagitokch.

column2: In fact they talk about what a marvelous welcome you gave us, how you abandoned idols and turned to God, how you serve the true and living God,
column3: Si amt s-ap ab i t-neid k ab i s-wohoch g s-wohokam Jiosh k gam hu ha dagito hegam mo d wabsh hemajkam ha-nahtoi. Id o wehsko an aꞌaga g hemajkam.

column2: as you look forward to the coming of his Son from heaven—Jesus, the one God raised from the dead, who will save us from the judgment to come.
column3: Ab o wa t-aihim g s-koꞌok namkida ab amjed g Jiosh. T wabshaba g Jiosh alidag am t-wehhejed e muhkid mat wo t-doꞌibia. T g Jiosh ab i wuhshad muhkig amjed k ab uhpam ep bei. Hemuch amsh s-ap nenida mat ia ep wo jiwia g Jiosh. Alidag ab dahm kahchim t amjed.

column2: Brothers and sisters, you yourselves know what our visit meant to you, and that it wasn't wasted!
column3: Am am wa s-mahch ahpim t-wehm wohochuddam mat s-ap haꞌichu am hab e juh heg hekaj matt am dada am ahgachugch g Jiosh haꞌichu ahga.

column2: You'll recall that after having had much trouble and bad treatment at Philippi, with the help of God we still dared to share God's good news with you, despite the opposition we faced.
column3: Am ach wa em-ahgid mat haꞌi t-shoꞌigch amai Philippi kihhim t am matt eda koi am hu dada em-wui. T wabshaba g Jiosh ab i t-mah g gewkdag. Kutt am wabsh s-chechojim ahgachug g s-kehg haꞌichu ahgaj em-wui, chum as muꞌi ab t-wui gegok.

column2: For what we speak about isn't deceptive, or worthless, or fraudulent.
column3: Haꞌichu t-chegitoidag o am wabsh si s-apꞌe. Pi ach em-iattogid ch wabshaba wabsh s-chechojim ahg g Jiosh haꞌichu ahga mamt ab wui wo i e dagito.

column2: On the contrary, we have God's approval for what we say—he's entrusted us with sharing the good news. We don't set out to please people, but God. He's the one who judges our motives.
column3: Jiosh at t-aꞌappem k am i t-chuhcha matt wo i ahgahi g s-kehg haꞌichu ahgaj. Kuch heg hab waꞌi junihim mo haschu d tatchuij ch pi wabsh g hemajkam ha-tatchui hab junimk. Jiosh o am t-mamche mach haschu ahgch hab haꞌichu junihim.

column2: As you know, we've never used flattering words. Nor were we covering up some greedy, selfish attitude—as God is our witness!
column3: Am am wa s-mahch mach pi wabsh em-hehosimhun ch pi em-iattogid machs wo haꞌichu em-wohppoꞌi. Jiosh o s-mahch mo d wohokam ihda.

column2: We weren't trying to win anybody's praise—not from you, nor anyone else. We could have become a “burden” to you as messengers of Christ,
column3: Pi ach hekid am hu t-gahgid mas g oꞌodham ab wo ge has t-elidad ch ab wo t-hehgchulidad.

column2: but instead we acted kindly among you, like a mother caring for her own children.
column3: Bo hi wa chum mahs mamt ab wo si has t-elidad ch haꞌichukaj wo i t-wehmtad ahchim mach d Jesus chuhchai. Kuch wabshaba pi am hu t-gahgid ihda nach pi si s-hemajim ab em-neid hab masma mat g ha-jeꞌe ab wo ha neidad g e-aꞌaliga.

column2: We loved you so much that we were delighted to share with you not just God's good news, but also our very own selves, because you had become so dear to us.
column3: Si ach pihk t-elid ab em-wui ch hekaj am wabsh i t-dagitokch em-wehhejed mach em-ahgidahim g s-kehg haꞌichu ahgaj g Jiosh, chum achs hems heg hekaj wo t-koꞌij.

column2: Don't you remember, brothers and sisters, all our hard work— working day and night so we wouldn't be a burden to any of you as we shared God's good news with you?
column3: Am amtp hu waꞌi s-chegito mach si chikpan wabsh i siꞌalim amjed ch mehk s-chuhugam k ed matt pi haꞌichukaj wo em-kudu.

column2: You yourselves can testify as to how we acted, and God can too—how we treated you believers with a holy attitude, fairly and blamelessly.
column3: Si ach wa s-ap ab em-neid ch pi hekid hab wua g pi apꞌekam ab hema i em-wui. Jiosh o s-mahch ihda. Kum ahpim hab waꞌap s-mahch.

column2: You know how we cared for every one of you like a father caring for his own children. We encouraged you, comforted you, and shared with you our experience  so that you could live as God would want you to live—the God who calls you to his own kingdom and glory.
column3: Jiosh o ab i em-waid mamt am wo apꞌedagk kihdaj ed ch ab wehmaj wo uꞌukchid g ab has elidadag. Kum s-mahch mach am i em-gewkemhun wepo masma mo g ha-ohg ch ab s-ap i em-neneokid ch i em-chehani mamt am hab wo masmak mam d Jiosh aꞌaliga.

column2: Another thing: we're always thanking God that when you heard and accepted the word of God, you didn't treat it as some human words, but what it truly is, the word of God. This is what is at work in those of you who trust in him.
column3: Heg ach waꞌi ahgachug Jiosh haꞌichu ahga ch pi g hemajkam haꞌichu ha-ahga. Kumt hab waꞌi masma hab elid k hekaj ab i s-wohoch. Jiosh o am i chikpan em-shahgid ch am wohokamchud mo d haꞌichu ahgaj. Kuch hekaj chum hekid ab si hoꞌigeꞌelid.

column2: The experience you brothers and sisters have had imitates that of God's churches that belong to Christ Jesus in Judaea. Just like your fellow Jewish Christians you suffered as they did at the hands of the Jewish leaders
column3: Am am ha oidch hab e wua hegam e-wehm wohochuddam mo am aꞌai kih Judea ch ed. Ha-wehm oꞌodham o ha shoꞌigchud. K hegam wabsh s-ap ab nakog. Kum ahpim hab waꞌap wabsh s-ap ab nakog mo g em-wehm oꞌodham em-shoꞌigchud.

column2: who killed the Lord Jesus and the prophets, and chased us out. They don't please God and they are hostile to everyone,
column3: Do hegam ni-wehm oꞌodham mat wa mua g t-kownalig Jesus. Kush d t-shohshon mat wa ha kokda g Jiosh haꞌichu i tashogiddam. K hegam ni-wehm oꞌodham t-shoꞌigchud ch gm hu i t-wuwhas ahchim mach am ahgachug g s-kehg haꞌichu ahgaj g Jiosh. K g Jiosh pi hohhoꞌid mo has e wua. Chum o hems ab wehs ha wui gegok g hemajkam

column2: trying to prevent us from speaking to the other nations to prevent them from being saved. They're always sinning to the maximum extent, but for them full judgment has arrived!
column3: chum t-shohbidch ahchim mach ha ahgid g goꞌol hemajkam hegai mat hekaj wo e doꞌibia. T id ab wabsh baꞌich i geꞌedaj g pi ap ha-chuꞌijig. Kut heg gam hu ai mat ab ha wui wo jiwia g wehs s-koꞌok ha-namkidadag.

column2: Brothers and sisters, since we felt as if we'd experienced a family separation because we hadn't seen you for a while (separated physically though not in spirit), we tried even harder to come and see you again face to face because that's what we wanted to do.
column3: Pi att shaꞌi pi em-chegito matt hekid am i t-gawulkai ab em-amjed. Chum ach s-em neidamk

column2: We really wanted to come and visit you, and I, Paul, tried again and again—but Satan stopped us.
column3: ch am ha hekaj chum si i t-nako matt am uhpam wo hihi em-wui. Ahni Paul ant muꞌikko am chum uhpam s-himim. T am ni-kuh g jijawul ha-geꞌejig Satan.

column2: For what gives us hope, what makes us happy, what we are really proud of as we stand before our Lord Jesus Christ when he comes back—is having you there too!  You are our pride and joy!
column3: M eda d ahpim mach am si em-hiwig ch em-hekaj wo si s-hehgigk ch ab wo si hoꞌigeꞌel g t-kownalig Jesus mat hekid ep wo jiwia.

column2: So when we couldn't bear it any longer, we decided it would be best for us to stay behind in Athens,  and send Timothy on to you. He is our brother and God's co-worker in spreading the good news of Christ. We sent him to strengthen and encourage you in your trust in God
column3: Am att i pi t-nako am em-chegitokch. Kum s-mahch matt am i kei g t-wehnag Timothy mat am wo him k am wo em-nei. Tt ahchim am hejel wih Athens kihhim t am. Timothy o si s-ap ahgachug g s-kehg haꞌichu ahgaj g Jiosh ab amjed g Christ. Kutt hab i t-ah mat am wo him k am wo i em-gewkemhun k am wo i gewkai g em-wohochudadag.

column2: so that none of you would be upset by your troubles—for you know we should expect such things.
column3: Kumt hab pi hedai wo shaꞌi dagito g Jiosh haꞌichu ahga heg hekaj e-shoꞌigchudadag. Am am wa s-mahch matt wo t-shoꞌigch id hekaj t-wohochudadag.

column2: Even while we were with you we kept on warning you that we would suffer persecution soon— and as you well know that is exactly what has happened.
column3: Id ach wa heki hu am em-ahgid mach eda am em-wehmajkahim. Kum s-mahch mat wa woho hab e juh.

column2: This is why, when I couldn't stand it anymore, I sent to find out whether you were still trusting in God. I was concerned that the Devil  had successfully tempted you and that all our work had been for nothing!
column3: Kunid s-gihug mat am hu wo i em-bijim g ge Jiawul. Kut wo heki e wua g t-chikpan am em-shahgid. Nt pi ni-nako manis am baꞌich ep wo i neahi k hekaj am i kei g Timothy mat wo s-mai mams am wabsh kia ab s-wohochud.

column2: Now Timothy has just returned from visiting you and he has brought us good news of your trust in God and the love you have. He's told us that you still have fond memories of us, longing to see us just as we long to see you.
column3: T hemuch ia ep jiwia ab em-amjed k ia uꞌapa g s-ta hohhoꞌidam ahga ab amjed g em-wohochudadag ch pihk em-elidadag. Am o t-ahgid mam chum hekid si s-ap am t-chegito ch hab wa masma chum s-t-neidamk mach ahchim has i masma chum s-em-neidamk.

column2: This news really encouraged us while we were suffering troubles ourselves, brothers and sisters, knowing that you continue to hold on to your trust in God.
column3: Muꞌi ach haꞌichu nakog ch muꞌi t-shoꞌigchud. K wabshaba g em-wohochudadag ab t-gewkemhun.

column2: For us life is worth living now because you're standing firm in the Lord!
column3: S-gegokim amki ab s-wohochud g t-kownalig Jesus. Kuch ab si t-nenenashanichud

column2: As we go into the presence of our God, how can we ever thank God enough for you because of all the joy you bring to us?
column3: ch ab si i hoꞌigeꞌelid g Jiosh mam hab wa masma ab t-mahkch g s-hehgig.

column2: Night and day we pray with all our hearts, hoping to see you again face to face, and to help you continue developing your trust in God.
column3: Chum ach hekid ab tahni g Jiosh wehs t-ihbdagkaj matt wo wa ep em-neid k ab wo i em-wehmt mamt s-ap ab wo s-wohochudad g Jiosh haꞌichu ahga.

column2: May God our Father and our Lord Jesus make it possible for us to come to see you soon.
column3: Mat hems wo waꞌi t-hiwigi g t-ohg Jiosh ch t-kownalig Jesus matt am wo wa ep em-nei.

column2: May the Lord increase your love so it overflows to one another, and to everyone, just as we love you.
column3: Ab ach tahni g Jiosh mat baꞌich ab wo i em-mah g gewkdag mamt hekaj wo si pihk e elidad ab aꞌai e wui ch ab ha wui g wehs hemajkam.

column2: In this way may the Lord strengthen you so you may stand with minds that are holy and blameless before our God and Father at the coming of our Lord Jesus with all his holy ones.
column3: Kumt s-gegokim ab wo wohochudad g Jiosh ch ab wui wo gawulkdask ab amjed g pi apꞌekam mamt pi wo ha chuꞌijigk mat hekid ep wo jiwia g t-kownalig Jesus wehs ha wehm hegam mo d hemajkamgaj ch heki hu koi.

column2: A few more things: Brothers and sisters, we plead with you and urge you in the Lord Jesus to behave in ways that please God, just as we instructed you. Of course you're already doing this, just do it more and more!
column3: Pegih, t-wepnag, am ach wa em-ahgid mamt has masma wo himad g e-doakag ch hab wo hohhoꞌidach g Jiosh. Ab amt bei g haꞌichu t-ahga. Kuch hemuch ab si em-tahni ch ab em-chehani am wehhejed g t-kownalig Jesus mamt baꞌich am hab wo i junihid.

column2: You remember the instructions we gave you on behalf of the Lord Jesus.
column3: S-mahch am mach wa has masma am em-shelinid g gewkdajkaj.

column2: What God wants is for you to live holy lives. So stay away from sexual immorality
column3: Jiosh o em-tatchuid mamt ab wo si i e gawulkai pi apꞌekam amjed k wo si e nuhkud g hejel e-wehm kihkam wehhejed.

column2: in order that each of you may control yourselves  in a way that is holy and respectful,
column3: Ahpim chechoj amt wo s-mahchk mamt wo si s-ap ha hohnt am tahgio g Jiosh ch am hemajkam ha tahgio.

column2: not indulging passionate lust like the heathen who have no knowledge of God.
column3: Hegam mo pi mahch g Jiosh o wabsh hejel e-tatchui wehhejed bebhe g uwi. Mt wabshaba ahpim pi hab masma wo be

column2: Don't cheat or take advantage of another Christian in these matters, for the Lord is the one who executes justice in all such things, as we've already clearly explained to you, and warned you about.
column3: k hab pi ab hu hedai wui pi ap has wo chuꞌi. Heki ach hu am em-ahgid mat g Jiosh s-koꞌokam wo ha namkid matp hedai am hab wo juh ihda pi apꞌekam.

column2: For God did not call us to live impure lives, but holy lives.
column3: Jiosh at pi hab ahgk ab i t-gawulkai machs am hab wo junihid g s-uam haꞌichu. Do tatchuij matt d wo hekia s-apꞌekamk.

column2: So anyone who rejects this position isn't just rejecting what a human being is saying; they are rejecting God, who gives his Holy Spirit to you.
column3: K heg hekaj ab t-mahkch g Hekia S-apꞌekam Gewkdag. Hegai matp hedai wo s-ohhod ihda mashchama at wo s-ohhod g Jiosh.

column2: We certainly don't need to write and tell you to love fellow believers, because God teaches you to love one another—
column3: Heki atsh hu i em-tashogi g Jiosh mamt wo si pihk e elidad wehs ha hekaj g e-wehm wohochuddam. K pi hab chum mahs machs am hu ep wo ge em-oꞌohani ab amjed.

column2: and in fact you are demonstrating this love to all the believers throughout Macedonia. Even so we want to encourage you, brothers and sisters, to love more and more.
column3: Si amsh pihk e elid wehs ha hekaj g e-wehm wohochuddam am wehs Macedonia jewed ch ed. Kuch wabshaba ab si em-tahni mamt baꞌich am hab wo i e junihid.

column2: Try to live a quiet life, minding your own business, doing your own work, as we've already explained to you,
column3: Am g wo i e nakog mamt wo s-dodolimak ch am hab wo junihid g hejel e-chikpan ch wo haꞌichu e gahgidad. Id ach wa heki hu hab em-ahgid.

column2: so that your way of life may be respected by non-Christians and you won't have to rely on anyone to provide what you need.
column3: Bamt masma pi hedai ab hu wo hiwgad mas ab wabsh wo em-mah hegai mam haschu i tatchua. T hegam mo pi mahch g Jiosh wo em-nei mam s-chikpnadag k ab wo si has em-elidad.

column2: We don't want you to be confused about what happens when people die,  brothers and sisters, so that you won't grieve like others who don't have any hope.
column3: Si ach em-tatchuid mamt wo s-mahchk g wohokam ab ha amjed hegam mat heki hu koi. T hahawa pi wo i em-bijim g pi ap tahhadkam hab masma mat hab wo ha juh g pi wohochuddam.

column2: Since we're convinced that Jesus died and rose again, we're also sure that God will bring with Jesus those who have died trusting in him.
column3: Neh, ab at i wuhsh g Jesus muhkig amjed. Kuch s-wohochud ihda ch hekaj ab wui nenea mat g Jiosh ab ep wo i ha wuwhas hegam mat koi ab s-wohochudch g haꞌichu ahgaj ab amjed g Jesus.

column2: What we're telling you comes from the Lord: those of us who are alive and still here when the Lord comes certainly won't precede those who have died.
column3: Hegam atsh wo i wuwha ab amjed g muhkig matt koi an hu wo nam g t-kownalig Jesus.

column2: For the Lord himself will come down from heaven with a commanding shout, with the cry of the archangel, and with the sound of God's trumpet, and those who have died in Christ will rise first.
column3: Wehpeg at ab wo si s-kaidam t-wai g anghil ha-geꞌejig. T g Jiosh kuikud ab haha wo kaida. T ab haha wo i hud g t-kownalig Jesus ab dahm kahchim t amjed. T hegam mat heki hu koi ab s-wohochudch g Jesus ab wo i wuwha.

column2: Then those of us who are alive and still here will be carried up together with them into the clouds, and we shall meet the Lord in the air. Then we will be with the Lord forever!
column3: T hegam mat hedai in d wo kia dodakamk heg i tash ed ab haha wo i e hemapai ha wehm chewagi ch ed k an wo nam g t-kownalig. Kutt am i amjed chum hekid wo wehmajk g t-kownalig.

column2: So encourage one another with these words.
column3: Ab g wo si e gewkemhunad id hekaj haꞌichu ahga.

column2: Brothers and sisters, we don't need to write anything to you about prophetic times and dates.
column3: Pi o hab mahs manis am hu wo em-oꞌohani ab amjed mas hekid hab wo i e juh ihda haꞌichu mani am ahg.

column2: You yourselves know very well that the day of the Lord will come like a thief in the night.
column3: Am am wa s-ap s-mahch mat chum s-aꞌagi wo e ai mat ep wo jiwia g t-kownalig Jesus. Neh, pi o ta machima mas hekid wo i jiwia g s-chu ehskam chuhug ch ed, o mas hekid wo i e ai mat g uwi ab wo taht g s-koꞌok k wo bei g ali. K hab waꞌap pi ta machima am ha wehhejed g pi e doꞌibiakam mas hekid ep wo jiwia g t-kownalig.

column2: When people talk about peace and security suddenly they will be completely ruined. It will be just like the sudden onset of childbirth, and they certainly won't escape.
column3: Idam at hab wo kaijjid mo wehs haꞌichu am wabsh i si s-apꞌe ch s-dodolima. T am wabsh wo si e ai mat wo e koꞌijid k pi wo e doꞌibia.

column2: But you, brothers and sisters, are not in the dark about this so that you won't be caught by surprise when the Day of Judgment  arrives suddenly like a thief.
column3: Kum eda ahpim e doꞌibiakam s-mahch ihda. K pi hab chum mahs mat s-aꞌagi wo jiwia hegai tash em-wui hab sha masma mo g s-chu ehskam.

column2: For you are all children of light and children of the day. We don't belong to the night or to darkness.
column3: Jiosh o haꞌichu t-tashogid. Kuch an uꞌukch g tonlig hab masma mo hegam mo am tash ed hihim.

column2: So then we shouldn't be sleeping like everybody else—we should stay awake and keep ourselves clear-headed.
column3: Pegih, tt wo chum s-nenenashanik ch pi hab wo masmak mo g nawkkoi.

column2: For it's during the night that people sleep; and it's at night that they get drunk.
column3: Hegam mo pi nenenashanik ch nawkkoꞌo o am eda g s-chuhugam.

column2: But since we belong to the day we should keep our heads clear, strapping on the breastplate of trust and love, and putting on as a helmet the hope of salvation.
column3: Kutt wabshaba ahchim s-ap wo t-nahtokchid hab masma mo g shondal. T-wohochudadag ch pihk t-elidadag o d wainomi lihwa t-wehhejed. Kuch ab wui t-gewpkadch mat g t-doꞌibiadag s-ap wo e nahto. K id hab sha masma mo g wainomi wonami t-wehhejed.

column2: For God hasn't placed us in a position to be punished, but has reserved us for salvation through our Lord Jesus Christ.
column3: Pi at hab ahgk ab i t-gawulkai g Jiosh mas wo t-namkid heg hekaj pi ap t-chuꞌijig k wabshaba hab ahgk mat g t-kownalig Jesus Christ wo t-doꞌibia.

column2: He's the one who died for us so that whether we're alive or dead we shall live together with him.
column3: Heg at muh t-wehhejed k i wuhsh matt d wo dodakamk wehmaj. K wabsh chum has masma s-apꞌe chum achs wo heki hu koi o in d wabsh wo kia dodakamk mat wo jiwia.

column2: So encourage and strengthen one another, just as you are doing.
column3: Mt heg hekaj ab wabsh wo si aꞌai e gewkemhunad ch ab aꞌai haꞌichukaj wo i e wehmajk mam am hab wa e junihim.

column2: Brothers and sisters, we're asking you to respect those who work with you, who lead you in the Lord and teach you.
column3: Ab ach si em-tahni mamt s-ap ab wo ha neidad g e-wanimeddam ch hegam mo am em-mashcham ch ab shohbidch g pi apꞌekam em-shahgid. Do Jiosh hab elida mo hab wua.

column2: You should value them highly in love for the work they do. Live in peace with each other.
column3: Ab g wo si has ha elidad ch s-ha hoꞌigeꞌidad no pi hab wua a Jiosh chikpan. Am g wabsh wo s-dodolim kihk e wehm.

column2: We urge you, brothers and sisters, to warn those who are lazy, encourage those who are anxious, help those who are weak, and be patient with everyone.
column3: Ab ach si em-tahni mamt wo ha ahgidad hegam mo s-papadma mat wo chikpanad. Ab g wo i ha gewkemhunad hegam mo pi wihnam gegok am e-wohochudadag ed. I g wo ha wehmtad hegam mo pi ha gewpdag ch ab wehsijj wo si ha bahbgi.

column2: Make sure none of you pays back evil for evil, but always try to do good to one another, and to everyone.
column3: Pi g am uhpam wo agwua mat hema s-koꞌokam wo em-juh k wabshaba chum hekid am wo i e nakogad mamt s-ap haꞌichu hab wo wuad ab aꞌai e wui ch ab wehs ha wui g hemajkam.

column2: Always be full of joy,
column3: Chum g hekid wo s-ap e tahtkkad.

column2: never stop praying,
column3: Chum g hekid wo e hoꞌigeꞌidahunad.

column2: be thankful in every situation—because this is what God in Christ Jesus wants you to do.
column3: Ab g wo s-hoꞌigeꞌidad g Jiosh, chum atp haschu has wo i chuꞌigk. Id o d Jiosh tatchui em-wehhejed ahpim mamt ab i e hemakoj g Jesus Christ wehm.

column2: Don't hold the Spirit back,
column3: Pi g am hu wo shohbid g Hekia S-apꞌekam Gewkdag.

column2: don't look down on prophecy,
column3: Pi g am wo s-kaihogi hegam mo g Jiosh ab ha mahkch g haꞌichu ahga

column2: make sure to check everything. Hold onto whatever is good;
column3: k wabshaba wehs haꞌichu wo i aꞌappemad ch g s-apꞌekam ab wo uꞌukchid.

column2: keep away from every kind of evil.
column3: Im g hu wehs hab wo i juhni g pi apꞌekam.

column2: May the God of peace himself make you completely holy, and may your whole being—body, mind and spirit—be kept blameless for when our Lord Jesus Christ returns.
column3: Jiosh o ab t-mahkch g s-ap tahhadkam. Kuni ab tahni mat wehs gam hu hab wo i juh g pi apꞌekam ab em-amjed k wo si nuhkudad g em-doakag ch em-ihbdag ch em-hon mat d wo hekia s-apꞌekamk. Mt am hahawa pi wo ha chuꞌijigk mat ep wo jiwia g t-kownalig Jesus Christ.

column2: The One who calls you is trustworthy, and he will do this.
column3: Jiosh at ab i em-wai e wui k chum hekid hab junihim mo has i kaij.

column2: Brothers and sisters, pray for us.
column3: Am g wo t-wehhejed e hoꞌigeꞌidahunad.

column2: Greet all the believers there affectionately.
column3: Am g wo ha ahgid g t-wehm wohochuddam mat ab wo i s-t-hoꞌigeꞌel.

column2: I'm requiring you by the Lord that this letter be read to all the believers.
column3: Ni ab si em-chehani g t-kownalig Jesus gewkdagkaj mamt am wo neꞌokchul ihda oꞌohana am wehs ha wui g t-wehm wohochuddam amai.

column2: May the grace of our Lord Jesus Christ be with you.
column3: Neh, ab at wo wa baꞌich i s-em-hoꞌigeꞌel g t-kownalig Jesus Christ.

column2: I'm sending it to you Timothy. You are my true son because of your trust in God. May you have grace, mercy, and peace from God the Father and Christ Jesus our Lord.
column3: Ab g ni-kaiham ahpi Timothy map d ni-alidag ab i s-wohochudk g haꞌichu ni-ahga ab amjed g Jesus Christ.

column2: When I was on my way to Macedonia I asked you to stay behind in Ephesus, so that you could speak with those who teach false ideas and insist that they stop.
column3: Ab ani wa si s-ap m-ahgid mapt am wo wih Ephesus t am mani wa am him gam hu wo himk Macedonia wui. Am g wabsh i dakad ch am wo si ha keshwua hegam mo g iattogi chum ha mashcham.

column2: They shouldn't concern themselves with legends and never-ending obsessions about ancestry. Such ideas only lead to pointless debates, instead of understanding God as we trust in him.
column3: Idam o chum ha mashcham mo g hohoꞌoki aꞌagida ab wehnags g Jiosh haꞌichu ahga ch ep chum ha mashcham mat hemho wa wo s-chegitok g e-shohshonbad ha-chechgig. T wabshaba ihda ha-mashchama hab wo ha juh mat wo dagito g Jiosh hab elida k ab wabsh aꞌai wo e neꞌowinad. Bat waꞌi masma wo s-mahchk g Jiosh hab elida mat ab wo i s-wohoch g haꞌichu ahgaj.

column2: The reason why I insist on this is so we may have love that comes from a pure heart, from a clear conscience and sincere trust in God.
column3: Pt wo ha ahgi mat woho ab wo s-wohochudad g Jiosh haꞌichu ahga ch heg hab wo waꞌi junihid mo haschu s-mahch mo d s-apꞌekam ch hab pi wo e kudutad. Id at hab wo ha juh mat wo i geꞌeda g ha-tatchuidag.

column2: Some have deviated from these things, and have ended up talking nonsense.
column3: Haꞌi at dagito g e-wohochudadag k hekaj wabsh ha wehm e neꞌowin.

column2: They have ambitions to be teachers of the law, but they have no idea what they're talking about or what they're so boldly announcing!
column3: Idam o hab chum e elid mo d chehanig ha mashchamdam ch wabshaba pi amichud g Jiosh haꞌichu ahga chum as hab e elid mo s-e mahchk ch neneok.

column2: Now we recognize that the law is good if people use it properly.  We also know that law isn't laid down for those who do what is right, but for those who are rebellious and ignore the law. It applies to people who have no use for God, who are sinful, who treat nothing as holy and are completely irreligious. It's for those who kill fathers and mothers, for murderers,
column3: S-apꞌe o g chehanig. K wabshaba idam pi ap hekaj am chum ha shohbidch hegam mo hab wua g s-apꞌekam. K eda g chehanig chum e hekaj mat wo ha shohbi hegam mo g pi apꞌekam hab wua. Idam o pi ab hu has elid g Jiosh ch pi ab hu wohog elid. Haꞌijj o s-ha muꞌamk chum hems g e-ohg o g e-jeꞌe.

column2: for those who are sexually immoral, homosexuals, kidnappers, liars, false witnesses—and anything else that's opposed to good teachings
column3: Haꞌijj o g s-totontom haꞌichu chegitok ch chum hems chum e uꞌuwichud o e chechojchud ch e wehm hab junihim g s-uam haꞌichu. Haꞌijj o ha lilsochud wabsh hejel e wehhejed ch ha iattogid ch ab haꞌichu ha abchud g s-apꞌekam oꞌodham. Nahnko masma o ab wui gegok g mashchamaj g Jiosh hegam mo chum ha mashcham g iattogi.

column2: as determined by the wonderful good news of our blessed God which he entrusted to me.
column3: Jiosh o ni-nuhkudachud ihda s-kehg haꞌichu e-ahga. K heg am t-tashogid ihda mant em-ahgi.

column2: I'm just so grateful to Christ Jesus our Lord for the strength he's given me, and that he considered me trustworthy, appointing me to work for him.
column3: T-kownalig Jesus oki hab ni-elid mant s-ap am hab wo junihid ihda chickpan nat pi am i ni-kehsh k ab ni-mahkch g gewdag wehhejed. Kuni heg hekaj ab si hoꞌigeꞌid.

column2: Even though I used to insult God, and persecuted and abused God's people, God showed me mercy because of my ignorance and unbelief.
column3: Heki anid hu wa ha shoꞌigchud hegam mo ab s-wohochud g Jesus ch ab ha wui pi ap has ahg g Jesus. Kut eda heg ab si i s-ni-hoꞌigeꞌel nani pi pi ni-mahch ch hab junihim pi ab hu wohochudch.

column2: Our Lord in his grace filled me to overflowing with trust and love that comes from Christ Jesus.
column3: Si at s-hemajim ab ni-wui i e tashogi. Nt hab ab i s-wohochud k ab i ni-hemakoj wehmaj k ab wui a pihk ni-elid.

column2: You can trust this saying that everyone should accept: “Christ Jesus came to this world to save sinners,” and I'm the worst of them.  For this reason I was shown mercy—since I'm the worst sinner, Jesus Christ could demonstrate his infinite patience as an example to those who choose to trust in him and gain eternal life.
column3: Neh, hema hab cheꞌidag o hab chuꞌig, “Ia at jiwia g t-kownalig Jesus jewed dahm mat wo ha doꞌibia g pi ap chuꞌijkam.” K id d si wohokam nat pi ab si s-ni-hoꞌigeꞌel. Ni eda shahag wepo mani wa wehs ha baꞌiwechkim d si pi ap chuꞌijkam mani wa cheggia g t-doꞌibiakam Jesus ha shoꞌigchudch hegam mo ab s-wohochud. T heg ab wabsh ni-bahbgi mat wehs am wo ha chehgi g hemajkam mat ab wabsh wo ha bahbgi. Tp hems hab waꞌap ab wo i s-wohochud k ab wo bei g pi ha huhugedam doakag.

column2: Honor and glory forever and ever to the eternal King, the immortal, invisible, and only God! Amen.
column3: Neh, wehs haꞌichu dahm o d kownal g Jiosh ch pi ta neidagma ch pi hekid im hu hab wo i e juh. Kutt ab wo si uhgk i ulin k ab wo hehgchulidad chum hekid. Neh, woho o wa ihda.

column2: These are the instructions I want to give to you, Timothy, my son, following the prophecies that brought you this far,  so you can fight the good fight!
column3: Pegih, ni wehnag, Timothy, heki o hu am i t-tashogid g Jiosh maptki am hab wo junihid ihda chikpan. Kuni ab ep i m-gewkemhun mapt hab wo wa junihid. Hegai Jiosh haꞌichu ahga ab m-wui at hab wo masmak mo g s-kehg cheggiakud. Pt hekaj ab wui kehkkad g ge Jiawul.

column2: Keep on trusting God and make sure you have a clear conscience. Some have refused to do this and have shipwrecked their trust in God.
column3: An g si uꞌukchid g e-wohochudadag ch heg hab wo waꞌi junihid map haschu s-mahch mo d s-apꞌekam. Haꞌijj oki pi hab masma ch hekaj padch g e-wohochudadag.

column2: Hymenaeus and Alexander are such people, and I have “handed them over to Satan” to teach them not to misrepresent God.
column3: Hymanaeus ch Alexander oki haꞌi hegam ch pi ap has ahg g Jiosh. Nt gam hu i ha dagito ge Jiawul wui mat wo e shoꞌigchud k atp hems wo dagito g pi ap e-chuꞌijig.

column2: First of all, I want to encourage you to pray for everybody: make requests of God, ask on their behalf, and give thanks.
column3: Si ani s-m-ahgidamk mapt wo haꞌichu ha ahgi g t-wehm wohochuddam. Do si haꞌichu mat ab wo e hoꞌigeꞌidahunad Jiosh wui. Pt wo ha ahgi mat ab wo tahnid g i wehmtadag ch wo e hoꞌigeꞌidahunad am ha wehhejed g wehs nahnko mahs hemajkam.

column2: Pray like this for kings and all types of leaders so that we may live quiet and peaceful lives, always thinking about God and taking life seriously.
column3: K hab ep mahs mat wo e hoꞌigeꞌidahunad am ha wehhejed g kokownal ch uꞌusagakam mat idam s-ap hab wo junihid g e-chikpan. Kutt hab s-dodolim wo kihdagk ch wo s-ap t-tahtkkad.

column2: This is what is good, and what pleases God our Savior.
column3: Neh, id at wo hohhoꞌidach g Jiosh no pi d t-doꞌibiakam

column2: He wants everyone to be saved, and come to understand what truth really is.
column3: ch tatchua mat wehs nahnko mahs hemajkam wo e doꞌibia k wo s-mai g wohokam ab amjed.

column2: For there is one God, and one mediator of God and mankind—the man Christ Jesus.
column3: Do waꞌi hemako g t-ohg Jiosh. K hab waꞌap d waꞌi hemako g si Kehshaj ch d Jesus Christ ch d waꞌi hegai mat i t-hemakoch g Jiosh wehm. Jesus Christ at t-wepo e juh mat d wo oꞌodhamk

column2: He gave himself so we could all be won back, demonstrating the evidence at the right time.
column3: ch ab wo bei g s-koꞌok t-namkidadag k hab wo t-doꞌibia. Id o am t-chehgidch mo wehs hemajkam s-ha doꞌibiamk g Jiosh.

column2: I was appointed to share this message and be its messenger,  a teacher to the foreigners about trusting God and the truth (I'm not lying, I'm telling the truth!).
column3: Kut heg hekaj am i ni-kei mant wo i ahgahi ab amjed g alidaj k wo ha mashcha g gawul mahs hemajkam g wohokam. S-mahch ap wehs ihda.

column2: What I really want is for men everywhere to pray sincerely to God.  No anger or arguments!
column3: Bant wo chei mat wahm g chechoj ab wo e hoꞌigeꞌidahunad Jiosh wui ch atp hems am wo uhgk uhꞌul e-nohnhoi. S-ap at haꞌichu hab wo elidad ch pi wo shaꞌi s-bagak ab hedai i wui.

column2: In the same way, women should dress sensibly, modestly, and appropriately. They should be attractive not in their hairstyle or by wearing gold or pearls or expensive clothes,
column3: Kunt hab ep wo chei mat g uꞌuwi wabsh s-ap ab wo e enigadadch ch ep s-ap hab wo juhkchid g e-moꞌo mat pi heg hekaj wo chum si e hahaschudad.

column2: but by the good things they do—as is appropriate for women who claim to follow God.
column3: Ab o ha ab mat chum hekid am hab wo junihid g s-apꞌekam ch heg amjed wo e chehgidch mo d wohochuddam.

column2: Women should learn quietly, respecting their place.
column3: Ab o d ep ha-wuikam mat wabsh s-bahbagi ch s-dodolim ab wo kaiham k wo mahchid g Jiosh himdag.

column2: I don't allow women to be instructors, or to dominate men; let them remain quiet.
column3: Ahni ani pi shaꞌi ha hiwgid g uꞌuwi mas wo ha mashcha g chechoj o am ha dahm wo e uhꞌulinchid.

column2: For Adam was made first, and then Eve.
column3: Ab o ha ab g chechoj mat am wo i ha wanim g hemajkam id eda himdag. Jiosh at wehpeg nahto g cheoj k am haha wabsh oidk nahto g uwi. Idam ash wa hab chechgig Adam ch Eve.

column2: Adam wasn't deceived, but Eve was completely deceived, and she fell into sin.
column3: Kush pi d Adambad mat e iattogi. Hegai uwi atsh e iattogid k melchkwua g Jiosh chehanig.

column2: However women will be saved through becoming mothers, as long as they continue to trust and love, and to live holy, sensible lives.
column3: T g Jiosh heg hekaj ab ha mah g uꞌuwi mat wo e shoꞌigch hekid am i ha mamsijid g aꞌal. T wabshaba ab ha amjed wo mahsi g t-doꞌibiakam. Kut wo e doꞌibia matp ab wo s-wohochudad g Jiosh ch wo si pihk e elidad wehs ha hekaj ch wo s-apꞌek ch wo s-e neimakad.

column2: This is a trustworthy statement: “If someone aspires to be an elder, this is a good work to want to do.”
column3: Tatchua o g si s-kehg chickpan hegam matp hedai s-ha wanimelimk g wohochuddam. Neh, id o d hab ha cheꞌidag ch d wohokam.

column2: An elder must be above reproach, married to one wife, self-controlled, well-balanced, sensible, hospitable, and able to teach.
column3: Kunt am wo i em-chegitoch mat has wo chum masmak hegam mo hab s-e junimk. S-ap at d wo oꞌodhamk. T hab pi hedai wo e nako mas ab wo haꞌichu ha abch. Hemako at wo waꞌi hohnigk ch wo si s-e tahtkk wehs haꞌichu k ed ch wo si s-ap hejel e nuhkudad ch s-ap haꞌichu am hab wo junihid ch wo s-chechojimak hegam ha wui matp hedai am wo ha chehgio ha-kihki am. Ab o ha ab mat wo s-mahchk mat has masma wo ha mashcha.

column2: He should be someone who doesn't get drunk or become violent, but is gentle, and is not argumentative or greedy for money.
column3: Pi o hab chuꞌig mas wo nawkkoꞌod o s-hohtam wo babgatad o wo ha kawnid o heg waꞌi lial ab wo si tatchuad.

column2: He must handle his own family well. His children must respect what he tells them to do.
column3: S-hemajim at am wo ha dahmk g e-wehm kihkam. T g aꞌaligaj ab wo wechok ch ab wo si has elidad.

column2: (For if a man doesn't know how to manage his own family, how can he manage God's church?)
column3: Pi at has masma wo s-ap i ha wanim g e-wehm wohochuddam matp pi ap wo ha wanim g e-wehm kihkam.

column2: He should not be a new believer, in case he gets so full of himself he falls under the same condemnation as the devil.
column3: Pi at d wo hema hegamk mat hemuch ab i s-wohoch g Jiosh haꞌichu ahga nat pi am hu wo chum si e haschudad ch wo i gei hab masma matsh wa g ge Jiawul hab e juh.

column2: People outside the church should also speak well of him so that he won't disgrace himself and fall into the devil's trap.
column3: Heg amt am wo i kei mo chum hems g pi wohochuddam ab si has elid. T hab pi hedai ab hu haꞌichu wo chuꞌijigch mas heg hekaj wo i wua g ge Jiawul.

column2: Similarly deacons  should be respected, and not hypocritical. They should not be addicted to drink, and should not be trying to dishonestly enrich themselves.
column3: T hab waꞌap s-ap d wo oꞌOdhamk hegam mo am i ha wehmaj g ha wanimeddam. Pt wo ha ahgi mat pi wo chu iattomk ch pi wo nawkkoꞌod ch pi heg waꞌi lial ab wo tatchuad.

column2: They must stick to the revealed truth about God, trusting in him with a pure conscience.
column3: Do si haꞌichu mat am wo si wehs s-ap oidad g Jiosh haꞌichu ahga ch heg hab wo waꞌi junihid mo haschu s-mahch mo d s-apꞌekam.

column2: They should be tried out first, and if they can't be faulted then let them serve as deacons.
column3: Wehpeg amt am wo i ha mamche k am haha wo i ha chuhcha matp s-ap am hab wo masmak.

column2: Their wives should be respected too. They should not slander people with gossip, and they should be self-controlled and trustworthy in all they do.
column3: Uꞌuwi chikpandam at hab waꞌap s-ap d wo uꞌuwik ch pi wo chu ahgamk ch pi wo nawkkoꞌod ch pi wo chu iattomk.

column2: Deacons should be married to one wife, managing their children and their homes well.
column3: Idam i ha-wehmtdam at hehemako wo wehm kihkamk ch hab waꞌap s-ap wo ha dahmk g e-aꞌaliga ch s-ap wo himad g e-kihdag.

column2: Those who serve well as deacons gain a good reputation and much confidence in their trust in Christ Jesus.
column3: Hegam mat s-ap hab wo juh g e-chikpan at pi wo has e elid k si s-gewkam am hab wo junihid. Kumt ab wo si has ha elidad.

column2: Even though I hope to see you soon, I'm writing about all this to you so that  if I'm delayed you'll know how people should behave themselves in God's house. This is the church of the living God, the support pillar and foundation of the truth.
column3: Bani chum ni-tahtk mant s-hohtam am wo i m-chehgim. Tp wabshaba hems pi wo ni-apꞌet. Kunt heg hekaj am wo haꞌichu i m-oꞌohani. Kumt id ab wo s-mahchk mamt has masma hab wo e junihid mamt s-ap wo himchudad g Jiosh himdag. Dam Jiosh hemajkamga ch d nuhkuddam g wohokam.

column2: There's no question about it: the revealed truth about God is amazing! He was made known to us in human form, he was vindicated by the Spirit, seen by angels, declared to the nations, trusted in by the world, and taken up in glory!
column3: Pi o wa ta machima matt has masma wo s-apꞌekamk am Jiosh tahgio. T wabshaba id am i t-tashogi g Jiosh. K d wohokam ihda mo an hab chuꞌig neꞌi ed:

column2: However the Spirit very clearly explains that in the last times some will abandon their trust in God, and will listen to deceptive spirits and beliefs that come from demons.
column3: Si o tasho am i ni-tashogid g Hekia S-apꞌekam Gewkdag mat ab wo i e ai g tash mat muꞌi wo dagito g e-wohochudadag. Haꞌi at wo ha mashcha g iattogi nat pi g jijawul wo i ha wahmud. T muꞌi hemajkam ab wo ha wohog el.

column2: These hypocritical liars, whose consciences have been seared,
column3: Hegam mat chum hekid wo ha iattogidad at pi wo shaꞌi e kudutad heg hekaj nat pi ged hu wabsh wo i ha apꞌet.

column2: tell people to not marry and not to eat certain foods made by God that should be accepted with thanks by those who trust and know the truth.
column3: Idam o ha mashcham mo d pi apꞌekam mat wo e hohont ch ep pi ha hiwgid mas wo koꞌad g has mahs haꞌichu hugi. K eda wehs ihda d Jiosh nahtoi ch am wa s-apꞌe am t-wehhejed. Ahchim mach s-mahch g wohokam att hekaj ab wo hoꞌigeꞌel g Jiosh k ab wo ui g nahtoij.

column2: Everything created by God is good, and nothing should be rejected but should be received with thanks,
column3: Jiosh at wehs haꞌichu nahto. K wehs s-kehgaj. Tt hekaj ab wo i hoꞌigeꞌid k ab wo ui.

column2: since it is made sacred by the word of God and by prayer.
column3: Bo kaij g Jiosh mat g hoꞌigeꞌidahuna am wo i apꞌech nenaj ed.

column2: If you point out these things to the brothers and sisters you will be a good minister  of Christ Jesus. You gain strength by trusting in the truth, and in the good teaching you've followed.
column3: Dapt wo s-apꞌekam piongajk g Jesus Christ maptp am wo i ha ahgi g t-wehm wohochuddam ihda haꞌichu mashchama. Kupt an wabsh s-ap wo uꞌukchid g e-wohochudadag ch wehs haꞌichu mashchama ab amjed map hab hi wa masma hab e wua.

column2: Reject what is irreligious, and old wives' tales. Make sure your exercise is spiritual—
column3: Pi g am hab masma hekaj g hohoꞌoki aꞌagida mas d Jiosh haꞌichu ahga. Pi at hab wo em-juh mamt wo s-aꞌapꞌek am Jiosh nena ed. Am apt wo si e mashchamad mapt am hab wo junihid s-apꞌekam himdag.

column2: for while physical exercise is useful to some extent, spiritual exercise is much more useful. For “it has promise for the present life, and for the life to come.”
column3: S-apꞌe mapt wo e momoisha k wo s-gewkk. K wabshaba ab him g tash mat wo huhug ihda. K heg hekai baꞌich i s-apꞌe mapt wo i e gewkai am e-wohochudadag ed. Id o ab m-mahkch g s-apꞌekam doakag idani ch imhab i baꞌich.

column2: You can trust this saying that should be accepted by everyone.
column3: Do si wohokam ihda haꞌichu ahga. K hab chuꞌig mat wehs ab wo i chum s-e wohoch.

column2: The reason we work and do the best we can is because our hope is in the living God. He is the Savior of all people, especially of those who trust in him.
column3: Jiosh at wehs wo ha doꞌibia hegam mat ab wo i s-wohoch g haꞌichu ahgaj k am wo i e gewpkai wui. Kuch ab s-wohochud ch heg hekaj am si t-nakog ch muꞌi haꞌichu ab nakog matt wo ha ahgi hemajkam ab amjed ihda.

column2: This is what you should teach. Tell everyone to follow your instructions.
column3: Am g i ha mashcham ihda mani m-ahgid k ab i ha chehani mat am hab wo junihid.

column2: Don't let anyone look down on you because you are young. Be an example to those who trust in God—in the way you speak, the kind of life you live, in love, in trust, and in purity.
column3: Bapt masma s-ap hab wo e junihid ch s-ap wo neokad. T pi hedai pad has wo m-elidad map d wabsh wechij hemajkam. Ab g si pihk e elidad wehs ha wui ch wo si e nuhkudad ch pi hab wo junihid g pi apꞌekam. T hab wo e chehgidahid g em-wohochudadag.

column2: Until I get there, make sure you read the Scriptures to the church, and encourage them by your speaking and teaching.
column3: Am g i e nakog mapt am wo wa neꞌokchulidad g Jiosh haꞌichu ahga am ha-namki ed ch wo ha mashchamad ch am wo i ha gewkemhunad.

column2: Don't neglect the gracious gift you have that was given to you by prophetic inspiration when the church elders laid their hands on you.
column3: Neh, ha wanimeddam at was e hoꞌigeꞌidahu m-wehhejed k ab m-taht. T wa hegam mo d Jiosh haꞌichu i tashogiddam am ah mat has mahs chikpan ab m-mah g Jiosh. Pegih, am g i e nakogad ch heg am hab wo junihid.

column2: Think carefully about these things, and dedicate yourself completely to them so that everyone can see the progress you're making.
column3: T hab ab wo i e gewkemhunad g wohochuddam an m-neidch.

column2: Mind what you're doing and what you're teaching. Keep going with all of this, because as you do so you'll save both yourself and those who listen to you.
column3: Si g s-e nenꞌoid map has e junihim ch haschu ha mashcham k hekaj pi wabsh wo heki wua g e-doakag. T hegam mat ab wo m-kaiha hab waꞌap pi wo heki wua g e-dodakag.

column2: Don't rebuke a man who is older than you. Instead, encourage him as if he were your father. Treat younger men as brothers,
column3: Pi g ab wabsh si chehmod g keli oꞌodham k wabshaba ab wabsh wo s-ap haꞌichu kakke hab masma mapt g hejel e-ohg hab chum masma hab wo juhkchid. Wechij oꞌodham apt hab masma ab wo ha neidad mo d m-wepnag.

column2: older women as mothers, younger women as sisters, with the highest standards of decency.
column3: ch g oꞌoki hab masma map g e-jeꞌe ch g wechij uꞌuwi hab masma mo d m-uꞌuwiga. Pt wabsh si s-ap wo ha chegitokad.

column2: Help widows who don't have a family.
column3: Am g ha ahgid hegam mo am hemiap e mihshmad mat wo ha nuhkud hegam mo d si heheꞌejel wiꞌikam uꞌuwi.

column2: For the Christian responsibility of a widow's children or grandchildren is to do their duty for their own family, and repay their parents by helping them out. This is what pleases God.
column3: K wabshaba pi ab hu ha ab mas wo ha nuhkud hegam mo ge aꞌaliga. Idam ha-aꞌaliga at wo chum ha nuhkud nat pi ha geꞌegel. K d Jiosh tatchui mat aigo epai wo i ha wehmtad,

column2: Now a real widow, having no family, alone and without support, puts her hope in God and prays for help night and day.
column3: Hegam mo woho d si heheꞌejel wihpkam o heg ab waꞌi hiwig Jiosh ch chum hekid ab tahni g i wehmtadag. Idam amt wo ha nuhkudad

column2: But a widow who concentrates on pleasing herself is already dead, even though she's still physically alive.
column3: ch wabshaba wabsh wo ha dagito hegam mo wabsh e gahgid g s-tahhadkam.

column2: Give people these instructions so that they will be above criticism.
column3: Neh, pt wo ha ahgi hegam mo e wehm mihshmad mat hab wo juh ihda mani m-ahgid. T hab pi hedai has wo ha ahgad.

column2: But those who don't look after their relatives, especially their own family, have denied their beliefs, and are worse than those who don't believe.
column3: Hegam mat pi wo ha nuhkud g e-hajuni o baꞌich d i pi apꞌekam mo g mischini.

column2: Only widows over sixty who have been faithful to their husbands should be put on the list.
column3: Pi at an hu wo ha ui g wechij uꞌuwi mat wo ha nuhkud. Hegam mat wo i ha wehmtad at wo aisk g chuhdpo wehst-mahm aꞌahidag ch d wo hegamk mo s-ap e nuhkudahim g e-kunbad wehhejed

column2: The widow should have a reputation for doing good. Did she bring up children properly? Has she been hospitable? Has she washed the feet of church members? Has she helped those who were in trouble? Has she really tried to do good in every way?
column3: ch s-ap ha geꞌegel g aꞌal ch s-ap ha nuhkud g Jiosh wohochuddam ch wehsko s-e mahch mo haꞌichukaj i ha wehmt hegam mo tatchua g i wehmtadag, chum as hems pi d wo ha-machigak.

column2: Don't take on widows who are younger, because when their physical desires make them want to re-marry they abandon their dedication to Christ.  In this they are guilty of breaking their previous commitment.
column3: Wechij uꞌuwi atp hems ep wo s-kuhkuntam mo eda hab chum kaij mat pi hab wo e juh k wabsh wo chikpani g Jiosh, neh, k hab masma wo e chuꞌijigchud k gam hu hab wo i e juh ab amjed g Christ.

column2: They also get used to a lazy life, just visiting each other in their homes. Not only lazy, but they gossip and meddle, talking about things they shouldn't.
column3: Haꞌi atp hems wabsh wo s-e papadmakamch an oiopodch ha-kihki oidch, wahm baꞌich i pi apꞌe mat wo mai g has ahgadag k an wo gantanad g pi kehg haꞌichu ahga.

column2: So my best advice is that younger widows marry and have children and take care of the home. That way there's no opportunity for criticism from the Enemy.  However some have already gone the way of Satan.
column3: Haꞌi at heki hu hab masma hab e juh k am i oi g Jiawul. Id o hekaj baꞌich i a-apꞌe mat g wechij uꞌuwi ep wo kuhkunt k wo mahmadt k wo s-ap dagioꞌi g e-kihdag. T heg hekaj g t-obga pi wo e nako mas wo pi ap has t-ahgad.

column2: Any Christian woman who has widows in the family should help them, so that the church is not burdened with the responsibility, and can help those widows who are truly in need.
column3: Am g ha ahgid g uꞌuwi mat wo i ha dagioꞌi g heheꞌejel wihpkam e-hajuni k pi ab hu hedai wo mohtoꞌi. Hegam mo am hemiap e mihshmad at hegam wo waꞌi ha dagioꞌi mo d si heheꞌejel wihpkam

column2: Elders who direct the church well should be seen as doubly valuable,  particularly those who work in speaking the Word and in teaching.
column3: Am g wehs ha ahgid mat ab wo si has i ha elidad hegam mo d kekel em-wanimeddam ch s-ap am hab junihim g e-chikpan, wahm hegam mo si chikpan ch hab junihim g mashchama ch mihshmda.

column2: As Scripture says, “You must not muzzle the ox when it is threshing the corn.” Also, “The worker deserves to be paid.”
column3: An o oꞌohanas Jiosh heki hu oꞌohana ed:

column2: Don't entertain any accusation against an elder unless two or three witnesses support it.
column3: Pi g ab hu kaiham g haꞌichu abchuda ab hema i ha ab idam kekel, heg hi wa mat gohk o waik hab wo chei mo si s‑ap s‑mahch haꞌichu ab ha amjed, mt am haha wo i mamche.

column2: Censure those who sin in front of everyone as a warning to others as well.
column3: Am apt hemajkam ha kailid k wo si s‑ha kehꞌel hegam mat hedam pi gam hu wo dagito g pi apꞌekam. T hab masma wo s‑e gihugad haꞌi ehp.

column2: Before God and Christ Jesus, and the holy angels, I instruct you to follow these instructions without bias. Don't do anything from an attitude of favoritism.
column3: Am g wehs wepo masma hab ha juhni idam mani m‑shelinid k pi hedai shaꞌi gam hu wo i gawulkai. Id ani si s‑bahbagi ab m‑chehani am ha tahgio g Jiosh ch Jesus ch am ha tahgio g hekia s‑apꞌekam anghil.

column2: Don't be in a hurry to lay hands on anyone; and don't get involved in the sins of others. Keep yourself pure.
column3: Pi g am wabsh si s‑e hohtkid mapt am wo hema i kei mat wo chikpani g Jiosh. Tp hems d pi ap chuꞌijkam. Kut d wo m‑chuꞌijig mapt s‑hohtam am i kei.

column2: Don't just drink water, but use a little bit of wine because of your bad stomach—you're sick so often! The sins of some people are really obvious, and they are clearly guilty, but the sins of others are not seen until later.  Similarly some good works are obvious, and even those that are hidden won't be for long.
column3: Haꞌi o g pi ap ha‑chuꞌijig am tasho e neid. Kum s‑ap s‑mahch ch pi woho am hu wo i ha chuhcha idam. K wabshaba haꞌijj pi am hu tasho e neid g ha‑chuꞌijig. Mt heg hekaj am wo si i ha mamche mamt hedai am wo i ha chuhcha. (25) K hab wa masma g s‑kehg ha‑chikpan am tasho e neid. Chum as hi wa pi am hu i si tasho ch wabshaba pi wo ehsto g s‑kehg ha‑chikpan imhab i baꞌich.

column2: All who are bound under slavery should consider their masters worthy of respect, so that God's name and Christian beliefs won't be defamed.
column3: Hegam wohochuddam mo d nenehol at ab wo si has ha elidad g e‑aꞌamo. T heg hekaj pi hedai wo has ahgad g Jiosh ch pi wo has ahgad g t‑mashchama.

column2: Slaves who have Christian masters should not disrespect them because they are brothers. Instead they should serve them even better, because those who are benefiting from their service are fellow-believers they should love. Teach these instructions, and encourage people to follow them.
column3: Hegam mo g ha‑aꞌamo hab waꞌap d wohochuddam at baꞌich ab wo i si has ha elidad ch baꞌich i s‑ap wo ha chikpani nat pi g ha‑chikpan d wo ha‑apꞌedagk g ha‑wehm wohochuddam.

column2: Those that teach different beliefs, and don't listen to good counsel, particularly the words of our Lord Jesus Christ and the true teachings of God,  are arrogant and don't understand anything. They're obsessed with speculation and philosophical debates which only lead to jealousy, arguments, malicious gossip and evil suspicions—
column3: Ho o wabsh chum si e hahaschud ch d wabsh pi haꞌichu mahchim hegam mat hedai i pi heg hekaj wo ha mashcha t‑kownalig Jesus Christ mashchama. Heg o d wohokam t‑mashchama ch am t‑tashogid g s‑apꞌekam himdag. K idam wabsh tatchua mat wo ha neꞌowinad ch wo ha kawnid. Id o wabsh i wahmud g hehgamdag ch bagatalig ch pi ap has ahgadag.

column2: the constant arguing of people whose minds are totally corrupt and who have lost the truth, thinking that they can profit financially from religion…
column3: Kut hegam wo ha kawhainad matp hedam pi ap haꞌichu chegito ch pi mahch g wohokam ch hab chum elid mat g oꞌodham wo s‑e kaisch id hekaj t‑himdag.

column2: But knowing and following God is so incredibly satisfying!
column3: K wabshaba id d s‑wohokam s‑t‑kaisdag matt wo himad g s‑apꞌekam ch wo si s‑ap t‑tahtkkad, chum achs pi haꞌichu wo edgidad.

column2: For we didn't bring anything into the world, and we can't take anything out with us either.
column3: Pi ach haꞌichu shaꞌi uꞌad ch in mahsi id dahm jewed ch pi haꞌichu shaꞌi be k wo hih.

column2: But if we have food and clothes then that's enough for us.
column3: Heg o am wa chum s‑apꞌe am t‑wehhejed matt ab wo wa al heꞌes haꞌichu koꞌad ch ab s‑ap wo t‑enigadadch.

column2: Those who are determined to become rich fall into the trap of temptation, following many foolish and damaging impulses.
column3: Hegam mo s‑e kaischudamk at heg hekaj hab wo s‑junim g pi apꞌekam. T g ha‑tatchui gam hu hab wo i ha juh ab amjed g Jiosh. Kut haꞌi ep wo ha padch.

column2: For the desire to be rich leads to many kinds of evil results. Some of those who longed for this have turned away from the truth, and have hurt themselves, experiencing a lot of pain.
column3: Nahnko mahs pi apꞌekam o ab shohshon heg amjed mat hema heg waꞌi lialkaj wo si pihk e elidad. Haꞌi at heg hekaj im hu hab i e juh ab amjed g e‑wohochudadag k oi wa muꞌi haꞌichu pi ap tahhadkam ab nako.

column2: But you as a man of God should run away from such things. You should seek to do what is right, practice true religion, and trust in God. Aim to love, to be patient, and gentle.
column3: Pi g hab masma hab e juhni mo hegam mani am ha ahg nap pi d Jiosh chikpandamga. Id apt eda am wo i e nako s‑apꞌekam ch e‑wohochudadag ch pihk elidadag ch haꞌichu nakogadag ch hemajimatalig mapt wo wepo chuꞌigk mo g Jiosh.

column2: Fight the good fight as you trust in God. Hold on tightly to the eternal life to which you were called. This is what you promised to do in front of many witnesses.
column3: Am g si e gewkad wehhejed g Jiosh k wo s‑wihnam uꞌukchid g e‑wohochudadag mapt hekaj am wo i wah Jiosh kihdag ed hab masma mat g s‑melidkam hab wo e juh mat wo ha gehg.

column2: My charge to you before God the Life-giver, and before Christ Jesus who testified to the good news before Pontius Pilate,  is to follow faithfully what you've been told so you will be above criticism until our Lord Jesus Christ appears.
column3: Bapt wabsh masma hab wo e juh matsh wa g t‑kownalig Jesus natsh pi heg s‑ap ah g wohokam am tahgio hegai geꞌe kownal mo hab chehgig Pontius Pilate. Kupt wehs am hab wo juh ihda mani m‑ahgid k ab wo ai mat ab ep wo i hih g Jesus. T hab pi hedai ab hu haꞌichu wo m‑chuꞌijigch. Id ani ab si m‑chehani am tahgio g Jesus ch am tahgio g Jiosh. Jiosh o ab ha mahkch g doakag wehs haꞌichu dodakam ch ab ep wo i m‑wehmt mapt hab wo juh g ni‑chehanig.

column2: At the right time Jesus will be revealed—he who is the blessed and only Sovereign, the King of kings, and Lord of lords.
column3: Jesus at ia ep wo i e chehgi heg i tash ed mo kehshch g Jiosh. Jiosh o si s‑hemajima ch wehs haꞌichu nuhkud ch d kownal wehs ha dahm g kokownal.

column2: He is the only one who is immortal, and lives in unapproachable light. No one has seen him or can see him—honor and eternal power is his! Amen.
column3: ch pi hekid ha mumkku. Pi o hedai neid ch pi hedai wo e nako mas wo nei. An o haꞌichug hab mahs tonlig ch ed mat pi hedai wo e nako mas ab wo miabi. Pi at hekid wo huhug g gewkdaj. Kutt ab wo si has elidad chum hekid. Neh, bo masma.

column2: Warn those who are rich in the present world not to become proud. Tell them not to place their trust in wealth that is so insecure but in God who so freely gives us everything for our enjoyment.
column3: Ab g i ha chehani hegam mo d s‑kakais mat pi wo si e hahaschudad heg hekaj haꞌichu e‑eniga ch pi ab hu wo hiwgad ch wabshaba ab wo hiwgad g Jiosh. Heg o wud mo s‑baꞌama ab t‑mahk wehs haꞌichu mach haschu i hekaj s‑ap t‑tahtk.

column2: Tell them to do good, and to become rich in doing good things, ready to share what they have, and to be generous.
column3: Ab g i ha chehani mat am hab wo i junihi g s‑kehg chikpan ha wehhejed hegam mo tatchua g i wehmta k pi wo chu daꞌad ch wo haꞌichu ha hoꞌidad g shoꞌigkam. Id o d woho s‑kaisdag.

column2: In this way they store up treasure that will provide a solid basis for the future, so that they can take hold of true life.
column3: Bo masma heg wa wepo mo e toꞌidahim g s‑namkig haꞌichu an dahm kahchim ch ed hekaj wo si s‑ap tahtkkad chum hekid.

column2: Timothy, take care of what's been given to you. Don't pay any attention to pointless chatter and arguments based on so-called “knowledge.”
column3: Si g s‑ap nuhkud hegai mamt ab m‑nuhkudach. Pi g am hu ha wehmajk hegam mo wabsh pehegi e neꞌowin heg hekaj mo hab chum elid mo d haꞌichu mahchig. Id at pi wo shaꞌi i t‑wehmajk matt baꞌich i s‑ap wo s‑mai g Jiosh.

column2: Some who promote these ideas have wandered away from their trust in God. May grace be with you.
column3: Haꞌi o hab chum e ahg mo edgid ihda mahchig ch oi wa wabsh heb hu wua g e‑wohochudadag.

column2: May you have grace and peace from God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ.
column3: Ab o wa si s-em-hoꞌigeꞌid g t-ohg Jiosh g t-kownalig Jesus Christ wehm ch ab wo wa baꞌich i em-mahkad g i wehmtadag ch s-ap tahhadkam.

column2: Praise be to God, the Father of our Lord Jesus Christ! He is the compassionate Father and the God of all comfort.
column3: T-kownalig Jesus Christ ohg o hab waꞌap d t-ohg Jiosh ch si s-hemajima ab t-wui. Wehs g i gewkemhunadag o ab amjed him. Kutt heg hekaj ab wo si i hoꞌigeꞌidad.

column2: He comforts us in all our troubles, so that we can comfort those who are also in trouble with the comfort we ourselves receive from God.
column3: Heg o am i t-gewkemhun wehs t-kudutadag ed. Kuch heg hekaj t-nakog matt am epai wo i ha gewkemhunad hegam mo nahnko mahs haꞌichukaj e kudut heg wa hekaj mat haschu g Jiosh hekaj i t-gewkemhu.

column2: The more we share in Christ's sufferings, the more we receive the abundant comfort of Christ.
column3: M o wa woho mach hebai t-shoꞌigchud mach d Jesus Christ wohochuddam. K wabshaba g Jiosh baꞌich i t-gewkemhun heg hekaj mat haschu g Jesus Christ am hab t-juni.

column2: If we are in distress, it is for your comfort and salvation. If we are being comforted, it is for your comfort, which results in you patiently bearing the same sufferings that we suffer.
column3: Ahchim ach wa t-shoꞌigchud am i em-wehmajch mamt wo e doꞌibia. K g Jiosh am i t-gewkemhun matt hab waꞌap am wo i em-gewkemhu. Mt hab ab wo bei g gewkdag mamt s-ap wo nako hegai hab mahs shoꞌigdag mach ahchim nakog.

column2: We have great confidence in you, knowing that as you share in our sufferings you also share in our comfort.
column3: Pegih, s-mahch ach mamt hemho wa hab waꞌap wo bei g i gewkemhunadag nam pi hab waꞌap nakog g shoꞌigchudadag.

column2: Brothers and sisters, we won't keep you in the dark about the trouble we had in Asia. We were so overwhelmed that we were afraid we wouldn't have the strength to continue—so much so we doubted we would live through it.
column3: Tatchua ach matt am wo i em-chegitoich ahpim t-wepnag matt heꞌekia i t-shoꞌigch am Asia jewed ch ed. Shaꞌat waꞌi si s-wechima ab t-maꞌish hegai cheggiadag. Kunt wa shaꞌi si s-mukima ni-taht.

column2: In fact it was like a death sentence inside us. This was to stop us relying on ourselves and to trust in God who raises the dead.
column3: Bo wa sha tahhadag mant ni-lodaitachud k hemho wa wo ni-muꞌij. Id atki hab ahgk hab e juh matt pi ab hu hejel wo t-hiwgad ch wabshaba heg waꞌi Jiosh ab wo si hiwgad. Heg o ab i ha wuwhasid g koꞌi muhkig amjed
