column2: He saved us from a terrible death, and he will do so again. We have total confidence in God that he will continue to save us.
column3: ch t-doꞌibia ab amjed hegai si s-ta ehbidamakam haꞌichu matt am chum t-koꞌij. Kuch ab si hiwig mat ep wo t-doꞌibia matt pi wo t-koꞌij.

column2: You help us by praying for us. In this way many will thank God for us because of the blessing that God will give us in response to the prayers of many.
column3: Kum ahpim am i t-wehmaj am e hoꞌigeꞌidahunch t-wehhejed. T g Jiosh am hab wo juh mam haschu ab tahni k ab wo s-t-hoꞌigeꞌel. T muꞌi ab wo hoꞌigeꞌel g Jiosh t-hekaj.

column2: We take pride in the fact—and our conscience confirms it—that we have acted properly towards people, and especially to you. We have followed God's principles of holiness and sincerity, not according to worldly wisdom but through the grace of God.
column3: Jiosh o si s-hemajim ab t-mahkch g gewkdag. Kuch heg hekaj si s-ap himchud g t-doakag id dahm jewed ch pi haꞌichu shaꞌi em-iattogid ch hab pi t-kudut. Id o ab t-mahkch g s-ap tahhadkam.

column2: For we are not writing anything complicated that you can't read and understand. I hope you'll understand in the end,
column3: Heg ach am waꞌi em-oꞌohanid mamt haschu s-ap wo neꞌokchulid k wo s-amich. Am ani hab hi wa chum em-elid mamt am hu wa hebai wehs s-ap wo s-amich

column2: even if you only understand part of it now, so that when the Lord comes you will be proud of us, just as we are of you.
column3: mam haschu wabsh heꞌes i s-amichud hemu. Kumt hekaj baꞌich ab wo si has i t-el hab masma matt ahchim ab wo si has em-el mat hekid wo jiwia g t-kownalig Jesus.

column2: Because I was so sure of your confidence in me I planned to come and visit you first. That way you could have benefited twice,  as I would go on from you to Macedonia, and then return from Macedonia to you. Then I would have had you send me on my way to Judea.
column3: D ant huꞌi heki hu hab masma i chum apꞌech mant am wo i em-nei am himadch Macedonia wui k am ep wo i em-nei ab uhpam himadch. Mt hab gokko ab wo bei g hoꞌigeꞌidadag k wo i ni-wehmt mant am wo hih Judea wui.

column2: Why did I change my original plan? Do you think I make my decisions lightly? Do you think that when I plan I'm like some worldly person who says Yes and No at the same time?
column3: Nt eda pi koi am hu i em-chehgim. Kumki haꞌi hab ni-elid mani wabsh pehegi neok ch pi woho am hu hab wo ni-juh mani wa has i kaij.

column2: Just as God can be trusted, when we give you our word it's not both Yes and No.
column3: K eda pi woho ihda. Jiosh o s-mahch mani hab chum s-junimk mani haschu hab i ahg mant hab wo juh.

column2: The truth of the Son of God, Jesus Christ, was announced to you by us—me, Silvanus, and Timothy—and it wasn't both Yes and No. In Christ the answer is absolutely Yes!
column3: Neh, am ach ahgachug g Silas ch Timothy wehm ab amjed g Jesus Christ. K heg d Jiosh alidag ch chum hekid hab wua mo haschu hab i ahg.

column2: However many promises God has made, in Christ the answer is always Yes. Through him we respond, saying Yes to the glory of God.
column3: Wehs at am hab t-juni g Jiosh g hab e-elida am gahi wuhshanim g Jesus Christ. Kutt heg gahi wuhshanim ab wo si hehgchulidad g Jiosh.

column2: God has given both us and you the inner strength to stand firm in Christ. God has appointed us,  placed his stamp of approval on us, and given us the guarantee of the Spirit in our hearts.
column3: Do Jiosh mat am i t-gewpkadch Christ himdag ed ab t-mahk g Hekia S-apꞌekam Gewkdag. K heg am wohokamchud mach d hemajkamgaj ch wehs wo bei hegai mo ab t-makiog.

column2: I call God as my witness that it was to avoid causing you pain that I chose not to come to Corinth.
column3: S-mahch o g Jiosh mani pi em-kudutamk ch heg hekaj pi koi am hu ep em-wui hih. Baꞌich o i s-apꞌe mamt wehpeg am wo i apꞌech hegai mo pi apꞌe am em-shahgid.

column2: This isn't because we want to dictate how you relate to God, but because we want to help you have a joyful experience—for it's by trusting God that you stand firm.
column3: Pi o hab chum chuꞌig machs ahchim am wo em-nuꞌichkwuhid em-wohochudadag ed. Baꞌich o i s-apꞌe matt am wo i em-gewkemhu em-wohochudadag ed. Kumt hab wo s-gegokkad heg eda.

column2: That's why I decided that I would avoid another sad visit with you.
column3: Am ant si i ni-oidahim k hab i ni-ah mantki pi am hu wo i em-chehgim hemu manis wo ge s-em-kehꞌel.

column2: For if I make you sad, who will be there to make me happy? It won't be those I've made sad!
column3: Mt pi wo ap e taht mantp hab wo ni-juh. Nt ahni hab waꞌap pi wo ap ni-taht.

column2: That's why I wrote what I did, so that I wouldn't be sad over those who should make me happy. I was so sure that all of you would share in my happiness.
column3: Heg ant hekaj am wabsh em-oꞌohani. Ab amt wo chum ni-mah g s-ap tahhadkam. Kuni pi tatchua manis am wo chum jiwia em-wui k wabsh pi wo ap ni-taht em-wehhejed. S-mahch ani mamt wo s-hehgigk mant hekid ahni wo s-hehgigk.

column2: I was crying many tears when I wrote to you, in great anguish and with a heavy heart—not to make you sad, but so you would know how much love I have for you.
column3: Si ani pi ap ni-tahtk ch muꞌi ni-ohꞌog iawua am em-oꞌohanidk nani pi si pihk ni-elid em-hekaj. Ni eda pi tatchua manis ab wo em-mah g pi ap tahhadkam.

column2: Not to put it too strongly, but the person caused more pain to all of you than to me.
column3: Ab at i em-mah g pi ap tahhadkam hegai mat am si pi ap has chuꞌi em-shahgid. Kuni pi tatchua manis ab wabsh wo si em-chehmo.

column2: This person suffered enough punishment from the majority of you,
column3: Am at wa geꞌe ab nako g e-namkidadag ab em-amjed mamt has i masma am apꞌech.

column2: so now you should forgive him and be kind to him. Otherwise he may sink into despair.
column3: Mt hahawa ab wo i s-hoꞌigeꞌid k ab wo i gewkemhu nat pi has e juh k am hu wo si pi ap e tahtam k wabsh si s-wohom gm hu hab wo i e juh.

column2: So I urge you to publicly affirm your love towards him.
column3: Am g dahm ep wo ahgid mam ab si pihk e elid wui.

column2: That's why I wrote: so I could discoverer your true character and whether you're doing everything you were told to do.
column3: S-mahchimk ani am i em-oꞌohanidk mams ab wo s-ni-wohog el. Kumt wa woho am hab e juh.

column2: Anyone you forgive, I forgive too. What I have forgiven, whatever it may be, I have forgiven before Christ for your benefit.
column3: Kunt hab waꞌap ab wo i s-hoꞌigeꞌel hegai mat pi ap has chuꞌi mamtp ahpim ab wo i s-hoꞌigeꞌel.

column2: In this way Satan will not be able to take us in, because we know the tricks he thinks up.
column3: T hab pi wo e nako g Jiawul mas wo t-wohppoꞌi ihda t-wehnag. S-mahch ach mo hab wa s-e junimk.

column2: Now when I arrived in Troas to spread the good news of Christ, the Lord opened a door of opportunity for me.
column3: Pegih, nt wa pi am hu em-wui hih am himadch Macedonia wui k wabshaba am hih Troas wui. Tki g Jiosh am apꞌech mant am i ahgachug g haꞌichu ahgaj amai.

column2: But my mind wasn't at peace because I couldn't find my brother Titus. So I said goodbye and went over to Macedonia.
column3: Nt am hu hebai ni-kudu nat pi pi oi jiwia g Titus am i em-chehgimedk. Kunt am i ha hoꞌigeꞌel g t-wehm wohochuddam amai k gam hu hih Macedonia wui. T am ni-nam g Titus k am ni-ahgid mamt s-ap am hab juh g ni-neꞌoki.

column2: But praise be to God, who always leads us in a triumphal procession in Christ, and reveals through us the sweet scent of his knowledge wherever we go!
column3: Kuni heg amjed ab si ihm g Jiosh mat am i apꞌech hegai mo pi apꞌe am em-shahgid. Jiosh o chum hekid ab t-mahkch g gewitoidag hekaj hegai mat g Christ am t-wehhejed hab juh. Haꞌichu t-ahga ab amjed g Christ o an wehsko e gantan hab sha masma mat g s-ap uhwchu wehsko wo e hewagi mat hebai wo e mehi.

column2: We are like a fragrance of Christ to God, rising up from among those who are being saved as well as those who are dying.  To those who are dying it is the smell of decay, while to those who are being saved it is the scent of life! But who is up to such an assignment?
column3: Hegam mat wo e doꞌibia o ab si s-hohhoꞌid ch kah mo g Jiosh ab ha makiog g pi ha huhugedam doakag. K hegam mat pi wo e doꞌibia pi hohhoꞌid ch kah mo am hihim pi ha huhugedam muhkig wui. Pegih, do si s-has haꞌichu chikpan ihda.

column2: We are not like the majority who trade in the word of God for profit. Quite the opposite: we are sincere in sharing the word of God in Christ, knowing God is watching us.
column3: Kut pi wo e nako mat am hab wo juh hegam mo wabsh pehegichud g Jiosh haꞌichu ahga ch wabsh s-uꞌimk g lial. Ahchim Christ pionag ach hi pi hab shaꞌi masma ch pi em-iattogid ch wabshaba s-ap am ahgachug ihda wohokam mo g Jiosh ab t-mahkch.

column2: Are we starting to speak well of ourselves again? Or do we need to have some letter of recommendation for you, or from you, as some people do?
column3: Pi ani wabsh hejel ni-wohokamchud mani d kehshaj g Christ ch pi tatchua mams ab wo ni-wohokamch g oꞌohanakaj.

column2: You are our letter, written in our hearts, that everybody reads and knows about.  You demonstrate that you are a letter from Christ, delivered by us; not written with ink but with the Spirit of the living God; not written on stone slabs but on human hearts.
column3: Ahpim mamt ab i s-wohoch g haꞌichu ni-ahga am heg wa wepo mam d oꞌohanaj g Christ ch am wohokamchud mani d kehshaj. K id pi an hu oꞌohanas hohodai t ab hab masma mash wa hegai heki hu wehst-mahm chehanig ch wabshaba an oꞌohanas em-dodakag ed nat pi g Hekia S-apꞌekam Gewkdag gawul em-juh k am i em-apꞌech heg hekaj haꞌichu ni-ahga. Kut wehs wo nei mat has em-juni g Jiosh k wo s-mahchk mani d Christ kehsha.

column2: We have total confidence before God through Christ.
column3: Id ani hab kaij nani pi ab hiwig g Jiosh heg hekaj mat g Christ hab t-juni.

column2: Not that we would consider ourselves able to do this on our own—it's God who gives us this capacity!
column3: Pi o d hejel t-gewpkdag ch wabshaba d Jiosh gewkdag mach hekaj am hab junihim g Jiosh chikpan.

column2: He also gave us the ability to be ministers of a new agreement, based not on the letter of the law, but on the spirit. The letter of the law kills, but the spirit gives life.
column3: K ihda mach ahgachug d wechij haꞌichu ahgaj g Jiosh. K ab haꞌi kaiham. K g Hekia S-apꞌekam Gewkdag ab ha mahk g wechij doakag. Pi o hab masma hegai hekiukam haꞌichu ahgaj ch wabshaba d chehanig. K g pi ap chuꞌijkam heg hekaj s-mahch mo ab ha wui him g s-koꞌok ha-namkidadag.

column2: However, the old way of relating to God, written in letters carved in stone, ended in death, even though it came with God's glory—so much so that the Israelites couldn't even bear to look at Moses' face because it shone so brightly, even though the glory was fading.
column3: Hegai hekiukam chehanig ash an oꞌohanas hohodai t ab. Tsh g Jiosh am ha chehgi g e-gewkdag ch e-tonlig matsh wa ab ha mah ihda g Tutuligo. Mosesbad wuhiosha ash wa si tonod heg hekaj Jiosh gewkdag mash wa an wehmajkahim doꞌag t ab ch ab bei hegai chehanig. Tsh pi shaꞌi e nako g wehmaj oꞌodham mas ab wo i nei g Mosesbad. Kush eda am wa chum chukhim hegai tonlig. Neh, Jiosh atsh hab wa masma am ha chehgi g e-gewkdag mat wa ab ha mah hegai hekiukam chehanig mo ab t-namkid g muhkigkaj

column2: If that was so, shouldn't the new way of relating to God in the Spirit come with even greater glory?
column3: k wabshaba baꞌich am t-chehgidch g e-gewkdag mo ab t-mahkch g Hekia S-apꞌekam Gewkdag. K heg am t-eda chikpan.

column2: If the old way that condemns us has glory, the new way that makes us right with God has so much more glory!
column3: Do si s-has haꞌichu hegai hekiukam chehanig mach hekaj s-mahch mo ab t-aihim g s-koꞌok t-namkidadag heg hekaj pi ap t-chuꞌijig. Pegih, k baꞌich d i si haꞌichu hegai haꞌichu ahgaj g Jiosh mach hekaj s-mahch mo gam hu hab i junihog g pi ap t-chuꞌijig matt d haha wo s-apꞌekamk am tahgio.

column2: For the old that was once glorious has no glory at all in comparison with the incredible glory of the new.
column3: T wabsh pi e haꞌichuch g gewkdaj g hekiukam chehanig am t-wehhejed no pi baꞌich i s-gewkdag g Christ haꞌichu ahga.

column2: If the old that is fading away had glory, the new that continues has so much more glory.
column3: Hekiukam chehanig at am i huhug. T wabshaba g Christ haꞌichu ahga pi hekid wo ha huhug.

column2: Since we have such a confident hope, we are truly bold!
column3: Id ach ab ab t-gewpkadch ch hekaj am si s-t-mahch ch ahgachug.

column2: We don't have to be like Moses, who had to put on a veil to cover his face so the Israelites wouldn't be dazzled by the glory, even though it was fading away.
column3: Mosesbad atsh wa ab maꞌish g e-wuhiosha matsh g wehmaj oꞌodham pi ab hu wo nei hegai tonlig mo ab ab tonod ab amjed g Jiosh gewkdag. Sh hegam pi neid mo huhughim hegai tonlig. Ch ahchim hi pi ab hu maꞌishch hegai Jiosh gewkdag mo ab t-ab e chehgidch.

column2: In spite of that, their hearts became hard. For right up until today when the old agreement is read, the same “veil” remains. Only through Christ can it be removed.
column3: K eda wabsh kia e ehstokch muꞌi ha wehhejed g ni-wehm oꞌodham. K heg hekaj pi mahch mo huhughim g gewkdaj hegai hekiukam chehanig. Im at hu hab wo i e juh hegai pi ha-amichudadag mat hekid ab wo i s-wohoch g Jiosh haꞌichu ahga ab amjed g Christ.

column2: Even today, whenever the books of Moses are read, a veil covers their minds.
column3: Chum wa hems id i tashkaj o heg wa wepo mo ab maꞌishpi g ha-amichudadag mo hekid am i neꞌokchulid hegai haꞌichu ahga mat g Mosesbad an oꞌoha.

column2: But when they turn and accept the Lord, the veil is removed.
column3: Neh, ab atsh i e maꞌishpiꞌo g Mosesbad matsh hekid ab ep i miabi g Jiosh. T idam ha-amichudadag hab waꞌap wo i e maꞌishpiꞌo mat hekid ab wo i miabi g Jiosh.

column2: Now the Lord is the Spirit, and wherever the Spirit of the Lord is, there's freedom.
column3: Hekia S-apꞌekam Gewkdag o d Jiosh ch am haꞌichug t-doakag ed am i t-apꞌechudk g Jiosh wehhejed. Kuch hab t-wulꞌokch mach pi chum t-apꞌechud g chehanigkaj.

column2: So all of us, with our faces unveiled, see and reflect the glory of the Lord as in a mirror. We are being transformed into the same mirror image, whose glory grows brighter and brighter. This is what the Lord the Spirit does.
column3: Pi o ab hu maꞌishpi g t-amichudadag ahchim mach ab ihm g Christ. Kuch ab wui nea ch ab chehgidch g gewkdaj ch tonligaj hab sha masma mo g neidakud. K g Hekia S-apꞌekam Gewkdag am si gawul t-junihim. Tt hekaj baꞌich wo i wepo masmak g Christ.

column2: So then, since God in his mercy has given us this new way of relating to him, we don't give up.
column3: Ab o s-t-hoꞌigeꞌid g Jiosh ch ab t-chehani matt am wo ahgachugad g haꞌichu ahgaj. Heg ach hekaj pi haꞌichukaj t-shohbidch ch heg am hab wua.

column2: But we have given up secret, shameful acts. We don't behave in deceitful ways and we don't distort the word of God. We demonstrate who we are by revealing the truth before God so everybody can decide in their own minds.
column3: Pi ach hab wua g s-aꞌagi haꞌichu ch pi ha iattogid ch pi am hu gawul wua g Jiosh haꞌichu ahga. Jiosh o s-mahch mach am ahg g wohokam ch am i t-nakog matt wo s-apꞌek am hemajkam ha-nena ed.

column2: Even if the good news we share is veiled, it is veiled to those who are dying.
column3: Ihda s-kehg haꞌichu ahgaj g Jiosh mach ahgachug o hegam waꞌi ha wehhejed pi tasho mo pi d e doꞌibiakam.

column2: The god of this world has blinded the minds of those who don't trust in God. They can't see the light of the good news of the glory of Christ, who is the image of God.
column3: Jiawul o geꞌe gewkdag id dahm jewed ch daishch g ha-amichudadag. K hekaj pi amichud mo s-ha doꞌibiamk g Christ ch d si hekia s-apꞌekam ch wepo d doakam g e-ohg Jiosh. Heg o wa wepo mo g Jiosh gewkdag d si s-mahs tonlig ch ab ab tonod g alidaj. K eda idam pi neid.

column2: We are not promoting ourselves, but Christ Jesus as Lord. In fact we are your servants for Jesus' sake.
column3: Pi ach hejel t-amjed haꞌichu ahgachug. Jesus Christ o d t-kownalig. Kuch heg amjed an ahgachug ch d wabsh em-pionag wehhejed.

column2: For God who said, “Let light shine out of the darkness,” shone in our hearts to illuminate the knowledge of God's glory in the face of Jesus Christ.
column3: Jiosh atsh am wa i tonlid g s-chuhugam ged huꞌi si wehpeg. K heg ha wepo mat am epai i tonlid g t-doakag nat pi t-mahtchul g Christ. K heg am t-chehgidch g Jiosh.

column2: But we have this treasure in clay jars, to show that this supreme power comes from God and not from ourselves.
column3: Dach wabsh chum hemajkam. K eda g Jiosh ab t-mahkch g e-gewkdag. T hab wo s-e mahchk mo d wa Jiosh gewkdag ch am t-eda. Kuch heg hekaj hab sha masma mo g bid hahaꞌa mat hema g lai am ha eda wo toꞌakchid g s-e-kaisdag.

column2: We are attacked from every direction, but we are not crushed. We are at a loss as to what to do, but never in despair.
column3: Muꞌikko ach haꞌichukaj t-kudut. K wabshaba pi haꞌichu t-shohbidch. Hebai ach haꞌichu pi aꞌamichud ch wabshaba am wabsh baꞌich i t-gewpkad.

column2: We are persecuted, but never abandoned by God. We are knocked down, but not dead yet!
column3: Muꞌikko am t-shoꞌigchud. K wabshaba g Jiosh chum hekid t-wehmaj. Hebai am hi wa chum si s-koꞌokam has t-wua. Ch wabshaba pi t-koꞌijid.

column2: In our bodies we always share in the death of Jesus, so that we can also demonstrate the life of Jesus in our bodies.
column3: Chum o hekid am hab chuꞌig g muhkig t-wehhejed mamt wa hab masma hab juh g Jesus. K hab masma am tasho e neid g Jesus doakag am t-doakag ed.

column2: While we live we are always under the threat of death for Jesus' sake, so that the life of Jesus may be revealed in our mortal bodies.
column3: T-doakag oidch o am hab chuꞌig mattp hems wo t-muhkid am wehhejed g Jesus. K hab wa masma ab e chehgidch g Jesus doakag id amjed t-chuhkug mo am him muhkig wui.

column2: As a result, we are facing death so that you may have life!
column3: S-ni-mukimakam o chum hekid am hab chuꞌig nani pi am hab junihim ihda chikpan. K am wa s-apꞌe namt pi id hekaj ab bei g wechij doakag.

column2: Since we have the same spirit of trust in God that Scripture refers to when it says, “I trusted in God, and so I spoke out,” we also trust in God and speak out for him.
column3: Bo chuꞌig an Jiosh heki hu oꞌohana ed mash hema hab kaij:

column2: So we don't give up. Even though our physical bodies are falling apart, our inner selves are being renewed daily.
column3: Heg att hekaj pi hekid haꞌichukaj an hu wo t‑shohbi matt am hab wo junihid ihda chikpan. Ab o hi wa chum aihim g muhkig g t‑chuhkug nach pi hekitahim. K wabshaba g t‑doakag wehs tashkaj ab i e wechijid.

column2: These trivial troubles we have only last for a little while, but they produce for us an ever-increasing degree of glory.
column3: Hebaichujj ach hab hi wa elid mo shaꞌi si geꞌej g t‑kudutadag iia. K wabshaba heg ab wui t‑uꞌa g woho si geꞌe apꞌechudaj g Jiosh. Heg eda at g Jiosh chum hekid ab wo si has t‑elidad. T pi an hu wo haꞌichugk g jewed t ab t‑kudutadag.

column2: We don't concern ourselves with what can be seen, for we look forward to what can't be seen. What we see is temporary, but what we can't see is eternal.
column3: Ab ach wui t‑gewpkadch hegai apꞌedag, chum achs hi wa chum pi neid g t‑wuhpuikaj. Hegai mach haschu i neid hemu at wabsh wo huhug. T wabshaba pi hekid wo huhug hegai mach am wui t‑gewpkadch.

column2: We know that when this earthly “tent” we live in is taken down, we have a house prepared by God, not made by human hands. It is eternal and is in heaven.
column3: Ihda t‑chuhkug o heg wa wepo mo d wabsh uhksha nat pi wabsh wo e padch. Kutt wabshaba wo edgidad g baꞌich i s‑kehg honshpadag an dahm kahchim ch ed. T id g Jiosh hab wo t‑juni. Kut hab wo masmak mo g si s‑kehg kih ch pi hekid wo e padch.

column2: We sigh with longing for this, wanting so badly to be clothed with this new heavenly home.  When we put on this clothing we won't be seen naked.
column3: Hebaichujj ach si i shahshani nach pi am chum s‑hihimimk dahm kahchim wui ch s‑behimk hegai s‑kehg honshpadag mat g Jiosh ab wo t‑mah.

column2: While we are in this “tent” we sigh, being weighed down by this life. It's not so much that we want to take off the clothing of this life but that we look forward to what we shall be clothed with, so that what is mortal may be overwhelmed by life.
column3: Pi ach hab ahgch shahshani machs im hu hab i s‑junimk ihda t‑honshpadag ch wabshaba hab ahgch matt oi ab wo bei hegai wechij t‑honshpadag an dahm kahchim ch ed k pi d haha wo mukimkamk.

column2: It's God himself who prepared us for all this, and who provided the Spirit as a guarantee to us.
column3: Jiosh at am i t‑apꞌech id wehhejed k ab t‑mah g Hekia S‑apꞌekam Gewkdag mat wo t‑wehmajk ch am wo i wohokamch mo haschu ab t‑makiog.

column2: So we remain confident, knowing that while we are at home here in our physical bodies, we are away from the Lord.
column3: Pegih, si ach s‑ap t‑tahtk ch ia chewed,

column2: (For we live by trusting in God, not by seeing him).
column3: chum achs pi neid g t‑kownalig Jesus, nach pi ab s‑wohochud ch hab s‑ap himchud g t‑doakag.

column2: As I say, we are confident, wanting to be away from the body so we can be at home with the Lord.
column3: Kuch wabshaba baꞌich i chum tatchua matt an wo i t‑chihwiapad wehmaj, chum achs wo dagito ihda t‑chuhkug.

column2: That's why our goal, whether home here in our bodies or not, is to make sure we please him.
column3: K wabshaba pi has d shaꞌi ahga machs hebai hab chuꞌig. Id o baꞌich d i si haꞌichu matt am hab wo juh g tatchuij, chum achs ia wo haꞌichugk id dahm jewed o an wo wehmajk anai.

column2: For all of us must appear before Christ's seat of judgment. Each of us will receive what we deserve for what we have done in this life, whether it is good or bad.
column3: Wehsijj att hemho wa am wo i t‑chehgi Christ wui mat am wo t‑aꞌappem k ab wo i t‑mahkhi g t‑namkidadag mattp has i masma s‑ap hab junihim o pi ap hab junihim hegai chikpan mo ab t‑mahkch iia.

column2: Knowing how we are in awe of the Lord, we try to convince others. It's clear to God what we are, and I hope that it's clear to your minds too.
column3: S‑toꞌo ehbidam hab mahs g Jiosh lodaita. Kuni heg hekaj ab si i ha chehani g hemajkam mat wo hiwigi mat g Jiosh am wo i ha apꞌech e tahgio. S‑mahch o g Jiosh mo id d wohokam mani em‑ahgid. Kuni hab chum em‑elid mam ahpim hab waꞌap s‑mahch.

column2: We are not trying to speak well of ourselves again, just trying to give you the opportunity to be proud of us, so you can answer those who are proud of outward show and not what they are inside.
column3: Pi ani hejel chum ni‑haꞌichuchud. K wabshaba muꞌijj ab si has ha elid hegam mo si s‑kehg hab mahs pi shaꞌi mahchk g ha‑iꞌibdag. Kuni am haꞌichu em‑ahgid mamt hekaj wo e nakog k ab wo uhpam i nodagi g ha‑neꞌoki.

column2: If we are “crazy people,” it's for God. If we make good sense, it's for you.
column3: Haꞌi ash hab ni‑elid mani ge pi ni‑mahch ch hab ni‑junihim. Ni eda wabsh s‑gewkam am hab junihim g Jiosh tatchui. Kum ahpim s‑mahch mani s‑ni‑tahtk ch am hab ni‑junihim em‑wehhejed.

column2: Christ's love urges us on, because we're absolutely sure that he died for everyone, and so everyone died.
column3: E at muhkid g Christ wehs t‑wehhejed no pi ab si t‑tatchua. Kuch hekaj ab aigo si tatchua ch hemho wa am hab s‑junimk g tatchuij. Id o heg wa wepo matt ahchim wehmaj koi

column2: Christ died for everyone so that they shouldn't live any longer for themselves, but for him who died and rose again for them.
column3: nach pi hahawa pi am hu hab junimk g hejel t‑tatchui ch wabshaba heg tatchui am hab s‑junimk mat e muhkid k ep e chegito k i wuhsh t‑wehhejed.

column2: From now on we don't look at anyone from a human point of view. Even though we once viewed Christ this way, we don't do so any longer.
column3: Heki ani hu wa hab ni‑elid mani s‑mahch mo has chuꞌig g hemajkam ch s‑mahch mat has wo chum chuꞌigkad hegai mat d wo Jiosh si Kehshak. Ni wabshaba hemuch id s‑mahchimk ab amjed g Jiosh.

column2: That's why anyone who is in Christ is a new being—what was old is gone, the new has come!
column3: Do si wechij doakam matp hedai ab i e hemakoj g Christ wehm. Im at hu hab i e juh g hekiukam haꞌichu. T g wechij haꞌichu ab i wuhsh.

column2: God did all this by changing us from enemies into friends through Christ. God gave us this same work of changing his enemies into his friends.
column3: Jiosh at wehs id hab juh. Heki ach hu wa d obgaj. T wabshaba g Christ am gawul t‑juh mach d hahawa naipijjuj g Jiosh k ab t‑chehani matt am wo i ahgahi g haꞌichu ahgaj mat haꞌijj hab waꞌap ab wo i nawojt g Jiosh.

column2: For God was in Christ bringing the world back from hostility to friendship with him, not counting anyone's sins against them, and giving us this message to change his enemies into his friends.
column3: Id o d haꞌichu ni‑ahga mat g Jiosh ab chum i ha nawojt g hemajkam k gam hu hab i juh g ha‑chuꞌijig heg hekaj mat g Christ haschu hab juh ha wehhejed.

column2: So we are ambassadors for Christ, as though God is pleading through us: “Please, won't you come back and be God's friend?”
column3: Neh, kuch si s‑hemajim ab em‑waid am wehhejed g Christ mamt ab wo i hiwigi g Jiosh mat am gawul wo i em‑juh mamt hahawa pi d wo obgajk.

column2: God made Jesus, who never personally sinned, experience the consequences of sin so that we could have a character that is right as God is right.
column3: Wehs at ab abch g e‑alidag g pi ap t‑chuꞌijig mat heg hekaj ab wo t‑abch g Christ s‑apꞌekam ahchim matt ab wo i s‑wohoch.

column2: As workers together with God we also plead with you not to make your acceptance of God's grace worthless.  Just as God said, “At the right time I heard you, and on the day of salvation I rescued you.”  Believe me: now is the right time! Now is the day of salvation!
column3: Bo chuꞌig an Jiosh heki hu oꞌohana ed mo hab kaij g Jiosh:

column2: I've been speaking bluntly, my Corinthian friends, loving you with a big heart!
column3: Neh, id ani wehs ahg si ni‑ihbdag amjed nani pi ab si em‑tatchua.

column2: We haven't kept our love from you, but you have kept your love from us.
column3: Pi ani d ahni manis pi ab hu em‑tatchua. Dam ahpim haꞌi mam pi ab hu ni‑tatchua.

column2: Please respond in the same way, as if you were my children, and be big-hearted!
column3: Bani masma chum em‑wehm neok mam d ni‑aꞌaliga. Am g hig wo i ni‑chehgid mam ab ni‑tatchua hab masma mani ahni hab masma ab em‑tatchua.

column2: Don't join together with people who don't believe—for what connection does goodness have with wickedness? What do light and darkness have in common?
column3: Pi g ab hu wabsh wo si e behꞌi ha ab hegam mo pi ab hu ihm g Jesus Christ. Shaht hig masma g s‑apꞌekam ab wo e wehnadk g pi apꞌekam? Shaht masma g tonlig ab wo e wehnadk g s‑chuhugam.

column2: How could Christ and the Devil  ever agree? How could a believer and an unbeliever share together?
column3: Jiawul o ab wui kehk g Christ. Kumt heg hekaj pi ab hu wo i e hemakoj g pi wohochuddam ha wehm.

column2: What compromise could the Temple of God make with idols? For we are a temple of the living God, just as God said: “I will live in them and walk among them. I will be their God, and they will be my people.”
column3: Ab ach ihm g Jiosh. K pi hab chum chuꞌig machs haꞌichu ab ep wo ihmad. Jiosh o am t‑eda. K id heg wa wepo mach d cheopigaj. Neh, bo kaij g Jiosh:

column2: Dear friends, since we have these promises, we should wash ourselves clean from all that makes both body and spirit dirty, aiming for complete holiness out of reverence for God.
column3: Neh, id ash hab kaij g Jiosh, ni‑wepnag, mat am hab wo t‑juni. Kutt hekaj ab hig wo si i t‑apꞌech heg amjed mo haschu uamhun g t‑chuhkug ch t‑doakag k am wo si i t‑dagito Jiosh wui ab si has elidch.

column2: Please make room in your hearts for us! We haven't done anyone wrong, we haven't corrupted anyone, and we haven't taken advantage of anyone.
column3: Ab g wo si i s‑ni‑hoꞌigeꞌelid. Pi ant hedai shaꞌi s‑koꞌokam has juh manis has i masma ha iattogid o manis haschukaj i ha padch o manis haschu i ha ehs.

column2: I'm not saying this to condemn you—as I already told you, you mean so much to us that we live and die together with you!
column3: Pi ani heg hekaj hab kaij ihda manis ab haꞌichu em‑abchud. Am am wa s‑mahch mani ab si em‑tatchua. Kut pi haꞌichu wo shaꞌi i t‑gawulkai, chum hems g muhkig.

column2: I speak up very strongly for you because I am so proud of you. You are such an encouragement to me. I am so happy for you despite all our troubles.
column3: Ab ani si has em‑elid ch ab si em‑hiwig ch si s‑hehgig ch am si i ni‑gewkaj, chum as muꞌi haꞌichu t‑kudut.

column2: When we arrived in Macedonia we didn't have a minute's peace. We were attacked from every direction, with external conflicts and inner fears.
column3: Wehsko o wa an hab chuꞌig g kudutadag mant eda am jiwia Macedonia jewed ch ed. Muꞌijj o wa ni‑kawhain. Kuni wa am ni‑kudut nani ge s‑mahch mam has masma hab e junihim.

column2: Even so, God who encourages the downhearted, encouraged us with Titus' arrival.
column3: K wabshaba g Jiosh chum hekid ab t‑mahk g gewkemhuna mach eda t‑kudut. Kunt wa ab i ni‑gewkemhu mat am ni‑nam g Titus.

column2: Not just by his arrival, but also by the encouragement you gave him. He told us how you were longing to see me, how sorry you were, and how concerned you were about me, which made me even happier.
column3: Heg o si s‑ap e tahtk ch am ni‑ahgid mamsh chum si s‑ni‑neidamk ch si pi ap e tahtk heg hekaj mat haschu has e juh am em‑shahgid. K hab kaij mamsh ab ha wui gegok hegam mo has ni‑ahg. Kuni hekaj baꞌich i si s‑hehgig hemuch.

column2: Even though I made you sorry by the letter I wrote, I don't regret it—though I did regret it because the letter did hurt you, but just for a while.  I'm happy now, not for hurting you, but because this pain led you to change your minds. You were made sorry in a way God would want, and so weren't harmed by us in any way.
column3: Si amsh pi ap e tahtk am neꞌokchulidk g ni‑oꞌohana. Kuni wa chum pi hohhoꞌid mant heg am em‑oꞌohani. Kumsh wabshaba pi tash pi ap e tahtk ch am wabsh i apꞌech hegai mash pi apꞌe am em‑shahgid. Jiosh at hekaj hegai em‑shoꞌigchudadag. Kuni hahawa si s‑ap ni‑tahtk.

column2: The kind of sorrow God wants us to have makes us change our minds and brings salvation. This kind of sorrow leaves no sense of regret, but worldly sorrow brings death.
column3: Bo wa masma hekaj g Jiosh g pi ap tahhadkam am t‑doakag ed matt gam hu wo s‑ohhod g pi ap t‑chegitoi k wo bei g s‑ap tahhadkam. T wabshaba hegam mo pi ab hu e dagitokch Jiosh wui baꞌich im hu hab wo i e juh ab amjed mat ab wo ha ai g pi ap tahhadkam.

column2: See what happened to you when you had this very same experience of sorrow that God wants. Remember how enthusiastic you became, how keen you were to defend yourselves, how angry you were at what had happened, how seriously you took it, how you longed to do right, how concerned you were, how you wanted justice to be done. In all of this you showed that you were sincere in wanting to make things right.
column3: S‑mahch am mat has em‑juh g Jiosh mamt pi ap e taht. Am amt i e oidahim k si tatchua mat pi hedai ab hu wo em‑abch mams pi ap chuꞌi. Si amt pi hohhoꞌi hegai mo am pi ap chuꞌig em‑shahgid k ab si i e shohbi hegaj k si s‑gewkam i tatchua mamt am wo i apꞌech hegai mo wa am pi apꞌe. Am amt e chehgi moki pi d em‑chuꞌijig hegai matp am hab chuꞌig em‑shahgid.

column2: So when I wrote to you, I wasn't writing about who did the wrong or who was wronged, but to show you how devoted you are to us in God's sight.
column3: Pi ant heg waꞌi hekaj am wa em‑oꞌohani mamt am wo i apꞌech hegai mo wa am pi apꞌe. Jiosh o s‑mahch mant wa am em‑oꞌohani mat hekaj am wo e chehgi em‑shahgid mam ab si ni‑tatchua.

column2: We are so encouraged by this. Added to our own encouragement, we were so pleased to see how happy Titus was, because you set his mind at rest.
column3: Kuch ab i t‑gewkemhun mamtsh ab bei g i wehmta.

column2: I boasted to him about you, and you didn't let me down. Just as all I've told you is true, my boasting about you to Titus has proved to be true too!
column3: nant pi si s‑ap has em‑ah ab wui. Kumt pi si ni‑edawua. Chum ach hekid g wohokam ahg ab em‑wui. Kut hab waꞌap am e wohokamch hegai mant am ahgi g Titus ab em‑amjed.

column2: Titus cares for you even more as he remembers how you did what he told you, how you welcomed him with great respect.
column3: Baꞌich o ab i si em‑tatchua am i chechegitodch mamt si s‑ap ab i neid k am si i e nako mamt ab wo s‑wohog el.

column2: I am so happy that I can be completely confident of you.
column3: Si am s‑ap hab junihim hegai mani has i kaij. Kuni heg hekaj ab si em‑hiwig ch si s‑hehgig.

column2: Brothers and sisters, we want to let you know about the grace of God shown to the Macedonian churches.
column3: Neh, t‑wepnag, am ach s‑em‑ahgidamk mat haschu wa hab juh g Jiosh am ha shahgid g wohochuddam amai Macedonia jewed t am.

column2: Even though they have suffered terrible trouble, they are overflowing with happiness; and even though they are very poor, they are also overflowing in their generosity.
column3: Muꞌi shoꞌigdag at nakog k wabshaba wabsh si s‑hehgig ch si s‑ap e tahtk ch am hab wua g mahkig mo eda d wa chum si shoꞌigkam.

column2: I can confirm that they gave what they could, in fact even more than that! By their own choice
column3: Bat juh ihda mahkig mat heꞌes i e nako, pej baꞌich i mo heꞌes i chum e nakog, wabsh hejel hab e elidk.

column2: they kept on pleading with us to have a part in this privilege of sharing in this ministry to God's people.
column3: Ab at si t‑tai matt wo ha hiwigi mat hab wo juh ihda k hab masma am wo i ha wehmt hegam mo d Jiosh hemajkamga ch si e shoꞌigchud amai Judea t am.

column2: They didn't just do what we hoped they would do, but they gave themselves to the Lord, and then to us, as God wanted them to do.
column3: Kut baꞌich am hab i juh mach heꞌes hab i chum ha elid nat pi wehs am i e dagito chikpanaj ed g t‑kownalig Jesus Christ mach has masma am ha tashogid.

column2: So we have encouraged Titus—since it was he who started this work with you—to return and complete this gracious ministry of yours.
column3: Am at wa heki hu i chikp ihda g Titus. Kuni am si i chehani mat am wo i em‑wehmt k wo nahto ihda s‑kehg chikpan.

column2: Since you have an abundance of everything—your trust in God, your eloquence, your spiritual knowledge, your complete dedication, and in your love for us—make sure that your abundance also extends to this gracious ministry of giving.
column3: Si am geꞌe haꞌichu ab apꞌedag ch ab si s‑wohochud g Jiosh haꞌichu ahga ch haꞌichu s‑mahch ab amjed g Jiosh ch s‑kehg neneok ch s‑wapagima ch ab si t‑tatchua. Kuch heg hekaj hab em‑elid mamt wo i ha wehmt hegam mo e shoꞌigchud am Judea ch ed.

column2: I'm not ordering you to do this, but to prove how sincere your love is in comparison with the dedication of others.
column3: Pi ani ab hu s‑gewkam em‑chehani mamt hab wo juh ihda. Ni wabsh chum s‑mahchimk mas heꞌes i geꞌej g em‑pihk elidadag. Heg ani hekaj am em‑ahgid mat has masma hab juh g i wehmta idam haꞌi.

column2: For you know the grace of our Lord Jesus Christ. Even though he was rich, he became poor for you, so that through his poverty you could become rich.
column3: Am am wa s‑mahch mat has masma am chehgi g e‑hemajimatalig g t‑kownalig Jesus Christ. Dach wabsh shoꞌigkam. T heg an dagito g e‑kihdag ch e‑apꞌedag k shoꞌig ia haꞌichugkahim matt ahchim ab wo si i bei g apꞌedag.

column2: This is my advice: it would be good if you finished what you started. Last year you were not only the first to give but the first to want to do so.
column3: Bani masma hab elid ihda mamt am wo i nahto hegai mamt wa am hab i chum juh haꞌakid. Ahpim amt wa wehpeg si s‑hohhoꞌid k am hab i junihi ihda i wehmta.

column2: Now finish what you planned to do. Be as keen to finish as you were to plan, and give as you are able.
column3: Pegih, am g wo i e gewpkad k wo nahto. Bamt wa masma s‑wapagimam am wo i nahto mamt wa ged hu i wehpeg hab e juh.

column2: If the willingness is there, it's fine to give what you have, not what you don't have!
column3: Mt wo s‑ap e taht k am hab wo juh mamt heꞌes wo i e nako. T g Jiosh wo wa s‑hohhoꞌi.

column2: This is not to make things easier for others and harder for you, but simply to be fair.  At the moment you have more than enough and can meet their needs, and in turn when they have more than enough they can meet your needs. In that way everyone is treated fairly.
column3: Pi ani hab ahg mams ahpim wo e shoꞌigch am i ha wehmajch hegam wohochuddam mo e shoꞌigchud. Idani am haꞌichu s‑edgid ch hekaj wo i ha wehmt. T hegam am epai wo i em‑wehmt mamtp hekid wo i tatchua g i wehmta. Bamt masma am aꞌai wo i e wehmt mamt hekid wo i tatchua g i wehmta.

column2: As Scripture says, “The one who had much didn't have any excess, and the one who didn't have much didn't have too little.”
column3: Bat masma hab wo e juh hegai mo an hab chuꞌig Jiosh heki hu oꞌohana ed ch hab chuꞌig:

column2: Thanks be to God that he gave to Titus the same devotion for you that I have.
column3: Titus o si pihk e elid em‑hekaj hab masma mani ahni. Kuni heg hekaj ab si i hoꞌigeꞌid g Jiosh.

column2: Though he agreed to do what we told him, he's coming to see you because he really wants to, and had already decided to do so.
column3: S‑ap o e tahtk mani ab ahgid mat am wo i em‑wehmt ch am hejel si e nako mat am wo i em‑chehgim.

column2: We're also sending with him a brother who is praised by all the churches for his work in spreading the good news.
column3: Am ani hema ep ahgid mat wo oi g Titus. Id o s‑ap ahgachug g s‑kehg haꞌichu ahgaj g Jiosh. K heg hekaj wehsko ab si has elid g t‑wepnag.

column2: He was also appointed by the churches to go with us as we deliver this gracious offering we're carrying. We do this to honor the Lord and to show our eagerness to help others.  We want to guard against anyone criticizing us about how we use this gift.  We're concerned to do things the right way, not only in the eyes of the Lord, but also in the eyes of everyone.
column3: K id d ha‑kehsha mat wo t‑oi matt am wo i ui g em‑mahkig ha wui hegam mach am i s‑ha wehmtamk. Si ach s‑t‑nenꞌoid matt s‑ap hab wo juh ihda em‑wehhejed. T hab pi hedai has wo t‑ahg k wabshaba ab wo has elidad g Jiosh.

column2: We're also sending with them another brother who has proved to be reliable on many occasions, and who is eager to help. He is now even more eager to help because of the great confidence he has in you.
column3: Pegih, t am wo oi g Titus ihda t‑wehnag. Muꞌikko att am aꞌappe ab tahnich mat am wo i t‑wehmt. Kuki chum hekid s‑t‑wehmtamk, wahm hemuch no pi ab si has em‑elid.

column2: If anyone asks about Titus, he is my companion. He works with me on your behalf. The other brothers are representatives from the churches and an honor to Christ.
column3: Kum s‑mahch mo g Titus d ni‑wehm chikpandam ch am wo i em‑wehmt. K idam haꞌi mat am wehmaj wo hihi am d ha‑chuhchai g t‑wepnag ch ab si haꞌichuchud g Christ.

column2: So please welcome them before all the churches and show them your love, proving how rightly proud we are of you.
column3: Ab ani si s‑ap has em‑ahg am ha tahgio. Kumt am wo ha chehgi mam ab si ha tatchua. T hegam mat am i ha chuhcha wo s‑mahchk mani g wohokam am ha ahgid.

column2: I really don't need to write to you about this offering for God's people.  I know how keen you are to help—I was boasting about this to those in Macedonia that you in Achaia have been ready for over a year, and your enthusiasm has encouraged many of them to give.
column3: S‑mahch ani mam tatchua mamt wo i ha wehmt g shoꞌigkam e‑wepnag, chum anis hems pi am hu wo em‑oꞌohani heg amjed. Ia ani wa heki hu si s‑ap has em‑ahg ha wui idam t‑wepnag am ha ahgidch mamt heki hu hab i e ah haꞌakid mamt am wo i ha wehmt hegam shoꞌigkam. Id at muꞌijj am si i ha gewpkai.

column2: But I'm sending these brothers so that my boasting about you regarding this won't be proved wrong, and that you're prepared, just as I said you would be.
column3: Kuni idani am ha ahgid idam t‑wepnag mat am wo hihi em‑wui. Mt wo si e nahtokch heg hekaj e‑mahkig. Kut pi wabsh wo heki e wua g s‑kehg ni‑neꞌoki ab em‑amjed.

column2: This is just in case some Macedonians should come with me and find you unprepared. We, not to mention you, would be really embarrassed if this project failed!
column3: Tp hems wo haꞌi t‑wehmajk g Macedonia t am hemajkam. Kunt wo si ni‑el mamtp pi wo e nahtokch mani eda si s‑ap em‑ahg am ha wui. Mt ahpim hab waꞌap wo si e el.

column2: That's why I decided I should ask these brothers to visit you in advance, and complete the arrangements to collect this offering, so that it would be ready as a gift, and not as something demanded.
column3: Heg ani hekaj hab elid mo s‑apꞌe mant am wo si i ha cheha idam t‑wepnag mat am wehpeg wo hihim k am wo i em‑wehm apꞌech g em‑mahkig. Bat masma heki hu wo nahtoisk mant am haha wo jiwia. Mt am wo e chehgi mam woho i s‑ha wehmtamk g shoꞌigkam ch pi hab wabsh wua manis ab si em‑chehani mamt am hab wo juh.

column2: I want to remind you of this: If you only sow a little, you'll only reap a little; if you sow plenty, you'll reap plenty.
column3: S‑mahch am mat muꞌi wo nei g haꞌichu bahidag hegai mat muꞌi wo ei g haꞌichu kai. T pi ab hu muꞌi wo nei hegai mat pi muꞌi wo ei. Pegih, mt hab waꞌap muꞌi ab wo nei g apꞌedag mamtp s‑baꞌama ab wo haꞌichu ha mah am Jiosh wehhejed.

column2: Everybody should give as they've already decided—not reluctantly, or because they have to, for God loves those who give with a cheerful spirit.
column3: Mt wabshaba hejel hab wo e ah mamt heꞌekia ab wo i ha mah. Pi o ab hu t‑chehani g Jiosh machs ab haꞌichu wo ha mah no pi s‑hohhoꞌid matt si s‑ap t‑taht k am hab wo juh g t‑mahkig k pi wo ge s‑daꞌad.

column2: God is able to graciously provide you with everything, so that you will always have all you need—with plenty to help others too.
column3: Jiosh at wo e nako mat ab wo em‑mah hegai mam haschu i tatchua. Kumt chum hekid wo edgidad mam haschu i tatchua hejel e wehhejed ch am dahm ep wo edgidad mamt am hab wo juh g i wehmta.

column2: As Scripture says, “He gives generously to the poor; his generosity is everlasting.”
column3: Neh, bo chuꞌig an Jiosh heki hu oꞌohana ed:

column2: This is me Paul, personally appealing to you through Christ's kindness and gentleness, the one who is “shy” when I have to face you but who is “bold” when I'm not there.
column3: Haꞌijj amsh hab kaij manish s‑em‑kehꞌid wabsh em‑oꞌohanidch ch antsh ep wo s‑hemajimak am ep jiwiak. Pegih, bani wa masma chum si s‑hemajima mo g Christ.

column2: I'm pleading with you, so that the next time I'm with you I won't have to be as tough as I think I'll have to be, boldly dealing with those who think we behave in worldly ways.
column3: Am g wabsh wo s‑dodolimak. Nt hab pi wo em‑kehꞌel am jiwiak.

column2: Even though we live in this world, we don't fight as the world does.
column3: In ach d dodakam jewed dahm ch wabshaba pi hab masma hab t‑junihim mo hegam mo pi mahch g Jiosh.

column2: Our weapons are not of this world but God's mighty power that destroys fortresses of human thinking, demolishing misleading theories.  Every high wall that stands tall and proud against the knowledge of God is knocked down. Every rebel idea is captured and brought into obedient agreement with Christ.
column3: Hegam o ab wui gegok g Jiosh ch ha iattogid ch ab si haꞌichuchud g hejel haꞌichu e‑mahchig. K wabshaba ahchim ab t‑mahkch g Jiosh g gewkdag. Kuch heg gewkdagkaj wehs gewito ihda pi apꞌekam ch pi g hejel t‑gewkdagkaj.

column2: When you are completely obeying Christ then we're ready to punish any disobedience.
column3: Pegih, am amt wo i e chehgi mam am wehs e dagitokch id eda Christ himdag. Nt haha wo s‑koꞌokam ha namkid hegam mo am wa haꞌichukaj pi am hu wehs i e dagitokch.

column2: Look at what's staring you in the face! Anyone who considers that they belong to Christ should think again—just as they belong to Christ, so do we!
column3: Haꞌi amki ab wabsh dahmjed haꞌichu neid ch hab chum si e elid mam d si Christ pionag. Am g wo si i e oidahim. Ahchim ach hab wa masma d Christ pionag mamtp has i masma hab e elid.

column2: Even though I may seem to be boasting a little too much about our authority, I'm not embarrassed about it. The Lord gave this authority to us to build you up, not to knock you down.
column3: Pi ani shaꞌi si ni‑elid am heꞌes i em‑ahgidch ab amjed ihda gewkdag mat g t‑kownalig Jesus ab ni‑mah. Ab o ni‑mahkch mant hekaj am wo i em‑gewkemhun k pi gam hu hab wo i em‑juh ab amjed.

column2: I'm not trying to scare you by my letters.
column3: Pi ani hab ahgch am em‑oꞌohanid manis wo em‑tods.

column2: People say, “His letters are tough and severe, but in person he's feeble, and he's a useless speaker.”
column3: Tp hems hema hab wo chei, “Paul o si s‑ta keꞌidam kaij ab t‑oꞌohanidch ch wabshaba ia t‑wui jijiwhia ch pi gewkdag. K g neꞌokij d wabsh pi haꞌichu.”

column2: People like that should realize that what we say through letters when we're not there we will do when we are there!
column3: T eda hegai mat hab wo wa chei wo chum s‑mahchk mant hab wa masma hab wo chei hekid am em‑wehmajkch mani has i kaij am ni‑oꞌohana ed.

column2: I hope you can put up with a little more foolishness from me—well you already do put up with me!  I agonize over you with a divine kind of jealousy, for I promised you to a single husband—Christ—so that I could present you as a pure virgin to him.
column3: Pi o hab chum chuꞌig manis hab masma hejel ni‑wehhejed wo neokad. Kuni eda ab si em‑tatchua am wehhejed g Christ. Kumt hekaj ab wo ni‑kaiha. Bam sha masma mam d hohntaj. Kuni si s‑em‑daꞌa hab masma mo g Jiosh mamt wo si e nuhkud g Christ wehhejed.

column2: I worry that in some way, just as the serpent deceived Eve with his devious cunning, that you might be led astray in your thinking from your sincere and pure commitment to Christ.
column3: Am g wo s‑chegitok matsh wa pi wohoch g Jiosh hegai wehpeg uwi mash hab chehgig Eve. Jiawul atsh wa s‑aꞌagi iattogi am gahi wuhshanim g wamad. Kuni s‑gihug mat hab waꞌap wo em‑juh am gahi ha wuhshanim hegam mash chum em‑iattogid. Kumtp hems wo s‑ohhod g Christ

column2: If anyone comes and tells you about a different Jesus to the one we shared with you, you easily go along with them, accepting a different spirit to the one you received, and a different kind of good news to the one you believed.
column3: namsh pi ha hiwgid ch ab ha kaiham. Ab ani em‑ahgid hegai mo haschu am i ni‑tashogid g Hekia S‑apꞌekam Gewkdag ab amjed g Christ. Kumsh eda haꞌi ab ha kaiham hegam mash gawul haꞌichu am em‑ahgid ab amjed.

column2: I don't believe I'm inferior to these “super-apostles.”
column3: Idam amsh haꞌi ab si has ha elid hab masma mo d Christ chuhchai. Ni eda ahni hig woho d kehshaj.

column2: Even though I may not be skilled in giving speeches, I do know what I'm talking about. We have made this absolutely clear to you in every way.
column3: M o hi wa woho mani pi am hu i si s‑mahch g amogida. Kuni wabshaba s‑mahch g Jiosh haꞌichu ahga ch am em‑wui i tashogid.

column2: Was it wrong of me to humble myself so you could be elevated, since I shared the good news with you at no charge?
column3: Haꞌi amsh hab ni‑elid mani pi ab hu ni‑haꞌichuchud pi shaꞌi em‑hiwgidch mams ab wo ni‑namkid. Ni eda am hab ni‑junihim mant g s‑apꞌekam am hab wo em‑juni.

column2: I robbed as it were other churches, taking pay from them so I could work for you.  When I was there with you and needed something, I wasn't a burden to anyone because the believers who came from Macedonia took care of my needs. I was determined never to be a burden to you and I never shall.
column3: Tatchua ani g lial ch wabshaba pi tatchua manis wo em‑wechhu. T hegam wohochuddam mo am aꞌai kihhim Macedonia jewed ch ed ab ni‑mamka mani haschu i tatchua.

column2: This is as certain as the truth of Christ that is in me: nobody in all Achaia will stop me boasting about this!
column3: Am ani em‑ahgid wehsko Greece jewed ch ed mant pi wo em‑hiwigi mams ab wo ni‑namkid mani eda am ahgachug g Jiosh haꞌichu ahga em‑shahgid.

column2: And why? Because I don't love you? God knows that I do!
column3: Pi ani heg hekaj hab kaij ihda manis pi ab hu em‑tatchua. Jiosh o s‑mahch mani ab si em‑tatchua.

column2: I'll continue to do what I've always done, so as to remove any opportunity for those who want to boast that their work is the same as ours.
column3: K wabshaba haꞌi hab chum kaij mash hab masma chikpan mani ahni. Ni eda ahni pi haꞌichu em‑kowlant. K idam hi em‑kowlant ch hab em‑iattogid. Am ash chum ni‑wepo e wua ahni mani d Christ kehsha. Pegih, t hemho wa wo chum ahgad g Jiosh haꞌichu ahga pi ab hu haꞌichu em‑kowlantch.

column2: These people are false apostles, dishonest workers, who pretend to be apostles of Christ.
column3: K wabshaba pi d wohokam Christ chuhchai ch haꞌichu ha iattogid ch chum t‑wepo e wua ahchim mach d si s‑wohom Christ chuhchai.

column2: Don't be surprised at this for even Satan himself pretends to be an angel of light.  So it's no wonder then if those who serve him pretend to be agents of good. But their final end will be in accordance with what they've done.
column3: Am o wa tasho mat hab masma hab wo e wuad no pi d Jiawul pionag. Jiawul o chum e wepogid g s‑apꞌekam anghil. T g piongaj hab waꞌap wo e wepogidad ahchim mach am ahgachug g s‑apꞌekam. T wabshaba g Jiosh s‑koꞌokam wo ha namkid heg hekaj.

column2: Let me say it again: please don't think I'm being foolish. However, even if you do, accept me as someone who is foolish, and let me also boast a little.
column3: Haꞌi amsh hab ni‑elid mani wabsh pehegi neok. Nt eda am wo em‑ahgi g wohokam ab amjed g ni‑chikpan. Ab g wo kaiham mant has wo chei.

column2: What I'm saying is not as the Lord would say it—all this foolish boasting.
column3: Pi o ab hu ni‑chehani g t‑kownalig Jesus mant hab kaidam wo neokad.

column2: But since many others are boasting in the way the world does, let me boast too.
column3: Nt wabshaba am hab wo ni‑juh no pi muꞌijj wabsh hejel si e haschud.

column2: (You're happy to put up with fools, since you are so wise!)
column3: Kum ahpim hab e elid mam s‑chu aꞌamichud ch eda wabsh ha hiwgid hegam mo pi haꞌichu aꞌamichud

column2: You put up with people who make you slaves, who take what you have, who exploit you, who arrogantly put you down, who hit you in the face.
column3: mat am hab wo em‑juh mo haschu d i ha‑tatchui. Tp hems am haꞌichu wo em‑wohppoꞌi o atp s‑wihnam an wo em‑ui o atp pi ab hu has wo em‑elidad o atp s‑koꞌokam has wo em‑ah.

column2: I'm so sorry that we were too weak to do anything like that! But whatever people dare to boast about, I dare to do too. (Here I'm talking like a fool again).
column3: Haꞌi ash hab ni‑elid mani pi hab masma ab em‑wui mo hegam nani pi si ni‑elid. Pegih, woho o wa mant wo si ni‑el mantp hab wo masmak. Hegam o si e haschud ch e wehhejed neneok. Pegih, nt ahni hab waꞌap ni‑wehhejed wo neo.

column2: Are they Hebrews? Me too. Are they Israelites? Me too. Are they descendants of Abraham? Me too.
column3: Neh, bash e aꞌaga mash d Tutuligo ch d Jiosh hemajkamga ch d Abrahambad amjedkam. Pegih, ahni ehp.

column2: Are they servants of Christ? (This will sound like I'm talking crazy). But I have done so much more. I've worked harder, been imprisoned more often, whipped more times than I can count, faced death time and again.
column3: Bo kaij mo d Christ pionag. Nt ahni hab wo chei mani baꞌich d i si piongaj mo hegam, chum ams hab wo ni‑elidad mani wabsh pehegi neok. Baꞌich ani i si s‑gewkam chikpan ch baꞌich i muꞌikko ni‑kuhpach g Christ wehhejed. Baꞌich amt i muꞌikko ni‑gewitta. Muꞌikko ant chum alo muh.

column2: Five times I received from the Jews the forty lashes less one.
column3: Hetaspo at am hugkam ab ni‑chuꞌijigch g ni‑wehm Tutuligo mat waikko gamai humukto ni‑gewitta.

column2: Three times I was beaten with rods, once I was stoned, three times I was shipwrecked. Once I spent twenty-four hours adrift on the ocean.
column3: Waikko at ni‑gewitta g Rome t am hahaꞌichu. Hemho amt ni‑maꞌichkwua. Waikko at wachum g wahlko mani an eda. Kuni hemako tash ch hemako chuhug chehmoꞌim am wiꞌinoghim shuhdagi ch ed.

column2: During my many journeys I have faced the dangers of crossing rivers, robber gangs, attacks from my own countrymen, as well as from foreigners. I have faced danger in cities, in the deserts, and on the sea. I have faced the danger of people who pretend to be Christians.
column3: S‑to o ehbidama am ni‑wehhejed mani hebai i oimmed. An o hab chuꞌig g wiꞌindag ch muꞌij g s‑chu eꞌeskam. Haꞌijj o s‑ta ehbidam s‑ni‑kehꞌid g ni‑wehm oꞌodham ch gawul mahs oꞌodham. Am o haꞌichug g s‑ta ehbidam haꞌichu kihhim ch ed ch gam hu jegko ch an geꞌe shuhdagi dahm. K hegam mo d chum t‑naipijju chum s‑koꞌokam ni‑jujju.

column2: I have faced hard labor and struggles, many sleepless nights, hungry and thirsty, often going without food, cold, without enough clothing to keep warm.
column3: Muꞌikko ant si gewko k pi ha kohsig ch hebai d bihugimkam ch tonomkam. Muꞌikko ani pi ha haꞌichu hugi ch pi ha kih ch s‑wihonagi eniga.

column2: Besides all this, I face the daily concerns of dealing with all the churches.
column3: Am baꞌich ehp mani wehs tashkaj si ha chegitok hegam mo ab ihm g Christ ch an aꞌai hab chuꞌig.

column2: Who is weak, and I don't feel weak too? Who is led into sin, and I don't burn up?
column3: Ab ani ha wehm nakog haꞌichu hegam mo pi gewpkdag. Tp hema am wo gei pi apꞌekam ch ed, ni ha wehm si ni‑kudut.

column2: If I have to boast, I will boast about how weak I am.
column3: Pi ani hejel si ni‑haꞌichuchud. Do Jiosh mo am chehgidch g e‑gewkdag am ni‑eda mani eda d wabsh si shoꞌig pi gewkam hemajkam. Ni heg ab waꞌi haꞌichuchud.

column2: The God and Father of the Lord Jesus—may he be praised forever—knows I am not lying.
column3: Jiosh alidag o d ni‑kownalig. K g Jiosh s‑mahch mo wehs woho ihda mani em‑ahgid. Kunt chum hekid ab wo si hehgchulidad.

column2: While I was in Damascus, the governor under King Aretas had the city guarded in order to capture me.
column3: Neh, hegai kownal mo ab wecho g geꞌe kownal Aretas at wa am i ha chuhcha g shondal ab Damascus kihhim kihjeg t ab mat an wo ni‑be k wo ni‑kuh.

column2: But I was lowered in a basket from a window in the city wall, and so I escaped from him.
column3: Mt wabshaba an ni‑dai washomi ch ed k ab i ni‑huduni hodai kolhai amjed. Nt hab hi wa al masma ni‑doꞌibia.

column2: I suppose I have to boast, even though it doesn't really help. Let me go on to visions and revelations from the Lord.
column3: Pi at haꞌichu wo ni‑apꞌet manis wo em‑ahgi hegai mani haschu am hab junihim. Heg ant wo waꞌi em‑ahgi mat haschu g Jiosh am ni‑chehgi.

column2: I know a man in Christ who fourteen years ago was taken up to the third heaven (whether physically in the body, or out of it, I don't know, but God knows).  I know that this man (whether taken up physically in the body, or apart from it, I don't know, but God knows),
column3: Heg at am uhgk i ni‑bei e‑kihdag wui an dahm kahchim ch ed. Id at hab e juh gamai giꞌik aꞌahidag wehgaj. Pi ani hi wa mahch manis s‑wohom an jiwia, aha nat hegai ni‑doakag an jiwia. Heg o waꞌi Jiosh s‑mahch ihda. Heg ani hi wa s‑mahch mant an i ni‑nei Jiosh kihdag ed.

column2: how he was taken up into Paradise, and heard things too wonderful to be spoken, in words so sacred that no human being is allowed to say.
column3: An ant s‑ta kakaim haꞌichu kah. K g Jiosh pi ni‑hiwgid manis am wo ah.

column2: Something like that I'll boast about, but I won't boast about myself, except for my weaknesses.
column3: Id ant ab wo si has ah mat g Jiosh am ni‑chehgi k pi ahni ab hu hejel has wo ni‑ah. Jiosh o ab ni‑chehgidch g e‑gewkdag nani pi d wabsh shoꞌig pi gewkam hemajkam.

column2: I wouldn't be foolish if I wanted to boast, because I'd be telling the truth. But I won't boast, so that nobody will think more of me than what they see me doing or hear me saying.
column3: Kuni muꞌi haꞌichu hab wua heg hekaj gewkdaj ch wabshaba pi em‑ahgid nani pi pi tatchua mas hedai ab hu wo si has ni‑elidad heg hekaj. Heg amt waꞌi hekaj ab wo si has ni‑elidad mam haschu i neid mani hab wua ch haschu i kah mani hab kaij.

column2: Also, because these revelations were so amazingly great, and so that I wouldn't become proud, I was given a “thorn in my flesh” a messenger from Satan to hurt me so that I wouldn't become proud.
column3: Pi o hab mahs manis wo si ni‑haꞌichuchudad heg hekaj mo haschu am ni‑chehgid g Jiosh. K g t‑kownalig Jesus hiwgid g Jiawul mat wo i ni‑mumkichud k wo ni‑kudutad mant pi ab hu wo si ni‑haꞌichuchudad.

column2: I pleaded with the Lord three times to get rid of this problem.
column3: Waikko ant ab chum si ni‑hoꞌigeꞌidahu Jesus wui ab tahnich mat gam hu hab wo i juh ihda ni‑mumkidag.

column2: But he told me, “My grace is all you will need, for my power is effective in weakness.” That's why I happily boast about my weaknesses, so that Christ's power may reside in me.
column3: Kut hab masma i nodagi g e‑neꞌoki, “Baꞌich at i s‑ap wo e chehgi g ni‑gewkdag ab m‑ab mapt wabsh s‑ap wo nakogad g e‑shoꞌigdag napt pi pi wo e nako maps hejel wo nako. Heg waꞌi ni‑gewkdagkaj apt wo e nako.”

column2: So I appreciate weaknesses, insults, troubles, persecutions, and difficulties that I suffer for Christ's sake. For when I'm weak, then I'm strong!
column3: Heg o am chehgidch g e‑gewkdag am ni‑wehhejed mani hekid i mukialig. Kuni heg hekaj wabsh si s‑ap ni‑tahtk mani mukialig ch ab nakog g s‑koꞌok has ahgadag ch s‑wehch haꞌichu ch shoꞌigchudadag ch kudutadag wehhejed g Christ.

column2: I'm talking like a fool, but you made me do it! You should really have been speaking well of me, for in no way am I inferior to the super-apostles,  even though I don't count for anything.
column3: Ab o em‑ab mamt ni‑wehhejed wo neneokad ab ha wui hegam mash has ni‑ahg am em‑shahgid. Msh wabshaba pi hab e wua. Kunt hemho wa am ni‑wehhejed has wo chei, chum anis pi hohhoꞌid manis hab wo ni‑juh nani pi d wabsh pi haꞌichu. K wabshaba g t‑kownalig Jesus ab ni‑mahkch g gewkdag am ni‑kehshch. Pegih, m haschu ahgch baꞌich ab has i ha elid hegam mash wabsh em‑iattogid.

column2: Yet the marks of an apostle were patiently demonstrated among you—signs, wonders, and powerful miracles.
column3: Bani wa junihim g s‑hasig haꞌichu ch muꞌi haꞌichu ab nakog mani wa eda am ahg g Jiosh haꞌichu ahga em‑wui. K id am chehgidch mani d Christ kehsha.

column2: In what way were you inferior to the other churches except I wasn't any burden to you? Please forgive me for doing you wrong!
column3: S‑ap ani hab ni‑junihim ab em‑wui hab wa masma mani ab wehs ha wui hegam mo an aꞌai d Christ ihmdam, heg hi wa mani pi em‑hiwgid mams ab wo haꞌichu ni‑namkid. Ab g wabsh wo s‑ni‑hoꞌigeꞌid mani pi em‑hiwgid.

column2: Now I'm preparing to visit you for the third time, and I won't be a burden to you. I don't want what you have, I want you yourselves! After all, children shouldn't save up for their parents, but parents should for their children.
column3: Id o d i waikkokam mant am wo i em‑chehgim. Kunt pi haꞌichu ab hu wo em‑tai nani pi ahpim ab em‑tatchua ch pi g em‑lialiga. Bam sha masma mam d chuꞌuchum ni‑aꞌaliga namt pi hemu ab i s‑wohoch g haꞌichu ni‑ahga ab amjed g Christ k hekaj bei g wechij doakag. K hab chum mahs mat g jehj wo ha dagioꞌidad g chuꞌuchum e‑aꞌaliga ch pi hab mahs mas g chuꞌuchum aꞌai wo ha dagioꞌidad g e‑jehj.

column2: I will happily spend myself, and be spent, for you. If I love you so much more, will you love me even less?
column3: Am o wa s‑apꞌe mant am wo hugio g haꞌichu ni‑eniga ch ni‑doakag em‑wehhejed. Ab ani baꞌich i si pihk ni‑elid em‑wui mo g jehj ab e‑aꞌaliga ha wui. Kumt heg hekaj ab wo chum si ni‑tatchuad.

column2: Well, even if that's so, I wasn't a burden to you. Maybe I was being devious, and tricked you with my cunning ways!
column3: S‑mahch am mani pi haꞌichukaj shaꞌi em‑wechun. Kumsh eda haꞌi hab kaij manish wabsh em‑iattogid

column2: But did I take advantage of you by anyone I've sent to you?
column3: ch ui g em‑lialiga hejel ni‑wehhejed. Pi o woho ihda. Am ant ha cheha hegam Titus mat am wo hihim k wo i hemapai g lial g shoꞌigkam ha wehhejed.

column2: I urged Titus to go and see you, and I sent another brother with him. Did Titus take advantage of you? No, we both have the same spirit and use the same methods.
column3: K hegam wabsh s‑ap haꞌichu hab elid ch am hab e junihim mani ahni has i masma.

column2: Maybe you're thinking that all along we've been just trying to defend ourselves. No, we speak for Christ before God. Everything we do, friends, is for your benefit.
column3: Naꞌams haꞌi hab ni‑elid mani gam hu wabsh chum ni‑oan id hekaj mani wa hab kaij. K eda pi hab chuꞌig. Am ani Jiosh tahgio hab kaij hegai mo d Christ tatchui. K wehs hegai mach haschu hab i junihim d i em‑wehmtadag.

column2: I do worry when I visit that somehow I won't find you as I would want to, and that you won't find me as you would want to! I'm afraid that there will be arguments, jealousy, anger, rivalry, slander, gossip, arrogance, and disorder.
column3: S‑gihug ani mant wo cheh am jiwiak mamt gawul wo masmak mani hab masma chum em‑tatchuid. Mt ahpim hab waꞌap wo cheh mant ahni gawul wo masmak mam has i chum ni‑tatchuid. Ntp hems wo cheh mam haꞌi wabsh kia e kawani ch haꞌi s‑e hehgamk ch haꞌi pi babmuistk ch s‑chu daꞌa ch s‑koꞌokam has e ahg ch chum si e haschud ch aꞌai e cheggia.

column2: I'm afraid that when I visit, my God will humble me in your presence, and that I will be weeping over many of those who have sinned previously, and who still have not repented of impurity, sexual immorality, and indecent acts that they committed.
column3: T heg wo ni‑mah g si edadag am Jiosh tahgio. Kunt wo shoakad mamtki koi gam hu s‑ohhod g pi ap e‑chegitoi k pi ap e nuhkud ch ha ehsid g ha‑wehm kihkam ch s‑tohntom has e wua ch g pi apꞌekam tatchua.

column2: This is my third visit to you. “Any charge must be verified by two or three witnesses.”
column3: Neh, s‑koꞌokam ant ab wo ha namkid g pi ap chuꞌijkam am i ep em‑chehgimedk. K wabshaba an oꞌohadag:

column2: Even though he was crucified in weakness, now he lives through the power of God. We too are weak in him, but you will see that we live with him through the power of God.
column3: Woho o wa mat e wepogi g shoꞌig pi gewpkam oꞌodham k ab e muhkid kots t ab. T wabshaba g Jiosh am chehgi g e‑gewkdag. K g Christ hahawa ep doakam heg gewkdagkaj.

column2: Examine yourselves to see if you are trusting God. Put yourselves to the test. Don't you yourselves realize that Jesus Christ is in you? Unless you have failed the test…
column3: Am g wo si e mamche k am hejel wo i e aꞌamich mams am hi wa s‑ap hab chuꞌig e‑wohochudadag oidch. Mt wo wa chum s‑ap s‑mahchk mam ab uꞌukch g Hekia S‑apꞌekam Gewkdag mamtp woho d wohochuddam

column2: However, I hope that you realize that we have not failed the test.
column3: k hab wa masma wo s‑mahchk mani ahni hab waꞌap woho d wohochuddam.

column2: We pray to God that you won't do anything bad—not so we can show we passed the test, but so you can do what is good, even if we appear to be failures.
column3: Ab ani si ni‑hoꞌigeꞌidahun Jiosh wui mamt pi am hu hab wo junihid g pi apꞌekam ch wabshaba g s‑apꞌekam am hab wo junihid, chum as wo pi ap ni‑ahgad hegam mo s‑ni‑kehꞌid.

column2: We can't do anything against the truth, only for the truth.
column3: Pi att wo t‑nako matt wo shohbi g wohokam. Hemho wa att am wo wohokamch.

column2: We're happy when we are weak, and you are strong—we pray that you may continue to improve.
column3: Tt wo s‑ap t‑taht k ab wabsh wo i t‑shoꞌigch mamtp ahpim wo i gewpka am e‑wohochudadag ed. Ab ach si t‑hoꞌigeꞌidahun mamt wehs ab wo i e dagito k am s‑ap wo i e nahto.

column2: That is why I write about this while I'm not with you, so that when I am with you I won't have to treat you harshly by imposing my authority. The Lord gave me authority for building up, not for tearing down.
column3: T‑kownalig Jesus o ab ni‑mahkch g gewkdag mant wo shohbi g pi em‑apꞌekam. Kunt am i em‑oꞌohani mamt hekaj am wo i apꞌech mant eda koi jiwia. Nt hab pi wo em‑kehꞌel am jiwiak. Do Jiosh hab elida mant am wo i em‑gewkemhu. Kuni hab pi em kehꞌidamk.

column2: Finally, brothers and sisters, I say goodbye. Continue to improve spiritually. Encourage one another. Be in agreement. Live in peace, and the God of love and peace will be with you.
column3: Pegih, ni‑wepnag, haꞌas ant hab wo chei. Am g wo i e nakogi mamt wehs ab wo i e dagito Hekia S‑apꞌekam Gewkdag wui. T heg wehs wo i em‑apꞌech. Ab g wo i s‑wohog elidad g t‑mashchamadag ch ab wo i hemakoch g e‑wohochudadag k wo s‑ap e tahtk ch e wehm kihkad. T g Jiosh wo em‑wehmajk ch wo em‑mah g pihk elidadag ch s‑ap tahhadkam.

column2: Greet each other with Christian affection.
column3: Ab g aꞌai wo si e tatchuad.

column2: All the believers here send their greetings.  May the grace of the Lord Jesus Christ, the love of God, and the communion of the Holy Spirit be with you all.
column3: Ab o si s‑em‑hoꞌigeꞌid g t‑kownalig Jesus Christ. K g Jiosh ab si em‑tatchua. K g Hekia S‑apꞌekam Gewkdag ab em‑makiog g gewkdag mamt ab aꞌai e wui wo si s‑ap e tahtkkad.

column2: May grace, mercy and peace continue to be with us, from God the Father and from Jesus Christ, the Son of the Father, in truth and in love.
column3: Ab o wa si s-em-hoꞌigeꞌid g t-ohg Jiosh g e-alidag Jesus Christ wehm ch ab wo wa baꞌich i em-mah g i wehmtadag ch s-ap tahhadkam. Kumt ab wo uꞌukchid g wohokam ch wo si pihk e elidad wehs ha hekaj.

column2: I was delighted to discover that some of your children are following the truth, just as the Father commanded us.
column3: Si ani s-ap ni-tahtk ch ia haꞌi ha neid g em-wehm kihkam. K idam an uꞌukch g wohokam hab masma mo ab t-chehani g Jiosh.

column2: Now I'm telling you, dear lady, not as a new instruction, but following what we've understood from the beginning, that we should love one another.
column3: Kuni ab wehs i em-gewkemhun mamt ab aꞌai e wui wo si pihk e elidad. Pi o d wechij chehanig ihda mani am em-ahgid. Edgid ach ihda ged hu i shohshon k amjed.

column2: This is what love is: we should follow God's commands. The command, just as you heard right from the beginning, is that you should live in love.
column3: Kutt ab aꞌai t-wui wo si pihk t-elidad ch hekaj am wo t-chehgidad mach ab s-wohog elid ihda chehanigaj g Jiosh.

column2: I'm telling you this because many deceivers have left and gone out into the world. They don't accept that Jesus Christ has come as a human being. Anyone like this is a deceiver and an antichrist.
column3: Muꞌi at an i wuwha mo chum s-ha mashchamamk g hemajkam ch eda d wabsh s-chu iꞌattomkam ch d obgaj g Jiosh alidag no pi pi ha mashcham mat ia mahsi k d oꞌodham hab masma mach ahchim.

column2: Be careful that you don't lose what we've worked so hard for, and that you receive all that you should.
column3: Kumt heg hekaj wo s-e nenꞌoidk mamt pi gam hu hab wo i e juh ab amjed g Jiosh haꞌichu ahga k wabshaba wehs wo bei mo haschu ab em-makiog g Jiosh.

column2: All those who become extremists and don't continue to follow the teaching of Christ don't have God with them. Those who continue to follow the teaching of Christ have both the Father and the Son with them.
column3: Hegam matp hedai am gawul wo juh g Jiosh alidag mashchama o pi shaꞌi mahch g Jiosh. S-mahch ach g Jiosh ch ep s-mahch g alidaj ahchim mach am oidch hab masma g alidaj mashchama.

column2: If people come to you and don't show evidence of Christ's teaching, don't take them in, don't welcome them—
column3: Kumt heg hekaj pi ab hu wo ha kaihamad hegai mat hedai wo chum s-em-mashchamam k eda pi wo ahgachugad g Jiosh alidag mashchama. Pi g am hu wo i ha wahpkid e-kihki ed k chum hems pi hab wo chei ab ha wui. “Jiosh at wo wa em-wehmajk,”

column2: for if you encourage them you share in their evil work.
column3: mamt pi ab hu wo i ha wehmt hegam mat am wo ahgachugad g pi wohokam.

column2: I have so many things to tell you that I won't write any more with paper and ink, for I hope to visit you and talk with you face to face. How happy that would make us!
column3: Muꞌi ani haꞌichu s-em-ahgidamk ch wabshaba pi id hekaj am i em-oꞌohani nani pi am s-himimk mant wo em-neid k wo em-wehm neo. Kutt am t-wehm si s-ap wo t-tahtkk.

column2: Greetings to you from the children of your chosen sister.
column3: Ia o haꞌi kih g t-wepnag ch ash si pihk e elid em-hekaj.

column2: May you have ever more grace and peace as you grow in the knowledge of God and of Jesus our Lord.
column3: S-mahch am g Jiosh ch ep s-mahch g t-kownalig Jesus. K heg hekaj ab si s-em-hoꞌigeꞌid ch ab baꞌich wo i em-mahkad g s-ap tahhadkam.

column2: Through his divine power we have been given everything that's important to live a God-centered life. This comes through knowing him who called us to himself by his own glory and goodness.
column3: Pegih, s-mahch ach g Jiosh. K heg hekaj ab t-mahkch wehs hegai mach tatchua matt hekaj s-ap wo himchudad g t-doakag ch d wo s-apꞌekamk. Ab at i t-gawulkai ab t-chehgidch g si s-tondam e-gewkdag ch s-e-apꞌekam.

column2: Through these promises you can share in the divine nature, being rid of the corruption caused by this world's evil desires.
column3: Si geꞌe haꞌichu atsh hab wo t-juni g Jiosh. Kumt ab i s-wohochud k hab wo edgidad g Jiosh doakag ch wo e doꞌibia ab amjed hegai pi apꞌekam mo in haꞌichug heg hekaj pi ap ha-tatchui g hemajkam.

column2: For this same reason, do everything you can! Add to your trust in God, goodness; add to goodness, knowledge;
column3: Pegih, ab o em-mahks g wohochudadag. Kumt wo si e nakogad mamt wo s-apꞌek ch am wo si i mamche g s-apꞌekam

column2: add to knowledge, self-control; add to self-control, patience; add to patience, reverence;
column3: ch wo s-dodolimak ch s-chechojim ab wo nakogad haꞌichu ch ab wo ihmad g Jiosh.

column2: add to reverence, affection for fellow-believers, add to affection for fellow-believers, love.
column3: Ab o em-ab mamt ab ep wo si ha tatchuad g e-wehm wohochuddam ch ab wo si pihk e elidad chum hems ha hekaj g hemajkam.

column2: The more you have these qualities, the more they will keep you from being ineffective and unproductive in your knowledge of our Lord Jesus Christ.
column3: Neh, id amt wehs eda am wo e nakogad ch hekaj s-wapagim am hab wo junihid g tatchuij g t-kownalig Jesus Christ.

column2: For anyone who doesn't have such qualities is short-sighted, or blind. They forget that they've been cleansed from their past sins.
column3: Kutp hedai pi hab wo junihid ihda ch hab wo masmak mo g pi neadam no pi pi ap neid mat gam hu hab i juh g Jiosh g pi ap chuꞌijigaj.

column2: So, brothers and sisters, be all the more determined to make sure you are truly “called and chosen.” If you do this, you won't ever fall.
column3: Neh, mt hekaj am baꞌich wo i si e nako mamt si s-wihnam wo bei hegai mat haschu wehhejed ab i em-waid k ab i em-gawulkai g Jiosh. T hab pi hekid hab wo e juh mams wo i shul ab amjed g Jiosh.

column2: You will receive a tremendous welcome into the eternal kingdom of our Lord and Savior Jesus Christ.
column3: Jiosh at s-ap ab wo em-mah g apꞌedag mamt am wo i wahp t-doꞌibiakam Jesus Christ kownaltalig ed.

column2: That's why I always remind you about these things, even though you know them already, and you stand firm in the truth that you possess.
column3: Heki amki hu s-mahch ihda mani ia em-ahgid ch s-wihnam gegok heg eda wohokam mamt ab bei. Nt wabshaba am wo i em-chechegitolidad mamt wo s-chegitok ch ab s-ap wo bei g e-apꞌedag.

column2: But I still think it's a good idea to encourage you by giving you reminders while I live.  I know the time when I shall leave this life will be coming soon— our Lord Jesus Christ has made this clear to me.
column3: E o aihim mant im hu hab wo i ni-juh mad hab ni-ahgid g t-kownalig Jesus Christ. Ni hekaj hab ni-ahg mant am wo si em-chechegitolidad wehs ihda am hugkam mant hebai hugkam d wo doakamk.

column2: I will do my best so that when I'm gone you will always be able to remember these things.
column3: Am ant wo i ni-nako mant am wo oꞌoha wehs ihda. Mt hab masma chum hekid wo s-chegitokad am i dahm mant hekid im hu hab wo i ni-juh.

column2: We didn't follow made-up myths when we told you about the coming in power of our Lord Jesus Christ—we saw his majesty for ourselves.
column3: Ia atsh ep wo jiwia g t-kownalig Jesus Christ jewed dahm. T g gewkdaj am ep wo e chehgi. Wohokam ach am em-ahgid id amjed ch pi g hohoꞌoki aꞌagida ahchim machd heki hu am neid g si s-tondam gewkdaj g si t-wuhpuikaj.

column2: He received honor and glory from God the Father when the voice of majestic glory spoke to him and announced, “This is my Son, the one I love, and who truly pleases me.”
column3: An achd wehmaj g Jesus. Kud g ohgaj Jiosh ab mah g si has elidadag k ab neok ch hab kaij, “Id o d si ni-tatchuidch ni-alidag.”

column2: We ourselves heard this voice speak from heaven when we were with him on the holy mountain.
column3: Id achd kah mo ab neok dahm kahchim t amjed anai machd an wehmaj doꞌag dahm.

column2: We also have the confirming word of prophecy that's absolutely trustworthy, and you will benefit from paying close attention to it. It's like a lamp that shines in a dark place until the day dawns, and the morning star rises in your hearts.
column3: Id o am si wohokamchud mo haschu heki hu am ahg g Jiosh haꞌichu i tashogiddam. Haꞌichu ha-ahga o wabsh heꞌes ab i t-mahkch g amichudadag hab sha masma matp hems g kanjel t-tonlidch am s-chuhugam k ed. K wabshaba g Jesus am t-mahtchulid ch baꞌich i geꞌe ab t-mahkch g amichudadag hab sha masma mo g s-mahs huꞌu baꞌich i t-tonlidch mat hekid ab wo i chesh mo e aihim g mahsidag. Mt heg hekaj wo s-chegitok g haꞌichu ha-ahga g Jiosh haꞌichu i tashogiddam k ab wo e dagitokch Jesus wui.

column2: Most of all you should realize that no prophecy of scripture is a matter for interpretation based on the whims of an individual,  for no prophecy originated in human ideas, but prophets spoke for God as they were moved by the Holy Spirit.
column3: Haꞌichu ha-ahga o pi d wabsh hemajkam haꞌichu ha-ahga. Hekia S-apꞌekam Gewkdag o am ha tashogid g Jiosh haꞌichu ahga. T heg hekaj pi hedai wo e nako mas wabsh g hejel e-mahchigkaj wo i tashogi g haꞌichu ha-ahga.

column2: But just as there were false prophets among the people then, there will be false teachers among you. They subtly introduce false and destructive teachings, even denying the Lord who redeemed them, quickly bringing destruction on themselves.
column3: An atsh wa haꞌi i wuwha mash wa e wepogid g Jiosh haꞌichu i tashogiddam ch wabshaba wabsh ha iattogid g hemajkam. Kut hab waꞌap in wo i wuwha em-shahgid hegam mat wo chum em-mashcha g pi wohokam k wo padch g em-wohochudadag. Jesus Christ o d t-doꞌibiakam. K wabshaba idam pi wohokamchud. S-hohtam at im hu hab wo i ha juh g Jiosh mat hekid wo e ai g ha-tashga.

column2: Many will follow their immoral perversions, and because of them people will condemn the way of truth.
column3: Muꞌijj at am ha oidch hab wo junihid g s-bihtagi haꞌichu hab ha-juni. T heg hekaj muꞌi hemajkam wo pad has ahgad g Jesus himdag.

column2: They will greedily exploit you with false tales. However they are already condemned: their sentence has been hanging over them for a long time, their destruction won't be postponed.
column3: Hegam mo em-iattogid ab amjed g Jiosh haꞌichu ahga o wabsh s-uꞌimkch g em-lialiga. K wabshaba am e nahtokch g Jiosh mat wo ha lodait k im hu hab wo i ha juh.

column2: For God didn't even spare the angels when they sinned. He threw them into Tartarus, holding them in dark pits ready for judgment.
column3: Si o tasho mo e aihim g lodaita tash. Haꞌi atsh am shul g anghil pi apꞌekam ch ed. Tsh g Jiosh am ha shul s-chuhugam k ed k am ha uꞌukch mat haha wo ha lodai geꞌe lodaita tash ed.

column2: God didn't spare the ancient world either, but he protected Noah who told people about the God who did right. He was one of the eight who were saved when God sent a flood upon a world of evil people.
column3: Muꞌijj g heki hu hemajkam ash wa pi ab hu wohog elid g Jiosh. Kutsh hab juh g geꞌe wiꞌindag matsh ha wiꞌin. Sh eda am wa chum ahgahim g s-apꞌekam ihda mash hab chehgig Noah. Tsh id doꞌibia g Jiosh ch wewaꞌak ehp g wehmaj kihkam.

column2: God condemned the cities of Sodom and Gomorrah to total destruction, burning them to ash, as an example of what will happen to those who live evil lives.
column3: Sh gam hu baꞌich, kush shaꞌi si pi apꞌe hegam mash am d kihkam Sodom ch Gomorra t am. Tsh g Jiosh am wabsh i ha hugio idam kihhim g meikaj mat wo ha chehgi g pi ap hemajkam mat has wo ha juh.

column2: But God rescued Lot because he was a good man, sickened by the disgusting immorality of his neighbors.  (Lot lived among them, but he did what was good and right. He saw and heard what they did day after day, and their wickedness tormented him.)
column3: Kush am hema kih g s-apꞌekam oꞌodham ch hab chehgig Lot ch si s-wohom pi hohhoꞌid g pi ap haꞌichu hab ha-juni. Tsh id g Jiosh doꞌibia matsh hekid i ha hugio hegam kihhim.

column2: As you can see, the Lord is able to rescue from their troubles those who respect him, and to keep the wicked until the day of judgment when their punishment is completed.
column3: Wehs ihda o am t-tashogid mo g Jiosh e nahtokch mat wo ha doꞌibia g s-apꞌekam oꞌodham ab amjed g ha-kudutadag k s-koꞌokam ab wo ha namkid g pi apꞌekam mat wo e ai g geꞌe lodaita tash.

column2: This is especially so for those who follow their corrupt human desires, and contemptuously disregard authority. Arrogant and proud, they're not even afraid to defame heavenly beings.
column3: Jiosh at baꞌich i si s-koꞌokam wo ha namkid hegam mo d wabsh totonto ch pi ap hekaj g e-chuhkug ch pi ab hu wohog elid g t-kownalig Jesus Christ.

column2: Angels, on the other hand, even though they are stronger and more powerful, don't disparage them before the Lord.
column3: Anghil o ha baꞌich i s-gewpkdag ch eda pi shaꞌi koꞌokam ab ha abchud hegam hahaꞌichu am tahgio g Jiosh.

column2: These people are like mindless beasts, produced like farm animals to be captured and slaughtered. They condemn things they don't know anything about, and just like animals they will be destroyed.
column3: K eda hegam s-chu iꞌattomkam pi haꞌichu am hu chegito hab masma mo g mischini haꞌichu doakam ch s-koꞌokam has ahg hegai mo haschu pi amichud. T g Jiosh wo ha hugio hab masma mamtp hems wo mua g haꞌichu doakam.

column2: They will be paid back in harm for the harm they have done. Their idea of fun is to commit their evil lusts in broad daylight. They are stains and blemishes on your community. They enjoy their deceptive pleasures even while they eat together with you.
column3: S-koꞌokam at ab wo bei g e-namkidadag heg hekaj mo am hab junihim g pi apꞌekam. Dash ha-hohhoꞌida mat chum hems tash ed hab wo junihid g si s-uam haꞌichu. Am ash em-wehm e gegosid. K d si edadag mo hab s-junimk g iattogida.

column2: They're always on the lookout for adulterous relationships—they just can't stop sinning. They seduce the vulnerable; they have trained themselves in greed; they are offspring under a curse.
column3: Heg o waꞌi tatchua mat g uꞌuwi an wo ha neidad ch pi ap haꞌichu am wo chegitod. Shahag wepo mo pi ha huhuge g pi ap ha-tatchui. S-uꞌimk o hegai mo pi ab hu d ha-wuikam ch im hu hab pi apko i ha wanimed hegam mo pi gewpkdag. Jiosh o heki hu ab ha mohtoꞌidch g s-koꞌok namkidadag.
