column2: They have abandoned the right path and went astray, following the way of Balaam, the son of Beor, who loved to be paid for doing evil.
column3: Heki at hu i e mehkod ab amjed g s-apꞌekam hab masma matsh wa hema hab e juh mash hab chehgig Balaam. Ihda Balaambad ash d chum Jiosh haꞌichu i tashogiddam ch wabshaba s-uꞌimk g lial am hab junihidch g pi apꞌekam.

column2: But he was told off for his evil actions—a dumb donkey spoke with a human voice and stopped the prophet's foolishness!
column3: Tsh g Jiosh shohbi g pi ap haꞌichu hab elidaj am hab juhk g wuhlu shoigaj mat haha wabsh neo.

column2: People like these are springs without water, mists blown away by the wind. They are destined for blackest darkness—forever.
column3: No hig pi woho mo pi haꞌichu wehhejed s-kehgaj g shongam matp wo gaksh o g s-chuchk chewagi matp gam hu wabsh wo wiꞌichkwua? Pegih, k hab waꞌap pi haꞌichu wehhejed s-kehgaj idam mo pi ahg g wohokam. Jiosh at am wo ha shul si s-chuhugam k ed.

column2: Inflated with their own nonsense, they appeal to sensual desires, luring back into immorality those who have only just escaped from those who live in error.
column3: Chum o si s-gimaim ch pehegi neneok ch s-uam haꞌichukaj i ha wanchshulig hegam mo chum e nakog mat wo e doꞌibia

column2: They promise them freedom, even though they themselves are slaves to depravity. “You are a slave to whatever conquers you.”
column3: no pi am ha ahgid mo wabsh chum haschu s-apꞌe ch eda hejel e wupulshch g pi apꞌekamkaj. Matp haschukaj wo e gewito g oꞌodham k heg hekaj wo e wulshchid.

column2: If people manage to escape from the evil influence of the world by knowing the Lord and Savior Jesus Christ, and then get tangled up in sin again and are defeated, they are worse off than they were in the first place.
column3: Hegam s-chu iꞌattomkam at s-mai g wohokam ab amjed g t-kownalig Jesus Christ k hekaj wo chum e doꞌibia. Kut heg hekaj baꞌich wo i pi apꞌek mat am ep wo e wupulsh g pi apꞌekamkaj.

column2: It would have been better not to have known the right way of truth, than to have known it and then turn away from the sacred instructions they'd been given.
column3: Ab o ha mahkch g Jiosh g haꞌichu e-ahga. K wabshaba baꞌich i s-apꞌe mat hems pi wo kah matp wabsh gam hu wo s-ohhod.

column2: This proverb has come true for them: “The dog has returned to its own vomit, and the washed pig has gone back to rolling in the mud.”
column3: T am wo e wohokamch ihda hab ha-cheꞌidag:

column2: My friends, this is my second letter to you. In both of them I've tried to stir you up and remind you to think clearly with pure minds.
column3: Pegih neh, ni‑wepnag, id o d waꞌi gokkokam mant am i em‑oꞌohanid k am i em‑chegitol idam haꞌichu.

column2: Remember the words spoken in the past by the holy prophets, and what the Lord and Savior commanded through your apostles.
column3: Chum ani si em‑tatchuid mamt wo s‑chegitok g haꞌichu ha‑ahga g Jiosh haꞌichu i tashogiddam ch ep wo s‑chegitok hegai chehanigaj g t‑doꞌibiakam kownal Jesus mo g am chuhchaij am wa em‑ahgid.

column2: Above all you should know that derisive people will come in the last days, full of mockery and following their own evil desires.
column3: Mt wo s‑mahchkad mat am wo i e aihi mat ep wo jiwia g Jesus, t an haꞌi wo i wuwha mo heg waꞌi hejel e‑tatchui am hab s‑junimk. Idam at wo has em‑ahgad

column2: “So what happened to this coming he promised?” they ask. “Right from the time our ancestors died, everything's continued as it always has, ever since creation began.”
column3: ch pi ab hu has wo elidad g wohokam ch hab wo kaijjid, “Mki wabsh hejel e iattogid mam hab chechꞌe matsh ep wo uhpam jiwia g Jesus. T eda pi jiwia. T muꞌijj heki hu waꞌi koi g t‑shohshon. Wehs haꞌichu o am hab wabsh i e junihim mo has i e junihim ga hu hebai i amjed mashp hekid in i e nahto g jewed.”

column2: But they deliberately ignore the fact that by God's command the heavens were created long ago. The earth came into existence from the water, and was surrounded by water.
column3: Idam o hab s‑e junimk mo pi mahch mo id d wohokam matsh wa g Jiosh am neok k am nahto g dahm kahchim ch jewed. Ihda jewed atsh ab i wuhsh shuhdagi t amjed k g shuhdagikaj e nahto.

column2: It was through water that the world that then existed was destroyed—through being flooded by water.
column3: K am i himdam, sh d wa ep shuhdagi mat ha wiꞌin k ha hugio g hemajkam.

column2: But by means of that same divine command the heavens and the earth that now exist are reserved for destruction by fire at the day of judgment when the wicked will be destroyed.
column3: K hab wa masma wabsh g e‑neꞌokikaj an uꞌukch g Jiosh g dahm kahchim ch jewed ch ab wo ai mat wo ha lodai g pi ap hemajkam k im hu hab wo i ha juh mei ch ed.

column2: However, my friends, don't forget this one thing: that for the Lord a day is like a thousand years, and a thousand years is like a day.
column3: Id amt ep wo s‑chegitok mo g mihl aꞌahidag hab waꞌi masma mo g hemako tash am wehhejed g Jiosh.

column2: The Lord is not delaying the fulfillment of his promise, as some define delay, but he is being very patient with you. He doesn't want anyone to be lost, but everyone to come and repent.
column3: K wabshaba am hemajkam t‑wehhejed shahag wepo mo si chewaj g tash mat g Jiosh am hab wo juh hegai mash hab s‑t‑junidamk. K eda g Jiosh si s‑ha bahbgi g hemajkam ch ab chum ha nenida no pi pi hab chum shaꞌi elid mas hedai wo huhug am pi apꞌekam ch e d pi gam hu s‑ohhodk g pi ap e‑chegitoi.

column2: However the day of the Lord will come, unexpectedly like a thief. The heavens will explode with a thunderous roar, and the elements  will be destroyed as they are burned up. The earth and everything in it will vanish.
column3: Neh, no hig pi woho mo pi ta machima mas hekid g s‑chu ehskam am wo wah em‑kih ed? Pegih, k hab waꞌap pi ta machima mas hekid ep wo jiwia g t‑kownalig Jesus. S‑hohtam atsh wo jiwia. Kutsh wo si s‑kaidam huhug g dahm kahchim k wo meitto g tash ch huhuꞌu ch jewed.

column2: Since everything is going to be destroyed in this way, what kind of people should you be? You should be living lives that are pure, dedicated to God,
column3: Wehs haꞌichu atsh wo huhug. Mt heg hekaj ab wo chum si i e dagitokch Jiosh wui

column2: waiting expectantly and being eager for the coming of the day of God. That day the heavens will catch fire and be destroyed, and the elements will melt in the heat.
column3: ch ab wo nenidad hegai tash ch am wo e nakogad mat hems s‑hohtam wo e ai.

column2: But as for us, we are looking for new heavens and a new earth that God has promised where everything is right.
column3: Sh wabshaba g Jiosh hab kaij mat heg i dahm am haha wo nahto g wechij dahm kahchim ch wechij jewed. Tsh g s‑apꞌekam an hab wo waꞌi e junihid anai. Neh, id ach ab si nenida.

column2: So, my friends, since you're anticipating these things, make sure you'll be found pure and blameless, and at peace with God.
column3: Pegih oi g wo, tt hig am wo si i t‑nako matt wo si s‑apꞌek am Jiosh tahgio k wo si s‑ap t‑tahtkkad ab aꞌai t‑wui. T g Jiosh s‑ap ab wo t‑neidad.

column2: Remember that it is our Lord's patience that gives the opportunity for salvation. That's what our dear brother Paul was explaining to you in all his letters with the wisdom given to him by God.
column3: Am g wo s‑amichudad mo g Jiosh am wabsh s‑t‑bahbgi mattp hems wehsijj wo t‑doꞌibia. Paul at wa am hab waꞌap em‑oꞌohani ihda heg hekaj amichudadag mo g Jiosh ab mahkch.

column2: He spoke about these things, though some of what he wrote is certainly hard to understand. Some ignorant and unbalanced people have twisted what he wrote to their own loss—just as they do other scriptures.
column3: Bo wa masma hab chuꞌig wehs oꞌohanaj ed mo am ha oꞌohanid g aꞌai hemajkam id amjed. Hahasko o s‑hasigam hab kaidag g oꞌohanaj. K pi ap am hu i tashogid hegam mo pi amichud g e‑wohochudadag ch pi wihnam gegok heg eda mo hab wa masma hab ep wua g heki hu oꞌohanaj g Jiosh. Ho o wabsh hejel ab e mohtoꞌid g pi ap chuꞌijig. T im hu hab wo i ha juh g Jiosh.

column2: My friends, since you already know this, make sure that these errors of the wicked don't lead you astray, and you don't fall from your firm position.
column3: Am am wa heki hu s‑mahch wehs ihda, ni‑wepnag. Hegam mat pi ab hu wo wohog elidad g Jiosh at gam hu hab wo i e juh ab amjed. Kumt wo s‑e nenꞌoidad mamt pi am hu ha oidk hab wo e junihid.

column2: May you grow in the grace and in the knowledge of our Lord and Savior Jesus Christ. May he have glory, both now and forever! Amen.
column3: Am att hig wo i t‑nako matt ab baꞌich wo i mahchid g t‑doꞌibiakam kownal Jesus Christ ch baꞌich wo i bei g i wehmtadag ab amjed. Heg ach ab si hehgchulid ch chum hekid ab wo si ihmad.

column2: May you have grace and peace from God the Father and the Lord Jesus Christ.
column3: Ab o wa si s-em-hoꞌigeꞌid g t-ohg Jiosh g t-kownalig Jesus Christ wehm ch ab wo wa baꞌich i em-mahkad g i wehmtadag ch s-ap tahhadkam.

column2: We keep on thanking God for you, brothers and sisters—we just have to! This is the right thing to do because your trust in God is growing in leaps and bounds, and the love you all have for each other increases more and more.
column3: Chum ach hekid ab si hoꞌigeꞌid g Jiosh em-hekaj, t-wepnag. Am amsh si i gewkahim e-wohochudadag ed ch baꞌich i si pihk e elid ab aꞌai e wui.

column2: We speak so proudly of you among the churches of God because of your patient courage and trust in God during all the persecution and trouble you're going through.
column3: Kuch heg hekaj si s-ap t-tahtk ch wehsko ha ahgidahim g t-wehm wohochuddam ab em-amjed. Msh am em-shoꞌigchud nam pi ab s-wohochud g Jiosh. Kumsh eda s-ap ab nakog g e-shoꞌigdag am wehhejed g Jiosh.

column2: For this is evidence that God is right in the decisions he makes, and that you deserve the kingdom of God for which you are suffering.
column3: Id o am wohokamchud mat am i em-apꞌech g Jiosh e wehhejed k pi ab hu haꞌichu wo em-abch am lodaita ch ed. Am am e shoꞌigchud wehhejed g Jiosh kownaltalig. K g Jiosh hab em-elid mam d s-apꞌekam ch am wo i em-wahpki e-kihdag ed.

column2: Since God does what's right he will deal appropriately with those who cause you trouble.
column3: Jiosh at s-ap hab wo juh g lodaita. Hegam mo em-shoꞌigchud at wo e shoꞌigch heg hekaj.

column2: He will free you from your suffering—and us too—when the Lord Jesus appears from heaven in blazing fire with his powerful angels,
column3: Kumt ahpim wo e doꞌibia ab amjed g e-shoꞌigchudadag. Jiosh at hab wo juh ihda mat hekid ep wo jiwia g t-kownalig Jesus ab dahm kahchim t amjed. T ia wehmaj wo dada g anghiligaj k wo si s-gewkdagk.

column2: bringing judgment on those who reject God and refuse to accept the good news of our Lord Jesus.
column3: T ia wehmaj ep wo e chehgi g si geꞌe mei. T wo s-koꞌokam ha namkid g Jesus hegam mo pi mahch g Jiosh ch pi ab hu wohog elid g s-kehg haꞌichu ahgaj ab amjed g t-kownalig Jesus.

column2: They will rightly experience the consequence of eternal loss, separated from the presence of the Lord and his glorious power,
column3: Hegam at gam hu wo si i e gawulkai ab amjed g Jiosh k pi hekid wo bei g geꞌe gewkdaj k chum hekid ab wo beihid g s-koꞌok e-namkidadag.

column2: on the day when he comes to receive glory from his people, admired by all those who trust in him. This includes you because you were convinced about what we told you.
column3: Id at hab wo e juh mat hekid ia ep wo jiwia g t-kownalig Jesus. Kut g gewkdaj am haha wo i chehgi mat t-doꞌibia k ab i t-gawulkai e wehhejed.

column2: That's why we continue to pray for you, that our God may make you worthy of what he's called us to do. May God powerfully fulfill every desire you have to do good and every action that comes from trusting him
column3: Pegih, heg ach hekaj chum hekid ab t-hoꞌigeꞌidahun Jiosh wui am em-wehhejed. Ab at i em-wai mamt wo e doꞌibia k d wo aꞌaligajk. M hab hahawa s-junimk g s-apꞌekam ab s-wohochudch. Kuch ab tahni g Jiosh mat am e-tatchui oidk hab wo em-juh k hab s-ap hab wo em-elidad. Jiosh o gewkdag mat hab wo juh ihda mach ab tahni.

column2: so that the name of our Lord Jesus may be honored by what you do—and in turn you are honored by him through the grace of our God and the Lord Jesus Christ.
column3: Kumt ab wo si haꞌichuchudad g t-kownalig Jesus. T heg hab waꞌap ab wo si em-haꞌichuchudad. Jiosh at si s-hemajim am i apꞌech g e-alidag wehm mat id hab wo em-juni.

column2: Talking about the coming of our Lord Jesus Christ and how we're brought together to him, brother and sisters—
column3: Bach wa em-ahgid mat ep wo jiwia g t-kownalig Jesus Christ k ab e wui wo i t-ui.

column2: please don't become upset or concerned by any spiritual revelation, or message, or letter supposedly from us that makes you think that the day of the Lord has already come.
column3: Kush am hema em-ahgid mat heki hu hab e juh. Pi g am wo shaꞌi e kudut k pi shaꞌi ha wohochud, chum as hems hab wabsh e wua mo heg am ha tashogid g Jiosh o atp hems em-ahgid matt ahchim hab masma haꞌichu oꞌoha.

column2: Don't let anyone deceive you in any way, because the Rebellion must come first, and the lawless man be revealed, the one whose end is destruction.  He is the enemy of God, and proudly sets himself up over everything that is called God and is worshiped. He even installs himself in God's Temple, claiming to be God.
column3: Koi at e ai. Hemho wa at wehpeg am hab wo e juh mat muꞌi ab wui wo gegokiwua g Jiosh hegam mo hab chum kaij mo ab s-wohochud. T am hahawa hema wo i wuhsh g oꞌodham k wehs ha baꞌiwechkim d wo pi apꞌekamk ch d wo si obgajk g Jiosh ch am wo i wah geꞌe cheopi ch ed am Jerusalem t am k am wo dahiwua mat g hemajkam ab wo jiosht. Kut pi wo ha hiwigi mas haꞌichu ep wo jioshgak. T g Jiosh s-koꞌokam wo namkidad chum hekid.

column2: Don't you remember that I told you all this while I was still with you?
column3: Am am wa s-chegito mani wa am wa heki hu em-ahgid ihda mani eda am em-wehmaj.

column2: Now you know what's keeping him in check, because he will be revealed for what he is at the appropriate time.  For the secret ways of lawlessness  are already at work; however he who now restrains it will continue to do so until he is out of the way.
column3: S-mahch am mo g pi apꞌekam an e shohbidch hemu. T wabshaba has tash in hu hab wo i e juh hegai mo an shohbidch.

column2: Then the lawless one will be revealed, the one whom the Lord Jesus will wipe out, blowing him away,  destroying him by the brilliance of his coming.  He (the lawless one) comes to do Satan's work, having all kinds of powers, using miracles, and performing amazing but deceptive displays.  Using every type of evil trick he deludes those who are on their way to destruction, because they refused to love the truth and so be saved.  Because of this God sends them a convincing delusion so that they put their trust in the lie.
column3: T am haha wo i wuhsh hegai si pi apꞌekam oꞌodham. T g jijawul ha-geꞌejig Satan ab wo mah g gewkdag. Kut hab wo juh g nahnko mahs s-hasig haꞌichu ch s-ta neidamam haꞌichu mat wo ha iattogi g hemajkam. Kut hegam ab wo i s-wohoch mo hedai d pi e doꞌibiakam. Jiosh at hab wo ha juh mat wabsh g haꞌichu iattogi ab wo s-wohoch no pi idam s-hohhoꞌid g pi apꞌekam ch pi ab hu wo bei g wohokam mat hekaj wo chum e doꞌibia. T am haha wo jiwia g t-kownalig Jesus k si s-masma ab wo e chehgid k ab ab wo ihbhe hegai si pi ap oꞌodham k hekaj wo muꞌa k gam hu wo si i daꞌich mamt hebai wo ha nehnich g jijawul.

column2: As a result everyone who did not trust in the truth will be condemned, for they preferred what is evil.
column3: T hegam mo e iattogid ch ab s-wohochud hab waꞌap ab wo bei g s-koꞌok e-namkidadag.

column2: But we just have to keep on thanking God for you, brothers and sisters loved by the Lord, because God from the beginning chose you to be saved through the Spirit who makes you right as you trust in the truth.  This is what he called you to through the good news we shared with you, so that you could participate in the glory of our Lord Jesus Christ.
column3: Mt wabshaba ahpim wo e doꞌibia ab amjed g s-koꞌok e-namkidadag. Si o pihk e elid g t-kownalig Jesus Christ em-hekaj. Kumt am wehmaj ab wo e haꞌichuchudad. Gd hu i si wehpeg at am i apꞌech g Jiosh mat g Hekia S-apꞌekam Gewkdag ab wo i em-gawulkai wehhejed. Kumt ab i s-wohoch ihda s-kehg haꞌichu ahgaj mach wa am em-ahgid. Id ach hekaj ab i hoꞌigeꞌid g Jiosh.

column2: So, brothers and sisters, stand firm, and hold on to what you've been taught, whether by what you were told, or through a letter from us.
column3: Pegih, am ach wa em-mashcham ihda wohokam ch am ep em-oꞌohanid ab amjed. Kumt s-wihnam wo gegokkad ch an wo uꞌukchid.

column2: Now may our Lord Jesus Christ himself and God the Father (who through his grace gave us eternal confidence and a trustworthy hope),
column3: Ab o t-wui si pihk e elid g t-kownalig Jesus Christ g Jiosh t-ohg wehm ch ab si s-t-hoꞌigeꞌel. Kuch heg hekaj ab wui t-gewpkadch.

column2: encourage you and strengthen you so you can say and do everything that is good.
column3: Ahchim ach ab tahni mat ab wo i em-gewpkadch mamt g s-apꞌekam am hab wo junihid ch hab wo kaijjid.

column2: Lastly, brothers and sisters, please pray for us, so that the Lord's message may spread and be truly appreciated, just as it is by you—
column3: Ab g wo e hoꞌigeꞌidahun, t-wepnag, k ab wo tai g Jiosh mat pi ab hu wo e shohbi g haꞌichu t-ahga ab amjed t-kownalig Jesus. T muꞌijj ab wo si has i elid k ab wo s-wohog el hab masma mo am hab e wua em-shahgid.

column2: and that we may be kept safe from immoral and evil men, because not everyone trusts in God.
column3: Pi ap hehemajkam o pi ab hu wohochud g Jiosh haꞌichu ahga ch ab t-wui gegok. Kumt am wo si e hoꞌigeꞌidahunad mat wo t-doꞌibia g Jiosh ab ha amjed.

column2: But the Lord is trustworthy and will strengthen you, and protect you from the Evil One.
column3: Jiosh at hemho wa am hab wo juh mo haschu i t-ahgid. S-mahch ach mat ab wo i em-mah g gewkdag k wo em-nuhkud mat pi wo em-gehg g Jiawul.

column2: We have great confidence in the Lord that you are doing and will continue to do what we told you.
column3: Dam t-wehm wohochuddam. Kuch heg hekaj hab em-elid mam am hab junihim hegai mach ab i em-mashcham ch am hab wabsh wo i junihid.

column2: May the Lord lead you into a deeper understanding of God's love for you and the endurance of Christ.
column3: Ch ab i tahni g t-kownalig Jesus mat hab wo em-juh mamt baꞌich wo i mai g Jiosh pihk elidadag k wo s-chu nakogad hab masma mo hab masma g Jesus Christ.

column2: Now we want to tell you, brothers and sisters, in the name of our Lord Jesus Christ, not to associate with any believer who can't be bothered to work for their living—those who don't follow the teachings they learned from us.
column3: Heki ach hu em-mashcham mamt wo s-wapagimak. K eda haꞌi hegam mo d wohochuddam s-papadma ch pi am hu oidch hab e junihim g t-mashchama. Ch ab em-chehani g t-kownalig Jesus Christ gewkdagkaj mamt pi am hu wo ha wehmajk.

column2: You certainly know that you should follow our example, because while we were with you we weren't lazy,
column3: Am am wa t-neid mach wa pi shaꞌi papadma mach wa am em-wehmajkahim. Kum am wa s-mahch mamt am chum t-oidk hab wo wa masmak.

column2: —we didn't eat anyone's food without paying for it. Instead we worked hard day and night so we wouldn't be a burden to any of you.
column3: Si ach wa chikpan chum hems s-chuhugam k ed matt am wo wa haꞌichu ha namkidad hegam mach hedai i kih am dadha mamt pi haꞌichu wo heki gei t-wehhejed.

column2: Not that we don't have the right to do so—but we wanted to be an example to you, so that you could copy what we did.
column3: Bo hi wa chum mahs mach apꞌedag mamt ab haꞌichu wo i t-namkid nach pi d Jiosh pionag em-wehhejed. Ch wa wabshaba hejel t-dagioꞌid matt am wo em-chehgi mamt has wo chum masmak.

column2: Even while we were with you we gave strict instructions that anybody who didn't want to work shouldn't eat.
column3: Bach wa em-ahgid mach eda am em-wehmaj mamt pi wo ha gegos hegam mo pi tatchua mat wo chikpanad.

column2: But now we hear that there are some lazy busybodies among you who don't work at all.
column3: Kah ach mo am em-shahgid haꞌi s-papadma ch pi chikpan ch wabsh himchud g has ahgadag.

column2: We're ordering such people, urging them in the Lord Jesus, to settle down and work to pay for their own food.
column3: Ch ab si ha chehani g t-kownalig Jesus Christ gewkdagkaj ch ab ha gewkemhun mat am wabsh wo i e bahbgi k wo chikpanad ch hekaj wo e dagioꞌidad.

column2: Brothers and sisters, don't give up doing good.
column3: Kumt ahpim mam wabsh s-ap am hab e junihim am hab wabsh wo i junihid g s-apꞌekam ch pi wo dagito

column2: Take note of anyone who doesn't do what we're telling you in this letter, and make sure you don't associate with them, so that they may become embarrassed.
column3: ch wabshaba wabsh wo dagito hegai matp hedai pi ab hu wo wohog elidad ihda mani ia em-chehani. Tp hems ab wo wa bei g si edadag k am wo i e apꞌech.

column2: Don't consider them enemies, but warn them as a brother or sister.
column3: Am g wo s-chegitok mo pi d em-obga ch wabshaba d em-wepnag mamt ab wo shohbidad haꞌichukaj.

column2: May the Lord of peace himself grant you peace in every situation in every way. May the Lord be with all of you.
column3: Chum at hekid am wo em-wehmajk g t-kownalig Jesus. Kuch ab tahni mat chum hekid baꞌich ab wo i em-mahkad g s-ap tahhadkam.

column2: Notice the greeting to you from me, Paul, in my own handwriting. This is my signature on every letter I write.
column3: Ahni Paul ant ia hahawa si hejel haꞌichu wo oꞌoha hab masma mani hab wa wua an wehs ni-oꞌohana ed. Mt hab masma wo s-mahchk mani d ahni.

column2: May the grace of our Lord Jesus Christ be with all of you.
column3: Neh, ab at wo baꞌich i s-em-hoꞌigeꞌel g t-kownalig Jesus Christ.

column2: I'm sending it to you Timothy, my dear son. May you have grace, mercy, and peace from God the Father and Christ Jesus our Lord.
column3: Ab g ni-kaiham ahpi map d ni-alidag t-wohochudadag ed.

column2: I'm always thinking of you and I'm so thankful to God, whom I serve as my ancestors did, with a clear conscience. I never forget to mention you in my prayers.
column3: Chum ani hekid ab si hoꞌigeꞌid g Jiosh mani hekid i ni-hoꞌigeꞌidahun m-wehhejed. Jiosh ash wa am ha tashogid g t-shohshon matt has masma wo himad g t-doakag ch ab wo si has elidad. Kuni hab masma hab ni-wua ch hab pi shaꞌi ni-kudut.

column2: I remember how you cried, and I so want to see you! That would make me really happy.
column3: P ahpi hab waꞌap ab s-wohochud g s-kehg haꞌichu ahgaj g Jiosh. Kuni s-chegito mapt si pi ap e taht mant hekid am i m-dagito. Kuni s-m-neidamk mapt ep wo si s-hehgigk.

column2: I keep in mind your sincere trust in God, the same trust that your grandmother Lois and mother Eunice also had—and I know that same trust continues in you.
column3: Am apt ha oidk hab e juh g e-huꞌul Lois ch e-jeꞌe Eunice mapt ab i s-wohoch g Jiosh haꞌichu ahga.

column2: That's why I want to remind you to revitalize God's gracious gift to you which you received when I placed my hands on you.
column3: Pt wo s-chegito matt ab toa g t-nohnhoi m-ab k am m-wehhejed t-hoꞌigeꞌidahu. T g Jiosh ab m-mah g gewkdag k am m-chehgi mapt has i mahs chikpan hab wo junihid wehhejed. Pegih, pt wo i e gewkad k am hab wo junihid.

column2: God didn't give us a spirit that makes us fearful, but a spirit of power and love and good sense.
column3: Jiosh at ab t-mah g Hekia S-apꞌekam Gewkdag mat an wo t-uꞌukchid ch ab wo t-mahkchid g gewkdag ch pihk elidadag ch dodolimadag ahchim mach d hemajkamgaj. Kutt heg hekaj pi haꞌichu wo shaꞌi ehbidad.

column2: So don't be ashamed to tell others about our Lord, or be ashamed of me. Instead be ready to share in suffering for the good news as God gives you strength.
column3: Pegih, pt pi has wo e elidad am wehhejed neokch g t-kownalig Jesus ch hab wa masma pi has wo e elidad ab ni-amjed mani wehhejed d lihso. Ab o t-mahkch g Jiosh g gewkdag matt am wehhejed wo t-shoꞌigch. Kupt wo si nako g e-shoꞌigdag am ahgachugch g s-kehg haꞌichu ahgaj.

column2: He is the one who has saved us and called us to live a holy life—not through what we do, but by God's own plan and through his grace.
column3: Do Jiosh mat t-doꞌibia ab pi apꞌekam t amjed. Pi att has masma has wo t-juh k wo t-doꞌibia. Gd hu i si wehpeg at am i apꞌech mat wo s-t-hoꞌigeꞌel am gahi wuhshanim g e-alidag Jesus Christ matt d wo Jiosh hemajkamgak.

column2: He gave this grace to us in Christ Jesus before the beginning of time, and is now revealed in the appearing of our Savior Christ Jesus. He destroyed death, making life and immortality brilliantly clear through the good news.
column3: Ia at jiwia g t-doꞌibiakam Jesus Christ k am i t-tashogi g Jiosh hoꞌigeꞌidadag. Kah att g s-kehg haꞌichu ahgaj k s-mai matt has masma s-ap am wo gahi wuwha g muhkig edgidch g pi ha huhugedam doakag.

column2: I was appointed speaker, apostle, and teacher of this good news.
column3: Jiosh at am i ni-kei mant wo ahgachugad g s-kehg haꞌichu ahgaj ch wo ha mashchamad.

column2: That's also the reason I'm suffering all this, but I'm not ashamed, because I know whom I've trusted. I'm confident that he can look after what I've entrusted to him until the Day he returns.
column3: Kuni heg hekaj hab muꞌi ni-shoꞌigchud ch pi shaꞌi has ni-elid id amjed nani pi s-mahch hegai mani ab s-wohochud. T heg wo e nako mat s-ap wo ni-nuhkudad mant wehs am hab wo juh mat haschu wehhejed ab i ni-gawulkai k ab wo ai mat ep wo jiwia.

column2: You should follow the model of good advice that you learned from me, with an attitude of trust and love in Christ Jesus.
column3: Ab ani m-mashcham mo has chuꞌig g Jiosh haꞌichu ahga. Kupt heg wo waꞌi ahgahid nap pi heg s-wohochud ch ab si tatchua g Christ ch d hemako heg wehm.

column2: Guard the truth that was entrusted to you through the Holy Spirit who lives in us.
column3: Am o t-eda g Hekia S-apꞌekam Gewkdag ch ab t-mahkch g gewkdag. Kutt hekaj am wo si s-ap nuhkud g s-kehg haꞌichu ahgaj g Jiosh.

column2: You already know that everyone from Asia has abandoned me, including Phygelus and Hermogenes.
column3: Am ap wa s-mahch mat ia wabsh i ni-dagito hegam mo ab Asia t amjed ia ni-wehmajkahim, chum wa g Phygelus ch Hermogenes.

column2: May the Lord be kind to the family of Onesiphorus, because he often took care of me and wasn't embarrassed about me being in prison.  When he was in Rome, he took the trouble to search for me, and he found me.
column3: K wabshaba g Onesiphorus pi has e elid mani d lihso ch an i ni-gahghi ia jiwiak Rome kihhim t am am hugkam mat ni-cheh k muꞌikko ia i ni-chehgimed k ab ni-mamka g s-ap tahhadkam. Kuni ab tahni g Jiosh mat baꞌich ab wo i s-ha hoꞌigeꞌel hegam Onesiphorus.

column2: May the Lord grant him his blessing in the Day of Judgment. (Timothy, you're very much aware of how much Onesiphorus did for me when he was in Ephesus).
column3: Jiosh at wo wa s-hoꞌigeꞌel g Onesiphorus heg i tash ed matt ab wo nam g Jiosh. S-mahch ap mat heꞌes haꞌichu s-ap am hab ni-juni g Onesiphorus amai Ephesus kihhim t am.

column2: So then, my son, grow strong in the grace of Christ Jesus.
column3: Jiosh o si s-hemajim ab t-mahkch g gewkdag ahchim matt ab i t-hemakoch g Jesus Christ wehm. Kuni heg hekaj m-ahgid mapt s-gegokim wo himad g e-chikpan wehhejed.

column2: Take what you heard me say in front of many witnesses and share it with those who are trustworthy, who then can teach others as well.
column3: Muꞌi hemajkam ani ha mihshmad m-kaichudch. Kupt ahpi epai wo ha mashcha hegam mat am wo i e nakog k haꞌijj epai wo ha mashcha ihda.

column2: Suffer together with me like a good soldier of Christ Jesus.
column3: Neh, bapt masma wo e shoꞌigch mat g shondal am hab junihidch g e-chikpan am wehhejed g Jesus Christ.

column2: A soldier on active duty doesn't get caught up in the business of everyday life. He wants to please the one who enlisted him.
column3: S-mahch ap mat g shondal wehs hab wo junihid hegai mat g uhgchugaj ab wo cheha ch pi haꞌichu wo hiwigi mas wo shohbi. Kupt ahpi hab waꞌap wo masmak am wehhejed g Jiosh.

column2: Similarly athletes who compete in the games don't win a prize if they don't keep to the rules.
column3: S-mahch ap mat g s-melidkam pi ab hu wo bei g e-gehgewi heg hi wa mat am hab wo junihid g ha-chehanig. Kupt ahpi hab waꞌi masma wo bei g e-gehgewi mapt am Jiosh tatchui oidk hab wo e junihid.

column2: The farmer that does all the hard work should be the first to benefit from the crop.
column3: Hegai mo si chikpan g e-esha at wehpeg ab wo ui g e-oda mat wo bai. Kupt ahpi hab waꞌap ab haꞌichu wo i nei am chikpank g Jiosh wehhejed.

column2: Think about what I'm telling you. The Lord will help you to understand all this.
column3: Am g i oidahim ihda mani m-ahgid. T g Jiosh am wo i m-wehmt mapt wo s-amich.

column2: Focus your mind on Jesus Christ, a descendant of David, who was raised from the dead. This is my good news,
column3: Jesus Christ o hab waꞌap d oꞌodham ch ab s-ap nakog g shoꞌigdag. T g Jiosh ab uhpam i wuhshad heg i dahm mat muh. Do ihda s-kehg haꞌichu ahga mani am ahgachug. Kupt am wo oidahid mat haschu ab nako g Christ ch s-ap ab wo nako g e-shoꞌigdag.

column2: and I'm suffering imprisonment because of it as if I were a criminal—but the word of God is not imprisoned.
column3: Ni ahni hab waꞌap ni-shoꞌigchud am ahgachugch ihda s-kehg haꞌichu ahga hask mam ep ge ni-wulshch g e hukshchim wapainomikaj hab masma mantp d si pi ap hemajkam. K wabshaba g Jiosh neꞌoki pi e wulshch.

column2: Despite all this I'm willing to keep on going for the sake of God's people so that they may gain the salvation of Christ Jesus that is eternal glory.
column3: Am ani wabsh i ni-dagitokch mantp haschu ab wo i nako ha wehhejed hegam mat g Jiosh am i apꞌech mat wo e doꞌibia. Idam at ab wo i s-wohoch g haꞌichu t-ahga ab amjed g Jesus Christ. T g Jiosh chum hekid ab wo si has ha elidad.

column2: This is a trustworthy saying: “If we died with him, we will also live with him;
column3: Do si wohokam ihda hab ha-cheꞌi:

column2: This is what you should remind people about, telling them before God that they shouldn't have meaningless arguments over words. To do this only harms those who listen.
column3: Am g i ha chegitochud ihda mani wa m-ahgid k ab ha shohbid g Jiosh gewkdagkaj mat pi wabsh pehegi wo neneokad ch pi wo e cheggiad. Id at wo ha padch hegam mat wo kaiha.

column2: Make sure you work hard so you can present yourself to God and gain his approval. Be a worker that doesn't need to be embarrassed, using the word of truth correctly.
column3: Am g si i e nakog mapt d wo si s-ap piongajk g Jiosh ch si s-ap am wo ha mashchamad g Jiosh wohokam mapt pi wo shaꞌi si e elidad.

column2: Avoid pointless chatter because people who do this are heading away from God.  Their teachings are as destructive as gangrene that destroys healthy flesh. Hymenaeus and Philetus are like this.  They have deviated from the truth by saying that the resurrection has already happened, which has ruined some people's trust in God.
column3: Haꞌi at dagito g wohokam k ha mashcham mat heki hu ab i wuwha g koꞌi muhkig amjed. Gohkajj idam mo id hekaj ha iattogid o d Hymanaeus ch Phyletus. K g ha-mashchama padchud g ha-wohochudadag hab masma mat g pi kehg hihwdag wo em-cheawuagi. Pi g ha wehm aꞌagad g ha-mashchama. Gm at hu hab wo i m-juh ab amjed g Jiosh.

column2: But God's solid, trustworthy foundation stone stands firm, with this inscription, “The Lord knows those who belong to him,” and “Everyone who calls on the name of the Lord should stay away from all that is evil.”
column3: T wabshaba g Jiosh s-wihnam shondad g e-neꞌoki mat pi hedai wo shaꞌi gawul juh. K an oꞌohanas:

column2: A stately home doesn't just have cups and bowls made of gold and silver. It also has ones made from wood and clay. Some are made for special use; others for more commonplace functions.
column3: Neh, matp hems am wo haꞌichugk g nahnko mahs hohashahaꞌa am s‑kais kih ed. Tp hems haꞌi d wo ohlak ch haꞌi d wo plahtak ch haꞌi d wo uhsk ch haꞌi d wo bidk. Kut wo e hekaj hegam mo s‑namkig ha wehhejed g s‑has hahaꞌichu. T g pi namkigchu wabsh chum has masma wo e hekaj.

column2: So if you get rid of what is evil, you will become a cup or bowl that is holy and special, useful to the Lord, ready to do all that's good.
column3: Pegih, t g Jiosh hab wa masma si s‑has haꞌichukaj wo t‑hekaj mattp hedai wo t‑kegchudch ab amjed g pi apꞌekam natt pi wo t‑nahtokch ch wo i t‑gawulkadch wehhejed.

column2: Run away from anything that fires up the desires of youth. Run after what is right and trustworthy, run after love and peace along with those who are true and pure Christians.
column3: Pegih, pi g am i e dagito pi apꞌekam ch ed k am s‑ap wo i e gewkadch s‑apꞌekam k ed ch am hab wo junihid mapt haschu wo ha ahgi ch wo si pihk e elidad wehs ha hekaj ch wo si s‑ap e tahtkkad ab ha wui g e‑wehm wohochuddam. T hegam mo ab ihm g Jiosh ch s‑ap haꞌichu chegito m‑wehm hab wo masmak.

column2: Avoid foolish and childish debates, for you know they only lead to fights.
column3: Bant ep wo chei mapt pi wo ha neꞌowi hegam mat wabsh wo has hu kaijjid ch pi e mahch ch e neꞌowin. S‑mahch ap mat id am wabsh wo ha uꞌapa kawhaina ch ed.

column2: For the Lord's minister must not fight, but be kind to everyone, able to teach, patient,
column3: Jiosh pionag at pi wo chum ha kawhainad ch wabsh wo si s‑hemajimak ab wehs ha wui ch wo si s‑ap ha mashchamad

column2: gently correcting opponents. Perhaps God may help them to come to repent and to understand the truth.
column3: ch si s‑hemajim wo ha shohbidad hegam mat ab wui wo gegokiwua ch wo ha mashchamad. Tp hems ab wo ha mah g Jiosh g apꞌedag mat wo s‑ohhod g pi ap e‑chegitoi k ab wo s‑mai g wohokam.

column2: In this way they may come to their senses and escape the devil's trap. For he has captured them and made them do whatever he wants.
column3: T hab masma uhpam wo bei g s‑ap e‑chegitoidag k wo e doꞌibia ab amjed g Jiawul.

column2: Be aware that there will be troubled times in the last days.
column3: Si g s‑chegitok mat wehs haꞌichu wo s‑hasigk mat d wo i ha oidch tatshk.

column2: People will love themselves and love money. They will be boastful, arrogant, abusive, disobedient to their parents, ungrateful, and without God in their lives.
column3: Hemajkam at wo s‑chu daꞌad ch wo si pihk e elidad g lialkaj ch wo chum si e hahaschudad. Muꞌi hemajkam at wo aꞌai s‑koꞌokam has e ahgad ch pi ab hu uhpam wo i nodgidad g s‑apꞌekam. Muꞌi at wo has ahgad g Jiosh. T g aꞌal pi ab hu wo wohog ha elidad g e‑geꞌegedga.

column2: Heartless and unforgiving, they'll commit slander and have no self-control. Brutal people who hate what's good,
column3: Muꞌi hemajkam at wo pi aꞌamdagk ch pi hedai ha hekaj wo pihk e elidad ch haꞌichu wo e iattogidad ab aꞌai e amjed ch wo s‑ta ehbidamak ch wo s‑ta kekeꞌidamak. Muꞌi at wo s‑ohhodad g s‑apꞌekam.

column2: they will betray others and be totally thoughtless. They are absurdly full of themselves, living so much for pleasure that they don't care about loving God.
column3: Muꞌi at pi ab hu wo ha tatchuad hegam mo d chum ha‑naipijju ch has am wabsh wo si e wuad ch pi ab hu wo tatchuad g Jiosh ch wabshaba g pi kehg s‑tahhadkam ab wo tatchuad.

column2: They may give an outward impression of being religious, but they don't actually believe it works. Stay away from these people!
column3: Hemajkam at hi wo wa e mihshmdad ch wabsh pi wo wohochudad hegai mo haschu ab chum kah ch im hu hab wabsh wo i juh g Jiosh gewkdag. Pi g am hu ha wehmajk idam hab mahs hemajkam.

column2: They're the kind of people that slip into homes and take control of vulnerable women who are burdened down by the guilt of sin and distracted by all kinds of desires.
column3: Haꞌi at am wabsh ep wo si i wahpkad ha‑kihki ed ch wo s‑ap ha iattogi g uꞌuwi. T hegam mo pi gewkpdag am e‑wohochudadag ed ab wo ha kaihamad no pi tatchua g pi apꞌekam ch e kudut g e‑chuꞌijigkaj

column2: These women are always trying to learn but they're never able to understand the truth!
column3: ch pi mahch g wohokam, chum as hems hi wa chum s‑mahchimk.

column2: Just like Jannes and Jambres opposed Moses, these teachers also oppose the truth. They are people with corrupted minds whose supposed trust in God is a lie.
column3: Hegam mo ha iattogid o ab wui gegok g wohokam hab masma mo wa Jannesbad ch Jambresbad ab wui gegok g Mosesbad. Ho o wabsh pi ap haꞌichu chegito ch d ep hegam mat pi e nako am Jesus wohochudadag ed.

column2: But they won't get far. Their stupidity will be obvious to everyone, just like that of Jannes and Jambres.
column3: T wabshaba wehsijj wo s‑mai mo pi haꞌichu aꞌamichud hab masma mat wa am hab e juh ha tahgio g Jannesbad ch Jambresbad. Kut heg hekaj pi wo e nako mat geꞌe haꞌichu wo padch.

column2: But you know all about my teaching and behavior, and my aim in life. You know my trust in God and my love. You know what I've had to endure—
column3: P wabshaba ahpi hig am oid g haꞌichu ni‑mashchama ch haꞌichu hab ni‑juni ch haꞌichu hab ni‑elida. S‑mahch ap mani haschu ab s‑wohochud ch has masma ab i s‑ha bahbgi g hemajkam ch pihk ni‑elid ha hekaj ch nakog haꞌichu.

column2: how I've been persecuted and what I've suffered. You know what happened to me at Antioch, at Iconium, and at Lystra—the troubles I had and how the Lord rescued me from all of them.
column3: S‑mahch ap mam ni‑shoꞌigchud. Kuni muꞌi haꞌichu s‑koꞌok nakog. S‑mahch ap mant muꞌi haꞌichu nako am Antiok t am ch Iconium t am ch Lystra t am. T wabshaba g Jiosh ni‑doꞌibia wehs amjed ihda.

column2: Of course it's true that everyone who wants to live a life devoted to God in Christ Jesus will experience persecution,
column3: Kupt ahpi hab waꞌap wo e shoꞌigch natt pi wehs wo t‑shoꞌigch ahchim mach tatchua matt am wo oidad g s‑apꞌekam doakag ab si i t‑dagitok Jesus wui.

column2: while wicked people and frauds will do well, going from bad to worse, deceiving others and deceiving themselves too.
column3: T wo i e gewpkai g pi apꞌekam ch s‑chu iꞌattomkam k baꞌich wo i ha iattogidad g hemajkam ch hejel wo e iattogidad.

column2: But you must hold onto the things you've learned and are convinced are true. You know who taught you.
column3: Tt wabshaba ab i m‑mashcha g wohokam. Kupt ab si s‑gewkam i s‑wohochud k wo s‑wihnam uꞌukchid s‑mahchch matt hedai m‑mashcha.

column2: From your childhood you've known the holy Scriptures which can give you understanding for salvation by trusting in Christ Jesus.
column3: S‑mahch ap map ga hu i e‑alijk amjed ab kaiham g Jiosh oꞌohana. K id d hegai map amjed ab bekch g e‑amichudadag. Kupt hekaj ab i s‑wohoch g Jesus Christ k e doꞌibia.

column2: All Scripture inspired by God is useful for teaching, for confronting what is wrong, for setting us straight, and for telling us what is right.
column3: Ab o tashogid g Hekia S‑apꞌekam Gewkdag hegai mo g Jiosh tatchua mat an wo e oꞌohan k d wo t‑mashchamak. K heg wehs d i t‑wehmtadag matt hekaj aꞌai wo t‑mashcham k wo s‑mahchk g wohokam ch wo shohbidad g pi t‑apꞌekam ch am wo i t‑shelinid matt has masma s‑ap wo himchudad g t‑doakag.

column2: This is how God provides a thorough preparation for those who work for him to accomplish all that's good.
column3: Kutt heg hekaj wo s‑ap t‑nahtokch ahchim mach ab ihm g Jiosh matt am hab wo juh wabsh chum has mahs s‑kehg chikpan wehhejed.

column2: This is what I instruct you to do before God and Christ Jesus who will judge the living and the dead when he comes to establish his kingdom.
column3: Jesus at am s‑ap wo i nahto g e‑kownaltalig ia ep jiwiak k wo ha lodai wehs hemajkam, chum hems hegam mat eda d wabsh wo kia dodakamk. Heg ani hekaj si m‑chehani am tahgio g Jiosh

column2: Speak God's word whether it is convenient or not, tell people where they're going wrong, warn them, encourage them. Do this with a great deal of patient teaching.
column3: mapt am wo si ahgahi g Jiosh haꞌichu ahga k am wo si e gewkadch mapt am wo ahgad wabsh chum hekid ch pi am hu wo chum ge nenidad mat hekid am wo s‑apkot mapt am wo ahgad. Ab g i ha shohbid pi apꞌekam amjed k am i ha gewkemhun mat hab wo junihid g s‑apꞌekam wabsh s‑bahbgim ha mashchamch.

column2: For the time is coming when people won't bother to listen to true teaching. Instead they will be curious to listen to something different, and will surround themselves with teachers who'll tell them what they want to hear.
column3: Ab o him g tash mat wo i muꞌida hegam mat gawul haꞌichu wo ha mashcha. Kut muꞌi hemajkam ab wo s‑ha kaim

column2: They will stop listening to the truth and wander off following myths.
column3: k g wohokam mashchama wo dagito k ab wo hiwgad g hohoꞌoki aꞌagida.

column2: You need to keep your wits about you at all times. Put up with troubles, do the work of sharing the good news, fulfill your ministry.
column3: Pt wabshaba ahpi wo si s‑e nenꞌoidk ch wo s‑e chegitok wehs haꞌichu k ed ch ab wo nako g shoꞌigdag. Am g wehs hab juhni g e‑chikpan am ahgachugch g Jiosh haꞌichu ahga nap pi d piongaj g Jiosh.

column2: For I'm about to be sacrificed—the time of my death is approaching.
column3: Ahni at hi e ai g ni‑tashga mant wo ni‑muhkid.

column2: I have fought the good fight, I have finished the race, I have kept my trust in God.
column3: S‑ap ant nahto g ni‑chikpan am s‑gewkam i oidk hab masma mo g s‑melidkam am si i e nakog mat wo bei g s‑apꞌekam e‑gehgewi.

column2: Now there's a prize reserved for me—the crown for a life lived according to what is right. The Lord, (who is the judge that always does what's right), will give that to me on that Day. And not just to me, but to everyone who longs for his coming.
column3: K heg am waꞌi wiꞌis mant wo bei g s‑apꞌekam ni‑gehgewi nani pi g s‑apꞌekam am hab junihim. Jiosh alidag o d s‑apꞌekam usagakam ch ab wo i ni‑mah ihda mat hekid ep wo jiwia k ab wo i t‑gawulkai geꞌe lodaita ch ed. Kut wehsijj hab waꞌap ab wo bei g e‑gehgewi hegam mo hedai ab si pihk e elid hekaj g Jiosh alidag ch nenida mat ep wo jiwia.

column2: Please try to come to me as soon as you can.
column3: Am g i e nakog k s‑hohtam ab i ni‑chehgimed

column2: Demas has abandoned me because he loves the things of this world more, and has gone to Thessalonica. Crescens has gone to Galatia, and Titus to Dalmatia.
column3: nant pi hejel ia wih. Crescens at gam hu hih Galasia jewed wui. T g Titus gam hu hih Dalmasia jewed wui. Demas at ab si tatchua g jewed t ab haꞌichu k ia wabsh i ni‑dagito k gm hu hih Thessalonica wui.

column2: Only Luke is here with me. Bring Mark with you, because he can help me with my work.
column3: Heg o waꞌi Luke ia ni‑chechga. Ab apt wo i bek g Mark. T am wo i ni‑wehmt id eda chikpan.

column2: I sent Tychicus to Ephesus.
column3: Ab ant cheha g Tychicus mat am wo hih Ephesus kihhim wui.

column2: When you come please bring the cloak I left behind with Carpus in Troas—and the books, especially the parchments.
column3: Ab g i ni‑behid g ni‑lihwa ch ni‑oꞌohana, wahm hegam mant hejel oꞌoha. Ab ant nuhkudach g Carpus amai Troas kihhim t am.

column2: Alexander the coppersmith caused me a lot of trouble—may God judge him for what he did.
column3: S‑koꞌokam at wa has ni‑dohdda hegai Alexander mo d hihliyo. T g Jiosh wo wa mah g s‑koꞌok namkidadag.

column2: You watch out for him too, because he was very much against what we were saying.
column3: Neh, pt wo si s‑e nenꞌoidad ab amjed no pi shaꞌi si wui kehk g haꞌichu t‑ahga.

column2: When it came to my first defense,  no-one stood up for me—everyone abandoned me. May they not be blamed for this.
column3: Hegam mat wo chum i ni‑wehmt at ia wabsh i ni‑dagito mamt wa wehpeg ni‑lodai. Ab ani tahni g Jiosh mat pi ab hu wo ha abch ihda.

column2: But the Lord stood by me and gave me strength so that I could declare the whole of the message so that all the foreigners  could hear it. I was rescued out of the lion's mouth!
column3: Jiosh at wa i ni‑wehmt k ab i ni‑mah g gewkdag. Nt hekaj hab ni‑nako mant am s‑ap ah g Jiosh haꞌichu ahga am ha wui hegam mo am haꞌichug nahnko mahs hemajkam. T ab i ni‑doꞌibia mamt pi am hu ni‑wua maipid ha wui

column2: The Lord will rescue me from all the evil things done against me, and will bring me safely to his heavenly kingdom. His is the glory forever and ever. Amen.
column3: k hab waꞌap wo ni‑doꞌibia ab wehs amjed g pi apꞌekam haꞌichu k an wo ni‑uꞌapa dahm kahchim ch ed. Ab att wo si has elidad g Jiosh chum hekid. Neh, id o waꞌi si.

column2: My greetings to Prisca and Aquila, and to Onesiphorus's family.
column3: Am apt wo ha ahgi g Priscilla ch Aquila ch hegam Onesiphorus wehm kihkam mat ab wo i s‑ni‑hoꞌigeꞌel.

column2: Erastus stayed on in Corinth. I left Trophimus behind in Miletus because he was sick.
column3: Ga at hu wih g Erastus Corinth kihhim t am. Nt g Trophimus ga hu wuiok Miletus kihhim t am nat pi mumku.

column2: Please try to come before winter. Eubulus sends his best wishes—and Pudens, Linus, Claudia, and all the brothers and sisters too.
column3: Am g i e nakog k ab wo i hih mat koi wo e ai g s‑hehpichꞌedkam.

column2: The Lord be with you. May his grace be with you all.
column3: Neh, am at wo wa em‑wehmajk g t‑kownalig Jesus. T g Jiosh wo wa s‑em‑hoꞌigeꞌel.

column2: My friend, I pray most of all that you're doing well and are in good physical health, for I know you're doing well spiritually. I was delighted when some fellow-believers arrived and told me about your commitment to the truth, and how you continue living in the truth.
column3: Ia at haꞌi dada hegam mash am em-wui ahgachug g Jiosh haꞌichu ahga k ia t-ahgid mapsh si s-ap himchud g e-doakag am oidch g Jiosh haꞌichu ahga map has i masma chum hekid hab e junihim. Si ani s-hohhoꞌid ch kah mapsh am wabsh kia si s-ap e tahtk am Jiosh wui. Kuni ab tahni g Jiosh mat wehs haꞌichu wo s-apꞌek am m-wehhejed. Kupt wabsh wo si s-doak.

column2: Nothing makes me happier than to hear how my dear friends are following the truth.
column3: Do si s-ap tahhadkam am ni-wehhejed mat hegam mani ha ahgid g Jiosh haꞌichu ahga wo si s-ap uꞌukchid.

column2: My friend, you show you are trustworthy in what you're doing by looking after the brothers,  even those you don't know.
column3: Kupsh am s-ap ha dagioꞌid hegam mash am daiw am ahgachugch g Jiosh haꞌichu ahga, chum as pi d m-machiga.

column2: They have spoken well about your love in front of the church. Please be so kind as to send them on their journey in a way that God would appreciate,
column3: Idam mat ia dada o t-ahgid mapsh si pihk e elid ha hekaj. Kuni ab si i m-gewkemhun mapt baꞌich wo i ha wehmajk mat gam hu hasko ep wo i ahgachugad g Jiosh haꞌichu ahga.

column2: for they are traveling in his name, not accepting anything from non-believers.
column3: Idam o t-ahgid mash pi ha hiwgid hegam mo pi ab hu wohochud g Jesus mas haꞌichu ab wo i ha mah.

column2: We ought to support them so we can share together in the truth.
column3: Ahchim o ab d t-wuikam mach ab s-wohochud g Jiosh alidag matt wo i ha wehmtad hegam mo ahgachug g Jiosh haꞌichu ahga.

column2: I did write about this to the church, but Diotrephes, who loves being in charge, refuses to accept our authority.  So if I do visit, I will make it clear what he's been doing. He's been making malicious accusations against us. Not satisfied with doing that, he refuses to welcome any other brothers. He won't let anyone else welcome them either, and throws those who do so out of the church.
column3: Id ani chum em-tashogid heki hu ni-oꞌohana ed ahpim mam am e wehm e mihshmad. Kush wabshaba g Diotrephes pi chegima g ni-oꞌohana ch am em-iattogid ch pad neok ab t-amjed ahchim mach ahgachug g Jiosh haꞌichu ahga. Tatchua ash g Diotrephes mat d wo em-wanimeddamk. Am ant wo em-tashogi am jiwiak mo pi apꞌe hegai mo haschu am hab junihim. Pi ash ab hu i ha wahpkid ch pi ha dagioꞌid hegam mo am daiw am ahgachugch g Jiosh haꞌichu ahga ch ash pi em-hiwgid mams ahpim hab wo chum juh ch wo chum em-wuwhas ab em-namki amjed.

column2: My friend, don't imitate what is evil, but what is good. Those who do what's good belong to God; those who do evil don't know God.
column3: Matp hedai hab masma hab wo junihid g pi apꞌekam ch pi mahch g Jiosh. Pi g am hu s-ha wepom k wabshaba hegam s-ha wepom mat hab wo junihid g s-apꞌekam. Idam o d Jiosh aꞌaliga.

column2: Everyone speaks well of Demetrius—and the truth does so too! We also speak well of him, and you know we tell the truth.
column3: Hema hegam mo hab junihim g s-apꞌekam o d Demetrius. Wehsijj am hab wa kaij. Kuni s-mahch mo d wohokam. Kum ahpim s-mahch mani chum hekid g wohokam ahg.

column2: I have so much to say to you, but I don't want to do it in writing with pen and ink.
column3: Muꞌi ani haꞌichu s-m-ahgidamk ch wabshaba pi id hekaj am i m-oꞌohani

column2: I hope to see you soon so we can talk face to face.
column3: nani pi am s-himimk mant wo m-neid k wo m-wehm neo ab amjed.

column2: May peace be with you! The friends here send their greetings to you. Please personally greet our friends there by name.
column3: Si g s-ap e tahtk am Jiosh wui mat m-doꞌibia.

column2: until the day he was taken up to heaven. This was after he'd given instructions through the Holy Spirit to his chosen apostles.
column3: Hekia S-apꞌekam Gewkdag ash wa ab mahkch g Jesus g gewkdag. Kutsh heg am haꞌi i ha chuhcha k am ha mashcha g e-chehanig.

column2: Over the course of forty days after the death he suffered, he showed himself to them, proving that he was alive with convincing evidence. He appeared to them, and told them about the kingdom of God.
column3: Mtsh am hahawa shoꞌigchud k mua. Tsh wabshaba uhpam ep e chegito k am e chehgid ha wui g e-chuhchai ch nahnko masma wohokamchud mo d doakam. Kush idam muꞌikko neid am oidam g giꞌikko wehst-mahm tash matsh eda koi im hu i e bei dahm kahchim wui. Sh g Jesus muꞌi haꞌichu ha mashcham ab amjed g Jiosh kownaltalig.

column2: While he was still with them he instructed them, “Do not leave Jerusalem. Wait to receive what the Father promised, just as you heard it from me.  It's true that John baptized with water, but in just a few days' time you will be baptized by the Holy Spirit.”
column3: Sh wa am hu hebai am e hemapadch. Sh hab kaij g Jesus ab ha wui, “Mat ab i em-mah g John g pahl wakona. T wabshaba g Hekia S-apꞌekam Gewkdag g si geꞌe gewkdag ab wo i em-mah pi shaꞌi muꞌi tash iꞌajed. Ni am wa heki hu em-ahgid mo hab kaij g Jiosh matsh id am hab wo em-juni. Kumt ia wabsh wo haꞌichugk Jerusalem kihhim t am k ab wo ai mat hab wo e juh.”

column2: So when the disciples met with Jesus, they asked him, “Lord, is this the time when you will re-establish Israel's kingdom?”
column3: Sh am hema ep d tash. Tsh am ep i e hemapai g chuhchaij wehmaj g Jesus k ab kakke, “T-kownalig, napt ab hahawa ep wo t-mah ahchim Tutuligo hemajkam g apꞌedag matt hejel am wo i himch g t-kownaltalig?”

column2: “You don't need to know about the dates and times that are set by the Father's authority,” he told them.
column3: Sh hab kaij g Jesus ab ha wui, “Heki at hu i apꞌech g Jiosh mat hekid am hab wo i e juh hegai mam haschu ab ni-kakke. K pi d em-wuikam mams wo s-ap s-mahchk iaꞌi idani mas hekid wo i k.

column2: “But you will be given power when the Holy Spirit comes upon you, and you will be my witnesses in Jerusalem, throughout Judea and Samaria, and to the farthest places on earth.”
column3: Kumt wabshaba am wo i ahgahid mam haschu i s-ap s-mahch ab ni-amjed. Hekia S-apꞌekam Gewkdag at ab wo i em-mah g si geꞌe gewkdag mamt hab wo junihid. Kumt wehpeg am wo i ahgahi Jerusalem kihhim ch ed k amjed wehsko am Judea chekshani ch ed k amjed gam hu Samaria chekshani ch ed. T amjed gam hu wehsko wo i e ahgahi aꞌai jewed dahm.”

column2: After Jesus had told them this, he was taken up as they were watching and a cloud hid him from their sight.
column3: Neh, bash kaij ch amjed im hu hahawa i e bei dahm kahchim wui k gam hu pi e mahsid chewagi ch ed.

column2: While they were staring intently at the sky as he ascended, two men dressed in white were suddenly standing beside them.
column3: Sh am wabsh kia gegok ch am uhgk si nenea idam. Tsh am haha wabsh gohk i e chehgi g anghil k si s-tohtam e enigadadch

column2: “Men of Galilee, why are you standing here staring at the sky?” they asked. “This same Jesus who has been taken up from you to heaven shall come in the same way you saw him go into heaven.”
column3: ch hab kaij, “Pi g ia hu wabsh wo gegokk ch am uhgk nenead mat hebai hih g Jesus. Hema tash at wo wa uhpam jiwia hab masma mam hemuch am neid mat has i masma gam hu hih.”

column2: Then the disciples went back to Jerusalem from the Mount of Olives which is about a Sabbath day's walk from Jerusalem.
column3: Id atsh hab e juh Olive Uꞌus Kawulk t ab. Sh heg d al eda hugkam mihya ab amjed g Jerusalem. Tsh ab hahawa i huhud hegam Jesus chuhchai kawulk amjed k am hihim

column2: When they arrived, they went upstairs to the upper room where they were staying: Peter, John, James and Andrew; Philip and Thomas; Bartholomew and Matthew; James the son of Alphaeus, Simon the Zealot, and Judas the son of James.
column3: k gan hu dada mo an dadha k d idam Peter, John, James, Andrew, Philip, Thomas, Bartholomew, Matthew, ch hegai James mash g ohgaj hab chehgig Alphias, ch hegai Simon mash d hema hegam mash tatchua mat g Tutuligo hejel wo himchudad g e-kownaltalig, ch hegai Judas mash g ohgaj hab chehgig James.

column2: They all joined together in prayer, together with the women and Mary, Jesus' mother, and his brothers.
column3: Sh g Jesus jeꞌe ch wepnag ch haꞌi ehp g uꞌuwi am ha wehm e hehemapad ch am e hoꞌigeꞌidahun Jiosh wui.

column2: At this time Peter stood up and addressed a crowd of around one hundred and twenty believers who had gathered together.
column3: Sh am heꞌekia d i tash matsh am ep i e hemapad k d siant gokko wehst-mahm (120) hegam mash ab ihm g Jesus e doꞌibiakch. Kutsh am hahawa i kekiwua g Peter k ash hab kaij,

column2: “My brothers and sisters,” he said, “The Scriptures, spoken by the Holy Spirit through David, had to be fulfilled regarding Judas, who guided those who arrested Jesus.
column3: “Ni-wepnag, Hekia S-apꞌekam Gewkdag atsh am i tashogi g t-kownaligbad David matsh has wo e juh hegai Judasbad mo chum t-wehmaj. Kut hemho wa hab e juh mash has i kaij. Judas at am i ha wanim hegam mat am bei g Jesus,

column2: He was counted as one of us, and shared in this ministry.”
column3: chum as d ep chum kehshaj mat am wo ahgahid g s-kehg haꞌichu ahgaj.” Bash kaij g Peter.

column2: (Judas had bought a field with his ill-gotten gains. There he fell down headfirst, and his body burst apart, spilling out all his intestines.
column3: Kumtsh wa chum namkid g Judasbad matsh gagda. Tsh wabshaba hema e nolawt g oidag heg hekaj namkidadaj. Kutsh g Judasbad am him k am e naggia heg eda k ab si wantsh g e-wohk. Tsh g hihij gam hu si e iawua.

column2: Everybody who lived in Jerusalem heard about this so that the field was called in their language “Akeldama,” which means, “Field of blood.”).
column3: Sh heg hekaj hab e aꞌaga Ehꞌed Oidag.

column2: As it's written in the book of Psalms, “Let his home be abandoned, and no-one live there;” and “Let someone else take over his position.”
column3: Kush g Peter heg hekaj hab ep kaij, “An o hab chuꞌig heg eda nenꞌei oꞌohana mo an hab chuꞌig Jiosh heki hu oꞌohana ed:

column2: “So now we have to choose someone who has been with us the whole time that Jesus was with us,  from the time John was baptizing up until the day Jesus was taken up to heaven from us. One of these must be chosen to join together with us as we witness, giving evidence of Jesus' resurrection.”
column3: “Kut id hekaj hemho wa am hema wo i kekiwua t‑wehm mat hab waꞌap wo wohokamch mat uhpam e chegito g t‑kownalig Jesus. T hemho wa d wo hema t‑ahchimk mach ga hujed i wehmajkahim g Jesus am i amjed mat g John pahl wako am hugkam mat im hu hih dahm kahchim ch ed.” Neh, bash kaij g Peter ch am i haꞌasa neo.

column2: Two names were put forward: Joseph Justus, also known as Barsabbas, and Matthias.
column3: Tsh am hahawa gohk i ha wuwhas. K hema hab chehgig idam Matthias. K hema d ep Joseph Justus ch hab ep e chechcheg Barsabas.

column2: They prayed together and said, “Lord, you know everyone's thoughts please show us which of these two you have chosen
column3: Tsh am hahawa e hoꞌigeꞌidahun k hab kaij, “Ge t‑kownalig, t am i dagito g Judas ihda chikpan k atki am ai g s‑koꞌok e‑namkidadag. Kuch ahchim pi shaꞌi mahch mo has e tatatk g hemajkam. Pt heg hekaj am wo si i t‑tashogi mapt hedai am wo i ha kei idam gohk

column2: to replace Judas as an apostle in this ministry that he gave up to go to where he belongs.”
column3: mat d wo si m‑kehshak ch am wo i ahgahi g haꞌichu m‑ahga am kehkud ed g Judas.”

column2: They cast lots, and Matthias was chosen. He was counted as an apostle with the other eleven.
column3: Tsh am hahawa i ha tashogi mat d wo Matthiask ch d wo si kehshajk.

column2: When the day of Pentecost came, they were all meeting together in one place.
column3: Tsh am i e ai matsh g Tutuligo hemajkam wo e nam k am hab wo juh g hehgchulida Jiosh wui heg hekaj haꞌichu e‑bahijida. Kutsh am wehs i e hemapai hema kih ch ed hegam mash ab ihm g Jesus.

column2: Suddenly a noise came from heaven like a roaring wind that filled the whole house where they were staying.
column3: Tsh haha wabsh ab dahm kahchim t amjed haꞌichu hab kaida mo g s‑gewk hewel wabsh shashawuk heg eda kih.

column2: They saw what looked like separate tongue-shaped flames that settled on each of them.
column3: Sh hahawa haꞌichu ep neid mash hab mahs mo g mei. Tsh id ab aꞌai i e gantad k ab i dahiwuhi wehsijj ha ab.

column2: All of them were filled with the Holy Spirit and began to speak in different languages as the Spirit gave them the ability to do so.
column3: Kutsh g Hekia S‑apꞌekam Gewkdag ab i ha mah g si geꞌe gewkdag. Tsh hekaj haha wabsh nahnko mahs neꞌokikaj neneo matsh eda chum pi hebai mai.

column2: At that time there were devout Jews from every nation on earth living in Jerusalem.
column3: Sh eda muꞌijj ab dadha Jerusalem t ab hegam mash d Tutuligo ch ab aꞌai i hihi muꞌikpa jejewed amjed matsh ab wo ihm g Jiosh.

column2: When they heard this noise, a large crowd of them gathered. They were puzzled because everyone heard their own language being spoken.
column3: Tsh an wehsko i kaida hegai mash hab kaidag mo g s‑gewk hewel. Kutsh idam am i kah k am e chehm mash hebai i kaidag. Sh idam Jesus ihmdam haha wabsh am neneok g ha‑neꞌokikaj mash hedai haschu i neꞌokikaj neok.

column2: They were totally amazed, saying, “Look, these people who are speaking—aren't they all Galileans?
column3: Kutsh si e totods idam k hab kaij, “Hab kaidam neneok ch eda d wabsh Galilee t am oꞌodham.

column2: So how is it that we can all hear them speaking in our own mother tongue?
column3: Kus has masma hab chuꞌig mach wehsijj s‑ha amichud g heheꞌejel t‑neꞌokikaj?

column2: Parthians, Medes and Elamites; people from Mesopotamia, Judaea and Cappadocia, Pontus and Asia,
column3: Kuch eda muꞌikpa jejewed amjed, haꞌi ab Parthia t amjed ch haꞌi ab Media t amjed ch ab amjed g Elam ch Mesopotamia ch Judea ch Cappadocia ch Pontus ch Asia

column2: Phrygia and Pamphylia; from Egypt and the area of Libya around Cyrene; visitors from Rome, both Jews and converts,  Cretans and Arabians—we hear them speaking in our own languages about all the great things God has done.”
column3: ch Phrygia ch Pamphylia ch Egypt ch Crete ch Arabia ch gam hu Cyrene kihhim wehgaj am Libya jewed ch ed ch ab Rome kihhim t amjed. K ia haꞌi t‑wehmaj g gawul mahs hemajkam mat ab i wahp t‑himdag ed. Kuch wehsijj kah g heheꞌejel t‑neꞌokikaj heg amjed mat haschu si s‑hasigam hab juh g Jiosh.

column2: They were all amazed and confused. “What does this mean?” they asked each other.
column3: A t haschu ahgk hab haꞌichu e juh?” Bash kaij nash pi si has elid.

column2: But others jeered and said, “They've been drinking too much wine!”
column3: Sh wabshaba haꞌijj wabsh nahnko ha ahg ch hab kaij, “Tki wabsh nawkk idam.”

column2: Then Peter stood up with the eleven disciples and spoke in a loud voice: “Fellow Jews and everyone living here in Jerusalem: pay attention to me and I'll explain all this to you!
column3: Tsh ab hahawa i gegokiwua g Jesus chuhchai. Sh g Peter am amog, “Ni‑hajuni ch ahpim mam ia wabsh sha kih Jerusalem t am, ab g wo si i ni‑kaiham k am wo i oidahi mant haschu wo i em‑ahgi.

column2: These men aren't drunk as you presume. It's only nine in the morning!
column3: Pi ach d nawkkoi.

column2: What's happening is what was predicted by the prophet Joel:
column3: Ihda mat haschu has i e juh o d hegai matsh g Joelbad an oꞌoha. Heg ash wa d Jiosh haꞌichu i tashogiddam ch an oꞌoha hab masma:

column2: ‘God says, “In the last days I will pour out my Spirit on everyone. Your sons and daughters will prophesy. Your young men will see visions. Your old men will dream dreams.
column3: Bo kaij g Jiosh:

column2: People of Israel, listen to this: Jesus of Nazareth was a man confirmed by God to you by the powerful miracles and signs that God performed through him, right here among you—as you well know.
column3: “Kumt ab wo i ni‑kaiha, ni‑hajuni. Ihda Jesus mo ab d kihkam Nazareth t ab at hab juh g s‑hasigam haꞌichu mat pi hedai hejel wo shaꞌi e nako mat hab wo juh. T id hekaj am i t‑tashogi g Jiosh mo id am d si Kehshaj. Kum ihda am wa hejel s‑mahch heg hekaj mat wehs am hab e juh em‑shahgid.

column2: God, knowing beforehand what would happen, followed his plan and resolved to hand him over to you. By means of the hands of wicked men, you killed him by nailing him to a cross.
column3: Jiosh atsh heki hu i apꞌech matsh has masma wo e muhkid g alidaj k heg hekaj am i dagito em‑wui. Kumt an be k ha mah hegam mo pi mahch g Jiosh chehanig nam pi s‑muꞌamk. Kut idam mua ab kots t ab naggiak.

column2: But God raised him back to life, freeing him from the burden of death, because death did not have the power to keep him a prisoner.
column3: T wabshaba g Jiosh ab i wuhshad ab amjed g s‑koꞌok muhkig nat pi am hab waꞌap i apꞌech mat ep wo e chegito. Kut hemho wa am hab wo e juh.

column2: David says of him, ‘I saw the Lord always in front of me. I will not be shaken, for he is right beside me.
column3: “T an wa oꞌoha g t‑kownaligbad David mat hab wo chei g Jiosh si Kehsha:

column2: My brothers and sisters, let me tell you plainly that our ancestor David died and was buried, and his tomb is here with us to this day.
column3: “Neh, ni‑naipijju, batki masma an oꞌoha g Davidbad. K wabshaba si tasho mo pi hejel hab e ahg mat pi wo padt no pi g ohꞌoj am wabsh kia wehch hihaꞌinij ed id i tashkaj.

column2: But he was a prophet, and knew that God had promised on oath to place one of his descendants on his throne.
column3: Davidbad ash d Jiosh haꞌichu i tashogiddam ch heg hab ahg Jiosh si Kehsha matsh pi wo padt k wo uhpam i wuhsh ab muhkig amjed. Jiosh ash wa heki hu ahgid g Davidbad mat am wo hema i kei g amjedkam am kehkud ed mat d wo geꞌe kownalk.

column2: David saw what would happen and spoke about the resurrection of Christ—for Christ was not abandoned to the grave nor did he experience decay.
column3: Davidbad oki s‑mahch ihda ch heg hab ahg ch hab kaij mat pi am hu wo shaꞌi dagito amai mo hebai haꞌichug g koꞌi k pi wo shaꞌi hiwigi mat wo padt g chuhkugaj.

column2: God has raised this Jesus from the dead, and we're all witnesses of that.
column3: Pegih, k d hegai Jesus mat g Jiosh ab i wamigi muhkig amjed. Kuch ahchim g t‑wuhpuikaj neid mach haschu ia em‑ahgid.

column2: Now he's been exalted to God's right hand, and has received from the Father the Holy Spirit whom he promised, and has poured out what you're seeing and hearing.
column3: Jiosh at am i wahkid k an kei si e‑hugid an. Kut ab bei g apꞌedag k cheha g Hekia S‑apꞌekam Gewkdag mat ab t‑wui wo hih. Heki ash hu hab kaij g Jiosh mat hab wo e juh. K d ihda mam am neid ch kah hemuch mat hab t‑juni.

column2: For David didn't ascend into heaven, but he did say, ‘The Lord told my Lord, “Sit down here at my right hand
column3: Pi o hejel hab e ahg g Davidbad ch wabshaba heg hab ahg Jiosh si Kehsha mat pi wo padt k wo uhpam hih am dahm kahchim wui nat pi an ep oꞌoha:

column2: Now let everyone in Israel be totally convinced of this: God has made this Jesus, who you killed on a cross, both Lord and Messiah!”
column3: “Pegih, ihda Jesus mamt ab naggia kots t ab o d Jiosh si Kehsha ch d wo t‑doꞌibiakam kownalk. Kutt id wo chum si s‑ap s‑mahchk wehsijj ahchim Tutuligo hemajkam.” Neh, bash kaij g Peter.

column2: When the people heard this they were conscience-stricken. They asked Peter and the other apostles, “Brothers, what should we do?”
column3: Kush si s‑koꞌokam pi ap e tahtk g hemajkam am i kaiok ch hab kaij ab ha wui hegam Peter, “Ih, tt has wo t‑juh, t‑naipijju?”

column2: “Repent!” Peter told them. “All of you must be baptized in the name of Jesus Christ for the forgiveness of your sins, and you will receive the gift of the Holy Spirit.
column3: Sh hab kaij g Peter ab ha wui, “Heheꞌejel g gam hu wo s‑ohhod g pi ap e‑chegitoi k wo e pahl‑wapko ab chehchegch g Jesus Christ. Kut gam hu hab wo i juh g Jiosh g pi ap em‑chuꞌijig. T amjed wo si em‑wehmajkad g Hekia S‑apꞌekam Gewkdag

column2: This promise is given to you, to your children, and to all who are far away—everyone the Lord our God calls.”
column3: nash pi g Jiosh hab kaij mat ab wehsijj wo ha mah g Hekia S‑apꞌekam Gewkdag hegam mat ab wo i ha wai e wui.”

column2: Peter went on speaking, giving them much more evidence. He warned them, “Save yourselves from this perverted generation.”
column3: Sh tash am neok g Peter ch am chum ha ahgid ch hab kaij, “Am g wo e doꞌibia. Si s‑koꞌok namkidadag o ab ha aihim hegam t‑wehm hemajkam mat pi gam hu wo ohhod g pi ap e‑chuꞌijig.”

column2: Those who accepted what he'd said were baptized, adding about three thousand people to the group of believers that day.
column3: Kutsh waik mihl ab i s‑wohoch g haꞌichu ahgaj heg i tashkaj k e pahl‑wapkon k ab i e hemakoj ha wehm.

column2: They committed themselves to what the apostles had taught them, and to the fellowship of the believers, “breaking bread” and praying together.
column3: Sh g Jesus chuhchai am hahawa ha mashcham. Kush am ha wehm e mihshmad ch e hoꞌigeꞌidahun ch ha wehm huhuga g chemait.

column2: Everyone was in awe, and many miracles and signs were done through the apostles.
column3: Kush muꞌi haꞌichu s‑hasigam hab junihim idam Jesus chuhchai g Jiosh gewkdagkaj. Tsh heg hekaj muꞌijj ehp ab si has i el mat haschu hab juh g Jiosh.

column2: All the believers were together and shared everything they had.
column3: Sh wehsijj g Jesus ihmdam ab si e hajunit ch wehs haꞌichu ab i aꞌai e mahk mash hedai haschu i pi edgid,

column2: They sold their property and belongings, sharing the proceeds with everyone as they needed.
column3: chum as hems wo gagda g haꞌichu e‑eniga mat heg hekaj lial am wo i ha wehmt hegam mo haꞌichu i pi edgid.

column2: Day after day they continued to meet together in the Temple, and ate together in their homes. They enjoyed their meals humbly and happily. They praised God, and everyone thought favorably of them.
column3: Sh wehs tashkaj am e nanmek geꞌe cheopi ch ed ch am ep e wehm e gegosid aꞌai e‑kihki ed si s‑ap e tatatk ch ab wabsh i e shoꞌigchudch Jiosh wui

column2: Every day the Lord added to their number those who were being saved.
column3: ch ab si hehgchulid g Jiosh. Kush wehsijj g hemajkam si s‑ha hoꞌigeꞌelid. Sh g Jiosh ab i ha wahpkid ha shahgid wehs tash ab hegam mat hab waꞌap e doꞌibia.

column2: Peter and John were on their way up to the Temple at the time of the afternoon prayer, around 3 p.m.
column3: Kush am waꞌi hebai amjed, tsh am dada g Peter g John wehm geꞌe cheopi t am. Kush d i waik ohla gam hu i juhk mo eda e aꞌahe mat wo e hoꞌigeꞌidahu.

column2: A man who had been lame from birth was being carried there. Every day he was placed beside the Temple gate called “Beautiful” so he could beg from the people going into the Temple.
column3: Sh ab hema daha g shoꞌigkam hemajkam heg bahsho kolhai kihjeg mash hab e aꞌaga Si S‑kehg Kihjeg. Kush ihda oꞌodham ga hu e‑alijk amjed pi himdag. Kumsh wehs tashkaj am wabsh i bebhe ch ab dadsha ab kolhai kihjego. Kush wabsh haꞌichu ha tahni hegam mo am daiw.

column2: He saw Peter and John as they were about to enter the Temple and asked them for some money.
column3: Tsh eda am wo i wahp idam Peter ch John. Sh ab haꞌichu chum ha tahni.

column2: Peter looked right at him. John did, too.
column3: Tsh ab si i nei idam Peter k hab kaij, “Ab g si i t‑neid.”

column2: The lame man gave them his full attention, expecting to get something from them.
column3: Kutsh wa woho ab si i ha nei hab e ahgch mat wo haꞌichu mah.

column2: “I don't have any silver or gold,” Peter told him, “but I'll give you what I have. In the name of Jesus Christ of Nazareth, walk!”
column3: Sh oi wa hab wabsh kaij g Peter, “Neh, ni‑nawoj, pi ani ha lialiga ch wabshaba haꞌichu wo m‑mah mat heg baꞌich wo i m‑wehmt. K d ihda mant hab wo m‑ah mapt ab wo i hiw g Jesus Christ k wo kekiwua k wo hih.”

column2: Peter took him by the right hand and helped him up. Right away his feet and ankles became strong.
column3: Bash kaij ch ab hahawa bei g nowij k ab i wuhshad. Kutsh am wa i hekaj ab gewpka g kakhioj.

column2: He jumped to his feet, and then began to walk. He went with them into the Temple, walking and jumping and praising God.
column3: Tsh am si uhgk daꞌa k kekiwua k am wa i hekaj s‑ap hih. Kutsh idam Peter im hu i wahp cheopi kolhai ch ed. Tsh heg ha wehm i wah k si chehk dadꞌehim ch ab si hehgchulid g Jiosh.

column2: Everyone there saw him walking around and praising God.  They recognized him as the beggar who used to sit by the Temple's Beautiful Gate, and they were surprised and amazed at what had happened to him.
column3: Kutsh si has i el g hemajkam am i neidok mo d hegai pi himidkam mo ab dahiwup kolhai kihjego.

column2: He held on tightly to Peter and John while everyone ran to them by Solomon's Porch in complete astonishment at what had happened.
column3: Batsh e juh ihda anai mash hab e aꞌaga Solomonbad Watto. Kush ihda pi himidkam gan hu wabsh i si e uꞌukch ab ha ab g Peter ch John mat pi wo i e gawulkai ab ha amjed. Tsh ab hahawa aꞌaijed i wohp g hemajkam k gan hu ha biha si has i elidk mat e doaj.

column2: When Peter saw this opportunity he told them, “People of Israel, why are you surprised at what's happened to this man? Why are you staring at us as if it was by our own power or faith that we made him walk?
column3: Tsh am wabsh apꞌet g Peter mat am ha mihshmad k hab kaij:

column2: The God of Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob—the God of our forefathers—has glorified his servant Jesus. He was the one you betrayed and rejected in the presence of Pilate, even after Pilate had decided to release him.  You rejected the One who is Holy and Right, and demanded a murderer be released to you.  You killed the Author of life, the one God raised from the dead—and we are witnesses to this.  By trusting in Jesus' name this man was healed by him. You see this man here; you know him. Through trusting in Jesus this man has received complete healing right in front of all of you.
column3: Jiosh si Kehsha at hab t‑juni nach pi ab hiwig. K d hegai Jesus mam ahpim s‑muꞌamk ch ab mah g kownal Pilate. K eda g Jiosh d pionag g Jesus ch d hekia s‑apꞌekam ch pi ha chuꞌijig. T ha chum wo dagito g Pilate. M wabshaba ahpim hab ahg mat wo muꞌa k heg wo dagito mo d ha muꞌakam. K heg hekaj d em‑chuꞌijig mat e muhkid. K eda d hegai mo ab t‑makiog g pi ha huhugedam doakag. T wabshaba g Jiosh ab si haꞌichuchud k uhpam i wuhshad ab amjed g muhkig k am i bei dahm kahchim wui. Hegam t‑shohshonbad mash d Abraham ch Isaac ch Jacob ash ab si has i elid g Jiosh. Kum eda ab wui gegok g Jiosh si Kehsha.

column2: Now I know, brothers and sisters, that you did this in ignorance, like your rulers.
column3: “Pegih, ni‑wepnag, mtp hems heg hekaj s‑muꞌam g Jesus mam pi mahch mo heg am d si Kehshaj g Jiosh mat wo t‑doꞌibia.

column2: But God fulfilled what he had prophesied through all the prophets: that his Messiah would suffer.
column3: T eda heki hu waꞌi amjed an oꞌoha g kelibad Jiosh haꞌichu i tashogiddam mat g si Kehshaj wo e shoꞌigch. T idani woho am hab e juh.

column2: Now repent, and change your ways, that your sins can be wiped away, so the Lord can send opportunities for you to heal and recover,
column3: Pegih, oi g gam hu wo s‑ohhod g pi ap e‑chegitoi k ab wo i e nohnogi Jiosh wui. T heg wo s‑em‑hoꞌigeꞌid k gam hu hab wo i juh g pi ap em‑chuꞌijig k ab wo si i wechijid g em‑dodakag.

column2: and send Jesus, the Messiah appointed for you.
column3: T ab em‑wui wo i hih g si Kehshaj Jesus.

column2: For he must stay in heaven until the time when everything is restored, as God announced through his holy prophets long ago.
column3: K hab mahs mat an wo haꞌichugk ihda Jesus dahm kahchim ch ed am hugkam mat hab wo e juh hegai mo haschu i t‑tashogid g kekelibad Jiosh haꞌichu i tashogiddam.

column2: Moses said, ‘The Lord God will send you a prophet from among your own people who is like me. You must listen to everything he tells you.
column3: “Neh, bash wa kaij g Mosesbad am t‑shohshon ha wui:

column2: God prepared his Servant and sent him to you first, to bless you by turning every one of you from your evil ways.”
column3: “Neh, t wa woho hab e juh mat am i kei g e‑alidag Jesus. T heg wehpeg ab i s‑t‑hoꞌigeꞌel ahchim Tutuligo k ab t‑wui him k ab i t‑mah g apꞌedag matt ab wo i t‑nohnogi ab amjed g pi apꞌekam.”

column2: While they were talking to the people, the priests, the captain of the Temple guard, and the Sadducees came up to them.
column3: Sh am wabsh kia ha mihshmad g Peter ch John. Kutsh am haha wabsh haꞌi dada g papal ch ha‑geꞌejig g geꞌe cheopi nuhkuddam ch haꞌi ehp mash am oid g Sajusi himdag.

column2: They were angry that they were teaching the people, telling them that through Jesus there is resurrection from the dead.
column3: Sh eda wa idam Peter ch John am ha mashcham g hemajkam mat ab i wuhsh g Jesus e‑muhkig amjed. Sh idam Sajusi pi hohhoꞌid nash pi pi wohochud mat ep wo e chegito g koꞌi.

column2: They arrested them and placed them under guard until the following day since it was already evening.
column3: Sh eda e aihim mat wo s‑chukk. T heg hekaj ged hu ha kuh mat wo ha lodai baꞌich tash.

column2: But many who had heard the message believed it, and the total number of believers grew to about five thousand.
column3: Tsh wabshaba muꞌijj hegam matsh kah g Peter ch John ab i s‑wohoch g Jiosh haꞌichu ahga. Tsh am i muꞌida hegam mash ab ihm g Jesus. Kush hegam mash d chechoj d hahawa hetasp mihl.

column2: The next day, the rulers, elders, and religious leaders met together in Jerusalem.
column3: Sh am baꞌich d i tash. Tsh am e hemapai g hemajkam ha wanimeddam ch geꞌeged ch chehanig ha mashchamdam.

column2: They included the high priest Annas, Caiaphas, John, Alexander, and others of the high priest's family.
column3: Kush am ha wehmaj hegai uhgchu pahl mash hab chehgig Annas. Sh g hajunij am hab waꞌap haꞌichug mash haꞌi d Caiaphas ch John ch Alexander.

column2: They brought Peter and John before them and asked, “By what power or by whose authority have you done this?”
column3: Tsh ab hahawa i ha wuwhas idam Peter kukpaikud amjed k ga hu i ha chuhcha k ab ha kakke, “Shahchu am e wepogid ch hab haꞌichu wua? Dohm hab elid mamt heg ab bei g e‑gewkdag k doaj ihda pi himidkam?”

column2: Peter, filled with the Holy Spirit, answered them. “Rulers of the people, and elders:
column3: Tsh ab baꞌich i gewkai g Peter g Hekia S‑apꞌekam Gewkdag. Sh hab kaij:

column2: Are we being interrogated regarding a good deed done to a man who couldn't help himself, and how he came to be healed?
column3: matt hemho wo wa bei g apꞌedag matt hab wo juh g s‑apꞌekam.

column2: If so, all of you should know, and all the people of Israel, that it was in the name of Jesus Christ of Nazareth, the one you killed on a cross and whom God raised from the dead—it's because of him that this man stands before you completely healed.
column3: Pegih, nt wo em‑ahgi mat g Jesus Christ ab i t‑mah hegai gewkdag matt hekaj doaj ihda oꞌodham. Ahpim amt hab juh hegai Jesus Christ mat ab e naggia kots t ab. T wabshaba g Jiosh ab uhpam i wuhshad muhkig amjed.

column2: ‘He is the stone you builders rejected, but he has been made the chief cornerstone.’
column3: Id o hab ahg Jesus g kelibad Jiosh haꞌichu i tashogiddam ch an oꞌoha ihda haꞌichu wepogida mo hab chuꞌig:

column2: When they saw Peter and John's confidence, and realized they were uneducated, ordinary men, they were very surprised. They also recognized them as Jesus' companions.
column3: Sh si s‑e mahch ch neneok idam Peter. Tsh hekaj si has i ha el idam hahaꞌichu, wahm mat am i s‑mai am i ha kahkch mo d wabsh si oꞌodham ch pi hasko shaꞌi uhgk e mashchamahim. Tsh am hahawa i amich moki an wehmajkahim g Jesus.

column2: Since they could see the man who had been healed standing right there with them, they had nothing to say in response to what had happened.
column3: Kush am ha wehm kehk hegai mamt doaj. Sh pi e nakog hegam hahaꞌichu mas has wo chei nash pi g e‑wuhpuikaj neid mat woho e doaj hegai.

column2: So they instructed them to wait outside the council while they discussed the matter among themselves.
column3: Kumtsh gam hu hahawa i ha wuwhas hegam Peter matsh g hahaꞌichu am wo i aꞌaga.

column2: “What should we do with these men?” they asked. “We can't deny a significant miracle has happened through them. Everybody living here in Jerusalem knows about it.
column3: Kush hab kaij, “Shahtt wo ha juh. Wehsijj o s‑mahch g Jerusalem t am kihkam mat doaj g pi himidkam. K id d si s‑hasig haꞌichu. Kutt pi wo shaꞌi t‑nako machs hab wo chei mas pi woho hab juh.”

column2: But to prevent it spreading among the people any further, we should threaten them never to speak to anybody in this name again.”
column3: Sh hab hahawa ep kaij, “Matt wo keshwua ihda ha‑ahga mat pi hekid am hu ep wo shaꞌi aꞌagad ihda Jesus am hema i wui.”

column2: So they called them back in and ordered them never to speak or teach in the name of Jesus again.
column3: Kumtsh ab hahawa ep i ha wahpki. Sh hab ha ahg, “Chum as has wo chuꞌigk haꞌichu, mt pi am hu wo shaꞌi aꞌagad ihda Jesus.”

column2: But Peter and John responded, “Whether it's right in God's eyes to obey you rather than God—you decide.
column3: Sh hab hahawa si kaij hegam Peter, “Am g wo i aꞌamichud machs ahpim ab wo em‑wohoch aha natt g Jiosh.

column2: We can't help talking about what we've seen and heard!”
column3: Tt ahchim hi hemho am wo wa ahgahid mat haschu i si s‑kehg hab juh k haschu i si s‑kehg hab kaij g Jesus mach si neid ch kah.”

column2: After making more threats they let them go. They couldn't work out how to punish them because everyone was glorifying God for what had happened.  For the man who received this miracle of healing was more than forty years old.
column3: Kush wa eda hegai pi himidkam i baꞌiwchkim g giꞌikko wehst‑mahm aꞌahidag. Sh g hemajkam wehs ab si i hehgchulid g Jiosh mat doaj. Kutsh heg hekaj pi shaꞌi e nako g ha wanimeddam mas has masma s‑koꞌokam wo ha namkid k am wabsh si ha ebkiod k chum ha keshwua k hahawa ha dagito.

column2: After the disciples had been released, they went to the other believers and told them everything the chief priests and elders had said to them.
column3: Tsh am wa i hekaj ged hu uhpam dada e‑naipijju ha wui k am ha ahgid mo has i ha ahg g uꞌugchu papal ch geꞌeged.

column2: When they heard what had happened, they prayed to God together:
column3: Tsh am i kaiok am ha hekaj e hoꞌigeꞌidahun k hab kaij, “T‑kownalig Jiosh, wehs ap uꞌukch g gewkdag ch nahtokch g dahm kahchim ch jewed kahchim ch ge kahchki ch wehs haꞌichu mo haschu am i ha eda.
