column2: The following day as we were violently thrown about by the storm, the crew started throwing the cargo overboard.
column3: T ihda shaꞌi si s‑gewk hewel pi shaꞌi haꞌasa. K am baꞌich d i tash. T gam hu i shul hegai mo mohto g geꞌe wahlko.

column2: On the third day they grabbed the ship's gear and tossed it into the sea.
column3: K am baꞌich d ep i tash. K am wabsh kia si hewed. T gm hu i nehnch g hejel e‑nohnhoikaj hegai mo haschukaj chum himchud g geꞌe wahlko mat wo si i haukai.

column2: We hadn't seen the sun or the stars for many days as the storm beat down on us; so any hope of our being saved was lost.
column3: Kutt muꞌi tashkaj pi shaꞌi nei g tash tonlig o g huhuꞌu. K am wabsh i med g s‑gewk hewel. Tt am hu hebai hab haha wabsh i t‑ah mattki pi wo shaꞌi t‑doꞌibia.

column2: Nobody had eaten anything for a long time. Then Paul stood before them and told them, “Men, you should have listened to me and not sailed from Crete. Then you could have avoided all this hardship and loss.
column3: Kuch tash pi haꞌichu shaꞌi koꞌa. T g Paul ab i ha waid k hab kaij, “Mamt hems ab wo ni‑kaiha, kutt pi ab hu wo chum gahi i shul ab amjed matt wa ab dadhaiwua. Neh, t idani chum pi wo e padch g wahlko. T g haꞌichu mohtoi pi wo heb hu e shul.

column2: But now I advise you keep up your courage, because nobody is going to be lost, just the ship.
column3: Mt wabshaba pi has wo shaꞌi e tahtkkad. Pi amt hedai wo shaꞌi e muhkid. Heg at waꞌi wahlko wo e padch.

column2: Last night an angel of my God and whom I serve, stood beside me.
column3: Id ani s‑mahch nat pi hema am i e chehgi g anghil ni‑wui

column2: ‘Don't be afraid, Paul,’ he told me. ‘You have to stand trial before Caesar. See, God has graciously given to you everyone who is sailing with you.’
column3: k hab kaij, ‘Pi g shaꞌi haꞌichu ehbidad, Paul. Hemho wa apt am wo kekiwua si geꞌe kownal wui. T g Jiosh ab i m‑kaiham k wehs wo ha doꞌibia hegam mo m‑wehmaj.’ Neh, bo kaij g anghil ab ni‑wui.

column2: So men, have courage! I trust God, and I'm convinced things will happen just as I was told.
column3: “Kumt am wo si i e gewpkai. Jiosh at woho hab wo juh hegai mo haschu am ni‑ahgid g anghil

column2: However, we will be wrecked on some island.”
column3: k ab wo t‑uꞌapa g hewelkaj mo ab hebai al jewedag shuhdagi ch ed.”

column2: At around midnight on the fourteenth night of the storm, still being blown over the Sea of Adria, the crew suspected they were getting close to land.
column3: Am d i gohk domig amjed mat am t‑ai g s‑gewk hewel, t eda i e huh g s‑chuhugam. K am wabsh kia t‑wiꞌichkwuhim. K hegam wahlko nuhkuddam hab elid mach aihim mash ab hebai jewedag

column2: They checked the depth and found it was forty meters, and a little while later they checked again and it was thirty meters.
column3: ch heg hekaj am haꞌichu s‑wehch i huduni g wijinakaj an wudk mat heg hekaj wo s‑mai mas heꞌes i s‑juhk. T ged hu si taht g jewed mat siant gokko wehst‑mahm (120) tad wijina hekaj. Kut ab i wanchkwua ihda s‑wehch haꞌichu. K am shaꞌi heꞌes, t am ep i huduni. T ged hu ep si taht g jewed mat humukto wehst‑mahm (90) tad wijina hekaj.

column2: They were concerned that we might be wrecked on rocks, so they dropped four anchors from the stern, and prayed for daylight to come.
column3: T am i s‑mai moki ab aihim mo ab hema jewedag k s‑ehbid mat am hu ab wo gei hohodai ch ed g wahlko. T hekaj giꞌik am shul g s‑wehch wapainomi mo hekaj wulshshap g geꞌe wahlko k am hahawa si e hoꞌigeꞌidahu mat wo mahsij.

column2: The crew tried to leave the ship, and had lowered the ship's boat into the water with the pretext that they were going to drop anchors from the ship's bow.
column3: K haꞌi hejel s‑e doꞌibiamk g wahlko nuhkuddam ch am i huduni g al chum wahlko shuhdagi ch ed hab wabsh s‑e junimk mat am haꞌi ep wo i huhuds g wupulshpadaj g wahlko.

column2: But Paul told the centurion and the soldiers, “Unless the crew stays with the ship, you will be lost.”
column3: K wabshaba g Paul hab kaij ab wui g shondal ha‑geꞌejig ch hegam shondal, “Pi amt wo shaꞌi e doꞌibia matp wo sha t‑dagito idam wahlko nuhkuddam.”

column2: So the soldiers cut the ropes holding the ship's boat, and let it loose.
column3: T hekaj g shondal an si hikkumia g wipijina mo an hekaj wulshch g al chum wahlko. T ged hu gei shuhdagi ch ed.

column2: At daybreak Paul urged all of them to eat something. “It's been fourteen days now that you haven't eaten anything because you've been so worried and preoccupied,” he told them.
column3: Kuki eda mahsihim. K g Paul am ha chehani mat wo haꞌichu huh hab kaijch, “Do waꞌi gohk domig mamt amjed pi haꞌichu huh nam pi e kudut id hekaj pi t‑apꞌedag.

column2: “Please do what I say and eat some food. This will help give you strength. For not even a hair from anyone's head is going to be lost!”
column3: Mt ab hig wo haꞌichu hug k ab wo i e gewpkai. Hemho wa amt wehsijj wo e doꞌibia.”

column2: When he'd finished speaking he picked up a loaf of bread, and gave thanks to God for it in front of everyone. Then he broke the bread, and began to eat.
column3: Neh, bat cheꞌiok am ha hekaj bei g pahn k ab si ihm g Jiosh wehs ha wehhejed k am hahawa i hahain k huh.

column2: Everyone was encouraged and they ate too.
column3: T wehsijj am i neidok ab si i e gewkemhun k am hahawa haꞌichu huh.

column2: The total number of people on board was two hundred and seventy-six.
column3: Kuch eda d gohk siant wewaꞌakko gamai chuhdp (276).

column2: Once they'd had enough to eat, the crew made the ship lighter by throwing the supplies of wheat overboard.
column3: Tt am i wehsijj kokwod. Kut am hahawa ep i chikpan k gm hu shul g pilkani ge shuhdagi ch ed mat wo si i haukai g geꞌe wahlko.

column2: When dawn came they didn't recognize the coastline, but they saw a bay that had a beach. They planned to try running the ship aground there.
column3: T am i mahsi, t g wahlko nuhkuddam pi shaꞌi amich hegai jewed mattki ab wui i wuwha. K eda am s‑tadaniko i wahks g shuhdagi ch pi hohodaig an hugidaj an. T hab i e ah mat am wo himch g wahlko. Tp hems ab s‑ap wo dahiwua heg eda.

column2: So they cut the anchor ropes, leaving the anchors in the sea. At the same time they untied the ropes holding the rudders, raised the foresail to the wind, and made for the beach.
column3: T hekaj am si hikkumia g wupulshpadaj. T im hu shul shuhdagi ch ed. K eda an wupulshch hegai mo hekaj s‑apko e himchud g wahlko. Kumt gam si wuhpulꞌo k am hahawa wabsh i cheshaj hegai lohna mo gam hu baꞌich hab chuꞌig. T g hewel am t‑wiꞌichkwua am wui mo am i wahks g shuhdagi.

column2: But they struck a sandbar and the ship grounded. The bow hit, and stuck so firm it couldn't be moved, while the stern began to be broken apart by the pounding surf.
column3: T wabshaba ged hu si e hiash g wahlko moꞌo oꞌod ch ed mat koi am hu i wah. K eda shaꞌi si s‑gewkam ab i hihhim g shuhdagi toꞌotonk. Kut hegai mo gam hu oidch hab chuꞌig gam si e ohmi.

column2: The soldiers planned to kill the prisoners so none of them could swim away and escape.
column3: T g shondal am i e apꞌech mat wehs wo ha kokda g lilso mat pi wo i e watchwihim k wo heb hu wohp.

column2: But the centurion, because he wanted to save Paul's life, prevented them from doing this, and ordered those who could swim to jump overboard first and make for land.
column3: T wabshaba pi ha hiwigi g ha‑geꞌejig nat pi s‑doꞌibiam g Paul k am wehsijj ha chehani mat wo i e watchwihi am jewed koa wui. Tsh hegam mo s‑mahch g watchwi am wo i nehni k heheꞌejel wo i e watchwihi.

column2: The rest grabbed hold of planks and other wreckage, so that everyone was able to reach land safely.
column3: T heg haꞌi am wo i ha oi an e uꞌukch uꞌus t an mat ab e ohmi g wahlko. Kutt hab masma wehsijj t‑doꞌibia ga hu ak mo ab i koa g jewed.

column2: When we were safe ashore, we discovered that we were on the island of Malta.  The people there were very kind—they started a fire and called all of us over so we could warm up from the rain and the cold.
column3: Kuki am haꞌi d oꞌodham ch si s‑ap i e taht k ab i t‑neid k si s‑t‑nawojima. Kutt s‑mai mash ihda al jewed d Malta. K eda juhk ch s‑hehpid. Kutki am ge t‑nahj.

column2: Paul collected a bundle of firewood and threw it on the fire. But a poisonous snake was driven out of the bundle because of the heat and bit him, fastening itself on his hand.
column3: T g Paul am haꞌi kuꞌa mat am wo si i mehmed g nahda k am toa mei ch ed. T g koꞌoi ab hema si i daꞌiwush tonidk k an kiꞌish nowij an.

column2: When the people there saw the snake hanging from his hand, they said to each other, “This man must be a murderer. Even though he escaped death from the sea, Justice won't let him live.”
column3: T g kihkam am i nei ihda koꞌoi mo an kiꞌishch g Paul k hab kaij ab aꞌai e wui, “Id oki d ha muꞌakam ch hi wa chum pi e muhkid am shuhdagi ch ed. Kuki am hab wa mahs matki hemho wa wo e muhkid k ab wo bei g s‑koꞌok e‑namkidadag.”

column2: However Paul shook the snake off into the fire, and suffered no ill-effects.
column3: K wabshaba g Paul am si e nowigid ch gam hu wua g koꞌoi mei ch ed k pi shaꞌi koꞌokam e juh.

column2: They were expecting him to swell up, or suddenly fall down dead. But after waiting a long time, they saw that nothing bad had happened to him so they changed their minds and decided he must be a god.
column3: K idam kihkam am chum neid mat wo i tosko o wabsh chum hekid wo muhk k i gei. T wabshaba gam hu wabsh i mehko. T oi wa pi haꞌichu has shaꞌi juh g Paul. T am hahawa gawul ep i e ah k hab kaij moki d jiosh.

column2: Nearby were lands that belonged to Publius, the chief official of the island. He welcomed us and looked after us for three days very hospitably.
column3: Ha‑geꞌejig idam hemajkam o hab chehgig Publius ch am waꞌi mia oidag. Kuch am wehmaj dadkkahim waik tash nat pi si s‑ap ab i t‑nei.

column2: Now Publius' father was sick, lying in bed suffering from fever and dysentery. Paul went in to see him, and prayed for him, placed his hands on him, and healed him.
column3: Kuki g ohgaj woꞌok ch mumku g s‑tonjigkaj ch wakuidagkaj. T g Paul am i wah mo am woꞌo k an tahtam k am i tai g Jiosh mat wo doaj. T wa woho hab e juh mat doaj.

column2: After this happened, everyone else who was sick on the island came and was healed.
column3: T am i nei ihda g hemajkam. T am hahawa muꞌi ep dada g kokꞌodam k e dodaj.

column2: They presented us with many gifts, and when we had to sail they provided everything we needed for the voyage.
column3: T hekaj ab si has i t‑elid k shaꞌi muꞌi haꞌichu t‑mah. Am hu i hebai mat am i e ai matt wo hihi, t ab ep i t‑mah hegai matt haschu wo i tatchuad am gahi ep i shuligk.

column2: After a three month stay we set sail aboard a ship from Alexandria having a figurehead of the Heavenly Twins that had spent the winter at the island.
column3: T eda hema wuhshad g s‑hehpichꞌed g geꞌe wahlko ch hab e aꞌaga Kukadi Jijosh ch ab Alexandria t amjed. Am d i waik mashad, tt heg ab gam hu gahi i shul juhpin tahgio wui

column2: We stopped at Syracuse, and spent three days there.
column3: k ga hu dada mo am d Syracuse kihhim. Am d i waik tash,

column2: From there we sailed on to Rhegium. The following day a south wind blew, and on the second day we arrived at the port of Puteoli,
column3: tt gam hu gahi ep i shul juhpin tahgio wui k ga hu dada mo am d Regium kihhim.

column2: where we discovered some believers. They asked us to stay with them for a week.
column3: Kuki am haꞌi kih g t‑wehm wohochuddam ch ab si t‑ahgid mattsh am wo ha wehmajkahim hemako domig ab. Kutt wa woho hab t‑juh k gam hu hahawa hihi Rome wui.

column2: When some of the believers from Rome heard we had arrived they came to meet us at the Forum of Appius and the Three Taverns. When Paul saw them, he was thankful to God and much encouraged.
column3: Kutsh wa heki hu am kah hegam t‑wehm wohochuddam ab Rome t ab mattsh am wo dada k atki mehk ab i hihi mat wo t‑hoꞌigeꞌel. Kut haꞌi idam am t‑nam mo am d Waik Gegosidakud. T haꞌi am ep t‑nam mo am d Appius Nolawtakud. Kut ab i ha nei g Paul k ab ihm g Jiosh k ab si e gewkai.

column2: When we entered Rome, Paul was permitted to stay under house arrest with a soldier to guard him.
column3: Kutt am dada Rome t am. Kumt wabsh hiwigi g Paul mat wabsh hejelko wo i chiwia. K g shondal am hi wa nuhkud.

column2: Three days later Paul invited the Jewish leaders there to come to see him. When they were all together he told them, “Brothers, even though I had not done anything wrong against the people or the customs of our forefathers, I was arrested in Jerusalem and handed over to the Roman authorities.
column3: Muꞌi o am kih g Tutuligo. K am d i waik tash. T g Paul am i ha wai g ha‑geꞌegedga e‑kih wui. T am i e nam. K hab kaij ab ha wui:

column2: After they had interrogated me they wanted to release me because I had done nothing that warranted execution.
column3: T hegam Rome t ab hahaꞌichu ab haꞌichu ni‑kakke k chum s‑ni‑dagitoimk nat pi pi haꞌichu shaꞌi cheh manis heg hekaj wo ni‑muhkid.

column2: But the Jewish leaders opposed this, so I was forced to appeal to Caesar—not that I had any accusations against my own people.
column3: T wabshaba g t‑wehm oꞌodham ab wui gegokiwua ihda. Kunt hekaj hab i ni‑ah mantki hemho wa ab wo i gei si geꞌe kownal wui mo hi wa chum pi am hu haꞌichu d hegai manis ab wo ha abch g t‑wehm oꞌodham.

column2: That's why I asked to see you, and talk to you, because it is on account of the hope of Israel that I am chained up like this.”
column3: Ab ani hiwig hegai Jiosh si Kehsha mach wehsijj nenida ahchim Tutuligo. Ni hab elid mo hema d hegai ch heki hu am i wuhsh. K eda muꞌijj g t‑wehm oꞌodham pi wohochud mo d hegai ch hab s‑ni‑kehꞌid. Nt heg hekaj ab i em‑wai mant em‑wehm wo aꞌagad.”

column2: “We have not received any letters from Judea about you, and none of our people have come here with reports against you or to speak badly of you,” they told him.
column3: K hab kaij ab wui, “Pi at ab hu hedai shaꞌi t‑oꞌohani hegam geꞌeged oꞌodham ab Judea t ab ab m‑amjed. T pi hedai ia hu shaꞌi jiwia g t‑hajuni ab amjed mas am hu i pi ap has m‑ahg.

column2: “But we do want to hear from you what you believe—especially regarding this sect, which we know is condemned everywhere.”
column3: K eda wehsko g hemajkam muꞌi pi ap has ahg ihda himdag mapsh ahpi s‑wohochud. Kuch s‑kaimk maps has wo chei ab amjed.”

column2: They made an appointment to meet with him. On that day many people came to where he was staying. From morning till night Paul was explaining to them, telling them about the kingdom of God. He tried to convince them about Jesus using the writings of the law of Moses and the prophets.
column3: Neh, bo kaij. T am hahawa aꞌaga k kei g tash mat wo e jehnigi.

column2: Some accepted what Paul said, but some refused to believe.
column3: T haꞌi ab i s‑wohoch ab kaiok. T wabshaba haꞌijj pi shaꞌi wohoch.

column2: They couldn't agree among themselves, and they left after Paul told them this: “The Holy Spirit said it well through Isaiah the prophet to your forefathers,
column3: T am i pi shaꞌi e apꞌet k hab e juh mat wo aꞌai hihi. T hekaj id hab ep chei g Paul, “Do si wohokam mash wa has i kaij g Jiosh ab em‑amjed ab Isaiabad wui. K an hab chuꞌig Isaiabad oꞌohana ed:

column2: Consequently you should know that this salvation that comes from God has been sent to the foreigners and they will listen.”
column3: “Pegih, mtki pi ab hu wo kaiha g Jiosh haꞌichu ahga mat wo em‑doꞌibia. T g Jiosh heg hekaj ab wo ha mah g gawul mahs hemajkam ihda doꞌibiadag ahga mo ab chum s‑em‑mahkimk. T hegam ab hi wo kaiha.” [
T am i haꞌasa hab chei ihda g Paul. T gam hu aꞌai hihi hegam mo ab kah si e neꞌowinahimch.]

column2: For two full years Paul stayed there in the house he rented, welcoming everyone who came to see him.
column3: K am kihkahim g Paul gohk ahid ab hema kih ed mo namkid ch am kih. K g hemajkam am chechga.

column2: He spoke of the kingdom of God, and taught about the Lord Jesus Christ very boldly. No one prevented him.
column3: K g Paul si s‑ap e tahtk ch ab ha neid ch am wabsh si s‑mahchim haꞌichu ha ahgid ab amjed g Jiosh kownaltalig ch ha mashcham ab amjed g t‑kownalig Jesus Christ. K pi hedai shaꞌi shohbid.

column2: We are always thankful to God the Father of our Lord Jesus Christ for you, and pray for you.
column3: Chum ach hekid ab i hoꞌigeꞌid g Jiosh em-wehhejed t-hoꞌigeꞌidahunch.

column2: We've heard about your trust in Christ Jesus and your love for all the believers
column3: Ab amtsh i s-wohoch g wohokam ab amjed g t-kownalig Jesus Christ k ab hahawa si ha tatchua g e-wehm wohochuddam. Id ach hekaj ab i hoꞌigeꞌid g ohgaj Jiosh.

column2: because of the hope prepared for you in heaven. You already heard about this in the good news, the message of truth
column3: Bam masma nam pi ab wui i e gewpkadch hegai s-kehg kihdag mo g Jiosh am nahtokch t-wehhejed an dahm kahchim ch ed.

column2: that came to you just as it has gone throughout the whole world, spreading widely and bringing results. It's done the same for you too, ever since you heard it and realized the true nature of God's grace.
column3: Am at em-wui jiwia ihda s-kehg haꞌichu ahga no pi an wehsko chehmohim g jewed ch am ha apꞌechudahim hegam mo ab kaiham hab masma mo hab em-wua. Woho amsh s-mahch g Jiosh hoꞌigeꞌidadag

column2: Our dear friend and fellow-worker Epaphras, who is a trustworthy minister of Christ on our behalf, taught you about this.
column3: nash pi am em-ahgid ihda t-wehm chikpandam Epaphras. Id ach ab si tatchua ch hab elid mo si s-ap hab wua g e-chikpan am em-shahgid.

column2: He's also made clear to us your love in the Spirit.
column3: Ia at hahawa jiwia k am t-ahgid mamsh ab aꞌai si e tatchua g gewkdajkaj g Hekia S-apꞌekam Gewkdag.

column2: Because of this we continue to pray for you from the time we heard about you, asking God to give you understanding of what he wants you to do and to give you every kind of spiritual wisdom and understanding.
column3: Kuch heg hekaj chum hekid t-hoꞌigeꞌidahun em-wehhejed. Hekia S-apꞌekam Gewkdag o ab em-mahkch g amichudadag. Kuch ab tahni g Jiosh mat hab wo em-juh mamt s-ap wo hekaj hegai amichudadag k wo s-mahchk g tatchuij.

column2: That way you'll live lives that rightly represent the Lord and please him, producing all kinds of good results and gaining greater knowledge of God.
column3: Bamt masma ab wo si haꞌichuchudad g t-kownalig Jesus ch ab wo hehgchulidad am hab junihidch g s-apꞌekam namt pi baꞌich i s-ap wo s-mahchk g Jiosh.

column2: May you be made powerfully strong by his wonderful strength, having great patience and endurance.
column3: Jiosh o wehs edgid g gewkdag. Kuch ab tahni mat baꞌich ab wo i em-mahkad g gewkdag. Mt hekaj wehs haꞌichu s-e tahtk ch wo nakogad ch wo si s-hehgigk.

column2: May you happily praise the Father, who has made it possible for us to share in the inheritance of God's people who live in the light.
column3: Jiosh kownaltalig o d hekia tonlig. K g Jiosh s-kehg haꞌichu an nahtokch t-wehhejed ahchim mach d hemajkamgaj. Kumt ab wo si i hoꞌigeꞌel mat am i em-apꞌech mam d hahawa hemajkamgaj ch ab wo bei hegai mo an nahtokch.

column2: He rescued us from the tyranny of darkness and brought us into the kingdom of the Son he loves,
column3: Jiawul o an wehs ha uꞌukch hegam mo hedai pi mahch g Jiosh. K g kownaltaligaj d hekia s-chuhugam. T wabshaba g Jiosh ab i t-wuwhas ab gewkdaj amjed k am i t-wahpki si e-tatchuidch e-alidag kownaltalig ed.

column2: through whom we have been set free and our sins forgiven.
column3: T heg t-doꞌibia k gam hu hab i juh g pi ap t-chuꞌijig.

column2: The Son is the visible picture of the invisible God. He was before  all creation,
column3: Jiosh o pi ta neidagma ch wabshaba hemu e chehgidch gahi wuhshanim g e-alidag. Kutt hab waꞌi masma ab wo nei g Jiosh matt wo nei g alidaj. Heki o hu an wehmaj g e-ohg mat eda koi an hu haꞌichu e nahto ch wehs haꞌichu baꞌich d i si s-has haꞌichu.

column2: for everything was created through him—in heaven and on earth, visible and invisible, empires, rulers, leaders and authorities—everything was created through him and for him.
column3: Jiosh at am i kei g e-alidag mat wehs haꞌichu wo nahto. T heg wehs nahto hegai mo haschu an hab i chuꞌig dahm kahchim ch ed ch in jewed dahm, hegai mach haschu i neid ch hegai mach pi neid. K wehs d chuhchaij g nahnko mahs kokownal in jewed dahm ch an dahm kahchim ch ed. K d Jiosh tatchui mat wehs haꞌichu d wo enigajk g alidaj.

column2: He existed before everything, and he holds everything together.
column3: K wehs haꞌichu in hab chuꞌig g alidaj gewkdagkaj.

column2: He is also the head of the body, the church. He is the beginning, the first and highest of those raised from the dead, so that he is supreme in everything.
column3: K heg d t-moꞌo am himdam ahchim mach ab ihm. Kuch ab amjed bekch g t-doakag hab masma mo g honshpadag ab moꞌo t amjed bekch g e-doakag. Jiosh alidag o wehs d t-siꞌihegi ch ab i wuhsh muhkig amjed mat d wo si s-has haꞌichuk am wehs haꞌichu dahm.

column2: God was pleased to have his full nature live in him,
column3: Chum as hab masma ia jiwia g Jesus mo g oꞌodham k eda d Jiosh wehmaj g e-ohg ch heg hekaj wepo chuꞌig.

column2: and through him brought back everything in the universe to himself, since he made peace through the blood of his cross, through him reconciling all those on the earth and in heaven.
column3: Ab amt naggai kots t ab k mua. Kut eda ha hiwigi g Jiosh no pi hab d elidaj mat g alidaj wo hejel e iagchul. T heg hekaj wehs haꞌichu wo e nako mat wo chum i e apꞌech am Jiosh wui.

column2: You once were alienated from God, enemies in the way you thought and the way you acted,
column3: Mehk am wa ab amjed g Jiosh ch d obgaj nam pi pi ap haꞌichu chegito ch pi ap haꞌichu hab junihim.

column2: but now he has reconciled you through his dying human body, bringing you into his presence where you stand holy, pure, and faultless.
column3: T wabshaba g Jiosh gam hu hab i juh g e-obgatalig k ab wabsh i chum em-hemakoj e wehm heg hekaj e-alidag muhkig. Kumt heg hekaj d wo hekia s-apꞌekamk ch pi ab hu wo ha chuꞌijigk

column2: But your trust in him must continue rock-solid and immovable. Don't be shaken from the hope of the good news that you heard, the good news that's been shared throughout the world—that's the work that I Paul have been doing.
column3: mamtp am wabsh i s-gewkam wo wohochudad g s-kehg haꞌichu ahgaj ab amjed g alidaj ch pi gam hu hab wo i e juh ab amjed. Ihda s-kehg haꞌichu ahga o wehsijj ab d ha wuikam g hemajkam ch heg hekaj an wehsko chehmohim g jewed.

column2: I'm happy to have trouble for your sake, for by means of what happens to me physically I'm part of Christ's sufferings that he continues to experience for the sake of his body, the church.
column3: Bo sha mahs mach d honshpadaj g Christ ahchim mach ab ihm. Heg atsh si e shoꞌigch t-wehhejed. Kuni wabsh si s-ap ni-tahtk ch am oidch ni-shoꞌigchud mat s-ap wo e nahto g honshpadaj hegam ha hekaj mat hab waꞌap ab wo i s-wohoch g haꞌichu ni-ahga.

column2: I serve the church following the direction God gave me about you, to present fully the word of God to you.
column3: Am at i ni-kei g Jiosh mant wo em-ahgidahi ihda s-kehg haꞌichu ahgaj. Ni heg hekaj d em-pionag ch am em-ahgid.

column2: This is the mystery that was hidden down through the ages and for many generations, but it's now been revealed to God's people.
column3: E o ehstokch ged hu i shohshon k amjed mat woho has wo t-juni g Christ. T wabshaba hemuch am si tashogi g Jiosh t-wui.

column2: God wanted to make known to them the glorious wealth of this mystery to the nations: Christ living in you is the glorious hope!
column3: K d ihda mat g Christ ab wo t-mah g Hekai S-apꞌekam Gewkdag. Kut heg am wo t-edak, chum hems ahpim gawul mahs hemajkam, ch hab wo t-juh matt d wo Jiosh hemajkamgak ch wehmaj ab wo si has t-elidad am kihdaj ed.

column2: We're telling everyone about him, instructing and teaching them in the best way we know how so that we can bring everyone before God fully mature in Christ.
column3: Kuch am chum t-nakog matt wehs wo ha ahgi g hemajkam ab amjed g Jesus Christ k wo ha shohbid k ep wo ha mashcha mat has wo masmak haꞌas mach heꞌes i s-amichud. T hab s-geꞌema wo hihimad e-wohochudadag ed. Kutt am wo ha chehgi Jiosh wui mo hab masma.

column2: That's what I'm working for too, making every effort as I rely on his strength which is powerfully at work in me.
column3: Ab o si geꞌe ni-mahkch g Christ g gewkdag. Ni heg hekaj am si ni-gewkadch mant wo nahto ihda chikpan.

column2: I want you to know how hard I'm working for you, and for those at Laodicea—in fact for all those who haven't met me personally—
column3: Mamt hu wo i s-mahchk mani has i masma s-gewkam ni-hoꞌigeꞌidahun am em-wehhejed ch am ep ha wehhejed hegam mo am kih Laodicea t am, pej wehs ha wehhejed hegam mo pi ni-mahch no ge ni-neid.

column2: so that you may be encouraged. May you be bound together in love, experiencing the great benefit of being completely sure in your understanding, for this is what the true knowledge of God brings. May you know the revealed mystery of God, which is Christ!  In him you can discover all the rich wisdom and knowledge of God.
column3: Jiosh o am chum wehs t-tashogid g e-amichudadag ch e-mahchig gahi wuhshanim g e-alidag. Kuni ab tahni mat am wo si i em-gewkemhunad mamt wo s-ap s-mai hegai mo wa g Jiosh am t-tashogid k ab aꞌai wo i e tatchuad hab masma mam d e-hajunim.

column2: I'm telling you this so that no one will fool you by spinning you a tale.
column3: Haꞌi o chum ha iattogid ch gam hu ha wanchshulig ab amjed g Christ. Kumt wabshaba pi ab hu wo ha kaiha, chum as hems hab wo e wuad mo s-apꞌe.

column2: Even though I'm not physically there with you, I'm with you in spirit. I'm so happy to see the way you stick together and how firm you are in your trust in Christ.
column3: Pi ani am hu haꞌichug em-wehm ch wabshaba chum hekid am em-chegito. Am amsh aꞌai i e wehmt ch s-gewkam ab s-wohochud g Jesus Christ. Kuni heg hekaj si s-ap ni-tahtk.

column2: Just as you accepted Christ Jesus as Lord, go on following him,
column3: Ab amt i e dagito Jesus Christ wui mat d wo em-kownaligk. K d hahawa em-wuikam mamt ab wo wechok ch am wo himad g e-doakag ch wehmaj d wo hemakok.

column2: grounded in him and built up by him. May your trust in him continue to grow strong, following what you were taught, full of gratitude to God.
column3: An g behꞌi g e-gewkdag ab amjed mamt heg amjed baꞌich i s-gewkam ab wo wohochudad mam has i masma mashchamas ch chum hekid ab wo i mahkchid g e-hoꞌigeꞌidadag.

column2: Watch out that nobody enslaves you through their philosophy and worthless delusions, following human traditions and concepts of this world, and not following Christ.
column3: S-e g wo nenꞌoidk mat pi hedai wo em-iattogi. Haꞌi ash chum s-em-mashchamamk hegai mo haschu d wabsh oꞌodham ha-mahchig ch em-ahgid mamt heg ab s-ap wo himad g e-doakag. Tt wabshaba ab wo beihid g t-mashchamadag ab amjed g Christ

column2: For the fullness of God's divine nature lives in Christ in bodily form,
column3: no pi heg d Jiosh am wehmaj g e-ohg, chum as hi wa hab masma ia jiwia mo g hemajkam.

column2: and you have been made full in him. He is supreme over every ruler and authority.
column3: Kumt am i e hemakoj g Christ wehm k wehmaj d hekiakam. K heg ab em-mahkch g wechij doakag ch d kownal am wehs ha dahm g kokownal am jewed dahm ch an dahm kahchim ch ed.

column2: You were “circumcised” in him but not by human hands. You have been set free from sinful human nature by the “circumcision” Christ performed.  You were buried with him in baptism, and you were raised with him through your trust in what God did by raising him from the dead.
column3: Heki ach hu wa t-pahl hikuchk ahchim Tutuligo am t-chehanig oidch. K wabshaba d t-himdag ahchim matt ab ihm g Christ matt wo t-pahl wakon k hab wo t-chehgi matt ab i t-hemakoj heg wehm k ab i t-wulꞌo pi ap t-tatchui amjed. Gd att hu t-wachumch shuhdagi wecho t-pahl wakonch k am ep i wuhsh shuhdagi t amjed. K id heg wa wepo matt ged hu t-hiash muhk k amjed ab uhpam i wuhsh muhkig amjed hab masma mat g Christ hab e juh.

column2: And even though you were dead because of your sins and being physically “uncircumcised,” he brought you to life together with him. He has forgiven us all our sins.  He wiped out the record of our debts according to the Law that was written down against us; he took away this barrier  by nailing it to the cross.
column3: Neh, ahpim mam d gawul mahs hemajkam ch pi edgid g t-chehanig am wa si gawulkdas ab Jiosh t amjed heg hekaj pi ap e-chuꞌijig. T wabshaba g Jiosh ab em-wui mahtchul g e-alidag. Kumt ab i s-wohochud k hab bei g wechij doakag. Jiosh alidag at ab nako g s-koꞌok t-namkidadag kots t ab k gm hu hab i juh g pi ap t-chuꞌijig.

column2: He stripped away the power of spiritual rulers and authorities, and having publicly revealed what they were truly like, he led them captive behind him in victory.
column3: Jiawul o chum s-wulshpamk g Jiosh alidag. T wabshaba ab i e wulꞌo gewkdaj amjed k gewito t-wehhejed k hab masma wehs ha gewito g jijawul.

column2: So don't let anyone criticize you for what you eat or what you drink, or regarding which religious festival, new moon ritual, or ceremonial sabbaths you choose to observe.  These are just a shadow of what was to come, for the physical reality is Christ.
column3: Jiosh ash wa hab masma ha chehani g Tutuligo mat am wa has mahs haꞌichu hugi wo koꞌad ch am hab wo junihid g mihshmda piast. Idam chehanig o am chum t-tashogidahim mat has wo masmak g Jiosh si Kehsha mat hekid wo jiwia. T wabshaba ia hahawa jiwia g Jiosh si Kehsha k am hejel i e tashogi t-wui. K hahawa pi hab mahs machs am hab wo junihid hegai hab mahs haꞌichu k ch hekaj wo chum s-mahchk g Jiosh si Kehsha.

column2: Don't let anyone cheat you out of your prize by insisting you have to beat yourself, or worship angels. They think they are better than anyone else because of visions they say they've had, and become ridiculously conceited in their sinful minds.
column3: Haꞌi o hab e elid mo em-baꞌich i s-apꞌe natsh pi haꞌichu nei am e-nena ed ch hab chum kaij mamt pi wo e doꞌibia k hoꞌip ab i e shoꞌigchud k ab wo i has ha elidad g anghil. Pi g wo shaꞌi ha wohochud. Ho o wabsh chum si e hahaschud g hejel e-chegitoidagkaj

column2: Such people are not connected to the head that directs the body, nourished and joined together through the body's sinews and muscles. As the body is united together it grows the way God wants it to grow.
column3: ch pi ab hu hiwig g Jiosh si Kehsha. K eda heg d t-moꞌo ch s-ap ab i t-dagioꞌid ch t-geꞌelid. Kuch ahchim ab ab giꞌi k ch ab ep aꞌai t-ab giꞌi hab masma mo g hon ch hab waꞌap masma i geꞌelhim.

column2: If you died with Christ to the religious demands that this world insists upon,  why would you make yourself subject to such demands as if you were still part of this world?
column3: Id o heg wa wepo matt heki hu koi nach pi d hemako heg wehm mat t-wehhejed muh. Heg at ab i t-wulꞌo heg amjed mo d wabsh hemajkam ha-mashchama. Pi g heg hekaj am haha wo i chum e apꞌechud Jiosh tahgio.

column2: Things like: don't handle that, don't taste that, don't touch that!
column3: Hegam mo em-kudut o ab chum em-chehani mamt pi an hu wo hudawgad ch jejkad ch tattamad haꞌichu i.

column2: These commands refer to things that don't last since they're used up, and they're based on man-made requirements and teachings.
column3: K wabshaba am wa s-apꞌe mamt wabsh wo hekaj mo haschu i s-apꞌe. T wabsh wo huhug e hekajk. Hegai mo d wabsh hemajkam ha-chehanig ch ha-mashchama

column2: Such rules may make some kind of sense to those who practice self-centered piety, who are so proud of being humble, and who “mortify the body;” but in reality they don't help at all in dealing with sinful desires.
column3: o pi woho d haꞌichu amichudadag. Bo em-ahgid mamt heg oidk wo e mihshmdad ch wo e shoꞌigchudad ch hab ab wo e shoꞌigchudad Jiosh wui. T wabshaba id pi wo shaꞌi dodolimagi g pi ap em-tatchui.

column2: So if you've been brought back to life with Christ, look for what comes from above, where Christ is, sitting at God's right hand.
column3: Jiosh at ab t-mah g wechij doakag ahchim matt ab ihm g alidaj mo d t-doꞌibiakam. K id heg wa wepo mat ab i t-wuwhas muhkig t amjed hab masma mat ab i wuhshad g e-alidag. Hemuch o an daha g alidaj s-apkojed hugidaj an ch am t-wehhejed apꞌechud matt wo wehmajk. Kutt heg wui am wo i t-gewpkai.

column2: Fix your mind on what's above, not what's here on earth.
column3: Pi g am hu wo chegitokad g jewed dahm haꞌichu ch wabshaba g dahm kahchim haꞌichu wo tatchuad.

column2: You died, and your life is kept safe with Christ in God.
column3: Jiosh at am i t-wehnadk g e-alidag. T heg heki hu muh k an hab chuꞌig dahm kahchim ch ed. K id heg wa wepo matt heki hu koꞌo k an wehmaj.

column2: When Christ—your life—is revealed, then you will also share in his visible glory.
column3: Ia at ep wo i wuhsh g Christ jewed dahm. Kutt am wehmaj wo i wuwhag k wepo masma wo si s-kehgajk.

column2: So kill your worldly nature—sexual sin, immorality, lust, evil desires, greedily wanting to have more—this is the worship of idols.
column3: Mt gam hu hab wo i juh g pi kehg e-tatchui ch pi kehg e-chegitoi k pi wo wehmaj woꞌiwua matp hedai pi d em-wehm kihkam k pi wo pihk e elidad mamt geꞌe haꞌichu wo bei. Hegai mat wo s-behim mo haschu pi ab hu d wuikamaj o heg jioshchud.

column2: Because of such things, those who disobey experience God's judgment.
column3: S-koꞌok namkidadag at ab ha ab wo gei hegam mo hab masma haꞌichu hab junihim.

column2: At one time you lived like that when you behaved in such a way,
column3: Ahpim o wa an em-uꞌukch g pi kehg tatchui. Kum wa g pi apꞌekam hab junihim.

column2: but now you should get rid of such things as anger, rage, wickedness, abuse, and using obscenities.
column3: An o wa em-uꞌukch g bagatalig ch hehgamdadag ch kehꞌidadag. Mt wabshaba hemuch im hu wehs hab wo i juh ihda pi apꞌekam ab e amjed k pi hekid pad wo neokad

column2: Don't lie to each other, since you've discarded your old self and what you used to do,
column3: ch pi haꞌichu wo ha iattogidad. Wehs at mukito ihda hab mahs haꞌichu ab em-ab.

column2: and put on your new self that is always being made more like your Creator, understanding better who he really is.
column3: Ab amt i e dagito Jiosh wui. T heg ab em-mah g wechij doakag k em-tatchuid mamt wo wepo masmak ch ab wo s-ap s-mahchk.

column2: In this new situation there's no Greek or Jew, circumcised or uncircumcised, foreigner, barbarian, slave or free, for Christ is everything, and he lives in all of us.
column3: Christ o d si s-has haꞌichu am t-wehhejed ahchim mach ab ihm. Heg doakag o am haꞌichug t-dodakag ed. Kuch heg hekaj ab i t-hemakochudch. Pi ach hahawa t-gawulkadch ab em-amjed ahchim mach d Tutuligo. Pi o has d ahga g pahl hikuchka. Pi o t-gawulkadch g haꞌichu t-amichudadag. Nenehol o d hemako ahchim t-wehm mach pi d nenehol. Wehsijj ach d hemako ab ihmch g Christ.

column2: Since you are God's special people, holy and dearly loved, adopt a sympathetic nature that is kind, humble, gentle, and patient.
column3: Jiosh o si pihk e elid t-hekaj ch ab i t-gawulkai. Kutt heg hekaj wo si pihk t-elidad ha hekaj g hemajkam ch wo s-hemajimak ch s-t-tahtk ch wo nakogad haꞌichu ch pi hab wo chum t-wuad machs d s-has hahaꞌichu am ha-nena ed.

column2: Be patient with one another, forgive others among you if you have grievances against one another. Just as the Lord forgave you, you should do the same.
column3: Jiosh at ab s-t-hoꞌigeꞌid k gam hu hab i juh g pi ap t-chuꞌijig. Kutt hab waꞌap wo s-ha bahbgi hegam mat hab wo juh g pi apꞌekam ab t-wui k hab waꞌap ab wo s-ha hoꞌigeꞌel.

column2: Above all, love one another, which is the perfect bond that will hold you together.
column3: Ab o t-ab matt aꞌai t-hekaj wo si pihk t-elidad ch hab s-ap d wo hemakok.

column2: May the peace of Christ direct your thinking, because you were called to this by God who makes you one, and thank God for it!
column3: Christ o ab em-makiog g s-ap tahhadkam. Ab g wo i hoꞌigeꞌidad heg hekaj ch wo si s-ap e tahtkkad ab aꞌai e wui nam pi d hemako heg wehm hab sha masma mam d honshpadaj.

column2: Let Christ's message fully live in you. In every wise way teach and instruct one another through psalms and hymns and spiritual songs, graciously singing praise to God from your hearts.
column3: Mt am wo s-chegitok g Christ haꞌichu ahga. Jiosh o ab em-makiog g amichudadag. Kumt ab aꞌai wo i e mashchamad ch wo ahgad g Jiosh oꞌohana ed nenꞌei ch mihshmda nenꞌei ch wo neꞌichudad g Jiosh ch ab wo i mahkchid g geꞌe hoꞌigeꞌidadag.

column2: Whatever you do, whether in word or action, do everything in the name of the Lord Jesus, praising God the Father through him.
column3: Wehs amt hab wo jundad g t-kownalig Jesus hegai mamt haschu hab wo junihid. Kumt ab wo hoꞌigeꞌidad g t-ohg Jiosh am gahi wuhshanim g Jesus.

column2: You married women, respect your husbands appropriately in the Lord.
column3: Ahpim uꞌuwi mam ab ihm g Christ amt ab wo s-wohog ha elidad g e-wehm kihkam. Bo masma em-tatchuid g Jiosh.

column2: You married men, love your wives and don't treat them badly.
column3: Kumt ahpim chechoj wo si pihk e elidad ha hekaj g e-wehm kihkam ch ab wabsh wo i s-ha bahbgi.

column2: You children, always do what your parents tell you because this is what pleases the Lord.
column3: Ahpim aꞌal amt ab wo s-wohog ha elidad g e-jehj chum hekid. Id o d tatchuij g Jiosh.

column2: You fathers, don't make your children mad, so they won't feel like giving up.
column3: Kumt ahpim ha-jehj pi am wo si ha babgachudad g e-aꞌaliga mat pi wo heb hu wua g e-chegitoidag.

column2: Those of you who are servants, do everything your human masters tell you, not with just an eye to please them, but honestly and sincerely, respecting the Lord.
column3: Ahpim mam d ha-pionag amt ab wo s-wohog ha elidad g e-aꞌamo wohoꞌi e-tatchui ab heg wabsh hekaj mam ab si has elid g Jiosh ch pi heg hekaj mas am wo em-nei g em-aꞌamo k wo s-hohhoꞌi g em-chikpan.

column2: Do whatever you do really well, as if you're doing it for God, and not for people,  because you know that the Lord will give you your reward—an inheritance! You're serving Christ the Lord!
column3: Pi o d waꞌi oꞌodham mo em-chikpnachud ch wabshaba d t-kownalig Jesus. Ab o him g tash mamt an wo wehmajk. T heg ab wo em-namkid heg hekaj em-chikpan. Kumt heg hekaj wohoꞌi e-tatchui ab am hab wo junihid g e-chikpan.

column2: Whoever does what's wrong will be paid back for the wrong they've done, and God has no favorites.
column3: T-kownalig Jesus at ep wo namkid hegai matp hedai hab wo juh g pi apꞌekam. Heg at wo bei g s-koꞌok e-namkidag. Jiosh at wehs wo ha lodai g hemajkam k hab masma wo ha namkid matp has i masma hab e junihim.

column2: You masters, treat your servants in a way that is right and fair, recognizing that you too have a Master in heaven.
column3: Ahpim aꞌamo amt s-ap ab wo ha neidad g e-pionag ch ep wo s-chegitok mam hab waꞌap ge ahmo. K heg an daha dahm kahchim ch ed ch d Jiosh.

column2: Remember to keep on praying, with an alert and thankful mind!
column3: Ahpim wehs g chum hekid wo e hoꞌigeꞌidahunad ch ab ep wo i hoꞌigeꞌidad g Jiosh.

column2: Pray for us too that God may open a door of opportunity to spread the message, to tell about the revealed mystery of Christ—which is the reason I'm here in prison.
column3: Chum ach s-ahgamk g Jiosh haꞌichu ahga ab amjed g alidaj. Kumt ab wo tai mat ab wo t-mah g apꞌedag matt hab wo t-juh. Dani lihso nani pi heg ahgachug.

column2: Pray that I may make it as clear as I should when I speak.
column3: Kumt ab wo tai g Jiosh mat hab wo ni-juh mant am si tasho wo ahgad.

column2: Behave wisely with outsiders, making the best use of every opportunity.
column3: Am g si s-e mamachim hab wo e junihid am ha-nena ed hegam mo pi ab hu ihm g Jiosh. Ab o em-mahkch g Jiosh g apꞌedag mamt hab wo junihid g s-apꞌekam. Am g s-ap wo hekaj g e-apꞌedag.

column2: Always be gracious when you speak. Make sure it's in good taste, and think about how best to answer everyone.
column3: Kumt chum hekid s-hemajim wo neneokad ch wo s-ta kakaim haꞌichu ahgad. Do em-wuikam mamt wo s-mahchk mamt has masma s-ap ab uhpam wo i nodagi g neꞌoki ab wui g hemajkam haꞌichu kakkei.

column2: Tychicus will tell you all about what's happening to me. He's a dear brother, a trustworthy minister and co-worker in the Lord.
column3: Ia o t-wehmaj hegai mo hab chehgig Tychicus ch s-ap hab junihim g Jiosh chikpan.

column2: I'm sending him to you for this very reason—so that you'll know how things are with me and this will cheer you up.
column3: Kuni chehani mat am wo i em-chehgimed k am wo i em-gewkemhu am em-ahgidk mach has waꞌi masma.

column2: Onesimus is going with him too, a trusted and dear brother, who's one of you. They'll explain to you everything that's going on here.
column3: T heg wo oi em-wehm kihkam Onesimus k d hahawa t-wehm wohochuddam. Idam at am wo i em-ahgi wehs haꞌichu mo hab e junihim iia.

column2: Aristarchus who's with me here in prison sends his best wishes; likewise Mark, Barnabas' cousin (you've already had instructions to welcome him if he visits you),
column3: Aristarcas o ni-wehm d ep lihso k ch am ep i em-hoꞌigeꞌelid. K hegai Mark mo d Barnabas maꞌi am ep i em-hoꞌigeꞌelid. Heki ani hu em-ahgid mamt id am wo i wahkid k wo kaiha matp am wo hih em-wui.

column2: and Jesus—also called Justus—who are the only Jewish Christians among those working with me here for the kingdom of God, men who have been a great help to me.
column3: Joshua Justus o am hab waꞌap i em-hoꞌigeꞌelid. Do waꞌi idam waik mo d Tutuligo hemajkam ch ni-wehm chikpan am wehhejed g Jiosh. Kuni ha hekaj am si i ni-gewkemhun.

column2: Epaphras who is one of you and a servant of Christ Jesus, sends his greetings. He's always passionate in his prayers on your behalf, praying that you'll stand firm as grown-up Christians, totally convinced about everything as God would want.  For the record I can tell you that he's done a lot for you, and for those in Laodicea and Hierapolis as well.
column3: K ia ep dak ch am i em-hoꞌigeꞌelid hegai em-wehm kihkam mo hab chehgig Epaphras. Nt wo em-ahgi mo id chum hekid si e hoꞌigeꞌidahun am em-wehhejed ch am ha wehhejed hegam mo am kih Laodicea t am ch hegam mo am kih Hieropolis t am. Ab o tahni g mat Jiosh ab wo i gewkai g em-wohochudadag. Mt hab s-ap wo s-wohog elidad g Jiosh.

column2: Luke, our dear doctor, and Demas also send their best.
column3: Ihda si t-tatchuidch t-nawoj Luke mo d mahkai o am ep i em-hoꞌigeꞌelid. K g Demas am ep i em-hoꞌigeꞌelid.

column2: Greet the believers that are in Laodicea—Nympha too, and the church that meets in her house.
column3: Am g wo ha ahgid g t-wehm wohochuddam am Laodicea t am ch hegam mo am e-mihshmad kihj am g Nymphas mat ab wo s-t-hoꞌigeꞌel.

column2: And when this letter has been read to you, make sure it's read to the church in Laodicea too, and that you also read the letter sent to Laodicea.
column3: Ihda oꞌohana amt am wo neꞌokchulid k gam hu haha wo ha mah hegam mo am kih Laodicea t am. T am epai wo neꞌokchul. T hegam ab epai wo em-mah hegai mant ha oꞌohani. Kumt am epai wo neꞌokchul.

column2: Tell Archippus, “See that you follow through in doing the ministry God gave you.”
column3: Mt wo ahgi g Archipus mat am wo i nahto hegai Jiosh chikpan mani wa hab ahgid.

column2: I Paul write my closing greetings with my own hand. Remember I'm in prison. Grace be with you.
column3: Hejel ant an wo oꞌoha ihda wawnim ahni Paul mant am wo si em-hoꞌigeꞌel. Pi g wo shaꞌi pi chegito mani ia hu kuhpi.

column2: Grace and peace to you from God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ.
column3: Ab o wa si s-em-hoꞌigeꞌid g Jiosh t-ohg g t-kownalig Jesus Christ wehm ch ab wo wa baꞌich i em-mahkad g i wehmtadag ch s-ap tahhadkam.

column2: Praise God the Father of our Lord Jesus Christ, who has blessed us in Christ with all that's spiritually good in the heavenly world,
column3: Jiosh o ab wehs t-makiog g e-hoꞌigeꞌidadag nach pi ab s-wohochud g alidaj. Kutt heg hekaj ab wo si hoꞌigeꞌidad.

column2: just as he chose us to be in him  before the beginning of this world, so that in love we could be holy and without fault before him.
column3: Pi at wa koi haꞌichu shaꞌi nahto g Jiosh k hab i e ah mat ab wo i t-gawulkai matt d wo hekia s-apꞌekamk am tahgio ch pi wo ha chuꞌijigk. Si o pihk e elid t-hekaj

column2: He decided in advance to adopt us as his children, working through Jesus Christ to bring us to himself. He was happy to do this because this is what he wanted.
column3: ch am i apꞌech mat g alidaj am hab wo t-juh matt hab waꞌap d wo aꞌaligajk.

column2: So we praise him for his glorious grace that he so kindly gave us in his beloved Son.
column3: Heg att hekaj ab wo si hehgchulidad g Jiosh. Si o s-ap ab t-neid nach pi d hemako g si tatchuidch alidaj wehm.

column2: Through him we gain salvation through his blood, the forgiveness of our sins as a result of his priceless grace
column3: Heg ehꞌed at am e iawua kots t ab. Kut ab nako g s-koꞌok t-namkidadag mat gam hu hab wo i juh g pi ap t-chuꞌijig k wo t-doꞌibia. Si o geꞌej g Jiosh hemajimatalig ab t-wui.

column2: that he so generously provided for us, together with all wisdom and understanding.
column3: Ab o t-mahkch g haꞌichu mahchig ch haꞌichu amichudadag.

column2: He revealed to us his previously-hidden will through which he was happy to pursue his plan
column3: Pi o ta machima g Jiosh hab elida. T wabshaba heki hu am i apꞌech mat iaꞌi idani haha wo t-mahtchul.

column2: at the appropriate time to bring everyone  together in Christ—those in heaven and those on the earth.
column3: K id hab d elidaj matsh g Christ d wo kownalk wehs haꞌichu dahm. Am at i apꞌech g tash matsh wehs haꞌichu ab wo i hemakoj Christ wecho. Wehs hegai mo an dahm kahchim ch ed ch hegai mo in jewed dahm at ab wo wechokad.

column2: In him—we were chosen beforehand, according to the plan of the One who is working everything out according to his will,
column3: Wehs at hab wo e juh g Jiosh hab elida. K hab d elidaj ged hu i shohshon k amjed mat wehpeg ab wo i t-gawulkai ahchim Tutuligo.

column2: That's the reason, because I've heard of your trust in the Lord Jesus and the love that you have for all Christians,
column3: Ab amtsh i s-wohoch mo g Jesus d em-kownalig k si pihk e elid wehs ha hekaj g e-wehm wohochuddam.

column2: why I never stop thanking God for you and remember you in my prayers.
column3: Kuni heg hekaj chum hekid ab hoꞌigeꞌid g Jiosh.

column2: I pray that the God of our Lord Jesus Christ, the glorious Father, may give you a spirit of wisdom to see and know him as he really is.
column3: Jiosh o d si geꞌe s-apꞌekam ch d ohgaj g t-kownalig Jesus Christ. Kuni ab tahni mat ab wo em-mahkchid g amichudadag ch am baꞌich wo i e tashogidad em-wui. Mt hab baꞌich wo i s-ap s-mahchk g Jiosh.

column2: May your minds be enlightened so you can understand the hope he's called you to—
column3: Ab ani tahni mat wo em-tashogi mamt has wo masmak am ep i e chechegitok ch haschu wo edgidad mam d ab waidaj ch ab gawulkdas wehhejed.

column2: the glorious riches he promises as an inheritance to his trustworthy people. May you also understand God's amazing power
column3: Mt ep wo s-mahchk mat wehs wo hekaj g e-gewkdag am t-wehhejed ahchim mach ab s-wohochud. K g gewkdaj si geꞌej.

column2: that he demonstrated in raising Christ from the dead. God seated Christ at his right hand in heaven,
column3: Am at wa chehgi g e-gewkdag id hekaj matki ab i wuhshad g e-alidag muhkig amjed k ab dai s-apkojed e-hugid ab an dahm kahchim ch ed

column2: far above any other ruler, authority, power, or lord, or any leader with all their titles—not only in this world, but also in the coming world too.  God has made everything subject to the authority of Christ, and has given him the responsibility as head over everything for the church,
column3: mat d wo kownalk wehs haꞌichu dahm. Dahm kahchim ch ed kokownal ch jewed dahm kokownal o wehsijj ab wecho g Jiosh alidag.

column2: which is his body, filled full and made complete by Christ, who fills and brings everything to completion.
column3: Ch ahchim d hemajkamgaj ch wehmaj d hemako hab sha masma mach d honshpadaj. K heg d t-moꞌo. Kuch am t-wehm d hekiakam. K eda heg an wehsko haꞌichug ch wehs haꞌichu an uꞌukch ch wehs haꞌichu himchud am t-wehhejed.

column2: At one time you were dead in your sins and evil actions,
column3: Heki am hu pi edgid ihda wechij doakag nam pi d pi ap chuꞌijkam ch pi ab hu kaiham g Jiosh.

column2: living your lives according to the ways of the world, under the control of the devil,  whose spirit is at work in those who disobey God.
column3: Jijawul ha-geꞌejig o an em-uꞌukch hab masma mo an wehs ha uꞌukch hegam mo pi ab hu kaiham g Jiosh. Kum hegam ha oidch am hab e junihim ch ab s-wohog elid g ge Jiawul.

column2: All of us were once like that, our behavior determined by the desires of our sinful human nature and our evil way of thinking. Like everyone else, in our nature we were children of anger.
column3: Wehsijj ach hab wa masmakahim ch am hab junihim g hejel pi ap hab t-elida. K wa ab t-wui him g s-koꞌok t-namkidadag.

column2: But God in his generous mercy, because of the amazing love he had for us  even while we were dead in our sins, has made us alive together with Christ. Trusting in him has saved you!
column3: Pi ach wa ab hu wohog elid g Jiosh ch gam hu gawulkdas ab amjed heg hekaj pi ap t-chuꞌijig. K wabshaba g Jiosh t-hekaj si pihk e elid ch si s-hemajim t-doꞌibia ab amjed g t-chuꞌijig k ab t-mah g wechij doakag. Id o heg wa wepo mat heki hu ab i t-wuwhas muhkig t amjed

column2: He raised us up with Christ, and in Christ Jesus seated us with him in heaven,
column3: k am uhgk i t-uꞌu k an e-hugid an t-toa hab masma matsh hab juh g si e-alidag. Kuch hemu in melchud g Jesus kownaltalig jewed dahm hab masma mattsh an hahawa hab wo junihid dahm kahchim ch ed.

column2: so that in all eternity to come he could demonstrate the amazing extent of his grace in showing us kindness through Christ Jesus.
column3: Id at wehs am hab t-juni g Jiosh gahi wuhshanim g e-alidag. K hab d elidaj mat hab masma wehs am wo ha chehgi imhab i amjed mo has masma si s-hemajima ch ab si t-tatchua.

column2: For you've been saved by grace through trusting in him—it's not through yourselves, it's the gift of God!
column3: Ab at i s-t-hoꞌigeꞌel g Jiosh k doꞌibia natt pi ab i s-wohoch. Pi att wo shaꞌi t-nako machs hejel wo t-doꞌibia. Chum hems g t-wohochudadag o d mahkigdaj.

column2: This has nothing to do with human effort, so don't be proud of yourselves.
column3: Pi o am hu haꞌichug machs haschukaj wo chum si t-gimaihunad no pi pi hejel hab d t-juni machs hekaj t-doꞌibia.

column2: We're the product of what God does, created in Christ Jesus to do good, which God already planned that we should do.
column3: Ab at i t-mah g Jiosh ihda wechij doakag. Kuki hab d elidaj matt hekaj am hab wo junihid hegai s-ap chikpan mat heki hu am i apꞌech am t-wehhejed.

column2: So you who are “foreigners” humanly-speaking, called “uncircumcised” by those who are “circumcised” (which is only a procedure carried out by human beings), you need to remember
column3: Am g wo s-chegitok ahpim gawul mahs hemajkam mam has i masma mamt eda koi ab hu i s-wohoch g Christ. Pi am wa pahl hikuchkas hab masma mach ahchim Tutuligo.

column2: that once you had no relationship to Christ. You were barred as foreigners from being citizens of Israel, strangers to the covenant God had promised. You had no hope and you lived in the world without God.
column3: K g Jiosh pi ab hu em-mahkch hegai mo haschu ab t-mahkch ch pi ab hu em-mahtchulid mat ia wo i wuhshad g e-alidag mat d wo si Kehshajk. Kum wa pi ab hu wui i e gewpkad g Jiosh

column2: But now, in Christ Jesus, you who were once a long way off have been brought near by the blood of Christ. Christ is our peace. Through his body he made the two into one, and broke down the separating wall of hostility that divided us,  freeing us from the law with its requirements and regulations. He did this so he could create in himself one new person out of the two and so make peace,  and completely reconcile both of them to God through the cross as if they were just one body, having destroyed our hostility towards each other.
column3: ch pi mahch ch pi edgid g chehanigaj. Kuch wa heg hekaj s-em-kehꞌid. M ahpim ab aigo hab waꞌap s-t-kehꞌid. K hegai t-kehꞌidadag hab sha masma mo g kolhai ch gam hu aꞌai t-gaꞌagwulkadch. T wabshaba g Christ s-ap am oidk hab e juh ihda chehanig k ab e muhkid kots t ab t-wehhejed k hab masma hugio g gewkdaj g chehanig. K heg pi ab hu hahawa t-chuꞌijigchud ahchim mach ab s-wohochud g Jiosh. Jesus Christ at ab i t-hemakoj e wehm. Kuch pi hahawa aꞌai s-t-kehꞌid nach pi d hahawa hemako.

column2: He came and shared the good news of peace with those of you who were far away, and those who were nearby,
column3: Pegih, ia at wa jiwia g Jiosh alidag jewed dahm k am ahgachug t-shahgid ihda doꞌibiadag ahga matt am hahawa em-wui uꞌapa ahpim gawul mahs hemajkam mam wa pi shaꞌi mahch g Jiosh.

column2: because through him we both gain access to the Father through the same Spirit.
column3: K g Jiosh hab waꞌap ab em-mahkch g apꞌedag ahpim mamt hab waꞌap ab i s-wohochud k ab wui i e dagito. K hab waꞌap an em-uꞌukch g Hekia S-apꞌekam Gewkdag.

column2: That means you're no longer strangers and foreigners; you are fellow citizens of God's people and belong to God's family
column3: Pi am d haha wabsh mehkjed oꞌodham ch wabshaba d aꞌaligaj g Jiosh. K g Jiosh ab em-mahkch g apꞌedag am e-kihdag ed hab masma mo ahchim ab t-mahkch.

column2: that's being built on the foundation of the apostles and prophets, with Christ Jesus as the cornerstone.
column3: Id o heg wa wepo mam d Jiosh kihta. Kuch heg wa wepo mach d kih shon ahchim mach haꞌi d Jesus si chuhchai ch haꞌi d Jiosh haꞌichu i tashogiddam. K g Jesus an wehsijj t-uꞌukch hab masma mach an ab kihtas.

column2: In him the whole building is joined together, growing to form a holy temple for the Lord.
column3: Am o wabsh kia geꞌedahim ihda kih no pi g Jiosh i ha baꞌihamahim hegam mo ab hahawa s-wohochud.

column2: You too are being built together in him as a place for God to live by the Spirit.
column3: Kuch wehsijj t-wehm si s-ap hab chuꞌig ch d s-apꞌekam cheopi no pi g Hekia S-apꞌekam Gewkdag am t-eda.

column2: This is why, I, Paul, a prisoner of Jesus Christ for the sake of you foreigners,
column3: Ia am ni-kuhpch nani pi ahgachug g Jiosh haꞌichu ahga am ha shahgid g nahnko mahs hemajkam. Kuni am ni-hoꞌigeꞌidahun Jiosh wui em-wehhejed nam pi d ni-wehm wohochuddam.

column2: (well, I'm assuming you've heard that God gave me the specific responsibility of sharing God's grace with you),
column3: Am amtp hu waꞌi kah mo ab ni-wui si s-hemajima g Jiosh ch ab ni-mah ihda chikpan mant hekaj wo i em-wehmajk.

column2: how, by what God showed me, made clear the mystery that was previously hidden. I wrote to you briefly before about this,
column3: Am at i ni-chehgi g s-aꞌagi e-apchuda mant ia heꞌes hekaj em-oꞌohani.

column2: and when you read this you'll be able to understand my insight into the mystery of Christ.
column3: Kumt wo s-mai am neꞌokchulidch ihda mant am em-oꞌohani mani has masma s-amichud ihda s-aꞌagi haꞌichu ab amjed g Christ.

column2: In past generations this wasn't made clear to anyone, but now it's been revealed to God's holy apostles and prophets by the Spirit
column3: Id o heki hu pi mahch g hemajkam. T wabshaba g Hekia S-apꞌekam Gewkdag hemuch am hahawa i t-tashogi ahchim Jesus Christ chuhchai ch Jiosh haꞌichu i tashogiddam.

column2: that foreigners are joint heirs, part of the same body, and in Christ Jesus share together in the promise through the good news.
column3: Ihda s-aꞌagi haꞌichu ahga o hab chuꞌig mam ahpim gawul mahs hemajkam ab hahawa t-wehm apꞌedag ahchim Tutuligo id eda Jiosh hoꞌigeꞌidalig. Jiosh o ab t-mahkch g e-apꞌedag nach pi ab s-wohochud g haꞌichu ahgaj ch ab hiwig g Jesus Christ.

column2: I became a minister of this good news through the gift of God's grace that I was given by his power that was at work in me.
column3: Kuni ahni d em-pionag ch am em-ahgid ihda s-kehg haꞌichu ahgaj g Jiosh. Heg at si s-ni-hoꞌigeꞌid k am i ni-kehsh k ab ni-mah g gewkdag mant wo em-ahgi.

column2: This grace was given to me, the least important of all Christians, in order to share with the foreigners the incredible value of Christ,
column3: Shahag wepo mani ahni wehs ha baꞌich d wabsh pi haꞌichu am ha shahgid g Jiosh hemajkamga. T eda g Jiosh ab ni-mah ihda apꞌedag mant am wo em-ahgi ahpim nahnko mahs hemajkam g s-kehg haꞌichu ahgaj ab amjed g Christ hoꞌigeꞌidalig. Heg o baꞌich i si s-kehg s-ap hab chuꞌig mo hig chumpk g si geꞌe kaisdag. Kutt pi wo t-nako matt wehs wo s-amich.

column2: and to help everyone see the purpose of the mystery which from the very beginning was hidden in God who made everything.
column3: Id o d ni-chikpan mant am wo i ha tashogi g hemajkam mo has masma hab chuꞌig ihda s-aꞌagi haꞌichu apchudaj g Jiosh. Jiosh at wehs haꞌichu nahto k wabshaba pi mahsko wua ihda s-kehg hab e-elida muꞌi aꞌahidag oidam

column2: God's plan was that the various aspects of his wisdom would be revealed through the church to the rulers and authorities in heaven.
column3: nat pi iaꞌi idani wo ha chehgi g anghil kokownal g muꞌi nahnko mahs haꞌichu e-amichudadag am gai t-wuhshanim ahchim mat t-doꞌibia.

column2: This was in accordance with God's eternal purpose that he carried out in Christ Jesus our Lord.
column3: Jiosh at am hab juh ihda gahi wuhshanim g t-kownalig Jesus Christ mat has i masma apꞌech ga hu i wehpeg.

column2: Because of him and our trust in him we can come to God in total freedom and confidence.
column3: Kuch apꞌedag matt si s-gegokim ab wo i miabi g Jiosh ab s-wohochudch g haꞌichu ahgaj ab amjed g alidaj.

column2: So I'm asking that you don't get discouraged that I'm suffering—it's for you and you should value that!
column3: Ab ani shoak em-wui mamt am wabsh wo si i e gewpkad k pi has wo e tahtkkad mani ni-shoꞌigchud em-wehhejed. Wehs o d wabsh em-apꞌedag ihda ni-shoꞌigdag.

column2: This is why I kneel before the Father
column3: Id ani wehs am i chechegitod ch hekaj ab i gegshshe heg wui mat wehs haꞌichu nahto.

column2: from whom every family in heaven and on earth receives its nature and character,
column3: Wehs nahnko dakam hemajkam ch anghil o d nahtoij. T heg ab ha mah g ha-chechgig.

column2: asking him that out of his wealth of glory he may strengthen you in your innermost being with power through his Spirit.
column3: Wehs o edgid g gewkdag g Jiosh ch geꞌe ab t-makiog. Kuni ab tahni mat baꞌich ab wo i em-mah. Hekia S-apꞌekam Gewkdag o am t-eda haꞌichug ch ab t-makiog g Jiosh gewkdag.

column2: May Christ live in your hearts as you trust in him, so that as you are planted deep in love,
column3: Id o heg wa wepo mo g Christ am t-eda kih. Ab ani tahni g Jiosh mamt chum hekid hab wo masmak mo g Christ ch wo si pihk e elidad ab wehs ha wui.

column2: you may have the power to comprehend with all God's people the breadth and length and height and depth of Christ's love.  May you know the love of Christ that surpasses knowledge, so that you're made full and complete by the fullness of God.
column3: Shoꞌo waꞌi si geꞌej g Christ tatchuidag ab t-wui. Pi at hedai wo e nako mat wabsh hejel wo s-mai mo heꞌes i geꞌej. Kuni ab tahni g Jiosh mat am wo tashogidad em-wui mamt wo s-ap s-mahchk. T hab wo i em-shuhdad g Jiosh gewkdag.

column2: Now may he who—through his power working in us—can do infinitely more than we ever ask for or even think about,
column3: Jiosh at wo e nako mat baꞌich i geꞌe haꞌichu hab wo t-juni mach hems heꞌes ab i chum tahni o hems heꞌes i chegitod. Heg o hekaj hab t-junid e-gewkdag mo am chikpan t-eda.

column2: may he be glorified in the church and in Christ Jesus through all generations for ever and ever. Amen.
column3: Kutt chum hekid ab wo hehgchulidad ahchim mach d hemako g t-kownalig Jesus Christ wehm.

column2: So I—this prisoner in the Lord—am encouraging you to make sure you live according to the principles to which you were called.
column3: Dani lihso heg hekaj mani ahgachug g haꞌichu ahga ab amjed g t-kownalig Jesus. Kuni ab si s-em-hoꞌigeꞌidam am em-ahgid mamt hab wo masmak mo has masma g Jiosh em-tatchuid ch ab i em-gawulkai.

column2: Don't think proudly of yourselves; be gentle and patient, showing tolerance to each other in love.
column3: Pi g am wo chum si e haꞌichuchudad ch wabshaba wo s-hehemajimak ch chum hekid ab wo s-e bahbgik ch ab aꞌai wo e tatchuad. Am g wo e chehgidad mam ab aꞌai e tatchua.

column2: Make every effort to remain one in the Spirit through the peace that binds you together.
column3: Ab at i t-hemakoch g Hekia S-apꞌekam Gewkdag. Pegih, mt wo si s-ap e tahtkkad ab aꞌai e wui mamt pi gam hu aꞌai wo i e gaꞌagwulkai.

column2: For there's one body, and one Spirit, just as you were called to one hope.
column3: Heg o wa wepo mach d honshpadaj g Christ nach pi d hemako ab wecho. Dach hemako no pi g Hekia S-apꞌekam Gewkdag d waꞌi hemako ch am wehsijj t-eda. Kuch d hemako nach pi am t-wepo t-gewpkadch heg wui mo g Jiosh am t-wehhejed apꞌechudch dahm kahchim ch ed.

column2: The Lord is one, our trust in him is one, and there's one baptism;
column3: Wehsijj ach d hemako nach pi ab wecho g hemako kownal ch t-wepo haꞌichu ab s-wohochud ch t-wepo t-pahl wapko.

column2: there's one God and Father of everyone. He is over all and through all and in all.
column3: Dach hemako no pi g Jiosh d waꞌi hemako ch wehsijj d t-ohg ch wehs t-dahm d kownal ch an wehsko hab chuꞌig ch am ep wehsijj t-eda haꞌichug.

column2: To each of us grace was given in proportion to Christ's generous gift.
column3: Christ at wehsijj ab i t-mahkhi hegai matt hekaj ab aꞌai wo i t-wehmajk.

column2: As Scripture says, “When he ascended to the heights he took captives with him, and gave gifts to humanity.”
column3: Bo chuꞌig g Jiosh heki hu oꞌohana:

column2: We shouldn't be little children any more, tossed about and blown along by every passing breeze of doctrine, confused by human trickery, led into error by crafty people who deceitfully scheme;
column3: Pi att hab haha wo masmak mo g aꞌal machs in has aꞌai gawul wo junihid g t‑wohochudadag. T hab pi wo e nako hegam mo am nahnko masma e nakog mat wo t‑iattogi.

column2: instead by speaking the truth in love we ought to grow up in everything into Christ, who is our head.
column3: Am att wo ahgad g wohokam ab pihk t‑elidch ha wui ch am wo i geꞌegeꞌehogat matt hab wo masmak mo g Christ. Heg o wa wepo mo g Christ d t‑moꞌo.

column2: It's because of him that the whole body operates, every joint holding it together as each individual part does what it's supposed to, and the whole body grows, building itself up in love.
column3: Ch ahchim d honshpadaj mach ab wui t‑dagitokch ch s‑ap t‑wehm chikpan hab masma mach nahnko mahs d chuhchuꞌidaj. Batt waꞌi masma am wo i geꞌegeꞌehogat t‑wohochudadag ed matt ab aꞌai wo si t‑tatchuad ch am wo i t‑wehmajk.

column2: So let me say this to you—in fact I insist on it in the Lord—that you should no longer live like the foreigners do, in their empty-headed way.
column3: Pi g am hu ha oidk hab wo masmak hegam mo pi mahch g Jiosh. Id o d t‑kownalig Jesus chehanig. Hegam mo pi mahch g Jiosh o wabsh pehegi haꞌichu chegito

column2: In the darkness of their minds they don't understand, and they have been cut off from the life of God because they don't know anything and in their stubbornness they don't want to know.
column3: ch pi haꞌichu aꞌamichud ch ep pi chechkaidag. Id o heg wa wepo mo am s‑chuhugam k ed hihim. K g Jiosh heg hekaj pi ab hu ha mahkch g wechij doakag.

column2: Because they are past caring they abandon themselves to sensuality, and greedily do all kinds of disgusting things.
column3: Pi o edgid g si edadag no pi am wabsh e dagitokch pi apꞌekam wui ch hab junihim g nahnko mahs si s‑uam haꞌichu.

column2: But that's not what you learned about Christ!  Didn't you hear about him? Weren't you taught concerning him? Didn't you learn the truth as it is in Jesus?
column3: Mtsh wabshaba ahpim ab kah g doꞌibiadag ahga k am i s‑mai g Christ. Am amsh em‑mashcham g wohokam ab amjed. Mt amjed pi hab wo chum masmak mo hegam mo pi mahch g Jiosh.

column2: So get rid of your former lifestyle, that old nature that ruins you through deceptive desires!
column3: Im g hu hab wo i juhni g pi ap e‑tatchui. Heg o wa em‑iattogid ch em‑padchud.

column2: Let yourselves be re-made spiritually and mentally,
column3: T wabshaba g Jiosh am hab wo em‑juh mat g em‑tatchui ch em‑doakag d wo hekia s‑apꞌekamk.

column2: and put on your new nature that God created so you will be like him, right and holy in the truth.
column3: Jiosh o ab t‑mahkch g wechij doakag. K ihda doakag wepo masma mo g Jiosh doakag ch am e chehgidch mo heg waꞌi tatchua s‑apꞌekam. Am g wo himad g e‑wechij doakag ch am wabsh wo dagito g pi apꞌekam.

column2: So reject lies, and tell the truth to each other—for we belong to each other.
column3: Dach t‑wehm wohochuddam ch heg wa wepo mach d Christ honshpadag. K pi hab chum mahs machs aꞌai wo t‑iattogidad o hedai i ehp. Am g hab wo kaijjid g wohokam.

column2: Don't sin by getting angry; don't let evening come and find you still mad—
column3: Hemho wa amt wo babgat ab pi apꞌekam wui k wabshaba pi heg hekaj hab wo juh g pi apꞌekam. S‑hohtam g wo dagito g e‑bagatalig.

column2: and don't give the devil any opportunity.
column3: T hab pi wo e nako g Jiawul mas am hab wo em‑juh mamt hab wo juh g pi apꞌekam.

column2: Thieves, stop your stealing, and do honest, productive work with your hands, so you'll have something to give to those who need it.
column3: T wo haꞌasa haꞌichu ha ehs hegam matp hedai haꞌichu ha ehsid. Ab o hab waꞌap ha ab mat wo chikpanad ch heg amjed ab wo edgidad mat haschukaj am wo i ha wehmt g shoꞌigkam.

column2: Don't use bad language. Speak words that will encourage people as necessary, so that those who listen will be helped.
column3: Pi g am wo pi kehg neneokad ch wabshaba wo s‑ap neneokad ch ab aꞌai wo i e gewkemhunad. T g em‑neꞌoki hab masma d wo i ha wehmtadagk hegam mat hedai wo i em‑kahkad.

column2: Don't disappoint the Holy Spirit of God that marked you as belonging to him until the day of redemption.
column3: Pi g am wo pi ap tahtchud g Hekia S‑apꞌekam Gewkdag. Do hegai mo am t‑eda ulinig. Kuch heg hekaj s‑mahch mat g Jiosh s‑ap am wo i t‑wahpki e‑kihdag ed.

column2: Get rid of every kind of bitterness, rage, anger, verbal abuse, and insults, along with all forms of evil.
column3: Im g hu hab wo i juhni g kehꞌidadag ch pi amkadag ch bagatalig ch kawhaina ch has ahgadag.

column2: Be kind and compassionate to each other, forgiving one another, just as God in Christ forgave you.
column3: Jiosh at im hu hab i juh g pi ap t‑chuꞌijig matt ab i s‑wohoch g Christ. Kumt ahpim hab wa masma ab aꞌai wo s‑e hoꞌigeꞌidad ch im hu hab wabsh wo i juh matp hema i chum s‑koꞌokam has wo em‑juh.

column2: So then, imitate God since you're his much-loved children.
column3: Ab o si t‑tatchua g Jiosh. Kutt am oidch hab wo t‑junihid nach pi d aꞌaligaj.

column2: Live in love, just as Christ loved you. He gave himself for us, a gift and sacrificial offering to God like a sweet-smelling perfume.
column3: Christ o am hab junihim g e‑ohg Jiosh tatchui ch ab si t‑tatchua ch am t‑wehhejed e muhkid. Kutt ahchim hab waꞌap ab aigo wo si tatchuad ch ab aꞌai wo si t‑tatchuad.

column2: Sexual immorality or any kind of indecency or greed should never be mentioned concerning you, as God's people should not be doing such things.
column3: Dach Jiosh hemajkamga. K pi hab chum mahs machs wo ha wehm woꞌiwua matp hedai pi d t‑wehm kihkam o achs wo chegito g s‑uam haꞌichu o achs wo s‑behim matp haschu pi ab hu d t‑wuikam.

column2: Obscene talk, stupid chatter, and coarse jokes are totally inappropriate—instead you should be thanking God.  You know it's absolutely sure that no-one who is sexually immoral, or commits indecency, or who is greedy, or is an idol-worshiper will inherit anything in the kingdom of Christ and God.
column3: S‑mahch am mat pi am hu wo i ha wahpki g Jiosh hegam mo hab wa masma. Hegai mat wo s‑behim mo haschu pi ab hu d wuikamaj o heg jioshchud. (4) K pi hab chum mahs machs s‑bihtagim wo neneokad o achs pehegi wo neneokad. Ab g wo hoꞌigeꞌidad g Jiosh.

column2: Don't let anyone fool you with lying words, for it's because of such things that God's judgment is passed on the children of disobedience.
column3: Haꞌi oki hab kaij mo am wa s‑apꞌe hegam mo hab masma hab e junihim. Kumt wabshaba pi ab hu wo kaiha g pehegi ha‑neꞌoki. Jiosh at hemho wa s‑koꞌokam wo ha namkid hegam mat pi ab hu wo s‑wohog el.

column2: So don't partner with them in this.
column3: An g hu wabsh wo ha neidad hegam hab mahs hemajkam ch pi am hu ha oidch hab wo e junihid.

column2: At one time you were darkness, but now you are light in the Lord. You are to live as children of light
column3: Ahpim amsh hab waꞌap masma heki hu. Heg o wa wepo mam wa am s‑chuhugam k ed hihimad ch am hahawa i wuwha tonlig ch ed namt pi hahawa s‑mai g t‑kownalig Jesus Christ. Pegih, mt am wo hihimad g e‑doakag id eda s‑apꞌekam tonlig

column2: (and the fruit of light is everything that's good and right and true),
column3: ch hab masma hab wo junihid g s‑apꞌekam ch wo ahgad g wohokam.

column2: demonstrating what the Lord really appreciates.
column3: T g t‑kownalig Jesus wo s‑hohhoꞌidad hegai mam haschu hab wua.

column2: Don't have anything to do with the pointless things that darkness produces—instead expose them.  It's shameful even to speak about the things such people do secretly,
column3: Pi amt am hu wo ha wehmajk hegam mo hab junihim g pi apꞌekam. Dat wo s‑ta edam haꞌichuk mamt chum hems heg ab wo neneokad mo haschu s‑aꞌagi hab wua idam. Kumt wabshaba wo ha ahgi mo pi ap hab e junihim.

column2: but when anything is exposed by the light then it's revealed as it is. Light makes everything visible.  That's why it's said, “Wake up, those of you who are sleeping, rise up from the dead, and Christ will shine on you.”
column3: T haha wo s‑e mahchk mo has chuꞌig. Bo d ahga ihda cheꞌidag mo hab chuꞌig:

column2: So be careful how you live your life, not foolishly, but wisely,
column3: Am g wo si s‑e nenꞌoidk mamt has masma wo himchudad g e‑doakdag ch pi hab wo masmak mam d wabsh pi haꞌichu aꞌamichuddam.

column2: making the best use of opportunities because the days are evil.
column3: Geꞌej o g pi apꞌekam hemu. K wabshaba g Jiosh ab t‑mahkch g apꞌedag matt hab wo junihid g s‑apꞌekam. Am g s‑ap wo hekaj g e‑apꞌedag.

column2: So don't be ignorant—find out what the Lord's will is.
column3: Jiosh o am em‑wui tashogid g e‑tatchui. Am g wo si i aꞌamichud k wo s‑mai mo haschu wud.

column2: Don't get drunk on wine which will wreck your life, but be filled with the Spirit.
column3: Pi g wo nawkkad namt pi heg hekaj wo padch g e‑doakag mamt pi wo e doꞌibia. Am g wehs wo i e dagitokchid Hekia S‑apꞌekam Gewkdag wui. T heg an wo em‑uꞌukchid ch ab wo em‑mahkchid g si geꞌe s‑ap tahhadkam.

column2: Share together with one another using psalms and hymns and sacred songs, singing and making music to the Lord with your heart.
column3: Kumt hab ab aꞌai wo i e gewkemhunad ch ab wo ihmad g Jiosh g heki hu mihshmda nenꞌeikaj ch wechij mihshmda nenꞌei

column2: Always thank God the Father for everything in the name of our Lord Jesus Christ.
column3: ch chum hekid ab wo hoꞌigeꞌidad g Jiosh t‑ohg wehs haꞌichukaj am chehchegch g t‑kownalig Jesus Christ.

column2: Each of you should be willing to accept what others tell you to do out of reverence for Christ.
column3: Ab g aꞌai wo i e dagito e wui mamtp woho ab si has elid g Christ.

column2: Wives, do what your own husbands tell you to do, as you would if the Lord told you.
column3: Ahpim uꞌuwi amt ab wo i e dagito e‑kuhkun ha wui. Id o ab d em‑wuikam nam pi d Christ wohochuddam.

column2: The husband is head of the wife in the same way as Christ is head of the church—his body and its savior.
column3: Kun o gewkdag am dahm g e‑hohnig hab masma mo g Christ gewkdag am t‑dahm ahchim mach ab ihm ch ab si hiwig. Ahchim ach heg wa wepo mach d honshpadaj. K heg d t‑doꞌibiakam.

column2: In the same way that the church does what Christ says, wives should do what their husbands tell them in all things.
column3: Ab att wehs wo i chum t‑dagitokch wui. Kumt ahpim uꞌuwi hab wa masma wehs ab wo i chum e dagitokch e‑kuhkun ha wui.

column2: Husbands, you should love your wives in the same way as Christ loved the church and gave himself for it.
column3: Ahpim chechoj amt hab masma ab wo si ha tatchuad g e‑hohonig mo g Christ ab si t‑tatchua. Heg o haꞌas geꞌe ab si t‑tatchua mat am t‑wehhejed e dagito mamt wo mua.

column2: He made it holy, he made it clean by washing in the water of the word,
column3: Bat wa e juh mat hekaj wo t‑wapkon k gam hu hab wo i juh g pi ap t‑chuꞌijig ahchim mach ab s‑wohochud ch ab hiwig. Kut hab wa masma ab i t‑gawulkai

column2: so that he could make the church his own, with no flaw or blemish or any kind of fault, but holy and blameless.
column3: e wehhejed matt d wo hekia s‑apꞌekam enigajk.

column2: Husbands should love their wives just like this, as they love their own bodies. A man who loves his wife loves himself—
column3: Kumt ahpim chechoj ab wo si ha tatchuad g e‑hohonig hab masma mam ab si hejel e tatchua no pi heg wa wepo mam d hemako e wehm. Hejel e hekaj o si pihk e elid matp hedai g e‑hohnigkaj si pihk e elid no pi d waꞌi hemako.

column2: for no one ever hated his own body, but feeds it and looks after it, just as Christ does for the church,  for we are parts of his body.
column3: Pi o hekid hedai hejel s‑e kehꞌid ch wabshaba am i e nakog mat wo e gegosidad ch wo e nuhkudad. Kuch ahchim wohochuddam heg wa wepo mach d honshpadaj g Christ nach pi wehmaj d hemako. K heg s‑ap t‑nuhkud.

column2: “This is why a man leaves his father and mother, and is joined to his wife, and the two are united in one.”
column3: Kumt ahpim chechoj hab wa masma hab wo ha juhkchid g e‑hohonig no pi hab chuꞌig g Jiosh oꞌohana:

column2: Children, do what your parents tell you, for this is the right thing to do.
column3: Ab o em‑ab ahpim aꞌal mamt ab wo s‑ha wohog elidad g e‑jehj no pi id d Christ tatchui ch d s‑apꞌekam em‑wehhejed.

column2: “Honor your father and mother.” This is the first commandment that has a promise attached:  “that things may go well for you and you may live a long life on the earth.”
column3: Bo chuꞌig g Jiosh heki hu oꞌohana:

column2: Fathers, don't make your children mad, but look after them by disciplining them and instructing them about God.
column3: Ahpim jehj amt pi wabsh wo si s‑gewkam ha shohbidad g e‑aꞌaliga mamt wabsh wo ha babgach. Do Jiosh tatchui mamt am wo i ha mashcha ab amjed g Christ hab masma mam ha gegosid k ab wo i ha shohbi pi apꞌekam amjed.

column2: Servants, obey those who are your human masters, with proper respect and awe, doing things from sincere motives as if you were serving Christ.
column3: Ahpim nenehol amt ab wo s‑wohog ha elidad g e‑aꞌamo ch ab wo si has ha elidad ch ab si e‑tatchui amjed hab wo junihid g e‑chikpan hab masma mamtp hems g Christ hab masma wo chikpandad

column2: Don't just work well when you're being watched to gain approval, but work like servants of Christ, honestly doing God's will,
column3: ch d wo piongajk. Pi amt hab wabsh wo junihid mas heg hekaj wo em‑neidad g em‑ahmo ch wo s‑em‑hohhoꞌidad ch wabshaba hab wo junihid wehs g e‑ihbdagkaj, chum as hems pi am hu wo em‑neidad. Id o em‑tatchuidch g Jiosh.

column2: happily serving as if you were doing it for the Lord, and not for people.
column3: Kumt s‑ap e tahtk k am hab wo junihid g e‑chikpan nam pi g Jiosh ep chikpanid ch pi heg waꞌi oꞌodham.

column2: You know that whoever does what's good will be rewarded by the Lord, whether that person is a servant or someone who is free.
column3: Mt wo s‑chegitok mat g Jiosh ab uhpam wo i nodagi g em‑namkidadag mamt haschu i s‑kehg chikpan hab wo juh, chum ams hems d wo neholk o pi d wo neholk.

column2: Masters, you should treat your servants the same way. Don't threaten them, remember that the Lord in heaven is both their master and yours, and he treats people the same, without favoritism.
column3: Ahpim mam d aꞌamo amt wo s‑ap i ha nuhkudad g e‑pionag ch pi wo ha ebkiodad. Am g wo s‑chegitok mam e wehm ahmo an dahm kahchim ch ed. Kut ihda ahmo wehs t‑wepo masma wo t‑lodai.

column2: Lastly, stay strong in the Lord, and in his mighty power.
column3: Hemako haꞌichu ant hab ep wo chei. Ab g wo i e gewpkadch Jesus t ab no pi heg ab em‑mahkch g geꞌe gewkdag.

column2: Put on all the armor of God so you can withstand all the devil's attacks!
column3: Ab g wo i hekaj hegai mo haschu g Jiosh ab em‑mahkch k hab wo e nako mamt ab wui wo gegokiwua g ge Jiawul s‑aꞌagi cheggiadag.

column2: We're not fighting against human forces, but against supernatural rulers and powers, the dark lords of this world, against the spiritual forces of evil in the heavens.
column3: Pi ach g hemajkam ha cheggia ch wabshaba hegam ha cheggia mo d si pi apꞌekam gewpkdag in t‑dahm ch ha‑kokownalig ch ha‑hahaꞌichuga ch g jijawul.

column2: Take all the weapons God provides so that you may be able to stand your ground in the day of evil and after doing all you can, to find yourself still standing!
column3: Mt heg hekaj ab wo si i hekaj g Jiosh gewkdag mamt wo e nahtokch hemu ch wo e nako mamt ab wui wo gegokiwua g pi apꞌekam mat hekid ab wo i em‑cheggia. Kut pi wo shaꞌi i em‑shul.

column2: So stand up, wrap the belt of truth around your waist, tie on the breastplate of justice and right,
column3: Neh, mt wo si e nahtokchid wehhejed ihda cheggiadag. An g wo uꞌukchid g wohokam. T id heg wo wa wepok mo g cheggiakud giwud.

column2: and put on the shoes of readiness to share the good news of peace.
column3: Mt wo e nahtokchid mamt wo i ahgahi ihda s‑kehg haꞌichu ahga mo g Jiosh s‑ha doꞌibiamk. T id heg wo wa wepok mamt ab cheka g e‑shuhshk.

column2: Above all, take up the shield of trusting God, by which you'll be able to put out all the devil's flaming arrows.
column3: Jiawul o chum s‑em‑padchudamk hab sha masma mat wo ha mehi g hahpod k hekaj wo em‑mummu. Mt wabshaba s‑wihnam wo uꞌukchid g e‑wohochudadag hab wa masma mamt g kawad am e tahgio wo ulinichid. T hab pi has wo em‑juh.

column2: Wear the helmet of salvation, and carry the sword of the Spirit—the Spirit that's the word of God.
column3: Ab g wo s‑wohochud mat em‑doꞌibia g Jiosh k pi hekid wo em‑dagito. T ihda em‑doꞌibiadag hab wo wa masmak mo g wainomi wonami.

column2: Always pray in the Spirit as you do all this. Stay awake and keep on praying for all God's people.
column3: Kumt chum hekid wo e hoꞌigeꞌidahunad ch ab wo tahnid g Jiosh g i wehmtadag. Hekia S‑apꞌekam Gewkdag o am i t‑wehmaj t‑hoꞌigeꞌidahuna ed. Kumt wo s‑nenenashank ch wo e hoꞌigeꞌidahunad ha wehhejed g Jiosh hemajkamga.

column2: Pray for me too so that I'll be given the right words to say, and that I'll be able to explain confidently the hidden truths of the good news.
column3: Ahni amt am hab waꞌap wo e hoꞌigeꞌidahunad ni‑wehhejed mat g Jiosh ab wo ni‑mah g neꞌoki mat hekid wo i e ai mant am wo ha jehnigi. Nt hekaj s‑ni‑mamachim ch s‑gewkam am wo ah ihda s‑kehg haꞌichu ahgaj g Jiosh mat iaꞌi idani hahawa t‑tashogi.

column2: I'm an imprisoned ambassador for the sake of the good news, so please pray that I will speak fearlessly, as I should.
column3: Id ani hekaj d lihso mani id ahgachug. Kumt am wo si e hoꞌigeꞌidahunad mant s‑gewkam wo ahgad mant has wo i chum masmak.
