column2: Tychicus, our good friend and faithful minister, will give you all my news and explain everything so you'll know how I'm doing.  That's why I'm sending him to you—to tell you what's happened to us and to encourage you.
column3: Ab ani chehani g t‑wehnag Tychicus mat am wo i em‑chehgimed k am wo em‑ahgi mani has waꞌi masma ch has ni‑wua. Do si s‑ap piongaj g Christ ch si s‑ap am wo i em‑gewkemhu em‑ahigdch mach has t‑wua.

column2: Peace to all the Christians there, from God the Father and the Lord Jesus Christ, with love and trust in him.
column3: Am ani ni‑hoꞌigeꞌidahun mat g Jiosh t‑ohg ch g t‑kownalig Jesus Christ ab baꞌich wo i em‑mah g s‑ap tahhadkam ch pihk elidadag nam pi d wohochuddam.

column2: Grace to all those who eternally love our Lord Jesus.
column3: Jiosh at baꞌich ep wo i s‑em‑hoꞌigeꞌel wehs ahpim mam woho ab si tatchua g t‑kownalig Jesus Christ.

column2: All the brothers and sisters here with me join in sending this letter to the churches in Galatia.
column3: K ia haꞌi i ni-wehmt g t-wepnag ch ab s-em-hoꞌigeꞌid.

column2: May the grace and peace of God the Father and our Lord Jesus Christ be with you!
column3: Ab o wa s-em-hoꞌigeꞌid g t-ohg Jiosh g t-kownalig Jesus Christ wehm ch ab wo wa baꞌich i em-mahkad g i wehmtadag ch s-ap tahhadkam.

column2: Jesus gave himself for our sins to set us free from this current world of evil, following the will of our God and Father.
column3: Jesus Christ at ab s-wohog el g e-ohg k e shoꞌigchud k ab muh kots t ab mat gam hu hab wo i juh g pi ap t-chuꞌijigk ab wo i t-wuwhas ab amjed g pi t-apꞌedag. T g Jiosh ab i wuhshad muhkig amjed.

column2: To him be glory forever and ever! Amen.
column3: Pegih, tt heg hekaj ab wo si has elidad g Jiosh.

column2: I'm shocked at how quickly you're abandoning the God who by the grace of Christ called you. You are turning to a different kind of good news
column3: Jiosh o ab t-mahkch g e-hoꞌigeꞌidadag am gahi wuhshanim g e-alidag. Kunt si ni-tods mamtsh s-hohtam dagito g s-kehg haꞌichu ahgaj k ab s-wohoch g gawul haꞌichu ahga.

column2: that isn't good news at all! Some people there are confusing you, wanting to pervert the good news of Christ.
column3: K heg pi d shaꞌi doꞌibiadag ahga. Hegai waꞌi Jiosh haꞌichu ahga o d doꞌibiadag ahga. K eda haꞌi hemajkam gawul haꞌichu am chum em-ahgid ch heg hekaj ab i chum em-gaꞌagwulkad ab amjed g Jiosh haꞌichu ahga.

column2: But if anyone, even we ourselves, or even an angel from heaven, should promote any other kind of good news  than what we have already told you, let them be condemned!  I repeat what we've told you before: if anyone promotes any other kind of good news than what you've already accepted, let them be condemned!
column3: T wabshaba g Jiosh am wo ha lodait k s-koꞌokam wo ha namkid. Neh, mantp hems ahni o chum hems g anghil gawul haꞌichu wo em-ahgi, t g Jiosh hab wa masma wo t-lodait k s-koꞌokam wo t-namkid. Heki am hu ab kaiham g Jiosh haꞌichu ahga ch am wa chum s-mahch mo has chuꞌig.

column2: Whose approval do you think I want—that of people, or of God? Do you think I'm trying to please people? If I wanted to please people I wouldn't be a servant of Christ!
column3: Tp hems pi wo hohhoꞌi g hemajkam mani has kaij. Ni eda pi hab ahgch hab kaij mas g hemajkam wo s-hohhoꞌi. Jiosh o s-hohhoꞌid mani ahgachug g haꞌichu ahgaj. Dani Jiosh alidag pionag. K hab chum chuꞌig mant heg ab wo s-wohog elidad, chum as has wo ni-el g hemajkam.

column2: Let me make it clear, my friends, regarding the good news I'm declaring—it did not come from any human being.
column3: Mt wo chum s-mahchk mo pi ab hu d hemajkam ha amjedkam ihda s-kehg haꞌichu ahga mani am em-ahgid.

column2: I didn't receive it from anyone, and nobody taught it to me—it was Jesus Christ who revealed it to me.
column3: Pi at hedai oꞌodham ni-ahgi o ab ni-mashcha. Do Jiosh alidag mat ab mahsko wua ni-wui.

column2: You heard how I behaved as a follower of the Jewish religion—how I fanatically persecuted God's church, savagely trying to destroy it.
column3: Dani Tuhligo. Kumki heki hu kah mani wa hab masma ab ihm g Jiosh mo g ni-wehm oꞌodham ch si ha shoꞌigchud hegam mo ab ihm g Jesus ch am chum s-keshwuimk g ha-hehemapda.

column2: I surpassed my contemporaries in the practice of the Jewish religion because I was so fervently devoted to the traditions of my ancestors.
column3: Dani wa si s-has haꞌichu am t-himdag ed muꞌi ha baꞌiwechkim g ni-wepo geꞌedam nanid pi baꞌich i s-gewkam oid g t-himdag.

column2: But when God (who had set me apart from birth) called me through his grace, and was pleased
column3: T wabshaba g Jiosh s-ni-hoꞌigeꞌid k am heki hu i apꞌech mant eda koi mahsi mant d wo piongajk.

column2: to reveal his Son to me so that I could announce the good news to the nations, I didn't discuss this with anyone.
column3: T am hebai i cheka. T am hahawa mahsko wua g e-alidag ab ni-wui mant wo ahgachugad g s-kehg haꞌichu ahgaj ab em-wui ahpim goꞌol hemajkam. Kunt pi hedai i wui hih mas wo ni-tashogi g Jiosh haꞌichu ahga.

column2: I didn't go to Jerusalem to talk to those who preceded me as apostles; instead I left for Arabia, and then later returned to Damascus.
column3: Ab o dadha g Jesus Christ chuhchai Jerusalem kihhim t ab am Judea jewed ch ed ch am ahgachug g haꞌichu ahgaj. Nt wabshaba pi am hu shaꞌi hih manis hekaj wo ha neid k wo ha wehm neo. Im ant hu hab wabsh hih Arabia jewed wui k am hahawa ep uhpam hih Damascus kihhim wui.

column2: After three years I went to Jerusalem to visit Peter. I stayed with him for two weeks.
column3: Am o d i waik aꞌahidag dahm, nt am hih Jerusalem wui k ab haꞌichu wo kakke g Peter k am wehmaj dakahim gohk domig ab.

column2: I didn't see any other apostles except James, the Lord's brother.
column3: M ant waꞌi hemako ep nei g Jesus kehsha. K heg d James ch d wehngaj g Jesus.

column2: (Let me assure you before God that I'm not lying about what I'm writing to you!)
column3: Jiosh o s-mahch mo d wohokam ihda mani em-ahgid.

column2: Then I went to Syria and Cilicia.
column3: Am i dahm, mant am hahawa ep hih Syria jewed wui ch Cilicia jewed wui.

column2: Even so, my face wasn't known to those in the churches of Judea.
column3: K eda pi ni-mahch hegam mo ab ihm g Jesus ch am kih Judea jewed ch ed.

column2: They had only heard people say, “The man who used to persecute us is now spreading the faith he once tried to destroy!”
column3: Idam wabsh kah mo haꞌi hab kaij, “Hegai mo wa t-shoꞌigchud o am hahawa ahgachug ihda Jesus haꞌichu ahga mo wa heki hu chum s-keshwuimk.”

column2: —and they praised God because of me.
column3: Neh, bash kaij ch ab si ihm g Jiosh am i kaiok mat am gawul i ni-juh.

column2: Fourteen years later I returned to Jerusalem with Barnabas. I took Titus along with me.
column3: Am him k am d i wehst-mahm aꞌahidag, nt am hih Jerusalem wui wehmaj g Barnabas. Tt am hema i bei g gawul mahs oꞌodham. K id hab chehgig Titus.

column2: I went because of what God had shown me.  I met with the recognized church leaders there in private and explained to them the good news I was sharing with the foreigners. I didn't want the course I had followed, and what I was working so hard for, to come to nothing.
column3: Jiosh o wa ab ni-chehgid mant am wo him k wo ha nei hegam mo am d ha wanimeddam g Jesus ihmdam. Kutt am ha wehm t-nam. Ni am ha ahgid mani haschu i ahgachug am ha-shahgid g gawul mahs hemajkam nani pi s-gihug matp hems haꞌi wo padch g ni-chikpan.

column2: But as it turned out, nobody even insisted that Titus who was with me should be circumcised, though he was Greek.  (That issue only arose because some false Christians slipped in to spy on the freedom we have in Christ Jesus, trying to make us slaves.  We never gave into them, not even for a moment. We wanted to make sure to keep the truth of the good news unchanged for you.)
column3: K am haꞌi haꞌichug hegam mo chum s-em-wupulshpamk ahpim gawul mahs hemajkam hab em-elidch mant hemho wa am hab wo junihid g heki hu t-himdag ahchim Tutuligo. Idam o pi woho wohochud g Jiosh haꞌichu ahga ab amjed g Jesus ch wabsh am dadhak ch chum mamche machs haschukaj pi am hu oidch hab junihim hegai heki hu t-himdag. Am o t-wehmaj g Titus. K idam ab si t-ahgid matt hemho wo wa pahl hikuch. Kuch wabshaba ab ha wui gegok. K hegam mo am d ha wanimeddam t-wepo hab elid. Neh, bach wa masma s-ap nuhkud ihda s-kehg haꞌichu ahgaj g Jiosh mach am em-wui ahgachug.

column2: But those considered to be important didn't add anything  to what I said. (It doesn't concern me what kind of leaders they were, because God doesn't judge people the way we do.)
column3: Do wabsh ni-wehm wohochuddam hegam mo am d ha wanimeddam ch pi haꞌichu wechij ab hu ni-ahgid. Pi ani si has ha elid. Wehsijj ach t-wepo d hahaꞌichu am Jiosh tahgio.

column2: On the contrary, once they realized that I'd been given responsibility to share the good news with the foreigners just as Peter had been given the responsibility to share the good news with the Jews,  (for the same God  who worked through Peter as apostle to the Jews also worked through me as apostle to the foreigners),
column3: K hegam hab kaij matki g Jiosh am hab waꞌap i ni-kei hab masma mat am i kei g Peter. Heg o d kehshaj ch am ahgachug g s-kehg haꞌichu ahgaj ha wui g Tutuligo. Ni ahni hab waꞌap d kehshaj ch am ahgachug ha wui g gawul mahs hemajkam. K g Jiosh wepo ab t-mahkch g gewkdag.

column2: and once they recognized the grace that had been given to me, then James, Peter, and John, who bore the responsibility of church leadership, shook Barnabas and me by the hand as their fellow-workers.
column3: Bamki ha elid hegam James ch Peter ch John mo d ha wanimeddam. T idam am wohokamch mat g Jiosh ab ni-mah ihda chikpan k t-nowi-bebhe. Kutt am i t-apꞌech ab t-wui mat hegam am wo ahgachugad g Jiosh haꞌichu ahga Tutuligo hemajkam ha wui. Nt ahni hi g Barnabas wehm gawul mahs hemajkam ha wui wo ahgachugad.

column2: We were to work for the foreigners, while they would work for the Jews. Their only instruction was to remember to look after the poor, something I was already very committed to.
column3: K hegam hab t-ahg matt wo i ha wehmajk hegam mo d shoꞌigkam am ha shahgid. Am ani wa heki hu hab junihim ch hekaj si chikpan.

column2: However when Peter came to Antioch I did have to confront him directly, because he was clearly wrong in what he did.  Before some of James' friends arrived, Peter used to eat with the foreigners. But when these people came he stopped doing this and stayed away from the foreigners. He was afraid of being criticized by those who insisted that men had to be circumcised.
column3: Am ani wa kih Antiok kihhim t am ch am ha ahgid g Jiosh haꞌichu ahga. T am jiwia g Peter k am ha wehm oimmed hegam goꞌol hemajkam mat ab i s-wohoch g s-kehg haꞌichu ahgaj g Jiosh. T am hahawa haꞌi t-wui dada g Tutuligo ab amjed g James. K heg i dahm g Peter pi an hu ha wehm oimmed g goꞌol hemajkam ch pi ha wehm e gegosid no pi s-ehbid mat has wo chei hegam Tutuligo.

column2: As well as Peter, other Jewish Christians became hypocritical too, to the extent that even Barnabas was persuaded to follow their hypocrisy.
column3: K hegam ehp mo hab waꞌap d Tutuligo hab waꞌap e wua mo g Peter, chum wa hems g Barnabas.

column2: When I realized that they weren't taking a firm stand for the truth of the good news, I said to Peter in front of everyone, “If you're a Jew yet live like the foreigners and not like Jews, why are you forcing the foreigners to live like Jews?
column3: Ni am ha neid mo pi am hu shaꞌi ap hab junihim g e-wohochudadag ch hab kaij ab wui g Peter am ha kaichudch, “Neh, Peter, dap Tuhligo ch wabshaba hahawa pi am hu hab junihim hegai t-himdag mo wa g Jiosh ab t-chehani. Pegih, p haschu ahgch hab e elid mapt pi wo ha hajunimak g goꞌol hemajkam, t hoꞌip am hab i junihi g t-chehanig?”

column2: We may be Jews by birth, and not ‘sinners’ like the foreigners,
column3: Ahchim Tutuligo ach wa hab chum t-elid mach pi hab masma pi apꞌe mo g goꞌol hemajkam.

column2: but we know that nobody is made right by doing what the law demands—it is only through trusting in Jesus Christ. We have trusted in Christ Jesus so that we could be made right by placing our confidence in Christ, and not through doing what the law says—because nobody is made right by observing the requirements of the law.”
column3: T wabshaba am i t-chehgi g Jiosh mat pi hedai wo e nako mas am tahgio hejel wo i e apꞌech am hab junihidch g chehanig. Bo d elidaj matt ab wo i s-wohoch g haꞌichu ahgaj k ab wo i hiwigi g Jesus Christ. T heg am tahgio wo i t-apꞌech. Pegih, tt heg am hab waꞌi juh k am i t-apꞌech.

column2: For if, as we look to be made right in Christ, we ourselves prove to be sinners, does that then mean that Christ is in the service of sin?  Of course not!
column3: Am att i s-mai mach d pi ap chuꞌijkam am i s-mahchk ab amjed g Christ. Pi at heg hab t-juh machs d pi ap chuꞌijkam

column2: For if I were to rebuild what I've destroyed, then I only demonstrate I'm a law-breaker.
column3: k wabshaba am i t-apꞌech Jiosh tahgio. Kutt d wo pi ap chuꞌijkamk mattp wo chum s-t-apchudam g chehanigkaj.

column2: For through the law I died to the law in order that I could live for God.
column3: Chehanig o s-hasig. Kutt pi wo t-nako machs am oidk hab wo t-junihid ch am wo i t-apꞌech. Nt heg hekaj am i ni-dagito Jiosh wui mat am wo i ni-apꞌech k am hahawa d wo doakamk wehhejed.

column2: I've been crucified with Christ— so it's no longer I who lives, but it is Christ living in me. The life I now live in this body, I live by trusting in the Son of God, who loved me, and who gave himself for me.
column3: Jiosh alidag o ab si pihk e elid t-hekaj ch ab nako g s-koꞌok muhkig ab kots t ab am t-wehhejed mat heg hekaj ab wo i t-mah g wechij doakag. Kuch heg hekaj ab hiwig ch d dodakam am nenaj ed ch am wehhejed.

column2: How could I dismiss God's grace? For if we could be made right through keeping the law then Christ died a pointless death!
column3: T wabsh wo e nahnkogi g Christ muhkig matp g oꞌodham wo e nako mas wo s-apꞌek am Jiosh nena ed heg wabsh hekaj mo hab junihim g chehanigaj. K wabshaba pi hab chuꞌig. Ab o t-wui him g Jiosh hoꞌigeꞌidadag heg hekaj Christ muhkig. Kutt pi wo dagito g hoꞌigeꞌidadaj ab hiwigch g Christ.

column2: You Galatians, you've lost your heads!  Who has put you under a spell? The death of Jesus Christ on a cross was clearly presented to you so you could see!
column3: Heki am hu kah mat ab muh g Jesus Christ kots t ab am em-wehhejed. Kum d pi haꞌichu aꞌamichuddam mamt ab wo ha kaihamad hegam mo em-iattogid ch hab kaij mamt hab wo junihid g t-chehanig ahchim Tutuligo.

column2: So tell me—did you receive the Spirit by keeping the law, or by placing your trust in what you heard?
column3: Ab amt i s-wohoch g Jiosh haꞌichu ahga. T g Jiosh ab em-mah g Hekia S-apꞌekam Gewkdag.

column2: You really have lost your heads! You began living  in the Spirit. Do you really think you can now make yourselves perfect by your own human efforts?
column3: Kut heg s-ap i shonwuich g em-wechij doakag. Pegih, m haschu ahgch hahawa pi hiwig mat baꞌich wo i himad g em-doakag. Pi amt wo e nako mamt s-ap wo nahto g e-doakag g hejel e-gewkdagkaj.

column2: Did you go through so much suffering for nothing? (It really wasn't for nothing was it?)
column3: Muꞌi am haꞌichukaj e shoꞌigchud am wehhejed g Jiosh alidag. T g em-shoꞌigdag wo e nahnkogi mamt wo sha dagito g Jiosh alidag.

column2: Let me ask you: does God give you the Spirit and do so many miracles among you because you keep the law, or is it because you trust in what you heard?
column3: Ab amt si i s-wohoch g s-kehg haꞌichu ahgaj g Jiosh. T heg hekaj ab em-mah g Hekia S-apꞌekam Gewkdag mat wo em-wehmajk k hab ep wua g s-hasig haꞌichu am em-shahgid. Pi at hab ahgk hab e juh ihda mams am hab si junihim g Tutuligo ha-chehanig.

column2: It's just like Abraham who “trusted God, and was considered to be right.”
column3: An o hab chuꞌig Jiosh oꞌohana ed:

column2: In Scripture it's foreseen that God would make right the foreigners who trusted in him. The good news is revealed to Abraham beforehand with the words, “Through you all the nations will be blessed.”
column3: Kekelibad Jiosh haꞌichu i tashogiddam o heki hu s‑mahch ch an oꞌoha mat g Jiosh am hab wo ha juh g goꞌol hemajkam mat ab wo i s‑wohochud k wo i e apꞌech am tahgio. Kush hab kaij g Jiosh am wui g Abrahambad:

column2: All those who rely on keeping the law  are under a curse, for as Scripture says, “Cursed is everyone who doesn't carefully obey everything that's written in the book of the law.”
column3: An o hab chuꞌig Jiosh oꞌohana ed:

column2: Clearly nobody is made right with God by attempting to keep the law, for “Those who are made right will live by trusting God.”
column3: K wabshaba an oꞌohanas:

column2: Brothers and sisters, here's an example from daily life. If a contract is drawn up and agreed, signed and sealed, nobody can ignore it or add to it.
column3: Do t‑himdag matp haꞌi haꞌichu ab aꞌai wo e ahꞌad, t pi hedai wo e nako mas am hejel gawul wo juh.

column2: Now the promises were given to Abraham, and to his son. It doesn't say, “sons” as if plural, but singular: “and to your son,” meaning Christ.
column3: Pegih, k ab si ahꞌad g Jiosh g Abrahambad mat wo ha doꞌibia g nahnko mahs hemajkam am hema gahi wuhshanim g Abrahambad amjedkam. Kuki heg hab ahg Christ.

column2: Let me explain. The law, coming four hundred and thirty years later, doesn't cancel the previous covenant that God made, breaking the promise.
column3: Kut pi shaꞌi gawul juh g haꞌichu e‑ahga g Jiosh mat hekid ab i t‑mah ahchim Tutuligo g t‑chehanig mo idani d waꞌi giꞌik siant waikko wehst‑mahm (430) ahidag amjed.

column2: If the inheritance is derived from obedience to the law, it no longer comes from the promise. But God graciously gave it to Abraham by means of the promise.
column3: Jiosh at wo ha doꞌibia g hemajkam hab masma mat doꞌibia g Abrahambad mat wa hab masma ab ha ahꞌad haꞌichu. Id at wo em‑doꞌibia mamtp ab wo i s‑wohoch, k pi hegai chehanig.

column2: What was the point of the law, then? It was added to show what wrongdoing really is, until the son came to whom the promise had been made. The law was put in place by angels through the hand of a mediator.
column3: K wabshaba am wa haꞌichu wehhejed s‑apꞌe hegai chehanig. Heg o hekaj tasho mo haschu d pi apꞌekam. K hab d elidaj g Jiosh matt an wo uꞌukchid ihda chehanig am hugkam mat in wo i wuhsh g alidaj. Am ash ha ahgid g Jiosh g chehanig am gahi wuhshanim g anghil.

column2: But a mediator isn't needed when there's only one person involved. And God is one!
column3: Kush hema g oꞌodham am ha wehhejed neok g Jiosh ch hemajkam matsh eda am i apꞌech hegai chehanig. Sh wa eda g Jiosh si hejel am ahgid g Abrahambad g haꞌichu e‑ahꞌada.

column2: So does the law work against God's promises? Of course not! For if there was a law that could give life, then we could be made right by keeping it.
column3: Pi o ab hu wui kehk g Jiosh haꞌichu ahꞌada g chehanigaj. Mattp wo sha t‑nako machs wehs oidch am hab wo t‑junihid g Jiosh chehanig, t wabsh wo t‑hiwigi g Jiosh matt heg hekaj wo t‑doꞌibia. K wabshaba pi hab shaꞌi mahs. Heg at hekaj wo t‑doꞌibia g Jiosh mo has i masma ab haꞌichu t‑ahꞌad.

column2: But Scripture tells us that we all are prisoners of sin. The only way we can receive God's promises is by trusting in Jesus Christ.
column3: An o hab chuꞌig Jiosh oꞌohana ed mo wehs hemajkam d pi ap chuꞌijkam ch pi wo shaꞌi e nako mas hejel wo e doꞌibia. T heg hekaj wo ha doꞌibia g Jiosh k ab wo i ha mah g pi ha huhugedam doakag hegam mat ab wo hiwgad g alidaj.

column2: Before we trusted in Jesus we remained in the custody of the law until this way of trusting was revealed.
column3: An o wabsh t‑shohbidch g Jiosh g e‑chehanigkaj am hugkam mat ab i t‑chehgi matt ab wo i s‑wohoch g haꞌichu ahgaj k wo t‑doꞌibia.

column2: The law was our guardian until Christ came, so that we could be made right by trusting him.
column3: T‑mashchamahim o g e‑chehanigkaj matt has wo chum masmak ch ab wo ai matt ab wo i hiw g alidaj. Kut heg am wo i t‑apꞌech Jiosh tahgio mattp ab hiwig.

column2: But now this way of trusting Jesus has come, we no longer need such a guardian.
column3: K hahawa pi d ihda chehanig ch wabshaba d Jiosh alidag mo ab i t‑chehgidch matt has wo chum masmak.

column2: For you are all God's children through your trust in Christ Jesus.  All of you who were baptized into Christ have clothed yourselves with Christ.
column3: E amt pahl wapko mamt am wo e chehgi mamt ab i s‑wohoch g Jiosh haꞌichu ahga k ab bei g alidaj. Kum d hahawa aꞌaligaj g Jiosh ch hab wo masmak mo g si alidaj.

column2: There's no longer Jew or Greek, slave or free, male or female—you are all one in Christ Jesus.
column3: K g Jiosh wehs t‑wepo masma t‑neid ahchim mach ab s‑wohochud. Ahpim gawul mahs hemajkam am t‑wepo d haꞌichu ahchim Tutuligo am Jiosh tahgio. K g nenehol t‑wepo d haꞌichu ahchim mach pi d nenehol. K g uꞌuwi t‑wepo d haꞌichu ahchim chechoj. Wehsijj ach ab i t‑hemakochud ahchim mach an uꞌukch g Jesus Christ.

column2: If you are Christ's, then you are Abraham's children, and you are heirs of the promise!
column3: Kuch d hemajkamgaj ch heg hekaj hab waꞌi masma mach d amjedkamaj g Abrahambad ch wo bei hegai mat haschu g Jiosh am i apꞌech wehhejed.

column2: Let me explain what I'm saying. An heir who is under-age is no different from a slave, even though the heir may be the owner of everything.
column3: Chum as wehs d wo enigajk g ali g ohgaj haꞌichu eniga, t eda pi wo bei t hoꞌip am i geꞌeda.

column2: An heir is subject to guardians and managers until the time set by the father.
column3: Mt wo nuhkudad g ali ch ep wo nuhkudad hegai mat haschu d wo enigajk am hugkam mat wo ai g e‑geꞌelig.

column2: It's just the same for us. When we were children, we were slaves subject to the basic rules of the law.
column3: Kuch wa ahchim hab wa masma mo g aꞌal nat pi g Jiosh kei g e‑chehanig mat hekaj wo t‑nuhkud am hugkam matt ab wo i s‑wohoch g haꞌichu ahgaj.

column2: But at the appropriate time God sent his Son, born of a woman, born under the rule of law,
column3: T am i s‑ap e ai, t g Jiosh ab i ahꞌad g e‑alidag. Kut ab mahsi k wepo e juh g hemajkam k am i geꞌelhim k am hab junihim hegai chehanig mo g Jiosh ab ha mahkch g Tutuligo.

column2: so that he could rescue those who were kept under the rule of law, so that we could receive the inheritance of adopted children.
column3: Ab ach wa t‑abchud g t‑chuꞌijig ab chehanig wecho. Kut ia jiwia g Jiosh alidag jewed dahm mat wo t‑doꞌibia am t‑wehhejed nakogk g s‑koꞌok t‑namkidadag matt d haha wo aꞌaligajk g Jiosh.

column2: To show you are his children, God sent the Spirit of his Son into our hearts, causing us to call out, “Abba,” meaning “Father.”
column3: T g Jiosh heg hekaj ab t‑mah g Hekia S‑apꞌekam Gewkdag mat wo t‑wehmajk. Kuch hab d aꞌaligaj ch ab ihm ch hab kaij, “Jiosh t‑ohg”.

column2: Since you are now no longer a slave, but a child, and if you are his child, then God has made you his heir.
column3: nach pi hahawa pi d wabsh piongaj. T ab wo i t‑mah g Jiosh mat haschu i apꞌech am t‑wehhejed mach d aꞌaligaj.

column2: At the time when you didn't know God, you were enslaved by the supposed “gods” of this world.
column3: Heki am hu pi mahch g Jiosh ahpim goꞌol hemajkam ch ab haꞌichu e jijoshchud ch ab ha ihm mo eda pi d shaꞌi hegai doakam Jiosh.

column2: But now you've come to know God—or better, to be known by God. So how can you go back to those useless and worthless rules? Do you want to be slaves to those rules all over again?
column3: Pegih, m haschu ahgch am uhpam ha wui ep s‑hihimimk mamt d ep wo ha‑neneholigak hemu mam eda am wa chum s‑mahch g Jiosh. Pi at wo e nako hegam mas am wo i em‑wehmajk.

column2: I'm pleading with you, my friends: be like me, because I became like you.  You've never treated me badly.
column3: Am g hab wo masmak mani ahni nani pi hahawa pi ab hu wecho g heki hu t‑chehanig.

column2: You remember that it was because I was sick that I shared with you the good news on my first visit.
column3: S‑mahch am mo wa haꞌichu pi ni‑apꞌe mant wa am jiwia k am em‑ahgid ab amjed g Jiosh alidag.

column2: Even though my illness was difficult for you, you didn't despise or reject me—in fact you treated me like an angel of God, like Christ Jesus himself.
column3: M wa eda pi shaꞌi s‑ni‑tamhog ch ab i s‑ni‑hoꞌigeꞌid k i ni‑wahkid k am ni‑nuhkud heg wa wepo mantp d hema anghil o d Jiosh alidag.

column2: So what's happened to all your gratefulness? I tell you, back then if you could have pulled out your eyes and given them to me, you would have!
column3: Ab o wa si geꞌej g pihk em‑elidadag mamtsh chum hems g e‑wuhpui wo ni‑mah heg hekaj pi ni‑apꞌedag.

column2: So what has happened—have I become your enemy by telling you the truth?
column3: Kut haschu has e juh mam heg amjed hab ni‑elid manis s‑em‑kehꞌid ahni mani am chum em‑ahgid g wohokam?

column2: These people are keen to gain your support, but not for any good reasons. On the contrary, they want to keep you away from us so that you will enthusiastically support them.
column3: Hegam mo hab chum em‑elid mamt am oidk hab wo e junihid g chehanig ch hekaj am wo i e apꞌech Jiosh tahgio o hab wabsh e wua mo ab em‑tatchua ch wabshaba em‑iattogid no pi gam hu hab i s‑em‑junimk ab ni‑amjed mamt ab wo si ha haꞌichuchudad.

column2: Of course it's good to want to do good. But this should be at all times, not just when I'm there with you!
column3: M o wa s‑apꞌe mat ab hema wo em‑tatchuad haꞌichu s‑apꞌekam wehhejed. Bani wa ni‑tahtk chum anis pi am hu em‑wehmaj. K wabshaba idam em‑tatchua g haꞌichu pi apꞌekam wehhejed.

column2: My dear friends, I want to work with you until Christ's character is duplicated in you.
column3: Am am wa s‑mahch mo g jeꞌe muꞌi haꞌichu nakog g e‑aꞌaliga ha wehhejed ch ab aꞌahe mat wo ha geꞌegeꞌel. Pegih, ni ahni hab wa masma muꞌi haꞌichu nakog am em‑wehhejed mant ab wo em‑ahijidaj mamt hab wo masmak mo g Jiosh alidag.

column2: I really wish I could be with you right now so I could change my tone of voice… I'm so worried about you.
column3: Mant hu am wo i em‑wehmajk hemu ch wo em‑wehm aꞌaga ihda haꞌichu nani pi s‑em‑gihug.

column2: Answer me this, you people who want to live under the law: Don't you hear what the law is saying?
column3: M haschu ahgch hab chum e elid mamt am wo i e apꞌech Jiosh tahgio am oidch hab e junihidch g chehanig? Pi amt wo shaꞌi e nako mamt am hejel wo i e apꞌech.

column2: As Scripture says, Abraham had two sons, one from the servant girl, and one from the free woman.
column3: Id ant am wo em‑tashogi ab amjed g Jiosh heki hu oꞌohana.

column2: However the son from the servant girl was born following a human plan, while the son from the free woman was born as the result of the promise.
column3: Pi atsh koi bei g e‑mad d Sarabad k eda heki hu okst. Sh wabshaba g Jiosh am ha ahgid mat wo ge madt. Kush ihda madaj d ha‑aliga. Sh wabshaba g Hagarbad mad d ha‑neholiga hab masma mo g jeꞌej.

column2: This provides an analogy: these two women represent two covenants. One covenant is from Mount Sinai—Hagar—and she gives birth to slave children.  Hagar symbolizes Mount Sinai in Arabia, and corresponds to the current Jerusalem, because she is in slavery with her children.  But the heavenly Jerusalem is free. She is our mother.
column3: Sarabad ani wepogid g s‑kehg haꞌichu ahgaj g Jiosh. Ch ahchim mach ab s‑wohochud wepogidas g Sarabad mad nach pi woho d aꞌaligaj g Jiosh. Hagarbad ani wepogid hegai chehanig mat ab e mah Sinai doꞌag t ab am Arabia jewed ch ed. Wehs hegam mo chum s‑e apchudamk am oidch hab e wuadch g chehanig o wepogidas hegai mo d nehol mad no pi pi woho d Jiosh aꞌaliga. Muꞌijj o hab wa chum e wua g ni‑wehm Tutuligo ch hab an e uꞌukch hab masma mo g nehol. Ab Jerusalem t ab am ab si hiwig g chehanig. K wabshaba an t‑dahm hab chuꞌig g wechij Jerusalem. Kuch heg wui t‑gewpkadch wehsijj ahchim matt ab i s‑wohoch g Jiosh k am tahgio i t‑apꞌech.

column2: As Scripture says, “Rejoice you who are childless and who have never given birth! Shout aloud for joy, you who have never been in labor—for the abandoned woman has more children than the woman who has a husband!”
column3: An o hab chuꞌig Jiosh oꞌohana ed mash hab kaij g Jiosh:

column2: Now my friends, we are children of promise just like Isaac.
column3: Pegih neh, Isaacbad ash d si ha‑aliga hab masma mash am ha ahgid g Jiosh. Ch ahchim hab wa masma d aꞌaligaj g Jiosh.

column2: However just as the one born according to a human plan persecuted the one born through the Spirit, so it is today.
column3: Heg ash wa shoꞌigchud g Isaacbad mash pi d si ha‑aliga. K hemuch hab waꞌap t‑shoꞌigchud hegam mo pi d aꞌaligaj g Jiosh.

column2: But what does Scripture say? “Send away the servant girl and her son, for the son of the servant girl will not be an heir together with the son of the free woman.”
column3: An o oꞌohadag mash hab kaij g Jiosh ab Abrahambad wui:

column2: Christ set us free so we could have real freedom. So stand firm and don't get burdened down again by a yoke of slavery.
column3: T‑doꞌibia at g Christ. S‑wihnam g an wo uꞌukchid g e doꞌibiadag ch pi ab hu ep wo chum i hiw g chehanig mams hekaj wo e doꞌibia.

column2: Let me, Paul, tell you bluntly: if you rely on the way of circumcision, Christ will be of absolutely no benefit to you.
column3: Mamt wo sha e pahl hikuch hab elidch mamt hekaj wo e doꞌibia am oidch hab e junihidch g chehanig, k d si shel mamtki wabsh dagito g e‑wohochudadag k pi wo e doꞌibia.

column2: Let me repeat: every man who is circumcised has to keep the whole of the law.
column3: Nam woho hab e elid mamt am wo i e apꞌech Jiosh tahgio g pahl hikuchkakaj? Nt wo em‑ahgi mamt hemho wa am wehs oidk hab wo e juh g chehanig mamtp heg hekaj am wo i chum e apꞌech.

column2: Those of you who think you can be made right by the law are cut off from Christ—you have abandoned grace.
column3: Am o s‑em‑apchudamk g Christ. Mt wabshaba gam hu hab wo i juh mamtp hejel chum s‑e apchudamk am oidch hab e wuadch g chehanig.

column2: For through the Spirit we trust and wait in hope to be made right.
column3: Ab o t‑mahkch g gewkdag g Hekia S‑apꞌekam Gewkdag. Kuch hekaj ab wui t‑gewpkadch mat g Jiosh s‑ap am wo i t‑apꞌech e tahgio.

column2: For in Christ Jesus being circumcised or uncircumcised doesn't achieve anything; it's only trust working through love that matters.
column3: Pi o hi wa has chuꞌig matp hema heki hu wo e pahl hikuch o pi wo e pahl hikuch. Do waꞌi ihda mamt ab wo i s‑wohoch g Jiosh haꞌichu ahga k wo chehgidch g si pihk e‑elidadag am i ha wehmajch.

column2: You were doing so well! Who got in the way and prevented you from being convinced by the truth?
column3: S‑ap am wa chum s‑wohochud g wohokam. Tsh wabshaba am haꞌi dada em‑wui k im hu hab i chum em‑wanchshulig.

column2: This “persuasion” certainly isn't from the One who calls you.
column3: Pi o d Jiosh mo im hu hab i em‑wanchshulig ab amjed g wohokam.

column2: You only need a little bit of yeast to raise the whole batch of dough.
column3: Bamtp elid mo d wabsh al chum haꞌichu ihda. T eda wehs wo padch g em‑wohochudadag ch em‑doakag hab masma mat g jewajidakud wehs wo jewaj g wahga.

column2: I'm confident in the Lord that you won't change the way you think, and that the one who is confusing you will face the consequences, whoever he is.
column3: Bani em‑elid mam d wabsh kia ni‑wehm wohochuddam ch pi gam hu wo i e nohnogi ab amjed g Jiosh hoꞌigeꞌidadag. T g Jiosh s‑koꞌokam wo ha namkid hegam mo hedai im hu hab i chum em‑wanchshulig.

column2: As for me, brothers and sisters, if I were still advocating circumcision—why am I still persecuted? If that was true, it would remove the issue of the cross that offends people so much.
column3: Haꞌi o hab kaij mani ahni ahgachug mamt am hab wo junihid g t‑chehanig ch hekaj wo s‑apꞌek am Jiosh nena ed. T wabshaba pi wo chum ni‑muꞌam g ni‑wehm oꞌodham mantp heg wo ahgachugad. Heg o hekaj s‑ni‑muꞌamk mani ahgachug mat g Jiosh alidag ab muh kots t ab mat hekaj am wo i t‑apꞌech Jiosh nena ed.

column2: If only those who are causing you trouble would go even further than circumcision and castrate themselves!
column3: Mat hu wo i em‑dagito hegam mo hab em‑elid mamt wo e‑pahl hikuchk k hekaj wo s‑apꞌek am Jiosh nena ed.

column2: You, my brothers and sisters, were called to freedom! Just don't use your freedom as an excuse to indulge your sinful human nature—instead serve one another in love.
column3: Pi at hab ahgk ab i em‑wai g Jiosh mat ged hu wabsh wo i si em‑dagsh heg hekaj e‑chehanig k wabshaba hab ahgk mamt d wo aꞌaligajk. Pegih, mt heg hekaj ab wo si pihk e elidad ab aꞌai e wui ch pi wabsh g hejel e‑tatchui hab wo junihid.

column2: For the whole law is summed up in this one command, “You shall love your neighbor as yourself.”
column3: Bo chuꞌig g Jiosh oꞌohana:

column2: My advice is to walk by the Spirit. Don't satisfy the desires of your sinful human nature.  For the desires of the sinful nature are opposed to the Spirit, and the desires of the Spirit are opposed to the sinful nature. They fight one another, so you don't do what you want to do.
column3: Pi o wepo chuꞌig g oꞌodham tatchui ch Jiosh tatchui. Kumt ab wo e dagitokchid Hekia S‑apꞌekam Gewkdag wui. T heg ab wo em‑shohbidad ch wo i em‑wanimedad. Mt hab pi hab wo junihid g hejel pi ap e‑tatchui.

column2: But if the Spirit leads you, you're not under the law.
column3: Pi at ab hu haꞌichu wo em‑chuꞌijigch g chehanig mamtp woho am wo i e dagitokchid Hekia S‑apꞌekam Gewkdag wui.

column2: It's clear what the sinful human nature produces: sexual immorality, indecency, sensuality,
column3: M o tasho g wabsh oꞌodham tatchui. Hegam mo hab wua g hejel e‑tatchui atp hems woꞌiwup hema i wehm mo pi d ha‑wehm kihkam o hab wua g nahnko mahs s‑uam haꞌichu.

column2: idolatry, sorcery, hatred, rivalry, jealousy, anger, selfish ambition, dissension, heresy,
column3: Hegam mo pi mahch g Jiosh o gawul haꞌichu chum jioshchud o haꞌi atp hems ha hihoin o atp hems aꞌai e cheggia o aꞌai s‑e hehgamk o babgat o nahnko ha ahg o s‑chu daꞌadag o aꞌai e gaꞌagwulkad.

column2: envy, drunkenness, feasting, and similar things. As I warned you before so I warn you again: nobody who behaves like this will inherit the kingdom of God.
column3: o s‑behimk g haꞌichu ha‑eniga o nawkkoꞌo o s‑tohntom has e wua. Hegam mo hab masma haꞌichu hab wua at pi am hu wo i wahp Jiosh kihdag ed.

column2: But the Spirit produces fruit such as love, joy, peace, patience, kindness, goodness, trust,  gentleness, self-control—and there's no law against these kinds of things!
column3: Kuch wabshaba pi hab mahs ahchim mo am t‑eda ulinig g Hekia S‑apꞌekam Gewkdag. Heg o am chikpan g t‑doakag. Kuch hab si pihk t‑elid ha hekaj ch si s‑ap t‑tahtk ch ab wabsh i s‑dodolima ch s‑t‑tahtk ch nenida mo haschu g Jiosh apꞌechudch t‑wehhejed ch s‑ha hoꞌigeꞌid g hemajkam ch s‑apꞌe ch s‑hemajima ch wabsh si t‑shohbidch ch am hab wo juh mach has i kaij. Pi o an hu shaꞌi shohbidch g chehanig hegai hab mahs haꞌichu.

column2: Those who belong to Christ Jesus have nailed to the cross their sinful human nature, together with all their sinful passions and desires.
column3: Ahchim mach d Christ hemajkamga att hab i t‑ah matt pi am hu hab wo junihid g hejel t‑tatchui.

column2: If we live in the Spirit we should also walk in the Spirit.
column3: Hekia S‑apꞌekam Gewkdag at ab i t‑mah g wechij doakag. Tt heg hekaj ab wui wo t‑dagitokchid mat s‑ap wo t‑wanimedad.

column2: Let's not become boastful, or irritate and envy one another.
column3: Pi att wo ge t‑haschudad ch pi aꞌai wo t‑kudutad ch pi wo chu hehgamk.

column2: My friends, if someone is led astray by sin, you who are spiritual should bring them back with a gentle spirit. Watch out that you don't get tempted too.
column3: Matp hema pi ap haꞌichu hab wo juh g em‑wehm wohochuddam, mt am wo i gewkemhu mat am wo i e apꞌech ahpim mam am e dagitokch Jiosh wui. Kumt wabshaba wo e shoꞌigchud k si s‑hemajim am hab wo juh ihda heg hekaj mamtp hems hema ahpim haha wabsh pi ap haꞌichu hab wo juh.

column2: Carry each other's burdens, for in this way you fulfill the law of Christ.
column3: Nam hig woho am oidch hab s‑e junimk g chehanig? Pegih, k ab t‑chehani g Jiosh alidag matt am aꞌai wo i t‑wehmajk.

column2: Those who think they're really something—when they're actually nothing—only fool themselves.
column3: Pi g am wo chum si e haꞌichuchud. Dach wabsh shoꞌigkam ch wabsh hejel wo t‑iattogi mattp ab wo chum si t‑haꞌichuch.

column2: Carefully examine your actions. Then you can be satisfied with yourself, without comparing yourself to anyone else.  We have to take responsibility for ourselves.
column3: Pi att hab wo chei machs baꞌich i s‑ap hab wua g t‑chikpan mo hema ehp. Do wabsh heheꞌejel t‑chikpan hegai mach hab wua. Kutt heg wo waꞌi aꞌappe hejel t‑chikpan k wo si s‑ap t‑taht mattp s‑ap hab wo wuad.

column2: Those that are taught the Word should treat their teachers well, sharing with them all good things.
column3: K ab em‑ab mamt ab haꞌichu wo ha mah hegam mo am em‑mashcham g Jiosh haꞌichu ahga mamt hekaj am epai wo i ha wehmt.

column2: Don't be fooled, God can't be treated with contempt: whatever you sow, that's what you reap.
column3: Pi amt wo e nako mamt wo iattogi g Jiosh. Hejel am e iattogid mamtp hab elid mat pi wo em‑namkid g Jiosh heg hekaj mam haschu hab i junihim. Nat hig pi wo ui g eshdam hegai hab mahs kai mat haschu wo ei? Pegih, k hab wa masma am t‑doakag wehhejed.

column2: If you sow according to your sinful human nature, from that nature you'll reap self-destruction. But if you sow according to the Spirit, from the Spirit you'll reap eternal life.
column3: Mt wo s‑koꞌokam e namkid am i muhk mamtp hab wo sha juh g hejel e‑tatchui k wabshaba chum hekid an wehmaj wo kihkad g Jiosh mamtp wo e dagito Hekia S‑apꞌekam Gewkdag wui k hab wo junihid g Jiosh tatchui.

column2: Let's never tire of doing good, for we'll reap a harvest at the proper time, if we don't give up.
column3: Pi g shaꞌi haꞌasa hab wo junihid g s‑apꞌekam. Jiosh o am wa apꞌechudch g tash mat ab wo i em‑mah g em‑gehgewadag.

column2: So while we have time, let's do good to everyone—especially to those who belong to the family of faith.
column3: Ab g wehs wo i s‑ha hoꞌigeꞌidad ch am wo i ha wehmajk mamt heꞌes wo i e nako, wahm hegam mo d em‑wehm wohochuddam.

column2: Notice how big the letters are, now that I'm writing with my own hand!
column3: Hemu ant hejel haꞌichu am wo i em‑oꞌohani. Mt wo s‑mai mani d ahni an neidk mani haꞌas an i oꞌohan.

column2: Those people who only want to make a good impression are forcing you to be circumcised just so they won't be persecuted for the cross of Christ.  Even those who are circumcised don't keep the law, but they want to have you circumcised so that they can boast about you and claim you as their followers.
column3: Hegam mo ahgahim mamt wo e pahl hikuch k hab wo s‑apꞌekam am Jiosh tahgio o ab chum si e haꞌichuchud mam am oidch hab e junihim g ha‑chehanig. K eda hejel pi am hu ap hab junihim. Ab at muh g Christ kots t ab am t‑wehhejed. K eda hegam pi ahgachug ihda no pi s‑gihug mat g ha wehm Tutuligo wo ha shoꞌigch.

column2: May I never boast except in the cross of our Lord Jesus Christ. Through this cross, the world has been crucified to me, and I've been crucified as far as the world is concerned.
column3: Kuni eda heg waꞌi ahgachug matt ab wo i s‑wohoch mat g Jesus ab muh kots t ab am t‑wehhejed. Do waꞌi ihda mant hekaj ni‑doꞌibia. Kut g jewed t ab haꞌichu wabsh pi e haꞌichuch am ni‑wehhejed.

column2: Circumcision or uncircumcision doesn't matter—what matters is that we're created brand new!
column3: Pi o d shaꞌi haꞌichu g pahl hikuchka. Id o d si haꞌichu mamt ab wo i s‑wohoch g Jiosh haꞌichu ahga k hab wo bei g wechij doakag.

column2: Peace and mercy to all who follow this principle, and to the Israel of God!
column3: Id o d hahawa t‑himdag. T g Jiosh ab wo s‑em‑hoꞌigeꞌidad ch ab wo em‑mahkad g s‑ap tahhadkam ahpim mamt am oidk hab wo e junihid hab masma mo wehs hab ha wua g e‑hemajkamga.

column2: Please, don't anyone trouble me anymore, because I carry on my body the scars of Jesus.
column3: Pi ant hahawa haꞌichukaj wo shaꞌi ni‑kudu nani pi ab s‑babaliwuani heg amjed mat g Jiosh alidag obga muꞌikko ni‑gewittan k ni‑maꞌikka. Heg o wa wepo mant ni‑nakpi mani d piongaj g t‑kownalig Jesus.

column2: My brothers and sisters, may the grace of our Lord Jesus Christ be with your spirit. Amen.
column3: Neh, ab at wo wa baꞌich i s‑em‑hoꞌigeꞌidad g t‑kownalig Jesus Christ.

column2: God, who in the past spoke to our forefathers through the prophets at various times and in many ways,
column3: Heki atsh hu am haꞌi i ha chuhcha g Jiosh g t-shohshonbad matsh am wo amogad g haꞌichu ahgaj. Kush idam Jiosh haꞌichu i tashogiddam heꞌes am al i ha tashogid g Jiosh aꞌahidag oidam.

column2: has in these last days spoken to us through his Son. God appointed the Son heir of everything, and made the universe through him.
column3: Kutsh g Jiosh am hahawa i kei g e-alidag. Tsh id ia i wuhsh jewed dahm k si s-ap t-tashogid g Jiosh. Id o wud matsh g Jiosh ged hu i si wehpeg am i kei matsh wehs haꞌichu wo nahto. K heg hekaj wehs haꞌichu d enigaj.

column2: The Son is the radiant glory of God, and the visible expression of his true character. He sustains everything by his powerful command. When he had provided cleansing for sin he sat down at the right hand of the Majesty in heaven.
column3: Kutsh eda ia jiwia k e shoꞌigchud k e muhkid matsh gam hu hab wo i juh g s-koꞌok t-namkidadag mach d pi ap chuꞌijkam. Tsh g Jiosh ab hahawa uhpam ep i be k an dai si e-hugid an. Kush si s-kehg s-masma am e chehgidch g s-has haꞌichudaj mash woho si wepo chuꞌig g e-ohg ch wehs an uꞌukch g e-nahtoi matsh an s-ap hab wo chuꞌigk.

column2: He was placed much higher than the angels since he received a greater name than them.
column3: Neh, bo wa masma am e chehgidch mo id d alidaj g Jiosh. K heg hekaj tasho mo baꞌich d i si s-has haꞌichu mo hi g anghil.

column2: God never said to any angel, “You are my Son; today I have become your Father,” or “I will be a Father to him, and he will be a Son to me.”
column3: Jiosh ash pi hekid hema g anghil hab ahg mo d alidaj ch wabshaba hab kaij id wui:

column2: What are the angels? They are beings that serve, sent out to help those who will receive salvation.
column3: Anghil ash pi wepo masma g Jiosh alidag ch d wabsh gewpkdag mash am chikpan Jiosh wehhejed. Kuch ahchim d hahawa Jiosh aꞌaliga t‑doꞌibiak ch am wo i wahp kihdaj ed. Kush g anghil d Jiosh pionag ch atsh am wo i t‑wehmajk.

column2: So we should pay even closer attention to what we've learned so we don't drift away from it.
column3: Neh, wehs ihda o ab t‑chehgidch mo g Jiosh alidag wehs dahm g e‑nahtoi. Kutt heg hekaj ab wo si t‑uꞌukchid id ab s‑kehg haꞌichu ahgaj matt kah ch pi gam hu hab wo i t‑juh ab amjed.

column2: If the message the angels brought was trustworthy, and every sin and disobedient act brings its own consequence,
column3: Pi ash d Jiosh alidag ch d wabsh anghil matsh wa ia uꞌapa g Jiosh haꞌichu ahga heki hu. Tsh wabshaba s‑koꞌokam bei g e‑namkidadag hegam mash pi ab hu ha kaiham.

column2: how will we escape if we don't pay attention to this great salvation that the Lord first announced, and then we had confirmed to us by those who heard him.
column3: Sh eda d si alidaj g Jiosh hegai matsh hemu ia uꞌapa g haꞌichu ahgaj. Kutt hemho wa ab wo kaihamad. Am o t‑tashogid g doꞌibiadag. Kutt pi has masma wo t‑doꞌibia ab amjed g s‑koꞌok t‑namkidadag matt pi ab hu wo kaihamad.

column2: God also testified through signs and miracles, by acts that show his power, and by the gifts of the Holy Spirit, given as he chose.
column3: K g Jiosh hab ha junidahim g s‑hasig haꞌichu ch hekaj am wohokamchud g haꞌichu ha ahga. K g Hekia S‑apꞌekam Gewkdag ab t‑mahkch g gewkdag mach hekaj hab wua g nahnko mahs i wehmtadag ch i gewkemhunadag ab aꞌai t‑wui.

column2: It's not angels who will be in charge of the world to come that we're talking about.
column3: Pi ash d anghil mas g Jiosh am i ha chuhcha mat am wo himchudad g kownaltaligaj. Dach ahchim hemajkam.

column2: But as it's been said, “What are human beings that you should worry about them? What is a son of man  that you should care about him?  You set him a little lower than the angels; you crowned him with glory and honor, and placed him over all your creation.
column3: Neh, an o hebai hab chuꞌig Jiosh oꞌohana ed mash hema hab kaij ab Jiosh wui:

column2: It was appropriate that God, who creates and maintains everything, should bring many of his children to glory, and to completely prepare through suffering the one who leads them to salvation.
column3: Wehs haꞌichu o d Jiosh nahtoi ch wehhejed an hab chuꞌig. T heg si s‑hemajim am i apꞌech mat g Jesus wo e shoꞌigchud k hekaj wo t‑doꞌibia matt d wo aꞌaligajk ch am hahawa chum hekid wo wehmajk si s‑kehg kihdaj ed. Jiosh hab elida o wehs s‑apꞌe.

column2: For both the one who makes people holy and those who are made holy belong to the same family.  That's why he doesn't hesitate to call them “brothers,”
column3: Pegih, tsh hab wa masma ab i t‑gawulkai g Jiosh alidag matt hab waꞌap d wo Jiosh aꞌaligak ch pi wo ha chuꞌijigk. Kush heg hekaj pi shaꞌi e elid mat hab wo t‑aꞌagad ‘ni‑wepnag.’

column2: saying “I will announce your name to my brothers; I will praise you among your people when they meet together.”
column3: An o hab chuꞌig Jiosh oꞌohana ed mash g alidaj s‑t‑nawojimk ch hab ahg g Jiosh:

column2: Because the children share flesh and blood in common, he shared in this in the same way so that through death he could destroy the one that had the power of death—the devil—
column3: Kush eda g Jiawul edgid g gewkdag mat ab wo t‑abch g t‑chuꞌijig matt hekaj gam hu hab wo i t‑juh ab amjed g Jiosh. Tsh wabshaba g Jiosh alidag t‑wepo e juh mat hekaj s‑ap ab wo bei g s‑koꞌok t‑namkidadag k wo hugio g Jiawul gewkdag mat hahawa pi wo e nako mas gam hu hab wo i t‑juh ab amjed g Jiosh.

column2: and free everyone who through fear of death were enslaved all their lives.
column3: Jiosh alidag atsh gewito g Jiawul am t‑wehhejed. Kutt heg hekaj pi wo ehbidad g muhkig.

column2: Of course it's not angels he's concerned about; he's concerned to help the children of Abraham.
column3: Pi ash d anghil mas g Jiosh wo ha doꞌibia. Dach ahchim hemajkam mach ab s‑wohochud.

column2: That's why it was necessary for him to become like his brothers in everything, so that he could become a merciful and trustworthy high priest in the things of God, to forgive his people's sins.
column3: Tsh heg wa hekaj am t‑wepo e juh k t‑wepo masma ia oimmelhim ch haꞌichu nakog. Bat waꞌi masma s‑ap d wo t‑uhgchu pahligk ch ab wo s‑t‑hoꞌigeꞌidad ch gam hu hab wo i juh g t‑chuꞌijig am wehhejed g Jiosh.

column2: Because he himself suffered when he was tempted, he is able to help those who are tempted.
column3: Jiawul o chum t‑chehani matt hab wo juh g pi apꞌekam. K wabshaba g Jesus s‑ap e nakog mat am wo i t‑gewkemhunad nash pi hab waꞌap nakog mash wa g Jiawul chum chehani g pi apꞌekam.

column2: So, my brothers and sisters who live for God and who share in this heavenly calling, we need to think carefully about Jesus—the one we say is sent by God,  and is the High Priest.
column3: Pegih, ni‑wehm wohochuddam, ab at i em‑gawulkai g Jiosh gahi wuhshanim g e‑alidag Jesus. Heg o d Jiosh si Kehsha ch d uhgchu t‑pahlig. Kumt wo oidahid mo has chuꞌig.

column2: He was faithful to God in the work he was chosen to do, just like Moses was faithful to God in God's house.
column3: Jiosh atsh heki hu am i kei g Mosesbad ha dahm g e‑hemajkamga. Kush heg s‑ap am hab junihim g e‑chikpan. Pegih, sh g Jesus hab waꞌap s‑ap am hab junihim g e‑chikpan am Jiosh wehhejed.

column2: But Jesus deserves much greater glory than Moses, in the same way that the builder of a house deserves more credit than the house.  Every house has its builder; God is the builder of everything.
column3: Kutt wabshaba baꞌich ab wo i si has elidad g Jesus mach g Mosesbad no pi d Jiosh ch wehs haꞌichu nahto.

column2: As a servant, Moses was faithful in God's house. He provided evidence of what would be announced later.
column3: Mosesbad ash s‑ap am hab junihim g e‑chikpan am ha shahgid g Jiosh hemajkamga ch wabshaba d wabsh Jiosh pionag. Tsh g Jiosh am i kei matsh wo haꞌichu aꞌaga wehhejed matsh gam hu baꞌich hahawa s‑ap wo i e tashogit.

column2: But Christ is a son, in charge of God's house. And we are God's house as long as we hold on with confidence to the hope we boast we believe in.
column3: Kush eda g Jesus d Jiosh alidag ch d si kehshaj matsh wehs am wo ha dahmkad g hemajkamgaj. Kuch ahchim d hemajkamgaj mattp pi wo dagito g t‑wohochudadag k wabsh s‑ap t‑tahtkk ch wo nenida mat hab wo t‑juni mo has i kaij.

column2: This is why the Holy Spirit says, “If you hear what God is saying to you today,
column3: Neh, bash masma hab chuꞌig am t‑wehhejed mash wa hab chuꞌig am ha wehhejed g t‑shohshonbad ahchim Tutuligo. Hegam ha wui ash hab kaij g Hekia S‑apꞌekam Gewkdag:

column2: Brothers and sisters, make sure that none of you has an evil mindset that's given up trusting in the God of life.
column3: Neh, tsh wa woho hab e juh g Jiosh neꞌoki am ha wehhejed. Kumt heg hekaj wo s‑e nenꞌeidad mamt pi hab masma wo pi chechkaidagk. Jiosh o d doakam ch woho gam hu hab wo i em‑juh mamtp pi ab hu wo kaihamad.

column2: Encourage each other every day while you still have “today,” so that none of you will be deceived by sin and become hard-hearted.
column3: Ab o t‑waid g Jiosh hemu ch wabshaba pi chum hekid ab wo t‑waidad. Mt wo e iattogi g pi apꞌekamkaj mamtp pi ab hu wo kaihamad g Jiosh. Ab g aꞌai wo i e gewkemhunad mamt ab wo kaihamad.

column2: For we are partners with Christ as long as we hold on to our confidence in God from beginning to end.
column3: Dach s‑wohom Christ hemajkamga mattp an wo si uꞌukchid g t‑wohochudadag wehs t‑doakag oidam.

column2: As Scripture says, “If you hear what God is saying to you today, don't harden your hearts like the time you rebelled against him.”
column3: Mt heg hekaj wo s‑chegitok ihda mani am em‑ahgid ch pi wo pi chechkaidagk hab masma mash wa hegam mash pi ab hu wohog elid g Jiosh.

column2: Who was it that rebelled against God, even though they heard what he said? Wasn't it all those who were led out of Egypt by Moses?
column3: Jiosh atsh wa am ha doꞌibia ab ha amjed g Egypt t am hemajkam am gahi wuhshanim g Mosesbad. Kush eda hahawa pi chechkaidag.

column2: Who was God upset with for forty years? Wasn't it those who sinned, those who were buried in the desert?  Who was God speaking of when he vowed they should not enter into his rest? Wasn't it those who disobeyed him?
column3: Sh g Jiosh s‑ha kehꞌid ch hab kaij matsh pi wo ha hiwigi mas am wo i wahp amai mash hebai am chum apꞌechudch ha wehhejed k hoꞌip wehs koi hegam geꞌeged mash pi ab hu wohog elid. Kush heg hekaj am oiopo tohono jewed ch ed giꞌikko wehst‑mahm (40) aꞌahid ab.

column2: So we see that they were not able to enter because they didn't trust him.
column3: Neh, id o am t‑chehgidch matki heg hekaj pi am hu ha wahpki g Jiosh heg eda jewed mash pi ab hu wohochud.

column2: Therefore let's take care to make sure that even though God has given us his promise of entering his rest, none of you miss out!  For we've heard the good news just like they did, but it didn't help them because they didn't accept and trust in what they heard.
column3: Kutki heg hekaj pi am hu ha apꞌet g Jiosh waida. Kutt ahchim wo s‑t‑gihugad matt pi hab wo masmak mash wa hegam. Jiosh ash am t‑wehhejed apꞌechudch e‑kihdag ed hab sha masma mash wa am ha wehhejed chum apꞌechudch hegai jewed.

column2: However those of us who trust in God have entered into that rest God mentioned when he said, “In my frustration I vowed, ‘They shall not enter my rest.’ ” (This is so even though God's plans were already complete when he created the world).
column3: Id ash am apꞌechudas ged hu i amjed matsh am e nahto g jewed. Sh wabshaba hab masma hab chuꞌig am t‑wehhejed mash wa hab chuꞌig am ha wehhejed. Jiosh ash hab kaij matsh pi hedai am hu wo i wah pi ab hu wohochudch k wabshaba ab wo bei g s‑koꞌok e‑namkidadag. Kutt heg hekaj ab wo s‑wohochudad ch hab s‑ap am wo i wahp kihdaj ed am i t‑pihhunk ia jewed dahm.

column2: God's rest is still there for some to enter, even though those who previously heard the good news failed to enter because of disobedience.
column3: Hegam mat ab wo s‑wohoch g s‑kehg haꞌichu ahgaj g Jiosh atsh am wo i wahp Jiosh kihdag ed.

column2: So God again sets a day—today—saying a long time later through David as he did before, “If you hear what God is saying to you today, don't harden your hearts.”  For if Joshua had been able to give them rest, God wouldn't have spoken later about another day.
column3: Tsh wabshaba g ha‑aꞌaliga am i wahp. Tsh g Joshuabad am i ha wanim. Kush ab ha wui hab hahawa kaij g Hekia S‑apꞌekam Gewkdag ihda mani wa am em‑ahgid:

column2: For God's word is alive and effective, sharper than any twin-edged sword, so penetrating it separates life and breath, bone joints and their marrow, judging the thoughts and intentions of the mind.
column3: Shoꞌo waꞌi si s‑gewkdag g Jiosh neꞌoki. K g Jiosh heg hekaj am chehgidch mo has chuꞌig g t‑doakag ch t‑chegitoidag. Bo masma g neꞌokij mo g s‑muꞌuk wainomi mamtp hems heg hekaj ged hu wo si hikuch g chuhkug ch ohꞌo k wo cheh mo haschu ged hu si eda.

column2: No living being is hidden from his sight; everything is exposed and visible to the one we're accountable to.
column3: Pi att wo shaꞌi t‑nako machs haschu gam hu wo ehsto ab amjed g Jiosh. Wehs o haꞌichu s‑mahch. Kutt hemho wa hema tash am wo gegokiwua baꞌich k wehs wo ah g t‑chuꞌijig.

column2: Since we have such a great high priest who has ascended to heaven, Jesus the Son of God, let us make sure we hold on to what we say we believe.
column3: Do si uhgchu t‑pahlig ch d Jiosh alidag g Jesus ch an i wah Jiosh kihdag ed am t‑wehhejed. Kutt heg hekaj ab wo s‑wohochudad chum hekid.

column2: For the high priest we have isn't one who doesn't sympathize with our weaknesses, but one who was tempted in all the ways we are, but did not sin.
column3: Ihda uhgchu t‑pahlig o si pihk e elid t‑hekaj natsh pi ab nakog k s‑mahch hegai mach ahchim ab nakog. Jiawul ash hab waꞌap chum chehani mat hab wo juh hegai mo haschu pi d Jiosh tatchui hab masma mo hemu ab t‑chehani. Kush wabshaba s‑ap ab wui kehk ch pi hekid hab juh g pi apꞌekam.

column2: So we should go confidently to God on his throne of grace so we can receive mercy, and discover grace to help us when we really need it.
column3: Pegih, ab o t‑kaiham g Jiosh no pi g alidaj d uhgchu t‑pahlig ch si pihk e elid t‑hekaj. Kutt heg hekaj s‑ap wo t‑nako matt ab wo tahnid g i wehmtadag ch pi wo ehbidad. T heg ab wo i s‑t‑hoꞌigeꞌid k ab wo i t‑wehmt.

column2: Every high priest is chosen from the people and is appointed to work for the people as they relate to God. He presents to God both their gifts and sacrifices for their sins.  The high priest understands how ignorant and deluded people feel because he also experiences the same kind of human weaknesses.  As a result he has to offer sacrifices for his sins as well as for those of the people.
column3: Jiosh atsh am i apꞌech matsh hema g t‑wehm oꞌodham d wo uhgchu t‑pahligk ch ab wui hab wo junihid g iagchulida ch hoꞌigeꞌidahuna am t‑wehhejed ch hejel e wehhejed. Kut id hemho wo wa chum s‑hemajimak ab t‑wui no pi hab waꞌap d oꞌodham ch hebai hab wua g pi apꞌekam.

column2: No one can take the position of high priest for himself; he must be chosen by God, just like Aaron was.
column3: Pi atsh hedai am wabsh wo hejel i e kei mat d wo uhgchu pahlk. Jiosh atsh am wo i kei hab masma matsh wa hab juh g Aaronbad ged hu i heki hu matsh g amjedkamaj d wo papalk.

column2: In just the same way Christ did not honor himself by becoming high priest. It was God who said to him, “You are my Son. Today I have become your Father.”
column3: Tsh hab wa masma pi am hu wabsh hejel i e kei g Christ. Jiosh atsh wa am i kehsh k ab wui hab kaij:

column2: Jesus, while he was here in human form, prayed and appealed with loud cries and tears to God, the one who was able to save him from death. Jesus was heard because of his respect for God.
column3: Kush g Jesus ab wui e hoꞌigeꞌidahun ch shoak ch iawua g e‑ohꞌog mash eda ia oimmed ch ab aihim g muhkig. Kush g Jiosh ab kaiham nash pi heg si s‑hemajima ch ab si has elid.

column2: Even though he was God's Son, Jesus learned practically the meaning of obedience through suffering.
column3: Dash Jiosh hab elida matsh wo e shoꞌigchud k wo e muhkid am t‑wehhejed. Kutsh wa woho hab e juh k hab masma s‑mai g wohog elidadag, chum as d Jiosh alidag.

column2: When his experience was complete, he became the source of eternal salvation to everyone who does what he says,
column3: Bat wa masma am i apꞌech g Jiosh mat hab wo juh g pi ha huhugedam doꞌibiadag wehsijj t‑wehhejed mattp hedai ab wo s‑wohog el.

column2: having been designated by God as a high priest according to the order of Melchizedek.
column3: Kush hab kaij g Jiosh mat am i kei mat d wo uhgchu pahlk hab masma mat am i kei g Melkisedek.

column2: We have much to say about Jesus, and it's hard to explain because you don't seem able to understand!
column3: Muꞌi ani haꞌichu chum s‑em‑mashchamimk ab amjed g Christ id hekaj Melkisedek. Mt wabshaba pi wo amich.

column2: By now you should have had enough time to become teachers, but you need someone to teach you the fundamentals, the first principles of God's word. It's like you need to go back to baby milk instead of solid food!
column3: Idani amki tash d Jiosh wohochuddam ch hab wo chum chuꞌigk mamt haꞌi ep wo ha mashcha. Kumtki eda koi si s‑ap s‑mai g wehpeg mashchama. Bam sha masma mam d wabsh kia al hahaꞌas aꞌal ch hegai waꞌi wihbi ihꞌe

column2: Those who drink baby milk don't have the experience of living the right way—they're just babies.
column3: nam pi pi amichud g Jiosh neꞌoki ab amjed g s‑apꞌekam.

column2: Solid food is for grown-ups—those who by always using their brains have learned to tell the difference between good and evil.
column3: Hegam mat wo geꞌegeꞌehogat e‑wohochudadag ed at wo s‑amich g Jiosh neꞌoki k wo s‑mahchk mo haschu d s‑apꞌekam ch haschu d pi apꞌekam.

column2: So let's not get stuck on the basic teachings about Christ, but let's progress to a more mature understanding. We don't need to go over again the ideas of repenting from what we used to do, about trusting in God—
column3: Gd hu i si wehpeg att am em‑mashcha mamt gam hu wo s‑ohhod g pi ap e‑chegitoi k ab wo i s‑wohoch g Jiosh

column2: or teachings about baptism, the laying on of hands, the resurrection of the dead, and eternal judgment.
column3: k wo e pahl wapko. T g Jiosh ab wo i em‑wuwhas muhkig t amjed k pi wo em‑lodai. Kutt heki hu em‑mashcha mamt ab wo ha taht hegam mat hab waꞌap ab wo i s‑wohoch g Jiosh k wo e hoꞌigeꞌidahu am ha wehhejed. Kut ab wo bei g gewkdaj g Hekia S‑apꞌekam Gewkdag hab masma mamt ahpim.

column2: So let's get on with it, as God gives us the opportunity!
column3: Id o d hema hegam wehpeg mashchama am t‑wohochudadag ed. K wabshaba haꞌichu d ep hegai mamt ep wo s‑mai. Mt heg hekaj pi heg wo waꞌi aꞌagad mo d si shondaj g t‑wohochudadag.

column2: It's impossible for those who once understood and experienced God's heavenly gift—who shared in receiving the Holy Spirit,
column3: Pi at wo e nako hegam mat wo s‑mahchk g Jiosh ch wo dagito mas gam hu ep wo s‑ohhod g pi ap e‑chegito k ep wo bei g wechij doakag. Heki o hu ha tonlid g Jiosh g ha‑amichudadag. K g Hekia S‑apꞌekam Gewkdag am ha eda chikpan. Kut chum bei ihda wechij doakag

column2: who had known God's good word and the power of the coming age—
column3: k chum s‑mahch mo g Jiosh haꞌichu ahga s‑apꞌe ch neid g Jiosh gewkdag

column2: and then completely abandon God, for them to be brought back to repentance once more. They themselves have crucified the Son of God all over again and publicly humiliated him.
column3: ch wabshaba wehs dagito ihda heg hekaj pi apꞌekam. Heg o wa wepo mat ab ep sisish g Jiosh alidag kots t ab k si edawua am ep i e nohnogidk pi apꞌekam wui. Kut pi wo shaꞌi e nako mas gam hu ep wo s‑ohhod g pi ap e‑chegitoi.

column2: Land that has been watered by rain, and produces crops for those who farm it, has God's blessing.  But land that only produces weeds and thorns is worthless, and is about to be condemned. In the end all that can be done is to burn it.
column3: Neh, no hig pi woho mam hab elid g e‑eꞌes mat chum s‑kehg wo bahidagt mat hekid wo juh. Kumt wo dagito hegai oidag mat wabsh g hoꞌi wo i wuhshad. Pegih, t hab wa masma wo em‑dagito g Jiosh mamtp pi haꞌichu wehhejed wo s‑kehgajk.

column2: But dear friends, we believe better of you and your salvation, even if we talk like this!
column3: Ni wabshaba hab em‑elid mamt woho e doꞌibia k hab masma ab baꞌich wo i bei g Jiosh hoꞌigeꞌidadag.

column2: God wouldn't be so unjust as to forget what you've done and the love you've shown for him by the care you've shown for fellow-believers—something you're still doing.
column3: S‑ap am haꞌichu hab junihim ha wehhejed g e‑wehm wohochuddam ch hab wabsh kia junihim nam pi si pihk e elid ha hekaj. T g Jiosh wo s‑chegito hegai mam haschu hab junihim.

column2: We want each of you to show the same kind of commitment, confident in God's hope until it's fulfilled.
column3: Tatchua ani mamt hab wa masma am hab wo junihid wehs e‑doakag oidam ch ab wo ai hegai mo g Jiosh ab t‑makiog hahawa.

column2: Don't be spiritually lazy, but follow the example of those who through trusting in God and patience inherit what God has promised.
column3: Hegam mash wa heki hu ab s‑wohochud g Jiosh ash s‑bahbagi ab nenida mat hab wo ha juni mash haschu hab kaij mat hab wo juh. Kumt ahpim hab wo wa masmak.

column2: When God gave his promise to Abraham he could swear by no one greater so he took an oath on himself,
column3: Jiosh ash wa am si ahg g t‑shohshonbad Abraham mash haschu ab t‑makiog

column2: saying, “I will definitely bless you, and multiply your descendants.”
column3: ab wui hab kaijch:

column2: People swear on things that are greater than they are, and when they have some dispute the oath is taken as the final word on the matter.
column3: Neh, s‑mahch ach mat am Jiosh tahgio aꞌai wo i apꞌech g hemajkam mat woho hab wo juh g haꞌichu e‑ahga.

column2: That's why God wanted to demonstrate more clearly to those who would inherit the promise that he would never ever change his mind.
column3: Pegih, t g Jiosh am hejel e tahgio i apꞌech g haꞌichu e‑ahga Abrahambad wui no pi pi hedai baꞌich i geꞌej mas am tahgio wo i apꞌech. Bo masma am t‑chehgidch ahchim mach ab s‑wohochud mat pi hekid am gawul wo juh g hab e‑elida.

column2: So by these two actions that can't be changed, and since it's impossible for God to lie, we can have total confidence, having run for safety to take hold of the hope God presented to us.
column3: Kutt heg hekaj ab wo t‑gewkemhunad mat s‑ap wo nahto g t‑doꞌibiadag.

column2: This hope is our spiritual anchor—it's both certain and reliable, and it takes us past the curtain to the presence of God.  That's where Jesus went in on our behalf, because he had become a high priest according to the order of Melchizedek.
column3: Jesus atsh am heki hu i wah dahm kahchim ch ed. Kuch heg hekaj s‑mahch mat am wo i t‑wahpki ahchim mach ab s‑wohochud. Jiosh atsh am i kei matsh d wo uhgchu t‑pahligk chum hekid. Pi ash heg hekaj d pahl mas d papal ha amjedkam. Jiosh atsh am i kei hab masma matsh wa heki hu am i kei hegai mash hab chehgig Melkisedek.

column2: Melchizedek was king of Salem and priest of the Most High God. He met Abraham who was returning from defeating the kings and blessed him.
column3: Nt wo haꞌichu em‑ahgi ab amjed hegai Melkisedekbad mant wo em‑tashogi g Jesus chikpan. Jiosh atsh am i kei g Melkisedekbad. Kush d kownal am Salem kihhim ch ed ch d ep pahl.

column2: Abraham gave him a tithe of all that he had won. Melchizedek's name means “king of right” while king of Salem means “king of peace.”
column3: Tsh g Abrahambad ab mah mo haschu ab d wuikamaj g Jiosh mash d hemako tahpna mo wehst‑mahm e tahpanch g gehgewadaj.

column2: We don't have any information about his father or his mother or his family tree. We don't know when he was born or when he died. Like the Son of God he continues as a priest forever.
column3: Pi o an hu hebai oꞌohanas mas hedai d ha‑amjedkam g Melkisedekbad ch has masma mahsi k has masma heb hu hih. K id am t‑chehgidch mat has masma in wo i wuhsh g Jiosh alidag ab dahm kahchim t amjed k am uhpam ep wo him k d wo uhgchu pahlk chum hekid.

column2: Think how great this man was for Abraham the patriarch to give him a tithe of what was won in battle.
column3: Melkisedekbad oki baꞌich d i si s‑has haꞌichu mo g Abrahambad. Tsh heg ab mah g hemako tahpna mo wehst‑mahm e tahpanch g gehgewadaj matsh am ui cheggiadag ed

column2: Yes, the sons of Levi who are priests were commanded by the law to receive a tithe from the people, their brothers and sisters, who are descended from Abraham.
column3: K hab chuꞌig g t‑chehanig matsh hegam t‑wehm oꞌodham mo d Levibad amjedkam ch d papal ab t‑amjed wo ui hegai hemako tahpna matsh wehst‑mahm wo e tahpanch g t‑gehgewadag.

column2: But Melchizedek who doesn't share their ancestry received tithes from Abraham, and blessed the one who had God's promises.
column3: Kush ihda Melkisedekbad pi d Levibad amjedkam. Tsh eda g Abrahambad ab namkid hegai mo d Jiosh wuikam. Tsh g Melkisedekbad ab i s‑hoꞌigeꞌel.

column2: There's no argument that the lesser person is blessed by the one who is greater.
column3: Kuch s‑mahch mat g geꞌechu ab wo s‑hoꞌigeꞌel g chumchu. K heg hekaj baꞌich i geꞌej g Melkisedekbad mo g Abrahambad.

column2: In the one case tithes are received by men who die, but in the other by one who is said to be living.
column3: Melkisedekbad o baꞌich d i si s‑has haꞌichu mo g t‑papalig. Hegam o wabsh koꞌihim. K wabshaba pi an hu hebai oꞌohanas mat muh g Melkisedekbad.

column2: So you could say that Levi, the one who receives tithes, has paid tithes through being a descendant of Abraham,
column3: K heg wa wepo mat g t‑papalig ha‑shohshonbad Levi am namkid g Melkisedekbad

column2: for he was yet to be born from his father when Melchizedek met Abraham.
column3: nash pi ab d Abrahambad amjedkam mash heg am namkid.

column2: Now if perfection could have been achieved through the priesthood of Levi (for that's how the law was received), what was the need for another priest to come following the order of Melchizedek, and not following the order of Aaron?
column3: Jiosh atsh am i ha chuhcha g Levibad amjedkam matsh d wo t‑papaligk ch ab wo t‑mah g chehanigaj. T wabshaba pi wo shaꞌi e nako g t‑papalig mas am wo i t‑apꞌech g Jiosh wehhejed. Tsh heg hekaj ab hema ep i wuhsh mash gawul masma mo hegam ch wepo masma g Melkisedekbad.

column2: If the priesthood is changed, then the law needs to be changed too.
column3: Kut hemho wa am gawul juh g Jiosh g e‑chehanig mat am wo i kei g Jesus mat d wo t‑pahligk.

column2: The one we're talking about comes from a different tribe, a tribe that has never provided priests to serve at the altar.  It's clear that our Lord is a descendant of Judah, and Moses said nothing about priests coming from this tribe.
column3: Heg ash pi ab hu d Levibad amjedkam ch wabshaba ab d Judabad amjedkam matsh idam pi d wo chum papalk am t‑chehanig ed. K heg hekaj tasho mat g Jiosh am gawul juh g e‑chehanig am t‑wehhejed.

column2: What makes it even clearer is when another priest appears who is similar to Melchizedek,
column3: Neh, baꞌich ant am wo i em‑tashogi mo g Jesus pi ha wepo masma g t‑papalig ch wabshaba wepo masma g Melkisedekbad.

column2: and who didn't become a priest by virtue of his human ancestry but by the power of a life that cannot be ended.
column3: Pi atsh e pahlch g t‑chehanigkaj k wabshaba e pahlch g gewkdajkaj g e‑doakag. K g doakaj d pi ha huhugedam.

column2: That's why it says, “You are a priest forever according to the order of Melchizedek.”
column3: Heg o hekaj ab amjed oꞌohanas mash ab wui hab kaij g Jiosh:

column2: So the previous rule has been set aside because it was powerless and didn't work,  (for the law didn't make anything perfect). But now it's been replaced by a better hope by which we can come close to God.
column3: Kut heg am i t‑apꞌech Jiosh tahgio mach ab hahawa s‑ap miabid. Heki hu t‑chehanig o pi ab hu shaꞌi t‑mahkch g gewkdag machs hekaj am wo i t‑apꞌech Jiosh wehhejed. Kut hekaj g Jiosh gam hu hab i juh.

column2: This  was not without an oath, even though those who become priests do so without an oath.
column3: Jiosh ash hab wabsh kaij matsh g Levibad amjedkam d wo papalk

column2: But he became a priest with an oath because God told him, “The Lord has taken a solemn vow and will not change his mind: You are a priest forever.”
column3: ch wabshaba g e‑gewkdagkaj hab kaij ab wui g Jesus:

column2: There have been many priests because death prevented them from being able to continue;
column3: Hegam Levibad amjedkam at pi wo e nako mas d wo papalk chum hekid no pi koꞌihim.

column2: but since Jesus lives forever, his priesthood is permanent.
column3: T wabshaba g Jesus chum hekid d wo doakamk. T hab pi hedai ep am kehkud ed wo i kekiwua.

column2: As a result he is able to save completely those who come to God through him, living always to plead their case on their behalf.
column3: Kut wo e nako mat wehs wo ha doꞌibia hegam mat am gahi wuhshanim ab wo i e nohnogi Jiosh wui nat pi chum hekid d wo doakamk ch am ha wehhejed ab wo tahnid g Jiosh mat am wo i ha wehmt.

column2: He is exactly the high priest we need: holy and without fault, pure and separate from sinners, and given a place in the highest heavens.
column3: Tatchua ach g si s‑ap uhgchu pahl. K g Jesus woho hab masma ch d hekia s‑apꞌekam ch i e gawulkadch ab ha amjed g pi apꞌekam. Idani o an daha Jiosh wehm an dahm kahchim ch ed.

column2: Unlike those human high priests, he doesn't need to offer a daily sacrifice for his sins and then the sins of the people. He did this once, and for everyone, when he offered himself.
column3: Pi o wepo masma hegam mo d uꞌugchu papal am heki hu t‑chehanig ed. (a) Hegam o d pi ap chuꞌijkam ch wehpeg ab wo haꞌichu iagchul hejel e‑chuꞌijig wehhejed k ab haha wo iagchul g hemajkam ha‑chuꞌijig wehhejed. K wabshaba g Jesus pi ha chuꞌijig. (b) Hegam o chum hekid ab haꞌichu iagchulid Jiosh wui. T wabshaba g Jesus hemho hab juh. T heg wehs am i apꞌech g pi ap ha‑chuꞌijig. (c) Hegam o ab haꞌichu chum namkid g Jiosh. T wabshaba g Jesus hejel am i e dagito mat hekaj ab wo iagchul.

column2: The law appoints imperfect men as high priests, but God gave his solemn vow after the law, and appointed his Son, perfect forever.
column3: Hegam mo d papal ab heki hu t‑chehanig wecho o pi d shaꞌi hekiakam ch pi ap wo nahto g e‑chikpan. T wabshaba g Jiosh am hahawa i kei g e‑alidag g hejel e‑gewkdagkaj. K heg d uhgchu t‑pahlig ch d si hekiakam. Pi at hekid wo huhug g gewkdaj. T hab s‑ap wo nahto g e‑chikpan.

column2: The main point of what we're saying is this: We have just such a high priest who is seated at the right hand of God, who sits in majesty on his throne in heaven.
column3: Neh, bo wa masma d uhgchu pahl g Jesus mant am i em‑tashogi. Kush g Jiosh ab si has elid ch am e wehm dahshch e‑kownal daikud ed.

column2: He serves in the sanctuary, the true tabernacle that was set up by the Lord and not by human beings.
column3: Jiosh kihdag o si s‑wohom d geꞌe cheopi ch pi d wabsh hemajkam ha‑nahtoi. K heg eda am chikpan ihda si s‑wohom uhgchu t‑pahlig.

column2: Since it's the responsibility of every high priest to offer gifts and sacrifices, this high priest must also have something to offer.
column3: Uꞌugchu papal at ab haꞌichu wo chum iagchul Jiosh wui am wehhejed g pi ap ha‑chuꞌijig g hemajkam. T id hab waꞌap wo wa juh g Jesus.

column2: Now if he was here on earth, he wouldn't be a priest at all, because there are already priests to present the offerings that the law requires.
column3: K eda pi hiwgidas mas hab wo juh ia jewed dahm no ge d Levibad amjedkam. Do waꞌi idam mo am t‑himdag chehanig ed hab wua g chuꞌijig iagchulida.

column2: The place they serve is a copy, a mere shadow of what is in heaven. That's what God told Moses when he was going to set up the tabernacle: “Be careful to make everything according to the blueprint you were shown on the mountain.”
column3: K eda g ha‑chikpan wabsh t‑chehgidch g Jiosh kihdag ch hegai si s‑wohom chuꞌijig iagchulida.

column2: But Jesus has been given a far better ministry just as he is the one who mediates a far better agreed relationship between us and God, which is based on much better promises.
column3: Neh, hegam uꞌugchu papal o am i chum ha wehmt g hemajkam heg hekaj heki hu hab elidaj g Jiosh. K wabshaba ihda wechij haꞌichu hab elidaj baꞌich i s‑kehgaj no pi g Jiosh baꞌich i s‑kehg haꞌichu ab t‑makiog. K g Jesus baꞌich i s‑ap i t‑wehmt heg hekaj.

column2: If that first agreement had been perfect, then a second wouldn't have been necessary.
column3: Pi at am hu hab wo juh g wechij apchuda g Jiosh matp g hekiukam s‑ap am wo i t‑apꞌech wehhejed.

column2: Pointing out their failings, God told his people, “Pay attention, says the Lord, because the days are coming when I will make a new agreement relating to the house of Israel and the house of Judah.
column3: Neh, bash kaij g Jiosh:

column2: The former system had instructions as to how to worship, and an earthly sanctuary.
column3: Am o apchudas heg eda heki hu chehanig mat has masma g hemajkam ab has wo elidad g Jiosh ch am ep apchudas mat g hemajkam am wo i kei g ikus kih mat hab d wo ahgak.

column2: The first room in the tabernacle housed the candlestick, the table, and the sacred bread. This was called the Holy Place.
column3: Id ash wa an e eda kuhpi. K hegai wehpeg kih hab e aꞌaga ‘Hekia S‑apꞌekam Kih.’ Sh id eda am haꞌichug g lalampa chuhchakud ch mihsa. Sh heg ab mihsa g papal am doꞌaw g pahn ch hekaj ab si has elid g Jiosh.

column2: Past the second veil in the tabernacle was the room called the Most Holy Place.
column3: Kush hegai hema ep kih hab e aꞌaga ‘Si Hekia S‑apꞌekam Kih.’

column2: This contained the golden altar of incense, the gold-covered “agreement chest.”  Inside this were the golden pot containing manna, Aaron's rod that had produced buds, and the stone inscriptions of the agreement.
column3: Id ash eda am haꞌichug g ohla iagchulidakud. Kush id ab g papal an memheid g s‑ap uhw haꞌichu. Kush am ep haꞌichug hegai uhs washa mash d chehgida mach d chum Jiosh hemajkamga ahchim Tutuligo. Id ash wehsko e maꞌishch g ohlakaj. Am ash id eda e dahshch g ohla haꞌa. Sh id eda haꞌi nuhkud hegai haꞌichu hugi mash hab e aꞌaga ‘manna.’ Kush am e chekch hegai Aaronbad usaga mash wa ab i iꞌiwgi. Kush wa am ep e toꞌakch hegai gohk koꞌokmalk hohodai mo an ab oꞌohanas g Jiosh chehanig.

column2: Above this were the glorious angel cherubim covering the place of reconciliation. We can't discuss all of this in detail now.
column3: An dahm ihda uhs washa ash an nahtois g gohk anghil ch ab e wui gegok ch g e‑aꞌankaj am ehkchulidch matsh hebai wo e iawua g ehꞌedaj g ha‑iagchulida. Id ash am e iawua matsh hekaj g Jiosh wo s‑ha hoꞌigeꞌid k gam hu hab wo i juh g ha‑chuꞌijig. Pi ant am hu wo kia wehs haꞌichu t tashogi ab amjed ihda.

column2: Once all of this had been set up, the priests would go in regularly to the first room of the tabernacle to perform their duties.
column3: Neh, bash wa masma wehs apchudas idam haꞌichu. Sh g papal am i wahpk wehpeg kih ch ed wehs tashkaj ch am hab wua g e‑chikpan.

column2: But only the high priest went into the second room, and only once a year. Even then he had to make a sacrifice involving blood, which he offered for himself and for the people's sins of ignorance.
column3: Kush wabshaba heg waꞌi si uhgchu pahl ged hu i wapke heg eda baꞌich kih hemho ahid ab. Kush g haꞌichu doakam ehꞌed am iagchulid Jiosh wui am wehhejed g e‑chuꞌijig ch ha‑chuꞌijig g hemajkam matp hems am hab juh pi mahchch mo d pi ap chuꞌijig.

column2: By this the Holy Spirit indicated that the way into the true Most Holy Place hadn't been revealed while the first tabernacle still existed.
column3: Hegai Si Hekia S‑apꞌekam Kih o wepogidas g Jiosh kihdag. K g Hekia S‑apꞌekam Gewkdag am t‑chehgidch mo pi koi ab hu kuhpiꞌoks g Jiosh kihdag am t‑wehhejed mo eda wabsh kia an kuhpi hegai kih.

column2: This is an illustration for us in the present, showing us that the gifts and sacrifices that are offered can't make the worshiper's conscience clear.
column3: K d wabsh chehgida mo g haꞌichu doakam ab iagchulid Jiosh wui. Pi at woho am wo i ha apꞌech Jiosh tahgio. K heg hekaj am wabsh kia e kudut heg hekaj pi ap e‑chuꞌijig.

column2: They're just religious regulations—about food and drink, and various ceremonies involving washing—which were put in place until the time of God's new way of relating to him.
column3: Ihda heki hu chehanig o wa am ha chehgidch mat haschu wo koꞌad ch has masma wo i e apꞌechudad e lihmhunch am Jiosh wehhejed am hugkam mat hekid g Jiosh am wo i wechijid wehs haꞌichu am t‑wehhejed.

column2: Christ has come as a high priest of all the good experiences we now have. He went into the greater, more complete tabernacle that wasn't made by human hands—not part of this created world.
column3: Tsh wa id am woho hab e juh g Christ k d si uhgchu pahl am dahm hegai s‑kehg haꞌichu mash g Jiosh hab kaij matsh hab wo t‑juni. Hegai apchuda mo am eda chikpan g Christ o baꞌich i geꞌej ch baꞌich i s‑apꞌe mo hegai geꞌe cheopi mani am heki hu ahg. Pi at g oꞌodham am nahto. K pi d ihda jewed dahm haꞌichu.

column2: He didn't enter through the blood of goats and calves, but through his own blood. He entered once, for all time, into the Most Holy Place, setting us free forever.
column3: Hemho at am i wah g Christ heg eda apchuda s‑ap nahtok g t‑doꞌibiadag. Hegam mo d jewed dahm papal o wabsh g haꞌichu doakam ha‑ehꞌed am iagchulid. T wabshaba g Jiosh alidag g hejel e‑ehꞌedkaj ab t‑behi g pi ha huhugedam doakag.

column2: For if the blood of goats and bulls and the ashes of a cow sprinkled on those who are ritually unclean make the body ceremonially clean,
column3: Neh, mash wa g ha‑ehꞌed g siswat ch totolo ab e sihbanid ch g matai ab amjed g wisilo mehidag ab e nehnichud ha dahm g hemajkam mat wo ha chehgi mat wo i ha kegch g Jiosh heg amjed matp hems pi ap am hu hab junihim g e‑himdag chehanig.

column2: how much more does the blood of Christ—who offered himself in his sinless life to God through the eternal Spirit—clean your consciences from your past sinful lives so you can serve the living God?
column3: Pegih, t baꞌich i geꞌe haꞌichu hab t‑juni g Christ mat am i e dagito Jiosh wui k am t‑wehhejed e muhkid. Hekia S‑apꞌekam Gewkdag o wa ab mahkch g gewkdag mat hab juh. K d hekia s‑apꞌekam iagchulida. Heki achd hu t‑kudut heg hekaj pi ap t‑chuꞌijig. T wabshaba g Christ am iagchul g e‑ehꞌed Jiosh wui mat am wo i t‑apꞌech. Kuch am hahawa g Jiosh wehhejed chikpan.

column2: This is why he is the mediator of a new agreed relationship. Since a death has occurred to set them free from the sins committed under the first agreed relationship, now those who are called can receive the promise of an eternal inheritance.
column3: Bash kaij g Jiosh matsh ab wo t‑mah g pi ha huhugedam doakag k ab wo i t‑wahpki e‑kihdag ed. T g alidaj am i apꞌech ihda wechij haꞌichu ahgaj t‑wehhejed ahchim mo g Jiosh ab t‑waid. Muhkigaj at am i t‑wuwhas matt pi wo ai g t‑namkidadag heg hekaj pi ap t‑chuꞌijig ab wecho hegai heki hu apchuda.

column2: For a will to be implemented, the person who made it must be dead.
