column3: Neh, mat hema wo muh k am wo dagito g e‑ahga mat hedai wo i ui g haꞌichu enigaj. T hemho wa am wo e wohokamch mat muh ihda oꞌodham. Kut am hahawa hab wo e juh g ahgaj.

column2: A will is only valid when there's been a death—and is never applied while the person who made it is still alive.
column3: Pi at hab wo shaꞌi e juh g ahgaj mat wo kia doakad. T hekid wo i muh, t hab haha wo e juh.

column2: That's why the first agreement was established with blood.
column3: Chum hems hegai heki hu apchuda am ha shahgid g Jiosh ch hemajkam at i e apꞌech g ehꞌedkaj.

column2: After Moses had given all the commandments of the law to everyone, he took the blood of calves and goats, and together with water, scarlet wool, and hyssop, sprinkled the book itself and all the people.
column3: Mosesbad atsh wehpeg am wehs ha ahgi g chehanig mo has i masma an oꞌohanas k am hahawa wasib g wisilo ch siswat ha‑ehꞌed k g shuhdagi am i wehnad k id oꞌos heg ab oꞌohana mo an hab chuꞌig g chehanig ch ab ha dahm g hemajkam. Batsh juh ihda am wa has mahs shaꞌikaj mo hab e aꞌaga ‘hyssop’ ch kahwal wopo mo i wegiumdas.

column2: He said to them, “This is the blood of the agreed relationship that God has told you he wants with you.”
column3: Kush wa hab kaij g Mosesbad:

column2: So if the copies of what is in heaven needed to be cleansed in this way, the things in heaven needed cleansing by better sacrifices.
column3: Neh, bo masma i e kegchud idam mo am wabsh oidch hab chuꞌig hegai mash am Jiosh kihdag ed. T wabshaba g dahm kahchim apchuda hemho wa baꞌich i s‑apꞌekam iagchulidakaj wo i e kegch.

column2: For Christ hasn't entered a Most Holy Place constructed by human beings that is only a pattern of the original. He has entered heaven itself, and now appears on our behalf, speaking for us in God's presence.
column3: Hegai Si Hekia S‑apꞌekam Kih ash am oidch hab junis g Jiosh kihdag. Tsh g Jiosh alidag pi am wabsh i wah heg eda k wabshaba am i wah Jiosh kihdag ed k idani am t‑wehhejed neok am tahgio g Jiosh.

column2: This was not to repeatedly offer himself, like a high priest has to enter the Most Holy Place year after year, offering blood that is not his own.
column3: Uhgchu t‑pahlig ahchim Tutuligo o wabsh g haꞌichu doakam t‑mumꞌajid ch ab Jiosh wui iagchulid. Tsh wabshaba g Jiosh alidag baꞌich i s‑ap iagchulida hab juh nat pi hejel e muhkid am t‑wehhejed.

column2: Otherwise Christ would have had to suffer many times since the creation of the world. No: just this one time at the end of the present age he came to remove sin by sacrificing himself.
column3: Tsh wabshaba g Jiosh alidag wabsh hemho hab juh k pi muꞌikko e muhkid am t‑wehhejed. Neh, k hab masma tasho mat s‑ap nahto g e‑chikpan mat gam hu hab i juh g pi ap t‑chuꞌijig. Kush hemu hahawa e aihim mat g jewed wo huhug.

column2: Just as human beings die only once, and then are judged,
column3: Am o apchudas mat hemho wa wo muh g oꞌodham hemho k heg i dahm ab wo ai g geꞌe lodaita tash.

column2: so too for Christ—having been sacrificed once to take away the sins of many people, he will come again, not to deal with sin, but to save those who wait for him.
column3: Bat wa masma g Christ hab waꞌap hemho am i e dagito t‑wehhejed k gam hu hab i juh g pi ap t‑chuꞌijig. T id pi am hahawa ep d wo chikpanajk. Tsh wabshaba ia ep wo i e maskogi mat wo t‑doꞌibia ahchim mach ab si hiwig ch ab nenida mat ab ep wo jiwia.

column2: The law is just a shadow of the good that was to come, and not the actual reality. So it can never through the repeated sacrifices offered year after year make right those who come to worship God.
column3: Ab ash wa t‑chehani g Jiosh matt ab wui wo ha iagchulidad g haꞌichu doakam wehs aꞌahid ab. Id atki pi gam hu hab wo i juh g pi ap t‑chuꞌijig k wabshaba wabsh s‑kohmagim t‑chehgidch mat has masma g Jiosh gam hu hab haha wo i juh.

column2: Otherwise wouldn't the sacrifices have stopped being offered? If the worshipers had been made clean once and for all, they wouldn't have had guilty consciences any longer.
column3: Pi at ep wo t‑kudutad g pi ap t‑chuꞌijig matp gam hu s‑ap hab wo i e juh heg hekaj iagchulida. Kutt heki hu waꞌi haꞌasa hab wo juh.

column2: But in fact those sacrifices remind people of sins year after year,
column3: Ihda t‑iagchulida o am wabsh i t‑chechegitolid g t‑chuꞌijig wehs ahid ab.

column2: because it's impossible for the blood of bulls and goats to remove sins.
column3: Pi at hekid wo shaꞌi e nako g totolo ch siswat ha‑ehꞌed mas gam hu hab wo i juh g t‑chuꞌijig.

column2: That's why when Christ  came into the world he said, “You didn't want sacrifices or offerings, but you did prepare a body for me.  Burnt offerings and sacrifices for sin gave you no pleasure.
column3: Sh heg hekaj ab wui hab kaij g Jiosh g alidaj am wo jiwiak jewed dahm:

column2: Every priest officiates in the services day after day, again and again offering the same sacrifices that can never remove sins.
column3: Wehs tashkaj o am hab wua g e‑chikpan g t‑papalig ch muꞌikko hab wua g iagchulida. T wabshaba ihda iagchulida pi hekid gam hu hab wo i juh g pi ap t‑chuꞌijig.

column2: But this Priest, after he had offered for sins a single sacrifice that lasts forever, sat down at God's right hand.
column3: Jiosh alidag at hi hemako iagchulida hab juh mat gam hu hab wo i juh. K id chum hekid s‑kehgaj heg wehhejed. T g Jiosh ab hahawa si has elid k an e wehm dahshch e‑kownal daikud ed.

column2: Now he waits until all his enemies are conquered, becoming like a footstool for him.
column3: K idani ab dak ch ab wo ai mat g Jiosh wo ha gewitojel hegam mo ab wui gegok.

column2: For by a single sacrifice he has set right forever those who are being made holy.
column3: Pegih, t hemho am e iagchul t‑wehhejed k hekaj i ha apꞌech iaꞌi amjed wehs hegam mat gam hu oa g pi apꞌekam ha‑ihbdag ed.

column2: As the Holy Spirit also tells us, for having said,
column3: Hekia S‑apꞌekam Gewkdag o am hab waꞌap wohokamchud ihda hab masma:

column2: Now we have the confidence, brothers and sisters, to enter the Most Holy Place by the blood of Jesus.
column3: Ab ach hahawa si apꞌedag matt ab wo i miabi g Jiosh nat pi muh g Jesus am t‑wehhejed. Id o heg wa wepo mach apꞌedag matt am wo i wahp heg eda Si Hekia S‑apꞌekam Kih.

column2: Through his life and death,  he opened up a brand-new, living way through the veil to God.
column3: E at muhkid g Christ am t‑wehhejed k hab masma ab i kuhpiꞌo ihda wechij himdag am t‑wehhejed

column2: Since we have such a great priest placed in charge over the house of God,
column3: no pi s‑wohom d si uhgchu t‑pahlig ahchim Jiosh hemajkamga.

column2: let us come close to God with sincere minds, totally trusting in him. Our minds have been sprinkled to purify them from our evil way of thinking, and our bodies have been washed clean by pure water.
column3: Hekai ach hu t‑kudut g pi ap t‑chuꞌijigkaj. T wabshaba ab i t‑kegchud k gam hu hab i juh g pi ap t‑chuꞌijig. Kuch heg hekai ab si hiwig ch d hekiakam ch ab wo i miabi g Jiosh.

column2: So let us hold onto the hope we're telling others about, never hesitating, for God who promised is trustworthy.
column3: Jiosh at woho ab wo t‑juni mash has i kaij. Kutt heg hekaj si s‑wihnam wo t‑uꞌukch heg ab.

column2: Let's think about how we can motivate one another to love and to do what is good.
column3: Ab att hig aꞌai wo si pihk t‑elidad ch ab aꞌai wo i t‑wehmtad matt am wo chehgidad mach ab ha tatchua g hemajkam ch am wo i ha wehmajk.

column2: We should not give up meeting together, as some have done. In fact we should be encouraging one another, especially as you see the End approaching.
column3: Haꞌi at haꞌasa ha wehm e nam g e‑wehm wohochuddam. Kumt wabshaba ahpim pi hab wo chum e juh k ab wo si aꞌai i e gewkemhunad. E o aihim mat ep wo jiwia g t‑kownalig Jesus. Kutt hekaj wahm baꞌich ab wo i t‑gewkemhunad.

column2: For if we deliberately go on sinning after we've understood the truth, there's no longer any sacrifice for sins.
column3: Pi at gam hu hab wo shaꞌi e juh g chuꞌijigaj hegai mat am hab wo kia junihid g pi apꞌekam ha chum s‑mahchch g wohokam. Pi o am hu hahawa haꞌichug mas haschu am wo e iagchul heg wehhejed.

column2: All that's left is fear, expecting the impending judgment and the terrible fire that destroys those who are hostile to God.
column3: Jiosh atsh wo ha lodait k gam hu wo ha shul s‑koꞌok ha‑namkidadag ed. K id hab masma mo g pi ha huhugedam mei. Heg o am waꞌi wiꞌis mat wo chum si s‑ehbidad matsh has wo ha juh.

column2: Someone who rejects the law of Moses is put to death without mercy on the evidence of two or three witnesses.
column3: Mosesbad atki an oꞌohana Jiosh heki hu oꞌohana ed matsh gohk o waik wo wohokamch g chuꞌijigaj hegai mat gam hu wo s‑ohhod g Jiosh chehanig. Kutsh wo e muhkid.

column2: How much worse do you think someone will deserve their punishment if they have trampled underfoot the Son of God, if they have disregarded the blood that sealed the agreement and makes us holy, treating it as ordinary and trivial, and have abused the Spirit of grace?
column3: Kumt baꞌich i s‑koꞌok namkidadag ab wo bei mamtp pi ab hu wo haꞌichuch g Jiosh alidag. Heg at iawua g e‑ehꞌed k e muhkid mat gam hu hab wo i chum juh g pi ap t‑chuꞌijig. Hekia S‑apꞌekam Gewkdag o chum si s‑hemajima ab em‑wui. Kumt wabshaba wo si s‑nenꞌoidk

column2: We know God, and he said, “I will make sure that justice is done; I will give people what they deserve.” He also said, “The Lord will judge his people.”
column3: nash pi hab kaij g Jiosh:

column2: Just remember the past when, after you understood the truth, you experienced a great deal of suffering.
column3: Am g wo s‑chegito mo wa has chuꞌig haꞌichu am em‑wehhejed. Muꞌi haꞌichu amt nako amjed mamt ab s‑mai g wohokam k eda pi shaꞌi e gehgch heg hekaj.

column2: Sometimes you were made a spectacle of, being insulted and attacked; at other times you stood in solidarity with those who were suffering.
column3: Muꞌikko am s‑koꞌokam has em‑ahg ch em‑shoꞌigchud am hemajkam ha tahgio. Hebai am wa si pi ap e tahtk ha wehhejed hegam mo hab waꞌap hab masma e shoꞌigchud.

column2: You showed your sympathy for those in prison, and took it cheerfully when your possessions were confiscated, knowing that you have something better coming that will truly last.
column3: Ab am ha wehm nakog g shoꞌigdag hegam mat e kuhpach. Ab am wa wabsh s‑ap e tahtk mat wa chum wehs em‑wohppoꞌi g haꞌichu em‑eniga heg hekaj mam s‑mahch mo baꞌich d i si haꞌichu hegai mamt ab bei mat id pi hekid wo ha huhug.

column2: So don't lose your confidence in God—it will be richly rewarded.
column3: Pi g am wo heb hu wua g e‑wohochudadag. Id at wo em‑uꞌapajel g geꞌe em‑mahkigdag.

column2: You need to be patient so that having done what God wants, you'll receive what he has promised.
column3: Bamt wo junihid g Jiosh tatchui ch wo s‑chu nakogad. T g Jiosh am hab wo em‑juni mash haschu hab s‑em‑junimk.

column2: “In just a little while he will come, as he said—he won't delay.
column3: Neh, bo chuꞌig an Jiosh oꞌohana ed mo hab kaij g Jiosh:

column2: Now our trust in God is the guarantee of what we hope for, the evidence of what we can't see.
column3: T‑wohochudadag o hab d ahga mach s‑mahch mo woho hegai mach am wui t‑gewpkadch, chum achs hems pi t‑wuhpuikaj neid.

column2: People who lived long ago trusted God and this is what gained them God's approval.
column3: Muꞌijj g t‑shohshonbad ash ab s‑wohochud g Jiosh haꞌichu ahga. Sh hekaj ab s‑ha hohhoꞌid g Jiosh.

column2: Through our trust in God we understand that the whole universe was created by God's command, that what can be seen was made out of what cannot be seen.
column3: Ab ach s‑wohochud g Jiosh haꞌichu ahga ch hekaj s‑amichud mat wehs haꞌichu nahto pi haꞌichu amjed am wabsh neokk.

column2: By trusting him Abel offered God a better sacrifice than Cain, and as a result God identified him as someone who lived right. God showed this by accepting his offering. Even though Abel has been dead for a long time, he still speaks to us through what he did.
column3: Hema ash wa hab chehgig Abel ch ash ab s‑wohochud g Jiosh ch hekaj ab s‑wohog elid k ab wui iagchul g haꞌichu doakam e‑muꞌa. Tsh wabshaba g wehngajbad Cain pi hab masma hab e juh. Tsh g Jiosh ab si s‑hohhoꞌi g Abelbad natsh pi hab juh g tatchuij. Id ach an neꞌokchulid Jiosh oꞌohana ed. K id heg wa wepo mo g Abelbad am wabsh kia neok ch am haꞌichu t‑ahgid.

column2: By trusting God Enoch was taken to heaven so he didn't experience death. He couldn't be found on earth because God took him to heaven. Before this happened he was known as someone God was pleased with.
column3: Hema ash wa hab chehgig Enoc ch ash ab s‑wohochud g Jiosh. Sh g Jiosh s‑hohhoꞌid ch gam hu i bei mash wabsh kia doa. Kutsh pi hedai edagi.

column2: You can't expect God to be pleased with you if you don't trust him! Anyone who comes to God must believe that God exists, and that he rewards those who are searching for him.
column3: Hegam at wo waꞌi s‑ha hohhoꞌidad g Jiosh mat hedai ab wo s‑wohochudad. Hegai mat ab wo i miabi g Jiosh at hemho wa wo s‑wohoch mo an hema d Jiosh ch am i e tashogid ha wui hegam mo ab s‑mahchimk.

column2: Noah trusted God, and was warned by him about things that had never happened before. Because Noah paid serious attention to what God said, he constructed an ark to save his family. By trusting God, Noah showed that the world was wrong, and received the reward of being set right by God.
column3: Noahbad atsh ab i s‑wohoch g Jiosh k ab si has elid. Jiosh ash wa am ahgid mat hema hab wo juh g si geꞌe wahlko natsh pi wo ha wiꞌin. Tsh idam Noahbad woho hab e juh k heg eda e doꞌibia g e‑wehm kihkam wehm ch e‑aꞌaliga ha wehm. Bat masma am mahsko wua g Jiosh g hemajkam ha‑chuꞌijig natsh pi hegam pi ab hu wohoch. Kush hab kaij g Jiosh mash idam Noahbad d s‑apꞌekam nash pi ab s‑wohochud.

column2: Through trusting God Abraham obeyed when God called him to go to the land God was going to give him. He left, not knowing where he was going.
column3: Abrahambad ash ab s‑wohochud g Jiosh ch ab s‑wohog el. Jiosh ash hab ahg matsh am hu hebai wo mah g mehk jewed. Kutsh ab wui wo hih. Tsh g Abrahambad woho dagito g e‑kihdag k gam hu hih wa chum pi mahchch mas hebai wo hih.

column2: Trusting in God he lived in the promised land—but as a foreigner, living in tents, together with Isaac and Jacob who shared with him in inheriting the same promise.
column3: Jiosh atsh pi oi ha mah hegai jewed. Kush am wabsh i e chiwiapadad ch am kihkahim ikus kih ch ed am ha wehm g e‑amjedkam. Kush g Jiosh am hab waꞌap ha ahgid idam Abrahambad amjedkam matsh am hu hebai wo ha mah hegai jewed.

column2: For Abraham was looking forward to a city built on foundations that last, with God as its builder and maker.
column3: Abrahambad ash ab wui e gewkad hegai kihhim mo d Jiosh nahtoi ch pi hekid wo i gei.

column2: By her trust in God even Sarah herself was given the ability to conceive a child though she was too old, because she trusted God who had made the promise.
column3: Abrahambad ch Sarabad ash wa ab s‑wohochud g Jiosh mash wa hab ha ahgid matsh wo hema mahsid g ali matsh eda heki hu kekelit. Sh g Sarabad pi ha mamdat.

column2: That is why the descendants of Abraham, (who was as good as dead!), became as numerous as the stars of heaven, as countless as the sand of the sea-shore.
column3: Neh, sh wa g Abrahambad d si keli mat pi ep wo chum e nako mas wo alidt. T eda ab amjed i hih muꞌi hemajkam mo pi ta kuintama hab masma mo g huhuꞌu ch hab masma mo g oꞌod an ge kahchki babsho.

column2: They all died still trusting in God. Though they didn't receive the things God promised, they were still looking for them as it were from a distance and welcomed them, acknowledging that on this earth they were foreigners, people just passing through.
column3: Wehsijj idam mach am ha chehcheg at koꞌo k huhug koi wehs uꞌuk hegai mash haschu g Jiosh ab ha makiog. Heg o wa wepo wo mehkjed neid ch ab si tatchua hegai haꞌichu no pi s‑mahch mo d wabsh chihpiadam id dahm jewed.

column2: People who say such things make it clear that they're looking for a country of their own.
column3: Hegam mo hedai s‑mahch ihda o am tasho e gahgid g jewed mat d wo si ha‑enigak.

column2: For if they cared about the country they'd left behind, they could have returned.
column3: Pi o am hu uhpam e chegito heg wui jewed mat am dagito. Jiosh at wo ha hiwigi mat wo uhpam hihi matp hab wo e el.

column2: But they're looking for a better country instead, a heavenly country. That is why God isn't disappointed with them, and is happy to be called their God, for he has built a city for them.
column3: K wabshaba am e gewpkadch heg wui jewed mo baꞌich i s‑apꞌe, pej hegai dahm kahchim kihdag. Jiosh o s‑hohhoꞌid mo hab aꞌaga mo d ha‑Jioshga nat pi am heki hu nahto g kihhim ha wehhejed.

column2: Abraham trusted God when he was tested and offered Isaac to God. Abraham, who had accepted God's promises, was still ready to offer to God his only son,
column3: Abrahambad alidag ash hab chehgig Isaac. Tsh wa g Jiosh am wabsh aꞌappe g Abrahambad mash eda d doakam mat wo mua g e‑alidag k hekaj ab wui wo iagchul. Tsh g Abrahambad ab i s‑wohochud k hab chum juh, chum as g Isaacbad d si hejel alidag ch d Jiosh mahkigdag.

column2: even though he'd been told, “It's through Isaac that your descendants will be counted.”
column3: Jiosh ash wa hab ahgid mat ab Isaacbad amjed wo i hihi g amjedkamaj.

column2: Abraham had thought it through and decided that God could bring Isaac back to life from the dead. In a sense that's what did happen—Abraham received Isaac back from the dead.
column3: Abrahambad o ab s‑wohochud mat g Jiosh wo e nako mat ab uhpam wo i wuhshad g Isaacbad muhkig amjed. K heg wa wepo mat hab e juh nat pi oi wa doꞌibia.

column2: Trusting in God, Isaac blessed Jacob and Esau in regard to what the future would bring.
column3: Isaacbad ash wa ab s‑wohochud g Jiosh ch hekaj am ha ahgid g e‑aꞌalidag Jacob ch Esau matsh has masma ab wo s‑ha hoꞌigeꞌel g Jiosh.

column2: Trusting in God, Jacob as he was dying blessed each of Joseph's sons, and worshiped God, leaning on his staff.
column3: Jacobbad ash wa ab s‑wohochud ch ab ihm g Jiosh ch am ha ahgid hegam e‑wopsmad mash d Joseph aꞌalidag matsh has masma ab wo s‑ha hoꞌigeꞌel g Jiosh. Id at hab juh mo eda muhkhim an wabsh e‑cheowikud an e gewishch.

column2: Trusting in God, Joseph too, when his own death approached, spoke about the exodus of the Israelites, and gave instructions about what to do with his bones.
column3: Josephbad ash wa ab s‑wohochud g Jiosh ch hekaj hab kaij am i muhkhimk mat wo uhpam hihi g Tutuligo ab amjed g Egypt jewed ch am ep si shel ha ahgid mat has wo juh g ohꞌoj.

column2: Trusting in God, Moses' parents hid him for three months after he was born. They recognized he was a special child. They weren't afraid to go against what the king had commanded.
column3: Mosesbad jehj ash wa ab s‑wohochud g Jiosh. Kownal ash chum ha chehani g Tutuligo mat wo ha kokda g chechoj e‑aꞌaliga. Tsh eda g Mosesbad jehj pi shaꞌi ehbeni g kownal chehanig k eꞌesto g Mosesbad waik mashad amjed mat mahsi neidch mo s‑ap ulini d ali.

column2: Trusting in God, Moses, when he grew up, refused to be known as the adopted son of Pharaoh's daughter.
column3: Kownal alidag atsh an hahawa bei g Mosesbad k hab aꞌaga mo d madaj. K wabshaba g Mosesbad ab s‑wohochud g Jiosh ch pi hohhoꞌid am i geꞌehogatk mat hab wo e aꞌagad mo d madaj hegai mo pi d Jiosh hemajkamga.

column2: Instead he chose to share in the sufferings of God's people rather than to enjoy the temporary pleasures of sin.
column3: Baꞌich i mat ab wo nako g shoꞌigdag ha wehm g Jiosh hemajkamga ki hegai mat am heꞌes wo si s‑hehgigk ha wehm hegam mo pi ab hu wohochud g Jiosh.

column2: He counted the rejection he experienced from following Christ to be of far greater value than the wealth of Egypt—because he was focused on the reward to come.
column3: Am ash aꞌamichud mat wo e shoꞌigch wehhejed g Jiosh si Kehsha. K wabshaba id baꞌich d i si haꞌichu am wehhejed ki g Egypt jewed s‑kaisdag no pi am wa s‑chegitog mash haschu si s‑kehg haꞌichu ab ha makiog g Jiosh g e‑hemajkamga.

column2: Trusting in God, he left Egypt and wasn't scared of Pharaoh's anger—he kept going with his eyes fixed on the invisible God.
column3: Kutsh heg hekaj pi shaꞌi ehbeni g kownal k am dagito g Egypt jewed. Heg o wa wepo mo ab neid g pi ta neidagam Jiosh nash pi ab nakog g shoꞌigdag am wehhejed.

column2: Trusting in God he observed the Passover and the sprinkling of blood, so that the destroying angel would not touch the Israelites.
column3: Jiosh ash am ahgid g Mosesbad mat wo ha cheha g hemajkam mat wo ha kokda g kahwal mahmad k ab wui wo iagchul g ha‑ehꞌed ab e‑pupualit ab. Tsh hab pi wo ha kokda g anghil g wehpeg cheoj ha‑aꞌaliga. Tsh g Mosesbad ab i s‑wohochud k hab masma ha cheha g hemajkam.

column2: Trusting in God the Israelites crossed the Red Sea as if it were dry land. When the Egyptians attempted to do the same they were drowned.
column3: Kush g Jiosh hab ha ahg g Tutuligo mat am gahi wo i huhud S‑wegi Kahchki oidch. Kutsh ab i s‑wohochud k hab e juh. Kutsh am i tahp g shuhdagi. Tsh am wabsh s‑gaki jewed oidk hihi. Tsh g Egypt t am shondal am chum ha oidk heb e juh. Tsh ha maꞌish g shuhdagi k wehs ha kokda.

column2: Trusting in God, the Israelites marched around the walls of Jericho for seven days, and the walls fell down.
column3: Neh, an ash wa uhgk hohodai kolhaidag g Jerico kihhim. Kutsh wa g Jiosh hab ha ah g t‑shohshon matsh an wo e himtchul. Tsh ab i s‑wohochud k hab e juh. Tsh hekaj i shul g Jiosh hegai kolhai.

column2: Trusting in God, Rahab the prostitute didn't die with those who rejected God, because she had welcomed the Israelite spies in peace.
column3: Tsh am i wahp k wehs ha kokda hegam mo pi ab hu wohog elid g Jiosh. Tsh wabshaba hema ab s‑wohoch g Jiosh, chum as d chehpaꞌawi, k wa ha doꞌibia hegam Tutuligo mash wa am s‑aꞌagi chechga g jewed. Kumtsh heg hekaj pi mua mamt hekid ha gewito.

column2: What other examples should I give? I don't have time to talk about Gideon, Barak, Samson, Jephthah; about David, Samuel, and the prophets.
column3: Pi ant wo ni‑nako manis wehs in wo oꞌoha ab ha amjed hegam kekelibad mash hab chechgig Gideon ch Barak ch Samson ch Jephda ch David ch Samuel ch muꞌi ehp g Jiosh haꞌichu i tashogiddam.

column2: Because of their trust in God they conquered kingdoms, did what was right, received God's promises, shut the mouths of lions,
column3: Jiosh ash wa hab ha ahg matsh haschu hab wo juh. Kutsh ab i s‑wohochud k hab e juh. Haꞌijj atsh g nahnko mahs jejewed ha gewito k hab wua g s‑apꞌekam. Tsh g Jiosh ab ha mah mash haschu ha ahgid mat ab wo ha mah. Haꞌi atsh wa e doꞌibia ab ha amjed g maipid

column2: put out blazing fires, escaped being killed by the sword, were weak but made strong, did mighty deeds in war, and routed enemy armies.
column3: ch ab amjed mam chum s‑ha kokdaimk g meikaj ch is‑pahyokaj. Do wabsh oꞌodham ch eda ab bei g geꞌe gewkdag k am s‑chechojim ha gewito g e‑obga ab aꞌai jejewed amjed.

column2: Women were given their dead family members back through resurrection. Others were tortured, refusing to compromise and be pardoned, because they wanted to be part of a better resurrection.
column3: Jiosh atsh wa ab uhpam i ha chegitoich g ha‑koꞌidag haꞌi uꞌuwi mo ab s‑wohochud.

column2: Yet others suffered insults and whippings; they were put in chains and imprisoned.
column3: Haꞌijj amsh wa s‑koꞌokam has ha ahg ch ha gewittan k haꞌi ha wupulsh k ged hu si ha kuh.

column2: Some were stoned, cut in pieces, tempted, killed by the sword. Some dressed in sheepskins and goatskins: destitute, oppressed, and mistreated.
column3: Haꞌijj amtsh wa ha maꞌichshulig k haꞌijj an ha eda si ha hikuch k haꞌijj g is‑pahyokaj am ha kokda. Muꞌijj ash shaꞌi si shoꞌig ch wabsh g haꞌichu doakam eꞌelidagkaj e eꞌenigadadch. Msh wa muꞌi ha shoꞌigchud ch pi ab hu ap ha neid.

column2: The world was not worthy to have such people who wandered in the deserts and mountains, living in caves and holes in the ground.
column3: Kumsh wa ha shoꞌigchud no pi d si s‑ap hemajkam. An o wabsh oiopo tohono jewed oidk ch kaꞌakwulk oidk ch am wabsh kih wahpag ch ed ch chehcho ch ed.

column2: All of these people, even though they had God's approval, didn't receive what God had promised.
column3: Id o wehs d ha‑apꞌedag am Jiosh wehhejed no pi ab s‑wohochud. T eda chum koi ab hu nei mo wa haschu ha ahgid g Jiosh mat hab wo ha juni.

column2: God has given us something even better, so that they can't be complete without us.
column3: Jiosh at hab masma apꞌech mat ab t‑wehm wo bei g baꞌich i s‑kehg apꞌedag.

column2: For that reason, since we are surrounded by such a great crowd of people who gave evidence of their trust in God, let's get rid of everything that holds us back, the seductive sins that trip us up, and let's keep on running the race placed before us.
column3: Neh, idam muꞌi hemajkam at e nako no pi ab s‑wohochud g Jiosh. K id am t‑chehgidch matt ahchim hab waꞌap masma wo t‑nako. Muꞌi o haꞌichu ged hu wabsh i chum t‑wulshshap. Kutt hemho wa ab wo si i t‑hawpkaj hab masma mat g e wopoichuddam. Hegam mo d e wopoichuddam at am s‑gewkam wo wohp heg oidk mamt hebai wo i ha cheki. Kutt ahchim hab wa masma am s‑gewkam wo i t‑nako t‑wohochudadag ed.

column2: We should keep on looking to Jesus, the one who begins and completes our trust in God. Because of the joy ahead of him Jesus endured the cross, disregarding its shame, and sat down at the right hand of God's throne.
column3: Pegih, tt hig am wo i t‑gewpkai Jesus wui. Heg at ab i t‑mah g t‑wohochudadag k wo wa s‑ap t‑nahto heg eda. Pi at shaꞌi dagito g e‑chikpan, chum as e muhkid ab kots t ab k ab nako g si edadag no pi ab behiog g s‑ap tahhadkam. Tsh g Jiosh ab si has elid k an e wehm dahshch e‑kownal daikud ed.

column2: Think about Jesus who endured such hostility from sinful people so you don't grow tired and become discouraged.
column3: Muꞌi haꞌichu at ab nako g Jesus k ab ep nako g kehꞌidadag ab ah amjed g pi ap hemajkam. Pegih, mt ahpim am hab waꞌap wo si e nakog k pi wo shaꞌi haꞌasa.

column2: Your resistance so far hasn't cost you blood as you fight against sin.
column3: Koi amt haꞌichu shaꞌi nako ab wui gegokch g pi apꞌekam.

column2: Have you forgotten God's appeal to you when he reasons with you as his children? He says, “My child, don't treat the Lord's discipline lightly, and don't give up when he corrects you either.  The Lord disciplines everyone he loves, and he punishes everyone he welcomes as his child.”
column3: Pi g am wo pi chegito mo ab si i em‑gewkemhun g Jiosh ch hab masma ab em‑wehm neok mam d aꞌaligaj mash wa hab kaij:

column2: Be patient as you experience God's discipline because he is treating you as his children. What child doesn't experience a father's discipline?
column3: Pegih, ab g wo nakogi g e‑shoꞌigdag hab masma matp hems g em‑ohg s‑gewkam haꞌichukaj wo em‑shohbi. Em‑shoꞌigdag o am chehgidch mo g Jiosh hab masma hab em‑juhkch mam d aꞌaligaj. Pi o woho d ha‑alidag hegai mam pi haꞌichu i shohbid.

column2: If you are not disciplined, (which everyone has experienced), then you are illegitimate and not true children.
column3: Jiosh at si s‑koꞌokam wo em‑shohbidad. Kumt hekaj wo s‑mahchk mam d aꞌaligaj.

column2: For if we respected our earthly fathers who disciplined us, shouldn't we even more be subject to the discipline of our spiritual Father which leads to life?
column3: Neh, em‑jehj atp hems ab s‑gewkam haꞌichu em‑shohbi. Kum ab si has ha elid. Pegih, baꞌich o i matt ab wo i t‑dagito t‑ohg Jiosh wui k ab wo bei g pi ha huhugedam doakag.

column2: They disciplined us for a short while as they thought appropriate, but God does so for our benefit in order that we can share his holy character.
column3: T‑jehj id dahm jewed o heꞌes ab haꞌichukaj s‑gewkam t‑shohbidahim hab elidch mo s‑apꞌe. K wabshaba g Jiosh ab haꞌichukaj i t‑shohbid mat hab wo t‑juh matt d wo hekia s‑apꞌekamk mo heg hab masma.

column2: When it happens, all discipline seems painful and not something to be happy about. But later on it produces peace in those who have been trained in this way so that they do what is right.
column3: Pi o ta hohhoꞌidama mo hekid i s‑gewkam t‑shohbid g Jiosh. Ch wabshaba heg amjed bebhe g si s‑apꞌekam doakag ch hahawa si s‑ap t‑tahtk.

column2: So strengthen your feeble hands, and your weak knees!
column3: Mt hekaj ab wo si e gewpkai Jiosh wui k wo s‑gegokim gegokiwua.

column2: Make straight paths to walk on, so that those who are crippled won't lose their way, but will be healed.
column3: Am g hab wo junihid g s‑apꞌekam mamt am wo i gewpka e‑himdag oidk. Kut am wo em‑nei hegam mo pi gewpkdag k atp hems ab wo i gewpka.

column2: Do your best to live in peace with everybody, and look for holiness—if you don't have this you won't see the Lord.
column3: Am g wo i e nakog k wehs s‑ap ab wo ha neidad g hemajkam ch am hab wo junihid g s‑apꞌekam haꞌichu namt pi hab waꞌi masma am wo i wahp Jiosh kihdag ed.

column2: Make sure that none of you lack God's grace, in case some cause of bitterness arises to give trouble and end up corrupting many of you.
column3: Am at wo i wah g bagatalig em‑shahgid mamtp wo dagito g Jiosh hemajimatalig. Am g aꞌai wo si e nuhkudad mat pi hab wo e juh.

column2: Make sure there's nobody who is sexually immoral, or irreligious, like Esau was. He sold his birthright for a single meal.
column3: Am g wo s‑e nenꞌoidad mamt pi wo e uamhu g pi apꞌekamkaj wabsh pehegchudch g Jiosh haꞌichu hab masma matsh wa hab e juh hegai mash hab chehgig Esau. Id ash d geꞌechu ha‑alidag. K heg hekaj haꞌichu d chum apꞌedaj. Kush wabshaba pi ab hu has shaꞌi elid ch gagda mat si hemho gegosig ab i nei heg amjed.

column2: You remember that even when he wanted to receive the blessing later on he was refused. Even though he really tried, and cried hard, Esau couldn't change what he had done.
column3: S‑mahch am matsh am hahawa chum gawul juh g pi ap e‑chegitoi k chum shoak. Tsh wabshaba g ohgaj am hahawa pi e nako mas ab wo mah g Jiosh hoꞌigeꞌidalig.

column2: You haven't arrived at a physical mountain that can be touched, that burned with fire, to a stormy place of black darkness,
column3: S‑e g wo nenꞌoidk no pi d si s‑has haꞌichu ihda Jiosh haꞌichu ahga mamt ab i kaiha. Neh, t‑shohshonbad atsh ab wui hihi g Sinai Doꞌag matsh ab wo kaiha g Jiosh chehanig. Kush g mehi an dahm wuhshani hegai doꞌag. K an ha wehgaj g s‑chuhugam an kahch ch g s‑gewk hewel an med

column2: where the sound of a trumpet and a voice speaking was heard—and those who heard the voice begged never to hear it speak to them again.
column3: ch g kuikud ab kaida. K ab hema g neok. Tsh am i kah g hemajkam ihda mash ab neok k ab si shoani ch ab ahgid g Mosesbad mo pi kaimk hegai neꞌoki.

column2: For they couldn't take what they were told to do, such as, “Even if a farm animal touches the mountain, it must be stoned to death.”
column3: Jiosh ash ab ha chehani ch hab kaij:

column2: But you have arrived at Mount Zion, the city of the living God, heavenly Jerusalem, with its thousands and thousands of angels.
column3: Pegih, ch ahchim hemuch hab waꞌap kaiham g Jiosh haꞌichu ahga. K g Jiosh kihdag d si s‑wohom t‑kihdag ch d dahm kahchim ch ed Jerusalem kihhim. Bach aꞌaga amai mo am haꞌichug Sion Doꞌag. K id heg wa wepo mach ahchim hab waꞌap ab wui t‑gewpkadch g doꞌag hab masma mash wa g t‑shohshon. Muꞌi mihl anghil o an haꞌichug anai Jiosh kihdag ed.

column2: You have come to the church of the firstborn whose names are written down in heaven, to God, the judge of everyone, and to those good people whose lives are complete.
column3: Kutt ahchim mach ab s‑wohochud g Jiosh haꞌichu ahga an wo i t‑hemapad k an wo haꞌichugk ch wo si s‑hehgigk. Heki o hu an oꞌohadag g t‑chechgig mach d aꞌaligaj g Jiosh. Kutt g si hemako alidaj wehm wo edgidad wehs haꞌichu. Jiosh o d si usagakam wehs hemajkam ha dahm. Kuch ab s‑wohochud. K heg wa wepo matt heki hu ab wui hihi. An o haꞌichug hegam mat heki hu koi am i e apꞌechudk Jiosh wui. Kutt am wo ha wehmajk.

column2: You have come to Jesus, who shares with us the new agreed relationship, to the sprinkled blood that means more than that of Abel.
column3: Ab att i s‑wohoch g Jesus nat pi heg am i apꞌech g wechij haꞌichu ahgaj g Jiosh t‑wehhejed. E at iawua g Jesus ehꞌed mat e muhkid k hab gam hu hab i juh g pi ap t‑chuꞌijig. Id o baꞌich i s‑kehg d haꞌichu mo hegai matsh wa g Abelbad hab e juh.

column2: Make sure you don't reject the one who is speaking! If they didn't escape when they rejected God on earth, it is even more certain that we won't escape if we turn away from God who warns us from heaven!
column3: Neh, nahnko masma o ab t‑wui neok g Jiosh idani. Kumt pi gam hu wabsh wo s‑ohhod g neꞌokij. Hegam mash wa pi ab hu kaiham hegai mash am ha ahgid g Jiosh haꞌichu ahga ash wa pi e doꞌibia. Kutt baꞌich wo i bei g s‑koꞌok t‑namkidadag mattp pi ab hu wo kaiha hegai mo ab neok dahm kahchim t amjed.

column2: Back then God's voice shook the earth, but his promise is now: “One more time I'm going to shake not only the earth, but heaven too.”
column3: Neꞌokij ash wa uꞌugij g jewed ab Sinai Doꞌag amjed. K wabshaba iaꞌi idani hab kaij:

column2: Since we're receiving a kingdom that cannot be shaken, let us have a gracious attitude, so we can serve God in a way that pleases him, with reverence and respect.
column3: Pegih, tt ab wo si i hoꞌigeꞌel g Jiosh mat ab i t‑ui id eda kownaltalig mat pi haꞌichu wo e nako mat wo uꞌugij. Ab att hig wo si ihm g Jiosh am hohhoꞌidaj oidch ab has elidch ch ab ep s‑wohog elid.

column2: For “our God is a fire that consumes.”
column3: Jiosh atsh wehs wo hugio g pi apꞌekam hab masma mat g mehi wo hugio g s‑mehidkam.

column2: May love for each other as brothers and sisters always continue!
column3: Neh, ab am aꞌai e wui si pihk e elid hab masma mam d e‑hajunim ab ihmch g Jesus Christ. Pegih, pi g wo shaꞌi dagito ihda.

column2: Don't forget to show love for strangers too, because by doing so some have welcomed angels without knowing it.
column3: Nt ep wo em‑ahgi mamt am wo i ha wahpki g shoꞌigkam e‑kihki ed, chum ams pi ha mahch. Batsh wa e juh haꞌi k hahawa chum nei moki d anghil.

column2: Remember those who are locked up in prison as if you were imprisoned with them. Remember those who are mistreated as if you were physically suffering with them.
column3: Am g wo wa s‑ha chegitok hegam mam ged hu si ha kuhpch hab sha masma mamtp hems ahpim am ha wehm kuhpi. Am g wo s‑ha chegitok hegam mo e shoꞌigchud hab sha masma mamtp hems ha wehm e shoꞌigchud.

column2: Everyone should honor marriage. Husbands and wives should be faithful to each other. God will judge adulterers.
column3: Ab amt wo si has elidad g hohnta ch wo si e nuhkud aꞌai e wehhejed. Jiosh at ab wo ha mah g s‑koꞌok namkidadag hegam mat pi wo e nuhkud ch hegam mat wo ha ehs g ha‑wehm kihkam.

column2: Don't love money; be content with what you have. God himself has said, “I'll never let you down; I'll never give up on you.”
column3: Pi g heg waꞌi s‑kaisdag ab wo tatchuad ch wabshaba wabsh wo s‑ap e tahtkkad heg hekaj mam haschu i edgid.

column2: Remember your leaders who explained God's word to you. Look again at the results of their lives, and imitate their trust in God.
column3: Am g wo s‑chegitok g haꞌichu ha‑ahga hegam mo wehpeg am ahgahim g Jiosh haꞌichu ahga. Am g wo i chegito mo has masma in d dodakamkahim ch has masma e koꞌij k am oidk hab wo i juh g ha‑wohochudadag.

column2: Jesus Christ is the same yesterday, today, and forever.
column3: Jesus Christ o am hab wabsh i masma id i tashkaj mo wa ged hu i heki hu ch am hab wabsh wo i masmak chum hekid.

column2: Don't get distracted by different kinds of strange teachings. It's good for the mind to be convinced by grace, not by laws concerning what we eat.  Those who followed such laws didn't gain anything.
column3: Kumt pi wo shaꞌi hiwigi mas g gawul mahs mashchama im hu hab wo i em‑juh ab amjed g s‑apꞌekam himdag. Haꞌi o an uꞌukch g heki hu t‑himdag chehanig hab e elidch mat hab masma wo i gewkai g e‑wohochudadag. T wabshaba id pi wo shaꞌi i ha wehmt. An att wo uꞌukchid g Jiosh hemajimatalig. Bat wa masma wo i gewka g t‑wohochudadag.

column2: We have an altar that those priests of the Tabernacle have no right to eat from.
column3: Hegam mo an uꞌukch g heki hu e‑himdag chehanig o ge iagchulidakud. Pegih, ch ahchim hab waꞌap ge iagchulidakud. K d hegai kots mat g Jiosh si Kehsha ab ab e muhkid. T hegam mat hedai wabsh g chehanigkaj wo chum i e gahgidahi g e‑doꞌibiadag pi wo shaꞌi bei ab amjed ihda t‑iagchulidakud.

column2: The carcasses of the animals, whose blood is carried by the high priest into the most holy place as an offering for sin, are burned outside the camp.
column3: Uhgchu pahl o am iagchulid g haꞌichu doakam ehꞌed am heg eda Si Hekia S‑apꞌekam Kih mat heg hekaj im hu hab wo i juh g pi ap ha‑chuꞌijig g hemajkam. Kush g ha‑chuhkug g haꞌichu doakam gam hu jeg ed e memheid.

column2: In the same way Jesus also died outside the city gate so that he could make God's people holy through his own blood.
column3: Pegih, t g Jesus heg hekaj gam hu jeg ed e muhkid k g e‑ehꞌed iawua mat im hu hab wo i juh g hemajkam pi ap ha‑chuꞌijig.

column2: So let us go out to him, outside the camp, experiencing and sharing in his shame.
column3: Ahchim o d t‑edadag g pi ap t‑chuꞌijig. Kut eda heg ab moht am t‑wehhejed. Pegih, tt wo si s‑hehgigam aꞌagad mo d t‑doꞌibiakam am i dagitok g heki hu t‑himdag.

column2: For we don't have a permanent city to live in here, we're looking for the home that is still to come.
column3: Pi ach ia hu d si kihkam id dahm jewed. An ash hab chuꞌig g s‑kehg kihhim am t‑wehhejed. Kuch heg wui am nenea.

column2: So let us through Jesus always offer a sacrifice of praise to God—this means speaking well of God, declaring his character.
column3: Ab o t‑ab matt chum hekid ab wo si has elidad g Jiosh. Id o heg wa wepo mo d t‑iagchulida Jiosh wui. K g Jesus i t‑wehmt mach hab wua. Chum att hekid ab wo hoꞌigeꞌidad g Jiosh am chehchegch.

column2: And don't forget to do what is good, and to share with others what you have, for God is pleased when you make such sacrifices.
column3: Pi g am haꞌasa hab wo juhni g s‑apꞌekam k ab wabsh aꞌai wo i e wehmajk. K id hab waꞌap heg wa wepo mo d t‑iagchulida. K g Jiosh s‑hohhoꞌid.

column2: Follow your leaders, and do what they tell you, for they are watching out for you and are accountable. Act in such a way that they can do this happily—and not with sadness, for that wouldn't help you!
column3: Ab g wo s‑ha wohog elidad g e‑wanimeddam. Idam o chum hekid am nuhkud g s‑apꞌekam em‑dodakag nat pi hemho wa am wo i ahgahi g e‑chikpan am Jiosh wui. Kumt ab wo ha mah g s‑ap tahhadkam ha‑chikpan ed mamt ab wo ha wohog elidad. Pi at haꞌichu em‑wehhejed wo s‑kehgajk mamt ab wo ha mah g pi ap tahhadkam.

column2: Please pray for us. We're convinced we have acted in good conscience, always wanting to do what's right in every situation.
column3: Am g wo wa tahnid g Jiosh mat wo i ni‑wehmajkad. Bani wabsh s‑junimk g s‑apꞌekam ch pi shaꞌi haꞌichu hab wua manis hekaj ni‑kudut.

column2: I really want you to pray hard so that I can come back to see you soon.
column3: Kumt heg hekaj ab wo i tai g Jiosh mant s‑hohtam am wo i ni‑dagito. Nt hab s‑hohtam am uhpam wo i em‑chehgim.

column2: Now may the God of peace who raised our Lord Jesus, the great shepherd of the sheep, from the dead, with the blood of an eternal agreement—
column3: Ahni ani hab waꞌap ab haꞌichu tahni g Jiosh mat hab wo em‑juni. S‑mahch am mat g t‑kownalig Jesus e muhkid mat wo i t‑apꞌech Jiosh wehhejed. T g Jiosh ab i wuhshad muhkig t amjed s‑hohhoꞌidch mat has e juh. Kut g hab elidaj hahawa pi hekid gawul wo e juh. Jesus at chum hekid wo t‑nuhkudad.

column2: may he provide you with all that is good so you can do his will. May he work in us, doing everything that pleases him, through Jesus Christ—glory to him forever and ever. Amen.
column3: Pegih, ni ab tahni g Jiosh mat ab wo em‑mahkad mam haschu i tatchua mamt hekaj am hab wo junihid g tatchuij. Jesus o ab t‑makiog g gewkdag. Kutt ab wo si has elidad chum hekid.

column2: I want to encourage you, brothers and sisters, to pay attention to what I've written to you in this short letter.
column3: Neh, pi o shaꞌi chewaj ihda ni‑oꞌohana. Kuni ab si em‑ahgid ahpim ni‑wehm wohochuddam mamt wabsh si s‑ap e taht k wo kaiham k ab wo bei g i wehmtadag.

column2: You should know that Timothy has been set free. If he gets here soon, I will come with him to see you.
column3: Am ant wo em‑ahgi mamt i wuhshad g Timothy mamt wa ged hu si kuh. Kunt wo bek am i em‑chehgimedk matp wo sha s‑hohtam jiwia.

column2: Give my greetings to all your leaders, and to all the believers there. The believers here in Italy send their greetings.
column3: Am g wo ha ahgid g e‑wanimeddam ch wehs g t‑wehm wohochuddam mat ab wo i s‑t‑hoꞌigeꞌel. T‑wepnag iia Italy t am o am hab waꞌap s‑em‑hoꞌigeꞌid.

column2: May God's grace be with all of you. Amen.
column3: Jiosh at wo wa s‑em‑hoꞌigeꞌel.

column2: My friends, choose to stay happy even when all kinds of troubles come your way,
column3: Am g wabsh wo si s-ap e tahtkkad mat hekid ab wo em-aꞌahe g shoꞌigdag.

column2: because you know that endurance comes from dealing with challenges to your trust in God.  Let your endurance become as strong as possible, so that you will be completely mature, without any shortcomings.
column3: Id o aꞌappem g em-wohochudadag ch wo i gewkai. Kumt hab s-ap wo nahtoisk ch s-ap wo nakogad g e-shoꞌigdag.

column2: If any of you need wisdom, ask God, who gives generously to everyone without holding back.
column3: Haꞌijj amtp hems haꞌichu pi amichud. Kuni am em-ahgid mamt ab wo tai g Jiosh g amichudadag. T ab wo i em-mah. Jiosh o si s-baꞌama ab ha mamka g hemajkam mo haschu i tatchua ch pi ha kehꞌid.

column2: But when you ask, remember to trust in God—don't have any doubts. Someone who doubts is like the crashing waves of the sea, tossed about and driven by the wind.
column3: Mt wabshaba hemho wa wo s-wohochudad mat hab wo em-juni g Jiosh mam haschu ab i tahni. Hegam mo pi wohochud at wabsh haꞌichukaj wo e kudu hab sha masma mat g shuhdagi g hewelkaj wo e kudut k an aꞌai has wo e wuad.

column2: Nobody like that should think they'll get anything from the Lord—
column3: Idam at g Jiosh pi am hu hab wo ha juni mat haschu ab wo i tai

column2: their minds think every which way, and they're unstable in whatever they do.
column3: no pi pi am hu shelinim wawani g ha-wohochudadag.

column2: Believers who are born poor should take pride in the high position they've been given,
column3: Chum achs hems haꞌijj d shoꞌigkam ch eda wo chum si s-ap t-tahtkkad nat pi t-doꞌibia g Jiosh.

column2: while the rich should “boast” in the humble position they now have, since they will fade away like flowers in the field.
column3: Kut g s-kakais hab waꞌap wo chum si s-ap e tahtkkad e doꞌibiak. Jiosh o am wehs t-wepo t-haꞌichuchud. S-kakais at haꞌas s-hohtam gam hu hab wo i e juh mat g shoꞌigkam.

column2: For the sun rises along with the blistering wind and scorches the grass. The flowers fall and their beauty is marred. Everything the rich achieve will fade in just the same way.
column3: T g si s-has haꞌichu hab ha-juni wo huhug hab sha masma mat g haꞌichu wuhshanig wo huhug mat hekid wo gaksh g jewed am s-toni k ed.

column2: Happy is anyone who patiently endures temptation, for when they've proved that they are trustworthy, they will receive the crown of life which God promises to those who love him.
column3: Tt wo si s-ap t-tahtkk matt hekid s-ap ab wo nako g t-shoꞌigdag. Ab o t-mahkch g Jiosh g wechij doakag ahchim mach ab si tatchua ch am wo i t-wahpki e-kihdag ed matt hekid wehs wo gahi wuwha g t-aꞌappemadag.

column2: Nobody should say when they're tempted, “I'm being tempted by God.” For God is not tempted by evil, nor does he tempt anyone.
column3: Pi g hab wo shaꞌi chehꞌi mas g Jiosh hab chum em-wua mamtp wo sha pi ap nako g e-aꞌappemadag k hab wo juh g pi apꞌekam. Jiosh o pi hekid hab wua g pi apꞌekam ch pi hedai hab chum ha wua mas hab wo juh g pi apꞌekam.

column2: Temptations come from our own evil desires that lead us astray and entrap us.  Such desires lead to sin, and sin, when it's fully developed, causes death.
column3: Oꞌodham o wabsh hejel e-tatchuikaj hab wua g pi apꞌekam. T g Jiosh ab wo i ha mah g s-koꞌok namkidadag heg wehhejed.

column2: My dear friends, don't be deceived.
column3: Haꞌi o chum ha iattogid ch hab chechꞌe mo g pi apꞌekam ab d Jiosh amjedkam. Pi g ab hu wo shaꞌi ha wohochud, ahpim ni-wehm wohochuddam.

column2: All that's good, every perfect gift, is from above, and comes down from the Father who made heaven's lights. Unlike them he doesn't change—he doesn't vary or cause shadows.
column3: Jiosh at s-kehg nahto wehs haꞌichu. K wehs s-kehgaj hegai mo ab t-mahkch. Tash ch mashad ch huhuꞌu hebaichuj pi ab hu t-mahkch g tonlig no pi g jewed e nodgid. K wabshaba g Jiosh pi hekid gawul e wua ch chum hekid tonlidch g t-chegitoidag g wohokamkaj.

column2: He chose to give us new life through the word of truth, so that out of all his creation we would be very special to him.
column3: Jiosh at am i t-tashogi g wohokam. Kutt ab i s-wohoch. T hekaj ab i t-gawulkad k ab i t-mah g wechij doakag matt d wo aꞌaligajk.

column2: Remember this, my dear friends: everyone should be quick to listen but slow to speak, and slow to get angry,
column3: Pi g wo s-e hohtkid mamt haꞌichu hab wo chei. Baꞌich o i s-apꞌe mamt wo haꞌichu kaihamad.

column2: because human anger doesn't reflect the good character of God.
column3: Pi at hab masma wo i e apꞌech g pi em-apꞌedag. Jiosh at am wo waꞌi apꞌech g pi t-apꞌedag.

column2: So get rid of all that's filthy and evil. Humbly accept the word that's been implanted within you—for this is what can save you.
column3: Gam g hu hab wo i juhni wehs haꞌichu mo s-bihtagi am em-chegitoi ed ch am em-doakag ed. Ab g wabsh wo i e shoꞌigchud Jiosh wui k ab wo i s-wohoch g haꞌichu ahgaj. Kut heg hekaj wo em-doꞌibia.

column2: But do what the word says—don't just listen to it and delude yourselves.
column3: Pi g am wo hejel e iattogidad mamt wabsh wo kaihamad g Jiosh haꞌichu ahga ch eda pi am hu hab wo junihid.

column2: If you just listen to the word, and don't act on it, it's like staring at your own face in a mirror.
column3: Jiosh oꞌohana o hab sha masma mo g neidakud matt heg eda ab wo i t-neid k wo cheh mo haschu pi kehg hab mahs am t-doakag ed.

column2: You see yourself, but then you leave, and immediately forget what you looked like.
column3: Pi g gam hu wabsh wo hihim pi am hu i chegitok mo has mahs g em-doakag

column2: But if you look to the perfect law of freedom and follow it, not as someone who just listens and then forgets, but as someone who acts on it—then you will be blessed in what you do.
column3: k wabshaba am wo si oidahid g Jiosh haꞌichu ahga ch am hab wo junihid. T g Jiosh ab wo si i s-em-hoꞌigeꞌid k ab wo i em-wehmt wehs haꞌichu hab em-juni ed. Kut g haꞌichu ahgaj ab wo i em-wuwhas pi apꞌekam t amjed.

column2: If you think you're religious, but don't control what you say, you deceive yourself—your religion is pointless.
column3: Hegam mo hedai hab kaij mo d Jiosh wohochuddam ch eda wo pi ap neneokad o wabsh hejel e iattogid. K g ha-himdag pi haꞌichu wehhejed s-kehgajk.

column2: In the eyes of our God and Father, religion that's pure and genuine is to visit orphans and widows in their suffering, and to keep yourself from being contaminated by the world.
column3: Bo d elidag g Jiosh mat g t-wohochudadag haꞌichu wehhejed wo s-kehgajk. Hemho wa att wo si t-nuhkudad mat pi wo t-padch g jewed t ab haꞌichu. Kut hab ep wo t-juh g t-wohochudadag matt haꞌichukaj wo i ha wehmajk hegam mo d heheꞌejel wihpkam uꞌuwi ch aꞌal. T hab pi wo e shoꞌigchudad.

column2: My friends, as trusting believers in our glorious Lord Jesus Christ, you must not show favoritism.
column3: Ab am s-wohochud g t-kownalig Jesus Christ. Pegih, k pi hab chum chuꞌig mams pi ab hu wo ha haꞌichuch g shoꞌigkam.

column2: Imagine that a man comes into your synagogue wearing gold rings and fine clothes, and then a poor man comes in dressed in rags.  If you pay special attention to the well-dressed man, and say, “Please sit here in a seat of honor,” while you say to the poor man, “Stand over there, or sit on the floor by my feet,”
column3: Pi o apꞌe mamtp hema wo si s-ap dai g s-kais oꞌodham k eda hab wo ah g shoꞌigkam mat gam hu wabsh wo kehkkad o wo dahiwua jewedo.

column2: haven't you discriminated and judged with bad motives?
column3: Pi o apꞌe g em-tatchui mamtp ha baꞌich ab wo i haꞌichuch g s-kais oꞌodham.

column2: Listen, my dear friends: Didn't God choose those who the world considers poor to be rich in their trust in him, and to inherit the kingdom he promised to those who love him?
column3: Jiosh ash ab ha makiog g shoꞌig hemajkam g geꞌe wohochudadag mat am wo apꞌedagk kihdaj ed. Kutsh wehsijj ab wo i ha wahpki hegam mo ab tatchua.

column2: But you've treated the poor shamefully. Isn't it the rich who oppress you and drag you before the courts?
column3: M eda haꞌi pi ab hu has ha elid g shoꞌigkam ch hegam waꞌi s-kakais ab si has ha elid. Am g wo i oidahim mo haꞌi g s-kakais em-shoꞌigchud ch am i em-wahpkid chehanig ch ed

column2: Don't they insult the honorable name of the one who called you and to whom you belong?
column3: ch s-koꞌokam has ahg hegai mach ab ihm mo d t-doꞌibiakam.

column2: If you really observe the royal law of Scripture: “You shall love your neighbor as yourself,” then you do well.
column3: Am g hab wo junihid g Jiosh chehanig mo hab masma an oꞌohanas:

column2: You should speak and act as people who will be judged by the law of freedom.  Anyone who doesn't show mercy will be judged without mercy. Yet mercy wins out over judgment!
column3: T wabshaba g Jiosh gam hu hab i juh g pi ap t‑chuꞌijig mat wo t‑doꞌibia ab amjed g s‑koꞌok t‑namkidadag mat hekid wo t‑lodai. Pegih, tt hemho wa hab masma hab wo t‑junihid ch hab wo kaijjid mach d t‑doꞌibiakam ch ab wo i s‑ha hoꞌigeꞌidad g hemajkam. Pi at ab hu wo i ha hoꞌigeꞌel g Jiosh hegam mat pi ab hu wo ha hoꞌigeꞌidad g hemajkam.

column2: My friends, what's the good of someone saying they trust in God when they don't do what's right? Can such “trust” save them?
column3: Pi o woho d Jiosh wohochuddam hegam mat pi hab wo junihid g tatchuij. Kut pi wo ha doꞌibia. Haꞌichu hab t‑juni at wo t‑wohokamch machs d wohochuddam.

column2: If a brother or sister doesn't have clothes, or food for the day,
column3: Neh, matp hems haꞌi g t‑wehm wohochuddam d wo shoꞌigkamk ch wo haꞌichu si tatchua.

column2: and you say to them, “Blessings on you! Stay warm and have a good meal!” and you don't provide what they need to survive, what's the good of that?
column3: Pi o apꞌe machs pi am hu wo i ha wehmt k hab wabsh wo chei, “Jiosh at wo waꞌi i em‑wehmt.”

column2: By itself even your trust-based faith in God is dead and worthless if you don't actually do what's right.
column3: Pi ach woho wohochud g Jiosh mattp pi am hu hab wo junihid g tatchuij.

column2: Someone may argue, “You have your trust in God; I have my good deeds.” Well, show me your trust in God without good deeds, and I will show you my trust in God by my good deeds!
column3: Haꞌijj amki hab e elid mamt ab wabsh wo s‑wohochudad g Jiosh ch eda pi am hu hab wo junihid g tatchuij. K eda hab chuꞌig mat g haꞌichu hab t‑juni wo tashogi g t‑wohochudadag.

column2: You believe that God is one God? That's great—but demons believe in God too, and they're scared of him!
column3: Jijawul o hab waꞌap chum s‑wohochud mo an hema d Jiosh ch shaꞌi si s‑ehbid ch eda pi am hu hab junihim g tatchuij ch hab masma e chehgidch mo pi d shaꞌi e doꞌibiakam.

column2: You foolish people! Don't you know that trust in God without doing what's right is worthless?
column3: K heg hekaj tasho mo pi woho wohochud g Jiosh hegam matp hedai pi hab wo junihid g e‑wohochudadag. Am ant haꞌichu ep wo em‑ahgi mant hekaj wo si tasho em‑chehgi ihda.

column2: Wasn't our father Abraham made right by what he did—by offering his son Isaac on the altar?
column3: Ab ach d amjedkam hegai mash hab chehgig Abraham. Kush heg ab s‑wohochud g Jiosh. Tsh g Jiosh am cheha matsh ab wui wo iagchul g e‑alidag muꞌak. Tsh g Abrahambad am woho hab chum juh k hekaj e chehgid mo ab s‑wohochud g Jiosh ch d e doꞌibiakam. Tsh g Jiosh am hahawa pi hiwigi mas wo mua g e‑alidag no pi wabsh aꞌappem g wohochudadgaj.

column2: You notice that his trust in God worked together with what he did, and through what he did his trust in God was made complete.
column3: Abrahambad at ab wehnad g haꞌichu hab e‑juni g e‑wohochudadag. Wohochudadgaj at s‑ap i e nahto heg hekaj haꞌichu hab junij.

column2: In this way scripture was fulfilled: “Abraham trusted God, and this was considered as him doing right, and he was called the friend of God.”
column3: T hekaj am e wohokamch hegai mo an oꞌohanas:

column2: In the same way, wasn't Rahab the prostitute made right by what she did when she looked after the messengers and then sent them away by a different road?
column3: Am g wo s‑chegitok mo haschu an oꞌohanas ab amjed g Rahabbad. Heg atsh wa haꞌi ha doꞌibia g t‑shohshonbad mash eda g wehmaj oꞌodham s‑ha kokdaimk. Id at am wohokamch mo ab s‑wohochud g Jiosh. Kutsh g Jiosh doꞌibia.

column2: Just as the body is dead without the spirit, trust in God is dead if you don't do what's right.
column3: Pegih, am ach t‑chehgidch g haꞌichu hab t‑junikaj mach haschu ab i s‑wohochud. K hegam mat pi am hu hab wo junihid g Jiosh tatchui pi ab hu wohochud g Jiosh.

column2: My friends, not many of you should become teachers, because you know that we who teach will have a heavier responsibility in the judgment.
column3: Pi g am wabsh wo s‑e hohtkidad mamt d wo ha mashchamdamk ch wo ha ahgidad g ha‑chuꞌijig. Jiosh at baꞌich i s‑gewkam wo hudaw mach haschu has i junihim ahchim mach d ha mashchamdam natt pi chum baꞌich wo i s‑mahchk mo haschu d s‑apꞌekam.

column2: All of us make mistakes in many ways. Anyone who doesn't make mistakes in what they say is truly a good person who can keep the whole body under control.
column3: S‑ap at d wo oꞌodhamk ch s‑ap wo nuhkudad g e‑doakag hegam matp hedai s‑ap wo nuhkud g e‑nehni mat pi wo pi ap neo.

column2: We put bridles into the mouths of horses so that they'll obey us, and we can direct them wherever we want.
column3: Chum as si chumaj g t‑nehni ch eda d si s‑has haꞌichu hab masma mo g pilin. Pilin o d al chum haꞌichu. Kutt eda wo pilindad g kawyu k hekaj wo t‑nako matt wo i nodagi mattp hebai wo i s‑nodgidam.

column2: Look at ships as well: even though they're very big and are driven along by strong winds, they're steered by a very small rudder in the direction the pilot wants to go.
column3: Nt ep wo wepogi g wahlko nodgidakud matt hekaj wo i nodagi g geꞌe wahlko, chum as has masma s‑gewkam wo medad g hewel.

column2: In just the same way the tongue is a very small part of the body, but it makes great boasts! Think how a big forest can be set on fire by a very small flame!
column3: Nt ep wo wepogi g al chum chuhdagi mat muꞌi wo mehi g uꞌus. Pegih, k am wa tasho matt hab waꞌap wo t‑nako matt geꞌe haꞌichu wo padch g t‑neꞌokikaj.

column2: And the tongue is a fire! The tongue is a world of evil among the parts of the body. It disgraces all you are as a person, and can burn down the whole of your life, since it is set on fire by Gehenna.
column3: Pi kehg neꞌoki o ab d Jiawul amjedkam. Kutt hekaj wo padch g t‑chegitoi ch t‑doakag hab masma neneokch.

column2: People have tamed all kinds of animals, birds, reptiles, and sea creatures,
column3: T wo e nako g hemajkam mat wabsh chum has mahs haꞌichu doakam wo mahshoch nat pi ha mahshoch g jewed t ab haꞌichu oiopodam ch haꞌichu daꞌadam ch wahammad ch waptopi.

column2: but no one can tame the tongue—it's an evil thing, hard to control, full of deadly poison.
column3: T wabshaba pi hedai wo e nako mas wo hejel dodolimagi g e‑nehni. Chum o hekid e nahtokch mat hab wo juh g pi ap neꞌoki k hekaj wo padch g t‑chegitoi.

column2: We use the same tongue to bless our Lord and Father, as well as to curse people who are made in God's image—
column3: Hebaichujj ach i dagitokch g t‑nehni am Jiosh wui ch hekaj hehgchulid ch eda hebaichujj has ha ahg g hemajkam. K eda g hemajkam d Jiosh nahtoi. T e wepo masma chum ha nahto.

column2: blessings and curses come from the same mouth! Friends, it shouldn't be this way!
column3: Id o heg wa wepo mach has ahg g Jiosh mach eda chum hehgchulid.

column2: Does a spring send both sweet and bitter water out of the same opening?
column3: Neh, no hig ab e wehm i daꞌiwuni g s‑kehg shuhdagi ch s‑onk shuhdagi shon k amjed?

column2: My friends, a fig tree can't produce olives, and a vine can't produce figs, any more than a salt water spring can produce fresh water!
column3: No ab i wushke g suhna uhdwis waꞌug ab? Pegih, k haschu ahgch ab em‑amjed e wehm i wushke g hehgchulida ab Jiosh wui ch has ahga ab hemajkam ha wui mo eda idam d Jiosh nahtoi?

column2: Who among you has wisdom and understanding? Let their good lives demonstrate what they do—doing what is right with wise kindness and consideration.
column3: Pi g hab wabsh wo chehꞌi mam s‑chu amichud. Bag wo juhnid g s‑apꞌekam ch hab masma wo e chehgi mam s‑chu amichud.

column2: But if you have bitter jealousy and selfish ambition in your heart, don't boast about it and don't lie against the truth.
column3: Pi g am wo ha iattogidad ch pi wo chum ge e haschudad mo ab em‑mahkch g Jiosh g amichudadag mamtp wo s‑ta keꞌidamak ch wo s‑chu hehgamkk ch ep wo s‑chu daꞌad.

column2: This kind of “wisdom” doesn't come from above, but is earthly, unspiritual, and demonic.
column3: Pi o ab hu d Jiosh amjedkam hegai s‑ta keꞌidamadag ch s‑chu hehgamdadag ch s‑chu daꞌamkam. T pi hab wo chum chuꞌigk hegam mo e doꞌibiakch. Do wabsh jewed dahm haꞌichu ch ab d amjedkamaj g Jiawul hegai hab mahs haꞌichu.

column2: Wherever there is jealousy and selfish ambition you'll also find confusion and all kinds of evil practices.
column3: Muꞌi o haꞌichu pi apꞌe mo hebai hab chuꞌig g s‑chu hehgamdadag ch s‑chu daꞌamkam. Wehs nahnko mahs pi apꞌekam o am hab chuꞌig.

column2: However, wisdom that comes from above is first of all pure, and it also brings peace. It is kind and open to reason. It is full of mercy and produces good things. It is genuine and not hypocritical.
column3: Kuch wabshaba ahchim mach uꞌukch g amichudadag ab Jiosh t amjed d hekia s‑apꞌekam ch s‑dodolima ch ab ha oꞌodhamchud g hemajkam ch s‑ha hoꞌigeꞌid ch ha wehm s‑hemajim neneok ch pi ha iattogid.

column2: Those who sow peace will harvest the peace of what is truly right.
column3: Am g wo ha dodolimachud g hemajkam. Kut g Jiosh am wo i ha apꞌech mat am hahawa hab wo junihid g s‑apꞌekam.

column2: Where do the fights and quarrels you're having come from? Aren't they due to the sensual passions that are in conflict within you?
column3: Haꞌijj amsh am aꞌai e kamꞌon ch e cheggia mam eda d chum e doꞌibiakam. Nt wo em‑ahgi mam hab masma hab e wua nam pi haꞌichu s‑behimk mo pi ab hu d em‑wuikam

column2: You burn with desire, but don't get what you want. You kill for what you lust after, but don't get what you're looking for. You argue and you fight, but you don't get anything, because you don't pray for it.
column3: ch wo ha cheggia k wo ha mua mamt wo bei. K eda g Jiosh ab chum em‑makiog mam haschu i tatchua. Ab g wabsh wo tahni. T wo em‑mah. Pi am edgid nam pi pi ab hu tahni.

column2: You pray, but don't receive anything, because you ask with a wrong motive, wanting to spend what you'd receive on your selfish pleasures.
column3: T wabshaba g Jiosh pi ab hu wo em‑mah mam haschu i tahni matp g em‑tatchui pi wo apꞌek.

column2: You adulterous people! Don't you realize that friendship with the world is hatred towards God? Those who want to be friends of the world make themselves enemies of God.
column3: Haꞌijj am tatchua g pi apꞌekam ch hekaj d obgaj g Jiosh.

column2: Do you think Scripture doesn't mean what it says: that the spirit that he put in us is very jealous?
column3: K wabshaba an hab chuꞌig Jiosh heki hu oꞌohana ed mash g Hekia S‑apꞌekam Gewkdag ab wui kehk g pi ap t‑tatchui.

column2: But God gives us even more grace, as Scripture says: “God is against those who are arrogant, but gives grace to those who are humble.”
column3: Bo wa masma ab t‑makiog g Jiosh g gewkdag matt pi hab wo junihid g hejel t‑tatchui. Bo chuꞌig g oꞌohanaj:

column2: So place yourself under God's direction. Confront the devil, and he will run away from you.
column3: Mt heg hekaj ab wo i e dagito Jiosh wui k ab wui wo gegokkad g ge Jiawul mamt pi hab wo junihid g tatchuij. T g Jiawul s‑hohtam wo i e mehkod ab em‑amjed.

column2: Come close to God and he will come close to you. Wash your hands, you sinners. Purify your hearts, you people with divided loyalties.
column3: Ab g wo i miabid g Jiosh. Kut ab aigo epai wo i em‑miabi. Am g wabsh wo dagito g pi ap haꞌichu hab e‑juni ahpim mam ge gohkpa chegito mamtp woho wo s‑kaim g Jiosh. T g Jiosh wo i apꞌech g em‑doakag.

column2: Show some remorse, cry and weep! Turn your laughter into mourning, and your joy to sadness.
column3: Am g wabsh wo si pi ap e tahtk k wo iawua g e‑ohꞌog heg hekaj pi ap haꞌichu hab e‑juni ch pi wabsh wo hehemad ch pi wo s‑e tahhadchudad heg hekaj.

column2: Be humble before the Lord and he will lift you up.
column3: Ab g wo i e shoꞌigchud wui g Jiosh. T heg ab wo si em‑haꞌichuch.

column2: Friends, don't speak badly of one another. Anyone who criticizes a fellow-believer and condemns them, criticizes and condemns the law. If you condemn the law you're not someone who keeps the law, because you're sitting in judgment of it.
column3: Pi g am wo aꞌai has e ahgad, ahpim ni‑wehm wohochuddam. Hegam mat hab wo e junihid o ab wui gegok hegai chehanig mo hab chuꞌig matt ab aꞌai wo si pihk t‑elidad. Heg o wa wepo mo hudawk mas s‑apꞌe g Jiosh chehanig. K eda hab chum mahs matt hab wabsh wo junihid.

column2: There's only one lawgiver and judge—the one who can either save or destroy you—so who are you to judge your neighbor?
column3: Heg at wo waꞌi t‑lodai mo hedai t‑mahkch g chehanig. Ab o hejel ab g Jiosh mas wo t‑doꞌibia o im hu hab wo i t‑juh ab e amjed. K heg hekaj pi ab hu em‑ab mams am wo has ha ahgad. Ab g wabsh wo dagito g lodaita Jiosh wui.

column2: Come on now!—you people who say, “Either today or tomorrow we'll go to such-and-such a city, spend a year in business there, and make a profit.”
column3: Ab g wo i ni‑kaiham ahpim mam ab si e hiwig haꞌichu k ab. Tp hems hema hab wo chei mat hemu s‑hohtam wo chihpia am hema kihhim wui k am wo kihkad ahid ab mat wo haꞌichu chikpan k muꞌi wo nahto g lial.

column2: You have no idea what will happen tomorrow! What's your life like? It's just a mist that appears for a little while, and then is gone.
column3: Kum eda pi mahch mas haschu has wo e juh baꞌich tash. An amt al heꞌes wo i e neid k an wabsh wo i huhug hab sha masma mo g kuhbs.

column2: What you should say is, “If it's the Lord's will, we'll live like this and plan to do that.”
column3: Bamt wo chum chei, “Matp d wo Jiosh tatchuik, kutt hab wo juh haꞌichu.”

column2: But right now you're caught up in your vain ideas. All this boasting is evil.
column3: M eda am ge e hahaschud mamt haschu hab wo juh. Pi o apꞌe mams hab masma wo ge hahaschudad.

column2: For it is a sin if you know to do what's right but don't do it.
column3: Kut d wo pi ap chuꞌijkamk matp hedai pi am hu hab wo junihid g s‑apꞌekam mo eda s‑mahch mat has wo chum e juh.

column2: Come on, you rich people! You should weep and wail for all the problems that are coming your way!  Your wealth is ruined, and your clothes have been eaten by moths.  Your gold and your silver are corroded, and this corrosion will be evidence against you, eating away your flesh like fire. You hoarded up your wealth in these last days.
column3: Ab g wo kaiham mant haschu wo oꞌoha mamtp hedai s‑e kakaischud hab wuadch g pi apꞌekam. Bamki chum e elid mamt geꞌe haꞌichu wo edgidad kekeltk. T wabshaba g em‑kaisdag wabsh wo huhug. Kumt wo shoanid ch ab wo ai g s‑koꞌok e‑namkidadag.

column2: Look, the wages of your farm workers that you cheated are crying out against you—the cries of the farm workers have reached the ears of the Lord Almighty.  You've enjoyed a life of luxury here on earth, full of self-indulgent pleasure, fattening yourselves up for the day of slaughter!  You have condemned and killed the innocent who didn't even resist you.
column3: Em‑kaisdag o si geꞌej ch wohokamchud mam pi ap ha namkid g e‑pionag. Hegam o d wabsh shoꞌigkam ch am em‑ahgid g pi e‑apꞌedag ch shoani. M wabshaba pi ab hu ha kaiham ch chum hems ab haꞌichu ha abchud ch ha kokda. K idam pi e nakog mas wo e doꞌibia. K wabshaba g Jiosh ab ha kaiham ch wo ha doꞌibia. Ahpim mam e kakaischud ha shoꞌigchudch am ab aihim g lodaita hab masma mat g wipsilo wo e giꞌichud k ab wo ai mamt wo ha kokda.

column2: Friends, be patient as you wait for the Lord's return. Think of the farmer waiting patiently for the earth's precious harvest as it grows with the early and later rains.
column3: Pegih neh, ahpim ni‑wehm wohochuddam, am g wabsh wo s‑e tahtk ch nenida mat ep wo jiwia g t‑kownalig Jesus Christ. Am g wo neid mo has masma nenida g eshdam g juhki mat wo i wuhsh g eshaj.

column2: You need to be patient too. Stay strong for the Lord's return is near.
column3: Mt hab waꞌap s‑e tahtkk ch wo nenidad ch am wo si e gewkemhu no pi e aihim mat ep wo jiwia g geꞌechu t‑kownalig.

column2: My friends, don't complain about each other, so you won't be judged. Look, the judge is standing right at the door!
column3: E o nahtokch mat hab wo juh g lodaita.

column2: Take the prophets as an example, my friends—see how they spoke in the Lord's name as they suffered and waited patiently.
column3: Am g wo i ha chegito g Jiosh haꞌichu i tashogiddam. Hegam ash wa s‑e tahtk ch nakog g e‑shoꞌigdag. Kumt am ha oidk hab wo chum masmak

column2: Notice that we say that those who endure are blessed. You've heard about the patience of Job, and you've seen how the Lord brought this to a positive conclusion—for the Lord is full of compassion and mercy.
column3: nam pi s‑mahch mo g Jiosh ab ha mahkch g s‑ap tahhadkam. Hegai kelibad mash hab chehgig Job ash hab waꞌap s‑e tahtk ch nakog g e‑shoꞌigdag. Tsh g Jiosh am hahawa wehhejed geꞌe haꞌichu i apꞌech. Id o am t‑chehgidch mo si s‑t‑hoꞌigeꞌid ch si pihk e elid t‑hekaj.

column2: Above all, my friends, don't swear. Not by heaven, not by earth, and not by any other kind of oath. Just let your yes be yes, and your no be no, so you won't fall under condemnation.
column3: Am g hab wabsh wo juhni mamt haschu hedai wo i ha ahgi mamt hab wo juh. Pi o apꞌe mams wabsh chum hekid wo i gewkadch g e‑neꞌoki am chehchegch g Jiosh. Jiosh at wo em‑lodai mamtp hab wo e juh.

column2: Are any of you suffering? You should pray. Are some of you cheerful? You should sing songs of praise.
column3: Nam am hu haꞌi haꞌichukaj i e kudut? Pegih, e g wo hoꞌigeꞌidahun.

column2: Are any of you sick? You should call for the church elders and have them pray over you, and anoint you with oil in the Lord's name.
column3: Nam am hu haꞌi kokꞌo? Bo chum mahs mamt ab wo i ha wai hegam mo am d geꞌeged em‑shahgid. T hegam ab wo em‑huhu g e koꞌadam a‑saidihkaj k wo e hoꞌigeꞌidahu em‑wehhejed

column2: Such a prayer, trusting in God, will heal those who are sick, and the Lord will make them well. If they've committed sins, they will be forgiven.
column3: s‑wohochudch mat g Jiosh wo em‑doaj. Kut woho hab wo e juh.

column2: Admit the wrongs you've done to each other, and pray for one another so that you'll be healed. Earnest prayer from those who live right is very effective.
column3: Kumt heg hekaj ab aꞌai wo e ahgi g pi ap e‑chuꞌijig k wo e hoꞌigeꞌidahu aꞌai e wehhejed. T wo em‑doaj g Jiosh. Muꞌi at haꞌichu hab wo ha juni g Jiosh hegam mat ab wo tahnid ch d wo s‑apꞌekam oꞌodhamk.

column2: Elijah was a man who had the same human nature as we do. He prayed earnestly that it wouldn't rain, and it didn't rain on the earth for three and a half years.
column3: Heg at hekaj hab e juh mash haschu g Elijabad ab tahni g Jiosh. Heg ash d wabsh oꞌodham ch ab si tai g Jiosh mat hab wo juh mat pi wo ha juhkad. Kush wa woho pi ha juhk giꞌik aꞌahid ab.

column2: He prayed again—heaven sent rain and the earth gave its harvest.
column3: Kutsh ab hahawa tai g Jiosh mat wo juh. Kutsh hahawa juh. Tsh ab i wuhsh g haꞌichu bahidag ab amjed g jewed kahchim.

column2: My friends, if any one of you strays from the truth and someone brings you back,  let them know that whoever rescues a sinner from the error of their ways will save them from death, and will gain forgiveness for many sins.
column3: Neh, tp hems hema wo heb hu hih g em‑wehm wohochuddam ab amjed g wohokam. Kumt am uhpam wo i nodagi ab amjed g pi apꞌekam. T g Jiosh gam hu hab wo i juh g pi ap chuꞌijigaj k wo doꞌibia ab amjed g s‑koꞌok namkidadgaj.

column2: In the beginning the Word already was.  The Word was with God, and the Word was God.
column3: Gd hu i si wehpeg ash d doakam hegai mach hab aꞌaga Jiosh Neꞌoki. Id ash d Jiosh ch am wehmaj g e-ohg Jiosh.

column2: In the beginning he was with God.
column3: Jiosh ash am e wehm dahshch mash eda pi koi haꞌichu shaꞌi nahtois

column2: Everything came into being through him; nothing came into being without him.
column3: ch am i kei matsh wehs haꞌichu wo nahto. Kutsh wa woho wehs haꞌichu nahto

column2: In him was life, the life that was the light of everyone.
column3: k an uꞌukch g gewkdag ch wehs ha mah g haꞌichu doakam g doakag. K ihda doakag am tonlidch g hemajkam chegitoidag.

column2: The light shines in the darkness, and the darkness has not extinguished it.
column3: K wabshaba g hemajkam pi e nakog hejel mas wo s-amich mo haschu chum ha tashogid.

column2: God sent a man named John.
column3: Am ad hema i kei g Jiosh g oꞌodham mat wo t-mihshmad. D id hab chehgig John.

column2: He came as a witness to explain about the light so that everyone might believe through him.
column3: D g mihshmdaj hab chuꞌig matsh in wo i wuhsh jewed dahm hegai mo ab t-mahkch g t-doakag. K hab d elidaj g Jiosh mat wehs hemajkam wo kah ihda haꞌichu ahga k ab wo hiwgad hegai mat in i wuhsh.

column2: He himself was not the light, but he came to witness to the light.
column3: Pi ad hejel hab e ahg g John ch wabsh heg an ahgachug mad in i wuhsh.

column2: The true light was coming into the world to give light to everyone.
column3: Id o d wohokam tonlig ch am tonlidch g wehs hemajkam ha-chegitoidag.

column2: He was in the world, and though the world was made through him, the world didn't know who he was.
column3: Pegih, d ia haꞌichug g Jiosh Neꞌoki jewed e-nahtoi dahm. D wabshaba hemajkam nahtoij pi amichud.

column2: He came to his own people, but they didn't accept him.
column3: Ia adki mahsi k d t-wehm oꞌodham. D eda muꞌijj g Tutuligo pi amichud ch pi ab hu hiwig.

column2: But to all those who accepted him and trusted in him, he gave the right to become God's children.
column3: Kuchd wabshaba haꞌijj ab i s-wohoch mo d Jiosh si Kehsha k ab hiwig. Kud heg hekaj ab t-mah g apꞌedag matt d haha wo aꞌaligajk g Jiosh.

column2: These are the children born not in the usual way, not as the result of human desire or a father's decision, but born of God.
column3: Pi ach heg wabsh hekaj d Jiosh aꞌaliga matt in mamsi o heg wabsh hekaj mo g t-jehj ab s-wohochud g Jiosh o heg wabsh hekaj mach hab t-elid machs d aꞌaligaj. Jiosh at hab t-juh mach d hahawa aꞌaligaj.

column2: The Word became human and lived among us, and we saw his glory, the glory of the Father's one and only Son, full of grace and truth. John gave his testimony about him, shouting out to the people, “This is the one I was telling you about when I said, ‘The one who is coming after me is more important than me, for before I ever existed he already was.’ ”  We have all been recipients of his generous nature, one gracious gift after another.
column3: Hegai mo d Jiosh Neꞌoki ad e wepogi g hemajkam k woho t-wepo chuꞌig ch ia t-shahgid d doakam. D g John an aꞌaga k si s-kaidam hab kaij, “Id o d hegai mani hab ahg ch am em-ahgid mat ab hema wabsh ni-oidk wo i e maskogid k eda woho d si s-has haꞌichu nash pi chum hekid an haꞌichug.” Neh, bo kaij g John. Kuchd heg amjed s-mahch g Jesus Christ ch am hahawa s-mai moki d Jiosh alidag ch si s-hemajima ch heg waꞌi ahg wohokam ch woho ab si s-t-hoꞌigeꞌid.

column2: The law was given through Moses; grace and truth came through Jesus Christ.
column3: Dash Mosesbad matsh wa an oꞌoha g Jiosh chehanig am ha wehhejed g hemajkam. K wabshaba d Jesus Christ mad ia uꞌapa g Jiosh hemajimatalig ch wohokam.

column2: While no one has ever seen God, God the one and only, who is close to the Father, has shown us what God is like.
column3: Pi oki hekid hedai shaꞌi e-wuhpuikaj neid g Jiosh. K wabshaba g alidaj am wehmaj d hemako ch ab t-wui mahsko wua.

column2: This is what John publicly stated when the Jewish leaders sent priests and Levites from Jerusalem to ask him, “Who are you?”
column3: Am ad t‑mihshmad ihda John tohono jewed ch ed. K eda am Jerusalem kihhim t am dadha g t‑geꞌegedga ahchim Tutuligo. Tsh am i ha ai g haꞌichu kaida ab amjed g John. Kutsh am haꞌi ha cheha g papal ch hegam mo d papal ha wehm chikpandam matsh wo s‑mai mas hedai wud hegai John.

column2: John declared plainly and clearly without hesitation, “I am not the Messiah.”
column3: D ab wabsh si ha wehm neok g John ch am si tasho ha ahgid mo pi d hegai.

column2: “So then, who are you?” they asked. “Elijah?”
column3: D ab ep kakke, “Aha nap d hegai Elijabad ch ia uhpam jiwia?”

column2: “Well, who are you, then?” they asked. “We have to give an answer to those who sent us. What do you say about yourself?”
column3: D hab hahawa kaij, “Pegih, k am wo t‑ahgi map hedai wud. Hemho wa att am wo ha ahgi g t‑geꞌegedga map has e aꞌaga.”

column2: “I am ‘a voice calling in the desert, “Make the Lord's way straight!” ’ ” he said, using the words of the prophet Isaiah
column3: D g John hab hahawa kaij, “Ahni ani wud mo hab ni‑ahg ch an oꞌohanas:

column2: The priests and Levites sent by the Pharisees
column3: Idam mad ab haꞌichu kakke g John o d haꞌi hegam mo hab e aꞌaga Palasi. K hegam Palasi chum si nuhkud g t‑himdag.

column2: asked him, “Why then are you baptizing, if you're not the Messiah, or Elijah, or the Prophet?”
column3: D heg hekaj hab ep kaij idam ab John wui, “Pegih, p haschu ahgch ha pahl wapkon ch eda wa chum pi d Jiosh si Kehsha ch pi d Elijabad ch pi d hegai Jiosh haꞌichu i tashogiddam matsh in wo i wuhsh?”

column2: John replied, “I baptize with water, but standing among you is someone you don't know.
column3: D hab hahawa kaij ab ha wui, “Ha ani pahl wapkon mat wo i e nako. Hemu at in wo i wuhsh hegai mo hig woho d si s‑has haꞌichu, pej hemu ia haꞌichug em‑shahgid. Kum pi amichud.

column2: He is coming after me, but I am not even worthy to untie his sandals.”
column3: Pi g hab wo ni‑elidad manis ahni d si haꞌichu. Ihda mat am ni‑oidk wo i wuhsh at wehs ha baꞌich d wo i si haꞌichuk.”

column2: This all happened in Bethany beyond the Jordan, where John was baptizing.
column3: Neh, wehs ihda ad hab e juh gan hu aigojed g Jordan akimel mo am d wahlko kih.

column2: The next day John saw Jesus approaching him, and said, “Look, the Lamb of God, who takes away the sin of the world!
column3: Am baꞌich d i tash, d am jiwia g Jesus John wui.

column2: This is the one I was talking about when I said, ‘A man who is coming after me is more important than me, for before I ever existed he already was.’
column3: Id ani hab ahg mani wa hab em‑ahgid mat ab wabsh ni‑oidk wo i wuhshani k wabshaba wehs ha baꞌich d i si haꞌichu no pi chum hekid an haꞌichug.

column2: I didn't know myself who he was, but I came baptizing with water so that he could be revealed to Israel.”
column3: Pi ani hab wa shaꞌi mahch mas hedai d wo Jiosh si Kehshak. K wabshaba g Jiosh am ni‑chehani mant wo ha pahl wapko g hemajkam. T hab wa masma am wo tashogi g si e‑Kehsha am t‑wui ahchim Tutuligo.” Neh, bad kaij g John.

column2: John gave his evidence about him, saying, “I saw the Spirit descend from heaven like a dove and rest upon him.  I wouldn't have known him except he who sent me to baptize with water had told me, ‘The one you see the Spirit descend to and rest upon, he is the one who baptizes with the Holy Spirit.’
column3: D am hebai i cheka, d si s‑mahch ch ahg g John hab kaijch, “Bo kaij g Jiosh ab ni‑wui, ‘Ab at wo i hud g Hekia S‑apꞌekam Gewkdag k ab wo e ul si ni‑Kehsha ab. Kupt hab wo s‑mahchk mo d ihda mat wo ha mah g hemajkam g Hekia S‑apꞌekam Gewkdag.’ Neh, bo kaij g Jiosh ab ni‑wui. Kut wa woho si s‑hemajim ab i hud g Hekia S‑apꞌekam Gewkdag k ab e ul id ab Jesus hab masma mat g hohhi an hasko wo i dahiwua ab i hudunik.

column2: I saw it happen and I declare that this is the Son of God.”
column3: Kunt wa neid k heg hekaj si s‑mahch mo ihda Jesus d Jiosh alidag.”

column2: The next day John was standing there with two of his disciples.
column3: Am baꞌich d i tash, d am ep haꞌichug g John. Kuchd gohkajj an wehmaj ahchim mach ab si wecho t‑mashcham.

column2: He saw Jesus passing by, and said, “Look! This is the Lamb of God!”
column3: D ab him g Jesus. Kud g John neidok hab kaij, “Neh, m ia him hegai matsh kahwal mad wepo wo e iagchul am t‑wehhejed.”

column2: When the two disciples heard what he said they went and followed Jesus.
column3: Kuchd am i kah ahchim gohk k gam hu i oi g Jesus.

column2: Jesus turned round and saw them following him. “What are you looking for?” he asked them,
column3: D ab haꞌab i e wua k ab i t‑neid k hab kaij, “Shahchu am tatchua?”

column2: “Come and see,” he told them. So they went with him and saw where he was staying. It was about four p.m., and they spent the rest of the day with him.
column3: D hab kaij, “Oi g wo ni‑oid k wo nei mani hebai da.”

column2: Andrew, the brother of Simon Peter, was one of these two disciples who had heard what John said and followed Jesus.
column3: Hegai mad ni‑wehm kah g John ch am i oi g Jesus o hab chehgig Andrew. K g wehngaj ihda hab chehgig Simon.

column2: He went at once to find his brother Simon and told him, “We've found the Messiah! (which means ‘Christ’).”
column3: K g Andrew d wehpegkam mat am i gahghi g e‑wehnag k hekid am i chehg k hab ahgid, “Cheh att hegai moki d Christ.” (Id o hab d ahga ‘Jiosh si Kehsha.’)

column2: He took him to Jesus. Looking directly at Simon, Jesus said, “You are Simon, son of John. But now you will be called Cephas, (which means ‘Peter’).”
column3: D g Andrew am hahawa uꞌapa Jesus wui.

column2: The next day Jesus decided to go to Galilee. Jesus found Philip there, and told him, “Follow me.”  Philip was from Bethsaida, the same town that Andrew and Peter came from.
column3: Am baꞌich d i tash, d hab i e ah g Jesus mat gam hu wo hih Galilee chekshani wui. K eda an oimmed hegai mo hab chehgig Philip ch am d kihkam Bethsaida t am. (Ahchim g Andrew ch Peter ha wehm ach am hab waꞌap d kihkam Bethsaida t am.) Jesus ad am cheh g Philip k hab kaij ab wui, “Ab g i ni-oid k wo ni-wehmajk.”

column2: Philip found Nathanael and told him, “We've found the one that Moses wrote about in the law and that the prophets did too—Jesus of Nazareth, the son of Joseph.”
column3: D g Philip gam hu i gahghi g Nathanael k am i chehgiok hab kaij, “Cheh att hegai matki wa ab amjed an oꞌoha hegam Mosesbad ch kekelibad Jiosh haꞌichu i tashogiddam. Heg oki wud mash d Jesus ch heg d alidag mash d Josephbad ch ab Nazareth kihhim t ab d kihkam.”

column2: “From Nazareth? Can anything good come from there?” Nathanael wondered.
column3: D ab wabsh ge i nen k hab kaij, “Ih, nat hig woho haꞌichu s-apꞌekam wo i wuhsh ab Nazareth t amjed?”
