column2: As Jesus saw Nathanael approaching, he said about him, “Look, here's a true Israelite! There's nothing false about him.”
column3: D ga hu haha wabsh i hihim.

column2: “How do you know who I am?” Nathanael asked.
column3: D g Nathanael hab kaij, “P has masma s-ni-mahch?”

column2: “Rabbi, you are the Son of God, the king of Israel!” Nathaniel exclaimed.
column3: D hab kaij g Nathanael, “Ih, neh, kupki d Jiosh alidag ch d t-kownalig ahchim Tutuligo hemajkam.”

column2: “You believe this just because I told you I saw you under the fig tree?” Jesus replied. “You'll get to see much more than that!”
column3: D hab kaij g Jesus, “Ab ap ni-hiwig nani pi am wabsh tonlid ch m-neid. Nt wo si shel m-ahgi mapt baꞌich i s-ta neidamam haꞌichu wo nei imhab i baꞌich.

column2: Then Jesus said, “I tell you the truth, you will all see heaven open, and the angels of God going up and down on the Son of man.”
column3: Dani Jiosh si Kehsha ch am wo kuhpiꞌo g dahm kahchim am em-wehhejed. Kumt wo nei mat am wui wo i chehchsh g anghil ab ni-amjed k ab ni-wui ep wo i huhud.”

column2: Two days later a wedding was held at Cana in Galilee, and Jesus' mother was there.
column3: Am gohk d i tash amjed, tsh am haꞌi wo e hohont Cana kihhim t am. Ihda Cana o am Galilee chekchani ch ed. K am haꞌichug g Jesus jeꞌe.

column2: Jesus and his disciples had also been invited to the wedding.
column3: Kumd ahchim ab i t-wai. Chd am hihi g Jesus wehm k am haꞌichug. Kumd am hahawa hab juh g gegosig.

column2: The wine ran out, so Jesus' mother told him, “They don't have any more wine.”
column3: D wabshaba am i huh g nawait. D g Jesus jeꞌe ab wui hab kaij, “Huh at g ha-nawait.”

column2: “Mother, why should you involve me? My time hasn't come yet,” he replied.
column3: D hab kaij g Jesus, “Pi o ab hu haꞌichu ni-him heg amjed. Pi at koi chum e ai mant am wo i ni-maskogi.”

column2: His mother told the servants, “Do whatever he tells you.”
column3: D wabshaba g jeꞌej hab ha ahg g pion, “Am g hab wo juhni matp haschu wo i em-ahgi mamt am hab wo juh.”

column2: Standing nearby were six stone jars used by the Jews for ceremonial washing, each one holding twenty to thirty gallons.
column3: K eda d t-himdag ahchim Tutuligo mach muꞌi haꞌichu has masma wapkon. D g hohodai hahaꞌa chuhdp am dadha mamt ab wo chum waꞌig k am hab wo junihid g t-himdag. D idam hahaꞌa hemako am hu i waikko wehst-mahm walohn shuhdagi am wo e toa.

column2: “Fill the jars with water,” Jesus told them. So they filled them right up.
column3: D hab kaij g Jesus am ha wui g pion, “Am g wo i ha shuhshud g shuhdagikaj.”

column2: Then he told them, “Pour some out, and take it to the master of ceremonies.” So they took him some.
column3: D hab hahawa ep ha ahg, “Am g wo wassibi k wo mah hegai mo nuhkud g e-hohontam piast.”

column2: The master of ceremonies didn't know where it had come from, only the servants knew. But when he tasted the water that had been turned to wine, he called the bridegroom over.
column3: D ab jeh mo d si s-kehg nawait k eda pi mahch mas hebai waꞌi. Hegam o hi wa s-mahch pion mat hebai waꞌi.

column2: “Everyone serves out the best wine first,” he told him, “and once people have had plenty to drink, then they put out the cheaper wine. But you have kept the best wine till last!”
column3: D am i cheh g ha-hohntam am i jehk g nawait k hab kaij ab wui, “Shaꞌi s-ap ab kahk ihda nawait. Haꞌi at an hi wo wa i ha wassibi g s-kehg nawait ga hu i wehpeg k wabsh g pi kehg nawait wo ha wassibi im hu i oidch. Kuptki eda ahpi im hu i oidch g si s-kehg nawait ha wassibi.”

column2: This was the very first of Jesus' miraculous signs, and was performed in Cana of Galilee. Here he revealed his glory, and his disciples put their trust in him.
column3: Neh, k id d si wehpeg s-hasig haꞌichu hab junij g Jesus. D am mahsko wua g e-gewkdag. Kuchd ab si s-wohochud mo woho d Jiosh si Kehsha.

column2: After this Jesus left for Capernaum with his mother, brothers, and disciples where they stayed for a few days.
column3: D am hahawa hab i e ah g Jesus matt am wo hihi Capernaum kihhim wui. D g jeꞌej ch wepngaj ep t-oi. Ch am haꞌichugkahim heꞌekia tash.

column2: Since it was almost time for the Jewish Passover, Jesus went on to Jerusalem.
column3: Wehs ahid ab o am e wushshad Jerusalem t am matsh wa g Jiosh ha doꞌibia g t‑shohshon. Kud am i e ai. Kuchd gam hu hihim

column2: In the Temple he found people selling cattle, sheep, and doves; and money-changers sitting at their tables.
column3: k ged hu dada geꞌe cheopi t am. D eda am haꞌi ha gagda g haiwani ch kahwal ch hohohi ch am haꞌi kammialt g lial heg wehhejed.

column2: He made a whip out of cords and drove everyone out of the Temple, along with the sheep and cattle, scattering coins of the money-changers and turning over their tables.
column3: Kud si pi hohhoꞌi g Jesus mo id am hab e wua geꞌe cheopi t am k hekaj hema gewikudt g wijinakaj k gam hu wehs si ha shahmud g haiwani ch kahwal k am gai ha shul g ha‑mimsa hegam mo g lial kammialt k gam hu si gantad g ha‑lialiga

column2: He ordered the dove-sellers, “Take these things out of here! Don't turn my Father's house into a market!”
column3: k hab ha ahg hegam mo g hohohi ha gagda mat gam hu wo i ha wuwhas hab kaijch, “Pi g hab wo shaꞌi juhni g ni‑ohg kih mat d wabsh wo haꞌichu gagdakudk.”

column2: His disciples remembered the Scripture that says, “My devotion for your house is like a fire burning inside me!”
column3: Kuchd am hahawa i chegito mo g Jiosh heki oꞌohana hab chuꞌig:

column2: The Jewish leaders reacted, asking him, “What right do you have to do this? Show us some miraculous sign to prove it!”
column3: D ab si chehmo g hahaꞌichu k hab ahg, “Shahchu ap ahgch hab wua ihda? Am g hig t‑chehgid g s‑hasig haꞌichu. Kutt hab wo s‑mahchk map uꞌukch g e‑gewkdag ab amjed g Jiosh.”

column2: Jesus replied, “Destroy this Temple, and in three days I'll raise it up!”
column3: D hab kaij g Jesus, “Pegih oig, m ant wo wa em‑chehgi g s‑hasig haꞌichu. Mt wo padch ihda mo g Jiosh am eda kih. Kunt ahni ep wo i kegch mat d wo i waik tashk.”

column2: “It took forty-six years to build this Temple, and you're going to raise it up in three days?” the Jewish leaders replied.
column3: D idam si e shoꞌoshodkad k hab kaij, “Giꞌikko gamai chuhdp (46) aꞌahid ab at hahawa i e nahto ihda geꞌe cheopi. Kuptp eda ahpi waik tash ab ia wo i kei.”

column2: But the Temple Jesus was speaking of was his body.
column3: K eda g Jesus hejel hab e ahg mat wo e muhkid k uhpam ep wo e chegito.

column2: After he was raised from the dead, his disciples remembered what he said, and so they believed in Scripture and Jesus' own words.
column3: Kutt s‑chegito g neꞌokij mat hekid uhpam e chegito am e muhkidk. Neh, bo chuꞌig g Jiosh oꞌohana mat uhpam wo e chegito g Jiosh si Kehsha. Kutt hahawa s‑amichud k ab s‑wohoch.

column2: As a result of the miracles Jesus did while he was in Jerusalem during the Passover, many believed in him.  But Jesus did not trust himself to them, because he knew all about people.
column3: Am achd haꞌichugkahim Jerusalem t am wehs oidam g t‑shohshon ha‑doꞌibiadag wuhshda. Kud muꞌijj ab i s‑wohoch g Jesus. D wabshaba pi am hu i e tashogi ha wui mas hedai wud no pi s‑mahch mo heg wabsh hekaj ab s‑wohochud mo am neid mo hab juni him g s‑hasig haꞌichu.

column2: He didn't need anyone to tell him about human nature for he knew the way people think.
column3: Pi o hedai ab hu hiwig g Jesus mas am wo ahgi g hemajkam ha‑chegitoi no pi heki hu s‑mahch.

column2: There was a man named Nicodemus, a Pharisee and a member of the Jewish ruling council.
column3: Am ad hema d si s‑has haꞌichu am t‑himdag ed ch d ge Palasi ch hab chehgig Nicodemas.

column2: He came at night to where Jesus was and said, “Rabbi, we know you are a teacher who has come from God, for nobody could do the miraculous signs you're doing unless God was with him.”
column3: Kuchd am hu hebai dadha chuhug ch ed. D id am i chehgim g Jesus k hab kaij ab wui, “S‑mahch ach mat am i m‑kei g Jiosh mapt wo t‑mashcha. Pi at hedai wo e nako mas hejel hab wo juh hegai s‑hasig haꞌichu map hab junihim. Jiosh oki ab m‑mahkch g gewkdag.”

column2: “I tell you the truth,” Jesus replied, “Unless you are reborn, you can't experience God's kingdom.”
column3: D hab kaij g Jesus, “Nt wo si shel m‑ahgi mat hegam d wo waꞌi Jiosh hemajkamgak mat hedai gokko wo mamsi. Bo wa chuꞌig g Jiosh kownaltalig.”

column2: “How can you be reborn when you're old?” Nicodemus asked. “You can't go back into your mother's womb and be born a second time!”
column3: D hab kaij g Nicodemas, “Tt has hig masma ep wo mahsi heki hu kelitk. Aha natt am ep wo i wah t‑jeꞌe ed k ep wo mahsi?”

column2: “I tell you the truth, you can't enter God's kingdom unless you are born of water and the Spirit,” Jesus told him.  “What's born of the flesh is flesh, and what's born of the Spirit is Spirit.
column3: D g Jesus hab kaij, “Piaꞌa. Dam wabsh ha‑aꞌaliga ab ha ab mamsik. Bani m‑ahgid ab amjed g wechij doakag. Id at g Hekia S‑apꞌekam Gewkdag ab wo em‑mah mamt wo e chehgi g pahl wakonakaj mamt dagito g pi ap e‑chuꞌijig. Mt hab s‑ap am wo i wahp Jiosh kownaltalig ed.

column2: Don't be surprised at my telling you, ‘You must be reborn.’
column3: Pi g am e todsid mani hab kaij mamt hemho wa ep wo mamsi.

column2: The wind blows wherever it wants, and just as you hear the sound it makes, but don't know where it's coming from or where it's going, that's how it is for everyone who is born of the spirit.”
column3: Neh, kah ap g hewel m an hewelhog. Nap hig s‑mahch mas hebai amjed med ch hebai wo meh? Pegih, k hab wa masma pi ta machima hab e junihim g Hekia S‑apꞌekam Gewkdag ch an ha wechij mamsid mo hedai hab i elid.”

column2: “How is this possible?” Nicodemus asked.
column3: D g Nicodemas hab kaij, “A, kus has masma hab chuꞌig?”

column2: “You're a famous teacher in Israel,  and yet you don't understand such things?” Jesus replied.
column3: D hab kaij g Jesus, “Aha, nap pi amichud ch eda d wa chum ge uhgk ha mashchamdam g Tutuligo?

column2: “I tell you the truth, we speak of what we know and give evidence regarding what we have seen, but you refuse to accept our testimony.
column3: Do si wohokam ihda mani m‑ahgid. M ach ahgachug mach haschu s‑ap s‑mahch ch am em‑ahgid mach haschu neid. M eda pi wohochud g haꞌichu t‑ahga.

column2: If you don't trust what I say when I tell you about earthly things, how would you ever trust what I say if I were to tell you about heavenly things?
column3: Ihda mani em‑ahgid o in hab waꞌi e junihim jewed dahm. M eda pi ni‑wohochud ch hab pi wo e nako mams wo s‑ni‑wohoch mant am wo em‑ahgi mo haschu has e junihim an dahm kahchim ch ed.

column2: No one has gone up to heaven, but the Son of man came down from heaven.
column3: An ani wa kih dahm kahchim ch ed ch d Jiosh si Kehsha. Kut pi hedai ep wo e nako mas hab masma wo em‑ahgi ab amjed mant ahni.”

column2: Just as Moses lifted up the serpent in the desert, so the Son of man must be lifted up,
column3: D hab ep kaij g Jesus, “An o hab chuꞌig Jiosh oꞌohana ed matsh wa g t‑shohshonbad muꞌi e keꞌij g kohkꞌoikaj mash eda am oiopo tohono jewed ch ed. Kutsh wa g Mosesbad am hema hab juh g koꞌoi g kohwlikaj k ab uhgk ul uhs t ab. T hedai ab i neid k doa. Pegih, kumt ahni hab waꞌap uhgk wo i ni‑ul uhs t ab ahni Jiosh si Kehsha.

column2: that everyone who trusts in him will have eternal life.
column3: Kutp hedai ab wo ni‑hiwig k wo e doꞌibia ab amjed g pi ap e‑chuꞌijig.” Neh, bad kaij g Jesus.

column2: For God loved the world, and this is how:  he gave his one and only Son, so that everyone who trusts in him shouldn't die, but have eternal life.
column3: Pegih neh, ab o si t‑tatchua g Jiosh ch hiwigi g e‑alidag mat am i e dagito k e muhkid am t‑wehhejed mach d pi ap chuꞌijkam. Kut pi wo bei g s‑koꞌok e‑namkidadag matp hedai ab wo hiwig k wabshaba g pi ha huhugedam doakag wo bei.

column2: God didn't send the Son into the world to condemn the world, but to save the world through him.
column3: Jiosh at am cheha g e‑alidag mat in wo i wuhsh jewed dahm k wo ha doꞌibia g hemajkam. Kut pi heg hekaj in i wuhsh mas ab wo haꞌichu t‑mohtoꞌi.

column2: Those who trust in him are not condemned, while those who don't trust in him are condemned  already because they didn't trust in the one and only Son of God.
column3: Pi o ab hu haꞌichu mohtoꞌis hegam mo ab hiwig g Jiosh alidag. Hegam o ab heki hu haꞌichu mohtoꞌis mo pi ab hu hiwig.

column2: This is how the decision  is made: the light came to the world, but people loved the darkness rather than the light, for their actions were evil.  All those who do evil hate the light and don't come into the light, because they don't want their actions to be exposed.
column3: Ia at jiwia jewed dahm hegai mo woho tonlidch g t‑chegitoidag. K wabshaba hegam mo hab s‑junimk g pi apꞌekam pi tatchua g tonlig nat pi wo mahsko wua g pi ap haꞌichu hab ha‑juni. K oi wa ab him g lodaita heg hekaj pi apꞌekam.

column2: But those who do good come into the light, so that what God accomplishes in them can be revealed.”
column3: Hegam mo hab wua g s‑apꞌekam o tatchua g tonlig mat wo mahsko e wua mo hab wua g Jiosh tatchui.

column2: After this Jesus and his disciples went into Judea and spent some time with the people, baptizing them.
column3: Am i dahm, kuchd am i wuwha Jerusalem kihhim t amjed k am oiopohim Judea chekshani ch ed ch ha pahl wapkon g hemajkam.

column2: John was also baptizing at Aenon near Salim, because there was plenty of water there and people kept coming to be baptized.  (This was before John was imprisoned).
column3: Md eda wenog koi kuh hegai John mad ha pahl wapkon. Sh am oimmed ch ha pahl wapkon Aenon t am miabidch g Salim kihhim no pi am ge shohshon ch s‑shuhdagig.

column2: An argument developed between John's disciples and a Jew over ceremonial purification.
column3: Sh am haꞌichug hegam mash ab si wecho e mashcham. Kutsh am hema jiwia g t‑wehm oꞌodham k ha wehm neꞌowi ab amjed g pahl wakona.

column2: They went to John and told him, “Rabbi, the man you were with on the other side of the Jordan River, the one you testified in support of—see, now he's baptizing, and everyone is going to him!”
column3: Tsh idam am hahawa hihi John wui k hab kaij, “T‑mashchamdam, hema at wa am m‑wui jiwia map wa am ha pahl wapkon gam hu aigojed g Jordan akimel. Kup wa am si s‑mahch ch ahg mo hig woho d si s‑has haꞌichu. Pegih, heg ash hab waꞌap ha pahl wapkon. Kush wehsijj gam hu haꞌab him wui.”

column2: “No one receives anything unless they're given it from heaven,” John replied.
column3: Sh hab kaij g John, “Heg ach ab waꞌi bekch mo haschu g Jiosh ab t‑mahkch.

column2: “You yourselves can testify that I declared, ‘I'm not the Messiah. I've been sent to prepare his way.’
column3: Bani wa kaij mani pi d Jiosh si Kehsha ch wabsh am haꞌichu i apꞌechud g ia jiwhiadaj wehhejed. Am am wa kah mani wa hab kaij.

column2: The bridegroom is the one who has the bride! The best man waits, listening for the bridegroom, and is so happy when he hears the bridegroom's voice—in the same way my happiness is now complete.
column3: Jiosh si Kehsha o heg wepogidas mo g wo ha hohntam. K g hemajkam heg wepogidas mo g wo ha hohnta. T g nawojij wo si s‑hehgigk mat hekid s‑ap wo e hohont. Bani wa masma si s‑hehgig mo ab wui him g hemajkam nani pi d nawojij.

column2: He must become more important, and I must become less important.”
column3: Heg at am wo e maskogi mo hig woho d si s‑has haꞌichu. Kunt ahni im hu hab wabsh wo i ni‑junihi.” Neh, bash kaij g John.

column2: He who comes from above is greater  than all; he who comes from the earth belongs to the earth and talks about earthly things. He who comes from heaven is greater than all.
column3: Nt ahni hab wo chei mo g John d wabsh oꞌodham ch am t‑ahgid mo haschu i neid ch ep kah ia jewed dahm. T wabshaba g Jiosh alidag ia jiwia ab dahm kahchim t amjed k d si s‑has haꞌichu wehs haꞌichu dahm

column2: He gives evidence about what he has seen and heard, but no one accepts what he has to say.
column3: ch am t‑ahgid mash haschu i neid ch ep kah an dahm kahchim ch ed. K wabshaba pi shaꞌi muꞌijj ab wohochud g ahgaj.

column2: Yet anyone who accepts what he says confirms that God is truthful.  For the one God sent speaks God's words, because God doesn't restrict the Spirit.
column3: Jiosh at am cheha g e‑alidag mat ia wo jiwia jewed dahm k s‑baꞌama ab mah g Hekia S‑apꞌekam Gewkdag. K g alidaj heg hekaj ahg g neꞌokij. (33) Pegih, kuch heg hekaj s‑ap ab s‑wohochud g Jiosh neꞌoki ahchim mach ab s‑wohochud g alidaj ahga.

column2: The Father loves the Son and has placed everything in his hands.
column3: Jiosh o si pihk e elid ab e‑alidag wui ch wehs haꞌichu ab mah.

column2: Anyone who trusts in the Son has eternal life, but anyone who refuses to trust the Son will not experience eternal life but remains under God's condemnation.
column3: Kuch wehsijj uꞌukch g pi ha huhugedam doakag ahchim mach ab hiwig g alidaj. T hegam mat pi ab hu wo wohog el pi wo edagi g pi ha huhugedam doakag k wabshaba g s‑koꞌok e‑namkidadag wo edagi. T heg hab waꞌap pi hekid wo huhug.

column2: When Jesus realized that the Pharisees had discovered that he was gaining and baptizing more disciples than John,  (although it wasn't Jesus who was baptizing, but his disciples),
column3: D baꞌich i muꞌi hemajkam ab him Jesus wui mo ab wui g John kch ab wecho e mashcham. Kuchd ahchim ha pahl wapkon mach ab si wecho t‑mashcham. D am i kah hegam Palasi ihda k an si i neneo.

column2: he left Judea and returned to Galilee.
column3: D hekaj g Jesus hab i e ah matt wo i wuwha ab Judea chekshani t amjed k gam hu uhpam wo hihi Galilee chekshani wui.

column2: On the way he had to pass through Samaria.
column3: K eda idam ha shahgid chechkshani am hab chuꞌig g Samaria chekshani.

column2: So he came to the Samaritan city of Sychar, near to the field that Jacob had given his son Joseph.  Jacob's well was there, and Jesus, who was tired from the journey, sat straight down beside the well. It was around noon.
column3: Kuchd heg am gai hihimad ch gam hu ai g Sychar kihhim mat am dahm juh. K am wawhiag miabidch g kihhim. D am dahiwua g Jesus gewkok natt pi mehk waꞌi hihi.

column2: A Samaritan woman came to fetch water. Jesus said to her, “Please could you give me a drink?”  for his disciples had gone to the town to buy food.
column3: Kuchd ahchim gam hu hihi kihhim wui matt wo ha nolawt g haꞌichu hugi. D an hema i t‑bij g uwi waꞌigamedam k atsh am jiwia mo am daha g Jesus.

column2: “You're a Jew, and I'm a Samaritan woman. How can you ask me for a drink?” the woman replied, for Jews don't associate with Samaritans.
column3: Sh hab kaij g uwi, “Neh, dapki Tuhligo. Ni ahni d Samaria t am oꞌodham. P haschu ahgch ab ni‑tahni g wasib?” Neh, bash kaij nach pi s‑ha uhwaid ch chum hems g haꞌu pi ha wehm wo ha hekaj.

column2: Jesus answered her, “If you only recognized God's gift, and who is asking you, ‘Please could you give me a drink?’ you would have asked him and he would have given you the water of life.”
column3: Sh g Jesus hab epai kaij ab wui, “Ahpi apt aigo ab wo haꞌichu ni‑tai maptp wo s‑mahchk mani hedai wud ch haschu i m‑makiog. Hegai mani m‑makiog o ab Jiosh d amjedkam ch heg wepogidas mo g shonkam shuhdagi.”

column2: “Sir, you don't have a bucket, and the well is deep. Where are you going to get the water of life from?” she replied.
column3: Sh hab ep kaij g uwi, “Pt has hig masma wo waꞌi map pi ha kuhwo? K eda s‑juhk g wawhia.

column2: “Our father Jacob gave us the well. He drank from it himself, as well as his sons and his livestock. Are you greater than he?”
column3: Aha nap baꞌich i gewkdag mo g t‑shohshon Jacobbad. Heg at ia wawhiat e‑oid ed k ia ihꞌehim g e‑aꞌaliga ha wehm ch haꞌichu e‑shoshoiga.”

column2: Jesus answered, “Everyone who drinks water from this well will become thirsty again.
column3: Sh g Jesus hab kaij, “Huhume o g shuhdagi m‑waꞌigi. Kup ep tonommek.

column2: But those who drink the water I give won't ever be thirsty again. The water I give becomes a bubbling spring of water inside them, bringing them eternal life.”
column3: T wabshaba pi hekid wo huhug hegai mani ahni m‑makiog. Heg at am wo m‑edak ch hab wo masmak mo g shonkam ch ab wo m‑mah g pi ha huhugedam doakag.”

column2: “Sir,” replied the woman, “Please give me this water so I won't be thirsty, and I won't have to come here to fetch water!”
column3: Sh hab kaij g uwi, “Ih, pegih, si g s‑ni‑hoꞌigeꞌid k ab i ni‑mahki ihda shuhdagi mant pi hekid ep wo tonom k pi wo ge i waꞌigammedad.”

column2: “Go and call your husband, and come back here,” Jesus told her.
column3: Sh hab kaij g Jesus, “Pegih, k ab wo i wai g e‑kun.”

column2: “I don't have a husband,” the woman answered.
column3: Sh g uwi hab kaij, “Pi ani ha kun.”

column2: “You've had five husbands, and the one you're living with now is not your husband. So what you say is true!”
column3: Hetasp ap waꞌi ha kuhkunkahim. K hegai map hemuch an wehm kih pi d m‑kun.”

column2: “I can see you're a prophet, sir,” the woman replied.
column3: Tsh ab wabsh ge nen k kekiwua g uwi k hab kaij, “Ih, dapki ge Jiosh haꞌichu i tashogiddam!

column2: “Tell me this: our ancestors worshiped here on this mountain, but you say that Jerusalem is where we must worship.”
column3: Pegih neh, am g ni‑ahgid mam haschu ahgch ahpim Tutuligo hab chechꞌe mo g Jerusalem d waꞌi amai mat am wo e ihmad g Jiosh. Ch eda ahchim Samaria t am kihkam ia haꞌab ihm mo hebai g t‑shohshon ihmahim id ab doꞌag.”

column2: Jesus replied,  “Believe me the time is coming when you won't worship the Father either on this mountain or in Jerusalem.
column3: Sh hab kaij g Jesus, “Nt wo si shel m‑ahgi mo ab him g tash mat wabsh chum hebai wo e ihm g em‑ohg Jiosh, pi iia waꞌi id ab doꞌag o am Jerusalem t am.

column2: You really don't know the God you're worshiping, while we worship the God we know, for salvation comes from the Jews.
column3: T wabshaba g Jiosh ab i t‑gawulkai ahchim Tutuligo mat am gai t‑wuhshanim wo e maskogi am ha wui g nahnko mahs hemajkam. M ahpim Samaria t am oꞌodham pi koi am hu i si s‑mahch g Jiosh.

column2: But the time is coming—and in fact it's here already—when true worshipers will worship the Father in spirit and in truth, for these are the kind of worshipers the Father wants.
column3: E at ai g tash mat g hemajkam si e‑ihbdag amjed woho ab wo ihmad g e‑ohg Jiosh. Bo masma hab ha elid g Jiosh mat hab masma ab wo ihmad.

column2: God is Spirit, so worshipers must worship in spirit and in truth.”
column3: Do wabsh doakag g Jiosh ch pi ha honshpadag mams am hebai wo kihchud k heg waꞌi eda wo ihmad. Pegih, mt wabsh chum hebai wo ihmad ch wehs e‑ihbdag amjed.”

column2: The woman said, “Well, I know that the Messiah is coming,” (the one who is called Christ). “When he comes he will explain it all to us.”
column3: Sh am wabsh shaꞌi pi amichud g uwi ch hab kaij ab wui, “Heg ani hi wa s‑mahch mat wo jiwia hegai mo d Jiosh si Kehsha ch hab e aꞌaga Christ k wehs haꞌichu wo t‑ahgi.”

column2: Jesus replied, “I AM—the one who is speaking to you.”
column3: Sh hab kaij g Jesus, “Dani ahni Jiosh si Kehsha.”

column2: Just then the disciples returned. They were shocked that he was talking to a woman, but none of them asked “What are you doing?” or “Why are you talking with her?”
column3: Kuchd edapk i dada. D am wabsh kia wehmaj neok hegai uwi. Kuchd si has i t‑elid k wabshaba pi has shaꞌi kaij.

column2: The woman left her water jar behind and ran back to the town, telling the people,
column3: D ihda uwi am wabsh i dagito g e‑haꞌa k gam hu si s‑hohtam uhpam hih kihhim wui k ash am ha ahgid k hab kaij,

column2: “Come and meet a man who told me everything I ever did! Could this be the Messiah?”
column3: “Oi g ab wo i hihim k wo nei hegai mo am wehs ni‑ahgid mani has i ni‑wua. Kutp hu d i Jiosh si Kehsha.”

column2: So they went out of the town to go and see him.
column3: Kudki ab ha hekaj i hihi g hemajkam s‑neidamk g Jesus.

column2: Meanwhile Jesus' disciples were urging him, “Rabbi, please eat something!”
column3: D koi e chehm g hemajkam, kuchd ab chum si ahgid g Jesus mat wo haꞌichu huh.

column2: But Jesus replied, “I have food to eat that you know nothing about.”
column3: D wabshaba hab kaij, “Am o haꞌichug g hab mahs gegosig mam ahpim pi shaꞌi mahch.”

column2: “Did someone bring him food?” the disciples asked one another.
column3: Chd hab kaij ab aꞌai t‑wui, “A nat ia heki hu hema gegos?”

column2: Jesus told them, “My food is to do the will of the One who sent me, and to complete his work.
column3: D hab kaij g Jesus ab t‑wui, “Ni‑gegosig o d ihda mant hab wo juh g Jiosh tatchui k wo nahto hegai chikpan mo ab ni‑mohtoꞌid.

column2: Don't you have a saying, ‘four more months until harvest?’ Open your eyes and look around! The crops in the fields are ripe, ready for harvest.
column3: Neh, bo e chechꞌe mat g ha‑esha wo i e baꞌiha mat d wo giꞌik i mashadk. Nt wabshaba wo em‑chehgi mat hemu si s‑hohtam wo e baꞌiha haꞌichu.

column2: The reaper is being paid and harvesting a crop for eternal life so that both the sower and the reaper can celebrate.
column3: Ahni ant am ei g Jiosh haꞌichu ahga. Kumt ahpim wo ha baꞌiha hegam mat wo bei g pi ha huhugedam doakag. Kutt hekaj t‑wehm wo s‑hehgigk.

column2: So the proverb ‘one sows, another reaps,’ is true.
column3: Id o heg wepogidas hab cheꞌidag mo hab chuꞌig, ‘Hema oꞌodham at am wo haꞌichu ei. T d wabsh wo hemak ch am wo hih g esha.’

column2: I sent you to reap what you didn't work for. Others did the hard work and you have reaped the benefits of what they did.”
column3: Ab g wo neid hegam mo ab hihim. Pi amt ha ahgi g Jiosh haꞌichu ahga k wabshaba wo ha baꞌiha hegam mat wo e doꞌibia.”

column2: Many Samaritans from that town trusted in him because of what the woman said: “He told me everything I ever did.”
column3: Kud wa muꞌijj hegam kihkam ab i s‑wohoch mo g Jesus d Jiosh si Kehsha heg hekaj mo hab kaij hegai uwi, “Heg o wehs ni‑ahgid mani has i ni‑wua.”

column2: So when they came to see him they pleaded with him to stay with them. He stayed for two days,
column3: D heg hekaj ab si ahgid g Jesus am wui dadak mat wo si s‑ha hoꞌigeꞌid k am wo kia ha wehmajkahim heꞌekia tash. Kuchd wa woho am ha wehmajkahim gohk tash.

column2: and because of what he told them many more trusted in him.
column3: D muꞌijj ab ep i s‑wohoch ab i kaiok g ahgaj

column2: They said to the woman, “Now our trust in him isn't just because of what you told us but because we have heard him for ourselves. We're convinced that he really is the Savior of the world.”
column3: k hab hahawa kaij idam heg wui uwi, “B att hahawa si hejel kah k ab s‑wohochud k s‑mahch moki woho d wehs hemajkam t‑doꞌibiakam id dahm jewed.”

column2: After the two days he continued on to Galilee.
column3: Kuchd amjed gam hu hahawa haꞌab hihi Galilee chekshani wui

column2: Jesus himself had made the comment that a prophet is not respected in his own country.
column3: no pi hab kaij g Jesus, “No hu d wabsh i neida g Jiosh haꞌichu i tashogiddam amai mo hebai d si kihj am jewed.”

column2: But when he arrived in Galilee, the people welcomed him, because they had also been at the Passover feast and had seen everything he'd done in Jerusalem.
column3: D wabshaba muꞌijj g hemajkam amai ab haꞌichugkahim Jerusalem t ab ch wuhshad g t‑shohshon ha‑doꞌibiadag ch am neid g Jesus. Kud wa am hab wua g s‑hasig haꞌichu. D idam si s‑hehgig ch ab neid g Jesus matt ged hu dada.

column2: He visited Cana in Galilee again, where he had turned water into wine. Nearby in the town of Capernaum lived a royal official whose son was very sick.  When he heard that Jesus had returned from Judea to Galilee, he went to Jesus and begged him to come and heal his son who was close to death.
column3: Kuchd oi wa gam hu haꞌab hihi Cana kihhim wui mat wa am si wehpeg hab juh g si s‑hasig haꞌichu mat wa wabsh g shuhdagi nawaitt. D am hema jiwia g kownal pionag ab Capernaum kihhim t amjed am i kaiok mo am haꞌichug g Jesus. Sh id alidag muhkhim. D hab kaij ihda ab wui g Jesus mat am wo hih Capernaum wui k wo doaj g alidaj.

column2: “Unless you see signs and wonders you people really won't trust me,” said Jesus.
column3: D hab wabsh kaij g Jesus ab wui, “Aha, namt pi hedai ab hu wo i s‑ni‑wohoch, mt hekid wo ipki nei mant hab wo juh g si s‑hasig haꞌichu?”

column2: “Lord, just come before my child dies,” the official pleaded.
column3: D am hab waꞌap kaij g s‑has haꞌichu, “Ab g si i s‑ni‑hoꞌigeꞌid k wo ni‑oi am ni‑kih wui mat koi wo muh g ni‑aliga.”

column2: “Go on home,” Jesus told him. “Your son will live!”
column3: D hab hahawa kaij g Jesus ab wui, “Gamai g s‑ap e tahtk hihm. T wo doa g m‑aliga.”

column2: While he was on his way, his servants met him with the news that his son was alive and recovering.
column3: Sh am himad ch ab haꞌi ha nam g e‑pionag mash si s‑hehgig ch hab kaij, “Tki wo doa g m‑aliga.”

column2: He asked them what time it was when his son began to get better. “Yesterday at one p.m. the fever left him,” they told him.
column3: Sh am hahawa ha kakke, “Heꞌekia ohla k ed at ab i apꞌetahi.”

column2: Then the father realized this was the precise time when Jesus had told him, “Your son will live!” So he and everyone in his household trusted in Jesus.
column3: Sh am ha hekaj i chegito g ohgaj mo am d wabsh i si hegai ohla mo hab ahgid g Jesus, “T wo doa g m‑aliga.” Tsh ged hu jiwia e‑kih am k am si aꞌaga ihda g e‑wehm kihkam ha wehm. Tsh wehsijj ab i s‑wohoch mo g Jesus d Jiosh si Kehsha.

column2: This was the second miraculous sign Jesus did after coming from Judea to Galilee.
column3: Neh, id o d i gokkokam s‑hasig haꞌichu mat hab juh g Jesus ia Galilee chekshani ch ed.

column2: After this, there was a Jewish festival so Jesus went to Jerusalem.
column3: D am hahawa hema i e aihi g t‑mihshmda piast. Kuchd hekaj gam hu hihi Jerusalem wui.

column2: Now near the Sheep Gate in Jerusalem is a pool called Bethzatha in Hebrew, with five porches beside it.
column3: Am o hema woꞌog kihhim ch ed ch hab e aꞌaga Bethsada ch an miabidch hegai kolhai kihjeg mam an ha gagda g kahwal. K an hetasp wapttog heg wehgaj woꞌo.

column2: Crowds of sick people were lying in these porches—those who were blind, lame, or paralyzed.
column3: K idam ha wecho shaꞌi muꞌi nahnko mahs kokꞌodam an woꞌowop ch haꞌi d pi neneadam ch haꞌi d pi hihimidkam ch haꞌi ab wabsh i s‑momoik. [Kush idam nenida g shuhdagi matsh am wo i hoi

no pi hab elid mash hab hu g anghil am i huhuduk shuhdagi ch ed ch am i nonoig g shuhdagi. T hedai si wehpeg am wo hud shuhdagi ch ed mat am wabsh wo chum i nonoi k ash hab hu wo s‑doajima ab e‑mumkidag amjed.]

column2: One man who was there had been sick for thirty-eight years. Jesus looked at him, knowing he had been lying there for long time, and asked him,
column3: D am hema woꞌo g oꞌodham ch waikko wehst‑mahm gamai gigiꞌik (34) aꞌahid ab waꞌi mumku.

column2: “Do you want to be healed?”
column3: D g Jesus am neid ch s‑mahch mo tash am waꞌi woꞌo ch hab kaij ab wui, “Nap tatchua mapt wo doa?”

column2: “Sir,” the sick man answered, “I don't have anyone to help me get into the pool when the water is stirred. While I'm trying to get there, someone always gets in before me.”
column3: D hab kaij g mumkudam, “Ni‑nawoj, pi o an hu hedaig mas am wo i ni‑huduni shuhdagi ch ed mo hekid am i hoike. Ni im hu haha wabsh i ni‑nakog mant am wo i hud, k gam hu heki hu hema ni‑baꞌiwichchek.”

column2: “Stand up, pick up your mat, and start walking!” Jesus told him.
column3: D hab kaij g Jesus, “I wuhshani k am behꞌi g e‑wahkus k hihm!”

column2: Immediately the man was healed. He picked up his mat and started walking.
column3: Neh, d ha hekaj doa k am bei g e‑wahkus k s‑ap hih.

column2: So the Jews said to the man who'd been healed, “This is the Sabbath! It's against the law to carry a mat!”
column3: D haꞌi neid g t‑wehm oꞌodham ch hab ahg, “Neh, ahpi, melchkwua ap g t‑chehanig map kushwiotch g e‑wahkus. A nap pi mahch mo d mihshmda tash?”

column2: “The man who healed me told me to pick up my mat and start walking,” he replied.
column3: D hab hahawa kaij hegai mo wa mumkuhim, “Hegai mat ni‑doaj o hab ni‑ahg mant am wo bei g ni‑wahkus k wo hih.”

column2: “Who's this person who told you to carry your mat and walk?” they asked.
column3: D ab hahawa kakke mas hedai wud hegai mo hab ahg mat wo kushwiotk hih g e‑wahkus.

column2: However the man who'd been healed didn't know who it was, for Jesus had slipped away into the surrounding crowd.
column3: D wabshaba am wabsh i pi e amich nad pi g Jesus im hu pi e mahsid hemajkam ha shahgid no pi shaꞌi muꞌijj g hemajkam amai.

column2: Later on Jesus found the man in the Temple, and told him, “Look, now you've been healed. So stop sinning or something worse may happen to you.”
column3: D am hahawa g Jesus s‑neidam k am cheh geꞌe cheopi ch ed k hab ahg, “Neh, doa apt. Pi g am hu hab i ep junihim g pi apꞌekam nat pi haꞌichu baꞌich i pi ap hab wo e juh am m‑tahgio mapt am hab ep wo i junihi g pi apꞌekam.”

column2: The man went and told the Jews it was Jesus who had healed him.
column3: D am i wuhshani k gam hu him k am ha ahgi moki d Jesus mat doaj.

column2: So the Jews started to harass Jesus because he was doing things on the Sabbath.
column3: D am i s‑mai idam mash d Jesus mat hab juh ihda mihshmda tash ed k heg hekaj am i kudu ab neꞌowinch.

column2: But Jesus told them, “My Father is still working, and so am I.”
column3: D g Jesus hab kaij ab ha wui, “Ni‑ohg Jiosh o chum hekid g s‑apꞌekam chikpan. Ni ahni hab waꞌap chum hekid hab ni‑wua.”

column2: This was why the Jews tried even harder to kill him, for not only did he break the Sabbath but also called God his Father, making himself equal with God.
column3: D am hahawa i si e gewpkai mat wo mua nad pi am i kah mo hab masma ihm g Jiosh ch heg hekaj e wepogid g Jiosh.

column2: Jesus explained to them, “I tell you the truth, the Son can do nothing by himself; he can only do what he sees the Father doing. Whatever the Father does the Son does as well.
column3: D hab hahawa kaij g Jesus ab ha wui, “Nt wo si shel em‑ahgi mani pi haꞌichu hejel hab wua ch wabshaba hab wua mo haschu g ni‑ohg Jiosh ni‑chehani.

column2: For the Father loves the Son, and reveals to him everything he does; and the Father will show to him even more incredible things that will completely amaze you.
column3: Ni‑ohg o ab si pihk ni‑elid ch am ni‑chehgid mant has wo chum juni. T ab wo ni‑mah g gewkdag mant baꞌich i geꞌe haꞌichu hab wo juh mo ihda. Mt ab wabsh wo i hahaꞌadka.

column2: For just as the Father gives life to those he resurrects from the dead, in the same way the Son also gives life to those that he wants.
column3: Ni‑ohg o i ha wuwhasid g koꞌi ab muhkig amjed ch ab ni‑mahkch g gewkdag mant s‑ap hab wo juh. Nt hekaj ab wo i ha wuwhas mani hedai hab i elid.

column2: The Father judges no one. He has given to the Son all the authority to judge,
column3: K g ni‑ohg pi hedai ha lodait ch wabshaba ahni ab ni‑mah hegai apꞌedag mant wo ha lodai

column2: so that everyone may honor the Son just as they honor the Father. Anyone who doesn't honor the Son doesn't honor the Father who sent him.
column3: no pi hab elid mat wehsijj ab wo si has i ni‑el hab masma mo ab si has i elid g ni‑ohg. Am at i ni‑kei g Jiosh. T hedai pi ab hu has wo ni‑elidad ch hab wa masma pi ab hu has elid g ni‑ohg.

column2: I tell you the truth: those who follow what I say and trust the One who sent me have eternal life. They won't be condemned, but have gone from death to life.
column3: “Do si wohokam ihda mant hab wo chei. T wo edagi g pi ha huhugedam doakag k am wo wehmajk g Jiosh hegam mat hedai ab wo kaihamad g haꞌichu ni‑ahga ch ab wo hiwgad g Jiosh. Pi ant ab hu wo ha mohtoꞌi g ha‑chuꞌijig mas hekaj gm hu hab wo i e juh ab amjed g Jiosh.

column2: I tell you the truth: The time is coming—in fact it's here already—when the dead will hear the voice of the Son of God, and those who hear will live!
column3: Nt wo si shel em‑ahgi mo ab him g tash, pej heki hu e ai, mant ab wo i ha wai g koꞌi ahni Jiosh alidag. T hegam mat ab i kaiha g haꞌichu ni‑ahga ab wo i wuwha.

column2: Just as the Father has life-giving power in himself, so has he given the Son the same life-giving power in himself.
column3: Ni‑ohg o d hegai mo ab ha mahkch g doakag ch ab ni‑mahkch g gewkdag mant hab waꞌap wo ha mah g doakag.

column2: The Father also granted the authority for judgment to him, for he is the Son of man.
column3: T ab ni‑mah g gewkdag mant ahni hab wo juh g lodaita nani pi d si Kehshaj.

column2: Don't be surprised at this, for the time is coming when all those in the grave will hear his voice
column3: “Pi g am wo e totodsid id hekaj mani has i kaij. Ab o him g tash mat wehs g koꞌi s‑ap wo ni‑kah k ab wo i wuwha.

column2: and will rise again: those who have done good to the resurrection of life, and those who have done evil to the resurrection of condemnation.
column3: Hegam mo hab junihim g s‑apꞌekam at ab wo i e wamgid k ab wo bei g e‑apꞌedag. T hegam mo hab junihim g pi apꞌekam ab wo i e wamgid k ab wo bei g s‑koꞌok e‑namkidadag.”

column2: I can do nothing by myself. I judge based on what I'm told, and my decision is right, for I'm not doing my own will but the will of the One who sent me.
column3: D hab ep kaij g Jesus, “Pi ant wo shaꞌi ni‑nako mant hejel haꞌichu hab wo juh k wabshaba am si ni‑ohg oidk hab masma wo ha lodai. K hekaj hab s‑apꞌe g ni‑lodaita.

column2: If I were to make claims about myself, such claims wouldn't be valid;
column3: “Pi amt wo mahchk manis am ahg g wohokam mantp wabsh hejel wo ni‑wohokamch.

column2: but someone else gives evidence about me, and I know what he says about me is true.
column3: K heg hekaj am wa ni‑wehhejed neok g ni‑ohg Jiosh. Kuni s‑mahch mo d wohokam mo am ahg ab ni‑amjed.

column2: You asked John about me, and he told the truth,
column3: “Neh, am amt wa haꞌi hihi heg wui John mo wa em‑pahl wapkonahim. K wa am em‑ahgid g wohokam.

column2: but I don't need any human endorsement. I'm explaining this to you so you can be saved.
column3: Id ani hab wabsh kaij mamt hekaj wo e doꞌibia nam pi ahpim heg tatchua mat g oꞌodham am wo i wohokamch haꞌichu mamt ab haha wo i s‑wohoch. Ni ahni hi heki hu s‑mahch mani hedai wud ch pi shaꞌi tatchua mas am hema wo ge i ni‑wohokamch.

column2: John was like a brightly-burning light, and you were willing to enjoy his light for a while.
column3: John o wa ahgachug g wohokam ch hekaj em‑tonlidch. Kumt wa haꞌijj ahpim heꞌes ab si s‑hohhoꞌi g haꞌichu ahgaj k an e hehemapaid wehgaj hab masma mat g huꞌul nahgi wo s‑hohhoꞌi g tonlig.

column2: But the evidence I'm giving is greater than John's. For I am doing the work that the Father gave me to do,
column3: “John o s‑ap ni‑wohokamchud. K wabshaba ahni ab ni‑mahkch g Jiosh mani g s‑hasig haꞌichu hab wua. K id baꞌich i s‑ap ni‑wohokamchud mani d ni‑ohg kehsha.

column2: and this is the proof that the Father sent me. The Father who sent me, he himself speaks on my behalf. You've never heard his voice, and you've never seen what he looks like,
column3: Pi am hekid neid g Jiosh. K pi hekid ab hu em‑wuhiosha neid ch neok ch wabshaba am ni‑wohokamchud mani d kehshaj.

column2: and you don't accept what he says, because you don't trust in the one he sent.
column3: Am o ni‑wohokamchud g Jiosh mani d si Kehshaj. Kum eda pi ab hu ni‑tatchua nam ge wohochud.

column2: You search the Scriptures because you think that through them you'll gain eternal life. But the evidence they give is in support of me!
column3: Am am si hoan g Jiosh oꞌohana nam pi tatchua mamt wo e doꞌibia k wo edgidad g pi ha huhugedam doakag. K g Jiosh oꞌohana am ni‑wohokamchud

column2: And yet you don't want to come to me so that you might live.
column3: mani ahni d em‑doꞌibiakam. M eda pi ab hu ni‑hiwig.

column2: I'm not looking for human approval
column3: “Neh, pi ani heg nenꞌoid mas g hemajkam ab wo si ni‑haꞌichuch. Jiosh at ab wo si ni‑haꞌichuch.

column2: —I know you, and that you don't have God's love in you.
column3: Kuni s‑em‑amichud ch s‑mahch mam pi ab hu shaꞌi tatchua g Jiosh.

column2: For I've come to represent my Father, and you won't accept me; but if someone comes representing themselves, then you accept them!
column3: Ia ant jiwia g ni‑ohg si wehhejed. Kum pi ab hu has ni‑elid. Hegam at ab has d wo em‑elidak matp hedam wabsh hejel e wehhejed ab wo i wuwha.

column2: How can you trust in me when you look for praise from one another and yet you don't look for praise from the one true God?
column3: Pi amt has masma ab hu wo s‑wohoch g Jiosh nam pi heg am waꞌi s‑nenꞌoid mamt ab aꞌai wo si has i e el. K eda d chum Jiosh mamt ab wo chum hehgchul.

column2: But don't think I will be making accusations about you to the Father. It's Moses who is accusing you, the one in whom you place such confidence.
column3: Ni wabshaba pi d ahni manis ab wo haꞌichu em‑abch am ni‑ohg wui. Mosesbad chehanig am ab hiwig. K d hegai mat am wo tashogi g pi ap em‑chuꞌijig.

column2: For if you really trusted Moses you would trust in me, because he wrote about me.
column3: Mosesbad at haꞌichu oꞌoha ab ni‑amjed. Kumt ab wo s‑ni‑wohoch mamt hems woho ab wo s‑wohochudad g Mosesbad oꞌohana.

column2: But since you don't trust what he said, why would you trust what I say?”
column3: Pi amt has masma ab hu wo s‑wohoch g ni‑ahga namki pi woho wohochud mat haschu an oꞌoha g Mosesbad.” Neh, bad kaij g Jesus am ha mihshmadch.

column2: After this, Jesus left to go to the other side of the Sea of Galilee (also known as the Sea of Tiberias).
column3: Am hu hebai ep amjed machd an oiopohim Galilee Kahchki hugid an ch gam hu hahawa i chehchsh haꞌabjed k am dada.

column2: A large crowd was following him, for they'd seen his miracles of healing.
column3: D eda muꞌi hemajkam chum hekid an oidahim g Jesus neidok mo g s‑hasig haꞌichu hab wua ha doajidch g kokꞌodam.

column2: Jesus went up a hill and sat down there with his disciples.
column3: D ab i chesh g Jesus kawulk t ab. Kuchd ahchim waꞌi mach ab si wecho t‑mashcham am i oid k am wehmaj dadhaiwua.

column2: The time for the Jewish festival of the Passover was approaching.
column3: D eda e aihim mat wo e wuhshad g t‑shohshon ha‑doꞌibiadag.

column2: When Jesus looked up, and saw a large crowd coming towards him, he asked Philip, “Where can we buy enough bread to feed all these people?”
column3: Kud muꞌi hegam mad gam hu wo piasto ab i hihi s‑kaimkch g Jesus.

column2: He only asked this to see how Philip would respond, because Jesus already knew what he was going to do.
column3: Bo kaij ch wabsh s‑aꞌappemamk g Philip no pi wa chum s‑mahch mat has masma hab wo juh.

column2: “Two hundred silver coins wouldn't buy enough bread to give everyone even just a little,” Philip replied.
column3: D hab kaij g Philip, “Pi att wo shaꞌi t‑nako. Chum achs hems gohk siant pihshkaj wo ui g pahn, t eda pi wo ha ai g haꞌakia hemajkam.”

column2: One of his disciples, Andrew, Simon Peter's brother, spoke up.
column3: D hegai mo d Simon Peter nawoj ch hab chehgig Andrew hab kaij,

column2: “There's a boy here who has five barley loaves and a couple of fish, but what good is that when there are so many people?”
column3: “Ia o hema haꞌichug g ali ch hi wa hetasp sismito ch gohk waptopi uꞌa. T wabshaba pi haꞌichu ab hu wo shaꞌi ha nako haꞌakia hemajkam ha wehhejed”.

column2: “Have everybody sit down,” Jesus said. There was plenty of grass there, so they all sat down, the men numbering around five thousand.
column3: D ab hahawa t‑ahgid g Jesus matt wo ha cheha g hemajkam mat wo dadhaiwua no pi an s‑washaig. D am i wehsijj dadhaiwua g hemajkam k d hetasp mihl chechoj ch muꞌi ehp g uꞌuwi ch aꞌal.

column2: Jesus took the bread, gave thanks, and had it handed out to the people as they sat there. Then he did the same with the fishes, making sure the people had as much as they wanted.
column3: D g Jesus am ui g sismito k ab hoꞌigeꞌel g Jiosh k ab t‑mah. Kuchd ahchim an hahawa i ha mahkhi g hemajkam. D hab waꞌap juh hegam gohk waptopi. Kuchd wehsijj hug k si s‑kokwod.

column2: Once they were all full, he said to his disciples, “Collect what's left over so nothing is wasted.”
column3: D hab hahawa t‑ahg g Jesus, “An g wo i uꞌihim g ha‑wiꞌa. Kutt pi haꞌichu wo shaꞌi heki wua.”

column2: So they collected and filled twelve baskets with the pieces of the five barley loaves the people had eaten.
column3: Kuchd an i uꞌihim k gamai gohk wapshomi ha shuhshud heg hekaj wihpiꞌidag.

column2: When the people saw this miracle, they said, “Surely this is the Prophet who was to come into the world.”
column3: Neh, d am i nei g hemajkam mat si s‑hasig haꞌichu hab juh g Jesus k hab kaij, “Neh, mo d wabsh i si shel moki id d hegai Jiosh haꞌichu i tashogiddam mach nenida matsh ia wo jiwia id dahm jewed.”

column2: Jesus realized that they were about to force him to become their king, so he left them and went up into the hills to be by himself.
column3: D g Jesus ha amich mat an wabsh wo si be k wo geꞌe kownalch k hekaj gam hu hejel baꞌich i chesh doꞌag t ab.

column2: When evening came, his disciples went down to the sea,
column3: Hudunihim o g tash. Kuchd gam hu i huhud

column2: climbed into a boat, and headed across the water towards Capernaum. By now it was night and Jesus had not joined them yet.
column3: k am chum i chehchsh g wahlkokaj Capernaum wui nad pi hab t‑ah g Jesus k hab kaij matsh pi oi gam hu wo hih. D am i s‑chuk.

column2: A strong wind began blowing and the sea grew rough.
column3: D g s‑gewk hewel ab i med k ab i kudu g shuhdagi.

column2: When they had rowed three or four miles, they saw Jesus walking on the sea, coming towards the boat. They were very frightened.
column3: Kuchd am himchud g wahlko am hu i giꞌik mihya. D ab haha wabsh hema him t‑wui an wabsh shuhdagi dahm. Kuchd hab i neidok si t‑totods.

column2: “Don't be afraid!” he told them. “It's me.”
column3: D ab hahawa t‑wui neo k oki d Jesus ch hab kaij, “Pi g am wo e totodsid. Ahni ani wud”.

column2: Then they gladly took him into the boat, and immediately they reached the shore where they were going.
column3: Kuchd si s‑ap i t‑taht k gan hu i cheshajch wahlko ch ed. Neh chd am waꞌi hekaj gan hu aigo dada mach am haꞌab t‑tatchua.

column2: The next day the crowd that had stayed on the other side of the sea noticed that there had been only one boat there, and that Jesus had not got into the boat with his disciples, but they had left without him.
column3: Baꞌich i siꞌalim, d hegam hemajkam mad ab wih s‑mahch mad pi i t‑oi g Jesus no wa pi neid mo d hemako g wahlko. Kuchd ahchim waꞌi heg ab an dadhaiwua k i hihi.

column2: Then other boats arrived from Tiberias, landing near to the place where they'd eaten the bread once the Lord had blessed it.  Once the crowd realized that neither Jesus nor his disciples were there, they got into the boats and went over to Capernaum, looking for Jesus.
column3: D idam an chum gagahim ch pi cheh g Jesus k nei matt pi am hu ep dada. D oi wa am i haꞌi dada g wapalko ab Tiberias kihhim t amjed miabidk mat am ha gegos g Jesus hegam muꞌi hemajkam. D idam hemajkam an e baꞌiham k gam hu i gahgio Capernaum wui

column2: When they found him on the other side of the sea, they asked him, “Rabbi, when did you get here?”
column3: K hekid am i chehg k hab kaij ab wui, “T‑mashchamdam, hekid apt ia i jiwia?”

column2: “I tell you the truth,” Jesus replied, “you're looking for me because you ate as much bread as you wanted, not because you understood the miracles.
column3: D hab kaij g Jesus, “Am ani woho ni‑chehgidch em‑wui heg hekaj s‑hasig haꞌichu mani hab wua. M wabshaba pi heg hekaj ab s‑ni‑wohochudamk. Neh am ant em‑gegos. Kumt kokwod k heg wai hekaj ni‑gahg.

column2: Don't be preoccupied about food that doesn't last, but concentrate on the lasting food of eternal life which the Son of man will give you, for God the Father has placed his seal of approval on him.”
column3: Pi g am wo si e kudutad wabsh g haꞌichu hugikaj ch wabshaba heg wo chum s‑behim mo d pi ha huhugedam. Ahni ani em‑makiog g pi ha huhugedam doakag. Heg at hekaj am i ni‑kei g Jiosh k am ni‑wohokamch.”

column2: So they asked him, “What do we have to do in order to do what God wants?”
column3: D hab kaij g hemajkam, “Tt has wo t‑juh k ab wo bei g pi ha huhugedam doakag?”

column2: Jesus replied, “What God wants you to do is to trust in the one he sent.”
column3: D g Jesus hab ha ahg, “Ihda waꞌi mamt ab wo ni‑hiwgad ahni Jiosh si Kehsha.”

column2: “What miracle are you going to perform for us to see so we can trust you? What are you able to do?” they asked.
column3: D hab ep kaij g hemajkam, “Am g hig hab juhni g s‑hasig haꞌichu. T heg am wo t‑chehgi map woho d Jiosh si Kehsha. Tt ab wo s‑m‑wohoch.

column2: “Our forefathers ate manna in the desert in fulfillment of the Scripture that says, ‘He gave them bread from heaven to eat.’ ”
column3: Neh, ab ash gegshshe dahm kahchim t amjed hegai haꞌichu hugi mash hab e aꞌaga ‘manna’. Kush heg koꞌa g t‑shohshon mash am jeg ed oiopo. Bo chuꞌig g Mosesbad oꞌohana:

column2: “I tell you the truth, it wasn't Moses who gave you bread from heaven,” Jesus replied. “It's my Father who gives you the true bread of heaven.
column3: D hab ep kaij g Jesus, “Pi o d Mosesbad mo wa ab ha mahk hegai haꞌichu hugi. Do ni‑ohg mo wa hab wua. K heg d wabsh haꞌichu hugi mo wa heg hekaj d dodakam jewed dahm. K g ni‑ohg baꞌich i s‑kehg haꞌichu ab em‑makiog

column2: For the bread of God is the one who comes from heaven and gives life to the world.”
column3: mamt heg hekaj d wo dodakamk chum hekid. Id o heg wa wepo mo d s‑kehg haꞌichu hugi. Kumt wo be k heg ab wo bei g s‑kehg doakag.”

column2: “Lord, please give us this kind of bread all the time!” they said.
column3: D ab si tahni ch hab kaij idam, “Ih, pegih, ab g chum hekid t‑mahkad ihda map hab ahg.”

column2: “I am the bread of life,” Jesus replied. “Anyone who comes to me will never be hungry again, and anyone who trusts in me will never be thirsty again.
column3: D hab kaij g Jesus, “Ahni ani wud mo g ni‑ohg ab em‑makiog. Ab g wo ni‑hiwig. Nt wo em‑mah g pi ha huhugedam doakag. Id at heg wo wa wepok mamt wo huh g hab mahs haꞌichu mamt chum hekid d wo dodakamk ch pi hekid ep wo bihugk.

column2: But as I explained to you before, you have seen me,  but you still don't trust me.
column3: Nehꞌe mani wa hab wa heki hu kaij mam wa chum ni‑neid ch eda pi ab hu ni‑wui e dagitokch.

column2: All those the Father gives me will come to me, and I won't reject any of them.
column3: T wabshaba wehs ab ni‑wui wo i e dagito hegam mat g ni‑ohg am ha eda wo i chikp. Nt pi hedai wo shaꞌi ohhod mat ab wo i e dagito ni‑wui.

column2: For I came down from heaven not to do what I want, but to do what the One who sent me wants.  What he wants is for me not to lose anyone he has given to me, but for me to raise them up at the last day. What my Father wants is for everyone who sees the Son and trusts in him to have eternal life, and for me to raise them up at the last day.”
column3: Do ni‑ohg tatchui mamt ab ni‑wui wo i e dagito ch hab wo edagi g pi ha huhugedam doakag. Nt wo si em‑nuhkudad mamt pi hedai wo heb hu wua g e‑doꞌibiadag. Kunt ab wo i em‑wuwhas muhkig t amjed mat hekid wo huhug ihda jewed. Id o d ni‑ohg tatchui. Kunt heg hekaj ia jiwia ab dahm kahchim t amjed.”

column2: Then the Jews began to grumble about him because he had said, “I am the bread that came down from heaven.”
column3: D g hahaꞌichu si gahghai e mohmgid ch s‑babgam neneok

column2: They said, “Isn't this Jesus, the son of Joseph? We know his father and his mother. So how can he now tell us, ‘I came down from heaven’?”
column3: ch hab kaij, “K haschu ahgch hab kaij mat ia jiwia ab dahm kahchim t amjed? S‑mahch ach ch ep s‑ha mahch g jehj. Do wabsh Jesus ch d alidaj g Josephbad.”

column2: “Stop grumbling to each other,” Jesus said.
column3: D hab kaij g Jesus, “Pi g am wo gahghai e mohmgid k s‑babgam neneok.

column2: “No one can come to me unless the Father who sent me attracts them, and I will raise them up at the last day.
column3: Pi at hedai wo shaꞌi e nako mas ab wabsh hejel wo i e dagito ni‑wui. Jiosh ni‑ohg at am wo i chikp ha eda. T hekaj ab ni‑wui wo i e dagito. T ab wo i e ai g si oidchkam tash. Nt ab wo i ha wuwhas muhkig t amjed.

column2: As is written in Scripture by the prophets, ‘Everyone will be taught by God.’ Everyone who listens to and learns from the Father comes to me.
column3: Kekelibad Jiosh Haꞌichu i tashogiddam atki wa an oꞌoha:

column2: I tell you the truth: anyone who trusts in him has eternal life.
column3: “Neh, hegam mat ab wo i s‑ni‑wohochud k wo ni‑bei at hekaj wo edagi g pi ha huhugedam doakag.

column2: I am the bread of life.  Your forefathers ate manna in the desert but they still died.
column3: T‑shohshon ash wa koꞌa hegai manna ch wabshaba pi heg hekaj edagi g pi ha huhugedam doakag. Mt wo edagi hegai pi ha huhugedam doakag ab ni‑bek. Id o heg wa wepo mani d haꞌichu hugi em‑wehhejed.

column2: But this is the bread that comes down from heaven, and anyone who eats it won't ever die.
column3: Baꞌich ani d i s‑kehg haꞌichu hugi mo hi hegai manna namt pi g pi ha huhugedam doakag wo edagi ab ni‑bek.

column2: I am the life-giving bread from heaven, and anyone who eats this bread will live forever. The bread is my flesh that I give so that the world may live.”
column3: I atsh gei g manna ab dahm kahchim t amjed k ab ha mahkch g doakag. Ni wabshaba d ahni mant woho ia jiwia ab Jiosh kihdag amjed k ia uꞌapa g pi ha huhugedam doakag. Nt wo dagito g ni‑chuhkug mant wo ni‑muhkid k hab wo ha doꞌibia g hemajkam.”

column2: Then the Jews argued heatedly among themselves. “How can this man give us his flesh to eat?” they asked.
column3: D id kaiok am si s‑babgam e neꞌowi g hahaꞌichu hab kaijch, “Pi at has shaꞌi masma wo t‑mah g e‑chuhkug machs wo huh.”

column2: Jesus told them, “I tell you the truth, unless you eat the flesh of the Son of man and drink his blood, you cannot truly live.
column3: D hab kaij g Jesus, “Pi amt wo edagi g pi ha huhugedam doakag pi ab hu ni‑bek ahni Jiosh si Kehsha.

column2: Those who eat my flesh and drink my blood have eternal life, and I will raise them up at the last day.
column3: Ab amt wo i s‑wohoch mant wo iawua g ni‑ehꞌed k wo muh em‑wehhejed k hab wo edagi g pi ha huhugedam doakag. Id at heg wo wa wepok mamt wo huh g ni‑chuhkug k wo ih g ni‑ehꞌed. Kunt ab wo i em‑wuwhas muhkig t amjed mat hekid wo kuhgit g jewed.

column2: For my flesh is true food, and my blood is true drink.
column3: Ihda ni‑chuhkug ch ni‑ehꞌed o heg wa wepo mo d haꞌichu hugi ch haꞌichu iꞌidag.

column2: Those who eat my flesh and drink my blood remain in me, and I remain in them.
column3: T wo edagi g wechij doakag hegam mat ab wo ni‑bei. Am ant ha eda wo ul g ni‑doakag.

column2: Just as the life-giving Father sent me and I live because of the Father, so anyone who feeds on me will live because of me.
column3: Ni‑ohg at wa am ni‑cheha mant ia wo jiwia jewed dahm. Kuni d pi ha huhugedam doakam no pi g ni‑ohg d pi ha huhugedam doakam. T hab waꞌap d wo pi ha huhugedam doakamk matp hedam ab wo ni‑bei nant pi am ha eda wo ni‑ulinid chum hekid.

column2: Now this is the bread that came down from heaven, not the kind your forefathers ate and still died. Anyone who eats this bread will live forever.”
column3: Heg ani hekaj pi hab masma mo hegai manna. Hegam mash wa koꞌa hegai at pi heg hekaj edagi g pi ha huhugedam doakag. T wabshaba wo edagi matp hedam ab wo ni‑bei.”

column2: Jesus explained this while he was teaching in a synagogue at Capernaum.
column3: Neh, bad kaij g Jesus mad eda am ha mashcham g hemajkam ha‑cheopi ed amai Capernaum t am.

column2: Many of his disciples when they heard it said, “This is hard to accept! Who can follow it?”
column3: D muꞌijj hegam mo am t‑wehm oid g Jesus hab hahawa kaij, “Shoꞌoki waꞌi si s‑hasig ihda mashchamaj ch pi ab hu ta kaihama.”

column2: Jesus saw that his disciples were complaining about this, so he asked them, “Are you offended by this?
column3: D g Jesus wabsh ha amich mo has kaij an s‑juꞌujpij neneokch k hab kaij ab ha wui, “Pi amki hohhoꞌid g ni‑mashchama

column2: Then what if you were to see the Son ascend to where he was before?
column3: ch eda wo nei mant am uhpam ep wo hih dahm kahchim wui ahni Jiosh si kehsha.

column2: The Spirit gives life; the physical body doesn't do anything. The words I've told you are spirit and life!
column3: Pi amt wo bei g pi ha huhugedam doakag ab amjed g haꞌichu hugi k wabshaba ab wo s‑wohoch g haꞌichu ni‑ahga. Kunt ab wo cheha g Hekia S‑apꞌekam Gewkdag mat am em‑eda wo i e ulin k wo em‑mahkad g pi ha huhugedam doakag.

column2: Yet there are some of you who don't trust me.” (Jesus had known from the very beginning who didn't trust him, and who would betray him).
column3: Kum eda haꞌijj pi ab hu ni‑wohochud.” Neh, bo kaij g Jesus no pi s‑mahch mat hedam pi ab hu wo wohoch ch ep s‑mahch mat hedai wo gagda mat wo e muhkid.

column2: Jesus added, “This is why I told you that no one can come to me unless it is made possible by the Father.”
column3: D hab ep kaij, “Pi amt hedai wo e nako mams ab wo s‑ni‑wohochud k wo ni‑bei, heg hi wa mat g ni‑ohg am wo i chikp em‑eda.”

column2: From this time on many of Jesus' disciples gave up and no longer followed him.
column3: D muꞌijj hegam mo am t‑wehm oid g Jesus dagito am i kaiok g s‑hasig haꞌichu ahgaj k pi dahm an hu hahawa ep wehmaj.

column2: Then Jesus asked the twelve disciples, “What about you? Do you want to leave as well?”
column3: D heg hekaj hab kaij g Jesus ab t‑wui ahchim gamai gohk, “Mt ahpim has wo e juh? Namt hab waꞌap wo ni‑dagito?”

column2: Simon Peter answered, “Lord, who would we follow? You're the one who has the words of eternal life.
column3: D g Simon Peter hab kaij ab wui, “T‑kownalig, pi o an hu hedai ehp machs heg wui wo hihi. Ahpi ap waꞌi am ahgachug hegai matt hekaj wo bei g pi ha huhugedam doakag.

column2: We trust in you, and we're convinced that you are God's Holy One.”
column3: Ch hahawa s‑wohochud ch s‑mahch map ahpi d hekia s‑apꞌekam ch ab amjed i hih g Jiosh.”

column2: Jesus replied, “Didn't I choose you, the twelve disciples? Yet one of you is a devil.”
column3: D hab kaij g Jesus, “Heuꞌu, woho o wa. Kunt am i em‑chuhcha ahpim gamai gohk mamt id an wo ahgachugad. M wabshaba hema d wabsh sha jiawul.”

column2: (Jesus was referring to Judas, son of Simon Iscariot. He was the one of the twelve disciples who would betray Jesus).
column3: Pi achd mahch mas hedai hab ahg. Kuki eda heg hab ahg Judas mo d alidaj g Simon Iscariot ch d hema ahchim gamai gohk ch atki wo gagda g Jesus.

column2: After this, Jesus spent his time going from place to place in Galilee. He did not want to do so in Judea because the Jews were out to kill him.
column3: Am amsh chum s‑muꞌamk g Jesus Judea chekshani ch ed. D hekaj pi am hu himimk. Kuchd an oiopo Galilee chekshani ch ed.

column2: But as it was almost time for the Jewish festival of the Tabernacles,
column3: D eda e aihim hegai piast mach ab ihm g Jiosh mo babhaijid g t‑eꞌes.

column2: his brothers told him, “You ought to leave and go to Judea so your followers will be able to see what miracles you can do.
column3: D heg hekaj hab kaij g Jesus wepnag ab wui, “Pt hems gm hu wo hih iꞌajed Judea wui. T wo nei g s‑hasig m‑chikpan hegam mo wa an m‑oidahim Judea ch ed.

column2: No one who wants to be famous keeps what they do hidden. If you can do such miracles, then show yourself to the world!”
column3: Pi apt wo ge ehstod hegai map hab junihim maptp wo tatchuad mat ab wo i m‑mai g hemajkam. Am g ha chehgid g hemajkam map hab wua g s‑hasig haꞌichu.”

column2: For even his own brothers really didn't believe in him.
column3: Neh, bad kaij noki pi koi wohochud mo d Jiosh si Kehsha.

column2: Jesus told them, “This is not my time to go, not yet; but you can go whenever you want, for any time's the right time for you.  The world has no reason to hate you, but it does hate me, because I make it clear that its ways are evil.  You go on to the festival. I'm not going to this festival because this is not the right time for me, not yet.”
column3: D hab kaij g Jesus ab ha wui, “Pi ant am hu wo em‑oi id wui gegosig nat pi koi e ai mant am wo si s‑ap i ni‑maskogi. Mt gamai wo hihi namt pi ahpim hi wa wabsh chum hekid am wo e chehgi. Pi o am hu haꞌichug mas heg hekaj wo s‑em‑kehꞌidad g hemajkam. K wabshaba ahni s‑ni‑kehꞌid nani pi chum hekid ab ha ahgid mo am hab junihim g pi apꞌekam.”

column2: After saying this he stayed behind in Galilee.
column3: Neh, bad kaij ab ha wui ch am wabsh i wih Galilee ch ed.

column2: After his brothers left to go to the festival, Jesus also went, but not openly—he stayed out of sight.
column3: Heg i dahm mad gam hu hihi g Jesus wepnag, d am hahawa epai him k wabshaba wabsh s‑aꞌagi. Kuchd ahchim gam hu i oi.

column2: Now at the festival the Jewish leaders were searching for him and kept on asking, “Where is he?”
column3: Sh hegam mo d hahaꞌichu am Judea ch ed an gahg ch an kaiam mas hebai has chuꞌig.

column2: Many people in the crowds were complaining about him. Some said, “He's a good man,” while others argued, “No! He deceives people.”
column3: D eda an s‑juꞌujpij neneok g hemajkam ch hab kaij, “Do si s‑ap oꞌodham.”

column2: But no one dared to speak openly about him because they were afraid of what the Jewish leaders would do to them.
column3: K wabshaba s‑aꞌagi an aꞌaga no pi s‑ha ehbid g hahaꞌichu.

column2: When the festival was halfway through Jesus went to the Temple and began to teach.
column3: Kud eda hugkam waꞌi hih g piast. D am hih g Jesus geꞌe cheopi wui k am i ha mashcha.

column2: The Jewish leaders were very surprised, and asked, “How does this man have so much learning when he hasn't been educated?”
column3: D hegam hahaꞌichu si has i elid k hab kaij, “S has hig masma geꞌe haꞌichu s‑mahch ihda oꞌodham mat eda pi shaꞌi e mashcha g papal ha‑mashchama?”

column2: Jesus answered, “My teaching is not from me but from the One who sent me.
column3: D hab kaij g Jesus ab ha wui, “Jiosh at ab ni‑cheha mant ia wo jiwia jewed dahm. K d Jiosh mashchamadag ihda mani i ha mashcham.

column2: Anyone who chooses to follow what God wants will know if my teaching comes from God or if I'm only speaking for myself.
column3: Tp hedai wo i tatchuad mat am hab wo juh g Jiosh tatchui wo chum s‑mahchk mas wa woho d Jiosh amjedkam ihda mani i ha mashcham.

column2: Those who speak for themselves want to glorify themselves, but someone who glorifies the one who sent him is truthful and not deceitful.
column3: Hegai mat wo ah g hejel e‑mahchig at wabsh wo chum si e haschud k atp hems d s‑chu iattomkam. Nt wabshaba ahni ab haꞌichuchud g Jiosh ch am ahg g wohokam.

column2: Moses gave you the law, didn't he? Yet none of you keeps the law! Why are you trying to kill me?”
column3: Bam chum e wua mam am hab si junihim hegai chehanig mat wa g Jiosh ab mah g Moses am em‑wehhejed. M wabshaba pi woho hab junihim nam pi s‑ni‑muꞌamk.”

column2: “You're demon-possessed!” the crowd replied. “No one's trying to kill you!”
column3: D ab si neneok g hemajkam ch hab kaij, “P haschu ahgch hab kaij mam s‑m‑muꞌamk? Jiawul o an uꞌukch g m‑chegitoidag.”

column2: “I did one miracle and you're all shocked by it,” Jesus replied.
column3: D hab kaij g Jesus ab ha wui, “Woho am s‑ni‑muꞌamk. Ha ant dodaj mihshmda tash ed. Kum heg hekaj s‑ni‑muꞌamk.

column2: “However because Moses told you to circumcise—not that it really came from Moses, but from your forefathers before him—you perform circumcision on the Sabbath.
column3: Neh, nt am wo em‑chehgi mam ahpim hab waꞌap wua g chikpan mihshmda tash ed. Mosesbad atki wa an oꞌoha mat haschu g Jiosh heki hu ab ha cheha g t‑shohshon mamt wo ha pahl hikuch g e‑chechoj aꞌaliga mat d wo i gigiꞌik tashk ab ha‑mahsidag amjed. Kum heg hab wua chum as hems d wo mihshmda tashk

column2: If you circumcise on the Sabbath to make sure that the law of Moses isn't broken, why are you angry with me for healing someone on the Sabbath?
column3: mamt pi wo mul hegai chehanig matki g Mosesbad an oꞌoha. Pegih, mt haschu ahgk babgat mant hema s‑ap doaj am mihshmda tash ed?

column2: Don't judge by appearances; decide what's right!”
column3: Am g wo si i aꞌamichud mamt s‑ap wo s‑mahchk haꞌichu.”

column2: Then some of those from Jerusalem began wondering, “Isn't this the one they're trying to kill?
column3: D haꞌijj hab kaij g Jerusalem t am kihkam, “Aha no hig pi woho d ihda mam chum s‑muꞌamk.

column2: But see how openly he's speaking, and they're saying nothing to him. Do you think the authorities believe he's the Messiah?
column3: K eda haschu ahgch pi hedai has ahg? K ia t‑jehnigid. Aha no hab elid g hahaꞌichu mo wa woho d Jiosh si Kehsha?

column2: But that's not possible because we know where he comes from. When the Messiah comes, nobody will know where he's from.”
column3: S has hig masma d wo hegaik mach eda s‑mahch mo hedai d amjedkam ch hebai d kihkam. Kutsh wa eda g Jiosh si Kehsha pi hedai wo mahchk mat hebaijed ia wo jiwia.”

column2: While he was teaching in the Temple, Jesus called out in a loud voice, “So you think you know me and where I'm from? However I did not come for my own sake. The One who sent me is true. You don't know him,  but I know him, for I come from him, and he sent me.”
column3: D si s‑kaidam hab kaij g Jesus, “Pegih, s‑mahch am mani hedai wud ch hebaijed him. Nt wabshaba pi wabsh hejel ni‑wehhejed i hih. Jiosh o ab ni‑chehani mant ia wo i wuhsh jewed dahm. Kum pi mahch g Jiosh ch hekaj pi woho ni‑mahch. Ahni ani hi s‑mahch ch ep s‑mahch mo d wohokam nant pi ab amjed i hih.” Neh, bad kaij g Jesus am ha mashchamch geꞌe cheopi ch ed.

column2: So they tried to arrest him, but no one laid a hand on him because his time had not yet come.
column3: Kumd am hahawa chum bei. T wabshaba pi koi e ai g tashgaj. D pi e nako idam.

column2: However many of the crowd did put their trust in him. “When the Messiah appears, will he do more miraculous signs than this man has done?” they said.
column3: Kud muꞌi ab i s‑wohochud k wabsh s‑juꞌujpij hab kaij ab aꞌai e wui, “Naꞌas woho d Jiosh si Kehsha nat pi pi hedai wo shaꞌi e nako mas hab wo juh hegai hab mahs s‑hasig haꞌichu mo ihda hab wua.”

column2: When the Pharisees heard the crowd whispering this about him, they and the chief priests sent guards to arrest Jesus.
column3: D am haꞌi oiopo g Palasi ch am i kah hegai mo hab e kaij k am hihim k atsh am ha ahgi g uꞌugchu papal. Tsh hegam am ha cheha g geꞌe cheopi nuhkuddam mat an wo bei g Jesus.

column2: Then Jesus told the people, “I'll be with you just a little longer, but then I'll return to the One who sent me.
column3: D hab kaij g Jesus, “Pi ant shaꞌi tash ia hu wo em‑wehmajkahim ch gam hu hahawa uhpam wo hih heg wui mat ia i ni‑ahꞌad.

column2: You'll search for me but you won't find me; and you can't come where I'm going.”
column3: Kumt wo chum ni‑gahgad ch wabshaba pi wo ni‑edgid k pi wo e nako mams am wo hihi mant hebai wo haꞌichugk.”

column2: The Jews said to each other, “Where could he be going that we couldn't find him? Is he planning to go to those scattered among the foreigners, and teach the foreigners?
column3: D am wabsh i pi amich g hemajkam k hab kaij ab aꞌai e wui, “A t hebai wo hih, chs hab pi wo edagi?”

column2: What does he mean by saying, ‘You'll search for me but you won't find me; and you can't come where I'm going’?”
column3: A shahꞌo d ahga mo hab kaij matt wo chum gahgad ch wabshaba pi wo edgid k pi wo t‑nako machs am wo hihi mat hebai wo haꞌichugk.”

column2: On the last and most important day of the festival, Jesus stood up and shouted out in a loud voice, “If you're thirsty, come to me and drink.
column3: D am i e ai g si oidchkam tash mo baꞌiwechkim d si geꞌe tash heg eda piast. D am e hemapadch g hemajkam. Kud g Jesus am si amog ch hab kaij, “Ab g wo i e dagito ni‑wui k ab wo bei g wechij doakag hab masma mamt hemho wa wo ih am i tonomk.

column2: If you trust in me, you will have streams of life-giving water flowing out from within you, as Scripture says.”
column3: Bo chuꞌig g Jiosh oꞌohana mamtp hedai ab ni‑wui wo i e dagito k heg wa wepo mamt wo edgidad g shonkam shuhdagi am e‑ihbdag ed. T heg chum hekid ab wo daꞌiwunid.”

column2: He was referring to the Spirit that those who trusted in him would later receive. The Spirit hadn't been given yet because Jesus hadn't yet been glorified.
column3: Bo kaij g Jesus ch hab ahg matt ab wui wo i t‑dagito k hekaj wo bei g Hekia S‑apꞌekam Gewkdag. K eda wenog koi ab hu t‑mahks g Hekia S‑apꞌekam Gewkdag nat pi koi gahi wuhsh g muhkig g Jesus k koi bei g e‑kownaltalig.

column2: When they heard these words, some of the people said, “This man is definitely the Prophet!”
column3: D muꞌi hab kaij am i kaiok, “Ihda oꞌodham oki d wa woho hegai Jiosh haꞌichu i tashogiddam mach nenida.”

column2: Others said, “He is the Messiah!” Still others said, “How can the Messiah come from Galilee?
column3: D hai hab ep kaij, “Doki Jiosh si Kehsha.”

column2: Doesn't Scripture say that the Messiah comes from David's lineage, and from David's home town of Bethlehem?”
column3: K eda an hab chuꞌig Jiosh oꞌohana ed matsh g Jiosh si Kehsha ab d wo t‑kownaligbad David amjedkamk ch ab wo amjedk g Bethlehem kihhim. Am ash d kihkam g Davidbad Bethlehem t am.”

column2: So the crowd had a strong difference of opinion about him.
column3: D heg hekaj ab aꞌai e wui gegokiwua g hemajkam.

column2: Some wanted to arrest him, but nobody laid a hand on him.
column3: Haꞌijj o chum s‑kuhpamk. D wabshaba pi hedai shaꞌi e nako mas hab juh.

column2: Then the guards returned to the chief priests and the Pharisees who asked them, “Why didn't you bring him in?”
column3: D am uhpam hihi g geꞌe cheopi nuhkuddam am ha wui g uꞌugchu papal ch Palasi. D idam ab ha kakke ch hab kaij, “Shahchu amt ahgk pi an hu bei?”

column2: “Nobody ever spoke like this man does,” the guards replied.
column3: D hab kaij g geꞌe cheopi nuhkuddam, “Pi o hekid hedai hab shaꞌi kaidam neok mo ihda.”

column2: “Have you been fooled too?” the Pharisees asked them.
column3: D hab kaij hegam Palasi ab ha wui, “Aha nat hab waꞌap em‑iattogi?

column2: “Has a single one of the rulers or Pharisees believed in him? No!
column3: Pi ach hedai ab hu s‑wohochud ahchim Palasi o hegam mo d t‑wanimeddam mas d Jiosh si Kehsha ihda.

column2: But this crowd that knows nothing about teachings of the law—they're damned anyway!”
column3: Idam pi haꞌichu aꞌamichuddam hemajkam o ab s‑wohochud no pi pi mahch g Mosesbad chehanig. T g Jiosh s‑koꞌokam wo ha namkid.”

column2: Nicodemus, who had previously gone to meet Jesus, was one of them and asked them,
column3: D am ha wehmaj hegai mat wa am hu hebai chuhug ch ed am i chehgim g Jesus k hab chehgig Nicodemas. Id o hab waꞌap d Palasi ch hab kaij ab ha wui,

column2: “Does our law condemn a man without a hearing and without finding out what he actually did?”
column3: “Bo chuꞌig g t‑chehanig matt pi hedai ab hu wo shaꞌi haꞌichu ha abch k hoꞌipki am i mamche am lodaitk mas wa woho pi ap haꞌichu hab juh.”

column2: “So you're a Galilean as well, are you?” they replied. “Check the Scriptures and you'll discover that no prophet comes from Galilee!”
column3: D hab kaij idam, “Pegih, pki ahpi ab ep si ha wehmaj idam mo ab wabsh al Galilee t amjed. Am g i hoan g Jiosh haꞌichu ahga k wo s‑mai mo pi hema g Jiosh haꞌichu i tashogiddam ab hu shaꞌi Galilee t amjed.”

column2: Then they all went home,
column3: D amjed gam hu aꞌai himto g hemajkam.

column2: but Jesus went to the Mount of Olives.
column3: Kuchd ahchim gam hu hihim k an kohksh Olive Uꞌus Kawulk t an.

column2: Early in the morning he returned to the Temple where many people gathered around him and he sat down and taught them.
column3: D ab i chesh g tash. Kuchd ged hu uhpam dada geꞌe cheopi wui. D muꞌi am e chehm g hemajkam Jesus wui k gan hu biha. D am dahiwua k ha mashcha.

column2: The religious teachers and the Pharisees brought in a woman caught committing adultery and made her stand before everyone.
column3: D ab wui haꞌi dada g chehanig ha mashchamdam ch Palasi am hema uꞌapadch g uwi. Id atsh ha ehs g ha‑kun. Kud am t‑shahgid i kehsh

column2: They said to Jesus, “Teacher, this woman was caught in the act of adultery.
column3: K hab kaij ab wui g Jesus, “Neh, ahpi map ia ha mashcham, ihda uwi att s‑ap cheh mat ha ehs g ha‑kun.

column2: Now in the Law Moses commanded us to stone such women. What do you say?”
column3: K eda hab chuꞌig g t‑chehanig matt hemho wo wa maꞌichkwua k wo mua g uwi mat hab wo sha e juh. Pt ahpi has wo chei?”

column2: They said this to try and trap Jesus so they could condemn him. But Jesus bent down and wrote on the ground with his finger.
column3: Neh, bo kaij no pi wabsh haꞌichu s‑kaimk ch s‑abchudamk g Jesus.

column2: They kept on demanding an answer, so he stood up and told them, “Whichever one of you has never sinned may throw the first stone at her.”
column3: D oi wa idam pi dagito k ab ep kakke.

column2: Then he bent down again and went on writing on the ground.
column3: Bo kaij ch am hahawa i e jumalkad k am ep oꞌoha jewedo.

column2: When they heard this they began to leave, one by one, starting with the oldest until Jesus was left in the middle of the crowd with the woman still standing there.
column3: D am i kah ihda g chehanig ha mashchamdam ch Palasi k wabsh sha hehemako gam hu aꞌai hihi si e elidch. D hegam mo d geꞌeged wehpegat k wehsijj himto. K heg am waꞌi wih uwi Jesus wehm.

column2: Jesus straightened up and asked her, “Where are they? Didn't anybody stay to condemn you?”
column3: D ab i e shel g Jesus k ab wui hab kaij, “Baht hihi hegam mo ab haꞌichu m‑abchud? Nat pi ia hu hema wih mat ab wo m‑maꞌihi?”

column2: “No one did, sir,” she replied.
column3: D hab kaij g uwi, “Pi at ia hu hema wih, ni‑kownalig.”

column2: Jesus spoke again to the people, telling them, “I am the light of the world. If you follow me you won't walk in darkness for you will have the life-giving light.”
column3: D hab ep kaij g Jesus ab ha wui g hemajkam, “Dani geꞌe tonlig am wehs ha wehhejed g hemajkam. Kut s‑ap am wo himad Jiosh apꞌedag ed ch pi hekid haꞌichukaj wo pi e amich hegam mat hedai ab ni‑wui wo e dagitokchid.”

column2: The Pharisees replied, “You can't be your own witness! What you say doesn't prove anything!”
column3: D eda am haꞌi gegok g Palasi ch ab wui hab si kaij, “Ih, p wabsh chum hejel e wohokamchud ch aptp hems wabsh t‑iattogid.”

column2: “Even if I am my own witness, my testimony is true,” Jesus told them, “for I know where I came from and where I'm going. But you don't know where I came from or where I'm going.
column3: D hab kaij g Jesus, “Pi ani em‑iattogid chum anis am hi wa hejel ni‑wohokamchud. Do wohokam mani has i kaij. S‑mahch ani mant hebaijed ia jiwia k hebai wo hih. Ahpim am hi pi mahch ihda.

column2: You judge in a typically human way, but I don't judge anyone.
column3: Am am chum ahg mani has chuꞌig ab wabsh ni‑neidch ch eda pi woho ni‑mahch. Ni ahni hemu pi hedai em‑lodait.

column2: Even if I did judge, my judgment would be right because I am not doing this alone. The Father who sent me is with me.
column3: Kut wabshaba d wo wohokamk g ni‑ahga mant hekid wo ah mam has chuꞌig nat pi g Jiosh am ni‑wehm wo em‑aꞌappe.

column2: Your own law states that the testimony of two witnesses is valid.
column3: Neh, an o oꞌohanas em‑chehanig ed mamt wo s‑ha wohoch matp gohkajj am haꞌichu wo wohokamch.

column2: I am my own witness, and my other witness is my Father who sent me.”
column3: Pegih, ni ahni hejel ni‑wohokamchud. K g ni‑ohg am hab waꞌap ni‑wohokamchud.” Neh, bo kaij g Jesus.

column2: “Where is your father?” they asked him.
column3: D ab kakke idam, “A k hebai has chuꞌig g m‑ohg?”

column2: Jesus explained this while he was teaching near the Temple treasury. Yet no one arrested him because his time had not yet come.
column3: Neh, id ad wehs hab kaij g Jesus am geꞌe cheopi t am heg eda kih mo g hemajkam am shulig g e‑mahkigdag g geꞌe cheopi wehhejed. T pi hedai e nako mas an wo bei nat ge koi e ai g tashgaj.

column2: Jesus told them again, “I'm leaving, and you'll search for me, but you'll die in your sin. You can't come where I'm going.”
column3: D hab ep kaij g Jesus ab ha wui, “Am ant hu wo hih. Kumt an haha wo i chum ni‑gahghim k wabshaba wo koi pi e doꞌibiak. Pi amt wo e nako mamt am wo hihi mant hebai wo i hih.”

column2: The Jews wondered out loud, “Is he going to kill himself? Is that what he means when he says ‘You can't come where I'm going’?”
column3: D heg hekaj hab kaij hegam hahaꞌichu, “Shahꞌo ahgch hab kaij matt pi wo t‑nako matt am wo hihi mat hebai wo i hih. Aha nat wabsh hejel wo e mua.”

column2: Jesus told them, “You are from below; I am from above. You are of this world; I am not of this world.
column3: D hab kaij g Jesus ab ha wui, “Ia am waꞌi amjed id dahm jewed. Ni ahni hi ab dahm kahchim amjed.

column2: That is why I told you that you'll die in your sins. For if you don't trust in me, the ‘I am,’ you'll die in your sins.”
column3: Kum eda pi ni‑wohochud mani d ge ahni. Ni heg hekaj am em‑ahgid mamt wo koi pi e doꞌibiak.”

column2: Then they asked him, “Who are you?”
column3: D ab kakke, “Kup hedai wud higi?”

column2: “There's much I could say about you, and much I could condemn. But the One who sent me tells the truth, and what I'm saying to you here in this world is what I heard from him.”
column3: Muꞌijj o g em‑chuꞌijig. Kunt heg wo ah. K g ni‑ahga d wohokam nani pi heg waꞌi ahg mo haschu ni‑ahgid hegai mat am i ni‑kei. K heg chum hekid ahg g wohokam.”

column2: They didn't understand that he was talking to them about the Father. So Jesus explained to them:
column3: D idam pi amichud mo g Jiosh hab ahg.

column2: “When you have lifted up the Son of man then you'll know that I am the ‘I am,’ and that I do nothing of myself, but only say what the Father taught me.
column3: D heg hekaj hab ep kaij g Jesus, “Mt wo mai mani d ge ahni mamt hekid ab uhgk wo ni‑ul mamt wo ni‑mua ahni Jiosh si Kehsha. Am amt haha wo mai mani pi hab wua g hejel ni‑tatchui ch wabshaba hegai waꞌi ni‑ohg tatchui hab wua ch g mashchamaj ahgachug.

column2: The One who sent me is with me; he has not abandoned me, for I always do what pleases him.”
column3: Chum ani hekid ab s‑wohog elid. K heg hekaj ni‑wehmaj.” Neh, bo kaij g Jesus.

column2: Many who heard Jesus say these things put their trust in him.
column3: T muijj hegam mat ab kah ihda ab i s‑wohoch.

column2: Then Jesus said to those Jews who trusted in him, “If you follow my teaching then you really are my disciples.
column3: D heg hekaj hab kaij g Jesus ab ha wui hegam mat ab i chum s‑wohoch, “Mtki woho ab i e dagito ni‑wui mamtp am hab wo i junihi g ni‑mashchama.

column2: You will know the truth, and the truth will set you free.”
column3: Mt haha wo mai g wohokam. T heg hab wo em‑juh mamt hahawa pi d wo neneholk.”

column2: “We're descendants of Abraham! We've never been slaves to anyone,” they answered. “How can you say that we'll be set free?”
column3: D haꞌi hab kaij, “Pi ach hekid hedai d shaꞌi neneholiga nach pi d Abrahambad amjedkam. P haschu hab ahg ch hab kaij matt hahawa pi d wo neneholk?”

column2: Jesus replied, “I tell you the truth, everyone who sins is a slave of sin.
column3: D g Jesus hab kaij, “Wehs am d nenehol mamtp hedai hab i junihim g pi apꞌekam nam pi heg hekaj e wulshch.

column2: A slave doesn't have a permanent place in the family, but the son is part of the family forever.
column3: Pi o am hu ha wehm d si kihkam g nehol mo hig g ha‑aliga.

column2: If the Son sets you free, then you're truly free.
column3: Nt ahni woho wo i em‑wulꞌo mamtp ab wo i e dagito ni‑wui. Kumt hahawa pi d wo neneholk namt pi d wo aꞌaligajk g ni‑ohg Jiosh.

column2: I know you're Abraham's descendants, yet you're trying to kill me because you refuse to accept my words.
column3: S‑mahch ani mam d Abrahambad amjedkam. M eda s‑ni‑muꞌamk nam pi pi ab hu ap wohochud g ni‑mashchama.
