column2: I'm telling you what the Father has revealed to me, while you do what your father told you.”
column3: Heg ani am ahgahim mo haschu g ni‑ohg ab ni‑chehgid. M ahpim hi heg wa wepo mam d ge Jiawul amjedkam nam pi hab wua g tatchuij.”

column2: “Abraham is our father,” they answered.
column3: D hab kaij ab wui, “Pi ach d ge Jiawul amjedkam. Abrahambad o d t‑shohshon.”

column2: “But you are trying to kill me now, because I told you the truth that I heard from God. Abraham would never have done that.
column3: M eda am e nakog mamt wo ni‑mua ahni mani heg waꞌi em‑ahgid wohokam mo g Jiosh ab ni‑ahgid.

column2: You're doing what your father does.”
column3: Heg am d wabsh amjedkam mam am oidch hab e junihim.”

column2: Jesus replied, “If God really was your father, you would love me. I came from God and now I am here. The decision to come wasn't mine, but the One who sent me.
column3: D hab kaij g Jesus, “Ia ant jiwia ab amjed g Jiosh. Kumt heg hekaj ab wo si ni‑tatchuad mamtp woho d wo aꞌaligajk. Pi ant wabsh hejel hab i ni‑ah mant ab wo i hih. Jiosh at ab ni‑chea.

column2: Why can't you understand what I'm saying? It's because you refuse to hear my message!
column3: Pi am amichud mani has i kaij nam pi s‑koꞌokod g haꞌichu ni‑ahga.

column2: Your father is the Devil, and you love to follow your father's evil desires. He was a murderer from the beginning. He never stood for the truth, because there is no truth in him. When he lies he reveals his true character, for he's a liar and the father of lies.
column3: Dam wabsh ge jiawul amjedkam ch s‑hohhoꞌid mamt am hab wo wuad g tatchuij. Heg o d ha muꞌakam ged hu i si wehpeg amjed ch d ep s‑chu iattomkam ch pi has shaꞌi elid haꞌichu ha iattogidch no pi wehs g iattogig ab d amjedkamaj.

column2: So because I tell you the truth, you don't believe me!
column3: Kuni ahni g wohokam ahg. Kum heg hekaj pi ni‑wohochud.

column2: Can any one of you prove that I'm guilty of sin? If I'm telling you the truth, why don't you believe me?
column3: Neh, namt hig wo e nako mamt am wo wohokamch mas haschu d i pi ap ni‑chuꞌijig? Pegih, ab o em‑ab mamt ab wo s‑ni‑wohoch nani pi em‑ahgid g wohokam.

column2: Anyone who belongs to God listens to what God says. The reason you don't listen is because you don't belong to God.”
column3: Hegai mo ab d amjedkamaj g Jiosh o ab kaiham g Jiosh neꞌoki. Kum pi ab hu kaiham nam pi pi ab hu d amjedkamaj.”

column2: “Aren't we right to call you a Samaritan who is demon-possessed?” said the Jews.
column3: D g hahaꞌichu ab hahawa si chehmo g Jesus ch hab kaij, “Dapki wabsh t‑obga ch d wabsh sha jiawul.”

column2: “No, I don't have a demon,” Jesus replied. “I honor my Father, but you dishonor me.
column3: D hab kaij g Jesus, “Pi o woho mam has i kaij. Pi ani d shaꞌi jiawul. Ab ani si haꞌichuchud g ni‑ohg. M wabshaba ahpim wabsh pi ni‑haꞌichuchud.

column2: I'm not here looking to glorify myself. But there is One who does this for me and who judges in my favor.
column3: Pi ani heg am hu neidahim mas hedai ab wo si has ni‑elidad. K wabshaba am hema d hegai mo am ni‑gahgid g ab has elidadag ch wo ha lodai hegam mo pi ab hu has ni‑elid.

column2: I tell you the truth, anyone who follows my teaching will never die.”
column3: Nt wo si shel em‑ahgi mat pi hekid wo huhug hegai mat hedai ab wo si i bei g haꞌichu ni‑ahga.”

column2: “Now we know you're demon-possessed,” said the Jews. “Abraham died, and the prophets did too, and you're telling us ‘anyone who follows my teaching will never die’!
column3: D hab kaij ab wui, “Si att hahawa s‑ap s‑mai mapki d wabsh sha jiawul. Neh, muh at g Abrahambad. T g kekelibad Jiosh haꞌichu i tashogiddam hab waꞌap koꞌok k huhug. P eda hab kaij mat pi hekid wo huhug hegai mat hedai ab wo si i bei g haꞌichu m‑ahga.

column2: Are you greater than our father Abraham? He died, and the prophets died. Who do you think you are?”
column3: Chum apki si e haꞌichuchud ch hab kaij ihda. Abrahambad atki muh. Nap hab e elid map gam hu baꞌich d i si haꞌichu mo hegai? T g Jiosh haꞌichu i tashogiddambad hab waꞌap koꞌok k huhug. Dohp hab chum e elid?”

column2: Jesus answered, “If I glorify myself, my glory means nothing. But it is God himself who glorifies me, the one you claim, ‘He is our God.’
column3: D hab kaij g Jesus, “Nt wabsh wo pehegi neokad mantp ab hejel wo chum si ni‑haschudad. Heg o ab si has ni‑elid ni‑ohg mam e‑Jioshga ahg.

column2: You don't know him, but I know him. If I were to say, ‘I don't know him,’ I'd be a liar, just like you. But I do know him, and I do what he says.
column3: Pi am hekid shaꞌi woho mahch hegai. Ni wabshaba ahni s‑mahch. Kuntp hab wo chei mani pi mahch k d wabsh wo s‑chu iattomkamk mam hab chuꞌig ahpim. S‑mahch ani ch ab si uꞌukch g haꞌichu ahgaj.

column2: Your father Abraham was delighted as he looked forward to see my coming, and was so happy when he saw it.”
column3: Em‑shohshon Abrahambad o si s‑ap e tahtk mat wo nei mant an wo i wuhsh. T hekid i neidok si s‑hehgig.”

column2: The Jews replied, “You're not even fifty years old, and you've seen Abraham?”
column3: D si has i el idam k hab kaij, “Ih, heki at hu waꞌi muh. Aha nap neid ch eda pi koi ai g hetaspo wehst‑mahm ahidag?”

column2: “I tell you the truth, before Abraham was born, I am,” said Jesus.
column3: D hab kaij g Jesus, “Nt wo si shel em‑ahgi mani an haꞌichug ni‑ohg kih ed mat eda koi mahsi g Abrahambad.”

column2: At this they picked up stones to stone him, but Jesus was hidden from them and he left the Temple.
column3: Neh, d gan hu i uꞌihi g hohodai mat hekaj wo maꞌichkwua g Jesus. D wabshaba wabsh s‑aꞌagi am ha shahgid him k gam hu i wuhsh geꞌe cheopi amjed.

column2: As Jesus was passing by, he saw a man born blind.
column3: Kuchd am hihim. D ab haha wabsh hema daha g oꞌodham ch e‑mahsidag amjed pi nea.

column2: His disciples asked him, “Rabbi, why was this man born blind? Was it him who sinned, or was it his parents?”
column3: Kuchd ab kakke g Jesus, “Neh, t‑mashchamdam, dohꞌo d chuꞌijig mo d pi neadam ihda oꞌodham? No d hejel chuꞌijigaj aha no d geꞌegedgaj ha‑chuꞌijig?”

column2: Jesus replied, “It wasn't because the man or his parents sinned. But so that what God can do may be shown in his life,
column3: D hab kaij g Jesus, “Id o pi hab d shaꞌi ahga mas d ha‑chuꞌijig. Heg o hekaj pi nea mat g Jiosh am wo chehgi g e‑gewkdag ab amjed.

column2: we have to keep on doing the work of the One who sent me as long as it is still daytime. The night is coming when no one can work.
column3: Am att hab wo junihid g chikpanaj hegai mat ia i ni‑ahꞌad mo idani am kia wiꞌis g tash no pi ab him mamt hahawa pi wo e nako.

column2: While I'm here in the world I am the light of the world.”
column3: Dani tonlig am em‑wehhejed mani ia em‑wehmaj.”

column2: After he'd said this, Jesus spat on the ground and made some mud with the saliva which he put on the man's eyes.
column3: D hab cheꞌiok g Jesus k am siswua jewed dahm k am hab juh g bid k hekaj ab bidsh g wuhpuij hegai pi neadam

column2: Then Jesus told him, “Go and wash in the Pool of Siloam” (which means “sent”). So the man went and washed, and when he went home he could see.
column3: k hab ahg, “Am g him k ab i wakon g e‑wuhiosha heg eda woꞌo mo hab e aꞌaga Siloam.” (K hab d ahga ihda “I Ahꞌad.”) T wa woho am hih ihda pi neadam k am wako g e‑wuhiosha k am i uhpam jiwia s‑ap haꞌichu neidch.

column2: His neighbors and those who had known him as a beggar, asked, “Isn't this the man who used to sit and beg?”
column3: Hegam mo s‑mahch ch hegam mo si neid mo wabsh haꞌichu ha tahni ad am i neidok hab kaij, “Aha no pi woho d hegai mo am dahiwup ch haꞌichu ha tahni?”

column2: Some said he was, while others said “no, it's just someone who looks like him.” But the man kept saying, “It is me!”
column3: D haꞌi hab kaij mo d hegai. D haꞌi hab ep kaij, “Pi o d hegai. Ho o wabsh si wepo mahs.”

column2: “So how is it you can see?” they asked him.
column3: Kumd ab ep kakke, “Shahpt masma nent?”

column2: He replied, “A man called Jesus made some mud and put it on my eyes and told me, ‘Go and wash yourself in the Pool of Siloam.’ So I went and washed, and now I can see.”
column3: D hab kaij, “Hegai mash d Jesus at ab bidsh g ni‑wuhpui am jewedo siswuak k hab ni‑ahg mant wo him k wo wako g ni‑wuhiosha am Siloam woꞌo ch ed. Kunt am him k hab wabsh chum ni‑wakon k ha hekaj s‑ap haꞌichu neid.”

column2: “Where is he?” they asked.
column3: D hab kaij idam, “T hebai hih?”

column2: They took the man who had been blind to the Pharisees.
column3: D am wa haꞌi bei ihda oꞌodham mo wa pi nea am Palasi ha wui.

column2: Now it was the Sabbath when Jesus had made the mud and opened the blind man's eyes.
column3: K d t‑mihshmda tash mad eda g Jesus hab juh ihda.

column2: So the Pharisees also asked him how he could see. He told them, “He put mud on my eyes, and I washed, and now I can see.”
column3: D g Palasi ab hahawa kakke mas has masma nent.

column2: Some of the Pharisees said, “The man who did this can't be from God because he doesn't keep the Sabbath.” But others wondered, “How could a sinner do such miracles?” So they were divided in their opinion.
column3: D haꞌi hab kaij hegam Palasi, “Neh, pi o ab hu shaꞌi Jiosh amjed nat pi melchkwua g t‑chehanig hab juhk ihda t‑mihshmda tash ed.”

column2: So they went on questioning the man. “What's your opinion about him, then, since it's your eyes he opened,” they asked.
column3: D heg hekaj ab ep si kakke hegam Palasi, “Shahp i elid hegai oꞌodham map hab kaij mat m‑nench.”

column2: The Jewish leaders still refused to believe that the man who had been blind could now see until they had called in the man's parents.
column3: D wabshaba pi wohochud idam hahaꞌichu mas wa woho d pi neadam ch am ha waid g geꞌegedgaj

column2: They asked them, “Is this your son whom you say was born blind? So how is it that now he can see?”
column3: ch muꞌi haꞌichu ha kakke mas d ha‑aliga ihda ch ga hu i e‑mahsidag amjed pi nea, kch ehp mas has masma hahawa haꞌichu neid.

column2: His parents answered, “We know this is our son who was born blind.
column3: D hab hahawa kaij g geꞌegedgaj mo d ha‑aliga ch ga hu e‑mahsidag amjed pi nea

column2: But we've no idea how he can see now, or who healed him. Why don't you ask him, he's old enough. He can speak for himself.”
column3: ch wabshaba pi mahch mas has masma s‑ap haꞌichu neid ch ep pi mahch mas hedai doaj ch ab ha ahgid mat wo kakke no pi d geꞌe k ch hejel am wo e ah.

column2: The reason his parents said this was because they were afraid of what the Jewish leaders would do. The Jewish leaders had already announced that anyone who declared that Jesus was the Messiah would be thrown out of the synagogue.  That was why his parents said, “Ask him, he's old enough.”
column3: Hegam hahaꞌichu ad wa am heki hu apꞌech mat pi wo ha hiwigi mat am hu ep wo i wahp cheopi ch ed hegam mat hedam hab wo chei mo g Jesus d Jiosh si Kehsha. D heg hekaj s‑ha ehbid g geꞌegedgaj ch hab kaij mat ab wo kakke, t hejel am wo e ah.

column2: Once more they called in the man who had been blind, and told him, “Give God the glory! We know this man is a sinner.”
column3: D ab ep i wai g Palasi ihda mat bei g e‑nendag k hab ahg, “Am g t‑ahgid g wohokam mapt ab wo hehgchul g Jiosh. S‑mahch ach mo ihda has chehgi d pi ap chuꞌijkam.”

column2: The man replied, “Whether he's a sinner or not, I don't know. All I know is that I was blind and now I can see.”
column3: D hab kaij ihda mat bei g e‑nendag: “Pi ani shaꞌi mahch mas d pi ap chuꞌijkam ch wabshaba id s‑ap s‑mahch mani pi neakahim ch hemuch haha wabsh si s‑nea.”

column2: Then they asked him, “What did he do to you? How did he open your eyes?”
column3: D idam ab hahawa ep kakke, “T has m‑juh k m‑nench?”

column2: The man replied, “I already told you. Weren't you listening? Why do you want to hear it again? You don't want to become his disciples too, do you?”
column3: D hab kaij, “M ani wa heki hu em‑ahgid. Mt pi ab hu ni‑kaiha. A m haschu ahgch ab ep ni‑kakke? Aha namt ahpim hab waꞌap ab wo i s‑wohoch mo d Jiosh si Kehsha?”

column2: They shouted abuse at him, and said, “You're that man's disciple.
column3: D idam ab si s‑kehꞌid ch hab kaij, “Ahpi apt ab i s‑wohoch hegai hemajkam. Ahchim ach hi g Mosesbad ab s‑wohochud.

column2: We're disciples of Moses. We know that God spoke to Moses, but as for this person, we don't even know where he comes from.”
column3: S‑mahch ach mo g Jiosh g Mosesbad ab haꞌichu ahgid. Kuch pi shaꞌi mahch mas hebai amjed him hegai.”

column2: The man answered, “That's incredible! You don't know where he comes from but he opened my eyes.
column3: D hab kaij ihda, “M haschu ahgch pi mahch mas hebai amjed him. T eda ab i ni‑nench.

column2: We know that God doesn't listen to sinners, but he does listen to anyone who worships him and does what he wants.
column3: S‑mahch ach mo g Jiosh pi ab hu kaiham g pi ap chuꞌijkam ch wabshaba ab ha kaiham hegam mo ab si has elid ch am hab junihim g tatchuij.

column2: Never before in the whole of history has anyone heard of a man born blind being healed.
column3: Pi ach hekid shaꞌi kah mas hedai i nench hegai mo e‑mahsidag amjed pi nea.

column2: If this man weren't from God, he could do nothing.”
column3: T hi wo wa e nako hema mat hab wo juh ihda hab mahs haꞌichu matp ab Jiosh amjed wo himad.”

column2: “You were born totally sinful, and yet you're trying to lecture us,” they replied. And they threw him out of the synagogue.
column3: D ab si s‑koꞌokam has ahg ch hab kaij, “Dap wabsh si hekia pi apꞌekam ga huꞌi e‑mahsidag amjed ch eda chum haꞌichu t‑mashcham.” D amjed gam hu si i wuhshad cheopi t amjed k pi hiwigi mas am ep wo i wah.

column2: When Jesus heard that they had thrown him out, he went and found the man, and asked him, “Do you trust in the Son of man?”
column3: D kah g Jesus mamt i wuhshad k am i gahghim k hab kaij am i chehgiok, “Nap ab si hiwig g Jiosh si Kehsha?”

column2: The man replied, “Tell me who he is, sir, so I can put my trust in him.”
column3: D hab kaij ihda oꞌodham, “A k hedai wud. Am g ni‑ahgid. Nt ab wo si i hiw.”

column2: “You've already seen him. He's the one speaking with you now!” Jesus told him.
column3: D hab kaij g Jesus, “Dani ahni map hahawa s‑ap ni‑neid mant wa m‑nench.”

column2: “I trust you, Lord!” he said, and he kneeled in worship before Jesus.
column3: D ab si i gei wui k hab kaij, “Ab ani si m‑hiwig, s‑apꞌekam ni‑kownalig.”

column2: Then Jesus told him, “I've come into the world to bring judgment so that those who are blind may see, and those who see will become blind.”
column3: D hab hahawa kaij g Jesus, “Ia ant jiwia jewed dahm mant wo mahsko wua mo hedai pi nea ch hedai s‑nea id eda Jiosh apꞌedag.”

column2: Some Pharisees who were there with Jesus asked him, “We're not blind too, are we?”
column3: D haꞌi am gegok g Palasi ch si has i elid k hab kaij, “Nap ahchim hab ep chum t‑ahg mach hab waꞌap pi nenea.”

column2: Jesus answered, “If you were blind, you wouldn't be guilty. But now that you say you see, your guilt remains.”
column3: D hab kaij g Jesus, “Pi amt ab hu wo em‑abch mamtp wo wohokamch mam pi nenea am Jiosh apꞌedag ed. M wabshaba hab chum kaij mam s‑nenea.”

column2: “I tell you the truth, anyone who doesn't come in through the gate of the sheepfold but climbs in some other way is a thief and a robber.
column3: D hab ep kaij g Jesus, “No hig pi woho mat g s‑chu ehskam wabsh s‑aꞌagi haskojed ab wo i wah heg eda kolhai mam am ha nuhkud g kahwal k wo s‑ha ehsidam?

column2: The one who comes in through the gate is the shepherd of the sheep.
column3: T wabshaba g si ha nuhkuddam ab wo i wah kihjeg amjed.

column2: The gatekeeper opens it for him, and the sheep respond to his voice. He calls his own sheep by name, and leads them out.
column3: T g kihjeg nuhkuddam ab wo i kuhpiꞌoki. K g ha nuhkuddam am si ha chehcheg ch gam hu i ha wanimed.

column2: After bringing them out, he walks ahead of them, and the sheep follow him because they recognize his voice.
column3: T am wo i wuwhag k gam hu wo i oi no pi s‑mahch g neꞌokij. T am ha baꞌich wo himad.

column2: They won't follow strangers. In fact they run away from a stranger because they don't recognize the voice of strangers.”
column3: Pi at hedai ep wo i oi no pi pi mahch g ha‑neꞌoki k wabsh wo e gantad.”

column2: When Jesus gave this illustration those who were listening to him didn't understand what he meant.
column3: Neh, id ad hekaj am chum haꞌichu ha mashcham g Jesus. D wabshaba pi shaꞌi amichud mo haschu hab ahg.

column2: So Jesus explained again, “I tell you the truth: I am the gate of the sheepfold.
column3: D heg hekaj hab ep kaij, “Ahni ani hab ni‑ahg ch ni‑wepogid g kolhai kihjeg.

column2: All those who came before me were thieves and robbers, but the sheep didn't listen to them.
column3: Hegam mo hab e aꞌaga mo d em‑wanimeddam ch eda pi ab hu ni‑wohochud o d s‑chu eꞌeskam ch d ha muꞌakam. K wabshaba g ni‑wohochuddam pi ab hu ha kaiham.

column2: I am the gate. Anyone who comes in through me will be healed. They will be able to come and go, and find the food they need.
column3: Heg ani wepo mo g kihjeg. Kahwal o am wapke kolhai ch ed. K pi haꞌichu has e wua am ha tahgio. Kumt ahpim ab wo s‑ni‑wohochud k hab waꞌap wo e doꞌibia. Kahwal o ab mahks g s‑kehg haꞌichu hugi. Kum ahpim ab ep mahks mam haschu i tatchua.

column2: The thief comes only to steal, kill, and destroy. I've come to bring you life, life full to overflowing.
column3: S‑chu ehskam at wo jiwia mat wo ha uꞌu k wo ha kokda. Nt ahni ia jiwia mant s‑baꞌama ab wo i em‑mah g doakag

column2: I am the good shepherd. The good shepherd lays down his life for the sheep.
column3: nani pi s‑wohom d em‑nuhkuddam.

column2: The man paid to look after the sheep is not the shepherd and he runs away when he sees the wolf coming. He abandons the sheep because they're not his, and the wolf attacks and scatters the flock
column3: Hegai mo d wabsh ha‑pionag at am wabsh wo i ha dagito k wo meh mat am wo jiwia g shehꞌe. T g shehꞌe am wo wahk k wo muꞌa k wo ha gantad.

column2: for the man is only working for pay and doesn't care about the sheep.
column3: Pion at wo heb hu meh no pi pi ha tatchua g ha‑shoshoiga.

column2: I am the good shepherd. I know who are mine, and they know me,  just as the Father knows me and I know him. I lay down my life for the sheep.
column3: “Nt eda ahni wo i nako g shoꞌigdag am ha wehhejed g ni‑wohochuddam hab masma mo g si ha nuhkuddam g kahwal chum anis wo ni‑muhkid am ha wehhejed. Kahwal ch ha nuhkuddam o ab aꞌai s‑e mahch. Kuch g ni‑wohochuddam ch ahni ab hab waꞌap aꞌai s‑t‑mahch. Ch ahchim g ni‑ohg wehm hab wa masma ab aꞌai s‑t‑mahch.

column2: I have other sheep that are not in this sheepfold. I must bring them too. They will listen to my voice and there will be one flock with one shepherd.
column3: Ha nuhkuddam at wehs ab wo i ha hemapai g e‑kahwaliga. Nt ahni hab wa masma ab wo i ha hemapai wehs hegam mat ab wo i s‑ni‑wohoch, chum hems g gawul mahs hemajkam.

column2: This is why the Father loves me, because I lay down my life so I may take it up again.
column3: “Am ant wabsh wo i ni‑dagito muhkig wui. K g ni‑ohg heg hekaj si ni‑tatchua. Nt ab uhpam ep wo i ni‑chegito.

column2: No one takes it from me; I choose to lay it down. I have the right to give it up, and I have the right to take it back. This is the command my Father gave me.”
column3: Pi at hedai wo shaꞌi e nako mas wabsh hejel wo e elid k wo ni‑mua. Uꞌukch ani g ni‑apꞌedag mant am wo i ni‑dagito muhkig wui k ab uhpam ep wo i ni‑chegito. Ab o ni‑chehani g ni‑ohg mant id am hab wo juh.”

column2: The Jews were again divided in their opinion about Jesus over these words.
column3: D am ep aꞌai e neꞌowi g hemajkam heg hekaj mo has i kaij.

column2: Many of them said, “He's demon-possessed! He's mad! Why are you listening to him?”
column3: Kud muꞌijj hab nahnko kaij babgatk, “Doki wabsh jiawul. Pi o wehsig. Shahchu am ahgch ab kaiham?”

column2: Others said, “These aren't the words of someone who's demon-possessed. Besides, a demon can't open eyes that are blind.”
column3: D wabshaba haꞌijj hab epai kaij, “Pi at wo e nako hegai mo d wabsh sha jiawul mas hab kaidam s‑kehg wo neokad ch wo nench g pi neadam.”

column2: It was winter, and the time of the Festival of Dedication in Jerusalem.
column3: D am i e ai g geꞌe cheopi wakonadag tash. D eda d s‑hehpichꞌedkam.

column2: Jesus was walking in the Temple through Solomon's porch. The Jews surrounded him, asking,
column3: Kuchd am oiopo anai mo hab e aꞌaga Solomonbad watto am geꞌe cheopi t am.

column2: “How long are you going to keep us hanging in suspense? If you are the Messiah then tell us plainly!”
column3: D am i e chehm g hahaꞌichu k hab kaij ab Jesus wui, “Tt heꞌes i tash wo m‑nenida mapt wo t‑ahgi maps wa woho d Jiosh si Kehsha.”

column2: Jesus replied, “I already told you but you refuse to believe it. The miracles I do in my Father's name prove who I am.
column3: D hab kaij g Jesus, “Heki ani hu am em‑ahgid. M eda pi ni‑wohochud. Ni‑ohg o ab ni‑mahkch g gewkdag mant hab wo juh g s‑hasig haꞌichu. K heg am chum em‑tashogid mani hedai wud.

column2: You don't believe me because you are not my sheep.
column3: M wabshaba pi ab hu ni‑wohochud nam d ge ni‑hemajkamga.

column2: My sheep recognize my voice; I know them, and they follow me.
column3: Neh, am o oid g e‑nuhkuddam g kahwal no pi s‑mahch am i s‑amichudk g neꞌokij. K hab waꞌap ni‑oid g ni‑wohochuddam no pi s‑ni‑mahch. Ni ahni ep s‑ha mahch.

column2: I give them eternal life; they shall never be lost, and no one can snatch them from me.
column3: Ab ani ha mahkch g pi ha huhugedam doakag. T hegam pi hekid wo huhug. T pi hedai wo shaꞌi ni‑wohppoꞌi.

column2: My Father who gave them to me is greater than anyone else; no one can snatch them from him.
column3: Ni‑ohg o wehs haꞌichu dahm s‑gewkdag ch si s‑wihnam an ha uꞌukch hegam mo ab ni‑mahkch. T pi hedai wo wohppoꞌi.

column2: I and the Father are one.”
column3: Ahni g ni‑ohg wehm ach d hemako.” Neh, id ad hab wabsh chum chei g Jesus.

column2: Once again the Jews picked up stones to stone him.
column3: D g hemajkam am ep uꞌihi g hohodai mat wo maꞌichkwua.

column2: Jesus said to them, “You've seen many good deeds that I've done from the Father. Which one are you stoning me for?”
column3: D hab kaij g Jesus, “Muꞌi ant haꞌichu hab juh g s‑apꞌekam nat pi ab ni‑mah g ni‑ohg g gewkdag. K haschu d hegai mamt heg hekaj wo ni‑maꞌichkwua?”

column2: The Jews replied, “We're not stoning you for a good deed, but for blasphemy because you are just a man but you're claiming to be God.”
column3: D hab kaij g hemajkam, “Pi ach heg hekaj s‑m‑maꞌichkwuimk s‑apꞌekam ch wabshaba heg hekaj map pad neok. Dap wabsh oꞌodham ch eda hab chum aꞌaga g Jiosh mo d si m‑ohg ch hab ab chum e wepogid g Jiosh.”

column2: Jesus answered them, “Isn't it written in your law, ‘I said, you are gods’? He called those people ‘gods,’ the people to whom the word of God came—and Scripture can't be altered.
column3: D hab kaij g Jesus, “An o oꞌohanas em‑chehanig ed mo g Jiosh hab ha aꞌaga jijosh hegam mo uꞌachug g haꞌichu ahgaj, chum as d wabsh hemajkam.

column2: So why are you saying the one whom the Father set apart and sent into the world is blaspheming because I said ‘I am the Son of God’?
column3: T wahm ahni hig woho am si i ni‑kehsh k ia i ni‑ahꞌad id dahm jewed. M eda haschu ahgch hab ni‑ahg mani pad neok mani hab kaij mani d Jiosh alidag?

column2: If I'm not doing what my Father does, then don't believe me.
column3: Mantp wa woho pi am hu hab wo junihid g ni‑ohg chikpan, mt s‑ap pi wo ni‑wohoch.

column2: But if that is what I'm doing, even though you don't believe me, you should believe because of the evidence of what I've done. That way you can know and understand that the Father is in me, and I am in the Father.”
column3: Ni wabshaba am hab junihim. Mt heg hekaj wo s‑mahchk mach d hemako g ni‑ohg wehm.”

column2: Once again they tried to arrest him, but he escaped from them.
column3: D g hahaꞌichu am hahawa ep chum cheha g cheopi nuhkuddam mat am wo hihim k wo bei. D wabshaba ep e doꞌibia ab ha amjed.

column2: He went back across the Jordan River to the place where John had begun baptizing, and he stayed there.
column3: Kuchd gam hu hahawa hihim k gam hu ai g Jordan Akimel k am aigo i chehchsh k am dada mo wa g Johnbad am ha pahl wapkon k am dadha.

column2: Many people came to him, and they said, “John didn't perform miracles, but everything he said about this man has come true.”
column3: D muꞌi hemajkam am wui dada hab kaijch, “Pi at wa haꞌichu s‑hasigam hab juh g John. Kuki wabshaba d wohokam mo haschu i t‑ahgid id amjed oꞌodham.”

column2: Many who were there put their trust in Jesus.
column3: D muꞌi hemajkam ab i s‑wohoch g Jesus amai.

column2: A man named Lazarus was sick. He lived in Bethany with his sisters Mary and Martha.
column3: Am ad wa hema kih Bethany kihhim t am ch hab chehgig Lazarus ch am hu hebai haha wabsh mumku. Lazarusbad uꞌuwiga ad d Marda ch Mary.

column2: Mary was the one who had anointed the Lord with perfume and wiped his feet with her hair. It was her brother Lazarus who was sick.
column3: (Ihda Mary o wa d hegai mad wa g uhw shuhdagi an iawua Jesus tahtad an k an i dagio wabsh g e‑cheꞌechew moꞌokaj.)

column2: So the sisters sent a message to Jesus: “Lord, your close friend is sick.”
column3: Kudki idam uꞌuwigaj am hema cheha mad am wo him k wo ahgi g Jesus, “S-apꞌekam t-kownalig, si m-nawoj at mumku.”

column2: When Jesus heard the news he said, “The end result of this sickness will not be death. Through this God's glory will be revealed so that the Son of God may be glorified.”
column3: D am i kah g ha-ahga g Jesus k am t-ahgid, “Lazarus ash mumku. K wabshaba pi hab d ahga mat gam hu hab wo i e juh. Nt wo doꞌibia mamt hekaj ab wo ihm g Jiosh. T g Jiosh heg hekaj ab epai wo ni-ihm.”

column2: Even though Jesus loved Martha, Mary, and Lazarus,
column3: Jesus ad wa ab wa chum si pihk e elid ha wui idam Marda ch Mary ch Lazarus

column2: and had heard that Lazarus was sick, he remained where he was for two more days.
column3: ch wabshaba pi am hu wa hekaj i hih mo ab waid.

column2: Then he told the disciples, “Let's return to Judea.”
column3: D hab kaij ab t-wui, “M att hig ep wo uhpam hihi Judea chekshani wui.”

column2: The disciples replied, “Rabbi, just a few days ago the Jews were trying to stone you. Do you really want to go back there now?”
column3: Kuchd ahchim chum pi hohhoꞌid ch hab kaij ab wui, “T-mashchamdam, pi o koi d shaꞌi tash mo wa am chum s-m-maꞌichkwuimk g hemajkam. Ttp eda am ep wo hihi!”

column2: “Aren't there twelve hours in a day?” Jesus replied.  “If you walk during the day you don't stumble because you can see where you're going by the light of this world. But if you walk during the night you stumble because you have no light.”
column3: D hab kaij g Jesus, “T am wabsh s-ap wo himad g oꞌodham tash ch ed ch wabshaba wo e huchwua s-chuhugam k ed. Pegih, pi at has wo e juh mo eda ni-apꞌechudch g Jiosh mant hab wo junihid g chikpanaj.”

column2: After telling them this, he said, “Our friend Lazarus has fallen asleep, but I'm going to go there and wake him up!”
column3: D hab ep kaij g Jesus, “Koi at g t-nawoj Lazarus. Nt wabshaba am wo uhpam him k wo wuha.”

column2: The disciples said, “Lord, if he's sleeping then he'll get better.”
column3: Kuchd hab kaij, “Kohsig o s-kehgaj wehhejed. T wo wa hejel apꞌet.”

column2: Jesus had been referring to the death of Lazarus, but the disciples thought he meant actual sleep.
column3: D eda g Jesus heg hab ahg mat muh g Lazarus

column2: So Jesus told them plainly, “Lazarus is dead.
column3: ch heg hekaj hab kaij, “Neh, muh at g Lazarus.

column2: For your sake I'm glad I wasn't there, because now you will be able to trust in me. Let's go and see him.”
column3: Ni wabshaba wabsh s-ap ni-tahtk mani pi am hu wehmaj namt pi haha wo nei mant has wo ni-juh k ab baꞌich wo i s-ni-wohoch. Tt oi wo hihim k wo nei.”

column2: Thomas, the Twin, said to his fellow-disciples, “Let's go too so we can die with him.”
column3: D ihda Thomas mam hab aꞌaga Kuadi hab kaij ab t-wui, “Pegih, ttp wo oi g t-mashchamdam k wehmaj wo t-koꞌij.”

column2: When he arrived, Jesus learned that Lazarus had been in the tomb for four days.
column3: Kuchd ged hu dada Bethany t am k s-mai mash d waꞌi giꞌik tash matsh ged hu e cheh g Lazarus.

column2: Bethany was just two miles from Jerusalem,  and many Jews had come to console Mary and Martha at the loss of their brother.
column3: Tki eda muꞌijj am dada g hemajkam ab Jerusalem t amjed mat am wo i ha gewkemhu g Marda ch Mary no pi d waꞌi gohk mihya.

column2: When Martha found out that Jesus was coming, she went to meet him, but Mary stayed at home.
column3: D ga hu t-nam g Marda nash pi kah mo ab him g Jesus. Tki g Mary ga hu waꞌi wih ha-kih ab.

column2: Martha said to Jesus, “Lord, if you'd been here, my brother wouldn't have died.
column3: D hab kaij g Marda ab wui g Jesus, “Neh, ni-kownalig, mapt hems s-hohtam wo jiwia, t chum pi wo muh g t-wehnag.

column2: But I'm certain that even now God will give you whatever you ask.”
column3: Ni wabshaba s-mahch mat g Jiosh ab wo m-mah mapt haschu ab wo i tai, chum hems hemuch mat i geꞌeda g haꞌichu pi t-apꞌedag.”

column2: Jesus told her, “Your brother will rise again.”
column3: D hab kaij g Jesus, “T wo uhpam e chegito g em-wehnag.”

column2: “I know he will rise again in the resurrection at the last day,” Martha answered.
column3: Kud hab ep kaij g Marda, “S-mahch ani mat uhpam wo e chegito mat hekid wo i huhug g jewed.”

column2: Jesus said, “I am the resurrection and the life. Those who trust in me will live, even though they die.  All who live in me and trust in me will never die. Do you believe this?”
column3: D hab kaij g Jesus ab wui, “Ia ani haꞌichug ahni mant wo i ha wuwhas g koꞌi ab amjed g muhkig k ab wo i ha mah g doakag. Ab ani ha mahkch g pi ha huhugedam doakag hegam mo ab ni-hiwig. T wo uhpam e chechegito am i koꞌok. Nap s-wohochud ihda?”

column2: “Yes, Lord,” she replied, “I believe you are the Messiah, the Son of God, the one expected to come to this world.”
column3: Kud hab kaij g Marda, “Heuꞌu, ni-kownalig, s-wohochud ani map d Jiosh si Kehsha ch d Jiosh alidag. An o oꞌohadag Jiosh oꞌohana ed maptsh ia wo jiwia jewed dahm.”

column2: When she had said this, she went and told her sister Mary in private, “The Teacher's here, and asking to see you.”
column3: Kud gam hu hahawa uhpam hih g Marda k atsh am wabsh s-aꞌagi wai g Mary ash hab kaijch mo ab him g ha mashchamdam ch ab waid.

column2: As soon as she heard, Mary quickly got up and went to see him.  Jesus hadn't arrived in the village yet. He was still at the place where Martha had met him.
column3: D am ha hekaj s-hohtam hih g Mary k ged hu jiwia mat am t-nam g Marda natt ge koi ai g kihhim.

column2: The Jews who had been comforting Mary in the home saw how she'd got up quickly and left. So they followed her, thinking she was going to the tomb to weep there.
column3: Kud muꞌijj i oi g Mary hegam moki am ha wehm shoani ash hab em-ahgch mat gam hu uhpam ep wo hih hihaꞌini wui mat am wo shoakad.

column2: When Mary arrived at the place where Jesus was and saw him, she fell at his feet and said, “Lord, if you'd been here, my brother wouldn't have died.”
column3: D am i cheh g Mary g Jesus k ab i gei wecho k hab kaij, “Ni-kownalig, mapt hems s-hohtam wo jiwia, t chum pi wo muh g t-wehnag.”

column2: When Jesus saw her crying, and the Jews who had come with her crying as well, he was very troubled and upset.
column3: D am i nei g Jesus mo shoak g Mary. D hegam ep shoani mo wehmaj. D ged hu si ai g ihbdaj. D si has e tahtk

column2: “Where have you laid him?” he asked.
column3: k ab ha kakke mas hebai ehsto g chuhkugaj.

column2: Then Jesus cried too.
column3: D am i shosha g Jesus.

column2: “See how much he loved him,” the Jews said.
column3: D heg hekaj hab kaij g hemajkam, “Neh, kuki ab si pihk e elid wui.”

column2: But some of them said, “If he could open the eyes of a blind man, couldn't he have kept Lazarus from dying?”
column3: D wabshaba haꞌijj hab ep kaij, “Neh, t wa g pi neadam doaj. T haschu ahgk pi doaj g Lazarus mat pi wo muh?”

column2: Very troubled, Jesus went to the tomb. It was a cave with a large stone placed at the entrance.
column3: D am ep si has i e taht g Jesus k am i miabi g hihaꞌini. Id o ab cheho ch ed hab chuꞌig ch g hodaikaj ab kuhpi.

column2: “Remove the stone,” Jesus told them.
column3: D hab ha ahg g Jesus mat gam hu wo i nuꞌichkwua g hodai.

column2: “Didn't I tell you that if you trusted me you would see God's glory?” Jesus replied.
column3: D hab kaij g Jesus ab wui, “Napt pi chegito mani wa m-ahgid mapt wo nei g s-hasig haꞌichu k wo taht g Jiosh gewkdag maptp ab wo s-ni-wohoch.”

column2: So they removed the stone. Jesus looked heavenwards, and said, “Father, thank you for listening to me.
column3: D gam hu hab i e nuꞌichkwua g hodai. D am e dahm i nea g Jesus k hab kaij, “Ni-ohg, ab ani i m-hoꞌigeꞌelid map ab ni-kaiham.

column2: I know you always listen to me. I said this because of the crowd standing here so that they will believe that you sent me.”
column3: S-mahch ani map chum hekid ab ni-kaiham ch wabshaba hab kaij ihda idam ha wehhejed hemajkam. T hab wo s-wohoch mapt ahpi ia i ni-ahꞌad,”

column2: After saying this, Jesus shouted, “Lazarus, come out!”
column3: k am i haꞌasa e hoꞌigeꞌidahun k am hahawa si s-kaidam neok ch hab kaij, “Lazarus, ab g i wuhshani!”

column2: The dead man came out, his hands and feet bound with strips of linen, and with a cloth around his face.
column3: D ab i wuhsh g Lazarus k an wabsh kia bihiwigs g iꞌikuskaj mach hekaj ha bihiwig g t-koꞌi ch ab wabsh kia maꞌishp g wuhioshaj g ikuskaj. D hab ha ahg g Jesus, “Gam g hu wo padch g iꞌikus k wo hiwigi mat wo hih uhpam.” Neh, d wa woho hab e juh.

column2: Consequently many of the Jews who had come to comfort Mary and who saw what Jesus did put their trust in him.
column3: Muꞌijj hegam mad am i ha chehgio g Marda ch Mary ad ab i s‑wohoch mo g Jesus d Jiosh si Kehsha am i neidok mad haschu hab juh.

column2: But others went to the Pharisees and told them what Jesus had done.
column3: Tki wabshaba haꞌi ehp gam hu hihi Palasi ha wui k am ha ahgi mat haschu hab juh.

column2: Then the chief priests and the Pharisees called a meeting of the ruling council. “What shall we do?” they asked. “This man is doing many miracles.
column3: Kutsh am e nam g Palasi ch uꞌugchu papal ha wehm g geꞌe e jehnigiddam k am aꞌaga mas has wo juh ihda s‑hasig haꞌichu hab wuadam.

column2: If we allow him to continue, everybody will believe in him, and then the Romans will destroy both the Temple and our status as a nation.”
column3: “Wehsijj at ab wo i s‑wohoch mo d Jiosh si Kehsha mattp am wabsh wo neidad. T g Rome kokownal am wo i e nakog k wo i wua g geꞌe t‑cheopi k wo wehs t‑kokda,” bad kaij idam am aꞌagadch.

column2: “You don't understand anything!” said Caiaphas, who was high priest that year.
column3: Sh am haꞌichug hegai mad d si uhgchu pahl ch hab chehgig Caiaphas ch si s‑gewkam hab ha ahg, “Kaij, ahpim am shaꞌi pi haꞌichu aꞌamichud

column2: “Can't you see that it's better for you that one man die for the people so that the whole nation won't be destroyed?”
column3: ch pi mahch mo baꞌich i s‑apꞌe mat hemako oꞌodham wo muh wehs t‑wehhejed kih hegai mattp wehsijj wo t‑koꞌij.”

column2: He didn't say this on his own behalf, but as chief priest that year he was prophesying that Jesus would die for the nation.
column3: Neh, bad kaij ch eda pi mahch mo g Jiosh am tashogid heg hekaj neꞌokij mo e aihim mat g Jesus wo e muhkid ha wehhejed g Tutuligo

column2: And this was not just for the Jewish nation, but for all the scattered children of God so that they might be gathered together and be made into one.
column3: ch wehs ha wehhejed g nahnko mahs hemajkam. T idam haꞌi ab wo i s‑wohoch g Jesus k ab wo i e hemakoj e wehm.

column2: From that time on they plotted how they might kill Jesus.
column3: Neh, iaꞌi amjed ad g hahaꞌichu am i e nako mat wo mua g Jesus.

column2: So Jesus did not travel openly among the Jews but went to a town called Ephraim in the region near the desert and stayed there with his disciples.
column3: D heg hekaj hahawa pi an hu s‑masma oimmed g Jesus Judea chekshani ch ed am i dagitok g Bethany. Chd gam hu hihim k am haꞌichugkahim mo am d Ephraim kihhim mo am miabidch g tohono jewed.

column2: It was nearly time for the Jewish Passover, and many people went from the countryside to Jerusalem to purify themselves for the Passover.
column3: Kud eda e aihim mat wo e wuhshad g t‑shohshon ha‑doꞌibiadag. K muꞌijj am hihim gam hu aꞌaijed Jerusalem kihhim wui mat am wo i e nako heg wehhejed.

column2: People were looking for Jesus and talking about him as they stood in the Temple. “What do you think?” they asked each other. “Isn't he coming to the festival?”
column3: D chum hedai an chum neid g Jesus am i e hemapadk geꞌe cheopi t am ch hab kaij ab aꞌai e wui, “Pi atp hems ia hu wo shaꞌi jiwia. Shahm i elid.”

column2: The chief priests and the Pharisees had given orders that anyone who knew where Jesus was should report it so they could arrest him.
column3: Kuki eda g uꞌugchu papal ch Palasi am i ha chehani g hemajkam mat hemho wa wo ha ahgi sha s‑mahchk mo hebai haꞌichug g Jesus. T an wo bei.

column2: Six days before the Passover Jesus went to Bethany, to the home of Lazarus who had been raised from the dead.
column3: Chuhdp tash o wa am wiꞌis mat wo e ai g t‑shohshon ha‑doꞌibiadag wuhshda.

column2: There a dinner was arranged in his honor. Martha helped serve the food while Lazarus sat at the table with Jesus and the others guests.
column3: Kud wa am hab e juh g geꞌe gegosig Bethany t am wehhejed g Jesus. Kuchd gam hu hihim k am ha wehm t‑gegosid. D g Lazarus am ep t‑wehmaj. Marda ad am ha wehmaj hegam mad am hihidod ch an t‑toꞌid.

column2: Mary brought a pint of pure nard perfume and anointed Jesus' feet, wiping them dry with her hair. The scent of the perfume filled the whole house.
column3: D g Mary ged hu jiwia Jesus wui k g si s‑namkig uhw shuhdagi uꞌa ch an iawua Jesus tahtad an. K eda d hemako s‑wehch. D an i dagio wabsh g e‑cheꞌechew moꞌokaj. D wehsko uhwa ihda uhw shuhdagi am kih ch ed.

column2: But one of the disciples, Judas Iscariot, who would later betray Jesus, asked,
column3: D hab kaij hegai t‑wehm kehshaj g Jesus mo hab chehgig Judas Iscariot,

column2: “Why wasn't this perfume sold and the money given to the poor? It was worth three hundred denarii.”
column3: “T haschu ahgk pi e gagda ihda uhw shuhdagi matt wo ha mah g shoꞌigkam, natt pi ahim g waik siant pihsh namkigdag ab wo i nei g lial heg amjed.”

column2: He wasn't saying this because he cared about the poor but because he was a thief. He was the one who looked after the disciples' money and he often took some for himself.
column3: D eda pi woho s‑ha hoꞌigeꞌid g shoꞌigkam ch wabshaba s‑behimk g lial nadki pi s‑chu ehsk ch chum nuhkud g t‑lialiga ch wabsh hejel hekaj.

column2: “Don't criticize her,” Jesus replied. “She did this in preparation for the day of my burial.
column3: D hab kaij g Jesus ab wui, “Dagitoni. T‑himdag oidk at hab juh g ni‑muhkig wehhejed.

column2: You'll always have the poor here with you, but you won't always have me here.”
column3: Chum o hekid ia em‑shahgid g shoꞌigkam. Nt wabshaba ahni hi pi wabsh chum hekid ia wo em‑shahgidk.”

column2: A large crowd had found out that he was there. They came there not just to see Jesus but because they wanted to see Lazarus, the man Jesus had raised from the dead.
column3: D eda wehsko kaidag mad g Jesus ab i wuhshad g Lazarus muhkig amjed. Kud muꞌi am dada g Judea t am hemajkam s‑ha neidamk.

column2: So the chief priests planned to kill Lazarus as well,  since it was because of him that many Jews were no longer following them but putting their trust in Jesus.
column3: Kud muꞌijj ab i s‑wohoch mo g Jesus d Jiosh si Kehsha k am i ha dagito g e‑wanimeddam am i neidok g Lazarus. D am i s‑mai g uꞌugchu papal k am i e nako mat g Lazarus hab waꞌap wo mua.

column2: The following day the crowds of people who had come for the Passover festival heard that Jesus was on his way to Jerusalem.
column3: D am baꞌich i mahsi. Kuchd am i t‑nakog k gam hu hihi Jerusalem wui. D eda muꞌi am e hemapadch g hemajkam kihhim ch ed mat wo wuhshad g t‑shohshon ha‑doꞌibiadag. Chd am hihim wohg ch ed. D muꞌijj ga hu t‑nam am i kaiok mat am wo jiwia g Jesus.

column2: They cut off palm branches and went to welcome him, shouting, “Hosanna! Blessed is the one coming in the name of the Lord. Blessed is the king of Israel.”
column3: Idam ad ha uhꞌukch g chukud shosha uꞌus iꞌibhonig ch ab si has elid g Jesus si s‑kaidam hab kaijch, “Id o d s‑apꞌekam t‑kownalig ch ia jiwia am wehhejed g Jiosh. K g Jiosh si s‑hoꞌigeꞌid.”

column2: Jesus found a young donkey and rode on it, as Scripture says:
column3: D g Jesus am hema ha tai g wechij wuhlu k heg cheshadk.

column2: “Don't be afraid, daughter of Zion. Look, your king is coming, riding a donkey's colt.”
column3: Heki o hu an hab chuꞌig Jiosh oꞌohana ed matsh id hab wo e juh ch hab chuꞌig:

column2: At the time, Jesus' disciples did not understand what these things meant. It was only later when he was glorified that they realized what had happened had been prophesied and applied to him.
column3: Kuchd pi shaꞌi amichud wehs ihda. Kut wa wabshaba hekid ab uhgk i e bei g Jesus dahm kahchim wui, tt am hahawa i chegito mo an oꞌohanas ihda Jiosh oꞌohana ed. Kutki heg hekaj hab e juh am wehhejed.

column2: Many in the crowd had seen Jesus call Lazarus from the tomb and raise him from the dead and were telling the story.  That was the reason so many people went to meet Jesus—because they had heard about this miracle.
column3: Idam muꞌi hemajkam ad wa am nam g Jesus nash pi kah mat ab i wuhshad g Lazarus muhkig amjed. Hegam mo wa am neid ash am ha ahgid.

column2: The Pharisees said to one other, “Look, we're getting nowhere. Everyone's running after him.”
column3: D hab kaij g Palasi ab aꞌai e wui am i ha neidok, “Ha g wo neid matki wehsijj am i oi. Pi attki wo t‑nako matt wo keshwua.”

column2: Now some Greeks had come to the festival to worship.
column3: D am haꞌi dada g Greek hemajkam Jerusalem t am mat ab wo has el g Jiosh heg eda doꞌibiadag wuhshda piast.

column2: They came to Philip of Bethsaida in Galilee, and said, “Sir, we'd like to see Jesus.”
column3: Kuchd am oiopo. D idam am dada k am cheh g Philip k am ahgi mo s‑neidamk g Jesus.

column2: Philip went and told Andrew. Then they both went to Jesus and told him.
column3: D g Philip am ahgi g Andrew. (Idam ad am d chum kihkam Bethsaida t am am Galilee chekshani ch ed.) Kud am hahawa e wehm hihim k am ahgi g Jesus.

column2: Jesus replied, “The time has come for the Son of man to be glorified.
column3: D hab kaij g Jesus ab ha wui, “Idani at e ai g ni‑tashga mat g ni‑ohg wo ni‑maskogi mani d si Kehshaj.

column2: I tell you the truth: unless a grain of wheat is planted in the soil and dies  it remains just one grain. But if it dies, it produces many more grains of wheat.
column3: T wabshaba wehpeg haꞌichu hab wo e juh am ni‑tahgio. Neh, nat hig am wo i wuhshani k ab wo muꞌida g pilkani pi am hu e eshk? Hemho wa at am wo e ei jewed wecho k wo muh k hab waꞌi masma wo i wuhshani k ab wo muꞌida.

column2: If you love your own life you will lose it, but if you don't love your own life in this world you will keep your life forever.
column3: Id ani hab ahg mat g oꞌodham wo heki wua g e‑doakag matp wo s‑huwidad hejel e wehhejed k wabshaba wo edgidad g pi ha huhugedam doakag matp wo hugio g e‑doakag am ni‑wehhejed.

column2: If you want to serve me you need to follow me. My servants will be where I am, and my Father will honor anyone who serves for me.
column3: Bat wo junihid g ni‑tatchui hegai matp hedai hab e elid mat d wo ni‑pionagk. Kunt hab wo juh mat an wo ni‑wehmajk mant hebai wo i haꞌichugk. Ni‑ohg at ab wo si has i ha el hegam mo hab junihim g ni‑tatchui.”

column2: Now I am troubled. What should I say? ‘Father, save me from this coming time of suffering? ’ No, for this is why I came—to go through this time of suffering.
column3: D hab ep kaij g Jesus, “Ni‑ihbdag at ab si i e kudu. Ni hab chum ni‑tahtk mant hab wo chei, ‘Ni‑ohg, pi g hiwgid mas hab wo e juh ihda am ni‑tahgio.’ Nt eda heg hekaj ia jiwia mant am wo gahi wuhsh hegai s‑koꞌok haꞌichu.

column2: Father, show the glory of your character.”
column3: Pegih, ni‑ohg, am g maskogid g e‑gewkdag am gahi ni‑wuhshanim.”

column2: The crowd that was standing there heard it. Some said it thundered; others said an angel had spoken to him.
column3: Muꞌi o wa am gegok g hemajkam ch kah hegai mo ab neok. Haꞌijj o hab kaij, “Ab o kaidaghim g tataniki.”

column2: Jesus told them, “This voice spoke not for my sake, but for yours.
column3: D Wabshaba hab kaij g Jesus ab ha wui, “Ahpim at em‑wehhejed ab s‑kaidam neo, ch pi ahni ni‑wehhejed.

column2: Now is the judgment of this world; now the prince of this world will be thrown out.
column3: E at ai mat geꞌe wo bei g chuꞌijig g hemajkam. Jijawul ha‑geꞌejig o chum e kownalchud id dahm jewed. Nt wabshaba oi wo gewito.

column2: But when I am lifted up from the earth I will attract everyone to me.”
column3: Ab amt wo ni‑naggia uhs t ab ahni Jiosh si Kehsha. Kunt ab haha wo i ha wanchshul g hemajkam ni‑wui.”

column2: (He said this to point out the kind of death he was going to die).
column3: Neh, bo wa kaij g Jesus ch oki heg hab ahg mat has masma wo muh.

column2: The crowd responded, “The Law tells us that the Messiah will live forever, so how can you say the Son of man must be ‘lifted up’? Who is this ‘Son of man’?”
column3: D hab kaij g hemajkam, “An o hab chuꞌig Jiosh oꞌohana ed mat g Jiosh si Kehsha pi hekid wo muh. P haschu ahgch hab kaij mapt ab wo e naggia uhs t ab maptp woho d Jiosh si Kehsha?”

column2: Jesus replied, “The light is here with you for a little longer. Walk while you have the light so that the darkness doesn't overtake you. Those who walk in the dark don't know where they're going.
column3: D hab kaij g Jesus ab ha wui, “Ia ant heꞌes i tash wo haꞌichugk em‑shahgid ch heg wa wepo mani d tonlig em‑wehhejed. Am g s‑ap wo hihimad tonlig oidch. T hab pi wo em‑maꞌish g s‑chuhugam. Hegai matp hedai am wo himad s‑chuhugam k ed o pi mahch mas hebai him.

column2: Put your trust in the light while you still have it so that you can become children of light.” When Jesus had told them this, he left and hid himself from them.
column3: Ab g wo i s‑ni‑wohochud mani eda ia wabsh kia haꞌichug k hab masma tonlig ch ed wo hihimad.” Neh, bad kaij ch gam hu hahawa i e mehkod ab ha amjed.

column2: But despite all the miracles he had done in their presence, they still did not trust in Jesus.
column3: Muꞌikko ad wa hab juh g s‑hasig haꞌichu g Jesus am ha‑nena ed idam hemajkam. Kud wabshaba muꞌijj pi ab hu wohochud mo d Jiosh si Kehsha.

column2: This fulfilled the message of Isaiah the prophet who said, “Lord, who has believed what we told them? To whom has the Lord's power been revealed?”
column3: Neh, d hab wa masma hab e juh hegai matki g kelibad Jiosh haꞌichu i tashogiddam Isaiah an oꞌoha. An o hab chuꞌig:

column2: Even so many of the leaders did trust in him. However, they did not openly admit it because they did not want the Pharisees to expel them from the synagogue,
column3: Kud muꞌi ab hi wa chum s‑wohoch g hahaꞌichu. Tsh wabshaba g Palasi gam hu wo i ha wuwhas matp wo s‑mai mat ab s‑wohoch. D heg hekaj pi am hu tasho e ahg

column2: loving human admiration more than God's approval.
column3: no pi s‑hohhoꞌid g ab has ha‑elida g hemajkam ch g Jiosh ab has elida wabsh pi ab hu haꞌichuchud.

column2: Jesus called out, “If you trust in me you're not just trusting in me but also in the One who sent me.
column3: Jesus ad am ep ha jehnigid ch si s‑kaidam hab kaij, “Matp hedai ab wo i s‑ni‑wohochud k hab waꞌap s‑wohochud g ni‑ohg Jiosh.

column2: When you see me, you're seeing the One who sent me.
column3: K hedai i ni‑neid ch hab waꞌap neid.

column2: I have come as a light shining into the world, so if you trust in me you won't remain in the dark.
column3: Ia ant jiwia id dahm jewed k hab sha masma mo g tonlig am em‑wehhejed nani pi am tashogid g wohokam himdag. Kumt s‑ap wo himad g e‑doakag hab masma mam am tonlig ch ed mamtp ab wo ni‑hiwgad.

column2: I don't judge anyone who hears my words but doesn't do what I say. I came to save the world, not to judge it.
column3: Muꞌijj o pi ab hu ni‑kaiham ch pi ab hu ni‑hiwig. Nt wabshaba pi heg hekaj ia jiwia manis wo ha lodai. S‑ha ani doꞌibiamk.

column2: Anyone who rejects me and does not accept my words will be judged at the end-time judgment in accordance with what I have said.
column3: T wo e lodai g ni‑neꞌokikaj mat hekid wo i huhug g jewed.

column2: For I'm not speaking for myself but for my Father who sent me. He is the One who instructed me what to say and how to say it.
column3: Ni‑ohg o ab ni‑chehani mant haschu hab wo chei. Ni pi g hejel ni‑neꞌoki hab kaij.

column2: I know that what he told me to say brings eternal life—so whatever I say is what the Father told me.”
column3: Kumt heg hekaj ab wo kaiham k hab wo bei g pi ha huhugedam doakag. Heg ani waꞌi hab kaij mo g Jiosh ab ni‑chehani.” Neh, bad kaij g Jesus.

column2: It was the day before the Passover festival, and Jesus knew that the time had come to leave this world and go to his Father. He had loved those in the world who were his own, and he now demonstrated his complete and utter love for them.
column3: D am him k am i e ai matt baꞌich tash wo mua g kahwal mad k wo wuhshad g t‑shohshon ha‑doꞌibiadag. Kuki s‑mahch g Jesus mat am wa e ai matki ia wo dagito ihda jewed k wo hih am e‑ohg wui. D eda si pihk e elid wehs e‑doakagkaj ab ha wui hegam mat ab i s‑wohoch.

column2: It was during supper, and the devil had already put the thought of betraying Jesus into the mind of Judas, son of Simon Iscariot.
column3: D am e apꞌech matt am wo t‑gegos hema kih am gam hu i juhk. D wa eda heki hu ab i kaiha g Judas Iscariot g ge Jiawul k am i e shelch mat wo gagda g Jesus.

column2: Jesus knew that the Father had placed everything under his authority, and that he had come from God and was going back to God.
column3: Ab atsh Jiosh amjed ia jiwia g Jesus k ab wui ep wo i e nodagi. Kush g Jiosh ab wehs mahkch g gewkdag. D id s‑mahch g Jesus

column2: So Jesus stood up from eating supper, took off his robe and wrapped a towel around his waist.
column3: ch wabshaba am i kekiwua k am wuahawua g e‑lihwa k g tuayakaj ab e bahshodad

column2: He poured water into a basin and began to wash his disciples' feet, drying them with the towel he had wrapped around him.
column3: k am ge was wakonakud ch ed k ab i wapkonahi g t‑tahtad k heg hekaj ha dagio tuaya mat ab e bahshodad.

column2: He came to Simon Peter, who asked him, “Lord, are you going to wash my feet?”
column3: D ab i ai g Simon Peter. D heg si has e tahtk ch hab kaij, “Ih, napt wo wapko g ni‑tahtad k eda d ge ni‑kownalig!”

column2: Jesus replied, “You won't realize what I'm doing for you now. But one day you'll understand.”
column3: D hab kaij g Jesus ab wui, “Pi ap hi wa amichud hemuch mani haschu chum em‑tashogid id hekaj ch wabshaba wo wa amich imhab i baꞌich.”

column2: “No!” Peter protested. “You'll never wash my feet!”
column3: Kud hab hahawa kaij g Peter, “Pi apt hekid wo shaꞌi wapko g ni‑tahtad.”

column2: “Then, Lord, wash not just my feet but my hands and my head as well!” Simon Peter exclaimed.
column3: Kud hahawa si s‑hohtam hab kaij g Peter, “Ni‑kownalig, pi g heg waꞌi ni‑tahtad wapkon k wabshaba g ni‑nohnhoi ch ni‑wuhiosha ehp.”

column2: Jesus responded, “Those who have had a bath only need to wash their feet and then they're clean all over. You are clean—but not all of you.”  For he knew who was going to betray him. That's why he said, “Not all of you are clean.”
column3: D hab kaij g Jesus, “Heki apt hu e wako wehsko koi jiwiak. Heg at waꞌi e‑tahtad wo wapko hegai mat hedai heki hu wehsko e wako mat koi am hu wo jiwia kih t am. Id ani hab ahgch hab kaij mat g em‑dodakag wehs i e kegch, heg hi wa i hemako mat pi i e kegch.” Neh, bad kaij g Jesus no pi s‑mahch mat hedai wo gagda.

column2: After Jesus had washed their feet, he put his robe back on, and sat down. “Do you understand what I've done to you?” he asked them.
column3: T am i ha wapko g ha‑tahtad k ab uhpam wah g e‑lihwa k ga hu hahawa ep dahiwua mihsa wui k ab ha kakke, “Nam s‑amichud mant haschu ahgk hab em‑juni ihda?

column2: “You call me ‘Teacher’ and ‘Lord,’ and rightly so, for that's who I am.
column3: Neh, bam ni‑aꞌaga mani d em‑kownalig ch d em‑mashchamdam. K am wa s‑apꞌe no pi woho ihda.

column2: So if I, your Teacher and Lord, washed your feet, you ought to wash one another's feet.
column3: Dani wa chum em‑kownalig ch d em‑mashchamdam ch eda am i ni‑jumalkad k heg ni‑wepogi mani d wabsh em‑pionag. Pegih, mt ahpim hab wa masma ab aꞌai wo e neidad

column2: I have set you an example, so you should do just as I did.
column3: mant am em‑chehgi ch ab aꞌai wo i e wehmtad

column2: I tell you the truth, servants are not more important than their master, and the one sent is not greater than the sender.
column3: nam pi d ni‑pionag. Kut pi hebai g pion hab wo chum e elidad mas baꞌich d i si haꞌichu mo hi g ahmoj.

column2: Now that you understand these things, you will be blessed if you do them.
column3: M hahawa s‑mahch mamt has wo chum masmak. Kut d wo s‑ap tahhadkamk am em‑wehhejed mamtp woho hab wo masmak.

column2: I'm not talking about all of you—I know those I have chosen. But this is to fulfill Scripture: ‘The one who shares my food has turned against me.’
column3: “Mt wabshaba pi wehsijj ab hu wo bei ihda no pi an hab chuꞌig Jiosh oꞌohana ed mamt hema ab ni‑wui wo kekiwua ahpim mam ni‑wehm e gegosid. Kuni s‑mahch mat hedai hab wo e juh nani pi wehs s‑em‑mahch ahpim mant ab i em‑gawulkai.

column2: I'm telling you this now, before it happens, so when it does happen you will be convinced that I am who I am.
column3: Kuni heki hu ab em‑ahgid mat koi hab e juh. Kut hekid hab wo i e juh, mt ab haha wo s‑wohoch mani woho d Jiosh si Kehsha.

column2: I tell you the truth, whoever welcomes anyone I send welcomes me; and whoever welcomes me, welcomes the One who sent me.”
column3: Jiosh o ab ni‑mahkch g haꞌichu e‑ahga. Kuni ab epai em‑mahk. K heg hekaj ab s‑ap ni‑neid ch ab s‑ap neid g Jiosh hegam mat hedai ab wo s‑ap em‑neidad.”

column2: After he had said this, Jesus was deeply troubled, and declared: “I tell you the truth, one of you is going to betray me.”
column3: D am hahawa si e kudu g Jesus k hab t‑ahg, “Pi ant ap ni‑taht k wo em‑ahgi mamt hema ahpim wo ni‑gagda.”

column2: The disciples looked at each other, wondering which of them Jesus was talking about.
column3: Kuchd si has i t‑taht k ab wabsh aꞌai si t‑neid pi shaꞌi amichudch mas hedai hab ahg.

column2: The disciple whom Jesus loved was sitting next to Jesus at the table, leaning close him.
column3: Kunid eda an hugidaj an daha g Jesus ahni mo ni‑hekaj si pihk e elid.

column2: Simon Peter motioned to him to ask Jesus which one he was talking about.
column3: D hekaj g Simon Peter wabsh s‑aꞌagi ab ni‑ahgid mant wo kakke mas hedai hab ahg.

column2: So he leaned over to Jesus and asked, “Lord, who is it?”
column3: Kunid wabsh s‑aꞌagi ab epai kakke g Jesus mas hedai hab ahg.

column2: Jesus replied, “It's the one to whom I will give a piece of bread after I have dipped it.”
column3: D hab kaij ab ni‑wui, “Hegai mant wehpeg ab wo bih o d hegai.” Kud wa woho am ge bia g hidod k ab mah g Judas Iscariot.

column2: After dipping the piece of bread, he gave it to Judas, son of Simon Iscariot. Once Judas had taken the bread, Satan entered him. “What you're going to do, do it quickly,” Jesus told him.
column3: D am wabsh i chum huh g e‑bih. D g ge Jiawul am baꞌich i chikp eda.

column2: No one at the table understood what Jesus meant by this.
column3: Kuchd pi shaꞌi amichud mas haschu hab ahg ch hab kaij ihda.

column2: Since Judas was in charge of the money some of them thought that Jesus was telling him to go and buy what was needed for the Passover festival, or to donate something to the poor.
column3: D eda nuhkud g t‑lialiga hegai Judas. Kuchd heg hekaj haꞌi hab t‑ahg mo hab ahg mat ep wo ha nolawt g haꞌichu hugi heg wehhejed geꞌe gegosig o haꞌichu wo ha mah g shoꞌigkam.

column2: Judas left immediately after he'd taken the piece of bread, and went out into the night.
column3: D ha hekaj i wuhsh g Judas gam hu jeg ed. Kuki eda ab wabsh i si s‑chuhugam.

column2: After he'd left, Jesus said, “Now the Son of man is glorified, and through him God is glorified.
column3: D hab hahawa kaij g Jesus, “Neh, hemu at wehs wo e nahto hegai mat g Jiosh am i ni‑kei mant hab wo juh ia jewed dahm. Am ani wa chehgid g Jiosh gewkdag.

column2: If God is glorified through him, then God will glorify the Son himself, and will glorify him immediately.
column3: T g Jiosh heg hekaj am wo tashogi g ni‑gewkdag hemu s‑hohtam.

column2: My children, I will be with you only a little while longer. You will look for me, but I'm telling you now just as I told the Jews: you cannot come where I'm going.
column3: “Pegih neh, ahpim mani ab si em‑tatchua, pi ant shaꞌi tash ia hu wo e‑wehmajk nant pi gam hu wo hih. Kumt pi wo e nako mams wo ni‑cheh. Am ant hab ep wo chei em‑wui mani wa haschu ha ahgid g hemajkam mamt pi wo e nako mamt hejel am wo hihi mant hebai wo i hih.

column2: I am giving you a new command: Love one another. Love one another in the same way I have loved you.
column3: “Hemu ant ab wo em‑mah g wechij chehanig. K d ihda mamt ab aꞌai wo si pihk e elidad hab masma mani ahni hab em‑juhkch.

column2: If you love one another you will prove to everyone that you are my disciples.”
column3: Wehsijj at wo s‑mahchk mam ab i e dagitokch ni‑wui mamtp ab aꞌai wo si pihk e elidad.”

column2: Simon Peter asked him, “Where are you going, Lord?” Jesus answered, “You can't follow me now where I'm going. You will follow me later.”
column3: D hab kaij g Simon Peter, “A pt hebai wo hih, ni‑kownalig?”

column2: “Lord, why can't I follow you now?” Peter asked. “I'll lay down my life for you.”
column3: D hab kaij g Peter, “Nt haschu ahgk pi wo ni‑nako mant wo m‑oi hemuch? Ni‑nahtokch ani mant wo m‑wehhejed muh.”

column2: “Are you really ready to die for me? I tell you the truth: before the cock crows you will deny me three times,” Jesus replied.
column3: D hab kaij g Jesus, “Ab ant wo si shel m‑ahgi map pi woho e nahtokch mapt wo muh ni‑wehhejed. Neh, waikko apt hab wo waꞌi chei map pi shaꞌi ni‑mahch mat koi wo kuhu g keli chuchul.”

column2: “Don't let your minds be anxious. Trust in God, trust in me as well.
column3: D hab ep kaij g Jesus, “Pi g wo shaꞌi e kudut. Ab g wabsh i s‑wohochud mo an haꞌichug g Jiosh k ahni ab ep wo i s‑ni‑wohoch mani d si Kehshaj.

column2: In my Father's house there are many rooms. If this wasn't so I would have told you. I'm going to prepare a place for you.
column3: Am o wiꞌis ni‑ohg kihdag ed am wehs ha wehhejed g ni‑wohochuddam. Nt wo wa chum em‑ahgi matp pi am hu wo wiꞌisk. Nt am wo him k am wo i apꞌech em‑wehhejed

column2: Once I've gone and prepared a place for you, I will come again and take you with me, so that you can be there with me too.
column3: k ia ep wo jiwia k ia wo em‑ui mamt an wo ni‑wehmajk.

column2: You know the way to where I'm going.”
column3: S‑mahch am mamt has masma am wo hihi amai mant am wo hih.”

column2: Thomas said to him, “Lord, we don't know where you're going. How can we know the way?”
column3: D hab kaij g Thomas ab wui, “Ih, ni‑kownalig, pi ach shaꞌi mahch maps hebai wo hih ch hab pi mahch machs has masma wo dada.”

column2: Jesus replied, “I am the way and the truth and the life. No one comes to the Father except through me.
column3: D hab kaij g Jesus ab wui, “Ab amt wo ni‑hiwgad. Nt ahni an wo waꞌi em‑uꞌapa anai ni‑ohg kihdag ed. Id o heg wa wepo mani d am wui himdam wohg em‑wehhejed ch d Jiosh wohokam ch d m‑wechij doakag.

column2: If you had known me, you would know my Father as well. From now on, you do know him and you have seen him.”
column3: Matp hedai woho s‑ap wo s‑ni‑mahchk ch hab wa masma wo s‑mahchk g ni‑ohg. Neid am g ni‑ohg nam pi ni‑neid.”

column2: Philip said, “Lord, show us the Father, and we'll be convinced.”
column3: D hab kaij g Philip ab wui, “Pegih, t‑kownalig, am g t‑chehgid g e‑ohg. Heg ach waꞌi tatchua.”

column2: Jesus replied, “Have I been with you such a long time, Philip, and yet you still don't know me? Anyone who has seen me has seen the Father. How can you say, ‘Show us the Father’?
column3: D hab kaij g Jesus ab wui, “Tash ani ia em‑wehmaj. Kupki eda pi woho ap ni‑mahch, ahpi Philip. Hegai mo hedai i ni‑neid ch hab masma ep neid g ni‑ohg. P haschu ahgch ab ni‑tahni mant wo em‑chehgi g ni‑ohg?

column2: Don't you believe that I live in the Father and the Father lives in me? The words I speak are not mine; it's the Father living in me who is doing his work.
column3: Ahni kch ni‑ohg ach d hemako. Kupki pi koi ab hu s‑wohochud ihda.”

column2: Believe me when I tell you that I live in the Father, and the Father lives in me, or at least believe because of the evidence provided by all that I've done.
column3: Ab g wo s‑wohochud mach d hemako g ni‑ohg wehm heg wabsh hekaj mani am em‑ahgid, o amtp pi wo e nako hab masma k wo s‑wohoch mach d hemako heg hekaj s‑hasig haꞌichu mani hab junihim.

column2: I tell you the truth, anyone who trusts in me will do the same things I am doing. In fact they will do even greater things because I am going to the Father.
column3: Nt wo si shel em‑ahgi matp hedai ab wo s‑ni‑wohochud k wo e nako mat hab wo junihid g s‑hasig haꞌichu hab masma mani ahni, pej baꞌich i geꞌe hab wo juh g s‑hasig haꞌichu nant pi ahni hi wo hih am ni‑ohg wui.

column2: I'll do whatever you ask in my name, so that the Father may be glorified through the Son.
column3: Kunt am hab wo em‑juni mamtp haschu ab wo i tai g ni‑ohg am ni‑chehchegk. T heg hekaj g hemajkam ab wo si hehgchul g ni‑ohg Jiosh.

column2: Whatever you ask for in my name, I will do it.
column3: Pegih, mt haschu ab wo i tai g ni‑ohg am ni‑chehchegk, nt ahni hab wo juh.

column2: If you love me, you will keep my commands.
column3: “Am g hab wo junihid g ni‑chehanig mamtp woho ab wo si ni‑tatchuad.

column2: I will ask the Father, and he will give you another Comforter,
column3: Nt ab wo tai g ni‑ohg mat ab wo em‑mah g Hekia S‑apꞌekam Gewkdag. T heg chum hekid wo em‑wehmajk ch am wo i em‑tashogidad g wohokam.

column2: the Spirit of truth, who will always be with you. The world cannot accept him because it isn't looking for him and does not know him. But you know him because he lives with you and will be in you.
column3: Pi o ta neidagma g Hekia S‑apꞌekam Gewkdag. T heg hekaj pi wo shaꞌi e nako mas wo s‑mahchk hegam mo pi ni‑mahch. M wabshaba ahpim hi s‑mahch no pi em‑wehmaj hemu ch am wo e ul em‑doakag ed.

column2: I will not abandon you like orphans: I will come back to you.
column3: “Pi ant ia hu hejel wo em‑dagito k wabshaba ia wo wa em‑wehm haꞌichugk am i dahm mant im hu wo uhpam hih.

column2: Soon the world will not see me anymore, but you will see me. Because I live, you will live too.
column3: Kumt wo s‑mahchk mant ia wo em‑wehmajk. T wabshaba hegam mo pi ab hu ni‑wohochud pi wo mahchk mani ia haꞌichug nat pi pi wo ni‑neidad. Kumt d wo wechij dodakamk ab ni‑amjed heg waꞌi hekaj mant ab wo i wuhsh muhkig amjed k d ep wo doakamk.

column2: On that day you will know that I live in the Father, you live in me, and I live in you.
column3: Iaꞌi amjed amt wo s‑mahchk mach d hemako g ni‑ohg wehm k ch ep wo s‑mahchk mamt ahpim ab i e hemakoj ni‑wehm.

column2: Those who keep my commands are the ones who love me, those who love me will be loved by my Father. I will love them too, and will reveal myself to them.”
column3: “Am o e chehgid mo ab si ni‑tatchua hegam matp hedai ab wo bei g ni‑chehanig k hab wo junihid. Kunt ab ha wui wo si pihk ni‑elidad g ni‑ohg wehm ch ab ha wui wo i ni‑tashogi.”

column2: Judas (not Iscariot) responded, “Lord, why would you reveal yourself to us and not to the world?”
column3: D hab kaij g Judas, hi wa pi hegai Judas Iscariot, “T‑kownalig, pt has masma ahchim waꞌi t‑wui wo i e tashogid k pi ab hu wehs hemajkam ha wui?”

column2: Jesus replied, “Those who love me will do as I say. My Father will love them, and we will come and make our home with them.
column3: D hab kaij g Jesus ab wui, “Hegai mo hedai ab si ni‑tatchua at wo wohog el g haꞌichu ni‑ahga. Kut hahawa ab wui wo si pihk e elidad g ni‑ohg. Kutt g ni‑ohg wehm am haha wo i t‑maskogi wui k am wo wehmajkad.

column2: Those who don't love me don't do what I say. These words don't come from me, they come from the Father who sent me.
column3: Pi at ab hu wo wohog el g haꞌichu ni‑ahga hegai mat pi ab hu wo ni‑tatchua. K eda g ni‑ohg d amjedkam ihda haꞌichu ni‑ahga.

column2: I'm explaining this to you while I'm still here with you.
column3: “Id ani hi wa em‑ahgid hemuch mani ia em‑wehmaj.

column2: But when the Father sends the Comforter, the Holy Spirit, in my place, he will teach you everything and remind you of all that I told you.
column3: T g ni‑ohg ab haha wo cheha g Hekia S‑apꞌekam Gewkdag mat heg am wo i em‑wehmajk am ni‑wehhejed ch wo em‑gewkemhunad ch wo em‑mashcha mani haschu i s‑em‑mashchamamk ch hab wo em‑juh mamt wehs haꞌichu wo s‑chegitok mani haschu i em‑ahgid.

column2: Peace I leave you; my peace I'm giving you. The peace I give you is nothing like what the world gives. Don't let your minds be anxious, and don't be afraid.
column3: “Am g wabsh wo i s‑ap e tahtkkad. Ab ant wo i em‑mah hegai hab mahs s‑ap tahhadkam mani ahni edgid. Pi at hedai wo e nako mat hab mahs s‑ap tahhadkam wo em‑mah. Pi g wo shaꞌi e kudutad ch pi haꞌichu wo ehbidad.

column2: You've heard me tell you, ‘I am going away, but I will come back to you.’ If you really loved me, you would be happy because I'm going to the Father, for the Father is greater than I.
column3: “Am am wa ni‑kah mani wa hab kaij mant gam hu wo hih ab em‑amjed k wabshaba ia wo wa ep em‑wehmajk. Ni‑ohg o baꞌich i s‑gewkdag mani ahni. Kumt heg hekaj wo chum si s‑hehgigkad mant im hu uhpam wo hih wui mamt hems g wehs e‑ihbdagkaj ab wo ni‑tatchuad.

column2: I've explained this to you now before it happens so that when it does happen you will be convinced.
column3: Id ani em‑ahgid mat koi hab e juh. Mt hab ab wo i s‑wohoch g haꞌichu ni‑ahga mat hekid hab wo i e juh.

column2: I can't talk to you much longer, for the prince of this world is coming. He has no power to control me,
column3: “Hemu at am geꞌe wo chehgi g e‑gewkdag g jijawul ha‑geꞌejig no pi chum e kownalchud ia jewed dahm. K heg hekaj pi am hu geꞌe s‑ni‑apꞌe mant tash am haꞌichukaj wo em‑wehm neo. K eda pi uꞌukch g gewkdag mas hab wo ni‑juh manis ab wecho wo i ni‑ul.

column2: but I'm doing what my Father told me to do so that the world will know that I love the Father. Now get up. Let's go.”
column3: Wehs ani hab junihim mo haschu ab i ni‑chehani g ni‑ohg. K hab masma s‑mahch g hemajkam mani ab si tatchua g ni‑ohg.

column2: “I am the true vine, and my Father is the gardener.
column3: D hab ep kaij g Jesus, “Dach waꞌi hemako hab masma mo g uhdwis jeꞌe d hemako g e‑iꞌibhonig wehm. Ahni ani heg wepogidas mo g uhdwis shon waꞌug. M ahpim heg wepogidas iꞌibhonigaj. K g ni‑ohg t‑nuhkud.

column2: He cuts off every one of my branches that doesn't bear fruit. He prunes every branch that bears fruit so it can bear even more.
column3: Hegai iꞌibhonigaj at ab wo chum bahidagt. Mt ahpim hab waꞌap s‑kehg haꞌichu hab wo chum junidahid g Jiosh. Eꞌes nuhkuddam at an wo si hikkumia hegai iꞌibhonig mat pi ab hu wo bahidagt k wo i kegch hegai mat ab wo bahidagt. T hab baꞌich i muꞌi ab wo bahidagt.

column2: You are already pruned and made clean  through what I've told you.
column3: “Heki am hu kegchudas ahpim mam ab kaiham ch ab s‑wohog elid g haꞌichu ni‑ahga.

column2: Remain in me, and I will remain in you. Just as a branch cannot produce fruit unless it remains part of the vine, so it is for you: you cannot bear fruit unless you remain in me.
column3: Pi g gam hu hab wo shaꞌi i e juhni ab ni‑amjed. Nt ahni hab wa masma pi gam hu hab wo i ni‑juh ab em‑amjed. Mt hab s‑ap hab wo juh haꞌichu k s‑ap hab wo masmak hab masma mo hegai iꞌibhonig mat s‑ap ab wo bahidagt ab giꞌikch e‑waꞌug ab.

column2: I'm the vine, you're the branches. Those who remain in me, and I in them, will produce much fruit—for apart from me you can't do anything.
column3: “Pi at ab hu wo bahidagt g iꞌibhonig pi ab hu giꞌikch e‑waꞌug ab. Mt ahpim hab waꞌap pi wo e nako mamt haꞌichu s‑kehg hab wo juh mamt gam hu hab wo i e juh ab ni‑amjed.

column2: Anyone who doesn't remain in me is like a branch that is thrown out and dries up. Such branches are gathered together, thrown into the fire and burned.
column3: Hegai iꞌibhonig mat wo e hikkumia at am wo i e hemapad k wo e mei. Neh, id o hab mahs matp hedai gam hu hab wo i e juh ab ni‑amjed k ab wo e ahijidach mat hahawa pi haꞌichu wehhejed wo s‑kehgajk am Jiosh wehhejed.

column2: If you remain in me, and my words remain in you, then you can ask for whatever you want, and it will be given you.
column3: Ab ant wo i em‑mah mamt haschu ab wo i ni‑tai mamtp ab wo s‑wohog elidad g haꞌichu ni‑ahga ch ab wo ni‑hiwgad.

column2: My Father is glorified as you produce much fruit, proving you are my disciples.
column3: Hegam matp hedai woho ab i e dagitokch ni‑wui at muꞌi haꞌichu hab wo junihid ni‑wehhejed. T heg hekaj ab wo hehgchul g hemajkam g ni‑ohg Jiosh.

column2: As the Father loved me, so I have loved you. Remain in my love.  If you do what I say, you will remain in my love, just as I do what my Father says and remain in his love.
column3: “Bani masma si em‑tatchua ch si pihk em‑elid mo hab masma si ni‑tatchua g ni‑ohg. Ab ani si s‑wohog elid g ni‑ohg. Ch ab aꞌai si pihk t‑elid. Kumt ahpim hab waꞌap ab wo s‑ni‑wohog elidad. Tt ab aꞌai wo si pihk t‑elidad.

column2: I've explained this to you so that my joy may be in you and that your joy may be complete.
column3: Id ani em‑ahgid mamt wo bei g s‑hehgig am hab junihidch g ni‑chehanig hab masma mani ahni s‑hehgig am hab junihidch g ni‑ohg chehanig.

column2: This is my command: love one another as I have loved you.
column3: Ab ani em‑chehani mamt ab aꞌai wo pihk e elidad hab masma mani ahni has i masma si pihk em‑elid.

column2: There is no greater love than to give your life for your friends.
column3: Hegai matp hedai wo e muhkid ha wehhejed g e‑naipijju o d hegai mo woho si pihk e elid ha hekaj.

column2: You're my friends if you do what I tell you.
column3: Ahpim am d ni‑naipijju mamtp hab wo junihid g ni‑chehanig.

column2: I don't call you servants any longer, for servants are not taken into their master's confidence. I call you friends, for everything my Father told me I've explained to you.
column3: Kuni hahawa pi hab em‑aꞌaga mam d wabsh ni‑pionag ch wabshaba hab em‑aꞌaga mam d ni‑naipijju nani pi ab em‑ahgid wehs haꞌichu mani ab kah ni‑ohg amjed. Neh, mo hema d wabsh pionag ch pi mahch mo haschu am hab i wua g ahmo.

column2: You didn't choose me, I chose you. I have given you the responsibility to go and produce lasting fruit. So the Father will give you whatever you ask in my name.
column3: Pi amt hejel e elid k am wo i gegokiwua ni‑wehhejed. Ahni ant am i em‑chuhcha mamt am wo hihim k hab wo juh g geꞌe chikpan. Kut pi hekid wo huhug hegai mamt hab wo juh. T g ni‑ohg am hab wo em‑juni mamtp haschu ab wo i tai am ni‑chehchegch.

column2: This is my command to you: love one another.
column3: Pegih, id ani ab em‑chehani mamt ab aꞌai wo pihk e elidad.”

column2: If the world hates you, remember that it hated me before it hated you.
column3: D hab ep kaij g Jesus, “Mt wo s‑chegitok mo ahni wehpeg s‑ni‑kehꞌid hegam mo pi ab hu tatchua g Jiosh ch hab waꞌap wo s‑em‑kehꞌidad.

column2: If you were part of this world, it would love you as its own. But you're not part of the world, and I chose you out of the world—that's why the world hates you.
column3: Ab at wo em‑tatchua mamtp hems pi ab hu wo tatchua g Jiosh. Nt wabshaba ab si em‑gawulkai ab ha amjed. Kum pi ha wepo chegito haꞌichu. K hekaj hab s‑em‑kehꞌid.

column2: Remember what I told you: servants aren't more important than their master. If they persecuted me, they will persecute you too. If they did what I told them, they will do what you tell them too.  But everything they do to you will be because of me, for they don't know the One who sent me.
column3: Mt wo s‑chegitok mani wa hab em‑ahgid mat pi hebai g pion hab wo chum e elidad mas baꞌich d i ge haꞌichu mo g e‑ahmo. T wo em‑shoꞌigch hegam mo ni‑shoꞌigchud. Kut ab wo s‑em‑wohog el hegam mo ab s‑ni‑wohog elid. Hegam mo pi mahch g ni‑ohg o ni‑shoꞌigchud ch hab waꞌap wo em‑shoꞌigchudad nam pi ab ni‑wui e dagitokch.

column2: If I hadn't come and spoken to them, they wouldn't be guilty of sin—but now they have no excuse for their sin.  Anyone who hates me hates my Father as well.  If I had not given them such a demonstration through things that no one had ever done before, they wouldn't be guilty of sin, but despite seeing all this they hated both me and my Father.
column3: Ia ant jiwia ha wui k am ha ahgi ab amjed g ni‑ohg k am ha chehgi g s‑hasig chikpan mat pi hedai hekid hab juh. K wabshaba s‑ni‑kehꞌid. K heg hekaj tasho mo s‑kehꞌid g ni‑ohg. Kut hab masma mahsko wua g pi ap e‑chuꞌijig.

column2: But this just fulfilled what Scripture says, ‘They hated me for no reason at all.’
column3: An o hab chuꞌig Jiosh oꞌohana ed mat wo s‑ni‑kehꞌidad pi haschu shaꞌi ahgk. Kut wa woho hab e juh.

column2: But I will send you the Comforter from the Father. When he comes, he will give evidence about me. He is the Spirit of truth who comes from the Father.
column3: “Ab ant wo cheha g Hekia S‑apꞌekam Gewkdag mat am wo em‑wehmajk. Heg o am wehmaj g Jiosh ch ab em‑wui wo him k wo em‑wehmajkad ch am wo i em‑gewkemhunad ch am wo haꞌichu em‑tashogidad ab ni‑amjed.

column2: You will also give evidence about me because you were with me from the beginning.
column3: Kumt ahpim wo i ahgahi ab ni‑amjed nam pi ni‑wehmajkahim ga hu i amjed mant am i shonwuich g ni‑chikpan.”

column2: I've told you this so you won't give up your trust in me.
column3: D hab ep kaij g Jesus, “Am ani em‑ahgid ihda mamt heg hekaj pi wo ni‑dagito.

column2: They will expel you from the synagogues—in fact the time is coming when those who kill you will think they are doing God a service.
column3: T wo i em‑wuwhas ab amjed g cheopi. K ab him g tash mamt wo em‑muꞌa k hab wo e ahgad mat wehhejed hab juh g Jiosh.

column2: They'll do this because they have never known the Father or me. I've told you this so that when these things happen, you'll remember what I told you.
column3: Id amt hab wo em‑juh heg hekaj mo pi ni‑mahch ch ep pi mahch g ni‑ohg.

column2: I didn't need to tell you this right at the beginning because I was going to be with you.
column3: Mt wabshaba wo s‑chegitok mani id am em‑ahgid mat hekid hab wo i e juh.”

column2: But now I'm going to the One who sent me, and yet not one of you is asking me, ‘Where are you going?’
column3: K wabshaba hemu e aihim mant uhpam wo hih am ni‑ohg wui. M eda pi ab hu shaꞌi s‑ni‑kakkeimk manis hebai wo hih

column2: Of course, now that I've told you, you're full of grief.
column3: ch wabsh pi ap e tahtk s‑mahchok mant gam hu wo hih.

column2: But I'm telling you the truth: it's better for you that I go away, for if I don't the Comforter won't come to you. If I go away, I will send him to you.
column3: T eda pi ab hu wo i hih g Hekia S‑apꞌekam Gewkdag em‑wui nt hoꞌip gam hu hih. K heg hekaj baꞌich i s‑apꞌe mant gm hu wo hih.

column2: When he comes, he will convince those in the world that they have wrong ideas regarding sin, what's right, and judgment:
column3: T ab haha wo i hih g Hekia S‑apꞌekam Gewkdag k am wo i ha tashogi g hemajkam g s‑apꞌekam ch pi apꞌekam ch Jiosh lodaita.

column2: Sin, for they don't trust in me.  What is right, for I'm going to the Father and you won't see me any longer.
column3: Ni‑ohg at ab wo ni‑haꞌichuch mant am wui wo him k pi ia hu wo haꞌichugk. T g Hekia S‑apꞌekam Gewkdag heg hekaj wo wohokamch am ha wui g hemajkam mani d s‑apꞌekam am Jiosh nena ed k ep wo wohokamch mo hab junihim g pi apꞌekam mo eda pi ab hu ni‑wohochud

column2: Judgment, for the ruler of this world has been condemned.
column3: k ep wo wohokamch mat wo e lodai hegam mo hab junihim g pi apꞌekam nat pi am wa e ai mat g Jiosh wo lodai g ge Jiawul.

column2: There's much more I want to explain to you, but you couldn't stand it now.
column3: “Muꞌi ani haꞌichu ep s‑em‑ahgidamk. Mt wabshaba pi wo e nako mamt wo s‑amich mant wo chum em‑ahgi hemuch.

column2: However, when the Spirit of truth comes, he will teach you the whole truth. He doesn't speak for himself, but he only says what he hears, and he will tell you what's going to happen.  He brings me glory for he teaches you whatever he receives from me.
column3: Hekia S‑apꞌekam Gewkdag at am wo i em‑tashogi g wohokam k am ep wo i em‑ahgi mat haschu has wo e juh imhab em‑baꞌich. Nt am wo ahgi mat has wo chei. Kut am wo em‑tashogid k hab ab wo si ni‑haꞌichuch.

column2: All that belongs to the Father is mine. This is why I said that the Spirit teaches you whatever he receives from me.
column3: Wehs g ni‑ohg gewkdag o d ep ni‑gewkdag. Ni hekaj hab kaij mat g Hekia S‑apꞌekam Gewkdag am wo i em‑tashogi mani haschu ab i ahgid.”

column2: In a little while you won't see me anymore, but then a little while after that you will see me.”
column3: D hab ep kaij g Jesus, “Do shaꞌi haꞌas, mt pi an hu wo ni‑neidad, ch am ep wo shaꞌi haꞌas, mt hahawa ep wo ni‑neidad.”

column2: Some of his disciples said to one another, “What does he mean, ‘In a little while you won't see me, but a little while after that you will see me’? and ‘For I'm going to the Father’?”
column3: Kuchd hab kaij ab aꞌai t‑wui, “Shahchu o hab ahg ch hab kaij mas wo shaꞌi haꞌas, tt pi an hu wo neidad, ch am ep wo shaꞌi haꞌas, tt ep wo neidad. K wa hab ep kaij mat wo hih am e‑ohg wui.

column2: They were asking, “What does he mean by ‘in a little while’? We don't know what he's talking about.”
column3: Pi ach shaꞌi amichud mo haschu hab ahg ch hab kaij.”

column2: Jesus realized that they wanted to ask him about this. So he asked them, “Are you wondering about my comment, ‘In a little while you won't see me, but a little while after that you will see me’?
column3: D s‑mahch g Jesus machd ab s‑kakkeimk ch hekaj hab kaij, “Pi am shaꞌi amichud mani haschu hab ahg ch hab kaij mat wo shaꞌi haꞌas, mt pi wo ni‑neidad, ch am ep wo shaꞌi haꞌas, mt ep wo ni‑neidad.

column2: I tell you the truth, you will weep and mourn, but the world will rejoice. You will grieve, but your grief will turn into joy.
column3: Pegih, nt wo haꞌichu em‑ahgi mat woho hab wo e juh. Mt wo si pi ap e taht k wo si shoanid. T g s‑ni‑kehꞌiddam wabsh wo si s‑hehgigk. T amjed haꞌichu hab wo e juh mat ab wo em‑mah g si geꞌe s‑hehgig.

column2: A woman in labor suffers pain because her time has come, but once the baby is born, she forgets the agony because of the joy that a child has been brought into the world.
column3: Neh, s‑mahch am mat has wo e juh mat hekid wo e ai mat wo mahmadho g uwi. T wo pi ap e taht mat wo nako g s‑koꞌok. T wabshaba am wo i mahsi g ali. T am wabsh wo i pi chegito g s‑koꞌok heg hekaj mo si s‑hehgig mat an i e mahsid g ali.

column2: Yes, you're grieving now, but I will see you again; and you will rejoice, and no one can take away your joy.
column3: Bo wa masma am em‑tahgio mam hemuch pi ap e taht. Nt wabshaba ab ep wo ni‑chehgi em‑wui. Kumt haha wo si s‑hehgigk. T pi hedai wo shaꞌi padch hegai hab mahs s‑hehgig em‑wehhejed.
