column2: When that time comes you won't need to ask me for anything. I tell you the truth, the Father will give you whatever you ask in my name.
column3: “Mt hahawa pi ab hu wo ge ni‑kaiamad haꞌichu ch wabshaba ab wo e hoꞌigeꞌidahunad ch ab wo kakke g ni‑ohg am ni‑chehchegch. T wa woho wo em‑mah.

column2: Until now you haven't asked for anything in my name, so ask and you shall receive, and your happiness will be complete.
column3: Pi am koi hekid ni‑chehcheg am e hoꞌigeꞌidahunch. Am g hab wo i e juhni. T g ni‑ohg am hab wo em‑juni. T ab wo si e shuhdad g em‑doakag g s‑hehgigkaj.”

column2: I've been talking to you using picture language. But soon I won't use such picture language any more when I speak to you. Instead I'll explain the Father to you very plainly.
column3: D hab ep kaij g Jesus, “Am ani haꞌichu i chum em‑tashogid g haꞌichu wepogida ahgakaj. Ab o him g tash mant hahawa si tasho wo em‑ahgi ab amjed g ni‑ohg.

column2: At that time you will ask in my name. I'm not saying to you that I will plead with the Father on your behalf,
column3: T ab haha wo em‑abk mamt ab wo i e hoꞌigeꞌidahunad ni‑ohg wui am ni‑chehchegch. Pi amt heg wo waꞌi hiwgad manis ahni am wo waꞌi ni‑hoꞌigeꞌidahunad em‑wehhejed.

column2: for the Father himself loves you—because you love me and believe that I came from God.
column3: Ni‑ohg o ab si em‑tatchua nam pi ab si ni‑tatchua ch ab s‑wohochud mant ia jiwia ab amjed g Jiosh.

column2: I left the Father and came into the world; now I leave the world and return to my Father.”
column3: Ia ant woho jiwia ab amjed g ni‑ohg id dahm jewed. T e ai mant uhpam ep wo hih am ni‑ohg wui.”

column2: Then the disciples said, “Now you're talking very plainly and not using picture language.
column3: Kuchd ab wui hab kaij, “Nehꞌe, hemuch ap si tasho am ahg haꞌichu ch pi hekaj g wepogida haꞌichu ahga.

column2: Now we're certain that you know everything, and that in order to know what questions people are thinking you don't need to ask them. This convinces us that you came from God.”
column3: Ch hahawa s‑mahch map wehs haꞌichu s‑mahch. Pi o hab hahawa mahs machs hedai ab wo ge haꞌichu m‑kakke. Ch hekaj hahawa s‑wohochud map ab amjed g Jiosh.”

column2: “Are you really convinced now?” Jesus asked.
column3: D hab kaij g Jesus, “Nam hig hab elid mam id woho s‑wohochud?

column2: “The time is coming—in fact it's just about to happen—when you will be scattered, each of you to your own homes, leaving me all alone. But I'm not really alone, for the Father is with me.
column3: Ab o e aihim mamt gam hu aꞌai wo si e gantad k gam hu uhpam wo hihi e‑kihki wui ia hejel ni‑dagitok. Ni wabshaba pi hejelig. Ni‑ohg o chum hekid ni‑wehmaj.

column2: I've told you all this so that you may have peace because you are one with me. You will suffer in this world, but be brave—I have defeated the world!”
column3: “Wehs ani em‑ahgid ihda mamt heg hekaj wo si s‑ap e tahtkkad. T wo em‑shoꞌigch hegam mo pi ab hu tatchua g Jiosh. Mt wabshaba am wo si e gewpkai nant pi heki hu s‑ap wo em‑gewitojel g pi apꞌekam.”

column2: When Jesus finished saying this he looked up to heaven and said, “Father, the time has come. Glorify your Son so that the Son may glorify you.
column3: D am i kuhgi g Jesus g haꞌichu e‑ahga k am i nea dahm kahchim wui k am e hoꞌigeꞌidahun k hab kaij, “Ni‑ohg, ia at i e ai g ni‑tashga. Ab g uhpam ni‑mahki hegai ni‑gewkdag mani wa an uꞌukch m‑hugid an. Nt ab haha wo si has m‑elid k wo mahsko wua g m‑gewkdag.

column2: For you gave him authority over all people so that he might give eternal life to all those you have given to him.
column3: Ab apt i ni‑mah g gewkdag am wehs ha dahm g hemajkam. Kut haꞌi ab ni‑wui e dagito no pi d m‑hemajkamga. K hab d m‑elida mant wo ha mah g pi ha huhugedam doakag.

column2: Eternal life is this: to know you, the only true God, and Jesus Christ whom you sent.
column3: Dap wohokam Jiosh ch am i ni‑kei mant ia wo jiwia jewed dahm. Kut wehs wo bei g pi ha huhugedam doakag hegam mat wo s‑t‑mahchk.

column2: I have brought glory to you here on earth by completing the work you gave me to do.
column3: Ia ant ha chehgi g hemajkam g m‑gewkdag k nahto hegai chikpan mapt ab i ni‑cheha mant hab wo juh.

column2: Now Father, glorify me in your presence with the glory I had with you before the beginning of the world.
column3: Pegih, ni‑ohg, ab g uhpam ni‑be k ep wo ni‑mah hegai ni‑gewkdag mani wa edgid an m‑hugid an matt eda koi an hu nahto g jewed.

column2: I have revealed your character to those you gave me out of the world. They belonged to you; you gave them to me; and they have done what you said.
column3: “Ab apt ni‑wui i ha gawulkai idam chechoj mo ia ni‑wehmaj. K d m‑hemajkamga. Am ani i m‑mahtchulid ha wui ch ha ahgid g haꞌichu m‑ahga. Kut ab s‑wohog elid

column2: Now they know that everything you have given me comes from you.
column3: k hahawa s‑mahch mo wehs g ni‑mahchig ab d m‑amjedkam.

column2: I have given them the message that you gave me. They accepted it, completely convinced that I came from you, and they believed that you sent me.
column3: Ab ap ni‑mahkch g haꞌichu e‑ahga. Kuni am ha ahgid. T ab i s‑wohochud k heg hekaj s‑mahch mani ab d m‑amjedkam.

column2: I'm praying for them—not for the world, but for those you gave me, for they belong to you.
column3: “Idam o d m‑hemajkamga. Kuni heg hekaj am ha wehhejed ni‑hoꞌigeꞌidahun ch pi ha wehhejed hegam mat pi ab hu wo m‑tatchua.

column2: All who belong to me are yours, and those who belong to you are mine, and I have been glorified through them.
column3: Hegam o d waꞌi m‑hemajkamga mat ab wo ni‑hiw mant wo ha doꞌibia. T g ni‑gewkdag ab wo e chehgi ha ab.

column2: I am leaving the world, but they will remain in the world; I am coming to you. Holy Father, protect them in your name, the name that you gave to me, so that they may be one, just as we are one.
column3: T hemuch e ai mant wo hih am m‑wui k pi ia hu haha wo haꞌichugk id dahm jewed. T wabshaba idam ia hu wo haꞌichugk. Kuni ab m‑tahni mapt wo ha nuhkudad, ni‑ohg. Dap hekia s‑apꞌekam. Kut ab wo m‑ihmad ch hab d wo hemakok hab masma mach ahchim d hemako.

column2: While I was with them, I protected them in your name that you gave to me. I watched over them so that no one was lost except the ‘son of the lost,’ so Scripture was fulfilled.
column3: Ia ani ha nuhkudahim mat ab wo m‑ihmad. Kut heg waꞌi pi e doꞌibia mo an oꞌohanas matki hab wo e juh.

column2: Now I'm coming to you, and I say these things while I am still here in the world so they may share completely in my joy.
column3: “Id ani hab kaij mani ia wabsh kia ha wehmaj ch koi ab hu m‑wui hih mant hekaj ab wo si ha mah g s‑ap tahhadkam.

column2: I gave them your message, and the world hated them because they are not of the world, just as I'm not of the world.
column3: Ab ant ha ahgi g haꞌichu m‑ahga. T ab i s‑ni‑wohochud k ab ni‑hiwig ch ab i e gawulkai ha amjed hegam mo pi ab hu m‑tatchua. K hegam heg hekaj s‑ha kehꞌid.

column2: I'm not asking you to take them out of the world, but for you to protect them from the Evil One.
column3: Pi ani heg hab ahg maps ia wo i ha wuwhas ab amjed g jewed ch wabshaba hab ahg mapt wo ha nuhkudad. T hab pi gm hu wo i ha nuꞌichshul g ge Jiawul.

column2: They are not of the world, just as I'm not of the world.
column3: Ab o gawulkdas idam pi apꞌekam t amjed hab masma mani ahni.

column2: Make them holy by the truth; your word is truth.
column3: Ab g i ha gawulkad e wehhejed heg hekaj haꞌichu e‑ahga. Haꞌichu m‑ahga o d wohokam.

column2: Just as you sent me into the world, I have sent them into the world.
column3: Am apt i ni‑kei mant ia wo ahgad g haꞌichu m‑ahga jewed dahm. Kunt hab wa masma am i ha chuhcha.

column2: I dedicate myself for them so that they may also be truly holy.
column3: Ab ant si i ni‑dagito m‑wui mat idam wo s‑mahchk g wohokam ch hekaj ab hab waꞌap wo i e dagito m‑wui.

column2: I'm not only praying for them, I'm also praying for those who trust in me because of their message.
column3: “Pi ani idam waꞌi ha wehhejed ni‑hoꞌigeꞌidahun ch wabshaba hegam ehp mat ab wo i s‑wohoch g haꞌichu ha‑ahga k ab wo i e dagito ni‑wui.

column2: I pray that they all may be one, just as you, Father, live in me, and I live in you, so that they too may live in us so that the world will believe you did send me.
column3: Id o d haꞌichu ni‑tahnig mat wehs am wo i e hemakoch hab masma mach ahchim d hemako. Kut hab wo s‑mai g hemajkam map d ahpi ch am i ni‑kei mant ia wo jiwia.

column2: I have given them the glory that you gave me, so that they may be one, just as we are one.
column3: M‑gewkdag o d ep ni‑gewkdag nach pi d hemako. Kuni ab ha mahkch g t‑gewkdag mat t‑wehm d wo hemakok.

column2: I live in them, and you live in me. May they be completely one, so the whole world will know that you did send me, and that you love them, just as you love me.
column3: Dani hemako ha wehm hab masma mach ahchim d hemako. T hab wehs s‑ap d wo hemakok idam. T heg hekaj wo s‑mai g hemajkam mapt am i ni‑kei mant ia wo jiwia jewed dahm k ep wo s‑mai map ab si ha tatchua idam hab masma map ahni.

column2: Father, I want those you have given me to be with me where I am, so they can see the glory which you gave to me—for you loved me before the world was created.
column3: “Ni‑ohg, ab apt i ni‑mah idam mo ab si ni‑tatchua. Kuni si tatchua mat am wo ni‑wehmajk anai mant anai wok. An apt ni‑mah g si s‑kehg apꞌedag nap pi si ni‑tatchua mat eda koi e nahto g jewed. Kuni ab m‑tahni mat idam am wo ni‑wehmajk ch heg wo neidad map haschu ab ni‑mahkch.

column2: Good Father, the world does not know you, but I know you, and these here with me know that you sent me.
column3: Dap hekia s‑apꞌekam, ni‑ohg. K pi hi wa chum m‑mahch hegam mo pi ab hu m‑tatchua. Ni wabshaba ahni s‑m‑mahch. K idam ep s‑mahch mapt am i ni‑kei.

column2: I have revealed your character to them and will continue to make it known, so that the love you have for me will be in them, and I will live in them.”
column3: Am ant m‑mahtchul ha wui k am baꞌich wo i m‑mahtchul ha wui. T hab wo si pihk e elidad ni‑hekaj hab masma map ahpi. Nt ahni am wo i ni‑hemakoch ha wehm.”

column2: After Jesus had finished speaking, he and his disciples crossed over the Kidron brook and went into an olive grove.
column3: D am i haꞌasa e hoꞌigeꞌidahu g Jesus. Kuchd gam hu aigo i chehchsh hegai aki mo hab e aꞌaga Kidron k am dada mo am eshas g uꞌus.

column2: Judas the betrayer knew the place, for Jesus had often gone there with his disciples.  So Judas took with him a troop of soldiers together with guards from the chief priests and the Pharisees. They arrived there carrying torches, lanterns, and weapons.
column3: D eda pi an hu t‑wehmaj g Judas nadki pi gam hu him k am si gagda g Jesus ha wui g uꞌugchu papal ch Palasi. Kudki idam ab muꞌi ha cheha g shondal ch cheopi nuhkuddam mat am wo oi g Judas. Dki heg ab i ha wanim no pi s‑mahch matt hebai wo haꞌichugk no pi muꞌikko am t‑wehm dahiwup amai. D idam haꞌijj ge iꞌis‑papayo ch haꞌijj ge lalamba ch haꞌijj wabsh kuhdch.

column2: Jesus knew everything that was going to happen to him. He went to meet them, and asked, “Who are you looking for?”
column3: D eda wa chum wehs s‑mahch g Jesus mat haschu has wo e juh am tahgio ch wabshaba am i hih ha wui k hab kaij, “Dohm in gahg?”

column2: “Are you Jesus of Nazareth?” they asked.
column3: D hab kaij idam, “Hegai Jesus mo ab Nazareth t ab d kihkam.”

column2: When Jesus said “I am,” they fell back and dropped to the ground.
column3: D haha wabsh e totods hegam k ab taꞌi si i gegokiwua k wabsh i shul.

column2: So he asked them again, “Who are you looking for?”
column3: D ab ep ha kakke g Jesus, “A m hedai in gahg?”

column2: “I already told you I am,” Jesus replied. “So if I'm the one you're looking for, let these others go.”
column3: D hab kaij g Jesus, “Am ani wa heki hu em‑ahgid mani d ahni. Mtp ahni in wo ni‑gahghid ch pi has wo ha juh idam.”

column2: These words fulfilled what he had previously said: “I have not lost any of those you gave me.”
column3: Neh, bo kaij no pi s‑t‑doꞌibiamk. Kud hab masma hab e juh g neꞌokij mo wa hab kaij matt wehsijj wo t‑doꞌibia.

column2: Then Simon Peter drew a sword and struck Malchus, the high priest's servant, cutting off his right ear.
column3: D g Simon Peter ge is‑pahyo ch ab i huhpan k ab hu wabsh si i widut k higshp an si hikuch g s‑apkojed nahkaj hegai mo d uhgchu pahl neholiga ch hab chehgig Malcus.

column2: Jesus told Peter, “Put the sword away! Do you think I shouldn't drink the cup the Father has given me?”
column3: D hab kaij g Jesus ab Peter wui, “Ga g hu uhpam hab juhni g e‑is‑pahyo. Pi apt wo e nako mapt wo ha shohbi nant pi hemho wa wo nako mo haschu g ni‑ohg apꞌechudch am ni‑wehhejed.”

column2: Then the soldiers, their commander, and the Jewish guards arrested Jesus and tied his hands.
column3: D ab ha cheha g shondal g ha‑geꞌejig mat am wo i ha wehmt g cheopi nuhkuddam. D am bei g Jesus k gan hu si wulsh g nohnhoij k gam hu i wanim Jerusalem wui.

column2: First they took him to Annas, the father-in-law of Caiaphas, the current high priest.
column3: Am ad kih g uꞌugchu papal. Kud gan hu wehpeg i bei heg wui mo hab chehgig Annas. Ihda Annas o d baꞌamad ohgaj hegai mo d si uhgchu pahl ch hab chehgig Caiaphas.

column2: Caiaphas was the one who had told the Jews, “It's better that one man die for the people.”
column3: K d ihda Caiaphas mad wa am ha shelinid g hahaꞌichu mat hemako wo muh g oꞌodham wehs ha wehhejed.

column2: Simon Peter followed Jesus, and another disciple did so too. This disciple was well-known to the high priest, and so he entered the high priest's courtyard with Jesus.
column3: Kuchd gohkajj g Simon Peter wehm am i ha oi mo am bebhehim g Jesus. K eda g uhgchu pahl s‑ni‑mahch. Nid hekaj am i wah kolhai ch ed.

column2: Peter had to remain outside by the door. So the other disciple who was known to the high priest went and spoke to the servant girl watching the door and brought Peter inside.
column3: D g Peter ga hu waꞌi kehk jeg ed ab kihjeg t ab. Nid am hahawa him k ab ahgid hegai chehia mad ab nuhkud g kihjeg mat ab wo i wahki g Peter.

column2: The girl asked Peter, “Aren't you one of that man's disciples?”
column3: D hab kaij ihda chehia ab wui g Peter, “Nap hig pi ahpi an ep wehmaj hegai mamt an bei?”

column2: It was cold, and the servants and guards were standing by a fire they had made, warming themselves. Peter went and stood with them, warming himself.
column3: D eda s‑hehpid. D hekaj am ge nahdch g pion ch cheopi nuhkuddam ch am gegok ch e huhkalid. D g Peter am him k am ha wehm i kekiwua k e huhkal.

column2: Then the chief priest questioned Jesus about his disciples and what he had been teaching.
column3: D g uhgchu pahl ab kakke g Jesus mas haschu ahgk ab haꞌi i ha gawulkad k haschu ha mashcham.

column2: “I've spoken openly to everyone,” Jesus replied. “I always taught in the synagogues and in the Temple where all the Jewish people meet. I haven't said anything in secret.  So why are you questioning me? Ask the people who heard me what I told them. They know what I said.”
column3: D hab kaij g Jesus, “P haschu ahgch ahni ab ni‑kakke? Pi ani hekid s‑aꞌagi haꞌichu ahg ch wabshaba wehs hemajkam wui hab kaij ch am ha mashcham ha‑cheopi ed ch geꞌe cheopi ch ed mach am wehs t‑hehemapad. Pegih, ab g hig ha kakke mani haschu i ha mashcham. S‑mahch o mani haschu ha ahgid.”

column2: When he said this, one of the guards standing nearby slapped Jesus, saying, “Is that any way to speak to the high priest?”
column3: D hab wabsh chum chei. D ab si shonikka g cheopi nuhkuddam k hab ahg, “Pi apt hab shaꞌi kaidam wo neokad ab uhgchu pahl wui.”

column2: Jesus replied, “If I said something wrong, tell everyone what was wrong with it. But if what I said was right, why did you hit me?”
column3: D hab hahawa kaij g Jesus, “Am g hig wehs wo ha ahgi manis haꞌichu pi ap hab kaij. Wohokam ani em‑ahgid. Pt haschu ahgk ab ni‑shonikka?”

column2: Annas sent him, his hands still tied, to Caiaphas the high priest.
column3: D g Annas am hahawa ha cheha mat am wo uꞌapa Caiaphas wui. Kud an wabsh kia wulshch g Jesus.

column2: As Simon Peter stood warming himself by the fire, the people there asked him, “Aren't you one of his disciples?”
column3: D eda g Peter am wabsh kia e huhkalid ha‑nahda wui. D hab kaij hegam mad am wehmaj, “Nap hig pi ahpi an ep wehmaj hegai mamt an bei?”

column2: One of the high priest's servants, a relative of the man whose ear Peter had cut off, asked Peter, “Didn't I see you in the olive grove with him?”
column3: D am hema kehk g neholigaj g uhgchu pahl ch d hajunij hegai mat g Peter hikuch g nahkaj ch hab kaij ab wui g Peter, “Nani pi woho m‑neid amai matt am bei ihda?”

column2: Peter denied it again, and immediately a cock crowed.
column3: D hab kaij g Peter, “Ih, piaꞌa.” D edapk am i kuhu g keli chuchul.

column2: Early in the morning they took Jesus from Caiaphas to the palace of the Roman governor. The Jewish leaders didn't enter the palace because if they did they would be ceremonially defiled, and they wanted to be able to eat the Passover meal.
column3: Wabsh i siꞌalim mad koi i chesh g tash, md gam hu i bei g Jesus kownal kih wui. D hab chehgig hegai Pilate. D pi am hu i wahp g Tutuligo kownal kih ed no pi g t‑himdag hab chuꞌig matt wo t‑uamhu mattp am wo i wahp gawul hemajkam ha‑kih ed. Kut pi wo apꞌedagk mat wo huh g kahwal mad iagchulig gegosig imhab i juhk matp am wo i wahp.

column2: So Pilate came out to meet them. “What charge are you bringing against this man?” he asked.
column3: D heg hekaj gam hu i wuhsh g Pilate k am ha nam k hab kaij, “Shahchu am ab abchud ihda oꞌodham?”

column2: “If he wasn't a criminal, we would not have handed him over to you,” they answered.
column3: D hab kaij ab wui, “Pi att woho ia wo uꞌapa ahpi m‑wui hegai matt pi koi wo s‑mai mo am hab junihim g pi apꞌekam.”

column2: “Then you take him and judge him according to your law,” Pilate told them.
column3: D hab kaij g Pilate, “Pegih, mt ahpim wo be k ab wo mah g s‑koꞌok namkidadag mo has i mahs g em‑himdag chehanig.”

column2: This fulfilled what Jesus had said about how he would die.
column3: Id ad wa hab e juh mat hab masma wo e muhkid g Jesus mo wa hab kaij no pi g kownal hab masma ha muhkid.

column2: Pilate went back into the governor's palace. He summoned Jesus, and asked him, “Are you the King of the Jews?”
column3: D g Pilate gam hu uhpam wah e‑kih ed k ab i wai g Jesus k hab kaij ab wui, “Neh, nap hab e elid map d ha‑kownalig g Tutuligo?”

column2: “Did you think of this question yourself, or did others talk to you about me?” Jesus responded.
column3: D hab kaij g Jesus, “Nap ab ni‑kakke ihda ab hejel e amjed, aha no haꞌijj ab haꞌichu i m‑ahgid ab ni‑amjed?”

column2: “Am I a Jew?” Pilate countered. “It was your own people and high priests who handed you over to me. What is it that you've done?”
column3: Kud hab kaij g Pilate, “Pi ani d shaꞌi Tuhligo manis wo s‑mahchk ihda. M‑wehm hemajkam ha wehm g e‑papalig at ia m‑uꞌapa. Pt haschu has juh?”

column2: Jesus answered, “My kingdom is not of this world. If it was of this world, my subjects would fight to keep me from being handed over to the Jews. But my kingdom is not from here.”
column3: D hab kaij g Jesus, “Ni‑kownaltalig o pi hab chuꞌig mo g id dahm jewed kokownaltalig, Tp hems hab wo chuꞌigk, t wo ha cheggia hegam mo ab si ni‑wecho e mashcham mamt pi am hu wo i ni‑dagito hahaꞌichu ha wui. Pi o hab mahs g ni‑kownaltalig.” Neh, bad kaij g Jesus.

column2: Then Pilate asked, “So you are a king, then?”
column3: D heg hekaj hab ep kaij g Pilate, “Kupki woho hab kaij map d kownal!”

column2: “What is truth?” Pilate asked.
column3: D gam hu hab si e widu g Pilate k hab kaij, “Mas haschu d i wohokam.”

column2: However it is customary for me to release a prisoner to you at Passover. Do you want me to release the King of the Jews?”
column3: K eda wehs ahid ab am hema i e dadagitod g lihso em‑wehhejed iaꞌi idani mam wushshad g e‑shohshon ha‑doꞌibiadag. Pegih, nam tatchua mant id wo dagito mash d em‑kownalig ahpim Tutuligo?”

column2: “No, not him! We want Barabbas instead!” they shouted back. Barabbas was a rebel.
column3: D si s‑kaidam hihnk ch hab kaij, “Pi hegai. Barabbas ach tatchua.” D eda d s‑chu ehskam ch d ha muꞌakam ihda Barabbas.

column2: Then Pilate took Jesus and had him flogged.
column3: D am hahawa ha cheha g Pilate g shondal mat wo s‑koꞌokam gewitta g Jesus. Kud wa woho hab e juh

column2: Soldiers made a crown of thorns and placed it on his head, and put a purple robe on him.
column3: k am hahawa ge hoꞌi gihkot k ab wahki moꞌoj ab k ab wahki g kownal kahba

column2: Time and again they went up to him and said, “Hail, King of the Jews!” and slapped him.
column3: k wabsh has ahg ch hab kaij, “Wapt wo si tash d Tutuligo ha‑kownaligk,” ch ab hahawa si shonikkash.

column2: Pilate went outside once more and said to them, “I'm bringing him out here to you so you'll know I find him not guilty of any crime.”
column3: D am ep i wuhsh g Pilate k hab kaij am ha wui g hemajkam, “Nehꞌe, ab ant ep wo i wuhshad k wo em‑chehgi mant pi haꞌichu shaꞌi cheh g pi ap chuꞌijig mas hekaj wo e muhkid.”

column2: Then Jesus came out wearing the crown of thorns and the purple robe. “Look, here's the man,” said Pilate.
column3: Md am hahawa i wuhshad k ab wabsh kia wahkch g hoꞌi gihko ch hegai kownal kahba.

column2: When the chief priests and the guards saw Jesus, they shouted out, “Crucify him! Crucify him!”
column3: D am i nei g uꞌugchu papal ch cheopi nuhkuddam k si s‑kaidam hab wabsh ge kaij muꞌikko, “Muꞌani! Muꞌani ab kots t ab!”

column2: The Jewish leaders replied, “We have a law, and according to that law he must die because he claimed to be the Son of God.”
column3: D hab kaij hegam Tutuligo, “Ahchim at hi melchkwua g t‑chehanig am hugkam mat hemho wa wo e muhkid no pi hab e aꞌaga mo d Jiosh alidag.”

column2: When Pilate heard this he was more afraid than ever,
column3: Neh, d am i ha kah g Pilate mad hab kaij idam k baꞌich i e ebkiod

column2: and he went back into the governor's palace. He asked Jesus, “Where do you come from?” But Jesus didn't respond.
column3: k gam hu uhpam i wah k hab kaij ab Jesus wui, “Bahp amjed him?”

column2: “Are you refusing to talk to me?” Pilate said to him. “Don't you realize that I have the power to have you released or to crucify you?”
column3: D hab ep kaij g Pilate ab wui, “Aha, napt pi has wo chei ab ni‑wui k eda s‑mahch mani gewkdag mant wo m‑dagito o ab wo m‑mua kots t ab!”

column2: “You would have no power over me unless it had been given to you from above,” Jesus answered. “Therefore the one who handed me over to you is guilty of the greater sin.”
column3: D hab kaij g Jesus ab wui, “Jiosh at ab m‑mah hegai gewkdag. K heg hekaj si pi ap hab e wua idam Caiaphas mo m‑piꞌichud mapt pi ap wo hekaj g e‑gewkdag.”

column2: When Pilate heard this he tried to set Jesus free, but the Jewish leaders shouted, “If you set this man free you're not Caesar's friend. Anyone who sets himself up as a king is rebelling against Caesar.”
column3: D am i kah g Pilate ihda k am ep i wuhsh ha wui k am chum si e nako mat wo dagito. D wabshaba si s‑babgam hihnk hegam hahaꞌichu ch hab kaij, “Nehꞌe, ihda hemajkam o hab e ahg mo d si geꞌe kownal ch heg hekaj ab wui kehk hegai mo d si geꞌe kownal ch ab Rome t ab. Kupki ahpi hab waꞌap ab wui kehk g si geꞌe kownal mapt wo sha dagito ihda.”

column2: When Pilate heard this, he brought Jesus outside and sat down on the judgment seat at a place called Stone Pavement (Gabbatha in Hebrew).
column3: D am i kah g Pilate ihda k am hahawa i wuhshad g Jesus k heg ga hu i dahiwua usagakam daikud ed amai mach hab aꞌaga Gabbatha mo an sha uhgk i hodaitas.

column2: It was around noon on the preparation day before the Passover.
column3: D eda e aihim g dahm juhk. Kud wo e kokda g kahwal mahmad imhab i juhk mat wo e wuhshad g t‑shohshon ha‑doꞌibiadag. D hab kaij g Pilate ab ha wui g hahaꞌichu, “Ia g hu wo neid g e‑kownalig.”

column2: “Kill him! Kill him! Crucify him!” they screamed out.
column3: D ab ep si s‑babgam hihnk ch hab kaij, “Muꞌani! Muꞌani ab kots t ab!”

column2: So he handed Jesus over to them to be crucified.
column3: D am hahawa i dagito g Pilate g Jesus mamt ab wo mua kots t ab.

column2: They led Jesus away, who carried his own cross, and went out to the “Place of the Skull,” (Golgotha in Hebrew).
column3: D g Jesus am kushwiot g hejel e‑kots. Kuchd am dada amai mo am e kokda. Bach aꞌaga amai Golgotha mo hab d ahga Koshwak.

column2: They crucified him there, and two others with him: one on either side, with Jesus between them.
column3: Kumt gam si wuahawua g wehschugaj k ab sisish kots t ab k ab uhgk i bei. D eda gohk d ep lilso. Kumd idam hab waꞌap ab ha sisish kokots t ab k gan hu aꞌaijed ha chuhcha Jesus hugid an.

column2: Pilate had a notice made and placed on the cross which said, “Jesus of Nazareth, the King of the Jews.”
column3: D an sisishp g tapial Jesus kots t ab. K an ab hab chuꞌig:

column2: Then the chief priests came to Pilate and asked him, “Don't write ‘the King of the Jews,’ but ‘This man said I am the King of the Jews.’ ”
column3: D gam hu uhpam ep hihi g uꞌugchu papal Pilate wui am i neꞌokchulidk ihda k hab ahg, “Pi g hab masma an oꞌohan mo d t‑kownalig k wabshaba an oꞌohan mo heg hejel hab kaij mo d t‑kownalig.”

column2: Pilate replied, “What I have written I have written.”
column3: D hab kaij g Pilate ab ha wui, “Mant haschu an i oꞌoha, t heg an wo oꞌohadagk.”

column2: When the soldiers had crucified Jesus they took his clothes and divided them in four so that each soldier had his share. There was also his robe, made without seams, woven in one piece.
column3: D hegam shondal mad am naggia g Jesus d giꞌik ch hekaj am giꞌikpa e tahpad g Jesus wepschuga. K am hema d si s‑namkig haꞌichu eniga ch pi hebai ha shohmas.

column2: So they said to each other, “Let's not tear it, but let's decide who will have it by rolling dice.” This fulfilled the Scripture that says, “They divided my garments among them and rolled dice for my clothing.”
column3: D id hab ahg g shondal ch hab kaij ab aꞌai e wui, “Pi att am hu aꞌai wo t‑wanchid ihda k am wabsh wo t‑chichwi matt hedai wo t‑gehg k heg wo bei.” Neh, bad kaij ch woho am hab e juh. Kud hab masma am e wohokamch g Jiosh oꞌohana mo an oꞌohanas hab masma:

column2: So that is what the soldiers did.
column3: D am gegok g jeꞌej ch jiskaj g Jesus miabidch amai mo am naggia. Kud gohk am ep ha wehmaj mo hema d hegai Mary mo g wehmaj kihkam d Clopas ch hema d ep Mary Magdalene.

column2: When Jesus saw his mother, and the disciple he loved standing beside her, he said to his mother, “Mother, this is your son.”
column3: Nid ahni am ha wehm kehk mo ni‑hekaj si pihk e elid g Jesus. Kud g Jesus an ni‑aꞌaga ch hab ahg g e‑jeꞌe, “Neh, id at d haha wo m‑madk m in kehk,”

column2: Then he said to the disciple, “This is your mother.” From then on the disciple took her into his home.
column3: ch hab ep ni‑ahg, “Id at d haha wo m‑jeꞌek.” Neh, nid am i amjed bei g jeꞌej. Kud heg am t‑wehm kih.

column2: Jesus now realized that he had finished all that he had come to do. In fulfillment of Scripture, he said, “I'm thirsty.”
column3: D hahawa s‑mahch g Jesus mat wehs hab juh mat haschu hab wo chum juh mat koi wo muh ch hab kaij, “Tonom ant.”

column2: A jar of wine vinegar was standing there, so they soaked a sponge in the vinegar, put it on a hyssop stick, and held it to his lips.
column3: D an hema daha g haꞌa mad am shuhdagi g pad nawait. D am hema g shondal haꞌichu wakch pad nawait ch ed k an haꞌichu k an uskon k ab uhgk i be k ab kams hab masma mo an oꞌohadag Jiosh heki hu oꞌohana ed.

column2: After he'd had the vinegar, Jesus said, “It's finished!” Then he bowed his head and breathed his last.
column3: D ab i winiun k hab hahawa kaij, “Ia ant i wehs haꞌichu nahto.” Neh, bad kaij ch am hahawa jumal i moꞌowua k am i muh.

column2: It was preparation day, and the Jewish leaders didn't want to leave the bodies on the crosses during the Sabbath day (in fact this was a special Sabbath), so they asked Pilate to break the legs, so that the bodies could be removed.
column3: D am e nakog g hemajkam mat wo e mihshmad nat pi g baꞌich tash d wo shahwaik ch d wo geꞌe tashk. Kutsh g hahaꞌichu ab kakke g Pilate mat wo e ohmi g ha‑kakhio hegam mad am nahngia. T hab wo e oiwigi g ha‑muhkig mat gam hu wo i e uꞌu k pi ab wabsh wo kia nahngiak t‑mihshmda tash ed, wahm mat id d wo si geꞌe t‑tashgak.

column2: So the soldiers came and broke the legs of the first one and then the other of those crucified with Jesus,
column3: D ab ha chehani g Pilate g shondal mat wo ha ohmi g ha‑kakhio. Kud hab ha juh hegam gohk mo ab hugidaj ab nahngia g Jesus.

column2: but when they came to Jesus they saw he was already dead, so they didn't break his legs.
column3: D wabshaba g Jesus heki hu muh. Kud pi ohmi g kakhioj.

column2: However one of the soldiers stuck a spear into his side, and blood mixed with water came out.
column3: D hema g shondal g e‑is‑pahyokaj chuꞌakad g Jesus ab hudaj ab. Kud ab ha hekaj si e iawua g ehꞌed ch shuhdagi.

column2: The one who saw this has given this evidence, and his evidence is true. He's certain that what he says is true so you can believe it too.
column3: Id anid neid ch s‑mahch mat woho muh. Kuni hab masma am em‑ahgidahim mamt ahpim hab waꞌap wo s‑mahch mat woho muh.

column2: It happened like this so Scripture would be fulfilled: “Not one of his bones will be broken,”
column3: Jiosh oꞌohana o hab chuꞌig:

column2: and as another Scripture says, “They will look at the one they pierced.”
column3: K an ep oꞌohanas ch hab chuꞌig:

column2: After this Joseph of Arimathea asked Pilate if he could take down the body of Jesus, and Pilate gave his permission. Joseph was a disciple of Jesus, but in secret because he feared the Jews. So Joseph came and took the body away.
column3: K hema d Joseph ch ab Arimathea t amjed ch s‑wohochud mo g Jesus d Jiosh si Kehsha ch wabshaba s‑ha gihug hegam mo pi hohhoꞌid. D wabshaba hekid am i muh g Jesus, d id am hih Pilate wui k ab e shoꞌigchud k ab tahni g honshpadaj. D am i hiwigi. D ga hu ep jiwia k ab i huduni g muhki k gam hu i bei.

column2: He was joined by Nicodemus, the man who had first visited Jesus at night. He brought with him a mixture of myrrh and aloes weighing about seventy-five pounds.
column3: D heg am ep haꞌichug Nicodemus mat wa ged hu i wehpeg chehgim g Jesus chuhug ch ed. Idam atsh s‑ap wo juh g muhki. D g Nicodemus heg hekaj uꞌa g siant s‑wehch hegai mo d s‑ap uhw haꞌichu ch d myrrh ch aloes.

column2: They took Jesus' body and wrapped it in linen cloth together with the mixture of spices, in accordance with Jewish burial customs. There was a garden near where Jesus was crucified;  and in the garden was a new, unused tomb.  Since it was the Jewish day of preparation and the tomb was nearby, they laid Jesus to rest there.
column3: S‑e ad hohtkid nad pi hudunihim. D baꞌich tash d t‑mihshmda tash. K eda an mia cheotas hodai ch ed mamt am hab juh g hihaꞌini k wabshaba koi shaꞌi hekaj. K an wehgaj eshas g uꞌus. Kumd am i bei g honshpadag k am i hobino g s‑kehg ikuskaj heg wehnadk s‑ap uhw haꞌichu mach hab masma hab ha wua g koꞌi k am cheh heg eda hihaꞌini k gam hu hihi.

column2: Early on the first day of the week, while it was still dark, Mary Magdalene went to the tomb and saw that the stone had been moved from the entrance.
column3: Domig wabsh i siꞌalim mad wabsh kia s‑chuhugam, tsh gm hu hihi hegam Mary Magdalene k am dada cheo t am. Kutsh heki hu gam hu i e nuꞌichkwua g hodai mad hekaj ab chum kuhpi.

column2: So she ran to tell Simon Peter and the other disciple, the one Jesus loved, “They've taken the Lord out of the tomb, and we don't know where they've put him.”
column3: Tsh am chum neid k am hahawa uhpam meh kihhim wui k ad gd hu t‑wui mel ahni John ch Simon Peter k am t‑ahgid ch hab kaij, “Am atki i e wuhshad g t‑kownaligbad hon heg amjed hihaꞌini mat am e cheh. Kuch pi shaꞌi mahch mas hebai has e juh.”

column2: Then Peter and the other disciple went to the tomb.
column3: Kuchd g Peter wehm am ha hekaj wohp.

column2: The two of them were running together, but the other disciple ran faster and reached the tomb first.
column3: Nid ahni wehpeg ged hu mel nanid pi ahni baꞌich i s‑hohtam meh mad g Peter.

column2: He bent down, and looking in he saw the grave-clothes lying there, but he didn't go in.
column3: Nid am i koachsh k nei mo am wehch hegai s‑kehg ikus k wabshaba pi am hu i wah.

column2: Then Simon Peter arrived after him and went right into the tomb. He saw the linen grave-clothes lying there,
column3: D am hahawa mel g Peter k am wabsh si i wah k cheh hegai ikus

column2: and that the cloth that had been on Jesus' head wasn't with the other grave-clothes but had been folded and placed on its own.
column3: ch heg ehp mat hekaj e hobino g Jesus moꞌo. D id ged hu hab wabsh hejelko holiwek ch kahch.

column2: Then the other disciple who had reached the tomb first went inside as well.
column3: Kunid ahni am hahawa epai i wah k am i neidok ab hahawa i s‑wohoch mat woho i wuhsh ab muhkig amjed.

column2: He looked around and believed it was true for up till then they hadn't understood the Scripture that Jesus had to rise from the dead.
column3: Kuchd eda pi koi s‑amichud hegai Jiosh oꞌohana mo hab chuꞌig mat hemho wa wo i wuhsh ab muhkig amjed.

column2: Then the disciples went back to where they were staying.
column3: Kuchd gam hu hahawa hihi uhpam.

column2: But Mary stayed outside the tomb crying, and as she was crying, she bent down and looked into the tomb.
column3: Sh am ep oimmed g Mary cheo kihjego ch shoak ch atsh am i e jumalkad k am i koachsh hihaꞌini ch ed

column2: She saw two angels in white, one sitting at the head and the other at the foot of where Jesus' body had been lying.
column3: ch ash gohk ha neid g anghil. Idam ash s‑tohtam e enigadadch ch ga hu aꞌai dadha, hema ab moꞌoshko ch hema ga hu aigo

column2: “Why are you crying?” they asked her.
column3: ch hab kaij, “Uwi, shahchu ap ahgch shoak?”

column2: After she'd said this, she turned round and saw Jesus standing there, but she didn't realize it was Jesus.
column3: Tsh hab cheꞌiok ab sikol i kekiwua k ash neid mash ab hema kehk ch ash wabshaba pi shaꞌi mahch mo hedai wud.

column2: “Why are you crying?” he asked her. “Who are you looking for?”
column3: Sh eda d Jesus ch ab kakke ch hab kaij, “Uwi shahchu ap ahgch shoak? Dohp in gahg?”

column2: Jesus said to her, “Mary!”
column3: Sh hab kaij g Jesus ab wui, “Mary.”

column2: “Don't hold onto me,” Jesus said to her, “for I haven't yet ascended to my Father; but go to my brothers and tell them I am ascending to my Father and your Father, my God and your God.”
column3: Sh hab kaij g Jesus, “Pi g am hu ni‑shohbid. Koi ant am hu hih ni‑ohg wui. Pt wabshaba am wo him k am wo ha ahgi g ni‑naipijju mant wo uhpam i ni‑nodagi heg wui mo d ni‑ohg ch ahpim d ep em‑ohg. Heg o d ni‑Jioshga ch ahpim d ep em‑Jioshga.”

column2: So Mary Magdalene went and told the disciples, “I've seen the Lord,” and she explained to them what he had said to her.
column3: D wa woho am uhpam hih g Mary Magdalene k am t‑ahgi mo neid g t‑kownalig Jesus. K heg am ahgid ihda.

column2: That evening, on the first day of the week, as the disciples were meeting together behind locked doors because they were afraid of the Jews, Jesus came and stood among them and said, “May you have peace.”
column3: D gam hu si i juh domig hudunk. Kuchd am t‑nam hema kih am. D ga hu si yahwidag g kihkjeg nachd pi s‑ha ehbid g hahaꞌichu.

column2: After this greeting he showed them his hands and his side. The disciples were full of joy to see the Lord.
column3: ch ab hahawa t‑chehgid g e‑nohnhoi ch e‑huda. Kuchd si s‑hehgig ab i neidok.

column2: “May you have peace!” Jesus told them again. “In the same way the Father sent me, so I'm sending you.”
column3: D hab ep kaij ab t‑wui, “Am g wabsh wo s‑ap e tahtk. Am ant i em‑chuhcha hab masma mat g ni‑ohg am i ni‑kei. Kumt hab waꞌap am wo ahgachugad g haꞌichu ahgaj.”

column2: Saying this, he breathed on them, and told them, “Receive the Holy Spirit.
column3: T hab chei ihda k ab t‑dahm ihbheiwua k hab kaij, “Ab g wo i behꞌi g Hekia S‑apꞌekam Gewkdag.

column2: If you forgive anyone's sins, they are forgiven; if you hold them unforgiven, unforgiven they remain.”
column3: Kumt wo s‑mahch k ah mas hedai g pi ap chuꞌijigaj gm hu hab i juni g Jiosh ch hedai pi gam hu hab i juni.” Neh, bad kaij ch am hahawa i piꞌata.

column2: One of the twelve disciples, Thomas, who was called the Twin, wasn't with them when Jesus came.
column3: D g Thomas pi am hu t‑wehmaj mad wa am jiwia g Jesus.

column2: So the other disciples told him, “We've seen the Lord.”
column3: Kuchd am hahawa chum ahgid matt nei g t‑kownalig.

column2: One week later the disciples were together inside the house; and Thomas was with them. The doors were closed, and Jesus came and stood among them.
column3: Hemako domig amjed, chd am ep i t‑hemapai kih ch ed. D am hahawa t‑wehmaj g Thomas. Chd ab ep si yahwidadch g kihkjeg. D wabshaba ab i wah g Jesus k am jiwia t‑wui k hab kaij, “Am g wabsh wo si s‑ap e tahtk.”

column2: Then he said to Thomas, “Put your finger here, and look at my hands. Put your hand in the wound on my side. Stop doubting and trust in me!”
column3: D hab hahawa kaij ab Thomas wui, “Ab g i ni‑neid k ab tahtam g ni‑nohnhoi ch ni‑huda k ab wo s‑ni‑wohochudad.”

column2: “My Lord and my God!” Thomas responded.
column3: D hab hahawa chei g Thomas, “Ni‑kownalig ch ni‑Jioshga!”

column2: “You trust in me because you've seen me,” Jesus told him. “Happy are those that haven't seen me yet still trust in me.”
column3: D hab ep kaij g Jesus ab wui, “Ab apt i s‑ni‑wohoch nap pi ni‑neid. Baꞌich at wo i s‑hehgigk hegam mat ab wo i s‑ni‑wohoch wa chum pi g e‑wuhpuikaj ni‑neidch.”

column2: Jesus did many other miraculous signs while he was with his disciples that are not recorded in this book.
column3: Muꞌi s‑hasig haꞌichu ad hab ep juh g Jesus am t‑nena ed mant pi oꞌoha id eda oꞌohana.

column2: But these are written down here so that you may trust that Jesus is the Messiah, the Son of God, and that by trusting in him as he is you will have life.
column3: Nt id in hi wa ha oꞌoha mamt ab amjed wo s‑wohoch mo g Jesus d Jiosh si Kehsha ch d alidaj k hab masma ab wo bei g wechij doakag.

column2: Later Jesus appeared again to the disciples by the Sea of Galilee. This is how it happened.
column3: Am waꞌi hebai amjed, d am ep i e chehgi g Jesus t‑wui amai al kahchki am am Galilee jewed ch ed.

column2: Simon Peter, Thomas the Twin, Nathanael of Cana in Galilee, and Zebedee's sons, and two other disciples were together.
column3: Am achd wa oiopo g ni‑nawoj James wehm. K g Simon Peter ch Thomas Kuadi ch Nathanael ch gohk ep g t‑wehm e mashchamdam am t‑wehmaj.

column2: “I'm going fishing,” Simon Peter said to them. “We'll come with you,” they replied. So they left and went out in the boat, but all night they caught nothing.
column3: D hab kaij g Simon Peter ab t‑wui, “Ih, nt hi wo sha ha uꞌim g waptopi.”

column2: When dawn came Jesus was standing on the shore, but the disciples didn't know it was him.
column3: D ab i chesh g tash. D ab hema kehk shuhdagi hugidgo. Kuchd pi shaꞌi mahch mo hedai wud.

column2: Jesus called to them, “My friends, haven't you caught anything?”
column3: D hab kaij, “Wihpiop, namt pi haꞌichu shaꞌi bei?”

column2: “Throw the net out on the right side of the boat, and you'll find some,” he told them. So they threw out the net, and they weren't able to haul it in because it had so many fish.
column3: D hab hahawa kaij, “An g wo daꞌichud g e‑chuagia inhab s‑apkojed g e‑wahlko k wo haꞌi ha ui.”

column2: The disciple Jesus loved said to Peter, “It's the Lord.” When Peter heard it was the Lord, he put some clothes on since he was naked, and jumped into the sea.
column3: Nid hab hahawa kaij ab Peter wui, “Doki t‑kownalig Jesus!” D am i kah g Simon Peter moki d Jesus k ab wah g e‑eniga mat wuahawua k am i dah shuhdagi ch ed k am i e wachwihim k ga hu jiwia wui.

column2: The other disciples followed in the boat, pulling the net full of fish, because they were not far from the shore, only about a hundred yards.
column3: Chd ahchim haꞌi ab hahawa i himch g wahlko ab chewaimedch g chuagia waptopi shuhdch nachd pi am waꞌi waik siant keishpa ab amjed mo an i hug g shuhdagi.

column2: Once they'd landed they saw a fire with fish cooking on it, and some bread.
column3: Kuchd an i huhud shuhdagi koa an k nei mo g chuhdagi am wehch. D am dahm kahch g watopi. D g pahn am ep wehch.

column2: Jesus told them, “Bring some of the fish you've just caught.”
column3: D hab kaij g Jesus ab t‑wui, “Ab g wo haꞌi uꞌuk g waptopi em‑uꞌi.”

column2: Simon Peter went aboard and pulled the net full of fish ashore. There were 153 large fish, yet even so the net hadn't torn.
column3: Ab ad wabsh i si shuhdags g chuagia g geꞌeged waptopikaj. Kud g Simon Peter gan hu i chesh wahlko ch ed k ab i chewaim. Kud d siant hetaspo wehst‑mahm gamai waik (153). D eda pi e wantsh g chuagia.

column2: “Come and eat some breakfast,” Jesus said to them. None of the disciples was brave enough to ask him, “Who are you?” They knew it was the Lord.
column3: D hab t‑ahg g Jesus, “Oi g wo i hihim k e gegosid.”

column2: Jesus took the bread and gave it to them and the fish as well.
column3: D am hih g Jesus k am bei g pahn k an i t‑hainidahim k g watopi am ep be k an i ha t‑mahkhi.

column2: This was the third time Jesus had appeared to the disciples after being raised from the dead.
column3: Id o d waꞌi waikkokam mad am i e chehgi g Jesus t‑wui amjed mad ab i wuhsh muhkig amjed.

column2: After breakfast, Jesus asked Simon Peter, “Simon, son of John, do you love me more than these?”
column3: Kuchd am i t‑nahto t‑gegosidk. D hab kaij g Jesus ab Simon Peter wui, “Simon map d Jonas alidag, nap baꞌich i si pihk e elid ni‑hekaj mo hi idam?”

column2: “Take care of my lambs,” Jesus told him. “Simon, son of John, do you love me?” he asked for the second time.
column3: D hab ep kaij g Jesus ab wui, “Simon, nap woho si pihk e elid ni‑hekaj?”

column2: “Look after my sheep,” Jesus said to him. “Simon, son of John, do you love me?” he asked a third time.
column3: D id d i waikko mad hab kaij g Jesus, “Simon, nap ab si ni‑tatchua?”

column2: “I tell you the truth,” said Jesus, “when you were young, you dressed yourself and went wherever you wanted. But when you're old, you'll hold out your hands and someone will dress you and take you where you don't want to go.”
column3: Neh, s‑mahch ap map hejel s‑ap an has i e wua ch am hab e junihim map has i tatchua. Nt wabshaba wo si shel m‑ahgi mapt am wo i si kelit k ab haha wo uhgk i uhꞌul g e‑nohnhoi. T wabsh hema ab wo m‑enigadad k am wo i m‑bei map hebai chum pi am hu himimk.”

column2: Jesus said this to explain the kind of death by which he would glorify God. Then he said to Peter, “Follow me.”
column3: Kudki heg hab ahg matki has masma wo e muhkid g Peter. T hab wo s‑mai g hemajkam g Jiosh gewkdag. Kud g Jesus hab hahawa ahg g Peter mat gam hu hasko wo oi.

column2: As Peter turned round, he saw the disciple Jesus loved following them, the one who had leaned over to Jesus during the supper and asked, “Lord, who is going to betray you?”
column3: D am wehmaj i hih g Peter. Nid ab i ha oi. Kud g Peter ab uhpam i nea k ni‑neid

column2: Peter asked Jesus, “What about him, Lord?”
column3: k hab kaij ab Jesus wui, “Ni‑kownalig, kut haschu am hab wo e juh am tahgio ihda John.”

column2: Jesus told him, “If I want him to remain alive here until I return, why is that your concern? You follow me!”
column3: D hab kaij g Jesus ab wui, “Neh, mantp wo tatchuidad g John mat pi wo ha muh k ab wo ai mant ep wo jiwia, k pi ab hu haꞌichu m‑him heg amjed. Am apt wabsh wo ni‑oidad.”

column2: This is why the saying spread among the believers that this disciple would not die. But Jesus didn't say to him that he wouldn't die, just that “If I want him to remain alive here until I return, why is that your concern?”
column3: Kudki an i e ahgidahi am ha shahgid g Jesus wohochuddam mantsh pi wo ha muh. D eda pi hab kaij g Jesus manis pi wo ha muh ch hab kaij, “Mantp wo tatchuidad mat pi wo ha muh k ab wo ai mant ep wo jiwia, k pi ab hu haꞌichu m‑him heg amjed.”

column2: This disciple confirms what happened and wrote all this down. We know that what he says is true.
column3: Ahni ani wud manid neid ch kah ch ia oꞌoha. Kuni si s‑mahch mo d wohokam.

column2: Jesus did many other things as well, and if it all was written down, I doubt the whole world could hold all the books that would be written.
column3: Neh, muꞌi ad haꞌichu hab ep juh g Jesus. Tp hems am wo i e oꞌohanahi wehs k wabsh wo shuhd g jewed.

column2: May God's mercy, peace, and love increase in your experience!
column3: Ab ani tahni g Jiosh mat ab baꞌich wo i s-em-hoꞌigeꞌidad ch ab baꞌich wo i em-mahkad g s-ap dahhadkam ch pihk elidadag.

column2: My friends, I was already looking forward to writing to you about the salvation that we share. But now I need to write urgently to you and encourage you to vigorously defend the truth about God,  given once and for all time to God's holy people.  For some people have quietly crept in among you. They were written about and condemned a long time ago, for they are wicked people who pervert God's grace, turning it into a license to immorality, while also denying our Lord and master Jesus Christ.
column3: Ab ant haꞌichu wo i chum em-oꞌohani ab amjed g t-doꞌibiadag. T wabshaba haꞌi i wuwha mo d s-chu iꞌattomkam ch am chum gawul s-junimk g Jiosh haꞌichu ahga ab amjed g doꞌibiadag ch ab wui gegok g t-kownalig Jesus Christ. Idam o hab s-junimk g pi apꞌekam ch heg hekaj hab kaij mat g oꞌodham wabsh chum haschu has wo junihid ab i s-wohochudk g Jiosh haꞌichu ahga. K wabshaba heki hu an oꞌohanas mat s-koꞌokam wo ha namkid g Jiosh hegam mat ab wui wo gegokiwua. Heki o hu t-ahgid g Jiosh matt haschu ab wo chum s-wohochudad. Kum ahpim ab s-wohochud g haꞌichu ahgaj. Nt heg hekaj am wo i em-oꞌohanid k ab wo i em-gewkemhu mamt si s-gewkam wo uꞌukchid.

column2: Even though you already know this, I want to remind you that though the Lord saved his people out of the land of Egypt, later he still destroyed those who disbelieved.
column3: Am g wo s-chegitok mat has ha juh g Jiosh hegam mo pi ab hu wohog elid. Chum as wehs e doꞌibia g Tutuligo ab Egypt jewed t amjed, k eda muꞌijj pi ab hu wohog elid g Jiosh ch hekaj s-koꞌokam e koꞌij.

column2: Even those angels that were not content with their God-given positions but abandoned their rightful places—he has placed them in eternal chains of darkness until the great Day of Judgment.
column3: Am g wo s-chegitok mat has e juh g anghil. Ab o chum s-wohog elid g Jiosh ch wabshaba haꞌi gam hu hab i e juh ab amjed. T hegam am i ha kuh g Jiosh k am s-wihnam ha kuhpch s-chuhugam k ed mat wo ha lodai geꞌe lodaita tash ch ed.

column2: In just the same way, Sodom and Gomorrah and the towns nearby that pursued immorality and perverted sex are provided as an example of those that experience the punishment of eternal fire.
column3: Am g wo s-chegitok mat has i ha juh hegam mo am kih Sodom kihhim t am ch Gomorra kihhim t am ch gan hu ha wehgaj. Bo wa ep pi ab hu wohog elid g Jiosh ch hab junihim g pi apꞌekam am ha wehm wohpiwup hegam mo pi d ha-wehm kihkam. Chechoj o am e wehm wohpiwup ch hab wua g pi apꞌekam. T g Jiosh ab i huduni g mehi am ha dahm idam kihhim k am wehs ha kokda g hemajkam. Bo wa masma i t-tashogid g Jiosh mat s-koꞌokam wo ha namkid hegam mat pi wo dagito g pi apꞌekam. T g s-koꞌok ha-namkidadag pi hekid wo huhug.

column2: Likewise these dreamers pollute their bodies, disregard authority, and insult heavenly beings.
column3: Idam s-chu iꞌattomkam mo am haꞌichu chum em-mashcham ash haꞌichu chehchk ch heg oidch am hab e junihim ch hekaj e uamhun ch pi ab hu wohog elid g Jiosh ch nahnko ha ahg g anghil.

column2: Even the archangel Michael, when he was arguing with the devil over Moses' body, didn't dare to condemn him with a slanderous insult, but said, “May the Lord rebuke you.”
column3: Chum ash wa hems hegai anghil ha-geꞌejig mash hab chehgig Michael pi s-koꞌokam ab abchud g ge Jiawul no pi heg hab waꞌap d chum anghilkahim. Jiawul ash wa pi ap hab e wua am chum s-behimkch g Mosesbad mat am i muh. Kush ihda Michael am s-daꞌid ch wabshaba pi s-koꞌokam has ahg ch hab hi wabsh kaij, “Jiosh at wo waꞌi s-m-kehꞌel heg hekaj.”

column2: But these people ridicule whatever they don't understand; and what they do understand they instinctively follow like unthinking animals—this is what destroys them.
column3: Sh wabshaba hegam s-chu iꞌattomkam nahnko ahg mo haschu i pi amichud ch hab wua mo haschu i tatchua hab masma mo g mischini haꞌichu doakam ch hab masma e uamhun.

column2: They're in terrible trouble! For they have followed Cain's way. Like Balaam and his delusion, they have abandoned themselves to the profit motive. Like Korah and his rebellion, they have destroyed themselves.
column3: Jiosh at s-koꞌokam wo ha namkid no pi pi ab hu wohog elid.

column2: These people spoil your fellowship meals, for they are selfish shepherds that don't have the slightest sense of shame—they only take care of themselves. They're clouds blown along by the wind that bring no rain. They're bare trees without fruit—twice dead, pulled out by the roots.
column3: Kah ani mash idam s-chu iꞌattomkam am em-wehm e gegosid ch am chum em-uamhun.

column2: They're violent ocean waves, foaming in their own disgrace. They're false stars, doomed forever to utter darkness.
column3: S-ta edam haꞌichu ash am wabsh e chehgid ab ha amjed hab masma mo g totshagi am e chehgid an shuhdagi hugid an. Idam o wabsh pi dodolima ch ab aihim mat g Jiosh gm hu wo ha shul geꞌe s-chuhugam k ed.

column2: Enoch, seven generations on from Adam, spoke prophetically about these people: “Look! The Lord is coming, together with thousands and thousands of his holy ones  to judge everyone, to reveal all the wicked things people have done, and all the terrible things hostile sinners have said against him.”
column3: Tsh wabshaba g Jiosh heki hu hema tashogi mat has wo ha juh. Sh id hab chehgig Enoc ch d wosmdaj hegai mash g woskaj wosk d si wehpeg oꞌodham. Sh g Jiosh hab ahg mat wo ha ahgi g hemajkam mat ab wo i hih g Jiosh mat wehs wo ha lodait k s-koꞌokam wo ha namkid hegam mo pi tatchua ch has ahg ch hab wua g pi apꞌekam. T wehst-mahm mihl anghil ab wo i oi.

column2: Such people are grumblers, always complaining. They follow their own evil desires, speaking boastfully about themselves, and flattering others to get what they want.
column3: Idam s-chu iꞌattomkam o chum hekid aꞌaga g pi e-apꞌedag ch hab wua g pi ap e-tatchui. Ge o e hahaschud ch hab wabsh e wua mo ab haꞌi si ha hahaꞌichuchud mat hekaj ab aigo wo si ha hahaꞌichuch.

column2: But you, my dear friends, please remember what you were told by the apostles of our Lord Jesus Christ.
column3: Am g wo s-chegitok mo haschu i em-ahgid hegam mo d chuhchaij g t-kownalig Jesus Christ.

column2: They explained to you that in the last times mockers would come, following their own wicked desires.
column3: Bo wa kaij ab em-wui, “Am at haꞌi wo i wuwha em-shahgid mo eda e aihim g si ha oidch tash k hab wabsh wo junihid g hejel e-tatchui ch wo nahnko em-ahgad.”

column2: They cause divisions; they are worldly people who don't have the Spirit.
column3: T am wo tashok mo idam pi shaꞌi e dagitokch am wui g Hekia S-apꞌekam Gewkdag no pi am hab junihim g hejel e-tatchui ch hab chum em-wua mamt ab aꞌai e wui wo gegokiwua.

column2: But you, my friends, are to build yourselves up through your trust in God. Pray in the Holy Spirit,
column3: Do si hekia s-apꞌekam g t-wohochudadag. Kumt heg ab baꞌich i s-wihnam wo e uꞌukchid. T g Hekia S-apꞌekam Gewkdag ab wo em-mahkchid g gewkdag mamt hekaj am wo neneokad Jiosh wui.

column2: keep yourselves safe in God's love, and wait for the mercy of our Lord Jesus Christ who brings eternal life.
column3: Mt wabsh chum hekid am wo edak g Jiosh pihk elidadag ch s-e tahtk ch wo nenidad mat g t-kownalig Jesus ab wo i em-wahpki Jiosh kihdag ed mamt hahawa chum hekid an wo haꞌichugk.

column2: Show kindness to those who doubt.
column3: Ab g wo i s-ha hoꞌigeꞌid hegam mo pi mahch mas haschu wo s-wohoch

column2: Save those you can by snatching them out of the fire. Show mercy—but with great care, hating even the “clothing” that is contaminated by sinful human nature.
column3: k am wo i ha ahgi g Jiosh haꞌichu ahga. T hab wo e doꞌibia ab i s-wohochudk. Kumt wabshaba wo s-e nenꞌoidk mo haschu pi ap hab wua mamt ahpim hab waꞌap pi heg hekaj wo e uamhu.

column2: As you know, many others have attempted to put down in writing the things that have been fulfilled  that involve us.  They based their accounts on evidence from the earliest eyewitnesses and ministers of the Word,  and so I also decided that since I have followed these things very carefully from the beginning, it would be a good idea to write out an accurate account of all that happened.  I have done this dear Theophilus so you can be certain that what you were taught is completely reliable.
column3: Ni-nawoj map ab si tatchua g Jiosh:

column2: During the time when Herod was king of Judea, there was a priest called Zechariah, who came from the Abijah priestly division. He was married to Elizabeth, who was also descended from Aaron the priest.
column3: Amjed atsh ab i shohshonwua ihda mash eda g Herodbad am d kownal Judea chekshani ch ed am ha dahm g Tutuligo hemajkam. Sh am hema d ha-pahlig ch hab chehgig Zacaria. Sh g wehmaj kihkam hab chehgig Elisabed. Idam ash ab d amjedkamaj hegai mash d ha-shohshonbad g papal ch hab chehgig Aaron. Kush g Zacaria ab hema d amjedkam mash hab chehgig Abia.

column2: They both did what was right before God, being careful to follow all the Lord's commandments and regulations.
column3: Kush idam Zacaria ch Elisabed am si oid g s-apꞌekam ch s-ap am hab junihim wehs hegai mo g Jiosh ab ha chehani g Tutuligo.

column2: They had no children because Elizabeth wasn't able to have any, and they were both growing old.
column3: Kutsh wabsh okst ihda Elisabed k pi ha mahmadt. Tsh g Zacaria hab waꞌap kelit.

column2: While Zechariah was serving as a priest before God, on behalf of his priestly division,
column3: Kutsh hema tash am i e ai matsh g Abiabad amjedkam am hab wo juh g e-chikpan geꞌe cheopi ch ed.

column2: he was chosen by lot according to priestly custom to enter the Temple of the Lord and burn incense.
column3: Kumtsh am i kei g Zacaria matsh am wo ha mehmhei g s-ap uhw kuhbhondakud. Tsh am i wah cheopi ch ed.

column2: During the time of offering incense a large crowd of people were praying outside.
column3: Kush am jeg ed gegok g hemajkam ch e hoꞌigeꞌidahun.

column2: An angel of the Lord appeared to Zechariah, standing to the right of the altar of incense.
column3: Tsh am cheopi ch ed hema i e chehgi g anghil Zacaria tahgio k ash ab kehk s-apkojed abai mash ab kuhbhoni g s-ap uhw kuhbhondakud.

column2: When Zechariah saw the angel, he was startled and became terrified.
column3: Tsh am i nei g Zacaria k si e todsid k si s-ehbeni ihda.

column2: But the angel told him, “Don't be afraid, Zechariah. Your prayer has been heard, and your wife Elizabeth will bear you a son, and you shall call him John.
column3: Kush wabshaba hab kaij g anghil, “Pi g am shaꞌi e todsid, Zacaria. Jiosh at kah g m-hoꞌigeꞌidahuna. T g m-wehm kihkam wo wa hema madt. T d wo cheojk. Kupt hab wo chehch John.

column2: He will bring you joy and gladness, and many will celebrate his birth.  He will be great in the sight of the Lord. He will refuse to drink wine or other alcoholic drink. He will be filled with the Holy Spirit even before he's born.
column3: Jiosh at ab a wo si has elidad. Kut pi koi wo mahsi. T g Jiosh ab wo mah g Hekia S-apꞌekam Gewkdag. Kupt heg hekaj wo si s-hehgigk. T g muꞌi hemajkam hab waꞌap wo si s-hehgigk mat hekid wo mahsi. Kut ihda em-aliga pi hekid wo ihꞌed hegai mo s-nawmdag.

column2: He will turn many Israelites back to the Lord their God.
column3: ch muꞌi ab wo i ha nohnogi g Tutuligo hemajkam ab Jiosh wui.

column2: He will go ahead of the Lord in the spirit and power of Elijah, to turn the hearts of the fathers back to their children, and to turn those who are rebellious back to a right understanding—to prepare a people ready for the Lord.”
column3: T koi in hu wo i wuhsh g Jiosh si Kehsha jewed dahm. T g em-aliga ia wehpeg wo ahgachugad mat in wo i wuhsh. T g Hekia S-apꞌekam Gewkdag ab wo mah g gewkdag heg wehhejed hab masma mo wa ab mahkch g Elijabad. Kut hab wo ha juh g hemajkam mat ab wo si pihk e elidad ha hekaj g e-aꞌaliga k hegam hab wo ha juh mo d pi apꞌekam mat ab wo kaihamad g ha-amichudadag hegam mo d s-apꞌekam. Neh, bat masma am wo i ha apꞌech g hemajkam heg wehhejed jiwhiadaj g Jiosh si Kehsha.” Neh, bash kaij hegai anghil.

column2: “How can I be sure about this?” Zechariah asked the angel. “I'm an old man, and my wife is getting old too.”
column3: Kush g Zacaria hab kaij, “Nt has hig masma wo si s-ap s-mahchk machs wo hema bei g ali natt pi kekelt?”

column2: “I am Gabriel,” the angel replied. “I stand in God's presence, and I was sent to speak to you and give you this good news.
column3: Sh hab kaij g anghil ab wui, “Dani Jiosh chikpandam, Gabriel. Kut ab ni-cheha mant ia wo m-ahgi ihda si s-hehgig haꞌichu ahgaj.

column2: But since you didn't believe what I told you, you'll become dumb, unable to speak, until the appointed time when my words come true.”
column3: Kupt eda pi ab hu ni-wohoch. T heg hekaj hab wo m-juh mapt pi wo shaꞌi e nako maps wo ha neokad iaꞌi amjed am hugkam mat hab wo e juh ihda mani m-ahgid.” Neh, bash kaij hegai anghil.

column2: Outside the people were waiting for Zechariah, wondering why he was taking so long in the Temple.
column3: Sh eda heg oidam am chum nenida g hemajkam g Zacaria ch si has i elid k hab kaij, “A t has e juh k pi oi ab hu i wuhsh?”

column2: When eventually he came out, he wasn't able to speak to them. They realized he'd seen a vision in the Temple, for though he could make gestures, he was completely dumb.
column3: Tsh am hu hebai ab hahawa i wuhshani k chum neo am ha wui k wabsh pi shaꞌi e nako. Sh am ha hekaj wabsh i amich g hemajkam matki ab haꞌichu e chehgi wui no pi ab wabsh i ha magwuid g e-nowikaj ch pi ab hu has shaꞌi kaij.

column2: After he'd finished his time of service, he went back home.
column3: Tsh am wabsh i chum huhug g tash mat heꞌes tash am hab wo juh g e-chikpan. Tsh gam uhpam hih e-kih wui.

column2: Some time later his wife Elizabeth became pregnant. She stayed at home for five months. “The Lord has done this for me,” she said, “now that he's taken away my disgrace in the eyes of others.”
column3: Kush amai i mia amjed matsh woꞌiwua g ali. Kush am wabsh s-ap e tahtk ch am e ehstokch g Elisabed e-kih ed hetasp mashad hab kaijhim, “Chum ani hekid si ni-elid mani pi ha mahmadt. Kutki wabshaba id hab ni-juni g Jiosh k hekaj gam hu hab i juh g si ni-edadag am hemajkam ha-nena ed.”

column2: In the sixth month of her pregnancy God sent the angel Gabriel to a young girl called Mary who lived in the town of Nazareth in Galilee.  She was engaged to a man named Joseph.
column3: Neh, tsh am him k am d i chuhdp mashad am i dahm matsh am woꞌiwua g Elisabed mad. Tsh g Jiosh am chea hegai anghil mash d Gabriel matsh am wo uꞌapa g haꞌichu ahgaj hema wui g chehia.

column2: The angel greeted her. “You are very privileged,” he told her. “The Lord is with you.”
column3: Kutsh koi e ai matsh wo e hohont. Tsh am jiwia hegai anghil Mary wui k hab kaij, “Si g s-hehgigk Mary. Jiosh at ab i s-m-hoꞌigeꞌid k am wo i m-wehmt.”

column2: Mary was very puzzled at what he said, and wondered what this greeting meant.
column3: Tsh am wabsh i pi amich mas haschu hab ahg k si e kudu heg hekaj.

column2: “Don't worry, Mary,” the angel went on, “for God has shown his graciousness to you.
column3: Sh hab ep kaij g anghil, “Pi g am shaꞌi e todsid, Mary. Ab at i m-mah g Jiosh g hoꞌigeꞌidadag.

column2: You will become pregnant and give birth to a son. You shall call him Jesus.
column3: Kut am wabsh wo e nahto g ali m-eda k wo mahsi k d wo cheojk. Kupt hab wo chehch Jesus.

column2: He will be very great, and he will be called the Son of the Most High. The Lord God will give him the throne of David his father,
column3: Kut d wo si s-has haꞌichuk no pi d alidaj g Jiosh. T g Jiosh am wo i kei mat d wo kownalk am kehkud ed g e-shohshonbad David.

column2: and he will reign over the house of Jacob forever. His kingdom will never come to an end.”
column3: Kut chum hekid d wo ha-kownaligk g Jiosh hemajkamga. Pi at hekid wo huhug g kownaltaligaj.” Neh, bash kaij g anghil.

column2: “How is this possible?” Mary asked. “I'm still a virgin.”
column3: Sh hab kaij g Mary ab wui, “Nt has hig masma wo ge madt mani d wabsh kia chehia ch pi koi ha kun?”

column2: He replied, “The Holy Spirit will come upon you, and the power of the Most High will cover you. The baby who is to be born is holy, and will be called the Son of God.
column3: Sh g anghil ab wui hab kaij, “Jiosh at ab wo cheha g Hekia S-apꞌekam Gewkdag. T heg hab wo juh g Jiosh gewkdagkaj. Mt heg hekaj wo s-mahchk mat d wo si hekia s-apꞌekam alik ch d wo Jiosh alidagk.

column2: And Elizabeth, your relative, even she is pregnant in her old age. The woman that people said couldn't have children is already six months pregnant.
column3: “Neh, s-mahch ap mat heki hu okst g m-hajuni Elisabed k pi ha mahmadt. Kut eda g Jiosh ab s-hoꞌigeꞌel. Kut g cheoj ali wo bei. K d chuhdp mashad hemu mat am woꞌiwua g ali.

column2: Nothing is impossible for God.”
column3: Kupt id amjed wo s-mahchk mat wo e nako g Jiosh mat am hab wo juh hegai mo haschu hab e ahgahim.” Neh, bash kaij g anghil.

column2: “Here I am, ready to be the Lord's servant,” said Mary. “May it happen to me just as you said.” Then the angel left her.
column3: Kush hab hahawa kaij g Mary, “Neh, dani piongaj g Jiosh. K am wa s-apꞌe mat am hab wo juh g e-tatchui ab ni-ab” Tsh gam hahawa hih g anghil ab amjed.

column2: A little while later, Mary got herself ready and hurried up into the hills of Judea, to the town where  Zechariah's house was. She called out to Elizabeth as she went in.
column3: Tsh ab ha hekaj i e nako g Mary mat am wo chehgim g Elisabed. Sh hegam Elisabed ch Zacaria am kih mash am hema kihhim kaꞌakwulk ch ed am Judea chekshani ch ed. Tsh am jiwia Mary ha-kih am k ab ha-ihm.

column2: As soon as Elizabeth heard Mary's voice, the baby jumped for joy inside her. Elizabeth was filled with the Holy Spirit,
column3: Tsh am i kah g Elisabed k ab taht matsh g madaj am si al i banimme eda. Tsh g Hekia S-apꞌekam Gewdag ab si i mah g gewdag.

column2: and cried out in a loud voice,
column3: Kush hekaj si s-hehgigam hab kaij ab wui g Mary, “Neh, ab atki si i s-m-hoꞌigeꞌel g Jiosh baꞌiwechkim mo chum hedai uwi. Kutki wo mahsi m-amjed hegai mash ab mahks g si geꞌe s-apꞌekam.

column2: Why am I so honored that the mother of my Lord should visit me?
column3: Kuptki d wo jeꞌejk hegai mat d wo ge t-kownalig. Kuni si s-ap ni-tahtk mapt iaꞌi ni-chehgim.

column2: As soon as I heard you call out in greeting, my baby jumped for joy inside me.
column3: Neh, am at si i banimme g ni-mad mant am i m-kah mapt ab ni-ihm. K heg hekaj am ni-chehgid g Jiosh mo ab si s-m-hoꞌigeꞌid.

column2: How fortunate you are, because you are convinced that the Lord will do what he has promised you!”
column3: Woho at hab wo e juh hegai mo ab m-chehgid g Jiosh. K d si geꞌe hoꞌigeꞌidalig mapt ab i s-wohoch.” Neh, bash kaij g Elisabed.

column2: Mary replied, “How I praise the Lord!
column3: Kush g Mary hab kaij:

column2: The time came for Elizabeth to have her baby and she gave birth to a son.
column3: Tsh am hahawa i e ai. Tsh madt g Elisabed. Kush d cheoj ali.

column2: Her neighbors and relatives heard how the Lord had showed her great kindness, and they celebrated together with her.
column3: Sh g hajunij ch hugidaj an kihkam si s-hehgig wehmaj am i kaiok matsh g Jiosh ab si i s-hoꞌigeꞌel.

column2: Eight days later they came to circumcise the boy. They planned to call him Zechariah after his father.
column3: Kush am d i gigiꞌik tash g ali. Kumtsh wo pahl hikuch mo d ha-himdag. Tsh am e chehm g hemajkam k hab wo chum chehch Zacaria am oidk g ohgaj.

column2: “No,” Elizabeth said. “He shall be called John.”
column3: Kush wabshaba hab kaij g jeꞌej, “Pi atsh g e-ohg oidk wo chehgigk ch wabshaba hab wo chehgigk John.”

column2: “But there's nobody among your relatives who has this name,” they told her.
column3: Sh hab kaij hegam, “Pi o hedai hab shaꞌi chehgig g m-hajuni,”

column2: Through gestures they asked Zechariah, the boy's father, what he wanted to call his son.
column3: ch amjed ab wabsh i chum kakke g ohgaj mat am wo ha ahgi mas has wo chehch.

column2: Zechariah motioned for something to write on. To everyone's surprise he wrote, “His name is John.”
column3: Sh heg hema ha tahni g oꞌohanakud. Mtsh hema mah. Kutsh id an oꞌoha, “Bo chehgig John”. Tsh wehsijj si e totods.

column2: Immediately he could speak again, and he started praising God.
column3: Kutsh am waꞌi hekaj s-ap neok k ab si ihm g Jiosh ch ab si hoꞌigeꞌid.

column2: All those living nearby were in awe at what had happened, and the news spread throughout the hill country of Judea.
column3: Tsh wehsijj ab si has el g Jiosh hegam mo an ha wehgaj kih. Tsh gan hu aꞌai s-e mai am Judea chekshani ch ed mat has i e juh.

column2: Everyone who heard the news wondered what it meant. “What will the little boy grow up to be?” they asked, for it was clear he was very special to God.
column3: Ab ash si s-hoꞌigeꞌid g Jiosh ihda ali. Kush wehsijj hegam mash am kah am si i oidahim ch hab kaij, “Kus has mahs wo haꞌichuk ihda ali?”

column2: Zechariah, his father, filled with the Holy Spirit, spoke this prophecy:
column3: Kutsh g Hekia S-apꞌekam Gewkdag g si geꞌe gewkdag ab i mah g Zacaria. Tsh heg am si s-hewelim neok k gam hu baꞌich ah mat haschu has wo e juh hab kaijch:

column2: The boy John grew and became spiritually strong. He lived in the desert until the time came for his public ministry to Israel.
column3: Kutsh si s-gegokim i geꞌeda g ali am e tashogid mo am Jiosh tatchui oidch him. Kush am hebai d i himdam, tsh gm hu i e gawulkai tohono jewed ch ed k am haꞌichugkahim ch ab ai mat am i e maskogi Tutuligo ha wui.

column2: It was the time when Caesar Augustus issued a decree that there should be a census of everyone in the Roman Empire.
column3: Sh am hema d si geꞌe lai wehs ha dahm g jejewed ch hab chehgig Augustus. Sha am hu hebai, tsh id am hab juh g chehanig matsh wehs wo e oꞌohan k wo e kuint g hemajkam heheꞌejel e‑kihhim ab.

column2: This was the first census under governor Quirinius of Syria.
column3: Id ash d si wehpeg kuintadag. Kush am hema d kownal Syria jewed ch ed hab chehgig Quirinius.

column2: So everybody went to their own city to be registered.
column3: Tsh am himto g hemajkam ab heheꞌejel e‑kihhim wui matsh wo e oꞌohan k wo e kuint.

column2: Joseph was descended from King David, so he left Nazareth in Galilee to go to Bethlehem, the city of David, in Judea.
column3: Tsh hegai Joseph mash wa am kih Nazareth t am ch atsh wo hohnt g Mary gam hu hih Bethlehem wui am Judea chekshani ch ed nash pi ab d kownalibad David amjedkam. Sh g Davidbad am d kihkam Bethlehem t am.

column2: He went to register there, together with Mary, who was pledged in marriage to him and expecting a baby.
column3: Tsh g Mary am oi g Joseph. Sh eda e aihim matsh wo bei g e‑mad.

column2: While they were there, the time came for her to have her baby.  She gave birth to her firstborn son. She wrapped him up in strips of cloth and laid him in a manger because the inn had no rooms left.
column3: Tsh am dada Bethlehem t am. Sh eda pi am hu ha jeg am koksikud kih ch ed. Tsh heg hekaj am dadhaiwua haꞌichu doakam kih ch ed. Kutsh si e ai. Tsh madt g Mary. Kush heg d wehpegkam ch d cheoj. Kutsh am si i hobino s‑moik ikus ch ed k am heg eda woi mo g haꞌichu doakam am e gegosid.

column2: Nearby some shepherds were spending the night out in the fields, keeping watch over their flocks.
column3: Sh am haꞌi dadha g kahwal ha nuhkuddam gam hu jeg ed ch an ha nuhkud g e‑shoshoiga.

column2: An angel of the Lord appeared to them, and the glory of the Lord shone all around them. They were scared out of their wits!
column3: Tsh ab haha wabsh ha wui e chehgi g anghil ab dahm kahchim t amjed. Kutsh an si i ton ha wehgaj matsh am e chehgi g Jiosh gewkdag. Kutsh wabsh wohoꞌi e totods.

column2: “Don't be afraid!” the angel told them. “I'm here to bring you good news that will make the all the people really glad.
column3: Sh hab hahawa kaij g anghil, “Pi g am wo shaꞌi e totodsid. Ia ant jiwia mant haꞌichu wo em‑ahgi. K id wehs hemajkam d ha wuikam. T wo si s‑ap e tahtkkad ab amjed.

column2: The Savior has been born to you today, here in David's city. He is the Messiah, the Lord.
column3: Idani at am mahsi Davidbad kihhim ed hegai mo d Jiosh si Kehsha mat d wo em‑doꞌibiakamk ch d wo geꞌechu em‑kownaligk.

column2: You will recognize him by this sign: you will find the child wrapped in strips of cloth and lying in a manger.”
column3: Kumt id ab wo s‑mahchk mat am wo woꞌok heg eda mo am e gegosid g haꞌichu doakam ch g s‑moik ikuskaj wo e hobinodch.”

column2: Suddenly many heavenly beings appeared, praising God, saying,
column3: Tsh haha wabsh shaꞌi muꞌi anghil ab ha wui i e chehgi wehmaj hegai hema k si neꞌe ch ab hehgchulid g Jiosh ch hab kaij.

column2: They hurried there and found Mary, Joseph, and the baby, who was lying in the manger.
column3: Tsh wa woho am si s‑hohtam hihim k am i ha gahghim k ha cheh. Kush woho am woꞌo g ali heg eda mo am e gegosid g haꞌichu doakam.

column2: After they'd seen for themselves, they spread the news of what had happened and what they had been told about this baby.
column3: Tsh hegam kahwal ha nuhkuddam am hahawa i ahgahi mash has kaij g anghil ab amjed.

column2: All those who heard about it were amazed at what the shepherds told them.
column3: Tsh wehsijj hegam mash ha kah ab si has i el mo haschu ha ahgid.

column2: But Mary was careful to remember all the things that had happened and often thought about them.
column3: Kush am si oidahim g Mary ch am wabsh hejel i s‑mahch.

column2: The shepherds went back to watching their flocks, glorifying and thanking God for all that they'd heard and seen, for it was just as they'd been told.
column3: Tsh g kahwal ha nuhkuddam gam hu uhpam hihi ab si hehgchulidch g Jiosh natsh pi wehs nei hegai mo haschu am ha ahgid g anghil.

column2: After eight days, the time came for the baby to be circumcised, and he was named Jesus. This was the name given to him by the angel before he had even been conceived.
column3: Kush am d i gigiꞌik tash g ali. Kumtsh an pahl hikuch mo d ha‑himdag k hab chehch Jesus matsh wa g anghil ia uꞌapa g ahga mat eda koi woꞌiwua.

column2: When the time of their purification according to the law of Moses was finished, Joseph and Mary took him to Jerusalem to present him to the Lord,  as the law of the Lord states, “Every firstborn son must be dedicated to the Lord.”  There they made a sacrifice, as God's law also states, of “a pair of turtle doves or two young pigeons.”
column3: Tsh am i e ai g tash matsh g Mary am wo e chehgi mo kegchudas mat hab masma g Mosesbad an oꞌoha g Jiosh chehanig. Bo chuꞌig matsh heg hekaj gohk wo ha kokda g hohhi o g pap‑loloma k ab wo iagchul Jiosh wui. K hab ep chuꞌig matp d wo cheojk g wehpeg mahsidkam ch ab wo i e dagito Jiosh wui. Tsh heg hekaj am bei g ali k am hihi geꞌe cheopi wui ab Jerusalem t ab.

column2: Living in Jerusalem at that time was a man called Simeon. Simeon did what was right and was very devout. He was waiting expectantly for the hope of Israel, and the Holy Spirit was upon him.
column3: Sh am hema kih g keli ch hab chehgig Simeon ch ash d si s‑apꞌekam ch ab si has elid g Jiosh ch ash ab si nenida mat wo ha doꞌibia g Tutuligo. Sh g Hekia S‑apꞌekam Gewkdag ab si wehmaj

column2: The Holy Spirit had shown him that he would not die before he saw the Lord's Messiah.
column3: ch ash am i tashogi matsh pi wo muh k ab wo ai mat wo nei g Jiosh si Kehsha.

column2: Following the Spirit's leading, he went to the Temple. When Jesus' parents brought in the little boy to be dedicated as required by the Law,
column3: Neh, tsh am i e ai g tash. Tsh am hahawa i tashogi mat am wo i wah geꞌe cheopi ch ed. Kutsh g Joseph ch Mary am uꞌapa g Jesus matsh am hab wo juni mo has i masma d ha‑chehanig.

column2: Simeon took Jesus in his arms, thanked God, and said,
column3: Tsh g Simeon an koh g ali k ab si e hoꞌigeꞌidahun Jiosh wui hab kaijch.

column2: Jesus' father and mother were shocked at what Simeon said about him.
column3: Sh g Joseph ch Mary si has e tahtk heg hekaj mo has i kaij ab amjed g ali.

column2: Then Simeon blessed them, and said to Jesus' mother Mary, “This child is destined to cause many in Israel to fall and many to rise. He is a sign from God that many will reject,
column3: Sh hab hahawa kaij g Simeon ab ha wui, “Jiosh at wo wa s‑em‑hoꞌigeꞌel,” ch ash hab ep kaij ab jeꞌej wui, “Neh, ihda ali at g Jiosh am si i kei. Kut muꞌi wo t‑doꞌibia. T wabshaba muꞌijj g t‑wehm Tutuligo pi ab hu wo wohochud k im hu hab wo i e juh. Jiosh at ab wo e chehgi t‑wui id hekaj ali. T muꞌijj wo s‑kehꞌid

column2: revealing what they really think. For you it will feel like a sword piercing right though your heart.”
column3: k hekaj wo mahsko wua g e‑chegitoidag. Kut g m‑ihbdag wo si s‑koꞌokkad hab waꞌi masma matp hems g is‑pahyo ab wo si m‑chuꞌakad m‑ihbdag ed.” Neh, bash kaij g Simeon.

column2: Anna the prophetess also lived in Jerusalem. She was the daughter of Phanuel of the tribe of Asher, and she was very old. She had been married for seven years,
column3: Sh hema g oks am d Jiosh haꞌichu i tashogiddam ch hab chehgig Anna. Sh g ohgajbad hab chehgig Phanuel ch ab d amjedkamaj g Asherbad. Kush g keligaj ihda Anna muh mash eda d haha wabsh i e wehm kihkam wewaꞌak aꞌahid ab.

column2: and then she had been widowed. She was eighty-four years old. She spent her time at the Temple in worship, fasting and praying.
column3: Sh am haha d hejel wiꞌikam gigiꞌikko gamai giꞌik (84) aꞌahid ab. Tash oidam ch chuhug oidam ash am haꞌichug geꞌe cheopi t am ch ab si has elid g Jiosh ab wui e hoꞌigeꞌidahunch ch hab al heꞌes haꞌichu koꞌa.

column2: She came up to them right at that moment, and began praising God. She spoke about Jesus to all those who were looking forward to the time when God would set Jerusalem free.
column3: Sh am haꞌichug g ali ch jeꞌej g Joseph wehm. Kutsh am jiwia hegai Anna k ash ab hoꞌigeꞌelid g Jiosh ch am hahawa wehsijj ha ahgid ab amjed g ali hegam mash hab waꞌap nenida matsh g Jiosh wo ha doꞌibia.

column2: Once they had completed everything God's law required, they returned to their home town of Nazareth in Galilee.
column3: Neh, kutsh wehs am hab juh hegai mo an oꞌohanas chehanig ch ed k gam hu hahawa uhpam hihi Galilee chekshani wui k am dada e-kih am Nazareth kihhim t am.

column2: The child grew strong, and was very wise. God's blessing was with him.
column3: Kutsh ab si s-gegokim i geꞌelhi g ali k wabsh shaꞌi haꞌichu s-amichud. Sh g Jiosh pihk elidadag am si e tashogid wehhejed.

column2: Jesus' parents traveled to Jerusalem every year for the Passover festival.
column3: Wehs ahid ab ash am e wushshad Jerusalem t am matsh wa ha doꞌibia g Jiosh g ha-shohshon ab ha amjed g Egypt t am hemajkam. Kush g Jesus jehj chum hekid am hihhim.

column2: When Jesus was twelve years old, they went to the festival as they always did.
column3: Kush am d i gamai gohk aꞌahidag g Jesus. Tsh am i e ai hegai ha-doꞌibiadag wuhshda. Tsh am ep hihi bekch g Jesus k am haꞌichugkahim mo heꞌes i tash am hab e wua.

column2: When the festival had finished and it was time to return home, the boy Jesus remained in Jerusalem, but his parents didn't realize this.
column3: Tsh am i kuhgit. Tsh gam hu i e nohnogi uhpam. Tsh eda am waꞌi wih g Jesus Jerusalem t am. Sh g jehjij pi mahch mo pi am hu ha wehmaj

column2: They assumed he was with all the others traveling home. A day passed before they started looking for him among their friends and relatives.
column3: nash pi hab elid mash an wa hebai ha wehmaj g hihimdam mash am muꞌi e wehm hihim. Kush hekaj hemako tash waꞌi chihpia k an chum gahghi ha oidk g e-hajuni ch e-nanꞌaipijju.

column2: When they couldn't find him they returned to Jerusalem to look for him there.
column3: Sh eda pi am hu haꞌichug. Kutsh oi wa gam hu uhpam hihi Jerusalem wui mat an wo i gahghi.

column2: It was three days before they found him in the Temple. He was sitting among the religious teachers, listening to them and asking them questions.
column3: Kush am d i waik tash. Tsh ged hu hahawa cheh geꞌe cheopi ch ed. Kush am dak ch ab ha kaiham g s-chu aꞌamichuddam ch ab si haꞌichu ha kakke mash am aꞌaga g Jiosh oꞌohana.

column2: All who heard him speak were surprised by his understanding and his answers.
column3: Sh idam ab epai haꞌichu kakke. Kush si s-e mamachim neok ch si s-ap ab uhpam i nodgid g haꞌichu ha-kakkei. Sh wehsijj hegam mash kah ab wabsh i hahaꞌadka si has i e tahtk.

column2: His parents were totally confused when they saw what he was doing. His mother asked him, “Son, why have you treated us like this? Your father and I—we've been worried sick! We've been looking everywhere for you!”
column3: Neh, tsh g Joseph ch Mary hab waꞌap si has i e taht am chehgiok. Sh g jeꞌej hab kaij, “Ni-sulijga, shahchu apt ahgk hab t-juh? Shelkam att nonda g m-ohg wehm pi m-edgidk.”

column2: “Why is it that you were looking for me?” Jesus replied. “Didn't you know I should be here in my Father's house?”
column3: Kush hab kaij ab ha wui, “Chum am wa s-mahch mant hemho wa am wo haꞌichugk ni-ohg Jiosh kih ed.”

column2: But they didn't understand what he meant.
column3: Sh eda pi shaꞌi amichud mo haschu ahgch hab kaij.

column2: Then he went back with them to Nazareth, and did what he was told. His mother kept a careful note of everything that happened.
column3: Kutsh gam hu hahawa uhpam hih ha wehm Nazareth wui k ab ha wechokahim. Sh g jeꞌej pi hekid shaꞌi pi chegito ihda matsh has e juh.

column2: Jesus grew steadily wiser and stronger, favored both by God and by the people.
column3: Neh, kutsh ab si s-gegokam i geꞌehogatahi g Jesus k baꞌich i edagi g amichudadag k ash am si oid g Jiosh chehanig. Kush ab si s-hoꞌigeꞌid g Jiosh. Sh g hemajkam ab si has elid.

column2: By now Tiberias had been Caesar for fifteen years. Pontius Pilate was governor of Judea. Herod was ruler of Galilee, his brother Philip was ruler of Iturea and Trachonitis, and Lysanius was ruler of Abiline.  Annas and Caiphas were the current high priests. This was the time when the word of God came to John, Zechariah's son, who was living in the desert.
column3: Tsh am hebai i cheka. Kush am daha ihda John mo d Zacariabad alidag am tohono jewed ch ed.

column2: He went throughout the whole Jordan region, announcing to everyone that they needed to be baptized to show they had repented and their sins had been forgiven.
column3: Sh g John an wehsko ahgachug g Jiosh haꞌichu ahga anai Jordan akimel woꞌoshani ed hab ha ahgch, “Gam g hu wo s‑ohhod g pi ap e‑chegitoi k wo e pahl wapko. Tsh g Jiosh gam hu hab wo i juh g pi ap em‑chuꞌijig.”

column2: As Isaiah the prophet wrote: “A voice was heard crying out in the desert, ‘Prepare the way of the Lord: make his paths straight.
column3: Batsh wa e juh hab masma matki an heki hu oꞌoha hegai kelibad Jiosh haꞌichu i tashogiddam mash hab chehgig Isaiah. K hab chuꞌig g oꞌohanaj:
