column3: Tsh am i e hoꞌigeꞌidahu g Jesus k atsh am gawul i e juh. Tsh g wehschugaj hab e juh mash si s‑tondam s‑tohta.

column2: Two men appeared in brilliant glory. They were Moses and Elijah, and they began to talk with Jesus.
column3: Tsh haha wabsh am wehmaj i e chehgi g Mosesbad ch Elijabad.

column2: They spoke about his death, which would soon happen in Jerusalem.
column3: Kush g Jiosh gewkdag ab ha ab e chehgid hab masma mo g tonlig. Sh idam am wehmaj aꞌaga g Jesus matsh pi shaꞌi tash amjed am hab wo e juh hegai matsh haschu g Jiosh am apꞌech matsh wo muh am Jerusalem t am.

column2: Peter and the others were asleep. When they woke up they saw Jesus in his glory, and the two men standing next to him.
column3: Sh eda hegam Peter shaꞌi si gewpkog ch s‑kohksim ch wabshaba ab si i nehnea k nei g Jesus ch hegam gohk oꞌodham mash am wehmaj gegok.

column2: As the two men were about to leave, Peter said to Jesus, “Master, it's great to be here. Let's make some shelters: one for you, one for Moses, and one for Elijah.” He really didn't know what he was saying.
column3: Tsh gam hu wo hihi hegam gohk. Tsh g Peter wabsh kohsh k daꞌiwuni k hab kaij, “T‑mashchamdam, s‑apꞌe oki mach ia haꞌichug. Tt ia waik hab wo em‑juni g al chechopi matt hekaj ab wo si has em‑el ahpi ch Mosesbad ch Elijabad.”

column2: While he was speaking a cloud came and spread over them. They were terrified as they entered the cloud.
column3: Tsh g chewagi ab i wuhsh mash eda wabsh kia neok g Peter k ab ehka ha dahm. Kutsh si s‑ehbeni hegam Peter matsh ab i hud g chewagi.

column2: A voice spoke from the cloud, saying, “This is my Son, the Chosen One. Listen to him!”
column3: Tsh g Jiosh neꞌoki ab kaida chewagi t amjed k hab kaij, “Jesus o d si ni‑tatchuidch ni‑alidag. Heg amt ab wo si kaihamad.”

column2: When the voice finished speaking, Jesus was there alone. They kept this to themselves, and didn't tell anyone at that time what they'd seen.
column3: Sh am hahawa hejel kehk g Jesus. Kush pi am hu haꞌichug hegam gohk.

column2: The next day, when they had come down the mountain, a huge crowd was waiting to meet Jesus.
column3: Sh am baꞌich d i tash. Tsh ab hahawa i huhud doꞌag t amjed. Kush shaꞌi muꞌi hemajkam am nenida g Jesus ch ab nam.

column2: A man in the crowd called out, “Teacher, please look at my son. He's my only child.
column3: Kush hema si s‑kaidam neok ch hab kaij, “Ha mashchamdam, id o d waꞌi ni‑alidag m ia kehk.

column2: A spirit possesses him and he screams immediately. It sends him into convulsions and makes him foam at the mouth. It hardly ever leaves him alone and it causes him a lot of pain.
column3: K g jiawul an bebhe ch am si hihnk ch am i wuhpa jewedo. K g totshagi i chechshshaj chinij ab. S‑koꞌokam o has wua g jiawul ch chum alo pi dadagitosh.

column2: I begged your disciples to drive it out, but they couldn't.”
column3: Kuni ab wa chum si ha ahgid g m‑pionag mat gam hu hab wo i juh. T wabshaba pi e nako.”

column2: “What an unbelieving and corrupt people you are! How long do I have to remain here with you, and put up with you?” said Jesus. “Bring your son here.”
column3: Sh hab kaij g Jesus ab ha wui g e‑chuhchai, “Shoꞌo waꞌi pi geꞌej g em‑wohochudadag. M im hu hab wabsh i si e juhkch ab ni‑amjed. Shahag wepo mant hemho wa tash ia wo em‑wehmajkad ch ab wo em‑nakogad mat hekaj wo i geꞌeda.” Bash kaij ch am hahawa ahgi hegai oꞌodham, “Ab g i bekaꞌi g e‑alidag.”

column2: Even as the boy came over, the demon sent him into convulsions, throwing him to the ground. But Jesus intervened, rebuking the evil spirit and healing the boy, and then gave him back to his father.
column3: Sh ab chum him g ali. Sh haha wabsh ep i wua hegai jiawul am jewedo. Kush am si banimmed. Tsh g Jesus ab si s‑kehꞌel g jiawul k i wuhshad k am hahawa bei g al k ab i wanim ohgaj wui.

column2: Everyone was amazed at this demonstration of God's power. However even though everyone was amazed by all he did, Jesus warned his disciples,
column3: Kutsh wehsijj si e totods g hemajkam mat g Jiosh hab masma am i chehgi g e‑gewkdag k ab si has elid wehs hegai mo g Jesus hab junihim.

column2: “Listen carefully to what I'm telling you: the Son of man is about to be betrayed into the hands of men.”
column3: “Am g wo s‑chegitok ihda mant am wo em‑ahgi. E o aihim mat g s‑ni‑kehꞌiddam an wo ni‑bei ahni Jiosh si Kehsha k am wo ni‑gagda ha wui g hahaꞌichu.”

column2: But they didn't understand what this meant. Its meaning was hidden from them so they didn't realize its implications, and they were afraid to ask him about it.
column3: Kush pi shaꞌi amichud mas haschu hab ahg ch wabshaba s‑ehbid mas ab wo kakke.

column2: Then an argument started among the disciples about which of them was the greatest.
column3: Sh am hu hebai am e neꞌowin hegam Jesus chuhchai mas hedai d wo si haꞌichuk.

column2: But Jesus, knowing what they were arguing about, picked up and placed a small child next to him.
column3: Kush g Jesus s‑ha amichud mo haschu am chegito ch heg hekaj g al ali ab i kei e‑hugid an

column2: Then he said to them, “Anyone who accepts this little child in my name accepts me, and anyone who accepts me accepts the One who sent me. Whoever is least among you all is the greatest.”
column3: k ash hab kaij ab ha wui, “Hegai mat hedai am ni‑wehhejed s‑ap ab wo neidad g al ali ch hab waꞌap s‑ap ab ni‑neid. Kutp hedai s‑ap ab wo ni‑neidad ch hab waꞌap s‑ap ab neid g Jiosh nani pi d Kehshaj. Hegai mo hedai i si pi e haꞌichuchud am em‑shahgid o d si haꞌichu.”

column2: John spoke up, saying, “Master, we saw someone driving out demons in your name and we tried to stop him because he wasn't one of us.”
column3: Sh am hu hebai g John hab kaij, “T‑mashchamdam, hema ach neid g oꞌodham. K heg am m‑chehcheg ch gam hu hab i ha wua g jijawul ab ha amjed hegam mo an ha uꞌukch. Kuch hab ahg mat wo haꞌasa no pi pi am hu t‑wehmaj.”

column2: “Don't stop him,” Jesus replied. “Anyone who isn't against you is for you.”
column3: Kush hab kaij g Jesus ab ha wui, “Pi g am wo shaꞌi shohbid. Tki wo i em‑wehmt hegai matp hedai pi ab hu em‑wui kehk.”

column2: As the time approached for him to ascend to heaven, Jesus was determined to go to Jerusalem.
column3: Kush s‑mahch g Jesus mo e aihim mat g Jiosh am wo uhpam i bei e‑kihdag wui ch heg hekaj am i e shelch mat am wo hih Jerusalem wui k am wo i e nako.

column2: He sent messengers on ahead to a Samaritan village to get things ready for him.
column3: Sh am hihimad ch am hema miabid g kihhim Samaria chekshani ch ed. Kutsh g Jesus am haꞌi ha cheha g e‑chuhchai matsh ha baꞌich wo hihim k wo bei g koksikud ch haꞌichu hugi. Kutsh idam ha e juh.

column2: But the people would not welcome him because he was determined to press on to Jerusalem.
column3: Tsh wabshaba am i s‑mai hegam hemajkam mash d gam hu himdam g Jesus Jerusalem wui k heg hekaj pi hohhoꞌi mat am wo jiwia nash pi pi ha hohhoꞌid g Jerusalem t am hemajkam.

column2: When James and John saw this, they asked Jesus, “Master, do you want us to call fire down from heaven to burn them up?”
column3: Kutsh hekid g James ch John am i s‑mai mo pi hohhoꞌid k hab kaij, “T‑kownalig, nap tatchua matt ab wo i tai g Jiosh. T ab wo i huduni g mei k wo ha kokda?”

column2: But Jesus turned, and reprimanded them.
column3: Sh g Jesus si s‑gewkam ha shohbid.

column2: Then they proceeded to another village.
column3: Tsh amjed gam hu hahawa hihi hema ep kihhim wui.

column2: While they were walking, one man told Jesus, “I will follow you wherever you go!”
column3: Sh am hu hebai hihim. Kush hema g oꞌodham hab kaij ab Jesus wui, “Ni‑nahtokch ani ahni mant wo i m‑oid k wo i m‑wehmt.”

column2: Jesus told the man, “Foxes have their dens, and wild birds have their nests, but the Son of man doesn't even have a place to rest his head.”
column3: Sh hab kaij g Jesus ab wui, “Napt hig wo e nako? Neh, chum o hems g gagso ge wahpagga ch g uꞌuwhig ge koksh. Ni wabshaba ahni Jiosh si Kehsha pi shaꞌi ha kih ia jewed dahm. K heg hekaj s‑hasig maps wo ni‑oidad.”

column2: He told another man, “Follow me.” But the man replied, “Master, first let me go home and bury my father.”
column3: Sh hab ep kaij g Jesus ab hema wui g oꞌodham, “Oi g ni‑oid.”

column2: “Let the dead bury their own dead,” Jesus replied. “You go and proclaim God's kingdom.”
column3: Sh hab kaij g Jesus, “Am g ha hiwgid hegam mo pi uꞌukch g wechij doakag mat wo ha hiash g koꞌi. Pt ahpi hi am wo him k wo i ahgahi ab amjed g Jiosh kownaltalig.”

column2: Another man said, “Lord, I will follow you! But first let me go home and say goodbye to my family.”
column3: Sh hema hab ep kaij g oꞌodham, “Ni‑kownalig, am ant wo i m‑oid k wabshaba wehpeg wo hih uhpam k an wehs wo i ha neidok g ni‑hajuni.”

column2: But Jesus told him, “Nobody once they've started plowing and then looks back is fit for God's kingdom.”
column3: Sh hab kaij g Jesus ab wui, “Neh, nat hig shelinim wo moihunad hegai mat hedai am uhpam wo nea amai mo hebaijed him? Pegih, t hab wa masma pi haꞌichu wehhejed wo s‑kehgajk am Jiosh kownaltalig ed hegai mat am uhpam wo nea.”

column2: After this, the Lord appointed seventy other disciples, and sent them in pairs to every town and place that he planned to visit.
column3: Tsh amjed g Jesus am haꞌi ep i ha chuhcha wewaꞌakko gamai gohk matsh goꞌogok e wehm wo ahgahi g haꞌichu ahgaj am ha oidch hegam kihhim matsh hebai apꞌech matsh am epai wo hih.

column2: “The harvest is large, but the number of workers is small,” he told them. “Pray to the Lord of the harvest to send workers to his harvest fields.
column3: Sh hab kaij g Jesus ab ha wui, “Neh, muꞌij o hegam mo e nahtokch mat wo e doꞌibia. Kuch eda pi muꞌij ahchim mach am ha ahgidahim g doꞌibiadag ahga. Id o heg wa wepo mat hebai g ha‑hihka wo si geꞌejk. T g ha‑pionag pi wo muꞌijk. Ab g wo si tahnid g Jiosh mat muꞌi wo i ha chuhcha mat am wo ha ahgidahid g s‑kehg haꞌichu ahgaj ch ab wo i ha baꞌihamad hegam mo e nahtokch.

column2: So get on your way: I'm sending you like sheep among wolves.
column3: “Neh, bat masma wo s‑ta ehbidamak g hemajkam am em‑wehhejed mat g sheshꞌe am ha wehhejed g kahwal mahmad.

column2: Don't take any money or a bag or extra sandals, and don't spend time chatting with people you meet.
column3: Mt wabshaba pi haꞌichukaj wo e kudut k pi haꞌichu wo uꞌad nih g haꞌichu eniga nih chum hems g lial. Jiosh at hab wo ha juh g hemajkam mat wo em‑dagioꞌi. Am amt wo s‑e hohtmagi kihhim wui k pi hedai wo hiwigi mas wo em‑shohbi wohg ch ed.

column2: Whatever house you enter, first of all say, ‘May this house have peace.’
column3: “Kumt hebai wo dada ha‑kih am k am hab wo chei, ‘Jiosh o ab em‑makiog g s‑ap tahhadkam.’

column2: If there's a peaceful person living there, then your peace will rest on them; if not, it will return to you.  Stay in that house, eating and drinking whatever they give you, for a worker deserves to be paid. Don't go from house to house.
column3: Kut s‑ap ab wo i em‑nei matp ab wo s‑em‑wohoch k ab wo i em‑wahpki mamt am wo dadkkad. Kumt pi has wo elid k am wo dadkkad ch wo e gegosidad ch an wo i ha ahgidahid g s‑kehg haꞌichu ahgaj g Jiosh am hugkam mamt gam hu wo hihi ab amjed hegai kihhim. Chikpandam o ab d wuikam mat ab wo bei g e‑nam‑kidadag. K idam d ha wuikam mat am hab wo juh. Pi amt inhas wo wahpkid k am wo dadkkad am hugkam mamt ep wo baꞌich hihi.

column2: If you enter a town and the people there welcome you, then eat what's set before you
column3: Kut hebai g hemajkam s‑ap ab wo i em‑nei kihhim ch ed, mt wo huh mat haschu wo i em‑gegos

column2: and heal those who are sick. Tell them, ‘God's kingdom has come to you.’
column3: k wo ha doaj g kokꞌodam k wo ha ahgi g hemajkam mat ab i ha miabi g Jiosh kownaltalig.

column2: But if you enter a town and the people there don't welcome you, go through their streets telling them,
column3: “Kut hebai pi ap ab hu wo i em‑nei g hemajkam, mt am wo i wuwha kahya ch ed

column2: ‘We are wiping off even the dust from your town that clings to our feet to show you our disapproval. But you should recognize this: God's kingdom has come.’
column3: k ab wo si i shahmud g e‑shuhshk k hab wo chei, ‘Id att hekaj am wo em‑chehgi matt wo em‑dagito. Mt wabshaba wo s‑chegitok mat ab i chum em‑miabi g Jiosh kownaltalig.’

column2: I tell you, in the Day of Judgment it will be better for Sodom than for such a town.
column3: Neh, hegam si pi apꞌekam hemajkam mash wa am kihkahim Sodom kihhim ch ed at wo bei g s‑koꞌok e‑namkidadag mat hekid wo e ai g geꞌe lodaita tash. T wabshaba baꞌich wo i s‑koꞌokam e namkid hegam mat pi ab hu wo em‑kaiha.

column2: Shame on you Korazin! Shame on you Bethsaida! For if the miracles you saw happen had happened in Tyre and Sidon they would have repented a long time ago, and they would be sitting in sackcloth and ashes.  That's why in the judgment it will be better for Tyre and Sidon than for you.
column3: “Muꞌi s‑hasig haꞌichu ant am hab juh Korasin ch Bethsaida kihhim ch ed. Kutki eda g hemajkam amai pi ab hu ni‑wohoch. T heg hekaj ab wo bei g s‑koꞌok e‑namkidadag geꞌe lodaita tash ch ed. Hegam mo am kih Tyre ch Sidon kihhim t am ch pi geꞌe mahch ab amjed g Jiosh at pi am hu hugkam wo bei g s‑koꞌok e‑namkidadag. Tp hems ab wo i e shoꞌigchud k gam hu wo s‑ohhod g pi ap e‑chegitoi matp wo nei ihda s‑hasig haꞌichu.

column2: And you, Capernaum, you won't be exalted to heaven; you will go down to Hades.
column3: Capernaum t am hemajkam o ab si e haschud. T wabshaba g Jiosh gam hu wo i ha shul jiawul kih ed.”

column2: Anyone who hears you hears me, and anyone who rejects you rejects me. But anyone who rejects me rejects the one who sent me.”
column3: Sh hab ep kaij ab e‑chuhchai ha wui, “Heg o wa wepo mo ahni ab ni‑kaiham hegai matp hedai ab wo em‑kaiha. Kut ahni s‑ni‑ohhod matp hedai wo s‑em‑ohhod. Kutp hedai wo s‑ni‑ohhod k hab waꞌap s‑ohhod g Jiosh nani pi d kehshaj.”

column2: The seventy disciples returned in great excitement, saying, “Lord, even the demons do what we tell them in your name!”
column3: Tsh woho gam hu hihi hegam wewaꞌakko gamai gohk. Tsh am hebai i cheka. Tsh am i uhpam dada k shaꞌi si s‑hehgig ch hab kaij, “T‑kownalig, chum hems g jijawul ab s‑t‑wohog elid mach am m‑chechcheg ch ab si ha chehani mat gam hu hab wo i e juh.”

column2: Jesus replied, “I saw Satan fall like lightning from heaven.
column3: “Heuꞌu, nat pi hegai mo d ha‑geꞌejig ch d Satan heb hu wua g e‑gewkdag,” bash kaij g Jesus, “Neid ani mat ab i gei Jiosh kihdag amjed hab sha masma mat g wepgi.

column2: Yes, I have given you power to tread on snakes and scorpions, and to overcome all the enemy's strength, and nothing will harm you.
column3: Neh, ab ant em‑mah g gewkdag mamt wo e nako mamt am wabsh wo ha keish g kohkꞌoi ch nanakshel ch wehs g gewkdag g ge Jiawul. Kut pi wo shaꞌi s‑koꞌokam em‑juh.

column2: But don't take delight that the spirits do what you tell them—just be glad that your names are written in heaven.”
column3: Mt wabshaba pi heg hekaj wo s‑hehgigk mo g jijawul ab s‑em‑wohog elid. Heg amt hekaj wo s‑hehgigk mo gan hu oꞌohanas g em‑chechgig Jiosh kihdag an mam d e doꞌibiakam.”

column2: At that moment Jesus was filled with the joy of the Holy Spirit, and said, “I thank you Father, Lord of heaven and earth, for you hid these things from the wise and clever people and revealed them to children! Yes, Father, you were pleased to do it in this way.
column3: Kutsh iaꞌi idani g Hekia S‑apꞌekam Gewkdag ab mah g Jesus g si geꞌe s‑hehgig. Kush am e hoꞌigeꞌidahun ch hab kaij, “Ni‑ohg Jiosh, dap kownal wehs haꞌichu dahm. K hab d m‑elida mat pi hedai wo e nako mas hejel wo s‑amich g haꞌichu m‑ahga. E o ehstokch ab ha amjed g s‑chu aꞌamichuddam. Kup wabshaba am ha chehgid idam mo haꞌichu s‑mahchimk hab masma mo g aꞌal. Ni heg hekaj ab si m‑hoꞌigeꞌid.”

column2: My Father has handed over everything to me. No one understands the Son except the Father, and no one understands the Father except the Son, and those to whom the Son chooses to reveal him.”
column3: Neh, bash kaij g Jesus ch am hahawa ha ahgid g hemajkam, “Ni‑ohg Jiosh at ab ni‑mah wehs haꞌichu. Pi o hedai ni‑mahch ch hegai waꞌi ni‑ohg s‑ni‑mahch. K pi hedai mahch g ni‑ohg. Ni ahni waꞌi s‑mahch ch hegam ehp mani hedai i wui tashogid.”

column2: When they were by themselves Jesus turned to the disciples and told them, “Those who see what you're seeing should be really happy!
column3: Tsh am hahawa i e hejelko hegam Jesus. Kush hab ha ahg, “Do si s‑ap tahhadkam mam am neid ch kah ihda mam haschu i neid ch kah.

column2: I tell you, many prophets and kings have wanted to see what you're seeing, but they didn't see, and wanted to hear the things you're hearing, but didn't hear.”
column3: Muꞌijj g kekelibad Jiosh haꞌichu i tashogiddam ch kokownalbad o wa chum s‑neidamk hegai mam haschu i neid ch chum s‑kaimk mam haschu i kah.”

column2: Once an expert in religious law stood up and tried to trap Jesus. “Teacher,” he asked, “What do I have to do to gain eternal life?”
column3: Tsh am hu hebai am hema jiwia g chehanig ha mashchamdam k wabsh chum heki s‑himchudam g Jesus hab kaijch, “Ha mashchamdam, shahnt wo ni‑juh. T hekaj ab wo i ni‑wahki g Jiosh e‑kihdag ed?”

column2: “What is written in the law? How do you read it?” asked Jesus.
column3: Kush hab kaij g Jesus ab wui, “Nap hig pi mahch mo has chuꞌig an Jiosh oꞌohana ed heg amjed.”

column2: “You shall love the Lord your God with your whole heart, and your whole spirit, and your whole strength, and your whole mind; and love your neighbor as yourself,” the man replied.
column3: Sh hab kaij hegai oꞌodham, “Heuꞌu. Bo chuꞌig:

column2: “You're right,” Jesus told him. “Do this, and you will live.”
column3: Sh hab kaij g Jesus, “Heg o wud. Kut s‑ap ab wo i m‑wahki maptp heg am hab wo junihid.”

column2: But the man wanted to vindicate himself, so he asked Jesus, “And who is my neighbor?”
column3: Kush ihda oꞌodham s‑mahch mo pi am hu hab junihim hegai chehanig ch wabshaba gam hu wabsh chum s‑e oanamk ch ash ab kakke g Jesus, “K hedai d ni‑nawoj?”

column2: Jesus replied, saying, “A man was going down from Jerusalem to Jericho. He was attacked by robbers who stripped him and beat him, and left him for dead.
column3: Sh g Jesus am ahgid ihda haꞌichu wepogida ahga, “Neh, matp hems am hema hih g t‑wehm Tuhligo Jerusalem t amjed gam hu Jerico wui. T am haha wabsh g s‑chu eꞌeskam am cheggia k ehs g haꞌichu enigaj k gewichkwua k chum alo mua.

column2: It so happened that a priest was going the same way. He saw the man, but he passed by on the other side of the road.
column3: K am woꞌo.

column2: Then a Levite came along. But when he got to the place and saw the man, he also passed by on the other side.
column3: T hab wa masma g papal ha wehm chikpandam ab hema him k am nei hegai oꞌodham mo am woꞌo k gam hu wabsh bijim k gam hu hih.

column2: Finally a Samaritan man came along. As he passed by, he saw the man and felt sorry for him.
column3: T g hema Samaria t am oꞌodham am hahawa him k cheh ihda oꞌodham. Kum ab aꞌai s‑e kehꞌid g Samaria t am hemajkam ha wehm. T eda ihda si s‑hoꞌigeꞌid

column2: He went over and treated the man's wounds with oil and wine, and bandaged them. Then he placed the man on his own donkey and took him to an inn where he took care of him.
column3: k ab i wako g ehꞌed g nawaitkaj k ab i huhud k an i hobino g ikuskaj k an hahawa dai e‑shoiga an k gam hu i bei kihhim wui mat am hebai wo ha nuhkudach.

column2: The next day he gave two denarii to the innkeeper and told him, ‘Take care of him, and if you spend more than this, I'll pay you back when I return.’
column3: “K am baꞌich d i tash. T gam hu wo hih ihda oꞌodham k wabshaba ab haꞌi ha mah g lial mat wo nuhkud k hab ha ah, ‘Am g wo nuhkud. Kunt ia ep wo jiwia k wo wa em‑namkid mamt haschu baꞌich wo i heki gei wehhejed.’

column2: Which one of these three do you think was a neighbor to the man who was attacked by robbers?”
column3: “Neh, kup hedai hab elid idam waik mo s‑ap d nawojij hegai mamt gewichkwua?”

column2: “The one who showed him kindness,” the man replied.
column3: Sh hab kaij hegai chehanig ha mashchamdam, “Hegai mo s‑hoꞌigeꞌid.”

column2: While they were on their way, Jesus arrived at a village, and a woman called Martha invited him to her home.
column3: Sh amjed am hebai hihim idam Jesus ch am dada hema kihhim t am. Sh am hema g uwi hab chehgig Marda ch ab i ha wahpki e‑kih ed.

column2: She had a sister called Mary, who sat at the Lord's feet and listened to his teaching.
column3: Kush am wehmaj daha g wehngaj ch hab chehgig Mary ch id ab i dahiwua Jesus wui k ab si kaiham g haꞌichu mashchamaj.

column2: Martha was concerned about all that needed to be done to prepare the meal, so she came to Jesus and said, “Master, don't you care that my sister has left me to do all the work by myself? Tell her to come and help me!”
column3: Sh eda g Marda si chikpan ch e kudut k am jiwia Jesus wui k hab kaij, “Ni‑kownalig, nap pi shaꞌi has elid mat g ni‑wehnag am wabsh i ni‑dagito mant hejel hab wo juh g chikpan. Ab g ahgid mat ab wo i him k wo i ni‑wehmt.”

column2: “Martha, Martha,” the Lord replied, “you're worried and upset about all this.
column3: Sh hab kaij g Jesus ab wui, “Ih, Marda, muꞌi ap haꞌichukaj e kudut.

column2: But only one thing is really necessary. Mary has chosen the right thing, and it shall not be taken away from her.”
column3: K eda am d waꞌi hemako haꞌichu mo d si haꞌichu. Id at g Mary ab bei. Kut pi wo shaꞌi e wohppoꞌidach.”

column2: Once Jesus was praying in a certain place. When he finished, one of his disciples asked him, “Lord, please teach us to pray, just as John taught his disciples.”
column3: Sh am hu hebai e hoꞌigeꞌidahun g Jesus ch am i kuhgit. Sh hema hab kaij g chuhchaij ab wui, “T‑kownalig, oi g hig t‑mashcham matt has masma wo t‑hoꞌigeꞌidahu hab masma mo wa g John ha mashcham hegam mo ab si wecho e mashcham.”

column2: Jesus told them, “When you pray, say, ‘Father, let your name be honored as holy. May your kingdom come.
column3: Sh hab kaij g Jesus ab ha wui, “Id amt hab wo chei am e hoꞌigeꞌidahunch:

column2: Jesus went on to tell them, “Say you have a friend and you go to him in the middle of the night and ask, ‘My friend, lend me three loaves of bread  because a friend of mine has come to visit me, and I don't have any food to give him.’
column3: Sh hab ep kaij g Jesus ab ha wui hegam mo ab si wecho e mashcham, “Neh, tp hems hema pi am hu geꞌe wo haꞌichu hugik. T am hema mehkjed wo jiwia hudunk ab mat ab i chehgim. Kut am wo hih g kihkam e‑hugid am kihkam wui k ab wo haꞌi tai g sismito mat wo gegos g e‑nawoj.

column2: Your friend in the house might reply, ‘Don't bother me—I've already locked the door, and I and my children have gone to bed. I can't get up to give you anything now.’
column3: “T hab haha wabsh wo chum chei g hugidaj am kihkam, ‘Pi g ia hu ni‑kudut. Heki ant hu ab yahwidad g ni‑kihjeg. Kutt heki hu wohpiwua g t‑aꞌaliga ha wehm. Nt pi wo i wamig k wo m‑mah haꞌichu.’

column2: I tell you, even though he refuses to get up and give you anything, despite you being his friend, if you are persistent, your friend will get up and give you everything you need.
column3: “T wabshaba pi has wo e elid k ab wabsh wo kia tahnid. T am haha wo i wamig k ab wo mah nat pi pi haꞌasa ab wo tahnid.

column2: I tell you: ask, and you shall receive; seek, and you shall find; knock, and the door shall be opened to you.  For everyone who asks, receives; and everyone who seeks, finds; and to everyone who knocks the door will be opened.
column3: “Pegih, mt ahpim hab wa masma pi haꞌasa ab wo tahnid g Jiosh mam haschu i tatchua. T ab wo em‑mah. Am g wo haꞌichu i e gahgidad. T wo em‑chehgi. Ab g wo shontpag g kihjeg. T ab wo i e kuhpiꞌo em‑wehhejed.

column2: Which of you fathers, if your son asks for a fish, would give him a snake instead?
column3: “Neh, s‑mahch am mat pi hedai wabsh g wamad ab wo mah g e‑alidag mat g watopi ab wo tai.

column2: Or if he asks for an egg, would you give him a scorpion?
column3: Kut pi wabsh g nakshel ab wo mah mat g chuchul nonha ab wo tai.

column2: So if you, even though you are evil, still know to give good gifts to your children, how much more will the heavenly Father give the Holy Spirit to those who ask him?”
column3: Mam has i masma pi apꞌe ch wabshaba s‑mahch mamt g s‑kehg haꞌichu ab wo ha mah g e‑aꞌaliga. No hig pi g em‑ohg Jiosh baꞌich i e nahtokch mat ab wo ha mah g Hekia S‑apꞌekam Gewkdag hegam mat ab wo tai.”

column2: Jesus was driving out a demon that had made a man dumb. When the demon had left, the man who was dumb spoke, and the crowds were amazed.
column3: Sh am hu hebai hema pi ha neok g cheoj nash pi g jiawul an uꞌukch. Kutsh g Jesus gam hu hab i juh g jiawul. Tsh am ha hekaj i neo. Tsh g hemajkam si has i el.

column2: But some of them said, “He is driving out demons using the power of Beelzebub, the ruler of demons.”
column3: Sh eda haꞌi hab kaij, “Moki g jijawul ha‑geꞌejig ab mahkch g gewkdag. K heg hekaj gam hu hab i ha wua g jijawul ab ha amjed hegam mo an ha uꞌukch.”

column2: Others were trying to test Jesus by demanding a miraculous sign from heaven.
column3: Sh haꞌijj wabsh chum heki s‑himchudamk g Jesus ch ab chehani mat g s‑hasig haꞌichu hab wo juh k hekaj am wo ha chehgi mo ab Jiosh t amjed.

column2: Jesus knew what they were thinking and said, “Any kingdom divided against itself will be destroyed. A family  divided against itself will fall.
column3: Sh wabshaba g Jesus s‑mahch mo haschu am chegito ch hab kaij ab ha wui, “S‑mahch am mat g oꞌodham wo padch g hejel e‑jewedga mat ab aꞌai wo e cheggia. Kut g e‑wehm kihkam hab waꞌap wo padch g hejel e‑kihdag mat ab aꞌai wo e cheggia.

column2: If Satan is divided against himself, how can his kingdom stand? You say that I cast out demons using the power of Beelzebub.
column3: Pegih, t has hig masma g Jiawul pi wo padch g hejel e‑kownaltalig matp ab wo sha ni‑mah g gewkdag mant am wo i ha wuwhas g piongaj?

column2: But if I drive out demons by the power of Beelzebub, by whose power do your own people drive them out? They themselves will condemn you as wrong!
column3: Neh, em‑pionag o hab waꞌap i ha wuwhasid g jijawul. Kum eda pi hab masma hab ha elid mo g Jiawul ab ha mahkch g gewkdag. Pegih, idam at wo em‑ahgi mo pi woho hegai mam hab chum elid.

column2: However, if I am driving out demons by the power of God, then this proves God's kingdom has arrived. It's right here among you!
column3: Jiosh gewkdagkaj ani gam hu hab i ha wua g jijawul. K id am wohokamchud mat heki hu in i wuhsh g Jiosh kownaltalig em‑shahgid.

column2: When a strong man who is fully armed guards his house, all he owns is safe.
column3: “Nat hig pi wo e nahtokch g si s‑gegoki kownal g e‑cheggiakudkaj mat wo nuhkud g e‑kih. T hab pi hedai wo wohppoꞌi g haꞌichu enigaj.

column2: But if a stronger man comes and defeats him, taking from him all his weapons that he depended on, then he can carry off all his possessions.
column3: Tp wabshaba g baꞌich i s‑gegoki kownal wo cheggia k wo gewito k gam hu wo i ui hegai cheggiakudaj mo ab chum si hiwig k am wo aꞌai i tahp g haꞌichu enigaj am ha wehhejed g e‑shondalig. Neh, bani wa masma cheggia g ge Jiawul.

column2: Anyone who is not with me is against me, and anyone who doesn't build together with me is breaking it all apart.
column3: K hegam mat hedai pi ab hu wo i ni‑wehmajk ab ni‑wui gegok ch wabsh ha gantan hegam mani s‑ha doꞌibiamk.”

column2: When an evil spirit leaves someone, it goes through the desert looking for a place to stay. When it doesn't find anywhere, it says, ‘I'll return to the house I left.’
column3: Kush hab ep kaij g Jesus, “Matp hems g jiawul an wo hema uꞌukch g oꞌodham ch wabsh wo dagito mat am hebai ep wo e ul. Kut hegai oꞌodham wo i chum kegch g e‑doakag. T wabshaba g jiawul pi hebai wo chehg k hekaj hab wo i e ah, ‘Mo hig woho d ni‑kih hegai oꞌodham. Nt hig am uhpam wo hih wui.’

column2: When it returns, it finds its old home is swept and tidy.
column3: Kut wa woho am uhpam wo him k wo cheh mo am wabsh jeg ch si kegchudas ch hehosimhunas.

column2: So it goes and finds seven other spirits more evil than itself, and they go in and live there. In the end that man is worse off than before.”
column3: T am haha wo him k wewaꞌak ep wo ha uꞌapa g jijawul. T idam baꞌich wo i pi apꞌek ch am wehmaj wo i chiwia. Neh, t ihda oꞌodham hahawa baꞌich wo i pi apꞌek mo wa ga hu i heki hu.”

column2: As he was speaking, a woman in the crowd called out, “Blessed is the womb from where you came and the breasts that nursed you.”
column3: Sh an wehgaj gegok g hemajkam. Kush hema g uwi hab kaij am wui g Jesus, “Do si geꞌe s‑hehgig heg wehhejed uwi mat an m‑mahsid k m‑siꞌichudahim.”

column2: But Jesus said, “Even more blessed are those who hear God's word, and follow what it says.”
column3: Sh wabshaba hab kaij g Jesus, “Baꞌich at wo i s‑hehgigk hegam mat ab wo kaihamad g Jiosh haꞌichu ahga.”

column2: As people crowded around him, Jesus began telling them, “This is an evil generation for it's looking for some miraculous sign, but no sign will be given to it except the sign of Jonah.
column3: Sh am i muꞌidahim g hemajkam. Kush hab kaij g Jesus, “Muꞌijj o g ha‑chegitoidag pi apꞌe. K heg hekaj s‑neidamk mant hab wo juh g s‑hasig haꞌichu k am wo wohokamch mani ab Jiosh amjed. Bant waꞌi masma am wo ha chehgi mani d Jiosh si Kehsha matsh wa hab e juh hegai kelibad Jiosh haꞌichu i tashogiddam mash d Jonah.

column2: In the same way that Jonah was a sign to the people of Nineveh, so will the Son of man be a sign to this generation.
column3: Heg atsh wa am si has masma i e chehgi ha wui g Ninevah t am hemajkam. Nt ahni am si has masma wo i ni‑chehgi am ha wui g hemajkam iaꞌi idani.

column2: The queen of the south will rise in the judgment together with the people of this generation and will condemn them, for she came from the ends of the earth to hear Solomon's wisdom, and now there is someone greater than Solomon here!  The people of Nineveh rise in the judgment together with this generation, and will condemn it, for they repented when they heard Jonah's message, and now there's someone greater than Jonah here!
column3: “Hegam Ninevah t am hemajkam atsh gam hu s‑ohhod g pi ap e‑chegitoi am i kahk g Jonabad k hab pi ab hu wo e chuꞌijigch geꞌe lodaita tash ch ed. Ni ahni baꞌich d i si haꞌichu mo g Jonabad. Kum eda pi ab hu ni‑kaiham ch heg hekaj ab wo motoig g chuꞌijig lodaita tash ch ed. (31) Mehkjed atsh ab i hih g uwi kownal ab wakolim tahgio amjed mat ab wo kaiha g Solomonbad haꞌichu mahchig. Ni ahni baꞌich d i si haꞌichu mo g Solomonbad. Kum eda pi ab hu ni‑kaiham ch heg hekaj ab wo motoig g chuꞌijig lodaita tash ed.”

column2: No one lights a lamp and then hides it or places it under a bowl. No, you put it on a lamp stand so that those who come into the house can see the light.
column3: Kush hab ep kaij g Jesus, “Wohokam o wepogidas mo g lahmpa. Kum s‑mahch mo pi hab d ahga g lahmpa mas am wo e ehsto haꞌichu wecho. Mt an wo dai mat hebai wo ha tonlidad hegam mo ab i wahpk.

column2: Your eye is the light for your body. When your eye is good, your whole body is full of light. But when your eye is bad, your body is in the dark.
column3: “Em‑wuhpui at s‑ap am wo i wahki g tonlig matp wo s‑mamsk k wabshaba pi am hu wo i wahki matp pi wo mamsk. Kum heg hekaj s‑ap ha nuhkud.

column2: So make sure the light you have in you is not actually darkness.
column3: Pegih, wahm amt wo si s‑ap nuhkudad g haꞌichu e‑amichudadag mat heg s‑ap am wo i wahki g wohokam.

column2: If your whole body is full of light, with no areas of darkness, then it will be completely illuminated, just as a bright lamp gives you light.”
column3: Bat waꞌi masma ab wo i shuhdad g em‑chegitoidag g wohokam.”

column2: After Jesus had finished speaking, a Pharisee invited him to come and eat with him. So Jesus went and sat down to a meal.
column3: Tsh am i haꞌasa neo g Jesus. Tsh am hema jiwia g Palasi k am waid mat wo wehmaj e gegos. Kutsh wa woho am i wahk k am i dahiwua matsh wo e gegos.

column2: The Pharisee was surprised that Jesus didn't wash his hands before eating as ceremonially required.
column3: Tsh hegai Palasi si has i el neidok mat pi e wako hab masma mo d ha himdag.

column2: So the Lord told him, “You Pharisees clean the outside of the cup and the dish, but inside you're full of greed and wickedness.
column3: Kush s‑amichud g Jesus ch hab kaij ab wui, “Neh, ahpim Palasi am si kegchud g e‑honshpadag. K wabshaba g em‑chegitoi wabsh shuhdags g pi apꞌekamkaj. Heg o wa wepo mam an waꞌi wehgaj si kegchud g hohas‑hahaꞌa. K ged hu ha eda wabsh kia s‑bibtagi.

column2: You're so foolish! Don't you think the One who made the outside made the inside as well?
column3: Damt wabsh wo totontok mamtp heg wo waꞌi s‑ap nuhkud e‑honshpadag. Jiosh at hab waꞌap nahto g em‑doakag. Kumt heg ep wo chum nuhkud.

column2: If, acting from within, you do acts of kindness to others, then everything will be clean to you.
column3: Am g wehs wo i dagito Jiosh wui k hab wo s‑chechojimak ab shoꞌigkam ha wui ch wo nei mat wehs haꞌichu wo s‑kehgajk am em‑wehhejed.

column2: Shame on you Pharisees! You pay tithe on herbs and plants, but you neglect justice and the love of God. You need to pay attention to the latter, while not leaving the former things undone.
column3: “Neh, ahpim Palasi am ab mahk g Jiosh g hemako tahpani mo wehst‑mahm e tahpanch g em‑eniga, chum hems g nahnko mahs pi‑miandi ch haꞌichu tatk. T wabshaba g Jiosh s‑koꞌokam wo em‑namkid nam pi pi apꞌechud hegai mam haschukaj ha shoꞌigchud haꞌi ch pi ab hu tatchua g Jiosh.

column2: Shame on you Pharisees! You love to have the best seats in the synagogues, and to be greeted with respect when you go to the markets.
column3: Shaꞌam waꞌi s‑hohhoꞌid mamt si s‑apko wo dadhaiwua am cheopi ch ed ch s‑hohhoꞌid mat ab wo si has em‑elidad g hemajkam mamt an wo i wuwha kahya ch ed.

column2: Shame on you! You are like unmarked graves that people walk over without knowing.”
column3: Ih, shoꞌig! Mt wo si s‑koꞌokam e namkidach. Neh, pi at wo mahsk g hihaꞌini matp pi am hu wo tohnkdask. Kumtp hems am wabsh dahm wo oiopod. Pegih, bat sha masma pi wo mahchk g hemajkam mam d pi apꞌekam nam pi ehstokch g pi ap e‑chuꞌijig.”

column2: One of the experts in religious law reacted, saying, “Teacher, when you talk like this, you're insulting us too!”
column3: Kush hema hab kaij g chehanig ha mashchamdam ab wui, “Ha mashchamdam, ahchim ap hab waꞌap has t‑ahg hab kaijch.”

column2: Jesus replied, “Shame on you lawyers too! You place burdens on people that are too hard to carry, but you don't lift a finger to help them.
column3: Sh hab kaij g Jesus, “Pegih, ab em‑wui o hab waꞌap him g s‑koꞌok em‑namkidadag. Muꞌi s‑hasig haꞌichu am ab ha chehani g hemajkam. K id d s‑wehch haꞌichu mohtoi am ha wehhejed. M eda ahpim pi haꞌichu hab shaꞌi wua mams hekaj ha wehm wo moht.

column2: Shame on you! You build memorial tombs to honor the prophets, but it was your own fathers who killed them in the first place!  By doing this you are witnesses showing that you agree with what your fathers did. They killed the prophets, and you build their tombs!
column3: “Em‑shohshon at muꞌi ha kokda g Jiosh haꞌichu i tashogiddam. Kum ahpim ha wepo masma, chum ams ha hehosid g ha‑hihaꞌiniga hegam mamt ha kokda. K heg hekaj ab em‑wui him g s‑koꞌok em‑namkidadag.

column2: This is why God in his wisdom said, ‘I will send them prophets and apostles; some they will kill, and others they will persecute.’
column3: Heki o hu hab kaij g Jiosh, ‘Ab ant wo i ha wuwhas g haꞌichu i tashogiddam ha shahgid g hemajkam. Kut haꞌi wo ha‑kokda k haꞌi wo ha shoꞌigch.’

column2: Consequently, this generation will be held accountable for the blood of all the prophets shed from the beginning of the world,
column3: Neh, kum ha wepo chuꞌijig mamtp ha wepo haꞌichu elid. Kut wepo masma wo em‑ai g s‑koꞌok ha‑namkidadag heg hekaj wehs mat hab juh ga hu i amjed mat in i e nahto g jewed.

column2: from the blood of Abel right up to the blood of Zachariah who was killed between the altar and the sanctuary. Yes, I tell you, this generation will be held accountable for all of it.
column3: Abelbad atsh wa wehpeg e muhkid. Tsh amjed muꞌi ep e koꞌij. Tsh g Zecariabad ga hu si ha oidch e muhkid amai shahgid g iagchulidakud ch geꞌe cheopi. Kum ahpim ha wepo chuꞌijig hegam matsh wa ha kokda ch ha wepo masma wo bei g s‑koꞌok e‑namkidadag mamtp hedai ha wepo elid haꞌichu.

column2: Shame on you lawyers! You have removed the key of knowledge. You didn't go in yourselves, and you prevented others from going in too.”
column3: “Ahpim chehanig ha mashchamdam amt wo i chum ha amichudach g hemajkam mat has masma wo s‑mahchk g Jiosh. Kum eda ahpim pi mahch ch ep ha shohbidch hegam mo s‑mahchimk. Heg o wa wepo mam ab yahwidad g kihjeg mat pi hedai am hu wo i wah. Jiosh at s‑koꞌokam wo em‑namkid heg hekaj.”

column2: As Jesus was leaving, the religious teachers and the Pharisees began to attack him aggressively, asking questions to provoke him.
column3: Tsh am i wuhsh g Jesus k gam hu chum hih. Tsh hegam chehanig ha mashchamdam ch Palasi ab hahawa si s‑ta keꞌidam has ahg k muꞌi haꞌichu kakke

column2: They were hoping to catch him out, trying to get him to say something they could use against him.
column3: hab wabsh chum ahgch mat wo heki himch mat pi ap haꞌichu hab wo chei.

column2: In the meantime so many thousands of people had gathered that they were stepping on each another. Jesus began speaking first to his disciples. “Beware the yeast of the Pharisees—hypocrisy.
column3: Kutsh shaꞌi si muꞌi mihl hemajkam am i e hemapad k wabsh aꞌai e keishshap.

column2: For there's nothing hidden that won't be revealed, nothing secret that won't be made known.
column3: Hegai mo chum e maꞌishch at wehs wo e maꞌishpiꞌo. Pej, wehs s‑aꞌagi haꞌichu at wo s‑e mai.

column2: Whatever you have said in the dark will be heard in the light, and whatever you whispered in private will be announced from the rooftops.
column3: Wehs at wo mahsko e wua mamtp haschu chum s‑aꞌagi hab kaij. Kut wehs am si s‑kaidam wo e ahgad kih dahm amjed mamtp haschu i chum s‑jupij hab kaij ged hu si e‑kih ed.”

column2: I tell you, my friends, don't be afraid of those who kill the body, for once they've done that there's no more they can do.
column3: Sh hab hahawa kaij g Jesus ab ha wui g hemajkam, “Neh, ni‑naipijju, pi g wo shaꞌi ha ehbidad hegam matp hedai wo chum s‑em‑kokdaim. Pi at wo e nako mas baꞌich s‑koꞌokam has wo i em‑juh em‑kokdak.

column2: Let me make it clear whom you should be afraid of. You should be afraid of the one who after he has killed has the power to dispose of them in Gehenna. That's the one you should be afraid of.
column3: Heg at waꞌi Jiosh wo e nako mat am wo em‑daꞌich Jiawul kih ed mamtp pi am hu wo wohog elidad. Kumt heg ab wo waꞌi si has elidad.

column2: Aren't five sparrows sold for two pennies? But God doesn't forget a single one of them.  Even the hairs on your head have been counted. Don't be afraid—you're worth more than many sparrows!
column3: K wabshaba g Jiosh si s‑hemajima ch pi tatchua mas wo s‑koꞌokam em‑juh. Am g wo oidahim mo chum hems g al uꞌuwhig s‑ap ha nuhkud. K eda chum alo pi haꞌichu namkig idam. Kum ahpim wehs haꞌichu baꞌich d i haꞌichu am tahgio. Jiosh o wehs haꞌichu s‑mahch ab em‑ab. Mt heg hekaj pi haꞌichu wo shaꞌi ehbidad ab wui e dagitokch.”

column2: I tell you the truth, those who declare they belong to me, the Son of man will also declare they belong to him before God's angels,
column3: Sh hab ep kaij g Jesus, “Neh, am amt wo s‑ni‑mahch k ah hemajkam ha tahgio mani d em‑doꞌibiakam. Kunt ahni hab waꞌap wo s‑em‑mahch k ah am ha tahgio g anghil ch am Jiosh tahgio.

column2: but those who deny me will be denied before God's angels.
column3: Kutp wabshaba hedai pi wo ni‑mahch k ah am ha tahgio g hemajkam, nt ahni hab waꞌap pi wo mahch k ah am ha tahgio g anghil ch am Jiosh tahgio.

column2: Everyone who speaks against the Son of man will be forgiven, but anyone who blasphemes against the Holy Spirit will not be forgiven.
column3: “Jiosh at gam hu hab wo i juh g pi ap chuꞌijigaj hegai mat hedai wo wa chum has ni‑ah matp gam hu wo s‑ohhod g pi ap e‑chuꞌijig. T wabshaba pi gam hu hab wo i e juh g pi ap chuꞌijigaj hegai mat hedai wo s‑koꞌokam has ah g Hekai S‑apꞌekam Gewkdag.

column2: When you're brought to trial before synagogues, rulers, and authorities, don't worry about how to defend yourself, or what you should say.
column3: “Pi g wo shaꞌi kudut ab amjed mamt has masma e wehhejed wo neo mamtp hems am wo em‑lodai chechopi ch ed o am ha tahgio g kokownal.

column2: The Holy Spirit will teach you at that time what's important to say.”
column3: Hekia S‑apꞌekam Gewkdag at wo em‑ahgi mamt has wo chei.”

column2: Someone in the crowd asked Jesus, “Teacher, please tell my brother to share the inheritance with me.”
column3: Sh am hema g oꞌodham hab kaij ab wui, “Ha mashchamdam, hab g ahgid g ni‑nawoj mat am wo i ha ni‑tahpani hegai mat g t‑ohg an dagito t‑wehhejed.”

column2: “My friend,” Jesus replied, “Who appointed me as your judge to decide how your inheritance should be divided?” He told the people,
column3: Sh hab kaij g Jesus ab wui, “Pi ant heg hekaj ia hu jiwia manis wo em‑lodait k am wo i em‑apꞌechudach g haꞌichu em‑eniga am em‑shahgid.”

column2: “Watch out, and beware of all greedy thoughts and actions, for a person's life isn't summed up by all the things they own.”
column3: Sh am baꞌich hab ep kaij ab wehs ha wui, “Am g wo s‑e nenꞌoidk mamt pi heg wo waꞌi huꞌuidad s‑kaisdag. Pi amt d wo s‑ap doakamk heg hekaj mam haschu i eniga, chum ams d wo s‑kaisk.”

column2: Then he told them a story as an illustration. “Once there was a rich man who owned land that was very productive.
column3: Sh id am hahawa chum ha tashogid ch hab kaij, “Tp hems hema d wo s‑kaisk. K g eꞌeshaj si geꞌe babhe.

column2: The man said to himself, ‘What shall I do? I've nowhere to store my crops.’
column3: K hab e ahg, ‘Pi o an hu wiꞌis mant hebai ep wo toa g haꞌichu bahidag. Shuhshud at g ni‑waptto.

column2: ‘I know what I'll do,’ he decided. ‘I'll pull down my barns and build bigger ones, and then I'll be able to store all my crops and everything I own.
column3: Nt hig wo i ha shulig k am baꞌich i geꞌeged haꞌi wo i chuhcha k am wo baꞌiha g haꞌichu bahidag ch wehs haꞌichu ni‑eniga.

column2: Then I'll tell myself, “You have enough to live on for many years, so take life easy: eat, drink, and enjoy yourself!” ’
column3: Si at haꞌichu s‑ni‑abam. Nt muꞌi aꞌahidag ab wo hekaj ihda s‑iꞌowi haꞌichu k wo ni‑ulinihogidad ch wo ni‑gegosidad ch wo ihꞌed ch wo si s‑hehgigk.’ Neh, bo e ahg ihda s‑kais.

column2: But God said to him, ‘You foolish man! Your life will be demanded back this very night, and then who will get everything you've stored up?’
column3: “K wabshaba ab wui hab kaij g Jiosh, ‘Dap wabsh tohnto. Id i s‑chuhugam ab apt wo muh. Kut d wabsh wo hemak ch wo ui g haꞌichu m‑eniga map hejel am chum e wiꞌidch.’

column2: This is what happens to people who hoard up wealth for themselves but are not rich as far as God is concerned.”
column3: Neh, bo wa chuꞌig ch hab waꞌap wo wa chuꞌigk wehs ha wehhejed hegam mo hejel s‑e kaischudamk ch wabshaba pi am hu Jiosh wehhejed hekaj g s‑e‑kaisdag,” bo kaij g Jesus.

column2: Jesus told his disciples, “That's why I tell you don't worry about life, about what to eat, or about what clothes you should wear.
column3: Sh hab hahawa ep kaij g Jesus ab ha wui g e‑chuhchai, “Heg ani hekaj am em‑ahgid ihda mamt pi wo si e kudutad ab haꞌichu e‑hugi ab o ab haꞌichu e‑eniga ab.

column2: Life is about more than food, and the body is about more than wearing clothes.
column3: Jiosh at ab em‑mah g em‑doakag, pegih, k hab waꞌap ab wo em‑mah mamt haschukaj wo e dagioꞌidad.

column2: Look at the ravens. They don't sow or reap, they don't have any storerooms or barns, but God feeds them. And you're far more valuable than birds!
column3: “An g wo i ha neid g hahawani. Idam o pi haꞌichu eꞌeshad ch pi od g haꞌichu esha ch pi ha kihki o ha waptto mat am eda wo baꞌiha. Jiosh o ha gegosid. Kum eda ahpim baꞌich d i si haꞌichu mo g uꞌuwhig am tahgio g Jiosh. T heg s‑ap wo em‑dagioꞌidad.

column2: Can you add an hour to your life by worrying about it?
column3: Pi amt wo e nako mams am baꞌich wo i himch g e‑aꞌahidagga am wabsh hekaj e kudutch.

column2: If you can't do anything about such small things, why worry about the rest?
column3: Mamtp pi wo e nako mamt hab wo juh ihda al haꞌas chum haꞌichu, pegih, k haschu ahgk wo e kudutad g baꞌich i geꞌeged haꞌichukaj?

column2: Think of the lilies and how they grow. They don't work, and they don't spin thread for clothes, but I tell you, not even Solomon in all his glory was as beautifully dressed as one of them.
column3: “An g wo i ha neid hegam haꞌichu wuhshanig m an chuhch. Pi o chikpan ch pi shohshom g haꞌichu eniga. Kuki eda g ha‑heosig baꞌich i s‑kehgaj mo g haꞌichu enigaj hegai s‑kais kownalbad mash hab chehgig Solomon.

column2: So if God clothes the fields with such beautiful flowers, which are here today but gone tomorrow when they are burned in a fire to heat an oven, how much more will God clothe you, you who have so little trust!
column3: Neh, tp hems s‑hohtam wo gaksh hegai shaꞌi m an chuhch k wo hekaj e nanda. K eda heg wa wepo mo g Jiosh si s‑kehg enigadadch g heosigkaj. Pegih, am g wo s‑wohochud mat ab s‑ap wo em‑enigadadch.

column2: Don't be concerned about what you're going to eat or drink—don't worry about it.
column3: Pi g heg waꞌi hekaj wo e kudutad mamt wo e gahgi g haꞌichu hugi.

column2: These are all things that people in the world worry about, but your Father knows you need them.
column3: Wehs hemajkam an jewed dahm o chum hekid id an si e gahgid. K wabshaba g em‑ohg Jiosh s‑mahch mam tatchua ihda.

column2: Search for God's kingdom, and you'll be given these things as well.
column3: Mt g Jiosh kownaltalig wehpeg am wo ul e‑doakag ed. T g Jiosh ab epai wo em‑mah mam haschu i tatchua.

column2: Don't be afraid, little flock, for your Father is happy to give you the kingdom.
column3: “Pi g am wo shaꞌi haꞌichu ehbidad ahpim mam al heꞌekiajj ab ni‑hiwig. Em‑ohg Jiosh o ab si tatchua mat ab wo i em‑mah g e‑kownaltalig.

column2: Sell what you have, and give the money to the poor. Get yourselves purses that don't wear out: treasure in heaven that will never run out, where no thief can steal it and no moth can destroy it.
column3: Wehs g wo gagda mam haschu i edgid k wo ha mah g namkigaj g shoꞌigkam k an haha wo edgidad g baꞌich i s‑kehg kaisdag Jiosh kihdag ed. T heg pi hekid wo huhug. T pi hedai wo em‑ehs. T g hiopch pi hekid wo padch.

column2: For your heart will be wherever your treasure is.
column3: Kumt am wo s‑hihimim no pi g em‑tatchuidag am ulinig mo hebai haꞌichug hegai mam haschu hab elid mo d em‑kaisdag.”

column2: Be dressed and ready, and keep your lamps lit,  like servants waiting for their master when he returns from his wedding feast, prepared to open the door quickly for him when he comes and knocks.
column3: Kush hab ep kaij g Jesus, “Mt wo si e nahtokch mat haschu has wo e juh hab sha masma mat g pion wo si e nahtokch mat g ha‑ahmo wo uhpam jiwia. Ha‑ahmo atp hems am wui wo hih g wo ha hohntam gegosig k pi oi wo uhpam jiwia. T wabshaba g piongaj ab wo s‑ap e enigadadch ch ab wo mehidch g e‑kanjel ch g e‑ahmo ab wo nenida. T am wo i jiwia k wo si shontpa. T ab ha hekaj wo i kuhpiꞌo g kihjeg wehhejed.

column2: How good it will be for those servants that the master finds watching when he returns. I tell you the truth, he will get dressed, have them sit down for a meal, and will come and serve them himself!
column3: T wo si s‑hehgigk hegam pion mat g ha‑ahmo wo ha cheh mo nenead ch e nahtokch. Neh, t heg ab hab wo juh g bahshodag k wo si s‑ap ha dadsh k wo ha gegos.

column2: Even if he comes at midnight, or just before dawn—how good for them if he finds them watching and ready!
column3: T wo si s‑hehgigk hegam mat wo e nahtokch mat wo jiwia, chum as hems eda wo i huh g s‑chuhugam o i baꞌiwichkim.

column2: But remember this: if the master knew when a thief was coming, he would keep watch, and not allow his house be broken into.
column3: “Neh, pi o ta machima mas hekid hema wo i jiwia g s‑chu ehskam. Kum heg hekaj chum hekid nuhkud g e‑kihdag.

column2: You must also be ready, for the Son of man is coming when you don't expect him.”
column3: Pegih, k hab waꞌap pi ta machima em‑wehhejed manis hekid wo uhpam jiwia jewed wui ahni Jiosh si Kehsha. Mt heg hekaj wo si e nahtokchid chum hekid.”

column2: “Is this story you're telling just for us, or for everyone?” Peter asked.
column3: Sh hab kaij g Peter, “T‑kownalig, nap ahchim waꞌi hab t‑ahg aha nap wehs hab ha ahg?”

column2: The Lord replied, “Who then is the trustworthy and wise manager, the one person in the household that the master puts in charge to share out their food at the right time?
column3: Sh hab kaij g Jesus, “Chum amt hedai wo e nahtokch mamtp wo s‑wapagimak ch wo s‑chu aꞌamichudad. S‑mahch am mat g ha‑ahmo hema wo e gahgi g hab mahs chikpandam k wo nuhkudach g e‑kihdag. T heg s‑ap wo ha chikpanchudad ch wo ha dagioꞌidad g e‑wehm pion mat eda pi an hu wo haꞌichugk g ha‑ahmo.

column2: It will be good for that servant when his master returns and finds him doing what he should.
column3: T am ep wo jiwia k wo cheh mo ihda s‑ap am hab junihim g e‑chikpan. Kut d wo si geꞌe s‑hehgigk heg wehhejed pion

column2: I tell you the truth, the master will put that servant in charge of everything.
column3: nat pi g ahmoj am hahawa wehs dahm wo kei g e‑kihdag.

column2: But what if the servant were to say to himself, ‘My master is taking a long time in coming,’ and then starts beating the other servants, both men and women, feasting and getting drunk?
column3: “T wabshaba pi ap d wo ha‑kehshak matp hedai wo i ha shoꞌigchudad g e‑wehm pion ch wo si e gegosidad ch wo nawmmukad hab e ahgch mat pi oi wo jiwia g ahmoj.

column2: That servant's master will return unexpectedly one day at a time he wasn't aware of, and will punish him severely, treating him as totally untrustworthy.
column3: T haha wabsh wo jiwia k wo cheh mo pi ap hab wua g e‑chikpan k wo si s‑koꞌokam namkid k gam hu hab wo i juh.

column2: That servant who knew what his master wanted and yet didn't get ready or follow his instructions, will be beaten severely;
column3: “T wo bei g s‑koꞌok e‑namkidadag hegai pion mat wo s‑mahchk g e‑ahmo tatchui ch eda pi am hu hab wo junihid.

column2: but the servant who didn't know and did things deserving punishment will be beaten only lightly. From those who are given much, much will be required, and from those who are entrusted with more, more will be demanded.
column3: T wabshaba pi am hu i si s‑koꞌokam wo bei g e‑namkidadag hegai mo pi e mahch ch hab junihim g pi apꞌekam. Baꞌich i geꞌe haꞌichu amt uhpam wo s‑behim ab amjed hegai mamt baꞌich haꞌichu nuhkudach.”

column2: I have come to set the earth on fire, and I really wish it was already burning!
column3: Kush hab ep kaij g Jesus, “Ia ant jiwia jewed dahm mant wo i ha chuꞌamu g hemajkam hab sha masma mant am wo si i nai ha‑iꞌibdag ed. T hab wo s‑nenenashanik ab Jiosh wui. Mat huꞌi heki hu hab wo e juh.

column2: But I have a baptism to go through, and I'm in agony, wishing it was over!
column3: Am ant s‑ta ehbidam haꞌichu gahi wo wuhshani k si ni‑kudut heg hekaj.

column2: Do you think that I came to bring peace on earth? No, I tell you, I bring division.
column3: Pi g hab wo e elidad mat wo dodolimat g hemajkam mant ia jiwia.

column2: From now on, if there are five in a family, they will be divided against each other: three against two, and two against three.
column3: Ab at em‑wui wo gegokiwua hegam mat pi wo ni‑tatchuad, chum hems haꞌakia em‑wehm kihkam.

column2: They will be divided against each other—father against son, son against father, mother against daughter, daughter against mother, mother-in-law against daughter-in-law, and daughter-in-law against mother-in-law.”
column3: Cheoj atp hems wo s‑kehꞌidad g e‑ohg o g e‑alidag. T g uwi g e‑jeꞌe o g e‑mad o g e‑kahkma jeꞌe wo s‑kehꞌidad.”

column2: Then Jesus spoke to the crowds. “When you see a cloud rising in the west, you immediately say, ‘a rain-shower's coming,’ and it happens.  When a south wind blows, you say ‘it's going to be hot,’ and it is.  You hypocrites, how is it that you know how to rightly interpret the weather but you don't know how to interpret the present time?
column3: Sh hab hahawa ep kaij g Jesus, “Neh, mt wo s‑mahchk mas wo juh o as wo tonih am neidk mas hebaijed hewed ch has mahs chewagi i wushke. M eda pi am hu i aꞌamichud mo haschu has e junihog iaꞌi idani neidch mani haschu hab wua. Shahag wepo mam pi mahchimk.

column2: Why don't you think for yourselves and judge what's right?
column3: “E o aihim mat g Jiosh wo ha lodai g hemajkam. Am g wo aꞌamichud mamt has wo chum masmak.

column2: As you go with your accuser to the magistrate, on the way you should be working on a settlement. Otherwise you may be dragged before the judge, and the judge hand you over to the officer, and the officer throw you into prison.
column3: S‑mahch am mamt hemho wa s‑hohtam am wo i e apꞌech heg wehm mat ab wo haꞌichu i em‑abch. Tp hems am wo i em‑wahpki lodaita ch ed mamtp pi am hu wehmaj wo i e apꞌech. T g usagakam am wo i em‑dagito chi‑lihhi wui. T heg ged hu wo si em‑kuh.

column2: I tell you, you won't get out until you've paid the last penny.”
column3: Kumt pi wo shaꞌi i e wuhshad am hugkam mamt hekid wo i wehs ha namkid mamt heꞌekia i em‑toꞌi.”

column2: It was around this time that some people told Jesus about Pilate's killing of some Galileans while they were offering sacrifices in the Temple.
column3: Kush iaꞌi idani haꞌi g oꞌodham am ahgid g Jesus matsh g kownal Pilate haꞌi ha kokda g Galilee t am hemajkam mash eda idam am hab chum wua g iagchulida Jiosh wui.

column2: “Do you think that these Galileans were worse sinners than any other Galileans because they suffered like this?” Jesus asked.
column3: Sh g Jesus hab kaij am ha wui, “Kumtp hab elid mo id am wohokamchud mo baꞌich d i si pi apꞌekam mo hedai i Galilee t am kihkam namt pi hab masma ha kokda.

column2: “No, I tell you. But unless you repent, you will all perish as well.
column3: K eda pi woho. Wehsijj am hab masma d pi apꞌekam ch wo bei g s‑koꞌok e‑namkidadag mamt wo sha pi ohhod g pi ap e‑chegitoi.

column2: What about those eighteen people that were killed when the tower in Siloam fell on them? Do you think they were the worst people in the whole of Jerusalem?
column3: “Neh, am atsh i gei g uhgk kih Siloam woꞌo t am Jerusalem ch ed. Kutsh gamai gigiꞌik e koꞌij. Kum hab elid mo id am wohokamchud mo idam baꞌich d i si pi apꞌekam mo hedai i hegam mo am kih Jerusalem t am.

column2: No, I tell you. But unless you repent, you will all perish as well.”
column3: K eda pi woho. Wehsijj am hab masma d pi apꞌekam ch wo bei g s‑koꞌok e‑namkidadag mamt wo sha pi ohhod g pi ap e‑chegitoi.”

column2: Then he told them this story as an illustration. “Once there was man who had a fig tree planted in his vineyard. He came to look for fruit on the tree, but he didn't find any.
column3: Sh g Jesus am ha ahgid ihda haꞌichu wepogida ahga, “Neh, matp hema g oꞌodham ge suhnaga am uhdwis e‑oidag ed ch am him k am s‑uꞌim g suhna. K pi ab hu bahidag.

column2: So he told the gardener, ‘Look, for three years I've been coming to look for fruit on this fig tree and I haven't found any. Chop it down! Why should it be taking up space?’
column3: “K hab ahg g oidag nuhkuddam, ‘Neh, waik aꞌahid ab ach am nenneid hegai suhna uhs ch pi koi haꞌichu shaꞌi bei ab amjed. Pt wo shonch. S haschu ahgk am hig wo kehkk oidag ch ed?’

column2: ‘Master,’ the man replied, ‘please leave it alone for just one more year. I'll dig the soil around it and put down some fertilizer.
column3: “K wabshaba hab kaij g oidag nuhkuddam, ‘Am att hig wabsh wo dagito hemako ahidag ehp. Nt am wo si i moihun k am wo iawua g haiwani biht an wehgaj.

column2: If it produces fruit, then that's fine. If not, then chop it down.’ ”
column3: Kut am wo s‑apꞌek matp ab wo bahidagt. Nt wabshaba am haha wo si shonch matp pi ab hu wo bahidagt.’ ”

column2: One Sabbath Jesus was teaching in a synagogue,
column3: Sh am hu hebai mihshmda tash ch ed g Jesus am ha mashcham cheopi ch ed.

column2: and a woman was there who had been crippled by an evil spirit for eighteen years. She was bent over and could not stand straight.
column3: Sh am hema haꞌichug g uwi mash g jiawul an uꞌukch. Kush gamai gigiꞌik aꞌahid ab waꞌi mumku mash ab wabsh i e olatch ch pi e nako mat wo shel i kekiwua.

column2: When Jesus saw her, he called her over and told her, “You're freed of your sickness.”
column3: Tsh am i cheh g Jesus k ab si wai. Tsh ab i hih. Kush hab kaij, “Ahpi uwi, ia at wo i doa g m‑mumkidag,”

column2: Then he placed his hands on her, and immediately she straightened up, and she praised God.
column3: K ab hahawa taht. Kutsh ha hekaj shel i kekiwua k ab si ihm g Jiosh.

column2: However the synagogue leader was upset that Jesus had healed on the Sabbath. He said to the crowd, “There are six days for work. Come and be healed on those days, not on the Sabbath.”
column3: Kutsh ab si bagat hegai mash d ha‑wanimeddam am cheopi ch ed matsh g Jesus ha doaj ha‑mihshmda tash ed k ash hab ha ah g hemajkam, “Am o haꞌichug g chuhdp tash matt heg eda wo chikpanad. Kunt heg oidam tash ia wo dada k wo e doaj, hi wa pi t‑mihshmda tash ed mo g Jiosh am kehshch.”

column2: But the Lord answered him, “You hypocrites! Doesn't every one of you untie your ox or donkey from the stall and take it to drink?
column3: Sh hab kaij g Jesus ab wui, “Ih, pi ap shaꞌi woho ab hu has elid g Jiosh pi ab hu hoꞌigeꞌidch ihda uwi no pi d chum aligaj. S‑mahch ap mat wabsh chum hedai g e‑woiwisga o g e‑wuhluga am wo wulꞌok k am wo be k ged hu wo iꞌich, chum hems e‑mihshmda tash ed.

column2: Why shouldn't this woman, this daughter of Abraham whom Satan has kept tied up for eighteen years, be untied and set free this Sabbath day?”
column3: Pegih, tt wahm wo i wehmt ihda t‑wehm oꞌodham. Jiawul o wa ab wulshch gamai gigiꞌik ahid ab. Kutt hemho wa wo wulꞌo, chum hems mihshmda tash ed.”

column2: What he said shamed all his opponents, but everyone in the crowd was delighted by all the wonderful things he was doing.
column3: Kutsh si e el hegam mo s‑kehꞌid. Sh wabshaba g hemajkam si s‑hehgig heg hekaj si s‑kehg haꞌichu mat hab juh.

column2: Then Jesus asked, “So what is the kingdom of God like? What should I compare it to?
column3: Sh hab ep kaij g Jesus, “Am ant heꞌes wo i em‑tashogi g Jiosh kownaltalig

column2: It's like a mustard seed that a man planted in his garden. It grew into a tree, and the birds came and nested in its branches.”
column3: am wepogidch g haꞌichu kai. Neh, heg am eꞌesha mo al chumaj ch oi wa am wo wuhshani k haꞌas wo i geꞌeda mo g s‑ehheg uhs. Tp hems g uꞌuwhig an ab wo koksht. Pegih, t hab wa masma wo geꞌe i geꞌeda g Jiosh kownaltalig, chum as al chum am wo shonwua.”

column2: He asked again, “What shall I compare the kingdom of God to?  It's like yeast that a woman took and mixed into three measures of flour which made the whole batch rise.”
column3: Sh hab ep kaij g Jesus, “Jiosh kownaltalig o hab waꞌap wepogidas mo g jewajidakud. Heg amt wo be k am wo wah wehnadk g chuꞌi k am heꞌes wo i dai. T g jewajidakud wo chehmo g wahga mat wehs am wo i kopodka. Pegih, t g Jiosh kownaltalig hab wa masma wo chehmo g jewed.” Neh, bash kaij g Jesus

column2: Jesus went around the towns and villages, teaching on his way to Jerusalem.
column3: Sh am hihimhim hegam Jesus ha oidk g kihhim. Sh g Jesus am haꞌichu ha mashcham g hemajkam ch am wabsh i si haꞌab e gewkadch Jerusalem wui.

column2: Someone asked him, “Lord, will only a few be saved?”
column3: Sh hema ab kakke ch hab kaij, “Ni‑kownalig, nat pi shaꞌi muꞌi wo e doꞌibia g hemajkam?”

column2: “Try very hard to enter the narrow doorway, because I tell you that many will try to go in, and won't succeed.
column3: “Heuꞌu. Kumt heg hekaj am wo si e nakogad mamt am wo i wahp Jiosh kownaltalig ed. Muꞌijj at am wo chum s‑wahpkim k pi wo e nako. Heg o wa wepo mamt am wo i wahp al aj kihjeg t amjed.

column2: Once the house owner gets up and closes the door, you'll be standing outside knocking on the door, saying, ‘Master, please open the door for us.’ But he'll reply, ‘I don't know you or where you're from.’
column3: Id ant wo wepogi g kih enigakam mat am wo i ha wahpki g e‑machiga k am haha wo si kuh g pualit. T ab haꞌi ep wo i chum s‑wahpkim. T hab wo ha ah, ‘Gam g hu wo hihim. Pi ani shaꞌi em‑mahch.’

column2: Then you'll say, ‘But we ate and drank with you, and you taught in our streets!’
column3: “Neh, bat wa masma muꞌi am wo i chum s‑wahpkim ni‑kownaltalig ed hab kaijch, ‘M‑wehm ach t‑gegosidahim. Kup am ha mashcham t‑kihhim am.’

column2: He'll reply, ‘I tell you, I don't know you or where you're from. Get away from me, all of you who don't do what's right!’
column3: “Kunt hab wo ha ah, ‘Pi ani shaꞌi em‑mahch. Gam g hu wo hihim ab ni‑amjed. Dam si pi ap hehemajkam.’

column2: There will be crying and gnashing of teeth when you see Abraham, Isaac, Jacob and all the prophets in the kingdom of God but you are thrown out.
column3: “T haha wo si shoanid ch ga hu wabsh wo i si e kiꞌishch nat pi wo shaꞌi si s‑koꞌok haꞌichu nakogad. T eda am wo haꞌichugk g Abrahambad ch Isaacbad ch Jacobbad ch wehs g Jiosh haꞌichu i tashogiddam.

column2: People will come from the east and the west, the north and the south, and they will sit down to eat in the kingdom of God.
column3: Kut g hemajkam ab wo i hihi siꞌal tahgio amjed ch huduni tahgio amjed ch ab juhpin tahgio amjed ch wakolim tahgio amjed k am wo dadhaiwua e wehm Jiosh kownaltalig ed.

column2: For the last shall be first, and the first shall be last.”
column3: Kut am d wo si hahaꞌichuk hegam mo hemuch d pi hahaꞌichu. T hegam mo hemuch d si hahaꞌichu d haha wo pi hahaꞌichuk.”

column2: At that moment some Pharisees came to Jesus and told him, “You should leave here. Herod wants to kill you!”
column3: Tsh am ha hekaj haꞌi dada g Palasi k hab kaij ab Jesus wui, “Gam g hu hihm ia amjed nash pi s‑m‑muꞌamk g Herod.”

column2: Jesus replied, “Go tell that fox that I will go on driving out demons and healing people for today and tomorrow, and on the third day I'll achieve what I came to do.
column3: Sh hab kaij g Jesus ab ha wui, “Herod o sha ban masma ch hab kaij. Him k ahgid mant haꞌas tash am wabsh kia gam hu hab wo i ha junihid g jijawul ch wo ha doajidad g kokꞌodam ch haha wo s‑ap nahto g ni‑chikpan.

column2: Well anyway I must continue on my way for today and tomorrow, and the day after. For it wouldn't be right for a prophet to die outside of Jerusalem!
column3: Kunt pi wo shaꞌi ni‑muhkid im hu haha wabsh i himadch. Am o waꞌi Jerusalem t am e koꞌijid g Jiosh haꞌichu i tashogiddam.

column2: Oh Jerusalem, Jerusalem, you kill prophets and stone those who are sent to you! How often I have wanted to gather all your children together just like a hen does with her chicks under her wings, but you refused!
column3: “Ih, t wo si e shoꞌigch g Jerusalem t am hemajkam nat pi g Jiosh s‑ap wo ha dagito. Ha‑shohshon ash wa ha maꞌichshulig ch muꞌi ha kokda g Jiosh haꞌichu i tashogiddam. T idam am ha oidk hab wo e juh. Muꞌikko ani hab chum si ni‑tahtk mant wo si s‑ap em‑nuhkud hab sha masma mat g chuchul g e‑mahmad ab e wecho wo ha hemapai. M wabshaba pi ab hu tatchua manis hab wo em‑juh.

column2: Look, your house is left desolate, and I tell you that you won't see me again until you say, ‘Blessed is he who comes in the name of the Lord.’ ”
column3: K eda an hab chuꞌig Jiosh oꞌohana ed mamt ab wo chum ni‑ihmad ch hab wo chechꞌed mat g Jiosh am i ni‑kehsh k si s‑ni‑hoꞌigeꞌid. Kunt ia wo i s‑ap em‑dagito am hugkam mamt hab hahawa masma hab wo e juh.”

column2: One Sabbath Jesus went to have a meal at the home of one of the leaders of the Pharisees where they watched him closely.
column3: Sh hema d uhgchu ch d Palasi ch hebai hab juh g geꞌe gegosig ha‑mihshmda tash ed k ash ab i wai g Jesus. Kutsh am jiwia.

column2: A man was there whose arms and legs were swollen.
column3: Sh eda an hema haꞌichug g cheoj ch mahniko nash pi g kakhioj ch nohnhoij ge totskoni. Kumsh an si s‑nenꞌoid g Jesus mas wo doaj nash pi ab haꞌichu s‑abchudamk.

column2: So Jesus asked the experts in religious law and the Pharisees, “Does the law allow healing on the Sabbath, or not?”
column3: Sh hab kaij g Jesus ab ha wui hegam chehanig ha mashchamdam ch Palasi, “Shahchu am ahgch hab elid mo pi t‑hiwgid g t‑chehanig machs wo ha doaj t‑mihshmda tash ed?”

column2: But they kept quiet. Jesus touched the man, healed him, and sent him on his way.
column3: Sh pi hedai has shaꞌi kaij.

column2: Then Jesus said to them, “If your son or your ox happened to fall into a well on the Sabbath, wouldn't you go and pull him out immediately?”
column3: Sh hab hahawa kaij g Jesus ab ha wui, “Neh, namt hig pi woho ab ha hekaj wo i wuhshad g e‑alidag o chum hems g e‑woiwisga matp am wo sha gei wawhia ch ed, chum as d wo em‑mihshmda tashk?”

column2: They weren't able to give an answer.
column3: Kush pi hedai e nako mas has wo chei.

column2: So he told a story to the guests, noticing how they'd chosen to sit in places of honor.
column3: Kutsh haꞌi hegam ha‑waida gan hu si wehpeg s‑apko dadhaiwua. Kush am ha neid g Jesus ch hab kaij,

column2: “When you're invited to a wedding reception, don't take the place of honor, because someone more important than you may have been invited,” he began.
column3: “Pi g am hu si s‑apko wo dadhaiwua mamt hekid am wo hihi gegosig wui. Tp hems am hema wo jiwia mat am baꞌich d wo i s‑has haꞌichuk.

column2: “Your host who invited you both will come and tell you, ‘Give this man your place.’ Then in embarrassment you'll have to move to whatever place is left.
column3: Kut am haha wabsh wo jiwia hegai mat ab i em‑wai k hab wo em‑ah mamt wo hiwigi hegai s‑has haꞌichu abai mamt ab chum dahiwua. Kumt wo si e el namt pi hahawa ga hu wabsh si ha oidk wo dahiwua.

column2: Instead, when you're invited, take the lowest place, so that when your host comes in, he'll tell you, ‘My friend, please move to a better seat.’ Then you'll be honored before all the guests sitting with you.
column3: “Baꞌich at wo i s‑apꞌek mamt ga hu wabsh mehk wo dahiwua. Kut g kihkam ab wo i him k hab wo em‑ah, ‘Ni‑nawoj, oi g i hihm k ia hu s‑apko ni‑miabidch i dahiwua.’ Neh, t id ab wo em‑mah g si has elida am ha tahgio hegam haꞌi ha‑waida.

column2: For those who exalt themselves will be humbled, and those who humble themselves will be exalted.”
column3: “Mt wo pi haꞌichuch hegai mat hedai wo chum si e haꞌichuch k ab wo si haꞌichuch hegai mat wo pi e haꞌichuch.”

column2: Then he said to the man who had invited him, “When you give a lunch or a dinner, don't invite your friends, or your brothers, or your relatives, or your rich neighbors, for they may invite you back, and then you'd be repaid.
column3: Sh hab hahawa ep kaij g Jesus ab wui hegai mat ab i wai, “Pi g hegam ab waꞌi ha waid e‑naipijju o g e‑wepnag o g e‑hajuni o g s‑kakais e‑hugid an kihkam mapt hekid hab wo juh g gegosig. Ab at epai wo i m‑wai idam. Kupt hab masma ab wo bei g e‑namkidadag heg hekaj mapt id hab juh.

column2: Instead, when you give a banquet, invite the poor, the crippled, the lame, the blind,
column3: Ab g i ha waid g shoꞌigkam ch mamaniko ch pi hihimidkam ch pi neneadam mapt hekid hab wo juh g gegosig.

column2: and you will be blessed, for they have nothing to repay you with, and you'll be rewarded at the resurrection of the good.”
column3: Pi at wo e nako idam mat wo uhpam m‑namkid. T g Jiosh ab wo m‑mah g s‑kehg m‑mahkigdag mat hekid am wo i ha wuwhas g s‑apꞌekam hemajkam ab muhkig amjed.”

column2: When one of them eating at the table with Jesus heard this, he said to Jesus, “How wonderful it will be for those who feast in the kingdom of God!”
column3: Sh am hema daha g oꞌodham ch kah ihda. Tsh am i haꞌasa neo g Jesus. Sh id ab wui hab kaij, “Ttki wo si s‑hehgigkad, am i wahpk Jiosh kihdag ed, heg wa wepo matt am wo dadhaiwua geꞌe gegosig ch ed.”

column2: “Once there was a man who prepared a great banquet, and invited many guests,” Jesus replied.
column3: Sh hab kaij g Jesus, “Heuꞌu, mamtp woho am wo i wahp. Id o wepo masma matp hems hema hab juh g geꞌe gegosig k muꞌi ab ha waid g hemajkam.

column2: “When it was time to eat he sent his servant out to tell everyone who had been invited, ‘Come, because the banquet's ready.’
column3: T am i e ai. Kut am hema cheha g e‑pionag. T heg am him k ha‑ahgi mo wehs haꞌichu e nahtokch.

column2: But they all started to make excuses. The first said, ‘I've just bought a field and I have to go and see it. Please excuse me.’
column3: “K wabshaba idam am ahgid mat pi wo e nako mat am wo hihi.

column2: Another said, ‘I've just bought five pairs of oxen and have to go and try them out. Please excuse me.’ Still another said,
column3: “Kutp hems hema am wo ahgi, ‘Wehst‑mahm woiwis ant am ha nolawt k hegam s‑ha aꞌappemimk.’

column2: ‘I've just got married, so I can't come.’
column3: “Kutp hems hema am wo ahgi, ‘Ha ant hohnt k hekaj pi am hu wo hih.’

column2: The servant returned and told his master what they'd said. The home-owner became angry and told his servant, ‘Quickly, go out into the streets and alleys of the town, and bring in the poor and crippled and blind and lame.’
column3: “Neh, t am hahawa uhpam hih ihda ha‑pionag k am ahgi g e‑ahmo. T g ahmoj wabsh woho i bagat k hab kaij ab e‑pionag wui, ‘S‑hohtam g am hihm kahya ch ed ch wohg ch ed k ab wo i ha ui g shoꞌigkam ch mamaniko ch pi neneadam ch pi hihimidkam.’

column2: Then the servant said, ‘Master, I did what you told me, but there are still empty places.’
column3: “Kut wa woho hab juh k am hahawa jiwia k hab kaij, ‘Bant juh g m‑chehanig. K wabshaba am wabsh kia wiꞌis g kih.’

column2: So the master told the servant, ‘Go out on the country roads and lanes, and make people come—I want my house to be full.
column3: “K hab ep kaij g ahmoj, ‘Am g i wuhshani k an mehk hihm chuꞌuchum wopog oidch an shaꞌi ch ed k hab wo ha juh mat ab wo i hihi mat wo shuhd g ni‑kih.

column2: I tell you, not a single one of those people I invited will get a taste of my banquet.’ ”
column3: Pi at ab hu i hihi hegam mo d chum si ni‑waida. Kunt pi hema wo shaꞌi hiwigi mas wabsh wo i jeh g ni‑gegosig.’ ”

column2: A large crowd was accompanying Jesus. He turned to them and said,
column3: Sh am hu hebai hihim hegam Jesus. Sh muꞌi hemajkam am ha wehm hihim.

column2: “If you want to follow me but you don't hate your father and mother, and wife and children, and brothers and sisters—even your own life—you can't be my disciple.
column3: “Pi am ab hu shaꞌi ni‑tatchua mamtp pi baꞌich ab wo i ni‑tatchua mam hi g e‑jehj ch e‑wepnag ch e‑wehm kihkam ch e‑aꞌaliga.

column2: If you don't carry your cross and follow me, you can't be my disciple.
column3: Hemho wa amt gam hu wo dagito g hejel hab e‑elida k ahni hab ni‑elida hab wo junihid ch ni‑wehhejed wo e shoꞌigchudad. Id at heg wo wa wepok mam ab mohto g kots ch ab ab wo e muhkid.

column2: If you planned to build a tower, wouldn't you first work out how much it would cost, and see if you had enough money to complete it?
column3: “Neh, nat hig pi am hu wo i aꞌamich hegai matp hedai am hema geꞌe wo kiht mas am hi wa ahim lialiga mat wo nahto g e‑kihta?

column2: Otherwise, if after laying the foundation you weren't able to finish it, everyone who saw it would laugh at you, saying,
column3: Mt wo ashad matp am hab wabsh wo juh g shondaj k pi wo e nako mas am hu wo i nahto g e‑kihta.

column2: ‘Look at him: he started building but he couldn't finish it.’
column3: Kut hab wo e chechꞌed, ‘Ihda oꞌodham at am chum hema i kei g kih k wabshaba pi e nako mat wo nahto.’ Pegih, mt ahpim hab wa masma wo i aꞌamich mams wo e nakog k ab wo ni‑hiwgad.

column2: What king goes to war with another king without first sitting down with his advisors to work out whether he and his ten thousand can defeat the one marching against him with twenty thousand?
column3: “Neh, matp hems hema g kownal wo s‑cheggiam g e‑obga k eda al wehst‑mahm mihl (10,000) wo shondaligak. T g obgaj gokko wehst‑mahm mihl (20,000) wo shondaligak ch ab him. T hegai kownal am wo i chum aꞌamich mas hu hi wo wa e nako mat wo cheggia.

column2: If he can't, he'll send representatives to ask for peace while the other king is still a long way off.
column3: Tp hab wo mahsk matki pi wo e nako, t hemho wa am wo haꞌi ha cheha mat ab wo nam hegai hema kownal mat ga hu wabsh kia mehk wo himad k wo s‑mai mas heꞌekia wo i namkid. T pi wo cheggia.

column2: In the same way every one of you who doesn't give up everything can't be my disciple.
column3: Neh, bo chuꞌig. Kumt ahpim pi wo e nako mamt ab wo ni‑hiwgad, heg hi wa mamt wehs haꞌichu wo dagito am ni‑wehhejed.”

column2: Salt is good, but if it loses its taste, how can you make it salty again?
column3: Sh hab ep kaij, “Mt haꞌichu wehhejed wo chum s‑kehgajk hab masma mo g on.

column2: It's no good for the soil or for fertilizer—you just toss it out. Whoever has ears, then listen!”
column3: Heg at gam hu wabsh wo s‑e ohhod mat wo sha kahko. Kumt wo s‑e nenꞌoidad namt pi wabsh wo s‑e ohhod mamtp pi haꞌichu wehhejed wo s‑kehgajk. Ab g wo i aꞌamichud ahpim mam kah ihda.”

column2: Tax collectors and other “sinners” often used to come and listen to Jesus.
column3: Sh am hu i hebai, sh muꞌi lial ha kowlantdam ch pi ap hemajkam ab i miabi g Jesus mat ab wo kaiha.

column2: As a result the Pharisees and the religious teachers complained, “This man welcomes sinners, and eats with them.”
column3: Tsh g Palasi ch chehanig ha mashchamdam ab i s‑babgam neneok k hab kaij, “Ihda oꞌodham o wabsh s‑ap ab ha neid g pi ap hemajkam ch ha wehm e gegosid.”

column2: So Jesus told them this story as an illustration.
column3: Tsh heg hekaj am ha ahgi ihda haꞌichu wepogida ahga, hab kaijch:

column2: “Imagine a man who had a hundred sheep lost one of them. Wouldn't he leave the ninety-nine in the open pasture, and search for the one that's lost until he finds it?
column3: “Id o wepo masma mamtp hems hema ahpim siant wo kahwaligak. Kut hema wo heb hu hih. Namt hig pi am wo ha dagito hegam humukto gamai humukt kolhai ch ed k am wo i gahghi hegai hema am hugkam mamt wo chehg

column2: When he finds it, he joyfully puts it on his shoulders.
column3: k an haha wo kushwiot k hih uhpam

column2: Once he gets home, he calls his friends and neighbors together, saying, ‘Come and celebrate with me! I've found my lost sheep!’
column3: k ab wo i ha wai g e‑naipijju. T am wo i e hemapai. Kumt hab wo ha ah, ‘Si g wo s‑hehgigk ni‑wehm. Cheh ant g ni‑shoiga mat chum heb hu hih.’ Kut am em‑wehm wo si s‑hehgigk.

column2: I tell you that there's more joy in heaven over a sinner that repents than over ninety-nine good people who don't need to repent.
column3: Pegih, t hab wa masma d wo si s‑hehgigk an eda g Jiosh kihdag chum hems hemako em‑wehhejed mamt gam hu wo s‑ohhod g pi ap e‑chegitoi. Kum eda haꞌi hejel hab chum e elid mam d s‑apꞌekam hemajkam ch pi tatchua mams gam hu wo s‑ohhod g pi ap e‑chegitoi.”

column2: Imagine a woman who has ten silver coins, and loses one of them. Wouldn't she light a lamp and sweep the house, carefully searching until she finds it?
column3: Kush id am ep ha ahgid g Jesus ch hab kaij, “Matp hema g uwi wehst‑mahm wo enigak g lial ch hema wo heb hu wua. Tp hems wo mehi g e‑lahmpa k an wo i wosu g e‑kih k an wo i gahghi am hugkam mat wo chehg

column2: When she finds it, she calls her friends and neighbors together, saying, ‘Come and celebrate with me! I've found the silver coin that I lost.’
column3: k ab haha wo i ha wai g e‑naipijju. T am wo i e hemapai. T hab wo ha ah, ‘Si g wo s‑hehgigk ni‑wehm. Cheh ant g ni‑lialiga mant chum heb hu wua.’ Kut am wehmaj wo si s‑hehgigk.

column2: I tell you there is joy in the presence of God's angels over one sinner that repents.
column3: Pegih, t hab wa masma wo si s‑hehgigk g anghil chum hems hemako em‑wehhejed mamt gam hu wo s‑ohhod g pi ap e‑chegitoi.”

column2: Once there was a man who had two sons,” Jesus explained.
column3: Sh hab ep kaij g Jesus, “Matp hems hema g oꞌodham gohk wihpiopga.

column2: “The younger one told his father, ‘Father, give me my inheritance now.’ So the man divided his property between them.
column3: T g chumchu ab wui i him k hab kaij, ‘Ni‑ohg, wapt wo i ni‑mah hegai mat d wo chum ni‑wuikamk.’ Kut wa woho am i gawulkai g e‑eniga k ab ha mah g e‑wihpiopga hegai mo haschu d ha‑wuikam.

column2: A few days later the younger son packed up what he had and left for a distant country. Here he wasted all his money living a reckless life.
column3: “T ihda chumchu am ha hekaj gagda g e‑eniga k bei g namkigaj k gam hu simnolt mehk jewed wui k am heki wua g e‑lialiga am hab wuadch g pi apꞌekam.

column2: After he'd spent everything, the country was hit by a severe famine and he was starving.
column3: T am i huhug g lialigaj. T am hahawa gei geꞌe bihugig. K ihda simnoltdam pi haꞌichu edgid mas wo huh.

column2: So he went and took a job with one of the farmers there who sent him to his fields to feed pigs.
column3: K am hahawa hema chikpanachud e‑oidag ed mat wo ha nuhkud g kokji.

column2: He was so hungry that he would have eaten even the pig food, but no one gave him anything.
column3: Kut chum hems heg s‑hugim mo haschu g kokji koꞌa. T pi hedai haꞌichu mah mas wo huh.

column2: When he came to his senses, he said to himself, ‘All of my father's workers have more than enough to eat—why am I dying from hunger here?
column3: “T am hahawa haꞌichu kop moꞌoj ed. K hab e ahg, Wehs g ni‑ohg pionag o s‑edgid g haꞌichu hugi. Kuni eda ahni d bihugimkam.

column2: I'm going home to my father! I'll tell him, “Father, I've sinned against heaven and against you.
column3: Nt hig wo uhpam hih ni‑ohg wui k hab wo chei, ‘Ni‑ohg, pi ant ap has chuꞌi ab m‑wui ch ab Jiosh wui.

column2: I'm no longer worthy to be called your son. Please treat me as one of your hired workers.” ’
column3: K hahawa pi d ni‑wuikam mams hab wo ni‑aꞌagad mani d m‑alidag. Chum anis hems d wabsh wo m‑pionagk.’

column2: So he left and went home to his father.
column3: “Neh, t am ha hekaj i wuhshani k am wui hih g e‑ohg. T heg cheh mo im hu wabsh kia him k ab si s‑hoꞌigeꞌid k ab wui med k gan hu kohm k ab chintad.

column2: The son said to him, ‘Father, I've sinned against heaven and against you. I'm no longer worthy to be called your son.’
column3: “K ab wui hab kaij g alidaj, ‘Ni‑ohg, pi ant ap has chuꞌi am m‑wui ch am Jiosh wui. K hahawa pi d ni‑wuikam mams hab wo ni‑aꞌagad mani d m‑alidag.’

column2: But the father told his servants, ‘Quick—bring the best robe and put it on him. Put a ring on his finger and sandals on his feet.
column3: “T wabshaba g ohgaj hab wabsh ha ah g e‑pionag, ‘Ab g wo i bek g s‑kehg eniga k an wo wahkid k g anilo an wo shaꞌich nowij an k g shuhshk ab ep wo cheka

column2: Bring the calf we've been fattening and kill it. Let's have a feast to celebrate
column3: k wo mua g s‑gihg wisilo. Kutt hab wo juh g geꞌe gegosig k wo si s‑hehgigk.

column2: because this is my son who was dead, but who has returned alive; he was lost but now he's found.’ So they started celebrating.
column3: Uhpam at ep jiwia ihda ni‑alidag mat gam hu mehk hih. Id o heg wa wepo mat muh k ep e chegito.’ Neh, t wa woho hab e juh g si geꞌe s‑hehgig.

column2: Now the older son was working out in the fields. As he walked towards the house, he heard music and dancing.
column3: “K eda gam hu chikpan g geꞌechu alidaj oidag ch ed ch pihhun k ab hih. K eda si s‑hehgig ch neꞌed ch keihin.

column2: So he called one of the servants and asked what was going on.
column3: Kut kah k ab hema kakke g pion mas has d ahga ihda.

column2: ‘Your brother is back,’ he replied, ‘and your father has killed the fattened calf, because he's come home safe and sound.’
