column3: “K heg hab kaij, ‘M‑wehnag at jiwia. Kumt mua g s‑gihg wisilo k hab juh g geꞌe gegosig nat pi s‑ap jiwia.’

column2: The brother became angry. He refused to go in. So his father came out to plead with him.
column3: “Neh, t bagat ihda geꞌechu k pi am hu i wah. T am hahawa kah g ohgaj k am i wuhshani k am wabsh s‑ap ab chum waid.

column2: He told his father, ‘Look, all these years I've served you, and never disobeyed you, but you never once gave me even a young goat so I could have a party with my friends.
column3: K wabshaba ab wui hab kaij, ‘Nehꞌe, haꞌakia aꞌahidag ani ab m‑wecho ch chum hekid hab wua g m‑tatchui. Kupt eda pi hekid chum hems g siwat mad ab ni‑mah mant wo ni‑gegosid k wo s‑hehgigk am ha wehm g ni‑naipijju.

column2: Now this son of yours comes back, having spent your money on prostitutes, and you kill the fattened calf for him!’
column3: T wabshaba ia jiwia ihda m‑alidag mat hedai heki wua g m‑kihdag ha wehm g chechpaꞌawi. Kupt muꞌij g s‑gihg wisilo.’

column2: ‘Son,’ the father replied, ‘you are always here with me. Everything I have is yours.
column3: “K g ohgaj ab wui hab kaij, ‘Ni‑alidag, ahpi ap chum hekid ni‑wehmaj. K wehs hegai mo d ni‑eniga d m‑eniga.

column2: But we should be happy and celebrate! This is your brother who was dead, but who has returned alive; he was lost but now he's found!’ ”
column3: K wabshaba hemu am wa s‑apꞌe matt wo si s‑hehgigk nat pi uhpam ep jiwia ihda m‑wehnag mat am simnolt. Heg o wa wepo mat muh k ep e chegito,’ bo kaij g ohgaj.”

column2: Jesus told his disciples this story. “There was once a rich man whose manager was accused of wasting what belonged to his master.
column3: Sh am ep ha ahgid g Jesus ihda wepogida ahga ch hab kaij, “Tp hems am hu hebai hema d wo s‑kais oꞌodhamk. K hegai mat am i kei mo d maliom wabsh heki wua g lialigaj.

column2: So the rich man called in his manager, and asked him, ‘What's this I hear about you? Bring in your accounts, because you won't be continuing as manager.’
column3: T am i wai e wui k hab kaij, ‘Am ant haꞌichu sha naksh ab m‑amjed k antki hekaj hab wo chei mapt am wo i kuint k am wo oꞌoha wehs map has i masma nuhkud g haꞌichu ni‑eniga nantki pi wo m‑dagito.’

column2: The manager said to himself, ‘Now what will I do since my master is going to fire me from my job? I'm not strong enough to dig, and I'm ashamed to beg.
column3: “T hab i e ah ihda oꞌodham, ‘Tki wo i ni‑wuhshad g ni‑ahmo. Nis has wo ni‑juh? Pi ant wo ni‑nako manis wo waikkat k si ni‑elid manis wo haꞌichu ha tahnid.

column2: Oh, I know what I'm going to do so that when I'm sacked as manager people will make me welcome in their homes.’
column3: Neh, s‑mahch ani mantki has wo ni‑juh k muꞌi wo naipijjuk. T idam ab wo i ni‑wahki e‑kihki ed mamt hekid wo i ni‑wuhshad id amjed ni‑chikpan.’

column2: So he invited all those who were in debt to his master to come and see him. He asked the first one, ‘How much do you owe my master?’
column3: Bo kaij ch am hahawa hehemako ha waid hegam mo ab ab e wulshch g ahmoj. Kut am hema jiwia. K g maliom ab wui hab kaij, ‘Nap s‑mahch map heꞌekia ab ab i e wulshch g t‑ahmo?’

column2: The man replied, ‘A hundred units  of oil.’ He said to him, ‘Sit down quickly. Take your bill, and change it to fifty.’
column3: “K hab kaij ihda, ‘Heuꞌu, hemako siant waplin g a‑saidi ani ab ab ni‑wulshch.’

column2: Then he said to another, ‘How much do you owe?’ The man replied, ‘A hundred units of wheat.’ He said to him, ‘Take your bill and change it to eighty.’
column3: “K g maliom ab wui hab kaij, ‘Nap s‑mahch map heꞌekia ab ab i e wulshch g t‑ahmo?’

column2: The rich man commended his dishonest manager for his cunning idea. The children of this world are more cunning towards one another than are the children of light.
column3: “Neh, t g ahmoj si has i el am i kahk mat has e juh ihda s‑chu banmadamkam maliom nat pi si s‑e mahch k hab e juh. Neh, hegam mo pi mahch g Jiosh o em‑baꞌich i s‑e mahch ch hab wua haꞌichu.

column2: I tell you, use the wealth of this world to make friends for yourselves so that when it's gone, you'll be welcomed into an eternal home.
column3: “Id ani em‑ahgid mamt wo s‑ap hekaj g e‑kaisdag am ha wehhejed hegam mo tatchua g i wehmtadag. T g Jiosh s‑ap am wo i em‑wahpki e‑kihdag ed mamt hekid wo muh.

column2: If you can be trusted with very little you can also be trusted with much; if you are dishonest with very little you will also be dishonest with much.
column3: “Hegai matp hedai s‑ap wo nuhkud g al chuꞌuchum haꞌichu at hab waꞌap s‑ap wo nuhkud g geꞌeged haꞌichu. Kutp hedai wo ha banmad g al chuꞌuchum haꞌichukaj k hab waꞌap wo ha banmad g geꞌeged haꞌichukaj.

column2: So if you can't be trusted when it comes to worldly wealth, who will trust you with true riches?
column3: Am g wo s‑ap nuhkudad hegai mam haschu em‑nuhkudachud id dahm jewed. T g Jiosh am wo haꞌichu em‑nuhkudach e‑kownaltalig ed. Heg o d s‑wohom kaisdag

column2: And if you can't be trusted with what belongs to someone else, who will trust you with what is yours?
column3: ch d wo em‑enigak mamtp wo s‑ap nuhkud hegai mam haschu em‑nuhkudachud id dahm jewed.

column2: No servant can obey two masters. Either he will hate one and love the other, or he will be devoted to one and despise the other. You can't serve both God and Money.”
column3: “Pion at pi wo e nako mat gohk wo aꞌamok. Hema at baꞌich ab wo i tatchuad ch baꞌich i s‑ap wo chikpanidad. Kumt ahpim hab waꞌap pi wo shaꞌi e nako mams wepo ab wo ha tatchuad g Jiosh ch ihda jewed dahm s‑kaistalig.”

column2: The Pharisees, who loved money, heard what Jesus said and laughed at him.
column3: Sh am haꞌi kah g Palasi wehs ihda. K eda g Palasi si pihk e elid g s‑kaisdagkaj. Kush idam heg hekaj nahnko ahg g Jesus.

column2: But Jesus told them, “You appear pious to people, but God knows your hearts. What people value highly is detested by God.
column3: Sh hab kaij g Jesus ab ha wui, “Ahpim am hab chum e wua mam d s‑apꞌekam am ha tahgio g hemajkam. K wabshaba g Jiosh s‑mahch g em‑iꞌibdag. Hegai mo haschu i g hemajkam hab chum elid mo d si haꞌichu o d wabsh pi haꞌichu am Jiosh nena ed.

column2: What was written in the law and the prophets lasted until John. From then on the good news of the kingdom of God is being spread, and everyone is forcing their way in.
column3: “Mosesbad ch hegam haꞌi kekelibad Jiosh haꞌichu i tashogiddam at an oꞌoha mamt has wo chum masmak. Kumt id wo chum hekaj am hugkam mat ab i wuhsh hegai John mo em‑pahl wapkonahim. K am i amjed ihda s‑kehg haꞌichu ahga ab amjed g Jiosh kownaltalig am e ahgahim. K wabsh chum hedai am chum e nakog mat am wo i wah.

column2: However, it's easier for heaven and earth to pass away than for the smallest point of the Law to disappear.
column3: T wabshaba pi wabsh wo huhug hegai chehanig. Baꞌich at wo i pi hasigk mat g dahm kahchim ch jewed wo huhug.

column2: Any man who divorces his wife and marries someone else commits adultery, and a man who marries a divorced woman commits adultery.
column3: “Dat wo pi ap chuꞌijkamk hegai matp hedai wo s‑ohhod g e‑wehm kihkam k hema ep wo bei. K hab waꞌap wua g pi apꞌekam hegai matp hedai an wo bei g ha‑ohhoda.”

column2: Once there was a man who was rich. He wore purple clothes and fine linen, and enjoyed a luxurious life.
column3: Sh id am ep ha ahgid g Jesus:

column2: A beggar named Lazarus used to sit at his gate, covered in sores,
column3: K am hema d si shoꞌigkam oꞌodham ch hab chehgig Lazarus ch wehsko hihiwog. Kum ab i bebhe ch ab dadsha s‑kais oꞌodham kihjego.

column2: longing to eat the leftovers from the rich man's table. Even the dogs came and licked his sores.
column3: hab elidch mat heꞌes haꞌichu wo al huh mo ab i shulig s‑kais oꞌodham mihsa t ab. K g gogogs ab winikon g hihiwdaj.

column2: Then the beggar died, and angels carried him away to be with Abraham. The rich man also died and was buried.
column3: “T am i muh ihda shoꞌigkam oꞌodham. T g anghil am i be k an uꞌapa anai mam am ha nuhkud g s‑apꞌekam.

column2: In Hades, where he was in torment, he looked up and saw Abraham in the far distance, with Lazarus beside him.
column3: T am i e chegito k oki am haꞌichug mo am kuhkpi g pi apꞌekam ch shaꞌi si s‑koꞌok haꞌichu tahtk ch ab i nea e dahm. K g Lazarusbad ab wehmaj daha g t‑shohshon Abraham.

column2: ‘Father Abraham,’ he called out, ‘Have mercy on me and send Lazarus to dip the tip of his finger in water and cool my tongue, because I'm burning in agony.’
column3: K ihda s‑kais oꞌodham ab si s‑kaidam hab kaij, ‘Ni‑shohshon, Abraham, geꞌe s‑koꞌok ani nakog id eda mehi. Ab g si i s‑ni‑hoꞌigeꞌid k ab wo cheha g Lazarus mat am wo wahki g e‑nowi shuhdagi ch ed k ab wo i him k ab wo iawua ni‑nehni ab.’

column2: But Abraham replied, ‘My son, remember that you enjoyed the good things of life, while Lazarus had a very poor life. Now he is here being comforted, while you suffer in torment.
column3: “K wabshaba hab kaij g Abrahambad, ‘Ni‑hajuni, am g i chegito map wa in d doakam ch wehs haꞌichu s‑kehg edgid. K wa g Lazarus d wabsh si shoꞌigkam ch wabshaba hemuch ab si s‑ap e tahtk iia. Kup ahpi g s‑koꞌok tahtk.

column2: Apart from that, there's a great gulf that stretches between us and you. Nobody who wants to cross from here to you can do so, and nobody can cross from there over to us.’
column3: Gamai wa baꞌich o an ge sꞌtadani ch s‑juhk hiktani an t‑tahgio. Kutt pi wo t‑nako machs hedai am gahi wo i chesh em‑wui o mamt ahpim ab gahi wo i chesh t‑wui.’

column2: The rich man said, ‘Then Father, I beg you, please send him to my father's house.  For I have five brothers and he can warn them so that they don't end up here in this place of torment.’
column3: “K hab kaij g s‑kais oꞌodham, ‘Pegih, ni‑shohshon, am ani hetasp wepnag. K idam am wabsh kia d dodakam ch am kih ni‑ohgbad kih am. Ab g si i s‑ni‑hoꞌigeꞌid k am wo cheha g Lazarus mat am wo him k am wo ha shohbi. T pi ia hu haꞌab wo dada mo ia g s‑koꞌok e tahtk.’

column2: But Abraham replied, ‘They have Moses and the prophets. They should listen to them.’
column3: “K hab kaij g Abrahambad, ‘M‑wepnag o edgid g Moses oꞌohana ch Jiosh haꞌichu i tashogiddam ha‑oꞌohana. T heg am wo ha shohbi matp ab wo kaiha.’

column2: ‘No, father Abraham,’ said the man. ‘But they would repent if someone went to them from the dead!’
column3: “K hab hahawa ep kaij g s‑kais oꞌodham, ‘Ni‑shohshon, Abraham, pi at woho ab wo kaiha. Pt wabshaba hema hab wo sha juh mat ep wo e chegito. T ab wo kaiham k gm hu wo s‑ohhod g pi ap e‑chegitoi.’

column2: Abraham said to him, ‘If they won't listen to Moses and the prophets, they won't be convinced even if someone returns from the dead.’ ”
column3: “K hab kaij g Abrahambad, ‘Pi o ab hu kaiham g Moses oꞌohana ch Jiosh haꞌichu i tashogiddam ha‑oꞌohana. K am wa tasho mat hab waꞌap pi ab hu wo wohoch hegai matp hems ep wo e chegito.’ Neh, bo kaij ch am dagito.”

column2: Jesus said to his disciples, “Temptations are unavoidable, but it will be a disaster for those through whom they come!
column3: Sh hab hahawa ep kaij g Jesus ab ha wui hegam mash ab hiwig, “Chum o hekid haꞌichu hab e wua mamtp hems heg hekaj am wo i shul pi apꞌekam ch ed. T wabshaba s‑koꞌokam wo e namkid hegai mat hab wo em‑juh mamt am wo i shul.

column2: For such people it would be better to have a millstone hung around the neck and be thrown into the sea than to cause these little ones to sin.
column3: Baꞌich at wo i s‑apꞌek wehhejed matp hems wo e wachumchud k wo e mua. T hab pi am hu wo ha shul g al ni‑wohochuddam pi apꞌekam ch ed.

column2: So take care what you do. If your brother sins, warn him; and if he repents, forgive him.
column3: Am g wo s‑e nenꞌoidad!

column2: Even if he sins against you seven times a day, and seven times comes back and tells you, ‘I'm really sorry,’ forgive him.”
column3: Tp hems muꞌikko hab wo juh g pi apꞌekam ab em‑wui hemako tash ed. Mt wabshaba chum hekid ab wo i s‑hoꞌigeꞌel mat hekid gam hu wo s‑ohhod g pi ap e‑chegitoi k ab wo em‑tai g hoꞌigeꞌelig.”

column2: The apostles said to the Lord, “Help us to have more trust!”
column3: Sh hab kaij g Jesus chuhchai ab wui, “T‑kownalig, ab g i geꞌedajid g t‑wohochudadag.”

column2: The Lord replied, “Even if your trust was as small as a mustard seed, you could say to this mulberry tree, ‘Uproot yourself, and plant yourself in the sea,’ and it would obey you.
column3: Kush hab kaij g Jesus, “Pi am tatchua g geꞌe wohochudadag. Wehs at hab wo e juh hegai mamt hab wo cheꞌe k wo s‑wohoch mat hab wo e juh. Mtp hems am wo ahgi ihda gohi uhs mat wo e huhpshan k ged hu wo e ei ge shuhdagi ch ed. Kut wa woho hab wo e juh.”

column2: Say you have a servant who does plowing or shepherding. When he comes in from work, do you say to him, ‘Come in and sit down now for a meal’?
column3: Sh g Jesus am haꞌichu ha wepogid ch hab kaij, “Pi o ab hu shaꞌi ab g ha‑ahmo mas wo ha hihidol g e‑pionag, chum as hegam ge tash oidam am chikpan oidag ch ed.

column2: No. You say to him, ‘Prepare a meal for me, get yourself dressed, and serve me until I've finished my meal. After that you can have your meal.’
column3: Pion at wo hihidol g e‑ahmo k wo gegosid k hahawa hejel wo e gegos.

column2: And do you thank the servant for doing what you told him? No.
column3: Ab o ha ab mat am hab wo wa juh hegai mo haschu am hab i ha chehani. Kut pi hab wo chum el mas ab wo ha hoꞌigeꞌel.

column2: Likewise once you've done everything you were told, you should simply say, ‘We are undeserving servants. We just did our duty.’ ”
column3: Pegih, bo wa masma am em‑wehhejed. Wehs amt haꞌichu am hab wo juh mo haschu ab i em‑chehani g Jiosh k hab wabsh wo e ahgad mam d wabsh pion ch am hab wabsh juh g e‑chikpan.”

column2: As Jesus continued on his way to Jerusalem, he passed along the border between Samaria and Galilee.
column3: Sh am wabsh kia hihim hegam Jesus Jerusalem wui ch am hihi ha shahgid g Samaria chekshani ch Galilee chekshani.

column2: As he entered a particular village, ten lepers met him, standing at a distance.
column3: Sh am hema d al kihhim. Kush am haꞌi dadha jeg ed nash pi kokꞌo heg hekaj mo g ha chuhkug muhkhim ch chum pi ha doajig. Tsh am i chum wahp hegam Jesus mash em kihjeg g kolhai. Tsh idam kokꞌodam am cheh g Jesus k i wahpamig k d wehst‑mahm ch am nam k ga hu wabsh mehk gegok

column2: They called out, “Jesus, Master, please have mercy on us.”
column3: ch amjed s‑kaidam hab kaij, “Jesus, t‑kownalig, ab g i s‑t‑hoꞌigeꞌid.”

column2: When Jesus saw them, he said to them, “Go and show yourselves to the priests.” On their way there, they were healed.
column3: Sh ab ha neid g Jesus ch hab kaij, “Gamai g wo hihim k ab wo e‑chehgi papal ha wui.”

column2: One of them when he saw that he was healed, returned to Jesus, shouting praises to God.
column3: Kutsh hema ab uhpam i hih am i s‑mahchk mat doa k ab si ihm g Jiosh si s‑kaidam

column2: He fell down at Jesus' feet, thanking him. He was a Samaritan.
column3: k atsh am si gei jewed dahm ab Jesus wecho k ab si hoꞌigeꞌel. Kush eda ihda pi d Tuhligo ch d wabsh Samaria t am oꞌodham.

column2: “Weren't ten lepers healed?” Jesus asked. “Where are the other nine?
column3: Kush hab kaij g Jesus, “A nant pi woho wehst‑mahm oꞌodham ha dodaj.

column2: Didn't anyone else come back to praise God—only this foreigner?”
column3: T eda al hemako ia uhpam jiwia k ab hoꞌigeꞌel g Jiosh k d wabsh goꞌol oꞌodham.

column2: Jesus told the man, “Get up and go on your way. Your trust has healed you.”
column3: Kekiwuani k gamai hihm. Ab ap ni‑hiwig ch heg hekaj doa.”

column2: Once, when the Pharisees came and asked him when God's kingdom would come, Jesus replied, “God's kingdom doesn't come with visible signs that you can observe.
column3: Sh haꞌi g Palasi hab si kaij ab wui g Jesus, “A pt hekid hig am wo i t‑chehgi ihda Jiosh kownaltalig map an ahgachug?”

column2: People won't be saying, ‘Look, it's here’ or ‘Look, it's there,’ for God's kingdom is among you.”
column3: mams hab wo chei, ‘Ia o haꞌichug’ o ‘Gd o hu haꞌab haꞌichug.’ K eda am em‑shahgid.”

column2: Then Jesus told the disciples, “The time is coming when you'll long to see the day when the Son of man comes, but you won't see it.
column3: Sh amjed hab kaij hegam ha wui mash ab si wecho e mashcham, “Ab o him g tash mamt wo chum tatchuad mant ia wo em‑wehmajk chum hems hemako tash ab ahni Jiosh si Kehsha. Nt wabshaba pi ia hu wo haꞌichugk.

column2: They'll be telling you, ‘Look, there he is,’ or ‘Look, here he is,’ but don't go running off after them.
column3: Haꞌi at hab wo kaijjid ‘Gad g hu wo neid g Jiosh si Kehsha’ o ‘Ia g hu wo neid.’ Mt wabshaba pi am hu wo i ni‑gahghi.

column2: The day when the Son of man comes will be just like lightning that flashes, lighting up the sky from one side to the other.
column3: Wehsko ant wo ni‑chehgi mant hekid ep wo jiwia jewed dahm hab sha masma mat g wepgi s‑masma an gahi wo kekiwua chewagi ch ed.

column2: But first he will have to suffer many things, and be rejected by this generation.
column3: Nt wabshaba hemu muꞌi wo ni‑shoꞌigch. T pi ab hu wo ni‑tatchua idam hemajkam aiꞌi idani.”

column2: The time when the Son of man comes will be like it was in Noah's day.
column3: Kush hab ep kaij g Jesus, “Bat wo masmak mant hekid ep wo jiwia mash wa hab chuꞌig eda mash g Noahbad in d doakam.

column2: People went on eating and drinking, marrying and giving in marriage until the day Noah went into the ark. Then the flood came and destroyed them all.
column3: Hemajkam ash wa gam ha wabsh i si nenead ch e gegosid ch ihꞌed ch e hohont ch gam hu wabsh i pi chegito g Jiosh. T haha wabsh e ai g tash mat hegam Noahbad am i wahp geꞌe wahlko ch ed. Kut mel g shuhdagi k ha wiꞌin k wehs ha kokda.

column2: It will be like it was in Lot's day. People went on eating and drinking, buying and selling, planting and building.
column3: “Bat ep wo masmak mash wa hab masma mash wa g Lotbad in d doakam. Wehsijj ash gam hu wabsh i si nenead ch e gegosid ch ihꞌed ch haꞌichu ha nolawt ch haꞌichu gagda ch haꞌichu eꞌesha ch kihkit.

column2: But on the day Lot left Sodom, fire and brimstone rained down from heaven and destroyed them all.
column3: Kutsh wa g Lotbad ab i wuhsh Sodom kihhim t amjed. Tsh g mei ch haꞌichu s‑mehidkam ab ha dahmjed i e iawua hab sha masma mo g juhki. Kutsh wehs e kokda.

column2: The day when the Son of man appears will be just like that.
column3: “Bat wo wa masmak heg i tash mant am wo i ni‑maskogi.

column2: If you're up on the roof that day don't go down and get your things; and if you're out in the fields don't go back home either.
column3: Kut pi hedai am hu wo shaꞌi chum i wah e‑kih ed mat am wo haꞌichu ui, chum as hems imhab wo waꞌi oimmedad e‑kih wehgaj o am wo chikpanad oidag ch ed.

column2: Remember Lot's wife!
column3: Pi at chum hems wo s‑huwi g e‑kihdag. Batsh wa e juh g Lotbad hohnigbad k hekaj e muhkid.

column2: If you try to hold on to your life you'll lose it; but if you lose your life you'll save it.
column3: Bat wa masma wo heb hu wua g e‑doakag hegai matp hedai wo chum s‑huwidad g e‑doakag hejel e wehhejed. T wabshaba wo doꞌibia g e‑doakag hegai matp hedai wo hekaj ni‑wehhejed.

column2: I tell you, at that time two will be in bed at night; one will be taken and the other left.
column3: Tp hems gohk am wo kohkshad e‑kih ed ch hema gam hu wo i e be k hema am wo wih mant hekid ep wo jiwia.

column2: Two women will be grinding grain, one will be taken; and the other left.”
column3: Gohk uꞌuwi atp hems am e wehm wo chuꞌad g pilkani. T hema gam hu wo i e be k hema am wo e wuiok. [
Gohk oꞌodham at am wo oiopod oidag ch ed. T hema gm hu wo i e be k hema am wo e wuiok.]”

column2: “Where, Lord?” they asked. “Where the carcass is, that's where the vultures gather,” Jesus replied.
column3: Sh hab kaij g chuhchaij ab wui, “A t hebai hab wo i e juh ihda?”

column2: Jesus told them this story to encourage them to pray at all times, and not to become discouraged.
column3: “Chum amt hekid wo e hoꞌigeꞌidahunad am Jiosh wui ch pi hekid wo dagito,” bash kaij g Jesus ch am hahawa ha ahgid ihda haꞌichu wepogida ahga:

column2: “Once there was a judge in this particular town who didn't respect God or care about anyone,” Jesus explained.
column3: “Tp hems am hebai hema d usagakam ch wabshaba pi ab hu has elid g Jiosh ch pi ab hu ha haꞌichuchud g hemajkam.

column2: “In the same town lived a widow who time and again went to the judge, saying, ‘Give me justice in the case against my enemy!’  For a while he didn't want to do anything about it, but eventually he said to himself, ‘Even though I don't respect God or care about anyone,
column3: T am wui hema jiwia g hejel wiꞌikam uwi k ab tai mat am wo i wehmt namsh pi s‑lodaitamk. T pi ab hu wohog el. K wabshaba id chum hekid ab wui jijiwhia.

column2: this widow is so annoying I'll make sure she receives justice. Then she won't wear me out by her coming to see me so often.’
column3: K wabshaba shaꞌi si ni‑kudut ihda uwi ch wo am hu ni‑gewkoch pi ni‑dagitok. Nt heg hekaj am hab wo juni hegai mo ab ni‑chehani.’ ”

column2: Listen to what even an unjust judge decided,” said the Lord.
column3: Sh hab hahawa ep kaij g Jesus, “Neh, bat wo ha juni g pi apꞌekam usagakam hegai mo haschu chum hekid ab tahni.

column2: “Don't you think that God will make sure his chosen people receive justice, those who cry out to him day and night? Do you think he will make them wait?
column3: Pegih, bamt wa masma chum hekid ab wo tahnid g Jiosh g i wehmtadag.

column2: No, I tell you, he will give them justice quickly. However, when the Son of man comes, will he find people on earth who trust in him?”
column3: Kut s‑hohtam am wo i apꞌech haꞌichu am em‑wehhejed. T eda muꞌi am wo e chehgi mo pi woho ab hu ni‑hiwig mant hekid ia ep wo jiwia jewed dahm.”

column2: He also told this story about those who are so sure that they are living right, and who put everybody else down.
column3: Haꞌi ash hab e elid g hemajkam mo d s‑apꞌekam ch eda hab ha elid haꞌi ehp mo d pi apꞌekam. Sh g Jesus am ha ahgid ihda haꞌichu wepogida ahga:

column2: “Two men went to the Temple to pray. One was a Pharisee, and the other a tax collector.
column3: “Neh, gohk oꞌodham at am hihi geꞌe cheopi wui mat wo e hoꞌigeꞌidahu. K hema d Palasi

column2: The Pharisee stood up and prayed to himself, ‘God, I thank you that I am not like other people—cheats, criminals, adulterers—or even like this tax collector.
column3: ch am hejelko kehk ch am e hoꞌigeꞌidahun ch hab kaij, ‘Ab ani si m‑hoꞌigeꞌid, Jiosh, mani pi s‑banma ch pi hekid haꞌichu ha iattogid ch pi am hu hab junihim g s‑uam haꞌichu hab masma mo chum hedai hab e junihim. Ab ani m‑hoꞌigeꞌid mani pi hab masma mo hegai pi ap ha kowlantdam m an kehk.

column2: I fast twice a week, and I pay tithe on my income.’
column3: Gohk tash ani ni‑hoꞌigeꞌidahun ch pi haꞌichu koꞌa domig ed ch ab m‑mahk g hemako tahpani mo wehst‑mahm e tahpanch mani heꞌes haꞌichu ab i neid.’ Neh, bo wa masma e haschud g Palasi.

column2: But the tax collector stood at a distance. He wouldn't even look up to heaven. Instead he beat his chest and prayed, ‘God, please be merciful to me. I am a sinner.’
column3: “K wabshaba hegai hema ga hu wabsh mehk kehk ch pi e nako mas ab wo uhgk i nea dahm kahchim wui no pi si e shoꞌigchud. Id o hab kaij, ‘Jiosh, ab g si i s‑ni‑hoꞌigeꞌid ahni pi apꞌekam hemajkam.’ Neh, bo kaij hegai hema.

column2: I tell you, it was this man who went home right in God's sight and not the other. For those who exalt themselves will be humbled, while those who humble themselves will be exalted.”
column3: “Kunt wo em‑ahgi mat id am i apꞌech g Jiosh e tahgio. T s‑ap e taht k hih uhpam. T g Jiosh pi am hu i apꞌech hegai Palasi. Do wohokam mat g Jiosh wo haꞌichuch hegai mat hedai hejel pi wo e haꞌichuch k wo pi haꞌichuch hegai mat hejel wo chum e‑haꞌichuch.”

column2: Parents were bringing their infants to Jesus to have him bless them by his touch. When the disciples saw what was happening, they tried to stop them.
column3: Sh haꞌi g oꞌodham am ha uꞌapa g al chuꞌuchum aꞌal Jesus wui mat ab wo ha taht. Kush g chuhchaij ha neid ch chum s‑ha kehꞌid mo hab e wua.

column2: But Jesus called the children to him. “Let the little children come to me,” he said. “Don't prevent them, for the kingdom of God belongs to those who are like them.
column3: Tsh wabshaba g Jesus ab i ha wai g aꞌal k hab kaij ab ha wui g e‑chuhchai, “Ab g wabsh wo i ha hiwgid g aꞌal mat ab wo i hihi ni‑wui k pi an hu wo shaꞌi ha shohbi. Am at wabsh s‑moimam wo i wahp Jiosh kownaltalig ed ab ni‑hiwigch.

column2: I tell you the truth, anyone who doesn't welcome the kingdom of God like a little child will never enter it.”
column3: Nt wo si shel em‑ahgi mamt hab waꞌi masma wo i wahp.”

column2: One of the rulers came to Jesus and asked him, “Good Teacher, what do I have to do to inherit eternal life?”
column3: Kush hema g Tutuligo ha wanimeddam ab kakke g Jesus ch hab kaij, “Ha mashchamdam map d s‑apꞌekam, shahchu ant am hab wo juh mant ab wo bei g pi ha huhugedam doakag?”

column2: “Why do you call me good?” Jesus replied. “No one is good, only God.
column3: Sh hab kaij g Jesus, “Pi ap mahch map haschu ahgch hab ni‑aꞌaga mani d s‑apꞌekam. Heg o waꞌi Jiosh d s‑apꞌekam. Kup pi woho mahch mani hedai wud.

column2: You know the commandments: do not commit adultery, do not murder, do not steal, do not give false testimony, honor your father and mother.”
column3: S‑ha ap mahch idam chehanig mo hab chuꞌig:

column2: “I've kept all these commandments since I was young,” the man replied.
column3: Sh hab kaij ihda oꞌodham, “Wehs ihda ani hab junihim ged hu i ni‑alijk amjed.”

column2: When Jesus heard this he told the man, “You still lack one thing. Go and sell all you have, give the money to the poor, and you will have treasure in heaven. Then come and follow me!”
column3: Tsh am i kah g Jesus ihda k hab kaij ab wui, “Hemako haꞌichu o am wiꞌis mapt am hab wo juh. Wehs apt wo gagda map haschu i edgid k wo ha mah g namkigaj g shoꞌigkam k ab wo i ni‑oid k am wo ni‑wehmajk. Bapt masma wo edgidad g s‑kaistalig an dahm kahchim ch ed.”

column2: But when the man heard this he became very sad, for he was very wealthy.
column3: Tsh si pi ap e taht ihda oꞌodham am i kaiok nash pi d shaꞌi si s‑kais ch si s‑huwid g s‑e‑kaisdag.

column2: When he saw his reaction, Jesus said, “How difficult it is for the rich to enter the kingdom of God!
column3: Tsh am i nei g Jesus mo pi ap e tahtk k hab kaij, “Shaꞌat waꞌi si s‑kawkam wo i wahp Jiosh kownaltalig ed hegam mo d s‑kakais.

column2: It's easier for a camel to go through the eye of a needle than for a rich person to enter the kingdom of God.”
column3: Nam hig hab elid mat wo e nako g ka‑mihyo mas am wo gahi wuhsh hoꞌipad jeg ed. Pegih, t hab wa masma pi wo e nako hegam mo hiwig g haꞌichu e‑eniga mas am wo i wahp Jiosh kownaltalig ed.”

column2: Those who heard this wondered, “Who can be saved then?”
column3: Sh hab kaij idam, “A t hedai wo e nako mat wo e doꞌibia.”

column2: Jesus replied, “What is impossible in human terms is possible for God.”
column3: Sh g Jesus hab kaij, “Pi at hedai wo e nako mas hejel wo e doꞌibia. T wabshaba g Jiosh wo e nako mat wo ha doꞌibia.”

column2: Peter said, “We left everything to follow you!”
column3: Sh g Peter hab kaij, “Neh, ahchim att am i dagito g t‑kihdag matt wo i m‑oi.”

column2: “I tell you the truth,” Jesus told them, “anybody who leaves behind their home, wife, brothers, parents, or children for the sake of God's kingdom  will receive so much more in this life, and eternal life in the world to come.”
column3: Sh hab kaij g Jesus ab ha wui, “Woho amt hab e juh. Kunt am wo em‑ahgi mat g Jiosh baꞌich i geꞌe haꞌichu ab wo em‑mah ia jewed dahm ahpim mamt hedai wo dagito g e‑kihdag o g e‑wehm kihkam o g e‑wepnag o g e‑jehj o g e‑aꞌaliga wehhejed g Jiosh kownaltalig. T am i dahm g pi ha huhugedam apꞌedag ab wo em‑mah e‑kihdag ed.”

column2: Jesus took the twelve disciples aside, and told them, “We're going to Jerusalem, and all that the prophets wrote about the Son of man will be fulfilled.
column3: Kutsh am hejelko i ha ui hegam gamai gohk e‑chuhchai k hab kaij ab ha wui, “Neh, am att wo hihi Jerusalem wui. T am hab wo e juh am ni‑tahgio hegai mo wa g kekelibad Jiosh haꞌichu i tashogiddam an oꞌohan ab ni‑amjed.

column2: He will be handed over to the foreigners he will be mocked, insulted, and spat upon.
column3: Am amt wo i ni‑dagito ha wui g gawul mahs hemajkam. T hegam wo nahnko ni‑ahgad ch ab wo ni‑siswuimad

column2: They will flog him and kill him, but on the third day he will rise again.”
column3: ch wo ni‑gewittan k hahawa wo ni‑mua. Nt wabshaba ep wo ni‑chegito mat d wo i waik tashk amjed.”

column2: But they didn't understand anything Jesus told them. The meaning was hidden from them and they didn't grasp what he was talking about.
column3: Kush wabshaba pi shaꞌi amichud mas haschu hab ahg g Jesus. Heg o wa wepo mo e eꞌestokch g haꞌichu ahgaj.

column2: As Jesus approached Jericho a blind man was sitting beside the road begging.
column3: Sh am hihim hegam Jesus miabidch g Jerico. Sh g pi neadam am hema daha wohg hugid an ch haꞌichu ha nead.

column2: He heard the crowd going past, so he asked what was happening.
column3: Kutsh an bihbij. Sh id ha kah ch ab ha kakke mas haschu an has e wua.

column2: They told him, “Jesus of Nazareth is passing by.”
column3: Kumsh hab ahgid, “An o him hegai Jesus mo ab Nazareth t amjed.”

column2: He called out, “Jesus, son of David, please have mercy on me!”
column3: Sh am si s‑kaidam hab kaij, “Jesus, ab g si i s‑ni‑hoꞌigeꞌid, ahpi map d t‑kownaligbad David amjedkam.”

column2: Those at the front of the crowd told him to stop shouting and be quiet, but he only shouted louder, “Son of David, please have mercy on me!”
column3: Sh hegam mash am baꞌich hihim g Jesus si s‑kehꞌid ch hab ahg mat wo pi shahmuni.

column2: Jesus stopped and told them to bring the blind man to him. As he came over, Jesus asked him,
column3: Tsh am hahawa i kekiwua g Jesus k ha chehani mat ab wo i e bek g pi neadam oꞌodham. Tsh am i jiwia. Sh hab kaij g Jesus ab wui,

column2: “What do you want me to do for you?”
column3: “Shahchu ant hab wo m‑juni?”

column2: “Then see!” Jesus told him. “Your trust in me has healed you.”
column3: Sh hab kaij g Jesus, “Haꞌichu g neid. Doa apt nap pi ab ni‑hiwig.”

column2: Immediately the man could see. He followed Jesus, praising God. Everyone there who saw what happened also praised God.
column3: Tsh am ha hekaj wabsh s‑ap haꞌichu neid k ab si i hoꞌigeꞌel g Jiosh k gam hu i oi g Jesus. Tsh am i nei g muꞌi hemajkam ihda k wehsijj ab si ihm g Jiosh.

column2: Jesus entered Jericho and walked through the town.
column3: Tsh am dada hegam Jesus Jerico t am k am wabsh gahi wo wuwha.

column2: A man was there named Zacchaeus, a chief tax collector. He was very rich.
column3: Sh am hema chum si s‑neidamk g Jesus ch d uhgchu lial kowlantdam ch d si s‑kais ch ash hab chehgig Zackias.

column2: He wanted to see who Jesus was, but because he was short he couldn't see over the crowd.
column3: Sh wabshaba shaꞌi muꞌij g hemajkam. Kush eda al shopolk ihda ch pi ap neid

column2: So he ran ahead, and climbed up a sycamore tree to see Jesus as he passed by.
column3: ch hekaj gam hu ha baꞌich meh g hemajkam k an i chesh uhs t an.

column2: When Jesus got there, he looked up and said, “Zacchaeus, come down quickly! I need to stay at your house today.”
column3: Tsh am i ai g Jesus mo an da k ash an uhgk i neid k hab kaij ab wui, “S‑hohtam g ab i huduni, Zackias. Ab ant wo jiwia m‑kih am.”

column2: Zacchaeus climbed down quickly and was so happy to welcome Jesus to his home.
column3: Kutsh ha hekaj ab i hud g Zackias k si s‑hehgig ch ab i wahki e‑kih ed.

column2: When the people saw this they all complained, “He's gone to stay with such a sinner!”
column3: Kush wehsijj g hemajkam si s‑juꞌujpij neneok ch hab kaij, “Ihda oꞌodham atki am wo i dahiwua heg kih am mo d wabsh pi ap hemajkam.”

column2: But Zacchaeus stood up and said before the Lord, “Look, I'm giving half of everything I own to the poor, and if I've cheated anybody, I'll pay them back four times as much!”
column3: Tsh am i kekiwua g Zackias k hab kaij ab Jesus wui, “Nehꞌe, eda hugkam ant wo ha mah g shoꞌigkam g haꞌichu ni‑eniga k uhpam ep wo ha namkid giꞌikko e dahm mantp heꞌes i ha banmad.”

column2: In response Jesus said, “Today salvation has come to this house, because this man has shown he is a son of Abraham too.
column3: Sh hab kaij g Jesus ab wui, “Id o am chehgidch map wepo wohochudadag mo g t‑shohshon Abraham ch hekaj e doꞌibia id i tash ab.

column2: For the Son of man came to search for and save those who are lost.”
column3: Id ant hekaj ia jiwia jewed dahm ahni Jiosh si Kehsha mant an wo i ha gahghim k wo ha doꞌibia g pi ap chuꞌijkam.” Neh, bash kaij g Jesus.

column2: While they were still paying attention, Jesus told them a story for they were close to Jerusalem and the people thought that God's kingdom was going to become a reality right away.
column3: Pi ash shaꞌi tash matsh gam hu wo dada idam Jesus Jerusalem t am. Kush hab e ahg g hemajkam mat si e ai mat am wo i wuhsh g Jiosh kownaltalig. Tsh heg hekaj am ha ahgi g Jesus ihda haꞌichu wepogida ahga

column2: “Once there was a nobleman who left home to go to a distant country to be crowned king there, and then to return.
column3: k hab kaij:

column2: He called ten of his servants, divided money equally among them, and told them, ‘Invest this money until I return.’
column3: T pi koi him k ab i ha wai g wehst‑mahm e‑pionag k wehsijj g hemako ohla lial ab i ha mahkhi mat wo hekaj k am wo i muꞌidaj mat am wo i hih.

column2: But his people hated him, and sent a delegation after him to say, ‘We won't have this man as king over us.’
column3: K eda muꞌijj pi hohhoꞌid g wehmaj oꞌodham ch am haꞌi i e chuhcha mat am wo hihim k hab wo chei mo pi hohhoꞌid mat d wo ha‑kownaligk ihda oꞌodham.

column2: After he had been crowned king he returned. He ordered his servants brought to him. He wanted to know what profit they had made by investing the money he had given them.
column3: “Kumt wa woho hab juh hegai s‑has haꞌichu oꞌodham mamt kownalch. T am i uhpam jiwia k am ha hekaj ha wai hegam e‑pionag mat am wo dada k am wo e ah mat heꞌekia i dahm nahto g lial heg amjed mat wa ab ha mah.

column2: The first servant came in and said, ‘Lord, your money has earned ten times as much.’
column3: “K g wehpegkam hab kaij am jiwiak, ‘Ni‑kownalig, wehst‑mahm lial ant nahto am dahm hegai hemako mapt ni‑mah.’

column2: ‘Well done! You're a good servant,’ said the king. ‘Since you proved yourself trustworthy in a very small matter, I'm placing you in charge of ten cities.’
column3: “K hab kaij g ahmoj, ‘S‑ap apt hab e juh k d si s‑wagimakam ni‑pionag. Bant wo m‑juh mapt wehst‑mahm kihhim wo nuhkud napt pi s‑ap nuhkud g al chuꞌuchum haꞌichu.’

column2: The second servant came in and said, ‘Lord, your money has earned five times as much.’
column3: “K hema ep hab epai kaij am jiwiak. ‘Ni‑kownalig, hetasp lial ant nahto am dahm hegai hemako mapt ni‑mah.’

column2: ‘I'm placing you in charge of five cities,’ said the king.
column3: “K id hab ahg g ahmoj, ‘Bant wo m‑juh mapt hetasp kihhim wo nuhkud.’

column2: Another servant came in and said, ‘Lord, look, here's your money back. I kept it safe, wrapped up in a cloth.
column3: “K hema ep hab epai kaij am jiwiak. ‘Ni‑kownalig, m ia kahch g m‑lialiga. Gd ant hu si wuh pa‑nihda ch ed k ged hu si ehsto.

column2: I was afraid of you because you're a hard man. You take what doesn't belong to you, and you harvest what you didn't plant.’
column3: S‑m‑ehbid ani heg hekaj map s‑ta keꞌidama. Am ap wabsh uꞌu hegai map haschu pi chikpan ch am bahbhiam hegai haꞌichu bahidag mo pi d m‑esha.’

column2: ‘I'll judge you by your own words,’ the king replied. ‘You know I'm a hard man, “who takes what doesn't belong to me, and I harvest what I didn't plant.”
column3: “K hab kaij g ahmoj ab wui, ‘Hegai map has i kaij ant hab masma wo m‑mohtoꞌi g chuꞌijig, ahpi s‑padmakam pion. S‑mahch apki mani s‑ta keꞌidama ch wabsh uꞌu hegai mani haschu pi chikpan ch ab i bahbhiam hegai haꞌichu bahidag mo pi d ni‑esha.

column2: Why then didn't you deposit my money in the bank, so that when I returned I could have had my money with interest?’
column3: Pegih neh, pt haschu ahgk pi am hu cheh g ni‑lialiga wahnko ch ed mant ab uhpam wo ui wehnadk hegai mat haschu ab mahmadt.’

column2: The king told those who were standing beside him, ‘Take the money away from him, and give it to the one who made ten times as much.’
column3: k hab hahawa kaij ab ha wui hegam mo am gegok, ‘Gam g wo si wohppoꞌid hegai lial k heg wo mah mat g wehst‑mahm lial nahto.’

column2: ‘But master, he already has ten times as much,’ they replied.
column3: “K hab kaij idam ab wui, ‘T‑kownalig, heki o hu wehst‑mahm lialiga.’

column2: The king said, ‘I tell you, to those who have, more will be given; but those who do not have, even what they have will be taken away from them.
column3: “Sh hab kaij ab ha wui, ‘Pi at has e juh nat pi baꞌich haꞌichu ab ep wo i nei hegai mat s‑ap wo nuhkud g e‑nuhkuda. T wabshaba wo e wohppoꞌidach mo heꞌes al i chum nuhkud hegai mat pi ap wo nuhkud.

column2: And as for my enemies who didn't want me to be king over them, bring them here and kill them in front of me.’ ”
column3: Kumt ab wo i ha uꞌu k wo ha kokda am ni‑tahgio hegam ni‑obga mo chum pi tatchua mant d wo ha‑kownaligk,’ bo kaij g ha‑ahmo id eda haꞌichu ni‑ahga.”

column2: After he'd finished telling them this story, Jesus left for Jerusalem, walking on ahead.
column3: Kutsh gam hu hahawa hihi idam Jesus Jerusalem wui. Sh g Jesus am ha baꞌich him.

column2: As he approached Bethphage and Bethany on the Mount of Olives, he sent two disciples, telling them:
column3: Kush gohk al kihhimag ch hab chehgig Bethphage ch Bethany ch ab hugidaj ab g Olive Uꞌus Kawulk. Tsh gohk am ha cheha g e‑chuhchai

column2: “Go to the village farther on. As you enter it you'll find a colt tied up that no one has ever ridden. Untie it and bring it here.
column3: k hab ha ahg, “Am g wo hihim heg wui kihhim m am mia kehk k am wo i wahp. T am wo hema e wulshch g wechij wuhlu mat koi shaꞌi e chesh. Id amt wo wulꞌok k ab wo i wanim.

column2: If anyone asks you, ‘Why are you untying it?’ just say, ‘The Lord needs it.’ ”
column3: Kutp hema wo sha em‑kakke mams haschu ahgk wulꞌo, mt hab wo ah mani ahni em‑mashchamdam tatchua.”

column2: So the two disciples went and found that everything was just as Jesus had said.
column3: Kutsh wa woho am hihi hegam gohk. Kutsh hab masma hab e juh mash hab ha ahgid g Jesus.

column2: As they were untying the colt, its owners asked them, “Why are you untying the colt?”
column3: Kush am wupulꞌok hegai wuhlu. Sh hab kaij g enigakam mas haschu ahgk am wulꞌo.

column2: The disciples replied, “The Lord needs it.”
column3: Sh hab kaij hegam, “T‑mashchamdam o tatchua.” Kutsh ha hiwigi.

column2: They brought the colt to Jesus. Then they threw their cloaks over it, and sat Jesus on its back.
column3: Tsh gam hu i wanim g wuhlu Jesus wui k an toa g e‑liliwa wuhlu dahm k an i cheshaj g Jesus.

column2: As he rode along, people spread their cloaks on the road.
column3: Kush am him cheshajch. Sh idam g e‑liliwa am i toꞌahim wohg oidk.

column2: As he approached Jerusalem, right where the road goes down from the Mount of Olives, the crowd of disciples all began shouting joyful praises to God at the top of their voices for all the miracles they had seen.
column3: Sh am i aihim g Jerusalem. K g wohg am agshp i huduni ab amjed g Olive Uꞌus Kawulk. Sh muꞌi hemajkam an ha wehgaj ch ab i hoꞌigeꞌid g Jiosh ch ab si ihm si s‑kaidam heg hekaj si geꞌe haꞌichu mo neidchkahim ch hab kaij:

column2: Some of the Pharisees who were in the crowd said to Jesus, “Teacher, stop your disciples from saying that.”
column3: Sh am haꞌi gegok g Palasi ch hab kaij ab wui g Jesus,

column2: But Jesus replied, “I tell you that if they kept quiet then the stones will shout!”
column3: Sh hab kaij g Jesus, “Neh, matp idam wo haꞌasa hab chei, kut chum hems g hohodai si s‑kaidam ab wo ihmad g Jiosh ni‑hekaj.”

column2: But as he got closer, he saw the city and wept over it.
column3: Sh am i aihi g Jerusalem. Kutsh shosha g Jesus

column2: “I really wish today that you, even you, had known the path that leads to peace!” he said. “But now it's hidden from your eyes.
column3: k hab kaij, “Mat hu wo i s‑mahchk g Jerusalem t am hemajkam id i tashkaj mat has wo e juh k wo e doꞌibia.

column2: The time is coming upon you when your enemies will besiege you, building ramps to attack you, encircling you and closing you in from every side.
column3: Ab o him g tash mat wo ha biha g ha‑obga k wo ka kuh

column2: They will smash you to the ground, you and your children within you. They won't leave one stone on another within you, for you refused to accept salvation when it came to you.”
column3: k s‑ap wo ha hugio wehsijj hegam mat am wo haꞌichugk k wehs wo wuahawua g kihhim. K pi shaꞌi mahch mat idani wo chum ha doꞌibia g Jiosh.”

column2: Jesus entered the Temple and began driving out all the people trading there.
column3: Kutsh am hahawa hih g Jesus k ged hu jiwia geꞌe cheopi t am. Sh eda am haꞌi dadha geꞌe cheopi wehgaj ch am haꞌichu gagda. Kutsh gam hu si i ha wuwhas

column2: He told them, “Scriptures state that ‘my house will be a house of prayer,’ but you've turned it into a den of thieves.”
column3: hab kaijch ab ha wui, “Bo chuꞌig g Jiosh oꞌohana mo hab kaij g Jiosh:

column2: He was teaching in the Temple every day. The chief priests, the religious teachers, and the leaders of the people were trying to kill him.
column3: Kush wehs tashkaj am ha mashcham g Jesus geꞌe cheopi ch ed. Sh hegam uꞌugchu papal ch chehanig ha mashchamdam ch ha wanimeddam g hemajkam chum s‑muꞌamk.

column2: But they couldn't find a way to do it because everyone appreciated him, hanging on his every word.
column3: Sh wabshaba g hemajkam chum hekid ab si kaiham. Kush heg hekaj pi e nakog hegam mash chum s‑muꞌamk.

column2: Once when Jesus was teaching the people in the Temple, telling them the good news, some of the chief priests and religious teachers came with the elders.
column3: Sh am hu hebai g Jesus am ha mashcham g hemajkam geꞌe cheopi ch ed ch am ha ahgid g s‑kehg haꞌichu ahgaj g Jiosh. Kutsh am dada g uꞌugchu papal ch chehanig ha mashchamdam ha wehm g geꞌeged

column2: They asked him, “Tell us: by whose authority are you doing what you do? Who gave you the right to do this?”
column3: k hab kaij ab wui, “Dohp hab chum elid map ab amjed ab uꞌukch g e‑gewkdag ch am hab haꞌichu wua. Oi g am t‑ahgid.”

column2: “Let me ask you a question too,” Jesus replied. “Tell me:
column3: Sh hab kaij g Jesus ab ha wui, “Pegih, nt ahni wehpeg ab epai haꞌichu wo em‑kakke. Am g wo ni‑ahgid

column2: the baptism of John—was it from heaven, or was it just human?”
column3: mams hedai hab elid mat ab mah g Johnbad g gewkdag mat wo ha pahl wapko. Nat g Jiosh ab mah aha nat wabsh g oꞌodham?”

column2: They talked about it among themselves: “If we say it was from heaven, he'll ask, ‘Then why didn't you believe him?’
column3: Kush idam am wabsh hejel si aꞌaga ch hab kaij, “Shahtt hig wo chei? T ab wo t‑kakke matt haschu ahgk pi ab hu wohoch mattp hab wo chei mo ab Jiosh amjed uꞌukch g gewkdag.

column2: And if we say it was just human, everybody will stone us for they're sure John was a prophet.”
column3: T g hemajkam wo t‑maꞌichshul mattp hab wo chei mo ab wabsh oꞌodham amjed uꞌukch. Muꞌijj o hab elid mo d Jiosh haꞌichu i tashogiddam.”

column2: So they answered, “We don't know where it came from.”
column3: Neh, bash kaij ch ab hahawa uhpam i e nohnogi Jesus wui k hab kaij, “Pi ach shaꞌi mahch mas hedai amjed ab uꞌukch g e‑gewkdag.”

column2: Jesus replied, “Then I won't tell you by whose authority I do what I do.”
column3: Sh hab kaij g Jesus ab ha wui, “Pegih, nt ahni hab waꞌap pi wo em‑ahgi mani hedai amjed uꞌukch g ni‑gewkdag ch hab wua wehs ihda.”

column2: Then he began to tell the people a story:
column3: Neh, bash kaij g Jesus ch am hahawa ha ahgid g hemajkam ihda haꞌichu wepogida ahga hab kaijch:

column2: At harvest time he sent a servant to the tenant farmers to collect his share of the crop, but the farmers beat the servant and sent him away with nothing.
column3: Kut am i e ai mat wo bai g uhdwis. T am hema cheha g e‑pionag mat am wo him k ab wo i uꞌidk g wuikamaj. T wabshaba g nuhkuddam gewichkwua g piongaj k pi haꞌichu shaꞌi mah. Kut gam hu uhpam hih.

column2: So the owner sent another servant, but they beat him too and treated him shamefully, and sent him away with nothing.
column3: “T g enigakam hema ep cheha g e‑pionag mat am wo hih. T id ep gewichkwua g nuhkuddam k si s‑ta edam shoꞌigchud k pi haꞌichu shaꞌi mah. T gam hu uhpam hih.

column2: So he sent a third servant, but they wounded him and threw him out.
column3: “T g enigakam hema ep cheha mat am wo hih. T hab waꞌap s‑koꞌokam has juh k gam hu si wuhshad.

column2: The owner of the vineyard asked himself, ‘What shall I do? I know, I'll send my son whom I love. Perhaps they will respect him.’
column3: “K hab hahawa kaij g uhdwis oidag enigakam, ‘Neh, si ni‑tatchuidch ni‑alidag ant wo cheha mat am wo hih. Heg at hemho ab wo wa has el.’

column2: But when they saw him coming, the farmers said to themselves, ‘This is the owner's heir. Let's kill him! That way we can take his inheritance.’
column3: “T heg gan hu hih. T wabshaba ab i nei hegam nuhkuddam k hab kaij ab aꞌai e wui, ‘Id o d enigakam alidag. Tt hig wo mua. T d wo t‑enigak g uhdwis oidag.’

column2: They threw him out of the vineyard and killed him. Now what will the owner of the vineyard do to them?
column3: T wa woho hab e juh k gam hu si i wuhshad ab amjed g uhdwis oidag k am i mua.”

column2: He will come and kill these farmers and let others have the vineyard.”
column3: “Neh, nat hig pi woho wo ha kokda g oidag enigakam k am haꞌi ep wo ha hiwigi mat wo nuhkud.”

column2: But Jesus looked at them and said, “Then why is it written in the Scriptures, ‘The stone the builders rejected has now become the chief cornerstone’?
column3: Kush ab si ha neid g Jesus ch hab kaij, “Woho at hab wo e juh. K g Jiosh oꞌohana am tashogid mamt hab wa masma wo s‑ni‑ohhod. Id o hab ahgch hab chuꞌig g wepogida ahga Jiosh oꞌohana ed:

column2: Immediately the religious teachers and the chief priests wanted to arrest him because they realized that the story Jesus told was aimed at them, but they were afraid of what the people would do.
column3: Neh, bash kaij g Jesus ch hegam hab ha ahg chehanig ha mashchamdam ch uꞌugchu papal. Kutsh hegam heg hekaj wabsh chum si s‑behim. Sh wabshaba muꞌijj g hemajkam ab si has elid g Jesus. Sh idam ha mashchamdam ch papal s‑ha ehbid ch pi am hu be

column2: Watching for an opportunity they sent spies who pretended to be sincere. They tried to catch Jesus out in something he said so they could hand him over to the power and authority of the governor.
column3: k wabsh am s‑nenꞌoid mat am wo ha apꞌet. Tp hems haꞌichu hab wo chei mat heg ab wo abchud k an wo be k am wo i dagito kownal wui. Tsh heg hekaj haꞌi ha namkid mat am wui wo hihim k ab wo haꞌichu kakke k wo heki himch.

column2: They said, “Teacher, we know that you speak and teach what is right, and that you're not swayed by the opinions of others. You truly teach the way of God.
column3: Sh hab kaij idam ab wui, “Ha mashchamdam, s‑mahch ach map wabsh chum hedai ha mashcham g wohokam ab amjed g Jiosh himdag, chum as has wo chei hedai i.

column2: So should we pay taxes to Caesar or not?”
column3: Pegih, k am wo t‑ahgi maps has elid g geꞌe kownal kowlanta. No hig t‑hiwgid g t‑chehanig ahchim Tutuligo matt wo ha namkid aha no pi t‑hiwgid?”

column2: But Jesus saw through their trickery, and said to them,
column3: Sh wabshaba g Jesus s‑ha amichud mo g pi apꞌekam hab elid ch hab ha ahg,

column2: “Show me a coin—a denarius  Whose image and inscription is on it?” “Caesar's,” they answered.
column3: “Ab g wo hema ni‑chehgid hegai lial mam hekaj ha namkid.”

column2: “Then give back to Caesar what belongs to Caesar, and give back to God what belongs to God,” he told them.
column3: Sh hab hahawa ep kaij g Jesus, “Pegih, ab g wo i dagito kownal wui hegai matp d enigaj k am epai wo i dagito Jiosh wui mo haschu d epai enigaj.”

column2: They weren't able to trap him by what he told the people. They were stunned at his reply, and fell silent.
column3: Kutsh pi e nako idam mas wo heki himch am ha tahgio g hemajkam k oi wa am wabsh i pi has kaij ch si has i el mat has masma ab i nodagi g ha‑kakkei.

column2: Then some of the Sadducees, who deny the resurrection, came to Jesus with this question:
column3: Tsh am haꞌi dada Jesus wui hegam mash hab e aꞌaga Sajusi. Idam o d ha wohochudadag mat g Jiosh pi ep wo ha chegitoich g koꞌi. Sh ab kakke idam ch hab kaij,

column2: “Teacher,” they began, “Moses gave us a law that if a married man dies leaving a wife without children, then his brother should marry the widow and have children for his dead brother.
column3: “Ha mashchamdam, an o hab chuꞌig ihda chehanigaj g Jiosh Mosesbad oꞌohana ed ch hab chuꞌig matsh g oidchkam wehngaj hegai mat wo muh pi ha aꞌaligak hemho wo wa bei g hohnigaj g e‑wehnagbad. Tsh g aꞌaligaj hab masma wo e kuint mat d wo aꞌaligajk hegai mat muh.

column2: Once there were seven brothers. The first had a wife, and died without having children.
column3: Pegih, k am hu hebai wewaꞌak d e‑wepngam. Kut g si geꞌechu ge hohnt k pi ha aꞌalidtok am i muh.

column2: The second
column3: T g oidchkam an bei ihda uwi k hab waꞌap muh.

column2: and then the third brother also married her. In the end all seven brothers married her, and then died without having children.
column3: T amjed g waikkokam an be k hab waꞌap muh. T wehsijj hab e juh idam wewaꞌak mat pi ha aꞌalidtok koꞌo k huhug.

column2: Finally the wife died too.
column3: T gam hu si ha oidk heg ep muh uwi.

column2: Now whose wife will she be in the resurrection, since all seven brothers had married her?”
column3: Pegih, k idam wehsijj hohnigkahim. Kut hedai d wo hohnigk matp g koꞌi ep wo i wuwha?”

column2: “Here in this age people marry and are given in marriage,” Jesus explained.
column3: Sh g Jesus hab kaij ab ha wui, “Ia o waꞌi e hohont g hemajkam jewed dahm.

column2: “But those who are considered worthy to share in the age to come and the resurrection from the dead don't marry or are given in marriage.  They can't die any longer; they're like the angels and are children of God since they're children of the resurrection.
column3: K wabshaba pi hab chuꞌig an Jiosh kihdag ed. Jiosh at uhpam wo ha chegitoich g e‑doꞌibiakam k am wo i ha wahpki e‑kihdag ed. T hahawa pi wo e hohontad ch pi wo koꞌod hab masma mo g anghil hab chuꞌig.

column2: But on the question of whether the dead are raised, even Moses proved this when he wrote about the burning bush, when he calls the Lord, ‘the God of Abraham, the God of Isaac, and the God of Jacob.’
column3: Mosesbad atki wa an oꞌoha mash wa g Jiosh am e chehgid wui heg hekaj shaꞌi mash meihid ch pi meitto. Sh hab kaij g Jiosh:

column2: Some of the religious teachers responded, “That was a good answer, Teacher.”
column3: Kush haꞌi hegam mo d chehanig ha mashchamdam ab neneok ch hab kaij, “S‑ap apt hab chei, ha mashchamdam.”

column2: After this no one dared to ask him any more questions.
column3: Tsh amjed pi hedai e nako mas ab haꞌichu ep wo kakke.

column2: Then Jesus asked them, “Why is it said that Christ is the son of David?
column3: Sh hab kaij g Jesus ab ha wui, “Am g wo oidahim mas hedai d wo Jiosh si Kehshak. Bo e aꞌaga matsh d wo amjedkamk hegai t‑kownaligbad mash hab chehgig David.

column2: For David himself says in the book of Psalms, ‘The Lord said to my Lord, “Sit at my right hand
column3: Kush wa eda g Davidbad hab aꞌaga ‘ni‑kownalig’ natsh oꞌoha ihda mo an hab chuꞌig neꞌi ed heg eda Jiosh heki hu oꞌohana:

column2: While everyone was paying attention, he said to his disciples,
column3: Kush wehsijj ab si kaiham g Jesus hegam muꞌi hemajkam. Kush ab ha ahgid g e‑chuhchai ch hab kaij,

column2: “Watch out for religious leaders who like to go around in long robes, and love to be greeted with respect in the markets, and to have the best seats in the synagogues and places of honor at banquets.
column3: “Hegam mo d chum chehanig em‑mashchamdam o am si s‑apko dadhaiwup cheopi ch ed ch geꞌe gegosig ch ed. Si o s‑kehg e enigadad ch an oiopo no pi tatchua mamt ab wo si has ha elidad. Kumt wo s‑e nenꞌoidad mamt pi hab wo masmak mo hegam.

column2: They cheat widows out of what they own, and cover up the kind of people they really are with long-winded prayers. They will receive severe condemnation in the judgment.”
column3: Chum as si chew e hoꞌigeꞌidahun am em‑tahgio ch eda haꞌichu s‑aꞌagi ha wohppoꞌid hegam mo d heheꞌejel wiꞌikam. T g Jiosh baꞌich i s‑koꞌokam wo ha namkid heg hekaj pi ap ha‑chuꞌijig no pi wabsh pehegia e hoꞌigeꞌidahun ch hab wua ihda pi apꞌekam.”

column2: Looking around, Jesus watched rich people putting their gifts into the collection box.
column3: Sh am hu hebai dadha idam Jesus mash am e shulig g ha‑mahkigdag am wehhejed g geꞌe cheopi. Kush g s‑kakais muꞌi am shulig g lial.

column2: He also saw a very poor widow put in two small coins.
column3: Tsh am hema jiwia g al shoꞌigkam oks mash d hejel wiꞌikam k atsh gohk s‑oꞌamchu am shul. Kush am neid g Jesus

column2: “I tell you the truth,” he said, “this poor widow has put in more than all the rest together.
column3: ch hab ha ahg g e‑chuhchai, “Neh, ihda al shoꞌigkam oks at baꞌich i geꞌe mahkigdag hab juh mo hegam s‑kakais.

column2: All of them gave from their wealth what they had, but she gave from her poverty all she had to live on.”
column3: Hegam o ab wabsh mahk hegai mo haschu i pi tatchua no pi wabsh s‑lialiga. T wabshaba ihda al oks wehs mah mo haschu al i edgid mat hekaj wo chum kihdagk.”

column2: Some of those there were talking about the Temple, its fine stonework and the beautiful gifts that had been donated. But Jesus said,
column3: Kush am haꞌi neneok ab amjed g geꞌe cheopi ch am aꞌaga mo si s‑kehg hab mahs ch si s‑kehg hohodaikaj hab junis ch si s‑kehg mahkigdagkaj e heosid.

column2: “Regarding these things you're looking at… The time is coming when not one stone will be left on another; everything will be destroyed!”
column3: “Heuꞌu. Nt wabshaba wo si shel em‑ahgi mo e aihim mat wehs wo i e shul ihda mam neid.”

column2: “Teacher, when will this happen?” they asked him. “What will be the sign that these things are about to happen?”
column3: Sh g chuhchaij ab kakke ch hab kaij, “Hekid at hab wo i e juh ihda? Kut haschu d wo chehgidak matt heg ab wo s‑mahchk mo e aihim matki am hab wo e juh?”

column2: “Make sure you're not deceived,” Jesus warned them. “Many people will come claiming to be me, saying, ‘Here I am!’ and, ‘The time has come!’ but don't follow them.
column3: Sh hab kaij g Jesus, “Mt wo s‑e nenꞌoidad ch pi am hu wo e iattogi. Muꞌi at an wo i wuwha aꞌahidag oidam k ni‑wepo wo e chehcheg hab kaijch mo d Jiosh si Kehsha ch hab wo chei mat e ai g tash. Pi g am hu wo i ha oid idam.

column2: When you hear of wars and revolutions, don't be frightened, because these things have to happen first, but the end won't come immediately.
column3: An at wo kaida mo am hahasko aꞌai e cheggia g jejewed. Kumt wabshaba pi heg hekaj wo e kudutad, chum as hems wo wohok. Hemho wa at hab wo mahsk haꞌichu wehpeg. K wabshaba pi hab d ahga mat e ai mat wo huhug g jewed.

column2: Nation will fight nation, and kingdom will fight kingdom,” he told them.
column3: Jejewed at ab aꞌai wo i e cheggia.

column2: “There will be severe earthquakes, famines, and epidemic diseases in many lands, and extraordinary signs in the sky that are terrifying.
column3: T an aꞌai hab wo e juh mat g jewed shaꞌi s‑ta ehbidam wo uꞌugij. T g bihugig wo gehsh k g s‑cheawagig ab wo i hih. S‑ta ehbidam haꞌichu at am wo i e chehgi ab dahm kahchim t amjed.

column2: But before all this, they will seize you and persecute you. They will drag you before synagogues and throw you into prison, and put you on trial before kings and governors on account of me.
column3: “Mat koi hab wo e juh ihda, kumt an wo em‑uꞌu k wo em‑shoꞌigchud k am wo em‑uꞌapa chechopi ha wui k wo em‑kuh. Kumt wo e lodai am ha tahgio g kokownal nam pi ab s‑ni‑wohochud.

column2: But this will provide you an opportunity to speak on my behalf before them.
column3: Id at am wo em‑apꞌet mamt am wo ah g s‑kehg haꞌichu ahgaj g Jiosh.

column2: So make up your mind beforehand not to worry about how to defend yourselves,
column3: Pi g am heki hu wo e kudutad heg hekaj mamt has wo chei hejel e wehhejed.

column2: for I will give you words of wisdom that your enemies won't be able to dispute or contradict.
column3: Ab ant wo em‑mah g neꞌoki ch amichudadag. Kut pi wo e nako g em‑obga mas ab wo wui kekiwua mamt has wo chei.

column2: You will be betrayed even by your parents, brothers, relatives, and friends, and they will kill some of you.
column3: Em‑jehj ch em‑wepnag ch em‑hajuni ch em‑naipijju at am wo i em‑dagito ha wui g hahaꞌichu. Kumt haꞌijj wo e koꞌij.

column2: Everyone will hate you because of me.
column3: Muꞌijj at wo s‑em‑kehꞌel nam pi ab ni‑hiwig.

column2: But not a single hair of your head will be lost.
column3: Mt wabshaba s‑ap am wo gahi wuwha mamtp has wo i em‑juh

column2: By standing firm you will gain your lives.
column3: k wabsh wo s‑ha bahbgi. T g Jiosh wo em‑doꞌibia.

column2: However when you see Jerusalem surrounded by armies, then you know that its destruction is near.
column3: “Shondal at an wo biha g Jerusalem. Kumt hab wo s‑mahchk mo e aihim mat oi wo e padch g kihhim.

column2: Those who are in Judea should run away to the mountains, and those who are in Jerusalem should leave, and those who are the countryside shouldn't enter the city.
column3: Hemho wa at am wo ahhio dohdaꞌag wui hegam mat am wo haꞌichugk Judea chekshani ch ed. T hegam mo am haꞌichug Jerusalem kihhim t am hemho wa wo ahhio ab amjed. Kut hegam mo gam hu wabsh jegko kih pi am hu wo i wahp kihhim ch ed

column2: For these are days of punishment, fulfilling all that's written.
column3: nat pi wo e ai mat wo s‑koꞌokam ha namkid g Jiosh k am wo wohokamch wehs hegai mo an oꞌohanas oꞌohanaj ed.

column2: How hard it will be for those who are pregnant or nursing babies at that time! For terrible trouble is coming on the land and punishment against this people.
column3: Ih shoꞌig! S‑ta at ehbidam wo mahsk am ha wehhejed hegam mat wo chuꞌuchum mahmadk ch hegam mat wabsh wo kia woꞌok g ali. Ab at wo i hih g geꞌe shoꞌigdag id dahm jewed. T g s‑koꞌok ha‑namkidadag ab wo gei ha ab idam hemajkam heg hekaj ha‑chuꞌijig.

column2: They will be killed by the sword and taken away as prisoners to all the nations. Jerusalem will be trodden down by the foreign nations until their time is fulfilled.
column3: Mt wo haꞌi ha kokda k wo haꞌi ha lilsochud k gam hu wo i ha ui mehk jewed wui. Kut g gawul mahs hemajkam an wo bei ihda Jerusalem k ia wo i e chiwiadad am hugkam mat wo kuhgit g ha‑apꞌedag g gawul mahs hemajkam.

column2: There will be signs in the sun, moon, and stars, and on the earth the nations will be in distress, confused by the sea's rolling and crashing.  People will be faint from fear, terrified about what is happening to the world, for the powers of heaven will be shaken.
column3: “T wo e uꞌugij mo haschu an hab chuꞌig t‑dahm. Kut s‑ta ehbidam hab wo e juh g tash ch mashad ch huhuꞌu k wo dagito g e‑wopogga. Kut g ge shuhdagi an wo wewgad ch an wo toꞌotonkad. T id wehs wo chehgi mat geꞌe haꞌichu hab wo e juh wehsko jewed dahm. T g hemajkam wo si s‑ehbidad wehs jejewed ch ed ch wo s‑e chuhug nat ge wo mahchk mat haschu has wo e juh.

column2: Then they'll see the Son of man coming in a cloud with power and great glory.
column3: Kunt ab hahawa si s‑masma wo i hud chewagi ch ed ab Jiosh kihdag amjed ahni Jiosh si Kehsha. Kut am wo e maskogi g ni‑gewkdag.

column2: But when these things happen, stand up and look up, because you will soon be saved.”
column3: Bat masma wo e chehgi mo ab e aihim g ha‑doꞌibiadag hegam mat ab wo ni‑hiwgad. Kut heg hekaj wo chum si s‑ap e taht mat hekid wo i shonwua ihda mani em‑ahgid.”

column2: Then he told them this story as an illustration. “Look at the fig tree, or any other kind of tree.  When you see new leaves appear, you don't need to be told that summer is near.
column3: Tsh amjed g Jesus am ha ahgi ihda haꞌichu wepogida ahga, “Neh, mt wo s‑mahchk mo g toniabkam e aihim mamt wo nei mat g suhna jeꞌe ch nahnko mahs uꞌus ab wo i iꞌiwgi.

column2: In the same way, when you see these things happening, you don't need to be told that God's kingdom is near.
column3: K hab wa masma hab mahs mamt wo nei mat hab wo e juh idam mani am heki hu em‑ahgid k wo s‑mahchk mo e aihim mant ep wo jiwia.

column2: I tell you the truth, this generation won't come to an end before all this happens.
column3: “Neh, hegam mat wo nei ihda mani em‑ahgid at d wabsh wo kia dodakamk jewed dahm mat hekid wehs am hab wo e juh.

column2: Heaven and earth will come to an end, but my word will not.
column3: Wehs am gam hu hab wo i e juh ihda Jiosh nahtoi mam in neid. T wabshaba g ni‑neꞌoki pi hekid gam hu hab wo i e juh.

column2: Watch out that you don't become distracted by partying or getting drunk or by the worries of this life, so that this day catches you by surprise.
column3: “Si g wo s‑e nenꞌoidad mat haha wabsh wo em‑ai hegai tash. Mt am hu pi wo mahchk. Pi g am wo shaꞌi e hiwgid mamt wabsh si muꞌi haꞌichu k ed wo e nakogad ch wo si e gegosidad ch wo nawkkoꞌod ch g e‑kihdagkaj wo e kudutad.

column2: For this day will come upon everyone who lives on the face of the earth.
column3: Hegai tash at am hab haha wabsh wo si e juh wehs hemajkam ha tahgio.

column2: Always keep watch and pray, so that you may be able to escape all that will happen and stand before the Son of man.”
column3: Mt wo si s‑e nenꞌoidad ch wo e hoꞌigeꞌidahunad chum hekid mamt ab wo uꞌukch g gewkdag ch s‑ap am gahi wo wuhsh wehs ihda mat am hab wo e juh. Nt pi an hu haꞌichu wo em‑abch ahni Jiosh si Kehsha mamt hekid wo ha lodai g hemajkam.”

column2: Every day Jesus taught in the Temple, and every evening he went and stayed on the Mount of Olives.  All the people came early in the morning to listen to him in the Temple.
column3: Sh g Jesus wehs tashkaj am ha mashcham geꞌe cheopi ch ed. Kush muꞌijj am wui daiw wabsh i sisiꞌalimad mat ab wo kaiha. Sh am i huhuduk, sh gam hu hihhim idam Jesus Olive Uꞌus Kawulk wui ch am koksho.

column2: Now the Festival of Unleavened Bread, also called the Passover, was approaching.
column3: Sh am i e aihim mash eda e wushshad matsh wa g Jiosh ha doꞌibia g ha‑shohshonbad. Sh heg eda pi e koꞌa hegai pahn mo jewajidas.

column2: The chief priests and religious teachers were looking for a way to kill Jesus, but were afraid of what the people would do.
column3: Sh g uꞌugchu papal ch chehanig ha mashchamdam am wabsh s‑aꞌagi e nakog matsh wo mua g Jesus ch wabshaba s‑ha ehbid g hemajkam.

column2: Satan entered into Judas, surnamed Iscariot, one of the twelve disciples.
column3: Kutsh g ge Jiawul Satan an bei g Judas Iscariot.

column2: He went and discussed with the chief priests and guard officers how he could betray Jesus.
column3: Tsh id am i ha dagito hegam Jesus k am him k am ha wehm aꞌaga g uꞌugchu papal ch geꞌe cheopi nuhkuddam ha‑geꞌegeꞌejig mat has masma am wo i dagito g Jesus ha wui.

column2: They were delighted, and offered him money.
column3: Tsh si s‑hohhoꞌi idam k ab si ahgi mat wo namkid.

column2: He agreed, and began to look for an opportunity to hand over Jesus when a crowd would not be there.
column3: Tsh amjed am i e nako g Judas mat am wo neidad mat s‑aꞌagi wo gagda g Jesus ab ha wui. T pi wo mahchk g hemajkam ab amjed.

column2: The Day of Unleavened Bread arrived when the Passover lamb had to be sacrificed.
column3: Tsh am hahawa s‑ap i e ai hegai ha‑shohshonbad ha‑doꞌibiadag piast. Kush d wehpeg tash matsh eda wo e kokda g kahwal mahmad.

column2: Jesus sent Peter and John, telling them, “Go and prepare the Passover meal, so we can eat it together.”
column3: Sh g Jesus hab ha ahg g Peter ch John, “Am g wo hihim k am wo i apꞌech g t‑gegosig matt wo wuhshad g t‑shohshon ha‑doꞌibiadag.”

column2: They asked him, “Where do you want us to prepare for it?”
column3: Kush hab kaij hegam, “Bahtt hab wo juh g t‑gegosig?”

column2: He replied, “When you enter the city you'll meet a man carrying a jar of water. Follow him and go into the house he enters.
column3: Sh hab kaij, “Neh, am amt wo hihi Jerusalem wui. T ab hema wo himad g cheoj ch wo waꞌigchugad ab haꞌa t ab. Kumt am wo i oi. Kut am hu hebai wo him k am wo i wah hema kih ed.

column2: Tell the owner of the house, ‘The Teacher asks you, “Where is the dining room where I can eat the Passover with my disciples?” ’
column3: Kumt hab wo chei ab wui g kihkam, ‘Neh, s‑mahchimk o g t‑mashchamdam mas an hebai i ha wiꞌis matt wo wuhshad g t‑shohshon ha‑doꞌibiadag.’

column2: He'll show you a large upstairs room that already has the necessary furniture. Prepare the meal there.”
column3: Kut am wo hema em‑chehgi g kih. T id gan hu ha‑kih dahm hab wo chuꞌigk ch wo geꞌejk ch am wo apchudask. Kumt an haꞌab wo i apꞌech g t‑gegosig”

column2: They went and found that everything was just as he had told them, and they prepared the Passover meal there.
column3: Kutsh wa woho am hihi idam kihhim wui. Tsh wa woho s‑ap am hab e juh mash has i ha ahg. Kutsh am i apꞌech g gegosig.

column2: When the time came, he sat down at the table with his apostles. He told them,
column3: Tsh am i hud. Kutsh am hahawa dada hegam haꞌi. Tsh g Jesus am i dahiwua mihsa wui. Tsh g chuhchaij am ep dadhaiwua.

column2: “I've been really looking forward to eating this Passover meal with you before my sufferings begin.
column3: Kush hab kaij ab ha wui, “Si ani tatchua mant wo em‑wehm huh ihda gegosig mant koi wo ni‑muhkid

column2: I tell you I shall not eat it again until the time is fulfilled in the kingdom of God.”
column3: nant pi pi hekid ia hu em‑wehm ep wo huh ihda hab mahs gegosig. T wabshaba ab wo e ai mat wo s‑ap e nahto g em‑doꞌibiadag. Kumt an wo ni‑wehmajk dahm kahchim ch ed.”

column2: Jesus took the cup, and after he had given thanks, he said, “Take this and share it among yourselves.
column3: Mtsh ab hahawa mah g nawait am tahsa ch ed. Kutsh ab i hoꞌigeꞌel g Jiosh k hab kaij ab ha wui, “Ab g wo behꞌi ihda k wehsijj ab wo ha ih.

column2: I tell you that I won't drink again of the fruit of the vine until the kingdom of God comes.”
column3: Neh, ahni ant pi hekid ab hu ep wo ih ihda uhdwis wadag k ab wo ai mat wo e nahto g Jiosh kownaltalig.”

column2: He picked up some bread, and after he had given thanks, he broke it into pieces and gave it to them. “This is my body which is given for you; do this in order to remember me,” Jesus told them.
column3: Neh, bash kaij ch am hahawa bei g chemait k ab hoꞌigeꞌel g Jiosh k am i hahain k hab kaij, “Do ni‑honshpadag ihda mant am i em‑hahaini. Id ani hab ahgch hab kaij mant wo ni‑muhkid am em‑wehhejed. Ab g wo huhgi ihda hahainig k id chum hekid am hab wo junihid mamt hekaj wo s‑ni‑chegitok.”

column2: In the same way after they had finished supper, he picked up the cup and said, “This cup is the new agreement in my blood which is poured out for you.”
column3: Tsh ab hahawa ep ha mah g wasib k hab kaij, “Do ni‑ehꞌed ihda nawait. Id ani hab ahgch hab kaij mat g ni‑ehꞌed wo e iawua mat hekaj am hab wo e juh hegai mo wa g Jiosh hab kaij matsh hab wo em‑juni.

column2: “In spite of this, my betrayer is sitting right here with me at the table.
column3: “Neh, hegai mat wo ni‑gagda o ia ni‑wehm daha mihsa wui.

column2: For it has been determined that the Son of man will die, yet how disastrous it will be for his betrayer!”
column3: Bant wa masma wo ni‑muhkid mat has masma g Jiosh am i apꞌech mat g si Kehshaj wo e muhkid. T wabshaba wo si s‑koꞌokam e namkid hegai mat wo ni‑gagda.”

column2: They began to argue among themselves as to who this might be and who could do this.
column3: Tsh ab ha hekaj aꞌai i e kakke mas hedai wud wok ch hab wo e juh.

column2: At the same time they also got into a quarrel about which of them was the most important.
column3: Kush am e neꞌowin hegam Jesus chuhchai am aꞌagadch mas hedai d wo si haꞌichuk am ha shahgid.

column2: Jesus told them, “Foreign kings lord it over their subjects, and those having power even want people to call them ‘benefactors.’  But it should not be so with you! Whoever is highest among you should be like the lowest, and the leader should be like a servant.
column3: Sh hab kaij g Jesus ab ha wui, “Neh, ab am si e haꞌichuchud hab sha masma mo g kokownal. S‑mahch am mo hegam si s‑gewkam an ha uꞌukch g e‑hemajkamga. Kut hemho wa am hab wo junihid mo haschu ab ha chehani. Mt wabshaba ahpim pi hab masma am wo ha dahmkad g e‑wehm wohochuddam. Si amt s‑hemajim am wo i ha wehmtad. Hegam kokownal o tatchua mat g hemajkam hab wo ha elidad mo geꞌe haꞌichu hab ha junid. Mt wabshaba ahpim pi hab masma hab wo e elidad mam geꞌe haꞌichu hab ha junid g hemajkam.

column2: Who is greater—the one who sits at the table, or the one who serves? Isn't it the one who sits at the table? But I'm among you as the one who serves.
column3: Aha nam hig hab chum e elid mam d ha‑aꞌamo ch am wo dadhaiwua mat g em‑pionag wo em‑gegos? Ni eda ahni pi hab masma hab ni‑wua, chum anis d em‑kownalig ch wabshaba heg ni‑wepogid mani d em‑pionag.

column2: You have stayed with me throughout my trials.
column3: “Ahpim amt pi hekid shaꞌi ni‑dagito am oidam g haꞌichu ni‑nakogig,

column2: And I grant to you authority to rule, just as my Father granted it to me,
column3: Kunt heg hekaj wo em‑kokownalch hab masma mat g ni‑ohg Jiosh ni‑kownalch.

column2: so that you may eat and drink at my table in my kingdom, and sit on thrones judging the twelve tribes of Israel.”
column3: Mt am ni‑wehm wo e gegosidad ni‑kownaltalig ed. Kunt hab wo em‑juh mamt d wo uꞌusagakamk am ha dahm hegam gamai gohk kawod dakam Tutuligo hemajkam.”

column2: “Simon, Simon—Satan has asked to have all of you  to sift like wheat,
column3: Kush hab kaij g Jesus ab Simon Peter wui, “Ih, Simon, Jiosh at wo hiwigi g ge Jiawul mat wehsijj wo em‑aꞌappe hab sha masma mat g pilkani hihkdam wo nehnich g e‑hihka k gam hu wo i gawulkai g mohgaj. Jiawul o hab chum e ahg mat gam hu hab wo i em‑juh hab masma mo g mohg.

column2: but I have prayed for you that your trust in me may not fail. And when you have returned, encourage your brothers.”
column3: Nt wabshaba ab i tai g Jiosh mat wo i gewkaj g m‑wohochudadag, Simon. Kupt am wo i ha gewkemhu g e‑wehm wohochuddam mapt hekid ab uhpam wo i e nodagi ni‑wui.”

column2: Peter said, “Lord, I'm ready to go with you to prison, and to die with you!”
column3: Sh hab kaij g Peter, “Ni‑kownalig, ni‑nahtokch ani mant wo ni‑kuhpachud k wo ni‑muhkid m‑wehm.”

column2: Jesus replied, “I'm telling you, Peter, before the cock crows today, you will deny three times that you know me.”
column3: Sh hab kaij g Jesus, “Neh, Peter, pi at koi am hu wo kuhu g keli chuchul id i chuhug ab, kupt waikko hab wo chei map pi shaꞌi ni‑mahch.”

column2: Jesus asked them, “When I sent you out without money, without a bag, and without an extra pair of sandals, did you lack anything?”
column3: Sh hab ep kaij g Jesus ab ha wui, “Neh, namd haꞌichu i pi edagi mam wa ahgachug g haꞌichu ni‑ahga pi uꞌuk g e‑lial kokstal o g limoshana kokstal o g shuhshk?”

column2: “But now, if you have money you should take it, as well as a bag, and if you don't have a sword, sell your cloak and buy one.
column3: Sh hab hahawa ha ahg, “Mt wabshaba hemu an wo uꞌad g e‑lial kih ch e‑is‑pahyo chum ams hems wo gagda g e‑lihwa k hekaj wo hema ha nolawt g is‑pahyo.

column2: I tell you that this statement in Scripture about me must be fulfilled: ‘He was counted with the wicked.’ What was said about me is now being fulfilled.”
column3: Hemho wa at am hab wo e juh ihda mo ab ni‑amjed oꞌohanas ch hab chuꞌig:

column2: “Look, Lord, here are two swords,” they said.
column3: Sh hab kaij hegam chuhchaij, “Pegih, t‑kownalig, m ia gohk wehch g iꞌis‑papayo.”

column2: Jesus left and as usual went to the Mount of Olives together with his disciples.
column3: Tsh amjed gam hu hih g Jesus Olive Uꞌus Kawulk t ab mash hab wa e wua. Kutsh oi hegam chuhchaij.

column2: When he arrived he said to them, “Pray that you don't give in to temptation.”
column3: Tsh am i dada amai. Sh hab kaij ab ha wui, “Am g wo e hoꞌigeꞌidahun mamt s‑ap wo nako g e‑aꞌappema.”

column2: Then he left them and walked about a stone's throw away, where he kneeled down and prayed.
column3: Neh, tsh am hahawa ha dagito k am baꞌich shaꞌi him k am tonwua k e hoꞌigeꞌidahun

column2: “Father,” he prayed, “if you're willing, please take away this cup of suffering from me. But I want to do what you want, not what I want.”
column3: hab kaijch, “Ni‑ohg, matp am wo s‑apꞌek, pt gam hu hab hig wo i juh hegai si s‑koꞌok shoꞌigdag mo ab ni‑wui him. Kuni eda tatchua mat ahpi g m‑tatchui hab wo e juh.” [

column2: Then an angel appeared from heaven to strengthen him.
column3: Tsh am haha wabsh hema jiwia g anghil ab wui k ab si i gewkaj.

column2: In great distress Jesus prayed even harder, and his sweat fell like drops of blood onto the ground.
column3: Kutsh si e kudut k am baꞌich haha wabsh si e hoꞌigeꞌidahu. Kush g wahuddaj am e iawua jewed dahm k d wabsh ehꞌed.]

column2: He finished praying, stood up, and went over to the disciples. He found them asleep, worn out by grief.
column3: Tsh am i haꞌasa e hoꞌigeꞌidahun k am hih mash am dadha hegam chuhchaij. Kush am kohksh nash pi wabsh i ha baꞌiwich g pi ap tahhadkam.

column2: “Why are you sleeping?” he asked them. “Get up and pray so that you won't fall into temptation.”
column3: Sh hab kaij ab ha wui, “Shahchu am ahgch kohksh? Ab g wo nehnen k wo e hoꞌigeꞌidahu mamt s‑ap wo nako g e‑aꞌappema.”

column2: While he was still speaking, a crowd appeared led by Judas, one of the twelve disciples. Judas went up to Jesus to kiss him.
column3: Sh am wabsh kia neok. Sh ab haꞌi ge hihim g hemajkam. Kush heg ha wanimed Judas mash d chum hema kehshaj g Jesus ch ab wui i hih matsh ab wo chintad.

column2: But Jesus asked him, “Judas, are you betraying the Son of man with a kiss?”
column3: Sh hab kaij g Jesus, “Ih, Judas, pt wo ni‑gagda ab ni‑chintadk ahni Jiosh si Kehsha!”

column2: Jesus' followers asked him, “Lord, should we attack them with our swords?”
column3: Tsh am i nei hegam haꞌi Jesus chuhchai mo haschu has e wua k hab kaij, “T‑kownalig, natt wo ha cheggia g iꞌis‑papayokaj?”

column2: And one of them struck the high priest's servant, cutting off his right ear.
column3: Kutsh hema ab si i widu g is‑pahyo k g uhgchu pahl neholiga nahk an si hikuch.

column2: “Stop! No more of this!” said Jesus. He touched the man's ear and healed him.
column3: Sh hab kaij g Jesus, “Am g wo wa i haꞌasa,” k an taht ihda cheoj nahk k doaj.

column2: Then Jesus spoke to the chief priests, and the officers of the Temple guard, and the elders. “Am I some kind of criminal that you had to come with swords and clubs?” he asked.
column3: Tsh am wui dada g uꞌugchu papal ch cheopi nuhkuddam ha‑geꞌegeꞌejig ch g geꞌeged mat an wo bei. Sh hab kaij g Jesus ab ha wui, “Bamki ni‑elid mani d s‑chu ehskam ch hab ia dada uꞌukch g iꞌis‑papayo ch uꞌus.

column2: “You didn't arrest me before, even though I was with you in the Temple every day. But this is your moment now, the time when darkness is in power.”
column3: Am ani em‑wehm haꞌichug cheopi t am wehs tashkaj. Kumt pi an hu ni‑bei. T wabshaba hemu am i em‑apꞌet. Pi apꞌekam at s‑ap am hab wo e juh s‑chuhugam k ed.”

column2: They arrested him and led him away, taking him to the chief priest's house. Peter followed at a distance.
column3: Tsh an bei g Jesus k gam hu i bei uhgchu pahl kih wui. Sh g Peter ga hu wabsh mehkjed ha oid.

column2: They started a fire in the middle of the courtyard and sat down by it. Peter was there among them.
column3: Kutsh eda am ge e nai kolhai ch ed. Kutsh am i jiwia g Peter k am ha wehm dahiwua hegam mo am dadha.

column2: As he sat there, a servant girl noticed him in the firelight, and stared directly at him and said,
column3: Kutsh am hema jiwia g chehia pion k am nei g Peter k ab si i neid k hab kaij, “Ihda oꞌodham o wa an wehmaj hegai mamt an bei.”

column2: “This man was with him.” But Peter denied it. “Woman, I don't know him!” he said.
column3: Tsh wabshaba pi mahch k e ah g Peter hab kaijch, “Pi ani shaꞌi mahch hegai.”

column2: A little later someone else looked at him and said, “You're also one of them.” “No, I'm not!” Peter replied.
column3: Sh am shaꞌi haꞌas. Kutsh am hema ep cheh g Peter k hab kaij, “Ahpi ap d hema hegam Jesus.”

column2: About an hour later, another person insisted, “I'm sure he was with him too—he's a Galilean.”
column3: Sh am hu d i hemako ohla amjed. Kush hema oꞌodham am si e gewkaj ch hab kaij, “Woho o wa mo ihda oꞌodham hab d waꞌap ha wehm oꞌodham noki pi ab d kihkam Galilee chekshani ch ed.”

column2: “I've no idea what you're talking about!” Peter replied. Right then, while he was still speaking, the cock crowed. The Lord turned and looked at Peter.
column3: Sh hab kaij, “Pi ani shaꞌi mahch maps haschu hab ahg.” Neh, sh am wabsh kia neok. Tsh g keli chuchul am si ku.

column2: And Peter remembered what the Lord had said, how he'd told him: “Before the cock crows today, you'll deny me three times.”
column3: Kutsh ab si e sikolkai g Jesus k ab si i nei g Peter. Tsh am wabsh si chegito g Peter g jesus neꞌoki mo wa hab kaij, “Koi at wo kuhu g keli chuchul, kupt waikko hab wo waꞌi chei map pi ni‑mahch.”

column2: Peter went out and wept bitterly.
column3: Tsh gam hu hahawa i wuhsh g Peter k si pi ap e tahtk ch shoak.

column2: The men guarding Jesus began to mock him and beat him.
column3: Sh hegam mash am nuhkud g jesus nahnko ahg ch an si maꞌish k wuh g wuhpuij

column2: They put a blindfold on him, and then asked him, “If you can prophesy, tell us who hit you that time!”
column3: k ab si shonikkash ch hab ahg, “Am g hig t‑ahgid mas hedai ab m‑shonikka.”

column2: and shouted many other insults at him.
column3: Kush muꞌi nahnko ep s‑koꞌokam ahg.

column2: Early in the morning the council of elders gathered together with the chief priests and religious teachers. Jesus was led before the council.
column3: Tsh am i mahsi. Kutsh am e nam hegam geꞌeged ch uꞌugchu papal ch chehanig ha mashchamdam mash d e jehnigiddam. Kumtsh am ha wui uꞌapa g Jesus.

column2: “If you really are the Messiah, then tell us,” they said.
column3: Sh idam hab kaij, “Am g t‑ahgid maps d Jiosh si Kehsha.”

column2: “And if I were to ask you a question, you wouldn't answer.
column3: Kumt pi woho ab hu wo i nodagi hegai mantp haschu wo em‑kakke.

column2: But from now on the Son of man will sit at the right hand of the mighty God.”
column3: Nt wabshaba wo em‑ahgi mant iꞌajed an s‑apkojed hugidaj an wo dak g Jiosh ahni si Kehshaj.”

column2: They all asked, “So are you the son of God?”
column3: Kush wehsijj hab kaij, “A kuptp d Jiosh alidag?”

column2: “Why do we need any more witnesses?” they said. “We've heard it ourselves from his own mouth!”
column3: Sh hab kaij hegam, “Neh, pi ach shaꞌi hema tatchua mat wo si s‑mahch k ah. Ahchim ach hejel kah mo si pi ap neok ab Jiosh t amjed ch hekaj wo chum e muhkid.”

column2: The whole council rose and took him to Pilate.
column3: Kutsh wehsijj hegam hahaꞌichu ab si e wehmt k am i bei g Jesus heg wui mash d kownal am Judea chekshani ch ed ch hab chehgig Pilate.

column2: There they started to accuse him. “We found this man deceiving our nation, telling people not to pay taxes to Caesar, and claiming he is Messiah, a king,” they said.
