column3: Sh ab ha kaiham. Kush ab wui ab haꞌichu abchudahim g Jesus hab kaijch, “Neh, ihda oꞌodham o im hu hab wabsh i ha wawan g t‑hemajkamga hab ha ahgch mat pi wo namkid g geꞌe kownal. Kuch kah mo hab hejel e ahg mo d jiosh si Kehsha ch d uhg kownal. Kupt hemho wa wo mua.”

column2: “Are you the King of the Jews?” Pilate asked him.
column3: Kush ab kakke g Pilate g Jesus ch hab kaij, “Nap d ha‑kownalig g Tutuligo hemajkam?”

column2: Then Pilate said to the chief priests and the crowds, “I don't find this man guilty of any crime.”
column3: Tsh g Pilate am i mamche hegai mam ab abchud. Sh eda muꞌi an oiopo g hemajkam s‑neidamk mo has e wua. Tsh g Pilate am ha kaichudk hab ha ah g uꞌugchu papal, “Pi ant haꞌichu shaꞌi cheh mas pi ap hab juh ihda oꞌodham mat heg hekaj wo e muhkid.”

column2: But they insisted, saying, “He is inciting rebellion all over Judea with his teachings, from Galilee to right here in Jerusalem.”
column3: Kush wabshaba baꞌich i e gewpkad ch hab kaij, “Am o ha chuꞌamun g t‑wehm oꞌodham haꞌichu ha mashchamch wehsko ga hu Galilee t amjed ch ia Judea ch ed ch chum hems iia Jerusalem ch ed.”

column2: When he heard this, Pilate asked, “Is this man a Galilean?”
column3: Tsh am i kah g Pilate ihda k hab kaij ab ha wui, “Kutp ab Galilee chekshani ch ed d kihkam ihda oꞌodham?”

column2: When he discovered that Jesus came under Herod's jurisdiction, he sent him to Herod who was also in Jerusalem at the time.
column3: Kumsh am ahgid mash am haꞌab d kihkam. Sh g Herod am d ha‑kownalig Galilee chekshani ch ed ch iaꞌi idani am hab waꞌap haꞌichug Jerusalem t am. Kumtsh heg hekaj am wui uꞌapa g Jesus.

column2: Herod was very pleased to see Jesus since he had wanted to meet him for a long time. He had heard about Jesus and was hoping to see him perform a miracle.
column3: Kush si s‑hehgig g Herod nash pi tash waꞌi chum s‑neidamk hab chum e ahgch matp hems am tahgio hab wo juh g s‑hasig haꞌichu.

column2: He asked Jesus many questions, but Jesus did not answer him at all.
column3: Kumtsh am kei tahgio. Kush muꞌi haꞌichu kakke. Sh wabshaba pi has shaꞌi kaij g Jesus.

column2: The chief priests and religious teachers stood there, angrily accusing him.
column3: Kush g uꞌugchu papal ch chehanig ha mashchamdam am gegok ch si s‑gewkam ab haꞌichu abchud g Jesus.

column2: Herod and his soldiers treated Jesus with contempt and mocked him. Then they placed a royal robe on him and sent him back to Pilate.
column3: Sh g Herod g e‑shondalig ha wehm haha wabsh nahnko ahg g Jesus ch si ash k ash g si s‑kehg kahba ab wahki. Tsh ab hahawa ha cheha g Herod mat wo uhpam bei am Pilate wui.

column2: From that day on Herod and Pilate were friends—before that they had been enemies.
column3: Kutsh heg i tash ab g Pilate ch Herod ab hahawa e nawojt k ash eda chum s‑e kehꞌid.

column2: Pilate called together the chief priests, rulers, and the people,
column3: Tsh g Pilate am i ha hemapai g uꞌugchu papal ch ha wanimeddam g hemajkam

column2: and told them, “You brought this man before me, accusing him of inciting the people to rebellion. I've carefully examined him in your presence, and do not find him guilty of the charges you have brought against him.
column3: k ash hab kaij ab ha wui, “Ia amt uꞌapa ihda oꞌodham ni‑wui hab kaijch mo goꞌolko ha wanimed g hemajkam. Kunt hemuch ia em‑kaichudk am i mamche hegai mam ab abchud k pi haꞌichu shaꞌi cheh mas pi ap hab junihi m.

column2: Neither did Herod, for he sent him back to us. He has done nothing that demands he should be put to death.
column3: Kutsh Herod hab waꞌap pi haꞌichu shaꞌi cheh. T g shondaligaj ab uhpam i uꞌapa t‑wui. Pi atki haꞌichu hab juh ihda mas heg hekaj wo e muhkid.

column2: So I will have him flogged and then release him.”
column3: Kunt wabsh wo ha cheha mat wo gewittan k wo dagito.” [
Neh, bash kaij nash pi am hema i dadagitosh g lihso ha wehhejed wehs ahid ab mo eda hab e wua hegai geꞌe gegosig.]

column2: But they all shouted together, “Kill this man, and release Barabbas to us.”
column3: Kush wehsijj hegam muꞌi hemajkam mo am haꞌichug si s‑kaidam hab kaij, “Pi ach tatchua ihda. Barabbas apt wo i dagito t‑wehhejed.”

column2: (Barabbas had been put in prison for taking part in a rebellion in the city, and for murder.).
column3: Sh eda ihda Barabbas am e kuhpch nash pi chum haꞌi ha wehm cheggia g kownal ch haꞌi ha kokda.

column2: Pilate wanted to release Jesus, so spoke to them again.
column3: Sh am ep chum ha wehm neok g Pilate nash pi chum s‑dagitoimk g jesus.

column2: But they kept on shouting, “Crucify him! Crucify him!”
column3: Sh wabshaba am ep si s‑kaidam hab ge kaij muꞌikko, “Muꞌani! Muꞌani ab kots t ab!”

column2: Pilate asked them for the third time, “But why? What crime has he committed? I don't find any reason for executing him. So I will have him flogged and then release him.”
column3: Sh hab ep chum kaij g Pilate, “A t haschu pi ap hab juh. Pi ant haꞌichu shaꞌi cheh mas heg hekaj wo e muhkid. Ab ant wo ha cheha mat wo gewittan k wo dagito.”

column2: But they continued insisting with loud shouts, demanding that he be crucified. Their shouting succeeded,
column3: Sh wabshaba am wabsh si s‑kaidam hab kaij matsh ab wo naggia kots t ab. Neh, tsh g ha‑hihinki gewito g Pilate.

column2: and Pilate gave the sentence they demanded.
column3: Tsh am i apꞌech mat am hab wo e juh g ha‑tatchui.

column2: He released the man imprisoned for rebellion and murder, but he sent Jesus to be put to death in accordance with their demands.
column3: Kumtsh gam hu i wuhshad hegai mash d ha cheggiadkam ch d ha muꞌakam k amtsh g Jesus am i dagito ha wui mat am hab wo juh mo has i elid.

column2: As the soldiers  led him away, they seized a man called Simon of Cyrene, who had come in from the countryside. They put the cross on him and made him carry it behind Jesus.
column3: Kumtsh gam hu i bei g Jesus ab kushwiotachudk g kots. Kush am hu hebai hihim. Tsh ab hema i ha nam g oꞌodham mash ab him Jerusalem wui. Id ash hab chehgig Simon ch ab d kihkam mash am d Cyrene ch ash ab him ga hu oꞌoidag amjed. Kumtsh am wabsh si be k ab kushwiotach g kots k atsh hab juh mat ab oidk wo himad g Jesus.

column2: A large crowd followed him, along with women who were mourning and lamenting him.
column3: Kush muꞌi hemajkam ab oidch hihim. Sh g uꞌuwi si shoanihim wehhejed.

column2: Jesus turned to them and said, “Daughters of Jerusalem, don't weep for me. Weep for yourselves and your children.
column3: Tsh ab i ha nei g Jesus k hab kaij ab ha wui, “Pi g am ni‑wehhejed wo shoanid, ahpim Jerusalem t am kihkam, ch wabshaba hejel e wehhejed ch e‑aꞌaliga ha wehhejed.

column2: For the time is coming when they'll say, ‘Happy are those who are childless, and those who never had babies, and those who never nursed them.’
column3: Ab o him g tash mat hab wo chei g hemajkam mo si haꞌichu s‑ha abamk hegam uꞌuwi mat pi hekid shaꞌi mahmadt.

column2: They'll say to the mountains, ‘Fall down on us,’ and to the hills, ‘Cover us.’  For if they do this to wood that is new, what will happen when it's dried out?”
column3: Woho o wa mat s‑ta ehbidam haꞌichu hab wo e juh am ni‑tahgio. T wabshaba baꞌich i s‑ta ehbidam haꞌichu hab haha wo juh am ha tahgio hegam mo d pi ap chuꞌijkam ch pi ab hu ni‑wui e nohnogimk. (30) Hegam at pi wo e nako mas heg wo nako k heg hekaj wo chum tatchua mat g dohdaꞌag am ha dahm wo i shulig k wo ha ehsto.”

column2: They also took two others who were criminals to be executed with him.
column3: Kumsh gohk ep ha uꞌa mamtsh am wehmaj wo ha kokda. Sh idam d pi ap hehemajkam.

column2: When they reached the place called the Skull they crucified him together with the criminals, one on his right, and the other on his left.
column3: Kumtsh an dada anai mash am hab e aꞌaga Koshwak. Tsh g shondal ab hahawa sisish g Jesus kots t ab k am i kei g kots wag ch ed k gan hu aꞌai hab waꞌap ha nahngia hegam pi ap hehemajkam kokots t ab.

column2: Jesus said, “Father, please forgive them, for they don't know what they're doing.” They divided up his clothes by throwing dice for them.
column3: Tsh ab hahawa e hoꞌigeꞌidahu g Jesus k hab kaij, “Ni‑ohg Jiosh, ab g wabsh si i s‑ha hoꞌigeꞌid hegam mat ab ni‑naggia. Pi o shaꞌi mahch mani d si m‑Kehsha ch d s‑apꞌekam.”

column2: The people stood and watched and the leaders sneered at Jesus. “He saved others, let him save himself, if he is really God's Messiah, the Chosen One,” they said.
column3: Sh g hemajkam am gegok ch neid wehs ihda. Sh g ha wanimeddam nahnko ahg g Jesus ch hab kaij, “Ha at doꞌibia haꞌi, pegih, k hejel wo e doꞌibia matp d Jiosh si Kehsha.”

column2: The soldiers also mocked him, coming up to him and offering him wine vinegar, saying,
column3: Kush g shondal hab waꞌap nahnko wua ch hab wabsh s‑junim k ab chum mah g nawait

column2: “If you're the King of the Jews, then save yourself.”
column3: ch wabsh nahnko ahg hab kaijch, “Oi g hejel e doꞌibiad napsh pi d ge kownal.”

column2: Above Jesus was a sign on which it was written, “This is the King of the Jews.”
column3: Sh am dahm oꞌohadag ihda, “Id o d Tutuligo hemajkam ha‑kownalig.”

column2: One of the criminals hanging there joined in the insults against Jesus. “Aren't you the Messiah?” he asked. “Then save yourself—and us too!”
column3: Kush hema hegam pi ap hehemajkam mash ab hab waꞌap naggia kots t ab ab si s‑koꞌokam has ahg g Jesus ch hab kaij, “Neh, kuptp d ge Jiosh si Kehsha, pegih, k wo hejel e doꞌibia k ahchim ep wo t‑doꞌibia.”

column2: But the other criminal disagreed and argued with him, “Don't you fear God even when you're suffering the same punishment?” he asked.
column3: Kush g hema ab si s‑kehꞌid ihda ch hab kaij, “Aha nap pi ehbid g Jiosh. Ia ach t‑wehm nahngia ch ab t‑wepo mohtoꞌidas g chuꞌijig.

column2: “For us the sentence is right since we're being punished for what we did, but this man didn't do anything wrong.”
column3: Kuch ahchim s‑ap ab mohtoꞌidas nach pi wa woho d pi ap chuꞌijkam. Kutsh eda ihda pi hab shaꞌi juh g pi apꞌekam.”

column2: Then he said, “Jesus, please remember me when you come into your kingdom.”
column3: Neh, bash kaij ihda hema ch ab Jesus wui hab hahawa ep kaij, “Jesus, ab apt wo wa al s‑ni‑chegitok hekid ab bek g e‑kownaltalig.”

column2: Jesus replied, “I promise you today you will be with me in paradise.”
column3: Sh hab kaij g Jesus ab wui, “Neh, ni ab si m‑ahgid mapt id i tashkaj wo ni‑wehmajk an Jiosh kihdag ed.”

column2: By this time it was around noon and darkness fell over the whole land until three in the afternoon.
column3: Kutsh am i dahm juh. Tsh muh g tash k wehsko s‑chuhugam ch ab ai g waik ohla.

column2: The sun's light was shut out, and the Temple veil was torn in two.
column3: Kutsh am geꞌe cheopi ch ed g s‑kowk ikus kuhpadag ab si shel e wantsh.

column2: Jesus called out in a loud voice, “Father, I place myself in your hands.” Having said this he breathed his last.
column3: Kush am si s‑kaidam e hoꞌigeꞌidahun g Jesus Jiosh wui ch hab kaij, “Ni‑ohg, ab ant i m‑mah g ni‑doakag.” Neh, bash cheꞌiok am i muh.

column2: When the centurion saw what had happened he praised God and said, “Surely this man was innocent.”
column3: Kutsh am i nei g shondal ha‑geꞌejig matsh haschu has e juh k ab si ihm g Jiosh ch hab kaij, “Woho oki d s‑apꞌekam oꞌodham ihda.”

column2: When all the crowds that had come to watch saw what happened they went home beating their chests in grief.
column3: Tsh amjed muꞌijj gam hu uhpam hihi hegam mash ab neid ab wabsh e wecho wahpkch nash pi oi wa si ap e tatat.

column2: But all those who knew Jesus, including the women who'd followed him from Galilee, watched from a distance.
column3: Kush wehsijj hegam mo si s‑mahch g Jesus ga hu wabsh mehk gegok ch ab neid wehs ihda. Haꞌi idam ash d hegam uꞌuwi mash ga hu Galilee t amjed an wehmajkahim g Jesus.

column2: There was a man called Joseph who was good and honest. He was a member of the council,  but he hadn't agreed with its decisions and actions. He came from the Jewish town of Arimathea, and was waiting expectantly for the kingdom of God.
column3: Sh eda wa hema hegam e jehnigiddam chum pi hohhoꞌid matsh g wehmaj e jehnigiddam s‑muꞌam k ah g Jesus. Id ash hab chehgig Joseph ch ab d kihkam mash am d Arimathea ch s‑ap d oꞌodham ch ab nenida g Jiosh kownaltalig.

column2: Joseph went to Pilate and asked for Jesus' body.
column3: Tsh hekid am i muh g Jesus, tsh ha hekaj am wui hih g Pilate k ab si e shoꞌigchud k tahni g honshpadaj. Tsh am wa apꞌech matsh wo bei.

column2: Once he'd taken it down, he wrapped it in a linen cloth. He laid Jesus in an unused tomb cut into the rock.
column3: Tsh gam hu ep him k ab i huduni. Sh am mia hab chuꞌig g hihaꞌini ch ab heki hu cheotas hodai ch ed ch pi koi e hekaj. Tsh g Joseph am i bei g honshpadag k ged hu heg eda cheh am i hobinodk g s‑kehg ikuskaj.

column2: It was preparation day  and the Sabbath would soon begin.  The women who had come with Jesus from Galilee had followed Joseph and had seen the tomb where Jesus' body had been laid.
column3: Tsh hegam uꞌuwi mo wehmajkahim g Jesus ab Galilee t amjed gam hu oi g Joseph k ash neid mat hebai e cheh g Jesus k has masma ab e woi. (54) Kush d wialos. Sh g hemajkam chum e nakog no pi g shahwai d ha‑mihshmda tash.

column2: They returned home and prepared spices and ointments. But on the Sabbath they rested, observing the commandment.
column3: Kutsh gam hu uhpam hihi idam uꞌuwi mash hebai dadha k am i apꞌech haꞌichu mat hekaj wo s‑ap hab juh mo hab masma hab ha wua g e‑koꞌidag k ash am hahawa e ulinihogi mihshmda tash ch ed mo hab masma d ha‑chehanig.

column2: Very early on the first day of the week, the women went to the tomb, taking the spices they'd prepared.
column3: Sh am e aihim g domig tash. Tsh am hihi idam uꞌuwi hihaꞌini wui k ash uꞌa hegai matsh am nahto matsh hekaj wo i apꞌech g muhki.

column2: They found that the stone had been rolled away from the entrance to the tomb,
column3: Kush gam hu e melchudas hegai geꞌe hodai mash ab hekaj e kuhpch g hihaꞌini.

column2: but when they went in they didn't find the body of the Lord Jesus.
column3: Tsh am i wahp k pi shaꞌi edagi g muhki

column2: While they were wondering what was going on, two men suddenly appeared dressed in clothes that shone brilliantly.
column3: k am wabsh i gegok pi amichudch ihda. Tsh am haha wabsh gohk i e chehgi ha wui mo hab sha mahs mo g oꞌodham. Kush wabsh si tonod g haꞌichu ha‑eniga.

column2: The women were terrified and bowed down, their faces on the ground.
column3: Kutsh si e totods idam uꞌuwi k ab si i shul jewedo.

column2: He's not here; he's risen from the dead! Remember what he told you while you were still in Galilee:
column3: Pi o ia hu haꞌichug g Jesus nat pi i wuhsh ab muhkig amjed. Am g wo i chegito mo wa has kaij ab em‑wui. Am am wa wabsh kia haꞌichug Galilee t am.

column2: ‘The Son of man must be betrayed into the hands of evil men, be crucified, and on the third day rise again.’ ”
column3: K wa hab kaij, ‘Hemho ant am wo wa i ni‑dagito pi apꞌekam hemajkam ha wui ahni Jiosh si Kehsha. T hegam ab wo ni‑naggia kots t ab mat wo ni‑mua. Nt wabshaba wo i wuhsh muhkig amjed am heg eda waik tash amjed.’ Neh, bo kaij g Jesus ab em‑wui.”

column2: Then they remembered what he'd said.
column3: Kutsh idam uꞌuwi am i chegito mash wa hab kaij g Jesus

column2: When they returned from the tomb they reported all that had happened to the eleven disciples and to all the others.
column3: k ga hu uhpam hihim k ash am ha ahgid hegam gamai hemako Jesus chuhchai ch wehs g haꞌi mat has e juh.

column2: Those who told the apostles what had happened were Mary Magdalene, Joanna, Mary the mother of James, and other women with them.
column3: Haꞌi idam uꞌuwi mash am ha ahgid ash d Mary Magdalene ch Joanna ch hegai Mary mash g madaj hab chehgig James.

column2: But it seemed like nonsense to them, so they didn't believe the women.
column3: Kush hegam Jesus chuhchai pi ab hu ha wohochud nash pi hab ha elid mo wabsh pi e mahch ch hab kaij.

column2: However Peter got up and ran to the tomb. Bending down, he looked in and saw only the linen grave-clothes. So he went back home, wondering what had happened.
column3: Tsh wabshaba g Peter am i e nakog k am meh hihaꞌini wui k ged hu meliw k am i koachsh. Kush heg am waꞌi kahch s‑kehg ikus mash heg hekaj chum e hobinodch. Tsh amjed gm hu uhpam hih am wabsh i pi amichudch matsh haschu has e juh.

column2: The same day two disciples were on their way to a village called Emmaus, about seven miles from Jerusalem.
column3: Kush heg waꞌi tash gohkajj am hihim Emmaus kihhim wui. Id amt ab wo ai kihhim am hu i gohk ohla ab am hihimadch Jerusalem t amjed.

column2: They were talking about all that had happened.
column3: Sh idam am hihimad ch neneok ab amjed hegai matsh haschu has e juh am tahgio g Jesus.

column2: As they discussed and debated, Jesus came up and fell into step with them.
column3: Tsh g Jesus am ha aꞌa k am ha wehm hih.

column2: But they were kept from recognizing him.
column3: Kush hi wa chum neid ch wabsh pi amichud.

column2: “What are you discussing as you walk along?” he asked them. They stopped, their faces sad.
column3: Sh hab kaij g Jesus ab ha wui, “Shahchu am am si aꞌagad ch ia hihim?”

column2: One of them, called Cleopas, replied, “Are you just visiting Jerusalem? You must be the only person who doesn't know the things that have happened in the past few days.”
column3: Sh hema idam hab chehgig Cleopas ch id hab kaij ab wui, “Aha nap ahpi waꞌi hejel pi mahch mat haschu has e juh hemuch huꞌi ch eda am daha Jerusalem t am?”

column2: “What things?” Jesus asked. “About Jesus of Nazareth,” they replied. “He was a prophet who spoke powerfully and performed great miracles before God and all the people.
column3: Sh hab kaij g Jesus, “Shahchu ap hab ahg?”

column2: But our high priests and leaders handed him over to be condemned to death, and they crucified him.
column3: Kut g uꞌugchu papal ch t‑wanimeddam am i dagito kownal wui mat wo mua. Kumt ab sisish kots t ab k mua.

column2: We had hoped he was the one who was going to rescue Israel. It's been three days now since all this happened.
column3: Kuch eda id hab chum si elid mo d hegai matsh wa wo t‑doꞌibia ahchim Tutuligo hemajkam. K hemuch d i waik tash amjed mat hab e juh.

column2: But then some of the women in our group surprised us.
column3: Kut am haꞌi hihi g uꞌuwi t‑wehm wohochuddam wabsh i siꞌalim

column2: At dawn they went to the tomb and they didn't find his body. They came back saying that they'd seen a vision of angels who told them he's alive.
column3: k atsh pi cheh g muhki k uhpam dada k t‑tods am t‑ahgidch matsh am haꞌi i e chehgi g anghil ha wui. Sh idam hab ha ahgid mo d doakam g Jesus.

column2: Some of us went to the tomb, and found it just as the women said—but they didn't see him.”
column3: T am haꞌi hihi g chechoj hihaꞌini wui k am s‑mai mash wa woho pi am hu haꞌichug g muhki mo hab chum kaij hegam uꞌuwi.”

column2: Jesus told them, “You're so dull! How slow you are to trust in all that the prophets said!
column3: Sh hab hahawa kaij g Jesus ab ha wui, “S‑wohom am hig pi haꞌichu aꞌamichud ch pi wohochud hegai mo wa g kekelibad Jiosh haꞌichu i tashogiddam am ahg.

column2: Didn't the Messiah have to suffer before he could enter into his glory?”
column3: No hig pi hab wa mahs mat hab masma wo e shoꞌigch g Jiosh si Kehsha k am wo i wah si s‑kehg e‑apꞌedag ed.”

column2: Then, starting with Moses and all the prophets, he explained to them everything that was said in Scripture about himself.
column3: Neh, bash kaij g Jesus ch amjed am i wuhshad k am tashogi wehs hegai matki g Mosesbad ch wehs hegam kekelibad Jiosh haꞌichu i tashogiddam an oꞌoha ab amjed.

column2: As they approached the village they were going to, Jesus made it seem as if he was going farther.
column3: Kutsh am hihim k am i aihi hegai al kihhim mo am wui d hihimdam. Sh gam hu wabsh i si him g Jesus.

column2: But they urged him, saying, “Please come and stay with us. It's getting late—the day is almost over.” So he went to stay with them.
column3: Kush wabshaba an shoshobid ch hab kaij, “Ia apt wo waꞌi jiwia t‑wehm. Hudunihim o k ch ab i s‑chuhugamhi.”

column2: When he sat down to eat with them, he took the bread and gave thanks, broke it, and gave it to them.
column3: Tsh am wo i gegos. Tsh am bei g chemait k am e hoꞌigeꞌidahun k am hahawa hahain k ab ha mah.

column2: Their eyes were opened, and they recognized him. Then he disappeared from view.
column3: Kutsh am hahawa i amich. Tsh wabshaba am wabsh i piꞌata.

column2: The two disciples said to each other, “Weren't our thoughts on fire when he spoke to us, as he explained the Scriptures to us?”
column3: Sh hab hahawa kaij ab aꞌai e wui, “Neh, ab at wa si i t‑shuhdad g s‑ap tahhadkam mo wa ab t‑wehm neokhim ch am tashogid g Jiosh oꞌohana mach ab hihim wohg oidch.”

column2: They got up right away and returned to Jerusalem. There they found the eleven disciples and those who were with them meeting together,
column3: Tsh am ha hekaj i e nakog k gam hu uhpam hihi Jerusalem wui. Kush am e hemapadch hegam gamai hemako Jesus chuhchai haꞌi ha wehm g e‑wehm wohochuddam. Tsh am dada idam gohk.

column2: who said, “The Lord has really risen again! He has appeared to Simon.”
column3: Kush hegam am ha ahgid ch hab kaij, “Neh, woho atki i wuhsh g t‑kownalig Jesus ab muhkig amjed. Kutsh g Simon nei.”

column2: Then those who had just arrived explained to the other disciples what had happened to them on the road, and how they had recognized Jesus when he broke bread.
column3: Kush idam gohk am hahawa epai ha ahgid matsh haschu has e juh am wohg ch ed ch heg ehp matsh amich g Jesus matsh am hahai g chemait.

column2: While they were talking, Jesus himself stood among them, and said, “Peace to you!”
column3: Sh am wabsh kia aꞌaga ihda. Sh am haha wabsh kehk ha shahgid g Jesus ch ash hab kaij ab ha wui, “Am g wo s‑ap e tahtkkad.”

column2: They were startled and afraid, thinking they were seeing a ghost.
column3: Kutsh shaꞌi si e totods hab em‑ahgch mo d wabsh kokꞌoi.

column2: “Why are you frightened? Why are you doubting?” he asked them.
column3: Sh hab kaij ab ha wui, “Pi g wo shaꞌi e kudut k ab wabsh wo s‑ni‑wohochudad.

column2: “Look at my hands and my feet—you can see it's me. Touch me and you'll be certain, for a spirit doesn't have flesh and bones, as you see I have.”
column3: Ab g wo i neid g ni‑nohnhoi ch ni‑tahtad k wo s‑mai mani d ahni. Ab g wo ni‑tahtam k wo nei mani pi d kokꞌoi. Kokꞌoi o pi ha chuhkug ch pi ha ohꞌo mani ahni hemuch imhab chuꞌig.”

column2: Having said this, he showed them his hands and feet.
column3: Kush hab cheꞌiok ab ha chehgi g e‑nohnhoi ch e‑tahtad.

column2: But they still couldn't believe it because they were so elated and amazed. He asked them, “Do you have anything to eat?”
column3: Kush chum si s‑ap e tahtk ch wabshaba wabsh i hahaꞌadka natsh pi wabsh i pi mai mat has wo el. Kush heg hekaj ab ha kakke mas am haꞌichu chekch mat wo hu.

column2: They gave him a piece of cooked fish,
column3: Kutsh ab ge mah g watopi gaꞌi.

column2: and he took it and ate it in front of them.
column3: Kutsh ab be k huh. Sh id wehsijj neid.

column2: Then Jesus said to them, “This is what I explained to you while I was still with you. Everything written about me in the law of Moses, the prophets, and the psalms, had to be fulfilled.”
column3: Kush hab hahawa kaij ab ha wui, “Wehs ani am em‑ahgid ihda heki hu. Wehs haꞌichu at hemho wa am hab wo e juh mo an oꞌohanas ab ni‑amjed ha‑oꞌohana ed g Mosesbad ch hegam haꞌi kekelibad Jiosh haꞌichu i tashogiddam ch heg eda nenꞌei oꞌohana mo an hab chuꞌig Jiosh heki hu oꞌohana ed.”

column2: Then he opened their minds so they were able to understand the Scriptures.
column3: Neh, bash kaij ch ab hahawa i ha mah g amichudadag mat wo s‑amich g Jiosh oꞌohana

column2: He told them, “It was written like this: the Messiah would suffer and rise from the dead on the third day, and in his name
column3: k ash hab kaij ab ha wui, “Bant masma hab ni‑juh mo wa hab chuꞌig an Jiosh oꞌohana ed mant hab wo wa ni‑juh. An o oꞌohanas mantsh wo ni‑shoꞌigchud k wo ni‑muhkid. Kutsh d wo i waik tashk amjed. Ntsh ep wo ni‑chegito. Neh, heg ant hab juh.

column2: repentance for the forgiveness of sins would be preached to all nations, beginning in Jerusalem.
column3: Kut ia Jerusalem t amjed am aꞌai wo i e ahgahi gam hu wehsko jejewed ha dahm mat g hemajkam ab wo i ni‑hiwig k gm hu wo s‑ohhod g pi ap e‑chegitoi. T g Jiosh im hu hab wo i juh g pi ap ha‑chuꞌijig.

column2: You are witnesses of all this.
column3: Ahpim amt am wo ahgahid ihda si s‑has haꞌichu mam neid ch kah.

column2: Now I'm going to send you what my Father promised—but wait in the city until you receive power from heaven.”
column3: T g Hekia S‑apꞌekam Gewkdag ab wo em‑mah g gewkdag mamt hab wo junihid. Heg ant am wo cheha mat wo em‑wehmajkad hab masma mo g ni‑ohg Jiosh hab kaij mat hab wo e juh. Mt heg hekaj ia wo dadkad Jerusalem t ab ch ab wo ai mamt ab wo bei hegai gewkdag.”

column2: Then he led them out until they were near Bethany, and lifting up his hands, he blessed them.
column3: Tsh am hahawa i ha wanim amai mash am miabidch g Bethany. Tsh am hu hebai i dada. Kutsh am uhgk ul g e‑nohnhoi ha dahm k ab ha hoꞌigeꞌelid,

column2: While he was blessing them, he left them, and was taken up to heaven.
column3: Tsh g Jiosh gam hu i bei dahm kahchim wui.

column2: They worshiped him, and then they returned to Jerusalem full of joy.
column3: Sh idam ab si has elid ch gam hu hahawa hihi Jerusalem wui s‑hehgigch

column2: They spent all their time in the Temple praising God.
column3: k amjed chum hekid am hihhim geꞌe cheopi wui ch ab hoꞌigeꞌelid g Jiosh.

column2: This book is the record of Jesus the Messiah, the son of David, the son of Abraham, beginning with the family line:
column3: Ia atsh mahsi g Jesus Christ jewed dahm k ab d amjedkamaj hegai t‑kekelibad ha‑kownalig mash hab chehgig David. Kush g Davidbad ab d amjedkamaj hegai mash d t‑shohshon ahchim Tutuligo ch hab chehgig Abraham.

column2: Abraham was the father of Isaac; and Isaac the father of Jacob; and Jacob the father of Judah and his brothers;
column3: Abraham atsh wa an alidt g Isaac.

column2: So all the generations from Abraham to David add up to fourteen; from David to the Babylonian exile, fourteen; and from the Babylonian exile to the Messiah, fourteen.
column3: Pegih, nt gamai giꞌik an oꞌoha g ha‑chechgig hegam mo d e‑oꞌogbad am i amjed mash eda am oimmed g Abrahambad ch am hugkam mash eda am oimmed g Davidbad. Kunt hab waꞌap gamai giꞌik an oꞌoha g ha‑chechgig hegam mo d e‑oꞌogbad heg i amjed ch gam hu hugkam matsh eda gam hu hab i e juh g t‑shohshon Babylon wui. Kunt gamai giꞌik an oꞌoha g ha‑chechgig hegam mo d e‑oꞌogbad heg i amjed ch gam hu hugkam matsh ab mahsi hegai mo hab e aꞌaga Jiosh si Kehsha (Christ).

column2: This is how the birth of Jesus the Messiah happened. His mother, Mary, was engaged to Joseph, but before they slept together she became pregnant by the Holy Spirit.
column3: Ia ant wo oꞌoha matsh has e juh matsh eda mahsi g Jesus Christ. Am amtsh i apꞌech matsh idam Joseph ch Mary wo e hohont. Tsh am hahawa s‑e mai mat g ali wo bei.

column2: Joseph, her fiancé, was a good man and didn't want to shame her publicly, so he decided to break the engagement discreetly.
column3: K hab chuꞌig g chehanig mat chum pi wo ha bei g cheoj matp hab wo wa e juh. Kush g Joseph am wabsh si s‑ap oid g chehanig ch hekaj hab e elid mat pi wo be k wabshaba pi hedai wo ha ahgi. T hab pi wo si e el g Mary.

column2: While he was thinking about all of this, an angel of the Lord appeared to him in a dream and told him, “Joseph, son of David, don't be afraid to marry Mary because she is pregnant by the Holy Spirit.
column3: Sh am oidahim ihda g Joseph. Kutsh am haha wabsh ab wui i e chehgi g anghil am chehchkij ed k hab kaij, “Joseph map ab d Davidbad amjedkam, am g wabsh s‑ap e tahtk k wo bei g Mary mat d wo m‑wehm kihkamk. Hekia S‑apꞌekam Gewkdag at hab juh ihda ali mat g Mary wo bei.

column2: She will give birth to a son and you shall call him Jesus, for he will save people from their sins.”
column3: Kut d wo cheojk. Kupt hab wo chehch Jesus mo hab d ahga ha‑Doꞌibiakam. Bat wo chehgigk nat pi wo ha doꞌibia g e‑hemajkamga ab ha‑chuꞌijig amjed.” Neh, bash kaij g anghil am Joseph wui.

column2: Now this all happened to fulfill what the Lord said through the prophet:
column3: Wehs atsh wa hab e juh ihda hab masma mash wa hab masma heki hu hab kaij g Jiosh. Kelibad Jiosh haꞌichu i tashogiddam atki an oꞌoha mash wa hab kaij:

column2: Joseph woke up and did what the angel of the Lord told him to do.
column3: Kutsh hekid am i nea g Joseph k atsh am ha hekaj hab e juh mash has i kaij g anghil ab wui matsh an bei g Mary.

column2: Joseph married Mary, but did not sleep with her until after she had given birth to a son, whom he named Jesus.
column3: Sh wabshaba pi am hu hab masma e wehm kih mo g e wehm kihkam am hugkam mat hekid ip bei g ali. Tsh g Joseph hab hahawa chehch Jesus.

column2: After Jesus was born in Bethlehem in Judea during the reign of King Herod, wise men came from the east to Jerusalem.
column3: Jesus atsh am mahsi Bethlehem kihhim t am am Judea chekshani ch ed. Sh wenog am hema d kownal Judea ch ed ch hab chehgig Herod. Tsh ab haꞌi hihi siꞌal tahgio amjed mash s‑chu aꞌamichud ab huhuꞌu t ab. K eda g Jerusalem d kownal daikud am t‑jewedga ed. Tsh am dada idam k am ha kakke g hahaꞌichu ch hab kaij,

column2: “Where is the King of the Jews who has been born?” they asked. “We saw his star in the east and we've come to worship him.”
column3: “Bahꞌo haꞌichug hegai ali matki hemu mahsi matsh d wo ge ha‑kownaligk g Tutuligo. Am at dahiwua g huꞌu matt heg amjed s‑mai g mahsidaj. Kutt heg hekaj ab i hihi matt am hab wo juh g si has t‑elida ab wui.”

column2: When King Herod heard about it, he was very disturbed, and the whole of Jerusalem with him.
column3: Kutsh si e kudu g kownal am i kahk. Tsh heg hekaj wehs g kihkam amai hab waꞌap e kudu.

column2: Herod summoned all the chief priests and religious teachers of the people, and asked them where the Messiah was supposed to be born.
column3: Tsh g kownal am ha hekaj i ha hemapai g uꞌugchu papal ch chehanig t‑mashchamdam k ab ha kakke, “Bahtsh ab haꞌab wo mahsi hegai matsh g Jiosh d wo Kehshak mat d wo chum em‑kownaligk?”

column2: “Bethlehem in Judea,” they told him, “for that's what the prophet wrote:
column3: Sh hab ahg, “Ab Bethlehem t ab id eda chekshani. Batki masma an hema oꞌoha g kelibad Jiosh haꞌichu i tashogiddam mo g Jiosh hab kaij:

column2: Then Herod called the wise men and met with them in private and found out from them exactly when the star appeared.
column3: Tsh g Herod am s‑aꞌagim i ha wai hegam s‑chu aꞌamichuddam k ab ha amjed s‑mai matsh hekid ab i e mahsid hegai huꞌu. Tsh am ahgi.

column2: He sent them to Bethlehem, telling them, “When you get there, search for the child. Once you find him let me know so that I can come and worship him too.”
column3: Tsh g Herod am hahawa ha ahgi mat gam hu wo hihi Bethlehem wui hab ha ahgch, “Am g wo hihim k am wo si i gah hegai ali k hekid wo sha chehg k ia wo ni‑ahgi. Kunt ahni am hab waꞌap wo him k ab wo ihm mani ab has elid.”

column2: After they had heard what the king had to say they went on their way, and the star which they had seen in the east led them until it stopped right above the place where the child was.  When they saw the star they couldn't contain their happiness!
column3: Kutsh gam hu hahawa hihim k gam hu hebai i hihim. Tsh ab ep i e mahsid hegai huꞌu mash am wa heki hu neid. Kush si s‑hehegig am i neidok. Tsh heg am ha baꞌich him k am dahiwua heg dahm mash am dadha hegam Joseph.

column2: They went into the house and saw the child with Mary his mother. They bowed and worshiped him. Then they opened their bags of treasure and presented him with gifts of gold, frankincense, and myrrh.
column3: Tsh am dada k am i wahp kih ch ed. Sh am woꞌo hegai ali. Kush g jeꞌej am wehmaj. Tsh idam s‑chu aꞌamichuddam am wui i shul g ali k am hab juh g ab si has e‑elida k am hahawa i ha wuwhas g s‑namkig haꞌichu k ab mah. Sh id d ohla ch hegai s‑ap uhwchu mo hekaj e iagchulid ch hegai mo hekaj e huhud g muhki.

column2: Warned by a dream not to return to Herod, they left for their own country by a different route.
column3: Sh g Jiosh am ha ahgid am ha‑chehchki ed matsh pi am hu ep wo hihi Herod wui. Kutsh heg hekaj im hu wabsh hihi e‑jewedga wui am hema wohg ch ed.

column2: After they'd left, an angel of the Lord appeared to Joseph in a dream, and told him, “Get up, and take the child and his mother, and flee to Egypt. Remain there until I tell you, because Herod is going to search for the child to kill him.”
column3: Tsh ab hahawa i e chehgi g anghil Joseph wui am chehchkij ed k ash hab kaij, “Kownal Herod at am wo i gahghi ihda ali mat wo chum s‑muꞌam. Mt heg hekaj gam hu wo hihi Egypt jewed wui k am wo haꞌichugkad. Kunt am wo em‑ahgi mamt hekid ep wo i hihi.”

column2: So Joseph got up and took the boy and his mother, and left during the night for Egypt.
column3: Kutsh am ha hekaj i wami g Joseph k am bei g ali ch jeꞌej k heg waꞌi s‑chuhugam hihi am Egypt wui

column2: They stayed there until Herod's death. This fulfilled what the Lord said through the prophet, “I called my son out of Egypt.”
column3: k am wa dadha. Id atki am hab e juh mat hekaj s‑ap hab wo e juh hegai matki heki hu waꞌi oꞌoha g kelibad Jiosh haꞌichu i tashogiddam. Bo chuꞌig g oꞌohanaj mash g Jiosh hab kaij:

column2: When Herod realized he'd been fooled by the wise men, he got very angry. He sent men to kill all the young boys in Bethlehem and the regions nearby who were two years old and under. This was based on the time frame he'd discovered from the wise men.
column3: Pegih, tsh pi am hu ep i hihi Herod wui hegam s‑chu aꞌamichuddam mash wa am ha ahgid g Jiosh. Tsh heg hekaj bagat g Herod. Sh eda idam heki hu ahgid mo am hu d i gohk aꞌahidag mat wa am cheh hegai huꞌu. Kutsh heg hekaj ha cheha g e‑shondalig matsh wehs wo ha kokda g aꞌal wihpiop mash d gohk ahidkam ch am i wecho amai Bethlehem ch ed ch an i wehgaj.

column2: In this way Jeremiah's prophecy was fulfilled:
column3: Neh, id atsh wa hab e juh hab masma mash wa g Jiosh heki hu waꞌi hab kaij matsh hab masma hab wo e juh. Hegai kelibad Jiosh haꞌichu i tashogiddam mash hab chehgig Jeremiah atki an oꞌoha mash hab kaij g Jiosh:

column2: After Herod died the angel of the Lord appeared in a dream to Joseph in Egypt, and told him,
column3: Sh am dadha hegam Joseph g ali wehm Egypt jewed ch ed. Sh am hu hebai, tsh g Herod muh.

column2: “Get up! Take the child and his mother, and return to the land of Israel, because those who were trying to kill the child are dead.”
column3: “Muh at hegai mat chum s‑muꞌam g ali. Mt heg hekaj wo wahpamig k wo uhpam hihi am e‑jewedga wui.”

column2: So Joseph got up and took the boy and his mother, and returned to the land of Israel.
column3: Kutsh am i wami g Joseph k am ha ui g ali ch jeꞌej k ep hihi am e‑jewedga wui.

column2: But Joseph was afraid to go there after he learned that Archelaus had succeeded his father Herod as king of Judea. Warned in a dream, Joseph went to the Galilee area,
column3: K wabshaba g Herodbad alidag wenog am d kownal Judea ch ed ch hab chehgig Arkelaus. Tsh g Joseph am i s‑mai mo id d kownal k atsh sha s‑ehbeni mas am wo i dahiwua amai. Tsh g Jiosh am ep ahgi chehchkij ed matsh pi am hu ep wo hihi Judea wui. Tsh hekaj imhab haꞌab ep hihi Galilee chekshani wui

column2: and settled down in Nazareth. This fulfilled what the prophets had said, “He will be called a Nazarene.”
column3: k am dadhaiwua Nazareth kihhim ch ed. Heki atki hu hema oꞌoha g kelibad Jiosh haꞌichu i tashogiddam mamt hab wo aꞌagad ihda “Nazareth t am oꞌodham.”

column2: Some time later John the Baptist appeared on the scene, proclaiming in the Judean desert,
column3: Tsh am hahawa jegko i wuhsh Judea chekshani ch ed ihda mash d John ch ha pahl wapkon g hemajkam.

column2: “Repent, for the kingdom of heaven is near.”
column3: John jehnigida ash hab chuꞌig, “Gam g hu wo s‑ohhod g pi ap e‑chegitoi. E o aihim mat in wo i wuhsh g Jiosh kownaltalig.”

column2: He was the one Isaiah spoke about when he said, “A voice is heard crying out in the desert, ‘Prepare the way of the Lord. Make the paths straight for him.’ ”
column3: Neh, id o hab ahg John hegai kelibad Jiosh haꞌichu i tashogiddam mash hab chehgig Isaiah mash eda hab kaij:

column2: John had clothes made of camel hair, with a leather belt around his waist. His food was locusts and wild honey.
column3: Sh ab e enigadadch g John g ka‑mihyo wopo ikuskaj ch ge hogi giwud ch heg waꞌi hekaj e gegosid kohktpul ch sitꞌol.

column2: People came to him from Jerusalem, all of Judea, and the entire Jordan region,
column3: Kutsh ab wui i hihi g hemajkam miajed ch an i aꞌai wehskojed g Judea chekshani, chum hems ab Jerusalem t amjed.

column2: and were baptized in the Jordan River, publicly admitting their sins.
column3: Muꞌi ash am ahg g pi ap e‑chuꞌijig am i kahkch g John. Kush heg am ha pahl wapkon Jordan akimel ch ed.

column2: But when John saw many of the Pharisees and Sadducees coming to be baptized, he said to them, “You vipers' brood! Who warned you to run away from the coming judgment?  Show by what you do that you have truly repented, and don't presume to say proudly to yourselves, ‘Abraham is our father.’ I tell you that God could make children of Abraham from these stones.
column3: Haꞌi atsh am dada hegam mo d Palasi ch hegam mo d Sajusi matsh wo nei ihda pahl wakona. Sh hab ha ahg g John, “Hah, ahpim mam pi ap chegitoidag, bamki e elid mamt wo e doꞌibia ab amjed g s‑koꞌok e‑namkidadag heg wabsh hekaj mam ab d Abrahambad amjedkam. Nt wabshaba wo em‑ahgi mamt pi woho wo e doꞌibia, heg hi wa mamt am wo e chehgi am hab junihidch g s‑apꞌekam mamt gam hu s‑ohhod g pi ap e‑chegitoi. Wehs hegam mat gam hu wo s‑ohhod g pi ap e‑chegitoi at d wo Jiosh hemajkamgak ch hekaj hab masma wo e kuint mo d Abrahambad amjedkam, chum wa g nahnko mahs hemajkam.

column2: In fact the ax is ready to chop down the trees. Every tree that doesn't produce good fruit will be chopped down and thrown into the fire.
column3: Kumt ahpim gam hu wo s‑e ohhod hab masma mat g pi kehg bahidkam uꞌus mamtp pi gam hu wo s‑ohhod g pi ap e‑chegitoi k pi am hu hab wo junihid g s‑apꞌekam.”

column2: Yes, I baptize you in water to show repentance, but after me is coming one who is greater than I am. I'm not worthy even to remove his sandals. He will baptize you with the Holy Spirit and with fire.
column3: Kush hab ep kaij g John, “Pi g hab wo ni‑elid manis ahni d si haꞌichu. Ab at hema wo i wuhsh ni‑oidk k d wo si haꞌichuk. Ahni ani hi wa em‑pahl wapkon mamt eda gam hu wo s‑ohhod g pi ap e‑chegitoi. T wabshaba heg ab wo em‑mah g Hekia S‑apꞌekam Gewkdag k gam hu hab wo i juh g pi em‑apꞌekam hab sha masma mat g mehi wo mehi g shaꞌi.

column2: He has his winnowing tool ready in his hand. He will clean up the threshing floor and gather the wheat into the storehouse, but he will burn the chaff with fire that can't be put out.”
column3: Nam hig pi nehnichud g pilkan mamt g mohgaj gam hu wo i gawulkad k wo mehid k g pilkani ged hu wo i baꞌiha. Pegih, t hab waꞌap am aꞌai wo i ha gawulkai g hemajkam am lodaita ch ed ihda mani em‑ahgid k wo ha doꞌibia g s‑apꞌekam k g pi apꞌekam s‑koꞌokam wo ha namkid. T g ha‑namkidadag pi hekid wo huhug.” Neh, bash kaij g John.

column2: Then Jesus came from Galilee to the Jordan River to be baptized by John.
column3: Jesus atsh ab hahawa i hih Galilee chekshani t amjed mo hebai d i kihkam k ab jiwia Jordan akimel t ab matsh wo e pahl wako.

column2: But John tried to change his mind. He told Jesus, “I need to be baptized by you, and you come to me to baptize you?”
column3: Sh g John chum pi pahl wakonamk hab kaijch, “Nis haschu ahgk wo m‑pahl wako nap pi d hekia s‑apꞌekam? Ahpi apt wo chum ni‑pahl wako.”

column2: “Please do so, because it's good for us to do what God says is right,” Jesus told him. So John agreed to do it.
column3: Sh hab kaij g Jesus ab wui, “Bapt wo ni‑juh no pi g Jiosh hab d elida.”

column2: Right after he was baptized, Jesus came out of the water. The heavens were opened, and he saw God's Spirit like a dove descending, landing on him.
column3: Tsh am haha wabsh i chum wuhsh g Jesus shuhdagi t amjed. Tsh g dahm kahchim gam i e kuhpiꞌo. Tsh ab i hud g Hekia S‑apꞌekam Gewkdag ab ab g Jesus hab sha masma mat g hohhi.

column2: A voice from heaven said, “This is my son whom I love, who pleases me.”
column3: Sh ab neok g Jiosh ab dahm kahchim t amjed ch hab kaij, “Id o d si ni‑tatchuidch ni‑alidag ch am si ni‑tatchui oidch hab masma.”

column2: Then Jesus was led by the Spirit into the desert to be tempted by the devil.
column3: Sh g Hekia S‑apꞌekam Gewkdag hab hahawa ahg g Jesus mat gam hu hejelko wo hih mo am d tohono jewed matsh wo e aꞌappe. Tsh heg hekaj gam hu hih g Jesus

column2: After fasting forty days and nights, he was hungry.
column3: k am haꞌichugkahim giꞌikko wehst‑mahm tash ab pi haꞌichu koꞌadch nash pi e hoꞌigeꞌidahun ab Jiosh wui.

column2: The tempter came and said to him, “If you really are the Son of God, order these stones to turn into bread.”
column3: Kutsh ab wui jiwia g jijawul ha‑geꞌejig am chum s‑wuimk pi apꞌekam ch ed k hab kaij, “Bap chum e elid map d Jiosh alidag. Pegih, ab g hig chehani idam hohodai mat wo e pahnch naptki pi bihugim.”

column2: Jesus answered, “As Scripture says, ‘Human beings do not live by only eating bread, but by every word that comes from the mouth of God.’ ”
column3: Kush hab kaij g Jesus, “Pi ant hab wo juh. An o hab chuꞌig Jiosh oꞌohana ed:

column2: Then the devil took him to the holy city and placed him on the top of the Temple.
column3: Kutsh g ge Jiawul am hahawa wuhpuij tahgio i mahsid g geꞌe cheopi. Heg o am kehk amai mo hab e aꞌaga Si Hekia S‑apꞌekam Kihhim ch d Jerusalem.

column2: “If you really are the son of God, then throw yourself off,” he told Jesus. “As Scripture says, ‘He will order his angels to save you from harm. They will catch you so that you won't fall by tripping over a stone.’ ”
column3: Kush hab ahg, “Maptp woho d wo Jiosh alidagk, pegih, am g i dahꞌi amjed mo gan hu si uhgk kihtas. No hig pi hab chuꞌig an Jiosh oꞌohana ed:

column2: Jesus answered, “As Scripture also says, ‘You shall not tempt the Lord your God.’ ”
column3: Sh hab kaij g Jesus ab wui, “Pi ant wo pipꞌich g Jiosh. An o hab chuꞌig oꞌohanaj ed:

column2: Then the devil took Jesus to a very high mountain and showed him all the kingdoms of the world in all their glory.
column3: Kutsh am hahawa wuhpuij tahgio wehs i mahsid g kokownaltalig ch kaistalig jewed dahm

column2: He said to Jesus, “I will give you all these if you fall down on your knees and worship me.”
column3: k ab wui hab kaij, “Wehs ant am wo m‑mah ihda maptp ab ni‑wui wo i gehsh k ab wo ni‑ihmad.”

column2: “Go away, Satan!” said Jesus. “As Scripture says, ‘You shall worship the Lord your God and serve him, and him alone.’ ”
column3: Kush hab kaij g Jesus, “Gam g hu hihm, ahpi ge Jiawul. An o hab chuꞌig Jiosh oꞌohana ed:

column2: Then the devil left him, and angels came to look after him.
column3: Kutsh wa woho gam hu hih g ge Jiawul. Tsh g anghil ab wui hihi g Jesus k am i wehmt.

column2: When Jesus heard that John had been arrested, he returned to Galilee.
column3: Am hu hebai amtsh am kuh hegai John mo am wa ha pahl wapkon. Kutsh am i kah g Jesus mamtsh kuh k atsh gam hu hahawa hih Galilee chekshani wui

column2: Leaving Nazareth, he came to stay in Capernaum, on the shores of the sea in the regions of Zebulun and Naphthali.
column3: k am jiwia Nazareth t ab. K am hema ep d kihhim mo d Capernaum ch an hugidaj an g Galilee kahchki. Kutsh am i dahiwua g Jesus.

column2: This fulfilled what Isaiah the prophet said,
column3: Neh, heki atki hu waꞌi oꞌoha g Isaiabad matsh id am hab wo e juh. K hegai oꞌohanaj hab chuꞌig:

column2: From that time on Jesus began declaring his message, saying, “Repent, for the kingdom of heaven is near.”
column3: Kutsh wa woho am i wuhsh g Jesus k am i ahgahi g haꞌichu e‑ahga hab kaijch, “Gam g hu wo s‑ohhod g pi ap e‑chegitoi. E o aihim mat in wo i wuhsh g Jiosh kownaltalig.”

column2: As he was walking by the sea of Galilee Jesus saw two brothers. Simon, also called Peter, and his brother Andrew, were casting a net in the sea. They made their living by catching fish.
column3: Sh an him g Jesus Galilee kahchki hugid an. Kush am haꞌi oiopo g waptopi ha uꞌudam ch am wuhpa g chuagia shuhdagi ch ed ch hekaj am ha uꞌu g waptopi. Hema ash d Simon ch hab hahawa e chechcheg Peter. Kush hema d wehngaj ch hab chehgig Andrew.

column2: “Come and follow me, and I will teach you how to catch people,” he told them.
column3: k hab ha ahg, “Ab g wo i ni‑oid k wo ni‑wehmajkad. Kunt ahni wo em‑mashcha mamt g hemajkam wo i ha wanchkwua am s‑apꞌekam wui.”

column2: They left their nets immediately and followed him.
column3: Kutsh am ha hekaj wabsh i dagito g e‑chikpan k am i oi.

column2: Continuing on he saw two other brothers, James and John. They were in a boat with their father Zebedee, mending their nets. He called them to follow him.
column3: Tsh am shaꞌi hihi haꞌas huꞌi. Tsh g Jesus am i ha nei idam James ch John. Idam o hab waꞌap d e‑wepngam ch ash am chikpan g e‑ohg wehm wahlko ch ed ch am apꞌechud g e‑chuagia. Tsh g Jesus ab ha wai mat am wo wehmajk.

column2: They left the boat and their father immediately, and followed him.
column3: Kutsh am ha hekaj wabsh i dagito g e‑ohg ch e‑chikpan k am i oi g Jesus.

column2: Jesus traveled throughout Galilee, teaching in the synagogues, telling the good news of the kingdom, and healing all the diseases and illnesses the people had.
column3: Kush idam am hahawa hahasko oiopo Galilee chekshani ch ed. Kush g Jesus am ha mashcham g hemajkam ha‑chechopi ed ch am ha ahgidahim g s‑kehg haꞌichu ahgaj g Jiosh ab amjed g kownaltaligaj ch am ep ha dodajid g nahnko mahs kokꞌodam.

column2: News about him spread throughout the province of Syria. They brought everyone who was sick to him: people troubled by seizures, the demon-possessed, those who were mentally ill, people who were paralyzed, and he healed all of them.
column3: Tsh an wehsko i kaida g haꞌichu ahga ab amjed am Syria jewed ch ed mo heg eda g Galilee d chekshani. Tsh g hemajkam heg hekaj wehs ab ha uꞌapa wui hegam mo nahnko masma kokꞌo ch hegam mo haꞌichukaj e kudut ch hegam mo g jijawul an uꞌukch g ha‑chegitoidag ch hegam mo s‑ha chuhugchud ch hegam mo pi himdag. Tsh g Jesus wehs ha dodaj.

column2: Large crowds followed him from Galilee, Decapolis, Jerusalem, Judea, and the region beyond Jordan.
column3: Kutsh g hemajkam wehskojed i hihim k am oid g Jesus. Idam ash haꞌi d Galilee t am oꞌodham ch haꞌi ab amjed mo hab e aꞌaga Wehst‑mahm Kihhim ch haꞌi ab Jerusalem t amjed ch an wehskojed g Judea chekshani k ch haꞌi ga hu aigojed g Jordan akimel.

column2: When Jesus saw the crowds following him he went up a mountain. There he sat down together with his disciples.
column3: Tsh am i ha nei g Jesus idam muꞌi hemajkam k ab i chesh kawulk t ab mat ab ha wui wo neo. Kutsh an wehgaj i e hemapai hegam mash ab si wecho e mashcham.

column2: He began teaching them, saying:
column3: Tsh g Jesus am i ha mashcha.

column2: You are the salt of the earth, but if the salt becomes tasteless, how can you make it salty again? It's good for nothing, so it's thrown out and trodden down.
column3: “Neh, s‑mahch am mat pi wo e padch g chuhkug mamtp wo si onmad. Pegih, mt hab wa masma haꞌichu wehhejed wo s‑kehgajk am ha shahgid hegam mo pi mahch g Jiosh. Jiosh at gam hu hab wo i em‑juh mamtp pi haꞌichu wehhejed wo s‑kehgajk hab masma mamt hab wo juh g on matp wo kahko.

column2: You are the light of the world. A city built on a hill can't be hidden.
column3: “Ahpim mam ab si ni‑hiwig amt wehs wo ha tonolidad g hemajkam. Heg o wa wepo mam d tonlig am ha wehhejed. Pi g am wo ehstokch hegai mamt haschu hab wo junidad g Jiosh. Neh, no hig pi woho mat pi ap wo e ehsto g kihhim matp am wo dahmkad g tohnk.

column2: No one lights a lamp and then puts it under a bucket. No, it's placed on a lamp-stand and it provides light to everyone in the house.
column3: T g lahmpa hab waꞌap pi wo e ehsto haꞌichu wecho. Mt an wo dai mat hebai wo em‑tonolidad.

column2: In the same way you should let your light shine before everyone so they can see the good things you do and praise your heavenly Father.
column3: Pegih, mt ahpim pi wo ehsto g s‑em‑apꞌekam k wabsh wo ha hiwgidad g hemajkam mat wo nei. Kut hekaj ab wo si has elidad g em‑ohg Jiosh.

column2: Don't think I came to abolish the law or the writings of the prophets. I didn't come to abolish them, but to fulfill them.
column3: “Pi ant hab ahgk ia jiwia jewed dahm manis gam hu hab wabsh wo i juh hegai chehanig ch mashchamadag matsh wa g kekelibad Jiosh haꞌichu i tashogiddam ab bei Jiosh t amjed. Heg eda o an oꞌohanas mant has wo masmak ch has wo ni‑juh k wo nahto g ni‑chikpan.

column2: I assure you, until heaven and earth come to an end, not a single letter, not a single dot of the law will come to an end before everything is fulfilled.
column3: Nt wo si shel em‑ahgi mat pi hekid gam hu hab wo i e juh g Jiosh chehanig. Wehs at s‑ap wo e nahto hegai mo an oꞌohanas mat koi wo huhug g dahm kahchim ch jewed kahchim, chum hems g si al chuꞌuchum haꞌichu.

column2: So whoever disregards the least important commandment, and teaches people to do so, will be called the least in the kingdom of heaven; but whoever practices and teaches the commandments will be called great in the kingdom of heaven.
column3: Kut d wabsh wo pi haꞌichuk am Jiosh nena ed hegai mat hedai pi am hu wo wohog elidad g Jiosh chehanig ch wo ha mashcha haꞌijj ehp mat hab waꞌap pi ab hu wo wohog elidad. Kut heg d wo si haꞌichuk am Jiosh nena ed mat hedai ab wo wohog elidad g Jiosh chehanig ch wo ha mashcha haꞌijj ehp mat ab wo wohog elidad.

column2: I tell you, unless your righteousness is more than that of the religious teachers and the Pharisees, you can never enter the kingdom of heaven.
column3: Bo e elid g chehanig em‑mashchamdam ch Palasi mo s‑ap oid g Jiosh chehanig. Nt wabshaba wo em‑ahgi mamt hemho wa ha baꞌich i s‑ap wo oidad mamtp am s‑wahpkim Jiosh kihdag ed.

column2: You've heard that the law said  to the people of long ago: ‘You shall not murder, and anyone who commits murder will be condemned as guilty.’
column3: “S‑mahch am mo hab chuꞌig g heki hu chehanig mamt pi wo ha mua g hemajkam. Kut hemho wa wo e lodai matp hedai wo sha ha mua.

column2: But I tell you, anyone who is angry with his brother will be condemned as guilty. Whoever calls his brother an idiot has to answer to the council,  but whoever insults people is liable to the fire of judgment.
column3: Kunt ahni am baꞌich hab wo i ah mamt am wa hugkam ab wo moht g chuꞌijig mo g ha muꞌakam mamt chum hems wabsh wo bagat ab hema i wui k hab wo ah mo d wabsh pad haꞌichu. Ab o em‑wui him mat g Jiosh wo em‑lodai heg hekaj k gam hu wo i em‑wua Jiawul kih ed.

column2: If you're at the altar making an offering, and remember that your brother has something against you,
column3: “Am g wo haꞌasa e hoꞌigeꞌidahun mamtp wo s‑chegito mamt hema i pi ap dohdda. Pi at ab hu wo em‑kaiha g Jiosh.

column2: leave your offering on the altar and go and make peace with him first, and afterwards come back and make your offering.
column3: Wehpeg amt am wo i e apꞌech heg wui mamt pi ap dohdda k am haha wo e‑hoꞌigeꞌidahu.

column2: While you're on the way to court with your opponent, make sure you settle things quickly. Otherwise your opponent might hand you over to the judge, and the judge will hand you over to the court official, and you will be thrown into jail.  I tell you the truth: you won't get out of there until you've paid every last penny.
column3: Mtp hems wo em‑lodai mamtp pi am hu s‑hohtam wo i e apꞌech. Kumt wo e kuhpach am hugkam mamt wehs wo namkid wehhejed mamt has i juh. Baꞌich at wo i s‑apꞌek mamt wehpeg hejel am wo i e apꞌech aꞌai e wui.

column2: You've heard that the law said, ‘Do not commit adultery.’
column3: “S‑mahch am mo hab chuꞌig g heki hu chehanig mamt pi wo ha ehs g ha‑wehm kihkam.

column2: But I tell you that everyone who looks lustfully at a woman has already committed adultery with her in his heart.
column3: Kunt ahni am baꞌich hab wo i ah mo heg wa wepo mamt ha ehs mamtp am wabsh wehmaj wo s‑woꞌiwuim hegai mo pi d em‑wehm kihkam.

column2: If your right eye leads you to sin, then tear it out and throw it away, because it's better to lose one part of your body than to have your whole body thrown into the fire of judgment.
column3: Kut d wo em‑wuikamk mamt gam hu wo i e wua Jiawul kih ed. Baꞌich at wo i s‑apꞌek mamt chum hems wo heb hu wua g e‑nendag.

column2: If your right hand leads you to sin, then cut it off and throw it away, for it's better for you to lose one of your limbs than for your whole body to go into the fire of judgment.
column3: Do em‑wuikam mamt am hu wo i e wua Jiawul kih ed chum ams haschu pi apꞌekam hab wo juh. K baꞌich i s‑apꞌe mamt chum hems wo heb hu wua g e‑nowi.

column2: The law also said, ‘If a man divorces his wife, he should give her a certificate of divorce.’
column3: “S‑mahch am mo hab chuꞌig g heki hu chehanig mamt hemho wa am wo i wuhshad g ohhoda tapial e‑hohnig wehhejed mamtp wo s‑ohhod.

column2: But I tell you that any man who divorces his wife except for sexual immorality causes her to commit adultery, and whoever marries a divorced woman commits adultery.
column3: Nt wabshaba am wo em‑ahgi mat d wo pi apꞌekamk mamt wo s‑ohhod, heg hi wa mamt wo s‑mai am i chum hohntk mat heki hu ha wehm woꞌiwua. Kut d wo pi apꞌekamk mat g em‑ohhoda hema ep wo kunt. Id at d wo em‑chuꞌijigk mamtp wo s‑ohhod. Kut hegai mat wo hohnt hab waꞌap wo juh g pi apꞌekam.

column2: And again, you've heard that the law said to the people of long ago, ‘You shall not perjure yourself. Instead make sure you keep the oaths you swear to the Lord.’
column3: “S‑mahch am mo hab chuꞌig g heki hu chehanig mamt pi wo ha iattogidad ch hemho am hab wo wa juh mam haschu ha ahgid ch chehcheg g Jiosh.

column2: But I tell you, don't swear at all. Don't swear by heaven, because it's the throne of God.
column3: Nt wabshaba am wo em‑ahgi mamt hemho am hab wo wa juh g e‑neꞌoki. Pi o apꞌe mams wabsh chum haschu wehhejed wo gewkaj g e‑neꞌoki. Neh, am am wabsh pehegia gewkaj g e‑neꞌoki am chehchegch g dahm kahchim. K eda g dahm kahchim d Jiosh kihdag. K hab wa masma mamtp hems g Jiosh am chehch.

column2: Don't swear by the earth, because it's God's footstool. Don't swear by Jerusalem, because it's the city of the great King.
column3: Kum am ep chehcheg g jewed. K eda heg d Jiosh nahtoi ch heg wa wepo mo d keishpakudaj. Kum am ep chehcheg g Jerusalem. K eda heg d kihhimaj g Jiosh.

column2: Don't even swear by your head, because you're not able to make a single hair white or black.
column3: E‑moꞌo am hab waꞌap aꞌaga hab kaijch mamt wo moht g chuꞌijig mamtp pi hab wo juh g e‑neꞌoki. T eda g Jiosh wo waꞌi e nako mat wo em‑mohtoꞌi g chuꞌijig. Id o wehs hab masma mamtp hems am chehch g Jiosh.

column2: Simply say yes or no—more than this comes from the Evil One.
column3: Neh, bamt wo chum juh g e‑neꞌoki, chum ams pi wo gewkaj am chehchegch g Jiosh. T d wabsh wo ge Jiawul amjedkamk mamtp wo ha iattogi.

column2: You've heard that the law said, ‘An eye for an eye, and a tooth for a tooth.’
column3: “S‑mahch am mo hab chuꞌig g heki hu chehanig mamt wo ha lodai mat hedai s‑koꞌokam has em‑juh. T ab wui hab epai wo e juh mat has i em‑juh.

column2: But I tell you, don't resist someone who is evil. If someone slaps you on the right cheek, turn the other cheek to them as well.
column3: Nt wabshaba am wo em‑ahgi mamt pi wo shaꞌi e agwuim. Tp hems hema ab wo em‑shonihi em‑kahm ab. Pegih, mt wabsh wo hiwigi mat ab ep wo em‑shonihi.

column2: If someone wants to sue you in court and takes your shirt, give them your coat too.
column3: Kumt baꞌich haꞌichu ab wo mah hegai matp hedai wo em‑lodai haꞌichu s‑em‑wohppoꞌidamch.

column2: If someone demands that you go one mile, go with them two .
column3: Kumt gam hu wo si baꞌiwich mam haschu chikpan em‑mohtoꞌid wabsh s‑ap e tahtkch.

column2: Give to those who ask you, and don't turn away those who want to borrow from you.
column3: Pi g wo shaꞌi daꞌid matp haschu i tatchua g shoꞌigkam.

column2: You've heard that the law said, ‘Love your neighbor and hate your enemy.’
column3: “S‑mahch am mo e ahgachug mamt ab wo si ha tatchuad g e‑naipijju ch wo s‑ha kehꞌidad g e‑obga.

column2: But I tell you, love your enemies and pray for those who persecute you,  so you may become children of your heavenly Father. For his sun shines on both the good and the bad; and he makes the rain fall on both those who do right and those who do wrong.  For if you only love those who love you, what reward do you have? Don't even the tax-collectors do that?  If you only speak kindly to your family, what more are you doing than anyone else? Even the heathen  do that!
column3: Nt wabshaba am wo em‑ahgi mamt pi hegam waꞌi ab wo si ha tatchuad e‑naipijju. Chum o hems g pi ap hemajkam ab si ha tatchua g e‑naipijju ch wabshaba pi heg hekaj wo e doꞌibia. Neh, ahpim amt chum hems g e‑obga wo si ha tatchuad ch am ha wehhejed wo e hoꞌigeꞌidahunad Jiosh wui. Jiosh o chum hems g pi ap hemajkam ab si ha tatchua ch ab ha mahk g tash tonlig ch juhki. Kumt ahpim hab wo chum masmak mo g Jiosh nam pi d aꞌaligaj.

column2: Grow up and become completely trustworthy, just as your heavenly Father is trustworthy.
column3: Em‑ohg Jiosh o d si hekia s‑apꞌekam. Pegih, mt ahpim hab waꞌap d wo si hekia s‑apꞌekamk.”

column2: Make sure not to do your good deeds in front of people, just so they can be seen. Otherwise you won't have any reward from your Father in heaven.
column3: Kush hab ep kaij g Jesus, “Am g wo s‑e nenꞌoidad mamt pi am hu hab wabsh wo wuad g haꞌichu s‑apꞌekam hab ahgk mat g hemajkam wo neidad mam haschu am hab junihim. Jiosh at pi ab hu wo em‑mah g s‑kehg mahkigdag mamtp hab masma wabsh wo s‑e chehgidam.

column2: When you give to the poor, don't be like the hypocrites who blow their own trumpets to announce what they're doing in the synagogues and in the streets so that people will praise them. I tell you the truth: they already have their reward.
column3: “Pi g wo s‑e chehgidamk mamt hekid wo i ha wehmt g shoꞌigkam. Hegam mo s‑e chehgidamk mo i ha wehmt o am hab wua em‑namki ed ch an kahya ch ed. K g hemajkam ab si has ha elid. Neh, id o d ha‑namkidadag. Nt wo si shel em‑ahgi mat g Jiosh pi ab hu has wo ha el.

column2: When you give to the poor, don't let your left hand know what your right hand's doing.
column3: Ahpim amt wabsh s‑aꞌagi wo i ha wehmtad g shoꞌigkam mat pi hedai wo s‑mahchk.

column2: That way what you give will be in secret, and your Father who sees what happens in secret will reward you.
column3: T g em‑ohg Jiosh wo em‑neid k ab wo si has em‑elidad.

column2: When you pray, don't be like the hypocrites, for they love to stand up and pray in the synagogues and on the street corners so that people can see them. I promise you, they already have their reward.
column3: “Pi g wo s‑e chehgidamk mamt hekid wo e hoꞌigeꞌidahu. Hegam mo s‑e chehgidamk at wo gegokiwua k wo e hoꞌigeꞌidahu am em‑namki ed ch an kahya ch ed. Kut wehsijj wo ha neid k ab wo si has ha elidad. Neh, id o d ha namkidadag. Nt wo si shel em‑ahgi mat g Jiosh pi ab hu has wo ha elidad.

column2: But you, when you pray, go indoors and close the door, and pray to your Father in private, and your Father who sees what happens in private will reward you.
column3: Ahpim amt am wo i wahp e‑kih ed k ab wo si i kuh g kihjeg k am wabsh hejelko wo e hoꞌigeꞌidahu Jiosh wui. Kut heg wo waꞌi em‑neidad ch ab wo has em‑elidad.

column2: When you pray, don't babble on meaninglessly like the foreigners do, who think they will be heard because of all the words they repeat.
column3: “Hegam mo pi mahch g Jiosh o am wabsh muꞌikko e dahm hab haꞌichu chechꞌe hab elidch mat hab waꞌi masma wo ha kah g Jiosh. Mt wabshaba ahpim pi hab masma hab wo e junihid.

column2: Don't be like them, for your Father knows what you need even before you ask him.
column3: Jiosh o d em‑ohg ch heki hu s‑mahch mam haschu i tatchua mam wa chum koi ab hu tahni haꞌichu.

column2: So pray like this:
column3: Bamt masma am wo e hoꞌigeꞌidahunad:

column2: For if you forgive those who sin against you, your heavenly Father will also forgive you.
column3: Neh, bamt masma am wo e hoꞌigeꞌidahunad Jiosh wui wabsh pi chegitok g pi ap ha‑chuꞌijig. T g Jiosh gam hu hab wo i juh g pi ap em‑chuꞌijig.

column2: But if you don't forgive those who sin against you, then your heavenly Father won't forgive your sins.
column3: T wabshaba g em‑chuꞌijig pi gam hab wo i e juh mamtp pi wo pi chegito g ha‑chuꞌijig.

column2: When you fast, don't be like the hypocrites who put on sad faces and make themselves look terrible so that everyone can see they're fasting. I tell you the truth, they already have their reward.
column3: “Pi g wo s‑e chehgidamk mam pi ap e tahtk mamt hekid heꞌekkio pi wo e gegos e hoꞌigeꞌidahunch. Hegam mat wo s‑e chehgidam at wo nei g e‑namkidadag mat g hemajkam ab wo si has ha el. Nt wabshaba wo si shel em‑ahgi mat g Jiosh pi ab hu has wo ha el.

column2: Instead, when you fast, wash your face and look smart,
column3: Am g wo wakon g e‑wuhiosha k ab wo si i gaswua g e‑moꞌo.

column2: so that people won't see you're fasting, and your unseen Father who sees what happens in private will reward you.
column3: T hab pi wo mahchk g hemajkam ab i em‑neidk mam pi e gegosid. T heg wo waꞌi s‑mahchk em‑ohg Jiosh ch ab wo si has em‑elidad.

column2: Don't pile up wealth here on earth where moths and rust ruin it, and where thieves break in and steal it.
column3: “Pi g an hu wo e toꞌidahid g s‑kaisdag id dahm jewed. Tp hems wabsh wo padt o atp hems hema wo em‑ehs.

column2: Instead, you should store up your wealth in heaven, where moths and rust don't ruin it, and where thieves don't break in and steal it.
column3: Mt wabshaba wo hekaj g e‑kaisdag am Jiosh wehhejed. T heg wo wa wepok mam heg an e toꞌidahim Jiosh kihdag ed. T pi hekid wo padt. Kut pi hedai wo em‑ehs.

column2: For wherever you store your wealth, that's where your heart will be too.
column3: Kumt am wo s‑hihimim no pi g em‑tatchuidag am ulinig mo hebai haꞌichug mam haschu hab i elid mo d em‑kaisdag.

column2: The eye is like a lamp that lights the body. So if your eye is healthy,  then your whole body will have light.
column3: “Em‑wuhpui at s‑ap am wo i wahki g tonlig matp wo s‑mamsk

column2: But if your eye is evil, then your whole body will be in the dark. If the light in you is darkness, how dark is that!
column3: k wabshaba pi am hu wo i wahki matp pi wo mamsk. Kum heg hekaj s‑ap nuhkud. Pegih, wahm amt wo si s‑ap nuhkudad g haꞌichu e‑amichudadag mat heg s‑ap am wo i wahki g wohokam. Dat wo si geꞌe s‑chuhugamk em‑wehhejed matp pi wo apꞌek g em‑amichudadag.

column2: No one can serve two masters. Either you'll hate one and love the other, or you'll be devoted to one and despise the other. You can't serve both God and Money.
column3: “Pi at hedai wo e nako mas ha wepo hab masma ab wo ha neidad g gohk e‑aꞌamo. Hemho wa atp hems hema baꞌich wo i s‑wohog elidad. Em‑kaisdag o heg wa wepo mo d em‑ahmo mamtp heg hekaj baꞌich wo i pihk e elidad mam hi g Jiosh.

column2: That's why I'm telling you not to worry about your life. Don't worry about what to eat, or what to drink, or what clothes to put on. Isn't life more than food, and the body more than clothes?
column3: “Neh, nt heg hekaj hab wo em‑ah mamt pi wabsh wo i e kudutad heg hekaj mams haschukaj wo e gegos o mams haschukaj wo e enigadad. Jiosh at ab em‑mah g em‑doakag, pegih, k ab hab waꞌap wo em‑mah mamt haschukaj wo e dagioꞌidad.

column2: Look at the birds they don't sow or reap or store food in barns, for your heavenly Father feeds them. Aren't you worth more than they are?
column3: An g wo i ha neid hegam uꞌuwhig mo an nenꞌe. Idam o pi haꞌichu eꞌeshad ch pi od g haꞌichu esha ch pi gan hu e toꞌidahim g haꞌichu bahidag. K wabshaba g em‑ohg Jiosh ha nuhkud. Kum eda ahpim baꞌich d i si haꞌichu mo g uꞌuwhig.

column2: Who of you by worrying can add a minute to your life?
column3: Pi amt wo e nako mams am baꞌich wo i himch g e‑aꞌahidagga, chum ams hems wo si e kudutad am chegitokch.

column2: And why are you worried about clothes? Look at the beautiful flowers in the field. See how they grow: they don't work hard, they don't spin thread.
column3: “Pi g am wo si e kudutad ab amjed mams haschu ab wo enigat. An g wo i neidad g haꞌichu heosig m an wehsko chuhch. Heg o wa wepo mo si s‑kehg e enigadadch ch eda pi haꞌichu shaꞌi shohshom.

column2: But I tell you, not even Solomon in all his glory was dressed like one of these flowers.
column3: Solomonbad o pi hab masma s‑kehg e enigadadch, chum as d si s‑kais kownal.

column2: So if God decorates the fields like this, grass which is here today and tomorrow is thrown into the fire, won't he do much more for you, you people who trust so little?
column3: Neh, haꞌichu wuhshanig o wabsh al heꞌekia tash an hab chuꞌig. K eda g Jiosh si s‑kehg an wuhshad. Kum ahpim baꞌich d i haꞌichu am wehhejed. Kut woho ab wo em‑enigadad. Pegih, mt heg hekaj ab wabsh wo si hiwgad

column2: So don't worry, saying, ‘What shall we eat?’ or ‘What shall we drink?’ or ‘What shall we wear?’
column3: ch pi am hu wo e kudutad ab amjed mams hebai wo bei g e‑gegosig o g e‑wehschuga.

column2: These are all the things that the heathen chase after, but your heavenly Father knows everything you need.
column3: Hegam mo pi mahch g Jiosh o id am wa si oid. M eda ahpim d Jiosh aꞌaliga. K heg s‑mahch mam tatchua wehs ihda.

column2: Seek his kingdom first, and his way of doing right, and everything will be given to you.
column3: Wehpeg g am wo i e dagitok Jiosh wui k hab d wo s‑apꞌekamk. Kut heg wehs ab wo i em‑mah mam haschu i tatchua.

column2: So don't worry about tomorrow, because tomorrow can worry about itself. There's already enough evil in every day.
column3: “Pi g am wo shaꞌi e kudutad heg amjed mat haschu has wo i e juh baꞌich tash. Am o wa haꞌichug g em‑kudutadag id i tashkaj ch pi hab chum mahs mams g siꞌalim kudutadag ab wo i wehnad.

column2: Don't judge others, so that you won't be judged.
column3: “Pi g am hedai has wo ahgad nat pi ab uhpam wo i e nodagi em‑wui.

column2: For whatever standard you use to judge others will be used to judge you, and whatever measurement you use to measure others will be used to measure you.
column3: Mamt has i masma wo has ha ahgad, t ab wo i nod em‑wui g has ahgadag hab masma. Ab at wo i e nodagi em‑wui mamt has i masma ab wo neidad hema.

column2: Why do you see the speck that's in your brother's eye? Don't you notice the plank that's in your own eye?
column3: “Pi g am wo si s‑nenꞌoidad g hema chuꞌijig. Tp hems baꞌich i geꞌej g hejel em‑chuꞌijig. Id at heg wo wa wepok mam g chum haꞌichu ab i s‑wuhshdamk wuhij ed mo eda baꞌich i geꞌe haꞌichu ab woꞌo em‑wuhi ed.

column2: How can you say to your brother, ‘Let me take out that speck from your eye’ when you have a plank in your own eye?  You're being hypocritical! First get rid of the plank that's in your own eye. Then you'll be able to see clearly to take out the speck from your brother's eye.
column3: Do iattogi mamtp hab wo chei mamt haꞌichu ab wo i wuhshad wuhij ed mo eda g baꞌich i geꞌe haꞌichu ab woꞌo em‑wuhi ed. Hemho wa amt wehpeg wo i apꞌech g pi e‑apꞌedag k haha wo e nako mamt wo i apꞌech g hema pi apꞌedag.

column2: Don't give dogs what's holy. Don't throw your pearls to pigs. That way the pigs won't trample them underfoot, and the dogs won't turn and attack you.
column3: “Pi g ab hu wo ha ahgid g Jiosh haꞌichu ahga hegam mo pi ab hu tatchua. Heg at wo wa wepok mamt g s‑ta keꞌidam gogogs ab wo ha mah g hekia s‑apꞌekam haꞌichu o g kokji ab wo ha mah g si s‑namkig babiuga. Gogogs at hi ab wabsh wo i nehni k wo s‑koꞌokam has wo em‑juh. T g kokji hi wabsh wo kehiwia g babiuga.

column2: Ask, and it will be given to you; seek, and you will find; knock, and the door will be opened for you. Everyone who asks, receives; everyone who seeks, finds; and everyone who knocks has the door opened for them.
column3: “Ab g wo ha tahnid haꞌichu k ab wo bebhed. Am g wo e gahgidad haꞌichu k wo cheh. Ab g wo shontpagad. T ab wo i e kuhpiꞌo g pualit em‑wehhejed.

column2: Would any of you give your son a stone if he asked for bread?
column3: Ahpim oꞌog, namt hig wabsh g hodai wo mah g e‑alidag mat g simito wo em‑tai

column2: Or if he asked for fish, would you give him a snake?
column3: o wabsh g wamad wo mah mat g watopi hidod ab wo em‑tai?

column2: So if even you who are evil know to give good things to your children, how much more will your heavenly Father give good things to those who ask him.
column3: Chum ams d pi apꞌekam ch eda s‑mahch mamt s‑kehg haꞌichu wo ha mah g e‑aꞌaliga. Wahm hig g em‑ohg Jiosh at woho baꞌich i s‑kehg haꞌichu ab wo em‑mah mamt ab wo tahnid haꞌichu.

column2: Treat others the way you want them to treat you. This sums up the law and the prophets.
column3: “Am g hab wo ha juhkchid g hemajkam mam has i chum ha elid mat hab wo em‑juhkchid. Bamt masma wehs am hab wo juh mo haschu an oꞌohanas Jiosh heki hu oꞌohana ed.

column2: Enter by the narrow entrance. For the entrance is wide, and the way is broad that leads to destruction, and many travel that way.  But the entrance is narrow, and the way is difficult that leads to life, and only a few find it.
column3: “Am g wo i e dagitok Jiosh wui k ab wo s‑wohog elidad. Id at heg wo wa wepok mamt am i wahp al aj kihjeg t amjed k am aj wohg oidch hihim. Pi o muꞌijj hab masma hab e wua. Kumt hab waꞌi masma am wo bei g pi ha huhugedam doakag. (13) Pi o hasig mamt hab wabsh wo junihid g hejel e‑tatchui. Id at heg wo wa wepok mamt ab s‑tadani kihjeg t amjed i wahp k am s‑tadani wohg oidch hihim. Muꞌijj o hab masma hab e wua ch hab ab aihim g Jiawul kih.

column2: Watch out for false prophets who come wearing sheep's clothing, but who on the inside are vicious wolves.
column3: “Muꞌi at an wo i wuwha g s‑chu iꞌattomkam k hab wo e aꞌagad mo d Jiosh haꞌichu i tashogiddam. Am g wo s‑ha nenꞌoidad mat pi am hu wo i em‑shul pi apꞌekam ch ed. T wo s‑em‑padchudam hab masma mat g shehꞌe wo s‑muꞌam g kahwal.

column2: You can recognize them by their fruits. Do people harvest grapes from thorn bushes, or figs from thistles?
column3: Mt wo s‑mahchk mo pi d wohokam am neidch mo has masma. Nat hig wo e nako g hoꞌi shaꞌi mat wo bahidagt g uhdwis o g suhna? Pegih, t hab wa masma pi wo e nako hegam s‑chu iꞌattomkam mas wo em‑oidk hab wo e juh.

column2: So every good tree produces good fruit, while a bad tree produces bad fruit.
column3: Neh, heg at wo waꞌi s‑kehg bahidagt s‑kehg haꞌichu wuhshanig.

column2: A good tree can't produce bad fruit, and a bad tree can't produce good fruit.
column3: T g pi kehg wuhshanig pi kehg wo bahidagt.

column2: Every tree that doesn't produce good fruit is chopped down and thrown into the fire.
column3: Kumt wo shonch k gam hu wo mei.

column2: So you'll recognize them by their fruits.
column3: Neh, mt hab wa masma wo ha mai mas hu wa woho d Jiosh haꞌichu i tashogiddam mamt wo nei mas wa woho ab s‑wohog elid g Jiosh.

column2: Not everyone who calls me ‘Lord, Lord’ will enter the kingdom of heaven—only those who do the will of my Father in heaven.
column3: “Muꞌijj at hab wo chum ni‑aꞌagad mani d s‑apꞌekam ha‑kownalig ch wabshaba pi am hu hab wo junihid g ni‑ohg Jiosh tatchui. Kut g Jiosh pi am hu wo i ha wahpki e‑kihdag ed.

column2: Many will say to me at the Day of Judgment, ‘Lord, Lord, didn't we prophesy in your name and drive out demons in your name, and perform many miracles in your name?’
column3: “T ab wo i e ai g lodaita tash. T idam hab wo chum kaijjid ab ni‑wui, ‘S‑apꞌekam ni‑kownalig, m‑gewkdagkaj ach am ahgachug g Jiosh haꞌichu ahga ch gam hu i ha wuwhasid g jijawul ch am hab junihim g s‑hasig haꞌichu.’

column2: Then I will tell them, ‘I never knew you. Leave me, you people who practice wickedness!’
column3: “Kunt hab wo chei ab ha wui, ‘Pi ani hekid shaꞌi s‑em‑mahch. Gam g hu wo hihim ab ni‑amjed ahpim mam hab junihim g pi apꞌekam.’ T hemho wa gam hu wo hihi.

column2: Everyone that hears the words I say, and follows them, is like a wise man who built his house on solid rock.
column3: “Ab g wo s‑wohog elidad g haꞌichu ni‑ahga. T hab wo s‑apꞌek g em‑doakag. Id at heg wo wa wepok matp hems hema s‑wihnam wo shondad g e‑kihta.

column2: The rain poured down, and the floods rose, and the winds blew hard against the house, but it didn't fall down, because its foundations were on solid rock.
column3: T hab pi wo i gei mat hekid wo hewed k juh k wo s‑gewkam mel g shuhdagi. Pegih, mt hab wa masma s‑wihnam wo gegokkad mo ihda kih mamtp ab wo s‑ni‑wohog elidad.

column2: Everyone that hears the words I say, and doesn't follow them, is like a foolish man who built his house on the sand.
column3: “T wabshaba pi wo apꞌek g em‑doakag mamtp pi ab hu wo wohog elidad g haꞌichu ni‑ahga. Heg at wo wa wepok matp hems hema pi wihnam wo shondad g e‑kihta.

column2: The rain poured down, and the floods rose, and the winds blew hard against the house, and it fell down—it totally collapsed.”
column3: T wo si hewed k juh k s‑gewkam wo mel g shuhdagi. Kut g kihj wo i gehsh k am wabsh wo i e padch. Pegih, t hab wa masma wo i e padch g em‑doakag mo ihda kih mamtp pi ab hu wo ni‑wohog elidad.”

column2: When Jesus finished explaining these things, the crowds were amazed at his teaching,
column3: Neh, tsh am i haꞌasa ha mashcha g Jesus. Tsh g hemajkam si has i el

column2: for he taught like someone with authority, and not like their religious teachers.
column3: no pi s‑e mamachim ha mashcham. Sh eda hegam mo d chum chehanig ha mashchamdam pi hab masma s‑e mamachim ha mashcham.

column2: Large crowds followed Jesus once he'd come down from the mountain.
column3: Tsh ab hahawa i hud g Jesus kawulk t amjed. Tsh ab i oi hegam muꞌi hemajkam mo an wehmaj.

column2: A leper approached him and bowed down, worshiping him, and said, “Lord, if you're willing, please heal me.”
column3: Tsh am hema jiwia g oꞌodham mash mumku heg hekaj mumkidag mo g chuhkugaj muhkhim k atsh ab i gei Jesus wecho k hab kaij, “S‑apꞌekam ni‑kownalig, ab g si i s‑ni‑hoꞌigeꞌid k i ni‑doajid, pej maptp wo tatchuad.”

column2: Jesus reached out and touched him with his hand. “I am willing,” he said. “Be healed!” Immediately he was healed from his leprosy.
column3: Tsh g Jesus ab tahtam k hab kaij, “Am o wa s‑apꞌe. Doajini.”

column2: “Make sure you don't tell anyone,” Jesus told him. “Go and show yourself to the priest and give the offering which Moses required as public proof.”
column3: Sh hab hahawa kaij g Jesus ab wui, “Neh, pi apt hedai wo ahgid k wabshaba am ha hekaj wo hih pahl wui. T am wo m‑chechga k wo wohokamch mapt doa. Pt am hab haha wo juh hegai iagchulida mo wa g Jiosh em‑chehani Mosesbad oꞌohana ed. T hab wo s‑mahchk g hemajkam mapt woho doa.”

column2: When Jesus entered Capernaum, a centurion came up to him, begging for help,
column3: Kutsh gam hu hahawa hihi idam Jesus k am dada Capernaum t am.

column2: “Lord, my servant is at home, lying down, unable to move. He's in terrible agony.”
column3: “S‑apꞌekam ni‑kownalig, mumku at g ni‑pionag k ab woꞌo ni‑kih ab ch pi e nako mas an has wo i e juh k muꞌi e shoꞌigchud.”

column2: “I will come and heal him,” Jesus replied.
column3: Sh hab kaij g Jesus, “Am ant wo wa i him k wo doaj.”

column2: The centurion answered, “Lord, I don't merit a visit to my home. Just say the word, and my servant will be healed.
column3: Sh hab kaij hegai shondal ha‑geꞌejig, “Pi ani am hu hugkam d haꞌichu maps am wo i wah ni‑kih ed. Am apt hab wabsh wo chea. T wo doa g ni‑pionag.

column2: For I am myself under the authority of superiors, while I also have soldiers under my command. I command one, ‘Go!’ and he goes. I command another, ‘Come!’ and he comes. I tell my servant, ‘Do this!’ and he does it.”
column3: Bo wa masma ab haꞌichu ni‑chehani g ni‑geꞌejig. Kuni ab s‑wohog elid. K g ni‑shondalig hab waꞌap ab s‑ni‑wohog elid. Hema ant hab wo ah, ‘Am g hihm.’ T am wo hih. Nt hema hab ep wo ah, ‘Ab g i hihm.’ T ab wo i hih. Kuni g ni‑pionag hab ep aꞌaga mat haꞌichu hab wo ni‑juni. K am hab wua.”

column2: When Jesus heard what he said, he was astonished. He told those who were following him, “I tell you the truth, I haven't found this kind of trust anywhere in Israel.
column3: Kutsh si has i el g Jesus am i kaiok k hab kaij ab ha wui hegam mo an wehmaj, “Neh, ab o si ni‑hiwig ihda gawul mahs oꞌodham. Pi ani hekid shaꞌi kah mas hab masma ab si ni‑hiwig g Tutuligo.

column2: I tell you that many will come from the east and the west, and sit down with Abraham and Isaac and Jacob in the kingdom of heaven.
column3: Kunt hab wo em‑ahgi mat muꞌijj ab wo i hihi siꞌal wecho amjed ch hudunig wecho amjed k am wo wehmaj dadhaiwua g Abrahambad ch Isaacbad ch Jacobbad an Jiosh kihdag ed.

column2: But the heirs of the kingdom will be thrown out into utter darkness where there will be weeping and grinding of teeth.”
column3: Id o d chum ha‑apꞌedag g Tutuligo. T wabshaba muꞌijj pi am hu wo i wahp no pi pi ab hu ni‑hiwig. T g Jiosh gam hu wo ha shul s‑chuhugam k ed. Kut chum hekid am wo shoanid ch ga hu wabsh wo i si e kiꞌishch nat pi wo shaꞌi si s‑koꞌok haꞌichu nakogad.”

column2: Then Jesus told the centurion, “Go home. Because you trusted that it would happen, what you asked for has been done.” The servant was healed right away.
column3: Kush hab hahawa kaij g Jesus heg wui shondal ha‑geꞌejig, “Gamai g hihm uhpam. T heg am hab wo e juh map haschu ab ni‑tahni nap pi ab si ni‑hiwig.” Kutsh heg waꞌi ohla ab doa g piongaj.

column2: When Jesus arrived at Peter's house, he saw that Peter's mother-in-law was sick in bed with a high fever.
column3: Kutsh amjed gam hu haꞌi hihi idam Jesus Peter kih wui. Sh am woꞌok ch mumku g Peter hohnig jeꞌe ch g s‑toni iajidch.

column2: He touched her hand and the fever left her. She got up and began making him a meal.
column3: Kush g Jesus an taht g nowij. Tsh ha hekaj huhug g s‑tonjig ab ab. Kutsh am i wamig k ha hihidol.

column2: When evening came they brought many who were demon-possessed to Jesus. He made the spirits leave at his command, and he healed all those who were sick.
column3: Tsh gam hu i juh. Tsh g hemajkam muꞌi am ha uꞌapa g kokꞌodam ch hegam mo g jijawul an ha uꞌukch. Tsh g Jesus am i ha wuwhas g jijawul k am wehs ha doaj g kokꞌodam.

column2: This fulfilled what the prophet Isaiah said: “He healed our diseases, and freed us from our illnesses.”
column3: Heki atki hu waꞌi oꞌoha g Isaiabad matsh id am hab wo e juh. K hegai oꞌohanaj hab chuꞌig:

column2: When Jesus saw the crowds around him, he gave instructions that they should go to the other side of the lake.
column3: Sh muꞌi hemajkam an ha wehgaj. Sh heg hekaj hab ha ahg g Jesus hegam mo si ha mashcham mat wo e nako. T gan hu aigojed wo i chehchsh g sikod shuhdagi.

column2: One of the religious teachers approached him and said, “Teacher, I will follow you wherever you go!”
column3: Tsh wabshaba am hema jiwia g chehanig ha mashchamdam k hab kaij, “T‑mashchamdam, ni‑nahtokch ani mant am wo m‑oi.”

column2: “Foxes have their dens, and wild birds have their nests, but the Son of man has nowhere he can lie down and rest,” Jesus told him.
column3: Sh hab kaij g Jesus ab wui, “Napt hig wo e nako? Neh, chum o hems g gagso ch uꞌuwhig ge koksh. Ni wabshaba ahni Jiosh si Kehsha pi shaꞌi ha kih ia jewed dahm. K heg hekaj s‑hasig maps am wo ni‑oi.”

column2: Another disciple said to Jesus, “Lord, first let me go and bury my father.”
