column3: Sh hema hab kaij hegam mash ab wecho e mashcham, “S‑apꞌekam ni‑kownalig, chum ani hi wa am i s‑m‑oidamk idani. T wabshaba hoꞌipki hekid muh g ni‑ohg. Nt wo hiashpok haha wo m‑oi.”

column2: “Follow me. Leave the dead to bury their own dead,” Jesus replied.
column3: Sh hab kaij g Jesus, “Am g ha hiwgid hegam mo pi uꞌukch g wechij doakag mat wo ha hiash g koꞌi. Pt ahpi hi ab wo i him k wo ni‑wehmajk.”

column2: Then Jesus got into a boat and his disciples went with him.
column3: Sh g Jesus an hahawa dahiwua wahlko ch ed am ha wehm hegam mash ab si wecho e mashcham k am gahi i shul.

column2: A violent storm suddenly blew up, and waves crashed over the boat, but Jesus went on sleeping.
column3: Kutsh haha wabsh si s‑gewkam ab i meh g hewel shuhdagi dahm k ab i toꞌotonkai g shuhdagi matsh gam hu si i chesh wahlko dahm. Sh g Jesus am woꞌok ch kohsh.

column2: The disciples went over to him and woke him up. “Save us, Lord! We're going to drown!” they shouted.
column3: Kutsh am wui hihim k am wuhan k hab kaij, “T‑kownalig, t‑doꞌibiani. Ttki wo t‑koꞌij.”

column2: “Why are you so afraid? Why do you trust so little?” he asked them. Then he got up, and commanded the winds and the waves to stop. Everything was absolutely calm.
column3: Sh hab kaij g Jesus ab ha wui, “Shahchu amt ahgk si e totods. Pi amki ab hu si ni‑hiwig.” Bash kaij ch am wamig k ab si chehani g hewel ch shuhdagi toꞌotonk mat wo dodolimat. Kutsh gam hu wabsh i pi shahm.

column2: The disciples were astonished, and said, “Who is this? Even the winds and the waves obey him!”
column3: Tsh wehsijj si has i elid k hab kaij, “S has mahs d oꞌodham ihda mo chum hems g hewel ch shuhdagi toꞌotonk ab s‑wohog elid.”

column2: When he arrived on the other side, in the region of the Gadarenes, two demon-possessed men came out of the graveyard to meet him. They were so dangerous that nobody dared to travel that way.
column3: Tsh am aigo dada. K amai d ha‑chekshani g Gadarene hemajkam. Sh am ge chehchog mo am g koꞌi e toꞌaw. Tsh gohk ab i wuwha g chechoj. Kush g jijawul an ha uꞌukch. Kush shaꞌi s‑ta ehbidama. Sh chum hedai s‑ehbid matsh am haꞌab wo i bij.

column2: They shouted out, “What have you got to do with us, you Son of God? Have you come to torture us before our time?”
column3: Tsh idam an ha nam k si s‑kaidam hab kaij ab Jesus wui, “Shahchu apt ahgk ab t‑wui i hih, ahpi Jiosh alidag. Napt wo s‑koꞌokam t‑namkid mat wa chum koi e ai g tash?” Bash kaij nash pi g Jesus s‑ha wuwhasidamk g jijawul.

column2: In the distance a large herd of pigs was feeding.
column3: Sh eda muꞌi an oiopo g kokji kawulk bahsho ch e gegosid.

column2: The demons pleaded with him, “If you're going to drive us out, send us into the herd of pigs.”
column3: Sh idam jijawul ab si tahni g Jesus ch hab kaij, “Pt hig wo t‑hiwigi matt am wo i wahp hegam ha eda kokji.”

column2: “Go!” said Jesus. The demons left the men and went into the pigs. The whole herd ran down the steep hillside into the sea and drowned.
column3: Sh hab ha ahg g Jesus, “Hijiwo.”

column2: The pig herders ran away. They went to the town and told the people there everything that had taken place, and what had happened to the demon-possessed men.
column3: Kutsh hegam mash am ha nuhkud idam kokji gam hu si wohp k am dada kihhim t am k am ha ahgid mat haschu has e juh am ha tahgio idam oꞌodham mash g jijawul an ha uꞌukch.

column2: The whole town came out to meet Jesus. When they found him, they begged him to leave their district.
column3: Kutsh muꞌijj ab amjed hegai kihhim am i namkhi g Jesus k am i chehg k hab ahg mat wo si s‑ha hoꞌigeꞌid k gm hu wo hih ab ha‑chekshani amjed.

column2: So Jesus took a boat back across the lake to the town where he lived.
column3: Tsh an hahawa gahi ep hihi g wahlkokaj idam Jesus k am dada Capernaum t am mo am kih.

column2: There they brought to him a paralyzed man lying on a mat. When Jesus saw how they trusted him, he told the paralyzed man, “My friend, cheer up! Your sins are forgiven.”
column3: Tsh am haꞌi dada hema woꞌichugch wahkus ch ed nash pi ab wabsh i s‑moik ch pi himid. Sh am neid g Jesus mo ab si hiwig idam mat am wui uꞌapa ch hab kaij ab wui g mumkudam, “Am g si e gewkaj, ni‑nawoj. Gm ant hu hab i juh g pi ap m‑chuꞌijig.”

column2: In response some of the religious teachers said to themselves, “He's speaking blasphemy!”
column3: Sh haꞌi gegok g chehanig ha mashchamdam ch hab kaij ab aꞌai e wui, “Ih, shoꞌo waꞌi si pi ap neok hab masma e wepogidch g Jiosh.”

column2: But Jesus knew what they were thinking. He asked them, “Why are you thinking evil thoughts in your hearts?
column3: Kush g Jesus s‑mahch mo haschu am chegito ch hab kaij ab ha wui, “Am am g pi apꞌekam haꞌichu chegito

column2: What is easier to say, ‘Your sins are forgiven,’ or ‘Get up and walk’?
column3: hab elidch mani hab wabsh kaij ch pi woho edgid g gewkdag mant gam hu hab wo i juh g pi ap ha‑chuꞌijig. Bam elid mo s‑pehegim hab e kaij, ‘Gm ant hu hab i juh g pi ap m‑chuꞌijig,’ no ge hedai s‑mahch mas s‑wohom gam hu hab i e juh.

column2: But to convince you that the Son of man does have the authority to forgive sins…” he said to the paralyzed man, “Get up, pick up your mat, and go home!”
column3: Pegih, nt wo em‑chehgi mani woho ge gewkdag ch hab wua mani has i kaij ahni Jiosh si Kehsha,” k hab hahawa kaij ab wui ihda mo ab wabsh i s‑moik, “I g wamig k am behꞌi g e‑wahkus k hihm am uhpam.”

column2: The man got up and went home.
column3: Kutsh am i wamig k gam hu hih uhpam.

column2: When the crowds saw what had happened, they were scared. Then they praised God that he had given human beings such power.
column3: Kutsh am i nei g hemajkam ihda k si s‑ehbeni k ab si has i el g Jiosh natki pi ab mah g Jesus ihda gewkdag.

column2: As Jesus moved on from there he saw a man called Matthew sitting at the tax booth. Jesus called to him, “Follow me!” He got up, and followed Jesus.
column3: Tki amjed am hih g Jesus k am hu hebai himad ch ni‑cheh ahni Matthew. Nid wa eda am chikpan mo am g kownal ha kowlant g hemajkam g lial. D hab kaij g Jesus ab ni‑wui, “Ab g i hihm k ab si ni‑wecho wo e mashchamad.” Nid am ha hekaj i wuhshani k am i oi.

column2: While Jesus was eating at Matthew's home, many tax-collectors and sinners came and sat down at the table with Jesus and his disciples.
column3: Am hu hebai amjed, nid ab ha wai hegam Jesus mat am wo e gegos ni‑kih am. D ab i hihi. Kud muꞌi am dada k am t‑wehm e gegosid g lial ha kowlantdam ch hegam mo pi am hu si oid g t‑shohshon ha‑himdag.

column2: When the Pharisees saw this they asked Jesus' disciples, “Why does your Teacher eat with tax-collectors and sinners?”
column3: Dki am haꞌi dada g Palasi. Kuchd eda am t‑gegosid. D idam hab kaij ab t‑wui, “Ih, k haschu ahgch g em‑mashchamdam ha wehm e gegosid g pi ap hemajkam, chum hems g lial t‑kowlantdam?”

column2: When Jesus heard the question, he replied, “Those who are well don't need a doctor, but sick people do.
column3: D g Jesus am i ha kaiok hab kaij ab ha wui, “Idam pi ap hemajkam o s‑e doꞌibiamk hab masma mat g kokꞌodam wo s‑e doajidam. Hegam mat hab wo e elidad mo s‑apꞌe at pi wo tatchua g mahkai.

column2: Go and discover what this means: ‘I want mercy, not sacrifice. For I didn't come to call those who do right—I came to call sinners.’ ”
column3: Pi ant hab ahgk ia jiwia jewed dahm manis wo ha doꞌibia hegam mo pi e doꞌibiamk. Neh, an o oꞌohanas mash wa hab kaij g Jiosh:

column2: Then the disciples of John came and asked, “Why is that we and the Pharisees fast frequently, but your disciples don't?”
column3: D am haꞌi dada hegam mo ab si wecho e mashcham hegai John mo wa ha pahl wapkon k ab kakke g Jesus ch hab kaij, “Neh, muꞌikko ach pi t‑gegosid hab ahgch matt wo t‑hoꞌigeꞌidahu. K hegam Palasi hab waꞌap e wua. K eda haschu ahgch idam pi hab masma hab e wua mo ab si m‑wecho e mashcham?”

column2: “Do wedding guests mourn while the bridegroom is with them?” Jesus responded. “But the time is coming when the bridegroom will be taken from them, and then they will fast.
column3: D hab kaij g Jesus ab ha wui, “Nat hig pi wo e gegos g wo ha hohntam naipijju mat eda heg am wo ha wehmajk? T am wo i e ai mat pi am hu wo ha wehmajk. T am hahawa pi wo e gegos. Pegih, bat wo wa e juh idam ni‑naipijju mant hekid pi ia hu wo ha wehmajk.”

column2: No one puts a new patch on old clothes, otherwise it will shrink and make the tear worse.
column3: D am hahawa chum ha tashogid g Jesus mat g wechij mashchama pi ap wo wehnad g heki hu himdag hab kaijch, “Pi at hedai g wechij ikuskaj wo shohsho g hekiuchij lihwa mat wo s‑e wia nat pi wo i dahiwua hegai wechij ikus k baꞌich wo i wantp g hekiuchij.

column2: No one puts new wine in old wineskins either, otherwise the wineskins will burst, spilling the wine and ruining the wineskins. No, new wine is put into new wineskins, and both last.”
column3: K hab waꞌap pi hab mahs machs am wo toa g wechij uhdwis wadag am hekiuchij haꞌichu elidag kostal ch ed nat pi wo wantsh g hekiuchij am i e ak. Kut wo e iawua g uhdwis wadag. Wechij uhdwis wadag at am wo e toa wechij kokstal ch ed mat wehs wo s‑ap e nuhkud.”

column2: While he was telling them this, one of the leading officials came and bowed before him. “My daughter has just died,” the man told Jesus. “But if you come and place your hand on her, I know she will come back to life.”
column3: D am wabsh kia ha wehm neok g Jesus. Kud am hema jiwia g t‑hahaꞌichuga k ab i gei wui k hab kaij, “Ni‑chehiaga atp hems heki hu muh. Pt wabshaba ab wo i him k ab wo taht. T wo e chegito.”

column2: Jesus and his disciples got up and followed him.
column3: Kud gam hu wehmaj hih g Jesus. Kuchd ahchim gam hu ep ha oi.

column2: At that moment a woman who had been sick with bleeding for twelve years came up behind him and touched the hem of his cloak.
column3: Kudki eda am hema haꞌichug g uwi mash gamai gohk ahid ab waꞌi mumku heg hekaj mo g ehꞌedaj jegwoni. Kuchd am hihim. Kudki ab i hih Jesus wui k ab taht g kahbaj hugidag

column2: She had told herself, “If I can just touch his cloak, I'll be healed.”
column3: nash pi hab e elid matp hems an wabsh wo taht k wo doa.

column2: Jesus turned and saw her. “Be happy, for your trust in me has healed you,” he told her. The woman was immediately healed.
column3: D g Jesus am sikol i kekiwua k neidok hab ahg, “Pegih, ni‑uwiga, ab g si i e gewkad. Am apt wa doa napt pi ab i s‑ni‑wohoch.” Kud amjed gam hu s‑doa.

column2: Jesus arrived at the official's house. He saw the flute-players and the crowd that was weeping loudly.
column3: D amjed gam hu hih g Jesus k am i wah heg kih ed matsh g chehiagaj muh. Sh am si s‑nankosig g mumsigo ch shoanidam.

column2: “Please leave,” he told them, “For the girl isn't dead, she's just asleep.” But they laughed and made fun of him.
column3: Sh hab kaij g Jesus ab ha wui, “Gam g hu wo i wuwhaki wehsijj. Heg o wa wepo ni‑wehhejed mo wabsh kohsh g chehia.” Kush wehsijj si s‑koꞌokam ash nash pi s‑mahch matsh muh.

column2: But once the crowd had been sent out, he went in and took the girl by the hand, and she got up.
column3: Kumtsh am wabsh i chum ha wuwhas. Tsh g Jesus am i wah mo am woꞌo g chehia k ab bei nowij ab. Kutsh i wami.

column2: News of what happened spread throughout that region.
column3: Kum amjed an aꞌai wehsko aꞌagahim mat has e juh.

column2: As Jesus continued on from there, two blind men followed him, shouting, “Son of David, please have mercy on us!”
column3: Kuchd am hu hebai ep hihim. D gohk pi neneadam oꞌodham ab i oi g Jesus k si s‑kaidam hab kaij, “Ab g si i s‑t‑hoꞌigeꞌid ahpi mapsh d t‑kownaligbad David amjedkam.”

column2: When Jesus arrived at the house where he was staying, the blind men came in too.
column3: Kuchd ged hu i wahp kih ch ed. D idam gohk pi neneadam am dada wui g Jesus.

column2: Then Jesus touched their eyes, and said, “Because of your trust in me it will happen!”
column3: Kud g Jesus ab ha taht g ha‑wuhpui k hab kaij, “Am at hab wo e juh mam has i masma ab s‑wohochud.”

column2: And they could see. Then Jesus warned them, “Make sure nobody knows about this.”
column3: Kud wa woho ab bei g e‑nendag.

column2: But they went and spread the word about Jesus everywhere.
column3: D wabshaba am wabsh i chum dagito k gam hu hihim k am aꞌai i ahgahi wehsko anai ab amjed g Jesus.

column2: As Jesus and his disciples were leaving, a man was brought to him who was dumb and demon-possessed.
column3: D am hahawa haꞌi ep dada g hemajkam Jesus wui am hema uꞌapadch mo pi ha neok nash pi jiawul an uꞌukch. D g Jesus gam hu wabsh chum i wuhshad g jiawul ab amjed.

column2: Once the demon had been thrown out of him, the dumb man spoke, and the crowds were amazed. “Nothing ever happened like this before in Israel,” they said.
column3: Kud ha hekaj wabsh neo ihda oꞌodham.

column2: But the Pharisees remarked, “He throws out demons using the power of the chief of demons.”
column3: Kud wabshaba g Palasi hab kaij, “Jijawul ha‑geꞌejig o ab mahkch g gewkdag. Kuki heg hekaj e nakog ch ab i ha wuwhasid g jijawul.”

column2: Jesus went all over, visiting the towns and villages. He taught in their synagogues, telling them about the good news of the kingdom, and he healed all kinds of sicknesses and diseases.
column3: Am achd hahawa hahasko oiopod ch am daiw wehs kihhim ch ed. Kud g Jesus am ha mashcham g hemajkam ha‑chechopi ed ch am ha ahgidahim g s‑kehg haꞌichu ahga ab amjed g Jiosh kownaltalig ch am ep ha dodajid g nahnko mahs kokꞌodam.

column2: When he saw the crowds, Jesus was deeply moved with compassion for them, because they were troubled and helpless, like sheep without a shepherd.
column3: D muꞌi ab wui e chehm g hemajkam. Kudki g Jesus si i s‑ha hoꞌigeꞌel no pi si e kudut ch e shoꞌigchud hab sha masma mat g kakawal hab wo e wuad pi e nuhkudch.

column2: He told his disciples, “The harvest is large, but there are only a few workers.
column3: D hab kaij g Jesus ab t‑wui, “Neh, muꞌij o hegam mo e nahtokch mat wo e doꞌibia. Kuch eda pi muꞌij ahchim mach am ha ahgidahim g doꞌibiadag ahga. Id o heg wa wepo mat hebai g ha‑hihka wo si geꞌejk. T g ha‑pionag pi wo muꞌijk.

column2: Pray to the Lord of the harvest, and ask him to send more workers for his harvest.”
column3: Ab g wo si tahnid g Jiosh mat muꞌi wo i ha chuhcha mat am wo i ha ahgidahid g s‑kehg haꞌichu ahgaj ch ab wo i ha baꞌihamad hegam mo e nahtokch.”

column2: Jesus called his twelve disciples together and gave them power to throw out evil spirits, and to heal all kinds of diseases and sicknesses.
column3: Ab ad hahawa i t‑wai g Jesus ahchim mach ab si wecho t‑mashcham k ab t‑mah g gewkdag matt gam hu wo i ha wuwhas g jijawul ab ha amjed hegam mo an ha uꞌukch k wo ha dodaj g kokꞌodam.

column2: These are the names of the twelve apostles: first, Simon, (also called Peter), Andrew his brother, James the son of Zebedee, John his brother,
column3: Dachd gamai gohk ahchim mach d si chuhchaij. Simon o d wehpegkam ch hab ep chehgig Peter. K g Simon shehpij hab waꞌap d Jesus kehsha ch hab chehgig Andrew. K haꞌi ep d James ch John ch d e‑wepngam. K g ha‑ohg hab chehgig Zebedee.

column2: Philip, Bartholomew, Thomas, Matthew the tax-collector, James the son of Alphaeus, Thaddeus,
column3: K haꞌi ep d Philip ch Bartholomew ch Thomas. Ni ahni hab waꞌap d kehshaj ch hab chehgig Matthew ch wa d ge lial ha kowlantdam. K hema d hegai James mo g ohgaj d Alphias. K hema hab chehgig Thaddaus.

column2: Simon the revolutionary, and Judas Iscariot, who betrayed Jesus.
column3: K hema hab ep chehgig Simon ch d hema hegam mo tatchua matt ahchim Tutuligo hejel wo himchudad g t‑kownaltalig. K hema hab chehgig Judas Iscariot ch d ihda matki wo gagda g Jesus.

column2: These Twelve Jesus sent out, telling them, “Don't go to the foreigners, or to any Samaritan city.
column3: D g Jesus am hahawa i t‑shelini ahchim gamai gohk matt gm hu wo ahgachugad g haꞌichu ahgaj hab kaijch, “Pi g am hu wo hihim gawul mahs hemajkam ha wui ch Samaria hemajkam ha wui iaꞌi idani.

column2: You are to go to the lost sheep of the house of Israel.
column3: Am amt wo waꞌi hihi hegam ha wui e‑wehm Tutuligo. Idam o hab sha masma mo g heb hu hihimkam kahwal.

column2: Wherever you go, tell the people, ‘The kingdom of heaven is near.’
column3: Am g wo hihim k id am wo i ha ahgidahi mat am wo i himch g Jiosh g e‑kownaltalig jewed dahm.

column2: Heal those who are sick. Resurrect the dead. Cure the lepers. Drive out demons. You received freely, so give freely!
column3: Mt wo ha dodaj g kokꞌodam k ab uhpam wo i ha chechegitoich hegam mat wabsh chum koi k g jijawul ab wo i ha wuwhas ha amjed hegam mo an uꞌukch k wo ha dodaj hegam mo kokꞌo heg hekaj mo g ha‑chuhkug wabsh muhkhim. Ab ant wabsh em‑mah ihda gewkdag. Kumt pi haꞌichu wo ha kowlantad am hab ha junidch.

column2: Don't carry any gold, silver, or copper coins in your pockets,  or a bag for your journey, or two cloaks, or sandals, or a walking stick, for a worker deserves to be supported.
column3: “K wabshaba ab d ha‑wuikam hegam mat ab wo em‑kaiha mat ab aigo wo i em‑wehmaj k wo em‑dagioꞌi. Mt heg hekaj ab wabsh wo e enigadadch ch wo hihi pi haꞌichu uꞌadch mams hekaj wo e dagioꞌi o ams wo ha namkid. T g Jiosh wo em‑nuhkud. Kumt pi wo uꞌad g cheowikud mamt hekaj wo e nuhkud.

column2: Wherever you go, whatever town or village, ask for someone who lives according to good principles, and remain there until you leave.  When you enter the house, give it your blessing.  If the home deserves it, let your peace rest on it, but if it doesn't deserve it, let your peace return to you. If someone doesn't welcome you, and refuses to listen to what you have to say, then leave that house or that town, shaking its dust off your feet as you go.
column3: “Mt am wo i wahp kihhim ch ed k an wo i ha gahghi hegam mat hedai s‑ap ab wo i em‑nei k ab ha wui hab wo chei, ‘Jiosh o ab em‑makiog g si geꞌe s‑ap tahhadkam.’ Kut am wo i em‑wahpkid k wo em‑dagioꞌi am hugkam mamt hekid gm hu baꞌich ep wo i hihi. Kutp hems hebai pi ap ab hu wo i em‑nei g kihkam. Kumt am wo si i shahmud g jewed ab e‑tahtad ab k hab wo ha chehgi mamt wo ha dagito.

column2: I tell you the truth, it will be better for Sodom and Gomorrah at the Day of Judgment than for that town!
column3: Nt wo si shel em‑ahgi mat g Jiosh baꞌich i s‑koꞌokam wo ha namkid hegam mat pi ab hu wo kaiha ihda s‑kehg haꞌichu ahgaj matsh hi hegam hab ha juh pi ap hemajkam mash am kih Sodom ch Gomorra kihhimbad ch ed.

column2: Look, I'm sending you out like sheep among wolves. So be as wise as serpents and harmless as doves.
column3: “Neh, am amt wo oiopod ha shahgid g hemajkam. Kut haꞌi wo s‑ta ehbidamak am em‑wehhejed hab sha masma mo g sheshꞌe am ha wehhejed g kahwal. Mt wo si s‑e nenꞌoidad hab masma mo g ban ch wo si s‑hehemajimak hab masma mo g hohohi.

column2: Watch out for those who will hand you over to be tried by town councils and will whip you in their synagogues.
column3: Ab o him g tash mamt an wo em‑uꞌu k wo em‑lodait k atp hems ep wo em‑gewitta am chechopi ch ed.

column2: You will be dragged before governors and kings because of me, to witness to them and to the foreigners.
column3: Am amt wo em‑lodai ha tahgio g hahaꞌichu ch kokownal heg hekaj mam ab ni‑hiwig. Kumt wo s‑ni‑mahch k ah am ha tahgio ch am ha tahgio g gawul mahs hemajkam.

column2: But when they put you on trial, don't worry about how you should speak or what you should say, because you'll be told what to say at the right time.
column3: Pi g wo shaꞌi e kudut ab amjed mamt has masma e wehhejed wo neo.

column2: For it isn't you who will speak but the spirit of the Father will speak through you.
column3: Hekia S‑apꞌekam Gewkdag at wo em‑ahgi mamt has wo chei.

column2: Brother will betray brother and have him killed, and a father will do the same to his child. Children will rebel against their parents, and have them put to death.
column3: “Hahaꞌichu at wo em‑kokda. Kut ab ha wui wo em‑gagda chum hems g em‑wepnag o g em‑jehj o g em‑aꞌaliga.

column2: Everyone will hate you because you follow me, but those who endure until the end will be saved.
column3: Muꞌi hemajkam at wo s‑em‑kehꞌidad ni‑hekaj. Kumt wo sha e nakog k wo gahi wuwha g e‑shoꞌigdag. T g Jiosh am wo i em‑wahpki e‑kihdag ed.

column2: When you're persecuted in one town, run away to the next. I'm telling the truth: you won't finish going to the towns of Israel before the Son of man comes.
column3: Neh, mtp hems wo em‑shoꞌigch hasko. Pegih, mt wo ahhio heg amjed kihhim k gam hu baꞌich kihhim wui ep wo hihi. Nt wo shel em‑ahgi mant ep wo jiwia ahni Jiosh si Kehsha mamt koi wo ha chehmo g e‑wehm oꞌodham ha‑kihhim.

column2: Disciples are not more important than their teacher; servants are not more important than their master.  Disciples should be satisfied to become like their teacher, and servants like their master. If the head of the house has been called the head demon Beelzebub,  then the members of his household will be demonized even more!
column3: “E mashchamdam o ab wabsh wecho hegai mo d ha mashchamdam ch heg hekaj wepo wo nako haꞌichu. T g pion hab waꞌap wepo haꞌichu wo nako g e‑ahmo. Kumt ahpim hab waꞌap ni‑wepo wo nako haꞌichu. Neh, bo ni‑aꞌaga haꞌi mani d ge Jiawul ch wahm s‑koꞌokam has wo em‑ahgad ahpim mam ab si ni‑wecho e mashcham.

column2: So don't be frightened of them, for there's nothing covered that won't be exposed, and nothing hidden that won't be made known.
column3: “Pi g wo shaꞌi ha ehbidad g hemajkam nat pi wehs wo i e maꞌishpiꞌo mo haschu i e maꞌishch ch wehs wo s‑e mai mo haschu s‑e aꞌagchud.

column2: What I tell you here in the dark, declare when it's light, and what you hear whispered in your ear, shout from the rooftops.
column3: Si amt tasho wo i ahgahi wehsko mani haschu ab si hejel em‑ahgid.

column2: Don't be afraid of those who can kill you physically, but can't kill you spiritually. Instead, be afraid of the one who can destroy you physically and spiritually in the fires of destruction.
column3: Pi g wo shaꞌi ha ehbidad hegam matp hedai wo chum s‑em‑kokdaim. Pi at wo e nako mas baꞌich i s‑koꞌokam has wo em‑juh em‑kokdak. Heg at waꞌi Jiosh wo e nako mat am wo em‑daꞌich Jiawul kih ed mamtp pi am hu wo wohog elidad. Kumt heg ab wo waꞌi si has elidad.

column2: Aren't two sparrows sold for just one penny? But not a single one of them falls to the ground without your Father knowing about it.  Even the hairs on your head have all been counted.  So don't worry—you're worth more than many sparrows!
column3: “K wabshaba g Jiosh si s‑hemajima ch pi tatchua mas wo s‑koꞌokam em‑juh. Am g wo oidahim mo chum hems g al uꞌuwhig s‑ap ha nuhkud. K eda chum alo pi haꞌichu namkig idam. Kum ahpim d si haꞌichu am tahgio. Jiosh o wehs haꞌichu s‑mahch ab em‑ab. Mt heg hekaj pi haꞌichu wo shaꞌi ehbidad ab wui e dagitokch.

column2: Anyone who publicly declares their commitment  to me, I will also declare my commitment to them before my Father in heaven.
column3: “Neh, am amt wo s‑ni‑mahch k ah hemajkam ha tahgio mam d ni‑wohochuddam. Kunt ahni hab waꞌap wo s‑em‑mahch k ah am tahgio g ni‑ohg Jiosh.

column2: But anyone who publicly denies me, I will also deny before my Father in heaven.
column3: Kutp wabshaba hedai pi wo ni‑mahch k ah am ha tahgio g hemajkam, nt ahni hab waꞌap pi wo mahch k ah am tahgio g ni‑ohg Jiosh.

column2: Don't think I've come to bring peace on earth. I haven't come to bring peace, but a sword.
column3: “Pi g hab wo e elidad mat wo dodolimat g hemajkam mant ia jiwia. Ab at em‑wui wo gegokiwua hegam mo pi ab hu has ni‑elid.

column2: I've come to turn a man against his father, a daughter against her mother, and a daughter-in-law against her mother-in-law.
column3: Wihpiop atp hems wo s‑kehꞌidad g e‑ohg ch g chetcha g e‑jeꞌe o g e‑kahkma jeꞌe.

column2: Your enemies will be those of your own family!
column3: Em‑wehm kihkam atp hems d wo si em‑obgak.

column2: If you love your father or mother more than me you don't deserve to be mine, and if you love your son or daughter more than me you don't deserve to be mine.
column3: “Pi at haꞌichu wo namkigk g em‑wohochudadag mamtp pi baꞌich wo i ni‑tatchua mam hi g e‑ohg ch e‑jeꞌe ch e‑aꞌaliga.

column2: If you don't pick up your cross and follow me you don't deserve to be mine.
column3: Mt gam hu wo dagito g hejel hab e elida k ahni hab ni‑elida hab wo junihid ni‑wehhejed e shoꞌigchudch. Heg at wo wa wepok mam ab mohto g kots ch ab ab wo e muhkid. Kut pi haꞌichu wo namkigk g em‑wohochudadag mamtp pi hab masma ab wo i ni‑oi.

column2: If you try to save your life, you will lose it, but if you lose your life because of me you will save it.
column3: Pi amt wo heki wua g e‑doakag mamtp wo hekaj am ni‑wehhejed. Heg at wo heki wua g e‑doakag matp hedai wo chum s‑daꞌad.

column2: Those who welcome you welcome me, and those who welcome me welcome the one that sent me.
column3: “Heg o wa wepo mo s‑ap ab ni‑neid ahni matp hedai ahpim s‑ap ab wo em‑neidad. K hab waꞌap s‑ap ab neid g Jiosh matp hedai s‑ap ab wo ni‑neidad.

column2: Those who welcome a prophet because that's what they are will receive the same reward as a prophet. Those who welcome someone who does right will receive the same reward as someone who does right.
column3: Hegai mat hedai s‑ap ab wo i ha nei g ni‑chuhchai at ha wepo wo bei g s‑kehg mahkigdag. Kut hegai mat hedai s‑ap ab wo i nei g s‑apꞌekam oꞌodham heg wepo wo bei g s‑kehg mahkigdag.

column2: I tell you the truth, those who give a drink of cool water to the least important of my disciples will definitely not miss out on their reward.”
column3: Kut heg s‑wohom ab wo bei g s‑kehg e‑mahkigdag mat hedai chum hems g s‑hehpi shuhdagi ab wo hema ha wasibi idam al aꞌal am hema em‑wehhejed ahpim mam ab si ni‑wecho e mashcham.”

column2: When Jesus had finished giving instructions to his twelve disciples, he left to go and teach and speak publicly in the nearby towns.
column3: Am ad i haꞌasa haꞌichu t‑shelini g Jesus ahchim gamai gohk e‑chuhchai k gam hu hahawa him k atsh an i ha mashcham k ha mihshmad mo an aꞌai mia kihhimag.

column2: While John was in prison he heard what the Messiah was doing, so he sent his disciples
column3: Kumd wa eda am wabsh kia kuhpch hegai John mad am i shonwuich g pahl wakona. Sh hegam mad ab si wecho e mashcham am ahgid mo haschu chikpan hab wua g Jesus. Kutsh am haꞌi ha cheha mat am wo hihim k ab wo kakke mas woho d Jiosh si Kehsha.

column2: to ask on his behalf, “Are you the one we were expecting to come, or should we continue to look for someone else?”
column3: k ab kakke g Jesus ch hab kaij, “Ab o t‑chehani g John matt ab wo m‑kakke maps woho d Jiosh si Kehsha aha nat ab hahawa hema wo i wuhsh mat d wo hegaik.”

column2: Jesus answered them, “Go back and tell John what you hear and what you see.
column3: D eda g Jesus am ahg g e‑kehg haꞌichu e‑ahga ch ha dodajid g kokꞌodam ch hab hahawa kaij ab ha wui hegam John chuhchai, “Am g uhpam wo hihim k wo ahgi g John mam haschu i kah ch haschu i neid.

column2: The blind can see, the crippled can walk, the lepers are healed, the deaf can hear, the dead are resurrected, and the poor hear the good news.
column3: Ha ani dodajid g pi ha dodajidam kokꞌodam ch pi neneadam ch pi hihimidkam ch pi chechkaidkam ch ha chechegitoichud g koꞌi ch am ha ahgid g shoꞌigkam mat g Jiosh wo ha doꞌibia.

column2: Blessed are those who don't reject me!”
column3: T g Jiosh ab wo s‑em‑hoꞌigeꞌidad mamtp hedai ab wabsh wo ni‑hiwgad.”

column2: As they left, Jesus began to talk to the crowds about John. “What were you expecting to see when you went out into the desert? A reed tossed about by the wind?
column3: Neh, d amjed gam hu uhpam hihi.

column2: So what did you go to see? A man dressed in fancy clothes? People dressed like that live in kings' palaces.
column3: Kumt pi hema s‑neidam mo s‑kakaisim e enigadadch. Hegam mo hab masma e enigadadch o si s‑kakaisim kih.

column2: So what did you go to see then? A prophet? Yes, and I tell you he is much more than a prophet!
column3: Neh, heg amt s‑kaim haꞌichu i tashogiddam k heg wa woho kah. K g John am baꞌich haꞌichu k ed ep kehk.

column2: He's the one this Scripture was written about: ‘I'm sending my messenger on ahead of you. He will prepare your way for you.’
column3: Heg o hab ahg g Jiosh ch hab kaij:

column2: What shall I compare this generation to? It's like children sitting in the market places shouting to each other,
column3: D hab ep kaij g Jesus, “Hegam mat pi ab hu wohog el g John k pi ab hu ni‑bei o hab masma pi ta wepoma mo g aꞌal. Neh, tp hems am wo chichwid g aꞌal ch hab wo ha ah,

column2: ‘We played the flute for you and you didn't dance; we sang sad songs and you didn't cry.’
column3: ‘Am att em‑gehged g e hohontam ha‑piastakaj. Kumt pi e waila. Am att nei g muhki neꞌi. Kumt pi shaꞌi shoshani.’

column2: John didn't come feasting and drinking, so people say, ‘He's devil-possessed!’
column3: Id ani hab ahg mat g John ab i wuhshani k pi ihꞌe g nawait ch muꞌikko pi e gegosid e hoꞌigeꞌidahunch Jiosh wui. K muꞌijj hab kaij mo g jiawul an uꞌukch g chegitoidaj.

column2: On the other hand the Son of man came and did feast and drink, and people say, ‘Look, he's greedy and drinks too much; he's a friend of tax collectors and sinners!’ But wisdom is shown to be right by what it does…”
column3: Nt ahni ia jiwia Jiosh si Kehsha k wabsh chum hedai ha wehm ni‑gegosid. K muꞌijj hab kaij mani s‑banma ch s‑iꞌidag ch d ha‑nawoj g s‑ta kekeꞌidamakam lial ha kowlantdam ch hegam mo pi ap oid g t‑chehanig. Neh, bo masma pi ta wepoma ch im hu hab wabsh i juh g Jiosh amichudadag. K wabshaba hegam mo ab s‑wohochud g wohokam am chehgidch mo d wohokam.”

column2: Then he began to reprimand the towns where he'd done most of his miracles because they had not repented.
column3: Muꞌi kihhim ed ad wa am hab junihim g s‑hasig haꞌichu g Jesus. D eda muꞌijj pi gam hu s‑ohhod g pi ap e‑chegitoi ab kahk. D g Jesus si s‑ha kehꞌid

column2: “Shame on you, Korazin! Shame on you, Bethsaida! If the miracles had been performed in Tyre and Sidon which happened among you, they would have repented in sackcloth and ashes long ago.  But I tell you that on the Day of Judgment it will be better for Tyre and Sidon than it will for you!
column3: ch ab kaij, “Muꞌi s‑hasig haꞌichu ant am hab juh Korasin ch Bethsaida kihhim ch ed. Kutki eda muijj amai pi ab hu ni‑wohochud k heg hekaj ab wo bei g s‑koꞌok e‑namkidadag geꞌe lodaita tash ch ed. Hegam mo am kih Tyre ch Sidon t am ch pi geꞌe mahch ab amjed g Jiosh at pi am hu hugkam wo bei g s‑koꞌok e‑namkidadag. Tp hems ab wo i e shoꞌigchud k gam hu wo s‑ohhod g pi ap e‑chegitoi matp wo nei ihda s‑hasig haꞌichu.

column2: And what about you, Capernaum? Will you be exalted to heaven? No, you'll go down to Hades! If the miracles had been performed in Sodom which happened among you, Sodom would still be here today.
column3: Capernaum t am hemajkam o ab si e haschud. T wabshaba g Jiosh gam hu wo shul Jiawul kih ed. Hegam mash wa am kih Sodombad t am at gam hu wo s‑ohhod g pi ap e‑chegitoi matp wo nei ihda s‑hasig haꞌichu. Kut pi wo chum padch g ha‑kihhim.

column2: But I tell you that on the Day of Judgment it will be better for Sodom than it will for you!”
column3: Idam at pi am hu hugkam wo bei g s‑koꞌok e‑namkidadag mat g Capernaum t am hemajkam mat hekid wo e ai g geꞌe lodaita.”

column2: Then Jesus prayed, “I praise you, Father, Lord of heaven and earth, for you've hidden these things from the clever and sophisticated. Instead you've revealed them to ordinary people. Yes, Father, you were pleased to do this!
column3: D g Jesus am hahawa e hoꞌigeꞌidahun k hab kaij, “Ni‑ohg Jiosh, dap kownal wehs haꞌichu dahm. K hab d m‑elida mat pi hedai wo e nako mas hejel wo s‑amich g haꞌichu m‑ahga. E o ehstokch am ha wehhejed g s‑chu aꞌamichuddam ch haꞌichu s‑mahchim. Kup wabshaba am ha chehgid idam mo haꞌichu s‑mahchimk hab masma mo g aꞌal. Ni heg hekaj ab si m‑hoꞌigeꞌid.”

column2: Everything has been entrusted to me by my Father, and no one really understands the Son, except the Father, and no one really understands the Father, except the Son, and those to whom the Son chooses to reveal him.
column3: D hab ep kaij ab ha wui g hemajkam, “Ni‑ohg at wehs haꞌichu ab ni‑mah. Pi o hedai s‑ni‑mahch ch heg waꞌi ni‑ohg s‑ni‑mahch. K pi hedai mahch g ni‑ohg. Ni ahni waꞌi s‑mahch ch hegam ehp mani hedai i ha wui tashogid.

column2: Come to me, all of you who struggle and who are burdened down. I will give you rest.
column3: “Ab g wo i e dagito ni‑wui wehsijj ahpim mam d gewpkokam. Kunt ahni ab wo i em‑mah g ulinihogig.

column2: Accept my yoke, and learn from me. For I am kind and I have a humble heart, and in me you will find the rest you need.  For my yoke is gentle, and my burden is light.”
column3: Pi o hasig g ni‑himdag ch pi wechima wo i em‑mohtoꞌi haꞌichu. Si ani s‑hemajima ch ab wabsh ni‑shoꞌigchud. Kumt ab ni‑amjed wo s‑mahch k wo e ulinihogidad. Hegai mant ab heheꞌejel wo em‑mohtoꞌi at wo s‑hawkk nant pi am wo i em‑wehmajk hab sha masma matt wo t‑makodadch g yehwakaj.” Neh, bo kaij g Jesus.

column2: Around that time Jesus was walking through fields of grain on the Sabbath day. His disciples were hungry so they started to pick ears of grain and eat them.
column3: Kuchd am hu hebai hihim t‑mihshmda tash ed. K am eshas g pilkani wohg huhugid an. Kutt bihugk k hekaj ab ha wohni g pilkani ch i mohon ch koꞌa.

column2: When the Pharisees saw this they said to Jesus, “Look at your disciples—they're doing what isn't allowed on the Sabbath!”
column3: Kudki t‑neid hegam Palasi ch hab kaij ab Jesus wui, “Nehꞌe, melchkwua o g t‑chehanig mo id hab wua mihshmda tash ch ed.”

column2: But Jesus told them, “Haven't you read what David did when he and his men were hungry?
column3: D g Jesus hab kaij ab ha wui, “Bo wabsh masma hab e wua matsh wa g Davidbad. Pi amtki chegitoi matsh heg has e juh am si i bihugimk. Bo chuꞌig g Jiosh oꞌohana

column2: He went into the house of God, and he and his men ate the sacred bread that they weren't allowed to eat since it's only for the priests.
column3: matsh am i wah geꞌe cheopi ch ed k am ui g pahn k huh hegam ha wehm mash am wehmaj. K d hegai pahn mo am e toꞌaw k ch hegam d waꞌi ha‑wuikam papal. T eda hemho wa am hab e juh. K heg hekaj am wa s‑apꞌe.

column2: Haven't you read in the law that on the Sabbath day the priests in the Temple break the Sabbath but are not considered guilty?
column3: “Am g ep wo oidahim mo g papal am hab junihim g e‑chikpan geꞌe cheopi ch ed mihshmda tash ed. K eda g Jiosh pi ha mohtoꞌid g chuꞌijig no pi hemho wa am hab junihim g e‑chikpan geꞌe cheopi ch ed.

column2: However I tell you that someone is here who is greater than the Temple!
column3: Kuni ahni baꞌich d i si haꞌichu mo g geꞌe cheopi.

column2: Then Jesus left and went into their synagogue.
column3: D am ha dagito g Jesus. Kuchd gam hu hihi hema wui g cheopi.

column2: A man was there with a crippled hand. “Does the law allow healing on the Sabbath?” they asked him, looking for a reason to accuse him.
column3: D am hema daha g oꞌodham mad g nowij mahnikodag.

column2: “Suppose you have a sheep and it falls into a hole in the ground on the Sabbath. Don't you grab hold of it and pull it out?” Jesus asked them.
column3: D hab kaij g Jesus ab ha wui, “Matp hems hema g em‑kahwaliga am wo gei wag ch ed mihshmda tash ed. Namt hig pi wo chikpan k wo i wuhshad?

column2: “Don't you think a human being is worth much more than a sheep? So yes, you are allowed to do good on the Sabbath.”
column3: Oꞌodham o baꞌich d i si haꞌichu mo g kahwal. Pegih, k g t‑chehanig am t‑hiwgid matt am hema wo i wehmt mihshmda tash ed.”

column2: Then he said to the man, “Hold out your hand.” The man held out his hand, and it was healed, just as healthy as the other hand.
column3: Neh, bad kaij ch hab hahawa ahg g mahnikokam, “Ab g si i shelin g e‑nowi.” Kud am wabsh i chum shelin k am waꞌi hekaj apꞌet.

column2: But the Pharisees went out and plotted how to kill Jesus.
column3: D amjed gam hu hihi g Palasi k e wehm aꞌaga mat has hig masma wo mua g Jesus.

column2: Knowing this, Jesus left, with large crowds following him. He healed all of them,
column3: D am i kah g Jesus mash am s‑muꞌamk k gam hu hih ab amjed amai. Kud muꞌi hemajkam am i oi. D wehs ha dodaj g kokꞌodam

column2: but instructed them not to tell people who he was.
column3: ab si ha chehanich mat pi hedai haꞌichu wo ahgidad ab amjed.

column2: This fulfilled what Isaiah the prophet said:
column3: Neh, bad wa masma hab e juh hegai matki g Isaiabad heki hu waꞌi oꞌoha matsh hab wo e juh. Oꞌohanaj o hab chuꞌig mash g Jiosh an aꞌaga g si e‑kehsha ch hab kaij:

column2: Then a man was brought to Jesus who was demon-possessed and blind and dumb. Jesus healed him, so that the dumb man could speak and see.
column3: D haꞌi g hemajkam am hema uꞌapa g oꞌodham Jesus wui. Kudki id pi nead ch pi ha neok nadki pi g jiawul an uꞌukch. D g Jesus doaj ihda oꞌodham. D hahawa e nako mad neok k ep haꞌichu neid.

column2: All the crowds were amazed, and asked, “Could this really be the son of David?”
column3: D g muꞌi hemajkam ab si has i el ihda k hab kaij, “Shahag wepo mo id d hegai Davidbad amjedkam mach ab nenida.”

column2: But when the Pharisees heard this, they replied, “This man can only throw out demons through the power of Beelzebub, the chief of demons!”
column3: D am i ha kah hegam Palasi k hab kaij, “Moki g jijawul ha‑geꞌejig ab mahkch g gewkdag. Kuki heg hekaj gam hu hab i ha wua g jijawul ab ha amjed hegam mo an ha uꞌukch.”

column2: Knowing what they were thinking, Jesus told them, “Any kingdom that is divided against itself will be destroyed. No town or household that is divided against itself can stand.
column3: D g Jesus s‑mahch mo haschu am chegito ch hab kaij ab ha wui, “S‑mahch am mat g oꞌodham wo padch g hejel e‑jewedga o g hejel e‑kihhim mat ab aꞌai wo e cheggia. T g e‑wehm kihkam hab waꞌap wo padch g hejel e‑kihdag mat ab aꞌai wo e cheggia.

column2: If Satan drives out Satan, then he's divided against himself—so how could his kingdom stand?
column3: Pegih, t has hig masma g ge Jiawul pi wo padch g hejel e‑kownaltalig matp ab wo sha ni‑mah g gewkdag mant am wo i ha wuwhas g piongaj.

column2: If I'm throwing out demons in the name of Beelzebub, in whose name are your people throwing out demons? Your own people prove you're wrong!
column3: Neh, hegam mo ab si em‑wecho e mashcham o hab waꞌap i ha wuwhasid g jijawul. Kum eda pi hab masma hab ha elid mo g Jiawul ab ha mahkch g gewkdag. Pegih, id o am wohokamchud mo pi woho hegai mam hab chum elid.

column2: But if I'm throwing out demons through the power of the Spirit of God, then the kingdom of God has come to you!
column3: Hekia S‑apꞌekam Gewkdag o ab ni‑mahkch ihda gewkdag mani hekaj gam hu hab i ha wua g jijawul. K id am wohokamchud mat heki hu in i wuhsh g Jiosh kownaltalig em‑shahgid.

column2: Can you enter a strong man's house and take his belongings unless you tie him up first? If you do that then you can take everything in his house.
column3: “Neh, wohppoꞌid ani g ge Jiawul hegam mo an ha uꞌukch. Kum s‑mahch mat pi hedai wo e nako mas am hu wabsh wo wah hema kih ed mat wo s‑haꞌahamak k am wo ui g enigaj, heg hi wa matp wehpeg wo wulsh.

column2: Those who are not with me are against me, and those who do not gather together with me do the opposite: they are scattering.
column3: “Hegai matp hedai pi ab hu wo i ni‑wehmajk o ab ni‑wui kehk ch wabsh ha gantan hegam mani s‑ha doꞌibiamk.

column2: That's why I'm telling you that every sin and blasphemy you commit will be forgiven, except blasphemy against the Spirit which won't be forgiven.
column3: Wehs o gam hu hab i junihog g pi ap ha‑chuꞌijig g Jiosh. K wabshaba si geꞌej g em‑chuꞌijig mamtp ab wo has ah g Hekia S‑apꞌekam Gewkdag. T g Jiosh pi hekid gam hu hab wo i juh.

column2: Those who say something against the Son of man will be forgiven, but those who say something against the Holy Spirit won't be forgiven, neither in this life nor the next.
column3: Im at hu hab wo i juh g Jiosh g chuꞌijigaj hegai mat ab wo has ni‑ah ahni Jiosh si Kehsha k wabshaba pi hekid gam hu hab wo i juh g chuꞌijigaj hegai mat wo has ah g Hekia S‑apꞌekam Gewkdag.

column2: Either decide that the tree is good, and its fruit is good, or decide that the tree is bad and its fruit is bad—for the tree is known by its fruit.
column3: “Mt wo s‑mai mas hedai d s‑apꞌekam oꞌodham hab masma mamt wo s‑mai mas s‑kehgaj g bahidkam uhs. S‑kehg uhs at wo s‑kehg bahidagt. T g pi kehg uhs wo pi kehg bahidagt.

column2: You viper's brood, how can you who are evil say anything good? For your mouth simply says what your mind is busy thinking about.
column3: Ahpim Palasi am hab sha masma mam d kohkꞌoi ch pi wo shaꞌi e nako mams s‑kehg haꞌichu hab wo chei nam pi d pi apꞌekam ch hemho wa am hab wo chei mo haschu am hab i chuꞌig em‑ihbdag ed.

column2: A good person brings out good from their store of good things, and an evil person brings out evil from their store of evil things.
column3: S‑kehg haꞌichu o am hab chuꞌig ihbdaj ed g s‑apꞌekam oꞌodham. Kut heg s‑kehg haꞌichu hab wo kaijjid. K pi kehg haꞌichu am hab chuꞌig ihbdaj ed g pi apꞌekam oꞌodham. Kut heg pi kehg haꞌichu hab wo kaijjid.

column2: I tell you, people will have to account for every careless thing they say on the Day of Judgment.  For what you say will either vindicate you or condemn you.”
column3: “Id ant hab wo chei mat hemho wa wehs haꞌichu am wo mahsko e wua lodaita tash ch ed mam haschu has i kaij id dahm jewed. Jiosh at wo hekaj g hejel em‑neꞌoki mat wo em‑lodai, chum hems g s‑pehegi em‑neꞌoki.”

column2: Then some of the religious teachers and Pharisees came to him and said, “Teacher, we want you to show us a miraculous sign.”
column3: D am haꞌi haꞌichug g chehanig t‑mashchamdam ch Palasi ch hab ahg g Jesus, “Ha mashchamdam, ab g t‑chehgid g s‑hasig haꞌichukaj maptp woho d Jiosh si Kehsha.”

column2: “Evil people who don't trust in God are the ones who look for a miraculous sign. The only sign they will be given is the sign of the prophet Jonah,” Jesus told them.
column3: D hab kaij g Jesus, “Si o hig woho pi apꞌe ch mehk ab amjed g Jiosh hegam mat pi ab hu wo ni‑hiwgam k hoꞌip nei g s‑hasig haꞌichu. Heg ant ab wo waꞌi ha chehgi mant am oidk hab wo ni‑juh hegai Jiosh haꞌichu i tashogiddam mash hab chehgig Jonah.

column2: “In the same way Jonah was in the belly of a huge fish for three days and three nights, the Son of man will be in the heart of the earth for three days and three nights.
column3: Id ash wa waik tash oidam am haꞌichug geꞌe watopi wohk ed. Neh, nt hab wa masma waik tash oidam am wo kahchk hihaꞌini ch ed ahni Jiosh si Kehsha.

column2: The people of Nineveh will rise in the judgment together with this generation and they will condemn it because they repented in response to Jonah's message—and as you see, there's someone greater than Jonah here!
column3: “Jonabad ash wa am ha ahgid g Ninevah t am hemajkam g Jiosh haꞌichu ahga. Kutsh wa gam hu s‑ohhod g pi ap e‑chegitoi k hab pi ab hu wo e chuꞌijigch geꞌe lodaita tash ch ed. Ni ahni baꞌich d i si haꞌichu mo g Jonabad. Kum eda pi ab hu ni‑kaiham ch heg hekaj ab wo motoig g chuꞌijig lodaita tash ed.

column2: The Queen of the South will be raised in the judgment together with this generation and will condemn it because she came from the ends of the earth to hear the wisdom of Solomon—and as you see, there's someone greater than Solomon here!
column3: “Mehkjed atsh ab i hih g uwi kownal ab Sheba jewed t amjed matsh ab wo kaiha g Solomonbad haꞌichu mahchig. Ni ahni baꞌich d i si haꞌichu mo g Solomonbad. Kum eda pi ab hu ni‑kaiham ch heg hekaj ab wo motoig g chuꞌijig lodaita tash ed.”

column2: When an evil spirit leaves someone, it wanders through deserted places looking for rest, and finds nowhere to stay.
column3: Kud hab ep kaij g Jesus, “Matp hems g jiawul an wo hema uꞌukch g oꞌodham k wabsh wo dagito mat am hebai ep wo e ul. Kut hegai oꞌodham wo i chum kegch g e‑doakag. T wabshaba g jiawul pi hebai wo chehg.

column2: So it says, ‘I'll go back to the place I left,’ and when it returns it finds the place empty, all clean and tidy.
column3: K hekaj hab wo i e ah, ‘Mo hig woho d ni‑kih hegai oꞌodham. Nt hig am uhpam wo hih wui.’ Kut wa woho am wo uhpam him k wo cheh mo am wabsh jeg ch si kegchudas ch hehosimhunas.

column2: Then it goes and brings back seven other spirits even more evil than it is, and it enters and lives there. So the person ends up worse than they were at the beginning. That's the way it will be with this evil generation.”
column3: T am haha wo him k wewaꞌak ep wo ha uꞌapa g jijawul. T idam baꞌich wo i pi apꞌek ch am wehmaj wo i chiwia. T ihda oꞌodham baꞌich wo i pi apꞌek mo wa ga hu i heki hu. Neh, bat wa masma hab wo e juh hegam mat pi gam hu wo s‑ohhod g pi ap e‑chegitoi.”

column2: While he was speaking to the crowds, his mother and his brothers arrived and stood outside, wanting to talk to him.
column3: Am ad wabsh kia ha wui neok g hemajkam g Jesus. Kud am haha wabsh dada g jeꞌej ch wepngaj s‑neidamk. D wabshaba si muꞌij g hemajkam an wehgaj. Kud heg hekaj gam hu wabsh mehk gegok.

column2: Someone came and told him, “Look, your mother and brothers are outside, wanting to talk to you.”
column3: D hema hegam mo an wehgaj gegok g Jesus hab kaij ab wui, “M‑jeꞌe ch m‑wepnag ash am hu gegok ch s‑m‑neidamk.”

column2: “Who is my mother? Who are my brothers?” Jesus asked.  He pointed at his disciples, and said, “Look, they are my mother and my brothers!
column3: D g Jesus hab ahg, “Neh, idam mo ab ni‑kaiham o heg wa wepo mo d ni‑jeꞌe ch ni‑wepnag.

column2: For those who do the will of my heavenly Father, they are my brother, sister, and mother!”
column3: Hegam mat hab wo junihid g ni‑ohg Jiosh tatchui o hab masma mo d ni‑wepnag ch ni‑jeꞌe.”

column2: Later that day Jesus left the house, and sat down to teach  beside the lake.
column3: Heg waꞌi tash ed achd gam hu hihi Galilee Kahchki wui. D am i chum dahiwua g Jesus mat wo t‑mashcha.

column2: So many people gathered around him that he got into a boat and sat down there to teach, while all the crowds stood on the beach.
column3: Kud wabshaba shaꞌi muꞌi hemajkam an e hemapai wehgaj. D heg hekaj gan hu i chesh g Jesus wahlko ch ed k an dahiwua k amjed ha mashcham. D g hemajkam an gegok shuhdagi koa an ch amjed ab kaiham.

column2: He explained many things to them, using stories as illustrations.
column3: Kud muꞌi haꞌichu ha tashogid g wepogida ahgakaj ab amjed g Jiosh kownaltalig. Id o d haꞌichu ahgaj mo hab kaij:

column2: “As he was sowing, some of the seeds fell on the path. The birds came and ate them up.
column3: T haꞌi gan hu shul wohg ch ed. T g uꞌuwhig am dada k koꞌito.

column2: Other seeds fell on stony ground where there wasn't much earth where they sprouted quickly.
column3: T haꞌi gan hu shul waw t ab mo pi geꞌej g jewed k ab ha hekaj hi wa chum i wuhsh no pi pi an hu juhk g jewed.

column2: The sun rose and scorched them and they withered because they had no roots.
column3: T ab i chesh g tash. Kut wabsh gaksh no ge mehk tatk.

column2: Other seeds fell among thorns that grew up and choked them.
column3: T haꞌi gan hu shul shaꞌi ch ed. Kut g shaꞌi ab i geꞌege k ha kokda g haꞌichu esha.

column2: Still other seeds fell on good soil. They produced a harvest—some one hundred, some sixty, and some thirty times what had been planted.
column3: T wabshaba hegam mat an s‑ap shul moihuna ch ed an wuhshani k muꞌi ab kait. Haꞌi at siant ab kait ch haꞌi chuhdpo wehst‑mahm ch haꞌi waikko wehst‑mahm.”

column2: Anybody who has ears should be listening!”
column3: Kud hab hahawa ep kaij g Jesus, “Neh, am g wo s‑ap i aꞌamichud ihda.”

column2: The disciples came to Jesus and asked him, “Why do you use illustrations when you speak to the people?”
column3: D am hahawa i e hejelko. Kuchd am wui hihim k ab kakke mas haschu ahgch pi ta amichudam ha mashcham g haꞌichu wepogidakaj.

column2: “You're privileged to have revealed to you the mysteries of the kingdom of heaven, but they're not given such insights,” Jesus replied.
column3: D hab kaij, “Nt wo em‑ahgi mo has d ahga no pi g Jiosh em‑hiwgid mamt wo s‑mai mo haschu hemu am maskogid ab amjed g e‑kownaltalig. Ni wabshaba heg waꞌi ha ahgid haꞌichu wepogida ahga hegam mo pi ab hu wohochudamk. T hab pi wo amich haꞌichu ab amjed g Jiosh kownaltalig.

column2: “Those who already have will have more given to them, more than enough. But those who don't have, whatever they have will be taken away from them.
column3: Hegam mat s‑ap wo hekaj g e‑apꞌedag at baꞌich ep wo i nei. T hegam mat pi ap wo hekaj wabsh wo heb hu wua.

column2: That's why I speak to them in illustrations. For even though they see, they do not see; and even though they hear, they do not hear; nor do they understand.
column3: Heg ani hekaj g haꞌichu wepogidakaj haꞌichu ha ahgid:

column2: So listen to the story of the sower.
column3: “Am ant haha wo em‑ahgi mani haschu chum em‑mashcham id hekaj haꞌichu ni‑ahga ab amjed g haꞌichu eshdam. Heg kaichka ani wepogid g Jiosh haꞌichu ahga. Id o am e gantan ha shahgid g hemajkam hab masma mo g haꞌichu kai.

column2: When people hear the message about the kingdom, and don't understand it, the Evil One comes along and rips out what was sown in their heart. This is what happens to the seeds sown on the path.
column3: K eda haꞌi pi amichud no pi g ha‑iꞌibdag s‑kawpk hab sha masma mo g wohg. K g Jiawul am wabsh s‑pehegi ha wohppoꞌid mo haschu i kah.

column2: The seeds sown on stony ground are people who hear the message and happily accept it straight away.
column3: “K haꞌi g ha‑iꞌibdag hab sha masma mo hebai pi geꞌej g jewed ab waw t ab. K idam si s‑hohhoꞌid ch kah g Jiosh haꞌichu ahga

column2: They last for a while, but because they don't have roots, when problems and troubles come, they quickly fall away.
column3: ch wabshaba pi wihnam ab hu uꞌukch ch am hi wa heꞌes wo i s‑chegitokahimch. T oi wa g kudutadag ab ha wui wo i hih. Kumt wo ha shoꞌigch id hekaj Jiosh haꞌichu ahga. T ha hekaj wabsh wo taꞌi i shul.

column2: The seeds sown among thorns are people who hear the message, but then life's worries and the temptation of money choke the message so that they become fruitless.
column3: “K haꞌi g ha‑iꞌibdag hab sha masma mo hebai s‑shaꞌig. K am ha shaꞌijidch g pihk ha‑elidadag ch s‑ha‑kaisdag. Kut pi haꞌichu wehhejed wo s‑kehgajk am Jiosh wehhejed.

column2: The seeds sown on good soil are people who hear the message, and understand it, and who produce a good harvest—some one hundred, some sixty, and some thirty times what was sown.”
column3: “K haꞌi g ha‑iꞌibdag s‑moik hab sha masma mo g moihuna. Idam at wo s‑amich g Jiosh haꞌichu ahga k am wo ahgachugad matp hems haꞌi siant ab ep wo ha baꞌiha k atp hems haꞌi chuhdpo wehst‑mahm k haꞌi g waikko wehst‑mahm ab ep wo ha baꞌiha.”

column2: Then he told them another illustrated story: “The kingdom of heaven is like a farmer who sowed good seeds in his field.
column3: Jesus ad am hema ep ha ahgi g hemajkam g haꞌichu wepogida hab kaijch, “Am ant baꞌichu ep wo i em‑tashogi g Jiosh kownaltalig wepogidch mat hema ei g s‑kehg kai e‑oid ed.

column2: But while his workers were sleeping, an enemy came and sowed weed seeds on top of the wheat. Then they left.
column3: T am hu hebai haha wabsh hema jiwia g obgaj chuhug ch ed mo wehsijj kohksh k g shaꞌi kai am ei ha shahgid g pilkani k gam hu hahawa ep hih.

column2: So when the wheat grew and produced ears of grain, the weeds also grew up.
column3: Kut am i wuhsh g eꞌes k ab i mudadt. T am hahawa s‑masma i wuhsh g shaꞌi.

column2: The farmer's workers came and asked him, ‘Sir, didn't you sow good seeds in your field? Where did the weeds come from?’
column3: “K hab kaij g eshdam pionag, ‘S hebai amjed i wuhsh g shaꞌi mapt wa eda t‑mah g s‑kehg kaichka.’

column2: ‘Some enemy has done this,’ he replied. ‘Do you want us to go and pull up the weeds?’ they asked him.
column3: “K hab kaij am ha wui, ‘Ni‑obga at hab juh ihda.’

column2: ‘No,’ he answered, ‘as you pull up the weeds, you might uproot the wheat too.
column3: “K hab ha ahg, ‘Piaꞌa. Mt wo am hu wabsh g pilkani ha huhpsh.

column2: Let them both grow until harvest, and then at harvest-time I'll tell the reapers, “First gather the weeds, tie them up into bundles and burn them. Then gather the wheat and store it in my barn.” ’ ”
column3: Am g wabsh wo hiwgid mat am e wehm wo wuwha. T ab wo e ai mat wo e hih. Kunt hab haha wo ha ahgi g hihkdam mat g shaꞌi wehpeg am wo ha huhpsh k am wo i hemapad k ged hu wo mehid k am haha wo i hemapai g pilkani k ged hu wo i baꞌiha.’ Neh, bo kaij g ha‑ahmo.”

column2: He gave them another illustration: “The kingdom of heaven is like a mustard seed that a farmer sowed in his field.
column3: D am hema ep ah g haꞌichu wepogida g Jesus hab kaijch, “Am ant heꞌes wo i em‑tashogi g Jiosh kownaltalig am wepogidch g haꞌichu kai.

column2: Even though it's the tiniest of seeds it grows much bigger than other plants. In fact it grows into a tree big enough for birds to roost in its branches.”
column3: Neh, heg am eꞌesha mo al chumaj ch oi wa am wo wuhshani k haꞌas wo i geꞌeda mo g s‑ehheg uhs. Tp hems g uꞌuwhig an ab wo koksht. Pegih, t hab wa masma wo geꞌe i geꞌeda g Jiosh kownaltalig, chum as al chum am wo shonwua.”

column2: He told them another illustrated story: “The kingdom of heaven is like yeast that a woman mixed with a large quantity of flour, until all the dough was raised.”
column3: D am hema ep ah g haꞌichu wepogida g Jesus hab kaijch, “Jiosh kownaltalig o hab waꞌap wepogidas mo g jewajidakud. Heg amt wo be k am wo wah wehnadk g chuꞌi k am heꞌes wo i dai. T wo chehmo g wahga mat wehs am wo i kopodka. Pegih, t g Jiosh kownaltalig hab wa masma wo chehmo g jewed.”

column2: Jesus explained all these things to the crowds using illustrated stories—in fact he didn't speak to them without using stories.
column3: Jesus ad haschu i ha ahgid g hemajkam ch heg waꞌi hekaj haꞌichu wepogida ahga.

column2: This fulfilled the prophet's words: “I will speak using stories, and I will explain things hidden from the creation of the world.”
column3: Heki atki hu waꞌi oꞌoha g kelibad Jiosh haꞌichu i tashogiddam mat id am hab wo wa e juh. K hab chuꞌig g oꞌohanaj:

column2: Then he left the crowds and went into a house. His disciples came over to him, and asked him, “Please explain to us the story about the weeds in the field.”
column3: D g Jesus gam hu ha dagito g hemajkam k ged hu i wah kih ch ed. Kuchd am wehmaj hihim k ab hahawa kakke mas has d ahga hegai wepogida ahga ab amjed g shaꞌi mo am t‑ahgid.

column2: “The one who sows the good seed is the Son of man,” Jesus explained.
column3: D hab kaij, “Heg ani wepogidas mo g haꞌichu eshdam ahni Jiosh si Kehsha.

column2: “The field is the world. The good seeds are the children of the kingdom. The weed seeds are the children of the Evil One.  The enemy that sowed the weed seeds is the devil. The harvest is the end of the world. The reapers are angels.
column3: K g oidag d ihda jewed. K g s‑kehg kai d hegam mat wo e doꞌibia k am wo haꞌichugk Jiosh kownaltalig ed. K g ni‑obga d jijawul ha‑geꞌejig. K g eshaj d hegam mat pi wo e doꞌibia. Hihka tash o d lodaita tash. K hegam mat hab wo juh g hihka d anghil.

column2: Just as the weeds are harvested and burned so it will be at the end of the world.
column3: “Hegai shaꞌi mehidda o hab d ahga mat g pi ap hehemajkam gam hu wo i e shul jiawul kih ed mat hekid wo i e ai g lodaita tash.

column2: The Son of man will send out his angels, and they will gather up every sinful thing and everyone who does evil,
column3: Am ant wo i ha chuhcha g anghil ahni Jiosh si Kehsha. Kut ab wo i hihi jewed wui k gam hu hab wo i juh hegai matp haschu am wo i em‑wua pi apꞌekam ch ed

column2: and will throw them into the blazing furnace, where there will be weeping and grinding of teeth.
column3: k gam hu wo ha shul g pi ap chuꞌijkam mei ch ed. T idam wo si shoanid ch ga hu wabsh wo i si e kiꞌisch nat pi wo shaꞌi si s‑koꞌok haꞌichu nakogad.

column2: Then those who live rightly will shine like the sun in the kingdom of their father. Anybody with ears should be listening!
column3: T am hahawa wo si tondad g s‑apꞌekam hemajkam e‑ohg Jiosh kownaltalig ed. Neh, am g wo i aꞌamichud ihda ahpim mam kah!”

column2: The kingdom of heaven is like treasure hidden in a field. A man found it, reburied it, and then full of joy went and sold all he had and bought that field.
column3: D am hema ep ah g Jesus g haꞌichu wepogida ahga hab kaijch, “Jiosh kownaltalig o heg wepogidas mo g s‑namkig haꞌichu mat am hema ehsto oidag ch ed k hahawa muh. T am hema haha wabsh chehg k am wabsh uhpam i maꞌishp k si s‑hehgig ch am i wehs gagda g haꞌichu e‑eniga k am hahawa uhpam ep him k wabsh wehs ha nolawt ihda oidag.”

column2: The kingdom of heaven is also like a trader looking for good pearls.  When he found the most expensive pearl ever he went and sold all he had and bought it.
column3: Kud hab ep kaij g Jesus, “Bamt masma wo s‑behim g Jiosh kownaltalig mat g s‑namkig hohodai nolawtdam wo s‑behim hegai mat wehs ha baꞌich wo i s‑kehgajk. Heg at wehs wo gagda g haꞌichu e‑eniga mat wo e nakog k wo ha nolawt hegai s‑namkigchu.”

column2: Once more, the kingdom of heaven is like a fishing net thrown into the sea that caught all kinds of fish.
column3: D hab ep kaij g Jesus, “Am ant heꞌes wo i em‑tashogi g Jiosh kownaltalig am wepogidch g waptopi uꞌikud chuagia. Heg at am wo wua g waptopi ha uꞌudam shuhdagi ch ed. T am wo e baꞌiha g nahnko mahs waptopi.

column2: When it was full it was dragged ashore. The good fish were put into baskets while the bad ones were thrown away.
column3: Kut am wo i wanchkwua shuhdagi hugid an k am wo dahiwua k wo i ha gawulkad k hegam wo e toꞌi mo s‑kehgaj k g pi kehg waptopi gam hu wo nehnich.

column2: That's the way it will be when the end of the world comes. The angels will go out and separate the evil people from the good,
column3: Bat wo wa masmak mat hekid wo i e ai g lodaita tash. Anghil at am wo aꞌai hihim k am wo i ha gawulkai g pi apꞌekam hemajkam

column2: and throw them into the blazing furnace where there will be weeping and grinding of teeth.
column3: k ged hu wo ha shul mei ch ed. T idam wo si shoanid ch ga hu wabsh wo i si e kiꞌishch nat pi wo shaꞌi si s‑koꞌok haꞌichu nakogad.”

column2: Now do you understood everything?”
column3: D g Jesus ab hahawa t‑kakke, “Namt am wa s‑amich wehs ihda?”

column2: “Every religious teacher who's learned about the kingdom of heaven is like a house-owner who brings out from his storeroom both new and old treasures,” Jesus said.
column3: D hab hahawa ep kaij ab t‑wui, “Pegih, mt hahawa pi wabsh g Jiosh heki hu oꞌohana wo ha mashchamad ch wabshaba id wehnadk ep wo ha mashchamad wechij mashchama ab amjed g Jiosh kownaltalig.”

column2: After Jesus finished telling these stories, he left.
column3: D g Jesus am i haꞌasa ah idam haꞌichu wepogida ahga.

column2: He went back to his home town and taught in the synagogue there. People were amazed, and asked, “Where does he get his wisdom and miracles from?
column3: Kuchd gam hu hihi Nazareth wui mo am d si kihkam. D g Jesus am haꞌichu ha mashcham ha‑cheopi ed.

column2: Isn't this the carpenter's son? Isn't his mother's name Mary, and his brothers James, and Joseph, and Simon, and Judas?
column3: No hig pi woho d alidaj hegai t‑nawojbad mo d huk chikpandam? No hig pi g Mary d jeꞌej ch g wepngaj d James ch Joses ch Simon ch Jude.

column2: Don't his sisters live here among us? So where does he get all this from?”
column3: Ia o wa kih g uꞌuwigaj. Kus hebai mai wehs ihda.”

column2: And so they refused to believe in him.
column3: Neh, bad kaij ch wabsh pi haꞌichuch.

column2: Since they failed to trust in him, he did not do many miracles there.
column3: Neh, bad kaij ch pi muꞌi s‑hasig haꞌichu hab juh amai no pi pi ab hu wohochud idam mas d Jiosh si Kehsha.

column2: At that time Herod the tetrarch heard what Jesus was doing
column3: D eda am hahasko haꞌi d ha‑kokownalig g Tutuligo ch d giꞌik. D idam am hema d kownal Galilee chekshani ch ed ch hab chehgig Herod. Kumd eda wehsko aꞌaga g Jesus.

column2: and he told his servants, “He must be John the Baptist resurrected from the dead, and that's why he has such powers!”
column3: Kush id hab ha ahgid g e‑hahaꞌichuga, “Heg oki d hegai mo wa ha pahl wapkonahim ch hab chehgig John. Mua ant. Kutki wabshaba uhpam e chegito k hekaj hab e nakog mat hab wo juh g s‑hasig haꞌichu.”

column2: Herod had detained John, and had him put in chains and imprisoned on account of Herodias, the wife of Philip, his brother.
column3: Herod atsh wa an bei g John k wulshp k ged hu si kuh am wehhejed g e‑hohnig. Id ash hab chehgig Herodias ch ash d chum hohnigaj g Herod wehnag. Kush heg hab chehgig Philip. Tsh g Herod ehs g hohnigaj.

column2: For John had told him, “It's not legal for you to marry her.”
column3: Sh amjed g John chum hekid hab a aꞌaga, “Mo pi shaꞌi hiwgidas maps g e‑wehnag hohnig wo ehs.” Kush g Herodias heg hekaj ahgid g Herod mat ged hu wo si kuh.

column2: Herod wanted to kill John but he was afraid of the people's reaction for they considered John a prophet.
column3: Tsh g Herod chum s‑muꞌam nash pi am ahg g pi ap ha‑chuꞌijig. K wabshaba g Tutuligo hab kaij mo d Jiosh haꞌichu i tashogiddam. Kush s‑ha ehbid ch hekaj pi mua.

column2: However, on Herod's birthday the daughter of Herodias danced for the party, and Herod was delighted with her.
column3: Kutsh am i e ai g Herod mahsidag. Sh geꞌe piastchud. Tsh g Herodias uwi mad am e waila ha tahgio. Tsh g Herod si s‑hohhoꞌi ihda

column2: So he promised with an oath to give her whatever she wanted.
column3: k wehs ha kaichudch si s‑kaidam hab kaij mat hemho wa wo mah mat haschu ab wo i tai.

column2: Prompted by her mother, she said, “Give me here on a plate the head of John the Baptist.”
column3: Sh g jeꞌej hab ahg mat hab wo chei mat ab wo mah g moꞌoj g John am hoas‑haꞌa ch ed dahshk. Tsh wa woho heg ab tai.

column2: Then the king regretted the promise he had made, but because of the oaths he'd made in front of his dinner guests, he gave the order to do it.
column3: Kutsh si pi ap e taht g kownal. Sh wabshaba wehsijj kah mo has i kaij. Tsh heg hekaj pi e nako mas pi am hu hab wo juh

column2: The order was passed on and John was beheaded in prison.
column3: k am hahawa hema cheha g shondal mat an wo him k wo shonch g John moꞌo.

column2: John's head was brought on a plate and given to the girl, who took it to her mother.
column3: Tsh wa woho hab e juh k am hahawa uꞌapa g moꞌoj am hoas‑haꞌa ch ed dahshch k ab mah ihda uwi. Kut ihda gd hu hahawa epai mah g e‑jeꞌe.

column2: John's disciples came and took the body, and buried him. Then they went and told Jesus.
column3: Kutsh am hahawa dada hegam mad ab si wecho e mashcham g John k am bei g honshpadaj k ged hu chehg k am hahawa hihim k ged hu ahgid g Jesus.

column2: When Jesus heard the news he went away by boat to a quiet place to be alone, but when the crowds learned where he was, they followed him on foot from the towns.
column3: D am i kah g Jesus mamt mua g John k am hahawa gam hu hejelko s‑himimk. Kuchd an dadhaiwua wahlko ch ed k gam hu aigo i chehchsh haꞌabjed. Dki wabshaba kah g hemajkam k gn hu i bihbij wabsh hihimk.

column2: When Jesus got out of the boat and saw the huge crowds, he was full of sympathy for them, and healed their sick.
column3: Kuchd am dada k am wabsh i chum huhud. D eda muꞌijj am heki hu haꞌichug g hemajkam. D g Jesus si i s‑ha hoꞌigeꞌid k ha dodaj g kokꞌodam.

column2: As evening came the disciples went up to him and said, “This place is miles from anywhere and it's getting late. Send the crowds away so they can go to the villages and buy food for themselves.”
column3: D gam hu si i juh. Kuchd am wui dada g Jesus k hab chum ahg, “Neh, mehk at waꞌi juh. K eda ia hu wabsh si jegko. Am g ha ahgid g hemajkam mat gam hu wo hihi kihhim wui k wo ha nolawt g haꞌichu hugi mat wo huh.”

column2: But Jesus told them, “They don't need to leave. You give them something to eat!”
column3: D hab kaij g Jesus ab t‑wui, “Ahpim amt wo haꞌichu ha mah mat wo huh.”

column2: “All we have here are five loaves and a couple of fish,” they replied.
column3: Kuchd hab kaij ab wui, “Pi ach geꞌe haꞌichu edgid. Al hetasp sismito ch gohk waptopi ach am toꞌakch.”

column2: “Bring them to me,” said Jesus.
column3: D hab hahawa ep kaij g Jesus, “Ab g wo i uꞌukaꞌi.” Kud am e uꞌapa.

column2: He told the crowds to sit down on the grass. Then he took the five loaves and the two fish, looked up to heaven and blessed them. After that he broke the loaves into pieces and gave the bread to the disciples, and the disciples gave it to the crowds.
column3: D am hahawa ha cheha g hemajkam mat am wo dadhaiwua washai ch ed. Kud am dadhaiwua. Kud am ui ihda hetasp sismito ch gohk waptopi k am e dahm i nen k ab hoꞌigeꞌel g Jiosh k am hahawa hahain k ab t‑mah. Kuchd gam hu aꞌai ha mahkhi g hemajkam.

column2: Everybody ate until they were full. Then they collected up the leftovers which filled twelve baskets.
column3: Kuchd wehsijj hug k kokwod. Kuchd ahchim chuhchaij an hahawa i uꞌihim k uꞌapa g wihpiꞌidaj mat am huꞌi gamai gohk hoha wo ha shuhshud.

column2: Some five thousand men ate the food, not counting women and children.
column3: Kuchd am hu d i hetasp mihl chechoj ch muꞌijj g uꞌuwi ch aꞌal ehp.

column2: Right after this he made the disciples get into the boat and go back to the other side of the lake while he sent the crowds on their way.
column3: D am hahawa t‑ahgi g Jesus matt gam hu aigo wo hihi. Tsh heg am wo wiꞌi k am wo ha ahgi g hemajkam mat gam hu wo hihi e‑kihki wui. Kuchd an i chehchsh wahlko ch ed k gam hu hihi.

column2: After he'd sent the crowds away, he went up into the mountains to pray. Evening came and he was there all alone.
column3: D g Jesus am ha dagito g hemajkam. Kud gam hu himto. D am hahawa hejel i chesh kawulk dahm k am e hoꞌigeꞌidahu. D am i hud. D am wabsh kia hejel haꞌichug.

column2: By now the boat was a long way out from land, being pounded by the waves because the wind was blowing against it.
column3: D g t‑wahlko gam hu si eda i cheka g shuhdagi. Kud g hewel ab si s‑gewkam meh ab t‑wui. D g shuhdagi toꞌotonk am si aꞌai hab t‑wua wehs s‑chuhugam oidk.

column2: About 3 a.m. Jesus caught up with them, walking on the sea.
column3: Kud koi mahsi. D ab hema him t‑wui an wabsh shuhdagi dahm.

column2: When the disciples saw him walking on the sea, they were terrified. They screamed out in fear, “It's a ghost!”
column3: Kuchd ab i neidok si s‑ehbeni ch si hihnk ch hab kaij mo d wabsh kokꞌoi.

column2: But immediately Jesus said to them, “Don't worry, it's me! Don't be afraid!”
column3: D ab hahawa si t‑wui neok ch d Jesus ch hab kaij, “Pi g wo shaꞌi ni‑ehbenid. Dani ahni. Mt oi wo s‑ap e taht.”

column2: “Lord, if it's really you, tell me to come over to you, walking on the water,” Peter replied.
column3: Kud g Peter si s‑kaidam hab kaij ab wui, “Ni‑kownalig, maptp d wo ahpik ch ab wo i ni‑wai. Nt ab wo i hih m‑wui an wabsh shuhdagi dahm.”

column2: “Come on then,” said Jesus. Peter got out of the boat and walked on the water towards Jesus.
column3: D hab kaij g Jesus, “Oi g ab i hihm.”

column2: But when he saw how strong the wind was, he became scared, and started to sink. “Lord! Save me!” he cried out.
column3: D wabshaba am wabsh si s‑gewkam hewed. D g Peter si s‑ehbenid k gam hu wabsh i wachumkahi shuhdagi ch ed k ab si e shoꞌigchud k hab kaij, “Ni‑kownalig, ni‑doꞌibiani.”

column2: Immediately Jesus reached out and grabbed hold of him, and said, “You have such little trust in me. Why did you doubt?”
column3: D ha hekaj am i wuhshad g Jesus k hab kaij ab wui, “Pi apki ab hu si ni‑hiwig.”

column2: When they got into the boat, the wind died down,
column3: D ged hu hahawa e wehm i chehchsh wahlko ch ed. D am waꞌi hekaj huhug g hewel.

column2: and those in the boat worshiped him, saying, “You really are the Son of God!”
column3: Kuchd ab hahawa si has elid ch ab ihm g Jesus ch hab kaij ab wui, “Woho apki d Jiosh alidag.”

column2: After crossing the lake they arrived at Gennesaret.
column3: Ga achd hu aigo i chehchsh k ab dada Gennesaret t am.

column2: When the people there realized Jesus was there, they let everyone in the whole area know. They brought all who were sick to him,
column3: Kud g hemajkam s‑amich g Jesus k hekaj ab i ha wai g kokꞌodam wehsko an heg oidk chekshani. Md ha uꞌapa Jesus wui

column2: and pleaded with him to let the sick just touch the edge of his cloak. Everyone that touched him was healed.
column3: k ab si e shoꞌigchud k ab ahgid mat chum hems wabsh g kahbaj hugidag an wo taht. Kud s‑ap ha doda mad hedai an i taht.

column2: Then some Pharisees and religious teachers from Jerusalem came to Jesus and asked him,
column3: D am haꞌi dada g Palasi ch chehanig ha mashchamdam ab Jerusalem t amjed k ab kakke g Jesus hab kaijch,

column2: “Why do your disciples break the tradition of our forefathers by not washing their hands before they eat a meal?”
column3: “K haschu ahgch g m‑pionag pi ab hu wohog elid g haꞌichu ha‑mashchamadag g kekelibad? Neh, e o gegosid pi am hu t‑himdag oidch ha wapkonk g e‑nohnhoi.”

column2: “Why do you break God's commandment because of your tradition?” Jesus replied.
column3: D hab kaij g Jesus ab ha wui, “M ahpim haschu ahgch pi ab hu wohog elid g Jiosh chehanig ch wabsh g hejel e‑himdag am hab junihim?

column2: “For God said, ‘Honor your father and mother,’ and ‘Those who curse their father or mother should be put to death.’
column3: Id o d chehanigaj g Jiosh mo hab chuꞌig:

column2: He called the crowd over and told them, “Listen, and understand this:
column3: D g Jesus ab hahawa i ha wai g hemajkam k hab kaij ab ha wui, “Ab g wo ni‑kaiham k wo s‑amich.

column2: it's not what goes into you through your mouth that defiles you. It's what comes out of your mouth that defiles you.”
column3: Pi at im hu hab wo i em‑juh g Jiosh heg hekaj mamt haschu wo huh k wabshaba im hu hab wo i em‑juh heg hekaj pi kehg em‑chegitoidag.”

column2: Then Jesus' disciples came to him and said, “You do realize that the Pharisees were offended by what you said.”
column3: Kuchd am dada wui ahchim k hab kaij, “Nap s‑mahch mat si e taht g Palasi heg hekaj map hab kaij?”

column2: “Every plant my heavenly Father didn't plant will be uprooted,” Jesus replied.  “Forget about them—they are blind guides. If a blind man leads another blind man, then they'll both fall into a ditch.”
column3: D hab kaij g Jesus, “Pi g has wo e tahtkkad ab ha amjed. Do chum em‑wanimeddam ch eda hab sha masma mo d pi neneadam ch chum ha wanimed g haꞌi ep pi neneadam ch atp hems am wabsh ha wehm wo i shul hiktani ch ed. Ni‑ohg Jiosh at gam hu hab wo i ha juh hab sha masma mamt wo huhpsh k gam hu wo nehnich g haꞌichu wuhshdag am e‑esha ed.”

column2: Then Peter asked, “Please tell us what you mean by this illustration.”
column3: D g Peter ab neok ch hab kaij, “Am g t‑ahgid maps haschu tashogid ch hab kaij mat pi im hu hab wo i t‑juh g Jiosh heg hekaj matt haschu wo huh.”

column2: “Haven't you understood this yet?” replied Jesus.
column3: D hab kaij g Jesus ab t‑wui, “Kumt ahpim hab waꞌap pi koi shaꞌi amich hegai mani em‑ahgid.

column2: “Don't you see that whatever goes in through the mouth then passes through the stomach, and then leaves the body as waste?
column3: Pi at im hu hab wo i em‑juh ab amjed g Jiosh mamtp haschu wo huh.

column2: But what comes out through the mouth comes from the mind, and that's what defiles you.
column3: Heg at im hu hab wabsh wo i em‑juh ab amjed g Jiosh mat wo pi apꞌek g em‑chegitoi.

column2: For what comes from the mind are evil thoughts, murder, adultery, sexual immorality, theft, false witness, and blasphemy
column3: Heg at hab wo em‑juh mamt hab wo juh g haꞌichu pi apꞌekam. Neh, mtp hems wo ha mua o wo ha ehs g ha‑wehm kihkam o hab wo juh g s‑tohntom haꞌichu o wo haꞌichu ha ehs o wo haꞌichu ha iattogi ab hema i ep amjed o wo pi ap neo.

column2: and those are what defile you. Eating with unwashed hands doesn't defile you.”
column3: Id o d hegai mat im hu hab wo i em‑juh ab amjed g Jiosh. Pi at heg im hu hab wo i em‑juh mamt pi am hu ha‑chehanig oidk wo wapko g e‑nohnhoi k haha wo e gegos.”

column2: Jesus left and went to the region of Tyre and Sidon.
column3: Kuchd gam hu hahawa hihi Syria jewed wui k am miabi g Tyre ch Sidon kihhim.

column2: A Canaanite woman from that area came, shouting out, “Lord, son of David! Please have mercy on me, because my daughter is suffering badly because she's possessed by a demon!”
column3: D am hema d uwi ch pi d t‑wehm oꞌodham ch am t‑wui jiwia k hab kaij ab wui g Jesus, “S‑apꞌekam ni‑kownalig mapsh d Davidbad amjedkam, ab g si i s‑ni‑hoꞌigeꞌid. Ni‑chehiaga o g jiawul an uꞌukch ch si shoꞌigchud.”

column2: But Jesus didn't reply at all. His disciples came to him and told him, “Tell her to stop following us. All her shouting is really annoying!”
column3: D wabshaba g Jesus pi ab hu has shaꞌi kaij wui. Kuchd ab si ahgid mat hig wo cheha mat gam hu wo hih no pi an t‑oidahim ch si s‑nakosig.

column2: “I was sent only to the lost sheep of the house of Israel,” Jesus said to the woman.
column3: D hab kaij g Jesus ab wui ihda uwi, “Heg o d waꞌi ni‑chikpan idani mant wo i ha wehmt g Tutuligo hemajkam.”

column2: But the woman came and kneeled before him, and said, “Lord, please help me!”
column3: D ab ha hekaj i gei wecho ihda uwi k hab kaij, “Am g hig i ni‑wehmt.”

column2: “It's not right to take the children's food and throw it to the dogs,  Jesus told her.
column3: D hab kaij g Jesus, “Heg at wo wa wepok mamt ab wo ha mah g gogogs g ha‑chechmait g aꞌal.”

column2: “Yes, Lord, but even dogs are allowed to eat crumbs that fall from their master's table,” she replied.
column3: D hab kaij hegai uwi, “Woho o wa. T wabshaba chum hems g gogogs am wo huh g aꞌal ha‑haꞌichu hugi hahainig. Kunt ahni hab wa masma wo si s‑ap ni‑taht mapt id am hab wo al i ni‑juni.”

column2: “You have great trust in me,” Jesus answered. “Your wish is granted!” And her daughter was healed immediately.
column3: D hab hahawa kaij g Jesus ab wui, “Neh, m‑neꞌoki o am chehgid map ab si ni‑hiwig. T heg hekaj am hab wo e juh ihda map ab ni‑tahni.” Kutsh am waꞌi hekaj doa hegai chehiagaj.

column2: Jesus returned, passing by the Sea of Galilee. He went into the mountains nearby where he sat down.
column3: Amjed achd gam hu hahawa ep hihi Galilee shuhdagi babsho. D g Jesus am i chesh kawulk dahm.

column2: Huge crowds came to him, bringing those who were lame, blind, crippled, dumb, and many others who were sick. They laid them on the ground at his feet, and he healed them.
column3: Kud muꞌijj am dada g hemajkam k am ha uꞌapa g pi hihimidkam ch pi neneadam ch pi neneokdan ch muꞌi nahnko mahs kokꞌodam. D g Jesus ha dodaj.

column2: The crowd was astounded at what they saw happen: the deaf could speak, the crippled were healed, the lame could walk, and the blind could see. They praised the God of Israel.
column3: Kud si has i elid g hemajkam neidok mo neneok g mumio ch g pi hihimidkam oiopo ch g momjo hahawa ab wehsig ch g pi neneadam s‑ap haꞌichu neid. D wehsijj ab si has elid g Jiosh.

column2: Jesus called his disciples over and told them, “I feel really sorry for all these people, because they've been with me now for three days, and they have nothing to eat. I don't want to send them away hungry, in case they faint on their way home.”
column3: D g Jesus ab hahawa i t‑waid k hab kaij, “Neh, waik tashkaj in o waꞌi t‑wehmaj idam hemajkam ch heki hu waꞌi pi haꞌichu huh. Ni s‑ha hoꞌigeꞌid. Tp hems haꞌi wo s‑e chuhugi matp gam hu wo sha hihi pi haꞌichu hugok.”

column2: “Where could we find enough bread here in this desert to feed such a huge crowd?” the disciples responded.
column3: Kuchd hab kaij ab wui, “Kuchs hebai hig wo ui g haꞌichu hugi id eda tohono jewed matt hekaj wo ha gegos g haꞌakia hemajkam?”

column2: “How many loaves of bread do you have?” Jesus asked.
column3: D hab kaij g Jesus, “Heꞌekia at am i wih g sismito?”

column2: Jesus told the crowd to sit down on the ground.
column3: D g Jesus am hahawa ha chehani g hemajkam mat wo dadhaiwua. Kud am dadhaiwua.

column2: He took the seven loaves and the fish, and after blessing the food he broke it into pieces and gave it to the disciples, and the disciples gave it to the crowds.
column3: D am ha ui hegam wewaꞌak sismito ch waptopi k ab hoꞌigeꞌel g Jiosh k am i hahain k ab t‑mah. Kuchd an i ha mahkhi g hemajkam.

column2: Everybody ate until they were full, and then they collected the leftovers, filling seven baskets.  Four thousand men ate the food, not counting women and children.
column3: D wehsijj hug k oi wa hi si s‑kokwod chum as am hu hebai d giꞌik mihl chechoj ch muꞌi ehp mo d uꞌuwi ch aꞌal ch pi kuintas. Kuchd an hahawa i uꞌihi g wihpiꞌidaj mat am huꞌi wewaꞌak hoha wo ha shuhshud.

column2: Then he sent the crowds away, got into a boat, and went to the Magadan region.
column3: D g Jesus am hahawa ha ahgi g hemajkam mat gam hu wo hihi. Kuchd gan hu dadhaiwua wahlko ch ed k gam hu aigo i chehchsh Magadan chekshani am.

column2: The Pharisees and Sadducees came to test Jesus, demanding that he show them a sign from heaven.
column3: D am haꞌi dada g Palasi ch Sajusi k ab neꞌowin g Jesus ch ab chum si chehani mat am wo ha chehgi g si s‑hasig haꞌichu matp woho d Jiosh si Kehsha.

column2: Jesus replied, “In the evening you say, ‘It'll be a fine day tomorrow, because the sky is red,’  while in the morning you say, ‘It'll be bad weather today, because the sky is red and overcast.’ You know how to predict the weather by what the sky looks like, but you can't recognize the signs of the times!
column3: D hab kaij g Jesus ab ha wui, “Neh, s‑mahch am mat has mahs tash ab wo himad ab wabsh neidch mas hebaijed hewed ch has mahs chewagi i wushke. Pegih, mt hab waꞌap wo chum s‑mahchk mo haschu has e junihog iaꞌi idani am neidch mo haschu hab e junihim.”

column2: Evil people who don't trust in God are the ones who look for a miraculous sign, and no sign will be given to them except the sign of Jonah.” He left them and went away.
column3: D hab ep kaij, “Si o hig woho pi apꞌe ch mehk ab amjed g Jiosh hegam mat pi ab hu wo ni‑hiwgam k hoꞌip nei g s‑hasig haꞌichu. Heg ant ab wo waꞌi ha chehgi mant am oidk hab wo ni‑juh hegai kelibad Jiosh haꞌichu i tashogiddam mash d Jonah.” Bad cheꞌiok k am ha dagito k gam hu hih.

column2: Going to the other side of the lake, the disciples forgot to bring bread with them.
column3: Kuchd am gahi ep i shul wahlko ch ed k ga hu aigo dada k s‑mai machdki pi haꞌi uꞌuk g sismito.

column2: “Watch out for the yeast of the Pharisees and Sadducees,” Jesus told them.
column3: D am waꞌi hekaj mad hab kaij g Jesus ab t‑wui, “Si g wo s‑e nenꞌoidk mat pi wo em‑cheawogi g ha‑jewajidakud hegam Palasi ch Sajusi.”

column2: The disciples started arguing among themselves. “He's saying that because we didn't bring any bread,” they concluded.
column3: Kuchd am si aꞌaga ihda k hab kaij, “Heg oki hekaj hab kaij mattki pi haꞌi uꞌuk g sismito.”

column2: Jesus knew what they were saying and said, “You have so little trust in me! Why are you arguing among yourselves about not having any bread?
column3: Kudki s‑t‑amichud g Jesus ch hab kaij, “Pi amki koi amichud mani heꞌes edgid g gewkdag ch hekaj am aꞌaga mach pi ha sismitoga.

column2: Haven't you worked it out yet? Don't you remember the five loaves that fed five thousand? How many baskets of leftovers did you collect?
column3: Am am wa chum neid mant al hetasp sismitokaj ha gegos g hetasp mihl chechoj ch muꞌi ehp. Ms huꞌi pi chegito mamt heꞌekia i hoha an i ui g wihpiꞌidaj.

column2: And what about the seven loaves that fed the four thousand? How many baskets of leftovers did you collect?
column3: Kum am wa chum neid mant al wewaꞌak sismitokaj ha gegos g giꞌik mihl chechoj ch muꞌi ehp. Ms huꞌi pi chegito mamt heꞌekia i hoha an i ui g wihpiꞌidaj.
