column2: Haven't you worked it out yet that I wasn't talking to you about bread? Watch out for the yeast of the Pharisees and Sadducees!”
column3: Pegih, mt wo chum s‑mahchk mani pi wabsh g haꞌichu hugi hab ahg ch hab kaij mamt wo s‑e nenꞌoidad ab amjed g Palasi ch Sajusi ha‑jewajidakud.”

column2: Then they realized that he wasn't warning them to watch out for bread yeast, but about the teachings of the Pharisees and Sadducees.
column3: Kuchd am hahawa i s‑amich moki pi heg hab ahg jewajidakud mo hekaj e pahnt ch oki heg hab ahg Palasi ch Sajusi ha‑mashchamadag.

column2: When Jesus arrived in the region of Caesarea Philippi, he asked his disciples, “Who do people say that the Son of man is?”
column3: Kuchd gam hu hahawa hihim k am i miabi g Cesaria Philippi kihhim. D g Jesus ab t‑kakke ch hab kaij, “Am g wo ni‑ahgid Dohꞌo ni‑elid g hemajkam?”

column2: “Some say John the Baptist, some say Elijah, and others say Jeremiah or one of the other prophets,” they replied.
column3: Kuchd hab kaij, “Haꞌijj o hab m‑elid map d hegai Johnbad mo wa chum t‑pahl wapkonahim ch haꞌijj hab kaij map d Elijabad o Jeremiabad o hema i ep kekelibad Jiosh haꞌichu i tashogiddam.”

column2: “But what about you?” he asked them. “Who do you say I am?”
column3: D ab hahawa ep t‑kakke, “M ahpim hig hedai ni‑elid?”

column2: “You are the Messiah, the Son of the living God,” Simon Peter replied.
column3: D ihda Simon mamt hab hahawa chehch Peter hab kaij, “Dap Jiosh alidag ch d si Kehshaj g Jiosh,”

column2: “You are truly blessed, Simon son of John,” Jesus told him. “For this wasn't revealed to you by human flesh and blood, but by my Father in heaven.
column3: D hab kaij g Jesus, “Simon, Jiosh at si s‑m‑hoꞌigeꞌid k am m‑chehgi mani d si Kehshaj. Pi at wabsh g hemajkam am m‑chehgi.

column2: I also tell you that you are Peter,  and on this rock I will build my church and the powers of death won't overcome it.
column3: Kupt ab i s‑wohoch g Jiosh k ab si ni‑hiwig. Nt heg hekaj hab wo m‑chehch Peter (Hodai). Neh, id ab waw ant am wo i kei g ni‑cheopiga. Bani ahgch hab kaij mat wehsijj hegam mat hab waꞌap ab wo si ni‑hiwgad at d wo ni‑hemajkamgak. Kut pi hedai wo shaꞌi e nako mas wo ha keshwua, chum hems g jijawul.

column2: I will give you the keys of the kingdom of heaven, and whatever you ban on earth will be banned in heaven, and whatever you allow on earth will be allowed in heaven.”
column3: Kunt ab wo m‑mah g gewkdag mapt wo s‑mahch k ah g Jiosh haꞌichu ahga k hab wo yahwitpiꞌo g apꞌedag am ha wehhejed hegam mat ab wo s‑wohoch. Ab ant wo m‑mah g gewkdag mapt hab wo ah mo haschu shohbidas ch haschu hiwgidas am ha wehhejed hegam mat ab wo ni‑hiwgad.”

column2: Then he warned his disciples not to tell anyone that he was the Messiah.
column3: Neh, bad kaij g Jesus ch ab hahawa si t‑chehani matt pi hedai wo ahgi mo heg d Jiosh si Kehsha.

column2: From that time on Jesus began to explain to his disciples that he would have to go Jerusalem, and that he would suffer terribly at the hands of the elders, chief priests, and religious teachers; and that he would be killed, but he would rise again on the third day.
column3: D am i amjed am hahawa si tasho t‑ahgi g Jesus k hab kaij, “Hemho wa ant am wo hih Jerusalem wui. Kut muꞌi wo ni‑shoꞌigch g geꞌeged ch uꞌugchu papal ch chehanig ha mashchamdam k am wo i ni‑dagito mant wo ni‑muhkid. T wabshaba am wo him k d wo i waik tashk amjed. Nt ab wo uhpam i wuhsh muhkig amjed.” Neh, bo kaij g Jesus.

column2: Peter took Jesus aside and started to tell him he shouldn't talk like that. “God forbid, Lord, that this would ever happen to you!” he said.
column3: D g Peter im hu goꞌolko i be k ab si s‑gewkam neok wui hab kaijch, “Pi at woho wo shaꞌi hiwigi g Jiosh mamt hab wo m‑juh.”

column2: Jesus turned to Peter, and told him, “Get away from me, Satan! You are a trap to trip me up, because you're thinking in a human way, and not as God thinks!”
column3: D hab kaij g Jesus ab wui, “Pi g shaꞌi ni‑shohbid. Do wabsh hejel hab m‑elida ihda. Kup ab wui kehk g Jiosh hab elida hab masma mo g ge Jiawul.”

column2: Then Jesus told his disciples, “If you want to be a follower of mine, you must deny yourself, take up your cross, and follow me.
column3: D hab hahawa ep kaij ab wehsijj t‑wui, “Mamtp am wo s‑oidam g niꞌhimdag k hemho wa gam hu wo dagito g hejel e‑tatchui k ahni ni‑tatchui hab wo junihid ni‑wehhejed e shoꞌigchudch. Heg at wo wa wepok mam ab mohto g kots ch ab ab wo e muhkid.

column2: For if you want to save your life you will lose it, and if you lose your life for my sake you will save it.
column3: Pi amt wo heki wua g e‑doakag mamtp wo hekaj am ni‑wehhejed am ahgachugch g Jiosh haꞌichu ahga. Heg at wo heki wua g e‑doakag matp hedai wo chum s‑daꞌad.

column2: What benefit is it for you to gain the whole world, yet lose your life? What would you give in exchange for your life?
column3: Pi at haꞌichu wehhejed wo s‑kehgajk matp g oꞌodham wehs wo bei mo haschu i tatchua id dahm jewed k wabshaba pi wo e doꞌibia. Pi o an hu haꞌichug id dahm jewed mas heg hekaj wo e doꞌibia g oꞌodham.

column2: For the Son of man is going to come in his Father's glory, together with his angels. Then he will give everyone what they deserve according to what they've done.
column3: Jiosh at ab uhpam wo ni‑mah g si geꞌe gewkdag an e‑kihdag ed. Kunt heg hekaj si s‑tondam wo tondad ch ia ep wo jiwia jewed dahm. T muꞌi anghil wo i ni‑wehmajk. Kunt wehs wo ha namkid g hemajkam heg hekaj mo haschu hab i junihim.

column2: I tell you the truth, there are some standing here who won't die before they see the Son of man coming in his kingdom.”
column3: Nt wo si shel em‑ahgi mamt haꞌijj an d wabsh wo kia dodakamk ch wo nei mant s‑gewkam am wo chehgi g ni‑kownaltalig em‑shahgid.”

column2: Six days later Jesus took Peter, James and his brother John, with him and they went up a high mountain to be by themselves.
column3: D am d i chuhdp tash amjed. D g Jesus ab i ha wai g Peter ch James ch John. D am wehmaj ab i chehchsh hema uhgk doꞌag t ab k atsh gan hu dada doꞌag dahm.

column2: He was transformed in front of them. His face shone like the sun. His clothes turned white as light.
column3: Kutsh g Jesus am hahawa gawul e juh. Sh g wuhioshaj hab waꞌi masma tonod mo g tash ch g wehschugaj hab masma s‑tohta mo g tonlig.

column2: Then suddenly Moses and Elijah appeared before them, talking together with Jesus.
column3: Kutsh ab haha wabsh i e chehgi g Mosesbad ch Elijabad k am wehmaj neneok g Jesus.

column2: Peter spoke up, saying to Jesus, “Lord, it's really good to be here. If you want I'll make three shelters—one for you, one for Moses, and one for Elijah.”
column3: Sh g Peter hab kaij ab wui g Jesus, “T‑kownalig, s‑apꞌe oki mach ia haꞌichug. Kutt ia waik wo ha chuhcha g al chechopi matt hekaj ab wo si has em‑el ahpi ch Mosesbad ch Elijabad maptp wo tatchuad.”

column2: While he was still speaking, a bright cloud covered them. A voice came from the cloud, saying, “This is my son whom I love, who pleases me. Listen to him.”
column3: Neh, sh am wabsh kia neok g Peter. Kutsh g si s‑mahs chewagi ab i wuhshani k ab ehka ha dahm. Tsh g Jiosh neꞌoki ab kaida chewagi t amjed k hab kaij, “Jesus o d si ni‑tatchuidch ni‑alidag. Heg amt ab wo si kaihamad.”

column2: When they heard this, the disciples fell down on their faces, absolutely terrified.
column3: Kutsh si s‑ehbeni hegam Peter am i kahk g neꞌoki k am wabsh si kupal shul jewedo.

column2: Jesus went over to them and touched them. “Get up,” he told them. “Don't be afraid.”
column3: Tsh am hahawa jiwia g Jesus k an ha tahtam k hab kaij, “Gegokiwuio. Pi g wo shaꞌi e todsid.”

column2: When they looked up they didn't see anybody there except Jesus.
column3: Tsh am hahawa i chum nenhog. Kush heg waꞌi Jesus hejel am kehk. Sh pi am hu haꞌichug hegam gohk.

column2: As they descended the mountain Jesus gave them strict instructions. “Don't tell anybody what you saw until the Son of man has risen from the dead,” he told them.
column3: Sh ab hahawa i huhudkhim doꞌag t amjed. Sh ab si ha chehani g Jesus ch hab kaij, “Pi g am hedai wo shaꞌi ahgid mamt haschu nei, nt hoꞌip kia uhpam i wuhsh ab muhkig amjed ahni Jiosh si Kehsha.”

column2: “So why do the religious teachers say that Elijah has to come first?” his disciples asked.
column3: Kush hab kaij idam ab wui g Jesus, “Neh, bo chechꞌe hegam chehanig t‑mashchamdam matsh ia wehpeg wo e maskogi g Elijabad. Tsh g Jiosh si Kehsha ia haha wo e maskogi. Pegih, t haschu ahgk pi ia wehpeg m‑baꞌich e maskogi hegai Elijabad?”

column2: “It's true that Elijah comes to put everything in place,” Jesus replied,
column3: Sh hab kaij g Jesus, “Hema at woho wehpeg wo e maskogid k hab wo masmak mash wa g Elijabad ch wehs haꞌichu wo i apꞌech.

column2: “but I tell you that Elijah has already come and yet people didn't recognize who he was. They did whatever they felt like to him. In the same way the Son of man will also suffer at their hands.”
column3: Kunt wo em‑ahgi mat wa woho heki hu jiwia. K Wabshaba muꞌijj pi mahch mo hedai wud ch ab wui hab wabsh juh g pi ap e‑tatchui. Pegih, k e aihim mat hab waꞌap wo ni‑juh k wo ni‑shoꞌigch ahni Jiosh si Kehsha.”

column2: Then the disciples realized that Jesus was referring to John the Baptist.
column3: Kutsh am hahawa i amich idam moki heg hab ahg John mat wa am i shonwuich g pahl wakona.

column2: When they approached the crowd, a man came to Jesus, and kneeled before him.
column3: D eda muꞌi hemajkam am haꞌichug amai machd am wih. Kud am uhpam dada hegam Jesus. D ab hema i tonwua Jesus wui

column2: “Lord, please have mercy on my son,” he said. “He loses his mind and suffers such terrible fits that he often falls in the fire or into water.
column3: k hab kaij, “Ab g si i s‑hoꞌigeꞌid g ni‑sulijga. Si o pi ap mumku ch hebai am wabsh s‑e chuchkagid ch muꞌikko am gegshe nahda ch ed o am shuhdagi ch ed.

column2: I brought him to your disciples but they couldn't heal him.”
column3: Kunt ia chum uꞌapa ha wui idam m‑chuhchai. T pi e nako mas wo doaj.”

column2: “You people refuse to trust me, and are so corrupt!” Jesus responded. “How long do I have to remain here with you? How long do I have to put up with you? Bring him here to me!”
column3: D hab kaij g Jesus ab t‑wui, “Shoꞌo waꞌi pi geꞌej g em‑wohochudadag. M im hu hab wabsh i si e Juhkch ab ni‑amjed. Shahag wepo mant tash ia wo em‑wehmajkad ch wo em‑nakogad mat haha wo i geꞌeda.” Bad kaij g Jesus ch hab hahawa ahg hegai oꞌodham, “Ab g i bekaꞌi g e‑alidag.”

column2: Jesus confronted the demon and it left the boy, and he was healed straight away.
column3: D ab hahawa i bei wui. D g Jesus am si s‑gewkam chehani g jiawul mat gam hu hab wo i e juh. Kud wa woho hab e juh. D am ha hekaj wabsh i doa g ali.

column2: Later the disciples came to Jesus in private and asked him, “Why couldn't we drive it out?”
column3: Kuchd ab hahawa hejelko kakke g Jesus machs haschu ahgk ahchim pi t‑nako matt gam hu hab wo i juh g jiawul.

column2: “Because you don't trust enough,” Jesus told them. “I tell you, even if your trust was as small as a mustard seed, you could say to this mountain, ‘Move from here to there,’ and it would move. Nothing would be impossible for you.”
column3: D hab kaij g Jesus, “Heg amt hekaj pi e nako mam pi ab hu wohochud mat hab wo e juh. Nt wo si shel em‑ahgi mamt wo e nakog k wabsh chum haschu hab wo juh mamt hab wo chei s‑wohochudch mat hab wo e juh. Chum at hems g geꞌe doꞌag gan hu hab wo i kekiwua mamt wabsh wo ahgi s‑wohochudch mat hab wo e juh. [
T wabshaba ihda hab mahs haꞌichu hab waꞌi masma gm hu hab wo i juh mamt wo si e hoꞌigeꞌidahunad Jiosh wui pi haꞌichu koꞌadch.]”

column2: As they were walking together through Galilee, Jesus told them, “The Son of man is going to be betrayed and people will have power over him.
column3: Am achd wabsh kia oiopo Galilee chekshani ch ed. D hab kaij g Jesus ab t‑wui, “E o aihim mat wo ni‑bei hegam mo s‑ni‑kehꞌid k ab wo ni‑dagito

column2: They will kill him, but on the third day he will rise again.” The disciples were filled with sadness.
column3: mant wo ni‑muhkid. T wabshaba am wo him k d wo i waik tashk amjed. Nt ab wo uhpam i wuhsh muhkig amjed.”

column2: When they arrived at Capernaum, those who were in charge of collecting the half-shekel Temple tax came to Peter and asked him, “Your teacher does pay the half-shekel tax, doesn't he?”
column3: Kuchd ged hu dada Capernaum t am. D am hema jiwia Peter wui hegam mo an hemapad g cheopi kowlanta k ab kakke ch hab kaij, “No ha namkid g cheopi kowlanta g em‑mashchamdam?”

column2: “Yes, of course,” Peter replied.
column3: D hab kaij g Peter, “Hemho wa,” K amjed ged hu i wah kih ch ed.

column2: “From others,” Peter replied. So Jesus told him, “In that case the sons are exempt.
column3: D hab kaij g Peter, “Piaꞌa.”

column2: But to avoid giving offense to anyone, go to the lake, and throw out a fishing line with a hook. Pull in the first fish you catch, and when you open its mouth there you'll find a stater coin. Take the coin and give it to them for both me and you.”
column3: Ch wabshaba pi tatchua machs wo ha kudu idam hemajkam. Kupt heg hekaj am wo hih shuhdagi wui k am wo wua g waptopi hukshpakud. Kut g si wehpeg watopi mapt wo huksh g lial ab wo kamshchid mat wo ai hegai cheopi kowlanta an ni‑wehhejed ch ep m‑wehhejed. Pt am wo be k hekaj wo ha namkid.”

column2: Around that time the disciples came to Jesus, and asked, “Who is the greatest in the kingdom of heaven?”
column3: Kuchd ab kakke g Jesus ch hab kaij, “Doht d wo si s‑has haꞌichuk am Jiosh kownaltalig ed?”

column2: Jesus called over a small child. He had the child stand in front of them.
column3: D eda an hema kehk g al chum ali. D g Jesus am i waid k ab t‑baꞌich i kehsh

column2: “I tell you the truth, unless you change the way you think and become like little children, you won't ever enter the kingdom of heaven,” he told them.
column3: k hab kaij, “Nt wo shel em‑ahgi mamt hab waꞌi masma am wo i wahp Jiosh kownaltalig ed mamt am gawul wo juh g e‑chegitoidag k ab wabsh wo i pi e haꞌichuchud k hab wo masmak mo ihda al chum ali.

column2: “But whoever humbles themselves and becomes like this little child is the greatest in the kingdom of heaven.
column3: Hegai mat hab wo juh ihda at d wo s‑has haꞌichuk am Jiosh kownaltalig ed.

column2: Whoever accepts a little child like this in my name accepts me.
column3: T hedai i s‑ap ab wo i ha nei g aꞌal am ni‑wehhejed o heg wa wepo mat ahni s‑ap ab ni‑nei.

column2: But anyone who makes one of these little ones who trust in me sin, it would be better for them to have a large millstone tied around their neck and be drowned in the depths of the sea.
column3: “S‑toꞌo ehbidam hab mahs am wehhejed hegai mat hema am wo i ha wanchkwua pi apꞌekam wui idam al aꞌal mo ab al ni‑hiwig. Baꞌich at wo i s‑apꞌek wehhejed matp hems wo e wachumchud k wo e muhkid mat koi hab wo juh ihda chuꞌijig.

column2: What a disaster is coming on the world for all its temptations to sin! Temptations will surely come, but it will be a disaster for the person through whom the temptation comes!
column3: Chum o hekid an hab e wua g pi apꞌekam jewed dahm. K hegam mo hab wua am haꞌi ep ha wanchshulig pi apꞌekam wui. T g Jiosh hemho wo wa ha namkid.

column2: If your hand or your foot causes you to sin, cut it off and throw it away. It's better for you to enter eternal life crippled or lame rather than to have two hands or two feet and to be thrown into eternal fire.  If your eye causes you to sin, pull it out and throw it away. It's better for you to enter eternal life with one eye than to have two eyes and to be thrown into the fire of judgment.
column3: “Pi at hedai wo e nako mas ab uhpam wo i wuhsh Jiawul kih amjed. Kut pi hekid wo huhug g ha‑shoꞌigchuda amai. Heg at wo wa wepok mat am mei ch ed wo e shoꞌigchudad. Mt heg hekaj am wo i e nako mamt pi am hu wo gei heg eda. Baꞌich at wo i s‑apꞌek mamt chum hems wo heb hu wua g e‑nowi o g e‑tad o g e‑wuhi matp hema idam hab wo em‑juh mamt am wo gei Jiawul kih ed k pi wo bei hegai pi ha huhugedam doakag mo g Jiosh ab em‑makiog.

column2: Make sure you don't look down on these little ones. I tell you that in heaven their angels are always with  my heavenly Father.
column3: “Am g wo s‑nenꞌoidk mamt pi wo s‑ha kehꞌidad idam al chuꞌuchumchu. Jiosh o ab si has ha elid ch am ha nuhkudachud g anghil. [
Ia ant jiwia jewed dahm mant wo ha doꞌibia g heb hu hihimkam.]

column2: What do you think about this? If a man has a hundred sheep, and one of them gets lost, won't he leave the ninety-nine on the hills and go in search of the one that's lost?
column3: “Neh, am g wo i oidahim ihda. Mamtp hems hema ahpim siant wo kahwaligak. Kut hema wo heb hu hih. Namt hig pi woho am wo s‑apko ha dagito hegam humukto gamai humukt k am wo hih doꞌag oidk k am wo i gahghi g heb hu himkam e‑shoiga.

column2: And if he finds it, I tell you he really rejoices over that sheep more than the ninety-nine that didn't get lost.
column3: Kut woho d wo s‑hehgigk mamtp wo cheh.

column2: In the same way my heavenly Father does not want any of these little ones to be lost.
column3: Bo wa masma pi shaꞌi tatchua g em‑ohg Jiosh mat hema wo heb hu hih idam al chuꞌuchum aꞌal.

column2: If a brother  sins against you, go and point out the wrong to him, just between the two of you. If he listens to you, you've won your brother over.
column3: “Mt heg waꞌi hejel wo ahgi e‑wehm wohochuddam matp pi ap wo chuꞌi ab em‑wui. Kutp hems ab s‑ap wo em‑kaiha. Kut ab hahawa ep wo i e hemakoch g em‑chegitoidag,

column2: But if he doesn't listen, then take one or two more people with you, so that by two or three witnesses the truth can be confirmed.
column3: Tp wabshaba pi ab hu wo em‑kaiha, kumt hemako o gohk am ha wehm wo him k am wo ah g chuꞌijigaj. Kut hab masma gohk o waik wo s‑mahchk g chuꞌijigaj mo id hab masma an oꞌohanas Jiosh oꞌohana ed.

column2: If however he refuses to listen to them, then tell the church. If he refuses to listen to the church as well, then treat him as a foreigner and a tax-collector.
column3: Kutp eda wa sha pi ab hu wo em‑kaiha, kumt am wo ha ahgi wehsijj hegam mam am ha wehm e mihshmad. Kutp pi ab hu wo ha kaiha idam, kumt haha wo dagito hab masma mo pi d em‑wehm wohochuddam.

column2: I tell you the truth, whatever you ban on earth will be banned in heaven, and whatever you allow on earth will be allowed in heaven.
column3: “Nt wo si shel em‑ahgi mant ab wo em‑mah g gewkdag mamt hab wo ah mo haschu shohbidas ch haschu hiwgidas am ha wehhejed g ni‑hemajkamga.

column2: I also tell you that if two of you agree here on earth about something you're praying for, then my heavenly Father will do it for you.
column3: Jiosh at am hab wo em‑juni mamt haschu ab wo tahnid e wepo hab elidch.

column2: For where two or three gather together in my name, I'm there with them.”
column3: Kunt am wo haꞌichugk em‑shahgid mamt hebai am wo i e hemapai, chum ams d wo waꞌi gohkk o waikk.”

column2: Peter came to Jesus and asked him, “How many times should I forgive my brother for sinning against me? Seven times?”
column3: D g Peter ab kakke g Jesus ch hab kaij, “Ni‑kownalig, nant wewaꞌakko ab wabsh wo i s‑hoꞌigeꞌel g ni‑wehm wohochuddam matp haꞌakkio hab wo juh g pi apꞌekam ab ni‑wui?”

column2: “No, not seven times. I would say seventy times seven!” Jesus told him.
column3: D hab kaij g Jesus, “Pi amt wabsh wewaꞌakko ab wo i s‑hoꞌigeꞌel. Matp heꞌekkio hab wo i juh g pi apꞌekam, mt haꞌakkio wo s‑hoꞌigeꞌel.

column2: “This is why the kingdom of heaven is like a king who wanted to settle accounts with those servants who owed him money.
column3: Bo wa e wua g em‑kownalig Jiosh ch em‑tatchuid mamt am hab waꞌap wo e junihid.

column2: As he began to settle accounts, one servant was brought to him who owed him ten thousand talents.
column3: Kumt am hema uꞌapa g piongaj, K id ab ab e wulshch g muꞌi mi‑yohn pihsh.

column2: Since he didn't have the money to pay, his master ordered him to be sold, along with his wife and children and all his possessions, so that the debt could be paid back.
column3: Kuki ihda pi am hu hugkam edgid g lial mat wo namkid g e‑wulshpadag. T hekaj g ahmoj am ha cheha mamt wo gagda k g wehmaj kihkam ch aꞌaligaj ch haꞌichu enigaj ep wo ha gagda. T d wabsh wo neneholk.

column2: The servant fell down on his knees and said to his master, ‘Please be patient with me! I will pay everything back!’
column3: “Kut ihda ha‑pionag ab i gei e‑ahmo wui k ab i tahni mat ab wabsh wo i s‑hoꞌigeꞌel. Kut wo wa wehs ha namkid.

column2: The master took pity on the servant, released him, and canceled the debt.
column3: T am i s‑hoꞌigeꞌel g ahmoj k im hu hab i juh g wulshpadaj k dagito.

column2: But when that same servant went out he found one of his fellow-servants who owed him just a hundred denarii. He grabbed him by the neck and choked him, saying, ‘Pay me back what you owe me!’
column3: Kut am hih ihda oꞌodham.

column2: His fellow-servant threw himself down at the man's feet and begged him, ‘Please be patient with me! I will pay you back!’
column3: “Kut ihda wehmaj pion ab i gei wecho k ab i e shoꞌigchud wui mat ab wabsh wo i nenida. Kut wo wa uhpam namkid.

column2: But the man refused, and went and threw his fellow-servant into prison until he paid back what he owed.
column3: “Kut wabshaba pi ab hu kaiham k wabsh ha chehani mamt ged hu wo si kuh am hugkam mat hekid wo i namkid.

column2: When the other servants saw what took place they were shocked and upset. They went and told their master everything that had happened.
column3: “Neh, t haꞌi ehp g pion si pi ap e taht neidok mat has e juh k am hihim k am ahgid g e‑ahmo wehs haꞌichu.

column2: Then the master called the man back in and told him, ‘You evil servant! I forgave you all your debt because you begged me to.
column3: “T g ha‑ahmo ab i wai ihda e‑pionag k hab kaij ab wui, ‘Ahpi si pi amkam ni‑pionag, ab ant i si s‑m‑hoꞌigeꞌid k im hu hab i juh wehs hegai m‑wulshpadag heg waꞌi hekaj map ab si ni‑tahni.

column2: Shouldn't you have been merciful to your fellow-servant as well, just as I was merciful to you?’
column3: Kupt hab wa masma wo chum s‑hoꞌigeꞌel g e‑wehm pion mant has i masma s‑m‑hoꞌigeꞌel.’

column2: His master became angry and handed him over to the jailors until he had repaid all the debt.
column3: Neh, bo kaij ch si bagat k ged hu si kuh am hugkam mat hekid wehs wo i namkid.

column2: This is what my heavenly Father will do to every one of you unless you sincerely forgive your brothers.”
column3: “Pegih, t hab wa masma am hab wo em‑juh g ni‑ohg Jiosh mamtp pi hab hu e‑ihbdag amjed wo i s‑ha hoꞌigeꞌel hegam mat ab em‑wui pi ap wo chuꞌi.”

column2: When Jesus finished speaking he left Galilee and went to the region of Judea beyond the Jordan River.
column3: Am ad i haꞌasa ha mashcha g Jesus k am i dagito g Galilee chekshani. Kuchd gam hu aigo hihi Jordan akimel haꞌabjed k am hihim k am dada Judea chekshani ch ed.

column2: Large crowds followed him, and he healed those who were sick there.
column3: D muꞌi hemajkam an oidahim g Jesus. Kud ha doajid.

column2: Some Pharisees came to test him. “Is a man allowed to divorce his wife for any reason?” they asked.
column3: D am haꞌi dada g Palasi hab chum ahgk mat ab wo haꞌichu kakke k hekaj wo heki himch. K g ha‑kakkei hab chuꞌig, “No hiwgidas an t‑chehanig ed mat g oꞌodham wo s‑ohhod g e‑hohnig?”

column2: Jesus replied, “Haven't you read that God who created people in the beginning made them male and female?
column3: D hab kaij g Jesus, “An o hab chuꞌig Jiosh oꞌohana ed:

column2: “Then why did Moses give a law that a man could divorce his wife by giving her a written certificate of divorce, and sending her away?” they asked.
column3: D hab kaij g Palasi ab wui, “K wabshaba an oꞌohanas t‑chehanig ed matsh g oꞌodham wo mah g e‑hohnig g ohhoda tapial k wo s‑ohhod.”

column2: “Because of your hard-hearted attitude Moses permitted you to divorce your wives, but it wasn't like that in the beginning,” Jesus replied.
column3: D hab kaij g Jesus, “Heuꞌu, bo chuꞌig mamt wo ha mah g ohhoda tapial mamtp pi ab hu wo kaihamad g Jiosh ch pi wo pihk e elidad ha hekaj. K wa eda chum pi hab masma ga hu i wehpeg mat in ha nahto g Jiosh g hemajkam.

column2: “I tell you, anyone who divorces his wife except on the grounds of sexual immorality and then marries another woman, commits adultery.”
column3: Kunt id hab wo em‑ahgi mat d wo pi apꞌekamk mamt wo s‑ohhod g e‑wehm kihkam k hema ep wo hohnt, heg hi wa mamt wo s‑mai am i chum hohntk matki heki hu ha wehm woꞌiwua.”

column2: “If that's the situation between husband and wife, it's better not to marry!” his disciples told him.
column3: Kuchd hab kaij ab wui, “Kuki heg hekaj baꞌich i chum s‑apꞌe mat g oꞌodham pi wo ha hohnt.”

column2: “Not everyone can accept this instruction, only those it's given to,” Jesus told them.
column3: D hab kaij g Jesus, “Pi at wehsijj wo e nako hab masma, heg hi wa mat g Jiosh am wo i ha wehmt.

column2: “Some are born as eunuchs, some are made eunuchs by men, and some choose to be eunuchs for the sake of the kingdom of heaven. Those who can accept this should accept it.”
column3: Haꞌijj at pi wo hohont no pi hab masma d mahsikam mo pi tatchua g hohnig ch haꞌijj d hegam mamt hab wabsh ha juh mat pi ap wo hohont. Haꞌijj o ep pi hohont heg hekaj mo g Jiosh kownaltalig baꞌich hab i elid. Kumt id am hab wo juh mamtp wo e nako.”

column2: The people brought little children to him so he could bless them and pray for them. But the disciples told them not to.
column3: Kud haꞌi am ha uꞌapa g e‑aꞌaliga mat ab wo ha taht g Jesus k wo e hoꞌigeꞌidahu ha wehhejed. Kuchd chum s‑ha kehꞌid mo hab e wua.

column2: But Jesus said, “Let the little children come to me. Don't stop them. The kingdom of heaven belongs to those who are like them!”
column3: D hab kaij g Jesus, “Ab g wabsh wo i ha hiwgid g aꞌal mat ab wo i hihi ni‑wui k pi an hu wo shaꞌi ha shohbi. Am at wabsh s‑moimam wo i wahp Jiosh kownaltalig ed ab ni‑hiwigch. Kumt hab waꞌi masma am wo i wahp.”

column2: He placed his hands on them to bless them, and then he left.
column3: Neh, bad kaij ch ab hahawa ha tahtam k amjed gam hu hih.

column2: A man came to Jesus and asked him, “Teacher, what good things must I do to gain eternal life?”
column3: D am hu hebai am hema jiwia g wechij oꞌodham Jesus wui k hab kaij, “Ha mashchamdam, shahchu ant am hab wo juh g s‑apꞌekam mant ab wo bei g pi ha huhugedam doakag?”

column2: “Why do you ask me what is good?” Jesus replied. “There's only one who is good. But if you want to have eternal life, then keep the commandments.”
column3: K hab kaij g Jesus, “Ab ap ni‑kakke ab amjed g s‑apꞌekam. K eda heg waꞌi Jiosh d s‑apꞌekam. Am g hab junihid g Jiosh chehanig maptp wo tatchuad mapt wo bei g pi ha huhugedam doakag.”

column2: “Which ones?” the man asked him.
column3: D hab kaij g oꞌodham, “Hedai hegam chehanig?”

column2: “I've kept all these commandments,” the young man said. “What else do I need to do?”
column3: D hab kaij g oꞌodham, “Wehs ani am hab wa chum ha junihim idam chehanig. Shahchu ant hab ep wo juh?”

column2: Jesus told him, “If you want to be perfect, then go and sell your possessions, give the money to the poor, and you'll have treasure in heaven. Then come and follow me.”
column3: D hab kaij g Jesus ab wui, “Pegih, pt am wo him k wo gagda wehs haꞌichu map haschu i eniga k wo ha mah g namkigaj g shoꞌigkam k ab wo i him k wo ni‑oidad maptp woho s‑behimk hegai map chum e gahgid.”

column2: When the young man heard Jesus' answer he went away very sad, because he had many possessions.
column3: Kud si pi ap e taht am i kaiok k gam hu hih no pi d shaꞌi si s‑kais ch si s‑huwid g e‑kaisdag.

column2: “I tell you the truth,” Jesus said to his disciples, “rich people find it hard to enter the kingdom of heaven.
column3: D hab hahawa ep kaij g Jesus ab t‑wui, “Neh, nt wo si shel em‑ahgi mat wo shaꞌi si s‑hasigk mas g s‑kakais am wo i wahp Jiosh kownaltalig ed.

column2: I also tell you this: It's easier for a camel to pass through the eye of a needle than for a rich person to enter the kingdom of God.”
column3: Mam hig hab elid mat wo e nako g ka‑mihyo mas am wo gahi wuhsh hoꞌipad jeg ed? Pegih, t hab wa masma pi wo e nako hegam mo hiwig g haꞌichu e‑eniga mas am wo i wahp Jiosh kownaltalig ed.”

column2: When the disciples heard this, they were very surprised, and asked, “So who can be saved?”
column3: Kuchd am wabsh i pi amichud k hab kaij ab wui, “A t hedai hig wo e doꞌibia.”

column2: Jesus looked at them and said, “From a human point of view it's impossible, but all things are possible with God.”
column3: D g Jesus ab si shel i t‑neid k hab kaij, “Pi at wo e nako wabsh g oꞌodham. T wabshaba g Jiosh wo e nako mat wabsh chum haschu am hab wo juh.”

column2: Peter answered him, “Look, we've left everything and followed you. What reward will we have?”
column3: D g Peter hab kaij, “Nehꞌe, ahchim att wehs haꞌichu dagito k am i m‑oi. Tt haschu ab wo bei heg hekaj?”

column2: Jesus replied, “I tell you the truth: when everything is remade and the Son of man sits on his glorious throne, you who have followed me will also sit on twelve thrones, judging the twelve tribes of Israel.
column3: D g Jesus hab kaij ab t‑wui, “Woho o wa mamt ab si i ni‑oi. Kunt am wo si shel em‑ahgi mant an wo dahiwua s‑kehg ni‑kownal daikud ed ahni Jiosh si Kehsha. Kumt ahpim an hab waꞌap wo dadhaiwua gamai gohk kownal dadaikud an k d wo uꞌusagakamk am ha dahm hegam gamai gohk dakam e‑wehm Tutuligo.

column2: All those who because of me have left their homes, brothers, sisters, father, mother, children, and fields, will receive back a hundred times more, and will receive eternal life.
column3: Matp hedai am wo i dagito g e‑kih o g e‑wepnag o g e‑jehj o g e‑aꞌaliga o g e‑oidag at ab wo ui siant e dahm baꞌich i muꞌi k ab wo bei g pi ha huhugedam doakag.

column2: For many who are first will be last, and many who are last will be first.
column3: Muꞌijj hegam mo d wehpegkam hemu at d wo si ha oidchkamk ch muꞌijj hegam mo ga hu si ha oidch hemu d wo wehpegkamk.

column2: For the kingdom of heaven is like a landowner who went out early in the morning to hire workers for his vineyard.
column3: “Id ant am wo em‑tashogi id hekaj mant wo haꞌichu wepogi g Jiosh kownaltalig. Heg o wepogidas mat g uhdwis oidag enigakam wabsh i siꞌalim am him k haꞌi ha ui g oꞌodham mat am wo chikp oidaj ed.

column2: He agreed to pay the workers one denarius for the day, and sent them to work in his vineyard.
column3: T g ha‑namkidadag d wo hegaik mo haschu i uꞌu g pion tash ab. T am ha hekaj hihim k chikp.

column2: Around 9 a.m. he went out and saw others without work standing in the marketplace.
column3: “T am hahawa ep hih humukt ohla ch ed. K am haꞌi gegok g oꞌodham ch pi haꞌichu has wua.

column2: ‘Go and work in the vineyard too, and I'll pay you what's right,’ he told them. So they went to work.
column3: K hab ha ahg, ‘Nt wo s‑ap em‑namkid mamt wo chikp am ni‑oidag ed.’

column2: Around noon and 3 p.m. he went out and did the same thing.
column3: Kut wa woho am chikpano idam. T hab wa masma hab ep e juh am i gamai gohk ohla ch ed ch waik ohla ch ed.

column2: At 5 p.m. he went out and found others standing there. ‘Why are you standing around all day doing nothing?’ he asked them.
column3: “K am hu d i hetasp ohla. T am hih kahya wui. K am wabsh haꞌi gegok. K hab kaij ab ha wui, ‘Shahchu am ahgch wabsh heki wua g tash pi haꞌichu has wuadch?’

column2: ‘Because nobody has hired us,’ they replied. ‘Go and work in the vineyard too,’ he told them.
column3: “K hab kaij idam, ‘Pi at hedai t‑chikpanach.’

column2: When evening came, the owner of the vineyard told his manager, ‘Call the workers in, and pay them their wages. Begin with the workers hired last and then move on to those hired first.’
column3: “Neh, t gam hu si i juh. Kut ihda oidag enigakam hab ah g e‑pionag ha‑geꞌejig, ‘Ab g i ha waid g pion k ab wo i ha namkidahi. T hegam wehpeg wo e namkid mant si ha oidch an ha ui k amjed hegam ehp mant ep ha ui k hegam ga hu si ha oidk wo e namkid mant si wehpeg an ha ui.’

column2: When those who were hired at 5 p.m. came in, they each received one denarius.
column3: “Kut hegam mat gam hu si i juhk chikp mo d i hetasp ohla ab ui g e‑namkidadag haꞌakia mo heꞌekia uꞌu g pion tash ab ch amjed wehs g haꞌi.

column2: So when those who were hired first came in, they thought they would get more, but they also received one denarius.
column3: “Kut ab ha ai hegam mat wabsh i siꞌalim chikp. K hab e ahg mat baꞌich i muꞌi wo ui g e‑namkidadag. Mt wabshaba haꞌakia wa ha namkid.

column2: When they received their pay, they complained to the owner.
column3: T ab ui g e‑lialiga k babgat ab wui g e‑ahmo k ab wui hab kaij,

column2: ‘Those who were hired last only worked for an hour, and you've paid them the same as us who worked the whole day in the burning heat,’ they grumbled.
column3: ‘Neh, hegam oꞌodham mapt si oidk an ha ui al hemako ohla ab chikp. Kutt ahchim ge tash oidk chikp am s‑toni k ed. Kupt eda am wo haꞌakia t‑namkid mapt hegam.’

column2: The owner answered one of them, ‘My friend, I haven't treated you unfairly. Didn't you agree with me to work for one denarius?
column3: “K hab kaij g oidag enigakam ab wui hegai mo ha wehhejed neok, ‘Neh, ni‑nawoj, pi ant shaꞌi em‑iattogi namt pi am wa apꞌech mamt haꞌakia k ab wo chikp ni‑wehhejed.

column2: Take your pay and go. I want to pay those who were hired last the same as I paid you.
column3: Pegih, ab g wabsh wo uhꞌi g e‑namkidadag k gam hu hihim uhpam no hig pi ab ni‑ab ahni hejel mant haꞌakia wo wa ha namkid hegam mant gam hu si i juhk ha ui mant ahpim heꞌekia em‑namkid.

column2: Can't I choose to do what I want with my own money? Why should you give me evil looks because I want to do good?’
column3: Ab o ni‑ab mant has masma wo hekaj g ni‑lialiga. Aha nam wabsh s‑ni‑hehgamk mani s‑hemajima?’ ”

column2: In this way the last shall be first and the first shall be last.”
column3: D hab hahawa ep kaij g Jesus, “Nehꞌe, t hekaj hab hegam mo gam hu si i ha oidch d wo wehpegkamk ch hegam mo d wehpegkam ga hu wo si ha oidchk.”

column2: On the way to Jerusalem, Jesus took the twelve disciples aside as they walked along and told them,
column3: Am achd i t‑nakog k gam hu hihi. Kud g Jesus am hejelko t‑wai ahchim gamai gohk

column2: “Look, we're going to Jerusalem, and the Son of man will be betrayed to the chief priests and religious teachers. They will condemn him to death
column3: k hab kaij, “Neh, am att wo hihi Jerusalem wui. T hegam mo s‑ni‑kehꞌid am wo ni‑dagito ha wui g uꞌugchu papal ch chehanig em‑mashchamdam. Kut idam ab wo haꞌichu ni‑abch s‑ni‑muꞌamk

column2: and hand him over to the foreigners to mock him, whip him, and crucify him. But on the third day he will be raised from the dead.”
column3: k am wo ni‑dagito ha wui g goꞌol hemajkam. T idam wo nahnko ni‑ahgad ch wo ni‑gewittan k amjed ab wo ni‑sisish kots t ab. Nt ab wo muh. T am wo him k d wo i waik tashk amjed. Nt ab wo uhpam i wuhsh muhkig amjed.”

column2: Then the mother of the sons of Zebedee came with her two sons to Jesus. She kneeled down before him to make a request.
column3: D eda am t‑wehmaj g ha‑jeꞌe g James ch John. D idam am wehmaj hihi Jesus wui ab haꞌichu s‑tahnimk. D g ha‑jeꞌe ab si has elid k ab wui hab kaij matsh ab wo haꞌichu tai.

column2: “What is it you are asking me for?” Jesus said to her.
column3: D hab kaij g Jesus, “Shahchu ap tatchua?”

column2: “You don't know what you're asking,” Jesus told them. “Are you able to drink the cup I'm about to drink?”
column3: D hab kaij g Jesus ab ha wui, “Pi am shaꞌi ap mahch mam haschu ab ni‑tahni. Wehpeg ant ab wo nako g geꞌe shoꞌigdag. Kut hegam mat am ni‑oidch d wo si hahaꞌichuk hab waꞌap wo e juh.”

column2: “You will certainly drink from my cup,” he said to them, “but the privilege to sit on my right or on my left isn't mine to give. My Father is the one who has decided who that will be.
column3: D hab hahawa ha ahg g Jesus, “Pegih, woho amt ab wo nako hegai hab mahs shoꞌigdag. K wabshaba pi ab hu ni‑ab manis ahni am wo i ha chuhcha mat hedai am ni‑oidch d wo hahaꞌichuk. Hegam at am wo i e chuhcha mat hedai i ha wehhejed am apꞌech g Jiosh.”

column2: When the other ten disciples heard what they had asked, they were annoyed with the two brothers.
column3: Kuchd ahchim haꞌi babgat ab ha wui hegam gohk mad hab masma ab hejel chum e haꞌichuchud.

column2: Jesus called them together and told them, “You know that foreign rulers lord it over their subjects, and powerful leaders oppress them.
column3: D g Jesus ab hahawa wehs i t‑hemapad k hab kaij ab t‑wui, “S‑mahch am mo g ha‑maliomig s‑gewkam ha chehani g e‑pionag ch g ha wanimeddam am ha himchudahim.

column2: It shall not be like that for you. Whoever among you wants to be the most important will be your servant.  Whoever among you wants to be first will be like a slave.
column3: T wabshaba pi hab masma hab wo shaꞌi chum mahsk am em‑shahgid. Mt wabsh si s‑hemajim am wo i ha wehmtad g e‑wehm wohochuddam hab sha masma mam d wabsh ha‑pionag mamtp wo tatchuad mamt wo ha wanimedad.

column2: In the same way the Son of man didn't come to be served, but to serve, and to give his life as a ransom for many.”
column3: Ahni ani hab wa masma si s‑hemajim i em‑wehmt ch pi ab hu ni‑haꞌichuchud em‑dahm, chum anis d Jiosh si Kehsha. Ab o em‑wui him g s‑koꞌok namkidadag heg hekaj pi ap em‑chuꞌijig. Nt wabshaba ahni em‑wehhejed wo nako mamt wo e wupulꞌo.” Neh, bad kaij g Jesus.

column2: As they left Jericho, a huge crowd followed Jesus.
column3: Kuchd gam hu i wuwha ab Jerico t amjed. D muꞌi hemajkam ab i t‑oi.

column2: Two blind men were sitting at the side of the road. When they heard that Jesus was passing by, they called out, “Have mercy on us, Lord, son of David!”
column3: D am hu hebai wohg hugid an gohk am dadha g pi neneadam oꞌodham. Kuchd am hihim. D am i t‑kah k s‑mai mo an him g Jesus k si s‑kaidam hab chechꞌe, “Ab g si i s‑t‑hoꞌigeꞌid, ahpi map d s‑apꞌekam t‑kownalig ch apsh d t‑kownaligbad David amjedkam.”

column2: The crowd told them to be quiet, but they shouted even louder, “Have mercy on us, Lord, son of David!”
column3: D hegam mo an ha wehgaj si s‑ha kehꞌid ch hab ha ahg mat wo pi shahmunik.

column2: Jesus stopped. He called them over, asking, “What do you want me to do for you?”
column3: Kud am hahawa i kekiwua g Jesus k ab i ha waid k hab kaij, “Shahchu am tatchua mant hab wo em‑juni?”

column2: “Lord, please make us able to see,” they replied.
column3: D hab kaij idam, “Si g s‑t‑hoꞌigeꞌid k ab i t‑nenchud.”

column2: Jesus had pity on them and touched their eyes. Immediately they could see, and they followed him.
column3: Kud si s‑ha hoꞌigeꞌel g Jesus k ab ha taht ha‑wuhpui ab. D ha hekaj haꞌichu s‑ap neid k ab i oi.

column2: Jesus and his disciples went to Jerusalem. As they were getting close, they came to the village of Bethphage on the Mount of Olives. Jesus sent two disciples on ahead,
column3: Kuchd amjed am hihim Jerusalem wui k am ai g Olive Uꞌus Kawulk. D heg mia kihhimag ch hab chehgig Bethphage.

column2: telling them, “Go into the village. Right there you'll find a donkey tied up with a colt. Untie them and bring them to me.
column3: D g Jesus gohk hab ha ah g e‑chuhchai, “Am g wo hihim k ga hu wo dada kihhim t am. Kut am hema wo wulshpik g wuhlu g e‑mad wehm. Mt gam wo ha wulꞌo.

column2: If anyone asks you what you're doing, just tell them, ‘The Lord needs them,’ and they will send them right away.”
column3: Kumt ab wo em‑kakke mams has wo juh. Kumt hab wo ha ah mani ahni d em‑mashchamdam ch tatchua. Kut ab wabsh wo i ha dagito mamt ab wo i ha wanim ni‑wui.” Neh, bad kaij g Jesus.

column2: This was to fulfill what the prophet said:
column3: K eda heki hu waꞌi oꞌohanas matsh id am hab wo e juh. Hema atki wa an oꞌoha g kelibad Jiosh haꞌichu i tashogidam. K g oꞌohanaj hab chuꞌig:

column2: The disciples went and did as Jesus had instructed.
column3: Kud am hihi idam gohk k am hab juh mo haschu hab ha ahg g Jesus

column2: They brought back the donkey and the colt. They placed their cloaks on them, and he sat on them.
column3: k am ha uꞌapa hegam wuplu. Kuchd an toa g t‑liliwa ha ab. D an dahiwua heg an mo d wechij.

column2: Many people in the crowd spread their cloaks on the road, while others cut branches from the trees and laid them on the road.
column3: Kud muꞌi hemajkam an t‑wehgaj ch am i tahtdahim g e‑liliwa wohg ch ed. D haꞌi g wechij uꞌus iꞌibhonig an hikkumiꞌak k am toꞌahim wohg oidch.

column2: The crowds that went ahead of him and those that followed were all shouting, “Hosanna to the son of David! Blessed is he who comes in the name of the Lord! Hosanna in the highest!”
column3: D hegam muꞌi hemajkam mo an t‑wehgaj hihim si s‑kaidam hihnk ch hab kaij,

column2: When Jesus arrived in Jerusalem, the whole city was in an uproar. “Who is this?” they were asking.
column3: Kuchd am i dada Jerusalem kihhim t am. D muꞌijj am wabsh i pi amich mo haschu has e wua k hab kaij, “Dohꞌo wud hegai?”

column2: “This is Jesus, the prophet from Nazareth in Galilee,” the crowds replied.
column3: D haꞌijj hab ep kaij, “Id oki d Jiosh haꞌichu i tashogiddam ch hab chehgig Jesus ch am d kihkam Nazareth t am am Galilee chekshani ch ed.”

column2: Jesus went into the Temple, and threw out all the people buying and selling. He overturned the tables of the money-changers and the chairs of the dove-sellers.
column3: D am i wah g Jesus kolhai ch ed mo am kehk g geꞌe cheopi. D eda am haꞌi dadha mo am haꞌichu gagda ch haꞌichu ha nolawt cheopi miabidch. D g Jesus gam hu si ha shahmud k g ha‑dadaikud kuhkpal ha shul. D am haꞌi ep dadha ch am kammialt g lial. Kud g ha‑mimsa gam hu aꞌai kuhkpal si ha shulig

column2: He told them, “Scripture says, ‘My house shall be called a house of prayer,’ but you've turned it into a den of thieves.”
column3: k hab hahawa wehs ha ah, “Bo chuꞌig an Jiosh oꞌohana ed mo hab kaij g Jiosh:

column2: The blind and the lame came to Jesus in the Temple, and he healed them.
column3: Kumd am wui ha uꞌapa am geꞌe cheopi t am hegam mo d pi neneadam ch hegam mo pi aꞌapkodag. Kud ha dodaj.

column2: But when the chief priests and religious teachers saw the wonderful miracles he did, and the children shouting in the Temple, “Hosanna to the son of David,” they were offended.
column3: D g aꞌal am si hihnk geꞌe cheopi t am ch hab kaij, “Ab ach si has elid ihda mo d t‑kownaligbad David amjedkam ch d Jiosh si Kehsha.”

column2: “Yes,” Jesus replied. “Haven't you ever read the Scripture that says, ‘You arranged for children and infants to give you perfect praise’?”
column3: k hab kaij ab Jesus wui, “Shahchu ap ahgch pi ha shohbid? Aha nap pi has shaꞌi elid mo has i kaij?”

column2: Jesus left them and went out of the city to stay at Bethany.
column3: ch am ha dagito. Kuchd gam hu hihi Bethany kihhim wui k am kohk.

column2: The next morning as he walked back into the city, he was hungry.
column3: Baꞌich tash, chd gam hu hebai uhpam hihim Jerusalem wui. Tsh bihugim g Jesus.

column2: He saw a fig tree at the side of the road, so he went over to it but didn't find any fruit, only leaves.
column3: D eda am hu hema kehk g suhna uhs. Kuchd ab wui hihi no pi s‑hahhagag ch ab wo chum bahidagk. D oi wa pi ab hu haꞌichu shaꞌi ihbdag. D hekaj hab kaij, “Pi at dahm ab hu ep wo bahidagt.” Kudki wa woho gaksh.

column2: The disciples were amazed to see this. “How did the fig tree wither so suddenly?” they asked.
column3: Kuchd am i neidok si has i elid k hab kaij, “S has masma shaꞌi si s‑hohtam gaksh.”

column2: “I tell you the truth,” Jesus replied, “If you really trust in God, and don't doubt him, you could not only do what was done to the fig tree, but even more. If you said to this mountain, ‘Get up and throw yourself into the sea,’ it would happen!
column3: D hab kaij g Jesus, “Nt wo si shel em‑ahgi mamt ab wabsh wo hiwgad g Jiosh. Kut wabsh chum haschu hab wo em‑juni. Mtp hems wo cheha ihda doꞌag mat gam hu wo e wua ge shuhdagi ch ed. Kut wa woho hab wo e juh mamtp wo s‑wohochudad mat hab wo e juh.

column2: You will receive everything you ask for in prayer, as long as you trust in God.”
column3: Ab g wo tahnid g Jiosh mamt haschu wo i tatchua. T heg hab wo em‑junidad mamtp woho wo s‑wohochudad mat hab wo e juh.”

column2: Jesus went into the Temple. The chief priests and the ruling elders of the people came to him while he was teaching and asked, “By what authority are you doing these things? Who gave you this authority?”
column3: Kuchd ged hu uhpam dada mo am kehk g geꞌe cheopi. D g Jesus am ha mashcham g hemajkam.

column2: “I too will ask you a question,” Jesus replied. “If you give me the answer, I will tell you by what authority I do these things.
column3: D hab kaij g Jesus ab ha wui, “Pegih, nt ahni wehpeg ab epai wo haꞌichu em‑kakke. Mt am wo ni‑ahgi. Nt am haha wo em‑ahgi g em‑kakkei.

column2: Where did the baptism of John come from? Was it from heaven, or was it from human beings?”
column3: Am g hig wo ni‑ahgid mams hedai amjed hab elid mo wa g Johnbad ab uꞌukch g e‑gewkdag ch ha pahl wapkonahim. No ab Jiosh amjed aha no ab oꞌodham amjed?”

column2: But if we say, ‘it was from human beings,’ then the crowd will turn against us, because they all consider John to be a prophet.”
column3: T g hemajkam has wo t‑juh mattp hab wo chei mo ab wabsh oꞌodham amjed uꞌukch. Muꞌijj o hab elid mo d Jiosh haꞌichu i tashogidam.”

column2: So they answered Jesus, “We don't know.”
column3: Neh, bad kaij ch ab hahawa uhpam i e nohnogi Jesus wui k hab kaij, “Pi ach shaꞌi mahch mas hedai amjed ab uꞌukch g e‑gewkdag.”

column2: “But what do you think about this illustration? Once there was a man who had two sons. He went to the first son, and said, ‘Son, go and work in the vineyard today.’
column3: D hab ep kaij g Jesus, “Am g wo oidahim ihda mant wo em‑ahgi. Matp hems hema g oꞌodham gohk wo aꞌalidagk ch hab wo ah g geꞌechu, ‘Ni‑sulijga, am g hihm k chikpan am uhdwis oidag ch ed id i tashkaj.’

column2: The son answered, ‘I won't,’ but afterwards he was sorry for what he said and he did go.
column3: “K hab kaij ihda, ‘Pi ani tatchua mant am wo hih,’ ch wabshaba am shaꞌi heꞌes gawul juh g e‑chegitoidag k am hih oidag wui.

column2: The man went to the second son, and told him the same thing. He replied, ‘I'll go,’ but he didn't.
column3: “Kut ihda ohg am hahawa hih heg wui alichu e‑alidag k hab waꞌap kaij ab wui.

column2: Which of the two sons did what his father wanted?”
column3: “Dohm hab elid mat ab s‑wohog el g e‑ohg?”

column2: “John came to show you the way to live right with God, and you didn't believe him, but the tax-collectors and prostitutes did believe him. Later, when you saw what happened, you still didn't repent and believe him.
column3: Ha pahl wapkondam John at wa ia jiwia em‑wui k am chum em‑chehgi g s‑apkokam. Kumt pi ab hu wohoch. T wabshaba idam ab s‑wohoch. Kumt wa chum nei ihda k eda wa pi gawul juh g pi ap e‑chegitoi mamt ab wo s‑wohoch.

column2: Here's another illustration. There once was a man, a landowner, who planted a vineyard. He put a fence around it, made a winepress, and built a watchtower. He rented it to some tenant farmers, and then left to go to a different country.
column3: “Am g hema ep wo kaiham g haꞌichu wepogida,” bad kaij g Jesus. “Neh, matp hems hema g jewed enigakam am wo ei g uhdwis e‑oidag ed. T g piongaj an si kolhaidad k heg ep nahto mat hekaj am wo i wuhshad g wadgaj k am kei g uhgk kih mat heg amjed wo nuhkudad g eshaj.

column2: At harvest time, he sent his servants to the farmers to collect the fruit that belonged to him.
column3: T am i e ai mat g uhdwis bai. T am haꞌi ha cheha g e‑pionag mat am wo hihim k ab wo bei hegai wadgaj mo ab d i chum wuikamaj g enigakam.

column2: But the farmers attacked his servants. They beat one, killed another, and stoned another.
column3: Kut idam nuhkuddam an ha uꞌu k hema gewittan k hema muꞌa k hema ep maꞌichkwua.

column2: So he sent more servants, but the farmers did the same things to them.
column3: “Kut am hahawa baꞌich i muꞌi ep ha cheha mat am wo hihi. Kut am hihim k am dada. T am hab wa masma hab ep ha juh hegam nuhkuddam.

column2: So then he sent his son. ‘They will respect my son,’ he told himself.
column3: “T g e‑alidag am hahawa ep cheha gam hu si ha oidch no pi hab ha elid mat ab wo wa has el.

column2: But the farmers, when they saw the son, said to each other, ‘Here's the heir! Come on! Let's kill him so we can take his inheritance!’
column3: “T wabshaba idam oidag nuhkuddam am i nei g alidaj k hab kaij ab aꞌai e wui, ‘Id o d enigakam alidag. Oi g wo, tt wo muꞌa k wehs wo bei g enigaj.’

column2: They grabbed him, threw him out of the vineyard, and killed him.
column3: Neh, t wa woho an be k gam hu si i wuhshad ab amjed g uhdwis oidag k mua.

column2: When the vineyard owner returns, what will he do to those farmers?”
column3: “Pegih neh, shaht hig wo ha juh idam g enigakam hekid i jiwiak?”

column2: The chief priests and elders said to Jesus, “He will put to death those wicked men in the most awful way, and rent out the vineyard to other farmers who will be sure to give him his fruit at harvest time.”
column3: D haꞌijj hab kaij hegam, “Hemho wa at wo ha kokda hegam si pi ap chechoj k gam hu baꞌich haꞌijj ab wo ha nuhkudach mat idam ab hi wo mah hegai mo haschu ab d i wuikamaj.”

column2: “So haven't you read the Scriptures?” Jesus asked them. “ ‘The stone which the builders rejected has become the chief cornerstone. The Lord has done this, and it is wonderful in our eyes.’
column3: D hab ep kaij g Jesus, “Heuꞌu, nat pi s‑ohhod g enigakam alidag. Kumt hab wa masma wo s‑ni‑ohhod. Id o hab ahgch hab chuꞌig g wepogida ahga Jiosh oꞌohana ed:

column2: That's why I'm telling you that the kingdom of God will be taken away from you. It will be given to a people who produce the right kind of fruit.
column3: “Neh, bo chuꞌig g Jiosh oꞌohana. T g Jiosh wo em‑wohppoꞌi g e‑kownaltalig ahpim Tutuligo k hegam ab wo ha mah mat s‑ap am wo i chikp.

column2: Anyone who falls on this stone will be broken, but it will completely crush anyone it falls upon.”
column3: Neh, t wo e shoꞌigch hegam mat pi wo ni‑amich. Id at heg wo wa wepok mat ab wo e keiko hodai t ab. Kut hegam mat wo s‑ni‑ohhod wo bei g s‑koꞌok e‑namkidadag. Id at heg wo wa wepok mat g hodai ab ha ab wo gehsh k am wabsh wo s‑ha wia.”

column2: When the chief priests and the Pharisees heard his illustrations, they realized he was speaking about them.
column3: D hegam uꞌugchu papal ch Palasi s‑mahch mo g Jesus ha wepogid hegam pi ap pion

column2: They wanted him arrested, but they were afraid of what the people would do because the people believed he was a prophet.
column3: ch heg hekaj an chum s‑behim. D wabshaba g hemajkam hab elid mo g Jesus d hema Jiosh haꞌichu i tashogiddam. K hegam uꞌukchu papal s‑ha gihug.

column2: Jesus spoke to them using more illustrated stories.
column3: Jesus ad am hema ep ha ahgid g haꞌichu wepogida am neokch ha wui g hemajkam ch hab kaij,

column2: “The kingdom of heaven is like a king who organized a wedding celebration for his son,” Jesus explained.
column3: “Bant masma am ep wo wepogi g Jiosh kownaltalig matp hems hema g kownal am wo i apꞌech g geꞌe gegosig am wehhejed g e‑alidag nat pi wo ha hohnt.

column2: “He sent out his servants to everyone who was invited to the wedding to tell them to come, but they refused.
column3: T am i e ai. Kut am ha cheha g e‑pionag mat an wo ha ahgidahi hegam mam ab heki hu ha waid. Kut wabshaba idam pi ab hu i hihimim.

column2: So he sent out more servants, with the instructions, ‘Tell those who are invited, “I've prepared the wedding banquet. The bulls and fattened calves have been killed—everything's ready. So come to the wedding!” ’
column3: “Kut am hahawa haꞌi ep ha cheha g e‑pionag mat an ep wo i ha ahgidahi. K idam an ha ahgidahim ch hab kaij, ‘Heki at hu e chuama g s‑gihgim ch e gagꞌe g wipsilo ch wehs haꞌichu e nahtokch. Kumt ab wo i hihim k wo e gegos.’

column2: But they ignored the invitation and left. One went to his fields; another to take care of his business.
column3: “T wabshaba idam mam ab ha waid pi ab hu shaꞌi kaiham k gam hu hab wabsh wua g hejel e‑chikpan. Hema at gam hu hih e‑oidag wui. T hema gam hu ep hih e‑tiannaga wui.

column2: The rest grabbed the king's servants, mistreated them, and killed them.
column3: Kut haꞌijj an ha ui idam pion k ha gewittan k ha kokda.

column2: The king became furious. He sent his soldiers to destroy those murderers and burn down their town.
column3: Kut shaꞌi si bagat hegai kownal k am ha cheha g e‑shondalig mat am wo hihim k epai wo ha kokda hegam mat ha kokda g pion k wo mehi g ha‑kihhim. T wa woho hab juh.

column2: Then the king said to his servants, ‘The wedding banquet is ready, but those who were invited didn't deserve to attend.
column3: “T am hahawa i ha wai g e‑pionag k hab kaij, ‘E at nahto g gegosig wehhejed g ni‑alidag hohnta. T wabshaba hegam hemajkam mant ab i chum ha wai hab e juh mo pi d hahawa ha‑wuikam.

column2: Go into the streets and invite everyone you find to come to the wedding.’
column3: Kumt am wo hihi wohg oidk k ab wo i ha wai gegosig wui mamtp heꞌekia i hemajkam wo ha cheh.’

column2: So the servants went out into the streets and brought back everyone they could find, both the good and the bad. The wedding hall was full.
column3: “Kut am wa woho hihi g piongaj wohg oidk k ab wehs i ha wai hegam mat ha cheh, chum hems g pi ap hemajkam. T am hahawa muꞌi dada. Kumt wehsijj ab ha mah g s‑kehg eniga heg wehhejed k am i ha wahpki. Kut shuhd g kih.

column2: But when the king came in to meet the guests, he noticed a man who didn't have a wedding robe on.
column3: “Kut am i wah g kownal k am ha nei hegam mat am dada. K am hahawa wabsh hema daha g oꞌodham mo pi ab hu wahkch hegai s‑kehg eniga.

column2: He asked him, ‘My friend, how did you get in here without a wedding robe?’ The man had nothing to say.
column3: K ab kakke ch hab kaij, ‘Ni‑nawoj, shahpt masma ia i wah pi ab hu wahkch g s‑kehg eniga id wehhejed?’

column2: Then the king told his servants, ‘Bind his hands and feet, and throw him out into the dark, where there'll be crying and grinding of teeth.’
column3: Kut ihda kownal am hahawa ha ahgi g e‑pionag k hab kaij, ‘Am g wo si wulshp k gam hu wo daꞌich s‑chuhugam k ed. Kut am hu wo shoak k ga hu wabsh wo i si e kiꞌishch nat pi wo shaꞌi si s‑koꞌok haꞌichu nakogad.’

column2: For many are invited, but few are chosen.”
column3: “Pegih, nt wo em‑ahgi mo muꞌi ab ha waid g Jiosh. K wabshaba al heꞌekia d i hemajkamgaj.”

column2: Then the Pharisees left and met together to plot how they could trap him by what he said.
column3: Kutsh am i e hemapai g Palasi am i aꞌamich mat has masma wo heki himch g Jesus ab haꞌichu kakkek.

column2: They sent their disciples to him, together with some of Herod's supporters.
column3: Tki am haꞌi i ha wehmt hegam mo ab si has elid g kownal Herod k am ha wehm hihi haꞌi hegam Palasi k am dada k hab kaij, “Ha mashchamdam, s‑mahch ach map s‑ap d oꞌodham ch wabsh chum hedai ha mashcham g Jiosh himdag, chum as has wo chei hedai i.

column2: So let us know your opinion. Is it right to pay Caesar's taxes, or not?”
column3: Pegih, k am wo t‑ahgi maps has elid g geꞌe kownal lial kowlanta. No hig t‑hiwgid g t‑chehanig ahchim Tutuligo matt wo ha namkid aha no pi t‑hiwgid?”

column2: Jesus knew their motives were evil. He asked them, “Why are you trying to trap me, you hypocrites?
column3: D wabshaba g Jesus am wa s‑ha amichud mo g pi apꞌekam hab elid ch hab ha ahg, “Ahpim s‑chu iꞌattomkam am wabsh chum heki s‑ni‑himchudamk.

column2: Show me the coin that is used to pay the tax.” They brought a denarius coin to him.
column3: Ab g wo hema ni‑chehgid hegai lial mam hekaj ha namkid.”

column2: “Whose image and whose title is inscribed here?” he asked them.
column3: D hab ha ahg, “Am g hig wo ni‑ahgid mo hedai wuhiosha ch hedai chehgig ab oꞌohadag id ab lial?”

column2: “Caesar's,” they replied.
column3: D hab kaij idam, “Hegai mo d uhgchu t‑kownalig.”

column2: When they heard Jesus' answer they were stunned. They went away and left him.
column3: Kud si has i el hegam k gam hu hihi ab amjed.

column2: Later the same day some Sadducees came to see him. (They are the ones who say there's no resurrection.)
column3: D heg waꞌi tash ed am haꞌi dada g Sajusi Jesus wui. Hegam mo d Sajusi o pi wohochud mat g muhki ab uhpam wo i wuhsh muhkig t amjed.

column2: They asked him, “Teacher, Moses said that if a married  man dies without having children, his brother should marry his widow and have children on behalf of his brother.
column3: D hab kaij idam, “Ha mashchamdam, Mosesbad atki an oꞌoha hegai chehanigaj g Jiosh mo hab chuꞌig matsh g am oidchkam wehngaj hegai mat wo muh pi ha aꞌalidagkch hemho wo wa bei g hohnigaj g e‑wehnagbad. Tsh g ha‑aꞌaliga hab masma wo e kuint mat d wo aꞌalidajk hegai mat muh.

column2: Well, once there were seven brothers here with us. The first married, and died, and since he had no children he left his widow to his brother.
column3: “Pegih, k am hu hebai wewaꞌak d e‑wepngam ch am t‑wehm kih. Kut g si geꞌechu ge hohnt k pi ab hu ha aꞌalidt k muh k an dagito g e‑hohnig. T g am oidchkam nawojij an hahawa ep bei g hohnigaj

column2: The same thing happened to the second and third husband, right up to the seventh.
column3: k hab waꞌap pi ab hu ha aꞌalidt k hab waꞌap muh. Kut ihda g oidchkam hab waꞌap hohnt k hab waꞌap muh pi ab hu ha aꞌalidtk. Neh, t hab masma i e oi idam wewaꞌak k wehsijj koꞌok huhug.

column2: In the end the woman died too.
column3: K am huꞌi hebai, t haha wabsh muh hab wa ehp ihda uwi.

column2: So when the resurrection takes place, whose wife of the seven brothers will she be, for she married all of them?”
column3: Pegih, am g hig t‑ahgid mas hedai d wo hohnigkad ihda matp ep wo e chegito g koꞌi no pi wehsijj hohnigkahim.”

column2: Jesus replied, “Your mistake is you don't know Scripture or what God can do.
column3: D hab kaij g Jesus ab ha wui, “Pi am ap chegito nam pi pi shaꞌi mahch g Jiosh oꞌohana ch ep pi shaꞌi mahch mo heꞌes i gewkdag.

column2: For in the resurrection people don't marry, and they aren't given in marriage either—they're like the angels in heaven.
column3: Woho at ab uhpam wo ha mah g koꞌi g doakag. T wabshaba hahawa pi wo hohontad hab masma mo g anghil pi hohont.

column2: As for the resurrection of the dead—haven't you read what God said to you,
column3: Mosesbad atki an oꞌoha mash wa hab kaij g Jiosh:

column2: When the crowds heard what he said, they were amazed at his teaching.
column3: Kud am i kah ihda g hemajkam k si has i el g mashchamaj.

column2: When the Pharisees heard that he'd left the Sadducees speechless, they got together and went to ask some more questions.
column3: Kud am haꞌi dada g Palasi mat wo heki himch g Jesus am i kaiok mat ab si ha chehmo g Sajusi.

column2: One of them, who was a legal expert, asked him a question to try to trap him:
column3: D hema hegam d Jiosh chehanig hudawogdam

column2: “Teacher, which is the greatest commandment in the law?”
column3: ch hab kaij, “Ha mashchamdam, shahchu o d si baꞌiwechkim geꞌe chehanigaj g Jiosh?”

column2: Jesus told them, “ ‘Love the Lord your God in all you think, in all you feel, and in all you do.’ This is the greatest commandment, the first commandment.
column3: D hab kaij g Jesus, “Id o d si geꞌe ch baꞌich i si s‑has haꞌichu chehanig:

column2: While the Pharisees were gathered there, Jesus asked them a question.
column3: D am i e hemapai g Palasi. D g Jesus hab ha ahg,

column2: “What do you think about the Messiah?” he asked. “Whose son is he?”
column3: “Am g wo ni‑ahgid mam hedai hab elid mat g Jiosh si Kehsha ab d wo amjedkamk?” D hab kaij hegam, “Heg atsh d wo amjedkamk t‑kownaligbad mash hab chehgig David.”

column2: “But how can David under inspiration call him ‘Lord’?” Jesus asked them. “He says,
column3: D hab kaij g Jesus, “Pegih, sh wa eda g Davidbad hab aꞌaga, ‘ni‑kownalig’ ch hab kaij g gewkdajkaj g Hekia S‑apꞌekam Gewkdag:

column2: Nobody could answer him, and from then on nobody dared to ask him any more questions.
column3: Kud pi hedai e nako mas ab hu uhpam has wo chei Jesus wui nih hemako neꞌoki. D heg i tashkaj amjed pi hedai e nako mas ab hu haꞌichu ep wo kakke.

column2: Then Jesus spoke to the crowds and his disciples:
column3: Muꞌi hemajkam ad am haꞌichug t‑wehm.

column2: “The religious teachers and the Pharisees are responsible as interpreters of the law of Moses,
column3: Kud hab kaij g Jesus ab wehsijj t‑wui, “Hegam chehanig em‑mashchamdam ch Palasi o d hegam mo ab mahks g gewkdag mat am wo i tashogi g chehanig.

column2: so obey them and do everything they tell you. But don't follow what they do, because they don't practice what they preach.
column3: Kumt heg hekaj ab wo s‑ha wohog elidad. K wabshaba muꞌijj idam pi am hu hab junihim mo haschu em‑mashcham. Kumt hekaj pi am hu ha oidk hab wo masmak.

column2: They tie up heavy burdens, and place them on people's shoulders, but they themselves don't lift a finger to help them.
column3: Neh, muꞌi s‑hasig haꞌichu o ab em‑chehani. K id d s‑wehch haꞌichu mohtoi am em‑wehhejed. K eda pi haꞌichu hab shaꞌi wua mas hekaj em‑wehm wo moht.

column2: Everything they do is to make sure they get noticed. They make themselves large prayer boxes  to wear and long tassels on their clothes.
column3: Wehs haꞌichu o heg wabsh hekaj am hab junihim mamt wo ha neidad. An o uꞌa g Jiosh oꞌohana heg wabsh hekaj mamt hab wo ha elidad mo ab wohog elid.

column2: They love to have the places of honor at banquets and the best seats in the synagogues.
column3: Si o s‑hohhoꞌid mat si s‑apko wo dadhaiwua am geꞌe gegosig ch ed ch am wa si hejelko dadaikud am cheopi ch ed.

column2: They love to be greeted with respect in the market places, and for people to call them, ‘Rabbi.’
column3: Si o s‑hohhoꞌid mamt ab wo si has ha elidad am hemajkam ha‑shahgid ch hab wo ha aꞌagad mo d ge ha mashchamdam.

column2: Don't let people call you ‘Rabbi.’ Only one is your Master Teacher, and you are all brothers.
column3: “Ahpim g pi wo shaꞌi tatchuad mams hab wo em‑aꞌagad ‘ha mashchamdam’ nam pi d aꞌai e‑wepngam. Kuni ahni d waꞌi em‑mashchamdam.

column2: Don't call anyone by the title ‘Father’ here on earth. Only one is your Father, who is in heaven.
column3: Pi g hedai hab wo aꞌagad ‘ge ni‑ohg’ id dahm jewed. Heg amt waꞌi Jiosh hab wo aꞌagad mo d ge em‑ohg.

column2: Don't let people call you ‘Teacher.’ Only one is your Teacher, the Messiah.
column3: Pi g hab wo e aꞌagad mam d ha wanimeddam. Ahni ani d waꞌi em‑wanimeddam Jiosh si Kehsha.

column2: The greatest among you will be your servant.
column3: Bamt waꞌi masma d wo si haꞌichuk mamt d wabsh wo ha‑pionagk.

column2: Those who make themselves great will be humbled, and those who humble themselves will be made great.
column3: Kut d wabsh wo pi haꞌichuk hegai matp hedai hab wo chum e elidad mo d si haꞌichu. Heg at d wo si haꞌichuk matp hedai ab wabsh wo i pi e haꞌichuchudch.”

column2: But what a disaster is coming on you, religious teachers and Pharisees, you hypocrites! You slam shut the door of the kingdom of heaven in people's faces. You yourselves don't go in, yet you don't let anyone in who is trying to enter.
column3: D hab hahawa ep kaij g Jesus, “Neh, muꞌijj ahpim chehanig ha mashchamdam ch ahpim Palasi am d wabsh s‑chu iꞌattomkam. Ih, shoꞌig! Jiosh at si s‑koꞌokam wo em‑namkid heg hekaj. Pi am ha hiwgid hegam mo am i chum s‑wahpkimk Jiosh kownaltalig ed ch hab waꞌap hejel pi am hu i wahp. Heg o wa wepo mam ab si yahwidadch g kihjeg am Jiosh kownaltalig wui.
“Ha am iattogid g heheꞌejel wiꞌikam uꞌuwi ch ha ehsid g ha‑kihki ch eda am wabsh s‑e chehgidamk mam si chew e hoꞌigeꞌidahun. Id at hekaj baꞌich wo i s‑koꞌokk g em‑namkidadag.]

column2: What a disaster is coming on you, religious teachers and Pharisees, you hypocrites! For you travel over land and sea to make a single convert, and when you do, you make him twice a son of darkness as you are yourselves.
column3: “Am am si i e nakog mamt chum hems hemako am wo i wanchkwua pi wohokam e‑himdag ed. T ihda baꞌich i s‑gewkam wo wulshpik mam ahpim mat am wo gei Jiawul kih ed nat pi baꞌich i s‑gewkam am wo oidad g pi wohokam em‑himdag. T g Jiosh si s‑koꞌokam wo em‑namkid heg hekaj.

column2: What a disaster is coming on those of you who say, ‘If you swear by the Temple that doesn't count, but if you swear by the gold of the Temple, then you have to keep your oath.’ How foolish and blind you are!
column3: “Neh, am am haꞌi ep chum ha mashcham ch eda hab chechꞌe, ‘Pi att hemho wa hab wo juh g t‑neꞌoki mattp wabsh wo gewkaj chehchegch g geꞌe cheopi, heg hi wa matt wo chehcheg hegai ohla mo hekaj e heosid.’

column2: What is greater—the gold, or the Temple that makes the gold holy?
column3: K eda g geꞌe cheopi baꞌich d i si haꞌichu mo hegai heosidakud.

column2: You say, ‘If you swear on the altar that doesn't count, but if you swear on the sacrifice that's on the altar, then you have to keep your oath.’
column3: “Kum hab ep chechꞌe, ‘Pi att hemho wa hab wo juh g t‑neꞌoki mattp wabsh wo gewkaj chehchegch hegai iagchulidakud mo am hab chuꞌig geꞌe cheopi t ab, heg hi wa matt wo chehcheg hegai mo an ab e iagchulid.’

column2: How blind you are! What is greater—the sacrifice, or the altar that makes the sacrifice holy?
column3: K eda g iagchulidakud baꞌich d i si haꞌichu mo hi hegai mo an ab e iagchulid.

column2: If you swear by the altar, you swear by it and by everything that's on it.
column3: K heg wa wepo mam heg chehcheg iagchulidakud mam eda chehcheg g iagchulida.

column2: If you swear by the Temple you swear by it and by the One who lives there.
column3: Kum chehcheg g Jiosh mam eda chehcheg g geꞌe cheopi no pi heg d Jiosh kih.

column2: If you swear by heaven you swear by the throne of God and the One who sits there.
column3: Kum hab waꞌap chehcheg g Jiosh mam eda chehcheg g dahm kahchim.

column2: What a disaster is coming on you, religious teachers and Pharisees, you hypocrites! You pay a tithe of mint, aniseed, and cumin, but you neglect the vital aspects of the law—doing right, showing mercy, exercising trust. Yes, you should pay your tithe, but don't forget these other things.
column3: “Im am hu hab wabsh i juhkch hegai mo d chum si haꞌichu am Jiosh chehanig ed mamt hab wabsh wo juhkchid g al chum haꞌichu. Neh, wehs am haꞌichu hemako tahpani mahk g Jiosh mo wehst‑mahm e tahpanch, chum hems g haꞌichu hahhag ch haꞌichu kai, ch wabshaba pi ap ha lodait ch pi ha hoꞌigeꞌid ch pi ab hu wohochud g Jiosh. T g Jiosh heg hekaj si s‑koꞌokam wo em‑namkid.

column2: You blind guides—you strain what you drink to keep out a fly but then you swallow a camel!
column3: Am am wabsh s‑nenꞌoid g al chuꞌuchum haꞌichu ch g geꞌeged haꞌichu pi chegito. Id o heg wa wepo mamtp hems wo oꞌos g e‑wasib mat am eda wo gei g al chukumug k wabshaba wabsh wo bah wehnadk g ka‑mihyo matp heg am eda wo gei.

column2: What a disaster is coming on you, religious teachers and Pharisees, you hypocrites! You clean the outside of the cup and the plate, but inside you're full of greed and self-indulgence.
column3: “Baꞌich at wo i s‑koꞌokk g em‑namkidadag nam pi hi wa chum si s‑ap e chehgid. K wabshaba am em‑eda haꞌichug g pi amdag ch s‑chu daꞌadag.

column2: You blind Pharisees! First clean the inside of the cup and the plate, so that the outside will also be clean.
column3: Am g wo i e kegchud e‑iꞌibdag ed. T g haꞌichu hab em‑juni am haha wo s‑apꞌek.

column2: What a disaster is coming on you, religious teachers and Pharisees, you hypocrites! You are like white-washed tombs, looking good on the outside, but on the inside full of skeletons and all kinds of rottenness.
column3: “Neh, nat hig pi wo i e kegch g hihaꞌini an e dahm, chum as am eda wo wehchk g ohꞌo ch jewalig? Pegih, m ahpim hab sha masma mo g hihaꞌini

column2: You're just the same. On the outside you look like good people to others, but on the inside you're full of hypocrisy and wickedness.
column3: nam pi ab chum e chehgidch mam d s‑apꞌekam. K eda g em‑chegitoi pi aꞌpe. Ih shoꞌig! Jiosh at si s‑koꞌokam wo em‑namkid.

column2: What a disaster is coming on you, religious teachers and Pharisees, you hypocrites! You build tombs as memorials to the prophets, and decorate the tombs of the good,  and you say, ‘If we had lived in the times of our ancestors we would not have joined them in shedding the blood of the prophets.’  But by saying this you testify against yourselves, proving that you belong to those who murdered the prophets!
column3: “Em‑shohshon at muꞌi ha kokda g kekelibad Jiosh haꞌichu i tashogiddam. Kum ahpim si s‑kehg ha hehosid g ha‑hihaꞌiniga hegam mamt ha kokda ch hab chechꞌe mamt ahpim hi pi wo chum ha kokda. Dam s‑chu iꞌattomkam ch ha wepo masma mash wa g em‑shohshon. Ih, shoꞌig! Jiosh at si s‑koꞌokam wo em‑namkid namt pi am ha oidk hab wo e juh.

column2: So get on with it—finish it all off using your forefathers' methods!
column3: S‑ap amt wo nahto hegai mat g em‑shohshonbad i shonwuich.

column2: You snakes, you brood of vipers, how will you escape the judgment of condemnation?
column3: Damt wo ha muꞌakamk hab masma mo g kohkꞌoi ch hekaj pi hab mahs mams wo e doꞌibia.

column2: That's why I'm sending you prophets, wise men, and teachers. Some of them you will kill, some of them you will crucify, and some of them you will flog in your synagogues, hunting them from town to town.
column3: Pegih, nt wo em‑ahgi mant am i ha wuwhas g haꞌichu i tashogiddam ch s‑chu aꞌamichuddam ch ha mashchamdam am em‑shahgid. Kumt haꞌi wo ha gewitta am e‑chechopi ed k haꞌi an has wo ha shahmudahim k haꞌi wo ha kokda, chum hems ab ha sisishpk kots t ab.

column2: As a result, you will be held accountable for the blood of all the good people that has been poured out on the land—from the blood of Abel, who did what was right, to the blood of Zachariah son of Barachiah, whom you killed between the Temple and the altar. I'm telling you, the consequences of all this will fall on this generation.
column3: T g s‑koꞌok em‑namkidadag ab em‑ab wo gei hemu s‑hohtam. Neh, Abelbad atsh wa wehpeg e muhkid. Tsh amjed muꞌi ep e koꞌij. Tsh ga hu si ha oidch hegai Zecariabad mash d Barackiabad alidag e muhkid am ha shahgid g geꞌe cheopi ch iagchulidakud, Kum ahpim ha wepo chuꞌijig hegam matsh wa ha kokda ch ha wepo masma wo bei g s‑koꞌok e‑namkidadag mamtp hedai ha wepo elid haꞌichu.”

column2: O Jerusalem, Jerusalem, you who kill the prophets and stone those who are sent to you! So often I wanted to gather your children as a mother hen gathers her chicks under her wings—but you wouldn't let me.  Now look—your house is left abandoned, totally empty.
column3: K hab ep kaij g Jesus, “Ih, shoꞌig, ahpim Jerusalem t am hemajkam, nat pi g Jiosh s‑ap wo em‑dagito. Em‑shohshon ash wa ha maꞌichshulig ch muꞌi ha kokda g Jiosh haꞌichu i tashogiddam. Kumt ahpim am ha oidk hab wo e juh. Muꞌikko ani chum tatchua mant wo si s‑ap em‑nuhkud hab sha masma mat g chuchul g e‑mahmad ab e wecho wo ha hemapai. M wabshaba pi ab hu tatchua manis hab wo em‑juh.

column2: I tell you this: you won't see me again until you say, ‘Blessed is the one who comes in the name of the Lord.’ ”
column3: K eda an hab chuꞌig Jiosh oꞌohana ed mamt ab wo chum ni‑ihmad ch hab wo chechꞌed mat g Jiosh am ni‑kehsh k si s‑ni‑hoꞌigeꞌid. Kunt ia wo i s‑ap em‑dagito am hugkam mamt hab hahawa masma hab wo e juh.”

column2: As Jesus was leaving the Temple his disciples came to him, pointing proudly to the Temple buildings.
column3: Kud gam hu hahawa i wuhsh g Jesus ab amjed g geꞌe cheopi. Kuchd am i oid k am wui dada k am aꞌaga mo si s‑kehg hab mahs g geꞌe cheopi.

column2: But Jesus replied, “You see all these buildings? I tell you the truth: there won't be one stone left upon another. Every last one will come crashing down!”
column3: D hab kaij, “Heuꞌu, woho o hi wa si s‑kehg hab mahs. Nt wabshaba si shel wo em‑ahgi mo e aihim mat wehs wo i e shul ihda.”

column2: As Jesus sat on the Mount of Olives, the disciples came to him in private, and asked, “Please tell us when this will happen. What will be the sign of your coming and the end of the world?”
column3: Kuchd amjed gam hu hejelko hihi wehmaj g Jesus k ab i chehchsh k ab dadhaiwua Olive Uꞌus Kawulk t ab. Kuchd hab ahg g Jesus, “Am g hig t‑ahgid mas hekid hab wo i e juh hegai map am t‑ahgid. Kut haschu d wo chehgidak matt heg ab wo s‑mahchk mo e aihim mapt ep wo jiwia. T g jewed wo huhug.”

column2: “Make sure no one misleads you,” Jesus replied.
column3: D hab kaij g Jesus, “Mt wo si s‑e nenꞌoidad mat pi hedai wo em‑iattogi.

column2: “Many will come claiming to be me, saying, ‘I'm the Messiah,’ and they will deceive many people.
column3: Muꞌi at an wo i wuwha aꞌahidag oidam k ni‑wepo wo e chehcheg hab kaijch mo d Jiosh si Kehsha. Kut muꞌijj ab wo s‑ha wohoch.

column2: You'll hear about wars, and rumors about wars, but don't be anxious. These things have to happen, but this isn't the end.  Nations will attack other nations, and kingdoms will fight against other kingdoms. There will be famines and earthquakes in various places,
column3: T g nahnko mahs hemajkam ch jejewed ab aꞌai wo i e checheggia. Mt wabshaba pi wo e totods. Hemho wa at hab wo e juh hab masma. K wabshaba pi hab d ahga mat e ai mat wo kuhgit. Bihugig at wo gehsh k g jewed wo uꞌugij muꞌikpa.

column2: but all these things are just the beginnings of birth pains.
column3: Id at d wabsh wo shohshonajk g shoꞌigdag nat pi baꞌich wo i geꞌeda.

column2: Then they will arrest you, they will persecute you, and they will kill you. All people will hate you because of me.
column3: “T wo e ai mamt am wo em‑uꞌu k wo em‑dagito mamt wo em‑shoꞌigchud k wo em‑kokda. Wehsko jejewed dakam hemajkam at wo s‑em‑kehꞌidad ni‑hekaj.

column2: At that time many believers will give up believing. They will betray one another and hate one another.
column3: Muꞌijj at wo ni‑dagito heg hekaj k wo aꞌai e gagda k wo s‑e kehꞌidad.

column2: Many false prophets will come and deceive many people.
column3: Muꞌi at an wo i wuwha g s‑chu iꞌattomkam k hab wo e aꞌagad mo d Jiosh haꞌichu i tashogiddam. T muꞌi hemajkam ab wo s‑ha wohoch.

column2: The increasing evil will lead the love of many to grow cold,
column3: Pi apꞌekam at wo i geꞌeda. T muꞌijj wo huhug g pihk ha‑elidadag ab aꞌai e wui.

column2: but those who hold out to the end will be saved.
column3: “Mt wo sha e nakog k wo gahi wuwha g e‑shoꞌigdag. T g Jiosh am wo i em‑wahpki e‑kihdag ed.

column2: The good news of the kingdom will be proclaimed around the whole world so everyone will be able to hear it, and then the end will come.
column3: Ihda s‑kehg haꞌichu ahgaj g Jiosh ab amjed g kownaltaligaj at an wehsko wo e ah jewed dahm. T am haha wo e ai mat wo kuhgit.

column2: So when you see the ‘evil that defiles’ standing in the holy place that the prophet Daniel spoke about (those who read this please consider carefully),
column3: “Am g wo amichud ihda mam in neꞌokchulid. Hegai Danielbad mash d Jiosh haꞌichu i tashogiddam at an oꞌoha mat g em‑obga am wo i kei g s‑uam haꞌichu ged hu si eda g geꞌe cheopi.

column2: then the people living in Judea should run away to the mountains.
column3: Kut hemho wa am wo ahhio dohdaꞌag wui hegam mat hedai ia wo haꞌichugk Judea jewed ch ed.

column2: Anyone who is on the housetop must not go down and fetch what's in the house.  Anyone who is out in the fields must not go back to get a coat.
column3: Kut pi hedai am hu wo shaꞌi chum i wah e‑kih ed mat am wo haꞌichu ui, chum as hems imhab wo waꞌi oimmedad e‑kih wehgaj o am wo chikpanad oidag ch ed.

column2: How awful it will be for those who are pregnant, and those who are nursing babies at that time!
column3: S‑ta at ehbidam wo mahsk am ha wehhejed hegam mat wo chuꞌuchum mahmadk ch hegam mat wabsh wo kia woꞌok g ali.

column2: Pray that you don't have to run away in winter, or on the Sabbath day.
column3: “Mt ab wo tahnid g Jiosh mat pi eda hab wo e juh ihda em‑mihshmda tash ed o g s‑hehpichꞌed.

column2: For at that time there will be terrible persecution—more terrible than anything that has happened from the beginning of the world up till now, and won't ever happen again.
column3: Baꞌich at d wo i si geꞌe shoꞌigdagk mo pi hekid g hemajkam shaꞌi neid ch pi hekid hab masma ep wo nei.

column2: Unless those days are cut short, nobody will be saved, but for the sake of the chosen those days will be cut short.
column3: Pi at hedai wo e nako mas am gahi wo wuhsh hegai shoꞌigdag matp tash wo hih. T g Jiosh heg hekaj wo i shopolkai am ha wehhejed g e‑hemajkamga.

column2: So if anyone tells you, ‘Look, here's the Messiah,’ or, ‘There he is,’ don't believe it.
column3: “Pi g wo shaꞌi ha wohochud matp hema hab wo sha chei mo am hebai haꞌichug g Jiosh si Kehsha.

column2: For false messiahs will appear, and false prophets too, and they will perform incredible signs and miracles in order to deceive the chosen, if that were possible.
column3: Muꞌi at in wo i wuwhag k hab wo chei mo d ni‑ahni Jiosh si Kehsha o d Jiosh haꞌichu i tashogiddam k am hab wo wuad g s‑hasig haꞌichu mat hekaj wo i chum ha wanchshul g Jiosh hemajkamga matp wo e nako.

column2: Notice that I've told you this before it even happens.
column3: Neh, ni heki hu am em‑ahgid mamt hekaj wo s‑e nenꞌoidk.

column2: So if they tell you, ‘Look, he's out in the desert,’ don't go looking there; or if they say, ‘Look, he's secretly here,’ don't believe it.
column3: “Tp hems haꞌi hab wo chei mo am haꞌichug g Jiosh si Kehsha tohono jewed ch ed o am hebai e ehstokch. Kumt wabshaba pi wo ha wohochud k pi am hu wo chum hihi.

column2: For the coming of the Son of man will be like the lightning that flashes brightly from east to west.
column3: Wehsko ant wo ni‑chehgi mant hekid ep wo jiwia jewed dahm ahni Jiosh si Kehsha hab sha masma mat g wepgi s‑masma an gahi wo kekiwua chewagi ch ed.

column2: ‘Vultures gather where the carcass is.’
column3: “Neh, s‑mahch am mat hebai wo woꞌok g haꞌichu muhkig an wabsh ha neidch g nunuwi mat am wo e chehm. Pegih, mt hab waꞌap s‑ap wo s‑mahchk mant hebai wo haꞌichugk.”

column2: But right after those days of persecution the sun will be darkened, the moon will not shine, the stars will fall from heaven, and the powers of heaven will be shaken.
column3: D hab ep kaij, “T am wabsh wo i chum kuhgi hegai jewed shuhdgim shoꞌigdag. T g tash tonlig wo huhug. T g mashad ep pi wo ha ton. T g dahm kahchim wo ugij. T g huhuꞌu wo i shul.

column2: Then the sign of the Son of man will appear in heaven, and all the peoples of the earth will mourn. They will see the Son of man coming on the clouds of heaven with power and in brilliant glory.
column3: Nt ab haha wo i ni‑chehgi ab dahm kahchim t amjed k wo jiwia. T wehs hemajkam wo si shoanid ab i ni‑neidok. Nt si s‑masma ab wo hudunihi chewagi ch ed. Kut am wo e maskogi g ni‑gewkdag.

column2: With a blast from a trumpet he will send his angels to gather his chosen ones from every place, from one end of heaven and earth to the other.
column3: T ab si s‑kaidam wo e kuhu g kuikud. Kunt wo ha cheha g ni‑anghiliga mat ab wehs wo i ha hemapai hegam mant am i ha chuhcha mat wo e doꞌibia. T am wo hihi imhab siꞌal tahgio ch imhab hudunig tahgio ch imhab wakolim tahgio ch imhab juhpin tahgio k wo ha hemapai.”

column2: Learn an illustration from the fig tree. When its shoots become tender and leaves begin to sprout, you know that summer is coming.
column3: “Nt wo haꞌichu em‑mashcha heg hekaj suhna uhs. Mt wo s‑mahchk mo g toniabkam e aihim mamt wo nei mat ab wo i iꞌiwgi.

column2: In the same way when you see all these things happening, you know that his coming is near, in fact it's right at the door!
column3: Pegih, mt hab waꞌap wo s‑mahchk mo e aihim mat wehs wo kuhgit mamt wo nei mat hab wo e juh hegai mani em‑ahgid.

column2: I tell you the truth: this generation won't pass away until all these things have happened.
