column3: Nt wo si shel em‑ahgi mat d wabsh wo kia dodakamk hegam mat wo nei ihda mani em‑ahgid mat hekid wehs wo kuhgit.

column2: Heaven and earth may pass away, but my words won't pass away.
column3: Neh, wehs at gam hu hab wo i e juh ihda Jiosh nahtoi mam in neid. T wabshaba g ni‑neꞌoki pi hekid gam hu hab wo i e juh.”

column2: But no one knows the day or hour when this will take place, not the angels in heaven, nor the Son. Only the Father knows.
column3: D hab ep kaij, “Heg o waꞌi s‑mahch ni‑ohg Jiosh mant hekid ep wo jiwia. Pi o hedai ep s‑mahch, chum hems g anghil nih ahni mani d hi wa chum alidaj.

column2: When the Son of man comes it will be like it was during the time of Noah.
column3: Bat wo masmak haꞌichu mant hekid ep wo jiwia mash wa hab chuꞌig mash eda g Noahbad in d doakam.

column2: It will be as in the days before the flood, when they were eating and drinking, marrying and giving in marriage, right up until the day that Noah went into the Ark.
column3: Hemajkam ash wa gam hu wabsh i si nenead ch e gegosid ch ihꞌed ch e hohont ch gam hu wabsh i pi chegito g Jiosh. T haha wabsh e ai g tash mat hegam Noahbad am i wahp geꞌe wahlko ch ed.

column2: They didn't realize what was going to happen until the flood came and swept them all away. That's how the coming of the Son of man will be.
column3: Kut wehs ha wiꞌin g hemajkam k ha hugio. Kut hab wo wa masmak mant hekid ep wo jiwia.

column2: Two men will be working in the fields. One will be taken, the other left.
column3: Neh, gohkajj at am wo chikpanad oidag ch ed. T hema gam hu wo i e be k hema am wo wa i e wuiok.

column2: Two women will be grinding grain with a mill. One will be taken, the other left.
column3: Gohk uꞌuwi at am wo haꞌichu chuꞌad. T hema gam hu wo i e be k hema am wo wa i e wuiok.

column2: So stay alert, because you don't know what day your Lord is coming.
column3: “Pegih, mt wo si s‑e nenꞌoidad. Pi o ta machima am em‑wehhejed mant haschu tash ed ep wo jiwia ahni em‑kownalig.

column2: But consider this: if the house-owner knew what time a thief was coming, he would keep watch. He would not allow his house to be broken into and robbed.
column3: Neh, pi o ta machima mas hekid hema wo jiwia g s‑chu ehskam. Kum heg hekaj chum hekid nuhkud g e‑kihdag.

column2: You also need to be ready, because the Son of man is coming at a time when you're not expecting him.
column3: Pegih, k hab waꞌap pi ta machima em‑wehhejed manis hekid wo uhpam jiwia jewed wui ahni Jiosh si Kehsha. Mt heg hekaj wo si e nahtokchid chum hekid.

column2: For who is the trustworthy and thoughtful servant? It's the one his master puts in charge of his household to provide them with food at the proper time.
column3: “Chum amt hedai wo e nahtokch mamtp wo s‑wapagimak ch wo s‑chu aꞌamichudad. S‑mahch am mat g ha‑ahmo hema wo e‑gahgi g hab mahs pion k wo nuhkudach g e‑kihdag. T heg s‑ap wo ha chikpanchudad ch wo ha dagioꞌidad g e‑wehm pion mat eda pi an hu wo haꞌichugk g ha‑ahmo.

column2: How good it will be for that servant to be found doing that when his master returns!
column3: T am ep wo jiwia k wo cheh mo s‑ap am hab junihim g e‑chikpan. Kut d wo si geꞌe s‑hehgigk heg wehhejed pion.

column2: I tell you the truth: the master will put that servant in charge over everything he has.
column3: Nt wo si shel em‑ahgi mat g ahmoj am hahawa wehs dahm wo kei g e‑kihdag.

column2: But if he was evil, the servant would say to himself, ‘My master is taking a long time,’
column3: “T wabshaba pi ap d wo ha kehshak matp hedai hab wo i e ah, ‘Pi at oi wo jiwia g ni‑ahmo,’

column2: and would start beating the other servants, feasting and drinking with the drunks.
column3: k wo i ha shoꞌigch g e‑wehm pion k g s‑iꞌimkam ha wehm wo ihꞌed ch wo e gegosidad.

column2: Then that servant's master will return when the man doesn't expect him, at a time he doesn't know.
column3: T haha wabsh wo jiwia g ahmoj k wo cheh mo pi ap hab wua g e‑chikpan

column2: He'll cut him to pieces, and treat him in the same way as the hypocrites, sending him to a place where there's crying and gnashing of teeth.
column3: k wo si s‑koꞌokam namkid k gam hu hab wo i juh. Neh, bat wa masma hab wo e juh ha wehhejed hegam mat pi ab hu wo wohog elidad g Jiosh. Heg at s‑koꞌokam wo ha namkid. Kut heg hekaj wo shoakad ch ga hu wabsh wo i si e kiꞌishch.”

column2: The kingdom of heaven is like ten girls, who took their lamps with them to go and meet the bridegroom.
column3: D hab ep kaij g Jesus, “Baꞌich ant am wo i em‑tashogi g Jiosh kownaltalig am wepogidch hegai kih mat hebai haꞌi wo e hohont. Mt am haꞌi ha wai wehst‑mahm chetcha. T am hihi ha uꞌadch g e‑lalampa k am wo i wahp g wo ha hohntam wehm mat hekid wo jiwia.

column2: Five were foolish, and five were wise.
column3: Hetasp idam o pi haꞌichu nenꞌoid

column2: The foolish girls took their lamps but didn't take any oil with them,
column3: ch ep pi ha waꞌigchug g a‑saidi.

column2: while the wise took jars of oil with them as well as their lamps.
column3: Hetasp o s‑chu nenꞌoid ch ep ha waꞌigchug g a‑saidi.

column2: The bridegroom took a long time and all the girls became drowsy and fell asleep.
column3: Kut pi oi jiwia g wo ha hohntam. T wehsijj s‑ha kohksimch idam chetcha. T gam hu kohk.

column2: At midnight the shout came, ‘Look, the bridegroom's here! Come out and meet him!’
column3: “Neh, t am i e ai g eda hugkam g s‑chuhugam. T ab kaida ihda, ‘Ab o him g wo ha hohntam. Oi g wo i hihim k ab wo namkhi.’

column2: All the girls got up and trimmed the wicks of their lamps. The foolish girls said to the wise ones,
column3: T hegam wehst‑mahm chetcha nehnen k i ha kegchud g e‑lalampa.

column2: ‘Give us some of your oil, because our lamps are going out.’ But the wise girls replied,
column3: “K hab kaij hegam mo pi haꞌichu nenꞌoid, ‘Ab g wo i ha t‑mahki g e‑a‑saidiga. Chuhchkim o g t‑lalampa.’

column2: ‘No, because otherwise there won't be enough for both you and for us. Go to the shopkeepers and buy some oil for yourselves.’
column3: “K hab kaij hegam mo s‑chu nenꞌoid, ‘Pi att wo t‑nako. Am o wabsh i hejel t‑wehhejed ahim am shuhdagi ch pi wo em‑ai. Am amt wo hihi tianna wui k am hejel wo ha nolawt.’

column2: While they went to buy oil, the bridegroom arrived, and those who were ready went in with him to the wedding, and the door was locked shut.
column3: “T wa woho hab e juh hegam haꞌi k gam hu hihi mat wo ha nolawt g a‑saidi. Kut eda ia hu ha oidk jiwia g wo ha hohntam. Kut hegam hetasp mo e nahtokch gam hu wehmaj i wahp mat am wo e gegos wehmaj. T ab si e kuh g kihjeg.

column2: The other girls came later. ‘Lord, Lord,’ they called, ‘Open the door for us!’
column3: “T am i uhpam dada hegam haꞌi k ab chum shoani ch hab kaij, ‘Ab g si s‑t‑hoꞌigeꞌid k ab i kuhpiꞌoki matt am wo i wahp.’

column2: But he answered, ‘I tell you the truth: I don't know you.’
column3: ‘Nt wo si shel em‑ahgi mani pi shaꞌi em‑mahch mams hedai wud,’ ch am hahawa si kuh g kihjeg.”

column2: So stay alert, for you don't know the day, or the hour.
column3: Neh, d am i kuhgit g e‑wepogida g Jesus hab kaijch, “Neh, mt wo s‑e nenꞌoidad nam pi pi shaꞌi mahch mant hekid ep wo jiwia.

column2: It's like a man who went away on a trip. He called in his servants and entrusted them with what he owned.
column3: “Bant masma ep wo i wepogi g Jiosh kownaltalig matp hems g oꞌodham hema hasko wo him k ab i ha wai g e‑pionag mat ab wo ha nuhkudach g haꞌichu e‑eniga.

column2: To one of them he gave five talents, to another he gave two, and to another one, according to their different abilities. Then he left.
column3: Hema at mah g hetasp mihl pihsh k hema gohk mihl pihsh k hema ep g hemako mihl pihsh no pi s‑mahch mat heꞌekia i s‑ap wo chikpanad k amjed gam hu mehk jewed wui hih.

column2: Immediately the one with five talents went and invested them in a business, and made another five talents.
column3: “Hegai piongaj mat g hetasp mihl pihsh ab ui at am ha hekaj i e nakog k hekaj ihda lial mat am dahm hetasp mihl pihsh ep nahto.

column2: In the same way the one with two talents made another two.
column3: Kut hegai mat g gohk mihl pihsh ab ui hab waꞌap e juh k gohk mihl pihsh am dahm nahto.

column2: But the man who'd received the one talent went off and dug a hole and hid his master's money.
column3: T wabshaba hegai mat g hemako mihl pihsh ab ui gam hu him k am hebai wagt k am ehsto.

column2: A long time later the master of those servants returned, and settled accounts with them.
column3: “K mehk amjed mat jiwia g ha‑ahmo idam k am ha ui mat wo s‑mai mat has masma hekaj g lialigaj.

column2: The one with five talents came and presented the other five talents. ‘Master,’ he said, ‘You gave me five talents. Look, I've made a profit of five talents.’
column3: “Hegai piongaj mat g hetasp mihl pihsh ab ui at ab i wah k ab i mah g hetasp mihl pihsh am dahm hegai mat ab ui k hab kaij, ‘Ab apt wa ni‑mah g hetasp mihl pihsh. Neh, nt am baꞌich hetasp mihl pihsh ab ep wo m‑mah mant nahto.’

column2: His master said to him, ‘You've done well—you are a good, faithful servant. You have proved yourself trustworthy over small things, so now I'm placing you in charge over many things. Be happy because I'm really pleased with you!’
column3: “K hab kaij g ahmoj, ‘S‑ap aptki hab e juh, s‑apꞌekam ni‑pionag, s‑ap hekajk mant heꞌekia ab i m‑mah. Nt hekaj ab baꞌich i muꞌi wo m‑nuhkudach. Am g ni‑wehm s‑hehgigkad.’

column2: The one with two talents also came. ‘Master,’ he said, ‘You gave me two talents. Look, I've made a profit of two talents.’
column3: “T heg ab hahawa ep i wah piongaj mat g gohk mihl pihsh ab mah k hab kaij, ‘Neh, gohk mihl pihsh apt wa ab ni‑mah. Kunt am baꞌich gohk mihl pihsh ab ep wo m‑mah mant nahto.’

column2: His master said to him, ‘You've done well—you are a good, faithful servant. You have proved trustworthy over small things, so now I'm placing you in charge over many things. Be happy because I'm really pleased with you!’
column3: “K hab kaij g ahmoj, ‘S‑ap aptki hab e juh, s‑apꞌekam ni‑pionag, s‑ap hekajk mant heꞌekia ab i m‑mah. Nt hekaj ab baꞌich i muꞌi wo m‑nuhkudach. Am g ni‑wehm s‑hehgigkad.’

column2: Then the man with one talent came. ‘Master,’ he said, ‘I know that you're a hard man. You reap where you didn't sow, and you harvest crops that you didn't plant.
column3: “T ab hahawa i wah hegai piongaj mat g hemako mihl pihsh ab mah k hab kaij, ‘Ni‑ahmo, s‑mahch ani map s‑ta keꞌidama ch s‑beihimk hegai map haschu pi ab hu chikpan.

column2: So since I was afraid of you I went and buried your talent in the ground. Look, you can have back what belongs to you.’
column3: Kunt heg hekaj gam hu s‑aꞌagko eꞌesto g m‑lialiga. Neh, m ia wehch mo haschu d m‑eniga.’

column2: But his master answered him, ‘You wicked and lazy servant! If you think I reap where I don't sow, and harvest crops I didn't plant,
column3: “K hab kaij g ahmoj, ‘Si pi ap ch s‑padmakam ni‑pionag, kups wa chum s‑mahch mani s‑ta keꞌidama ch s‑beihimk hegai mani haschu pi ab hu chikpan.

column2: then you should have deposited my silver in the bank so that when I returned I could have had my money with interest.
column3: Pegih neh, pt hems am hi wo wa chum toa g ni‑lialiga wahnko ch ed. Kunt ab wehs uhpam wo ui wehnadk mat haschu ab wo i mahmadt.’

column2: Take the talent away from him, and give it to the one with ten talents.
column3: “K hab hahawa ha ahg g haꞌi ep e‑pionag, ‘Mt wo wohppoꞌid k ab wo mah hegai mo wehst‑mahm mihl pihsh edgid.

column2: For everyone who has will be given even more; and everyone who doesn't have anything, even what they have will be taken away from them.
column3: Baꞌich at ep wo nei g e‑apꞌedag hegam mat hedai s‑ap wo hekaj. T wabshaba wo e wohppoꞌidach mo haschu al i edgid hegam mat pi ap wo hekaj.

column2: Now throw this useless servant out into the darkness where there'll be crying and gnashing of teeth.’
column3: Mt gam hu wo daꞌich hegai s‑padmakam pion s‑chuhugam k ed. T am wo si shoakad ch ga hu wabsh wo i si e kiꞌishch nat pi wo shaꞌi si s‑koꞌok haꞌichu nakogad.’

column2: But when the Son of man comes in his glory, and all the angels with him, then he will sit on his majestic throne.
column3: “An ant wo dahiwua ni‑kownal daikud an mant hekid wo i jiwia ha wehm g ni‑anghiliga.

column2: Everyone will be brought before him. He will separate them from one another, as a shepherd separates the sheep from the goats.  He'll place the sheep on his right hand, and the goats on his left.
column3: T wehs hemajkam am wo e hemapai ni‑baꞌich. Nt ab wo i ha gawulkai hegam mo d wohokam ab ha amjed hegam mo pi d wohokam hab masma mamt am wo i ha gawulkai g kahwal ch siswat.

column2: Then the king will say to the ones on his right, ‘Come, you who are blessed by my Father, and inherit the kingdom that's been prepared for you from the beginning of the world.  For I was hungry, and you gave me food to eat. I was thirsty, and you gave me a drink. I was a stranger and you invited me in.  I was naked and you clothed me. I was sick and you looked after me. I was in prison and you visited me.’
column3: Bant wo ha ahgi hegam mant ab i ha gawulkai, ‘Ab g wo i hihim. S‑em‑hoꞌigeꞌid o g Jiosh. Ni‑gegos amt mani wa d bihugimkam k ni‑wasibi mani wa d tonomkam k am i ni‑wahki e‑kih ed mani wa d wabsh ge oꞌodham k ni‑enigadad mani wa pi haꞌichu edgid k ni‑nuhkud mani wa mumku k am ni‑chechga mani wa d lihso. K g Jiosh am nahtokch g kihdag em‑wehhejed ga hu i amjed mat in i nahto g jewed. Ab g wo i wahpkid k wo edagi.’

column2: Then those who are right will answer, ‘Lord, when did we see you hungry and fed you, or thirsty and gave you a drink?  When did we see you as a stranger and invite you in, or naked and clothe you?  When did we see you sick, or in prison, and visit you?’
column3: “Kut hab wo chei ab ni‑wui, ‘T‑kownalig, kuchs hekid i m‑gegosid k m‑wasbid k ab i m‑wahki t‑kih ed k ab m‑enigadad k m‑nuhkud k am m‑chechga?’

column2: The king will tell them, ‘I tell you the truth: whatever you did for one of these of least importance you did for me.’
column3: “Nt hab wo chei, ‘Nt wo si shel em‑ahgi mam ahni am i ni‑wehmt hekid am i ha wehmtch hegam mo d shoꞌigkam ch ab ni‑hiwig.’

column2: He'll also say to those on his left, ‘Go away from me, you who are doomed, into the eternal fire prepared for the devil and his angels!  For I was hungry and you didn't give me anything to eat. I was thirsty and you didn't give me a drink.  I was a stranger and you didn't invite me in. I was naked and you didn't clothe me. I was sick and in prison and you didn't visit me.’
column3: “Kunt hab haha wo chei ab ha wui hegam mant pi ab hu i ha gawulkai, ‘Gam g hu hab wo i e juhni. Ab o em‑mohtoꞌid g Jiosh g s‑koꞌok namkidadag. Pi amt ni‑gegos mani wa d bihugimkam k pi ni‑wasibi mani wa d tonomkam k pi am hu i ni‑wahki e‑kih ed mani wa d ge oꞌodham k pi ab hu ni‑enigadad mani wa pi haꞌichu eniga k pi ni‑nuhkud mani wa mumku k pi am hu ni‑chechga mani wa d lihso. Neh, am amt wo e shul heg eda mehi mo d ha wuikam g jijawul.’

column2: Then they will also answer, ‘Lord, when did we see you hungry, or thirsty, or a stranger, or naked, or sick, or in prison, and didn't look after you?’
column3: “Kut hab wo chei hegam ab ni‑wui, ‘T‑kownalig, ch hekid i m‑neid maps d bihugimkam o d tonomkam o d ge oꞌodham o pi haꞌichu eniga o mumku o d lihso, kuchs pi am hu i m‑wehmt.’

column2: Then he will tell them, ‘I tell you the truth: whatever you didn't do for one of these of least importance you didn't do for me.’
column3: “Nt hab wo chei, ‘Nt wo si shel em‑ahgi mam ahni pi am hu i ni‑wehmt, hekid pi am hu i ha wehmtch hegam mo d shoꞌigkam ch ab ni‑hiwig.’

column2: They will go away into eternal condemnation, but those who are right will enter eternal life.”
column3: “Kut idam am wo e shul pi ha huhugedam s‑koꞌok namkidadag ed. T g s‑apꞌekam an wo i wahp anai mat an hahawa chum hekid wo edgidad g s‑apꞌekam doakag.”

column2: After Jesus had said all this, he told his disciples,
column3: D am i haꞌasa haꞌichu ha mashcha g Jesus k hab hahawa kaij ab t‑wui,

column2: “You know that it's Passover in two days time, and the Son of man will be handed over to be crucified.”
column3: “S‑mahch am mo gohk tash am wiꞌis matt wo wuhshad mat g Jiosh ha doꞌibia g t‑shohshonbad. Kutki hab wo e juh mat an wo ni‑bei hegam mo ab ni‑wui gegok k ab wo ni‑naggia kots t ab mat wo ni‑mua.” Neh, heg o hab waꞌi kaij.

column2: Then the chief priests and the elders of the people gathered in the courtyard of Caiaphas, the high priest.
column3: Kumsh eda woho aꞌaga mamtsh has masma wo be k wo mua. Si uhgchu pahl atsh am i ha hemapai hegam haꞌi uꞌugchu papal ch geꞌeged. Kutsh ab kihj ab nam

column2: There they plotted to arrest Jesus on some deceitful pretext and kill him.
column3: k am apꞌech mat s‑aꞌagi an wo bei g Jesus k wo mua,

column2: But they said, “Let's not do this during the festival so that the people don't riot.”
column3: ash am wabsh aꞌai e ahgid, “Hi wa pi am hu heg eda mat ia wo e hemapadch g hemajkam id hekaj piast. T wo am hu e babgachud k wo t‑cheggia.”

column2: While Jesus was staying at Simon the leper's house in Bethany,
column3: Kuchd am hu hebai am dada Bethany kihhim t am. D am d kihkam hegai mad hab chehgig Simon ch wa chum mumku heg hekaj mo g chuhkugaj wabsh muhkhim.

column2: a woman came over to him carrying an alabaster jar of very expensive perfume. She poured it on Jesus' head while he was sitting eating. But when the disciples saw what she did, they were upset.
column3: Id ad ab i t‑waid k t‑gegos. Kuchd am dadhak ch t‑gegosid. T ab haha wabsh hema i wah g uwi g si s‑namkig s‑ap uhw shuhdagi waꞌigchugch am al s‑toa hodai haꞌa ch ed k ab iawua Jesus moꞌo ab.

column2: “What a terrible waste!” they objected.
column3: Kud haꞌi si pi hohhoꞌi g t‑wehm e mashchamdam k hab kaij, “Ih, pt wabsh heki wua ihda s‑namkig haꞌichu.

column2: “This perfume could've been sold for a lot of money and given to the poor!”
column3: Eda atp huꞌi muꞌi lial wo nam sha e gagdak. T heg wo e hekaj ha wehhejed g shoꞌigkam.”

column2: Jesus was aware of what was going on and told them, “Why are you upset with this woman? She's done something wonderful for me!
column3: Kud s‑mahch g Jesus mach haschu am aꞌaga ch hab kaij ab t‑wui, “Pi g am wo shaꞌi kehꞌidad ihda uwi. Si at s‑kehg haꞌichu hab juh am ni‑wehhejed.

column2: You'll always have the poor with you, but you won't always have me.
column3: Mt wabsh chum hekid wo i ha wehmt g shoꞌigkam. Kunt ahni hi pi tash ia hu wo em‑shahgidk.

column2: By pouring this perfume on my body she's prepared me for burial.
column3: Ab at iawua g uhw shuhdagi mat wo i nako g ni‑honshpadag hiashpa.

column2: I tell you the truth: wherever in the world this good news is spread, the story of what this woman has done will also be told in memory of her.”
column3: Nt wo si shel em‑ahgi mat am wo s‑e chegitok mat haschu has juh ihda uwi mat hebai wo i e ahgachugad g s‑kehg haꞌichu ahgaj g Jiosh an wehsko jewed dahm.”

column2: Then Judas Iscariot, one of the twelve disciples, went to the chief priests
column3: D am ha hekaj t‑dagito g Judas Iscariot k gam hu hih. Kuchd am i dahm s‑mai matsh am hih uꞌugchu papal ha wui

column2: and asked them, “How much will you pay me for betraying Jesus to you?” They paid him thirty silver coins.
column3: ash hab kaij, “Heꞌekia amt wo i ni‑namkid mant an wo em‑behi g Jesus?”

column2: From then on he looked for an opportunity to betray Jesus.
column3: Tsh ab i amjed g Judas am i e nako matsh wo gagda g Jesus.

column2: On the first day of the festival of unleavened bread, the disciples came to Jesus and asked him, “Where do you want us to prepare the Passover meal for you to eat?”
column3: D am hahawa s‑ap i e ai hegai t‑shohshonbad ha doꞌibiadag piast. K id eda pi e koꞌa hegai pahn mo jewajidas. Kud d wehpeg tash heg eda gegosig. Kuchd am dada Jesus wui k ab kakke machs hebai wo i apꞌech matt am wo huh g kahwal mad iagchulig gegosig.

column2: Jesus told them, “Go into the city and find this particular man, and tell him, ‘The Teacher says, “My time is approaching. I'm coming to celebrate the Passover with my disciples at your house.” ’ ”
column3: D gohkajj hab t‑ahg, “Am amt wo hihi Jerusalem wui. K am hema d kihkam ch am wo e chehgi. Mt hab wo ah mani hab kaij mat e ai g ni‑tashga. Kutt t‑wehm wo huh g kahwal mad iagchulig gegosig am kihj am.”

column2: The disciples did as Jesus told them, and prepared the Passover meal there.
column3: Kud am hab e juh mad hab ha ahg g Jesus k am i apꞌech g gegosig.

column2: When evening came he sat down to eat with the Twelve.
column3: D am i hud. Kuchd am dadhaiwua k am t‑gegosid.

column2: While they were eating he told them, “I tell you the truth: one of you is going to betray me.”
column3: Kud hab haha wabsh kaij g Jesus, “Nt wo si shel em‑ahgi mat has wo e juh hemu. Hema amt wo ni‑gagda ahpim mam ab si ni‑wecho e mashcham.”

column2: They were extremely upset. One after the other they asked him, “Lord, it's not me, is it?”
column3: Kuchd si pi ap t‑taht k gan hu hab i cheꞌiatahi, “Ih, hi wa pi ahni, ni‑kownalig.”

column2: “The one who's dipped his hand into the dish with me will betray me,” Jesus replied.
column3: D hab kaij g Jesus, “Heg at hab wo juh mat hedai am ni‑wehm wo wakch g chemait hidod ch ed.

column2: “The Son of man will die just as it was prophesied about him, but what a disaster it will be for the man who betrays the Son of man! It would be better for that man if he'd never been born!”
column3: Bant masma wo ni‑muhkid mo has masma heki hu oꞌohanas Jiosh oꞌohana ed mat g si Kehshaj wo e muhkid. T wabshaba wo si s‑koꞌokam e namkid hegai mat wo ni‑gagda. Baꞌich at wo i chum s‑apꞌek heg wehhejed mat hems wabsh pi wo chum mahsi.”

column2: Judas, the one who would betray Jesus, asked “It's not me, is it, Rabbi?”
column3: D hegai Judas matki gagda hab kaij, “Aha nap ahni hab ni‑ahg, t‑mashchamdam?”

column2: While they were eating, Jesus took some bread and blessed it. Then he broke it and gave pieces to the disciples. “Take and eat this for it is my body,” said Jesus.
column3: Chd am wabsh kia t‑gegosid. D g Jesus am bei g chemait k ab hoꞌigeꞌel g Jiosh k am hahawa i hahain k ab t‑mah k hab kaij, “Oi g wo huhgi ihda. Do ni‑honshpadag.”

column2: Then he picked up the cup, blessed it, and gave it to them. “Drink from it, all of you,” he told them.
column3: D am hahawa bei g tahsa k ab ep hoꞌigeꞌel g Jiosh k ab t‑mah g wasib k hab kaij, “Wehsijj g ab wo ihꞌe.

column2: “For this is my blood of the covenant, poured out for many for the forgiveness of sins.
column3: Id o d ni‑ehꞌed. Id ani hab ahgch hab kaij mant wo ni‑muhkid em‑wehhejed. T g ni‑ehꞌed wo e iawua. T g Jiosh heg hekaj am hab wo juh hegai mo wa hab kaij mat gam hu hab wo i juh g pi ap ha‑chuꞌijig g hemajkam.

column2: However, I tell you, I won't drink this fruit of the vine until the day I drink it new with you in the kingdom of my Father.”
column3: Ia o i s‑apꞌe. Kunt pi hekid em‑wehm hab ep wo juh ihda k wabshaba em‑wehm wo si s‑hehgigk Jiosh kihdag ed.”

column2: After they'd sung a song, they left for the Mount of Olives.
column3: Neh, kuchd am hahawa kuhgit am hema ahgk g mihshmda neꞌi k am wuwhag k gam hu hihi Olive Uꞌus Kawulk wui.

column2: “All of you will abandon me tonight,” Jesus told them. “As Scripture says, ‘I will strike the shepherd, and the flock of sheep will be completely scattered.’
column3: D hab t‑ahg g Jesus, “An o oꞌohanas mo hab kaij g Jiosh:

column2: But Peter objected, “Even if everyone else abandons you, I'll never abandon you.”
column3: D g Peter hab kaij, “Ahni ant hi pi hekid wo shaꞌi m‑dagito, chum as wehsijj wo m‑dagito idam.”

column2: “I'm telling you the truth,” Jesus told him, “This very night, before the cock crows, you'll deny me three times.”
column3: D hab kaij g Jesus ab wui, “Nt wo si shel m‑ahgi mat koi wo kuhu g keli chuchul id i chuhug ab. Kupt waikko hab wo waꞌi chei map pi shaꞌi ni‑mahch.”

column2: “Even if I have to die with you, I'll never deny you!” Peter insisted. And all the disciples said the same thing.
column3: D hab kaij g Peter, “Pi ant hekid hab wo shaꞌi chei manis pi m‑mahch, chum anis wo ni‑muhkid m‑wehm.” Kuchd wehsijj hab waꞌap kaij.

column2: Then Jesus went with his disciples to a place called Gethsemane. He told them, “Sit down here while I go over there and pray.”
column3: Kuchd ged hu dada heg ab oidag mo hab e aꞌaga Gethsemane. D pi am hu t‑wehmaj g Judas Iscariot. D hab kaij g Jesus ab t‑wui, “Ia g hu wo i dadhak. Nt ahni am baꞌich wo i him k wo ni‑hoꞌigeꞌidahu.”

column2: He took Peter and the two sons of Zebedee with him, and he began to suffer agonizing sorrow and distress.
column3: Bad kaij ch am ha uꞌuk g Peter ch James ch John. T idam gam hu oi.

column2: Then he said to them, “I am so overwhelmed with sadness that it's killing me. Wait here and keep watch with me.”
column3: ch hab kaij ab ha wui, “Ab at wabsh i si ni‑shuhd g pi ap tahhadkam ch si s‑ni‑mukima tahhadchud. Ia g wabsh wo dadk ch wo haꞌichu si nenashanad.”

column2: He went a little farther forward, fell face down, and prayed.
column3: Tsh g Jesus baꞌich ep shaꞌi him k am i gei jewedo k hab kaij ab Jiosh wui, “Ni‑ohg, matp am wo s‑apꞌek, pt im hu hab wo i juh hegai si s‑koꞌok shoꞌigdag mo ab ni‑wui him. Kuni eda tatchua mat ahpi g m‑tatchui hab wo e juh.”

column2: He went back to the disciples and found them asleep. He said to Peter, “What, you couldn't stay awake with me for just one hour?
column3: Tsh am hahawa uhpam ep jiwia ha wui hegam waik. Kush am kohksh. Sh hab kaij ab ha wui, “Pi amtki shaꞌi e nako mamt wo ni‑wehm nenead al hemako ohla ab.

column2: Stay awake and pray, so that you don't fall into temptation. Yes, the spirit is willing, but the body is weak.”
column3: Si g wo haꞌichu nenashanad ch ab wo tai g Jiosh g gewkdag mamt pi am hu wo shul pi apꞌekam ch ed. Chum am hi wa g s‑apꞌekam hab elid ch eda pi e nakog.”

column2: He went away a second time and prayed.
column3: Bash kaij ch amjed gam hu hahawa ep him k hab kaij ab Jiosh wui, “Ni‑ohg, am o wa s‑apꞌe ni‑wehhejed matp d wo m‑tatchuik mant hemho wa wo nako ihda si s‑koꞌok shoꞌigdag.”

column2: He went back and found them sleeping, for they just couldn't stay awake.
column3: Neh, k am hahawa uhpam ep jiwia ha wui. Kush ep kohksh no pi shaꞌi s‑ha kohksimchud.

column2: So he left them once more, and went off and prayed a third time, repeating the same things.
column3: Tsh gam hu hahawa ep hih g Jesus k heg hab kaij ab Jiosh wui matsh wehpeg

column2: Then he returned to the disciples, and told them, “How can you still be sleeping and resting? Look, the time has come. The Son of man is about to be betrayed into the hands of sinners!
column3: ch am hahawa uhpam ep jiwia ha wui k hab kaij, “Kumtki ep kohk. T eda e ai mamt ni‑gagda ahni Jiosh si Kehsha am ha wui g pi apꞌekam hemajkam.

column2: Get up, let's go! See, the one who's betraying me has arrived.”
column3: Oi g wo wahpamigi. Tt wo hihi. Neh, ia at hu jiwia hegai mat ni‑gagda.”

column2: As he said this, Judas, one of the Twelve, arrived with a large mob armed with swords and clubs sent by the chief priests and elders of the people.
column3: Am ad wabsh kia neok. Kud am jiwia g Judas. D shaꞌi si muꞌijj wehmaj, haꞌijj g iꞌis‑papayo uhꞌukch ch haꞌijj g uꞌus. Idam atki g uꞌugchu papal ch geꞌeged am ha cheha matsh am wo hihim k wo bei.

column2: The betrayer had arranged to give them a signal: “The one that I kiss, that's him—arrest him,” he'd told them.
column3: Kuki eda g Judas heki hu ha ahgid idam mo am wehmaj mat ab wo chintad g Jesus kahmaj ab. T hab masma wo s‑mahchk mat hedai an wo bei.

column2: Judas came up to Jesus immediately, and said, “Hello, Rabbi,” and kissed him.
column3: D am wabsh i chum jiwia g Judas k wabsh shel i hih ab Jesus wui k hab kaij, “Jiosh at wo s‑m‑hoꞌigeꞌel, ni‑mashchamdam!” Neh, bad cheꞌe k ab chintad.

column2: “My friend, do what you came to do,” Jesus said to Judas. So they came and grabbed hold of Jesus, and arrested him.
column3: D hab kaij g Jesus ab wui, “Ih, ni‑nawoj, oi g s‑hohtam am hab juhni hegai mapt haschu ahgk ia jiwia.”

column2: One of those who was with Jesus reached for his sword and pulled it out. He struck the high priest's servant, cutting off his ear.
column3: Kud hema g t‑wehm e mashchamdam am i wuhshad g e‑is‑pahyo k ab si gehg g neholigaj g uhgchu pahl k an si hikuch g nahkaj.

column2: But Jesus told him, “Put your sword away. Everyone who fights with the sword will die by the sword.
column3: D hab kaij g Jesus ab wui ihda, “Ga g hu uhpam kehsh g e‑is‑pahyo. Hegam mat wo hekaj g is‑pahyo at heg hekaj hab waꞌap wo e muhkid.

column2: Don't you think I could ask my Father, and he'd immediately send more than twelve legions of angels?
column3: Aha nap pi mahch mantp ab wo tai g ni‑ohg, t ha hekaj wo ha cheha g shaꞌi si muꞌi mihl anghil mat ni‑wehhejed wo ha cheggia.

column2: But then how could the Scriptures be fulfilled that say it must be like this?”
column3: K wabshaba an hab chuꞌig Jiosh oꞌohana ed mat hemho wa am ni‑tahgio hab wo e juh ihda mo hab e wua.”

column2: Then Jesus told the mob, “Have you come with swords and clubs to arrest me as if I was some kind of dangerous criminal? Every day I sat in the Temple teaching and you didn't arrest me then.
column3: Neh, bad kaij g Jesus ch hab hahawa ha ahg hegam mat an bei, “Wehs tashkaj ani am dahiwup ch ha mashcham geꞌe cheopi t am. Kumt pi an hu ni‑be k wabshaba hahawa ia dada an uhꞌukch g iꞌis‑papayo ch uꞌus mamt wo ni‑bei.

column2: But all this is happening to fulfill what the prophets wrote.” Then all the disciples abandoned him and ran away.
column3: Pegih, bat wa masma an heki hu oꞌoha g kekelibad Jiosh haꞌichu i tashogiddam mant hab masma an wo ni‑behij mat g pi ap hemajkam.” Neh, bad kaij g Jesus.

column2: Those who'd arrested Jesus took him to the home of Caiaphas, the high priest, where the religious teachers and elders had gathered.
column3: Kumtsh am i bei g Jesus heg kih wui uhgchu pahl mo hab chehgig Caiaphas. Tsh eda am heki hu i e hemapai g chehanig t‑mashchamdam ch geꞌeged.

column2: Peter followed him at a distance, and went into the high priest's courtyard. He sat there with the guards to see how things would end.
column3: Sh g Peter ga hu wabsh mehkjed ha oid ch am i wah kolhai ch ed. Sh am haꞌi dadha g ha‑pionag. Tsh g Peter am ha wehm i dahiwua s‑neidamkch mams has wo juh g Jesus.

column2: The chief priests and the whole council were trying to find some false evidence against Jesus so they could put him to death.
column3: Sh g uhgchu pahl ch hegam e jehnigiddam am chum i e nakog mat g iattogi haꞌichu ab wo abch g Jesus mat heg hekaj wo mua.

column2: But they couldn't find anything, even though many false witnesses came forward. Eventually two came forward
column3: Kutsh muꞌi ehp am i gegokiwua k ab haꞌichu chum abch. Sh wabshaba pi e wepot g haꞌichu ha‑ahga.

column2: and reported, “This man said, ‘I can destroy God's Temple, and rebuild it in three days.’ ”
column3: k hab kaij, “Ihda oꞌodham o hab kaij matsh wo e nako mat wo i wua g Jiosh geꞌe cheopiga. Tsh am d wo i waik tashk, tsh am uhpam ep wo kei.”

column2: The high priest stood up and asked Jesus, “Have you no answer? What do you have to say in your defense?”
column3: Tsh am hahawa kekiwua g uhgchu pahl k hab kaij ab Jesus wui, “Napt pi am hu has wo chei heg amjed mam ab m‑abchud?”

column2: But Jesus remained silent.
column3: Kush wabshaba g Jesus pi has shaꞌi kaij.

column2: “You said it,” Jesus replied. “And I also tell you that in the future you'll see the Son of man sitting at the right hand of the Almighty, and coming on the clouds of heaven.”
column3: Sh hab kaij g Jesus, “Dani ahni. Kunt ab ep wo em‑ahgi mat g Jiosh am wo e chehgi mo ab si has ni‑elid an e‑hugid an ni‑dahshk e‑kownal daikud ed. T am wo i e ai mant ab wo i hud chewagi ch ed k am ep wo jiwia jewed dahm. Kumt wehsijj wo s‑mai mani d ahni.”

column2: Then the high priest tore his clothes, and said, “He's speaking blasphemy! Why do we need any witnesses? Look, now you've heard for yourselves his blasphemy!
column3: Tsh g uhgchu pahl ab si wantsh g e‑eniga no pi si pi hohhoꞌid g neꞌokij k hab kaij, “Pi ach hedai ep shaꞌi tatchua mas am wo ah g chuꞌijigaj. Am am wa kah g pi kehg neꞌokij.

column2: What's your verdict?”
column3: Shahm i elid?”

column2: Then they spat in his face and beat him. Some of them slapped him with their hands,
column3: Tsh idam ab si siswua wuhioshaj ab k an si maꞌishk wuh g wuhpuij k ab si shonikkash

column2: and said, “Prophesy to us, you ‘Messiah’! Who just hit you?”
column3: ch hab ahg, “Am g hig t‑ahgid mas hedai ab m‑shonikka, ahpi Jiosh si Kehsha e ahga.”

column2: Meanwhile Peter was sitting outside in the courtyard. A servant girl came up to him, and said, “You were with Jesus the Galilean too!”
column3: Sh eda g Peter am daha kih bahsho. Kutsh am hema jiwia g uwi piongaj g uhgchu pahl k hab kaij ab Peter wui, “Ahpi ap ep wehmaj hegai Jesus.”

column2: But he denied it in front of everyone. “I don't know what you're talking about,” he said.
column3: Tsh wabshaba g Peter pi mahch k e ah g Jesus am ha tahgio hegam mo am dadha hab kaijch, “Pi ani shaꞌi mahch maps haschu hab ahg.”

column2: When he went back to the courtyard entrance another servant girl saw him and said to the people there, “This man was with Jesus of Nazareth.”
column3: Bash kaij ch ha hekaj gam hu hih mash am haꞌi gegok kolhai kihjeg t ab.

column2: Once again he denied it, saying with an oath, “I don't know him.”
column3: Kutsh ep pi e edagi g Peter hab kaijch, “Do si wohokam mani pi shaꞌi mahch hegai oꞌodham.”

column2: A little while later the people standing there came up to Peter and said, “You definitely are one of them. Your accent gives you away.”
column3: Kutsh shaꞌi haꞌas, tsh hegam chechoj mo am gegok am dada Peter wui k hab ahg, “Pi g shaꞌi pi e edgid. Dapki woho hema hegam Jesus. Ab ap wabsh e ahgch e‑neꞌoki ab map d ha wehm oꞌodham.”

column2: Then he started to swear: “Curses on me if I'm a liar! I don't know the man!” Immediately the cock crowed.
column3: Tsh g Peter am ha hekaj si ha ahgi, “Pi ani shaꞌi mahch ihda oꞌodham mam an aꞌaga. T g Jiosh wo si ni‑jehkaꞌich mantp em‑iattogid.”

column2: Then Peter remembered what Jesus had told him: “Before the cock crows, three times you will deny knowing me.” He went outside and wept bitterly.
column3: Tsh am ha hekaj i chegito g Peter mo wa g Jesus ab wui hab kaij, “Pi at koi wo kuhu g keli chuchul. Kupt waikko hab wo waꞌi chei map pi shaꞌi ni‑mahch.” Tsh gam hu wuhsh g Peter k si pi ap e tahtk ch shoak.

column2: Early in the morning all the chief priests and elders of the people consulted together and decided to have Jesus put to death.
column3: Tsh am wabsh i chum mahsi. Tsh am hahawa i apꞌech g uꞌugchu papal ch geꞌeged mat wo e muhkid g Jesus.

column2: They bound him, led him away, and handed him over to Pilate, the governor.
column3: Tsh am i e kuhgit g ha‑namki. Kutsh am si i maniadad g nohnhoij g Jesus k gam hu i wanim matsh am wo i bei heg wui mo d kownal heg eda chekshani ch hab chehgig Pilate.

column2: When Judas, the one who'd betrayed Jesus, saw that Jesus had been condemned to death, he regretted what he'd done and returned the thirty silver coins to the chief priests and the elders.
column3: Sh eda g Judas an himad ch ha neid. Sh am wanimed g Jesus kownal wui mat wo e muhkid. Kutsh si e tods g Judas k am him k am uhpam i ui hegai waikko wehst‑mahm plahda pihsh ha wui g uꞌugchu papal ch geꞌeged

column2: “I've sinned! I've betrayed innocent blood!” he told them.
column3: k hab kaij, “Tki wo e muhkid hegai mo pi ha chuꞌijig. K d ni‑chuꞌijig nant pi ab em‑wui gagda.”

column2: Judas threw the silver coins into the sanctuary and left. He went away and hanged himself.
column3: Tsh g Judas am si nehnich hegai lial k am shul geꞌe cheopi ch ed k gam hu hahawa wuhsh jeg ed k wabsh hejel e naggia.

column2: The chief priests took the silver coins and said, “This is blood money, so it's not lawful to put this in the Temple treasury.”
column3: Tsh g uꞌugchu papal am ui hegai lial k hab kaij, “Id o d namkigaj mat hema wo e muhkid. K g t‑chehanig pi t‑hiwgid matt am wo toa geꞌe cheopi wehhejed.”

column2: So they agreed to buy the potter's field as a place to bury foreigners.
column3: Bash kaij ch am apꞌech matsh heg hekaj wo hema ha nolawt g oidag mat d wo ha‑simin‑jihlok hegam mo d wabsh ge oꞌodham. Hegai mamt ha nolawt o heki hu hab e aꞌaga Hahaꞌatdam Oidag

column2: That's why the field is still called today the “Field of Blood.”
column3: ch wabshaba hab hahawa e aꞌaga Ehꞌed Oidag.

column2: This fulfilled the prophecy spoken through the prophet Jeremiah: “They took thirty silver coins—the ‘value’ of the one who was bought at the price set by some of the children of Israel—
column3: Neh, id atsh wa hab e juh hab masma mash wa g Jiosh heki hu waꞌi hab kaij matsh hab masma hab wo e juh. Hegai kelibad Jiosh haꞌichu i tashogiddam mash hab chehgig Jeremiah atki an oꞌoha mash hab kaij g Jiosh:

column2: Jesus was brought before Pilate the governor who asked him, “Are you the King of the Jews?”
column3: Sh eda am kehk g Jesus kownal wui. Sh hegam mo s‑muꞌamk ab abchud mo chum e kownalchud. Sh g kownal ab kakke, “No wa woho mapsh hab chum e elid map d ha‑kownalig idam Tutuligo?”

column2: But when the chief priests and elders brought charges against him, Jesus did not answer.
column3: Sh g uꞌugchu papal ch geꞌeged ab muꞌi haꞌichu abchud. Sh pi am hu has shaꞌi kaij g Jesus.

column2: “Don't you hear how many charges they're bringing against you?” Pilate asked him.
column3: Sh hekaj hab kaij g Pilate ab wui, “Neh, muꞌi haꞌichu o ab m‑abchud. Napt pi ab hu wo ha kaiha?”

column2: But Jesus didn't say anything, not a single word. This greatly surprised the governor.
column3: Kush ep pi am hu has shaꞌi kaij g Jesus. Tsh heg hekaj si has i el g kownal.

column2: Now it was the custom of the governor to release to the crowd during the festival whichever prisoner they wanted.
column3: K am hab e wua ahid ab id eda gegosig mo g kownal hema dadagitod g lihso am ha wehhejed g hemajkam.

column2: At that time a notorious prisoner was being held, a man named Barabbas.
column3: K am hema d lihso ch hab chehgig Barabbas. K wehsijj s‑mahch ihda.

column2: So Pilate asked the crowds that had gathered, “Who do you want me to release to you? Barabbas, or Jesus, called the Messiah?”
column3: Tsh am i e hemapai g hemajkam amai mash am daha g Pilate ch hab wua g lodaita. Tsh ab ha kakke, “Nam hab elid mant wo dagito g Barabbas aha nam id hab elid Jesus mo hab e aꞌaga Jiosh si Kehsha.”

column2: (He had realized it was because of jealousy that they had handed Jesus over to him to be tried.).
column3: Neh, bash kaij nash pi chum s‑dagitoimk g Jesus ch hab ha elid mo hegam waꞌi hahaꞌichu s‑hehgamk ch s‑muꞌamk.

column2: While he was sitting on the judge's seat, his wife sent a message to him that said, “Don't do anything to this innocent man, for I've suffered terribly today as a result of a dream about him.”
column3: Sh am daha g Pilate lodaita daikud ed. Kutsh eda g wehmaj kihkam heki hu hema cheha matsh am wo him k wo ahgi mo hab kaij, “Pi g am hu has shaꞌi juhni hegai oꞌodham no pi pi ha chuꞌijig. Muꞌi ant haꞌichu nako chuhug chehchkch ab amjed.”

column2: But the chief priests and the elders convinced the crowds to ask for Barabbas, and to have Jesus put to death.
column3: Sh eda hegam uꞌugchu papal ch geꞌeged ab ha chehani g hemajkam matsh ab wo tai g Pilate mat wo dagito g Barabbas k g Jesus hab wo juh mat wo e muhkid.

column2: When the governor asked them, “So which of the two do you want me to release to you?” they answered, “Barabbas.”
column3: Pegih, sh g kownal ab ha kakke mas hedai am wo i dagito ha wui idam gohk.

column2: “Then what shall I do with Jesus, the Messiah?” he asked them.
column3: Sh hab hahawa ep kaij g Pilate mas has wo juh hegai Jesus mo hab e aꞌaga Jiosh si Kehsha.

column2: “Why? What crime has he committed?” Pilate asked. But they shouted even louder, “Crucify him!”
column3: Kutsh hab chum chei g Pilate, “Haschu ahg? Shahchu at hig pi ap has juh?”

column2: When Pilate saw it was a lost cause, and that a riot was developing, he took some water and washed his hands in front of the crowd. “I'm innocent of this man's blood. It's on your heads!” he told them.
column3: Tsh am i nei g Pilate matki heki hu i babgat g hemajkam k am hu wo e cheggia. Tsh am ge was g shuhdagi k am hemajkam ha tahgio i ha wapko g e‑nohnhoi k hab kaij ab ha wui, “Pi o haꞌichu d shaꞌi ni‑chuꞌijig matp wo e muhkid ihda oꞌodham. Ahpim o d em‑chuꞌijig.”

column2: All the people answered, “May his blood be on us, and on our children!”
column3: Sh wehsijj hab kaij hegam mo am haꞌichug, “Ahchim g t‑aꞌaliga ha wehm att ab wo moht g s‑koꞌok namkidadag id hekaj.”

column2: Then he released Barabbas to them, but he had Jesus whipped and sent to be crucified.
column3: Tsh g Pilate am hahawa i dagito g Barabbas ha wui k am ha cheha g shondal mat wo gewitta g Jesus k am hahawa i dagito mat ab wo naggia kots t ab.

column2: The governor's soldiers took Jesus into the Praetorium and the whole troop surrounded him.
column3: Tsh amjed g Pilate shondaliga am i bei g Jesus k gd hu uꞌapa kownal geꞌe kih am k am wehs ha wai g e‑wehm shondal.

column2: They stripped him and put a scarlet cloak on him.
column3: Kutsh am i e hemapad k nahnko wua. Msh ab abchud mash chum e kownalchud. Pegih, tsh gam si wuashul g wehschugaj k g kownal eniga ab wahkid

column2: They made a crown of thorns and placed it on his head, and put a stick in his right hand. They kneeled down in front of him and mocked him, saying, “We salute you, King of the Jews!”
column3: k ge hoꞌi gihkot k ab wahki moꞌoj ab k g uhs an behijel s‑apko nowij an k wabsh nahnko ahg ch ab i tohtonwua wui k hab kaij, “Tash g d ha‑kownaligk g Tutuligo.”

column2: They spat on him, and took the stick and beat him over the head with it.
column3: Sh ab si siswuimad k an si gewitta moꞌoj an.

column2: When they'd finished mocking him, they took off the robe and put his own clothes back on him. Then they led him away to crucify him.
column3: Tsh am i haꞌasa nahnko juh k am wuahawua hegai kownal eniga k ab uhpam wahki g enigaj k gam hu hahawa i bei mat ab wo naggia kots t ab.

column2: On the way they found a man called Simon, from Cyrene, and they forced him to carry Jesus' cross.
column3: Tsh ab hema i ha nam g oꞌodham mo ab Cyrene kihhim t ab d kihkam ch hab chehgig Simon. Id amtsh ab wabsh si kushwiotach hegai kots mamt ab ab wo naggia g Jesus.

column2: When they arrived at Golgotha, meaning “Place of the Skull,”
column3: Kumtsh gam hu i bei g Jesus mamtsh am wo naggia. K hab e aꞌaga amai Golgotha. K id hab d ahga Koshwak.

column2: they gave him wine mixed with gall. But having tasted it, he refused to drink it.
column3: Kumtsh ab chum iꞌich g nawait mo g kulani am wehnags mat wo hehogi g s‑koꞌok. Tsh ab chum jeh k pi ab hu ih.

column2: After they had crucified him, they rolled dice to divide his clothes between them.
column3: Kumtsh ab hahawa sisish kots t ab k am i kei g kots. Tsh am haꞌi e chichwi g shondal k am aꞌai e gehg g wehschugaj

column2: Then they sat down and kept watch over him there.
column3: k am hahawa i dadhaiwua k nuhkud.

column2: They placed a sign over his head with the charge against him. It read, “This is Jesus, the King of the Jews.”
column3: Kumtsh an oꞌoha mam haschu ab abchud k ab sihsh kots t ab ab dahm mo ab i moꞌokch g Jesus. Sh hab chuꞌig, “Id o d Jesus ch d Tutuligo ha‑kownalig.”

column2: They crucified two criminals with him, one on the right, and one on the left.
column3: Tsh gohk ab ep ha nahngia kokots t ab gan hu aꞌai. Sh eda d s‑chu eꞌeskam idam.

column2: Those who passed by shouted insults at him, shaking their heads,
column3: Sh hegam mo an bihbimhim si gahi e moꞌogid ch ab si s‑koꞌokam has ahg g Jesus

column2: saying, “You who promised to destroy the Temple and rebuild it in three days, why don't you save yourself! If you really are the Son of God, then come down from the cross.”
column3: hab kaijch, “Naptsh woho wo i wua g geꞌe cheopi k am uhpam ep wo kei waik tash ab? Pegih, ab g hig i huduni kots t amjed k wo e doꞌibia maptp woho d wo Jiosh alidagk.”

column2: The chief priests mocked him in the same way, along with the religious teachers and elders.
column3: Sh g uꞌugchu papal ch chehanig ha mashchamdam ch geꞌeged hab wa masma ep nahnko ahg hab kaijch,

column2: “He saved other people, but he can't save himself!” they said. “If he really is the king of Israel, let him come down from the cross, and then we'll believe him!
column3: “Id atsh haꞌi ha doꞌibia k atki wabshaba pi wo e nako mas wo hejel e doꞌibia. Nash hig pi woho d t‑kownalig? Pegih, tt ab wo s‑wohoch matp ab wo i huduni k wo e doꞌibia.

column2: He trusts God so confidently—well let God rescue him now if he wants him, because he claimed ‘I am the Son of God.’ ”
column3: Ab o si hiwig g Jiosh ch hab e ahg mo d alidaj. Pegih, tt hig wo nei mas hu wo doꞌibia g Jiosh hemu.”

column2: The criminals who were crucified with him also insulted him in the same way.
column3: Chum wa hema hegam s‑chu eꞌeskam mamt ab hab waꞌap ha nahngia kots t ab hab waꞌap s‑koꞌokam has ahg.

column2: From noon until three o'clock darkness covered the whole country.
column3: T am i dahm juh. T wehsko gei g s‑chuhugam waik ohla ab.

column2: At about three o'clock Jesus shouted out loud, “Eli, Eli, lama sabachthani?” which means, “My God, my God, why have you abandoned me?”
column3: Kutsh am i e ai g waik ohla. Sh si s‑kaidam hab kaij g Jesus, “Eli, Eli, lama sabaktani,” mo hab d ahga, “Ni‑Jioshga, Ni‑Jioshga, shahchu apt ahgk am wabsh i ni‑dagito?”

column2: When some of those standing there heard it, they said, “He's calling for Elijah!”
column3: Sh haꞌijj hab kaij hegam mo am gegok, “Elijabad o ab chum waid.”

column2: Immediately one of them ran and grabbed a sponge, soaked it in vinegar, put it on a stick, and gave it to Jesus to drink.
column3: Tsh ab hema ha hekaj i med k an haꞌichu usko mat am wakch nawait ch ed k am uhgk i be k ab chum iꞌich g Jesus.

column2: But the others said, “Leave him alone. Let's see if Elijah will come and save him.”
column3: Kush haꞌi hab kaij, “Kia koi, tt hig wo nei mas ia wo jiwia g Elijabad k wo doꞌibia.”

column2: Jesus cried out again with a loud voice, and breathed his last.
column3: Kutsh am si s‑kaidam hab haꞌichu ep chei g Jesus k am hahawa i muh.

column2: Right then the veil of the Temple was torn apart from top to bottom. The ground shook, the rocks split apart,
column3: Kutsh hegai s‑kowk ikus kuhpadag mash am s‑tadnim naggia ged hu si eda g geꞌe cheopi ab si shel e wantsh. T g jewed uꞌugij k gam si e hahai g geꞌeged hohodai.

column2: and the graves were opened. Many of those who had lived good lives and had fallen asleep in death were raised to life.
column3: Kutki g hihaꞌini gam si e kuhkpiꞌo. T muꞌijj hegam mat heki hu koi ab s‑wohochudch g Jesus ab i wuwha muhkig amjed

column2: After the resurrection of Jesus they went out from the graveyards into the holy city where many people saw them.
column3: i dahm mat g Jesus i wuhsh k gam hu i wahp amai mo hab e aꞌaga Si Hekia S‑apꞌekam Kihhim ch d Jerusalem. K muꞌijj ha neid amai.

column2: When the centurion and those with him who were guarding Jesus saw the earthquake and what happened, they were terrified, and said, “This really was the Son of God!”
column3: Tsh idam shondal g e‑geꞌejig wehm am i nei mat g Jesus muh k taht g jewed uꞌujig k shaꞌi si e totodsid k hab kaij, “Woho oki d Jiosh alidag.”

column2: Many women were also watching from a distance, those who had followed Jesus from Galilee and had supported him.
column3: Sh eda muꞌijj am haꞌichug hegam uꞌuwi mo ga hu amjed wehmaj g Jesus ab Galilee t amjed ch am haꞌichukaj i wehmaj. Idam ash ga hu wabsh mehk gegok ch ab neid.

column2: These included Mary Magdalene, Mary the mother of James and Joseph, and the mother of the sons of Zebedee.
column3: Sh am ha wehmaj g Mary Magdalene ch hegai Mary mo d ha‑jeꞌe g James ch Joses ch heg ehp mo d Zebedeebad wehm kihkam ch d ha‑jeꞌe g James ch John.

column2: When evening came, a rich man named Joseph, from Arimathea, (who was also a disciple of Jesus),
column3: Tsh am hahawa jiwia ihda s‑kais oꞌodham mo hab chehgig Joseph ch ab Arimathea t amjed ch ab s‑wohochud mo g Jesus d Jiosh si Kehsha. K eda e aihim mat wo i hud.

column2: went to Pilate and asked for the body of Jesus. Pilate ordered it to be handed over to him.
column3: Tsh heg hekaj gam hu hih ihda Joseph ab Pilate wui k ab tahni g Jesus honshpadag. Kush g Pilate am ha chehani mamt wo mah.

column2: Joseph took the body and wrapped it up in a fresh linen cloth,  and placed it in his own new tomb, cut out of solid rock. He rolled a large stone across the entrance to the tomb, and left.
column3: Tsh gam hu uhpam jiwia. Kumtsh am wehhejed ab i huduni g Jesus honshpadag. K am mia hab chuꞌig g Joseph hihaꞌini ch ab heki hu cheotas hodai ch ed. Kumtsh am i bei g honshpadag k am i hobino g si s‑kehg ikuskaj k am cheh heg eda cheo k ab hahawa g ge geꞌe hodai i himchud k ab hekaj kuh g hihaꞌini. Tsh gam hu hahawa uhpam hihi hegam Joseph.

column2: Mary Magdalene and the other Mary were there, sitting opposite the tomb.
column3: Kush am dadha g Mary Magdalene heg wehm hema Mary ch am neid mat hebai cheh.

column2: The next day, after the Preparation day, the chief priests and the Pharisees went together to see Pilate.
column3: Baꞌich tash o d shahwai. Tsh am dada g uꞌugchu papal ch Palasi Pilate wui

column2: They said to him, “Sir, we recall that the imposter said while he was still alive, ‘After three days, I'll rise again.’
column3: k hab kaij, “T‑kownalig, s‑chegito ach mo wa ihda s‑chu iattomkam hab kaij matsh uhpam wo e chegito matsh d wo waik i tashk.

column2: Give orders to secure the tomb until the third day. That way his disciples can't come and steal his body and tell people that he was raised from the dead, and the deception in the end will become worse than it was at first.”
column3: Neh pt am wo ha cheha mat wo si e nuhkud g hihaꞌini waik tash ab. T hekaj hab pi wo e nako g piongaj mas ab wo ha ehs g honshpadag k hab wo ha ahgi g hemajkam matki i wuhsh ab muhkig t amjed. Neh, ihda ha‑iattogi at baꞌich wo i si pi apꞌek mo g wehpegkam.”

column2: “I'll give you a guard of soldiers,” Pilate told them. “Now go, and make it as secure as you possibly can.”
column3: Kush hab kaij g Pilate ab ha wui, “Am g haꞌi wo ha uꞌuk g shondal k am has i masma ab wo nuhkud g hihaꞌini.”

column2: So they went and made the tomb secure, sealing the entrance stone and posting soldiers as guards.
column3: Kutsh am ha oi g shondal. Kutsh gam hu hihim k ab si s‑wihnam i kuh g hihaꞌini k an bidsh g hodai k ab si chepos. Sh idam shondal am nuhkud g hihaꞌini tash oidam ch chuhug oidam.

column2: Early Sunday morning, at dawn, Mary Magdalene and the other Mary went to see the tomb.
column3: Sh am e aihim g domig tash. Tsh am hihaꞌini wui hihi g Mary Magdalene heg wehm hema Mary.

column2: All of a sudden there was a tremendous earthquake, for an angel of the Lord came down from heaven and rolled away the stone, and sat on it.
column3: D am hahawa si uꞌugij g jewed. Tsh g anghil ab i hud dahm kahchim t amjed k im hu hab i melch g hodai k an dahm dahiwua.

column2: His face blazed like lightning, and his clothes were as white as snow.
column3: Sh g wuhioshaj si s‑masma tonod hab masma mo g wepgi. Sh g wehschugaj hab masma s‑toha mo g s‑mohoni gew.

column2: The guards shook with fear, falling down as if they were dead.
column3: Kutsh wabsh wohoꞌi totods hegam shondal mo ab nuhkud k si gigiwek ch amjed hab sha e juh mo d wabsh koꞌi.

column2: The angel told the women, “Don't be afraid! I know you're looking for Jesus, who was crucified.
column3: Kush ab neok hegai anghil ch hab kaij ab ha wui hegam uꞌuwi, “Pi g am wo shaꞌi e totodsid. M ani wa s‑mahch mam g Jesus chuhkug an chum gahghim.

column2: He's not here. He's risen from the dead, just as he said he would. Come and see where the Lord was lying.
column3: Ab g wo i hihim k wo nei mo pi ia hu haꞌichug iia mat ia e cheh. Uhpam at ep i wuhsh muhkig amjed mo wa hab wa kaij.

column2: Now go quickly and tell his disciples that he's risen from the dead and that he's going on ahead of you to Galilee. You will see him there, I promise you!”
column3: Kumt am s‑hohtam wo hihim k wo ha ahgi hegam mo am wehmajkahim mat uhpam e chegito k gam hu wo hih Galilee wui. Mt gam hu wo hihim k am haꞌab wo nei. Neh, am ani em‑ahgid mo has i kaij.” Bash kaij g anghil.

column2: They left the tomb quickly, both afraid and very happy, running to tell his disciples.
column3: Kutsh si e totodsid k si s‑hohtam ga hu hihi ab amjed g hihaꞌini k eda si s‑hehgig ch ia hu chum wohp matsh wo t‑ahgi.

column2: Suddenly Jesus came to meet them, and greeted them. They went over to him, held onto his feet and worshiped him.
column3: Tsh wabshaba haha wabsh ha nam g Jesus k hab kaij, “T wo s‑em hoꞌigeꞌel g Jiosh.” Tsh ab si i shul wui k an ui tahtdaj an k ab si ihm.

column2: Then Jesus said to them, “Don't be afraid! Go and tell my brothers to leave for Galilee, and they will see me there.”
column3: Sh hab kaij ab ha wui, “Pi g am wo ni‑ehbenid. Am g wo hihim k wo ha ahgi g ni‑wepnag mat am wo hihi Galilee wui k am haꞌab wo ni‑nei.”

column2: As they left, some of the guards went into the city and explained to the chief priests everything that had happened.
column3: Kutsh gam hu hihi hegam uꞌuwi. Tsh hegam shondal mash am nuhkud g hihaꞌini am haꞌi hihim k ged hu dada kihhim t am k am ha ahgi g uꞌugchu papal wehs haꞌichu matsh haschu has i e juh.

column2: After the chief priests had met with the elders, and worked out a plan, they bribed the soldiers with a great deal of money.
column3: Tsh g uꞌugchu papal am ha wehm e nam g geꞌeged k am e aꞌaga k am hahawa muꞌi ha mah g lial idam shondal

column2: “Say that his disciples came during the night and stole him while we were sleeping,” they told the soldiers.
column3: k hab ha ahg, “Bamt wo chei matki am dada g piongaj chuhug ch ed k am em‑ehs g honshpadag mam kohksh.

column2: “And if the governor hears about this, we'll talk to him and you won't have to worry.”
column3: Kutp wo sha kah g kownal mam has i kaij, tt wo wa em‑doꞌibia.”

column2: So the soldiers took the money and did what they were told. This story has been spread among the Jewish people to this very day.
column3: Kutsh am ui g lial hegam shondal k am hab e juh mam has i ha ahg. Ia o i idani hab masma am e aꞌaga am ha shahgid g Tutuligo.

column2: But the eleven disciples went to Galilee, to the mountain where Jesus had told them to go.
column3: Kuchd ahchim gamai hemako am hihi heg wui doꞌag am Galilee ch ed mo wa hab kaij g Jesus matt am wo hihi.

column2: When they saw him they worshiped him, though some doubted.
column3: D g Jesus am haꞌichug. Kuchd ab si ihm. D eda hi wa haꞌi sha pi wohoch.

column2: Jesus came to them and told them, “All power in heaven and on earth has been given to me.
column3: D ab si i t‑miabi g Jesus k hab kaij ab t‑wui, “Jiosh at ab ni‑mah g gewkdag wehs haꞌichu dahm an dahm kahchim ch ed ch id dahm jewed.

column2: So go and make disciples of people of all nations, baptizing them in the name of the Father and of the Son and of the Holy Spirit.
column3: Gamai g wo hihim wehsko hemajkam ha wui k wo i ha mashcha g haꞌichu ni‑ahga k ab wo i ha pahl wapko am chehchegch g ni‑ohg Jiosh ch ahni ep ni‑chehcheg mani d alidaj ch heg ehp Hekia S‑apꞌekam Gewkdag.

column2: Teach them to follow all the commands I have given you. Remember, I am always with you, to the very end of the world.”
column3: Ab ani em‑chehani mamt has wo masmak. Kumt ab wo i ha mashcha g hemajkam mat ab wo s‑wohog elidad wehs haꞌichu mani haschu ab em‑chehani. Kunt chum hekid wo em‑wehmajk, chum as wo huhug g jewed.”

column2: Here is the beginning of the good news about Jesus Christ, the Son of God.
column3: Id o d s‑kehg haꞌichu ahgaj g Jiosh ab amjed g alidaj Jesus Christ. Shonaj ihda haꞌichu ahgaj.

column2: Just as the prophet Isaiah wrote, “I'm sending my messenger ahead of you to prepare your way.
column3: o an hab chuꞌig oꞌohanaj ed hegai Jiosh haꞌichu i tashogiddam mash hab chehgig Isaiah. Heg atki an oꞌoha mash g Jiosh hab kaij ab e‑alidag wui:

column2: This is what he had to say: “After me someone is coming who is greater than I am. I'm not worthy to bend down and untie his sandals.
column3: Sh hab ha ahg g John, “Pi g hab wo ni‑elid manis ahni d si haꞌichu. Ab atsh hema wo i wuhsh ni‑oidk mat d wo si s‑has haꞌichuk.

column2: I baptized you in water but he will baptize you in the Holy Spirit.”
column3: Ahni ani hi wabsh em‑pahl wapkon. Tsh wabshaba heg ab wo em‑mah g Hekia S‑apꞌekam Gewkdag matsh heg chum hekid wo em‑wehmajk.”

column2: Then Jesus came from Nazareth in Galilee and was baptized by John in the Jordan River.
column3: Kush eda g Jesus wenog ab d kihkam heg eda al kihhim mash d Nazareth ch am eda g Galilee chekshani. Kutsh am i him k am jiwia mo am oimmed g John hab ahgk matsh wo e pahl wako. Tsh g John am pahl wako akimel ch ed.

column2: As Jesus came out of the water, he saw the heavens split apart and the Spirit like a dove descending upon him.
column3: Tsh ab wabsh i chum wuhsh ab amjed g shuhdagi. Tsh g dahm kahchim ab si i e kuhpiꞌo. Kutsh g Hekia S‑apꞌekam Gewkdag i hud ab ab g Jesus hab sha masma mat g hohhi.

column2: A voice from heaven said, “You are my son, the one I love. I am very pleased with you.”
column3: Sh ab neok g Jiosh dahm kahchim t amjed ch hab kaij ab wui g Jesus, “Ahpi ap d si ni‑tachuidch ni‑alidag ch am si ni‑tatchui oidch hab masma.”

column2: Right after this the Spirit sent him away into the desert
column3: Am waꞌi hekaj, sh g Hekia S‑apꞌekam Gewkdag hab ahg g Jesus matsh gam hu hejelko wo hih.

column2: where he was tempted by Satan for forty days. He was with the wild animals, and angels took care of him.
column3: Kutsh am hih tohono jewed wui k am haꞌichug giꞌikko wehst‑mahm tash ab mo am haꞌichug g mischini haꞌichu doakam. Sh heg i oidam g ge Jiawul am chum s‑wuimk pi apꞌekam ch ed. Sh wabshaba g anghil am nuhkud.

column2: Later, after John was arrested, Jesus went to Galilee, announcing God's good news.
column3: Sh am hu hebai, tsh e kuhpach hegai John mo am ha pahl wapkon. Tsh heg i dahm am jiwia g Jesus Galilee chekshani t am am ahgachugch g s‑kehg haꞌichu ahgaj g Jiosh

column2: “The time predicted has come,” he said. “God's kingdom is near. Repent and believe in the good news.”
column3: hab kaijch, “Gam g hu wo s‑ohhod g pi ap e‑chegitoi k ab wo i s‑wohoch idda s‑kehg haꞌichu ahgaj g Jiosh. E at ai mat am baꞌich wo i e tashogi g Jiosh kownaltalig.”

column2: As he was walking beside the Sea of Galilee, Jesus saw Simon and his brother Andrew throwing a net into the water, for they made their living by fishing.
column3: Neh, bash kaijhim ch an him hugidaj an hegai al kahchki mo d Galilee Kahchki. Sh eda am haꞌi oiopo g waptopi ha uꞌudam ch am wuhpa g e‑chuagia shuhdagi ch ed. Tsh am ha cheh g Jesus. Kush d idam gohk e wepngam mo hab chehgig Simon ch Andrew.

column2: “Come and follow me,” he told them, “and I will have you fishing for people.”
column3: Sh hab ha ahg g Jesus, “Ab g wo i ni‑oid k pi hegam waꞌi waptopi wo ha uꞌud ch wabshaba g hemajkam wo i ha wanchkwua ab Jiosh wui.”

column2: They left their nets at once and followed him.
column3: Kutsh ha hekaj dagito g e‑chikpan k am i oi.

column2: He went a little farther and saw James and his brother John, the sons of Zebedee. They were in a boat mending their nets.
column3: Tsh am shaꞌi hihim k haha wabsh gohk ep ha cheh. Idam ash am kegchud g e‑chuagia wahlko ch ed ch d James ch John. Kush g ohgaj hab chehgig Zebedee.

column2: Immediately he called them to follow him, and they left their father Zebedee in the boat with the hired workers, and followed Jesus.
column3: Tsh ab i ha wai g Jesus. Kutsh gam hu i oi am dagitok g e‑ohg wahlko ch ed ha wehm g ha‑pionag.

column2: They left for Capernaum, and on Sabbath Jesus went into the synagogue and taught there.
column3: Kutsh am hihim k am dada Capernaum kihhim t am. Tsh am i e ai g shahwai mach heg eda t‑mihshmad. Kutsh am i wahp ha‑cheopi ed. Tsh g Jesus am ha mihshmad.

column2: The people were amazed at his teaching, for he spoke with authority, unlike the religious teachers.
column3: Kutsh g hemajkam ab si e totods ab mashchamadaj amjed nash pi baꞌich i si s‑e mamachim ha mashcham mo hi hegam mo d chum chehanig ha mashchamdam.

column2: Suddenly, right there in the synagogue, a man with an evil spirit started shouting out,
column3: Kush eda am hema haꞌichug g oꞌodham mash g jiawul uꞌukch g chegitoidaj.

column2: “Jesus of Nazareth, why are you bothering us? Have you come to destroy us? I know who you are! You're God's Holy One!”
column3: Tsh heg hab juh mash am si s‑kaidam neok ch hab kaij, “Shahchu ap ahgch t‑kudut, ahpi Jesus map ab Nazareth t amjed. Napt heg hekaj ia wabsh jiwia mapt gam hu hab wo i ni‑juh id amjed oꞌodham? S‑m‑mahch ani map d hekia s‑apꞌekam ch ab d Jiosh amjedkam.”

column2: Jesus interrupted the evil spirit, telling him, “Be quiet! Come out of him.”
column3: Tsh g Jesus ab si s‑kehꞌel g jiawul k hab kaij, “Ab g wabsh i pi shahmuni k gam hu hab wo i e juh.”

column2: The evil spirit screamed, threw the man into convulsions, and came out of him.
column3: Tsh g jiawul si ugij ihda oꞌodham. Kutsh si hihin. Tsh g jiawul hahawa dagito.

column2: Everyone was amazed at what happened. “What is this?” they asked each other. “What is this new teaching that has such authority? Even evil spirits do what he tells them!”
column3: Kutsh wehsijj si e totodsid k ab aꞌai i e kakke, “Shahꞌo d ahga ihda? No d wechij mashchama? No pi ab kaiham g jijawul mo haschu ab i ha chehani.”

column2: News about him spread quickly throughout the whole region of Galilee.
column3: Kutsh an wehsko i e ahgidahi am Galilee ch ed matsh haschu s‑kehg hab juh g Jesus.

column2: Then they left the synagogue and went to the home of Simon and Andrew, along with James and John.
column3: Kutsh ab i wuwha hegam Jesus cheopi t amjed k gam hu wa hekaj hihi ha‑kih wui hegam Simon ch Andrew. Tsh g James ch John ep i ha oi.

column2: Simon's mother-in-law was sick in bed with a fever, so they told Jesus about her.
column3: Kush eda am woꞌo g Simon hohnig jeꞌe ch g s‑tonjigkaj mumku. Kumsh am ahgid g Jesus.

column2: He went to her, took her by the hand, and helped her up. The fever immediately left her. Then she made them a meal.
column3: Tsh am i wah mo hebai woꞌo k ab bei nowij ab k i wamigi. Kutsh ha hekaj am i apꞌet k am haꞌichu ha hihidol.

column2: After sunset that evening, those who were sick and demon-possessed were brought to Jesus.
column3: Kutsh gam hu si i juh. Tsh g hemajkam ab i ha ui hegam mo kokꞌo ch hegam ehp mo g jijawul uꞌukch g ha‑chegitoidag.

column2: The whole of the town gathered outside.
column3: k am i e hemapai ha‑kih ab.

column2: He healed many people who had various diseases, and threw out many demons. He did not permit the demons to speak, for they knew who he was.
column3: Kutsh g Jesus wehs ha dodaj idam k gam hu hab i ha juh g jijawul ab ha amjed. Sh g jijawul s‑mahch mo d Jiosh alidag. Sh wabshaba pi ha hiwgid g Jesus mas idam am wo ah mo hedai wud.

column2: Very early in the morning, while it was still dark, Jesus got up and went alone to a quiet place to pray.
column3: Baꞌich siꞌalim mash wabsh kia s‑chuhugam, tsh am i wami g Jesus k gam hu hejelko him k am e hoꞌigeꞌidahun.

column2: Simon and the others went to search for him.
column3: Kutsh idam Simon am i gahghio.

column2: When they found him, they told him, “Everybody's looking for you.”
column3: k am hebai chehg k am ahgid, “Muꞌi hemajkam o an m‑gahg.”

column2: But Jesus replied, “We have to go to the other towns around here so that I can tell them the good news as well—for that's why I came.”
column3: Kush hab kaij g Jesus, “Oi g wo. Tt hig wo hihi am baꞌich kihhim wui. Nt am ep wo ha mihshmad nant pi heg hekaj i wuhsh.”

column2: So he went all over Galilee, speaking in the synagogues and expelling demons.
column3: Kutsh am i ha mihshmdahi ha‑chechopi ed wehsko Galilee chekshani ch ed k gam hu hab i ha juh g jijawul ab ha amjed hegam mo an ha uꞌukch.

column2: A leper came to him asking for help. The man kneeled down before Jesus, saying, “Please, if you're willing, you can heal me!”
column3: Sh am hu hebai, tsh am hema jiwia Jesus wui k mumku heg hekaj mo hab e aꞌaga ‘leprosy’ ch chum pi ha doajig. Id ash ab wui e shoꞌigchud g Jesus ch hab kaij, “Pt wo e nako mapt wo ni‑doaj maptp wo tatchuad.”

column2: With compassion Jesus reached out and touched the man, and said, “I am willing. Be healed!”
column3: Kutsh ab si i s‑hoꞌigeꞌid k ab taht k hab ahg, “Mant hab wo wa m‑juni.”

column2: The leprosy left him immediately, and he was healed.
column3: Kutsh ha hekaj doa.

column2: Jesus sent him away with a strong warning.  “Make sure you don't tell anybody anything about this,” he told him. “Go to the priest and show yourself to him. Give the offering which is required by the law of Moses for such cleansing, so that people will have proof.”
column3: Jesus atsh am hahawa si shel ahgid k hab kaij, “Pi g hedai shaꞌi ahgid k wabsh am wo him k am wo i e chehgi pahl wui. T am wo m‑chechga. Kupt wo ha mah hegai mo wa g Jiosh em‑chehani hab masma mat g Mosesbad oꞌoha mamt heg hekaj wo wohokamch mamt doa.”

column2: But the healed leper went out and told everyone what had happened. As a result Jesus could not openly go into the cities anymore, but had to stay out in the country where people came to him from everywhere around.
column3: Kutsh oi wa ihda oꞌodham wehsko i ha ahgidahi g hemajkam ab amjed. Tsh heg hekaj pi e nako g Jesus mas am ep wo i wuhsh mo am hemajkamag kihhim ch ed k wabshaba gan hu hab wabsh jegko oimmed. Sh g hemajkam am wui himto ga hu wepsko amjed.

column2: A few days later Jesus returned home to Capernaum, and news spread that he was there.
column3: Kush d wabsh i heꞌekia tash matsh am ep dada hegam Jesus Capernaum t am. Tsh gan hu wa hekaj kaida matsh am dada.

column2: So many people crowded inside the house that it was packed, even outside the door, as Jesus told them the message.
column3: Kutsh shaꞌi si muꞌi e hemapai g hemajkam k am shuhdad g kih k ab kihjeg t ab ab wabsh i si s‑kawkam gegokiwua. Kush g Jesus am ha mihshmad.

column2: Four men had brought a man who was paralyzed,
column3: Tsh am haꞌi dada hema uꞌadch g pi himidkam. Id ash ab wabsh i s‑moik ch am woꞌo e‑wahkus ch ed. Kush giꞌik oꞌodham an uꞌa.

column2: but they could not get near Jesus because of the crowds. So they went up on the roof and took it apart. After they had made an opening above Jesus, they lowered down the mat with the paralyzed man lying on it.
column3: Sh wabshaba pi am hu shaꞌi jeg nash pi shaꞌi si s‑hemajkamag. Kutsh gan hu i chehchsh kih dahm k am ge maggat g kih maꞌishpadag am hu i mash am daha g Jesus k am i huduni g pi himidkam.

column2: When Jesus saw the trust these men had, Jesus said to the paralyzed man, “Friend, your sins are forgiven.”
column3: Kutsh g Jesus am i nei g ha‑wohochudadag k hab kaij heg wui pi himidkam, “Ni‑nawoj, ab ani s‑m‑hoꞌigeꞌid ch gm hu hab i juh g pi ap m‑chuꞌijig.”

column2: Some of the religious teachers sitting there thought to themselves,
column3: Kush eda am haꞌi dadha hegam mo d chehanig ha mashchamdam ch ash hab e ahg,

column2: “Why is he talking like this? He is blaspheming! Who can forgive sins? Only God can do that!”
column3: “Ih, pi oki ap neok hab masma e wepogidch g Jiosh. Heg at waꞌi Jiosh wo e nako mat gam hu hab wo i juh g pi ap ha‑chuꞌijig.”

column2: Jesus knew right away what they were thinking. He said to them, “Why are you thinking like this?
column3: Kutsh ha hekaj ha amich g Jesus mo haschu am oidahim k hab kaij ab ha wui, “Pi g am wo shaꞌi oidahim

column2: What's easier: to say to the paralyzed man, ‘Your sins are forgiven,’ or ‘Get up, pick up your mat, and walk’?
column3: manis hab wabsh kaij ch pi woho edgid g gewkdag mant gm hu hab wo i juh g pi ap ha‑chuꞌijig. Bam elid mo s‑pehegim hab e kaij mat gam hu hab i e juh g pi ap chuꞌijigaj no ge hedai s‑mahch mas s‑wohom hab e juh.

column2: But to convince you that the Son of man has the right to forgive sins,
column3: Pegih, nt wo em‑chehgi mani woho ge gewkdag ch hab wua mani has i kaij ahni Jiosh si Kehsha.” K hab hahawa kaij ab wui hegai pi himidkam,

column2: I say to you (the paralyzed man), ‘Get up, pick up your mat, and go home.’ ”
column3: “I g wamig k am behꞌi g e‑wahkus k gam hu hihm uhpam.”

column2: He stood up, picked up his mat, and walked out in front of everyone there. They were all amazed, and praised God, saying “We've never ever seen anything like this!”
column3: Kutsh am ha hekaj bei g e‑wahkus k gam hu hih uhpam am wehs ha‑nena ed.

column2: Jesus went out beside the sea once more and taught the crowds that came to him.
column3: Kutsh gam hu hahawa hihi hegam Jesus k gam hu dada ge shuhdagi bahsho. Tsh muꞌi am e chehm g hemajkam. Sh am ep ha mashcham.

column2: As he walked along, he saw Levi son of Alphaeus sitting at the tax-collector's booth.
column3: Kush am hu hebai ep hihimad ch am bihbij amai mam am ha kowlant g lial kownal wehhejed. Sh am hema chikpan ch hab chehgig Levi (Matthew). Tsh g Jesus am jiwia wui k hab ahg, “Ab g i hihm k ab si ni‑wecho e mashcham.” Kutsh am ha hekaj wabsh i oi.

column2: That evening Jesus ate dinner at Levi's house. Many tax collectors and “sinners” joined Jesus and his disciples for the meal, for there were many of these people that followed Jesus. When the religious leaders of the Pharisees saw Jesus eating with such people, they asked Jesus' disciples, “Why does he eat with tax collectors and sinners?”
column3: Tsh am hu hebai i cheka. Kutsh g Levi am hab juh g gegosig ha wehhejed hegam Jesus. Kush am dadhak ch e gegosid. Sh am haꞌi oiopo hegam mo d t‑chehanig t‑mashchamdam ch d ep Palasi. Idam Palasi o chum s‑gewkam oidchug g t‑himdag. K eda m uꞌi am oidchug g Jesus hegam mo pi am hu si oidchug g t‑shohshon ha‑himdag. Kush haꞌi idam d lial t‑kowlantdam heg wehhejed mash d geꞌe kownal wehs jejewed dahm. Kush hegam t‑chehanig t‑mashchamdam hab ha ahg hegam mo ab si wecho e mashcham g Jesus, “Ih, k haschu ahgch g em‑mashchamdam ha wehm e gegosid g pi ap hemajkam, chum hems g lial t‑kowlandam?”

column2: When Jesus heard this, he told them, “It's not healthy people who need a doctor, but those who are sick. I haven't come to invite those who do what is right, but those who don't—the sinners.”
column3: Tsh am i ha kaiok g Jesus k hab kaij ab ha wui, “Idam pi ap hemajkam o s‑e doꞌibiamk hab masma mat g kokꞌodam wo s‑e doajidam. Hegam mat hab wo e elidad mo s‑apꞌe at pi wo tatchua g mahkai. Pi ant hab ahgk ia jiwia jewed dahm manis wo ha doꞌibia hegam mo pi e doꞌibiamk.”

column2: Now John's disciples and the Pharisees were fasting. Some of them came to Jesus, and asked him, “Why is it that John's disciples and the Pharisees fast, but your disciples don't?”
column3: Hebaichuj ach heꞌekkio pi t‑gegosid matt ab wo t‑hoꞌigeꞌidahu Jiosh wui. Kutsh am hu hebai am i e ai matsh hab wo chum e juh. Sh eda idam Jesus pi hab e wua.

column2: “Do wedding guests fast while the bridegroom is with them?” Jesus asked them. “No. While the bridegroom's with them, they can't fast.
column3: Sh hab kaij g Jesus ab ha wui, “Nat hig pi wo e gegos g wo ha hohntam naipijju mat eda heg am wo ha wehmajk?

column2: But the day is coming when the bridegroom will be taken from them, and then they'll fast.
column3: T am wo i e ai mat pi am hu wo ha wehmajk. T am hahawa pi wo e gegos. Pegih, bat wo wa e juh idam mant hekid pi ia hu wo ha wehmajk.”

column2: No one puts a patch that's not shrunk on old clothes. Otherwise the new piece will shrink away from the old, and make the tear worse.
column3: Sh am hahawa chum ha tashogid g Jesus mat g mashchamaj pi ap wo wehnad g ha‑himdag ash hab kaijch, “Pi at hedai g wechij ikuskaj wo shohsho g hekiuchij lihwa mat wo s‑e wia nat pi wo i dahiwua k baꞌich wo i wantsh g hekiuchij.

column2: No one puts new wine in old wineskins. Otherwise the wine will burst the wineskins, and both the wine and wineskins will be wasted. No. You put new wine in new wineskins.”
column3: K hab waꞌap pi hab mahs machs am wo toa g wechij uhdwis wadag am eda g hekiuchij haꞌichu elidag kostal. T wo am hu wantsh g hekiuchij k wo iawua. Wechij uhdwis wadag at am wo e toa wechij kokstal ch ed.”

column2: One Sabbath day as Jesus was walking through the grain fields, his disciples started picking heads of grain as they walked along.
column3: Sh am hu hebai hihim idam Jesus t‑mihshmda tash ed. Kush am eshas g pilkani wohg huhugid an. Sh idam haꞌi ab ha wohni g pilkani ch i mohon ch koꞌa.

column2: The Pharisees asked Jesus, “Look, why are they doing what is not permitted on the Sabbath?”
column3: Kush haꞌi hegam Palasi ab ha neid ch ab kakke g Jesus, “Shahchu o ahgch hab haꞌichu junihim mo pi hab shaꞌi chum mahs t‑mihshmda tash ed?”

column2: “Haven't you ever read what David did when he and his men were hungry and in need?” Jesus asked them.
column3: Kush hab kaij g Jesus ab ha wui, “Bo wabsh masma hab e wua matsh wa g Davidbad. Pi amtki chegito matsh heg has e Juh am i bihugimk. Bo chugꞌig g Jiosh oꞌohana

column2: “He went into God's house when Abiathar was high priest, and ate the consecrated bread which no one except the priests are permitted to eat, and gave it to his men too.”
column3: matsh wa am i wah geꞌe cheopi ch ed k am ui g pahn k huh hegam ha wehm mash am wehmaj. K d hegai pahn mo am e toꞌaw k ch hegam d waꞌi ha wuikam papal. T eda hemho wa am hab e juh. K heg hekaj am wa s‑apꞌe matsh ab mah g pahn hegai pahlibad mash am haꞌichug ch hab chehgig Abiathar.

column2: “The Sabbath was made for your benefit, not for you to benefit the Sabbath,” he told them.
column3: Id o am wohokamchud mo g chehanig d i chum ha wehmtadag g hemajkam. Em‑mihshmda tash at am e apꞌech em‑wehhejed. Kumt pi heg wehhejed e nahto e‑mihshmda tash.

column2: “So the Son of man is Lord even of the Sabbath.”
column3: Ni ahni d Jiosh si Kehsha ch gewkdag am dahm g em‑mihshmda tash.”

column2: Jesus went to the synagogue again. A man was there who had a crippled hand.
column3: Sh am hu hebai, tsh am ep i wahp idam Jesus hema cheopi ch ed. Kush am hema daha g oꞌodham mash g nowij mahnikodag.

column2: Some of those there were watching Jesus to see if he would heal the man on the Sabbath, because they were looking for a reason to accuse him of breaking the law.
column3: Kush am haꞌi dadha g Palasi ch am s‑nenꞌeid mas hab wo juh g doajida am ha mihshmda tash ed nash pi ab haꞌichu s‑abchudamk.

column2: Jesus told the man with the crippled hand, “Come and stand here in front of everyone.”
column3: Sh g Jesus hab kaij heg wui mahnikokam, “Ia g hu i kekiwua.” Kutsh gam hu i kekiwua.

column2: “Is it lawful to do good on the Sabbath, or to do evil? Should you save life, or should you kill?” he asked them. But they didn't say a word.
column3: Sh ab hahawa ha kakke, “Shahchu am ahgch hab elid mo pi hiwgidas mihshmda tash ed mamt wo i ha wehmt hegam mo e shoꞌigchud? Ab o em‑ab mamt wo i ha wehmt g shoꞌigkam k am wo i e nako mamt wo ha doꞌibia hegam mat am hu wo e koꞌij. Aha namt wabsh wo ha hiwigi mat wo e koꞌij?”

column2: He looked around at them in exasperation, very upset by their hard-hearted attitude. Then he told the man, “Hold out your hand.” The man held out his hand, and it was healed.
column3: nash pi pi shaꞌi pihk e elid heg wui mahnikokam. Sh heg hekaj si s‑koꞌokam an i ha nenashad g Jesus ch eda ep pi ap e tahtk ha wehhejed ch ash hab kaij heg wui oꞌodham, “Ab g si i shelin g e‑nowi.” Kutsh am wabsh i chum shelin k am waꞌi hekaj apꞌet.

column2: The Pharisees left, and immediately began plotting with Herod's party as to how they might kill Jesus.
column3: Kutsh babgat g Palasi matsh ha doaj ha mihshmda tash ab k gam hu hihim k am ha wehm e nam g piongaj hegai mo wa d kownal heg eda chekshani ch hab chehgig Herod. Kush idam e wehm aꞌaga matsh has hig masma wo mua g Jesus.

column2: Meanwhile Jesus returned to the Sea, and a large crowd followed him. They were from Galilee, Judea,
column3: Kutsh gam hu hahawa hihi hegam Jesus ge shuhdagi wui. Kutsh muꞌi hemajkam am i oi ab Galilee t amjed

column2: Jerusalem, Idumea, Transjordan, and from the regions of Tyre and Sidon. So many people came to see him because they'd heard all he was doing.
column3: ch ab Judea t amjed, chum hems ab Jerusalem kihhim t amjed, ch Idumia chekshani ch gan hu aigojed g Jordan akimel ch gam hujed mash d Tyre ch Sidon kihhim. Idam muꞌi atsh am himto am kaiok mo heꞌes i geꞌe haꞌichu hab wuihim g Jesus.

column2: Jesus told his disciples to have a small boat ready in case the crowd crushed him,
column3: Kush heg am ha ahgid hegam mo ab si wecho e mashcham matsh g wahlko an wo uꞌukchid am wehhejed natsh pi g hemajkam wabsh wo i si chehmo.

column2: because he had healed so many that all the sick people kept on pressing towards him so they could touch him.
column3: Kush wehs am chum s‑ahimk g kokꞌodam ch ab s‑tahtmamk mat wo ha apꞌet natsh pi muꞌijj ha dodaj.

column2: Whenever the evil spirits saw him they would fall down in front of him and shout out, “You are the Son of God!”
column3: Kutsh hekid wo sha nei g Jesus hegam mash g jijawul ha uꞌukch k ab wo i e shoꞌigch wui k wo si hihin k hab wo chei, “Ahpi ap d Jiosh alidag.”

column2: But he commanded them not to reveal who he was.
column3: Sh g Jesus am si ha chehani mat pi hedai wo shaꞌi ahgi mo hedai wud.

column2: Then Jesus went away to the hill country. He called those he wanted to be with him, and they came to him.  He chose twelve to be with him, and called them apostles. They were to be with him, and he would send them out to announce the good news,
column3: Tsh am hu hebai, tsh ab i chesh g Jesus kawulk t ab k ab i wai hegam mash ab s‑wohochud. Tsh ab wui i hihi. Kutsh gamai gohk am i ha chuhcha ab ha wui hab kaijch, “Ahpim amt chum hekid wo ni‑wehmajkad. Kunt hebaichuj am wo em‑cheha mamt am hebai wo hihim k wo ha mihshmad.

column2: and with the authority to drive out demons.
column3: Kumt wo edgidad g gewkdag mamt gam hu hab wo i ha juh g jijawul ab ha amjed hegam mo an ha uꞌukch.”

column2: These are the twelve he chose: Simon (whom he called Peter),
column3: Neh, bash kaij ch am i ha chuhcha hegam gamai gohk. Hema hegam o d Simon. Kutsh heg hab ep chehch Peter mo hab d ahga Hodai.

column2: James the son of Zebedee and his brother John (who he called Boanerges, meaning “sons of thunder”),
column3: Haꞌi ehp o d James ch John ch d Zebedee aꞌalidag. Kutsh idam hab ep ha chehch g Jesus ‘Tataniki Namkam.’

column2: Andrew, Philip, Bartholomew, Matthew, Thomas, James the son of Alphaeus, Thaddaeus, Simon the Revolutionary,
column3: Haꞌi ehp o d Andrew, Philip, Bartholomew, Matthew, ch Thomas. K hema d hegai mo d James ch d alidaj hegai mo hab chehgig Alphias. K hema hab ep chehgig Simon ch d hema hegam mo tatchua matt ahchim Tutuligo hejel wo himchudad g t‑kownaltalig. K hema d Thaddaus

column2: and Judas Iscariot (who betrayed him).
column3: K hema d hegai mat gagda g Jesus k hab chehgig Judas Iscariot. Neh, idam gamai gohk ash d Jesus chuhchai. Kush an oidchug.

column2: Jesus went home, but such a large crowd gathered again that he and his disciples didn't even have time to eat.
column3: Kutsh am uhpam hih g Jesus mash am kih. Tsh hegam gamai gohk am i oi. Kutsh g hemajkam am ep i e hemapad k shaꞌi si muꞌida. Tsh heg hekaj pi e nako mas ep wo e gegos idam Jesus.

column2: When Jesus' family heard about it, they came to take him away, saying, “He's lost his senses!”
column3: Kutsh am i kah g hahajunij k ab i hihim k am chum s‑behimk hab elidch mat sha heb hu wua g e‑chegitoi.
