column2: But the religious leaders from Jerusalem said, “He's possessed by Beelzebub! It's by the ruler of demons that he's driving out demons!”
column3: Sh am hai gegok g chehanig ha mashchamdam ch am dada Jerusalem t amjed ch ash hab kaij, “Jijawul ha‑geꞌejig oki an uꞌukch g chegitoidaj ihda.”

column2: But Jesus called them over to him. Using illustrations he asked them, “How can Satan throw out Satan?
column3: Tsh oi wa g Jesus ab i ha waid k hab masma am i ha tashogi, “Kus haschu ahgk hig g Jiawul wo i wuhshad g hejel e‑pionag?

column2: A kingdom fighting itself can't continue.
column3: S‑mahch am mat g oꞌodham wo padch g hejel e‑jewedga mat ab aꞌai wo e cheggia.

column2: A household that's divided is doomed.
column3: Kut g e wehm kihkam hab waꞌap wo padch g hejel e‑kihdag mat ab aꞌai wo e cheggia.

column2: If Satan is divided and fights against himself, he won't last long—he'll soon come to an end.
column3: Pegih, t has hig masma g jijawul pi wo padch g hejel e‑gewkdag mat ab aꞌai wo e cheggia?

column2: Clearly, if someone breaks into the house of a strong man and tries to take his things, he won't get far in his theft unless he ties up the strong man first.”
column3: “Neh, wohppoꞌid ani g ge Jiawul hegam mo an ha uꞌukch. Kum s‑mahch mat pi hedai wo shaꞌi e nako mas am hu wabsh wo wah hema kih ed mat wo s‑haꞌahamak k am wo ui g enigaj, heg hi wa matp wehpeg wo wulsh.

column2: “I tell you the truth: all sins and blasphemies can be forgiven,
column3: “Wehs o gam hu hab i junihog g pi ap ha‑chuꞌijig g Jiosh.

column2: but if people blaspheme by rejecting the Holy Spirit they can never be forgiven, because they are guilty of an eternal sin.”
column3: K wabshaba si geꞌej g em‑chuꞌijig mamtp ab wo has ah g Hekia S‑apꞌekam Gewkdag. T g Jiosh pi hekid gam hu hab wo i juh.”

column2: (Jesus said this because they said, “He has an evil spirit.”)
column3: Bash kaij g Jesus no pi hab ge ahg mash g ge Jiawul uꞌukch. Kush eda d Hekia S‑apꞌekam Gewkdag mo an uꞌukch.

column2: Then Jesus' mother and brothers arrived. They waited outside and sent him a message, asking him to come out.  The crowd that was sitting around him told him, “Your mother and brothers are outside asking for you.”
column3: Kutsh am hahawa dada g jeꞌej ch wepngaj g Jesus matsh wo nei. Sh wabshaba muꞌijj an wehgaj dadha g Jesus. Sh heg hekaj gam hu wabsh gegok jeg ed ch am chum waid. Kumsh am ahgid, “Nehꞌe, m‑jeꞌe ch m‑wepnag o am gegok jeg ed ch ab m‑waid.”

column2: “Who is my mother? Who are my brothers?” he responded.  Looking around at all those sitting there in a circle, he said, “Here is my mother! Here are my brothers!
column3: Sh g Jesus an i nenhoghi. Kush muꞌi an wehgaj dadha hegam mo ab kaiham. Kush hab kaij, “Neh, idam mo ab ni‑kaiham o heg wa wepo mo d ni‑wepnag ch ni‑jeꞌe.

column2: Whoever does what God wants, they are my brother, and sister, and mother.”
column3: Hegam mat hab wo junihid g Jiosh tatchui o hab a masma mo d ni‑wepnag ch ni‑jeꞌe.”

column2: Jesus began teaching beside the Sea again. So many people came to listen to him that he climbed into a boat and sat in it on the water while the crowd listened from the shore.
column3: Sh am hu i hebai, sh g Jesus am ep ha mihshmad ge shuhdagi hugid an. Kush shaꞌi si muꞌi hemajkam an wehgaj. Tsh heg hekaj gan hu i chesh g Jesus wahlko ch ed k an dahiwua k amjed ha mashcham. Sh hegam gan hu wabsh gegok shuhdagi hugid an.

column2: He illustrated his teachings using many stories.
column3: Kush muꞌi haꞌichu ha tashogid g wepogida ahgakaj ab amjed g Jiosh kownaltalig.

column2: “Listen,” he said. “A sower went out to sow.
column3: Id ash d haꞌichu ahgaj mo hab kaij:

column2: Now as he was scattering the seeds, some fell on the path, and birds came and ate them up.
column3: T haꞌi gan hu wabsh shul wohg ch ed. T g uꞌuwhig am dada k koꞌito.

column2: Other seeds fell on stony ground where there wasn't much earth. In the shallow soil the plants started growing quickly, but because the soil wasn't deep
column3: Kut haꞌi gan hu wabsh shul waw t ab mo pi geꞌej g jewed k ab ha hekaj hi wa chum i wuhsh no pi pi an hu juhk g jewed.

column2: they were scorched when the sun came up. Since they didn't have any real roots, they soon withered.
column3: T oi wa hekid ab i chesh g tash. T ha hekaj wabsh gaksh no ge mehk tatk.

column2: Other seeds fell among thorns. The thorns grew up and choked the sprouting seeds, so they produced nothing.
column3: T haꞌi gan hu wabsh ep shul shaꞌi ch ed. T oi wa hekid ab i geꞌege g shaꞌi k wabsh ha kokda. T pi ab hu ha kait.

column2: Other seeds fell on good soil where they sprouted and grew. They produced a harvest of some thirty, some sixty, and some a hundred times what was planted.
column3: T wabshaba hegam mat gan hu shul moihuna ch ed an i wuhshani k ab kait. Haꞌi atp hems waikko wehst‑mahm ab kait k haꞌi ep chuhdpo wehst‑mahm ab ep kait k haꞌi siant ab ep kait.

column2: If you have ears to hear, listen to what I'm saying.”
column3: Neh, am g wo i oidahim ahpim mam kah ihda.”

column2: When he was by himself, his twelve disciples and the others who were with him asked him what the illustrations meant.
column3: Neh, bash kaij g Jesus ch amjed am hahawa i e hejelkai. Kutsh ab wui i hihi g chuhchaij haꞌi ep ha wehm k ab kakke, “A tt has masma wo s‑ha amich g haꞌichu wepogida ahga?”

column2: He told them, “The mystery of God's kingdom has been given to you to understand. But outsiders only have the stories,
column3: Kush hab kaij ab ha wui, “Nt wo em‑ahgi mo has d ahga no pi g Jiosh em‑hiwgid mamt wo s‑mai hegai mo hemu am maskogid ab amjed g e‑kownaltalig. Ni wabshaba heg waꞌi ha ahgid haꞌichu wepogida ahga hegam mo pi ab hu wohochudamk.

column2: “Don't you understand this story?” Jesus asked them. “If you can't, how are you going to understand all the other stories?
column3: Kush hab ha ahg g Jesus, “Muꞌi ani haꞌichu chum em‑ahgid g haꞌichu wepogida ahgakaj. Kumki eda pi amichud. Nt hemho am wo wa em‑tashogi.

column2: The sower sows the word.
column3: “Hegai haꞌichu eshdam ani wepogid hegai mat an wo ahgachugad g Jiosh haꞌichu ahga. K g kaichkaj d Jiosh haꞌichu ahga. Id at am wo chum e ei oꞌodham amichudadag ed.

column2: The seeds on the path where the word is sown illustrate those who hear the message, but then Satan immediately comes along and takes away the word that's been sown in them.
column3: K eda haꞌi g ha‑iꞌibdag s‑kawpk hab masma mo g wohg. T g Jiawul am wabsh s‑pehegi wo ha wohppoꞌi mo haschu i kah.

column2: Likewise the seeds on the rocky ground illustrate those who hear the word, and happily accept it right away.
column3: “K haꞌi g ha‑iꞌibdag hab sha masma mo hebai pi geꞌej g jewed ab waw t ab. T idam wo si s‑hohhoꞌi Jiosh haꞌichu ahga ab kaiok k wabshaba pi wihnam ab hu wo bebhe k ch ab hi wa al heꞌes wo s‑wohochudad.

column2: But since they have no real roots, they only last for a while until trouble or persecution comes, and then they quickly fall away.
column3: T ab wabsh wo i chum hih g aꞌappema. T ha hekaj wabsh wo taꞌi i shul.

column2: Those sown among the thorns illustrate those who hear the word,
column3: “K haꞌi g ha‑iꞌibdag hab sha masma mo hebai s‑shaꞌig

column2: but worries of this world, the temptation of wealth, and other distractions choke the growth of the word, and it becomes unproductive.
column3: no pi e shaꞌijidch heg hekaj kudutadag ch s‑kaisdag ch s‑tahhadkam. Kut pi haꞌichu hab wo juh am Jiosh wehhejed.

column2: But the seeds sown on good soil illustrate those who hear the word, accept it, and are productive—producing thirty, sixty, and hundred times what was originally sown.
column3: “K haꞌi g ha‑iꞌibdag s‑moik hab masma mo g moihuna. Kut ab wo kaiha g Jiosh haꞌichu ahga k am wo si i nuhkud e‑ihbdag ed k gam hu wo i ha ahgidahi g hemajkam k haꞌakia ab wo waꞌi ep ha baꞌiha, Haꞌi atp hems waikko wehst‑mahm wo i ha baꞌiha k haꞌi chuhdpo wehst‑mahm k haꞌi siant ab ep wo i ha baꞌiha.”

column2: Who puts a lamp under a bucket, or beneath a bed?” Jesus asked them. “No, you put a lamp up on a lamp-stand.
column3: Kush hab hahawa ep kaij am ha wui, “Wohokam o wepogidas mo g lahmpa tonlig. Namt hig wo ehsto g lahmpa ab mehidk aha namt an wo dai mat hebai wo em‑tonlidch. Pegih, mt hab wa masma pi wo chum ehsto g wohokam.

column2: Everything that is hidden will be revealed, and everything that is secret will be brought out into the open.
column3: Wehs at wo s‑e mai matp haschu chum e ehstokch.

column2: If you have ears to hear, listen to what I'm saying!
column3: Am g wo i oidahim ahpim mam kah ihda.”

column2: Pay attention to what you're hearing,” he told them, “for you will be given according to how much you want to receive, measure for measure.
column3: Sh hab ep kaij am ha wui, “Am g wo s‑amichud mam haschu i kah. Mamt has i masma s‑baꞌama ab wo haꞌichu ha mah hedai i, t hab masma ab uhpam wo i e nodagi haꞌichu ab em‑wui ch atp hems gam hu baꞌich i.

column2: More will be given to those who already have understanding, but those who don't want to know will have what little understanding they have taken from them.
column3: Hegam mat s‑ap wo hekaj g e‑apꞌedag at baꞌich ep wo i nei. T hegam mat pi ap wo hekaj wabsh wo heb hu wua.”

column2: God's kingdom is like a man sowing seed in the ground,” Jesus said.
column3: Sh hab ep kaij g Jesus, “Jiosh kownaltalig o heg wepogidas matp hems g oꞌodham am gantad g haꞌichu kai e‑oid ed.

column2: “He goes to bed and gets up, day after day, but the man has no knowledge of how the seeds sprout and grow.
column3: k am haha wabsh nenida heꞌekia i tash. T g eshaj am i wuhshani k hahhagt k ab hahawa mudadagt k ab kait. K eda pi mahch g oꞌodham mo has masma hab e wua

column2: The earth produces a harvest by itself. First a shoot appears, then the heads of grain, and then the heads of grain ripen.
column3: no pi g haꞌichu kai wabsh hejel ab i wuhshani ab jewed t amjed.

column2: When the grain is ripe, the farmer reaps it with a sickle, because the harvest is ready.
column3: T am wabsh i chum bai. Kut am ha hekaj ha cheha g e‑chikpandam mat wo hihk k wo i baꞌiha.”

column2: What can we compare God's kingdom to? What illustration shall we use?” he asked.
column3: Kush hab ep kaij, “Am ant baꞌich wo i em‑tashogi g Jiosh kownaltalig am wepogidch g haꞌichu kai.

column2: “It's like a mustard seed, the tiniest seed of all.
column3: Neh, heg am eꞌesha mo al chumaj

column2: But when it's sown it grows into a plant that's larger than other plants. It has branches big enough that birds can roost in its shade.”
column3: ch oi wa am wo wuhshani k haꞌas wo i geꞌeda mo g s‑ehheg uhs. Tp hems heg ab an wo koksht g uꞌuwhig. Pegih, t hab wa masma wo geꞌe i geꞌeda g Jiosh kownaltalig, chum as al chum wo shonwua.”

column2: Jesus used many of these illustrated stories when he spoke to the people so they would understand as much as they could.
column3: Neh, bash masma heg waꞌi hekaj am ha mihshmad wepogida ahga mat heꞌes wo i s‑amich.

column2: In fact, when he spoke publicly, he only used stories; however in private he explained everything to his disciples.
column3: Tsh gam hu wo hihi g hemajkam. Kutsh am haha wabsh baꞌich wo i ha tashogi g e‑chuhchai g haꞌichu e‑ahga.

column2: Later that day, in the evening, he said to his disciples, “Let's go across to the other side of the Sea.”
column3: Tsh gam hu si i juh. Sh hab ha ahg g Jesus, “Oi g wo. Ga att hu shuhdagi aigojed wo i chehchsh.”

column2: Leaving the crowd behind, the disciples went with Jesus and got into a boat. Other boats went with them.
column3: Kutsh am i ha dagito g hemajkam k ab i chehchsh wahlko ch ed wehmaj g Jesus. Kutsh eda am haꞌi ep chum i ha oi g al wapalko.

column2: Soon a terrible storm started blowing, and waves crashed against the boat, filling it with water.
column3: Tsh ab haha wabsh i meh g s‑gewk jegos k shaꞌi si hewed. Tsh g shuhdagi shaꞌi si uhgk hab i e juh k ged hu wabsh e was wahlko ch ed.

column2: Jesus was asleep in the stern, resting his head on a cushion. The disciples woke him up, shouting at him, “Teacher, don't you care that we're about to drown?”
column3: Sh eda am woꞌok ch kohsh g Jesus si baikko g wahlko. Kutsh am wuha g chuhchaij k hab ahg, “Nap pi has shaꞌi elid mattki wo wachkk.”

column2: Jesus woke up. He told the wind to die down and told the waves, “Be quiet! Be still.” The wind stopped, and the water became completely calm.
column3: Tsh am hahawa wamig k ab si wui neo g hewel ch shuhdagi k hab ahg, “Am g wabsh i dodolimat k haꞌasa i hewed.” Kutsh ab wabsh si heweto k g shuhdagi gam hu wabsh i pi hoini.

column2: “Why are you so frightened? Haven't you learned to trust me?” he asked them.
column3: Sh hab hahawa kaij ab ha wui, “Pi g am wo haꞌichu ehbidad ch ab wabsh wo ni‑hiwgad.”

column2: They were stunned and terrified. They asked each other, “Who is this? Even the wind and the waves obey him!”
column3: Kutsh eda si s‑ehbeni k wabsh ab aꞌai i e kakke, “A kus hedai wud ihda oꞌodham mat g hewel ch shuhdagi ab kaiha.”

column2: They arrived on the other side of the lake in the region of the Gerasenes.
column3: Kutsh gam hu dada miabidch mo am d Gerasa kihhim.

column2: When Jesus got out of the boat a man with an evil spirit came from the graveyard to meet him.
column3: Tsh ab wabsh i chum hud g Jesus wahlko t amjed. Kutsh ab hema nam g cheoj mash ab e ulish cheo ch ed mash eda ab d hihaꞌini.

column2: This man lived among the tombs, and it had been impossible to tie him up any more, even with a chain.
column3: Sh g jijawul an uꞌukch ihda. Kush pi hedai e nakog mas wo mahshoch.

column2: He had often been tied up with chains and shackles, but he simply tore the chains apart and broke the shackles into pieces. No one had the strength to subdue him.
column3: Muꞌikko amsh chum wulshshap g e hukshchim wapainomikaj. Sh wabshaba wabsh wanikumiak. Sh pi hedai e nakog mas wo shohbi nash pi shaꞌi si s‑gewk.

column2: Day and night he was always shouting out among the tombs and in the hills nearby, cutting himself with sharp stones.
column3: Tash oidam ch chuhug oidam ash am ulinig hihaꞌini ch ed ch am doꞌag shahgid am hihnk ch e hikkumiak g hohodaikaj.

column2: Seeing Jesus from a distance he ran and kneeled in front of him.
column3: Tsh am jiwia g Jesus. Kutsh mehkjed chehg k am med k ab i gei wui.

column2: In a loud voice he cried out, “What have you to do with me, Jesus, Son of Almighty God? Swear by God that you won't torture me!”
column3: k am si s‑kaidam neok k hab ahg, “Ni‑dagitoni, ahpi alidaj g si Jiosh. Bani m‑ahgid ab si ihmch g Jiosh mapt pi ia hu wo ni‑hudawogad.”

column2: For Jesus had already told the evil spirit to leave the man.
column3: Bash kaij nash pi g Jesus ab i s‑wuhshdamk g jiawul id amjed oꞌodham.

column2: Then Jesus asked him, “What is your name?”
column3: Sh g Jesus ab hahawa kakke, “Shahp chehgig?”

column2: He also repeatedly pleaded with Jesus not to send them a long way away.
column3: ch ab wui si e shoꞌigchud mat pi mehk gam hu hab wo i ha juh hegam jijawul mo an uꞌukch.

column2: A large herd of pigs was feeding on the hillside nearby.
column3: Kush eda inhab shaꞌi si muꞌi kokji e nuhkud kawulk huda.

column2: The evil spirits pleaded with him, “Send us into the pigs so we can enter them.”
column3: Kutsh g jijawul ab si tahni g Jesus, “Am g hig t‑hiwgid matt am wo i wahp ha eda hegam kokji.”

column2: Jesus allowed them to do this. The evil spirits left the man and went into the pigs. The whole herd, about two thousand, rushed down the steep cliff into the sea and drowned.
column3: Kutsh ha hiwigi. Kutsh ab i wuwha heg amjed oꞌodham k gam hu hihim k am i wahp ha eda hegam kokji. Kutsh idam am e totodsid k am agshp i wohp k ged hu shul ge shuhdagi ch ed k wachkk k ash eda am hu d i gohk mihl.

column2: The pig-keepers ran away, and spread the news all over town and in the countryside. People came out to see what had happened.
column3: Hegam mash am chum ha nuhkud atsh e totodsid k wohp k gan hu wehsko ha ahgid mat has e juh. Kutsh am himto g hemajkam s‑neidamk matsh haschu has e juh

column2: When they found Jesus they saw the man who had been demon-possessed sitting there, dressed, and in his right mind—the one who had the legion of evil spirits—and they became frightened!
column3: k am hu dada. Kush am dak ch e enigadadch ch ash wabsh s‑apꞌe. Kutsh wehsijj si e totods.

column2: Then those who had seen what had happened to the man who had been demon-possessed and the pigs told the others.
column3: Hegam mash am neid atsh an i ha ahgidahi mat has e juh hegai mo g jijawul an uꞌukch k am ep ha ahgi mat has e juh g kokji.

column2: They began pleading with Jesus to leave their district.
column3: Kutsh ab wabsh si s‑bahbagi i ahgi g Jesus g hemajkam, “Mapt gam hig wo i e mehkod ab t‑amjed.”

column2: As Jesus climbed into the boat, the man who had been demon-possessed begged to go with him.
column3: Kush g Jesus an cheshajhim wahlko ch ed. Tsh ihda oꞌodham mash g jijawul uꞌukch ab chum ahgi, “Nt wo m‑oi.”

column2: But Jesus refused, telling him, “Go home to your own people, and tell them how much the Lord has done for you and how he has been merciful to you.”
column3: Kutsh oi wa pi hiwgid k ash hab wabsh ahg, “Pt wabsh wo wa hih am e‑kih wui k wo ha ahgi g e‑nanꞌaipijju mat haschu si s‑kehg hab m‑juni g Jiosh.”

column2: So the man went on his way and began to tell the people of the Ten Cities everything Jesus had done for him, and everyone was amazed.
column3: Kutsh gam hu hih ihda oꞌodham k gan hu ha ahgidahi g hemajkam amai mash am d Wehst‑mahm Kihhim matsh heꞌes geꞌe haꞌichu hab juni g Jesus. Kutsh wehsijj ab si has i e taht hegam mash kah.

column2: Jesus went back again by boat to the other side of the lake where a large crowd gathered around him at the shore.
column3: Kutsh an ep dadhaiwua idam Jesus wahlko ch ed k gn hu aigo i chehchsh.

column2: A synagogue leader, a man named Jairus, came to him. When he saw Jesus, he fell at his feet
column3: Tsh ab hema i hih g oꞌodham k d haꞌichu amai ha‑cheopi ed ch hab chehgig Jairus. Tsh ab i hud g Jesus. Kutsh ab wui i gehsh

column2: and pleaded with him, saying, “My little daughter is about to die. Please come and place your hands on her so she may be healed and live.”
column3: k hab kaij, “Si g s‑ni‑hoꞌigeꞌid. Ni‑chehiaga o muhkhim. Pt am wo him k wo doaj.”

column2: So Jesus went with him. Everybody followed, crowding and jostling him.
column3: Kutsh am i chum hih matsh wo oi ihda oꞌodham.

column2: A woman was there who had been ill from bleeding for twelve years.
column3: Sh eda am hema haꞌichug g uwi ch mumku gamai gohk aꞌahidagkaj. Sh heg wehs oidam g ehꞌedaj chum hekid jegwoni.

column2: She'd suffered considerably under the care of many doctors, and had spent all she had. But nothing helped her—in fact she'd grown worse.
column3: Kush muꞌi haꞌichu nakog ab ha amjed g mamakai ch wabshaba wabsh baꞌich i mumku. Kutsh g lialigaj huhug.

column2: She had heard about Jesus, so she came up behind him through the crowd, and touched his cloak.
column3: Sh am hahawa i kah mash haschu has junihim g Jesus. Kutsh am s‑apkot matsh am wo jiwia wui. Kutsh ab oidk i him k an taht g wehschugaj

column2: She was telling herself, “If I can just touch his cloak, I'll be healed.”
column3: hab e ahgch, “Chum anis hems an wabsh wo taht g wehschugaj, t wo ni‑apꞌet.”

column2: The bleeding stopped immediately, and she felt her body healed from her disease.
column3: Tsh ha hekaj am wabsh si huh g ehꞌedaj. Tsh e taht mat apꞌet.

column2: Jesus, sensing at once that power had gone out from him, turned around in the crowd and asked, “Who touched my cloak?”
column3: Kutsh g Jesus taht matsh g doajig gewkdag sha wuhsh ab ab k am ha hekaj i sikoliwua hemajkam ha wui k hab kaij, “Doht an ni‑taht?”

column2: “Look at the crowd jostling you. What do you mean, ‘Who touched me?’ ” the disciples replied.
column3: Kush hema hab kaij g chuhchaij, “An o si i t‑bihagch g hemajkam. Kup haschu ahgch hab kaij, Doht an ni‑taht?”

column2: But Jesus went on looking around to see who had done it.
column3: Kutsh an i nenhoghim k ab i nei hegai uwi matsh an taht.

column2: The woman, realizing what had happened to her, came and fell down before him, and told him the whole truth.
column3: Kutsh heg si e todsid k ab wui i gehsh k am ahgi mat doa.

column2: “My daughter, your trust in me has healed you. Go in peace. You have been completely cured of your disease,” Jesus told her.
column3: Sh hab kaij g Jesus, “Pegih, ni‑uwiga, am apt wa doa nap pi ab si ni‑hiwig. Gam g s‑ap e‑taht k hihm k am wabsh s‑doakad.”

column2: While he was still speaking some people came from the home of the synagogue leader. “Your daughter is dead,” they said. “You don't need to bother the Teacher any longer.”
column3: Kush am wabsh kia neok. Tsh am haꞌi dada ab kihj amjed hegai Jairus k hab kaij, “Muh at g m‑chehiaga. Kupt haschu hig ahgk am baꞌich wo i kudu g ha mashchamdam?”

column2: But Jesus paid no attention to what they said. He told the synagogue leader, “Don't be afraid, just trust in me.
column3: Kush wabshaba hab kaij g Jesus ab Jairus wui, “Pi g am shaꞌi has e tahtkkad ch am wabsh i ni‑hiwgad.”

column2: He wouldn't let anyone go with him except Peter, James, and James' brother John.
column3: Bash kaij ch am hahawa ha ui g Peter ch James ch John k am i oi.

column2: When they arrived at the synagogue leader's house, Jesus saw all the commotion, with people crying and wailing.
column3: Kutsh am hihim k ged hu dada mash am kih g Jairus. Kush am wabsh si s‑nakosigam hab e wua no pi si shoani g hemajkam.

column2: He went in and asked them, “Why are you making such a commotion with all this crying? The little girl isn't dead, she's just sleeping.”
column3: Kutsh am i wah g Jesus kih ch ed k hab kaij ab ha wui, “Pi g am wo shoanid. Heg o wa wepo ni‑wehhejed mo wabsh kohsh g chehia.”

column2: They laughed scornfully at him.
column3: Kush wehsijj si s‑koꞌokam ash nash pi s‑mahch matsh heki hu muh. Kutsh gam hu i ha wuhwhasid k am i ha ui hegam mash am wehmaj k am i wahp amai mash am woꞌo g muhki. Tsh g jehjij am ep i ha oi.

column2: Taking the little girl's hand he said, “Talitha koum,” which means, “Little girl, get up!”
column3: Tsh g Jesus ab bei nowij ab k hab kaij, “I wamigi, chehia.”

column2: The little girl, who was twelve years old, got up immediately and began walking around. They were completely astonished at what had happened.
column3: Kutsh ab ha hekaj i wami g chehia k ab i hih. Kutsh si has i e taht g hemajkam.

column2: He gave them strict instructions not to let anyone know, and he told them to give the little girl something to eat.
column3: Sh hab kaij g Jesus, “Ab g wabsh mahki g chehia g haꞌichu hugi.” Kutsh ab mah. Sh hab ep ha ahg mat pi hedai wo shaꞌi ahgi mat has e juh. Kush d gamai gohk aꞌahidag ihda chehia.

column2: Jesus left and went home to Nazareth with his disciples.
column3: Tsh gam hu hahawa hihi idam Jesus k ged hu dada Nazareth t am mash am d si kihkam g Jesus.

column2: On Sabbath he began teaching in the synagogue, and many of those who were listening were surprised.
column3: Kush am d i t‑mihshmda tash. Tsh am ep ha mihshmad g Jesus ha‑cheopi ed. Kush muꞌi hemajkam am haꞌichug ch am kah ch si has i e tahtam k ab aꞌai si e kakke, “Kus hebai mai wehs ihda amichudadag k has masma hab wua ihda s‑hasig haꞌichu?

column2: Isn't this the carpenter, Mary's son—the brother of James, Joseph, Judas and Simon? Don't his sisters live here among us?” They were offended and rejected him.
column3: No hig pi woho d wabsh hegai huk chikpandam mo d madaj g Mary ch d ha‑wehnag g James ch Joses ch Judas k ch Simon? No hig pi woho g uꞌuwi wepngaj ia kih?” Neh, bash kaij ch wabsh pi haꞌichuchud.

column2: “A prophet is treated with respect except in his home town, among his relatives, and within his own family,” Jesus told them.
column3: Sh g Jesus si has i e tahtk ch hab kaij, “Jiosh haꞌichu i tashogiddam at chum hebai ab si has wo e elidad. T wabshaba g si kihꞌamkam oꞌodham ch wehmaj kihkam pi ab hu has wo elidad”

column2: The result was that Jesus could not do any miracles there, except to heal a few sick people.
column3: Kutsh heg hekaj pi e nako mas g si s‑hasig haꞌichu hab wo junihid amai ch heg hab waꞌi juh mat al heꞌekia kokꞌodam ha dodaj.

column2: He was amazed at their lack of trust.
column3: Kutsh am hahawa i ha mihshmdahi g Jesus an wehgaj g Nazareth mo hebai i kihhimag.

column2: He called together the twelve disciples, and began sending them out two by two, giving them authority over evil spirits.
column3: Am hu hebai, tsh am ha cheha g e‑chuhchai matsh goꞌogok e wehm am wo ha mihshmdahi g hemajkam k gam hu hab wo i ha juh g jijawul ab ha amjed hegam mo an ha uꞌukch.

column2: He told them not to take anything with them except a walking stick—no bread, no bag, and no money in their belts.
column3: Neh, bash ha ahg, “Gm amt hu wabsh wo i hihim k heg waꞌi e‑cheowikud wo uꞌad ch pi wo bek g e‑limoshan kostal o g lial o g haꞌichu hugi o g haꞌichu eniga.

column2: They could wear sandals, but they were not to take an extra shirt.
column3: Mt ab wo i em‑wahpkid k wo em‑dagioꞌidad mamt hebai wo i ha mihshmad.

column2: “When you're invited into a home, stay there until you leave,” he told them.
column3: Kumt amokad k ab wo ai mamt baꞌich ep wo hihi.

column2: “If you're not welcomed and not listened to, then shake the dust from your feet as you leave as a sign you have given up on them.
column3: Mt gam hu wabsh wo hihi mamt hebai pi ap ab hu wo i em‑nei gam hu shahmudk g e‑shuhshk. T id wo ha chehgi mamt wabsh wo ha dagito nat pi pi ap hab chuꞌi. Dohwai.”

column2: So they went around telling people to repent.
column3: Kutsh wa woho an aꞌai i ha ahgidahi g hemajkam matsh gam hu wo s‑ohhod g pi ap e‑chegitoi.

column2: They drove out many demons, and healed many who were sick by anointing them with oil.
column3: Kutsh ab iawua g huhudakud ha‑mohmi ab g kokꞌodam. Kutsh doda. Tsh muꞌi gam hu hab ep i ha juh g jijawul ab ha amjed hegam mo an ha uꞌukch.

column2: King Herod got to hear about Jesus since he had become well-known. Some said, “This is John the Baptist risen from the dead. That's why he has such miraculous powers.”  Others said, “It's Elijah.” Still others said, “He's a prophet, like one of the prophets of the past.”
column3: An o wa wehsko hab kaidag mash has e junihim g Jesus. Kum am chum aꞌaga mas hedai wud. Haꞌi o hab kaij matp hems d Elijabad o hema ehp hegam kekelibad Jiosh haꞌichu i tashogiddam. K haꞌi hab ep kaij matp hems d hegai Johnbad mat wa am i shonwuich g pahl wakona. E atsh wa muꞌajid k atp hems uhpam e chegito k hab s‑hasig haꞌichu hab junihim.

column2: But when Herod heard about it, he said, “It's John, the one I beheaded! He's come back from the dead!”
column3: Sh hegai Herod mo am d wa kownal Galilee chekshani ch ed hab ep kaij, “Doki hegai John mo wa ha pahl wapkonahim. Heg ant mua. Kutki wabshaba uhpam e chegito k hekaj hab e nakog mat hab wo juh g s‑hasig haꞌichu.”

column2: For Herod had given orders to arrest and imprison John because of Herodias, his brother Philip's wife, whom Herod had married.  John had been saying to Herod, “It's against the law to marry your brother's wife.”  So Herodias had a grudge against John and wanted him killed. But she wasn't able to arrange it  because Herod knew John was a holy man who did what was right. Herod protected John and though what John said was very disturbing to him, he was still happy to hear what he had to say.
column3: Ihda Herod atsh wa heg hab juh am wehhejed g e‑hohnig. Heg ash hab chehgig Herodias ch ash d chum hohnigaj g Herod wehnag. Kush heg hab chechgig Philip. Tsh g Herod ehs g hohnigaj.

column2: Herodias had her opportunity on Herod's birthday. He gave a banquet for the nobles, military officers, and important leaders of Galilee.
column3: Sh g Herodias am wabsh nenida mat am wo s‑apꞌet. Kutsh am hu hebai s‑apkot wehhejed matsh e ai g Herod mahsidag tash. Kutsh g Herod ab i ha wai g e‑shondalig ha‑geꞌegeꞌejig ch hegam mo d si hahaꞌichu am Galilee ch ed. Tsh ab i hihim k am wehmaj piast.

column2: Herodias' daughter came in and danced for them. Herod and those eating with him were delighted at her performance, so he told the girl,
column3: Tsh am i wah g uwi madaj g Herodias k am e waila. Kush wehsijj s‑hohhoꞌid. Sh g Herod hab ahg, “Maptp haschu hab wo i elidad ch ab wo i ni‑tai, nt hab wo m‑juni.” Sh pi has shaꞌi kaij ihda uwi.

column2: “Ask me for whatever you like, and I'll give it to you.” He confirmed his promise with an oath, “I'll give you up to half my kingdom.”
column3: Kush hab hahawa ep si kaij, “Maptp haschu ab wo i ni‑tai, nt wo m‑mah, chum as hems eda hugkam g ni‑kownaltalig.”

column2: She went out and asked her mother, “What should I ask for?”
column3: Kutsh am hahawa him k am kakke g e‑jeꞌe, “Shahchu ant wo tai?”

column2: The girl hurried back in and said to the king, “I want you to give me right now the head of John the Baptist on a plate.”
column3: Tsh ab uhpam i wah k hab ahg g Herod, “John moꞌo apt wo ni‑mah am hoas‑haꞌa ch ed dahshk”

column2: The king was very upset, but because of the oaths he'd made in front of his guests, he didn't want to refuse her.
column3: Kutsh si pi ap e taht g Herod. Sh wabshaba wehsijj kah mo has i kaij. Tsh heg hekaj pi e nako mas pi am hu hab wo juh,

column2: So he immediately sent an executioner to bring him John's head. After beheading him in the prison,
column3: neh, k am hema cheha g shondal mat am wo him k an wo shonchk g John moꞌo k ab wo i bek.

column2: the executioner brought John's head on a plate and gave it to the girl, and the young girl handed it to her mother.
column3: k am uꞌapa g moꞌoj ab hoas‑haꞌa t ab k ab mah g uwi. Tsh g uwi am him k ab mah g e‑jeꞌe.

column2: When John's disciples heard what had happened they came and took his body and placed it in a tomb.
column3: Kutsh am i kah hegam mo ab si wecho e mashcham g John matsh e muhkid k am hihim k am bei g honaj mat wo s‑ap juh.

column2: The apostles returned and gathered around Jesus. They told him all they had done and what they had taught.
column3: Tsh am i uhpam dada g Jesus chuhchai k am wehs ahgid mat haschu has i juh k haschu ep ha mashcham.

column2: “Come with me, just yourselves. We'll go to a quiet place, and rest for a while,” Jesus told them, because there was so much coming and going that they didn't even have time to eat.
column3: Sh eda iaꞌi idani muꞌi am daiw g hemajkam. Tsh pi am hu shaꞌi ha apkot mas wo e gegos idam Jesus. Sh hab ha ahg g Jesus, “Am att hig wo t‑hejelkod k wo shaꞌi t‑uhꞌulinihogi.”

column2: So they went by boat to a quiet place to be alone.
column3: Kutsh gam hu hejelko hihi g wahlkokaj.

column2: But people saw them leaving and recognized them. So people from all the surrounding towns ran ahead and got there before them.
column3: Muꞌijj ash ha neid mat gam hu hihi ch gam hu ha baꞌich wohp k gam hu heki hu dada. Kutsh idam am hahawa i dada

column2: When Jesus got off the boat he saw a huge crowd, and he felt pity for them, because they were like sheep without a shepherd. So he began to teach them about many things.
column3: k am i huhud. Tsh g Jesus am i ha nei. Kush hab sha masma mo g heb hu hihimkam kakawal. Kutsh ab si i s‑ha hoꞌigeꞌid k muꞌi haꞌichu ha mashcha.

column2: It was getting late in the day and Jesus' disciples came to him. They told him, “We're miles from anywhere, and it's really late.
column3: Kutsh gam hu si i juh. Tsh g Jesus chuhchai am wui dada k hab chum ahg, “Neh, mehk at waꞌi juh. K eda ia hu wabsh si jegko.

column2: You should tell the people to go and buy themselves something to eat in the villages and countryside nearby.”
column3: Am g ha ahgid g hemajkam mat gam hu wo hihi kihhim wui k wo ha nolawt hegai mat wo huh”

column2: But Jesus replied, “You give them something to eat.”
column3: Kush hab ha ahg, “Ahpim amt wo haꞌichu ha mah mat wo huh.”

column2: “Well, how much bread do you have?” Jesus asked. “Go and see.”
column3: Sh ab ha kakke, “Shahchu o am i kahch? Am g wo neid.”

column2: Jesus told everyone to sit down in groups on the green grass.
column3: Kush hab ha ahg mat wo ha ahgi g hemajkam mat wehsijj am wo dadhaiwua jewedo heꞌekiajj i e wehm.

column2: They sat in groups of hundreds and fifties.
column3: Tsh am ha cheha. Kutsh am dadhaiwua heꞌekiajj i e wehm, haꞌi am hu i siant k ch haꞌi am hu i hehetaspo wepst‑mahm.

column2: Then he took the five loaves and the two fish. Looking up to heaven he blessed the food and broke the bread into pieces. Then he handed the bread to the disciples to give to the people, and he divided the fish up between all of them.
column3: Kutsh g Jesus am ui hegai haꞌichu hugi k am e dahm i nen k ab hoꞌigeꞌel g Jiosh k am hahawa hahai hegai sismito k ab ha mah g e‑chuhchai. Tsh an i ha mahkhi g hemajkam. Kutsh g waptopi an ep i hahain k ha mah. Tsh an i ha mahkhi.

column2: Everyone ate until they were full.
column3: Tsh wehsijj hug k oi wa hi si s‑kokwod.

column2: Then they collected up the leftovers of the bread and fish—twelve basketfuls.
column3: Kutsh g chuhchaij an i uꞌihim k uꞌapa g wihpiꞌidaj mat am huꞌi gamai gohk hoha wo ha shuhshud.

column2: A total of five thousand men plus their families ate the food.
column3: Kush am hu d i hetasp mihl chechoj ch muꞌijj g uꞌuwi ch aꞌal hegam matsh am e gegos.

column2: Immediately after this Jesus instructed his disciples to get back into the boat. They were to go on ahead to Bethsaida on the other side of the lake while he sent the people on their way.
column3: Tsh am hahawa ha ahgi g e‑chuhchai matsh gam hu aigo wo hihi heg wui kihhim mo hab chehgig Bethsaida. Tsh heg am wo wiꞌi k am wo ha ahgi g hemajkam mat gam hu wo hihi e‑kihki wui. Tsh heg hekaj an i chehchsh wahlko ch ed k gam hu hihi.

column2: Once he'd said goodbye to them he went up into the hills to pray.
column3: Tsh g Jesus am ha dagito g hemajkam. Tsh gam hu himto. Tsh am hahawa hejel i chesh kawulk dahm k am e hoꞌigeꞌidahun.

column2: Late that evening the boat was in the middle of the lake while Jesus was alone, still on land.
column3: Tsh am i hud. Sh am wabsh kia hejel haꞌichug. Tsh g wahlko gam hu si eda i cheka g shuhdagi.

column2: He could see them being buffeted about as they rowed hard because the wind was blowing against them. In the early morning hours Jesus came to them, walking on the water. He would have passed them,
column3: Kush g hewel ab si s‑gewkam med ha wui. Sh hekaj pi ap him. Kush s‑ap ha neid g Jesus mash shaꞌi si s‑wihnam himchud g wahlko.

column2: but when they saw him walking on the water they thought he was a ghost. They screamed out
column3: Tsh wabshaba am i nei s‑chuhugam k ed k am si hihnk nash pi si s‑ehbini hab e ahgch mash d wabsh kokꞌoi.

column2: because they could all see him and were absolutely terrified.
column3: Kush hab ha ah, “Pi g wo shaꞌi ni‑ehbenid. Dani ahni. Mt oi wo s‑ap e taht,”

column2: He went over to them and climbed into the boat, and the wind died down. They were totally shocked,
column3: k gan hu hahawa i chesh wahlko ch ed. Kutsh am wabsh si heweto. Tsh idam si has i el

column2: for they hadn't understood the meaning of the feeding miracle due to their stubborn, hard-hearted attitude.
column3: nash ge shaꞌi amichud mokis haꞌas edgid gewkdag. K eda d si s‑hasig haꞌichu mat ha gegos hegam muꞌi hemajkam.

column2: After crossing the Sea they arrived at Gennesaret and moored the boat.
column3: Kutsh ga hu aigo i chehchsh k ab dada amai mo am d Gennesaret k am wulsh g wahlko.

column2: As they climbed out, the people immediately recognized Jesus.
column3: Tsh g hemajkam ha hekaj s‑amich g Jesus

column2: They ran everywhere around the whole area to bring in all the sick on their mats to where they'd heard Jesus was.
column3: k gan hu aꞌai wohp k an i ha uꞌihi g kokꞌodam an ha‑wohpikud ab k ged hu ha uꞌapa Jesus wui.

column2: Wherever he went, in the villages, in the towns, or in the countryside, they put the sick in the marketplaces and begged Jesus to let the sick touch just the edge of his clothes. Everyone who touched him was healed.
column3: Kush an oiopo hegam Jesus ch am daiw kihhim ch ed ch oidag ch ed. Kutsh g hemajkam ab wui wo ha uꞌapad g kokꞌodam ch ab wo ahgidad g Jesus mat wo ha hiwigi g kokꞌodam mat chum hems wabsh g hugidaj g enigaj an wo taht. Kush wehsijj doda an tahtamk.

column2: The Pharisees and religious leaders who had come down from Jerusalem to meet Jesus
column3: Kutsh ab haꞌi hihi g Palasi ch chehanig ha mashchamdam k am e hemapai an ha wehgaj hegam Jesus. Tsh eda wo chum e gegos.

column2: noticed that some of his disciples ate with “unclean” (meaning unwashed) hands.
column3: Kutsh idam am cheh matsh am haꞌi wabsh dadhaiwua pi hab masma ha wapkonk g e‑nohnhoi mo hab masma d ha‑himdag g kekelibad.

column2: (The Pharisees and all Jews don't eat until they wash their hands, following the tradition of their ancestors.
column3: Ahchim Tutuligo ach muꞌi haꞌichu hab masma hab chum wua mo wa g t‑kekelibadga. K idam Palasi wehs t‑baꞌich i s‑gewkam oid g ha‑chehanig ch pi haꞌichu wo huh pi hab masma ha wapkonk g e‑nohnhoi mash wa g kekelibad.

column2: In the same way, they don't eat when they return from the market until they have had a wash. They observe many other rituals, like the washing of cups, pots, and pans).
column3: Kut g haꞌichu hugi hab waꞌap wo si e wapko mamt hekid ab wo i ui tianna t amjed. T g hohas‑hahaꞌa ch hihidodakud ch chum hems g wohpikud hab masma wo e wapko mash wa g kekelibad hab wua.

column2: So the Pharisees and religious leaders asked Jesus, “Why don't your disciples follow the tradition of our ancestors? They eat food with unclean hands.”
column3: Kush heg hekaj idam Palasi ch chehanig ha mashchamdam ab kakke g Jesus, “K haschu ahgch pi ab hu wohog elid g haꞌichu ha‑mashchamadag g kekelibad idam mo ab si m‑wecho e mashcham? Neh, e o gegosid pi am hu t‑himdag oidch ha wapkonk g e‑nohnhoi.”

column2: Jesus replied, “Isaiah was right about you hypocrites when he said, ‘These people claim they honor me, but in their thinking they are far from me.  There's no point in their worship of me, for what they teach as doctrines are merely human rules.’ You disregard God's law, and instead you carefully observe human traditions,” he told them.
column3: (8) Kush hab kaij g Jesus, “Kum ahpim haschu ahgch im hu hab wabsh wua g Jiosh chehanig ch im hu haꞌab ab s‑wohochud g ha‑chehanig hegam mo d kekelibad ch d wabsh oꞌodham? (6) Isaiabad oki si s‑ap hab em‑ahg ahpim mam hab wabsh s‑e junimk mat eda an oꞌoha mash hab kaij g Jiosh:

column2: “How cleverly you set aside God's law so you can support your traditions!
column3: K hab ep kaij g Jesus, “Si am s‑e mahch mamt has masma im hu hab wabsh wo i juh g Jiosh chehanig ch am wo wa hekajid mo haschu d hejel em‑mashchamig.

column2: Moses said, ‘Honor your father and mother,’ and ‘Whoever curses their father or mother should die.’
column3: Mosesbad at an oꞌoha mo hab kaij g Jiosh:

column2: Jesus called the crowd to him again and told them, “Please, everyone listen to me and understand.  It's not what's on the outside and goes into you that makes you unclean. It's what comes out that makes you unclean.”
column3: Kutsh am hahawa ep ha wai g hemajkam k hab kaij am ha wui, “Ab g wo i ni‑kaiham wehsijj ahpim k wo s‑amich ihda. (15) Pi at im hu hab wo shaꞌi em‑juh g Jiosh heg hekaj mamt haschu wo huh k wabshaba im hu hab wo i em‑juh heg hekaj pi kehg em‑chegitoidag.”

column2: Then Jesus went inside to escape the crowd, and his disciples asked him about his illustration.
column3: Tsh am i ha dagito g hemajkam k im hu wah kih ch ed. Kumsh ab hahawa kakke id amjed.

column2: “Don't you understand it either?” he asked them. “Don't you see that what you eat doesn't make you unclean?
column3: Sh hab kaij, “Pegih, kumtp ahpim hab waꞌap pi amichud. Pi at im hu hab wo shaꞌi i em‑juh ab amjed g Jiosh mamt haschu wo huh

column2: It doesn't go into your mind, but into your stomach, and then passes out of the body. So all foods are ceremonially ‘clean.’
column3: nat ge am hu wo i wah em‑chegitoi ed k wabshaba ged hu em‑wohk ed wo wah k amjed gam hu wabsh wo wuhsh.”

column2: It's what comes out of you that makes you unclean.
column3: k hab ep kaij, “Heg at im hu hab wabsh wo i em‑juh ab amjed g Jiosh pi ap em‑chegitoi

column2: It's from the inside, from people's minds, that evil thoughts come: sexual immorality, theft, murder, adultery,
column3: nat pi hab wo em‑juh mamt hab wo juh g haꞌichu pi apꞌekam. Neh, mtp hems hema haꞌichu wo ehs o wo ha mua

column2: greed, malice, deceit, indecency, envy, slander, pride, thoughtlessness—
column3: o wo ha ehs g ha‑wehm kihkam o wo tatchua g haꞌichu ha‑eniga o wo s‑chu iattomk o hab wo juh mat haschu si pi kehg hab wo mahsk o wo s‑chu hehgamk o hema wabsh wo s‑koꞌokam has ahgad o wo chum si e haschudad o wabsh pehegi has wo e wuad.

column2: all these evils come from inside and defile people.”
column3: Id at wehs ab wo i wuhsh ab amjed g pi kehg chegitoidaj g oꞌodham k im hu hab wabsh wo i juh ab amjed g Jiosh.”

column2: Then Jesus left and went to the region of Tyre. He didn't want anyone to know he was staying in a house there, but he couldn't keep it a secret.
column3: Kutsh gam hu hahawa hihi hegam Jesus k am dadhaiwua hema kih am mash am miabidch g Tyre kihhim matsh wo shaꞌi e hejelkoch. Kush eda an wa s‑nenꞌoid g hemajkam ch ha hekai s‑mai mo am daha g Jesus.

column2: As soon as a woman, whose little daughter had an evil spirit, heard about him she came and fell at his feet.  The woman was Greek, born in Syrophoenicia. She begged Jesus to drive out the demon from her daughter.
column3: Kutsh am hema jiwia g uwi mash am kih heg eda jewed ch d gawul mahs oꞌodham ch gam hu d mahsikam Syria jewed ch ed. Sh g neꞌokij d Greek. Kush g jiawul an uꞌukch g chehiagaj. Tsh heg hekaj ab i hih g uwi k ab wui i gei g Jesus k ab si tahni mat gam hu hab wo i juh g jiawul ab amjed g chehia.

column2: “First let the children eat until they're full,” Jesus replied. “It's not right to take the children's food and throw it to the dogs.”
column3: Sh wabshaba hab kaij g Jesus, “Heg at wo wa wepok mamt ab wo ha mah g gogogs g ha‑chechmait g aꞌal. Wehpeg ant am wo i apꞌech g pi ha‑apꞌedag g Tutuligo hemajkam no pi d chum Jiosh aꞌaliga.”

column2: “True, sir,” she said, “but even the dogs under the table eat the scraps the children leave.”
column3: Kush hab kaij ihda uwi, “Woho o wa. T wabshaba chum hems g gogogs am wo wa huh g aꞌal ha‑haꞌichu hugi hahainig mat ab wo i shul mihsa wecho. Kunt ahni hab wa masma wo si s‑ap ni‑taht mapt id am hab wo al i ni‑juni.”

column2: Jesus told her, “For such an answer you may go—the demon has left your daughter.”
column3: Sh hab hahawa kaij g Jesus ab wui, “M‑neꞌoki o am chehgid map ab si ni‑hiwig. Nt heg hekaj gam hu hab wo i juh g jiawul ab amjed g m‑chehiaga.”

column2: She went home and found the child lying on the bed, the demon gone.
column3: Kutsh gam hu hih uhpam k s‑mai matki gam hu hab i e juh g jiawul ab amjed g chehiagaj. Kush an wabsh s‑ap woꞌo.

column2: Leaving the region of Tyre, Jesus passed through Sidon and then on to the Sea of Galilee and the territory of the Ten Cities.
column3: Kutsh gam hu hahawa hihi hegam Jesus k am gahi wuwha g Sidon kihhim ch Wehst‑mahm Kihhim chekshani k gam hu dada Galilee kahchki am.

column2: There they brought him a deaf man who also could not speak properly. They asked Jesus to touch the man with his hand and heal him.
column3: Kutsh am haꞌi dada g hemajkam k am hema uꞌapa g oꞌodham mash pi chekaidag ch ep pi ap neok k ab i tahni g Jesus mat ab wo taht k wo doaj.

column2: After Jesus took him aside from the crowd, Jesus put his fingers in the deaf man's ears. Then he touched the man's tongue with spit.
column3: Kutsh imhab shaꞌi wuhshad hejelko k am i wahpki g al chuꞌuchum e‑nohnhoi am nahnkaj ed k am hahawa shaꞌi wadagi g e‑nowi g e‑siswuadagkaj k ab hekaj taht g nehnij

column2: Jesus looked up to heaven and with a sigh he said, “Ephphatha,” which means, “Open!”
column3: k am i neh e dahm k si i ihbhuiwua k hab kaij, “Doajini.”

column2: The man's ears were opened, his speech impediment was gone, and he began speaking properly.
column3: Tsh hahawa chekaid. Tsh g nehnij apꞌet matsh s‑ap neo.

column2: Jesus gave strict orders not to tell anyone, but the more he said this, the more they spread the news.
column3: Kutsh g Jesus am hahawa wehs ha ahgi mat pi hedai wo shaꞌi ahgi ihda. Sh oi wa haha wabsh wehsko ahg

column2: They were totally amazed and said, “Everything he does is marvelous. He even makes the deaf hear, and the dumb speak.”
column3: nash pi si geꞌe has elid ch hab kaij, “Shoꞌo waꞌi si s‑kehg haꞌichu hab junihim mo g pi chechkaidkam ha chechkaichud ch pi neneokdam s‑ap ha neokchud.”

column2: Around this time there was another large crowd that had nothing to eat. Jesus called the disciples together and told them,
column3: Kush pi shaꞌi tash amjed. Tsh muꞌi am ep i e hemapai g hemajkam k ab kaiham g Jesus waik tashkaj. Sh hahawa pi an hu haꞌichug mas haschu wo huh. Tsh g Jesus am i ha wai g e‑chuhchai k hah ha ahg,

column2: “My heart goes out to the crowd because they have already stayed with me for three days and they have nothing to eat.
column3: “Neh, waik tashkaj o in waꞌi t‑wehmaj idam hemajkam ch heki hu waꞌi pi haꞌichu huh. Ni s‑ha hoꞌigeꞌid.

column2: If I send them home without food, they'll faint on the way. Some have come from a long way away.”
column3: Tp hems haꞌijj wo s‑e chuhugi matp gam hu wo sha hihi pi haꞌichu hugok.”

column2: “Where could anybody find enough bread to feed them here in this wilderness?” answered his disciples.
column3: Sh hegam ab i kakke, “Kuchs hebai hig wo ui g haꞌichu hugi mat wehs wo ha aꞌahe idam?”

column2: “How many loaves do you have?” he asked.
column3: Sh ab ep ha kakke, “Heꞌekia at am i wih g sismito?”

column2: He told the crowd to sit down on the ground. Then he took the seven loaves of bread, and gave thanks. He broke the bread and handed the pieces to his disciples to give to the crowd.
column3: Jesus atsh am hahawa ha ahgi g hemajkam mat am wo dadhaiwua. Kush am dadhaiwua. Tsh am ui g sismito k ab hoꞌigeꞌel g Jiosh k am hahawa hahain k ha mah g e‑chuhchai. Kutsh an i ha mahkhi g hemajkam.

column2: They had a few fish as well, so having blessed them, he said, “Take these and share them too.”
column3: Kumsh am hi wa haꞌi al toꞌakch g waptopi. Kutsh ab ep hoꞌigeꞌel g Jiosh k am ha ahgi mat an ep wo i ha mahkhi. Tsh hab e juh.

column2: They ate until they were full, and then collected up seven baskets of leftovers.
column3: Tsh wehsijj hug k oi wa hi si s‑kokwod, chum as am hu hebai d i giꞌik mihl chechoj ch muꞌijj g uꞌuwi ch aꞌal.

column2: There were four thousand people there. After sending them on their way,
column3: Tsh g Jesus chuhchai an i uꞌihi g wihpiꞌidaj mat am huꞌi wewaꞌak hoha wo ha shuhshud.

column2: Jesus climbed into a boat with his disciples and went to the region of Dalmanutha.
column3: Tsh idam Jesus am ha hekaj i chehchsh wahlko ch ed k gam hu hihi mash am Dalmanutha chekshani k am i huhud.

column2: The Pharisees arrived and began to argue with him, wanting him to give them a miraculous sign from heaven, trying to get him to prove himself.
column3: Kutsh am haꞌi dada g Palasi k ab neꞌowin g Jesus ch ab chum si chehani mat g si s‑hasig haꞌichu am wo ha chehgi matp woho d Jiosh si Kehsha.

column2: Jesus sighed deeply, and asked, “Why do you people want a sign? I tell you the truth: I will not give you a sign.”
column3: Kutsh g Jesus am si ihbuiwua k hab kaij, “Kus haschu ahgch ab ni‑kakke idam hemajkam mant g si s‑hasig haꞌichu am wo ha chehgi. Si ant s‑wohom hab wo chei mant pi am hu wo shaꞌi ha chehgi g si s‑hasig haꞌichu.”

column2: So he left them behind, climbed into the boat, and went back across the lake.
column3: Neh bash kaij ch am hahawa ha dagito. Kutsh an ep i chehchsh wahlko ch ed k gam hu aigo ep hihi.

column2: But the disciples had forgotten to bring bread with them. All they had in the boat was one loaf.
column3: Tsh eda pi chegito idam mat wo ui g sismito. Kush hemako am kahch.

column2: “Watch out—beware of the yeast of the Pharisees and of Herod!” he warned them.
column3: Sh hab kaij g Jesus am ha wui, “Si g wo s‑e nenꞌoidk mat pi wo em‑cheawuagi g ha‑jewajidakud hegam Palasi ch hegam mo ab si has elid g Herod.”

column2: “He's saying that because we don't have any bread,” they concluded.
column3: Sh hegam chuhchaij am hahawa aꞌaga ch hab kaij ab aꞌai e wui, “Heg oki hekaj hab kaij mach pi ha sismitoga”

column2: Jesus knew what they were saying, and said, “Why are you talking about not having any bread? Are you still not thinking and not understanding? Have you closed your minds?
column3: Kush eda g Jesus s‑ha amichud mo has kaij ch hab ha ahg, “Pi amki koi amichud mani heꞌes edgid g gewkdag ch hekaj am aꞌaga mach pi ha sismitoga.

column2: You've got eyes to see, haven't you? And ears to hear?
column3: Am am wa chum neid mant al hetasp sismitokaj ha gegos g hetasp mihl chechoj ch muꞌi ehp. Pegih, namt pi chegito

column2: Don't you remember when I shared five loaves among five thousand? How many basketfuls of leftovers did you pick up?”
column3: mamt heꞌekia i hoha shuhshud k ui g wihpiꞌidaj?”

column2: “And the seven loaves divided among four thousand. How many basketfuls of leftovers did you pick up?”
column3: Sh hab ep kaij g Jesus, “Kumt heꞌekia i hoha shuhshud k ui g wihpiꞌidaj mant al wewaꞌak sismitokaj am ha gegos hegam giꞌik mihl chechoj ch muꞌi ehp?”

column2: “Do you still not understand?” he asked them.
column3: Kush hab kaij g Jesus, “Pegih, mt wo chum s‑mahchk mani heꞌes i edgid g gewkdag ch hab wo s‑amich mani pi heg hab ahg sismito ch wabshaba haꞌichu chum em‑tashogid ch heg am wepogid g jewajidakud.”

column2: They went to Bethsaida where some people brought a blind man to Jesus. They begged Jesus to touch him and heal him.
column3: Kutsh gam hu dada Bethsaida t am k am i huhud. Kutsh g hemajkam am hema uꞌapa g oꞌodham Jesus wui mash pi nea k ab i e shoꞌigch wui mat ab wo taht.

column2: Jesus took the blind man by the hand and took him outside the village. Jesus spat on the man's eyes and touched him with his hands.
column3: Kutsh an bei g pi neadam nowij an k am i wanimed k gam hu i wuhshad ab kihhim t amjed k ab hahawa siswua wuhpuij ab k ab ep taht k ab kakke, “Shahchu ap hig neid?”

column2: The man looked around, and said, “I can see people, but they look like trees walking.”
column3: Tsh ab i nen k hab kaij, “Neid ani mo an oiopo g hemajkam ch wabshaba hab sha mahs mo g uꞌus wuhshanim.”

column2: So Jesus touched the man's eyes again. He could see properly—he was cured and his sight was clear.
column3: Tsh ab ep taht g wuhpuij. Kutsh ab ep i nea. Tsh g wuhpuij am i apꞌet. Sh hahawa wehs haꞌichu si s‑ap neid.

column2: Jesus sent the man home, and told him, “Don't go back through the village.”
column3: Sh g Jesus hab ahg matsh gam hu uhpam wo hih e‑kihdag wui k pi am hu wo kia i wah kihhim ch ed.

column2: Jesus and his disciples left to go to the villages of Caesarea Philippi. On the way he asked his disciples, “Who do people say I am?”
column3: Kutsh gam hu hahawa hihi idam Jesus am haꞌi ep ha wui g kihhim am miabidch g Cesaria Philippi kihhim. Kush g Jesus ab ha kakke ch hab kaij, “Am g wo ni‑ahgid, dohꞌo ni‑elid g hemajkam?”

column2: “Some say John the Baptist, some say Elijah, others say one of the prophets,” they replied.
column3: Kush hab kaij, “Haꞌijj o hab m‑elid map d hegai Johnbad mo chum t‑pahl wapkonahim ch haꞌijj hab ep m‑elid map d Elijabad o hema i ehp hegam kekelibad Jiosh haꞌichu i tashogiddam.”

column2: “But who do you say I am?” he asked them.
column3: Sh ab ep ha kakke g Jesus, “Kum ahpim hig hedai ni‑elid?”

column2: Jesus warned them not to tell anybody about him.
column3: Kush hab ha ahg mat pi hedai wo shaꞌi ha ahgi hemu mo hedai wud.

column2: Then Jesus began to explain to them that the Son of man would suffer many things and be rejected by the elders, chief priests, and religious teachers. He would be killed, but three days later would rise again.
column3: Neh, tsh am i amjed am hahawa haꞌichu ha mashcha ab e amjed hab kaijch mat hemho wa muꞌi wo e shoꞌigch g Jiosh si Kehsha. Kutsh pi ab hu wo tatchua g geꞌeged ch uꞌugchu papal ch chehanig t‑mashchamdam k am wo i dagito mat wo e‑muhkid. Tsh amjed d wo i waik tashk, tsh ep wo e‑chegito.

column2: Jesus explained this to them very clearly. But Peter took Jesus aside and started to reprimand him for what he said.
column3: Neh, sh id am si tasho ha ahgid.

column2: Jesus turned around and looking at his disciples, reprimanded Peter. “Get away from me, Satan,” he said. “You're not thinking as God thinks, but as human beings do.”
column3: Kutsh wabshaba g Jesus ab haꞌab i kekiwua ha wui k ab epai si s‑gewkam neo ab wui g Peter hab kaijch, “Pi g shaꞌi ni‑shohbid. Do wabsh hejel hab m‑elida ihda. Kup ab wui kehk g Jiosh hab elida hab masma mo g ge Jiawul.”

column2: Jesus called the crowd and his disciples over to him, and told them, “If you want to follow me, you must give up on yourselves, pick up your cross and follow me.
column3: Sh eda muꞌij g hemajkam an ha wehgaj. Kutsh ab i ha waid k hab ha ahg, “Mamtp am wo s‑oidam g ni‑himdag k hemho wa gam hu wo dagito g hejel e‑tatchui k ahni ni‑tatchui hab wo junihid ni‑wehhejed e shoꞌigchudch. Heg at wo wa wepok mam ab mohto g kots ch ab ab wo e muhkid.

column2: If you want to save your life you will lose it, but if you lose your life because of me and the good news you will save it.
column3: Pi amt wo heki wua g e‑doakag mamtp wo hekaj am ni‑wehhejed. Heg at wo heki wua g e‑doakag matp hedai wo chum s‑daꞌad.

column2: What use is it for you to gain everything in the whole world, and lose your life?
column3: “Pi at haꞌichu wehhejed wo s‑kehgajk matp g oꞌodham wehs wo bei mo haschu i tatchua id dahm jewed k wabshaba pi wo e doꞌibia.

column2: What would you give in exchange for your life?
column3: Pi o an hu haꞌichug id dahm jewed mas heg hekaj wo e doꞌibia g oꞌodham.

column2: If you're ashamed to acknowledge  me and what I say among this unfaithful and sinful people, then the Son of man will be ashamed to acknowledge you when he comes with his Father's glory with the holy angels.”
column3: “Muꞌi hemajkam at wabsh s‑tahhadam hab wo junihid g pi apꞌekam ch wo pi em‑haꞌichuchudad. Kumt wabshaba ahpim pi wo si e elidad ni‑hekaj ch hekaj g ni‑mashchamadag. Nt ahni hab waꞌap pi wo si ni‑elidad em‑hekaj mant hekid ia ep wo jiwia. Idani at ab ni‑ab si s‑tondam wo e chehgidad g ni‑ohg gewkdag. T g muꞌi anghil ni‑wehm ab wo i hihi.”

column2: Jesus told them, “I tell you the truth: some standing here won't die before they see the kingdom of God having come with power.”
column3: Neh, bash kaij g Jesus ch hab ep kaij, “Nt wo si shel em‑ahgi mo ia haꞌi haꞌichug hemu mat pi koi wo koi k hoꞌip nei mat baꞌich i s‑gewkam inhab wo i e juh g Jiosh kownaltalig.”

column2: Six days later Jesus took Peter, James, and John with him, and led them up a high mountain to be by themselves. His appearance totally changed.
column3: Kush am d i chuhdp tash amjed. Tsh g Jesus ab i ha wai g Peter ch James ch John. Kutsh idam am wehmaj ab i chehchsh hema uhgk doꞌag t ab k ged hu dada k haha wabsh nei. Tsh am gawul e juh g Jesus.

column2: His clothes shone a brilliant white, whiter than anyone on earth could bleach them.
column3: Tsh g wehschugaj hab e juh mash si s‑tondam s‑tohta mo pi hebai haꞌichu hab masma.

column2: Then Elijah and Moses appeared in front of them as well, talking with Jesus.
column3: Kutsh ab haha wabsh i e chehgi g Elijabad ch Mosesbad k am wehmaj neneok g Jesus.

column2: Peter spoke up and said, “Rabbi, it's great for us to be here! We should make three shelters—one each for you, Moses, and Elijah.”  (He really didn't know what to say because they were all so frightened!)
column3: Kutsh si e totods idam Peter. Tsh g Peter wabsh kohsh k daꞌiwuni k hab kaij ab wui g Jesus, “T‑mashchamdam, s‑apꞌe oki mach ia haꞌichug. Tt ia waik wo ha chuhcha g al chechopi matt hekaj ab wo si has em‑el ahpi ch Mosesbad ch Elijabad.”

column2: Then a cloud covered them, and a voice came from the cloud, saying, “This is my Son, the one I love. Listen to him.”
column3: Tsh an hahawa si ha ehkaj g chewagi. Tsh g Jiosh neꞌoki ab kaida chewagi t amjed k hab kaij, “Jesus o d si ni‑tatchuidch ni‑alidag. Heg amt ab wo si kaihamad.”

column2: Then, all of a sudden, as they were watching, there was nobody. Only Jesus was with them.
column3: Tsh am hahawa i chum nenhog hegam Peter. Kush hegai waꞌi Jesus hejel am kehk. Sh pi am hu haꞌichug hegam gohk.

column2: As they came down the mountain Jesus instructed them not to tell anyone what they'd seen until the Son of man had risen from the dead.
column3: Sh ab hahawa i huhudkhim doꞌag t amjed. Sh ab si ha chehani g Jesus ch hab kaij, “Pi g am hedai wo shaꞌi ahgid mamt haschu i nei, nt hoꞌip kia am uhpam i wuhsh ab muhkig amjed ahni Jiosh si Kehsha.”

column2: They kept this to themselves, but they did argue with each other over what it meant to rise from the dead.
column3: Kutsh wa woho hab e juh k wabshaba hejel am aꞌaga mas has d ahga ihda mo hab kaij matsh am uhpam wo i wuhsh muhkig t amjed.

column2: “Why do the religious teachers state that Elijah has to come first?” they asked him.
column3: Am hu hebai, sh hab kaij ab wui g Jesus, “Neh, bo chechꞌe hegam chehanig t‑mashchamdam matsh ia wehpeg wo e maskogi g Elijabad. Tsh g Jiosh si Kehsha ia haha wo e maskogi. Pegih, t haschu ahgk pi ia wehpeg m‑baꞌich e maskogi hegai Elijabad.”

column2: “It's true that Elijah comes first to prepare everything,” Jesus replied. “But why then does it say in Scripture that the Son of man has to suffer so much and be treated with contempt?  However, I tell you that Elijah has come, and they abused him in whatever way they wanted, just as Scripture said they would.”
column3: Sh hab kaij g Jesus, “Hema at woho wehpeg wo e maskogid k hab wo masmak mash wa g Elijabad ch wehs haꞌichu wo i apꞌech. Kunt wo em‑ahgi mat wa woho heki hu jiwia. T wabshaba g hemajkam am wui hab juh g pi ap e‑tatchui mo hab masma an oꞌohanas Jiosh heki hu oꞌohana ed mat hab wo e juh. K an ep oꞌohanas mat ep wo ni‑shoꞌigchud k wo s‑ni‑ohhod ahni Jiosh si Kehsha.”

column2: When they returned to the other disciples, they saw them surrounded by a large crowd and some religious teachers arguing with them.
column3: Sh ged hu ha aihim hegam mat am wih. Kush muꞌi hemajkam am oiopo. Sh haꞌi d chehanig t‑mashchamdam ch am ha neꞌowin hegam mat am waꞌi wih.

column2: As soon as the crowd saw Jesus they were in total awe, and ran to greet him.
column3: Tsh g hemajkam am i nei mo ab him g Jesus k si s‑ap i e taht k ab i wohp k ab nam.

column2: “What are you arguing with them about?” Jesus asked them.
column3: Sh g Jesus ab ha kakke hegam e‑chuhchai mat am waꞌi wih, “Shahchu am ha wehm aꞌaga?”

column2: One of the people in the crowd answered, “Rabbi, I brought my son to you. He has an evil spirit that prevents him speaking.
column3: Kush am hema g oꞌodham hab kaij ab Jesus wui, “Neh, ia ant heki hu chum uꞌapa g ni‑alidag m‑wui no pi g jiawul an uꞌukch ch pi hiwgid mas wo neo.

column2: Whenever he has a seizure it throws him down, and he foams at the mouth, grinds his teeth, and he becomes rigid. I asked your disciples to drive it out of him, but they couldn't do it.”
column3: Hebai atp am si has tahtchud ch i wuhppa. K g totshagi i chechshshaj chinij ab. K g e‑tahtami si kuhm ch ab wabsh wo i si gewka. Kuni heki hu am chum ha ahgid idam mat gam hu hab wo i juh g jiawul. T pi e nako.”

column2: “You unbelieving people!” Jesus responded. “How long must I remain here with you? How long do I have to put up with you? Bring him over here to me!”
column3: Sh hab kaij g Jesus am ha wui, “Shoꞌo waꞌi pi geꞌej g em‑wohochudadag. Shahag wepo mant tash ia wo em‑wehmajkad ch ab wo em‑nakogad mat hekaj wo i geꞌeda.” Sh hab hahawa kaij heg wui oꞌodham, “Ab g i bekaꞌi ni‑wui.”

column2: So they brought him to Jesus. When the evil spirit saw Jesus it immediately sent the boy into convulsions and threw him on the ground, where he rolled around, foaming at the mouth.
column3: Kutsh ab hahawa i bei wui. Tsh ab i nei g Jesus. Kutsh g jiawul ha hekaj i wua g ali. Kutsh am gehsh k am si banimmed jewedo. Tsh g totshagi i wuhsh ab chinij ab.

column2: “How long has he had this?” Jesus asked the boy's father.
column3: Jesus ash ab hahawa kakke g ohgaj, “K hekid i amjed hab masma ihda?”

column2: “Often it throws him into the fire to burn him to death, or throws him into water to drown him. Please have mercy on us and help, if you can.”
column3: Muꞌikko o waꞌi chum s‑muꞌamk ch am wuhppa shuhdagi ch ed ch am nahda ch ed. Si g s‑ni‑hoꞌigeꞌid k i wuhshad maptp wo e nako.”

column2: “Why do you say, ‘if you can?’ ” replied Jesus. “Whoever trusts has every power!”
column3: Sh g Jesus hab kaij, “Maptp ahpi wo e nako k ab wo i ni‑hiw. Pi o haꞌichu shaꞌi wihnk am ni‑wehhejed maptp ab wo ni‑hiwgad.”

column2: “I do trust in you,” the man shouted out right away. “Help me not to distrust you.”
column3: Kush hab kaij g ohgaj, “M ani wa heꞌes ab chum m‑hiwig. Oi g i ni‑wehmt. Nt baꞌich ab wo i m‑hiwgad.”

column2: Jesus, seeing that the crowd was closing in, commanded the evil spirit, “Spirit that causes deafness and dumbness, I order you to come out of him and never return.”
column3: Tsh eda ab aꞌaijed i wohp g hemajkam an ha wehgaj. Kush hekaj s‑e hohtkid g Jesus ch si s‑kehꞌel g jiawul k hab ahg, “Dagitoni g ali, ahpi jiawul, k pi dahm an hu ep wo shaꞌi uꞌukchid.”

column2: The spirit screamed and threw the boy into severe convulsions. Then the spirit came out of the boy and left him for dead—to the extent that many of the people said, “He's dead.”
column3: Tsh am si s‑kaidam hihin k ab si s‑gewkam e ugij g ali. Tsh am hahawa dagito. Tsh hab wabsh e juh mat muh g ali. Sh g hemajkam hab kaij, “Muh atki.”

column2: But Jesus took the boy by the hand and helped him up, and he got to his feet.
column3: Tsh wabshaba g Jesus ab bei nowij ab k i wamigi. Tsh i wamig k kekiwua.

column2: Later, when Jesus had gone indoors, his disciples asked him in private, “Why couldn't we drive the evil spirit out?”
column3: Kutsh ged hu i wahp kih ch ed idam Jesus. Tsh g chuhchaij am hahawa hejelko kakke, “Tt haschu ahgk ahchim pi t‑nako machs gam hu hab wo i juh g jiawul?”

column2: “This kind can't be driven out except by prayer,” Jesus told them.
column3: Sh hab kaij g Jesus, “Jiawul at heg waꞌi hekaj gam hu hab wo i e juh mamt ab wo e hoꞌigeꞌidahu Jiosh wui.”

column2: They left and passed through Galilee. Jesus didn't want anyone to know where he was
column3: Tsh amjed gam hu hahawa hihim k gam hu gahi wuwha g Galilee chekshani. Tsh g Jesus pi am hu e chehgi hemajkam ha wui no pi ha mashchamahim g e‑chuhchai ch hab ha ahg,

column2: because he was teaching his disciples. “The Son of man will be betrayed to human authorities,” he told them. “They will kill him, but three days later he will rise again.”
column3: “E o aihim mat g s‑ni‑kehꞌiddam wo ni‑bei ahni Jiosh si Kehsha k am wo ni‑dagito haꞌi ha wui mat wo ni‑mua. Nt wabshaba ep wo ni‑chegito mat d wo i waik tashk amjed.”

column2: They didn't understand what he meant and were too afraid to ask him about it.
column3: Sh oi wa pi shaꞌi amichud mas haschu hab ahg ch wabshaba pi ab hu kakke nat pi e totods.

column2: They arrived at Capernaum, and once they were inside the house where they were staying, Jesus asked them, “What were you talking about on the way?”
column3: Kutsh am hihim k ged hu dada Capernaum t am k am i wahp kih ch ed mash hebai dadha. Sh eda haꞌi haꞌichukaj e neꞌowin hihimadch. Kush ab hahawa ha kakke ch hab kaij, “Shahchukaj am e neꞌowinahim mach ab hihim?”

column2: But they didn't say anything because they had been arguing over who was the most important.
column3: Kush oi wa pi hedai has shaꞌi kaij nash pi eda e neꞌowinahim mas hedai baꞌich d wo i s‑has haꞌichuk.

column2: Jesus sat down and called the twelve disciples together. “If anyone wants to be first, he has to be the very last, the servant of everyone else,” he told them.
column3: Kutsh am i dahiwua g Jesus k ab i ha wai. Tsh am i e hemapai wui. Kush hab ha ahg, “Pi g wo chum ge e haꞌichuchudad mamtp hedai d wo uhgchuk am e‑shahgid ch wabshaba hab wo e junihid mamt wehs d wo ha‑pionagk.”

column2: He took a small child and had the child stand right in the middle of them. Then he picked up and hugged the child, and told them,
column3: Sh am hema kehk g ali. Kutsh g Jesus an be k am kohm k hab kaij,

column2: “Whoever welcomes a child like this in my name, welcomes me, and whoever welcomes me doesn't welcome me but the One who sent me.”
column3: “Matp hedai hema wo ha dagioꞌidad g ali am ni‑wehhejed ch hekaj am wo e chehgidch mo ab si ni‑tatchua ch ab ep si tatchua hegai mani d kehshaj.”

column2: John said to Jesus, “Rabbi, we saw someone driving out demons in your name. We tried to stop him because he wasn't one of us.”
column3: Kush g John hab kaij ab wui g Jesus, “Hema oki gam hu hab i ha wua g jijawul heg hekaj m‑chehgig. Kuch am chum shohbid no ge m‑wecho e mashcham.”

column2: “Don't stop him,” Jesus replied. “For no one who is doing miracles in my name can curse me at the same time.
column3: Kush hab ha ahg, “Pi g am wo shaꞌi shohbid. Pi at woho has wo ni‑ah matp hedai hekaj g ni‑chehgig ch hab wua g s‑wihnk haꞌichu.

column2: Anyone who is not against us is for us.
column3: Tki wo i t‑wehmt hegai matp hedai pi ab hu t‑wui kehk.

column2: Anyone who gives a cup of water to you in my name, because you belong to Christ, won't lose their reward, believe me.
column3: Nt wo si shel em‑ahgi matp hedai wo i em‑wasibi g shuhdagi ahpim mam ab si ni‑wecho e mashcham k wo bei g s‑apꞌekam e‑namkidadag.”

column2: But if anyone leads one of these little ones who trust in me into sin, it would be better for them if they were thrown into the sea with a large millstone tied around their neck.
column3: Sh hab ep kaij g Jesus, “Shoꞌo waꞌi si s‑ta ehbidam hab mahs am wehhejed hegai matp hedai hema am wo i ha wanchkwua pi apꞌekam wui idam al aꞌal mo ab al ni‑hiwig. Baꞌich at wo i s‑apꞌek wehhejed matp hems wo e wachumchud k wo e muhkid mat koi hab wo juh ihda chuꞌijig.

column2: If your hand leads you to sin, cut it off! It's better to enter eternal life as a cripple than to go with both hands into Gehenna , into the fire that can't be put out.     If your foot causes you to sin, cut it off! It's better to enter eternal life lame than to be thrown into Gehenna still having two feet.    If your eye causes you to sin, gouge it out! It's better to enter the kingdom of God with just one eye than to be thrown into Gehenna still having both eyes,  where the worm doesn't die and the fire never goes out.
column3: “Pi at hedai wo e nako mas ab uhpam wo i wuhsh Jiawul kih amjed. Kut pi hekid wo huhug g ha‑shoꞌigchuda amai. Heg at wo wa wepok mat wo waptopadt k chum hekid wo e shoꞌigchudad am mei ch ed. Mt heg hekaj am wo i e nako mamt pi am hu wo gei heg eda. Baꞌich at wo i s‑apꞌek mamt chum hems wo heb hu wua g e‑nowi o g e‑tad o g e‑wuhi matp hema idam hab wo em‑juh mamt am wo gei Jiawul kih ed k pi wo bei hegai wechij doakag mo g Jiosh ab em‑makiog.

column2: Everybody will be ‘salted’ by fire.
column3: “Hemho wa at wehs wo e maskogi g pi ap ha‑chuꞌijig g hemajkam.

column2: Salt is good, but if it loses its taste, how could you make it salty again? You need to be like salt, and live in peace with one another.”
column3: Mt wabshaba hejel ab wo e abchud k wo dagito hemu. T hab pi ab hu wo em‑abch g Jiosh. Kumt haꞌichu wehhejed wo s‑kehgajk hab masma mo g on. Heg at pi has masma ep wo i e kegch mat wo onko. Kumt wo s‑e nenꞌoidad mamt pi wo heb hu wua g s‑e‑apꞌek am k wabshaba wo s‑ap e tahtkkad ab aꞌai e wui.” Neh, bash kaij g Jesus.

column2: Jesus left Capernaum and went to the region of Judea and Transjordan. Once again people flocked to see him, and he was teaching them like he always did.
column3: Tsh amjed gam hu hihi hegam Jesus k am gahi wuwha g Judea chekshani k am gahi i shul g Jordan akimel k gam hu aigo dada. Kutsh g hemajkam am ep i e hemapai Jesus wui. Tsh am ep ha mashcha mash chum hekid hab e wua.

column2: Some Pharisees came to see him. They tried to test him by asking the question, “Is divorce legal?”
column3: Kutsh ab haꞌi i hihi g Palasi k ab haꞌichu chum s‑abchudamk g Jesus ch ash ab kakke, “No hiwgid g t‑chehanig mat g oꞌodham wo s‑ohhod g e‑hohnig?”

column2: “What did Moses tell you to do?” he asked in reply.
column3: Sh g Jesus ab epai ha kakke, “Nam hig pi mahch mo has chuꞌig g chehanig?”

column2: “Moses allowed a man to write a certificate of divorce and send the woman away,” they replied.
column3: Kush hab kaij g Palasi, “Heuꞌu, hiwgid o mat g oꞌodham wo bei g tapial k wo ha mah k gam hu wo s‑ohhod.”

column2: Then Jesus told them, “Moses only wrote down this rule for you because of your hard-hearted attitude.
column3: Kush oi wa hab kaij g Jesus, “Heuꞌu, bo chuꞌig mamt wo ha mah g ohhoda tapial mamtp pi ab hu wo kaihamad g Jiosh ch pi wo pihk e elidad ha hekaj.

column2: However, in the beginning, from creation, God made male and female.
column3: K wabshaba ged hu i shohshonkam am ahgas:

column2: When they were back indoors, the disciples began asking him about this.
column3: Tsh ged hu hahawa i wahp kih ch ed. Tsh g chuhchaij ab i kakke mas haschu hab ahg.

column2: “Any man who divorces his wife and marries again commits adultery against her,” he told them.
column3: Kush hab kaij, “Bo wua g pi apꞌekam matp hedai wo s‑ohhod g e‑wehm kihkam k hema ep wo hohnt.

column2: “And if the wife divorces her husband and marries again she commits adultery.”
column3: K g uwi hab waꞌap wua g pi apꞌekam matp wo s‑ohhod g e‑wehm kihkam k hema ep wo kunt.”

column2: Some people brought their children to Jesus so that he could bless them, but the disciples told them off and tried to keep the children away from Jesus.
column3: Kutsh am haꞌi ha uꞌapa g e‑aꞌaliga Jesus wui hab ahgch mat ab wo ha taht k wo e hoꞌigeꞌidahu ha wehhejed. Kumsh chum s‑ha kehꞌid mo hab e wua.

column2: But when Jesus saw what they were doing, he became very upset and told them, “Let the children come to me! Don't stop them, for the kingdom of God belongs to those who are like these children.
column3: Kutsh oi wa pi hohhoꞌi g Jesus matsh chum pi ha hiwigi k hab ha ahg, “Ab g wabsh wo i ha hiwgid g al aꞌal mat ab wo i hihi ni‑wui k pi an hu wo shaꞌi ha shohbi. Am at wabsh s‑moimam wo i wahp Jiosh kownaltalig ed ab ni‑hiwigch.

column2: I tell you the truth, anyone who doesn't welcome the kingdom of God like a child won't enter it.”
column3: Nt wo si shel em‑ahgi mamt hab waꞌi masma am wo i wahp.”

column2: He hugged the children, placed his hands on them, and blessed them.
column3: Neh, bash kaij ch an i ha kohmkahim k ab i ha tahtamahi ha‑mohmi ab k ab i s‑ha hoꞌigeꞌel.

column2: As Jesus set out on his journey, a man came running over and kneeled down before Jesus. “Good teacher, what should I do to make sure I have eternal life?” he asked.
column3: Kutsh amjed haha wabsh i chum hihi. Kush ab hema med g oꞌodham ch ab i gei Jesus wui k ab kakke, “Ha mashchamdam map d s‑apꞌekam, shahchu ant am hab wo juh mant ab wo bei g pi ha huhugedam doakag?”

column2: “Why do you call me good?” Jesus asked him. “No one is good, only God.
column3: Sh g Jesus hab kaij, “Pi ap mahch map haschu ahgch hab ni‑aꞌaga mani d s‑apꞌekam. Heg o waꞌi Jiosh d s‑apꞌekam. Kup pi woho mahch mani hedai wud.

column2: You know the commandments: you shall not murder, you shall not commit adultery, you shall not steal, you shall not give false testimony, you shall not cheat, honor your father and mother…”
column3: S‑mahch ap g Jiosh chehanig. K hab chuꞌig:

column2: “Teacher,” the man replied, “I've obeyed all these commandments since I was small.”
column3: Kush hab kaij ihda oꞌodham, “Wehs ihda ani hab junihim ged hu i ni‑alijk amjed.”

column2: Jesus looked at him with love and said, “You're only missing one thing. Go and sell everything you own, give the money to the poor, and you will have treasure in heaven. Then come and follow me.”
column3: Tsh Jesus ab i nei ihda k ab si pihk i e el wui k hab kaij, “Hemako haꞌichu apki pi am hu hab wua. Him k gagda map haschu i eniga k ha mahki g namkigaj g shoꞌigkam k ab wo i him k ab si ni‑wecho wo e mashchamad ch an haha wo edgidad g baꞌich i s‑kehg kaisdag Jiosh kihdag ed.”

column2: At this, the man's face fell, and he left feeling very sad, for he was very wealthy.
column3: Kutsh ihda oꞌodham si pi ap e taht k kah mo has i kaij nash pi d s‑kais ch atsh im hu hih pi ap e tahtkk.

column2: Jesus looked around, and said to his disciples, “It's only with difficulty that wealthy people enter the kingdom of God!”
column3: Tsh g Jesus an i nenhog e wehgaj k hab kaij am ha wui g e‑chuhchai, “Neh, t wo shaꞌi si s‑hasigk mas g s‑kakais am wo i wahp Jiosh kownaltalig ed.”

column2: The disciples were shocked at this. But Jesus went on, “My friends, it is difficult to enter God's kingdom.
column3: Kutsh si has i e taht hegam chuhchaij am i kaiok mash has kaij.

column2: It's easier for a camel to go through the eye of a needle than for the rich to enter God's kingdom.”
column3: Nam hig hab elid mat wo e nako g kamihyo mas am wo gahi wuhsh mo am jeg g hoꞌipad? Pegih, t hab wa masma pi wo e nako hegam mo hiwig g haꞌichu e‑eniga mas am wo i wahp Jiosh kihdag ed.”

column2: The disciples were even more confused. “Then who on earth can be saved?” they asked one another.
column3: Kutsh baꞌich i si has i e taht k ab aꞌai e kakke, “Pegih, kus hedai hig wo e doꞌibia?”

column2: Looking right at them, Jesus replied, “From a human point of view, it's impossible—but not with God. Everything is possible with God.”
column3: Kutsh ab i ha nei g Jesus k hab kaij, “Oꞌodham wehhejed o s‑hasig ch wabshaba am Jiosh wehhejed pi hasig. Jiosh at wo e nako mat wehs hab wo juh mo haschu i tatchua.”

column2: Peter spoke up, “We've left everything to follow you…”
column3: Kutsh g Peter hab ha hekaj chei, “Nehꞌe, ahchim att hi wehs haꞌichu dagito k am i m‑oi.”

column2: “I tell you the truth,” Jesus replied, “anyone who has left behind their home or brothers or sisters or mother or father or children or lands because of me, and for the sake of the good news,  will receive in return in due course a hundred times as many homes and brothers and sisters and children and lands—as well as persecution. In the world to come they will receive eternal life.
column3: Kush hab kaij g Jesus, “Nt wo si shel em‑ahgi mamt baꞌich i muꞌi haꞌichu wo edagi mo chum hegai mam tp haschu i dagito am ni‑wehhejed, kihki, wepnag, jehj, aꞌal, oꞌoidag. Kumt muꞌi haꞌichu wo nako mamt wo ahgahi g s‑kehg haꞌichu ahgaj g Jiosh ab ni‑amjed k am haha wo ai g pi ha huhugedam s‑hehgig.

column2: However many of the first will be last, and the last first.”
column3: Kut wabshaba hegam mo wabsh hejel chum si e haꞌichuchud hahawa pi d wo haꞌichuk. T hegam mo hejel pi e haꞌichuchud am hahawa d wo si haꞌichuk.”

column2: They continued on their way to Jerusalem, with Jesus walking on ahead. The disciples were apprehensive and the other followers were afraid. So Jesus took the disciples aside and began to explain to them what was about to happen to him.
column3: Kutsh gam hu i oi g wohg Jerusalem wui. Sh gam hu ha baꞌich him g Jesus. Kush si e totodsid g chuhchaij. Kush am haꞌi ep ha wehm hihimad ch hab waꞌap e totodsid. Tsh g Jesus am i ha hemapai hegam gamai gohk k am ep ha ahgi mat haschu has wo e juh am tahgio,

column2: “We're going to Jerusalem,” he told them, “and the Son of man will be betrayed to the chief priests and religious teachers. They will condemn him to death and hand him over to the foreigners.
column3: ash hab kaij, “Nehꞌe, gam att hu wo hihi Jerusalem wui. Kut an wo ni‑bei g uꞌugchu papal ch chehanig em‑mashchamdam k ab wo ni‑mohtoꞌi g chuꞌijig ahni Jiosh si Kehsha no pi s‑ni‑muꞌamk ch im hu hab hahawa ep wo ni‑dagito ha wui g gawul mahs hemajkam.

column2: They will mock him, spit on him, flog him, and kill him. But three days later he will rise again.”
column3: Kut hegam wo nahnko ni‑ahgad ch ab ni‑ab wo siswuad ch ep wo ni‑gewittan k haha wo ni‑mua. Kut d wo waik i tashk, nt ep wo ni‑chegito.” Neh, bash kaij g Jesus.

column2: James and John, the sons of Zebedee, came to see him.
column3: Tsh amjed ab wui dada g James ch John k hab kaij, “T‑mashchamdam, am ach haꞌichu chum s‑m‑kakkeimk mapt am hab wo t‑juni.”

column2: “So what do you want me to do for you?” Jesus replied.
column3: Sh hab kaij g Jesus, “Shahchu am hab elid mant am hab wo em‑juni?”

column2: “When you're victorious and sit on your throne, make sure we sit beside you, one on the right, the other on the left,” they told him.
column3: Sh hab kaij, “Pt hig am wo i t‑chuhcha matt ahchim gohk am m‑oidch d wo hahaꞌichuk mapt hekid am wo i himch g e‑kownaltalig.”

column2: “You don't know what you're asking,” replied Jesus. “Can you drink the cup I drink? Can you be baptized with the baptism of pain I will suffer?”
column3: Kush hab kaij g Jesus, “Pi am shaꞌi ap mahch mam haschu ab ni‑tahni. Wehpeg ant ab wo nako g geꞌe shoꞌigdag. Kut hegam mat am ni‑oidch d wo si hahaꞌichuk hab waꞌap wo e juh.”

column2: “Yes, we can,” they replied.
column3: Sh hab kaij, “Pegih, tt wo t‑nako.”

column2: “But it's not for me to grant who should sit on my right or on my left. These places are reserved for those for whom they have been prepared.”
column3: K wabshaba pi ab hu ni‑ab manis ahni am wo i ha chuhcha mat hedai am ni‑oidch d wo hahaꞌichuk. Hegam at am wo i e chuhcha mat hedai i ha wehhejed am e apꞌech.”

column2: When the other ten disciples heard about this, they started getting upset with James and John.
column3: Kutsh hegam haꞌi babgat ab ha wui g James ch John mash hab masma ab hejel e haꞌichuchud.

column2: Jesus called the disciples together and told them,
column3: Tsh g Jesus ab hahawa wehs i ha hemapad k hab kaij ab ha wui, “S‑mahch am mo g ha‑maliomig s‑gewkam haꞌichu ha chehani g e‑pionag ch g ha wanimeddam am ha himchudahim.

column2: But for you it's not like this. Anyone of you who wants you to be a ruler must be your servant,  and anyone who wants to be first among you must be the slave of all of you.
column3: T wabshaba pi hab masma hab wo shaꞌi chum mahsk am em‑shahgid ahpim mam ab ni‑hiwig. Mt wabsh si s‑hemajim am wo i ha wehmtad g e‑wehm wohochuddam hab sha masma mam d wabsh ha‑pionag mamtp wo tatchuad mamt wo ha wanimedad.

column2: For even the Son of man did not come to be served but to serve, and to give his life as a ransom for many.”
column3: Ahni ani hab wa masma si s‑hemajim i em‑wehmt ch pi ab hu ni‑haꞌichuchud em‑dahm, chum anis d Jiosh si Kehsha. Ab o em‑wui him g s‑koꞌok namkidadag heg hekaj pi ap em‑chuꞌijig. Nt wabshaba ahni em‑wehhejed wo nako mamt wo e wupulꞌo.” Neh, bash kaij g Jesus.

column2: Jesus and his disciples passed through Jericho, and as they were leaving town, accompanied by a large crowd, Bartimaeus, a blind beggar, was sitting at the roadside.
column3: Kutsh am hihi idam Jesus k gam hu dada Jerico t am. Sh am shaꞌi heꞌes. Tsh am ep i chum hihi hasko. Kutsh shaꞌi si muꞌi hemajkam an ep i ha oidahi. Sh an hema daha wohg hugid an ch ha limoshan nash pi d pi neadam. Id amsh hab aꞌaga Bar Timaius nash pi d alidaj g Timaius.

column2: When he heard it was Jesus of Nazareth, he started shouting out, “Jesus, son of David, please have mercy on me!”
column3: Sh am hihim idam Jesus. Kutsh am i s‑mai ihda mash g Jesus an him k am ha hekaj si s‑kaidam hab kaij, “Ab g si i s‑ni‑hoꞌigeꞌid, Jesus, mapsh d t‑kownaligbad David amjedkam.”

column2: Lots of people told him to be quiet, but that only made him shout even more, “Jesus, son of David, please have mercy me!”
