column3: Kush muꞌijj s‑kehꞌid ch hab chum ahg matsh am wabsh wo i pi shahmunik. Tsh oi wabsh baꞌich i e gewkai, “Ab g si i s‑ni‑hoꞌigeꞌid, ahpi Davidbad amjedkam.”

column2: Jesus stopped, and said, “Tell him to come here.” So they called him over, telling him, “Good news! Get up. He's calling for you.”
column3: Kutsh am i kekiwua g Jesus k hab kaij, “Ab g wo i waid!”

column2: Bartimaeus jumped up, threw off his coat, and rushed over to Jesus.
column3: Kutsh heg am ha hekaj si wuahawua g e‑lihwa k am si daꞌiwuni k ab i him k am jiwia wui.

column2: “What do you want me to do for you?” Jesus asked him.
column3: Sh hab kaij g Jesus, “Shahchu ant hab wo m‑juni?”

column2: “You can go. Your trust in me has healed you.” Immediately Bartimaeus could see and he followed Jesus as he went on his way.
column3: Kush hab kaij g Jesus, “S‑ap g e tahtk k hihm. Doa apt nap pi ab ni‑hiwig.”

column2: As they approached Jerusalem, near to Bethphage and Bethany, beside the Mount of Olives, Jesus sent two of his disciples on ahead.
column3: Sh amjed ab hihim idam Jesus Jerusalem wui. Tsh am hebai i cheka. Kutsh am ai g Olive Uꞌus Kawulk. K heg mia gohk al kihhimag ch hab chehgig Bethphage ch Bethany.

column2: He told them, “Go into the village ahead of you, and as soon as you enter, you'll find a colt tied up that no one has ever ridden before. Untie it and bring it here.
column3: Tsh g Jesus gohk hab ha ah g e‑chuhchai, “Am g wo hihim k ga hu wo dada kihhim t am. Kut am hema wo wulshpik g wechij wuhlu mo koi shaꞌi e chechshshaj. Mt gam wo wulꞌo.

column2: If anyone asks you what you are doing, tell them, ‘The Lord needs it and will send it back soon.’ ”
column3: T hema ab wo em‑kakke mams has wo juh. Kumt hab wo ah mani ahni d em‑mashchamdam ch tatchua ch am haha wo dagito mamt uhpam wo uꞌapa. Kut ab wabsh wo i dagito mamt ab wo i wanim.”

column2: So they set off, and found a colt tied to a door, out on the street, and they untied it.
column3: Neh, tsh wa woho gam hu hihi idam gohk k am cheh mo am wulshpi g wuhlu k am wulꞌo.

column2: Some of the people standing around asked, “What are you doing, untying that colt”?
column3: Kush eda inhab haꞌi gegok g oꞌodham ch ha neid mash am wupulꞌok. Sh hema hab kaij, “Shahchu am ahgch am wupulꞌok g wuhlu?”

column2: The disciples replied just as Jesus told them to, and the people let them go.
column3: Sh am i ha ahgid mash has kaij g Jesus. Kutsh heg hekaj ha hiwigi matsh am wo bei.

column2: They brought the colt to Jesus, put their cloaks on it, and Jesus sat on it.
column3: Kutsh am i wanimed k ged hu uꞌapa Jesus wui k an toa g e‑liliwa an ab. Tsh an dahiwua g Jesus.

column2: Many people spread their cloaks on the road, while others laid down leafy branches that they'd cut in the fields.
column3: Sh muꞌi hemajkam an ha wehgaj ch am i ha tahtdahim g e‑liliwa wohg ch ed ch haꞌijj g wechij uꞌus iꞌibhonig an hikkumiak ch am toꞌahim heg oidch wohg mash am him g Jesus.

column2: Those leading in the front and those that were following were all shouting, “Hosanna! Bless the one coming in the name of the Lord.
column3: Kush hegam mash an wehgaj hihim si s‑kaidam hab kaij:

column2: Jesus entered Jerusalem and went in to the Temple. He looked around him, observing everything, and then, since it was getting late, he returned to Bethany with the twelve disciples.
column3: Kutsh gam hu dada Jerusalem t am. Tsh am i hud g Jesus k am i wah mo am kehk g geꞌe cheopi k an i neidahi mo an haschu has e wua. Sh am i hudunihim. Tsh hekaj am i wuwhag k gam hu hihi Bethany wui matsh am wo dadkad.

column2: The next day, as they left Bethany, Jesus was hungry.
column3: Sh am baꞌich d i tash mash ab uhpam hihim Jerusalem wui. Tsh bihugim g Jesus.

column2: From some distance away he saw a fig tree with leaves, so he went over to it to see if it had any fruit. But when he got there, he found it had only leaves, because it was not the season for figs.
column3: Kush am hu hema kehk g suhna uhs. Tsh ab wui hihi nash pi s‑hahhagag ch ab wo chum bahidagk, chum as pi koi e ai mat wo bai. Kush oi wa pi ab hu haꞌichu shaꞌi ihbdag.

column2: He said to the tree, “May no one eat fruit from you ever again.” His disciples heard his words.
column3: Kush hekaj hab kaij, “Pi at hedai ab hu ep wo huh g bahidag.” Kush kah idam.

column2: They arrived back in Jerusalem, and Jesus went into the Temple. He started driving out the people who were buying and selling in the Temple. He overturned the tables of the money-changers and the chairs of the people selling doves.
column3: Kud ged hu dada Jerusalem t am k am i wahp mo am kehk g geꞌe cheopi. D eda am haꞌi dadha ch am haꞌichu gagda ch haꞌichu ha nolawt geꞌe cheopi miabidch. D g Jesus gam hu si ha shahmud k gam hu aꞌai kuhkpal si ha shul g ha‑mimsa hegam mo g lial kammialt ch g ha dadaikud hegam mo g hohhi ha gagda.

column2: He stopped anyone carrying things through the Temple.
column3: D wenog g hemajkam haꞌichu gahi mohto mo am kehk g geꞌe cheopi. Kud g Jesus am ha shohbid

column2: He explained to them, “Doesn't Scripture say, ‘My house will be called a house of prayer for all nations’? But you have turned it into a den of thieves!”
column3: k am hahawa ha mashcham g hemajkam ch hab kaij, “Bo chuꞌig an Jiosh oꞌohana ed mo hab kaij g Jiosh:

column2: The chief priests and religious teachers heard what had happened, and tried to find a way to kill Jesus. But they were afraid of him, for everyone was so impressed by his teaching.
column3: D muꞌijj g hemajkam ab si has elid g mashchamigaj. Kudki heg hekaj s‑ehbid g uꞌugchu papal ch chehanig t‑mashchamdam ch am i aꞌaga mas has masma wo mua.

column2: When evening came Jesus and his disciples left the city.
column3: Kud am i hud. D am hahawa i wuwha kihhim t amjed hegam Jesus.

column2: The following morning as they returned, they saw the fig tree, withered from the roots up.
column3: Baꞌich mahsi, tsh am ep bihbij amai mash am kehk g suhna k nei matki gaksh.

column2: Peter remembered what Jesus had done, and said to him, “Rabbi, look, the fig tree that you cursed has withered.”
column3: Sh g Peter hab kaij, “Neh, t‑mashchamdam, hegai suhna mapt ab si has ah atki gaksh.”

column2: “Trust in God,” Jesus replied.
column3: Sh hab kaij g Jesus, “Ab g wabsh wo hiwgad g Jiosh.

column2: “Believe me when I say to you that if you told this mountain, ‘Get out of here and be thrown into the sea,’ and you don't doubt in your heart, but are convinced about what you asking, then it will happen!
column3: Kut wabsh chum haschu hab wo em‑juni. Mtp hems wo cheha ihda doꞌag mat gam hu wo e wua ge shuhdagi ch ed. Kut wa woho hab wo e juh mamtp ab wo hiwgad mat hab wo e juh.

column2: I'm telling you that whatever you pray for, whatever you ask, trust that you've received it, and it's yours.
column3: Ab g wabsh wo s‑wohochudad mat g Jiosh am hab wo em‑juni hegai mamt haschu ab wo i tai. Kut wa woho hab wo em‑juni.

column2: But when you're praying, if you have something against someone, forgive them, so that your Father in heaven may also forgive you your sins.”
column3: Mt wabshaba wehpeg wo pi chegito g pi ap ha‑chuꞌijig hegam matp hedai ab em‑wui hab juh g pi apꞌekam. T g Jiosh em‑ohg ab haha wo s‑em‑hoꞌigeꞌid k gam hu hab wo i juh g pi ap em‑chuꞌijig. [
Mtp wabshaba pi wo sha pi chegito g pi ap ha‑chuꞌijig, t g Jiosh g em‑chuꞌijig hab waꞌap pi gam hu hab wo i juh.]”

column2: They returned to Jerusalem, and as he was walking in the Temple, the chief priests, religious teachers, and the leaders approached him.
column3: Kud gam hu ep dada Jerusalem t am k ged hu i wahp mo am kehk g geꞌe cheopi. Kutsh g uꞌugchu papal ch chehanig t‑mashchamdam ch geꞌeged am dada wui g Jesus

column2: “By what authority are you doing all this?” they demanded. “Who gave you the right?”
column3: k ab kakke, “Dohp amjed hab chum e elid map uꞌukch g e‑gewkdag ch am hab haꞌichu wua? Oi g am t‑ahgid.”

column2: “Let me ask you a question,” Jesus told them. “You answer me, and I'll tell you by whose authority I do these things.
column3: Kush oi wa hab kaij g Jesus, “Pegih, nt ahni wehpeg ab epai wo haꞌichu em‑kakke. Mt am wo ni‑ahgi. Nt am epai wo em‑ahgi g em‑kakkei.

column2: John's baptism—did that come from heaven, or from people?”
column3: Am g hig wo ni‑ahgid mams hedai amjed hab elid mo wa g Johnbad ab uꞌukch g e‑gewkdag ch ha pahl wapkonahim. No ab Jiosh amjed aha no ab oꞌodham amjed?”

column2: They discussed it among themselves. They said, “If we say it's from heaven, he'll reply, ‘So why didn't you believe him?’
column3: Kush idam am wabsh chum hejel si aꞌaga ch hab kaij, “Shahtt hig wo chei? T wo s‑t‑kehꞌid k ab wo t‑kakke matt haschu ahgk pi ab hu wohoch g Johnbad mattp hab wo chei mo ab Jiosh amjed uꞌukch g gewkdag.

column2: But if we say, it's of human origin, well…” They were afraid of the crowd, because everyone believed that John was a true prophet.
column3: T g hemajkam has wo t‑juh mattp hab wo chei mo ab wabsh oꞌodham amjed uꞌukch. Muꞌijj o hab elid mo d Jiosh haꞌichu i tashogiddam.”

column2: So they answered Jesus, “We don't know.”
column3: Neh, bash kaij ch ab hahawa uhpam i e nohnogi Jesus wui k hab kaij, “Pi ach shaꞌi mahch mas hedai amjed ab uꞌukch g e‑gewkdag.”

column2: Then Jesus began to speak to them using illustrated stories.
column3: Neh, bash kaij g Jesus ch am hahawa ha ahgid ihda wepogida ahga hab kaijch, “Matp hems hema hab i e ah mat am hig wo ge ei g uhdwis. T g piongaj an ge kolhaidad k heg ep nahto mat hekaj am wo i wuhshad g wadgaj k am i kei g uhgk kih mat heg amjed wo nuhkudad g eshaj. T gam hu hasko chihpia g enigakam k haꞌi ha hiwigi g e‑oidag.

column2: When harvest-time came, he sent one of his servants to the tenant farmers to collect some of the grapes from the vineyard.
column3: “T am i e ai mat g uhdwis wo bai. Kut am hema ahgi g e‑pionag mat am wo him k ab wo bei hegai wadgaj mo ab d i chum wuikamaj g enigakam.

column2: But they grabbed hold of him, beat him up, and sent him away with nothing.
column3: Kut am him k am jiwia. T wabshaba hegam mo am nuhkud g oidag am wabsh be k am gewittan k hab ah mat gam hu wo hih.

column2: So the man sent another servant. They hit him over the head and abused him.
column3: “K am hu i hebai, t am hema ep cheha e‑pionag mat am wo hih. T am him k am jiwia. Kut am hab waꞌi ep juh mat hab juh g wehpegkam k s‑koꞌokam juh g moꞌoj k s‑koꞌokam has ah.

column2: He sent another servant, and this one they killed. He sent many other servants, and they beat some of them and killed others.
column3: “T g enigakam am hema ep cheha g e‑pionag mat am wo hih. T g nuhkuddam hab waꞌap juh k mua. T g enigakam am haꞌi ep ha cheha mat am wo hihi. T g nuhkuddam hab waꞌap s‑koꞌokam ha juh k haꞌi ha kokda.

column2: In the end the only one left was his son whom he loved, and eventually he sent him, thinking ‘they will respect my son.’
column3: “K am hema wiꞌis ch d alidaj. T heg am cheha mat am wo hih hab elidch mat ab has wo i el.

column2: But the farmers said to themselves, ‘Here's the owner's heir—if we kill him, we can get what he would have inherited!’
column3: “T wabshaba idam oidag nuhkuddam am wabsh e wehm neneok k hab kaij, ‘Id o d ihda mat ab wui wo i wuhsh g oidag. Tt hig wo mua. T d haha wo t‑enigak.’

column2: So they took him and killed him, and threw him out of the vineyard.
column3: Kut hab juh k muꞌa k gam hu daꞌich ab kolhai amjed.

column2: Now what is the owner of the vineyard going to do? He will come and kill those farmers, and then he will lease the vineyard to others.
column3: “Neh, m ant wo i em‑tashogi mat has wo e juh g oidag enigakam. Ab at wo i him k wo ha kokda hegam mat am chum ha nuhkudach g e‑oidag k am haꞌi ep wo ha nuhkudach.

column2: Haven't you even read this Scripture: ‘The stone rejected by the builders has become the chief cornerstone.
column3: Pi amki shaꞌi amichud mo has d ahga ihda wepogida ahga mo an hab chuꞌig Jiosh oꞌohana ed:

column2: The Jewish leaders tried to have him arrested because they realized that the illustration was directed at them, but they were afraid of the crowd. So they left him alone and went away.
column3: Neh, bash wabsh ha ahg hegam t‑uꞌugchuga g Jesus nash pi chum s‑ohhodamk. Kush heg hekaj an chum s‑behimk mat wo kuh. K wabshaba muꞌijj g hemajkam ab si has elid g Jesus. Kush s‑ha gihug ch am wabsh i dagito k gam hu hihi hasko.

column2: Later they sent some Pharisees with some of Herod's supporters to Jesus in an attempt to catch him out by what he said.
column3: Kumtsh am hahawa haꞌi hab ha ah g Palasi ch Herod pionag matsh am wo hihi Jesus wui k wo neꞌowin k wo haꞌichu cheh mat heg ab wo abch.

column2: They arrived and said, “Teacher, we know you are a truthful person and you don't look for approval, because you don't care about status or position. Instead you teach God's way in accordance with the truth. So is it right to pay tribute to Caesar or not?
column3: Kutsh am dada wui k hab kaij, “Ha mashchamdam, s‑mahch ach map s‑ap d oꞌodham ch wabsh chum hedai ha mashcham g Jiosh himdag, chum as has wo chei hedai i. Pegih, k am wo t‑ahgi maps has elid g geꞌe kownal lial kowlanta. No hig t‑hiwgid g t‑chehanig ahchim Tutuligo matt wo ha namkid aha no pi t‑hiwgid?”

column2: Should we pay up, or should we refuse?”
column3: Sh wabshaba g Jesus am wa s‑ha amichud mo g pi apꞌekam hab elid ch hab ha ahg, “Ahpim, s‑chu iꞌattomkam am wabsh chum heki s‑ni‑himchudamk. Ab g wo hema ni‑chehgid hegai lial mam hekaj ha namkid.”

column2: They gave him a coin. “Whose is this image, and whose inscription?” Jesus asked them. “Caesar's,” they replied.
column3: Kumtsh ab hema chehgi.

column2: “Then give back to Caesar what belongs to him, and give back to God what belongs to him,” Jesus told them. They were amazed at his reply.
column3: Kush hab hahawa ep kaij g Jesus ab ha wui, “Pegih, ab g wo i dagito kownal wui hegai matp d enigaj k am epai wo i dagito Jiosh wui mo haschu d epai enigaj.” Kutsh wehsijj si has i el g neꞌokij.

column2: Then the Sadducees, who deny the resurrection, came and asked a question:
column3: Kutsh am haꞌi dada Jesus wui hegam mash d Sajusi. K idam o pi d ha‑wohochudadag mat g muhki ab uhpam ep wo i wuhsh muhkig t amjed.

column2: “Teacher, Moses instructed us that if a man dies, leaving his widow childless, then his brother should marry his wife, and have children by her on his behalf.
column3: Kush hab kaij idam, “Ha mashchamdam, Mosesbad atki an oꞌoha hegai chehanigaj g Jiosh mo hab chuꞌig:

column2: Jesus told them, “This proves you're mistaken, and that you don't know the Scriptures or the power of God.
column3: Kush hab kaij g Jesus ab ha wui, “Pi am ap chegito nam pi pi shaꞌi mahch g Jiosh haꞌichu ahga ch ep pi shaꞌi mahch mo heꞌes i gewkdag.

column2: When the dead rise, they don't marry, and aren't given in marriage. They're like the angels in heaven.
column3: Woho at ab uhpam wo i ha wuwhas g koꞌi. T wabshaba hahawa pi wo hohontad hab masma mo g anghil pi hohont.

column2: But concerning the resurrection, haven't you read in Moses' writings the story of the burning bush, where God spoke to Moses and told him, ‘I am the God of Abraham, and the God of Isaac, and the God of Jacob?’
column3: Mosesbad atki an oꞌoha mash wa g Jiosh am e chehgid wui heg hekaj shaꞌi mash meihid ch pi meitto. Sh hab kaij g Jiosh:

column2: One of the religious teachers came and heard them arguing. He recognized that Jesus had given them a good answer. So he asked him, “Which is the most important commandment of all?”
column3: Kush am hema kehk g chehanig ha mashchamdam ch am ha kaiham. K eda tasho mo s‑ap hab ha ahg g Jesus. Neh, tsh hab i e ah mat ab hig epai haꞌichu wo kakke, ash hab kaij, “Shahchu o d si baꞌiwechkim geꞌe chehanigaj g Jiosh?”

column2: Jesus replied, “The first commandment is, ‘Hear, O Israel, the Lord our God is one.  Love the Lord your God with all your heart, with all your spirit, with all your mind, and with all your strength.’
column3: Kush hab kaij g Jesus, “Si geꞌe chehanig o d ihda:

column2: “That's right, Teacher,” the man replied. “It's true as you said that God is one, and there is no other.
column3: Kush hab kaij ihda, “S‑ap ap hab kaij, t‑mashchamdam. M o wa woho mo g Jiosh si s‑wohom d Jiosh ch pi an hu hema ehp.

column2: We are to love him with all our heart, all our understanding, and all our strength, and we are to love our neighbor as ourselves. This is far more important than offerings and sacrifices.”
column3: Kutt hemho wa ab wo si tatchuad g Jiosh wehs t‑ihbdagkaj ch id am wo chehgidch wehs t‑chegitoikaj ch wehs t‑gewkdagkaj ch ab wo si ha tatchuad g hemajkam mach has masma ab hejel si t‑tatchua. Idam gohk o baꞌich d i si haꞌichu mo hegai chehanig matt g haꞌichu t‑shoiga wo muꞌa k am wo iagchul Jiosh wui k haꞌichu si t‑eniga wo i dagito am Jiosh wui.”

column2: Jesus saw that he gave a thoughtful answer, and said, “You're not far from the kingdom of God.” After this no one was brave enough to ask him any more questions.
column3: Kutsh am i kah g Jesus mo s‑ap hab kaij k hab epai ahg, “Pi apki shaꞌi mehk ab Jiosh kownaltalig amjed.” Kutsh amjed hahawa pi hedai shaꞌi nako mas ab hu haꞌichu ep wo kakke.

column2: While Jesus was teaching in the Temple, he asked, “Why do the religious teachers state that Christ is the son of David?
column3: Kush am ha mashcham g Jesus geꞌe cheopi ch ed ch hab kaij, “Am g wo oidahim mas hedai d wo Jiosh si Kehshak. Chehanig em‑mashchamdam o em‑mashcham matsh heg d wo amjedkamk hegai t‑kownaligbad mash hab chehgig David.

column2: As David himself declared, inspired by the Holy Spirit, ‘The Lord said to my Lord, “Sit at my right hand until I put your enemies under your feet.” ’
column3: Kush wa eda g Davidbad hab aꞌaga ‘ni‑kownalig’ ch hab kaij g gewkdajkaj g Hekia S‑apꞌekam Gewkdag:

column2: Jesus continued to teach them, saying, “Beware of religious leaders! They love to walk around in long robes, to be greeted respectfully in the marketplaces.  They love to have the most important seats in the synagogues, and the best places at banquets.
column3: Sh hab kaij g Jesus, “Hegam mo d chehanig em‑mashchamdam o am si s‑apko dadhaiwup mam am e hehemapad ch si s‑kehg e enigadad ch an oiopo no pi si tatchua mamt ab wo si has ha elidad. S‑e g wo nenꞌoidad mamt pi hab wo masmak.

column2: They cheat widows out of what they own, and cover up the kind of people they really are with long-winded prayers. They will receive severe condemnation in the judgment.”
column3: Chum as si chew e hoꞌigeꞌidahun am em‑tahgio ch eda haꞌichu s‑aꞌagi ha wohppoꞌid hegam mo d heheꞌejel wihpkam. T g Jiosh baꞌich i s‑koꞌokam wo ha namkid heg hekaj pi ap ha‑chuꞌijig no pi wabsh pehegia e hoꞌigeꞌidahun.”

column2: Jesus sat down opposite the treasury collection box, watching people tossing in coins. Many of the rich were extravagantly throwing in a lot of money.
column3: Kutsh am dahiwua g Jesus miabidch g geꞌe cheopi. K ab e toꞌaw hegai lial mo hekaj e nuhkud g cheopi. Sh g Jesus am ha neid hegam mo am toꞌaw. Kush g s‑kakais shaꞌi si mumuꞌi am toꞌaw.

column2: Then a poor widow came along and put in just two small coins.
column3: Tsh am hema jiwia g hejel wiꞌikam oks k am hi wa al toa g gohk s‑wepegchu.

column2: He called his disciples together and told them, “I tell you the truth: this poor widow has put in more than all the rest together.  All of them gave from their wealth what they had, but she gave from her poverty what she didn't have. She put in all she had to live on.”
column3: Sh g Jesus am ha ahgid g e‑chuhchai, “Nehꞌe, hegam mo haꞌichu s‑edgid o hi wa baꞌich i mumuꞌi am toꞌaw. T wabshaba ihda al oks baꞌich i si haꞌichu hab juh nat pi am al toa wehs hegai mo haschu al i edgid.”

column2: As Jesus was leaving the Temple, one of his disciples said to him, “Teacher, look at these massive stones and magnificent buildings!”
column3: Kutsh gam hu hahawa i wuwha idam Jesus ab amjed g geꞌe cheopi. Kush idam hema hab kaij, “Nehꞌe, t‑mashchamdam, shoꞌo waꞌi si geꞌeged hohodaikaj in kihtas g geꞌe cheopi ch si s‑kehg hab mahs.”

column2: “You see all these great buildings?” Jesus replied. “Not one stone will be left on top of another. Everything will be torn down.”
column3: Kush hab kaij g Jesus, “Heuꞌu, nt wabshaba si shel wo em‑ahgi mo e aihim mat wehs wo i e shul ihda.”

column2: As Jesus sat on the Mount of Olives overlooking the Temple, Peter, James, John, and Andrew asked him in private,
column3: Tsh amjed gam hu hejelko hihi wehmaj g Jesus k ab i chehchsh Olive Uꞌus Kawulk t ab k ab dadhaiwua geꞌe cheopi wui. Kutsh idam Peter ch James ch John ch Andrew ab i hihi Jesus wui k hab ahg,

column2: “Tell us: when this will happen? What's the sign that all this is about to be fulfilled?”
column3: “Am g hig t‑ahgid mas hekid am hab wo i e juh hegai map am t‑ahgid. Kut haschu d wo chehgidak matt heg ab wo s‑mahchk moki e aihim.”

column2: Jesus began telling them, “Make sure no one deceives you.
column3: Kush am ha ahgid g Jesus, “Mt wo si s‑e nenꞌoidad mat pi hedai wo em‑iattogi.

column2: Many will come in my name claiming, ‘I am the Christ.’ They will deceive many people.
column3: Muꞌi at an wo i wuwha aꞌahidag oidam k ni‑wepo wo e chehcheg hab kaijch mo d Jiosh si Kehsha. Kut muꞌijj ab wo s‑ha wohoch.

column2: Don't be troubled when you hear of wars nearby and wars far away. These things must happen but this is not the end.  Nation will fight against nation, and kingdom against kingdom. There will be earthquakes in various places, and famines too. These are the beginnings of the world's birth pains.
column3: T g nahnko mahs hemajkam ch jejewed ab aꞌai wo i e checheggia. Mt wabshaba pi wo e totods. Hemho at hab wo wa e juh hab masma. K wabshaba pi hab d ahga mat e ai mat wo kuhgit. An at muꞌikpa wo uꞌugij g jewed. T g bihugig an ep wo gei muꞌikpa. Id at d wabsh wo shohshonajk g shoꞌigdag nat pi baꞌich wo i geꞌeda.

column2: Watch out for yourselves! They will hand you over to the courts to be tried. You will be beaten in synagogues. Because of me you will have to stand before governors and kings, and you will be witnesses to them.
column3: “Kumt wo s‑e nenꞌeidad namt pi wo em‑uꞌu k wo em‑lodait k am ep wo em‑uꞌapa kokownal ha wui heg hekaj mam ab ni‑hiwig. Mt wabshaba am wabsh wo ha ahgi g haꞌichu ni‑ahga.

column2: The good news must first be announced in every nation.
column3: T an wehsko wo i e ahgahi ihda s‑kehg haꞌichu ahgaj g Jiosh mat koi wo kuhgit g jewed.

column2: When they come to arrest you and put you on trial, don't worry what to say. Just say what you're told at that time, because it's not you speaking, but the Holy Spirit.
column3: Pi g has wo shaꞌi e tahkkad mams has wo chei mat hekid wo em‑uꞌapa k wo em‑lodai. Hekia S‑apꞌekam Gewkdag at ab wo i em‑ahgi mamt has wo chei.

column2: Brother will betray brother to death, and a father will betray his child. Children will turn against their parents and have them condemned to death.
column3: “Hahaꞌichu at wo em‑kokda. Kut ab ha wui wo em‑gagda chum hems g em‑wepnag o g em‑jehj o g em‑aꞌaliga.

column2: You will be hated by everyone because of me, but whoever endures until the end will be saved.
column3: Muꞌi hemajkam at wo s‑em‑kehꞌidad nam pi ab ni‑hiwig. Kumt wo sha e nakog k wo gahi wuwha g e‑shoꞌigdag. T g Jiosh ab wo i em‑wahpki e‑kihdag ed.”

column2: But when you see the ‘abomination of desolation’ standing where he should not be (let the reader understand), then those who are in Judea should run to the mountains.
column3: Kush hab ep kaij g Jesus, “Am g wo amichud mamt haschu in wo neꞌokchul Hegai kelibad Jiosh haꞌichu i tashogiddam Daniel at an oꞌoha mat g em‑obga am wo i kei g s‑uam haꞌichu ged hu si eda g geꞌe cheopi. Kut hemho wa am haha wo ahhio dohdaꞌag wui hegam mat ia wo haꞌichugk Judea jewed ch ed.

column2: Those who are on the roof—don't go back inside the house to get anything.  Those who are out in the fields—don't go home to get a coat.
column3: Kut pi hedai am hu wo shaꞌi chum i wah e‑kih ed k am wo haꞌichu ui, chum as hems imhab wo waꞌi oimmedad e‑kih wehgaj o am wo chikpanad oidag ch ed.

column2: How hard it will be for those who are pregnant or nursing at that time!
column3: S‑ta at ehbidam wo mahsk am ha wehhejed hegam mat wo chuꞌuchum mahmadk ch hegam mat wabsh wo kia woꞌok g ali.

column2: Pray that this won't happen during the winter.
column3: “Mt ab wo tahnid g Jiosh mat pi eda hab wo e juh ihda s‑hehpichꞌed.

column2: For these will be days of trouble like never before since the beginning of God's creation until now, and they won't ever come again.
column3: Baꞌich at d wo i si geꞌe shoꞌigdagk mo pi hekid g hemajkam shaꞌi neid ch pi hekid hab masma ep wo nei.

column2: If God doesn't cut short these days, no one will survive. However for the sake of those God has chosen, he has cut them short.
column3: Pi at hedai wo e nako mas am gahi wo wuhsh matp tash wo hih. T g Jiosh heg hekaj wo i shopolkai am ha wehhejed g e‑hemajkamga.

column2: So if anyone tells you, ‘Look, here is the Messiah,’ or ‘Look, there he is,’ don't believe it.
column3: “Pi g wo shaꞌi ha wohochud matp hema hab wo sha chei mo am hebai haꞌichug g Jiosh si Kehsha.

column2: For false Messiahs and false prophets will appear, and they will perform miraculous signs and wonders to deceive the chosen of God, if that were possible.
column3: Muꞌi at in wo i wuwhag k hab wo chei mo d ni‑ahni, Jiosh si Kehsha, o d Jiosh haꞌichu i tashogiddam k am hab wo wuad g si s‑hasig haꞌichu mat hekaj wo i chum ha wanchshul g Jiosh hemajkamga matp wo e nako.

column2: Watch out! I've told you everything before it happens.
column3: Ni wabshaba am heki hu em‑ahgid ihda mamt heg hekaj wo s‑e nenꞌeidad.”

column2: This is what will happen after those troubles: ‘The sun will become dark, the moon won't shine,
column3: Sh hab ep kaij, “T am wabsh wo i chum kuhgit hegai jewed shuhdgim shoꞌigdag.

column2: Learn a lesson from the fig tree. When its branches grow soft and send out leaves, you know that summer is near.
column3: “Nt wo haꞌichu em‑mashcha heg hekaj suhna uhs. Mt wo s‑mahchk mo g toniabkam e aihim mamt wo nei mat ab wo i iꞌiwgi.

column2: In the same way, when you see these things happening, you know that it's near—right outside the door!
column3: Pegih, mt hab waꞌap wo s‑mahchk mo e aihim mat wehs wo kuhgit mamt wo nei mat hab wo e juh hegai mani em‑ahgid.

column2: I tell you the truth, this generation won't come to an end until all these things have happened.
column3: Nt wo si shel em‑ahgi mat d wabsh wo kia dodakamk hegam mat wo nei ihda mani em‑ahgid mat hekid wehs wo kuhgit.

column2: Heaven and earth will come to an end, but my teachings will not.
column3: Neh, wehs at gam hu hab wo i e juh ihda Jiosh nahtoi mam in neid. T wabshaba g ni‑neꞌoki pi hekid gam hu hab wo i e juh.”

column2: No one knows the day or hour when this will happen—not even the angels in heaven, not even the Son; only the Father knows.
column3: Kush hab ep kaij, “Heg o waꞌi s‑mahch ni‑ohg Jiosh mant hekid ep wo jiwia. Pi o hedai ep s‑mahch, chum hems g anghil nih ahni mani d hi wa chum alidaj.

column2: Keep watch! Stay awake! For you don't know when this will happen.
column3: Kumt wo si s‑e nenꞌeidad ch ab wo neidachugad nam pi pi mahch mas hekid wo i k ihda.

column2: It's like a man who went away on a journey. He left his house, and gave each of his servants the authority to do what he told them. He told the doorkeeper to stay awake.
column3: K hab sha masma am em‑wehhejed matp hems hema wo ha hiwigi g e‑kihdag g e‑pionag k wo ha cheha mat has wo masmak hehemako k g kihjeg nuhkuddam ep wo cheha mat wo si s‑e nenꞌeidad k gam hu hahawa mehk jewed wui wo hih. T idam chum hekid wo s‑e nenꞌeidad no pi pi mahch mas hekid ep wo jiwia.

column2: So keep watch, because you don't know when the owner of the house is coming back. It may be in the evening, in the middle of the night, before dawn, or in the morning.  You don't want to be caught sleeping if he returns unexpectedly.
column3: Pegih, mt ahpim hab wa masma wo s‑e nenꞌeidad. Pi o ta machima am em‑wehhejed mas hebai hab wo i e juh g tash an aꞌai jejewed dahm mant hekid wo i uhpam jiwia.

column2: What I'm telling you, I'm telling everyone: Watch!”
column3: Kuni wehs hab s‑ha ahgidamk mani haschu hab em‑ahg mat hab waꞌap wo s‑e nenꞌeidad.”

column2: It was now two days before Passover and the Feast of Unleavened Bread. The chief priests and the religious leaders were trying to find a surreptitious way to arrest Jesus and have him killed.
column3: K eda gohk tash am wiꞌis matt wo wuhshad g t‑shohshon ha‑doꞌibiadag. Kush idam uꞌugchu papal ch chehanig t‑mashchamdam am chum e nakog mas has huꞌi masma s‑aꞌagim wo bei g Jesus k wo mua,

column2: “But not during Passover,” they said to themselves, “otherwise the people may riot.”
column3: ash am wabsh aꞌai e ahgid, “Hi wa pi am hu heg eda mat ia wo e hemapadch g hemajkam id hekaj piast. T wo am hu e babgachud k wo t‑cheggia.”

column2: Meanwhile Jesus was in Bethany, eating a meal at Simon the leper's home. A woman came in with an alabaster jar of very expensive pure nard perfume. She broke the jar open and poured the perfume on Jesus' head.
column3: Tsh am hu hebai am dada hegam Jesus Bethany t am. K am hema d kihkam mo hab chehgig Simon ch wa chum mumku heg hekaj mo g chuhkugaj wabsh muhkhim. Id atsh ab i ha waid k ha gegos. Sh am dadhak ch e gegosid. Tsh ab haha wabsh hema i wah g uwi g si s‑namkig s‑ap uhw shuhdagi waꞌigchugch am al s‑toa hodai haꞌa ch ed. K hab e aꞌaga ‘spikenard’ ihda shuhdagi. Kutsh am si hai g al haꞌa k an wehs iawua Jesus moꞌo dahm.

column2: Some of those who were there became annoyed and said, “Why waste this perfume?
column3: Kutsh haꞌi babgat am i neidok matsh has e juh k s‑juꞌujpij e wehm neneok ch ash hab kaij, “T wabsh heki e wua ihda s‑namkig haꞌichu.

column2: It could've been sold for a year's wages and the money given to the poor.” They were angry with her.
column3: Eda atp huꞌi chum waik siant pihsh wo nam sha e gagdak. T heg wo e hekaj ha wehhejed g shoꞌigkam.” Neh, bash kaij ch si s‑kehꞌid g uwi.

column2: But Jesus replied, “Leave her alone! Why are you criticizing her for doing something beautiful to me?
column3: Kush oi wa hab ha ahg g Jesus, “Pi g am wo shaꞌi kehꞌid ihda uwi. Si at s‑kehg haꞌichu hab juh am ni‑wehhejed.

column2: You'll always have the poor with you, and you can help them whenever you want. But you won't always have me with you.
column3: Chum o hekid ia em‑shahgid g shoꞌigkam. Kumt wabsh chum hekid wo i ha wehmt. Kunt ahni hi pi tash ia hu wo em‑shahgidk.

column2: She did what she could: she anointed my body in anticipation of my burial.
column3: T ihda uwi hab juh mat haschu i e nako mat am heki hu s‑ap juh ni‑chuhkug g ni‑muhkig wehhejed.

column2: I tell you the truth: wherever the good news is spread in the world, people will remember what she did.”
column3: Nt wo si shel em‑ahgi mat am wo e ahgahid mat haschu has ni‑juni mat hebai wo i e ahgahid g s‑kehg haꞌichu ahgaj g Jiosh.”

column2: Then Judas Iscariot, one of the twelve disciples, went to the chief priests and arranged to betray Jesus to them.
column3: Kutsh am ha hekaj ha dagito g Judas Iscariot k gam hu hih uꞌugchu papal ha wui hab ahgk matsh hegam ha wui wo gagda g Jesus.

column2: When they heard this, they were delighted, and promised to pay him. So Judas began to look for an opportunity to betray Jesus.
column3: Sh am si s‑hohhoꞌid ch kah idam mash has i kaij, ash ab si ahgid matsh wo namkid. Kutsh am hahawa si i e nako g Judas matsh hebai wo s‑apꞌek. Kutsh ab ha wui wo gagda.

column2: On the first day of the Feast of Unleavened Bread, the time when the Passover lamb is sacrificed, Jesus' disciples asked him, “Where do you want us to go and prepare the Passover meal for you?”
column3: T am hahawa s‑ap i e ai hegai t‑shohshonbad ha‑doꞌibiadag piast. K id eda pi e koꞌa hegai pahn mo jewajidas. K d wehpeg tash mat eda wo e kokda g kahwal mahmad. Sh g Jesus chuhchai ab wui hab kaij, “Bahp hab elid matt am wo huh g ha‑doꞌibiadag gegosig?”

column2: He sent two of his disciples, telling them, “Go into the city and there you'll meet a man carrying a water pot. Follow him,
column3: Kutsh am hahawa gohk hab ha ah, “Am amt wo hihi Jerusalem wui. T ab hema wo himad g cheoj ch wo waꞌigchugad ab haꞌa t ab.

column2: and when he goes into a house, ask the owner where I and my disciples can celebrate the Passover.
column3: Kumt am wo i oi. T am hu hebai wo him k am wo i wah hema kih ed. Kumt hab wo chei ab kihkam wui, ‘Neh, s‑mahchimk o g t‑mashchamdam mas an hebai i ha wiꞌis matt wo wuhshad g t‑shohshon ha‑doꞌibiadag.’

column2: He will take you to a large upstairs room that is furnished and ready. You can make preparations for us there.”
column3: Kut am wo hema em‑chehgi g kih. T id gan hu ha‑kih dahm hab wo chuꞌigk ch wo geꞌejk ch am wo apchudask. Kumt an haꞌab wo i apꞌech g t‑gegosig.”

column2: The disciples went into the city, and found things just as he'd described them. They prepared the Passover meal.
column3: Kutsh wa woho am hihi idam gohk k ged hu dada kihhim ch ed. Tsh wa woho s‑ap am hab e juh mash has i ha ahg. Kutsh am i apꞌech g gegosig.

column2: In the evening Jesus went there with the twelve disciples.
column3: Tsh am i hud. Tsh am hahawa dada hegam Jesus k am hu dadhaiwua k e gegosid.

column2: While they were sitting eating, Jesus said, “I tell you the truth: one of you is going to betray me; one who is eating with me now.”
column3: Sh hab haha wabsh kaij g Jesus, “M ant wo si shel em‑ahgi mat oi am hab wo e juh mamt hema wo ni‑gagda ahpim mam ab si ni‑wecho e mashcham.”

column2: They were shocked, and they each asked, “It's not me, is it?”
column3: Kutsh wehsijj pi ap e taht k gan hu hab i cheꞌiatahi, “Ih, hi wa pi ahni.”

column2: “It's one of the Twelve, one of you sharing this food with me,” he replied.
column3: Kush hab kaij g Jesus, “Heg at hab wo juh mat hedai am ni‑wehm wo wakch g chemait hidod ch ed.

column2: “The Son of man will die, just as the Scriptures predicted. But how terrible it will be for the man who betrays the Son of man! It would be better for that man if he'd never been born.”
column3: Bant masma wo ni‑muhkid mo has masma heki hu oꞌohanas Jiosh oꞌohana ed mat g si Kehshaj wo e muhkid. T wabshaba wo si s‑koꞌokam e namkid hegai mat wo ni‑gagda. Baꞌich at wo i chum s‑apꞌek heg wehhejed mat hems wabsh pi wo chum mahsi.”

column2: As they were eating, Jesus picked up some bread. He blessed it, and gave it to them. “Take it. This is my body,” he told them.
column3: Sh am wabsh kia e gegosid. Tsh g Jesus am bei g chemait k ab hoꞌigeꞌel g Jiosh k am hahawa i hahain k an i ha mah k hab kaij, “Oi g wo huhgi ihda. Do ni‑honshpadag.”

column2: Then he picked up the cup. He blessed it, and gave it to them. They all drank from it.
column3: Tsh am hahawa bei g tahsa k ab ep hoꞌigeꞌel g Jiosh k ab ha mah. Kutsh wehsijj ab ih.

column2: “This is my blood,” he told them, “the covenant that's being poured out for many.
column3: Kush hab ha ahg, “Do ni‑ehꞌed ihda nawait. Id ani hab ahgch hab kaij mant wo ni‑muhkid am em‑wehhejed. T g ni‑ehꞌed wo e iawua. T g Jiosh heg hekaj am hab wo juh hegai mo wa hab kaij matsh hab wo em‑juni.

column2: I tell you the truth, I won't drink of the fruit of the vine until the day I drink it fresh in God's kingdom.”
column3: Ia o i s‑apꞌe. Kunt pi hekid em‑wehm hab ep wo juh ihda k wabshaba em‑wehm wo si s‑hehgigk Jiosh kihdag ed.”

column2: After they had sung a psalm, they left for the Mount of Olives.
column3: Neh, kutsh am hahawa kuhgit am hema ahgk g mihshmda neꞌi k am i wuwhag k gam hu hihi Olive Uꞌus Kawulk wui.

column2: “All of you will abandon me,” Jesus told them. “For as the Scriptures say, ‘I will attack the shepherd, and the sheep will be completely scattered.’
column3: Kush hab ha ahg g Jesus, “An o oꞌohanas mo hab kaij g Jiosh:

column2: “I won't abandon you even if everyone else does,” Peter replied.
column3: Kush g Peter hab kaij, “Ahni ant hi pi hekid wo shaꞌi m‑dagito, chum as wehsijj wo m‑dagito idam.”

column2: Jesus answered him, “I tell you the truth that today, this very night, before the rooster crows twice, you will deny that you even know me three times.”
column3: Sh hab kaij g Jesus ab wui, “Nt wo si shel m‑ahgi mat koi gokko wo kuhu g chuchul id i chuhug ab, kupt eda heki hu waikko hab wo waꞌi chei map pi shaꞌi ni‑mahch.”

column2: But Peter was totally adamant, saying, “Even if I have to die with you, I will never deny you.” All of them said the same.
column3: Kutsh am wa si e gewkai g Peter, ash hab si kaij, “Pi ant hekid hab wo shaꞌi chei manis pi m‑mahch, chum anis wo ni‑muhkid m‑wehm.” Kush wehsijj hab waꞌap kaij.

column2: They arrived at a place called Gethsemane, where Jesus told his disciples, “Sit here while I go and pray.”
column3: Kutsh ged hu dada heg ab oidag mo hab e aꞌaga Gethsemane. Sh pi am hu ha wehmaj g Judas Iscariot. Kush hab ha ahg g Jesus, “Ia g hu wo i dadhak. Nt ahni am baꞌich wo i him k wo ni‑hoꞌigeꞌidahu.”

column2: He took Peter, James, and John with him. He began to be very disturbed and troubled.
column3: Bash kaij ch am ha uꞌuk g Peter ch James ch John. Tsh idam gam hu oi.

column2: Jesus told them, “My agony is so painful it feels like I'm dying. Please, remain here and stay awake.”
column3: ch hab kaij ab ha wui, “Ab at wabsh i si ni‑shuhd g pi ap tahhadkam ch s‑ni‑mukima tahhadchud. Ia g wabsh wo dadk ch wo haꞌichu si nenashanad.”

column2: He went a little farther on and then fell to the ground. He prayed, asking to be spared the time that was coming, if it were possible. “Abba, Father! You can do everything,” he said. “Please, take this cup of suffering away from me. Yet it's not what I want, but what you want.”
column3: Tsh g Jesus gam hu hahawa him k am i gei jewedo k hab kaij ab Jiosh wui, “Ni‑ohg, wehs haꞌichu o pi shaꞌi hasig am m‑wehhejed. Pt wo e nako mapt im hu hab wo i juh hegai si s‑koꞌok shoꞌigdag mo ab ni‑wui him. Kuni eda tatchua mat ahpi g m‑tatchui hab wo e juh.”

column2: Then Jesus returned and found the disciples asleep. “Simon, are you sleeping?” he asked Peter. “Couldn't you stay awake for just an hour?
column3: Tsh am hahawa uhpam ep jiwia ha wui hegam waik. Kush am kohksh. Sh hab kaij ab wui g Peter, “Simon, pi aptki shaꞌi e nako maps am hu i hemako ohla ab wo s‑nenashank,”

column2: Stay awake, and pray so you won't fall into temptation. The spirit is willing, but the body is weak.”
column3: ch ab wehs ha wui hab kaij, “Si g wo haꞌichu nenashanad ch ab wo tai g Jiosh g gewkdag mamt pi am hu wo shul pi apꞌekam ch ed. Chum am hi wa g s‑apꞌekam hab elid ch eda pi e nakog.”

column2: He left them once more, and prayed, saying the same things.
column3: Bash kaij ch amjed gam hu hahawa ep him k heg hab kaij ab Jiosh wui matsh wehpeg

column2: Then he returned, and again he found them sleeping because they couldn't keep their eyes open.  They didn't know what to say!
column3: ch am hahawa uhpam ep jiwia ha wui. Kush ep si kohksh ch pi shaꞌi nenashani ch pi shaꞌi mahch mas has wo chei ab wui.

column2: He returned a third time, and asked them, “Are you still asleep? Are you still resting? Well that's enough, because the time has come! Look, the Son of man is about to be betrayed into the hands of sinners.
column3: Ash d i waikkokam, tsh am ep jiwia ha wui. Kush ep si kohksh. Kush hab kaij, “Kumtki ep kohk k e uhꞌulinihogid. T eda e ai mamt ni‑gagda k am wo i ni‑dagito ha wui g pi apꞌekam hemajkam ahni Jiosh si Kehsha.

column2: Get up! Let's go! See, here comes my betrayer.”
column3: Oi g wo wahpamigi. Tt wo hihi. Neh, ia at hu jiwia hegai mat ni‑gagda.”

column2: Just as he was saying this, Judas—one of the twelve disciples—arrived with a mob carrying swords and clubs, sent by the chief priests, religious leaders, and elders.
column3: Sh am wabsh kia neok. Tsh am jiwia g Judas. Kush shaꞌi si muꞌijj am wehmaj haꞌijj g iꞌis‑papayo uhꞌukch ch haꞌijj g uꞌus. Idam atsh g uꞌugchu papal ch chehanig t‑mashchamdam ch geꞌeged am ha cheha matsh am wo hihim k wo bei.

column2: Now the betrayer had arranged a sign with them: “He's the one that I kiss. Arrest him, and take him away under guard.”
column3: Kush eda g Judas heki hu ha ahgid idam mo am wehmaj matsh ab wo chintad g Jesus kahmaj ab. Tsh hab masma wo s‑mahchk mat hedai an wo bei.

column2: Judas went right up to Jesus. “Rabbi,” he said, and kissed him affectionately.
column3: Tsh am wabsh i chum jiwia g Judas k wabsh shel i hih ab Jesus wui k hab kaij, “Ni‑mashchamdam.” Neh, bash kaij ch ab chintad.

column2: So they grabbed hold of Jesus and arrested him.
column3: Tsh ab haꞌi hihim k an bei g Jesus k gan hu si s‑wihnam uꞌukch.

column2: But one of those standing there pulled out his sword and struck the high priest's servant, cutting off his ear.
column3: Kutsh hema hegam chuhchaij am i wuhshad g e‑ispahyo k ab si gehg g neholigaj g uhgchu pahl k an si hikuch g nahkaj.

column2: “Am I some kind of rebel that you have come to arrest me with swords and clubs?” Jesus asked them.  “I was there with you, teaching in the Temple every day. Why didn't you arrest me then? But this is happening to fulfill the Scriptures.”
column3: Sh g Jesus hab ha ahg idam hemajkam, “Wehs tashkaj ani am dahiwup ch ha mashcham geꞌe cheopi t am. Kumt pi an hu ni‑be k wabshaba hahawa ia dada an uhꞌukch g iꞌis‑papayo ch uꞌus mamt wo ni‑bei. Pegih, bat wa masma an heki hu oꞌoha g kekelibad Jiosh haꞌichu i tashogiddam mant hab masma wo ni‑behij mat g pi ap hemajkam.” Neh, bash kaij g Jesus.

column2: Then all Jesus' disciples deserted him and ran away.
column3: Kutsh am hahawa wehsijj wabsh i dagito hegam chuhchaij k gam hu si aꞌai wohp.

column2: (One of his followers was a young man who was wearing only a linen garment.
column3: Sh an hema oidahim g Jesus ch d wabsh wechij oꞌodham ch heg waꞌi sawanokaj e hobinodch. Kutsh an chum bei g shondal.

column2: They seized hold of him, but he ran off naked, leaving the garment behind.)
column3: Tsh am wabsh i dagito g e‑sawano k gam hu si meh ab wabsh i s‑dahpkch.

column2: They took Jesus to the high priest's house where all the chief priests, elders, and religious teachers had gathered.
column3: Kumtsh am i bei g Jesus heg kih wui uhgchu pahl. Kush eda am e hemapdahim g uꞌugchu papal ch geꞌeged ch chehanig t‑mashchamdam.

column2: Peter followed him at a distance, and went into the courtyard of the high priest's house. He sat down with the guards and warmed himself by the fire.
column3: Sh g Peter ga hu wabsh mehkjed ha oid ch am i wah kolhai ch ed. Sh am ge nahdch g shondal. Kush am ha wehm e huhkalid g Peter.

column2: Inside the chief priests and the whole governing council were trying to find some evidence to have Jesus put to death, but they couldn't find anything.
column3: Kush eda idam e jehnigiddam am i chum haꞌichu gahg mat ab wo abch g Jesus mat heg hekaj wo mua.

column2: Many were giving false testimony against him, but their statements didn't agree.
column3: Muꞌijj ash ab haꞌichu chum abchud mash pi shaꞌi woho ch oi wa pi shaꞌi e wepo haꞌichu ahg.

column2: Some of them got up to speak falsely against Jesus.
column3: Kutsh am hahawa haꞌi gegokiwua k hab kaij,

column2: “We heard him say, ‘I will destroy this Temple that human hands built, and in three days I will build another without hands.’ ”
column3: “Kah ach mo hab kaij. ‘Nt wo padch ihda geꞌe cheopi mat g oꞌodham hab juh k hema ep wo nahto waik tash ab mat pi d wo oꞌodham nahtoik.’ ”

column2: But even so their testimony didn't agree.
column3: Kush idam hab waꞌap pi shaꞌi e wepot g haꞌichu ha‑ahga.

column2: Then the high priest stood up in front of the council, and asked Jesus, “Have you nothing to say in response to these charges made against you?”
column3: Kutsh g si uhgchu pahl am i kekiwua ha shahgid k ab kakke g Jesus, “Napt pi am hu has wo shaꞌi chei id amjed mo haschu ab m‑abchud idam?”

column2: But Jesus remained silent and didn't answer. So the high priest asked again, “Are you the Messiah, the Son of the Blessed One?”
column3: Kush oi wa pi am hu has shaꞌi ha kaij g Jesus.

column2: “I am,” Jesus replied, “and you will see the Son of man sitting on the right of the Mighty One, and coming with the clouds of heaven.”
column3: Kush hab kaij g Jesus, “Dani ahni. T g Jiosh am wo e chehgi mo ab si has ni‑elid an s‑apkojed e‑hugid an ni‑dahshk e‑kownal daikud ed. T ab wo i e ai mant ab wo i hud chewagi ch ed k am ep wo jiwia jewed dahm. Kumt wehsijj wo s‑mai mani d Jiosh si Kehsha.”

column2: The high priest tore his clothes and asked, “Why do we need any more witnesses?
column3: Kutsh g uhgchu pahl ab si wantsh g e‑eniga hab elidch mo pi ap neok k hab kaij, “Pi ach hedai ep shaꞌi tatchua mas am wo ah g chuꞌijigaj.

column2: You have heard the blasphemy! What's your reaction?”
column3: Am am wa kah g pi kehg neꞌokij. Shahm i elid?”

column2: Then some of them began to spit on him. They blindfolded him, hit him with their fists, and said, “Why don't you prophesy then, you ‘Prophet’!” The guards took him away and beat him up.
column3: Kutsh haꞌijj ab si siswuimad g Jesus. Mtsh ab hahawa si maꞌishk wuh g wuhpuij k ab si shonikkash ch hab ahg, “Am g hig t‑ahgid mas hedai ab m‑shonikka.” Tsh g shondal am hahawa be k ab si s‑kapnim shonikkash.

column2: Meanwhile Peter was down below in the courtyard. One of the high priest's servant-girls passed by,
column3: Sh eda g Peter am daha kih bahsho. Kutsh am hema jiwia g uwi piongaj g uhgchu pahl.

column2: and seeing Peter warming himself, looked straight at him and said, “You were with Jesus of Nazareth too!”
column3: Sh am daha g Peter ch e huhkalid. Tsh id ab si i neid k hab kaij, “Ahpi ap ep wehmaj hegai Jesus.”

column2: But he denied it. “I don't know what you're talking about or what you mean,” he replied. Then he went out to the forecourt, and a rooster crowed.
column3: Kutsh pi mahch k e ah g Peter hab kaijch, “Pi ani shaꞌi mahch ch pi amichud maps haschu hab ahg,” neh, k gam hu ha hekaj hih mash am haꞌi gegok kolhai kihjeg t ab. Kush eda kuhu g keli chuchul.

column2: Seeing him there, the servant girl repeated to those standing around, “This man is one of them!”
column3: Tsh am ep cheh g Peter hegai ha‑pionag k hab kaij am ha wui hegam mash an gegok, “Id o d ep hema hegam Jesus.”

column2: Once more Peter denied it. A little while later they said to Peter again, “You're definitely one of them because you're a Galilean too!”
column3: Kutsh ep pi e edagi g Peter.

column2: Peter began calling down curses on himself and he swore, “I don't know this man who you're talking about.”
column3: Kutsh g Peter am ha hekaj si ha ahgi, “Pi ani shaꞌi mahch ihda oꞌodham mam an aꞌaga. T g Jiosh wo si ni‑jehkaꞌich mantp em‑iattogid.”

column2: Immediately the rooster crowed the second time. Then Peter remembered what Jesus had said to him: “Before the rooster crows twice, you will deny me three times.” When he realized what he'd done, he burst into tears.
column3: Kutsh am ha hekaj gokko kuhu g keli chuchul. Tsh g Peter am wabsh si i chegito mash wa hab kaij g Jesus, “Koi at gokko wo kuhu g chuchul kupt eda heki hu waikko hab wo chei map pi shaꞌi ni‑mahch.” Tsh wabsh wohoꞌi pi ap e taht k s‑jupij shoak.

column2: Early the next morning, the chief priest, elders, and religious teachers—the whole governing council—came to a decision. They had Jesus bound and sent him to be handed over to Pilate.
column3: Tsh am wabsh i chum mahsi. Tsh am ep e nam hegam uꞌugchu papal ch geꞌeged ch chehanig t‑mashchamdam mo d e jehnigiddam k atsh am i mamche mat has hahawa ep wo e juh. Tsh am i kuhgit g ha‑namki. Kutsh am si maniadad g Jesus nohnhoi k gam hu be k am uꞌapa heg wui mo d kownal ch hab chehgig Pilate ab abchudch mo chum e kownalchud.

column2: Pilate asked him, “Are you the King of the Jews?”
column3: Kush ihda Pilate ab kakke g Jesus, “No wa woho mapsh hab chum e elid map d ha‑kownalig idam Tutuligo hemajkam?”

column2: The chief priests kept on making many accusations against him.
column3: Sh g uꞌugchu papal muꞌi haꞌichu ab abchud. Sh pi am hu has shaꞌi kaij g Jesus.

column2: Pilate questioned him again, “Aren't you going to answer? See how many charges they're bringing against you!”
column3: Sh g Pilate ab ep kakke, “Neh, muꞌi haꞌichu o ab m‑abchud. Napt pi am hu has wo shaꞌi chei ab amjed?”

column2: But Jesus didn't give any more answers, much to Pilate's surprise.
column3: Kush ep pi am hu has shaꞌi ha kaij g Jesus. Tsh g Pilate si has i e taht heg hekaj.

column2: Now it was Pilate's custom at the Passover feast to release a prisoner to the people, whoever they requested.
column3: K am hab e wua ahid ab id eda gegosig mo g kownal am hema i dadagitod g lihso am ha wehhejed g hemajkam.

column2: One of the prisoners was a man called Barabbas who belonged to a group of rebels who had committed murder during an uprising.
column3: Kush eda am haꞌi kuhpi g lilso matsh haꞌi ha kokda am i chum wushshadch g kownal. Sh hema hab chehgig idam Barabbas.

column2: The crowd went to Pilate and asked him to release a prisoner following his usual custom.
column3: Kutsh g hemajkam ab i kakke g Pilate matsh am hab hig wo ha juni hegai mash chum hekid am hab ha wuijid.

column2: “Do you want me to release to you the King of Jews?” he asked them,
column3: Sh g Pilate ab ha kakke, “Pegih, nam hab elid mant id am wo i dagito am em‑wehhejed mash d em‑kownalig?” nash pi chum s‑dagitoimk g Jesus

column2: for he realized that it was because of their jealousy of Jesus that the chief priests had handed Jesus over to him.
column3: ch hab ha elid mo d waꞌi idam uꞌugchu papal ch s‑hehgamk ch s‑muꞌamk.

column2: But the chief priests stirred up the crowd to have him release Barabbas to them instead.
column3: Kutsh wabshaba g uꞌugchu papal am i ha cheha g hemajkam matsh hab wo chei matsh g Barabbas wo e dagito. Kutsh wa woho am hab e juh.

column2: “Then what should I do with the one you call the King of the Jews?” he asked them.
column3: Kush hab ep kaij g Pilate, “Pegih, kunt has wo juh ihda oꞌodham mam hab aꞌaga mo d em‑kownalig?”

column2: “Crucify him!” they shouted back.
column3: Kush si s‑kaidam hab kaij g hemajkam, “Muꞌani ab kots t ab!”

column2: “Why? What crime has he committed?” Pilate asked them.
column3: Kutsh hab chum chei g Pilate, “Haschu ahg? Shahchu at hig pi ap has juh?”

column2: Wanting to please the mob, Pilate released Barabbas to them. First he had Jesus flogged and then handed him over to be crucified.
column3: Kush g Pilate tatchua mat wo s‑hohhoꞌi g hemajkam ch atsh heg hekaj am i dagito g Barabbas am ha wui k am ha cheha g shondal mat am wo gewitta g Jesus. Kumtsh wa woho hab juh. Tsh am hahawa ha wui dagito matsh gam hu wo be k ab wo naggia kots t ab.

column2: The soldiers took him away into the Praetorium  courtyard, where they called out the whole cohort.
column3: Kutsh gam hu hahawa i bei g shondal g Jesus kownal geꞌe kih am k am wehs ha wai g e‑wehm shondal.

column2: They put royal purple robes on him and made a crown of thorns that they placed on him.
column3: Kutsh am i e hemapad k nahnko wua. Msh wa ab abchud mash chum e kownalchud. Pegih, tsh ab wahki g kownal eniga k ge hoꞌi gihkot k ab wahki moꞌoj ab.

column2: Then they saluted him, saying, “Hail King of the Jews!”
column3: Kush hab wabsh s‑ahgamk ch hab kaij, “Tash g d ha‑kownaligk g Tutuligo hemajkam.”

column2: They repeatedly beat him around the head with a rod, spat at him, and fell on their knees before him as if in worship.
column3: Tsh haꞌi an si gewitta moꞌoj an g uhskaj k ab siswuimad k ab wui i shul pehegia ab has elidch.

column2: After they finished mocking him, they took off the purple robes, and put his own clothes back on him. Then they led him away to be crucified.
column3: Kumtsh am i haꞌasa nahnkogid k am si wuahawua hegai kownal eniga k ab uhpam wahki g enigaj k gam hu hahawa i bei mat ab wo naggia kots t ab.

column2: They forced a passer-by, Simon of Cyrene, who was coming from the countryside, to carry his cross. Simon was the father of Alexander and Rufus.
column3: D ab hema i ha nam g oꞌodham ch ab him Jerusalem wui ch ash hab chehgig Simon. Id ad an bei g shondal k ab kushwiotach hegai kots mamt ab ab wo naggia g Jesus. Ihda Simon ash ab d kihkam Cyrene kihhim t ab ch d ha‑ohg idam Alexander ch Rufus.

column2: They brought Jesus to the place called Golgotha, which means “the Place of the Skull.”
column3: Kumd gam hu i bei g Jesus mam am ha nahngia. K hab e aꞌaga amai Golgotha mo id hab d ahga Koshwak.

column2: They offered him wine mixed with myrrh, but he refused it.
column3: Kumd am chum iꞌich g nawait ch kulani mat wo hehogih g s‑koꞌok. Kud pi shaꞌi ih g Jesus.

column2: Then they crucified him. They divided his clothes, and threw dice to decide who would have what.
column3: Kumd ab hahawa sisish kots t ab k am kei g kots. D am haꞌi e chichwi g shondal k wo nei mas hedai haschu wo bei g haꞌichu enigaj.

column2: It was nine in the morning when they crucified him.
column3: K eda ga hu i juhk madki heki hu e ai g humukt ohla mamd ab naggia kots t ab.

column2: A sign with the written charge against him read: “The King of the Jews.”
column3: D an oꞌohanas g ha‑abchuda ab dahm mo ab i moꞌokch g Jesus ch hab chuꞌig, “Id o d ha‑Kownalig g Tutuligo Hemajkam.”

column2: They crucified two criminals with him, one on his left and one on his right.
column3: Kumd gohk ab ep ha nahngia kokots t ab gan hu aꞌai. Sh eda d s‑chu eꞌeskam idam. [
Kum hab masma am chehgidch mam hab elid mo g Jesus hab waꞌap d pi ap hemajkam. Neh, heki o hu an oꞌohanas Jiosh oꞌohana ed mat id am hab wo e juh.]

column2: People passing by shouted insults at him, shaking their heads, and saying. “Aha! You who claimed you were going to destroy the Temple and rebuild it in three days;
column3: D hegam mo am bihbimhim nahnko ahg ch hab ahg, “Naptsh woho wo i wua g geꞌe cheopi k am uhpam ep wo i kei waik tash ab?

column2: save yourself and come down from the cross!”
column3: Pegih, ab g hig i huduni kots t amjed k wo e doꞌibia maptp wo e nako.”

column2: Likewise the chief priests and the religious teachers made fun of him, saying to each other, “He saved others, but he can't save himself.
column3: D g uꞌugchu papal ch chehanig t‑mashchamdam am hab waꞌap nahnko ahg hab kaijch ab aꞌai e wui, “Id atsh haꞌi ha doꞌibia k atki wabshaba pi wo e nako mas wo hejel e doꞌibia.

column2: If he really is the Messiah, the King of Israel, then why doesn't he come down from the cross so we can see and believe!” Even those who were crucified with him insulted him.
column3: Nash hig pi woho d Jiosh si Kehsha ch d t‑kownalig? Pegih, tt ab wo s‑wohoch matp ab wo i huduni k wo e doꞌibia.” D hegam ehp mad ab wehmaj nahngia hab waꞌap nahnko ahg.

column2: At noon darkness fell over the whole land until three in the afternoon.
column3: D am i dahm juh. D wehsko gei g s‑chuhugam waik ohla ab.

column2: At three o'clock Jesus cried out, “Eloi, Eloi, lama sabachthani,” which means, “My God, my God, why have you abandoned me?”
column3: D am i e ai g waik ohla. D si s‑kaidam hab kaij g Jesus, “Eloi, Eloi, lama sabaktani.” Id o hab d ahga, “Ni‑Jioshga, ni‑Jioshga, pt haschu ahgk wabsh ni‑dagito?”

column2: Some of those standing there heard this, and said, “He's calling for Elijah.”
column3: D haꞌijj hab kaij hegam mad am gegok, “Nehꞌe, Elijabad o ab chum waid.”

column2: One man ran and filled a sponge with vinegar, put it on a stick, and tried to give it to Jesus to drink. “Leave him alone,” he said. “Let's see if Elijah will come to take him down.”
column3: Kud am hema med k an haꞌichu usko mad am wakch nawait ch ed k am uhgk i be k ab chum iꞌich g Jesus k hab chei, “Kia koi, tt hig wo nei mas ia wo jiwia g Elijabad k ab wo i huduni.”

column2: Then Jesus groaned loudly, and died.
column3: Kud am si s‑kaidam haꞌichu hab ep chei g Jesus k am hahawa i muh.

column2: The Temple veil was ripped in two from top to bottom.
column3: Kutsh hegai s‑kowk ikus kuhpadag mash am s‑tadnim naggia ged hu si eda g geꞌe cheopi ab si shel e wantsh.

column2: When the centurion standing there in front of Jesus saw how he died, he said, “This man was truly the Son of God.”
column3: D hegai moki d shondal ha‑geꞌejig gahab kehk kots wui ch am kah g Jesus ch am neid mat has masma muh ch hab kaij, “Ihda oki si s‑wohom d alidaj g Jiosh.”

column2: Some women were watching from a distance including Mary Magdalene, Mary the mother of James the younger and Joses, and Salome.
column3: D ga hu sha mehkjed g uꞌuwi ab haꞌi neid mat haschu has e juh. Haꞌi idam o d Salome ch Mary Magdalene ch hegai Mary mo d ha‑jeꞌe idam James ch Joses.

column2: They had followed Jesus and had taken care of him while he was in Galilee. Many other women who had come with him to Jerusalem were also there.
column3: Idam waik ash am wehmaj oiopohim g Jesus ch haꞌichukaj i wehmt mo eda gam hu oimmelhim Galilee chekshani ch ed. Kud muꞌi idam uꞌuwi am wehmaj ab i hihi g Jesus Jerusalem wui.

column2: It was Friday, the day before the Sabbath. When evening came,  Joseph of Arimathea, a member of the governing council who was himself waiting for the kingdom of God, had the courage to go to Pilate and ask for Jesus' body.
column3: D am haꞌichug hegai e jehnigiddam mo ab Arimathea t amjed ch hab chehgig Joseph. Id o si s‑ap d oꞌodham ch ab s‑neidamk g Jiosh kownaltalig. D eda e aihim mat wo i hud. Kuchd eda am chum t‑nakog matt baꞌich i tash wo chum t‑mihshmad. D heg hekaj am hih ihda Joseph k atsh ab tai g kownal g Jesus honshpadag.

column2: Pilate was surprised that Jesus had died so soon, so he summoned the centurion and asked him if Jesus had already died.
column3: Kush g Pilate hab kaij, “A nat wa s‑wohom heki hu i muh?” atsh am hahawa wai g shondal ha‑geꞌejig.

column2: Once he had confirmation from the centurion, Pilate gave permission for Joseph to take the body.
column3: Sh id hab kaij mat heki hu muh.

column2: Joseph bought a linen sheet. Then he took Jesus' body down from the cross and wrapped it in the sheet, and placed it in a tomb that had been cut out of rock. Then he rolled a heavy stone up against the entrance.
column3: Kutsh g Joseph am him k am ha nolawt g si s‑kehg ikus k am ep jiwia. Kumd am wehhejed ab i huduni g Jesus honshpadag. K am mia hab chuꞌig g hihaꞌini ch ab heki hu cheotas hodai ch ed. Kumd am i be k ged hu heg eda cheh am i hobinodk heg hekaj s‑kehg ikus. Kumd ab hahawa kuh g geꞌe hodaikaj.

column2: Mary Magdalene and Mary the mother of Joses were watching where he was laid.
column3: D g Mary Magdalene ch hegai Mary mo d ha‑jeꞌe g James ch Joses am wa neid mad hebai e cheh.

column2: Once the Sabbath had ended, Mary Magdalene, Mary the mother of James, and Salome bought aromatic ointments so that they could go and anoint Jesus' body.
column3: Kud am bij g shahwai machd eda t‑mihshmad. Kutsh am hahawa hihi g Salome ch Mary Magdalene ch hegai hema Mary k am ha nolawt g si s‑ap uhwchu matsh hekaj wo huhu g muhki.

column2: Very early Sunday morning, just at sunrise, they went to the tomb.  They were asking each other, “Who will roll away the stone for us from the entrance to the tomb?”
column3: Wabsh i siꞌalim mo e aihim g domig, tsh gam hu hihi idam hihaꞌini wui k am neneokhim ch hab kaij, “Kus hedai t‑wehhejed gam hu wo i nuꞌichkwua hegai hodai mat ab hekaj e kuh g cheo?” Tsh ab i chesh g tash matsh eda ged hu dada.

column2: But when they arrived and looked, they saw that the very large, heavy stone had already been rolled away.
column3: Tsh chum nei matsh heki hu in hu hab i e nuꞌichkwua.

column2: When they went into the tomb, they saw a young man sitting on the right, wearing a long white robe. They became very frightened.
column3: Tsh am i wahp. Kush inhab hema dak ch hab sha mahs mo g wechij oꞌodham. Sh g enigaj wabsh si s‑toa. Kutsh si e totods g uꞌuwi.

column2: “Don't be frightened,” he told them. “You are looking for Jesus the Nazarene, the one who was crucified. He is risen from the dead. He is not here.
column3: Sh wabshaba hab ha ahg, “Pi g am wo shaꞌi e totodsid. M ani wa s‑mahch mam g Jesus chuhkug chum gahghim. Am g wo neid mo pi ia hu haꞌichug iia mat ia e woi. Uhpam at ep i wuhsh muhkig t amjed.

column2: Look, this is the place where they laid him to rest. Now go, and tell his disciples and Peter that he's going ahead of you to Galilee. You will see him there just as he told you.”
column3: Kumt gam hu wo hihim k wo ha ahgi g chuhchaij, chum wa g Peter, mat uhpam e chegito k gam hu wo hih Galilee wui. Mt gm hu wo hihim k am haꞌab wo nei.” Neh, bash kaij g anghil.

column2: They left and ran from the tomb, shaking and confused. They said nothing to anyone because they were too scared.
column3: Kutsh i wuwhag k gam hu uhpam wohp pi hedai shaꞌi ha ahgidch wohg oidch nash pi si e totodsid.

column2: When Jesus rose from the dead on Sunday morning, he appeared first of all to Mary Magdalene, from whom he'd driven out seven demons.
column3: Pi atsh wa koi mahsi domig tash matsh eda e chegito g Jesus. Tsh ab i chesh g tash. Kutsh amjed am i e chehgi Mary Magdalene wui si wehpeg. Dash ihda matsh wa ab amjed i ha wuwhas g wewaꞌak jijawul.

column2: She went and told those who had been with him as they mourned and cried.
column3: Kutsh am hahawa ha wui hih g Mary hegam mash am wehmajkahim g Jesus. Sh eda am si pi ap e tahtk ch shoani idam. Kush hab ahg matki e chegito.

column2: When they heard that Jesus was alive and that she had seen him, they didn't believe it.
column3: Sh wabshaba pi shaꞌi wohochud.

column2: Later Jesus appeared in a different form to two other disciples who'd left to go to the countryside.
column3: Sh am i dahm haꞌi gam hu hasko hihimad ch d gohk. Tsh g Jesus gawul masma am i e chehgi ha wui.

column2: They returned and told the others, but they didn't believe them either.
column3: Kutsh idam am uhpam ep hihim k ged hu wehs ha ahgi g chuhchaij. Kush pi shaꞌi ha wohochud.

column2: After this he appeared to the eleven disciples as they were eating. He rebuked them for their lack of trust and their stubbornness, because they had not believed those who'd seen him after he had risen.
column3: Tsh am hahawa i e chehgi g Jesus hegam ha wui gamai hemako e‑chuhchai. Sh idam am e wehm e gegosid. Tsh am s‑ha kehꞌel nash ge ha wohochud hegam mash neid mo d doakam

column2: Then he told them, “Go to the whole world, and announce the good news to everyone.
column3: ch hab hahawa ha ahg, “Am g wo aꞌai hihim k am wo i ha ahgidahi wehs hemajkam ihda s‑kehg haꞌichu ahgaj g Jiosh ab ni‑amjed.

column2: Anyone who trusts in me and is baptized will be saved, but anyone who chooses not to trust will be condemned.
column3: Kut heg wo e doꞌibia matp hedai wo i s‑wohochud k wo e pahl wako. T wabshaba ab wo moht g pi ap e‑chuꞌijig k ab wo ai g pi ha huhugedam shoꞌigdag matp hedai pi ab hu wo wohoch.

column2: The following signs will accompany those who trust in me: in my name they will drive out demons; they will speak new languages;
column3: T wo tashok mo hedai ab ni‑hiwig nant pi ab wo ha mah g gewkdag. Kut am wo i ha wuwhasidad g jijawul ni‑wehhejed ch ep wo neneokad g gawul kaidam neꞌokikaj mat pi hebai mai.

column2: they will be able to handle snakes; if they drink something poisonous they won't be harmed; they will place their hands on the sick and they will be healed.”
column3: Kut pi has wo e juh matp wo ha taht g kohkꞌoi o atp wo ihꞌed g hialwui. Kut an wo ha taht g kokꞌodam. T wo doda.”

column2: Then, the Lord Jesus, when he had finished speaking to them, was taken up into heaven where he sat down at the right hand of God.
column3: Kutsh am i haꞌas ha wehm neo g Jesus k am i dahm hahawa uhgk i e bei dahm kahchim wui k ga hu s‑apkojed dahiwua e‑ohg Jiosh hugid ab.

column2: The disciples went out and spread the good news everywhere, and the Lord worked with them, confirming the message through miraculous signs that accompanied it.
column3: T idam gam hu aꞌai ha ahgidahi g hemajkam g s‑kehg haꞌichu ahgaj g Jiosh. Kut g Jiosh si s‑hasig haꞌichu hab ha juni mat hekaj wo s‑mahchk g hemajkam mo d wohokam g haꞌichu ha‑ahga.

column2: to our sister Apphia, to Archippus who fights alongside us, and to your house church.
column3: Kupt id am wo neꞌokchul Aphia wui ch heg wui Archipus mo wa t-wehm ahgahim g Jiosh haꞌichu ahga, pej wehs ha wui hegam mo am em-wehm e mihshmad em-kih am.

column2: May you have grace and peace from God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ.
column3: Ab o si s-em-hoꞌigeꞌid g t-ohg Jiosh ch t-kownalig Jesus Christ ch ab wo wa baꞌich i em-mahkad g i wehmtadag ch g s-ap tahhadkam.

column2: I always thank my God for you, remembering you in my prayers,  because I hear of your trust in the Lord Jesus and your love for all believers.  I pray that you will put the generous nature of your trust in God into action as you recognize all the good things we share in Christ.  Your love, my dear brother, has brought me much happiness and encouragement. You have revived the hearts of those of us who believe!
column3: Ab apsh wabsh kia si hiwig g t-kownalig Jesus ch si pihk e elid ha hekaj g e-wehm wohochuddam. (7) Sh hegam ab si i e gewkemhun ab neidch map s-ap haꞌichu hab ha junid. Ni heg hekaj si s-ap ni-tahtk (4) ch ab hoꞌigeꞌid g Jiosh ch ab tahni mat baꞌich wo i m-wehmt hemu. (6) Pt hab baꞌich ab wo i chehgi map geꞌe edgid g s-apꞌekam ab ihmch g Jesus Christ.

column2: That's why even though I'm brave enough in Christ to order you to do your duty,
column3: Ab o ni-mahkch g Christ g gewkdag mant ab wo haꞌichu em-cheha ahpim mam ab ihm.

column2: I would rather ask you this favor out of love. Old Paul, now also a prisoner of Christ Jesus,
column3: Nt wabshaba ab wabsh wo i m-gewkemhu mapt haꞌichu hab wo ni-juni heg wabsh hekaj map si pihk e elid t-hekaj. Dani keli hemu ch ia kuhpi Jesus Christ wehhejed. Kupt ab wo si pihk e el ni-wui k hekaj hab wo juh g ni-tatchui.

column2: is appealing to you on behalf of Onesimus who became my adopted son during my imprisonment.
column3: Ia o ni-wehmaj ihda m-neholiga mo hab chehgig Onesimus. Ni am ahgid ab amjed g t-kownalig Jesus. T ab i s-wohoch. K heg wa wepo mo d ni-alidag am t-wohochudadag ed.

column2: In the past he was of no use to you, but now he's useful to both you and me!
column3: Heki ash hu s-padmam chikpan m-wehhejed ch wabshaba hemu s-wagimam chikpan mo hab masma hab d ahga g chehgigaj ch hab haꞌichu ni-junid am m-wehhejed.

column2: I send him to you with my fondest wishes.
column3: Ab ani chehani mat am uhpam ep wo hih m-wui. Kupt hab masma ab wo neidad mo d ni-alidag.

column2: I'd have preferred to keep him here with me so that he could have helped me as you would have done while I am in chains for telling the good news.  But I decided not do anything without your permission. I didn't want you to be forced to do good, but to do so willingly.
column3: Chum ani hi wa tatchua mat ia wo i ni-wehmt m-wehhejed mani ia kuhpi ch ahg g s-kehg haꞌichu ahgaj g Jiosh. K wabshaba pi hab chum chuꞌig manis wo m-wohppoꞌi g m-pionag. Baꞌich o i s-apꞌe mat hejel hab wo i e ah mapt has masma wo i ni-wehmt.

column2: Maybe you lost him for a while so that you could have him back forever!
column3: Do heb hu himkam ihda m-pionag al heꞌes i tash. Kuki wabshaba hab d elidaj g Jiosh mat hab masma wo e chehg k d haha wo m-wehm wohochuddamk chum hekid.

column2: He's not a servant anymore, because he's more than a servant. He's a specially-loved brother, particularly to me, and even more to you, both as a man and as a fellow-believer in the Lord.
column3: Do si t-wehnag, wahm ahpi, no pi d m-pionag ch am i dahm d hahawa m-wehm wohochuddam.

column2: So if you consider me as a colleague working together with you for the Lord, welcome him as if you were welcoming me.
column3: Bap masma hab ni-elid mani d si m-wehnag, pegih, k ch hab wa masma hab wo elidad g Onesimus mat d wo si m-wehnagk.

column2: If he has done you any wrong, or owes you anything, charge it to my account.
column3: Ab atsh m-wui pi ap chuꞌi. Kupt wabshaba ahni ab wo ni-mohtoꞌi.

column2: I Paul am signing this with my own hand: I will repay you. Of course I won't mention what you owe me, including your very self!
column3: Ahni ant wo m-namkid heg hekaj, chum aps ahpi ab ni-ab e wulshch nant pi am m-wui uꞌapa g Jiosh haꞌichu ahga mapt hekaj e doꞌibia.

column2: Yes, brother, I'm expecting this favor from you in the Lord; please make me happy in Christ.
column3: Pegih, pt hab masma hab wo elidad g Onesimus mat d wo m-wehnagk. Id at ab wo si i ni-gewkemhu am wehhejed g Jiosh alidag.

column2: I'm writing about this to you because I'm convinced you'll do as I ask—in fact I know you'll do even more than I've asked!
column3: Id ant am i m-oꞌohani s-mahchch mapt baꞌich i dahm haꞌichu hab wo ni-juni mani m-tahni.

column2: In the meantime please have a room ready for me, for I hope to be able to return to see you soon in answer to your prayers.
column3: Jiosh at ab wo kaiha g em-hoꞌigeꞌidahuna k ab wo i ni-wuhshad ab amjed g kukpaikud. Nt am ep wo i em-chehgim. Kumt heg hekaj am wo i apꞌech g kih ni-wehhejed.

column2: Epaphras who is here in prison with me sends his greetings,
column3: Ia o ep ni-wehm kuhpi g Epaphras ch s-m-hoꞌigeꞌid.

column2: as do my co-workers Mark, Aristarchus, Demas, and Luke.
column3: K ia ep dadha g Mark ch Aristarcas ch Demas ch Luke ch hab waꞌap s-m-hoꞌigeꞌid.

column2: May the grace of our Lord Jesus Christ be with all of you.
column3: T-kownalig Jesus Christ at wo wa s-em-hoꞌigeꞌel.

column2: Grace to you and peace from God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ.
column3: Ab o wa si s-em-hoꞌigeꞌid g t-ohg Jiosh g t-kownalig Jesus Christ wehm ch ab wo wa baꞌich i em-mahkad g i wehmtadag ch s-ap tahhadkam.

column2: When I think of you I'm so thankful to my God,  and I'm always glad to remember all of you in my prayers,
column3: Ab ani hoꞌigeꞌid g Jiosh ch si s-ap ni-tattam ch ni-hoꞌigeꞌidahun mani hekid i em-chechegitod.

column2: because you've been partners with me in spreading the good news right from the beginning up till now.
column3: Am am chikpanid g Jiosh ch haꞌichukaj am i ni-wehmaj gd hu i amjed mani wa am em-ahgid g s-kehg haꞌichu ahgaj g Jiosh.

column2: I'm absolutely sure that God who began this good work in you will continue working and bring it to a successful conclusion when Jesus Christ returns.
column3: Kuni heg hekaj s-mahch mat am wo himchudahid g Jiosh ihda doꞌibiadag em-wehhejed. Am at i shonwuich em-doakag ed k wo nahto mat hekid ia ep wo jiwia g Jesus Christ jewed dahm.

column2: It's appropriate for me to be thinking this way about all of you because you mean so much to me. Whether I'm in prison or out there making the good news clear, all of you share God's grace together with me.
column3: Bani wa masma hab em-elid nani pi chum hekid am i em-chegitod. Kum ahpim hab waꞌap chum hekid s-ni-chegito ch haꞌichukaj i ni-wehmt, chum hems hemu mani ia hu d lihso.

column2: God is my witness as to my great affection for every one of you in the caring love of Christ Jesus.
column3: Ab o ni-mahkch g Jesus Christ g si geꞌe pihk elidadag em-hekaj. K g Jiosh s-mahch mo id d wohokam mani em-ahgid.

column2: My prayer is that your love may grow more and more in knowledge and understanding,
column3: Kuni ab tahni mat hab wo em-juh mat baꞌich wo i geꞌeda g pihk em-elidadag ch haꞌichu em-mahchig ch haꞌichu em-amichudadag.

column2: so that you can work out what's really important. That way you can be genuine and blameless when Christ returns,
column3: Mt heg amjed wo s-mahchk hegai mo s-apꞌe mamt hab wo junihid ch pi am hu wo edak g pi apꞌekam ch pi wo ha chuꞌijigk mat hekid ep wo jiwia g Jesus Christ.

column2: filled with the fruits of living right that come through Jesus Christ and give glory and praise to God.
column3: Heg o hab em-wua mamt am wo e chehgidch mam am hab wua g s-apꞌekam haꞌichu ch heg hekaj ab haꞌichuchud g Jiosh ch ab hehgchulid.

column2: I want you to know, my brothers and sisters, that all I've experienced has worked out to move the good news forward!
column3: S-em-ahgidamk ani mo baꞌich i e gantan ihda s-kehg haꞌichu ahgaj g Jiosh heg hekaj mani ia kuhpi.

column2: For everyone—including the whole praetorian guard now knows that I'm in chains for Christ;
column3: Wehsijj o s-mahch ia geꞌe kownal kih am ch an wehgaj mani d lihso heg waꞌi hekaj mani d piongaj g Jesus Christ.

column2: and because of my chains most of the Christians here have been encouraged to speak God's word boldly and fearlessly!
column3: K g t-wehm wohochuddam pi haꞌichu shaꞌi ehbid ch baꞌich i s-gewkam ia ahg g Jiosh haꞌichu ahga neidch mani wabsh s-ap ab nakog g ni-shoꞌigdag.

column2: Yes, some speak out of jealousy and rivalry. However there are those who speak from good motives.  They act out of love, because they know that I'm meant to be here to defend the good news.  Those others present Christ deceptively because of their selfish ambitions, trying to cause me problems in my imprisonment.
column3: Haꞌi o am hi chikpan ab si hejel e-tatchui amjed mat baꞌich wo i chum wahmud g haꞌichu pi ni-apꞌedag hemuch mani wa hu d lihso no pi s-ni-hehgamk ch wabsh ni-pipꞌichud. K wabshaba haꞌi ni-hekaj si pihk e elid ch ahgachug g Jiosh haꞌichu ahga no pi s-mahch mat g Jiosh am i ni-kei mant wo wohokamch g haꞌichu ahgaj.

column2: But so what? All I care about is that Christ is presented every which way, whether just pretending or whether from true convictions. That's what makes me happy—and I will go on being happy!
column3: K pi has chuꞌig. Ni wabsh s-ap ni-tahtk mo e ahgachug g Jiosh haꞌichu ahga, chum as haꞌi pi ap haꞌichu e-tatchui ab am wo ahgahi.

column2: Why? Because I'm convinced that through your prayers for me, and through the help of the Spirit of Jesus Christ, this will turn out to be my salvation.
column3: E am hoꞌigeꞌidahun am ni-wehhejed. K g Hekia S-apꞌekam Gewkdag i ni-wehmaj. Ni heg hekaj si s-ap ni-tahtk ch s-mahch mamt wo i ni-wuhshad.

column2: For it's my strongest hope and expectation not to do anything of which I would be ashamed. Instead it's my bold hope, as always, that even now Christ will be greatly honored through me, whether I live or die.
column3: Tatchua ani mant chum hekid wehs hab wo juh mo haschu i ni-tatchuid g Christ pi haꞌichu ehbidch, wahm hemuch. Bant masma ab wo si has elidad wehs ni-ihbdagkaj, chum anis hems wo ni-muhkid heg hekaj.

column2: As far as I'm concerned, living is for Christ, and dying brings gain.
column3: Neh, pi o has d ahga g ni-doakag ni-wehhejed. Chum ani hi wa s-wehmjimk g Christ. K heg hekaj chum s-apꞌe mant hu wo i muh.

column2: But if I'm to go on living here and this would be productive work, then I really don't know what's best to choose!  For I'm in a dilemma—I really want to leave and be with Christ, which would be far better,
column3: Ntp wabshaba d wo doakamk ch baꞌich wo i chikpandad g Christ. Ni-wehhejed o hi wa baꞌich i s-apꞌe mant wo muhk k wo wehmajk g Christ.

column2: and yet to remain physically here is more important as far you're concerned.
column3: K wabshaba em-wehhejed hi baꞌich i s-apꞌe mant d wo doakamk.

column2: Since I'm absolutely sure of this, I know that I'll stay here, remaining with you all to help you as your trust and delight in God grows,
column3: Ni heg hekaj s-mahch mant d wo doakamk ch hab am wo i em-wehmajk. Mt wo i geꞌehogat am e-wohochudadag ed ch hab wo si s-ap e tahtkkad.

column2: so that when I see you again your praise to Christ Jesus may be even greater because of me.
column3: Am ant wo em-wehmajk. Kumt baꞌich ab wo i si has elidad g Christ ni-hekaj.

column2: Just be sure that the way you live your lives corresponds to the good news of Christ, so that whether I come and see you or not I can get to hear how you're doing—that you stand firm in full agreement with one another, spiritually united as you work together for the trusting faith of the good news.
column3: Bamt masma wo himad g e-doakag mamt wo haꞌichuch g s-kehg haꞌichu ahga ab amjed g Christ. Nt haha wo kah mam am e hemakochudch ch s-ap ahgachug mat g hemajkam ab wo s-wohoch g s-kehg haꞌichu ahgaj g Jiosh, chum anis hems pi am hu ep wo em-nei.

column2: Don't let your enemies scare you. By being brave you will demonstrate to them that they will be lost, but that God himself will save you.
column3: Pi g wo shaꞌi ha ehbidad hegam mo ab em-wui gegok. T heg amjed wo s-mahchk mat ab wo bei g s-koꞌok e-namkidadag. Mt ahpim ab wo bei g e-doꞌibiadag ab amjed g Jiosh.

column2: For you have been given the privilege not only of trusting in Jesus, but suffering for him as well.
column3: Do Jiosh hab elida mamt pi ab wabsh wo s-wohochudad g Christ ch wabshaba am wehhejed ep wo e shoꞌigchudad.

column2: You're experiencing the same struggle you saw me having—a struggle I still have, as you now know.
column3: Ab amt wui wo gegokkad g pi apꞌekam hab masma mam am wa neid mani hab ni-wua ch hemu kah mani hab wabsh kia ni-wua.

column2: So then, if you're encouraged by being in Christ, if you're comforted by his love, if you share together in the Spirit, if you have compassion and sympathy—
column3: Bani em-elid mam s-ap ab e dagitokch Jesus Christ wui. K heg ab si i em-gewkemhun. Kum si s-ap e tahtk no pi si em-tatchua. Hekia S-apꞌekam Gewkdag o am em-wehmaj. Kum aꞌai e hekaj si pihk e elid.

column2: then make my joy complete by thinking the same way and loving the same way, spiritually united and having one purpose.
column3: Nt heg hekaj ab wo si i em-gewkemhu mamt wo i hemakoj g e-chegitoidag k ab baꞌich wo i e tatchuad ch baꞌich wo i s-ap e tahtkkad ab aꞌai e wui. Nt heg amjed wo si s-ap ni-taht.

column2: Don't do anything from a spirit of selfishness or pride, but humbly think of others better than you do of yourself.
column3: Pi amt wo s-chu daꞌad ch pi wo chum ge e haꞌichuchudad. Ab amt wabsh wo i e shoꞌigchudch ab aꞌai e wui ch pi waꞌi si hejel am wo e chegitod.

column2: None of you should be preoccupied about your own things—instead concern yourself with the interests of others too.
column3: Am g wo waꞌi chegitod g ha-apꞌedag haꞌi ehp, pi heg waꞌi hejel e-apꞌedag.

column2: The attitude you should have is the same as that of Christ Jesus.
column3: Bamt masma haꞌichu wo chum chegitok mash wa g Jesus Christ ch pi hejel wo chum si e haꞌichuch.

column2: So, my good friends, continue to work towards the goal of salvation with complete reverence and respect for God, following what you were told—not just when I was with you, but even more so now I'm away from you.
column3: Ni-naipijju, chum am hekid s-wohog elid hegai Jiosh haꞌichu ahga mani wa am em-ahgid mani eda em-wehmaj. K baꞌich d i si haꞌichu mamt ab wo s-wohog elidad hemu mani wa chum pi am hu em-wehmaj. Am g wabsh wo chikpanad ch wo geꞌegeꞌelhid am e-doꞌibiadag ed ch ab wo si has elidad g Jiosh.

column2: For it's God who is working within you, creating the will and the ability to do what he wants you to do.
column3: Chum o hekid em-makiog g Jiosh g tatchuidag ch gewkdag mamt am hab wo junihid g hab elidaj.

column2: Do everything without complaining or arguing
column3: Kumt heg am hab wo junihid pi has ahgch mamt hekid heg hekaj wo e shoꞌigch.

column2: so that you'll be sincere, innocent of any wrong. Be God's blameless children living in the middle of a dishonest and corrupt people. Shine among them as lights to the world,
column3: T hab pi wo em-chuꞌijigch g Jiosh. Dam Jiosh aꞌaliga ch d wo chum si hekia s-apꞌekamk am ha shahgid hegam mo pi mahch g Jiosh. Idam o s-chu iꞌattomk ch totontodag. Kumt hab wo sha masmak am ha wehhejed mo g huhuꞌu am ha wehhejed g s-chuhugam k ed oiopodam

column2: holding out to them the word of life. That way I'll have something to be proud of when Christ returns, proving I didn't run around and work for nothing!
column3: am ha ahgidch mo g Jiosh ab ha makiog g wechij doakag. T g Jesus Christ ab wo si em-haꞌichuch mat hekid ia ep wo jiwia jewed dahm. Nt heg hekaj wo si s-hehgigk mat g ni-chikpan pi wabsh wo e nahnkogi.
