column2: So even if I pour out my life as a sacrifice and offering so you may trust in God, I'm happy for it, and I'm glad together with all of you,
column3: Ab amt i s-wohoch g haꞌichu ni-ahga k am i e dagito Jiosh wui hab sha masma mo wa ab wui haꞌichu e iagchulid. Kunt hemho wa wo si s-ap ni-taht mamt am wui i e dagito, chum anis hems wo ni-muhkid nani pi ahgachug g Jiosh haꞌichu ahga. Id at heg wo wa wepok mat g ni-ehꞌed wo e iawua em-wehhejed hab sha masma mo wa g nawait e iawua ab ab g iagchulida.

column2: just as you have such joy and are glad with me.
column3: Pegih, ahpim g ep wo si s-ap e tahtk ni-wehm matp g Jiosh hab wa masma wo haꞌichuch g ni-chikpan.

column2: I'm hoping, if that's what the Lord Jesus wants, to send Timothy to you soon. It will cheer me up once I know how you're doing.
column3: Hemu ant wo cheha g Timothy mat am wo i em-chehgim matp d wo t-kownalig Jesus tatchuik. T heg ia wo uꞌapa g haꞌichu ahga ab em-amjed mat am wo i ni-gewkemhu.

column2: I don't know anyone who genuinely cares about you as he does.
column3: Timothy o d waꞌi hegai mo hab wa masma hab e tahtk ab em-amjed mani ahni ch si s-ap wo em-nuhkud.

column2: Other people only worry about their own interests, not those of Jesus Christ.
column3: Haꞌi o hi g hejel e-tatchui am hab elid ch wabsh pi ab hu haꞌichuchud g hab elidaj g Jesus Christ.

column2: But you already know what he's like—just as a child working to help his father, so he's worked with me to spread the good news.
column3: Kum eda am wa s-mahch mo hab masma ni-wehm chikpan g Timothy mo g ha-alidag.

column2: So I hope to send him as soon as I see how I'm doing,
column3: Hemu ant wo s-mai matp haschu has wo i mahsk am ni-wehhejed. T am haha wo hih g Timothy em-wui.

column2: and I trust in the Lord that shortly I'll be able to come too.
column3: Bani elid mo d tatchuij g t-kownalig Jesus mant ahni am hab waꞌap wo i him k wo em-nei.

column2: But I thought it was important to send Epaphroditus to you. He's a brother to me, a co-worker and fellow-soldier. He's the one you sent to look after me,
column3: Ia ant wo cheha g em-kehsha Epaphroditus mat am uhpam ep wo hih em-wui. Ia o i ni-wehmaj hab masma mamsh am ahgid ch muꞌi haꞌichu ni-wehm nakog.

column2: and he's been longing to see all of you, worried about you because you'd heard he was sick.
column3: Msh wabshaba kah mat wa mumku. K si s-em-neidamk ch e kudut mamsh id kah.

column2: He certainly was sick—he nearly died—but God had mercy on him. Not just on him, but on me too, so that I wouldn't have tragedy upon tragedy.
column3: Woho o wa mat si mumku k chum alo muh. T wabshaba g Jiosh ab si i s-hoꞌigeꞌid k doaj. K hab waꞌap d ni-hoꞌigeꞌidadag mat pi muh nant pi wo si pi ap ni-taht mat hems wo sha muh.

column2: That's why I'm so keen to send him, so that when you see him you'll be happy, and I won't have to be so anxious.
column3: Ni heg hekaj chehani mat am uhpam wo hih. Mt hab wo si s-hehgigk am neidok. Nt ahni hab waꞌap wo si s-hehgigk ch pi wo ni-kudu em-hekaj.

column2: So welcome him with much happiness in the Lord—honor people like him,  because in working for Christ he nearly died, putting his life on the line to make up for the help you weren't in a position to give me.
column3: Kumt ab wo si has el nat pi pi huwi g e-doakag mat hab wo juh g Christ tatchui k wo i ni-wehmt em-wehhejed.

column2: To sum up: my dear friends, delight in the Lord! It's not a burden for me to repeat these things to you—it's to keep you safe!
column3: Mt wabsh wo si s-hehgigk mo d em-kownalig g Jesus Christ. Pi ani has shaꞌi ni-tahtk mant am ep em-oꞌohani hegai mant wa heki hu em-oꞌohani. Kut id d wo i em-wehmtadagk.

column2: Watch out for the wolves, those who do evil, those who insist on physical circumcision—
column3: Haꞌi o hab junihim g pi apꞌekam ch eda chum ahgahim mamt hab wo junihid g chehanig ch hab wo i e apꞌech am Jiosh tahgio. Mt wo si s-e nenꞌoidk ab ha amjed. Bo masma pi haꞌichu amichud mo g gogogs.

column2: for it's we who are truly circumcised, worshiping by the Spirit of God, placing our assurance in Christ Jesus. We have no confidence in human abilities
column3: Pi am tatchua mamt wo e pahl hikuch hab masma mo heki hu chehanis matt ahchim Tutuligo hab wo t-juh. Jiosh at heki hu i em-apꞌech e wehhejed namt pi ab i s-wohoch g haꞌichu ahgaj k ab i hiw g Jesus Christ. K id heg wa wepo mam pahl hikuchkas. Hekia S-apꞌekam Gewkdag o ab t-mahkch g gewkdag ahchim mach ab s-wohochud g Jiosh haꞌichu ahga. Kuch hekaj ab si ihm g Jiosh ch ab si has elid g Jesus Christ ch pi ab hu shaꞌi hejel t-hiwig machs am oidk hab wo t-juh g chehanig k hekaj wo t-doꞌibia.

column2: for if there was a way to rely on human nature then I myself could have that confidence! If anyone thinks they have confidence in such human things, then I outdo them:
column3: Ahni ant baꞌich wo i ni-nako mo hegam mant ab wo hiwgad g chehanig

column2: I was circumcised on the eighth day, I'm an Israelite of the tribe of Benjamin, a true Hebrew. Regarding legal observance I'm a Pharisee;
column3: nani pi d Tuhligo ch ni-pahl hikuch mani eda d gigiꞌik tash hab masma mo an oꞌohanas chehanig ch ed. Benjaminbad o d ni-shohshon ch d hema hegam gamai gohk t-shohshon ahchim Tutuligo. Dani wa Palasi mo hegam hab e elid mo pi ha chuꞌijig ab amjed g t-chehanig.

column2: as for religious dedication I was a persecutor of the church; while in regard to doing right according to the law I was blameless!
column3: Ha anid shoꞌigchud hegam mo ab ihm g Jesus Christ nani pi hab ha elid mo ab wui gegok g t-chehanig. Neh, banid wa masma hab ni-wua ch hekaj hab ni-elid mani pi ha chuꞌijig.

column2: But in whatever way such things gained me anything, I count them as a loss for Christ.
column3: T wabshaba am hahawa i e tashogi g Jesus Christ ni-wui. Kuni hemuch hahawa pi ab hu haꞌichuchud wehs ihda nani pi g Jesus Christ ab si haꞌichuchud.

column2: Truly, I count everything as loss in exchange for the incredible benefit I've gained through knowing Christ Jesus my Lord. I've thrown away all these things for him, and consider them trash, so that I might gain Christ.
column3: Wehs haꞌichu o d wabsh pi haꞌichu hahawa no pi baꞌich i s-apꞌe mant wo s-mahchk g t-kownalig Jesus Christ. Wehs ant haꞌichu s-ohhod mant wo s-mai g Jesus Christ

column2: I want to be found in him, not being right because of what I've done, or what the law requires, but made right through confidence in Christ, set right by God through trusting in him.
column3: k am wo i ni-hemakoj heg wehm. Heki anid hu g chehanig oidch hab ni-elid mani s-apꞌe am Jiosh tahgio. T wabshaba am hahawa i ni-tashogi g wohokam g Jesus Christ. Kunt ab i s-wohoch. T hekaj am i ni-apꞌech g Jiosh e tahgio.

column2: I want to really know him, and the power of his resurrection—to take part in his suffering and become like him in his death,
column3: Ni hahawa tatchua mant wo si s-mahchk g Jesus Christ ch ab wo taht hegai gewkdaj mat hekaj i wuhsh ab muhkig amjed, chum anis hems hab waꞌap wo ni-shoꞌigch.

column2: so that somehow I might be part of the resurrection from the dead!
column3: Neh, bant wa masma hab waꞌap wo i wuhsh ab muhkig amjed mat d wo si oidchkam tashk.

column2: Not that I've already got it all, or that I'm already perfect—but I run so that I might win what was won for me by Christ Jesus.
column3: Pi ani hab kaij manis heki hu wehs ab i neid ihda ch wehs apꞌechudas ch wabshaba am ni-nakog mant heg ab wo bei mo haschu ab ni-makiog g Jesus Christ ch hekaj an ni-bei.

column2: My friends, I don't consider that I've already won, but this is my one objective: disregarding what is behind me, I strain forward to what is in front of me.
column3: Heg ant hekaj pi wo chegito mat haschu heki hu has i e juh am ni-tahgio k am wui wo ni-gewkai hegai mo haschu am ni-baꞌich.

column2: I run towards the finish line to win the prize of God's invitation to heaven through Christ Jesus.
column3: Neh, mo g s-melidkam am e gewkadch mat wo ha gehg k wo bei g s-ap e-namkidadag. Kuni ahni am hab waꞌap ni-gewkadch mant wo bei g s-ap ni-namkidadag. K d ihda mant an haha wo wehmajk g Christ an Jiosh kihdag ed.

column2: Those of us who are spiritually mature should think like this, and if you think anything different, then God will reveal this to you.
column3: Wehsijj att hab wo wa chum t-junihid ahchim mach s-gegokim hihim g t-wohochudadag. Haꞌijj amtp hems pi hab masma hab e junihim. T wabshaba g Jiosh wo mahsko em-wuij mam haschu i pi ap hab wua.

column2: We just need to make sure that we follow what we already have understood.
column3: Am amt wo oidad g wohokam mam ab heꞌes i heki hu s-mahch ch am hab junihim.

column2: My friends, copy my example as others do and take note of the way to behave since you have us as a model.
column3: Am ani si s-gewkam oid g Jiosh haꞌichu ahga ch am em-chehgid mamt has wo masmak. Mt wo si ha nenashanad hegam mo am hab e wua mani has i masma em-chehgid ch am ha oidk hab wo e junihid.

column2: The way some people live makes them enemies of the cross of Christ—as I've often told you before and repeat again though it pains me so much I want to weep.
column3: Ab at e muhkid g Jesus Christ kots t ab mat wo t-doꞌibia. K eda muꞌijj ab wui gegok ihda s-kehg haꞌichu ahga. Id o si pi ap ni-tahtchud. Kuni wa muꞌikko am em-ahgid ihda heki hu ch hemu am ep em-ahgid.

column2: They will end up being completely lost, these people whose “god” is their physical desires and who are proud of what they should be ashamed of, thinking only about the things of this world.
column3: Idam o heg waꞌi ab si has elid hejel e-tatchui ch heg waꞌi s-hohhoꞌid jewed t ab haꞌichu. T g Jiosh gam hu wo i ha shul Jiawul kih ed no pi e hahaschud heg hekaj mat hekaj wo chum si e ehꞌelidad.

column2: But our homeland is heaven, and we're waiting for a Savior, the Lord Jesus Christ, to come from there too.
column3: Kuch wabshaba ahchim am chegito g dahm kahchim ch ed t-kihdag. Ab at amjed wo jiwia g t-doꞌibiakam Jesus Christ. Kuch ab nenida.

column2: He will re-create our defective human bodies so that they will be made like his glorious body using the power by which he brings everything under his control.
column3: Heg at gawul wo juh g mukialig t-hon heg hekaj si geꞌe e-gewkdag mat hekaj wehs haꞌichu wo dahmkad. T g t-hon si s-kehg hab wo masmak hab masma mo g honaj si s-kehg hab mahs ab i wuhshanik muhkig amjed.

column2: So stand firm in the Lord, my dear friends who mean so much to me, who make me so happy! To me you are my crowning achievement! I truly love you and long to see you!
column3: Pegih, ab amt i s-wohoch g haꞌichu ni-ahga ab amjed g t-kownalig Jesus. M d hahawa si ni-tatchuidch ni-wepnag. Ni heg hekaj si s-ap ni-tahtk ch chum si s-em-neidamk. S-gegokim g wo gegokkad am eda g e-wohochudadag.

column2: Euodia and Syntyche—I urge you to resolve your differences with each other and agree in the Lord.
column3: Ab ani s-em-ahgidamk ahpim Euodia ch Syntyche mamt pi wo e neꞌowinad ch am wabsh wo i e wehmajk nam pi d e wehm wohochuddam.

column2: In fact, my faithful fellow-worker, let me ask you to help these women, for they worked together with me to spread the good news—as well as Clement and my other co-workers, whose names are recorded in the book of life.
column3: Idam uꞌuwi o am si i ni-wehmajkahim mach wa am ahgachug g Jiosh haꞌichu ahga. Ni heg hekaj am ep s-m-ahgidamk ahpi map hab e chechcheg I-ha-Wehmtdam mapt woho am wo i ha wehmajk map hab masma i ni-wehmajkahim. Clement ch haꞌi ehp o hab waꞌap i ni-wehmajkahim. Pi o wehs s-e mahch g ha-chechgig ch wabshaba an oꞌohadag heg eda mo an e oꞌohan g e doꞌibiakam ha-chechgig ch an kahch Jiosh kihdag ed.

column2: Always be happy in the Lord—I repeat, Be happy!
column3: Si g wo s-hehgig ab amjed g t-kownalig Jesus Christ mani hab masma chum hekid hab chechꞌe.

column2: Everyone should know about your kindness. The Lord will soon be here.
column3: E o aihim mat ep wo jiwia. Kumt heg hekaj wabsh wo i s-hehemajimak ab wehs ha wui g hemajkam.

column2: Don't worry about anything, but take everything to God in prayer, explaining your requests to him and thanking him for all he does.
column3: Pi g wo shaꞌi e kudut heg hekaj mam haschu i chum tatchua k ab wabsh wo i tai g Jiosh k ab wo i hoꞌigeꞌel matp haschu hab wo i t-juni.

column2: Then the peace that comes from God, which is better than we can ever imagine, will keep your hearts and minds protected in Christ Jesus.
column3: T g Jiosh ab wo em-mahkad g s-ap tahhadkam. K ihda s-ap tahhadkam pi ta amichudama ch wabshaba wo chehmo g t-dodakag. Kutt hab pi haꞌichukaj wo t-kudutad ahchim matt ab i t-hemakoch g Jesus Christ wehm.

column2: Lastly, whatever is true, honorable, right, pure, beautiful, commendable, whatever is truly good and deserves to be praised, think about these kinds of things.
column3: Am g wo chegitok wehs ihda mo haschu d s-apꞌekam k ab wo hehgchulidad g Jiosh heg amjed mo haschu d wohokam ch haschu d si oꞌodhamdag ch haschu d s-apꞌekam ch haschu s-kehgaj.

column2: Put into practice what you learned and received from me, what you saw me doing and heard me say. Then the God of peace will be with you.
column3: Am g wo i e mashcham k hab wo junihid hegai mam haschu i kahk ch ab bei ni-amjed. Kut wo e chehgi mo am em-wehmaj hegai mat t-doꞌibia k ab t-mahkch g s-ap tahhadkam.

column2: I'm so happy in the Lord that you've at last thought about me again—realizing that you were concerned about me before but you couldn't do anything about it.
column3: Si geꞌe s-hehgig ant bei ab amjed g Jiosh mamt ab ep i e chehgi mam ab si pihk e elid ni-wui. Tash o pi am hu em-apꞌe mams ab haꞌichu wo ni-mah k wo i ni-wehmt. Ni wabshaba s-mahch mam si pihk e elid ni-hekaj.

column2: I'm not talking about my own needs, because I've already learned to be satisfied in whatever situation I find myself.
column3: Ni pi hab ahgch hab kaij manis haꞌichu si tatchua nant pi s-mai mant ab wabsh wo si s-ap ni-tahtkk mani haschu i edgid,

column2: I'm used to having nothing, and I've experienced having plenty too. In every possible situation I've learned the secret of dealing with having plenty and going hungry, of being rich and of living in poverty:
column3: chum anis hebaichujj wo bihugim k pi haꞌichu wo edgidad o hebaichujj geꞌe haꞌichu wo edgidad.

column2: I can do anything through him who makes me strong!
column3: Jesus Christ o ab ni-mahkch g gewkdag. Nt heg hekaj wo ni-nako mant s-ap am hab wo junihid g Jiosh tatchui.

column2: Even so it was good of you to share with me during my troubles.
column3: K wabshaba si s-apꞌe mamt am i ni-wehmt pi ni-apꞌedag ed.

column2: You Philippians remember that right at the beginning of sharing the good news, when I left Macedonia, that yours was the only church that helped me financially.
column3: S-mahch am ahpim Philippi t am wohochuddam mam d waꞌi ahpim ch am i ni-wehmaj am i dahm mant am em-dagito am uꞌapak g s-kehg haꞌichu ahgaj g Jiosh amai Macedonia jewed ch ed.

column2: Even when I was in Thessalonica you helped me out not once but twice.
column3: Ni hebaichujj haꞌichu tatchua ab Thessalonica kihhim t ab. Kum ab ni-mamka.

column2: Not that I'm looking for a donation—I'm looking for your “account” to increase in “profit.”
column3: Pi o hab mahs manis heg ab waꞌi tatchua em-mahkig. Baꞌich ani i tatchua mamt ab wo bei g hoꞌigeꞌidalig ab amjed g Jiosh.

column2: For I have everything, more than I need! I'm thankful to receive from Epaphroditus the things you sent. They're like a sweet-smelling sacrifice that pleases God and that he approves of.
column3: Ia at uꞌapa g em-mahkig g Epaphroditus. Kuni hahawa pi haꞌichu shaꞌi tatchua. Em-mahkig o hab sha masma mo hegai s-ap uhw haꞌichu mo wa ab e iagchulid Jiosh wui. K g Jiosh ab si s-hohhoꞌid

column2: My God will fill you with everything you need in accordance with his glorious wealth in Christ Jesus!
column3: ch hab waꞌap wo em-mahkad mam haschu i tatchua. Ab o e chehgidch ab amjed g Jesus Christ mo g Jiosh geꞌe haꞌichu an toꞌakch am t-wehhejed.

column2: Glory be to God the Father, forever and ever. Amen.
column3: Chum att hekid wo hehgchulidad g Jiosh t-ohg! Chum hekid!

column2: Greet every fellow-believer in Christ Jesus. The Christian brothers and sisters with me send their greetings.
column3: Ab amt wo ha ahgi g t-wehm wohochuddam mat ab wo i s-ni-hoꞌigeꞌel. Ni-wehm chikpandam iia o hab waꞌap kaij mamt ab wo i s-ha hoꞌigeꞌel.

column2: All the believers send you greetings, especially those from Caesar's palace.
column3: K wehsijj g t-wehm wohochuddam hab waꞌap kaij, wahm hegam mo ia haꞌichug geꞌe kownal kih ed.

column2: May the grace of the Lord Jesus Christ be with your spirit.
column3: Neh, ab at wo wa baꞌich i s-em-hoꞌigeꞌidad g t-kownalig Jesus Christ.

column2: This is the Revelation of Jesus Christ, which God gave him to show his servants what will happen soon. He sent his angel to reveal it to his servant John
column3: Hemu at am i tashogi g Jesus Christ hegai matsh haschu am hab wo e juh pi shaꞌi mehk iꞌajed. Jiosh ash am ahgid matsh am wo t-chehgi ahchim mach d piongaj. Tki heg am hema i kei g anghil. T id am ni-chehgi ahni John mani d piongaj g Jesus Christ.

column2: who confirmed everything he saw concerning the word of God and the testimony of Jesus Christ.
column3: Kuni ia oꞌohan hegai mani haschu i neid. Ihda ni-oꞌohana o d Jiosh haꞌichu ahga ch d hegai wohokam mat am i maskogi g Jesus.

column2: Anyone who reads this is blessed, as are those who hear these prophetic words and pay attention to what's written, because the time is near.
column3: Jiosh at wo wa s-ha hoꞌigeꞌel hegam mat am wo i neꞌokchul ch hegam mat ab wo kaihamad. E ash aihim mat am hab wo e juh wehs ihda gam hu baꞌich haꞌichu ahga mant in wo oꞌoha.

column2: This letter comes from John and is sent to the seven churches in the province of Asia. May you have grace and peace from the One who was, who is, and who is to come, and from the seven Spirits before his throne,  and from Jesus Christ the trustworthy witness, the firstborn from the dead, the ruler of earthly kings. To Jesus who loves us and freed us from our sins by his blood,
column3: Am ant wo i em-oꞌohani ahpim wewaꞌak dakam Jesus Christ ihmdam am Asia chekshani ch ed.

column2: who made us into his kingdom, priests to his God and Father—to Jesus be glory and authority for ever and ever. Amen.
column3: k hab t-juh mach d hahawa piongaj g t-ohg Jiosh ch am wo i ahgahid g haꞌichu ahgaj. Jesus Christ o wehs uꞌukch g gewkdag. Kutt ab wo ihmad chum hekid.

column2: Look, he is coming surrounded by clouds, and everybody shall see him, even those who killed him. All the peoples of the earth will weep because of him. May it be so! Amen.
column3: Neh, e o aihim mat ep wo jiwia ab dahm kahchim amjed. Wehs hemajkam at wo neidad, chum wa hegam mat ab sisish kots t ab. Wehs nahnko mahs hemajkam at wo shoshani heg hekaj.

column2: “I am the Beginning and the End,” says the All-powerful Lord God, who was, who is, and who is to come.
column3: T-kownalig Jiosh o wehs uꞌukch g gewkdag ch hab kaij, “Ahni ani d alpha ch d omega.” Idam o d si wehpeg ch si oidchkam oꞌohana. K hab ahg g Jiosh mo si wehpeg an haꞌichug ch si ha oidch an wabsh wo kia haꞌichugk.

column2: I am John, your brother who shares with you in the suffering and in the kingdom and in the patient waiting that are our experience in Jesus. I was detained on the island of Patmos for sharing the word of God and the truth as revealed by Jesus.
column3: Dani em-wehm wohochuddam ahni John nach pi ab t-hemakochudch g Jesus Christ wehm. Ni am em-wehm apꞌedag Jiosh kownaltalig ed ch hekaj em-wehm ni-shoꞌigchud. An amt ni-wua heg ab al sikod jewed mo hab chehgig Patmos ch am haꞌichug shuhdagi ch ed nani wa pi si s-gewkam ahgahim g Jiosh neꞌoki ch hegai wohokam mat g Jesus am i tashogi.

column2: I was filled by the Spirit on the Lord's day, and I heard a loud voice behind me that sounded like a trumpet.
column3: K am hu hebai d domig tash. Ni ab ihm g Jiosh. K g Hekia S-apꞌekam Gewkdag am si i ni-wehmaj. Kuni kah mat ab hema si s-kaidam neo ab ni-wehgaj k hab sha kaidag mat g kuikud ab ku

column2: It told me, “Write down in a book what you see and send it to the seven churches: Ephesus, Smyrna, Pergamum, Thyatira, Sardis, Philadelphia, and Laodicea.”
column3: k hab kaij, “An g oꞌohan mapt haschu wo i nei k am haha wo ha cheha mat am wo i bei ihda oꞌohana hegam ha wui wewaꞌak dakam Jesus ihmdam amai Ephesus t am ch Smyrna t am ch Pergamum t am ch Thyatira t am ch Sardis t am ch Philadelphia t am ch amai Laodicea t am.”

column2: I turned round to see who was speaking to me. When I turned I saw seven golden candlesticks,
column3: Neh, nt ab si sikol i kekiwua mant wo nei mas hedai ab ni-wui neok k haha wabsh nei mo g wewaꞌak ohla lalampa an dadha chuhchakud t an.

column2: and standing among the candlesticks was someone who looked like a Son of man. He was wearing a robe that reached down to his feet with a golden sash across his chest.
column3: K am ha shahgid hema kehk ch hab mahs mo g Jiosh si Kehsha. K g lihwaj ged hu si ais g tahtdaj. K g ohla giwud an hab juhkch e bahsho.

column2: His hair looked like white wool, and his eyes like flaming fire.
column3: K g moꞌoj si s-tohta hab masma mo g s-wihs gew. K g wuhpuij si s-masma tonod hab masma mo g s-toni nahda.

column2: His feet looked like polished brass that had been refined in a furnace. His voice sounded like a thundering waterfall.
column3: K g tahtdaj si s-wegima tonod hab masma mo g kohwli hahgig. K g neꞌokij hab masma hab kaidag mo g si geꞌe shuhdagi an med.

column2: He was holding seven stars in his right hand, and a sharp double-edged sword came out of his mouth. His face shone like the sun at its brightest.
column3: Id o an uꞌukch g wewaꞌak huhuꞌu s-apko e-nowi ed ch an kamshch g is-pahyo. K id ab i wuhshanis chinij ab. K g wuhioshaj shaꞌi si tonod hab masma mo g tash tonlig dahm juhk.

column2: When I saw him I fell down at his feet as if I were dead. But he touched me with his right hand and said, “Don't be afraid, I am the first and the last,
column3: Kunt am i neidok ab i gei wecho hab sha masma mo g muhki.

column2: the Living One. I was dead, but look! Now I am alive for ever and ever, and I hold the keys of death and the grave.
column3: Am ant wa chum ni-muhkid k uhpam ep ni-chegito k chum hekid d haha wo doakamk. Am ani dahm gewkdag g muhkig ch am dahm gewkdag amai mo am haꞌichug g koꞌi.

column2: So write down what you've seen—what's happening in the present and what will happen in the future.
column3: “Pegih, am g oꞌohan map haschu i neid mat hab wo e juh hemu ch haschu hab wo e juh imhab i dahm.

column2: The meaning of the seven stars that you saw me holding in my right hand and the seven golden candlesticks is this: the seven stars are the angels of the seven churches and the seven candlesticks are the seven churches.”
column3: Am ant wo m-ahgi g s-aꞌagi haꞌichu ab amjed idam wewaꞌak huhuꞌu mani in uꞌukch ch idam wewaꞌak lalampa. Idam wewaꞌak lalampa o d hegam ni-ihmdam mo am kihdag hegam ha eda wewaꞌak kihhim. K idam wewaꞌak huhuꞌu o d ha-wanimeddam.”

column2: “Write this to the angel of the Ephesus church: This is what the One who holds the seven stars in his right hand says, the one who walks among the seven golden candlesticks:
column3: K hab ep kaij ab ni-wui, “Am g oꞌohanid g ha wanimeddam hegam mo ab ni-ihm ch am kihdag Ephesus t am. Ihda ha wanimeddam at am wo ha ahgi mani hab kaij:

column2: I know what you've accomplished, your hard work and perseverance. I know you can't tolerate evil people, and how you investigated those who claimed to be apostles but are not, and discovered they were frauds.
column3: S-mahch ani mam haschu hab junihim. S-ap am chikpan ch am wabsh s-e bahbgi ch pi ab hu shaꞌi ha bahbgi hegam mo ab ni-wui gegok. Haꞌi o hab chum kaij mo d ni-chuhchai. Kumt eda ha aꞌappem k s-mai mo d wabsh s-chu iꞌattomkam.

column2: I know about your patience, and what you endured for my sake—and that you didn't give up!
column3: Ab amt s-bahbagi nako g shoꞌigdag ni-wehhejed k pi shaꞌi haꞌasa.

column2: But I have something against you: you have neglected your first love.
column3: “Neh, id o s-ta hohhoꞌidama. K wabshaba haꞌichu pi ta hohhoꞌidama ab em-ab. Pi am ab hu ni-tatchua hemuch hab masma mam wa ged hu i heki hu.

column2: So remember how far you've fallen—repent and go back to what you were doing at first. Otherwise I'll come to you and I will remove your candlestick from where it is—unless you repent.
column3: Am g wo i oidahim mamt heꞌesko i e mehkod ab ni-amjed k gam hu wo s-ohhod g pi ap e-chegitoi mamt hab ep wo masmak mam wa heki hu. Mtp sha pi gawul wo i e juh, nt gam hu wo i bei g em-tonligga.

column2: However you do have this to your credit: you hate the actions of the Nicolaitans,  just as I do.
column3: Id am hi wa s-ap am hab junihim mam si pi hohhoꞌid mo haschu s-ta edam hab junihim hegam mo am oid g Nicolas. Id o wa chum pi apko ha wanimed g Jiosh hemajkamga. Ahni ani hab waꞌap si pi hohhoꞌid ihda.

column2: If you have ears, listen to what the Spirit is telling the churches. I will give to those who are victorious the privilege of eating from the tree of life, which stands in the Paradise of God.
column3: “Hekia S-apꞌekam Gewkdag o am i maskogid g haꞌichu ni-ahga am em-wui ahpim mam ab si ni-hiwig ch am kihdag ha eꞌeda hegam wewaꞌak kihhim. Kumt wehsijj ab wo kaihamad. “Ab ant wo ha mah hegam mat gewito g pi apꞌekam g apꞌedag mat ab wo huh g bahidaj hegai uhs mo ab ha mahk g doakag ch am kehk Jiosh oidag ed.”

column2: Write this to the angel of the Smyrna church: This is what the first and last says, the One who was dead and came back to life:
column3: K hab ep kaij ab ni-wui, “Am g oꞌohanid g ha wanimeddam hegam mo ab si ni-hiwig ch am kihdag Smyrna t am. Id at am wo ha ahgi mani hab kaij:

column2: I know the troubles you are going through, and how poor you are (but you are rich), and the abuse from those who say they are Jews but are not, but belong to Satan's synagogue.
column3: S-mahch ani mam e kudut. Dam hi wa chum shoꞌigkam iia ch wabshaba d s-kakais am Jiosh tahgio. S-mahch ani mo haꞌi si pi ap has em-ahg g Tutuligo. Idam o hab e elid mo d Jiosh hemajkamga ch eda wa chum pi woho no pi d wabsh Jiawul hemajkamga.

column2: Don't be afraid about what you are going to suffer. Yes, the devil will throw some of you into prison to test you, and you will suffer persecution for ten days. Just remain faithful, even if it means death, and I will give you the crown of life!
column3: “Pi g am wo shaꞌi ehbidad mamtp haschu i s-koꞌok ab wo nako. Neh, mt wo em-kuh. K wabshaba d wabsh Jiawul chiꞌoida ihda. Kut am waꞌi wehst-mahm tash hab wo mahsk ihda em-kudutadag. Am amt wo hihimad e-wohochudadag oidch am hugkam mamt hekid wo i koi. Kunt ab wo em-mah g pi ha huhugedam doakag hab masma mamt g gihko wo mah hegai mat wo ha gewito.

column2: If you have ears, listen to what the Spirit is telling the churches. The second death will not harm those who are victorious.
column3: “Hekia S-apꞌekam Gewkdag o am i maskogid g haꞌichu ni-ahga am em-wui ahpim mam ab si ni-hiwig ch am kihdag ha eꞌeda hegam wewaꞌak kihhim. Kumt wehsijj ab wo kaihamad.

column2: Write this to the angel of the Pergamum church: This is what the One holding the sharp two-edged sword says:
column3: K hab ep kaij ab ni-wui, “Am g oꞌohanid g ha wanimeddam hegam mo ab si ni-hiwig ch am kihdag Pergamum t am. T id am wo ha ahgi mani hab kaij:

column2: I know you're living where Satan has his throne, and that you have stayed true to me. You have not denied your trust in me, even when my faithful witness Antipas was killed right among you there where Satan lives!
column3: S-mahch ani mo g Jiawul himdag si s-gewkdag amai. M eda ab wabsh kia s-ni-mahch ch e ahg. Hegai mo d Antipas ch ab si s-ni-wohokamchud at wa e muhkid amai. Kumt eda wa pi shaꞌi ni-dagito.

column2: But I have a few things against you: There are some among you who hold to the teaching of Balaam, who taught Balak how to entrap the children of Israel by means of eating food sacrificed to idols and committing sexual sins.
column3: “K wabshaba am haꞌichu d hegai mani pi hohoꞌid am em-shahgid. Am o haꞌi em-wehmaj ch am hab wua hegai mat wa haschu ha mashcha g Tutuligo idam Balaambad ch Balakbad. Idam at wa ha mashcha mat wo huh hegai haꞌichu hugi mo wa ab e toꞌid g ha-jijoshchuda ch ehp mat hab wo wuad g s-tohntom haꞌichu. Id o wehs d pi apꞌekam am ni-tahgio.

column2: Similarly you also have some who hold to the teaching of the Nicolaitans.
column3: Am o haꞌi ep em-wehmaj mo g Nicolas mashchama ab s-wohochud.

column2: So repent, or soon I will come to you and fight against them using the sword of my mouth.
column3: Gam g hu wo s-ohhod ihda pi apꞌekam. Nt wo em-cheggia heg hekaj is-pahyo mo ab i wuhshanis ni-chini amjed mamtp pi am hu wo i e apꞌech.

column2: If you have ears, listen to what the Spirit is telling the churches. I will give the hidden manna to those who are victorious. I will give them a white stone with a new name written on it that nobody knows except those who receive it.
column3: “Hekia S-apꞌekam Gewkdag o am i maskogid g haꞌichu ni-ahga am em-wui ahpim mam ab si ni-hiwig ch am kihdag ha eꞌeda hegam wewaꞌak kihhim. Kumt wehsijj ab wo kaihamad.

column2: Write this to the angel of the Thyatira church: This is what the Son of God says, the One who has eyes like flaming fire and feet like polished brass.
column3: K hab ep kaij ab ni-wui, “Am g oꞌohanid g ha wanimeddam hegam mo ab si ni-hiwig ch am kihdag Thyatira t am. T id am wo ha ahgi mani hab kaij:

column2: I know what you have accomplished, your love and faithfulness and service and perseverance, and that you are doing more now than when you first believed.
column3: S-mahch ani g s-apꞌekam em-chikpan, pihk em-elidadag, em-wohochudadag ch em-hemajimadadag ch em-bahbgidadag. Baꞌich am hab i e junihim iaꞌi idani.

column2: But I have something against you: you are allowing the woman called Jezebel who calls herself a prophetess to teach my followers, leading them astray into sexual sins, and to eat food sacrificed to idols.
column3: “K wabshaba am haꞌichu d hegai mani pi hohhoꞌid am em-shahgid. Am am wabsh hiwgid hegai uwi mo e wepogid g Jezebelbad ch hab e aꞌaga mo d Jiosh haꞌichu i tashogiddam. Id o ha mashcham g ni-ihmdam mat am hab wo junihid g pi apꞌekam haꞌichu ab aꞌai e wehm ch ep wo koꞌad hegai haꞌichu hugi mo ab e toꞌid g ha-jijoshchuda.

column2: I gave her time to repent of her sexual sins, but she's not willing to repent.
column3: Ab ant wa heꞌes i mah g tash mat gam hu wo s-ohhod g pi ap e-chegitoi. K wabshaba pi hohhoꞌid mat wo dagito g pi apꞌekam.

column2: So I'm throwing her into a bed together with her adulterous partners and they will suffer terribly unless they repent of what they have done with her.
column3: Kunt heg hekaj hab wo juh mat wo mumku k wo woꞌiwua. T hegam chechoj mo am wehmaj wohppo am wehmaj ep wo e shoꞌigch. S-hohtam ant hab wo juh ihda heg hi wa matp gam hu wo s-ohhod g pi ap e-chegitoi.

column2: I will put her children to death. Then all the churches will know that I am the one who examines thoughts and motives. I will repay each of you according to what you've done.
column3: Nt wo ha kokda g mahmdaj mat wehs g ni-ihmdam wo s-mai mani s-mahch g hemajkam ha-chegitoidag ch ha-tatchuidag. Ab ant wo em-namkid heg hekaj mam haschu has i junihim.

column2: For the rest of you there in Thyatira who don't follow this teaching, who have not learned Satan's ‘deep depravities’ as they are called, I don't place on you any other burden. I say to you,
column3: “Haꞌijj ahpim Thyatira t am hemajkam amt pi am hu i oi ihda pi apꞌekam mashchamadag k pi mai hegai mo haꞌijj hab aꞌaga ‘Jiawul si s-juhk s-aꞌagi haꞌichu.’ Pi ant ab hu baꞌich haꞌichu s-wehch wo em-mohtoꞌi.

column2: ‘Just hold on to what you have until I come.’
column3: Mt wabshaba hemho wa wo s-wihnam uꞌukchid hegai mam haschu i edgid ch ab wo ai mant wo uhpam jiwia.

column2: I will give authority over the nations to those who are victorious and who do what I say until the end.  He will rule the nations with an iron rod, breaking them into pieces like clay pots.  In the same way that I received authority from my Father,  I will give them the morning star.
column3: “Ni-ohg Jiosh at ab ni-mah g gewkdag mant wehs s-gewkam wo ha dahmkad g jejewed ch wo ha padch g pi apꞌekam kokownaltalig. Kunt ab wo ha mah ihda gewkdag hegam mat wo gewito g pi apꞌekam k am hab wo junihid g ni-tatchui ch ab wo ai mant ep wo jiwia. T am ni-wehm wo ha dahmkad g jejewed. Kut am ha wehhejed wo mahsi g hoꞌigeꞌidadag hab masma mat g s-mahs huꞌu.

column2: If you have ears, listen to what the Spirit is telling the churches.”
column3: “Hekia S-apꞌekam Gewkdag o am i maskogid g haꞌichu ni-ahga am em-wui ahpim mam ab si ni-hiwig ch am kihdag ha eꞌeda hegam wewaꞌak kihhim. Kumt wehsijj ab wo kaihamad.”

column2: “Write this to the angel of the Sardis church: This is what the One who has the seven Spirits of God and the seven stars says: I know what you have accomplished, and that you give the appearance of being alive—but in reality you are dead.
column3: K hab ep kaij ab ni-wui, “Am g oꞌohanid g ha wanimeddam hegam mo ab si ni-hiwig ch am kihdag Sardis t am. T heg am wo ha ahgi mani hab kaij:

column2: Wake up, and try to revive what is left that's about to die! For I have discovered that from the perspective of my God, nothing you've done has been finished.
column3: Neh, mt ab wo i nehnen k ab wo i gewkai hegai mam haschu wabsh kia edgid mat koi wo s-ap muh. Pi o hohhoꞌid g Jiosh hegai mam haschu am hab junihim.

column2: So remind yourselves of how this message came to you, and what you heard. Observe what you were told to do, and repent. If you don't watch out, I'll come unexpectedly like a thief, and you won't know at what time I'll come to you!
column3: Am g wo s-chegitok mam wa haschu ab em-mashcham k ab wo i s-wohog elid k gam hu wo s-ohhod g pi ap e-chegitoi. Kumtp pi wo sha nehnen, nt s-aꞌagi ia wo jiwia hab sha masma mo g s-chu ehskam. Kumt pi wo shaꞌi mahchk g ohla mant hekid wo i jiwia.

column2: But there are some among you in Sardis who have not ruined their clothes, and they will walk with me dressed in white, for they deserve to do so.
column3: “Haꞌijj ahpim amai Sardis t am am hi wa si e nuhkud mat pi haꞌichu wo em-uamhu. Ahpim mam s-ap am hab e junihim amt ni-wehm wo himad s-tohtam e enidadadch.

column2: Those who are victorious will be dressed in white like this. Their names will not be removed from the book of life, and I will speak for them in the presence of my Father and his angels.
column3: Hegam mat hedai wo gewito g pi apꞌekam at s-tohtam wo e enigadad. An o oꞌohadag g ha-chechgig an dahm kahchim ch ed mo d e doꞌibiakam. Kunt pi wo shaꞌi oa g ha chechgig k wabshaba hab wo chei am tahgio g ni-ohg Jiosh ch am ha tahgio g anghiligaj mo d ni-hemajkamga.

column2: If you have ears, listen to what the Spirit is telling the churches.
column3: “Hekia S-apꞌekam Gewkdag o am i maskogid g haꞌichu ni-ahga am em-wui ahpim mam ab si ni-hiwig ch am kihdag ha eꞌeda hegam wewaꞌak kihhim. Kumt wehsijj ab wo kaihamad.”

column2: Write this to the angel of the Philadelphia church: This is what the One says, the One who is holy and true, who has the key of David. He can open and nobody is able to shut, he can shut, and nobody is able to open:
column3: K hab ep kaij ab ni-wui, “Am g oꞌohanid g ha wanimeddam hegam mo ab si ni-hiwig ch am kihdag Philadelphia t am. T heg am wo ha ahgi mani hab kaij:

column2: I know what you have accomplished—look, I've opened a door for you that no one can shut. I know that you only have a little strength, but you did what I told you, and you did not deny me.
column3: S-mahch ani mam pi am hu i si s-gewpkdag ch wabshaba am oidch hab e junihim g ni-mashchama ch ab si ni-hiwig. Ab ant i hema kuhpiꞌo g kihjeg em-wehhejed. T pi hedai wo e nako mas ab ep wo kuh.

column2: From Satan's synagogue I will bring those who say they are Jews, (but are not, they are liars), making them come and worship at your feet, so that they will acknowledge that I love you.
column3: “Haꞌi o hab e aꞌaga mo d Tutuligo ch d Jiosh hemajkamga. K eda hab chuꞌig mo d wabsh Jiawul hemajkamga. Bant wo ha juh mat ab wo i hihi em-wui k ab wo i shulig k ab wo si has i em-el. T wo wehsijj s-mai mani ahpim ab si em-tatchua.

column2: Because you have persevered as I told you to, I will take care of you during the testing time that is coming on the whole world when those who live on the earth will be on trial.
column3: “Am am hab junihim g ni-chehanig ch s-bahbgim ab nakog haꞌichu. Nt heg hekaj wo em-nuhkud heg amjed kudutadag mo ab him ha wui g wehs hemajkam mat am wo ha aꞌappe wehs jewed shuhdgim.

column2: I am coming soon! Keep a tight grasp on what you have, so that no one takes your crown.
column3: S-hohtam ant wo jiwia. Am g wo si nuhkud hegai mani ab em-mahkch. T hab pi hedai wo shaꞌi em-wohppoꞌi hegai mani ab em-makiog hahawa.

column2: Those who are victorious I will make into pillars in the Temple of my God. They won't ever have to leave. I will write on them the name of my God, the name of the city of my God called New Jerusalem which descends from heaven from my God, and my own new name.
column3: “Bant wo ha juh hegam mat wo gewito g pi apꞌekam mat d wo uꞌugchuk am Jiosh kihdag ed hab sha masma mo g che-tondag am geꞌe cheopi ed. Kut idam pi hekid wo shaꞌi dagito g Jiosh kihdag. An ant ha ab wo oꞌoha g ni-Jioshga chehgig ch g Jiosh kihhim chehgig. Jiosh kihhim o d Wechij Jerusalem ch ab wo i hud Jiosh amjed an dahm kahchim ch ed. Ab ant ha ab ep wo oꞌoha g ni-wechij chehgig.

column2: If you have ears, listen to what the Spirit is telling the churches.
column3: “Hekia S-apꞌekam Gewkdag o am i maskogid g haꞌichu ni-ahga am em-wui ahpim mam ab si ni-hiwig ch am kihdag ha eꞌeda hegam wewaꞌak kihhim. Kumt wehsijj ab wo kaihamad.”

column2: Write this to the angel of the Laodicea church: This is what the Amen says, who is the faithful, true witness, highest ruler of God's creation:
column3: K hab ep kaij ab ni-wui, “Am g oꞌohanid g ha wanimeddam hegam mo ab si ni-hiwig ch am kihdag Laodicea t am. T heg am wo ha ahgi mani hab kaij:

column2: I know what you have accomplished—you're neither hot nor cold. I wish you were hot or cold!
column3: S-mahch ani mam has chuꞌig. Bam chum e elid mam s-ap ab ihm g Jiosh. Kum eda pi am hu woho i e dagitokch wui.

column2: But because you're lukewarm, neither hot nor cold, I'm going to spit you out of my mouth.
column3: Nt heg hekaj gam hu hab wo i em-juh ab ni-amjed hab sha masma mamt gam hu wo wiho g wabsh s-huhk wasib.

column2: You say to yourselves, ‘I'm rich, I have wealth, and don't need anything.’ But you don't know that you are miserable and poor and blind and naked.
column3: Bam chechꞌe mo am wabsh i s-em-apꞌe haꞌichu nam pi d s-kakais ch hab ep chechꞌe mam pi haꞌichu ep shaꞌi tatchua. Ni wabshaba em-ahgid mam si shoꞌig ch s-ta hoꞌigeꞌidama ch gm wabsh i s-dadpk ch pi nenea.

column2: I advise you to buy from me gold refined by fire so you may be rich; and have white clothes so you can be properly dressed and you won't reveal your nakedness and shame; and ointment to put on your eyes so you can see.
column3: Ab g wo i e dagito ni-wui k hab masma wo edagi g s-wohom kaisdag ch s-kehg wehschuga ch kulani am wehhejed g em-wuhpui. Kumt hahawa pi wo shoꞌigk ch pi wo s-dadpk ch wo s-neneak.

column2: Those I love I correct and discipline. So be really sincere, and repent.
column3: Haꞌichu ani shohbid ch ha gewittan hegam mani ab si ha tatchua mat hekaj gam hu wo s-ohhod g pi ap e-chegitoi.

column2: Look, I'm standing at the door, knocking. If anyone hears me calling and opens the door, I will come in and eat with them, and they with me.
column3: “Neh, ab ani em-waid ni-wui. K heg wa wepo mani ab kehk em-kihjeg ab ch ab shontpag ch ab em-chehcheg. Kumt wo kah mani ab neok k wo i kuhpiꞌo g kihjeg. Nt ab wo i wah. Kutt ab aꞌai wo t-ihmad ch t-wehm wo si s-hehgigk hab masma matt hems wo t-wehm t-gegosidad.

column2: I will have those who are victorious sit down with me beside my throne, just as I was victorious and sat down beside my Father on his throne.
column3: Ni-ohg Jiosh at an ni-dai e-hugid an kownal ni-daikud an nant pi gewito g pi apꞌekam. Kunt ahni am hab waꞌap wo em-dai ni-hugid an kownal daikud t ab mamtp hedai wo gewito g pi apꞌekam.

column2: If you have ears, listen to what the Spirit is telling the churches.”
column3: “Hekia S-apꞌekam Gewkdag o am i maskogid g haꞌichu ni-ahga am em-wui ahpim mam ab si ni-hiwig ch am kihdag ha eꞌeda hegam wewaꞌak kihhim. Kumt wehsijj ab wo kaihamad.”

column2: After this I saw a door that had been opened in heaven. The voice that I'd heard before, the one that sounded like a trumpet, told me, “Come up here, and I will show you what will happen next.”
column3: Ab ant hahawa i nen k haꞌichu ep neid. Am ni-tahgio o hab sha mahs mo ab kuhpiꞌokas g dahm kahchim hab sha masma mo ab ge kihjeg.

column2: Immediately I was filled by the Spirit and saw a throne set up in heaven, with someone sitting on the throne.
column3: T ha hekaj ab si i ni-wehmt g Hekia S-apꞌekam Gewkdag. K shahag wepo mat g dahm kahchim am e chehgi ni-wui. Kuki g geꞌe kownal daikud ab kehk. K an hema daha id ab.

column2: The one sitting there shone like jewels, like jasper and carnelian, and there was a rainbow that circled the throne, shining like an emerald.
column3: K g wuhioshaj wabsh tonod hab masma mo hegam si s-kehg hohodai mo hab e aꞌaga ‘jasper’ ch ‘carnelian.’ K an kownal daikud wehgaj hab chuꞌig g kiohod. K id s-chehdagi hab masma mo hegai s-kehg hodai mo hab e aꞌaga ‘emerald.’

column2: Around the throne were twenty-four other thrones, and twenty-four elders were sitting on these thrones, dressed in white and wearing golden crowns on their heads.
column3: Kuki an wehgaj hab ep chuꞌig g gokko gamai giꞌik kownal dadaikud. Kuki an ha ab dadha g gokko gamai giꞌik geꞌeged ch s-tohtakaj e enigadadch ch g ohla gigiko ab wahpkch.

column2: From the throne lightning flashed and thunder roared. Seven torches blazed in front of the throne—these are the seven Spirits of God.
column3: Kuki ab geꞌe kownal daikud amjed ab si memhe g wepgi. Kuki ab toahim g tataniki. Kuki g wewaꞌak kuhchki am memeihim baꞌich g geꞌe kownal daikud no pi g Hekia S-apꞌekam Gewkdag wewaꞌak masma e chehgidch am t-wehhejed.

column2: Stretching out in front of the throne was a sea of glass, as clear as crystal. In the center and all around the throne were four living creatures covered in eyes, both front and back.
column3: Am baꞌich g geꞌe kownal daikud oki shaꞌi si s-dahpk ch hab masma mo g mi-lihda am tadani ch am wabsh gai tonod.

column2: The first creature looked like a lion, the second like a young bull, the third had a human face, and the fourth looked like a flying eagle.
column3: K hema hab sha mahs mo g mawid. K hema hab ep mahs mo g wisilo. K hema g wuhioshaj hab mahs mo g oꞌodham wuhiosha. K hema hab mahs mo g baꞌag ch an daꞌa.

column2: The four living creatures each had six wings also covered with eyes. Day and night they never stop saying, “Holy, holy, holy is the All-powerful Lord God, who was, who is, and who is to come.”
column3: K wehsijj idam chuhdp aꞌan. K g ha-aꞌan wehsko wuhpui. K chum hekid neꞌe hab masma:

column2: I saw the one sitting on the throne holding a scroll in his right hand.  The scroll was written on both sides and was sealed with seven seals.
column3: Ni haha wabsh neid. Kuki an uꞌukch g holiwek oꞌohana s-apkojed e-nowi ed hegai mo an da kownal daikud t an. K wehsko oꞌohanas ab ab ihda ch wewaꞌakpa ab si bidshpi ch cheposidas.

column2: I saw a powerful angel shouting in a loud voice, “Who is worthy to open the scroll and break its seals?”
column3: Neid ani ehp g si s-gewk anghil. K heg si s-kaidam amog ch hab kaij, “Dohꞌo am hugkam apꞌedag mat wo e nako mat wo wantsh g chechposig k ab wo i kuhpiꞌo ihda oꞌohana?”

column2: Nobody in heaven, or on earth, or under the earth was able to open the scroll and read it.
column3: T wabshaba pi hedai e cheh an dahm kahchim ch ed ch in jewed dahm ch am jewed wecho mat wo e nakog k wo kuhpiꞌo k an wo i nei eda g oꞌohana.

column2: I cried many tears because nobody could be found who was worthy to open the book and read it.
column3: Ni heg hekaj si pi ap ni-tahtk ch shoak.

column2: One of the elders spoke to me and said, “Don't cry. Look, the Lion of the tribe of Judah, the Descendant of David, has won the battle and can open the scroll and its seven seals.”
column3: K hab hahawa kaij hema hegam geꞌeged ab ni-wui, “Pi g am shoakad. Neh, Mawid Namkam at gewito g pi apꞌekam k hab wo e nako mat wo wantsh g wewaꞌak chechposig k ab wo i kuhpiꞌo g holiwek oꞌohana. Bo masma hab chuꞌig mo hab masma oꞌohadag mo id ab d Judabad amjedkam ch d ep Davidbad amjedkam.”

column2: I saw a Lamb that looked as if it had been killed standing in the center by the throne and the four living creatures, among the elders. He had seven horns and seven eyes that are the seven Spirits of God that are sent out to all the earth.
column3: Kuni hahawa neid hegai moki hab ahg. K eda ihda Mawid Namkam hab masma ab i e chehgidch mo g kahwal mad ch atki heki hu e muhkid k idani am kehk si eda g kownal daikud. K an wehgaj gegok hegam giꞌik haꞌichu dodakam ch hegam geꞌeged. K hegai mo kahwalkaj ab e chehgidch wewaꞌak aꞌag ch wewaꞌak wuhpui. Idam wewaꞌak wuhpui o hab d ahga mat ab amjed i hih g Hekia S-apꞌekam Gewkdag k an wehsko neid ch nuhkud g Jiosh nahtoi.

column2: He went and took the scroll from the right hand of the One that sat on the throne.
column3: T am hih hegai mo kahwalkaj ab e chehgidch k am bei g holiwek oꞌohana ab s-apko nowij ab hegai mo ab da kownal daikud t ab.

column2: When he had taken the scroll, the four living creatures and the twenty-four elders fell down before the Lamb. Each of them had a harp and golden bowls full of incense, which are the prayers of the believers.
column3: T ha hekaj ab wui i shul hegam giꞌik haꞌichu doakam ch hegam gokko gamai giꞌik geꞌeged. K idam wehsijj ge ahlipa ch ohla hohas-hahaꞌa. K hegam ha eda hohas-hahaꞌa s-ap uhw shuhdagi ch id d ha-hoꞌigeꞌidahuna g Jiosh hemajkamga.

column2: They sang a new song, “You are worthy to take the scroll and open its seals, for you were slain and with your blood you redeemed for God people from every tribe, language, people, and nation.
column3: K am hema aꞌaga g wechij neꞌi. K g ha-neꞌi hab chuꞌig:

column2: As I looked I heard the voices of millions of angels around the throne, together with the living creatures and the elders,
column3: Nt am hahawa nea k ha kah muꞌi mihl anghil. Idam o an wehgaj gegok g geꞌe kownal daikud am ha wehm hegam giꞌik haꞌichu doakam ch hegam geꞌeged

column2: shouting loudly together: “The Lamb that was slain is worthy to receive authority, wealth, wisdom, strength, honor, glory, and blessing.”
column3: ch si s-kaidam neꞌe hab masma:

column2: I watched as the Lamb broke open the first of the seven seals. I heard one of the four living creatures shout with a thunderous voice, “Come!
column3: Ni ab neid hegai mo kahwalkaj ab e chehgidch. Kutki hema gam wantsh hegam wewaꞌak chechposig. K hema hab kaij hegam giꞌik haꞌichu doakam, “Ab g i hihm.”

column2: I looked and saw a white horse. Its rider was holding a bow. He was given a crown, and he rode out conquering so that he would be victorious.
column3: K g neꞌokij hab sha kaidag mo g tataniki. Nt hahawa ep chum nei. Tki g s-toa kawyu am hema i wuhsh. Kuki ab hema cheshaj ch g gaht uꞌa. Mt g gihko an hab juh moꞌoj an. Ge oki gewkdag ch am i wuhsh mat wo ha gewito g hemajkam.

column2: When he opened the second seal, I heard the second living creature say, “Come!”
column3: Kutki am hahawa ab kuhpiꞌo g gokkokam cheposig hegai mo kahwalkaj ab e chehgidch. Kuni kah g gokkokam haꞌichu doakam. K hab kaij, “Ab g i hihm.”

column2: Another horse came out, a red one. Its rider was given a large sword, and the power to take away peace from the earth so that people would slaughter one other.
column3: Tki ab hema ep i wuhsh g kawyu k ge s-wegi. K ab hema cheshaj. Kumt ab mah g gewkdag mat hab wo juh g cheggiadag an jewed dahm mat g hemajkam wo aꞌai e kokda. Kumt g geꞌe is-pahyo ab mah.

column2: When he opened the third seal, I heard the third living creature say, “Come!” I looked and saw a black horse. Its rider was holding a pair of scales in his hand.
column3: Tki ab hahawa i kuhpiꞌo g waikkokam cheposig hegai mo kahwalkaj ab e chehgidch. Kuni kah g waikkokam haꞌichu doakam. K hab kaij, “Ab g i hihm.” Nt chum nei. T g s-chuk kawyu ab i wuhsh. K hema cheshaj ch g pisaltakud uꞌa.

column2: I heard what seemed to be a voice coming from among the four living creatures that said, “Two pounds of wheat cost a day's wages, and three pounds of barley cost the same.  But don't damage the oil or the wine.”
column3: K am hema neok ab ha shahgid hegam giꞌik haꞌichu doakam ch hab kaij, “T wo si s-namkigk g haꞌichu hugi. Mt chum hems wo ha namkid g e-nahtoi am chikpank hemako tashkaj mamt wo ha nolawt g al hemako s-wehch pilkani o g waik s-wehch si-wahyo. Mt wabshaba pi wo shohbi g manjeki ch nawait.”

column2: When he opened the fourth seal, I heard the fourth living creature say, “Come!”
column3: Tki gam hahawa wantsh k kuhpiꞌo g giꞌikkokam cheposig hegai mo kahwalkaj ab e chehgidch. Ni kah g giꞌikkokam haꞌichu doakam. K hab kaij, “I hihm.”

column2: I looked and saw a pale horse. The rider was called Death, and Hades followed him. They received authority over a quarter of the earth to kill people by the sword, by famine, by plague, and by wild beasts.
column3: Nt ab i chum nei. Tki g s-kohmagi kawyu ab i wuhsh. Kuki hema cheshaj ch hab chehgig Muhki. Kuki ab si mia oidch him hegai mash hab e aꞌaga Jiawul Kih. Mtki idam ab ha mah g gewkdag am dahm g hemako tahpani mo giꞌikko e tahpanch (¼) ihda jewed. Kutki ha kokda cheggiadag ch ed ch g bihugigkaj ch mumkidagkaj. Tki g mischini haꞌichu doakam hab waꞌap haꞌi wo ha kokda.

column2: When he opened the fifth seal, I saw underneath the altar those who had been killed because of their dedication to the word of God and their faithful witness.
column3: Tki gam hahawa ep wantsh k kuhpiꞌo g hetaspokam cheposig hegai mo kahwalkaj ab e chehgidch. Kuni neid ab wecho g iagchulidakud g ha-dodakag hegam matki e koꞌij heg hekaj mo am ahgahim g Jiosh haꞌichu ahga ch pi shaꞌi dagito g haꞌichu e ahga.

column2: They cried out, shouting, “How long, Lord who is holy and true, before you will judge and bring to justice those on earth who spilled our blood?”
column3: Idam o si s-kaidam hihnk ch hab kaij, “Si s-gewkam kownal ch si s-apꞌekam ch si s-wohokam, heꞌes at wo i tashk mapt haha wo ha lodai g hemajkam an jewed dahm k ab wo ha mah g s-koꞌok namkidadag heg hekaj mat t-kokda?”

column2: Each one of them was given a white robe, and they were told to wait for a little longer until their number was complete—their fellow-believers and brothers who would be killed like them.
column3: Mt ab hahawa wehsijj i ha mahkhi g s-tohta liliwa k hab ha ahg mat wo shaꞌal baꞌich i e uhꞌulinihogid k ab wo ai mat wehs wo e koꞌij hegam ha wehm pion ch ha-wepnag mat ha wepo masma wo e koꞌij.

column2: When he opened the sixth seal there was a tremendous earthquake. The sun turned black like hair sackcloth and the whole moon turned red like blood.
column3: Tki gam hahawa ep wantsh k kuhpiꞌo g chuhdpokam cheposig hegai mo kahwalkaj ab e chehgidch. Tki am shaꞌi si uꞌugij g jewed. Kutki g tash ge chuku hab masma mo g s-kowk s-chuk ikus. Kutki g mashad wehsko ge wegih hab masma mo g ehꞌed.

column2: The stars of heaven fell to earth like unripe figs falling from a fig tree shaken by a windstorm.
column3: Tki g huhuꞌu i shul ab dahm kahchim amjed an jewed dahm hab sha masma mat g pi bakam suhna wo i shul ab e-jehj amjed mat g s-gewk hewel wo si uꞌugij.

column2: The sky disappeared like a scroll rolling up, and all the mountains and islands were moved from where they were.
column3: Tki g dahm kahchim ab wabsh i huhug hab sha masma mat g tapial wo i e holiwkad k ged hu wo e cheh. Tki wehs g dohdaꞌag ch g al siꞌiskod jejewed am shuhdagi ch ed gam hu gawulko i e uhꞌul.

column2: The kings of the earth, the great leaders, the wealthy, the powerful, and all people, slave or free, hid themselves in caves and among the rocks in the mountains.
column3: Ni ha neid matki wehs chum e eꞌesto g hemajkam, chum hems g kokownal ch si s-has hahaꞌichu ch shondal ha-geꞌegeꞌejig ch s-gewpkkam ch hegam ehp mo d shoꞌigkam ch hegam mo d nenehol. Am atki chum e eꞌesto chehcho ch ed ch am hohodai wepcho

column2: They called on the mountains and the rocks, telling them, “Fall upon us! Hide us from the face of the One who sits on the throne, and from the judgment of the Lamb.
column3: ch ab si hihnk dohdaꞌag ch hohodai wui hab kaijch, “Ab g wo i shulig t-dahm mat pi wo t-neidad g Jiosh. Oi g wo t-eꞌesto ab amjed hegai mo kahwalkaj ab e chehgidch mat pi wo s-koꞌokam t-namkid.

column2: For the terrible day of their judgment has come, and who can stand against it?”
column3: E o aihim g lodaita tash. Kutt pi wo shaꞌi t-nako matt ab wui wo gegokiwua.”

column2: Then I saw four angels standing at the four corners of the earth holding back the earth's four winds to prevent any wind from blowing on the earth, or over the sea, or against any tree.
column3: Ntki haha wabsh ha nei g giꞌik anghil. K hema ab kehk siꞌalig tahgio ch hema ab huduni tahgio ch hema ab wakolim tahgio k ch hema ab juhpin tahgio. Kuki idam an uꞌukch g giꞌik hewel mat pi an hu wo hewedad jewed dahm o an kahchki dahm. Kuki gam hu wabsh i pi hoini wehs haꞌichu.

column2: I watched another angel rise up from the east, holding the seal of the living God. He shouted in a loud voice to the four angels who had been given the power to damage the earth and the sea,
column3: Kuni hahawa hema ep neid g anghil. Kuki id ab him siꞌal wecho amjed ch g Jiosh cheposidakud uꞌa. Kuki eda ab mahks hegam giꞌik mat wo padch g jewed ch kahchki. K wabshaba ihda hema ab ha wui hab kaij.

column2: “Don't hurt the earth or the sea or the trees until we have placed a seal on the foreheads of God's true followers!”
column3: “Pi g am s-koꞌokam has wo juhni g jewed ch kahchki ch kukui. Kutt ab hoꞌip kia ha chepos g Jiosh pionag ab ha-koka ab.”

column2: I was told the number of those who were sealed: one hundred and forty-four thousand. Those who were sealed came from every tribe of the children of Israel:
column3: Kuni kah mash d siant giꞌikko wehst-mahm gamai giꞌik mihl (144,000) hegam mamt ha chepos heg hekaj Jiosh cheposidakud.

column2: twelve thousand from the tribe of Judah, twelve thousand from the tribe of Reuben, twelve thousand from the tribe of Gad,
column3: Am o haꞌichug g gamai gohk mihl (12,000) ab wehsijj i ha amjed g t-shohshonbad. Idam o wa d gamai gohk ch wa hab chechgig Judah, Reuben, Gad,

column2: twelve thousand from the tribe of Asher, twelve thousand from the tribe of Naphtali, twelve thousand from the tribe of Manasseh,
column3: Asher, Naphtali, Manasseh,

column2: twelve thousand from the tribe of Simeon, twelve thousand from the tribe of Levi, twelve thousand from the tribe of Issachar,
column3: Simeon, Levi, Issachar,

column2: twelve thousand from the tribe of Zebulun, twelve thousand from the tribe of Joseph, twelve thousand from the tribe of Benjamin.
column3: Zebulun, Joseph, Benjamin.

column2: After this I looked and saw a great crowd that nobody could count, made up of every nation, tribe, people and language. They were standing in front of the throne and the Lamb, dressed in white robes, with palm branches in their hands.
column3: Ntki hahawa ep ha nei moki am shaꞌi si geꞌe hemapig hab chuꞌig. Kuki pi ta kuintama idam hemajkam ch ab amjed g wehsko jejewed ch d nahnko mahs oꞌodham ch nahnko kaidam neneokdam.

column2: They gave a loud shout, “Salvation is from our God who sits on the throne, and from the Lamb.”
column3: ch si s-kaidam neneok ch hab kaij:

column2: All the angels surrounding the throne, and the elders and the four living creatures, fell down on their faces before the throne, worshipping God.
column3: Kuki wehsijj g anghil an ha wehgaj gegok ch am i shulig ch ab ihm g Jiosh ch hab ep kaij:

column2: One of the elders spoke to me and asked, “Who are those who are dressed in white robes, and where have they come from?”
column3: Tki hema hegam geꞌeged ab ni-kakke k hab kaij, “Dohꞌo wud idam hemajkam mo s-tohtam e enigadadch ch hebai amjed hihim?”

column2: I replied, “My Lord, you know the answer.” He told me, “These are the ones who have passed through great persecution. They washed their robes, making them white through the blood of the Lamb.
column3: Ni hab kaij ab wui, “Pi ani shaꞌi mahch. Ahpi ap wa s-mahch.”

column2: When he opened the seventh seal, there was silence in heaven for around half an hour.
column3: Tki am hahawa wantsh k kuhpiꞌo g wewaꞌakkokam cheposig hegai mo kahwalkaj ab e chehgidch. Kuki gam hu wabsh i pi shahmuni an dahm kahchim ch ed am huꞌi eda hugkam ohla.

column2: I saw the seven angels that stand before God. They were given seven trumpets.
column3: Kuni haha wabsh ha neid hegam wewaꞌak anghil moki am gegok Jiosh tahgio. Mtki idam ab i ha mahkhi g wewaꞌak kukuikud.

column2: Then another angel came and stood at  the altar. He had a golden censer and he was given a large quantity of incense to add to the prayers of all the saints on the golden altar that stands in front of the throne.
column3: Kuki am kehk g iagchulidakud kownal daikud baꞌich. Tki heg wui am hema ep jiwia g anghil k g ohla haꞌa uꞌa. Kumtki am eda geꞌe toꞌi g s-ap uhwchu mat ab wo i wehnad g ha-hoꞌigeꞌidalig g Jiosh hemajkamga k am wo iagchul Jiosh wui.

column2: The smoke of the incense rose together with the prayers of the saints before God from the hand of the angel.
column3: Kutki g anghil mehi g s-ap uhwchu. Tki g kuhbs ab amjed am uhgk i chesh wehnadk g ha-hoꞌigeꞌidalig g hemajkam.

column2: The angel took the censer and filled it with fire from the altar, and threw it down upon the earth; there was the sound of thunder, with lightning flashes, and a terrible earthquake.
column3: Tki am hahawa bei g mehi ab amjed g iagchulidakud heg hekaj ohla haꞌa k am iawua jewed dahm. Kutki am shaꞌi si kop g tataniki k si s-kaidag. Kuki g wepgi an tohonnod ch g jewed si uꞌugij.

column2: Then the seven angels holding the seven trumpets prepared to blow them.
column3: Tki hegam wewaꞌak anghil mo uꞌa g wewaꞌak kukuikud am i e nako mat wo ku.

column2: The first angel blew his trumpet. Hail and fire mixed with blood rained down on the earth. One third of the earth was burned up, one third of the trees were burned up and all the green grass was burned up.
column3: Tki g wehpeg anghil am si kuhu g e-kuikudkaj. Tki g chea ch mehi wehnadch g ehꞌed ab i e iawua an dahm g jewed. Kutki hemako tahpani mei g jewed mo waik e tahpanch (⅓). Kutki g kukui hab waꞌap masma haꞌas meitto. Tki g washai wehs meitto.

column2: The second angel blew his trumpet. Something looking like a huge mountain of flaming fire was thrown into the sea. One third of the sea turned to blood,
column3: Tki g gokkokam anghil am hahawa epai kuhu g e-kuikudkaj. Tki am haꞌichu e daꞌich ge shuhdagi ch ed ch hab sha mahs mo g ge geꞌe doꞌag ch meihim. Tki hemako tahpani mo waik e tahpanch g ge shuhdagi wabsh e ehꞌedch.

column2: and one third of the creatures that lived in the sea died, and one third of all ships were destroyed.
column3: Tki haꞌakia ep koi g haꞌichu doakam am ge shuhdagi ch ed ch haꞌakia ep wachkk g wapalko am shuhdagi ch ed.

column2: The third angel blew his trumpet. A great star fell from heaven, blazing brightly. It fell on a third of the rivers and springs of water.
column3: Tki g waikkokam anghil am hahawa ep ku. Tki g geꞌe huꞌu ab i gei dahm kahchim t amjed k hab masma meihim mo g kuhchki ch maꞌish g hemako tahpani mo waik e tahpanch g aꞌakimel ch shohshonkam shuhdagi.

column2: The name of the star is Wormwood, and one third of the water turned bitter,  and many people died from drinking the water because it had become poisonous.
column3: K hab chehgig ihda huꞌu S-siwkam. Kutki g hemako tahpani mo waik e tahpanch g shuhdagi wabsh ge siwa. Tki muꞌi hemajkam koi chum iꞌik ihda shuhdagi no pi si s-siw.

column2: The fourth angel blew his trumpet. One third of the sun, moon, and stars were struck so a third of them would be darkened, and a third part of the day would not give light, similarly the night.
column3: Tki g giꞌikkokam anghil am hahawa epai kuhu g e-kuikudkaj. Kutki g hemako tahpani mo waik e tahpanch g tash ch mashad ch huhuꞌu ge chuku. Kutki heg hekaj haꞌas huhug g ha-tonlig ch haꞌas tash pi tonod tash oidam ch chuhug oidam.

column2: I saw and heard an eagle flying in mid-heaven, shouting loudly, “Disaster, disaster, disaster is coming to those who live on the earth because of what is going to happen when the three remaining angels blow their trumpets.”
column3: Nt am hahawa ep i nen k kah. Kuki si s-kaidam hab kaij g baꞌag an uhgk daꞌadch, “Eh, si s-ta ehbidama! Dat wo si s-ta ehbidamak am ha wehhejed hegam mo an kih jewed dahm mat ab wo kaida g kuikud ab ha amjed hegam waik anghil mat am ep wo kuhk.”

column2: The fifth angel blew his trumpet. I watched a star fall from heaven to earth. He  was given the key to the opening of the Abyss.
column3: Tki am hahawa ep kuhu g hetaspokam anghil g e-kuikudkaj. Kuni neid g huꞌu. Tki id am gei jewed dahm ab dahm kahchim t amjed. Kumtki ab mah hegai yahwi mo heg d wuikam wag mo pi hebai hug.

column2: He opened the entrance to the Abyss, and smoke came up out of the Abyss like the smoke of a huge furnace. The sun and the atmosphere became dark because of the smoke from the Abyss.
column3: Kutki ihda huꞌu am kuhpiꞌo hegai wag. Tki g kuhbs hab masma ab i wuhsh mo ab amjed g si geꞌe nahdakud. Kutki g tash tonlig wabsh wehsko chuku heg hekaj kuhbs ab amjed g wag.

column2: Locusts came out of the smoke onto the earth, and they were given power like that possessed by scorpions.
column3: Tki g geꞌeged shoshꞌo ab i huhud amjed g kuhbs an dahm g jewed. Kumtki ab ha mah g gewkdag mat s-koꞌokam wo ha juh hab masma mo g nanakshel.

column2: They were told not to harm the grass or any vegetation or any trees, only those who did not have the seal of God on their foreheads.
column3: Kum hab ha ahg mat pi wo koꞌokam has juh g washai ch kukui ch wehs haꞌichu wuhshanig. Hegam atsh wo waꞌi s-koꞌokam has ha juh hemajkam mo pi ab hu cheposidas e-koka ab heg hekaj Jiosh cheposidakud.

column2: They were not allowed to kill, but they could torture these people for five months. The torture was like that of a scorpion when it stings someone.
column3: Kumtki pi ha hiwigi idam shoshꞌo mat wo ha kokda idam hemajkam k wabshaba wabsh wo s-koꞌokam ha shoꞌigch hetasp mashad ab. Kuki g s-koꞌok ab amjed g ha-shoꞌigchuda hab masma s-koꞌok mo g nakshel keꞌi.

column2: During that time people will look for death, but won't find it; they will want to die, but death will run away from them!
column3: Kutki heg oidam hetasp mashad idam hemajkam wo chum si s-koꞌim k wabshaba pi wo koi.

column2: The locusts looked like war-horses. They wore what seemed to be golden crowns on their heads, and their faces looked human.
column3: Kuki idam shoshꞌo hab mams mo hegam kakawyu mo e hekaj am cheggiadag ch ed. Kuki g ha-mohmi hab mams mo g uꞌuwi ha-mohmi. K an ha-mohmi an wahpkch g ohla gigiko.

column2: They had long hair like women and had teeth like lions.
column3: Kuki g ha-wuhpiosha sha oꞌodham ha-wuhpiosha mams. Kuki g ha-tahtami hab mams mo g mawid tahtami.

column2: Their breastplates looked like they were made of iron, and the noise made by their wings sounded like many horses and chariots racing into battle.
column3: Kuki g ha-babsho ab haꞌichukaj mamꞌaishch mo hab sha mams mo g wainomi koktoni. K g ha-aꞌan hab sha kaidag mo g muꞌi cheggiakud kakalit an wohpo mat wo ha cheggia.

column2: They had tails like scorpions, complete with stingers. They had the power to hurt people for five months with their tails.
column3: Kuki g ha-bahbhai ch ha-uꞌush hab mams mo g nanakshel ha-uꞌush. K g e-bahbhaikaj e nakog mat wo s-koꞌokam has ha juh g hemajkam hetasp mashad ab.

column2: Ruling over them as their king was the angel of the Abyss who is called Abaddon in Hebrew and Apollyon in Greek.
column3: Kuki ep ge kownalig. K id am ha wanimed ch d hegai anghil mo nuhkud g s-juhk wag ch hab chehgig am t-neꞌoki ed Abbadon k ch am Greek ha-neꞌoki ed hab chehgig Apollyon. K id hab d ahga Haꞌichu Padchuddam.

column2: The first Disaster is over, but there are still two more to come.
column3: Tki am i huhug ihda wehpeg si s-ta ehbidam haꞌichu. K id i dahm matki am hab ep wo e juh g gohk si s-ta ehbidam haꞌichu.

column2: The sixth angel blew his trumpet. I heard a voice come from the horns of the golden altar that stands in front of God
column3: Tki g chuhdpokam anghil am hahawa epai kuhu g e-kuikudkaj. Kuni kah mo ab hema neok ab chuhchpulij amjed hegai ohla iagchulidakud mo am kehk baꞌich g Jiosh.

column2: speaking to the sixth angel that had the trumpet: “Release the four angels that are tied up beside the great River Euphrates.”
column3: K hegai mo ab neok hab kaij heg wui anghil mo d chuhdpokam ch an uꞌukch g kuikud, “Ha g dagito hegam giꞌik anghil mo am e wupulshch heg bahsho akimel mo hab chehgig Euphrates.”

column2: The four angels who had been kept ready for this particular hour, day, month and year were released to kill one third of humanity.
column3: Mtki am i ha dagito idam giꞌik anghil. Idam oki wa e nahtokch id si wehhejed ohla id si tash ed id si mashad ab ch id si ahidag ed mat wo ha kokda g hemako tahpani mo waik e tahpanch wehs hemajkam.

column2: I was told the number of the army of soldiers on horseback: it was 200 million.
column3: Kum am ni-ahgid mash d gohk siant mi-yohn (200,000,000) idam mo g kakawyu ha chehchejch.

column2: In my vision I saw the horses and their riders who wore breastplates as red as fire, and dark blue and yellow. The heads of the horses looked like lions, and fire and smoke and sulfur streamed out of their mouths.
column3: Kuni am ni-tahgio neid g kakawyu ch hegam mo ha chehchejch. Kuki g ha-wainomi koktoni si s-wepegi ch ep s-oꞌam ch hab masma s-chehedagi mo g dahm kahchim. K g kakawyu ha-mohmi hab mams mo g maipid ha-mohmi. K ab ha-chihchini amjed ab i wuhshani g mei ch kuhbs ch s-uam uhw.

column2: One third of humanity was killed by these three plagues, by the fire and smoke and sulfur streaming out of their mouths.
column3: Tki g hemako tahpani mo waik e tahpanch g hemajkam e koꞌij id hekaj waik haꞌichu mo ab wuhshani ha-chihchini amjed.

column2: The horses' power was in their tails as well as their mouths, for their tails were like snakes' heads that they used to hurt people.
column3: Kuki idam kakawyu hab waꞌap s-gewpkdag am ha bahbhai am. Ha-bahbhai oki hab mams mo g kohkꞌoi ch ab ge mohmi. K id hekaj s-koꞌokam has ha wua.

column2: But the rest of humanity who were not killed by these plagues did not repent of what they were doing. They did not stop worshiping demons and idols of gold, silver, bronze, and stone—which can't see or hear or walk!
column3: Kutki wabshaba hegam hemajkam mat an wih pi gam hu s-ohhod g pi ap e-chuꞌijig k ab wabsh kia ha ihm g jijawul ch ab ep ha ihm g e-jijoshchuda. Kuki eda ihda pi am hu haꞌichu d i ha-wehmtadag. Ha-jijoshchuda o d wabsh haꞌichu ha-nahtoi ch pi haꞌichu neid ch pi haꞌichu kah ch pi shaꞌi oiopo no pi d wabsh ohla ch plahda ch kohwli ch hodai ch uhs.

column2: They did not repent of their murders, their witchcraft, their sexual sins, or their thefts.
column3: Idam hemajkam atki pi shaꞌi dagito g e-muꞌadag ch e-hihoina ch haꞌichu ehsig ch hegai mo s-tohntom haꞌichu wua aꞌai e wehm.

column2: Then I saw another powerful angel descending from heaven, with a cloud wrapped around him and with a rainbow over his head. His face looked like the sun, and his feet like pillars of fire.
column3: Ntki hahawa ab nei matki ab hema i hud g s-gewk anghil ab dahm kahchim amjed. Id oki g chewagikaj e enigadadch ch g kiohod an hab juhkch e-moꞌo an. Kuki g wuhioshaj hab mahs mo g tash. K g kakhioj hab mahs mo g mehi am wuhshanim.

column2: He was holding a small scroll that had already been opened. He placed his right foot on the sea, and this left foot on the land.
column3: Id oki g s-apko e-tadkaj am keishch g ge shuhdagi ch g s-ohgig e-tadkaj am keishch g jewed. Kuki an hab chuꞌig g oꞌohana nowij ed ch pi holiwkas.

column2: He gave a great shout, like a lion roaring. When he shouted, the seven thunders responded.
column3: Kuki am si s-kaidam neok ch hab sha kaidag mo g mawid ab todk. Kutki g wewaꞌak tataniki ab hahawa uhpam neneo todkch.

column2: When the seven thunders spoke, I was about to write down what they said when I heard a voice from heaven that told me, “Keep under seal what the seven thunders said. Don't write them down.”
column3: Nt am haha wabsh wo i chum oꞌoha. Tki wabshaba ab hema neo dahm kahchim t amjed k hab kaij, “Pi g am hedai shaꞌi ahgid mo has kaij idam wewaꞌak tataniki. Pi g an hu shaꞌi oꞌohan.”

column2: The angel I saw standing on the sea and on the land held up his right hand to heaven.
column3: Kutki ihda anghil mo an dahm kehk g ge kahchki ch jewed ab si uhgk i bei g s-apkojed e-nowi ab dahm kahchim wui

column2: He made a sacred oath by the One who lives for ever and ever, who created the heavens and everything in them, and the earth and everything in it, and the sea and everything in it. “No more delay!” he said.
column3: k hab kaij, “Jiosh o chum hekid an haꞌichug ch nahto g dahm kahchim ch jewed kahchim ch ge kahchki ch wehs haꞌichu mo am ha eda idam k hab kaij mat am wa e ai mat geꞌe haꞌichu hab wo e juh.

column2: But at the time when the seventh angel speaks, when he blows his trumpet, then the mystery of God will be completed—the good news he announced through his servants the prophets.
column3: Wewaꞌakkokam anghil at am wo kuhu g e-kuikudkaj. T am hab haha wo juh g Jiosh g s-aꞌagi e-apchuda mo wa am ha ahgid hegam e-pionagbad mo d Jiosh haꞌichu i tashogiddam.”

column2: Then I heard again the voice from heaven telling me, “Go and take the scroll that is open in the hand of the angel that stands on the sea and on the land.”
column3: Kutki hegai mo wa ab neok ni-wui ab dahm kahchim t amjed ab ep neok k hab kaij, “Neh, an o uꞌukch g oꞌohana hegai anghil mo an dahm kehk g kahchki ch jewed. Am g hihm k ab behꞌi.”

column2: So I went to the angel, and asked him to give me the little scroll. He said to me, “Take it and eat it up. It will be sour in your stomach, but sweet as honey in your mouth.”
column3: Nt am hih wui hegai anghil k ab tahni mat wo ni-mah.

column2: I took the little scroll from the angel and ate it up. In my mouth it was as sweet as honey, but it was sour in my stomach.
column3: Nt ab bei g al oꞌohana nowij ab k huh. K s-wohom si s-iꞌowi mant huh. Nt wabshaba am i bah. T hahawa si siwa am ni-wohk ed.

column2: I was told, “You must prophesy again regarding many peoples, nations, languages, and kings.”
column3: Kum ab hahawa ep ni-ahgid ihda, “Am apt ep wo oꞌoha g Jiosh haꞌichu ahga ab ha amjed muꞌi nahnko mahs mehk jewed dakam hemajkam ch kokownal ch nahnko kaidam neneokdam.”

column2: I was given a measuring rod and told, “Get up and measure the Temple of God, and the altar, and count those who are worshiping there.
column3: Kumtki ab hahawa hema ni-mah g kuintakud uhs k hab ni-ahg, “I g wuhshani k an kuint g Jiosh cheopiga ch g iagchulidakud k wo ha kuint hegam mo am e hoꞌigeꞌidahun Jiosh wui amai.

column2: Don't measure the court outside the Temple, leave that, because it has been handed over to the nations. They will trample down the holy city for forty-two months.
column3: T wabshaba hegai mo an wehgaj kolhaitas am i e dagito ha wui g nahnko mahs hemajkam. Pt pi an hu has wo i juh. Idam nahnko mahs hemajkam at wo kehiwia hegai mo d chum si Hekia S-apꞌekam Kihhim am oidam g giꞌikko wehst-mahm gamai gohk (42) mashad.

column2: I will give my two witnesses power, and they will prophesy 1,260 days, dressed in sackcloth.”
column3: Jiosh o hab kaij, “Gohk ant wo ha mah g ni-pionag g gewkdag. T idam am wo ahgahi g haꞌichu ni-ahga ab wabsh shoꞌig e enigadad g dahumkaj heg oidam hemako mihl gohk siant chuhdpo wehst-mahm (1260) tash.”

column2: They are the two olive trees and the two candlesticks that stand in front of the Lord of the earth.
column3: Neh, t am hahawa ni-chehgi matki has wo masmak idam gohk. Kutki hab wo masmak mo hegam gohk olive uꞌus wuhshanig mo wa heki hu oꞌohanas ab ha amjed ch hab ep wo masmak mo hegam gohk lalampa mo am chuhch geꞌe cheopi ch ed.

column2: If anyone tries to harm them, fire comes out of their mouths and burns up their enemies. This is how anyone who tries to harm them will be killed.
column3: Kuki g mehi ab i wushke ha-chihchini amjed ch ha kokda g ha-obga. Kut hedai wo i chum s-koꞌokam has ha juh k wo e kokda.

column2: These two witnesses have the power to close the sky so that it will not rain during the time of their prophecy. They also have the power to turn the waters into blood, and to strike the earth with all kinds of plagues, as often as they want.
column3: Ab oki mahks g apꞌedag mat wo kuh g dahm kahchim. T pi wo ha juhkad heg oidam mat am wo ahgad g Jiosh haꞌichu ahga. Ab oki ep mahks g apꞌedag mat wo ehꞌedch g shohshonkam shuhdagi k an wo i wuhshad g nahnko mahs si shoꞌigdag ch mumkidag ia jewed dahm.

column2: When they finish their testimony, the beast coming from the Abyss will attack them, defeat them, and kill them.
column3: Tki am wo i nahto g e-chikpan. Tki ab hema wo i wuhsh g s-ta ehbidamakam oꞌodham ge shuhdagi t amjed k e wepogidch g mischini haꞌichu doakam ch wo ha cheggia k wo ha gewito k wo ha kokda idam gohk.

column2: Their dead bodies will lie on the open street of the great city, called Sodom and Egypt in spiritual symbolism—also the place where their Lord was crucified.
column3: Tki g ha-koꞌidag am wo wehchkad wohg ch ed heg eda geꞌe kihhim mat wa amai g s-apꞌekam t-kownalig ab e naggia kots t ab. Ihda kihhim at e wepodad g si pi apꞌekam k hab e aꞌaga Sodom ch hab ep e aꞌaga Egypt.

column2: For three and a half days those from the peoples and tribes and languages and nations will look at their dead bodies, and will not allow their corpses to be buried.
column3: Wehs nahnko kaidam neneokdam an wehs jewed dahm atki wo ha neidad mat idam gohk am wo wehchk waik eda hugkam tash. Kumtki pi wo ha hiwigi mamt ged hu wo ha hihash.

column2: The inhabitants of the earth are delighted they are dead, and celebrate, sending gifts to each other, because these two prophets had been a torment to them.
column3: Tki g hemajkam wo si s-hehgigk mat koi ch wo pipiast k ab aꞌai wo e mah g haꞌichu mahkigdag noki pi ha shoꞌigchud idam gohk.

column2: But three and half days later God's life-giving breath entered them and they stood on their feet. Those who saw this were absolutely terrified.
column3: Am i dahm g waik eda hugkam tash, ni am neid matki g Jiosh ab haha wo i ha mah g doakag. Tki wo gegokiwua. Kutki wehsijj hegam mat wo nei ihda wo si s-ehbeni.

column2: The two witnesses heard a loud voice from heaven telling them, “Come up here!” So they ascended to heaven in a cloud while their enemies watched.
column3: Kutki idam gohk wo kah mo ab hema si neok ab dahm kahchim t amjed ch hab kaij, “Ab g wo i hihim.” Kutki am wo i chehchsh dahm kahchim wui am chewagi ch ed am ha-neidag ed g e-obga.

column2: At the same time there was a huge earthquake, and one tenth of the city collapsed. Seven thousand people were killed in the earthquake, and the rest were terrified, and gave glory to the God of heaven.
column3: Tki am waꞌi hekaj am si s-gewkam wo uꞌugij g jewed. Kutki g hemako tahpani mo wehst-mahm e tahpanch (1/10) g kihhim wo i gei. Kutki wewaꞌak mihl (7000) hemajkam wo e koꞌij heg eda jewed uꞌugij. Kutki hegam haꞌi matki am wo wih wo shaꞌi si s-ehbeni k ab wo si has el g gewkdaj g Jiosh.

column2: The second Disaster is over; the third Disaster is about to arrive!
column3: Id o d i gokkokam haꞌichu s-ta ehbidamakam mat iaꞌi kuhgi. T wabshaba g waikkokam hahawa s-hohtam hab wo e juh.

column2: The seventh angel blew his trumpet, and loud voices shouted in heaven, “The kingdom of the world has become the kingdom of our Lord, and of his Christ, and he shall reign for ever and ever.”
column3: Kut g wewaꞌakkokam anghil am hahawa kuhu g e-kuikudkaj. K am haꞌi si s-kaidam neneok ab dahm kahchim t amjed ch hab kaij, “Wehs g kokownaltalig ia jewed dahm at d haha wo Jiosh kownaltaligk. Kut am wo ha dahmkad g si e-kehsha wehm iꞌajed ch chum hekid.”

column2: The twenty-four elders who sit on their thrones in God's presence fell down on their faces and worshipped God.
column3: Kutki hegam gokko gamai giꞌik geꞌeged ab i shulig k gd hu si kokawua k ab ihm g Jiosh

column2: They said, “We thank you, O Lord God, the All-powerful One, who is and was, because you have taken up your great power and have asserted your rule.”
column3: ch hab kaij:

column2: Then the Temple of God in heaven was opened, and the ark of the covenant could be seen inside his Temple. There were lightning flashes, the sound of thunder, an earthquake, and a great hailstorm.
column3: Kutki g Jiosh cheopi an dahm kahchim ch ed ab i e kuhpiꞌo. T am e chehgi hegai uhs washa mo am eda wehch g Jiosh haꞌichu ahꞌadadag. Kut am si tohonno g wepgi. K an kaidag g tataniki. T g jewed uꞌugij. T g chea s-gewkam gei.

column2: Then an amazing sign appeared in heaven: a woman clothed with the sun, with the moon under her feet, and a crown of twelve stars on her head.
column3: Am atki hahawa haꞌichu si geꞌe e chehgi an dahm kahchim ch ed. Am aniki neid mat g uwi am hema i wuhsh. Kuki g ipudaj hab mahs mo g tash. Ihda uwi oki an keishch g mashad ch g gihko ab wahkch e-moꞌo ab. K id ab gamai gohk huhuꞌu an dadha.

column2: She was pregnant, and she cried out because of her labor pains, groaning as she was giving birth.
column3: Kutki wo ge madt. Tki ab i hihhi g s-koꞌok matki wo mahmadho. K hekaj am si shoshshak.

column2: Another sign appeared in heaven: a great red dragon with seven heads and ten horns, with seven small crowns on his heads.
column3: Am atki hahawa haꞌichu ep i e chehgi dahm kahchim ch ed. Niki am neid matki am hema i wuhshani k e wepogid g geꞌe nehbig hujud ch ge s-wegi ch ge wewaꞌak mohmi ch wehst-mahm aꞌag. K g gigiko an hab chuhchuꞌig wehs ha ab g mohmij.

column2: His tail swept away a third of the stars of heaven and threw them down to the earth. The dragon stood right in front of the woman who was giving birth, so that he could eat her child as soon as it was born.
column3: Kutki g e-baikaj i ha chewaim g hemako tahpani mo waik e tahpanch g huhuꞌu k im hu hab i ha juh ab dahm kahchim amjed ch am ha nehnich jewed dahm. Kutki wo mahmadho hegai uwi. T ihda Nehbig Hujud e wepogiddam am wui i kekiwua mat wo huh g madaj mat wabsh wo chum mahsi.

column2: She gave birth to a son, a male child, who will rule all nations with an iron rod. Her son was snatched up to God and his throne.
column3: Kutki am i mahmadho g uwi. Tsh g madaj am d wo kownalk wehs ha dahm g jejewed. Mtki am ha hekaj bei g ali k gam hu i bei Jiosh wui. K heg an da kownal daikud ed.

column2: The woman ran away into the desert, where God had prepared a place for her, so that she could be looked after for 1,260 days.
column3: Tki hegai uwi gam hu heb hu meh am tohono jewed ch ed. Am atki i apch g Jiosh wehhejed mat am wo e nuhkud hemako mihl gohk siant chuhdpo wehst-mahm (1260) tash.

column2: There was war in heaven. Michael and his angels fought with the dragon. The dragon and his angels fought  but he was not strong enough, and they could no longer remain in heaven.
