column2: May the God of hope completely fill you with all joy and peace as you trust in him, so that you will overflow with hope through the power of the Holy Spirit!
column3: Jiosh at hab em‑juh mamt wabsh wo nenidad matp haschu am hab wo i em‑juni. Kuni ab tahni mat ab wo i gewkai g em‑wohochudadag mamt hekaj wo si s‑hehgigk ch wo si s‑ap e tahtkk ab wui. Bamt masma baꞌich i s‑ap wo nenidad g e‑apꞌedag. T g Hekia S‑apꞌekam Gewkdag ab baꞌich wo i em‑mah g wohochudadag.

column2: I'm convinced that you, my brothers and sisters, are full of goodness, and that you are filled with every kind of knowledge, so you are well able to teach one another.
column3: Ni‑wepnag, s‑mahch ani mamtp hu hi wa i s‑ap am hab e junihim ch muꞌi haꞌichu s‑mahch mamt s‑ap aꞌai wo e mashcha.

column2: I've been blunt in the way I have written to you about some of these things, but this is just to remind you. For God gave me grace
column3: Ni wabshaba id eda oꞌohana si s‑gewkam haꞌichu am em‑ahgid mant am wo i em‑chegitoich. Jiosh at ab has ni‑elid k am i ni‑kei

column2: to be a minister of Christ Jesus to the foreigners, like a priest sharing God's good news, so that they could become an acceptable offering, made holy by the Holy Spirit.
column3: mant d wo piongajk g Jesus Christ em‑wehhejed ahpim gawul mahs hemajkam. Am ani wehsko ahgachug g s‑kehg haꞌichu ahgaj g Jiosh am ha wui g gawul mahs hemajkam. K heg hekaj ha apꞌechudahim g Hekia S‑apꞌekam Gewkdag. K ab ihm g Jiosh idam.

column2: So even though I have something to boast about because of my service for God,
column3: Kuni si s‑ap ni‑tahtk ch chikpanid g Jiosh ahgachugch g haꞌichu ahgaj ab amjed g Jesus Christ.

column2: (I wouldn't dare talk about any of this except as Christ has done it through me), I have led foreigners to obedience through my teaching and demonstration,
column3: Heg at am hab ha juh g gawul mahs hemajkam mat ab s‑wohog el g Jiosh heg hekaj mani has i kaij ch has ni‑wua. Kuni heg waꞌi s‑em‑ahgidamk mat heg has e juh.

column2: through the power of signs and miracles done with the Holy Spirit's power. From Jerusalem all the way over to Illyricum, everywhere I've shared fully the good news of Christ.
column3: Hekia S‑apꞌekam Gewkdag o ab ni‑mahkch hegai gewkdag mani hekaj hab wua g s‑hasig haꞌichu. K id am wohokamchud g haꞌichu ahgaj g Jiosh. Kunt am i ahgahi Jerusalem t amjed wehs jejewed ha oidch gam hu Illyricum (Albania) jewed hugkam.

column2: In fact I was keen to spread the good news in places that hadn't heard the name of Christ, so that I wouldn't be building on what others have done.
column3: Chum ani hekid hab ni‑elid mant am wo i ahgahi ihda s‑kehg haꞌichu ahga mo hebai pi koi shaꞌi kah g hemajkam ab amjed g Christ k hab si wechij am wo i shonwuich.

column2: As Scripture says, “Those who haven't been told the good news will discover him, and those who haven't heard will understand.”
column3: Neh, bo d ahga ihda Jiosh oꞌohana mo hab chuꞌig:

column2: But now, as there's nowhere left here to work, and since I've looked forward to visiting you for many years,
column3: K wabshaba hemu pi am hu ha wiꞌis manis am hu wo ahgachugad g Jiosh haꞌichu ahga am ha oidch idam jejewed. Muꞌi aꞌahidag ani am chum s‑em‑chehgimelimk

column2: when I go to Spain I hope to see you when I pass through. Maybe you can give me some help for my journey once we've enjoyed some time together.
column3: ch antp huꞌi haha wo ni‑nako hemuch am himadch Spain jewed wui nani pi am s‑himimk. S‑mahch ani hi wa mamt am wo i ni‑wehmt mant am wo him k am heꞌes wo i em‑neidchkahim ch s‑ap wo ni‑tahtkk.

column2: At the moment I'm on my way to Jerusalem to help the believers there,
column3: Nt wabshaba wehpeg gam hu wo hih Jerusalem wui k am haꞌichukaj wo i ha wehmt g t‑wehm wohochuddam amai.

column2: because the believers in Macedonia and Achaia thought it was a good idea to send a contribution to the poor among the believers in Jerusalem.
column3: Si ash e shoꞌigchud g t‑wehm wohochuddam Jerusalem t am. T hegam t‑wehm wohochuddam mo am kih Macedonia ch Greece jejewed ch ed hab i e ah mat wo i hemapai g lial k hekaj wo i ha wehmt.

column2: They were happy to do this because they're in their debt.  Now that foreigners are sharing their spiritual benefits, they owe it to the Jewish believers to help them in material things.
column3: S‑apꞌe o mat am aigo wo i ha wehmt nat pi ab ha amjed i hih g s‑kehg haꞌichu ahgaj g Jiosh.

column2: So once I've done this, and have safely delivered this contribution to them, I'll visit you on my way to Spain.
column3: Neh, am ant ha wehm wo hih hegam mat am wo i ui g ha‑mahkigdag Jerusalem t am. Heg i dahm ant am haha wo i em‑chehgim am himadch mant gam hu wo hih Spain wui.

column2: I know that when I come, Christ will give us his full blessing.
column3: S‑mahch ani matt ab aꞌai wo si s‑t‑hoꞌigeꞌel mant am wo jiwia em‑wui.

column2: I want to encourage you, my brothers and sisters through our Lord Jesus Christ and through the love of the Spirit, to join together in praying hard for me.
column3: Dam ni‑wehm wohochuddam g t‑kownalig Jesus Christ. K g Hekia S‑apꞌekam Gewkdag ab em‑mahkch g gewkdag mamt wo si pihk e elidad ha hekaj g e‑wehm wohochuddam. Kuni heg hekaj ab em‑tahni mamt ab wo si e shoꞌigch Jiosh wui

column2: Pray that I may be kept safe from the unbelievers in Judea. Pray that my work in Jerusalem will be welcomed by the believers there.
column3: k ab wo tai mat wo si ni‑nuhkudad. T hab pi has wo ni‑juh hegam mo pi ab hu wohochud g Christ amai Judea ch ed. Ab g ep wo tahni g Jiosh mat am hab wo ha juh g t‑wehm wohochuddam mat ab wabsh s‑ap wo ui g t‑mahkigdag.

column2: Pray that I will come to you with gladness, as God wills, so we can enjoy one another's company.
column3: Nt heg hekaj si s‑ap ni‑tahtk k am wo i em‑chehgim matp hab wo elidad g Jiosh.

column2: May the God of peace be with you all. Amen.
column3: Jiosh o ab t‑mahkch g s‑ap tahhadkam. Ni ab tahni mat ab baꞌich wo i em‑wehmt.

column2: I recommend to you our sister Phoebe, who is a deaconess at the Cenchreae church.
column3: Am atsh wo i em‑chehgim ihda t‑wehm wohochuddam mo hab chehgig Phebe ch am i ha wehmt g t‑wehm wohochuddam Cenchrea kihhim t am.

column2: Please welcome her in the Lord, as believers should, and help her in whatever way she needs, because she has been a great help to many people, myself included.
column3: Mt s‑ap ab wo i nei am wehhejed g t‑kownalig Jesus. Ab o d t‑wuikam matt ab wo i ha wahpki hegam mo an oiopod ch chikpan g Jiosh haꞌichu ahga. Geꞌe haꞌichu o am hab junihim ihda Phebe muꞌi t‑wehhejed. Kumt am wo i wehmt heg hekaj mat haschu wo i tatchua.

column2: Pass on my greetings to Prisca and Aquila, my co-workers in Christ Jesus,
column3: Am g wo ha ahgid g ni‑machiga amai mat ab wo i s‑ni‑hoꞌigeꞌel. Kah ani mash am dadha g Priscilla ch Aquila. Idam o wa am ni‑wehm chikpanahim

column2: who risked their lives for me. It's not just me who is very thankful for them, but all the churches of the foreigners too.
column3: ch chum alo e koꞌij ni‑wehhejed. Kuni ab si s‑ha hoꞌigeꞌid. K hegam gawul mahs hemajkam mo ab ni‑ab kah g Jiosh haꞌichu ahga hab waꞌap ab s‑ha hoꞌigeꞌid mat ni‑doꞌibia.

column2: Please also give my greetings to the church that meets in their home. Pass on my best wishes to my good friend Epaenetus, the first person to follow Christ in the province of Asia.
column3: Kah ani mash am haꞌi e hehemapad ch e mihshmad ha‑kih am idam Priscilla ch Aquila. Kumt am wo ha ahgi mat ab wo i s‑ni‑hoꞌigeꞌel.

column2: Give my greetings to Mary, who worked hard for you,
column3: Sh am si i em‑wehmt g ni‑machiga Mary. Kumt am wo ahgi mat ab wo i s‑ni‑hoꞌigeꞌel.

column2: and also Andronicus and Junia, from my own country and fellow-prisoners. They are well-known among the apostles, and became followers of Christ before me.
column3: Sh g ni‑hajuni Andronicus ch Junia am ep em‑wehmaj. Idam at wa wehpeg ab i s‑wohoch g s‑kehg haꞌichu ahgaj g Jiosh. Nt ab hahawa i s‑wohoch. S‑ap o ahgachug g Jiosh haꞌichu ahga mo heg hekaj ab gawulkdas. Kum wa hab waꞌap ha kuhpchkahim. Am g wo ha ahgid mat ab wo i s‑ni‑hoꞌigeꞌel.

column2: Give my best to Ampliatus, my good friend in the Lord;
column3: Kush g Ampliatas am ep dak ch d si ni‑nawoj am Christ himdag ed.

column2: to Urbanus, our co-worker in Christ; and to my dear friend Stachys.
column3: Sh am ep em‑wehmaj hegai Urbanus mo wa am ni‑wehm ahgachug g Jiosh haꞌichu ahga. Sh g Stacas am ep em‑wehmaj ch d si ni‑nawoj.

column2: My greetings to Apelles, a trustworthy man in Christ. Greetings to Aristobulus's family,
column3: Sh g Apelles am ep em‑wehmaj ch hab waꞌap e chehgidch mo am hab waꞌap haꞌichu hab junihim wehhejed g Christ.

column2: to my countryman Herodion, and to those from Narcissus' family who belong to the Lord.
column3: Sh g Herodion am ep em‑wehmaj ch d ni‑hajuni. Idam g wo ha ahgid mat ab wo i s‑ni‑hoꞌigeꞌel.

column2: My best wishes to Tryphaena and Tryphosa, hard workers for the Lord, and to my friend Persis, who has done so much in the Lord.
column3: Sh am ep em‑wehmaj g Tripina ch Triposa ch am chikpan g Jiosh haꞌichu ahga. Sh g Persis am ep si chikpan.

column2: Give my greetings to Rufus, an exceptional worker, and his mother—who I count as my mother too.
column3: Sh g Rufus g si geꞌe chikpan am hab waꞌap junihim. Rufus jeꞌe o hab masma ab ni‑neid mani d madaj. Kumt wehs am wo ha ahgi idam mat ab wo s‑ni‑hoꞌigeꞌel.

column2: Greetings to Asyncritus, Phlegon, Hermes, Patrobas, Hermas, and the fellow-believers who are with them.
column3: Sh am e wehm ab ihm g Jiosh hegam Asincritas ch Plegon ch Hermes ch Patrobas ch Hermas ch haꞌi ehp. Kumt am wo ha ahgi mat ab wo i s‑ni‑hoꞌigeꞌel.

column2: Best wishes to Philologus and Julia, Nereus and his sister, Olympas, and to all the believers with them.
column3: Sh am e wehm ab ihm g Jiosh hegam Philologas ch Julia ch hegam Nerias g e‑uwiga wehm ch Olimpas ch haꞌi ehp. Kumt am wo ha ahgi mat ab wo i s‑ni‑hoꞌigeꞌel.

column2: Greet one another affectionately. All the churches of Christ send their greetings to you.
column3: Ab g wo e chehgid mam aꞌai s‑e hoꞌigeꞌelid. Wehsijj hegam mo an aꞌai e nanmek ch ab ihm g Jesus Christ o ab s‑em‑hoꞌigeꞌid.

column2: Now I'm pleading with you my fellow-believers: watch out for those who cause arguments and confuse people about the teachings you learned. Stay away from them!
column3: Neh, am ant haꞌichu wo em‑ahgi, ni‑wepnag. An o haꞌi oiopod ch am gawul junihim g Jiosh haꞌichu ahga ch am haꞌichu hab ahg mat hekaj wo e kudu g t‑wehm wohochuddam k ab e wui wo gegokiwua. Kumt wo si s‑e nenꞌoidk ab ha amjed k pi ab hu wo i ha miabi.

column2: These people are not serving Christ our Lord but their own appetites, and by their smooth-talking and pleasant words they deceive the minds of unsuspecting people.
column3: Idam o wabsh hejel e wehhejed hab wua g pi ap e‑tatchui ch pi ab hu chikpanid g t‑kownalig Jesus Christ. Ho o iattogid hegam mo pi ap mahch g wohokam wabsh si s‑kehg neneokch ch s‑ap has ha ahg.

column2: Everyone knows how faithful you are. This makes me really happy. However I want you to be wise about what's good, and innocent of anything bad.
column3: Kumsh eda ahpim ab si s‑wohog elid g s‑kehg haꞌichu ahga ab amjed g Christ. Kuni heg hekaj ab si s‑hehgig em‑hekaj ch am s‑em‑ahgidamk mamt wo s‑ap s‑mahchk g s‑apꞌekam ch pi wo mahchk g pi apꞌekam.

column2: The God of peace will soon break the power of Satan and make him subject to you. May the grace of our Lord Jesus Christ be with you.
column3: Jiosh o ab t‑mahkch g s‑ap tahhadkam ch s‑hohtam wo em‑mah g gewkdag mamt wo gewito g Jiawul.

column2: Timothy my co-worker sends his greetings, as do Lucius, Jason, and Sosipater, my fellow-countrymen.
column3: Ia o ni‑wehm chikpan g Timothy ch hab kaij mamtsh ab wo i s‑hoꞌigeꞌel. K idam ab s‑em‑hoꞌigeꞌid ni‑wehm oꞌodham mo hab chechgig Lucius ch Jason ch Sosipater.

column2: Tertius—who wrote down this letter—also sends you greetings in the Lord.
column3: Ia o ni‑wehhejed em‑oꞌohanid ihda g Tershus ch hab ep kaij mamtsh ab wo i s‑hoꞌigeꞌel.

column2: My host Gaius, and the whole church here, send you greetings. Erastus the city treasurer, sends his best wishes, as does our fellow-believer Quartus.
column3: Ia ani da kihj am g Gaius. K id ab ep s‑em‑hoꞌigeꞌid. Ia kihj am o e nanmek g Christ wohochuddam. Hegai mo d lial nuhkuddam am wehhejed g kownal id eda kihhim o hab chehgig Erastus ch ab s‑wohochud g Jiosh ch hab waꞌap am em‑hoꞌigeꞌelid. K g Quartus hab waꞌap am em‑hoꞌigeꞌelid. [
Neh, ab at wo wa baꞌich i s‑em‑hoꞌigeꞌel g t‑kownalig Jesus Christ.]

column2: This gives them the hope of eternal life that God (who cannot lie) promised ages ago,
column3: Bo kaij g Jiosh mat eda pi koi haꞌichu shaꞌi nahto matsh ab wo ha mah g pi ha huhugedam doakag hegam mat ab wo i s-wohoch.

column2: but which at the proper time he revealed through his word in the message which I was entrusted to give, following the command of God our Savior.
column3: T hemu am i e ai mat s-ap maskogi g haꞌichu e-ahga.

column2: This letter is sent to Titus, my true son through the trust in God we share in common. May you have grace and peace from God the Father and Christ Jesus our Savior.
column3: Kupt ab i s-wohoch ab ni-ab k hahawa wepogidas map d ni-alidag.

column2: The reason I left you in Crete was for you to organize what was still needed and to appoint elders in every town, as I told you.
column3: Am ant i m-dagito Crete jewed t am mapt am wo i apꞌech mo haschu koi apꞌechudas am ha shaꞌashagid hegam mo hemiap e mihshmad. Am apt wo i ha chuhcha wehs kihhim ed hegam mat wo ha wanimedad mani wa id heki hu m-chehani. Kunt am wo i m-chegitoch mat has wo chum masmak.

column2: An elder must have a good reputation, the husband of one wife, and have children who believe and who are not accused of being wild or disobedient.
column3: Dat wo si s-ap oꞌodhamk ch hemako wo hohnigk ch pi wo ha chuꞌijigk. T g ha-aꞌaliga hemho wa d wo wohochuddamk ch ab wo ha kaihamad g e-geꞌegedga. T hab pi hedai wo e nako mas ab wo haꞌichu ha abch.

column2: As a leader for God, a head elder must have a good reputation and not be arrogant. He should not have a quick temper nor get drunk; he shouldn't be violent or greedy for money.
column3: Pi o hab chuꞌig mas g ha wanimeddam wo ge e haschudad o s-hohtam wo babgatad o wo nawkkoꞌod o wo ha cheggiad o muꞌi haꞌichu wo si s-behimkkad.

column2: He should be hospitable, someone who loves what's good and does what's right. He should be living a life for God, self-controlled,
column3: K wabshaba hab chuꞌig mat wo s-dodolimak ch hab wo junihid g s-apꞌekam ch chum hekid wo i ha wehmajk hegam mo tatchua g i wehmtadag.

column2: and must be devoted to the trustworthy message as it's taught. In this way he can encourage others through correct teaching, and be able to convince those who disagree.
column3: Am ap ha mashcham g Jiosh haꞌichu ahga. Kut id an wo si uꞌukchid mat heg hekaj wo i ha gewkemhunad g hemajkam ch wo i ha shohbidad hegam mo ab wui gegok g Jiosh haꞌichu ahga.

column2: For there are many rebels around who talk a lot of deceptive nonsense, especially from the circumcision group.  Their talking must stop, these people who throw whole families into turmoil, teaching things that aren't right for the sake of making money.
column3: Heki at hu muꞌi i wuwha hegam mo chum s-keshwuimk g Jiosh haꞌichu ahga ch ha iattogid g hemajkam ch heg hekaj ab ha wanchkwup mat wo ui g lial, wahm hegam mo d ni-wepo Tutuligo oꞌodham. Kumt heg hekaj wehs e wehm am wo i ha shohbi.

column2: As someone of their own people, a prophet, has stated, “Cretans are always liars, evil beasts who are lazy, greedy people.”
column3: Hema ash hab kaij g s-chu amichuddam am Crete t am, “Ahchim Crete t am oꞌodham ach s-chu iꞌattomk ch s-ta kekeꞌidama ch s-papadma ch wehs haꞌichu si s-behimk.”

column2: This is a true statement! Consequently give them a good telling-off so that they can have a healthy trust in God,
column3: Woho o wa mo has i kaij. Kupt heg hekaj si s-gewkam wo i ha shohbi. T hab ab wo m-kaiham k ab wo s-wohochudad g wohokam.

column2: not paying attention to Jewish myths and human commandments from those who deviate from the truth.
column3: Pt wo ha ahgi mat pi wo wohochudad g Tutuligo ha-hohoꞌoki aꞌagida ch hegai mo d wabsh ha-chehanig hegam mo pi tatchua g wohokam.

column2: To those who have clean minds everything is clean, but to those who are corrupt and refuse to trust in God, nothing is clean—both their minds and their consciences are corrupt.
column3: Wehs o s-kehgaj g Jiosh haꞌichu nahtoi am ha wehhejed hegam mo s-kehg haꞌichu chegitoidag. K wabshaba pi haꞌichu s-kehgaj am ha wehhejed hegam mo pi kehg haꞌichu chegitoidag ch pi wohochud g wohokam no pi g pi kehg haꞌichu ha-chegitoidag wehs haꞌichu padchud ha wehhejed. K pi has ab hu shaꞌi tahhadag g ha-iꞌibdag mo am hab junihim g pi apꞌekam.

column2: They claim to know God, but they prove this is false by what they do. They are detestable and disobedient, worthless for doing anything good.
column3: Idam o hab kaij mo s-mahch g Jiosh ch wabshaba hab e wua mo pi mahch no pi s-ta kekeꞌidama ch pi chechkaidag. K g ha-doakag pi kehg hab mahs. K pi ab hu shaꞌi ha ab ulini mas hab wo juh g s-apꞌekam.

column2: You however must teach what is consistent with healthy beliefs.
column3: Kupt wabshaba ahpi am wo ha mashcha g wohochuddam mat has wo e junihid ch hekaj wo e chehgidad mo s-kehgaj g Jiosh mashchamadag.

column2: Older men shouldn't drink; they should be respectable and sensible, with a healthy trust in God, loving and patient.
column3: Pt wo ha ahgi g kekel oꞌodham mat d wo si oꞌodhamk ch pi wabsh wo i e wahmud k wabshaba wabsh wo i e bahbgi wehs haꞌichu k ed. T wabsh shelinim wo oidad g e-wohochudadag ch wo pihk e elidad ab wehs ha wui ch s-e tahtk ch ab wo nakogad haꞌichu.

column2: Similarly older women ought to behave in a way that shows they live their lives for God. They shouldn't destroy people's reputations by what they say, and they shouldn't be addicted to wine.
column3: Kupt hab waꞌap wo ha ahgi g oꞌoki mat wo s-dodolimak ch wo e chehgidch mo am oidch hab e junihim g s-apꞌekam ch pi wo nawkkoꞌod ch pi wo pi kehg neneokad ab hedai k amjed.

column2: They should be teachers of what's good, teaching the young wives to love their husbands and their children.
column3: T g wechij uꞌuwi ab ha amjed wo mai mat has wo chum masmak ch ab wo i ha tatchuad g e-wehm kihkam ch e-aꞌaliga

column2: They are to be sensible and pure, working in their homes, doing good and listening to what their husbands tell them. In this way the word of God will not be spoken about badly.
column3: ch wo e nuhkudad mat pi hab wo wuad g pi apꞌekam ch wo si s-wapagimak am e-kihdag ed ch ab wo ha wohog elidad g e-wehm kihkam. T hab pi hedai has wo ahgad g Jiosh haꞌichu ahga.

column2: Likewise tell the young men to be sensible.
column3: Kupt hab waꞌap wo ha ahgi g wihpiop mat d wo si oꞌodhamk.

column2: You should set an example of doing good in all areas of life: show integrity and seriousness in what you teach,
column3: Chum apt hekid hab wo wuad g s-apꞌekam ch hab masma wo ha chehgi mat has wo chum e junihid.

column2: sharing healthy beliefs that can't be criticized. In this way those who are opposed will be ashamed of themselves and won't have anything bad to say about us.
column3: Kupt ab wo si has elidad g wohokam ab amjed g Jiosh ch heg wo waꞌi ha mashchamad. T hab wo si e elidad hegam mo ab wui gegok g Jiosh haꞌichu ahga ch pi wo e nako mas has wo m-ahgad.

column2: Tell servants to always obey their masters. They should try to please them and not talk back to them.
column3: Ab g ha ahgid wabsh chum hedai ha-pionag mat ab wo kaihamad g e-ahmo ch pi ab hu wo neꞌowinad

column2: They shouldn't steal things for themselves, but show they are completely trustworthy so that they may rightly represent the truth about God our Savior in every way.
column3: ch pi haꞌichu wo ehsidad ch wabshaba wo e chehgidahid mo s-ap d pion. Kut heg amjed am wo i e tashogi mo s-apꞌe g haꞌichu ahgaj g Jiosh matt heg hekaj t-doꞌibia.

column2: For God's grace has been revealed, bringing salvation to everyone.
column3: Jiosh o wehs s-ha hoꞌigeꞌid g hemajkam ch hab juh g doꞌibiadag chum wehs ha wehhejed. T id am wabsh s-ap i e chehgi.

column2: It teaches us to reject a godless way of life with the desires of this world. Instead we should live thoughtful, self-controlled lives that are right before God in the present world
column3: Kutt heg hekaj wo s-ohhod g pi apꞌekam k wo t-nuhkud matt hab wo wuad g s-apꞌekam ch ab wo si haꞌichuch g Jiosh id eda jewed.

column2: as we look for the wonderful hope of the glorious appearing of our great God and Savior Jesus Christ.
column3: Batt wo masmak nach pi nenida mach haschu s-wohochud mat ia ep wo jiwia k si s-tondam wo e chehgi hegai mo d t-Jioshga ch d t-doꞌibiakam Jesus Christ.

column2: He gave himself for us, so that he could set us free from all our wickedness, and to make us clean for him—a people who belong to him, keen to do good.
column3: Heg at am i e dagito mat s-koꞌokam e muhkid k hekaj t-doꞌibia ab amjed g pi apꞌekam k i t-kegch mach d hahawa si hemajkamgaj k si tatchua matt hab wo junihid g s-apꞌekam.

column2: This is what you should be teaching. You have the authority to encourage and to correct as necessary. Don't let anyone look down on you.
column3: Pegih, am g si ha ahgid wehs ihda k i ha gewkemhun mat hab wo junihid g s-apꞌekam k ep i ha shohbid mat hedai hab wo i wuad g pi apꞌekam. Pi at hedai wo chum pi m-haꞌichuchudad nap pi gewkdag mapt id am hab wo junihid.

column2: Remind them to follow what rulers tell them to do, and to obey authorities. They should always be ready to do what is good.
column3: Pt am wo ha ahgidad g wohochuddam mat has wo chum masmak. T wo s-ha wohog elidad g e-kokownalig ch am oidk hab wo e junihid g chehanig ch chum hekid wo e nahtokchid mat wo s-ap chikpanad ch hab wo junihid g s-apꞌekam.

column2: They should not speak badly about anyone, and they should not be argumentative. Tell them to show gentleness and kindness to everyone.
column3: Am g ha ahgid mat pi wo pi kehg neneokad ab hedai i amjed ch wabshaba wo si s-ap e tahtkkad ch wo si s-hemajimak ab wehs ha wui.

column2: For there was a time when we too were foolish and disobedient. We were deceived and slaves to various desires and pleasures. We lived wicked lives full of jealousy, hateful people hating one another.
column3: Neh, heki ach hu wa hab masmakahim mo hegam mo pi ab hu wohochud g Jiosh. Pi ach wa ab hu kaiham g Jiosh ch pi haꞌichu amichud ch hab s-junimk g pi apꞌekam ch pi aꞌamdag ch s-chu hehgamk. Haꞌi o s-t-kehꞌid. Kuch ab epai s-ha kehꞌid.

column2: But when the goodness and love of God our Savior was revealed, he saved us,
column3: K wabshaba g t-doꞌibiakam Jiosh si pihk e elid t-hekaj ch ia i e chehgi jewed dahm

column2: not because of anything good that we've done, but because of his mercy. He did this through the cleansing of rebirth and renewal of the Holy Spirit,  which he poured out on us abundantly through Jesus Christ our Savior.
column3: mat wo t-doꞌibia ab amjed g s-koꞌok t-namkidadag. Pi at hedai wo e nako mas wo e doꞌibia g hejel haꞌichu hab e-junikaj. T wabshaba g Jiosh ab i s-t-hoꞌigeꞌid k gam hu wako g pi ap t-chuꞌijig matt wo edagi g wechij doakag. Heg at hekaj ia jiwia g t-doꞌibiakam Jesus Christ jewed dahm k heg hekaj ab t-mah g Hekia S-apꞌekam Gewkdag. Heg o am t-eda ch ab t-mahkch hegai wechij doakag.

column2: Now that we are set right by his grace we have become heirs having the hope of eternal life.
column3: Jesus Christ o ab s-t-hoꞌigeꞌid ch am i t-apꞌech matt wo s-apꞌek am Jiosh tahgio. Kuch heg hekaj edgid ihda wechij doakag ch hab am wehmaj wo kihkad chum hekid am i dahm matt wo koi.

column2: You can trust what I'm saying, and I want you to emphasize these instructions so that those who trust in God will think seriously about them and continue to do good. They are excellent and helpful for everyone.
column3: Do wohokam ihda mani haschu m-ahgid. Kupt chum hekid am wo ha ahgidad g wohochuddam. T hekaj wo e nuhkud mat wo s-wapagimak ch hab wo junihid g s-apꞌekam. Id at d wo i ha-wehmtadagk g hemajkam.

column2: Avoid pointless discussions, and obsessions about ancestry. Don't get into arguments, and avoid fights over the Jewish laws—they're useless and don't help at all.
column3: Kupt pi wo ha neꞌowinad hegam mo wabsh pehegi haꞌichu m-kaiam ch am chum m-pipꞌichud ab amjed g Tutuligo ha-chehanig ch chum ge e haschud ch hab kaij mo ab d ha amjedkam g si s-has hahaꞌichu.

column2: Warn someone who is divisive once, and then again—after that don't pay them any attention,  realizing that they're perverse and sinful and have condemned themselves.
column3: Gokko apt wo s-ha daꞌi hegam mat hedai wo chum aꞌai ha gaꞌagwulkai g wohochuddam. Hegam mat pi ab hu wo m-kaiha o pi apꞌe. T g pi ap ha-chuꞌijig am wo ha chehgi. Kumt wabsh wo ha dagito.

column2: As soon as I send Artemas or Tychicus to you, try and come to me at Nicopolis because I'm planning to spend the winter there.
column3: Ia o ni-wehm dadha g Artemas ch Tychicus. Kunt idam am hema wo i kei mat am m-wui wo jiwia. Kupt am haha wo hih Nicopolis kihhim wui mapt am wo ni-wehmajk nant pi am wo dakad s-hehpichꞌed.

column2: Do all you can to help Zenas the lawyer and Apollos on their way so that they have everything they need.
column3: Kah ani mash am m-wehm da hegai Zenas mo d chehanig hudawogdam ch atsh am hebai wo ha mihshmdam g Apollos wehm. Kupt heꞌes wo i e nakog k am wo i ha wehmt mat pi haꞌichu wo pi edagi.

column2: May our people learn the habit of doing good in providing for the daily needs of others. They need to be productive!
column3: Bat wo wa chum masmak g wohochuddam mat hab waꞌap wo i ha wehmajk hegam mo hab masma tatchua g i wehmtadag.

column2: Everyone here with me sends their greetings. Give our best wishes to those who love us, those who trust in God. May grace be with you all.
column3: Wehsijj o am i m-hoꞌigeꞌid idam t-wehm wohochuddam mo ia kih. Am g wehsijj i ha hoꞌigeꞌid g t-wehm wohochuddam amai.
